author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the rice, onion, peppers, and garlic. Cook until the rice is browned and vegetables are tender. Stir in the water, tomatoes, chili powder, and salt and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the rice is tender, about 15 to 17 minutes. Stir in the cheese and transfer to a serving bowl.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 1/2 cups long-grain rice', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'2 cups water', u'1 (14 1/2-ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles', u'1 teaspoons chili powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup shredded Cheddar']
title: Mexican Rice

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Grease an 8-inch square pan, cast iron skillet, or cornbread mold. In a medium bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. To dry mixture, add egg, milk, sour cream, oil, and jalapenos and mix until smooth. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup yellow cornmeal', u'1 cup sifted all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 large egg', u'1 cup whole milk or buttermilk', u'1/3 cup sour cream', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons chopped jalapenos, or to taste']
title: Mexican Cornbread

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 13 by-9-inch pan with the cooking spray.', u'In a large bowl, stir together the 3 kinds of soup and the tomatoes. Stir in the chicken.', u'j', u'Layer the tortillas and the chicken mixture in the pan, beginning and ending with tortillas. Sprinkle the cheese over the casserole and bake for 30 minutes.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil cooking spray', u'1 (10 3/4-ounce) can cream of chicken soup', u'1 (10 3/4-ounce) can cheddar cheese soup', u'1 (10 3/4-ounce) can cream of mushroom soup', u'1 (10-ounce) can tomatoes', u'1 whole chicken, cooked, boned, and chopped or 4 cups leftover cooked chicken', u' Unsalted butter, for greasing pan', u'1 (11 1/2-ounce) package flour tortillas', u'2 cups shredded Cheddar']
title: Mexican Chicken

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Preheat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil - twice around the pan. Add chicken and season with chili powder, cumin, and red onion. Brown the meat, 5 minutes. Add taco sauce or stewed or fire roasted tomatoes. Add black beans and corn. Heat the mixture through, 2 to 3 minutes then season with salt, to your taste.', u'Coat a shallow baking dish with remaining extra-virgin olive oil, about 1 tablespoon oil. Cut the tortillas in half or quarters to make them easy to layer with. Build lasagna in layers of meat and beans, then tortillas, then cheese. Repeat: meat, tortilla, cheese again. Bake lasagna 12 to 15 minutes until cheese is brown and bubbly. Top with the scallions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 pounds ground chicken breast, available in the packaged meats case', u'2 tablespoons chili powder', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1/2 red onion, chopped', u'1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained', u'1 cup medium heat taco sauce or 1 (14-oz) can stewed or fire roasted tomatoes', u'1 cup frozen corn kernels', u' Salt', u'8 (8 inch) spinach flour tortillas, available on dairy aisle of market', u'2 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar or shredded pepper jack', u'2 scallions, finely chopped']
title: Mexican Lasagna

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'In an 8-inch, nonstick, oven-proof saute pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the scallions green onions and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Meanwhile in a medium bowl, beat the eggs with 1 tablespoon of water. Add cilantro and season with salt and pepper. Add egg mixture to pan and cookAdd the eggs and cilantro to the pan and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 8 minutes lifting the edges with a spatula, to allow any uncooked egg to flow to the bottom. Pour the Mexican crema over the top and sprinkle with the cheese. Transfer the pan to the oven and bake until puffed and golden, about 8 to 10 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 tablespoon olive oil', u'2 to 3 green onions/scallions, sliced (white and pale green parts only)', u'3 large eggs', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup Mexican crema or sour cream', u'1/4 cup shredded Oaxaca or mozzarella cheese']
title: Mexican Frittata

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Guacamole, recipe follows']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds beef shoulder', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 large onion, sliced', u'1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes, (recommended: San Marzano)', u'1 tablespoon ancho chile powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'3 bay leaves', u' Vegetable oil, for deep frying', u'6 fresh medium corn tortillas', u' Kosher salt', u'3 cups finely shredded white cabbage', u'1/4 bunch fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 (28-ounce) can whole tomatoes, drained, reserving the juice (recommended: San Marzano)', u'1 small red onion, roughly chopped', u'1 Serrano chile', u'1 garlic clove, roughly chopped', u'2 limes, juiced', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly cracked black pepper', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling', u'6 ripe avocados', u'3 limes, juiced', u'1 medium yellow onion, chopped', u'1 garlic clove, smashed then minced', u'2 serrano chiles, cut into rounds', u'1 big handful fresh cilantro with stems, about 1/2 cup, finely chopped', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Pot Roast Tacos

directions: [u'Frost rims of 2 cups with sugar.  Pass it through the fire, gilding the edge little by little. Add the tequila and the coffee liqueur to them tilting the cup a little towards the fire so that the liqueur begins to flame. Dust with cinnamon.  Immediately add hot coffee and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Top with a cherry.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons sugar, divided', u'3 ounces tequila, divided', u'3 ounces coffee liqueur (recommended: Kalhua), divided', u' Ground cinnamon, to dust', u'2 cups prepared coffee, divided', u'2 scoops vanilla ice cream, divided', u'2 cherries']
title: Mexican Coffee

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the dressing: Mix together the mayonnaise, milk, sour cream, parsley, cilantro, chili powder, cumin, hot sauce, garlic and salt and pepper to taste in a medium bowl. Set aside.', u'For the salad: Prepare a grill pan or grill for medium-high heat. Grill the corn until nice and golden, with good grill marks on the kernels, 10 to 12 minutes. Allow to cool a bit, then cut the kernels off the cobs.', u'Add all the salad ingredients to a bowl in layers: first the lettuce, followed by the tomatoes, corn, red onions, cheese and tortilla chips.', u'Pour the dressing into a small serving bowl and serve alongside the salad.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups mayonnaise', u'1 cup milk', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh cilantro', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin', u' A few dashes hot sauce, or to taste', u'1 clove garlic, grated', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 ears corn, shucked', u'3 heads green leaf lettuce, torn into chunks', u'2 cups halved red grape tomatoes', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u'1 cup grated Monterey Jack cheese', u'2 cups crushed-up tortilla chips']
title: Mexican Salad

directions: [u'For stovetop: In a large pot over medium heat, whisk together milk, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and nutmeg. Add chocolate chips. Stir until chocolate is melted. Cover and turn heat to low for 5 minutes.', u'For slow cooker: In a 4-quart slow cooker, whisk together milk, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and nutmeg. Add chocolate chips. Cover and cook on LOW setting for 2 to 3 hours, stirring every 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Serve with a dusting of cocoa powder.']
ingredients: [u'6 (12-ounce) cans evaporated milk', u'4 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'1 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u' Pinch cayenne pepper', u"2 (12-ounce) bags semisweet chocolate chips (recommended: Hershey's)", u' Cocoa powder, for serving']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Combine the simple syrup, grenadine, orange juice and frozen limeade in a large container. Add the lemon-lime soda, fill the container with ice and top with lime slices.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup simple syrup', u'1/4 cup grenadine', u' Juice of 2 oranges', u'1 small container frozen limeade', u' Two 2-liter bottles lemon-lime soda, such as 7-Up', u'4 limes, cut into slices']
title: Mexican Punch

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'For serving: sliced avocado, sour cream, grated Cheddar cheese, and tortilla chips', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place the chicken breasts skin side up on a sheet pan. Rub with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until done. When the chicken is cool enough to handle, discard the skin and bones, and shred the meat. Cover and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add the onions, celery, and carrots and cook over medium-low heat for 10 minutes, or until the onions start to brown. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the chicken stock, tomatoes with their puree, jalapenos, cumin, coriander, 1 tablespoon salt (depending on the saltiness of the chicken stock), 1 teaspoon pepper, and the cilantro, if using. Cut the tortillas in 1/2, then cut them crosswise into 1/2-inch strips and add to the soup. Bring the soup to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for 25 minutes. Add the shredded chicken and season to taste. Serve the soup hot topped with sliced avocado, a dollop of sour cream, grated Cheddar cheese, and broken tortilla chips.']
ingredients: [u'4 split (2 whole) chicken breasts, bone in, skin on', u' Good olive oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups chopped onions (2 onions)', u'1 cup chopped celery (2 stalks)', u'2 cups chopped carrots (4 carrots)', u'4 large cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 1/2 quarts chicken stock, preferably homemade', u'1 (28-ounce) can whole tomatoes in puree, crushed', u'2 to 4 jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander seed', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves, optional', u'6 (6-inch) fresh white corn tortillas']
title: Mexican Chicken Soup

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Cut avocados in half, working around the pit. Separate the 2 halves. Remove pit and scoop out avocado flesh with a spoon. Wedge avocados and pile in the center of a large platter. Seed and wedge tomatoes and arrange around the avocados. Spread sliced onion over platter. Sprinkle platter with cilantro. Squeeze the juice of 2 limes evenly over vegetables. Season with coarse salt. Drizzle platter with oil and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 ripe avocados', u'3 vine-ripe tomatoes', u'1/2 sweet onion, sliced', u' Chopped cilantro, about 2 tablespoons', u'2 limes', u' Coarse salt', u' Extra virgin oil, for drizzling']
title: Mexican Salad

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Remove the husks of the corn but leave the core attached at the end so you have something to hold onto. Grill the corn on a hot grill or cast iron griddle pan until slightly charred. Turn it so it gets cooked evenly all over. Mix the mayonnaise, sour cream and cilantro together. Grate the Parmesan in another bowl.  While the corn is still warm slather with mayonnaise mix. Squeeze lime juice over the corn and shower with Parmesan. Season with chili powder and serve with extra lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'4 ears corn', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 1/2 cups sour cream', u'1/4 cup freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 cup freshly grated Parmesan', u'1 lime, juiced', u' Red chili powder, to taste', u'2 limes cut into wedges, for garnish']
title: Mexican Grilled Corn

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the tomatoes, onion and garlic, stir and cook for a minute or two to soften the onion. Add 2 teaspoons of the chili powder, 1 teaspoon of the paprika and 1 teaspoon of the cumin. Stir and cook the mixture for another minute or two to release the flavors of the spices. Remove the mixture to a bowl and set aside.', u"In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add the chicken along with the remaining 2 teaspoons chili powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon cumin and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Saute the chicken until it's deep golden brown and done in the middle, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add 1 cup water and stir to make a sauce. Bring the sauce to a boil and cook until it's reduced by half, about 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the beans and set aside.", u'To assemble the casserole, pour half a jar (about 1 cup) of salsa verde into the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish or disposable foil baking pan. Add a layer of half the tortillas on top of the salsa verde, overlapping the edges. Spoon the rice over the tortillas, spread the tomato mixture over the rice, then sprinkle the corn over the tomatoes. Next, add the chicken and bean mixture, then sprinkle on half the cheese and pour over half the enchilada sauce. Next, add the rest of the tortillas, then pour on the rest of the salsa verde and the rest of the enchilada sauce and sprinkle on the rest of the cheese.', u"If you're baking the casserole right away, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and bake, covered with foil, for 20 minutes. Then remove the foil and continue baking for 15 to 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbly. Serve with sour cream and cilantro.", u"Find this recipe and more in Ree's new book, The Pioneer Woman Cooks: Dinnertime ($30, William Morrow Cookbooks).", u'Photograph by Steve Giralt']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 cups diced fresh tomatoes (about 3 to 5)', u'1 onion, diced', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'4 teaspoons chili powder', u'2 teaspoons paprika', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 large boneless, skinless chicken breast (about 12 ounces), cut into bite-size pieces', u' Kosher salt', u'1 15 -ounce can pinto beans, drained and rinsed', u'1 15 -ounce can kidney beans, drained and rinsed', u'1 16 -ounce jar salsa verde', u'10 large (burrito-size) flour tortillas or 12 small flour or corn tortillas', u'2 cups cooked rice (from 2/3 cup dry)', u'1 11 -ounce can corn kernels, drained', u'1 pound grated cheddar-jack cheese', u'1 1/2 cups red enchilada sauce', u' Sour cream and cilantro, for serving']
title: Mexican Tortilla Casserole

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare your favorite boxed or homemade brownies, adding 3/4 teaspoon ground chipotle chile pepper and 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon to the batter (for a batch that fits a 9-by-13-inch pan). Top each Mexican brownie with a scoop of ulce de leche ice cream and sprinkle with cinnamon.', u'Photograph by Tina Rupp']
title: Mexican Brownies

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a heavy large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Cool slightly.', u'In a medium bowl, mix together the onion, rice, cilantro, ground meat, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper. Using wet hands, shape the meat mixture into 20 to 22 (1-inch) meatballs.', u'Combine the carrots, serrano chile, potato, tomato paste, and vegetable stock in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the meatballs and zucchini and simmer on low heat until the meatballs are cooked through, about 20 minutes. Season the soup with salt and pepper, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/2 small onion, chopped (about 1/2 cup)', u'1/3 cup uncooked long-grain rice', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 pound ground sirloin beef', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 carrot, cut into rounds (about 3/4 cup)', u'1 serrano chile, whole', u'1 Yukon gold potato, skin on, diced (about 1 cup)', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'8 cups vegetable stock', u'2 zucchini, diced (about 1 cup)']
title: Mexican Meatball Soup

directions: [u'In a skillet, fry corn tortillas in hot vegetable oil until crispy. Drain. Remove oil from heat, Cut tortillas into bite-sized pieces. In butter, saute bell peppers and onion until soft. Add tomatoes. Beat eggs well. Add eggs to sauteed vegetables. Add tortilla chips. Scramble until eggs are done.']
ingredients: [u'2 corn tortillas', u' Vegetable oil', u' Butter', u'1 tablespoon diced bell pepper', u'1 tablespoon diced onion', u'1 tablespoon diced tomato', u'2 eggs']
title: Mexican Migas

author: Chris Santos
directions: [u'For the chipotle salt: Combine the chipotle powder and salt and store in an airtight container.', u'For the corn: Heat a grill or grill pan over high heat until hot, and then add the corn and char on all sides, turning occasionally, until blackened in parts, 12 to 15 minutes. When cool enough to handle, cut the kernels off the cobs.', u'Heat the oil in a saucepan over medium heat and saute the onions until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the charred corn kernels and cook until warmed. Stir in 1/2 cup of the cheese, the mayonnaise, cilantro and lime zest. Season with 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of the chipotle salt.', u'Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup cotija cheese and more chipotle salt.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons chipotle powder', u'3 tablespoons kosher salt', u'6 ears corn', u'1/2 red onion, minced', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'3/4 cup crumbled cotija cheese', u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh cilantro', u' Zest of 2 limes']
title: Deconstructed Mexican Style Corn

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u"Heat the oil in a large dutch oven and add the garlic and onions. Cook, 3 to 4 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and add the rice. Stir constantly, making sure the rice doesn't burn. Cook over low heat, about 3 minutes.", u'Next, add the whole tomatoes, diced tomatoes, cumin, salt, pepper, cayenne and turmeric. Stir to combine and let cook, about 2 minutes.  Finally, add the chicken broth and stir the mixture together. Bring the mixture to a boil, and then reduce heat to low. Cover, and simmer until the rice is not quite done, 10 to 15 minutes.', u'Top with the cheese, and then bake with the lid off until the cheese is melted and the rice fully cooked, about 15 minutes. Serve with chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 to 1 whole large onion, chopped', u'4 cups long grain rice', u' Two 14.5-ounce cans whole tomatoes', u' One 10-ounce can diced tomatoes and green chiles, such as Rotel', u'1 teaspoon cumin (or more to taste)', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'6 to 8 cups low-sodium chicken broth (more if needed)', u'1 1/2 cups grated Cheddar', u' Fresh cilantro, chopped, for serving']
title: Mexican Rice Casserole

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine 12 cups water, the brown sugar and cinnamon sticks in a large pot and bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Stir in the pumpkin and return to a simmer. Meanwhile, remove the zest from the limes in wide strips using a vegetable peeler; add the zest to the pot and simmer 15 minutes. Let cool, then refrigerate until the liquid is cold and the pumpkin pulp settles to the bottom, 2 to 3 hours.', u'Working in batches, ladle the liquid into a fine-mesh strainer set over a pitcher (repeat if necessary to strain out all the pumpkin pulp). Discard the pulp and lime zest. Return the cinnamon sticks to the punch and refrigerate until ready to serve.', u'Pour the punch into ice-filled glasses. Add rum, pineapple and/or pecans, if desired. Serve with the cinnamon sticks.', u'Photograph by Andrew Mccaul']
ingredients: [u'2 cups packed dark brown sugar', u'4 cinnamon sticks, preferably Mexican', u'1 29 -ounce can pure pumpkin (about 3 1/2 cups)', u'2 limes', u' Splash of rum (optional)', u' Pineapple chunks and/or pecans, for serving (optional)']
title: Mexican Pumpkin Punch

author: Daisy Martinez
directions: [u'To make the crullers: In a medium saucepan, heat 1 cup water, the butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt over medium-high heat until the edges of the liquid start to bubble. Add the flour all at once and stir briskly with a wooden spoon until well mixed and no lumps of flour remain.', u'Remove from the heat. Add 4 of the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well with a wooden spoon after each. The dough should look soft and glossy and keep a "hook" shape when the spoon is pulled from the dough. If not, beat in the last egg.', u'Scrape the dough into a pastry bag fitted with a star tip. Pour enough canola oil into a deep heavy skillet (cast iron is ideal) to fill 1-inch. Heat over medium heat until the tip of the handle of a wooden spoon gives off a slow steady stream of tiny bubbles. Carefully pipe the dough into the oil, forming 6-inch crullers. Pipe only as many crullers into the oil as fit comfortably. Overcrowding the pan will result in soggy crullers. Fry, turning once, until golden brown on each side. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with the remaining dough.', u'Put the sugar and the cinnamon in a paper bag. Crimp the top and shake well to mix. Drop a few crullers at a time into the bag and shake until coated. Best served as soon as possible.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup water', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'4 to 5 eggs', u' Canola oil, for frying', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon']
title: Mexican Crullers (Churros)

author: Aarón Sánchez
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on two sides. Press the paper into the corners of the pan and lightly grease the paper with butter.', u'Melt the 2 sticks of butter in a nonstick saucepan over medium-low heat; do not boil. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Add the sugar, eggs and vanilla to the saucepan and stir with a wooden spoon until combined.', u'Add the cocoa, flour, cinnamon, chili powder, salt and baking powder and mix until smooth. Spread the batter in the prepared pan and bake until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out fudgy, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in the pan on a rack, then use the parchment paper to lift out the brownies before slicing.', u'Photograph by Kate Sears']
ingredients: [u'2 sticks unsalted butter, plus more for greasing', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2/3 cup good-quality unsweetened cocoa powder', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon ground Mexican cinnamon (canela)', u'1/4 teaspoon pequin chili powder or cayenne pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder']
title: Aaron Sanchez's Mexican Brownies

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Roast the peppers by placing them on an open gas flame, turning them frequently with tongs until all sides are charred black, about 7 to 10 minutes. (Alternately, the peppers can be roasted under a broiler, or on top of a gas or charcoal grill.) Place the blackened peppers in a plastic or paper bag, and let rest until cool enough to handle, about 15 minutes. Peel the peppers, split in half lengthwise, and remove the seeds and the stems.', u'Butter a 9 by 13-inch baking dish. Spread the chiles in a flat layer across the bottom of the dish.', u'In a large skillet, cook the sausage over medium-high heat, stirring to break up the meat, until browned. Add the onions and bell peppers, and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add the garlic and chili powder, and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from the heat.', u'In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and half-and-half with the hot sauce, salt and black pepper.', u'In another bowl, combine the green onions, cilantro, jack, and cheddar, and mix well.', u'Spoon 1/3 of the sausage mixture over the chiles in the dish, top with 1/3 of the tortilla quarters, and 1/3 of the cheese mixture. Repeat layering, ending with a cheese layer. Pour the egg mixture over the ingredients. Let rest, covered, in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours, or overnight.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Bake until bubbly and golden brown, and a knife inserted into the custard comes out clean, about 1 hour and 10 minutes to 1 hour and 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and let rest 10 minutes before serving. Serve with sour cream and picante sauce.']
ingredients: [u'6 poblano chile peppers, about 1 1/2 pounds', u'1 teaspoon unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 pounds Mexican chorizo, or other hot sausage, removed from casings and crumbled', u'1 cup chopped yellow onions', u'1/2 cup chopped red bell peppers', u'4 teaspoons minced garlic', u'4 teaspoons chili powder', u'5 corn tortillas, quartered', u'10 large eggs', u'3 cups half-and-half', u'1/2 teaspoon hot red pepper sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup chopped green onions, green tops only', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 1/2 cups grated pepper jack', u'1 1/2 cups grated medium cheddar', u' Sour Cream, garnish', u' Picante Sauce (store bought), garnish']
title: Mexican Breakfast Casserole

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Place a stockpot over medium heat and coat with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the onions, garlic, jalapenos, and tomatoes; cook, stirring for 15 minutes until the vegetables are cooked down and pulpy. Pour in the stock, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for 20 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, heat 1-inch of canola oil in a skillet over medium-high flame. When the oil begins to smoke, add the tortilla strips in batches and fry until they are crisp on all sides. Remove to a paper towel-lined platter and sprinkle with salt while they are still hot.', u'Ladle the hot soup into 4 soup bowls and put a pile of shredded chicken on top of each. Top with the diced avocado and fried tortilla strips (and cheese if using). Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 medium white onions, diced', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 jalapenos, seeded and minced', u'3 ripe medium tomatoes, chopped', u'1 quart chicken stock, recipe follows', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Canola oil, for pan-frying', u'8 corn tortillas, cut into 1/8-inch-thick strips', u'1 1/2 cups shredded cooked chicken', u'2 avocados, halved, pitted, peeled, and diced', u'1 cup shredded Jack cheese, optional', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish', u'1 lime, cut in wedges, for serving', u'1 whole free-range chicken (about 3 1/2 pounds), rinsed, giblets discarded', u'2 carrots, cut in large chunks', u'3 celery stalks, cut in large chunks', u'2 large white onions, quartered', u'1 head of garlic, halved', u'1 turnip, halved', u'1/4 bunch fresh thyme leaves', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns']
title: Mexican Tortilla Chicken Soup

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'Preheat a grill pan. Rub corn with oil and place on the grill pan, turning corn so all sides are charred, about 6 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, mix together mayonnaise, chili powder, garlic salt, and black pepper. Remove corn from grill and brush with the mayonnaise mixture. Serve with lime quarters to squeeze over corn.']
ingredients: [u'4 ears sweet corn, husks removed', u'2 tablespoons corn oil', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon garlic salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 lime, quartered', u' Special equipment: grill pan']
title: Mexican Street Corn

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, celery, garlic, chili powder, and cumin, and cook until the onion softens, about 5 minutes. Add the chicken broth, bring to a boil, reduce the heat slightly, and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Add the green chiles, posole, tomatoes, and oregano and cook for another 5 minutes.', u'Pull the saucepan from the heat and stir in the chicken, cilantro leaves, and lime juice. Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Serve hot.', u'Copyright 2004 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'1 medium rib celery, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'6 cups chicken broth, low-sodium canned', u'1/4 cup canned green chiles', u'1 (15 1/2-ounce) can posole, drained or frozen corn kernels', u'4 canned whole peeled tomatoes, roughly chopped', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 cup cooked skinless shredded chicken breast (about 4 ounces)', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Juice of 1 lime', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Chicken Soup

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Put the water, rice, and cinnamon stick in a medium-size heavy saucepan set over medium-high heat.  Bring to a boil, uncovered, and cook until the rice is tender, about 18 minutes. Strain out the liquid, discard the cinnamon and reserve the rice. Return the rice to the saucepan. Stir in the evaporated milk, condensed milk, and whole milk. Continue cooking over medium-high heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook, uncovered, stirring constantly, until the mixture is thick, about 20 minutes.  Add the raisins, and stir well. Transfer the pudding to a serving bowl. Dust the top of the pudding with ground cinnamon and serve.']
ingredients: [u'7 cups water', u'1 cup long-grain white rice', u'1 (4-inch) cinnamon stick', u'1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk', u'1 (14-ounce) can condensed milk', u'1 cup whole milk', u'3/4 cup golden raisins', u' Ground cinnamon, for dusting']
title: Mexican Rice Pudding ("Arroz Con Leche")

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'In a heavy skillet, add the oil and heat over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrot, celery, and garlic. Cook, stirring often until vegetables are soft, about 8 minutes. Set aside until cool enough to handle. ', u'In a large bowl combine the sauteed vegetables, ground beef, chorizo, and diced poblano chile.', u'In a medium bowl, combine the salt, pepper, cayenne, cumin, and eggs. Add the ketchup and sour cream. Mix well with a fork and pour it on top of the mixed meats. Sprinkle with bread crumbs and mix thoroughly with clean hands.', u'Put the mixture into a 9 by 13-inch loaf-pan. Bake until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the meatloaf registers 160 degrees F, about 40 to 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and carefully pour off any accumulated pan juices.', u'Meanwhile, heat a heavy skillet over high heat. Add the whole tomatoes, onion, garlic cloves, and serrano chiles. Cook, turning frequently, until lightly charred on all sides. Peel the garlic cloves. Add all the charred ingredients to a blender. Pulse until chunky, then pour into a small skillet. Stir in the sugar, chipotle chile and mustard. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat. Cook until slightly thickened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Season with salt, to taste.', u'Slice the meatloaf and arrange on a platter. Spoon the salsa-glaze over the meatloaf and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/2 cup finely chopped onion', u'1 medium carrot, finely chopped', u'1 rib finely chopped celery', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1 pound ground beef', u'6 ounces soft Mexican chorizo, removed from casing and crumbled', u'1 poblano chile, roasted, peeled, and diced', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'2 eggs, well beaten', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'1/4 cup sour cream or Mexican sour cream', u'1/2 cup dried bread crumbs', u'2 medium tomatoes, cored', u'1/4 medium white onion', u'2 garlic cloves, unpeeled', u'1 to 3 serrano chiles', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1 canned chipotle chile in adobo sauce, minced', u'1 tablespoon yellow mustard', u' Kosher salt']
title: Mexican Meatloaf

directions: [u'On hot griddle toast the ancho and gaujillo chile and submerge in hot water. Let chiles sit for 20 minutes. Remove from water and puree in blender with a cup of warm water. Set aside. ', u'In a deep Dutch oven, add the beef and ribs, water, onion, and garlic cloves. Bring to boil and cook for 1 hour. At this point add the bay leaves, thyme, chile puree, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper simmer for 30 minutes. To make sauce, puree the garlic, vinegar, and chile powder in a blender. ', u'Serve the stew in a big bowl with a sprinkle of onion and cilantro and a squeeze of lime on top. Serve with corn tortillas and some of the sauce on the side, as well.']
ingredients: [u'4 guajillo chiles', u'4 ancho chiles', u'1 cup hot water', u'1 pound top round, cubed for stew', u'1 pound baby back ribs, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'2 1/2 quarts water', u'1 onion', u'6 garlic cloves', u'2 fresh bay leaves', u'6 sprigs thyme', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon Mexican oregano', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 garlic cloves', u'1 teaspoon ground chile piquin', u'1/2 cup diced onion', u'2 limes, cut into wedges', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro', u' Corn tortillas, as an accompaniment']
title: Mexican Stew: Birria

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add garlic and jalapeno and sweat until soft and translucent. Add spices and cook for 1 to 2 minutes until fragrant and aromatic. Add tomatoes, chicken, Worcestershire, and stock.', u'Bring to a simmer and cook 20 minutes.', u'Cut the lime in half, squeeze juice into the pot, and then add the juiced halves as well.', u'Add white rice and cook 5 minutes longer to warm rice through. Season, to taste, with salt.', u'Ladle into bowls and garnish with sour cream and cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, roughly chopped', u'4 large cloves garlic, roughly chopped', u'2 jalapenos, seeded and sliced', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon dried cumin', u'1 (28-ounce) can chopped tomatoes', u'3 cups shredded cooked chicken', u' Few dashes Worcestershire sauce', u'3 to 4 cups chicken stock', u'1 lime', u'1 cup cooked white rice', u' Kosher salt', u' Sour cream, for garnish', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Mexican Chicken Stew

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a medium, heavy saucepan, heat the lard over medium-high heat. Add the pork and cook, stirring until no longer pink. Add the sausages and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the onions and bell peppers, and cook, stirring, until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the stock, salt, and saffron, and stir well. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to low, cover, and cook undisturbed until all the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.', u'Remove from the heat and let sit, covered, for 10 minutes. Uncover and fluff the rice with a fork. Add the oregano and cilantro, and stir to incorporate.', u'Turn into a decorative bowl and garnish with the green onions. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons lard', u'1/2 cup ground pork', u'1/4 pound chorizo, halved lengthwise and cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1/2 cup chopped white onions', u'1/4 cup chopped green bell peppers', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 cups long grain rice', u'1 large tomato, peeled, seeded and chopped', u'4 cups chicken stock, or water', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon saffron', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions']
title: Mexican Rice

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the salad: Cook the macaroni according to the package directions. Drain and set aside to cool.', u'Heat an indoor grill and brush with oil. Cook the ears of corn, turning, until browned and cooked through. Cut the kernels off the cobs.', u'Put the corn in a big bowl with the black beans, olives, tomatoes, green onions and red onions and toss to combine.', u'For the dressing: In a separate bowl, whisk together the salsa, sour cream, mayonnaise, cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the salad ingredients and fold together until everything is coated. Taste and adjust the seasoning.', u'Serve chilled.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound elbow macaroni', u' Vegetable oil, for oiling grill', u'2 ears corn', u'1 can black beans, drained and rinsed', u'1/2 cup finely chopped black olives', u'6 Roma tomatoes, chopped', u'3 green onions, thinly sliced', u'1/2 red onion, finely diced', u'1 cup jarred salsa', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Macaroni Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u"This dish is a Chili con Carne made with stew meat rather than ground chuck. It is pretty enough to entertain with and made with top round rather than bottom, so it's lean enough to feel good about eating."]
ingredients: [u'6 ancho chiles', u'2 cups beef stock', u' Vegetable or olive oil, for drizzling', u'4 ounces smoky good quality bacon, chopped', u'2 pounds beef top round, cut into bite-size chunks', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 medium onions, finely chopped', u'4 large cloves garlic, finely chopped or grated', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u' About 2 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa', u' About 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' About 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1 (12-ounce) bottle Mexican-style lager beer (recommended: Negra Modelo)', u'1 (14-ounce) can whole, diced or crushed fire-roasted tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon honey', u' Juice of 1 lime', u' Sour cream', u' Fresh cilantro leaves', u' Warm or charred tortillas or rice', u' Black beans']
title: Mexican Beef Stew

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'In a skillet over medium heat, brown chorizo. Add salsa and simmer for 5 minutes. Lay pizza crusts on pizza pan or baking sheet covered in foil. Spread refried black beans over top of pizza crusts. Evenly spread chorizo mixture over beans. Cover in cheese and bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from oven and top with lettuce, followed by tomatoes, and then tortilla chips. Place ranch dressing in a resealable plastic bag and snip corner off of bag; pipe over pizzas. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound chorizo', u'1/2 cup medium salsa', u'4 (8-inch) premade pizza crusts (recommended: Boboli)', u'1 can black refried beans', u'1 package 4 cheese Mexican blend', u' Shredded lettuce', u' Finely chopped tomatoes', u' Chopped tortilla chips', u' Ranch dressing']
title: Mexican Pizza

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.', u'Brush corn with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Grill for 5 to 6 minutes, rotating on all sides, until the corn has some nice charred spots. Let cool and remove corn kernels from the cob.', u'Add corn, brown rice, beans, red bell pepper, jalapeno, and green onions to a large bowl.', u'In a smaller bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, cumin, garlic, cilantro, and salt and pepper. Fold dressing into the veggies and top with the crumbled cheese and toss.', u'Cook\'s Note: Queso fresco translates to "fresh cheese." It has a crumbly texture and slightly acidic flavor. Feta cheese can be substituted.', u"Cook's Note: Pinto beans have a delicious creamy taste and texture."]
ingredients: [u'2 ears corn, husked', u' Olive oil, for brushing', u'1 cup cooked brown rice', u'2 (15-ounce) cans pinto beans, drained and rinsed', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped', u'1 bunch green onions, sliced', u'1 small jalapeno, seeds and rib removed, diced', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'1 teaspoon cumin', u'1 clove garlic, finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup crumbled queso fresco or feta cheese']
title: Mexican Brown Rice Salad

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Cut the tomatoes in half, and remove the seeds.  Add the tomatoes and 2 cups of broth to a blender and puree. Strain into a bowl and reserve the liquid. Add enough extra broth to make 4 cups of liquid.', u'In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and carrots and saute for 4 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in the rice and cook until slightly toasted, about 3 minutes. Add the tomato broth mixture, stir and bring to boil. Add the salt, bay leaf, and the serrano chile. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer until the rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove the pan from heat. Scatter the peas over the top of the rice, cover, and let the rice stand 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork, transfer to a serving bowl and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 vine-ripened tomatoes', u'2 cups chicken broth, plus more as needed', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 large chopped onion', u'1 large finely diced carrot', u'1 large garlic clove, minced', u'2 cups medium-grain rice', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 whole serrano chile', u'1/4 cup fresh or frozen peas, thawed']
title: Foolproof Mexican Rice ("Arroz Mexicano")

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u'Melt 1 cup of the sugar in saucepan over low heat and cook until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Watch the sugar carefully as it can burn quickly (adding 2 tablespoons of water to the sugar will also help it not burn). Put the caramel into custard cups to cover the bottom. ', u'In mixing bowl add the remaining 1 cup sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Boil the milk, then slowly add to sugar egg mix whisking well. Strain through a fine strainer. Ladle the mixture into the caramel coated custard cups, filling 3/4 full. Put the filled cups into a water bath and cover. Cook for about 50 minutes. Check after 30 minutes. Cool to room temperature. ', u'To serve, run a knife around the edges to loosen and invert onto plates.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sugar', u'4 eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'2 cups milk']
title: Flan Mexican

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'In a small bowl, whisk together the sour cream, lime juice and cumin. Transfer half of the mixture to a larger bowl and add the beef. Allow the beef to marinate, refrigerated, for at least 3 hours. Refrigerate the remaining sour cream mixture.', u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Once hot, put a baking sheet lined with foil in the oven for 20 minutes to heat up.', u'Place the beef on the hot baking sheet (a little of the sour cream mixture sticking to the beef is fine). Sprinkle the peppers and corn over top and season with salt and pepper. Roast until the beef is medium rare and the peppers are slightly tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and keep warm.', u'Combine the cilantro and onions in a bowl. Warm the tortillas over a burner or in the oven.', u'Divide the beef and corn mixture among the tortillas, followed by the cilantro and onion mixture, jalapenos and cheese. Drizzle with the remaining sour cream mixture and serve with a lime wedge on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sour cream', u'2 tablespoons lime juice plus 1 lime, cut into wedges, for garnish', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'12 ounces skirt steak, sliced into 1/2-inch-wide strips', u'2 cups diced red bell pepper', u'1/2 cup corn kernels', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'2 cups fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 cup very thinly sliced Spanish onions', u' Six 6-inch white flour tortillas', u'1 jalapeno, seeded and julienned', u'1 cup grated cotija cheese']
title: Mexican "Street Corn" Fajitas Cheat Sheet

author: Ingrid Hoffmann
directions: [u'If using fresh corn, scrape kernels from cobs using small sharp knife or spoon. Place half of the corn kernels in blender with tomatoes, 2 cups of broth, and oregano. Puree until smooth. Set aside.', u'In a large saucepan over medium heat, cook bacon, turning once until brown and crisp, about 10 minutes. Remove bacon to a paper towel lined plate to drain. Set aside. Add onion to bacon fat in saucepan and cook, stirring frequently until onion is soft and translucent. Add garlic and stir for another minute.', u'Add tomato-corn puree to saucepan with remaining 2 cups of broth. Bring to a low boil and add remaining whole corn kernels. Simmer over medium-low heat until thickened, about 20 minutes. Stir occasionally and remove any foam as it develops with a large flat metal spoon. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Mix in half of the parsley and cream, if desired, and heat through.To serve, garnished with  crumbled bacon, remaining parsley, crumbled cheese and tortilla chips or strips.']
ingredients: [u'4 ears fresh or 3 cups frozen, thawed corn kernels', u'2 medium tomatoes, roughly chopped', u'2 cups chicken broth', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'4 slices thick cut bacon', u'1/2 onion, chopped (about 1 cup)', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u' Coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup heavy cream, optional', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u"1/2 cup queso fresco, fresh farmer's cheese, feta cheese, or sour cream, optional", u' Tortilla chips or fried tortilla strips, optional']
title: Mexican Corn Soup

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Grease an 8 by 8-inch or 9 by 9-inch square pan with softened butter or nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.', u'In a large bowl, mix together cornmeal, flour, baking powder, milk, eggs, salt, and oil. Stir in onion and creamed corn. Pour half of batter into prepared pan. Top with cheese and peppers, spreading onto batter. Pour remaining batter on top of cheese and peppers. Bake for about 35 minutes or until golden on top and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool slightly before cutting into squares.']
ingredients: [u' Butter or non-stick cooking spray, for greasing pan', u'1 cup all-purpose cornmeal', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons baking powder', u'2/3 cup milk', u'2 eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'1 (14-ounce) can creamed corn', u'1 cup grated Cheddar', u'1 cup chopped jalepeno peppers']
title: Layered Mexican Cornbread

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown the chorizo, crumbling the meat as it cooks. Add the garlic, onions and peppers and cook until softened, 5 minutes. Stir in the coriander, cumin and tomatoes, followed by the turkey, stock, chipotles, cornmeal and honey. Simmer over low heat to thicken, 45 minutes. Top with the chips, and serve with a lime wedge alongside.', u"Cook's Note: Cool and store for a make-ahead meal, reheating over medium heat."]
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable or olive oil', u'1 pound Mexican chorizo, cut from casings', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 onion, chopped', u'1 red or green bell pepper, chopped', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander (a palmful)', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin (a scant palmful)', u' One 15-ounce can diced tomatoes', u'1 pound cooked, diced turkey breast', u'2 to 3 cups chicken stock', u'2 tablespoons pureed chipotles in adobo', u'2 tablespoons cornmeal or quick-cooking polenta', u'1 tablespoon honey', u' Chili-flavored tortilla chips or Fritos, for topping', u' Lime wedges, for serving']
title: Mexican Chorizo and Turkey Chili

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the fish in a shallow dish and season with salt and pepper. Add the lime juice and toss; set aside. Put the potatoes in a saucepan, cover with water and season with salt. Bring to a boil; add the corn and cook, covered, until the vegetables are tender, about 8 minutes. Reserve 1 cup of the cooking water, then drain.', u'Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add all but 1/3 cup of the chopped onion to the skillet along with the thyme and cook until soft, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic, chile powder and half of the cilantro and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly reduced, about 4 minutes. Add the potatoes, corn and reserved cooking water.', u'Add the fish and lime marinade to the skillet and simmer, spooning the sauce over the fish, until cooked through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the stew among bowls and top with the remaining onion and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'4 6 -ounce tilapia fillets, each cut into 4 pieces', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'3 limes (2 juiced, 1 cut into wedges)', u'1/2 pound new potatoes, thickly sliced', u'4 small pieces frozen corn on the cob', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 large onion, finely chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon ancho or New Mexico chile powder', u'1 bunch cilantro, leaves and tender stems coarsely chopped', u'1 15 -ounce can no-salt-added diced fire-roasted tomatoes']
title: Mexican Fish Stew

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Coat an 11 by 7-inch baking pan with cooking spray.', u'In a large bowl, combine chicken, sour cream, 3/4 cup of the Monterey Jack cheese, 3/4 cup of the Cheddar, salsa, chiles, cilantro, chili powder, and cayenne pepper. Mix well and set aside.', u'Arrange half of the tortilla pieces in the bottom of prepared pan, overlapping pieces slightly to cover the surface. Top with half of the chicken mixture and smooth over with the back of a spoon to even the top. Layer remaining tortillas over top, and spoon over remaining chicken mixture. Top with remaining 1/4 cup each of Monterey Jack and cheddar cheeses.', u'Cover with foil and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 30 more minutes, until top is golden and bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.', u'To reheat, bake in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 15 minutes.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'12 ounces cooked chicken, cut into 1-inch cubes (about 3 cups)', u'1 cup sour cream (regular or low-fat)', u'1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese (regular or low-fat), divided', u'1 cup shredded Cheddar (regular or low-fat), divided', u'1/2 cup mild, medium or hot salsa', u'1 (4-ounce) can chopped green chiles', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 teaspoon ground chili powder', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', u'8 (6-inch) corn tortillas, cut into 6 wedges']
title: Mexican Lasagna

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until they soften, about 3 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook for 2 minutes more.', u'Put half of the onion mixture into a food processor with the black beans, chipotle pepper, 2 tablespoons of the lime juice, cumin, water and salt. Puree until smooth. Set aside.', u'Add the corn to the skillet with the remaining onion mixture and cook for about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro leaves.', u'In a small bowl mash the avocado with the remaining lime juice. In a medium bowl toss together the tomatoes, scallion and jalapeno, if using. Season tomato mixture with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Spread the black bean dip into the bottom of an 8 by 8 glass baking or serving dish. Top with the corn mixture, spreading it out to form a single layer over the beans, repeat with the avocado, then the tomatoes. Top with cheese. Serve with baked chips.', u'Per Serving:', u'Calories 140; Total Fat 8 g; (Sat Fat 2 g, Mono Fat 3 g, Poly Fat 0.7 g) ; Protein 5g; Carb 16 g; Fiber 5g; Cholesterol 6mg; Sodium 245 mg']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 (15.5-ounce) can black beans, preferably low-sodium, drained and rinsed', u'1 tablespoon minced chipotle pepper in adobo', u'4 tablespoons lime juice', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups corn kernels (10-ounce box frozen corn)', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u'2 ripe avocados', u'4 medium tomatoes, seeded and diced (about 2 cups)', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced scallion', u'1 tablespoon finely diced jalapeno pepper, optional', u'3/4 cup shredded extra-sharp Cheddar']
title: Five Layer Mexican Dip

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In small saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a boil over medium high-heat. Simmer until the sugar has dissolved completely. Set aside to cool.', u'Put the chile-lime powder on a small plate.  Using the lime wedge, moisten the rims of the martini glasses.  Invert the martini glasses into the chile-lime powder, to coat the rims.', u'In a blender, combine the simple syrup, cucumber, water, and lime juice until smooth. Strain the mixture into a pitcher. Add the vodka and mix well. Fill a martini shaker with ice and add about 1 cup of the prepared cucumber mixture. Shake well and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup water', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1/2 lime, cut into wedges', u' Chile-lime powder (recommended: Tajin, or salt)', u'2 cucumbers, peeled, thinly sliced', u'4 cups water', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup vodka', u' Ice']
title: Mexican Cucumber Martinis

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Set up the grill for direct cooking over medium heat. Oil the grate when ready to start cooking.', u'In a small bowl, stir to combine the sour cream and salsa; set aside.', u'Brown the ground beef in a skillet. Set aside to cool.', u'Lay out 2 wraps or tortillas. Divide the cheese and sprinkle over wraps. Top with remaining wraps; set aside. In a microwave-safe bowl, cook beans on high setting for 4 to 6 minutes in the microwave, or until done. Place the cheese-filled wraps on the hot oiled grill and cook for 2 minutes; turn over. Divide the black beans and spread on top of the wrap. Top with the reserved cooked beef and diced onions. Close the grill and cook for 2 more minutes.', u'Remove the pizzas from grill and top with lettuce, tomatoes, and drizzle with the sour cream salsa mixture. Serve hot, garnished with nacho rings.', u'INDOOR: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Complete above steps through microwaving the beans. In a skillet large enough to fit the wraps, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium heat. When the oil is hot, carefully fry both sides of wraps for 1 to 2 minutes, or until golden brown, turning with a large spatula. Transfer wraps to a baking sheet. Spread each wrap with the heated black beans and top with reserved ground beef and diced onions. Place in oven and bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and garnish as directed.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup sour cream', u'1/4 cup salsa (recommended: Pace)', u'1 1/4 pounds ground beef', u'4 garlic-herb wraps (recommended: Mission), or any large tortilla', u'2 cups shredded Mexican blend cheese (recommended: Kraft)', u'1 (16-ounce) can refried black beans (recommended: Rosarita)', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u'2 cups lettuce, shredded', u'1 tomato, diced', u' Nacho rings, for garnish']
title: Mexican Pizza

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the milk and sugar in a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer.  Off the heat, stir in the chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper with a wooden spoon and allow to steep for 3 minutes.  Reheat the hot chocolate over low heat until it simmers.', u'Strain the chocolate into a measuring cup and pour into mugs.  Stir with cinnamon sticks, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups whole milk', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'4 1/2 ounces bittersweet chocolate, such a Lindt, chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Smallest pinch cayenne pepper', u' Long cinnamon sticks for stirrers, optional']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.', u'\xa0', u"Using an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugar at low speed until it is smooth. Beat in the vanilla. At low speed gradually add the flour. Mix in the pecans with a spatula. With floured hands, take out about 1 tablespoon of dough and shape into a crescent. Continue to dust hands with flour as you make more cookies. Place onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 40 minutes. When cool enough to handle but still warm, roll in additional confectioners' sugar. Cool on wire racks."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup confectioners\u2019 sugar, plus more for coating baked cookies', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting hands', u'1 cup pecans, chopped into very small pieces', u' \xa0']
title: Mexican Wedding Cookies

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Butter an 8 by 8 by 2-inch glass baking dish. Set aside.', u'Place the bread cubes in the prepared baking dish. Bring the milk to a simmer in a large heavy saucepan. Remove from the heat. Add the chocolate and whisk until melted and smooth.', u'Using an electric hand mixer, beat the sugar, eggs, and egg yolks in a medium bowl until blended. Gradually whisk the chocolate mixture into the egg mixture. Add the raisins and cinnamon. Pour the custard over the bread. Let the mixture stand for 1 hour (some custard will not be absorbed). Can be prepared and refrigerated for up to 2 hours ahead.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Bake until just set and the center moves slightly when the dish is shaken, about 45 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, for greasing', u'5 cups (1-inch) bread cubes, preferably 1 day old (from about 3 bolillo rolls or 3/4 of a loaf of French bread)', u'2 3/4 cups whole milk', u'2 (3.1-ounce) discs Mexican chocolate,* chopped (recommended: Ibarra)', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'2 whole eggs', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1/3 cup raisins', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u' Powdered sugar, for dusting', u' * can be found in Hispanic or gourmet grocery stores']
title: Mexican Chocolate Bread Pudding

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a large heavy saucepan, heat the vegetable oil on medium-high heat. Add the rice, onions and garlic. Saute until the rice has an opaque color and is fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth, tomato paste and salt. Mix well to incorporate evenly. Then add in the chile and cilantro sprig. Cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until rice is ready, about 30 minutes. Fluff with a fork and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 cup long grain white rice', u'1/3 cup finely chopped white onion', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'2 1/4 cups chicken broth', u'3 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 serrano chile', u'1 fresh cilantro sprig']
title: Mexican Red Rice (Arroz Rojo)

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.', u'Season the pork shoulder with salt, pepper, fennel and cumin. Take a large roasting dish and place over medium-high heat. Add a 3-count of olive oil and sear pork shoulder all over until golden brown on the outside, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Add vegetables, spreading out tomatillos, poblanos, onion, garlic and bay leaf around the seared pork shoulder. Drizzle with olive oil, squeeze lime juice all over and season with salt and pepper. Cover the whole tray with aluminum foil and roast in the oven for 2 to 2 1/2 hours until the pork is falling apart. Remove from oven, set the pork aside and pull apart. Rake all the other ingredients into a blender (a bit at a time) with the bunch of fresh cilantro and process until smooth. Pour into a large Dutch oven. Set over medium heat and add chicken stock. Bring to a simmer and whisk in masa harina to thicken the sauce up. Fold in shredded pork shoulder and season with salt and pepper to finish. Serve with Chili bar toppings.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds boneless pork shoulder', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon toasted fennel seeds, ground', u'3 tablespoons ground cumin', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'15 whole tomatillos, husked', u'3 poblanos', u'2 white onions, quartered', u'4 garlic cloves, peeled', u'1 bay leaf', u'2 limes, halved', u'1 big bunch fresh cilantro', u'1 quart low-sodium chicken stock', u'1 cup masa harina, to tighten it up', u' Crispy fried tortilla strips, fresh corn tortillas cut into strips and deep fried in vegetable oil', u' Mexican crema, store-bought with lime zest', u' Shaved radishes, radishes shaved vertically on a mandoline', u' Crumbled queso fresco', u'2 limes, each cut into 8 wedges']
title: Mexican Pork Chili

directions: [u'Peel the shrimp and set aside, reserving the shrimp shells.', u'In a large saucepan, bring the water to a boil over medium heat. Add the shrimp shells and reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool the shrimp stock, and strain. Discard the shells.', u'In a large saucepan, bring 3 1/2 cups shrimp stock and 1/2 teaspoon salt to boil over medium heat. Add the grits, stirring well. Add the butter and stir until melted. Cover, and reduce the heat to low. Cook until thickened, stirring occasionally, about 15 to 20 minutes. Add the Velveeta, and stir until melted. Set aside and keep warm. ', u'In a large skillet over medium heat, add the chorizo and cook until browned and crumbly, about 5 minutes. Remove the chorizo, to a plate or bowl, leaving the drippings in the skillet. Add up to 3 tablespoons olive oil, if necessary. Put the skillet over medium heat, and add the onion. Cook for 4 minutes, then add the red pepper and jalapeno, and cook, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes. Sprinkle with the flour, stirring constantly for 3 minutes. Gradually add 2 cups of shrimp stock, stirring to scrape the bottom of the skillet and to prevent lumps. Stir in the cooked chorizo, and increase the heat to medium-high. Bring the mixture to a boil, and cook until slightly thickened. Add the shrimp, and cook until they turn pink, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat, then add the cream and lime juice. Stir in the green onion, cilantro and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Transfer the grits to a serving platter and spoon the shrimp mixture over the top. Garnish with green onion and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound medium fresh shrimp, shells left on', u'6 cups water', u'1 teaspoon salt, divided', u'3/4 cup white grits', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'6 ounces pepper jack Velveeta cheese, cubed', u'1/2 pound chorizo sausage, casings removed', u'3 tablespoons olive oil, optional', u'1 1/2 cups chopped Vidalia onion', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped into 3/4-inch pieces', u'1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream', u'1 teaspoon fresh lime juice', u'2 green onions, chopped, plus more for garnish', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Shrimp and Grits

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Mix all of the ingredients together in a large bowl. Pour the mixture into a greased iron skillet and cook for 10 to 15 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups self-rising cornmeal', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'1 (8-ounce) container sour cream', u'1 (8 1/2-ounce) can creamed corn', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'1 egg', u'1 jalapeno pepper, chopped']
title: Dallas' Mexican Cornbread

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350. Mix the meat, tortilla chips, egg, chopped cilantro, 1/4 cup scallions, minced garlic, 1 teaspoon chili power, 1 teaspoon cumin, and salt to taste in a bowl. Roll into 16 small meatballs.', u'Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the meatballs and lightly brown, turning as needed, about 5 minutes. Add the smashed garlic and the remaining 2 teaspoons chili powder and 1 teaspoon cumin; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes, cilantro sprigs and 1 1/2 cups water and season with salt. Bring to a simmer, then cover, reduce the heat to low and cook until the sauce thickens and the meatballs are tender, about 15 minutes.', u'About 5 minutes before the meatballs are done, toast the rolls in the oven. Place 2 roll halves in each of 4 shallow bowls and top with 4 meatballs. Drizzle with sauce, then pour the remaining sauce into the bowls. Top with avocado, cheese and/or scallions, if desired.', u'Per serving: Calories 499; Fat 22 g (Saturated 7 g); Cholesterol 127 mg; Sodium 794 mg; Carbohydrate 43 g; Fiber 5 g; Protein 31 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 pound meatloaf mix (ground beef, pork and veal)', u'1/4 cup finely crushed tortilla chips', u'1 large egg, beaten', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus 3 sprigs', u'1/4 cup finely chopped scallions, plus more for garnish (optional)', u'3 cloves garlic; 1 minced, 2 smashed', u'3 teaspoons ancho chili powder', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 cups canned fire-roasted diced tomatoes', u'4 crusty sub rolls, halved and split open', u' Diced avocado and crumbled Mexican cheese, for garnish (optional)']
title: Mexican Meatball Subs

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F, slipping in a cookie sheet at the same time.', u'For the sauce: Heat the oil in a saucepan on the stove and fry the onion, bell pepper and chiles. Add the salt and cook gently for 15 minutes, and once soft, add the chopped cilantro stalks.', u'Add the canned tomatoes then rinse the cans out with water and add this too. Spoon in the ketchup and let things come to a simmer, leaving the sauce (or salsa in keeping with the Mexican mojo) to cook while you get on with preparing the filling- about 10 minutes.', u'For the filling: Mix the drained beans and canned corn in a bowl. Add most of the grated cheese, reserving some to sprinkle on the top at the end, and mix together.', u'Start to assemble the lasagne by spooning about a third of the salsa into the bottom of your ovenproof dish and smear it about, then layer on 2 tortillas so that they cover the sauce overlapping slightly, like a Venn diagram.', u'Add a third of the beans and cheese mixture covering the tortillas, and then about a quarter of the remaining salsa and another 2 tortillas.', u'Repeat with another third of beans and cheese, and more salsa before layering on another 2 tortillas.', u'Finally, add the last layer of beans and cheese, nearly all of the remaining salsa and cover with the last 2 tortillas. Spread the very last bit of salsa over the tortillas and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.', u'Bake for 30 minutes, and let it rest for a good 10 to 15 minutes before slicing like a pizza, and eat with the avocado salsa.', u'Make Ahead Note: The lasagne can be assembled 1 day ahead. Cool the tomato salsa before assembling. Cover dish tightly with plastic and refrigerate until needed. Bake as directed in recipe, allowing an extra 5 to 10 minutes baking time and checking the lasagne is piping hot in centre before removing from oven.', u'Freeze Note:  The assembled but uncooked lasagne can be frozen for up to 3 months. Wrap dish tightly in double layer of plastic and a layer of aluminium foil. Thaw overnight in fridge and cook as above.', u'Further Note: Leftovers should be covered and refrigerated as soon as possible. To reheat, put individual slices in ovenproof dish, cover with foil and reheat in oven preheated to 350 degrees F for 15 to 20 minutes. Check the lasagne is piping hot before serving. Wedges of leftover lasagne can be frozen for up to 2 months, tightly wrapped in plastic wrap and then either in foil or in resealable bag. Thaw overnight in refrigerator and reheat as above.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon garlic flavoured oil', u'1 onion, peeled and chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'2 green chiles, chopped, with seeds', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt or 1/2 teaspoon table salt', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro stalks', u'2 (14-ounce) cans diced tomatoes, plus 1 2/3 cups water to rinse out empty cans', u'1 tablespoon ketchup', u'2 (15-ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed', u'3 1/4 cups drained canned corn, from about 1 1/2 (15-ounce cans)', u'2 1/2 cups grated mature goats Cheddar, or cheese of your choice', u'8 soft flour tortillas (approximately 10-inch diameter)', u'1 round ovenproof dish, approximately 10 inches diameter and 2 1/4 inches deep', u' Avocado Salsa, for serving, recipe follows', u'2 avocados', u'1 scallion, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons chopped green jalepenos from a jar or can', u' Salt', u'1 tablespoon lime juice', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Mexican Lasagne

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, cinnamon and salt and set aside. In another bowl, add the buttermilk, baking soda, vanilla and eggs. Mix with a fork and set aside.', u'In a medium saucepan, melt the butter. Add the cocoa and whisk to combine. Pour the boiling water into the melted butter mixture in the pan. Allow to bubble for a moment, then turn off the heat. Pour the chocolate mixture into the flour mixture. Stir together for a moment to cool the chocolate, then pour in the egg mixture. Stir together until smooth.', u'Pour the batter into 4 ovensafe 6-inch skillets (unbuttered) and bake until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean, about 20 minutes.', u'Drizzle the cakes with Cinnamon Hot Fudge Sauce and top with scoops of vanilla ice cream, a dollop of whipped cream and a cherry.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'2 cups sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 cup buttermilk', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'2 large eggs', u'2 sticks (1 cup) salted butter', u'4 heaping tablespoons cocoa powder', u'1 cup boiling water', u' Cinnamon Hot Fudge Sauce, recipe follows', u' Vanilla ice cream, for serving', u' Whipped cream, for serving', u' Cherries, for topping', u'2 cups sugar', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'2 cups cocoa powder', u'2 sticks (1 cup) salted butter', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon']
title: Mexican Chocolate Sundae

author: Jamie Deen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u"Heat the olive oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the garlic and onions and saute until soft, about 3 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook, while stirring, to toast. Add the tomato paste, chili powder, smoked paprika and salt and pepper to taste, and stir until it's well blended with the rice. Add the chicken stock and the black beans and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover with a lid and cook on low until the rice is tender and the chicken stock is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the rice steam, covered, for 5 minutes.", u'Remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork. Sprinkle the cheese on top and bake until the cheese is melted, about 10 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 onion, finely chopped', u'1 cup long grain white rice', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon smoked paprika', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 3/4 cup chicken stock', u' One 15-ounce can black beans, rinsed and drained', u'1 cup grated sharp Cheddar']
title: Cheesy Mexican Skillet Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"Bring 1/4 cup light corn syrup, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 cup confectioners' sugar, 1 cup mini marshmallows, 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon each nutmeg and cayenne pepper, and 1 tablespoon water to a boil in a large pot over medium heat, stirring. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla and a pinch of salt. Remove from the heat; using a rubber spatula, stir in 12 cups popcorn and 1 more cup mini marshmallows. Butter your hands, then shape into balls and roll in cinnamon sugar.", u'Photograph by Kang Kim']
title: Mexican Chocolate Popcorn Balls

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Position the oven rack at the lowest level. If you have a pizza stone, place it in the oven on the rack. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u"Heat the oil in a small saucepan and cook the mushrooms and green pepper over medium heat until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Cut the crusts into biscuit sized pieces using a biscuit cutter. Distribute the vegetables evenly over the crusts. Reserve 1 cup of the salsa and spoon the remaining salsa evenly over the pizzas. If you don't have a pizza stone, place the pizzas on a baking sheet. They won't be as crisp as they would be if you placed them directly on the rack, but this is a lot less messy.", u'Bake the pizzas for 10 to 12 minutes, then sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 7 minutes more. Serve the pizza slices topped with the reserved salsa, olives, cooked ham, shredded lettuce, and sour cream.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'3/4 cup sliced fresh mushrooms', u'3/4 cup chopped green bell pepper', u'2 (12-inch) pizza crusts or frozen cheese pizzas', u'2 (16-ounce) jars chunky salsa', u'2 (8-ounce) packages shredded Mexican cheese (Monterey Jack, Cheddar, and other mild cheeses combined)', u'1 (2 1/4-ounce) can sliced black olives', u'1 cup chopped cooked ham', u' Shredded lettuce', u' Sour cream']
title: Mexican Pizza

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u'For the spice blend: Combine the salt, brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, mustard seeds, coriander, cumin, ginger, oregano, cayenne and cinnamon.', u'For the braised beef: Bring the brisket to room temperature. Sprinkle with black pepper, then rub some of the spice blend onto the meat. Reserve 2 tablespoons spice blend for another use, such as Black Bean and Beef Chilaquiles with Fried Eggs. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high to high heat. Add the brisket and cook until browned. Transfer to a plate. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, the garlic, celery, carrots and onions and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Stir in the chipotle puree and tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the beer and cook for 1 minute more. Add the stock and tomato puree and bring to a low boil. Add the brisket, cover and braise in the oven until very tender, 2 1/2 to 3 hours.', u'Meanwhile, bake 12 drop biscuits according to the package instructions.', u'Transfer the brisket to a cutting board. Puree the sauce with an immersion blender or in a food processor. Slice the brisket. Reserve 1 1/2 pounds brisket for another use if desired, such as Black Bean and Beef Chilaquiles with Fried Eggs. Return the brisket to the sauce, stirring gently to coat.', u'For the apple-cabbage slaw: Whisk together the oil, vinegar, sugar and lime juice in a large bowl. Add the apples, cabbage and onions, season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Top with the cilantro.', u'Divide the beef and sauce among plates and serve with the biscuits and slaw.', u"Cook's Note: The beef can be refrigerated in the pureed sauce for a make-ahead meal. Reheat over medium heat, stirring gently. The slaw can be refrigerated until ready to serve."]
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'1/4 cup packed light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons sweet or smoked sweet paprika', u'1 tablespoon garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon mustard seeds', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons ground ginger', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 beef brisket (5 to 6 pounds), trimmed so that there is no more than 1/8-inch fat on top', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup olive or vegetable oil', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 to 3 stalks celery, chopped', u'2 carrots, chopped', u'1 large or 2 medium onions, chopped', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons pureed seeded chipotle in adobo', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 bottle Mexican beer, such as Negra Modelo', u'2 cups beef stock', u' One 32-ounce can tomato puree', u'1 package buttermilk biscuit mix', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'2 tablespoons superfine sugar or 3 tablespoons honey', u' Juice of 2 limes', u'1 green apple, peeled and grated', u'1 small red cabbage, finely shredded', u'1 red onion, grated', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Mexican Brisket and Biscuits

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 450 degrees F. Whisk 1/4 cup vinegar, 1 tablespoon sugar and the chili powder in a shallow microwave-safe dish. Add the onions, separating them into rings. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave until crisp-tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Toss to coat the onions with the liquid, then let cool.', u'Meanwhile, whisk 1/3 cup mayonnaise, the cilantro and the remaining 2 tablespoons vinegar and 1 tablespoon sugar in a large bowl. Add the cabbage, jalapenos, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste and toss. Refrigerate the slaw until ready to serve.', u'Whisk the remaining 2/3 cup mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon liquid from the pickled onions in a shallow dish. Put the crushed chips in another dish. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Dip the chicken in the mayonnaise mixture and then in the chips; place on the baking sheet. Mist the chicken with cooking spray. Bake until crisp and cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. Serve with the slaw and onions.', u'Per serving: Calories 771; Fat 41 g (Saturated 8 g); Cholesterol 103 mg; Sodium 1,079 mg; Carbohydrate 62 g; Fiber 6 g; Protein 39 g']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2 medium red onions, sliced into 1/4-inch-thick rounds', u'1 cup reduced-fat mayonnaise', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/2 small head cabbage, shredded (about 4 cups)', u'2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 9 -ounce bag low-sodium tortilla chips, finely crushed', u' Cooking spray', u'1 1/4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch strips']
title: Mexican Chicken Tenders

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Sprinkle the zucchini slices all over with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Set aside. Stir together the beans, pico de gallo and oregano in a medium bowl.', u'Arrange the following in layers in a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan or 10-inch round microwave-safe dish: 4 of the tortilla halves, one-third of the bean mixture, one-third of the zucchini and 1/4 cup of the cheese. Repeat twice, while packing down the layers. Sprinkle with additional salt and the remaining 1/4 cup cheese.', u'Microwave on high until the zucchini is fully cooked, about 10 minutes. Remove from the microwave and loosely cover with foil to finish the cooking process, about 5 minutes.
