(Alternatively, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F, cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and cook until heated through and the cheese is melted, 15 to 20 minutes.)', u'Sprinkle with the cilantro, slice into 4 wedges and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 medium zucchini (about 8 ounces), thinly sliced on the diagonal', u' Kosher salt', u' One 15-ounce can pinto beans, drained and rinsed', u'1 cup prepared pico de gallo or home-style fresh salsa', u'1 tablespoon fresh whole oregano leaves', u' Six 6-inch corn tortillas, halved', u'1 cup shredded Monterey Jack or Chihuahua cheese', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Mexican Layered Bean Casserole

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Toss 1 head shredded cabbage and 1 bunch thinly sliced radishes with 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt and the juice of 1/2 lime; let sit 15 minutes. Just before serving, toss with 1 small bunch chopped cilantro and 1 to 2 thinly sliced jalapenos.', u'Photograph by Anna Williams']
title: Mexican Radish Slaw

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'Heat the oil a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and saute until tender and translucent. Add the rice, chicken broth and the sazon packet and stir until the rice is coated with the oil and toasted. Stir in the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Reduce the heat to low and cover with a lid. Cook until the rice is tender and all of the liquid is absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the lid and fluff with fork. Gently fold in cilantro and transfer to a serving bowl.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large yellow onion, diced', u'4 garlic cloves, chopped', u'2 cups long-grain white rice', u'4 cups chicken broth', u'1 packet sazon seasoning with coriander and annatto (recommended: Goya)', u'2 small plum tomatoes, diced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Gina's Mexican Rice

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u"Cook's Note: To roast the chile peppers, broil, turning occasionally with tongs and leaving the oven door ajar to allow steam to escape, until the skins are blackened all over. Transfer to a bowl, cover and let cool. Peel, seed and chop.", u'Heat a drizzle of EVOO in a skillet. Add the chorizo and cook, crumbling with a wooden spoon, until browned. Drain off the fat.', u'Arrange the bread in a casserole dish. Top with the chorizo and then the roasted chiles.', u'Whisk together the milk, butter, hot sauce and eggs in a bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper; pour over the chiles. Top with the cheese. Cover and refrigerate at least overnight and up to 2 days.', u'To serve, bring the strata to room temperature and preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Bake the strata for 1 hour.', u'Meanwhile, whizz together the sour cream, avocado and lime juice in a food processor and season with salt and pepper.', u'Top the strata with tomatoes, cilantro and dollops of the avocado sour cream.']
ingredients: [u' EVOO or vegetable oil', u'1 pound fresh Mexican chorizo or other spicy bulk sausage', u'7 to 8 slices (1-inch thick) good-quality stale white or egg-based bread, cut into large cubes', u'3 roasted green New Mexico chile peppers or 2 poblano or Anaheim peppers, peeled, seeded and chopped, or two 4-ounce cans chopped green chilies, well drained', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1 stick (8 tablespoons) butter, melted and cooled', u'1 tablespoon hot sauce', u'6 large organic eggs', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 1/2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1 ripe avocado, pitted and peeled', u' Juice of 1 lime', u' Diced ripe heirloom tomato, for serving', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, torn, for serving']
title: Mexican Chorizo Strata

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a 4-quart saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion, jalapeno pepper, and garlic and cook stirring frequently, for 3 minutes. Stir in the beer and cook until the liquid is reduced by half.  Stir in the cream, cream cheese, and processed cheese, whisking until melted and smooth.', u'Stir in crabmeat, lime juice, green onion, cilantro, and chili powder and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the salt, black pepper, cayenne, and cumin. Transfer the dip to a serving bowl and garnish with sliced jalapeno pepper, if desired. Serve hot with tortilla chips.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1/2 cup finely chopped onion', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons seeded and chopped jalapeno pepper, plus slices for garnish, optional', u'1/2 cup light beer', u'2 cups heavy whipping cream', u'1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese', u'1 (8-ounce) block pasteurized prepared cheese product', u'1 pound lump crabmeat, drained and picked for shells', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice, (about 2 limes)', u'1/4 cup minced green onion', u'1/4 cup minced fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u' Pinch freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u' Tortilla chips, for serving, recipe follows', u' Oil', u'6 (10-inch) flour tortillas', u' Salt']
title: Warm Mexican Crab Dip

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u"Combine the milk, half-and-half and 2 of the cinnamon sticks in a small saucepan. Warm over medium-low heat, then stir in the chocolate discs. Stir until melted (though there will still be lovely particles of chocolate throughout). If it's too chocolatey for you, splash in a little more milk. If it's not quite sweet enough for you, add 1 teaspoon sugar.", u'Serve in mugs topped with toasted marshmallows, and place a cinnamon stick in each mug.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups milk, plus more if needed', u'1 cup half-and-half', u'8 cinnamon sticks', u'2 discs Mexican chocolate, such as Abuelita', u'1 teaspoon sugar, optional', u' Toasted marshmallows, for serving']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the chorizo and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 4 minutes. Remove the chorizo to a plate with a slotted spoon. Transfer all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings to a small bowl; stir the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil into the bowl (reserve the skillet). Divide the tortillas between 2 baking sheets and brush the tops with the drippings mixture. Bake until the tortillas are crisp and lightly golden, about 5 minutes.', u'Heat the skillet with the reserved 1 tablespoon drippings over medium-high heat. Add the refried beans and cook, stirring, until warm and spreadable, about 2 minutes. Spread the beans over the tortillas and sprinkle with the chorizo and cheese. Bake until the cheese melts, about 5 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, combine the lettuce, cilantro, radishes, jalapeno and lime juice in a large bowl; season with salt and toss. Top each tortilla with the salad, avocado and crema.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'8 ounces fresh chorizo, casings removed, crumbled', u'4 8 -inch flour tortillas', u'1 16 -ounce can refried beans', u'1 cup shredded Oaxaca or mozzarella cheese (about 4 ounces)', u'3 ounces mache lettuce or arugula', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro', u'3 radishes, thinly sliced', u'1 red jalapeno pepper, sliced (remove seeds for less heat) Juice of 1 lime Kosher salt', u'1 avocado, diced', u'1/3 cup Mexican crema or sour cream']
title: Mexican Tortilla Pizzas with Chorizo

directions: [u'Boil the black beans in water with  onions, 1/2 cup green peppers,  chipotle peppers, salt and pepper.   Add additional water if needed.   Cook beans until slightly tender,  then add the 1/4 cup green pepper  and remaining ingredients and  simmer approximately 45 minutes to  1 hour.  Add water as necessary for  consistency.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds black beans, dry', u'2 quarts water', u'1 1/2 cups onions, chopped', u'1/2 cup green pepper, chopped plus 1/4 cup green pepper, chopped', u'2 tablespoons chipotle chili pepper', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 quart chili sauce', u'1/4 cup red pepper, chopped', u'1/2 cup tomatoes, diced', u'3 tablespoons chili powder', u'1 tablespoon cumin', u'1 teaspoon lime juice', u'2 bunches cilantro, chopped', u'3 cups water or vegetable stock']
title: Mexican Black Bean Chili

author: Aida Mollenkamp
directions: [u'Combine chocolate, cinnamon, and oil in a medium heatproof bowl and set over a pot of simmering water. Stir until mixture is evenly melted and smooth, about 5 minutes. Set aside to slightly cool and thicken, about 3 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, parchment paper, or a silicone baking mat and insert sticks lengthwise into the center of each banana. Place toasted coconut in a shallow plate.', u'When chocolate is ready, tilt the bowl, and, working one at a time, dip the bananas evenly into the chocolate mixture. Tilt and turn to coat the banana evenly. Tilt banana so excess chocolate can drip back into the bowl.', u'When chocolate is just set, roll banana in the toasted coconut and transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Repeat to coat all the bananas. Place bananas in freezer to set up, at least 20 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'9 ounces semisweet chocolate, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'6 medium bananas, peeled and halved crosswise', u'2 cups toasted flaked coconut', u' Special Equipment: 12 craft or wooden pop sticks']
title: Mexican Chocolate Frozen Bananas

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Cake: Position a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Liberally butter and flour a 10-inch tube or Bundt pan.\t', u'Sift the flour, baking powder and salt into a large bowl.  In another large bowl, using an electric mixer beat the 1 /12 cups of butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, beating well after each addition. In batches, add the flour mixture, alternating with the buttermilk and ending with the flour mixture. ', u'Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan. Bake until the cake is golden and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 to 50 minutes. Transfer the cake to a wire rack and cool completely in the pan. Invert the cake onto the wire rack, then put it on a cake plate or platter. (Cooks Note: The cake can be prepared 1 day ahead.  Cover tightly with plastic wrap and store at room temperature.)', u'Topping: Combine the mango, water, sugar cream cheese and tequila, if using, in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth and thick, adding extra water, if needed. Taste and adjust the sweetness with extra sugar, if needed.', u'Spoon the mango topping evenly over the top of the cake and decorate with edible flowers, if desired', u'Cut into slices and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups or 3 sticks unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more for greasing the pan', u'3 cups cake flour, plus more for pan', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'6 large eggs', u'2 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 1/2 cups granulated sugar', u'2/3 cup buttermilk', u'2 cups chopped fresh or frozen and thawed mango', u'2 tablespoons water, plus extra, as needed', u'1 1/4 cup granulated sugar, plus extra, as needed', u'4 ounces cream cheese', u'2 tablespoons tequila, optional', u' Edible flowers as garnish, optional']
title: Mexican Mango Cake

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'For the crust: Spray a 9-inch pie dish with cooking spray.', u'Blend the cookie crumbs, butter and brown sugar in a food processor until the crumbs are moist. Press the crumb mixture into the bottom and up the sides of the prepared pie dish. Cover the crust and freeze while preparing the filling. (Can be made 1 week ahead. Keep frozen.)', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'For the filling: Combine the butter, brown sugar and corn syrup in a heavy medium saucepan. Bring to boil, stirring often. Boil 1 minute. Stir in the pecans and crema. Boil until the mixture thickens slightly, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the chocolate and stir until the chocolate melts and the mixture is well blended.', u'Pour the hot filling into the crust. Using a spoon, evenly distribute the nuts. Bake until the filling bubbles all over, about 10 minutes. Transfer the pie to a rack and cool completely before serving.']
ingredients: [u' Nonstick cooking spray, for spraying the pie dish', u'1 1/2 cups graham cracker or Maria cookie crumbs (about 6.5 ounces)', u'7 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup packed light brown sugar', u'6 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'3 cups pecan halves (about 10 ounces)', u'1/4 cup Mexican crema or whipping cream', u'1 disk Mexican chocolate, such as Ibarra, finely minced (about 3.1 ounces)']
title: Mexican Chocolate Pecan Pie

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a small, dry skillet, toast the cumin seeds, coriander seeds, chile, and pine nuts over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Transfer the dressing to a serving bowl and whisk in the olive oil.  Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Add the olives, tomatoes, cilantro and cheese. Toss gently to combine and serve.', u'*Cooks Note: The dried chile can also be cut into small rings using scissors.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons whole cumin seeds', u'2 teaspoons whole coriander seeds', u"1 chile de arbol (with seeds) torn into very small pieces or 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes* see Cook's Note", u'1/4 cup pine nuts', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup pitted and halved black kalamata olives', u'3/4 cup pitted and halved green olives', u'3/4 cup halved assorted colored cherry or grape tomatoes', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'8 ounces Mexican Cotija or feta cheese, cubed']
title: Mexican Summer Salad

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Season the cutlets with salt and pepper, to taste. Put the flour in a dinner plate and season with salt and pepper.  Put the bread crumbs in a second plate and the beaten eggs in a shallow bowl. Dip the cutlets into the flour, then the eggs and finally into the bread crumbs, pressing down on both sides so that the bread crumbs adhere to the meat.', u'Heat 1/2-inch oil in a large skillet to 350 degrees F. Pan-fry the cutlets in batches until golden, about 2 to 3 minutes per side depending on the thickness. Set aside to drain on paper towels.', u'To assemble the sandwiches, halve the rolls horizontally.  Pull out the soft center of the slices and discard.  Spread each roll evenly with the chipotle mayonnaise. Put the cutlets on the bottom halves of the rolls and top with lettuce, tomato, avocado, onion and jalapeno. Arrange the sandwiches on serving plates and garnish with lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'4 (4-ounce) chicken, beef or pork cutlets', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup all-purpose flour, for dredging', u'1 cup plain bread crumbs, for dredging', u'2 eggs, beaten', u' Vegetable oil, for shallow frying', u'4 Bolillo or Telera rolls or French bread', u' Chipotle mayonnaise, recipe follows', u'4 lettuce leaves optional', u'8 (1/4-inch) slices tomato', u'12 (1/4-inch) slices avocado', u'12 thin slices white onion', u'12 pickled jalapeno slices or 4 canned chipotles in adobo', u'8 lime wedges, for garnish', u'1 canned chipotle chile in adobo sauce or 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce', u'1 teaspoon fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Milanese Style Sandwiches ("Tortas")

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'For the milkshake: Combine 1 cup water and the granulated sugar in a small saucepan and cook over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Add the cinnamon stick and orange zest and let the mixture sit until the flavors infuse, about 5 minutes. Discard the cinnamon stick. Add the instant coffee and stir until completely dissolved. Let cool.', u'Transfer the infused simple syrup and the ice cream to a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately, or keep in the freezer until ready to serve.', u'For the optional garnishes: Whip the cream to soft peaks. Add the powdered sugar and continue to whip to stiff peaks. Dollop each shake with the whipped cream and dust with ground cinnamon to serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'2 tablespoons orange zest (from about 1 orange)', u'1 tablespoon instant coffee', u'1 quart coffee ice cream', u'1 cup heavy whipping cream', u'1 tablespoon powdered sugar', u' Ground cinnamon']
title: Mexican Coffee Milkshake

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'For the frittata: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'In an 8-inch nonstick, ovenproof saute pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the zucchini and cook until soft, about 4 minutes. Add the scallions and corn and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for about 1 minute.', u'Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, beat the eggs with 2 tablespoons of water. Add the egg mixture and cilantro to the pan along with some salt and pepper. Cook for about 8 minutes, lifting the edges with a spatula to allow any uncooked egg to flow to the bottom. Transfer the pan to the oven and bake until puffed and golden, 8 to 10 minutes. Pour the Mexican crema over the top and sprinkle with the cheese. Serve warm or at room temperature.', u'For the salad: Add the arugula, pepitas, cranberries, lemon juice, olive oil and some salt and pepper to a bowl and toss to combine. Top with Parmesan shavings']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'2 small zucchini, cut into 1-inch dice', u'2 scallions (white and pale green parts only), chopped', u'1 ear corn, kernels cut off the cob', u'1/3 cup diced tomatoes (1-inch dice)', u'5 large eggs', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/3 cup Mexican crema', u'1/3 cup shredded Oaxaca or mozzarella cheese', u'4 cups arugula', u'1/4 cup toasted pepitas (hulled green pumpkin seeds)', u'1/4 cup dried cranberries', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u' Drizzle of olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Big pieces of shaved Parmesan, for topping']
title: Seasonal Mexican Frittata with Salad

directions: [u'Combine the flour, cocoa, soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Mix thoroughly with a whisk. Set aside. Combine the sugars in a small bowl and mix well with fingers pressing out any lumps. (Process in a food processor if lumps are stubborn). ', u'In a medium mixing bowl, beat butter and margarine until creamy. Add sugar mixture, cinnamon, peppers, and vanilla. Beat on high speed for about one minute. Beat in egg white. Stop the mixer. Add the flour mixture. Beat on low speed just until incorporated. Gather the dough together with your hands and form it into a neat 9 to 10-inch log. Wrap in waxed paper. Fold or twist ends of paper without pinching or flatting the log. Chill at least 45 minutes, or until needed. ', u'Place oven racks in the upper and lower third of the oven preheat to 350 degrees. Line cookie sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil. ', u'Use a sharp knife to slice rounds of chilled dough a scant 1/4-inch thick. Place 1-inch apart on prepared baking sheets. Bake 12 to 14 minutes. Rotate baking sheets from top to bottom and front to back about halfway through. Cookies will puff and crackle on top, and then begin to settle down slightly when done. Use a metal spatula to transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool. Allow cookies to cool completely before storing or stacking. Store in an airtight container up to two weeks, or freeze up to 2 months. ', u'NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION PER COOKIE: 47 Calories; 1.8 G fat; 33 percent calories from fat; .64 G Protein; 7.6 G Carbohydrates; 2.1 Mg Cholesterol.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup all purpose flour', u'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon unsweetened Dutch Process cocoa powder', u'1/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'3 tablespoons sweet butter, slightly softened', u'3 tablespoons stick margarine', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Generous pinch of ground black pepper', u' Generous pinch of cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 egg white']
title: Mexican Chocolate Cookies

author: Aarón Sánchez
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Generously butter four 3/4-cup souffle dishes or custard cups. Arrange on a baking sheet.', u'Stir the chocolate and butter in heavy small saucepan over low heat until smooth. Remove from the heat; stir in the mescal. Cool 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.', u'Using an electric mixer, beat the eggs, yolks, 4 tablespoons sugar, molasses, 1 teaspoon canela powder and salt in medium bowl until very thick ribbons fall when beaters are lifted, about 6 minutes. Sift the flour over the batter; fold in the flour. Fold in the chocolate mixture. Divide the batter among the prepared dishes, filling completely. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover loosely; refrigerate. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before baking.)', u'Bake the cakes until the tops are puffed and dry and a tester inserted into the center comes out with moist batter still attached, about 15 minutes. Cool the cakes 5 minutes.', u'Beat the cream, the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon canela powder in small bowl until firm peaks form. Top the cakes with the whipped cream and serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) unsalted butter, plus more for greasing', u'5 ounces bittersweet (non-sweetened) or semisweet chocolate, chopped', u'1 tablespoon mescal', u'2 large eggs', u'2 large egg yolks', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon pomegranate molasses', u'1 1/2 teaspoons canela or Mexican cinnamon', u' Large pinch salt', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup chilled whipping cream']
title: Mexican Molten Chocolate Cakes

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Place rack in oven in middle of oven and heat broiler or place oven on 400 degrees F.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, a turn of the pan, in a skillet over medium-high heat.  Add pork and crumble up as it browns.  While pork browns, season the meat with cumin, coriander and salt and pepper.  Once browned evenly, stir in hominy and reduce heat to simmer.', u'While meat cooks heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a sauce pot, add onions, garlic and peppers, season with salt and pepper and saute until softened 5 to 6 minutes.  Place tomatillos and cilantro or parsley in food processor and process until almost smooth. Pour into onion and garlic mixture and simmer to mellow, 5 to 6 minutes more.  Replace the processor bowl.  Pit and scoop the avocado flesh into the processor, add the lime zest and juice. Add the honey, puree until smooth and season with a little salt.  Stir the avocado mixture into the green sauce and remove from heat.', u'Char all of the tortillas over an open flame or in dry hot skillet.', u'In a baking dish layer sauce, tortilla, meat, cheese, tortilla, sauce, meat, cheese, etc. End with a layer of tortilla, sauce and finally cheese.  Place baking dish in the oven and bake for 4 to 5 minutes until bubbly and cheese is brown.  Pass sour cream at the table.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 pounds ground pork', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 (15-ounce) can hominy', u'1 large red onion, chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, grated or chopped', u'2 jalapeno or serrano peppers, chopped', u'12 large tomatillos (14 to 16 if small), peeled and coarsely chopped', u' A handful cilantro or parsley leaves', u'3 avocados', u'2 limes', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 package large flour tortillas', u'1 pound pepper Jack cheese, shredded', u' Sour cream, to pass at table']
title: Posole Mexican Lasagna

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'For the sauce: In a blender or food processor, combine the peppers with the stock, garlic, onions, cilantro and some salt and pepper, then puree. In a saucepot over medium heat, melt the butter, then whisk in the flour. Add the milk and cream and raise the heat a bit. Add the poblano puree and simmer to thicken and cook the sauce, 20 to 25 minutes.', u'For the casserole: Heat the EVOO in a large skillet over medium-high heat; add the butter and melt into the oil. Brown the mushrooms, about 10 minutes. Then add the corn and shallots, and cook to lightly brown the corn and soften the shallots, about 5 minutes more. Add the turkey and stock and heat through.', u'Char the tortillas over an open flame on a gas burner, or in dry skillet.', u'Layer half the turkey, mushrooms and corn in a casserole dish, and top with half the sauce, cheese and a shingled layer of 3 tortillas. Top the tortillas with the remaining turkey, mushrooms and corn, tortillas, sauce and cheese. Cool and store for a make-ahead meal, or bake to serve. Bake at 400 degrees F from room temperature until heated through and brown and bubbly.']
ingredients: [u'3 medium poblano peppers, seeded and stemmed, chopped', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 small onion, chopped', u' A small handful fresh cilantro leaves, plus a few leaves for garnishing', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'2 tablespoons flour', u'1 cup milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream or Mexican crema', u'2 tablespoons EVOO', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'12 ounces sliced button or crimini mushrooms', u'2 cups fresh (about 4 ears) or frozen and defrosted corn kernels', u'2 shallots or 1 small red onion, chopped', u'4 to 5 cups chopped cooked turkey meat', u'1 cup chicken stock', u' Six 8-inch flour tortillas', u'2 1/2 cups shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar', u'1 1/2 cups shredded Manchego cheese']
title: Turkey, Mushroom and Corn Mexican Casserole

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Put 1/2 cup of the walnuts and the salt in a food processor and pulse until finely ground. Roughly chop the remaining 1 cup walnuts.', u'Position two oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 325 degrees F.', u'Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until smooth, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the granulated sugar and beat until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl. Beat in the flour, then the ground and chopped walnuts. Divide the dough in half, forming each half into a ball. Wrap separately in plastic and chill until cold, about 30 minutes.', u"Put the confectioners' sugar in a large bowl.", u'Working with half of the chilled dough at a time and keeping the rest in the fridge, roll the dough by 2 teaspoonfuls between your palms into balls. Arrange the balls on a large baking sheet, spacing them 1/2 inch apart.', u'Bake the cookies until golden brown on the bottom and just pale golden on top, about 18 minutes. Cool the cookies for 5 minutes on the baking sheet. Toss the warm cookies in the powdered sugar. Transfer the sugar-coated cookies to a rack to cool completely. The cookies can be prepared up to 2 days ahead. Once cooled, store them in an airtight container. You need to make sure they are cooled before storing them, otherwise they will get soggy. Sift additional powdered sugar and cinnamon over the cookies if desired before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups walnuts', u' Pinch fine salt', u'2 sticks (16 tablespoons) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u"1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, plus more for serving", u' Ground cinnamon, for garnish (optional)']
title: Polvorones (Mexican Wedding Cookies)

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Slice 1/4 of the top off of each apple and reserve. Using melon baller, scoop out the apple flesh to leave a hollow cavity (which will be filled with finished salad). Coarsely chop the apple flesh and mix with the remaining ingredients in large bowl. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Spoon about 3 tablespoons of the mixture in each hollowed out apple and place the reserved tops on the filling (any unused filling can be refrigerated for up to 1 day). Serve cold or at room temperature.', u"Cook's Note: To prevent the apples from turning brown while preparing the filling, place them in a bowl of water with the juice of 2 limes added."]
ingredients: [u'6 Granny Smith apples', u'2 cups diced pineapple', u'1/2 cup diced celery', u'1/3 cup raisins', u'1/3 cup sweetened shredded coconut', u'1/2 cup walnuts, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1 tablespoon sour cream', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Traditional Mexican Christmas Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Using the large holes of a box grater, grate the tomatoes and the onion into a bowl. Add the garlic, chile peppers and cilantro and stir to combine. Place half of the salsa in a plastic tub or storage container, season with a little salt, cover and store in the refrigerator. Place the remaining salsa in a large resealable plastic bag and add the EVOO. Sprinkle the chicken liberally with salt and pepper and add it to the bag, shaking it around to coat it with the marinade. Double-bag the chicken in case the first bag leaks. Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes and up to 2 hours.', u'Preheat a grill or a grill pan to medium-high heat.', u'Meanwhile, melt the butter  in a medium pot over medium heat. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the reserved salsa and the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover and cook for 20 minutes. After about 5 minutes, place the chicken on the grill and cook, turning occasionally, for 12 to 15 minutes.', u'If you are using black beans, rinse and drain them, then reheat them in a small pan with the cumin and some salt and pepper. If you are using refried beans, reheat them in a small pan with the cumin, thinning them with a splash of water.', u'Cut the lime into wedges and douse the chicken with lime juice when it comes off the grill. Serve the chicken with the rice.']
ingredients: [u'4 large plum tomatoes', u'1 small yellow or red onion', u'2 to 3 cloves garlic, grated or made into a paste', u'1 Fresno chile pepper, thinly sliced', u'1 jalapeno chile pepper, finely chopped', u' Generous handful of fresh cilantro leaves, chopped', u' Salt', u' About 1/3 cup EVOO', u'2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts or thighs', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 cup long-grain white rice', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'1 can black beans or vegetarian spicy refried beans', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 lime']
title: Salsa Marinated Chicken with Mexican Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and poblano and cook, stirring, until softened, 5 to 8 minutes. Add the tomatoes, garlic and cumin; season with salt and pepper. Cook until the liquid thickens, about 3 minutes. Add 5 cups water. Increase the heat to high and bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to maintain a simmer and cook 10 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, combine the chorizo, crushed tortilla chips, cilantro and a pinch each of salt and pepper in a small bowl; mix with your hands until just combined. Form into 1-inch meatballs (about 20).', u'Add the meatballs to the soup and simmer until just cooked through, 5 to 8 minutes. Remove from the heat and season with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls; top with the cheese and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges and tortilla chips.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 onion, chopped', u'1 poblano chile pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1 15 -ounce can diced tomatoes', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'8 ounces fresh chorizo, casings removed', u'1/4 cup finely crushed tortilla chips, plus more chips for serving', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for topping', u'1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (about 4 ounces)', u' Lime wedges, for serving']
title: Mexican Chorizo Meatball Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Brush a 9-inch square baking dish with oil. Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the fideos and cook, turning them with tongs, until golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes. Transfer the bundles and any broken pieces to a plate.', u'Add the onion to the skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 8 minutes. Stir in the garlic, coriander, oregano, chili powder, and bay leaf, and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Crush the tomatoes over the pot with your hand and add them to the pot along with their juices. Add the chipotles, increase the heat to high, and cook until thickened, about 2 minutes. Stir in the broth, the toasted fideos, salt, and pepper, to taste. Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer gently, uncovered, breaking up the fideos with a spoon, for about 5 minutes. Stir in the turkey.', u'Remove the bay leaf. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish, sprinkle the grated cheese over the top, and cover loosely with foil. Bake until the cheese melts and the casserole is hot through and through, about 20 minutes. If desired, serve with some crema drizzled over the top.', u'Copyright (c) 2003 Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for pan', u'12 ounces fideos (bundled vermicelli)', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano, preferably Mexican', u'1 teaspoon New Mexican chili powder', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 1/2 cups canned whole tomatoes', u'1 to 2 chipotles en adobo sauce, minced', u'1 1/2 cups chicken broth, homemade, or low-sodium canned', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups shredded smoked turkey', u'1 cup coarsely grated cheddar cheese (4 ounces)', u' Mexican crema, or sour cream thinned with a bit of milk, optional']
title: Sopa Seca: Mexican Noodle Casserole

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Place the tortillas onto a baking sheet and spread 2 tablespoons of black bean dip on top of each tortilla. Top with tomato and cabbage and bake for 10 minutes. Remove the pizzas from the oven and sprinkle some cilantro on each one. Allow to cool slightly before cutting into wedges.']
ingredients: [u'4 corn tortillas, or whole-wheat tortillas (6-inches in diameter)', u'1/2 cup Black Bean Dip, recipe follows', u'1 large tomato, seeded and diced', u'1 cup shredded green cabbage', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1/2 medium onion, diced', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon minced jalapeno pepper', u'1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon water', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
servings: 2 as a main course or 8 as an appetizer
title: Mexican Tortilla Pizza

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Dulce de leche ice cream, shaved chocolate, toasted almonds and/or dulce de leche, for topping', u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line an 8-inch-square baking dish with foil, leaving a 2-inch overhang on 2 sides; coat with cooking spray.', u'Melt the butter and semisweet and unsweetened chocolate in a medium saucepan over medium heat, stirring, until smooth. Remove from the heat and whisk in the brown sugar and granulated sugar until combined. Whisk in the eggs, vanilla and almond extract. Add the flour, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and the salt and stir until the batter looks like hot fudge.', u'Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and spread in an even layer. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs, 30 to 35 minutes. Transfer to a rack and let cool completely in the pan.', u'Beat the heavy cream, cayenne and a pinch of cinnamon in a large bowl with a mixer on medium-high speed until soft peaks form, about 2 minutes. Lift the brownies out of the pan using the foil and cut into pieces. Serve topped with ice cream, the spiced whipped cream, shaved chocolate, almonds and/or dulce de leche.', u'Photograph by Ryan Dausch']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'2 sticks unsalted butter', u'8 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped', u'2 ounces unsweetened chocolate, chopped', u'3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'3/4 cup granulated sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, plus a pinch', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 cup cold heavy cream', u' Pinch of cayenne pepper']
title: Mexican Chocolate Brownie Sundaes

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Place the flour in a shallow bowl or plate. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and 1 tablespoon water. In another shallow bowl or plate, combine the panko, cilantro, salt and pepper.', u'Begin by coating the mozzarella sticks in batches of 2, first dredging in the flour mixture and shaking off excess. Then dip in the egg mixture, letting any excess drip off. Finish by dredging in the panko crumb mixture and shaking any off excess. Transfer the breaded cheese sticks to a sheet pan greased with nonstick cooking spray. Cover and freeze until frozen, about 4 hours and up to 2 days (this will lessen the oozing of the cheese).', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Lightly spray the cheese sticks with nonstick cooking spray. Bake until the cheese is soft and the sticks are lightly browned, about 12 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 egg', u'1 1/2 cups panko breadcrumbs', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 teaspoon salt', u' Pinch freshly ground black pepper', u'1 (12-count) package mozzarella string cheese', u' Nonstick cooking spray']
title: Baked Mexican Cheese Sticks

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.', u'In a separate mixing bowl, combine the mashed bananas, egg, melted butter and milk until incorporated.', u'Stir the banana mixture into the dry ingredients just until blended (but do not over-mix as it could result in a tough muffin). Stir in the chopped Mexican chocolate.', u'Divide the batter among the prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.', u'Bake the muffins until the tops are pale golden and a tester inserted into the center comes out with some melted chocolate attached but no crumbs, about 30 minutes.', u'Transfer the muffins to rack to cool for 15 minutes. Then remove from the muffin tins.', u"Cook's Note: The muffins can be stored in an airtight container for up to 4 days."]
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'2/3 cup granulated sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups mashed bananas (about 2 big bananas)', u'1 large egg', u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'1/4 cup whole milk', u'1 (3.5-ounce) disc Mexican chocolate, chopped', u' Special equipment: 1 (12-cup) nonstick muffin tin with 12 paper cupcake liners']
title: Mexican Chocolate-Banana Muffins

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'In a  heavy sauce pot, over medium-high heat, bring the milk and chocolate to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes, whisking constantly until the mixture is frothy and the chocolate has dissolved completely. Remove the pan from the heat and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups whole milk', u'1 (3.1-ounce) disc Mexican chocolate*', u' *Can be found in Hispanic and gourmet grocery stores']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate

author: Aida Mollenkamp
directions: [u'Heat the oven to 425 degrees F and arrange a rack in the upper third. Place potatoes on a baking sheet, drizzle with oil, season with salt, and toss to coat. Roast until potatoes are fork tender, about 30 minutes.', u'Set potatoes aside until cool enough to handle. Meanwhile, heat a medium nonstick frying pan to medium heat and cook chorizo, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes. Set aside.', u'Slice potatoes in half and, using a melon baler or small spoon, scoop out most of the interior (leave about 1/4-inch of potato flesh). Divide chorizo among the skins and top with cheese. Bake until skins are warmed through and cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove from oven, garnish with green onions, and pass sour cream on the side.', u'Serves: 8* (does not include sour cream); Calories: 185; Total Fat: 12 grams; Saturated Fat: 4.5 grams; Protein: 9 grams; Total carbohydrates: 10 grams; Sugar: 1 gram; Fiber: 1 gram; Cholesterol: 25 milligrams; Sodium: 303 milligrams']
ingredients: [u'20 small new red potatoes', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'6 ounces Mexican chorizo, removed from casing', u'1/2 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese', u'2 green onions, thinly sliced crosswise', u' Sour cream, for serving']
title: Mexican Potato Skin Bites

author: Nancy Fuller
directions: [u'Special equipment: skewers', u'Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.', u'In a medium saucepan add the butter, hot sauce and chili powder over medium-high heat. Once the butter melts, add the garlic and vinegar, and saute until it sizzles and is fragrant, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Reserve a few tablespoons of the sauce for a later use.', u'Stick 3 shrimp on each skewer. Sprinkle the shrimp with salt and pepper on both sides. Place the shrimp on the grill and cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, basting with the sauce the last few minutes of grilling.', u'Remove the shrimp to a platter and drizzle the reserved sauce over the skewers. Serve the shrimp skewers with carrots, celery sticks and creamy blue cheese dressing.']
ingredients: [u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) butter', u"1/2 cup hot sauce, such as Frank's RedHot", u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 teaspoon white wine vinegar', u'2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Carrot sticks, for dunking', u' Celery sticks, for dunking', u' Blue cheese dressing, for serving']
title: Buffalo Mexican Shrimp Skewers

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Combine all ingredients and place in a collectible/re-useable canister with instructions. ', u'Instructions read: "Blend 1/2 cup mix with 1 cup steaming hot whole milk. Stir and enjoy".']
ingredients: [u'3 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u' Pinch cayenne pepper', u'3 cups hot cocoa mix']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate Mix

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Butter 8 (1/2 cup) ramekins or custard cups with 2 tablespoons butter. Set aside.', u'For the souffles: Stir the chocolate and 6 tablespoons butter in a large metal bowl set over saucepan of simmering water until the mixture is melted and smooth (mixture will be a little grainy). Remove the chocolate mixture from the heat and let cool slightly. Whisk in the egg yolks and add 2 tablespoons of the cooled melted chocolate to the yolks, mixing to incorporate. Add the rest of the chocolate and mix until nice and smooth. Using an electric mixer, beat the egg whites in a medium bowl until foamy. Add the sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold into the chocolate mixture in 3 additions. Divide the chocolate batter among the prepared ramekins, filling them three-quarters of the way.', u'Bake the souffles until puffed but the centers jiggle slightly, 16 to 18 minutes. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoon unsalted butter, at room temperature, for greasing the ramekins.', u'4 (3.1-ounce) disks Mexican chocolate, coarsely chopped (recommended: Ibarra, found in gourmet and Hispanic grocery stores)', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'6 large egg yolks', u'6 large egg whites', u'1/4 cup sugar']
title: Easy Mexican Chocolate Souffle

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Place coffee, cocoa and cinnamon in a filter for coffee brewing. Make 4 cups of brewed mocha-cinnamon coffee. Pour a shot of coffee liquor in the bottom of a coffee mug. Pour in a serving of brewed mocha-cinnamon Mexican coffee. Top off the mug with a generous swirl of whipped cream and garnish with another sprinkle of cinnamon. Repeat for desired number of mugfuls!']
ingredients: [u'4 scoops of ground coffee beans, Columbian or other variety - a coffee scoop is equivalent to a rounded tablespoon', u'1 scoop (rounded tablespoon) cocoa powder', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon - eyeball it, plus a sprinkle for garnish', u'4 jiggers (1 ounce shots) coffee liqueur (recommended: Kahlua)', u'1 canister whipped cream with spray top']
title: Mexican Coffee

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'In a deep skillet with a cover preheated over medium high heat, add oil, garlic, onion and jalapeno. Season with salt. Saute 2 minutes. Arrange mussels in the pan. Pour in beer and tomatoes and shake the pan to combine. Cover pan and cook 3 minutes or until mussels open. Remove from heat and spoon sauce down into shells. Garnish with parsley or cilantro. Serve immediately from the pan.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the pan', u'4 cloves garlic, cracked away from skin and crushed', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1 jalapeno, seeded and chopped', u' A couple pinches salt', u'2 1/2 dozen mussels, scrubbed and beards removed', u'1/2 bottle dark Mexican beer, such as Modelo Negro or Dos Equis', u'1 (15-ounces) diced tomatoes', u'2 tablespoons chopped flat-leaf parsley or cilantro, your preference']
title: Mussels in Mexican Beer

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'In a small saucepan, warm caramel sauce over low heat and season with cayenne pepper and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon. Place tortillas on a cookie sheet and brush liberally with melted butter. Sprinkle each tortilla with sugar and a pinch of cinnamon and bake until crispy and sugar has melted on the tortillas, 5 minutes. Remove tortillas from oven, let cool to harden and break into large, uneven pieces. Arrange the pieces of 1 tortilla in a sundae dish or on a dessert plate. Top with 2 large scoops ice cream. Drizzle the warm caramel sauce over each sundae using a spatula or wooden spoon. Top each sundae with whipped cream swirls and Spanish peanuts.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces store bought caramel sauce for ice cream', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon (1/2 teaspoon for sauce, 1/2 teaspoon for tortillas)', u'4 (8--inch) flour tortillas', u'2 tablespoons melted butter', u'4 teaspoons sugar', u'2 pints Dulce de Leche caramel ice cream or caramel swirl ice cream', u'1 canister real whipped cream, from dairy aisle', u'4 ounces, 1/2 cup, Spanish peanuts']
title: Mexican Caramel Sundaes

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Whisk together the flour, baking powder, mandarin peel, salt, dates and chocolate in a bowl. Whisk together ricotta, eggs, granulated sugar, and vanilla in another bowl. Mix in the flour mixture to form a chunky batter.', u"In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan, pour enough oil to fill the pan about a third of the way. Heat over medium heat until a deep-frying thermometer inserted in the oil reaches 350 degrees F. (If you don't have a thermometer a cube of bread will brown in about 4 minutes.)", u'Working in batches, gently drop a tablespoon of the batter in the oil and fry, turning occasionally, until deep golden in color, about 3 minutes per batch. Transfer with a slotted spoon onto paper towels to drain.', u'Dust generously with powdered sugar and serve with Mexican Hot Chocolate.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup all purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon mandarin or orange zest', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup minced pitted dates', u'1 (3.1-ounce) disc Mexican or bittersweet chocolate, such as Ibarra, chopped into 1/4-inch pieces*', u'1 cup whole- milk ricotta cheese', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u' Vegetable oil for frying', u' Powdered sugar for dusting', u' Mexican Hot Chocolate (recipe follows)', u' *Can be found in Hispanic and gourmet grocery stores']
title: Mexican Chocolate and Date Fritters

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Sprinkle the brisket with the coarse salt and pepper. Dredge in flour to coat and shake off any excess. In a large Dutch oven heat oil over high heat. Sear the meat until browned on all sides. Set aside. Reduce heat to moderate and add the carrots and onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the garlic and saute 2 minutes longer. Return the meat to the pan along with all remaining ingredients except the salt and garnishes. Bring to a boil, cover the pot and transfer to the oven. Bake for 2 1/2 hours, or until the meat slips off a fork when pierced. Lift out the brisket and place on a cutting board. Cover with a damp towel. Pour the broth with vegetables into a tall container and skim off the layer of fat that rises. Remove and discard the bay leaves and chiles. Pour the broth and vegetables into a blender or a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Puree until smooth, add salt to taste and strain. Reheat the sauce. Slice the brisket against the grain and arrange on a platter. Pour the warm sauce over it, sprinkle with sliced scallions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 1/2 pounds beef brisket', u'1 tablespoon coarse salt', u'2 teaspoons freshly ground pepper', u' Flour for dredging', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'3 large carrots, peeled and cut into 2-inch lengths', u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'10 garlic cloves, peeled and minced', u'3 dried chipotle or morita chiles', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'2 quarts chicken stock or water', u'5 bay leaves', u' Salt to taste', u'4 scallions, white and light green parts, thinly sliced on the diagonal, for garnish']
title: Mexican Beef Brisket

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Dressing:  Mix the soy sauce, lime juice, sesame oil, sugar, chile, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. ', u'Salad:  In a large salad bowl, add the jicama, beets, and cucumber along with the dressing  and toss to combine.  Cover and refrigerate until chilled.  Serve cold.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 small limes, juiced', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 dried arbol chile or any small, spicy red dried chile, stemmed, seeded, and cut into rings', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups shredded peeled jicama (from 1 small jicama)', u'3 medium raw beets, peeled and shredded', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded, and grated or thinly sliced']
title: Mexican Style Slaw

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'For the chorizo and bean topping: In a large heavy saute pan, heat 2 tablespoons oil on medium-high heat. Add the chorizo and cook until crisp, about 6 minutes. Remove from the heat and reserve.', u'In a large heavy saute pan, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil on medium-high heat. Add the beans and cook until warm, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and reserve.', u'For the tortillas: Combine the corn masa, 1 1/4 cups water and salt in a large mixing bowl. Mix thoroughly by hand to form a soft dough, about 2 minutes. If the dough feels dry, add more water (one tablespoon at a time).', u'Preheat a 12-inch cast-iron skillet. Place a piece of parchment paper on a flat surface. Put half of the dough onto the parchment paper and place another piece of parchment paper on top. Using a rolling pin, roll out the dough until it is 1/4-inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.', u'Drizzle the oil into the hot skillet and place the rolled out masa dough into the skillet to cook for about 2 minutes. Turn over to cook on the other side.', u'To assemble the pizza: Spread 1/2 cup of the warm refried beans onto the cooked side of dough. Add 1/4 cup Oaxaca cheese and 1/2 cup cooked chorizo. Continue to cook for until the cheese is melted, another 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the pizza from the pan onto a round serving platter. Top with the iceberg lettuce. Season with salt and pepper. Then sprinkle with crumbled queso fresco and a drizzle of Mexican crema. Cut into 4-inch squares and serve immediately. Repeat with the remaining half of dough and toppings.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'5 ounces raw pork chorizo', u' One 16-ounce canned refried black beans', u'2 cups instant corn masa', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup Oaxaca cheese', u' Iceberg lettuce, shredded', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Crumbled queso fresco', u' Mexican crema']
title: Mexican Chorizo Pizza (Tlayuda)

directions: [u'Equipment: Fondue pot; fondue forks or wooden or metal skewers', u'In a bowl, whisk together the sugar and cornstarch to blend. Slowly whisk in the cream; then the milk, coffee, cinnamon, and vanilla. Pour the mixture into a stainless steel saucepan and gently bring it to a boil. Cook, whisking, until thickened, about 4 minutes.', u'Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the chocolate and butter until melted. Using a fine-meshed sieve over a large bowl, strain the chocolate mixture and discard the solids. Pour into a warmed fondue pot and serve with assorted dippers and fondue forks.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 1/4 cups heavy cream', u'1 1/4 cups milk', u'2 tablespoons fresh-ground coffee', u'1/2 teaspoon ground Ceylon cinnamon or canela', u'1 vanilla bean, split', u'7 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u' Regular bananas', u' Small bananas, like Manzano or red', u' Strawberries, with stem', u' Marshmallows', u' Toasted cubes pound cake', u' Pineapple chunks', u' Anjou or Bartlett pear slices, unpeeled', u' Fried wonton wrappers', u' Bing cherries, with stem']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate Fondue

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'For the marinade and steak: Combine the cilantro, Worcestershire, garlic, chiles, lime juice, marjoram and onions in a bag. Sprinkle the steak with salt and pepper and add to the bag. Release air and seal the bag, then refrigerate. Marinate up to 2 hours.', u'To prepare, bring the steak to room temp, heat a grill pan to medium-high, shake off excess marinade and cook the steak for a few minutes on each side. Thinly slice and set aside.', u'For the soup: Bring a pot of water to a boil, salt the water and cook the barley to tender, but al dente, about 20 minutes. Drain and drizzle with a touch of oil. Store in a plastic container until the night you serve the soup.', u'In a soup pot, heat the 2 tablespoons EVOO, 2 turns of the pan, over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, celery, chile peppers, onions and bell peppers, and season with salt and pepper. Cook to soften the veggies, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the stock, tomatoes and cilantro, and simmer to combine the flavors, about 20 minutes. Cool, cover and store for a make-ahead meal.', u'To serve, heat the soup to a low boil. Add the barley and heat through. Serve the soup in shallow bowls and add the sliced skirt steak. Pass the lime wedges, Worcestershire and hot sauce for topping.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro or parsley leaves, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce', u'2 large cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 fresh chile, such as Fresno or jalapeno, seeded and finely chopped', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 teaspoon dried marjoram or oregano', u'1/4 red onion, minced or grated', u'1 pound skirt steak', u' Kosher salt and coarse black pepper', u' Salt', u'1 cup pearled barley', u'2 tablespoons EVOO, plus extra for drizzling', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 ribs celery, finely chopped', u'2 chile peppers, such as Fresno or jalepeno, seeded and chopped', u'1 red onion, chopped', u'1 small bell pepper, finely chopped', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'4 cups beef stock', u' One 32-ounce can stewed tomatoes', u' A handful of fresh cilantro or parsley leaves, chopped', u' Lime wedges, Worcestershire and hot sauce, to pass at table']
title: Mexican Sliced Steak and Barley Soup

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, bring the water and salt to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the squash and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Strain and set aside.', u'For the dip: In a food processor, blend the bell pepper, avocado, ground cumin, yogurt, and mayonnaise until smooth, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Transfer to a serving bowl and let stand for 10 minutes to thicken.', u'Serve the dip with warm or room-temperature chayote squash.']
ingredients: [u'5 cups water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 pound (about 4) chayote squash, seeded and cut lengthwise into 8 wedges', u'1 green bell pepper, roughly chopped to yield 1 cup', u'1/2 avocado, pitted', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'3/4 cup plain non-fat yogurt', u'1/4 cup low-fat mayonnaise', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Squash with Yogurt Dip

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Toss the tortilla strips with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil on a baking sheet, spread in a single layer and bake until crisp and golden, 12 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the chorizo and cumin and cook, breaking up the meat with a wooden spoon, until browned, about 4 minutes. Add the sweet potato, chicken broth, tomatoes and 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to maintain a simmer and cook until the sweet potato is tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the spinach and lime juice and season with salt. Divide among bowls and top with the tortilla strips, cilantro and avocado.', u'Per serving: Calories 582; Fat 27 g (Saturated 5 g); Cholesterol 101 mg; Sodium 840 mg; Carbohydrate 51 g; Fiber 9 g; Protein 36 g', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'6 corn tortillas, cut into strips', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u' Kosher salt', u'3/4 pound fresh chorizo or other spicy sausage, casings removed', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 large sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 14 -ounce can diced tomatoes', u'4 cups baby spinach', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'3/4 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 avocado, halved, pitted and chopped']
title: Mexican Chorizo and Sweet Potato Soup

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Scoop out ice cream into small bowls. Crush corn cereal in your hands (or in a re-sealable plastic bag) and top the ice cream. Sprinkle with cinnamon and drizzle with honey.']
ingredients: [u'1 pint coffee or vanilla ice cream, softened in microwave on defrost 30 seconds', u'2 cups flaky corn cereal (recommended: Corn Flakes)', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u' Honey, for drizzling']
title: Mexican "Fried" Ice Cream

directions: [u'Take a large platter and spread out a layer of refried beans on the bottom. Combine the avocados, lemon juice, salt and pepper and spread the mixture on top of the beans. Combine the sour cream and chipotle. Spread that mixture on top of the avocado mixture. Chop and combine the green onions, tomatoes and olives. Spread the mixture in a ring around the outside of the platter. Garnish the top with cheddar cheese and serve with tortilla chips.']
ingredients: [u'1 medium to large can refried beans', u'3 avocados, chopped', u'2 teaspoons lemon juice', u' Salt, pepper, to taste', u'1 large container sour cream', u'1 chipotle in adobo, chopped', u'1 bunch green onions, chopped', u'2 large tomatoes, seeded and chopped', u'1 to 2 cans sliced black olives', u'6 ounces grated cheddar cheese for garnish', u'1 package tortilla chips']
title: Mexican Fiesta Dip

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'In a large Dutch oven or countertop fryer using a high heat thermometer, bring the canola oil to 375 degrees F.', u'For the chocolate sauce: Bring a double broiler to a simmer over medium-low heat. Carefully melt the chocolate. Remove from the heat. With a wooden spoon or heat resistant spatula, stir in the heavy cream until the sauce is smooth. Set aside.', u'For the churros: Set a large saucepot over medium heat. Add 1 cup water, the butter, sugar and salt. Bring to 155 degrees F, then dump in the flour and stir with a wooden spoon to incorporate and remove lumps, about 1 minute.', u'Using the spoon, add the eggs into the batter one at a time, beating after each addition, until fully incorporated. Spoon the batter into a pastry bag fitted with a star tip and carefully pipe into the heated oil, forming 6-inch strips or free form shapes. Do not overcrowd the pot. Fry for 3 to 5 minutes, turning once as the underside browns. Remove with a spider or slotted spoon and drain on paper-towel-lined sheet tray or plate.', u'To finish: Working quickly, combine the sugar and cinnamon together in a large mixing bowl. Gently add the hot churros, tossing to coat. Serve with the chocolate dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups canola oil, for frying', u'1 1/2 cups Mexican chocolate', u'3/4 cup heavy cream', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 cup unbleached all-purpose flour', u'3 medium eggs', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon']
title: Cinnamon Churros with Mexican Chocolate Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place the mayonnaise and chipotle chiles in a food processor and blend until smooth. Generously spread the cut sides of the rolls with the chipotle mayonnaise. Cover the bottom half of each roll with 1 thinly sliced chicken breast, overlapping the slices. Top each portion of chicken with 5 slices of tomato and 4 slices of avocado. Cover with 2 slices of cheese.', u'Place assembled sandwiches open faced on a sheet pan and bake until cheese is melted, about 8 minutes. Cover the sandwiches, slice in half and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'2 canned chipotle chiles in adobo sauce', u'4 Mexican-style soft rolls (called Telera), split in half (see note)', u' Grilled Chicken, recipe follows', u'4 plum tomatoes, cut into 20 thin slices', u'1 Hass avocado, peeled, seeded, and cut into 16 thin slices', u'8 thin slices pepper Jack cheese (about 8 ounces)', u'1/4 cup lemon juice', u'1 clove garlic, crushed', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon paprika', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves (about 4 ounces each)']
title: Mexican Telera Sandwich

author: Ingrid Hoffmann
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook until the onion is soft, about 2 minutes. Add the rice, achiote powder, and bay leaf. Cook and stir until the rice is opaque, about 2 minutes,', u'Add the tomatoes and broth, stirring to combine. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook until the liquid evaporates to just below the level of the rice, about 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to the low, cover, and cook until the rice is tender, about 20 to 25 minutes. Uncover, fluff with a fork and serve with Chocolate Chicken Mole, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 cups long-grain white rice', u'1 teaspoon achiote powder', u'1 bay leaf', u'2 cups canned crushed tomatoes', u'2 1/2 cups low-sodium chicken broth']
title: Mexican Red Rice

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Cook the chorizo in a medium-size skillet over medium heat.  Drain on paper towels.', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Put the dough out onto a well-floured surface.  Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces.  Roll into 4inch circles, using a rolling pin or stretching it into circles by hand.  Arrange the circles on 2 baking sheets lightly brushed with oil.', u'Top each pizza with tomato slices and crumbled cooked chorizo.  Top with shredded cheese and sprinkle with dried oregano.', u'Bake until the dough is golden brown and cheese is bubbly, about 20 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ball store-bought pizza dough', u' Olive oil, for brushing pans', u'4 tomatoes, thinly sliced', u'12 ounces Mexican chorizo, casing removed, cooked and crumbled', u'1 /2 to 2 cups shredded mozzarella or Monterrey Jack cheese', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano']
title: Mexican Mini-Pizzas

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Combine the beans, garlic, onion, and bay leaves in a medium pot.  Add enough water to reach about 1 1/2 inches over the beans.  Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.  Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until the beans are tender, about 2 hours. Add more water if the beans are absorbing too much liquid. The beans should be soupy when done, with plenty of liquid remaining. Season the beans with salt and pepper, to taste.   ', u'Ladle the beans and cooking liquid into soup bowls and garnish with Mexican crema, cilantro and chopped white onions.  Alternatively, the beans can be drained and use as a filling for soft tacos.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups dried pinto beans', u'4 garlic cloves, peeled and mashed', u'1/4 large onion', u'2 bay leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Mexican crema or sour cream, chopped fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped white onion, for serving']
title: Mexican Bean Stew ("Frijoles De La Olla")

directions: [u'Combine the chicken with the stock in a soup pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook, uncovered, 30 minutes. Add the vegetables and rice and cook 20 minutes longer.', u'Cool the chicken in the stock. Lift out the chicken and remove and discard the skin and bones. Shred the chicken and return to the pot. Stir in the lime juice and epazote or mint and reheat the soup. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 (2 1/2 to 3 pound) chicken', u'2 quarts chicken stock', u'2 teaspoons sea salt, to taste', u'1 medium carrot, peeled and chopped', u'2 leeks, cleaned and chopped', u'1 chayote, skin on, pitted and chopped', u'2/3 cup shortgrain rice', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'6 tablespoons finely chopped fresh epazote or mint']
title: Mexican Chicken Rice Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 475 degrees F. Separate 1 egg; set the yolk aside. Whisk the egg white, chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl until frothy. Add the potatoes, onion and poblano; toss. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray; spread out the vegetables, then coat with more cooking spray. Bake, flipping once, until golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, toss the tomatoes, 2 tablespoons cilantro and 1 tablespoon hot sauce in a bowl; season with salt and set aside.', u'Whisk the reserved egg yolk and 7 eggs with 1/4 cup cilantro and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a bowl until frothy. Melt the butter in a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat; swirl to coat. Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring, until just set, about 5 minutes.', u'Toast the tortillas in a dry skillet or wrap in a damp paper towel and warm in the microwave. Toss the remaining 2 tablespoons cilantro and 1 tablespoon hot sauce with the vegetable mixture. Divide the vegetables and scrambled eggs among the tortillas. Serve with the tomato salsa.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'8 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u' Kosher salt', u'2 Yukon gold potatoes (about 1 pound), diced', u'1 onion, diced', u'1 poblano chile pepper, thinly sliced', u' Cooking spray', u'3 plum tomatoes, diced', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 tablespoons jalapeno hot sauce', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'12 white corn tortillas']
title: Mexican Egg Tacos with Potatoes

author: Ingrid Hoffmann
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard cupcake pan with liners.', u'To prepare the cupcake batter: In a large heat resistant bowl, combine the chocolate and butter over a pot of simmering water, without letting the bottom touch the water. Stir gently until melted and well combined. You may use a microwave, if preferable.', u'Remove chocolate from heat and stir in the vanilla. Add the sugar. Beat with a handheld electric mixture until smooth and combined, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, mixing for 20 seconds between each egg to incorporate. ', u'In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Mix until well blended.', u'Using ladle or small measuring cup, fill the cupcake cups 2/3 of the way full. Place a peanut butter cup in the center of each cup and press down slightly. Bake until the cupcakes are firm to the touch about 20 minutes.', u"To prepare the frosting: Using a handheld electric beater, cream the cream cheese and butter together thoroughly. Add the chili power and cinnamon, mixing to incorporate. Add the salt, vanilla, and confectioners' sugar. Finally, mix in the melted chocolate and blend thoroughly until smooth. If additional thickening is needed, add more sifted confectioners' sugar, a little at a time, until a spreadable consistency is reached."]
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup milk chocolate chips', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 cup sugar', u'3 large eggs', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'12 peanut butter cups', u'1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u"3 cups confectioners' sugar, sifted", u'3 ounces unsweetened chocolate, melted']
title: Double Feature Cupcakes with Mexican Hot Chocolate Frosting

author: Aarón Sánchez
directions: [u'Cut lengthwise around the middle of the avocados, then twist to separate the halves. Remove the pits by striking them with a knife blade, then scoop out the flesh with a spoon and dice.', u'Combine the avocados, tomatillos, onion, cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium bowl and gently mix.']
ingredients: [u'2 ripe hass avocados', u'3 tomatillos, husked, rinsed and diced (about 1 cup)', u'1/4 cup chopped sweet onion', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 jalapeno pepper, finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Mexican Avocado Salsa

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cook the chorizo in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until it just begins to brown, about 3 minutes. Add the bell pepper and jalapeno and cook, stirring occasionally, until they begin to sizzle, about 5 minutes. Add the beans and half of the scallions and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 4 minutes.', u'Whisk the whole eggs and egg whites with 1/4 cup water and 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a bowl; add to the skillet and cook, stirring with a rubber spatula, until just beginning to set, about 2 minutes. Add the chips, cheese, half of the cilantro, and the remaining scallions and continue cooking, stirring, until the eggs are just set, about 3 more minutes.', u'Divide the eggs among plates and top with the avocado, sour cream and remaining cilantro.', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces dried chorizo, diced (about 1 small link)', u'1 medium red bell pepper, chopped', u'1 jalapeno pepper, chopped (remove seeds for less heat)', u'1 14 -ounce can no-salt-added pinto beans, drained and rinsed', u'3 scallions, sliced', u'6 large eggs plus 2 egg whites', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 cup crushed baked tortilla chips (preferably low sodium)', u'3/4 cup shredded low-fat cheddar cheese (about 3 ounces)', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 avocado, pitted, peeled and sliced', u'2 tablespoons low-fat sour cream']
title: Mexican Eggs With Chorizo and Beans

directions: [u'Make the molds: Place the Elastack molding material in a saucepan over medium heat until melted. Use metal rulers to outline the mold that you would like to make. For my centerpiece, I used some ceramic art souvenirs I bought in Mexico. Place the rulers on a parchment paper lined sheet pan, and place the item to be molded in the center of that space. Pour the melted Elastack over the item to be molded until it is completely covered. Let this set for about 30 minutes until the Elastack hardens. When set, remove the original piece. Now the mold is ready to use. ', u'Make the cocoa pods: Use a ladle to fill the cocoa pod mold with white chocolate. When it is full, empty it into the bowl of chocolate. The inside of the mold should be evenly coated with chocolate. Wipe the edge of the mold clean on the side of the bowl and place it upside down on a wire rack placed over a baking sheet. Once the chocolate starts to harden, about 5 minutes, scrape the edge clean with a paring knife. When the chocolate sets, it shrinks or retracts from the sides of the mold. A clean edge will keep it from sticking and cracking as it shrinks. You can place the mold in the refrigerator for several minutes to help the chocolate to harden. Unmold. Repeat with as many cocoa pods as you would like. If you are using the cocoa pod as a container to hold something, do not glue the 2 halves together. Otherwise, use tempered chocolate to glue the 2 halves together.', u'If you want to paint the cocoa pods, there are 2 methods. The first is to mix together a few tablespoons of the cocoa butter with a small amount of powdered food color. It will be easier if you use a yogurt machine to store and warm your paints. Use a paintbrush to paint the inside of the mold, applying color where you are inspired to do so. Then, follow the instructions that follow to make a mold. The second method is to use an airbrush.', u'If you use an airbrush, simply place a few drops of color in the receptacle of the airbrush and decorate as you are inspired.']
ingredients: [u' Elastack molding material', u'5 pounds bittersweet chocolate, tempered', u'3 pounds white chocolate, tempered', u' Cocoa butter', u' Powdered food coloring, as desired', u' Vegetable oil']
title: Mexican Totem

directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine the rice with enough very hot tap water to cover. Stir and let sit for about 10 minutes. Drain, rinse in cold water, and drain again, shaking thoroughly. In a blender, combine the tomatoes, onion, and garlic and blend until smooth, scraping down the sides of the container as necessary. Set aside.', u'In a large heavy saucepan, heat the oil over mediumhigh heat. Add the rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice turns a light golden color, about 10 minutes. Do not let it scorch. Add the tomato puree and fry, scraping the bottom of the pan to stop the mixture from sticking, for 6 to 8 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Add the chicken broth, carrots, zucchini, and giblets, if using. Stir in the salt and reduce the heat to mediumlow. Cook the rice uncovered and undisturbed until almost all of the broth has evaporated and little air holes form in the surface. Cover the top of the pan with a towel and the lid, reduce the heat to very low, and cook for 5 minutes more. Remove the pan from the heat and let rest for 10 minutes more, so that the rice can absorb the steam and swell. Just before serving, turn the rice over from the bottom so that the juices are redistributed.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups unconverted longgrain rice', u'8 ounces tomatoes, roughly chopped with the skin on', u'1/2 small onion, finely chopped', u'1 clove garlic, coarsely chopped', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil, chicken fat, or lard', u'3 1/2 cups light chicken broth', u'1/2 medium carrot, cut into 1/4inch dice', u'1/2 zucchini, cut into 3/8inch dice', u'1/2 cup chopped poultry hearts and gizzards (optional)', u'3/4 teaspoon salt']
title: Mexican Rice

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Add the butter, corn, onions, red peppers, garlic and 1 teaspoon of salt to a medium saucepot set over medium-high heat. Saute until the onions are translucent, 6 to 8 minutes. Add the cumin, chile powder, cayenne pepper and flour and cook, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon, to make a roux, 3 to 4 minutes. Pour in the cold milk in a steady stream, stirring vigorously until the mixture is smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until starting to thicken, 8 to 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium-low and stir in the cheddar and Monterey Jack. Cook until the sauce is smooth and creamy, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the scallions, pepper and rigatoni and mix well to combine.', u'Pour the into a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle the panko evenly over the top and cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes, then uncover and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbling. Remove to a cooling rack and let rest for 8 to 10 minutes.', u'Garnish with the cotija, jalapeno and cilantro. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed', u'1 medium onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 red pepper, seeded, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'4 cloves garlic, peeled and minced', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 teaspoons cumin', u'2 teaspoons chile powder', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/4 all-purpose flour', u'4 cups milk, cold', u'2 cups shredded cheddar', u'1 cup shredded Monterey Jack', u'1/2 cup scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound mini rigatoni, cooked al dente according to package directions', u'1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs', u'1/2 cup crumbled cotija cheese, for garnish', u'1/4 cup cilantro leaves, minced, for garnish', u'1/4 cup pickled jalapenos, drained, minced, for garnish']
title: Mexican Mac-n-Cheese

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Begin by removing the chorizo from their casings. Set a medium saucepan over medium heat and coat with a little canola oil. Add the chorizo and use a spoon to break up the pieces into smaller chunks. Add the garlic and jalapeno. Allow the chorizo to cook and render for 4 to 5 minutes. When the oil is fragrant and red from the chorizo spices, add the cumin and black beans (including the liquid from one of the cans). Add 1/2 cup water, bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes to allow the flavors to come together. Add the lime juice and season with salt and pepper.', u'Serve the beans in a large bowl garnished with crumbled Cotija cheese and chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces Mexican chorizo (about 2 links)', u' Canola oil, for greasing pan', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/2 jalapeno, minced', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u' Two 15.5-ounce cans black beans', u' Juice of 1/2 lime', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup crumbled Cotija cheese', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Mexican Pork and Beans

directions: [u'Meatballs: ', u'Combine the ground beef with the cilantro, garlic, lime juice, cumin, hot sauce and salt and pepper. Form into 1-ounce balls. Heat oil in skillet over moderate heat.
