Cook until brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. ', u'Soup: ', u'In a large soup pot, heat 2 tablespoon vegetable oil. Add onions and garlic and cook for 5 minutes over low heat until translucent. Add chiles and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and their juice, chicken stock, chili powder, cumin, and hot sauce. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. ', u'In a small bowl, combine flour and chicken stock. Whisk into soup. Bring back to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add meat balls and simmer an additional 5 minutes. ', u'Serve soup with garnishes']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds lean ground beef', u'3 tablespoons chopped cilantro', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon hot sauce', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u'2 medium onions, chopped (about 2 cups)', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 (4-ounce) can green chilies, chopped', u'2 (15-ounce) cans Italian-style stewed tomatoes, chopped, reserving the juice', u'8 cups chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon hot sauce or to taste', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 cup chicken stock', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u' Chopped cilantro', u' Fried tortilla strips', u' Avocado cubes', u' Sour cream', u' Pickled Jalapeno', u' Monterey Jack cheese']
title: Mexican Tortilla Meatball Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the loaf: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine the butter, almonds, sugar, cocoa powder, egg yolks, cinnamon, flour and cayenne in a food processor and pulse to make a paste.', u'On a floured surface, roll out the dough into a 10-by-18-inch rectangle. Spread the cocoa mixture over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border on one of the long sides. Brush the clean border with water. Tightly roll the dough into an 18-inch log, rolling toward the clean border; pinch the seam to seal. Place seam-side down on the baking sheet; refrigerate until firm, 30 minutes.', u"Slide the parchment off the baking sheet and cut the log in half lengthwise with a chef's knife. Slide back onto the baking sheet and pinch one end together with the cut sides facing in. Twist the two halves together, crossing one over the other a few times. Pinch the end together, then tuck both pinched ends under the loaf slightly. Cover the loaf loosely with plastic wrap and set aside in a warm place until plump, 30 minutes.", u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Uncover the loaf and bake, rotating the baking sheet halfway through, until golden brown (a thermometer inserted into the middle should register 170 degrees F to 175 degrees F), 30 to 35 minutes.', u'Make the topping: Combine the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Brush the warm loaf with the melted butter and sprinkle with some of the cinnamon sugar. Let cool, then sprinkle with more cinnamon sugar.', u'Photograph by Johnny Miller']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1/3 cup sliced blanched almonds', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder', u'2 large egg yolks', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u' Large pinch of cayenne pepper', u'1 batch  Basic Sweet-Roll Dough, without nutmeg', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted']
title: Mexican Chocolate Loaf

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a 9-inch-square metal baking pan, then line with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on all 4 sides. Pulse the flour, almonds, cocoa powder, cinnamon, salt and cayenne, if using, in a food processor until the almonds are finely ground.', u'Beat the butter and granulated sugar in a large bowl with a mixer until light and fluffy. Add the flour mixture and beat until just combined (the dough will be crumbly). Press the dough into the bottom of the prepared pan (you can cover the dough with plastic wrap and use the bottom of a measuring cup to even it out).', u'Prick the dough all over with a fork, then use a sharp knife to cut it into 18 strips. Top with almonds, lightly pressing them in. Sprinkle with the raw sugar. Refrigerate until the dough is firm, about 10 minutes.', u'Bake until the shortbread is slightly puffed and firm, 30 to 35 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and immediately retrace the strips with a knife; cool completely in the pan on a rack. Lift up the parchment paper to remove the shortbread from the pan, then separate into bars. Store in an airtight container up to 1 week.', u'Photograph by Steve Giralt']
ingredients: [u'12 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, plus more for the pan', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'3 tablespoons sliced almonds, plus more for topping', u'6 tablespoons Dutch-process cocoa powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Pinch of cayenne pepper (optional)', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'2 tablespoons raw sugar']
title: Mexican Chocolate Shortbread

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Syrup: In a small pot, bring the water and sugar to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sugar is completely dissolved. Remove from the heat and cool slightly. ', u'Raspado: Add the strawberries, mango, orange zest, chiles, and simple syrup to a blender and blend until smooth.  Cool completely.  Pour the mixture into a 9 by 13-inch pan.  Freeze until firm, at least 8 hours or overnight.', u'Scrape with a fork and spoon into small glasses or cups and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 water', u'1/4 sugar', u'3 cups roughly chopped fresh strawberries', u'2 mangos, peeled and roughly chopped', u'1 tablespoon orange zest', u'2 serrano chiles, seeds and veins removed, diced']
title: No Fuss Mexican Ice (Raspado)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Mix together 2 packages muffin mix with 2 eggs, 4 tablespoons melted butter (melt in microwave 30 seconds), 1 1/2 cups milk and frozen corn kernels. Wipe a nonstick skillet with a little extra or vegetable oil and pour in the muffin mix. Use a large skillet, 10 to 12 inch. Choose a pan with oven safe handle or, double-wrap handle with foil to protect it in the oven. Place pan in oven and bake 12 to 15 minutes in center of the oven until light golden in color.', u'Brown the meat over medium high heat in a second skillet in extra or vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan. Add onions and spices and cook meat 5 minutes more.', u'Remove cornbread from oven and top with meat, cheese, and veggies. Add pan back to oven and cook 5 minutes more to melt cheese. Garnish with cilantro, optional. Cut into 8 wedges and serve the deep dish pan pizza from the skillet. Pass taco sauce at the table to sprinkle on top.']
ingredients: [u'2 boxes corn muffin mix, 8 1/2 ounces each (recommended: Jiffy)', u'2 eggs', u'4 tablespoons melted butter', u'1 1/2 cups milk', u'1 cup frozen corn kernels', u' Extra-virgin olive oil or, vegetable oil, for drizzling', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin or vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons cayenne sauce', u' Salt', u'2 1/2 cups (10-ounce sack from dairy aisle) shredded Cheddar or jack cheese', u'1/2 red bell pepper, chopped', u'1 small can, 2 1/4 ounces sliced chillies or jalapenos, drained', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'2 small vine ripe tomatoes, seeded and diced', u'2 tablespoons drained sliced green olives (salad olives)', u'1 to 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves, optional garnish', u' Mild to medium taco sauce to pass at table, 1 cup']
servings: 4 servings, 2 slices each of Mexican deep dish pizza pie
title: Mexican Meat-zza: Mexican Deep-Dish Pan Pizza

author: Ingrid Hoffmann
directions: [u'Place the potatoes in a large pot of cold water. Add the salt, bring to a boil and cook until tender, 20 minutes. Drain the potatoes and set aside.', u'Place the pork in a large pot of cold water. Add the onion half, the garlic, and the bay leaves. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low. Simmer gently until the pork is cooked through and is no longer pink in the center, about 45 minutes. Remove the pork from the water and set it aside until it is cool enough to handle (discard the cooking liquid). Using your fingers or 2 forks, shred the meat into small pieces and set aside.', u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute crumbled chorizo until completely cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes, stirring often. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the chorizo to a paper towel lined plate. Add the chopped onions to the chorizo skillet and cook until soft, about 3 to 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the shredded pork, the tomatoes, and the chipotle chiles. Cook until the tomatoes break down and release their juices, about 5 minutes. Return the potatoes and cooked chorizo to the pan. Stir in the vinegar, thyme, marjoram and salt, to taste. Continue to cook over medium heat until some of the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes.', u"While the pork cooks, heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add a tortilla and warm for 10 to 15 seconds. Flip the tortilla over and continue to warm until the tortilla is pliable and heated through, another 10 to 20 seconds. Place warm tortillas in a tortilla warmer or on a plate, cover with a kitchen towel, and set aside; repeat with the remaining tortillas (or warm the tortillas in the microwave: stack them on a plate and cover with a damp cloth; microwave for 30 seconds and keep them covered until you're ready to serve)."]
ingredients: [u'3 medium or 2 large russet potatoes to equal about a pound, peeled and diced', u'1 (2 to 3-pound) pork loin', u'1/2 yellow onion, whole, plus 1 onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 bay leaves', u'12 ounces raw chorizo, casing removed and crumbled', u'1 (28-ounce) can diced tomatoes', u'2 canned chipotle chiles in adobo, finely chopped (seeded and ribbed for less heat)', u'2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', u'1 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon dried marjoram', u' Salt', u'16 corn or flour tortillas', u' Lime wedges', u'1 avocado, halved, pitted, peeled and sliced', u'1 cup fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Mexican Pulled Pork (Tinga Pueblana)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Cut the tops off 4 tomatoes and trim a thin slice off the bottoms so that they will sit upright easily. Hollow out the tomatoes with a spoon over garbage bowl or sink. Season tomatoes with salt and pepper. Remove stem of remaining tomato. Seed and chop tomato.', u'In a bowl, combine chopped tomato, pimentos, onions, zucchini, jalapeno, lemon juice, oregano and cilantro or parsley. Sprinkle bread crumbs evenly over the bowl. Add extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the bowl in a slow stream or about 2 tablespoons. Toss mixture to combine and season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Fill the empty tomatoes with stuffing and serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 yellow vine-ripe tomatoes', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 jarred pimentos, drained and chopped', u'1/4 red onion, chopped', u'1/2 small zucchini, 1/4-inch dice', u'1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed in palm of your hand', u'2 tablespoons, a handful, fresh cilantro or flat-leaf parsley leaves, your choice, chopped', u'2 tablespoons dried bread crumbs', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the bowl']
title: Mexican Stuffed Tomatoes

author: Janet Johnston
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, over low heat, bring the milk, orange zest and sugar to a low simmer. Whisk in the cocoa, light corn syrup, and the chocolate chips. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Remove from the heat and reserve.', u'Cinnamon Sugar:', u'In a small bowl, combine the sugar and cinnamon Reserve.', u'Donuts:', u'Put the water, vanilla, butter, sugar, salt, and the orange zest into a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Remove the mixture from the heat and add the flour. Stir with a wooden spoon until the flour is incorporated and begins to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 8 minutes.', u'Fill a large Dutch oven, over medium heat, halfway with vegetable oil and heat to 360 degrees F.', u'Put the flour mixture into a large bowl. Using a hand mixer, slowly add the eggs 1 at a time. The mixture will break apart as you add each egg but will become smooth again once the egg is incorporated. Make sure each egg has been incorporated into the batter before adding the next.', u'Oil a 1-ounce ice cream scoop and scoop the batter into the hot oil. Fry the dough balls, in batches, until they are a deep golden brown on all sides. Test a fried donut to make sure that the center is cooked and then remove them from the oil. Frying will take about 8 minutes per batch.', u'Put a few donuts into a brown paper bag and pour in 2 tablespoons of the cinnamon sugar mixture. Close the bag and shake. Repeat steps. Serve with chocolate sauce for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/2 orange, zested', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup Mexican cocoa', u'1/2 cup light corn syrup', u'2 tablespoons bittersweet chocolate chips', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon Chinese cassia cinnamon', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 tablespoon Mexican vanilla extract', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 orange, zested', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'4 eggs', u' Brown paper bag']
title: Homemade Donuts with Mexican Chocolate Sauce

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'To make the rhubarb compote: In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring rhubarb, water and sugar to a boil. When sugar is dissolved, lower heat to a simmer and cook until rhubarb is soft, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Puree in a blender until smooth, if necessary. The rhubarb should break down to a smooth compote.', u'To make the brownie batter: In a medium bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, Chile powder, cinnamon and salt. Set aside. In a clean microwavable glass bowl, melt bittersweet and unsweetened chocolate together in the microwave at 50 percent power or in a double boiler. Set aside.', u'In a stand mixer, cream butter and sugar on medium speed. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, combining well. Add in the vanilla and rum. Stir the rhubarb into the chocolate mixture, then add to the batter. Mix until combined. Add the flour mixture and mix just until incorporated. Scrape down the sides with a rubber spatula and gently fold in the semisweet chocolate and walnuts. Do not over mix. Spray an 8 by 8 by 2-inch clear glass baking dish with shortening spray. Line bottom with parchment paper, then spray parchment.  Pour batter into the prepared pan and smooth out top. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 35 to 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool.  Cut into squares and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup rhubarb, strings removed, cut in 1/2-inch slices', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 tablespoon New Mexico chile powder (not chili powder)', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 ounces bittersweet chocolate', u'2 ounces unsweetened chocolate', u'1/2 cup unsalted butter (1 stick), room temperature', u'1 1/2 cups granulated sugar', u'2 large eggs, room temperature', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 teaspoon dark rum', u'2 ounces semisweet chocolate chips', u'1/4 cup chopped walnuts', u' Shortening spray, for baking dish']
title: Mexican Rhubarb Chocolate Chunk Brownies

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Put the chicken in a slow cooker. Sprinkle on the chili powder, cumin and some salt and pepper. Add the tomatoes, chicken broth, black beans, tomatoes with chiles, tomato paste, onion, chipotle pepper and red and yellow peppers. Stir, place the lid on the slow cooker and cook for 5 hours on high or 8 hours on low.', u'Stir in the lime juice. Remove the chicken to a plate and use 2 forks to break it into chunks (or shred it finely). Return the chicken to the pot, taste and add more seasoning if necessary.', u'Serve piping hot in a bowl with avocado, sour cream, grated cheese, crushed tortilla chips and cilantro leaves on top!']
ingredients: [u'3 boneless, skinless whole chicken breasts', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' One 28-ounce can whole or diced tomatoes, with juice', u'3 cups low-sodium chicken broth (more if you like the soup more liquid)', u' One 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed', u' One 10-ounce can diced tomatoes with green chiles, such as Ro*tel', u'4 ounces tomato paste', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1 canned chipotle pepper in adobo (you may add 2 to 3 if you like)', u'1/2 lime, juiced', u' Fixings: avocado, sour cream, grated cheese, crushed tortilla chips and fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Soup

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Put the rice in a large bowl and cover with very hot water. Let it soak anywhere from 5 to 10 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water and drain again.', u'Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan, add the rice and fry over high heat, stirring softly for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the onion and stir, from time to time, until the rice begins to change its color to milky white and it sounds and feels heavier, as if it were grains of sand, about 5 more minutes.', u'Add the chicken stock, celery, parsley, lime juice, salt and chile to the rice. When the mixture starts to boil, cover the pot, reduce the heat to lowest setting and cook until the rice is cooked through and the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes.', u"If the rice grains don't seem soft and cooked through, add a bit more chicken stock or water and let it cook for another 5 more minutes or so. Remove the pan from the heat and let it sit covered for 5 to 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside.", u'Plantains:', u"Cook's Note: The skin of the plantain should be almost entirely black when it is mature and ready to use.", u'Peel the plantains and slice them diagonally into 1/4-inch thick slices.', u'In a saute pan over medium heat, add about 1/4-inch of oil. Heat the oil until hot but not smoking. Add the plantain slices and fry until lightly browned, but not blackened, about 2 minutes. Remove the plantains from the oil to a plate covered with paper towels, to drain.', u'Transfer the rice to a large serving bowl and arrange the hot plantains on top. Garnish with a good dollop of sour cream and serve.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups long-grain white rice', u'3 tablespoons corn or safflower oil, plus more for frying plantains', u'1/2 cup finely chopped white onion', u'4 cups chicken stock, prepared or homemade, recipe follows', u'1 celery stalk, cut in 1/2', u'1 fresh parsley sprig', u'1 tablespoon lime juice', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 serrano chile', u'2 ripe plantains, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u' Sour cream, garnish', u'1 whole chicken, cut into pieces', u'2 carrots, peeled and cut into chunks', u'1 white onion, peeled and cut in 1/2', u'2 celery stalks, cleaned and cut into chunks', u'1 garlic clove', u'5 or 6 peppercorns', u' Bunch parsley sprigs', u'1 tablespoon sea or kosher salt, plus more for seasoning']
title: Mexican White Rice with Fried Plantains

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place chicken pieces in a large resealable plastic bag. Combine the tequila, lime juice, garlic, cilantro and brown sugar in a mixing bowl and whisk until the sugar is dissolved. Pour over chicken pieces and seal the bag, trying to release as much air as possible. Refrigerate the chicken for 45 minutes to 1 hour, turning occasionally.', u'While the chicken is marinating, make the sauce.', u'Preheat the broiler to 500 degrees F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'Combine the tomatoes, onion, and garlic cloves on the baking sheet and broil until slightly caramelized around the edges, about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and transfer the garlic to a small plate to cool. Using a spatula or large spoon, turn the tomatoes and onions so that the uncooked sides are up. Return to the broiler until slightly caramelized on the second side, about 6 to 8 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool. In a large skillet over high heat, toast the chiles on all sides until lightly browned and fragrant. Do not allow to burn. Transfer to a medium bowl, cover with hot water and allow to sit until softened, about 30 minutes. In the same skillet, combine the sesame seeds and reserved chile seeds and toast until light brown and fragrant. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside. Add the peppercorns, cinnamon stick, cloves, oregano and thyme to the hot skillet and "toast" for a few seconds, just until their perfume is released.  Transfer to the bowl with the sesame seeds.', u'When cool enough to handle, peel the garlic cloves and add these, along with the charred tomatoes and onion, to the bowl of a food processor. Add the seeds and spices. Drain the liquid off of the chiles and add these to the processor as well. Add the roasted nuts and raisins, and 1 cup of the chicken stock and puree the mixture until very smooth and thick, scraping down the sides of the blender frequently.', u'In a large deep pot, heat 3 tablespoons of the vegetable oil until very hot. Carefully pour the pureed mixture into the pot (be careful ? it will splatter) and bring the mixture to a boil. Lower the heat so that the mixture simmers, and add 3 1/2 ounces of the chocolate to the pot. Cover and cook, stirring frequently, for about 1 hour, or until the mole paste is very thick and flavorful. At this point you should have about 3 1/2 cups of mole paste. Reserve 1 cup to make the Mole sauce, and reserve the remaining paste for another use. The mole paste will keep for at least 6 months, refrigerated, or up to 1 year if frozen.', u'Preheat the broiler to 500 degrees F.', u'To make the sauce, heat the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until very hot. Add the tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the cup of reserved mole paste and the remaining 1 to 1 1/2 cups of chicken stock and stir to combine well. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, until the mixture is a nice sauce consistency. Add the remaining 1/2-ounce of Mexican chocolate and the salt and cook another 2 minutes, or until the chocolate is melted and the sauce is thick, smooth and flavorful. Keep warm while you cook the chicken.', u'Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and place the chicken pieces on the baking sheet. Broil for 5 minutes, or until the chicken is charred in places. Turn the chicken and continue to broil for an additional 5 minutes, or until the second side is charred. Reduce the heat to 325 degrees F and continue to cook the chicken until the juices run clear, about 10 more minutes.', u'Serve the chicken immediately, with some of the mole sauce spooned over the top, garnished with some of the chopped cilantro. Pass tortillas at the table.']
ingredients: [u'1 (3 1/2 to 4-pound) chicken, cut into 8 pieces', u'1/2 cup tequila', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'2 large tomatoes (1 1/4 pounds)', u'1 medium onion, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks', u'10 cloves garlic, unpeeled', u'10 ancho chiles, (3 ounces), stem removed and seeded (reserve seeds)', u'5 guajillo chiles, (1 1/2 ounces), stem removed and seeded (reserve seeds)', u'1/4 cup sesame seeds', u'1 tablespoon black peppercorns', u'1 stick cinnamon, about 2 inches long', u'4 whole cloves', u'1/4 cup fresh Mexican oregano leaves, or 2 teaspoons dried', u'1/4 cup fresh thyme leaves, or 2 teaspoons dried', u'1/4 cup shelled and skinned almond, roasted', u'1/4 cup shelled peanuts, roasted', u'1/4 cup raisins', u'2 to 2 1/2 cups chicken stock, hot (plus a little more if necessary)', u'4 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 ounces (2 tablets) Mexican chocolate, chopped', u'1 (14-ounce) can tomato puree', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro', u' Fresh tortillas, for serving']
title: Tequila-Marinated Chicken with Mexican Mole Sauce

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the onions, bell peppers, and jalapenos and cook, stirring, until soft, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until opaque and nutty in aroma, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the chicken broth, tomatoes, salt, Southwest Essence, and saffron, if using. Stir well and bring to a boil. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and transfer to the oven. Bake until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, 25 to 30 minutes.', u'Remove from the oven and let sit, undisturbed, for 5 to 10 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the green onions and cilantro, if desired. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup olive oil', u'3 cups chopped yellow onions', u'1 red bell pepper, chopped (about 1 cup)', u'1 green bell pepper, chopped (about 1 cup)', u'1/3 cup chopped seeded jalapenos (about 2 extra-large jalapenos)', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 1/2 cups long-grain white rice', u'2 1/2 cups canned low-sodium chicken broth or 2 1/2 cups chicken Stock', u'2 cups peeled, seeded, and chopped ripe Roma tomatoes (about 1 1/2 pounds)', u'2 teaspoons salt, or to taste, depending on the saltiness of the broth', u"2 teaspoons Emeril's Southwest Essence", u'2 pinches saffron, optional', u'1/3 cup thinly sliced green onions, optional', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves, optional']
title: Mexican Rice Casserole

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. ', u'Roast the poblano and jalepeno chiles directly in the flame of a gas burner, turning until charred on all sides. (Alternatively, if cooking with an electric stove, broil until charred.) Put chiles in a bowl, cover and steam until soft and cool, about 20 minutes. Peel, seed, and chop.  ', u'Spread the tomatillos on a foil-lined pan, season with salt, pepper and drizzle with olive oil.  Bake in the oven until soft and slightly charred, 30 minutes.  Meanwhile, cut tortillas into wedges and lay out on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Spray both sides with olive oil spray and bake until crisp and golden, turning half way in between, 8 minutes per side.', u'Saute onions and garlic in 3 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil until soft and starting to brown, 8 minutes. Add peppers, tomatoes, cumin, paprika, sugar and water and cook until tomatoes begin to burst and flavors come together, 5 minutes. ', u'Divide sauce between 4 small dishes. Poach eggs and lay 1 egg on each plate over sauce. Garnish with a couple of baked tortillas, crumbled queso fresco, a pinch of paprika and chopped cilantro. ', u'Copyright 2005 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'4 poblano chiles', u'2 jalapenos chiles', u'16 tomatillos, (about 1 pound) husked, rinsed, and quartered', u'3 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling tomatillos', u'1 (10-inch) whole wheat tortilla', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'1 large onion, finely diced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u' Pinch paprika, plus extra for garnish', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons water', u'4 large eggs', u'4 ounces queso fresco or feta cheese, crumbled', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Mexican Poached Eggs

directions: [u"In a large well seasoned or nonstick skillet, heat the oil or pork fat over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring frequently, until deep golden, about 10 minutes. Stir in the garlic, cook for a minute or so, then use a slotted spoon to scoop in about 1/4 of the beans, leaving most of the liquid behind. With a bean or potato masher, or the back of a large spoon, mash the beans into a coarse puree. Add another portion of the beans, mash them in, and continue until all the beans have been added and coarsely mashed. Add about a cup of bean liquid or water and stir frequently over the heat until the beans are still a little soupier than you'd like to serve them (they'll thicken as they sit.) Taste and season with salt if needed."]
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, lard, bacon or chorizo drippings', u'1 medium white onion chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped', u'4 cups undrained, seasoned cooked beans, slightly warm', u' Salt, to taste', u'1/2 cup crumbled Mexican queso fresco, queso anejo, pressed, salted farmers cheese, dry feta or Parmesan, for garnish', u' Tortilla chips, for garnish']
title: Classic Mexican Fried Beans with Onions and Garlic

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Build your salad on a large platter. Use bib lettuce as the bed, then layer the tomatoes and scatter the red onions around the platter.', u'Cut the avocado in half lengthwise cutting around the pit. Separate the halves and scoop out the pit with a spoon, then use the spoon to scoop the avocado from its skin. Place the avocado in a food processor bowl and combine with lemon juice, chopped red onion, cilantro, coarse salt and water. Grind until the avocado mixture is smooth, then stream oil into dressing. Adjust seasonings and pour over salad, then serve. Dressing may be stored 3 or 4 days in airtight container.']
ingredients: [u'2 heads bib lettuce, cleaned and dried', u'4 medium red vine ripe tomatoes, cut into wedges', u'2 medium yellow vine ripe tomatoes, cut into wedges', u'1/2 large red onion, thinly sliced plus 3 tablespoons chopped red onion', u'1 ripe avocado', u'3 lemons, juiced', u' Handful fresh cilantro leaves, 2 tablespoons', u'1 teaspoon coarse salt', u'3 tablespoons water, a couple of splashes', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil']
title: Mexican Salad with Tomatoes, Red Onions and Avocado Dressing

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Spread 2 tablespoons salsa over one side of tortilla. Top with cheese, red pepper, chiles and olives. Broil until cheese begins to bubble. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'2 tortillas, store bought', u' Salsa', u' Monterey jack cheese, grated', u' Red pepper, diced', u' Canned green chiles', u' Black olives, sliced']
title: Mexican Pizza

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a skillet, cook the sausage over medium-high heat, stirring, until browned and the fat is rendered, about 4 minutes. Add the onions, garlic, Essence, and chili powder, and cook, stirring, until the onions are soft, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool.', u'In a bowl, combine the cheeses.', u'Place 4 tortillas on a work surface. Top each tortilla with about 1/4 cup of the sausage mixture.', u'Top each with some cheese and a few jalapeno slices and top with another tortilla.', u'Add another layer of sausage, cheese, and jalapeno finishing with 1 more tortilla. Each stack should be 3 tortillas and 2 layers of filling.', u'Press firmly down on the top of each stack.', u'Lightly oil the grill or griddle and cook the stacks for about 3 minutes per side, or until the tortillas are golden brown and the cheese is melted. Cut each into 4 pieces.', u'Place on a serving platter and garnish with the cilantro. Serve hot with Spicy Sour Cream Dip, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'24 ounces chorizo or other hot sausage, removed from casings and crumbled', u'2 cups finely chopped yellow onions', u'1 1/2 tablespoons finely chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon Essence, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2 cups grated Monterey Jack', u'2 cups grated cheddar', u'4 large fresh jalapenos, stems and ends removed, cut into 20 slices about 1/4-inch thick each', u'12 corn tortillas', u' Chopped fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Spicy Sour Cream Dip, recipe follows', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 chipotle chile in adobo, chopped', u'1 teaspoon abobo sauce', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1/4 teaspoon salt']
title: Manly Mexican Bites

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and ancho chile powder. Sear, skin side down, in the oil until golden brown. Turn over and brown on the other side. Remove the chicken to a plate. ', u'Add the onion to the pan and cook until lightly golden brown. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the chicken back to the pot, add the chiles, stock, and cilantro, and bring to a boil. Cover and roast in the oven until the chicken easily falls away from the bone, about 40 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pot and strain the cooking liquid into a bowl. ', u'When the chicken is cool enough to handle, remove bones and cut or shred the meat into bite-sized pieces. Place the reserved cooking liquid into a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer. Add the shredded chicken, turn off the heat and let warm.', u'Divide the warm chicken among the warm tortillas, top with Salsa Verde and chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 pounds chicken legs and thighs, skin removed', u' Salt', u'3 tablespoons ancho chile powder', u'1 large yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 ancho chile, coarsely chopped', u'2 New Mexican chiles, coarsely chopped', u'4 cups chicken stock', u'6 sprigs cilantro, plus more chopped, for garnish', u'12 flour tortillas, warmed', u' Salsa Verde, recipe follows']
title: New Mexican-Style Soft Tacos with Hacked Chicken and Salsa Verde

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a medium saucepot on medium heat, melt the Mexican chocolate with the heavy cream. Whisk constantly until the chocolate is fully melted, and take care not to burn the chocolate. Turn the heat off and reserve.', u'Preheat a gas or charcoal grill, or a stovetop grill pan, over medium-high heat.', u'In a medium mixing bowl, mix the sugar with the cinnamon until evenly incorporated. Toss the bananas with the sugar-cinnamon mixture until fully coated. Transfer to the grill, flat-side down. Grill until the bananas are browned and the sugar is caramelized, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer the bananas to a serving platter. Drizzle with the Mexican chocolate sauce, sprinkle with some shredded coconut and serve with vanilla ice cream.']
ingredients: [u' One 3.2-ounce disk Mexican chocolate, chopped', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'4 firm, ripe bananas, peeled, halved lengthwise, cut into 4 pieces each', u' Vanilla ice cream, softened, for serving', u' Sweetened shredded coconut, for serving']
title: Grilled Bananas with Mexican Chocolate Sauce

directions: [u'Heat a stove-top grill pan or griddle with cooking spray and set over medium-high heat to preheat.', u'Place corn on hot pan and cook 3 to 5 minutes, until golden brown on all sides, turning frequently. Remove from heat and cool. When cool enough to handle, slice kernels from cob. Transfer kernels to a large bowl and add chicken, beans, cheese, olives, tomatoes, apple, jalapenos, and cilantro. Toss to combine.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'2 ears fresh or frozen cob corn, thawed', u'4 reserved cooked chicken breast halves, diced', u'1 (15-ounce) can pinto beans, drained', u'1 cup Monterey Jack or pepper Jack cheese, shredded', u'1/2 cup Spanish olives, sliced', u'1/2 cup tomatoes, diced', u'1 Granny Smith apple, cored and diced', u'1/4 cup pickled jalapenos, sliced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 cup cider vinegar']
title: Mexican Chopped Salad with Toasted Cumin Vinaigrette

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place an oven-proof container with 2 cups water in the lower rack of the oven (this will create steam and help to prevent the cheesecakes from cracking).', u'Put the graham crackers in the bowl of a food processor and process to crumbs (about 2 cups). Add the butter and process until well combined.', u'Divide the crumbs among the 12 muffin cups, patting them tightly with your fingers. Put the pan on a baking sheet and bake the crust until golden, about 5 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack, about 10 minutes.', u'In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese and condensed milk until smooth and pale, and then beat in the requeson and vanilla until smooth. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the orange zest and mix until just combined. Pour the custard into the cooled crusts.', u'Bake until the cheesecakes are puffed and golden and a tester inserted 1 inch from the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Let cool on a rack at room temperature for 35 minutes. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight. Carefully unmold each cheesecake and place on a platter. Bring to room temperature before serving.', u'Top each cheesecake with Apple Cranberry Compote, if desired, before serving.']
ingredients: [u'5 ounces (9 whole crackers) cinnamon-sugar graham crackers', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'4 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature', u'2/3 cup sweetened condensed milk (from a 14-ounce can)', u'1 cup fresh requeson or ricotta cheese', u'2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'2 large eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon grated orange zest (from 1 small orange)', u' Apple Cranberry Compote, recipe follows', u' Special equipment: 1 silicone 12 (1/2 cup) muffin mold', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter', u'1/4 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'1 Granny Smith apple, cored and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup dried cranberries', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon']
title: Mexican Ricotta Cheesecakes with Apple and Cranberry Compote

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the sweet lime yogurt: Mix together the yogurt, sweetened condensed milk and lime zest and juice in a medium bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.', u"For the fruit cocktail: Add the lime zest and juice to a pitcher with the sugar and 1 cup water. Stir until the sugar dissolves-you'll know this has happened when the liquid turns from cloudy to clear.", u'Add the mango, papaya, grapes, maraschino cherries, pineapple and melon to a large bowl. Gently mix the fruit with some of the lime syrup, adding more until it is as sweet as you would like it. (The lime syrup will keep for 1 month refrigerated.)', u'Serve with the sweet lime yogurt.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups plain Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk', u' Zest of 1/2 lime plus juice of 1 lime', u' Zest and juice of 2 large limes', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 mango, peeled and cut into cubes', u'1 papaya, peeled, seeded and cut into cubes', u'1 small bunch green grapes, cut in half', u'1 small jar maraschino cherries, drained and cut in half', u'1/2 pineapple, peeled and cut into chunks', u'1/2 honeydew melon, peeled, seeded and cut into chunks']
title: Mexican Fruit Cocktail with Sweet Lime Yogurt

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Whisk in the milk, little by little, until thoroughly combined. Add the chicken stock and bring sauce to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened and flavorful, about 10 minutes. Add the pepper jack and stir until melted. Season with the salt and remove from the heat. Set aside, covered, while you assemble the remaining ingredients.', u'Heat a small skillet over high heat. When hot, add 1/2 teaspoon of the vegetable oil and 1 of the tortillas. Cook until soft, turning midway, about 1 minute per tortilla. Transfer to a plate and cover while you cook the remaining tortillas, adding additional 1/2 teaspoon of oil for each tortilla. Set aside on a plate and cover with plastic wrap or foil.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-by 13-inch casserole.', u'Spoon 1 cup of the sauce onto the bottom of the casserole dish. Top with 6 of the tortillas, spreading them evenly to form a complete layer. Top with half of the chicken, 1 teaspoon of the Southwest Essence, half of the poblanos, half of the green onions, 1 1/2 cups of the sauce, and 1/3 of the shredded Monterey Jack. Make another layer in exactly the same way: 6 tortillas, the remaining chicken, 1 teaspoon of the Southwest Essence, remaining poblanos, remaining green onions, 1 1/2 cups of the sauce, and 1/3 of the shredded Monterey Jack. Top with the remaining 6 tortillas, remaining sauce, tomatoes, cilantro, and remaining Monterey Jack, then sprinkle the Queso Anejo evenly over the top.', u'Cover the casserole with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove the foil and continue to bake for about 15 minutes longer, or until the casserole is bubbly and light golden brown on top.', u'Serve immediately, garnished with a dollop of sour cream, more chopped cilantro, and a spoonful of salsa or pico de gallo, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons butter', u'6 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 1/2 cups milk', u'1 1/2 cups chicken stock', u'1/2 pound shredded pepper jack cheese', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'9 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'18 corn tortillas', u'4 cups cooked cubed or bite size chicken meat (2 pounds boneless skinless breasts)', u"2 teaspoons Emeril's Southwest Essence", u'6 poblano peppers, roasted, peeled and seeded', u'1 cup chopped green onions', u'3/4 pound (3 cups) shredded Monterey Jack cheese', u'1 cup chopped fresh tomatoes', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus more for garnishing, if desired', u'4 ounces Queso Anejo, shredded (substitute Parmesan if unavailable)', u'1 cup sour cream, for serving', u' Salsa or Pico de Gallo, for serving, optional']
title: Mexican Enchilada Suiza Lasagna

directions: [u'In a blender or food processor, blend chiles pasillas and anchos with tomatoes, onion and garlic. Strain. Heat oil in a stock pot. Pour blended chile mixture into a pot and fry until it thickens and fat rises to the surface. Add epazote. Mix in the boiling broth and long chiles pasillas. Salt to taste and simmer for 25 minutes. ', u'To serve, pour soup into a tureen. Divide tortillas strips among individual bowls. Ladle soup over tortilla strips. Serve chiles, avocado, cheese and creme fraiche in separate bowls, allowing diners to season soup, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 chiles pasillas, washed, seeded, deveined plus 2 long chiles pasillas, all fried in a little oil', u'2 chiles anchos, washed, seeded, deveined and fried in a little oil', u'4 medium tomatoes, peeled', u'1 white onion, sliced', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2/3 cup olive oil or corn oil', u'2 sprigs epazote or cilantro', u'6 quarts chicken broth', u' Salt', u'2 cups vegetable oil', u'24 tortillas, sliced in thin strips and dried for 1 day', u'8 chiles pasillas, fried in a little oil or lard', u'2 avocados, finely chopped', u'2 cups fresh cheese, such as panela or feta, finely crumbled', u'1 cup creme fraiche, or 1 cup sour cream mixed with 1/4 half-and-half']
title: Sopa de Tortilla a la Mexicana: Tortilla Soup, Mexican Style

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 13 by 9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Put a medium glass bowl over a pot of simmering water. Add the chocolate chips and 1 tablespoon canola oil. Stir frequently until the chocolate melts, then remove from the heat and let cool a bit.', u'In a large bowl add the sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Mix until well combined and the sugar has dissolved, about 2 minutes. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, pumpkin pie spice and chili powder.  Add to the egg mixture and stir well until everything is combined. Add the remaining oil and mix with an electric hand mixer until smooth. Stir in the melted chocolate and mix well. Pour into the prepared pan and bake until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the brownie, about 30 to 35 minutes. Cool and dust with powdered sugar before serving.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips', u'1 cup canola oil, plus 1 tablespoon', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup cocoa powder', u'1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'1 tablespoon powdered sugar, for garnish']
title: Mexican Brownies

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, mix the requeson, pickled vegetables and cilantro to combine. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Prepare a barbecue or grill pan to medium-high. Arrange the tortillas in a single layer on the grill. Cook until the tortillas are crisp, 5 minutes per side. Serve with the requeson spread.']
ingredients: [u'1 (1-pound) container whole milk requeson, or ricotta cheese', u'1/2 cup canned pickled jalapenos, carrots and onions, drained and chopped (recommended: La Costena)', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon ground pepper', u'6 white corn tortillas']
title: Mexican Ricotta Spread with Grilled Tostadas

directions: [u'In a very large stockpot, bring about 6 quarts water to a boil. Plunge the crabs headfirst into the water, and cook for 12 minutes from the time the water returns to the boil. Remove the crabs with tongs and set aside. When cool, remove the triangular belly flap on the underside and discard. Turn crab over and starting from rear of crab, pull firmly to lift off top shell, and discard. Pull off and discard the spongy fingers from the body and the tiny paddles from the front. Scoop out the orange crab butter and, if desired, reserve for another use. Cut the body into quarters and pick the crabmeat from inside, using a small fork or a metal pick, and reserve. Twist the claws and legs off of the body. Crack the claws and legs along the edges of the shells, using a heavy nutcracker or a small hammer. Pick the crabmeat from the claws and legs, and reserve. ', u'Try to keep the crabmeat in fairly large chunks, but make sure you get all of it. ', u'In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs lightly. Add the sour cream, diced poblano and yellow peppers, celery, salt, and pepper. Toss together until well mixed. Add the crab, shredding it into approximately 3/4 inch chunks, and the bread crumbs. Mix together gently but thoroughly. ', u'Divide the mixture into 12 cakes, shaping them into patties about 3/4 inch thick and 3 inches in diameter. Refrigerate them on a large plate, loosely covered, for 1 hour. ', u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. In a large heavy skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the butter and 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium high heat. Saute 6 crab cakes at a time, for about 3 minutes on each side, being very careful when you turn them so that they do not fall apart. They should be golden brown on each side. Place the cooked crab cakes on a baking sheet in the oven to keep warm while you add the remaining butter and oil to the pan and saute the other six crab cakes in the same way.']
ingredients: [u'3 whole Dungeness Crabs (about 6 pounds), or 1-1/2 pounds picked over crabmeat', u'2 large eggs', u'1 cup sour cream', u'2 poblano chiles, stemmed, seeded, and finely diced', u'1 yellow bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and finely diced', u'1 rib celery, finely diced', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup fresh bread crumbs', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil']
title: Mexican Crab Cakes

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Saute 1 chopped onion in 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in 1 cup white rice and cook until toasted, 3 minutes. Add 1 2/3 cups water, 1 chopped plum tomato, 2 teaspoons tomato paste and 1/2 teaspoon each kosher salt and cumin; bring to a boil. Add 1 whole jalapeno. Cover; simmer 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and let sit 5 minutes. Discard the jalapeno. Top with cilantro.', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
title: Spicy Mexican Rice

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Generously sprinkle the pork chops on both sides with salt and pepper. In a medium bowl, stir together the garlic, 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, the rosemary and thyme until combined. Rub the mixture evenly on both sides of the pork chops and let stand for 5 minutes.', u'Heat the remaining 1 teaspoon oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the pork chops on each side until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side.  Reduce the heat to medium, add the pineapple juice, wine and pearl onions. Cover and simmer until the pork chops are cooked through, about 8 minutes.', u'Using a slotted spoon, transfer the pork chops and onions to a serving platter and cover to keep warm.  In a small bowl, mash the butter and flour together with a fork until it forms a paste; whisk the paste into the simmering liquid and cook for about 1 minute, until the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper and drizzle it over the pork chops just before serving. Serve with Mexican Couscous.']
ingredients: [u' Four 4-ounce boneless pork chops, about 1/2-inch thick', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'5 cloves garlic, finely minced', u'2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped rosemary, from 1 sprig', u'2 teaspoons finely minced thyme leaves, from 1 large sprig', u'1 cup pineapple juice', u'1/3 cup dry white wine', u'1 pound fresh pearl onions, peeled, or frozen, thawed and drained', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, softened', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u' Mexican Couscous, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 cup dried couscous', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup pine nuts, toasted', u'1 jalapeno pepper, stemmed, seeded, deveined, and finely chopped', u' Kosher salt']
title: Pork Chops with Pineapple Gravy and Mexican Couscous

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.', u'For the lime salt: Add the kosher salt and lime zest to a spice grinder. Pulse a few times to combine. Set aside in a small bowl.', u'For the spicy mayonnaise: In a bowl, whisk the mayonnaise, chili sauce and lime juice together until combined. Set aside.', u'For the corn: Grill the corn until lightly charred on all sides. Cut the ears in half and transfer to a large bowl. Toss with the Monterey Jack and some of the spicy mayonnaise to coat, using more or less mayonnaise to your liking.', u'Stack the corn on a large plate and sprinkle with the lime salt. Garnish with lime wedges, cilantro leaves and extra cheese if you like.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup kosher salt', u' Zest of 2 limes', u'1 1/2 cups mayonnaise', u'3 tablespoons spicy chili sauce', u' Juice of 2 limes', u'6 ears fresh corn on the cob, shucked and silks removed', u'1 cup shredded Monterey Jack, plus more for garnish, optional', u' Lime wedges, for garnish', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Grilled Mexican Street Corn

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F. Mix 2 tablespoons butter, the garlic, lime zest, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a small bowl. Coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Place the salmon skin-side down on the prepared baking sheet and spread the lime butter evenly over the top. Bake until the salmon is just cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, melt the remaining 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and cook, stirring, until soft and translucent, 3 minutes. Add the tomatillos and cook until slightly soft, about 4 minutes. Add the corn and chile pepper. Cook, stirring often, until warmed through, about 6 minutes.', u'Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the crema, cilantro and half of the lime juice; season with salt, pepper and more lime juice. Cut the salmon into 4 pieces and serve with the creamed corn.', u'Photograph by Ryan Liebe']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 clove garlic, grated', u' Zest and juice of 1 lime', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Cooking spray', u'1 1/2 pounds skin-on salmon fillet (in one piece), preferably sockeye', u'2 medium shallots, chopped', u'5 small tomatillos (about 8 ounces), husked, rinsed and quartered', u'3 ears corn, kernels cut off (about 4 cups)', u'1 Fresno chile pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1/3 cup Mexican crema or sour cream', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped']
title: Slow-Roasted Salmon with Mexican Creamed Corn

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Brush an 8 x 8-inch casserole dish with oil. Set aside.', u'In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the raw noodle bundles, and saute turning with a pair of tongs until golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes. Transfer the noodles and any pieces to a plate.', u'Saute the onion in the same skillet, over medium heat, until light golden, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic, ground coriander, oregano, chile powder, and bay leaf, stirring until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and the chipotles, increase the heat to high, and cook for 2 minutes, until thickened. Add the broth and noodles to the skillet and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a gentle simmer, lower the heat and cook for 5 minutes, breaking up the noodles with a spoon. Stir in the turkey. Turn the mixture into the casserole dish. Sprinkle the cheese over and cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes.', u'In a small serving bowl, stir together the sour cream and fresh coriander. Serve the casserole with the flavored sour cream and the lime wedges on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for preparing the pan', u'10 ounces fine vermicelli noodles in bundles (fideo)', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'3 large garlic cloves, minced', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', u'1 teaspoon New Mexican chile powder', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 1/2 cups canned tomatoes and juices, crushed', u'1 to 2 chipotles en adobo, minced', u'1 1/2 cups chicken broth, homemade or low-sodium canned', u'2 cups diced cooked turkey, chicken, or smoked chicken breast', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup coarsely chopped queso anejo or feta cheese', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh coriander (cilantro)', u'1 lime, cut into wedges']
title: Mexican Turkey Noodle Casserole

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F and preheat 6 ounces canola oil to 400 degrees F.', u'For the tempura: In a small mixing bowl, add 1 cup flour, cornstarch, Sabor Italia, egg white and enough water to have a pancake-like consistency. Mix until thoroughly combined.', u'Thread chicken slices onto wooden skewers. Season, to taste, with Sabor Italia. Dredge the skewers into 1/2 cup flour and then into prepared batter. Place skewers immediately into preheated oil and fry until golden brown. Place onto a baking sheet and finish in the oven, about 5 minutes. Do the same for the shrimp.', u'For the sauce: In a medium saute pan over medium-high heat, saute the poblano, onions and a pinch of Sabor Italia. Add the red wine and chocolate and stir until combine. Add the chili powder and remaining Sabor Italia and stir until thickened. Add the chopped tomatoes and stir. Continue to cook for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro leaves.', u'Place skewers on a platter and top with sauce.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces canola oil', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, divided', u'1/2 cup cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons Sabor Italia, recipe follows', u'6 egg whites', u' Water, for consistency', u'2 chicken breasts, pounded thin and sliced', u'4 large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 poblano chile, grilled, peeled, seeded and diced', u'1/2 onion, diced', u'2 tablespoons Sabor Italia, divided, recipe follows', u'2 ounces red wine', u'1/4 cup milk chocolate', u'2 tablespoons chili powder', u'1/4 cup canned tomatoes', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u' Special equipment: wooden skewers soaked in water for 20 minutes', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', u'2 tablespoons granulated garlic powder', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/4 teaspoon dried basil', u'1/4 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/8 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes']
title: Mexican Style Tempura with a Chili Chocolate Sauce

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'In a food processor, combine the shrimp, egg, cilantro, garlic, 3/4 cup bread crumbs, poblano chile, salt, and pepper. Process until the mixture is a coarse puree.  Form the mixture into 6 patties and set aside (if the mixture is too wet, add additional bread crumbs, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the mixture can be molded easily). ', u'Put a grill pan over medium-high heat or preheat a gas or charcoal grill. Brush the patties with vegetable oil and grill until golden, about 3 minutes per side, depending on the thickness.  ', u'Avocado Aioli:', u'Scoop the avocado pulp into the bowl of a food processor.  Add the mayonnaise, lime juice, garlic cloves, serrano chile and cilantro. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'To assemble:', u'Serve the shrimp burgers on buns, topped with a dollop of avocado aioli, sliced tomato, and lettuce.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound medium shrimp, shelled and deveined', u'1 egg', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 garlic clove, peeled', u'3/4 cup plain bread crumbs, plus more as needed', u'1 poblano chile, roasted, peeled, stemmed, seeded, and diced', u'1 teaspoon sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 Hass avocado, halved, pitted, and peeled', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'2 medium garlic cloves, peeled', u'1 serrano chile, stemmed, halved and seeded', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'6 hamburger buns, split in half', u'3 medium tomatoes, sliced', u'6 lettuce leaves or a mixture of baby lettuce leaves']
title: Mexican Shrimp "Burgers"

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Using a sharp knife, break up the chocolate into smaller pieces. In a saucepan, combine the chopped chocolate, milk, sugar, and salt over medium-low flame. Heat and stir until the chocolate is completely melted and milk is very hot, but not boiling, about 10 minutes.', u'Remove from the heat and froth the chocolate milk with a mini whisk or molinillo. Divide the hot chocolate among big mugs, top each with a few marshmallows, and serve with the cinnamon sticks as stirrers.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces (tablet or cone) Mexican chocolate or bittersweet chocolate', u'3 cups milk', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u' Pinch salt', u' Miniature marshmallows, for serving', u'6 cinnamon sticks (preferably Mexican canela), for serving']
title: Mexican Hot Chocolate

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'In bowl over double boiler, melt piloncillo, both chocolates, and butter. Allow mixture to cool.', u'In another bowl, whisk the eggs, sugar, both extracts, and espresso until well mixed. Then pour cooled chocolate mixture in the eggs. Mix well then add the flour and walnuts. Add this mixture to a greased 9 by 13-inch baking pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes until brownies are well set.', u'Whisk cream until stiff, then add 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon (canela).', u'Cut a wedge of brownie and serve with dollop of canela crema.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound cone piloncillo', u'6 ounces unsweetened chocolate', u'6 ounces Mexican chocolate', u'1/2 pound butter', u'5 eggs', u'2 1/2 cups sugar, plus 1 tablespoon', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 teaspoon almond extract', u'3 teaspoon espresso', u'1 1/2 cup flour', u'1/2 pound walnuts', u'1 cup cream', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon']
title: Mexican Brownies with Canela Whipped Cream

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'In a medium mixing bowl combine black beans, diced tomatoes, taco seasoning and 1/2 cup of the shredded pepper jack. Mix to combined and set aside.', u'In a small bowl beat together the egg and water and set aside.', u'Place the 4 pie dough rounds on a floured work surface. Using a 3-inch round cutter cut out 32 dough circles.', u'Place about a teaspoon of the black bean mixture into the center of 1/2 of the dough circles. Place 1 dough circle on top of bean mixture and gentle press down with your finger to seal it to the bottom piece of dough. Crimp the edges with a fork. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.', u'Place all 16 formed pinata pockets onto two baking sheets. Brush the tops with egg wash and sprinkle each with remaining cheese. Bake for 15 minutes.', u'Serve hot with a bowl of salsa for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 (15-ounce) can black beans', u'1 (15-ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles', u'2 teaspoons taco seasoning', u'3/4 cup shredded pepper jack cheese', u'1 egg', u'1 tablespoon water', u'2 boxes refrigerator pie crust (4 rounds)', u' Jar salsa']
title: Mexican Pinata Pockets

directions: [u'Rinse chipotles. Wearing rubber gloves, separately seed and mince chipotles and jalapenos. Mince onion and garlic. Peel, seed, and chop tomatoes. Rinse and drain chick-peas, and in a large bowl stir together all ingredients except additional lime juice. ', u'Chill the salad, covered, at least 2 hours and up to 1 day. Season salad with salt and add additional lime juice. Serve salad at cool room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'2 canned chipotle chiles in adobo', u'3 fresh jalapeno chiles', u'1 medium onion', u'2 garlic cloves', u'3 medium vine-ripened tomatoes', u'4 cups drained canned chick-peas (2 19-ounce cans)', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice plus additional to taste', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican-Style Chick-Pea Salad

directions: [u'Trim the beef chuck and place in a container just large enough to hold it. Pour the Beer Marinade over and refrigerate several hours or overnight. ', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lift the meat from the marinade and pat dry. Reserve the marinade. Over a medium high heat, in a heavy Dutch oven, heat the lard. Brown the steak on both sides. Add the onions and cook for 3 minutes. Add the garlic, cook for 2 minutes and then add tomatoes, salt, pepper, bay leaves, beer, water, and the reserved marinade. ', u'Cover and bake about 45 minutes. Add the carrots and potatoes. Cover and cook an additional 45 minutes or until the meat is very tender.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 to 3 pounds beef chuck', u' Beer Marinade, recipe follows', u'3 tablespoons pork lard or vegetable oil', u'2 medium onions, cut into thick slices', u'4 garlic cloves, finely mashed', u'3 medium tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped', u'1 teaspoon sea salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 bay leaves', u'3 cups dark beer', u'3 cups water', u'4 large carrots, peeled and cut into chunks', u'4 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1 cup dark beer', u'1/4 cup lemon juice', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sea salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1 teaspoon basil', u'1 teaspoon oregano', u'1 teaspoon thyme']
title: Mexican Pot Roast

directions: [u'Spread the Chocolate Chipotle Powder out on a large plate. Rim 2 (8-ounce) martini glasses by rolling the edge of each glass on a clean wet sponge, then rolling the edge over the powder. Tap the glass gently to knock off the extra powder. Pour the rest of the ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker is frosty. Strain immediately into the glasses and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Chocolate Chipotle Powder, recipe follows', u'1 1/2 ounces dark chocolate liqueur', u'1 1/2 ounces chocolate vodka', u'1 1/2 ounces tequila (preferable 100 percent agave reposado)', u'1 1/2 coffee flavor liqueur (recommended: Kahlua)']
title: Mexican Chocolate Martini

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'For the Mexican chocolate ganache: Put the chocolate in a heatproof bowl. Bring the cream just to a boil in a small pan. Pour immediately over the chocolate and let sit for a minute or 2. Whisk until the chocolate is melted and the ganache is completely smooth. Set aside to cool.', u'For the ice cream sandwiches: Break the graham crackers in half. Put the candied walnuts on a small plate. Turn the pint of ice cream on its side and use a serrated knife to slice through the carton, creating 6 ice cream discs. Spread some of the Mexican chocolate ganache on each graham cracker half. Add an ice cream disc (remove the carton) to 6 of the graham cracker halves and top with the remaining graham crackers. Roll the edges in the candied walnuts. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces Mexican chocolate, chopped', u'3/4 cup (6 ounces) heavy cream', u'6 whole graham crackers', u'1 cup candied walnuts, roughly chopped', u'1 pint dulce de leche ice cream']
title: Graham Cracker and Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream Sandwich

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'For the Mexican shrimp burgers: Measure out 3/4 cup of the shrimp and set aside. Add the remaining shrimp to a food processor fitted with the blade attachment. Add the cilantro and eggs and pulse until the mixture is combined but not completely smooth. Transfer to a mixing bowl and set aside.', u'Roughly chop the reserved shrimp into small pieces, then add it to the mixing bowl. Add the breadcrumbs, chipotle adobo sauce, lime juice, salt, pepper and garlic and mix to blend the ingredients. Use a 1/2-cup measure to scoop and shape the shrimp mixture into 4 burgers. They will be sticky. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'For the avocado aioli: Add the mayonnaise, lime juice, garlic, avocado and some salt and pepper to a food processor and blend until smooth.', u"Coat the bottom of a large saute pan with the oil and place it over medium-high heat. Once it's very hot, saute the shrimp burgers until just cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side. They should be golden brown.", u'Add about 1 tablespoon of the avocado aioli to each half of the toasted buns. Add a burger to each, followed by a couple of tomato slices and a piece of lettuce. Close the burgers and enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'1 pound medium shrimp, shelled and deveined', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 large eggs', u'1 cup plain breadcrumbs', u'2 tablespoons chipotle adobo sauce', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoon sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 hamburger buns, split and toasted', u'2 medium tomatoes, sliced', u'4 butter lettuce leaves', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'2 medium cloves garlic', u'1 avocado, halved and pitted', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Mexican Shrimp Burgers

author: Janet Johnston
directions: [u'To add a little kick to these brownies, lightly brown 2 cups hazelnuts in', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil. Let cool, then remove the skins by rubbing the nuts in between a clean dish towel. In a food processor, pulse the nuts until they are slightly crumbled, then add the cocoa powder and the chili powder and pulse until fully incorporated. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Line an 8 by 8-inch baking pan with parchment paper leaving a 2-inch overhang to use as handles for removal.', u'Add the butter and chocolate to a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat, stirring to melt. Once melted and smooth, remove from heat. Whisk in the sugars. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, stirring between additions, then add the vanilla extract.', u'Whisk together the cocoa powder, flour, baking powder and salt, if using, in a separate bowl.  Add the dry ingredients to the chocolate mixture and stir well.', u"Fold in 1 1/2 cups of the hazelnut mixture. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Sprinkle the top with the remaining 1/2 cup of hazelnut mixture and bake for 20 to 30 minutes. Remove the brownies from the oven, and cool to room temperature. Cut into squares and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar before serving."]
ingredients: [u'2 cups hazelnuts, toasted', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 tablespoons Mexican cocoa powder', u'1/2 teaspoon ancho chili powder', u'1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature', u'5 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1/2 cup brown sugar, firmly packed', u'3 large eggs', u'2 teaspoons pure Mexican vanilla extract', u'1/3 cup Mexican cocoa powder', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour (plus 2 tablespoons when at high altitude)', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/8 teaspoon table salt, optional', u" Confectioners' sugar, to garnish"]
title: JJ's Mexican Brownies

directions: [u'Heat oven to 500 degrees F. Heat a grill pan to high. ', u'Cut potatoes into Texas fries, 10 per potato. Coat in extra-virgin olive oil, about 2 to 3 tablespoons, then season with chipotle powder, salt and pepper and roast 25 minutes, turning once.', u'Toast pumpkin seeds in a small skillet 2 minutes then grind in food processor or spice mill or a coffee bean grinder. Mix the ground pumpkin seeds with cumin and coriander. Season the tenderloin with salt and pepper and rub with the spices. Rub the grill pan with extra-virgin olive oil and grill pork tenderloins 20 minutes. ', u'Heat a skillet over medium-high heat with a tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, a turn of the pan. Add the chopped onion, garlic, jalapeno and cook a few minutes while you chop tomatillos. Add the tomatillos, season with salt and pepper and cook 7 to 8 minutes. Stir in lime zest and juice and cilantro and remove from heat. ', u'While salsa is cooking, toss the cabbage with sliced onion.   ', u'Wrap the tortillas in damp clean towel and warm in microwave 2 minutes or put in  the oven after you remove potatoes for 1 to 2 minutes. ', u'Thinly slice pork and serve 1/2 tenderloin per person. Wrap pork slices in soft tacos with salsa and some shredded cabbage and red onions. Serve with Texas chipotle fries.']
ingredients: [u'4 large russet potatoes, scrubbed and dried', u'4 to 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 tablespoon chipotle chili powder', u'1/2 cup pumpkin seeds', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon gound coriander', u'2 pork tenderloins, trimmed', u'1 onion, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, grated or chopped', u'1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', u'12 tomatillos, peeled and chopped', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'2 to 3 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro leaves', u'1/4 red cabbage, shredded', u'1 small red onion, quartered and thinly sliced', u'12 (6 inch) soft flour tortillas']
title: Mexican Sliced Spiced Pork Soft Tacos with Texas Oven Fries

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a large heavy-bottomed pot, heat a 2-count of olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions, celery, carrots, and garlic and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring, until the vegetables are very tender but not browned.', u'Raise the heat a bit. Take the ground veal and beef, break it up into chunks and add it to the pan. Cook, breaking up the clumps with a wooden spoon, until the meat is no longer pink. Add the wine and simmer until the wine has evaporated. Then add the tomatoes and stock and season with salt and pepper. Lower the heat and simmer very slowly for 2 to 2 1/2 hours, stirring now and then, until the sauce is very thick. Now add the milk - the milk will make the meat nice and tender - and simmer again until thickened, another 20 to 30 minutes. Taste again for salt and pepper. Mash the sauce against the side of the pan to really blend it. Transfer half of the sauce to containers and refrigerate for up to a week, or freeze for up to several months.', u'Bring a big pot of lightly salted water to a boil for the spaghetti. When you\'re ready to serve, drop the spaghetti into the boiling water and cook until tender yet firm ("al dente", as they say in Italian) 7 to 8 minutes. Drain and put the spaghetti into a big pasta bowl. Return the sauce remaining in the pot to a simmer and stir in the ricotta cheese. Pour the sauce over the drained spaghetti and give it a good toss. Garnish with a handful of grated Parmigiano, the basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. Pass more grated cheese at the table.']
ingredients: [u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 medium onions, finely chopped', u'4 celery stalks, finely chopped', u'4 carrots, peeled and finely chopped', u'8 large garlic cloves, minced', u'2 pounds ground veal', u'2 pounds ground beef', u'2 cups dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio', u'3 (28-ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, drained and crushed by hand', u'2 quarts chicken stock', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups milk', u'1 pound dried spaghetti', u' Large spoonful ricotta cheese', u' Handful freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, plus more for serving', u' Handful fresh basil leaves, torn into small pieces', u' Extra-virgin olive oil']
servings: 4 servings (plus enough sauce for at least 2 more meals)
title: Spaghetti Bolognese

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat butter and powdered sugar in mixer until light and fluffy, about 10-15 minutes. Add vanilla, salt and pecans. Remove from mixer and stir in pastry flour by hand being careful not to overmix. Form into football shapes about the size of small walnuts and place on a buttered cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until just beginning to get the slightest bit colored on the bottom. Remove upon the first sign of color and set on a rack to cool. When cool enough to touch place in a bowl with powdered sugar on top and bottom and toss gently. Occasionally toss with sugar while cooling, trying to get as much sugar as possible to stick. When cold, place cookies in airtight container and cover until ready to serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound soft unsalted butter', u'1 cup powdered sugar', u'2 tablespoons vanilla', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups finely chopped pecans', u'5 cups sifted pastry flour', u' Powdered sugar for dusting']
title: Mexican Wedding Cookies

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u"Click here to see how it's done.", u'In a large skillet, over medium heat, fry the bacon until just crisp. Add the jalapenos and saute until slightly softened.  Stir in the zesty rice salad and cook until rice is heated through.  Add corn, diced tomatoes, and chili seasoning.  Continue to fry on medium heat until corn is cooked and tomatoes are hot.  Season with salt and pepper, to taste.  Sprinkle with chopped cilantro before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 strips bacon, chopped', u'1 jalapeno pepper, seeds removed and diced', u'2 cups leftover zesty rice salad', u'1 cup frozen corn, thawed', u'1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', u'1 tablespoon chili seasoning', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 1/2 cups long-grain white rice', u'2 1/4 cups water', u'1 tablespoon chili seasoning', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 medium red onion, diced', u'1 yellow pepper, diced', u'1 (14.5-ounce) can red beans, drained and rinsed', u'1 tablespoon white vinegar', u'1 tablespoon freshly chopped cilantro leaves']
title: (Web Exclusive) Round 2 Recipe: Mexican Fried Rice

author: Michael Chiarello
directions: [u'Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Split the vanilla bean and add to the boiling water. Add sugar, cinnamon, espresso, and a pinch of salt. Simmer for 1 minute and add the bittersweet chocolate. Whisk until it gets thick. Add milk and simmer 1 minute. Serve immediately with a dollop of vanilla ice cream and a sprinkling of chili powder on top.', u"You may make this ahead and reheat. Make sure to either whisk it or blend it in a blender to make it light and foamy before serving. (The classic Mexican chocolate was whisked with a special wooden tool called a 'molinillo'.)"]
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup water', u'1 vanilla bean (or 1 teaspoon vanilla extract)', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 heaping tablespoon instant espresso', u' Pinch salt', u'2 1/2 ounces bittersweet chocolate, the best quality possible, grated', u'2 cups whole milk', u' Vanilla ice cream', u' Chili powder']
title: Hot Spiced Mexican Hot Chocolate with Ice Cream Dusted with Chili Powder

directions: [u'Combine the egg whites and sugar in a stand mixer bowl and whisk to combine. Place bowl over simmering water while whisking regularly until the mixture reaches 140 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer and the sugar is completely dissolved. Remove bowl from heat and whip the mixture at medium to high speed until the meringue has cooled almost completely.', u'Slowly add the room temperature butter piece by piece until the buttercream takes on a cottage cheese consistency. Add the melted cooled chocolates, spices, and vanilla until incorporated and smooth.', u'Cinnamon Vanilla Cake:', u'Cream the butter in a stand mixer until smooth and light. Add sugar and continue to mix until fully incorporated and fluffy.', u'Add 1 egg at a time, beating well after each addition. In a medium bowl sift together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Combine milk and vanilla. Add portions of the flour mixture and milk mixture to the electric mixer, alternating, starting and ending with flour. Pour evenly into 2 buttered and floured 9-inch cake pans.', u'Bake for 40 minutes or until golden - cake should pull away from the side and spring back to the touch.', u'Frost cake and decorate as desired.']
ingredients: [u'500 milliliters egg whites', u'800 grams granulated sugar', u'900 grams unsalted butter, room temperature', u'250 grams white chocolate, melted and cooled', u'250 grams dark chocolate, melted and cooled', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'2 teaspoons sweet ancho chile pepper', u'1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 sticks butter', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'3 cups sifted all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract']
title: Cinnamon Vanilla Wedding Cake with Mexican Hot Chocolate Buttercream

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Butter a 9-inch round cake pan and line the bottom with a disk of parchment paper.', u'Place chocolate in a double boiler over simmering water and stir until melted. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.', u'Whisk together the flour, cornmeal, sugar, chili powder, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
