Stir in the eggs and buttermilk and then stir in the melted chocolate. Scrape batter into the prepared pan and bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Cool in the pan on a rack. ', u'Once the bread is cool, break into 1-inch chunks and spread in the bottom of a 2-quart baking dish. ', u'Chocolate Custard:', u'Whisk together the sugar and yolks in a large bowl until pale. Whisk in the melted chocolate, milk, cream, and vanilla extract until combined. ', u'Using a fine sieve, strain the custard over the bread chunks. Press on the bread chunks so that they are soaked in the custard mixture. Place the pan in a roasting pan and fill the roasting pan halfway with hot water. Bake for 40 minutes or until the custard is set. Remove and let cool on a rack for 30 minutes before serving. This is best served warm. Spoon into bowls and drizzle with the Hot Mexican Chocolate Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'3 ounces semisweet chocolate, coarsely chopped', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup white cornmeal', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon ancho chili powder', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup buttermilk', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'6 large egg yolks', u'4 ounces semisweet chocolate, melted', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u' Hot Mexican Chocolate Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 1/2 cups heavy cream', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'8 ounces bittersweet chocolate, coarsely chopped', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons ground toasted almonds']
title: Chocolate Cornpone with Hot Mexican Chocolate Sauce

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.', u"Using an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugar at low speed until it is smooth. Beat in the vanilla. At low speed gradually add the flour. Mix in the pecans with a spatula. With floured hands, take out about 1 tablespoon of dough and shape into a crescent. Continue to dust hands with flour as you make more cookies. Place onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 40 minutes. When cool enough to handle but still warm, roll in additional confectioners' sugar. Cool on wire racks."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature', u"1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, plus more for coating baked cookies", u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting hands', u'1 cup pecans, chopped into very small pieces']
title: Mexican Wedding Cookies

directions: [u'Preheat broiler.', u'Cook bell peppers in olive oil on medium heat.  Season generously with salt and pepper.  Add onion and garlic.  Stir in olives, then tomatoes, stirring constantly.  Add serrano and potato.  Reduce heat to low and add herbs.', u'While vegetables are cooking, beat together egg whites, salt (to taste), and water, until mixture forms stiff, but not dry, peaks.  Separately combine cream and yolks, and thoroughly fold into egg whites.', u'Melt butter in a large, ovenproof pan over high heat.  Pour out half of butter and reserve.  Add 3/4 of egg mixture to pan, then add vegetables, distributed evenly.  When underside is cooked (takes less than a minute), pour on remaining egg mixture.  Place pan in broiler for 2 minutes.  ', u'To serve, invert onto a heated serving platter and brush with reserved melted butter.']
ingredients: [u'1 red bell pepper, roughly chopped', u'1 green bell pepper, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u' Freshly ground salt', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1/3 cup chopped onion', u'1 clove garlic, finely chopped', u'1/8 cup olives, halved', u'1 medium tomato, thinly sliced', u'1 serrano chili, finely chopped', u'1 potato, cooked in boiling, salted water, then diced', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u'4 tablespoons finely chopped parsley', u'6 eggs, separated', u'1/2 teaspoon cold water', u'1/4 cup heavy whipping cream', u'4 tablespoons salted butter']
title: Mexican Omelet

directions: [u'To cook the pasta, bring a large pot of water to a boil with salt and a little oil. Cook about 8 to 10 minutes or to al dente, drain well and spread on a sheet pan to cool. When almost dry lightly coat with olive oil. Then cover well till ready to toss salad.', u'To make the dressing, place the oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper in a jar. Cover and shake to mix well.', u'Toss the pasta, Panela cheese, onion, cucumbers, tomatoes, capers, and oregano with the dressing until well coated. Chill.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'3 clove garlic, minced', u' Sea salt, to taste', u' Freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'1/2 pound penne pasta, dry', u'1 cup Panela cheese, julienned', u'1 small red onion, chopped', u'3 pickling cucumbers, peeled and chopped', u'2 Italian Roma tomatoes, seeded and chopped', u'1/3 cup capers, drained of their liquid', u'1/2 bunch oregano, leaves chopped', u'2 Serrano chiles, stemmed, seeded and minced']
title: Mexican Macaroni Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.', u'Arrange zucchini on nonstick cookie sheet. Spray zucchini with cooking spray. Combine spices and sprinkle over the zucchini fries. Place in very hot oven and cook 15 to 18 minutes. Serve hot. Top with spoonfuls of chili sauce or taco sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 medium zucchini cut into 1/4-inch square 3-inch long sticks -- like fries', u' Vegetable cooking spray', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon grill seasoning', u'1 cup chili sauce or mild taco sauce']
title: Mexican Zucchini Oven Fries

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut the turkey into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Sprinkle with the cumin, and salt and pepper to taste. Heat the olive oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over high heat. Add the thyme, then add the turkey and cook until browned on one side, about 3 minutes. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 minutes.', u'Stir in 5 cups hot water, the potatoes, butternut squash, zucchini, salsa and tostadas (the tostadas will dissolve and help thicken the broth). Cover and bring to a boil, then uncover and reduce to a simmer. Cook until the vegetables are tender and the turkey is just cooked through, about 15 minutes. Serve with more tostadas.', u'Per serving: Calories 491; Fat 14 g (Saturated 2 g); Cholesterol 68 mg; Sodium 449 mg; Carbohydrate 46 g; Fiber 6 g; Protein 47 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless turkey breast', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'8 large sprigs thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'1/2 pound small red-skinned potatoes, thinly sliced', u'1 pound cubed peeled butternut squash', u'2 small yellow squash or zucchini (about 1/2 pound), cut into thick half-moons', u'3/4 cup prepared salsa verde', u'1 cup crumbled corn tostadas or tortilla chips, plus more for serving']
title: Mexican Turkey and Squash Stew

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the fryer to 375 degrees F. Cut the pork skin into pieces 2 inches long and 1/2-inch thick. Season with salt. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Fry the pork until golden brown and crispy, about 5 to 6 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels. Season with salt. Serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds of pork skin, partly frozen', u' Salt']
title: Mexican Chicharron

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Toss 4 cups cubed honeydew melon with 2 tablespoons lime juice, 1 teaspoon minced jalapeno and 1/4 teaspoon each kosher salt and ancho chile powder. Top with chopped cilantro, pepitas and crumbled Cotija cheese.', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
title: Mexican Honeydew Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak the rice in a bowl of hot water, about 5 minutes. Drain, rinse and shake dry.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the rice and toast, stirring, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, puree the garlic, onion and tomatoes in a blender. Add to the rice and cook until absorbed, about 3 minutes. Add 3 1/2 cups water, the jalapeno and a pinch of salt; cover and cook over medium heat until the rice is tender, about 10 minutes.', u'Remove the skillet from the heat. Uncover and place a clean towel over the rice, then re-cover and let stand 15 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork; serve with the jalapeno, if desired.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'2 cups long-grain white rice', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 clove garlic, roughly', u' chopped', u'1/2 white onion, chopped', u'4 plum tomatoes, chopped', u'1 jalapeno pepper, halved', u' Kosher salt']
title: Mexican Rice

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat a 12-inch oven proof skillet over medium and melt butter with brown sugar. Add bananas and saute until sugar becomes a syrup and remove from heat. Arrange bananas neatly in pan and set aside.', u'In a large bowl, mix flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and chocolate chips. In another bowl, combine egg whites, brown sugar, yogurt and vanilla. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Pour into skillet over sauteed bananas. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until middle of cake springs back when touched.', u'Remove from oven and cool slightly. Invert onto a large plate and cut into 16 slices.']
ingredients: [u'2 Tbs. butter', u'4 Tbs. brown sugar', u'4 medium bananas, sliced in half lengthwise', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/3 -cup cocoa powder', u'1 tsp. baking powder', u'1 tsp. baking soda', u'1 tsp. ground cinnamon', u'1/3 -cup chocolate chips', u'1/2 -cup egg whites', u'1 cup brown sugar', u'1 cup nonfat plain yogurt', u'2 tsp. pure vanilla extract']
title: Mexican Chocolate Banana Skillet Cake

author: Daisy Martinez
directions: [u'Pulse the walnuts in a food processor until the consistency of coarse cornmeal (twenty 2 second pulses). In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, tapioca and salt. In the bowl of a stand mixer or in a large bowl, using an electric hand mixer, add the butter and sugar and blend until smooth. Stir in the maple syrup and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients in thirds, using the paddle attachment on your mixer, at slow speed. Once the mixture has pulled together, mix at a slightly higher speed to fully incorporate the ingredients. Finally, add the walnuts and mix briefly to combine. Roll the dough into ball, flatten into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill for 1/2 hour.  ', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.  Line baking sheets with parchment paper. ', u"Measure 1 tablespoon of the dough into your hand, roll into a log with tapered ends and shape into a crescent. Repeat with remaining dough. Arrange the cookies, about 1-inch apart, on the baking sheets. Bake just until the bottom edges start to turn golden, about 14 to 16 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool on the cookie sheets for 10 minutes, then transfer to a rack until completely cool, about 20 minutes.  Put the confectioners' sugar in a shallow bowl, and dredge the cookies, 1 at a time, tapping off excess sugar. ", u"Daisy's Variation:", u"Add 1 teaspoon of good quality cinnamon, and 1 cup of mini morsels (recommended, Nestle's) to the dough. You can also flavor the confectioners' sugar by sifting it with 2 tablespoons of cocoa powder, for wonderful results."]
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 cups walnut pieces', u'2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 cup tapioca starch (tapioca flour)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 sticks butter, cut into pieces, room temperature', u'1 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons grade A dark amber maple syrup', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u"2 cups confectioners' sugar"]
title: Johnny's Impossible Tawdry Mexican Wedding Cookies

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat the butter in a medium stockpot over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic, carrots and celery and cook until soft. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes. Strain the stock into a clean medium saucepan and whisk in the pumpkin puree until smooth.  Bring to a simmer and add the 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, spices, honey and chipotle.  Cook for 15 to 20 minutes.  Add water, if the soup is too thick. Remove from the heat and whisk in 1/4 cup of the creme fraiche and season with salt and pepper to taste.  Mix together the remaining creme fraiche and remaining 1 teaspoon cinnamon until combined.  Divide the soup among 4 bowls and garnish with the cinnamon creme fraiche and a handful of pumpkin seeds.', u'For the Spinach, Pear and Pancetta Salad: Saute pancetta in skillet over medium heat until crisp.  Drain on paper towels.  Pour all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings out.  Add shallots and cook until soft.  Add vinegar, mustard and thyme; whisk to blend.  Add oil and whisk to blend.  Season with salt and pepper.  Keep warm. Combine spinach, pears, red onion and pancetta in a large bowl.  Toss with enough dressing to coat.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 large onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'1 large carrot, peeled and coarsely chopped', u'2 stocks celery, coarsely chopped', u'7 cups vegetable stock, or water', u'1 1/2 cups pumpkin puree (not flavored pie filling)', u'1/4 teaspoon ground Mexican cinnamon, plus 1 teaspoon (canella)', u'1/4 teaspoon allspice', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 teaspoons chipotle puree', u'3/4 cup creme fraiche or sour cream', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Garnish: 1/2 cup toasted pumpkin seeds', u'4 ounces pancetta, medium dice', u'1 small shallot, minced', u'1/4 cup sherry vinegar', u'1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'10 ounces fresh spinach leaves', u'2 Bosc pears, halved, cored and thinly sliced', u'1 small red onion, finely sliced']
title: Mesa Grill's Pumpkin Soup with Mexican Cinnamon Creme Fraiche and Toasted Pumpkin Seeds with Spinach, Pear and Pancetta Salad

directions: [u'In a kettle cook the garlic in the oil over moderately low heat, stirring for 1 minute, add the onion and the jalapeno peppers, and cook the mixture, stirring, until the onion is softened.  Add the cumin, the ground coriander seed, and salt and black pepper to taste and cook the mixture, stirring, for 2 minutes.  Add the carrot and the celery and cook the mixture over moderate heat, stirring, for 5 minutes.  Add the stock, the corn cobs, and 2 1/2 cups water and simmer the mixture for 15 minutes.  Add all but 1 cup of the reserved corn kernels, simmer the mixture for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the kernels are very tender, and discard the cobs.  In a blender puree the mixture in batches, blending each batch on high speed for at least 1 minute, or until it is very smooth.  (If an even smoother soup is desired, after using the blender force the mixture through a fine sieve set over a bowl, pressing hard on the solids.)  Let the soup cool to room temperature.  In a small saucepan of boiling water boil the remaining 1 cup reserved corn kernels for 2 to 4 minutes, or until they are tender, drain them in a colander, and refresh them under cold water.  Stir the corn into the soup with the roasted bell pepper, the minced coriander, the cayenne,  and salt and black pepper to taste and serve the soup at room temperature.  Garnish with fried tortilla strips.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 cup chopped onion', u' Two 2-inch fresh jalapeno peppers, seeds and ribs discarded and the flesh minced (wear rubber gloves)', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground coriander seed', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced carrot', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced celery', u'3 1/2 cups chicken stock or canned chicken broth', u'8 ears of corn, shucked, the kernels cut off the cobs, and the kernels and cobs reserved separately', u'1 red bell pepper, roasted and chopped fine', u'2 to 3 tablespoons minced fresh coriander or parsley leaves, or to taste', u' Cayenne to taste if desired', u' Garnish: Fried tortilla strips']
title: Mexican Corn Soup

author: Herb Mesa
directions: [u'In a medium pan, combine 2 cups water with shrimp heads and tails. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook for 20 minutes. Strain out the shrimp shells and set the stock aside.', u'In a large sauce pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat then add the potato, onion, bell pepper, chorizo, and garlic. Saute until the onion is tender and translucent, about 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in the cumin, paprika, bay leaves. Add the vegetable stock and shrimp stock, bring to a simmer and cook for 6 to 8 minutes to allow the flavors to infuse. Stir in the sriracha.', u'Add the clams, scallops, and shrimp and cook for an additional 6 to 8 minutes.', u'To serve, spoon the soup into bowls and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound medium Mexican shrimp, cooked, peeled, deveined, head and tail removed and reserved', u'2 cups water', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 cup chopped potato', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'1 medium green bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1/2 cup chorizo, thinly sliced', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'3 bay leaves', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup vegetable stock', u'2 tablespoons sriracha sauce', u'1 pound clams, cleaned, de-gritted', u'1 pound sea scallops, cleaned', u'1 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'6 lime wedges, for serving']
title: Mexican Shrimp Soup

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees.', u'Brown ground beef in a large skillet. Add onion and cook until they are soft and translucent. Drain beef, stir in spices and cook 2 minutes.', u'Remove from heat and stir in salsa. Add eggs. Fold in cheese and pour mixture into pastry crust. Bake 20 to 25 minutes until crust is golden brown. Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes. Cut into 6 or 8 wedges and top each wedge with a dollop of sour cream, cilantro, tomatoes, and black olives.']
ingredients: [u'1 8 or 9 inch deep dish pastry crust', u'1 -lb lean ground beef', u'3 large eggs, beaten', u'1 cup salsa', u'2 cups shredded cheese, your choice', u'1 small onion, finely diced', u'1 tsp cumin', u'1/2 tsp garlic powder', u'1/2 tsp onion powder', u' salt to taste', u' sour cream', u' cilantro, chopped', u' diced tomatoes', u' black olives']
title: Mexican Quiche

author: Jamie Deen
directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine the chili powder, dried oregano, smoked paprika and cayenne pepper. Mix until well combined. Sprinkle over the boiled peanuts.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon smoked paprika', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'12 cups store-bought boiled peanuts']
title: Mexican Spiced Boiled Peanuts

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Crust:  Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.  Spray a 12-inch diameter pie dish with vegetable oil cooking spray.', u'In a food processor, add the graham crackers and pulse into crumbs. Add the butter and sugar and pulse until the crumbs are moistened. Press the mixture onto the bottom and sides of the prepared pie dish. Refrigerate the crust for 10 minutes. (The crust can be made 1 week ahead, covered and frozen).', u'Filling:  Combine the butter, brown sugar and corn syrup in heavy medium saucepan. Bring to boil, over medium heat, stirring often. Boil for 1 minute, then stir in the pecans and cream. Boil until the mixture thickens slightly, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the chocolate and stir until melted and the mixture is well blended. Pour the hot filling into the crust. Bake until the filling bubbles all over, about 15 minutes. Transfer the pie to a wire rack and cool completely before serving, about 2 hours.', u"Cook's Note: This recipe can also be made in 2 (9-inch) pie dishes."]
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil cooking spray', u'10 graham crackers or Maria crackers, crumbled', u'14 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'1/4 cup light brown sugar', u'1 1/2 cups (3 sticks) unsalted butter', u'1 packed cup golden brown sugar', u'3/4 cup corn syrup', u'6 cups pecan halves', u'1/2 cup Mexican crema or whipping cream', u'1 1/2 (3.1-ounce) disks Mexican chocolate, such as Ibarra, finely minced*', u' *Can be found in Hispanic and gourmet grocery stores']
title: Mexican Chocolate Pecan Pie

directions: [u'For the salsa: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the peppers and onion and cook until the onion is translucent, 8 to 10 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, blend together the tomatoes and tomato sauce in a large blender until smooth. Once the peppers and onions are cooked, stir the tomato sauce mixture into the saucepan. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer and stir in the cumin, oregano and black pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes; taste for seasoning and add salt if needed. Keep warm. Makes about 5 cups.', u'For the queso sauce: Put the cheese and jalapenos in a heat-safe blender. Bring the milk to a boil over medium-high heat in a medium saucepan. Carefully pour the hot milk into the blender and blend until smooth. Return to the saucepan and keep warm over low heat.', u'Makes about 2 cups.', u'For the burrito: Heat the vegetable oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced steak and brown on one side. Loosen the meat with a spatula or spoon and brown the meat on the other side. Season with salt and pepper and remove from the skillet.', u'Put the tortilla on a microwave-safe dish and cover it with a damp paper towel. Heat in the microwave until quite hot and pliable, about 20 seconds. Discard the paper towel.', u'Put the refried beans, steak, rice, onion, cilantro, and cheese horizontally across the center of the tortilla, leaving a 2-inch border at both ends. Fold the left and right sides inwards perpendicular to the filling, then roll the burrito from front to back, pulling the filling tightly until the bottom of the burrito is now on top. Top with up to 1 cup of the salsa and about the same amount of queso sauce. Serve with sour cream, guacamole, and shredded lettuce if desired. Remaining salsa and queso sauce can be kept for up to 1 week, refrigerated.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 green bell pepper, chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, chopped', u'1/2 white onion, chopped', u' One 28-ounce can whole peeled tomatoes in sauce', u' One 28-ounce can tomato sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon ground oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u"1 pound melting white American cheese, preferably Land o' Lakes", u'1/4 cup pickled jalapenos', u'2 cups milk', u'1 teaspoon vegetable oil', u'4 ounces sirloin or skirt steak, sliced into bite-size pieces', u' Kosher salt and black pepper', u'1 large flour tortilla', u'1/2 cup canned refried beans, warm', u'1/2 cup cooked Mexican or Spanish rice, warm', u'2 tablespoons chopped white onion', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese', u' For serving, optional: Sour cream; guacamole; shredded lettuce']
servings: 1 burrito, with extra salsa and queso sauce
title: Mexican Wet Burrito

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Set a 12-inch saute pan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. Add the sausage to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until well caramelized, about 4 to 5 minutes.   Season the shrimp with the Essence and place in the pan. Sear the shrimp for 2 minutes, turn over and cook another 1 minute. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside. Add the onions, pepper and garlic to the pan and cook, stirring, until the onions are translucent, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, chipotle chiles, parsley, tequila and shrimp to the pan and bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook for 5 minutes. Season the gravy with salt, to taste, and add the cilantro, stirring to combine.', u'To serve, place about 1 1/4 cups of the rice in a bowl and spoon 1/4 of the gravy over top the rice. Serve garnished with extra cilantro.', u'For the Mexican Rice:']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 pound chorizo sausage, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch slices', u"1 pound large shrimp (16-20's), peeled and deveined", u"2 teaspoons Emeril's Southwest Essence", u'1/2 cup small diced yellow onion', u'1/4 cup small diced green bell pepper', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 (14 1/2-ounce) can diced tomatoes', u'1 (8-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'2 chipotle chilies in adobe sauce, roughly chopped', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1/4 cup tequila (recommended: Cabo Wabo Silver)', u' Salt', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus 1 tablespoon leaves for garnish', u'5 cups Mexican rice, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/2 cup chopped white onions', u'1/4 cup chopped green bell peppers', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 cups long-grain rice', u'1 large tomato, peeled, seeded and chopped', u'3 cups chicken stock, or water', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon saffron', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions']
title: Shrimp, Chorizo and Chipotle Gravy over Mexican Rice

directions: [u'Cook fusilli pasta in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender but still firm to bite. Drain. Rinse pasta with cold water to cool. Drain pasta. Transfer pasta to large bowl. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil and mix thoroughly to coat. Add diced tomatoes, corn kernels, carrot strips and chopped onion and toss.', u'Mix mayonnaise, Dijon mustard and fresh lime juice in small bowl. Mix in minced jalapeno chilies, chili powder and ground cumin. Add dressing and chopped fresh cilantro to salad and mix to blend. Season to taste with salt and pepper.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound fusilli pasta', u'1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil', u'4 large tomatoes, seeded, diced (4 cups)', u'3 cups corn kernels (fresh or frozen, thawed)', u'3 large carrots, thinly sliced on diagonal, slices cut lengthwise into thin strips', u'1/2 large red onion, chopped', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 jalapeno chilies, seeded, minced', u'1 1/4 teaspoons chili powder', u'1 1/4 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Mexican Pasta Salad

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat the oil in a medium heavy saucepan or skillet over medium low heat. Saute the rice, stirring constantly, until golden and crackling, about 5 minutes. Add the onions and Serranos and cook until the onions just soften. Then add the garlic and saute until the aroma is released. Pour in the stock or water and the tomato salsa, mixing well to combine. Transfer to a 4 quart baking dish or casserole. Cover with foil and bake until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, 3040 minutes. Stir and serve hot.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u'3 cups long grain rice, rinses', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'5 Serrano chiles, or to taste, stemmed, seeded if desired', u'2 garlic cloves, chopped', u'3/4 cup chicken stock, vegetable stock, or water', u'3 cups Red Tomato Salsa (recipe follows)', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'4 cups diced canned Italian plum tomatoes', u'1 cup tomato juice', u'2 garlic cloves, peeled', u'1 large jalopeno chile, stemmed, seeded if desired', u'1 teaspoon salt']
title: Mexican Red Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring 1 cup water, the quinoa and a pinch of salt to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Lower the heat to medium-low, cover and cook until the quinoa is tender and the water is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let sit, covered, for at least 5 minutes (the dish can be served warm or at room temperature).', u'Whisk together the yogurt, lime juice, cilantro and a pinch of salt in a small bowl.', u'Put the cooked quinoa in a cereal bowl, and top with the yogurt mixture, beans, salsa, avocados, radishes and pepitas in neat piles or rows. Garnish with cilantro. Then take a photo!', u'Per serving (1 bowl): Calories: 390; Fat: 13 g (Saturated: 2 g); Cholesterol: 5 mg; Sodium: 690 mg; Carbohydrate: 56 g; Fiber: 9 g; Protein: 17 g; Sugar: 6 g', u'Copyright 2015 Television Food Network, G.P.  All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup red quinoa, rinsed well', u' Kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons 2 percent Greek yogurt', u' Juice of 1/2 lime', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro leaves, roughly chopped, plus leaves for garnish', u'3 tablespoons drained and rinsed canned black beans', u'3 tablespoons salsa', u'1/4 small avocado, sliced', u'2 radishes, cut into thin matchsticks', u'1 tablespoon pepitas (pumpkin seeds)']
title: Mexican Quinoa Breakfast Bowl

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and ancho chile powder. Sear, skin-side down, in the oil until golden brown. Turn over and brown on the other side. Remove the chicken to a plate.', u'Add the onion to the pan and cook until lightly golden brown. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the chicken back to the pot, add the chiles, stock, and cilantro, and bring to a boil. Cover and roast in the oven until the chicken easily falls away from the bone, about 40 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pot and strain the cooking liquid into a bowl.', u'When the chicken is cool enough to handle, remove bones and cut or shred the meat into bite-sized pieces. Place the reserved cooking liquid into a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer. Add the shredded chicken, turn off the heat and let warm.', u'Divide the warm chicken among the warm tortillas, top with Salsa Verde and chopped cilantro.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 pounds chicken legs and thighs, skin removed', u' Salt', u'3 tablespoons ancho chile powder', u'1 large yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 ancho chile, coarsely chopped', u'2 New Mexican chilies, coarsely chopped', u'4 cups chicken stock', u'6 sprigs cilantro, plus more chopped, for garnish', u'12 flour tortillas, warmed', u' Salsa Verde, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium red onion, coarsely chopped', u'1 jalapeno, coarsely diced', u'8 tomatillos, husked and coarsely chopped', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: New Mexican-Style Soft Tacos with Hacked Chicken and Salsa Verde

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray.', u'Arrange tortillas on prepared baking sheet and spray with cooking spray.  Season the top of tortillas with cumin, salt and freshly ground black pepper.  Bake 6 minutes, until golden brown and crisp. Remove from oven.', u'While the tortillas are baking, in a medium saucepan, combine cheese, artichoke hearts, salsa, and spinach.  Set pan over medium heat and bring to a simmer, for 5 minutes or until cheese melts.  Pour into a serving bowl.', u'In a large bowl, combine: the chopped avocados, lime juice, chopped cilantro, chopped tomatoes, salt and freshly ground black pepper and smoked paprika, to taste, if using.', u'Adjust seasonings, if necessary.', u'Serve cheese fondue with baked chips and guacamole.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'8 flour or corn tortillas, cut into wedges', u' Ground cumin', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 to 3 cups shredded 4 cheese Mexican cheese blends (recommended: Monterey Jack, Cheddar, mozzarella, queso blanco, or any combination of cheese blends)', u'1 (14-ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped', u'1 cup salsa or pico de gallo sauce', u'1 (10-ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained', u'3 seeded, peeled and chopped avocados', u'2 to 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 to 2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 tomato, chopped', u' Smoked paprika, if desired']
title: Mexican Fondue

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'In a large saucepan set over high heat, add 1 cup water, the agave, 2 tablespoons salt, the cumin, cracked black pepper, garlic, oregano, 2 of the anchos, 1 of the chipotles, 2 of the guajillos, the beer and limes. Cook, stirring, until the salt dissolves. Remove from the heat, add the ice, and stir until cool. Pour the brine into a large, resealable plastic bag and add the pork chops. Seal the bag and refrigerate for up to 1 hour.', u'Preheat the grill to high heat and wipe the grates down carefully with some oiled paper towels to clean and create a nonstick surface.', u'In a dry skillet set over medium-high heat add the remaining 1 ancho, 2 chipotles and 1 guajillo chile. Cook the chiles until fragrant and lightly charred, 1 to 2 minutes. Place the chiles in a spice grinder and grind to a fine powder. In a small bowl, add the chile powder, cumin, granulated garlic, sugar, paprika, the remaining 1/2 tablespoon salt, the mustard and ground black pepper. Mix to combine, and set aside.', u'Remove the pork chops from the brine, then pat dry and brush with the canola oil. Coat evenly all over with the spice rub. Grill the pork chops for 2 1/2 minutes. Rotate the chops 90 degrees and cook another 2 1/2 minutes to create crosshatch sear marks. Flip the chops over and repeat the same process on the second side. Move the chops to an area of the grill with medium heat and continue cooking until cooked through and an internal thermometer inserted in the chops reads 145 degrees F for medium doneness, 7 to 8 minutes. Rest the chops for 5 to 7 minutes for the juices to redistribute.', u'Serve the pork chops with the Grilled Green Chile Sauce spooned over the top and garnish with Pico De Gallo.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup light agave', u'2 1/2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon cracked black pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'4 sprigs fresh oregano', u'3 dried ancho chiles, stemmed, broken and some seeds removed', u'3 dried chipotle chiles, stemmed, broken and some seeds removed', u'3 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed, broken and some seeds removed', u' One 12-ounce bottle Mexican beer', u'1 lime, quartered', u'2 cups ice cubes', u'4 double-cut, bone-in pork loin chops (each about 1 1/2-inches thick)', u'2 tablespoons canola oil, plus more for greasing', u'1 tablespoon granulated garlic', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons smoked paprika', u'1 teaspoon mustard powder', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Grilled Green Chile Sauce, recipe follows', u' Pico de Gallo, recipe follows', u'4 hatch chiles', u'2 Anaheim chiles', u'2 jalapenos', u'2 poblano chiles', u'1 medium sweet onion, halved', u'1/2 bunch scallions, trimmed', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon white vinegar', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u' Juice and zest of 1 lime', u'1/2 bunch cilantro, rinsed', u'2 cups diced Roma tomatoes', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'2 tablespoons seeded, stemmed and minced jalapenos', u'1 tablespoon fresh celery juice', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 sweet onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice']
title: Mexican Chile Pork Chops

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Melt the butter with 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a skillet; transfer to a bowl. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in the skillet. Add the onion, garlic and jalapeno and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the chili powder, cumin, cinnamon and 1 teaspoon salt; toast 30 seconds. Add the tomato and cilantro and cook until slightly dry, about 2 minutes. Stir in the chicken and sour cream and warm through. Remove from the heat.', u'Brush a rimmed baking sheet with some of the butter-oil mixture. Spread 2 tablespoons refried beans down the center of each tortilla, leaving a 2-inch border on both ends. Top with 1 cup chicken mixture and 1/4 cup cheese. Fold in the ends and roll up.', u'Put the chimichangas seam-side down on the baking sheet; brush with the butter-oil mixture. Bake 8 to 10 minutes per side, brushing again after you flip. Top with the sauce, more cheese, lettuce and tomato. Serve with rice and the remaining beans.', u"Make Chi-Chi's Mexi-sauce:", u'Saute 1/2 cup chopped onion and 2 chopped garlic cloves in a skillet with vegetable oil. Add a pinch each of chili powder, cumin, sugar and salt; cook 30 seconds. Stir in two 4-ounce cans chopped green chiles (drained and rinsed); cook 2 minutes. Add 1 cup chicken broth and simmer until thickened, then puree. Stir in 1/4 cup chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 white onion, chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 jalapeno pepper, diced (remove seeds for less heat)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chili powder', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Kosher salt', u'1 small tomato, chopped, plus more for topping', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 1/2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken', u'1/4 cup sour cream', u'1 15 -ounce can refried beans', u'4 10 -inch flour tortillas', u'1 cup shredded monterey jack cheese, plus more for topping', u' Mexi-sauce, for topping (see below)', u' Shredded lettuce, for topping', u' Mexican rice, for serving']
title: Almost-Famous Chimichangas

directions: [u'In a saucepan over medium heat, add the rice and olive oil. Cook, coating the rice in the oil and toasting it slightly, about 3 minutes. Add the stock, tomatoes, garlic and 2 teaspoons salt and bring to a boil. Cook, uncovered, until the liquid is at the same level as the rice, about 5 minutes. Cover and reduce the heat to low, and cook until the liquid is absorbed, about 14 minutes. Stir the rice and remove from the heat. Cover and let sit until the rice is tender, about 5 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups long-grain rice', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 3/4 cups vegetable or chicken stock', u' One 10-ounce can stewed tomatoes with chilies, such as Rotel Original', u' Kosher salt', u'1 clove garlic, minced']
title: Mexican Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the crust: Cut the lard into 1/2-inch cubes; transfer to a plate and freeze at least 1 hour. Combine the flour, granulated sugar, salt and baking powder in a large bowl. Cut in the lard with 2 knives until the mixture looks like coarse meal with pea-size bits of lard (do not overmix). A little at a time, stir in 1/2 to 1 cup ice water until the dough holds together when squeezed; the amount of water will vary depending on the humidity. (You can also make the dough in a stand mixer with the paddle attachment.) Divide the dough between 2 sheets of plastic wrap; use the plastic to help form each half into a disk. Wrap tightly and refrigerate until firm, at least 1 hour or overnight.', u'Make the filling: Combine the apples, flour, turbinado sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, lemon juice, green chiles and pine nuts in a large bowl and toss. Let sit 20 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Roll out 1 disk of dough into a 12-inch round on a lightly floured surface. Ease into a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate, then spoon the filling into the crust. Roll out the remaining disk of dough into a 12-inch round; lay the dough over the filling. Press the 2 crusts together around the edge, then fold the overhanging dough under itself and crimp with your fingers. Cut a few slits in the top crust or prick with a fork to let steam escape. Whisk the egg with 1/4 cup water and brush over the top crust. Sprinkle with turbinado sugar.', u'Bake, rotating the pie every 20 minutes, until golden brown, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Transfer to a rack and let cool completely. Serve with ice cream.', u'Photograph by Devon Jarvis']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons lard', u'2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u'1 tablespoon granulated sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'6 to 7 apples (such as Granny Smith, Fuji and/or Gala), peeled and sliced (about 6 cups)', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup turbinado sugar, plus more for sprinkling', u'2 tablespoons ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (from about 2 lemons)', u'1/4 cup canned or frozen chopped hot green chiles (thawed if frozen)', u'1/4 cup pine nuts', u'1 large egg', u' Vanilla ice cream, for serving']
title: New Mexican Apple Pie

directions: [u'Combine flour, cocoa and ancho chile pepper in large bowl. Add beef and toss to coat evenly with flour mixture. Remove beef and reserve any excess flour mixture.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon butter in stockpot over medium heat until hot. Brown half of beef and remove from stockpot. Repeat with remaining beef, adding remaining 1 tablespoon butter, if needed. Remove beef from stockpot; season with salt and black pepper.', u'Add bell peppers to the stockpot and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in tomatoes, broth, chipotle pepper, adobo sauce and reserved flour mixture. Return beef to stockpot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover tightly and simmer 1 3/4 to 2 1/4 hours or until beef is fork-tender.']
title: Mexican Beef Stew over Chipotle Sweet Potato Mashers (Nuevo Latino Beef Dishes)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u"For the dough: In a large mixing bowl, combine the sour cream, flour, butter, 2 whole eggs, egg yolk, 2 teaspoons salt and olive oil. Knead the mixture into a soft dough. Divide the dough in half and cover for 10 minutes. On a floured surface, roll each half of the dough into a thin circle, 1/4-inch thick. Cut the dough using a 3-inch circle cutter. For the filling: Season the beef with salt and pepper. In a saute pan, render the ground beef for 3 minutes. Remove from the pan and drain on a paper-lined plate. In a mixing bowl, combine the cheese, ground beef, shallots, garlic, green onion and egg. Mix well. Season with salt and pepper.  Place 1 tablespoon of the filling in the center of each circle of dough and fold over. Press and seal into half-moon shapes. Use a little water to seal the pierogi's. In a pot of boiling, salted water, cook the pierogi for 8 minutes, or until they float. Remove from the water and drain. In a saute pan, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Sear the pierogi for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown. Remove from the pan. The pierogi will need to be sauteed in batches. Arrange the pierogi's on a platter. Garnish with parsley and serve with sour cream."]
ingredients: [u'1 pint sour cream', u'5 cups flour', u'2 tablespoons melted butter', u'2 whole eggs', u'1 egg yolk', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1/2 pound ground beef', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 pound soft farmers cheese', u'2 tablespoons minced shallots', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/2 cup green onions, chopped', u'1 whole egg', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1/2 cup sour cream']
title: Polish Pierogies

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a large pot combine the spare ribs, onion, bay leaf and peppercorns, vinegar and cover with water. Bring to a simmer and cook until the meat is tender, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours. In another pot, cover the scrubbed beets with water and bring to a boil. Simmer the beets for 45 To 1 hour or until the beets are tender. Drain and rinse the beets under cold water until they are cool. Peel and grate the beets.', u'When the meat is tender, Remove the bones and strip off the meat in bite size pieces. Return the meat to the broth and stir in the grated beets. Season the soup with salt and pepper. In a large bowl stir together the sour cream, milk and flour. Add two cups of the hot stock to the sour cream mixture and stir to combine. Pour this mixture through a strainer into the soup. Heat the soup over medium heat at a gentle simmer, but do not allow it to boil. Boiling will cause the sour cream to curdle. Serve immediately with boiled potatoes and pumpernickel or rye bread']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds pork spareribs', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'1 bay leaf', u'3 peppercorns', u'2 tablespoons white vinegar', u'5 medium beets', u'2 cups sour cream', u'2 cups milk', u'3 tablespoons flour', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Bobcha's Polish Borscht

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a saucepan, over medium heat, combine the beer, water, onions and sausage.  Season with salt and pepper.  Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook, covered, for 25 minutes.  Remove the sausage from the pan and cool.  Slice the sausage into 1 -inch pieces.   In a large saute pan, over medium heat, melt the butter.  Stir in the flour and cook for 4 to 6 minutes for a light brown roux.  Stir in the vinegar, sugar and the reserved beer and onion mixture.  Season with salt and pepper.  Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce to a simmer and continue to cook until the sauce coats the back of a spoon, about 15 minutes.  Add the sliced sausage and continue to cook for 5 minutes.  Garnish with parsley.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces light beer', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'2 cups chopped yellow onions', u'2 pounds Kielbasa sausage, links', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'2 tablespoons flour', u'2 tablespoons white vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped parsley']
title: Kielbasa in Polish Sauce

directions: [u'Combine Italian dressing, garlic powder, oregano, and basil into a plastic bag. Add the chicken breasts and mix well. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. ', u'Preheat grill over medium heat. ', u'Make foil pouches of sliced red onion with butter and another pouch of sliced mushrooms with butter. Place onto hot grill and cook until tender. Drizzle portobello caps with olive oil and place on hot grill to soften. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. Grill chicken breasts until cooked throughout, sprinkling with Cajun seasoning and garlic powder, set to side of grill to keep warm. At same time, grill 4 strips of bacon.', u'Spread the cooked portobellos with a thick layer of cream cheese. Place 1 cooked chicken breast onto each, spoon on some of the sliced mushrooms, and finally some of the sliced onions. Place a strip of bacon onto that, and then cover with sliced mozzarella and shredded Monterey Jack cheese, put back on grill to melt cheese, and serve with a side of dirty rice.']
ingredients: [u' Italian dressing or marinade, to taste', u' Garlic powder, to taste', u' Oregano, to taste', u' Basil, to taste', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', u'1 medium red onion, sliced', u' Butter', u'1 package sliced mushrooms', u'4 large portobello mushroom caps', u' Olive oil', u' Cajun seasoning', u'4 strips bacon', u' Garden vegetable cream cheese', u' Sliced mozzarella cheese', u' Shredded Monterey Jack', u' Cooked dirty rice, for serving']
title: Mike's Polish Smothered Chicken

author: Michael Symon
directions: [u'Brush 4 (1 1/2 cup) brioche tins with melted butter, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the bread crumbs. Set aside.', u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Put honey in a mixing bowl and set over a pot of steaming water; warm until it gets loose. Add the sugar and egg yolks to the honey, and whisk until frothy.  Remove the bowl from the heat and whisk in remaining 1 3/4 cups bread crumbs and hazelnuts.', u'In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff and fold into the batter.', u'Place mixture into the brioche tins and bake for 45 minutes.', u'When cool remove from pan and garnish with whipped cream and a drizzle of honey.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon melted butter', u'2 cups plain fine dry bread crumbs', u'1 cup honey, plus more, for garnish', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'4 eggs, separated', u'1 cup toasted chopped hazelnuts', u' Whipped cream, for garnish']
title: Polish Honey Cake

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Heat the vegetable oil in a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat. Add the kielbasa and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Set in a baking dish and place in the oven to keep warm.', u'To the same skillet, add the onion and stir to combine with the oil remaining in the pan. Season with salt and pepper and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes. Once the onion is golden and soft, set aside.', u'To build the sandwich: Place a sausage on a bun, slather with good yellow mustard and top with an ample amount of caramelized onion and 2 or 3 pickled peppers. Wrap the sandwich in deli paper, parchment paper or foil. Let sit for 5 minutes to get all good and steamed up.', u'Photograph by Kang Kim']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'4 links Polish kielbasa (about 1 1/2 pounds), patted dry with a paper towel', u'1 large onion, thinly sliced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'4 poppy seed hot dog buns', u' Yellow mustard, for topping', u'8 to 12 pickled sport peppers or other pickled peppers']
title: Maxwell Street Polish Sausage Sandwiches

author: Michael Symon
directions: [u'Brush 4 (1 1/2 cup) brioche tins with melted butter, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of the bread crumbs. Set aside.', u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Place honey in a mixing bowl and set over a pot of steaming water; warm until it gets loose. Add the sugar and egg yolks to the honey, and whisk until frothy. Remove the bowl from the heat and whisk in remaining bread crumbs and hazelnuts.', u'In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff and fold into the batter. Place mixture into the  brioche tins and bake for 45 minutes.', u'When cool remove from pan and garnish with whipped cream and a drizzle of honey.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon melted butter', u'2 cups fine dry bread crumbs', u'1 cup honey, plus more, for garnish', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'4 eggs, separated', u'1 cup toasted chopped hazelnuts', u' Whipped cream, for garnish']
title: Polish Honey Cake

author: Michael Symon
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Saute scallions and garlic in oil and place on the bottom of an oiled 8-inch casserole. Mix flour, milk, sour cream and eggs and herbs, butter and seasoning. Place vegetables in casserole. Pour egg mixture on top and cover with crumbled feta. Bake 40 to 45 minutes']
ingredients: [u'1 bunch scallions, sliced', u'1 clove minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'3 tablespoons rye flour', u'1 1/2 ounces milk', u'2/3 cup sour cream', u'4 eggs beaten', u'1 tablespoon chopped cilantro', u'1 tablespoon chopped flat leaf parsley', u'2 tablespoons melted butter', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'1 cup cooked chopped spinach', u'2 red peppers, small dice', u'6 ounces crumbled feta cheese']
title: Baked Polish Omlette (Drachena)

directions: [u'In a large skillet, saute sausage, carrot, and onion in butter until onion is tender.', u'Add the cabbage, thyme, salt, and pepper. Reduce heat; simmer, covered 14-16 minutes or until cabbage is tender.', u'\tMeanwhile, heat potatoes according to package directions.', u'Serve with sausage mixture.']
ingredients: [u'1 package Johnsonville\xae Polish Kielbasa or 1 package (14 ounces) Johnsonville\xae Polish Kielbasa, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 cup cup carrot, sliced \xbc-inch', u'1 large onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 tablespoon butter', u'1 small head of cabbage, cut into wedges', u'1/2 teaspoon teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 package (24 ounces each) refrigerated prepared mashed potatoes']
title: Polish Kielbasa Cabbage Skillet

directions: [u'Slice the sausages on the diagonal and cook in a grill pan over medium-high heat, until grill marks form, about 3 minutes on each side.', u'Saute 1 quartered and sliced white onion in a medium pan in extra virgin olive oil until tender. Add a pinch of salt and pepper and 1/4 cup of sugar to the pan and coat the onions evenly. Add 2 tablespoons of butter to the pan and continually stir the onions until they are brown. Top sausages with onions and.serve with Sweet Potato Mash and Grilled Tomatoes.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'6 links polish sausage', u'1 white onion, quartered and sliced', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons whole, unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u' Sweet Potato Mash, recipe follows', u' Grilled Tomatoes, recipe follows']
title: Grilled Polish Sausage topped with Caramelized Onions, Sweet Potato Mash, and Grilled Tomatoes

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Cover the bottom of a skillet with softened butter. Arrange pierogis in the pan in a single layer. Add 1 cup water to the pan. Cover pan and place over medium high heat. Cook covered 8 minutes, remove lid and cook out any liquid in the pot. ', u'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Brown kielbasa and remove from pan. Cover kielbasa with foil to keep warm. Drain fat and add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and 1 tablespoon butter. Raise heat to high. Add onion to the pan and saute for a few minutes to soften. Add chopped kale in batches as it wilts into the pan. When kale is wilted, add sauerkraut. Season stir-fry with mustard, paprika, salt and pepper. Return kielbasa to pan. Toss to combine and transfer to a serving platter.', u'Let the pierogis "stick" and brown in the butter as the liquid evaporates. Remove crisp pierogis from heat to a plate.', u'Stir together the chopped herbs and sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve with pierogis.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons softened butter', u'1 package frozen pierogis, potato filled dumplings -- any brand or variety', u'1 1/2 pounds kielbasa, cut in large slices on an angle', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 turn of the pan', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 large red onion, quartered and sliced', u'1 1/2 pounds kale, trimmed and coarsely chopped', u'1 pound sauerkraut, drained', u'1 teaspoon ground mustard or 2 tablespoons prepared spicy brown mustard', u'1 teaspoon sweet paprika, 1/3 palm full', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill or 2 teaspoons dried dill leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped chives', u' A handful of parsley leaves, chopped', u'1 cup sour cream']
title: My Version of My Friend Jon's Polish Stir-Fry and Pierogis Pot Stickers with Herbs and Sour Cream

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 175 degrees F.', u'Heat the oil over medium heat in a heavy-bottomed skillet. Add the sausages and cook on each side, undisturbed, until golden brown, about 5 minutes a side. Set on a baking dish in the oven to keep warm.', u'To the same skillet, add the onions and stir to combine with the oil. Season the onions with salt and pepper and cook over medium-low heat, undisturbed, until the bottom of the onions begin to caramelize, about 10 minutes. Stir only once and cook for another 25 minutes, undisturbed. Once the onions are golden and soft, set aside.', u'For the sandwich build: Place a sausage on a bun, slather in good yellow mustard, top with an ample amount of caramelized onions and 2 or 3 sport peppers. Wrap the sandwich in deli paper, parchment paper or foil. Let sit for 5 minutes to get all good and steamed up. Eat while standing with only TWO napkins and a giant pop.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'4 links Polish kielbasa sausage, patted dry with a paper towel (about 1 1/2 pounds)', u'1 yellow onion, thinly sliced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 fresh poppy seed hot dog buns', u' Yellow mustard', u'6 to 10 pickled sport peppers']
title: Maxwell St. Style Polish Sausage Sandwich

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the pierogi dough: Whisk the applesauce, vegetable oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1 egg and 1/2 cup warm water in a bowl. Put the flour in another bowl and stir in the applesauce mixture. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes, dusting with flour as needed. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside, about 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, make the filling: Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Transfer to a paper towellined plate. Drain all but 2 tablespoons fat from the skillet. Add the mushrooms, season with salt and cook over high heat, stirring until browned, about 4 minutes. Add the onion and cook until soft, about 4 more minutes. ', u'Stir in the sauerkraut, thyme, paprika, 1 cup applesauce and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook until the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes, then uncover and cook until thickened, about 4 minutes. Chop the bacon and add to the skillet with the remaining 1/4 cup applesauce and salt to taste.', u'Make the pierogies: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Beat the remaining egg in a bowl with 1 tablespoon water. Roll out half of the dough to less than 1/8 inch thick (keep the remaining dough covered with plastic wrap). Cut into rounds using a 3 1/2-inch cookie cutter or a drinking glass. Top each round with 1 tablespoon of the mushroom filling, brush the edges with the beaten egg and fold in half; crimp with a fork to seal. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling.', u'Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Boil the pierogies in batches until tender, about 5 minutes, then transfer to the skillet using a slotted spoon and toss with the butter until browned. Serve with applesauce and sour cream. ', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup smooth applesauce or strained chunky applesauce, plus more for serving', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u' Kosher salt', u'2 large eggs', u'2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u' Sour cream, for serving', u'5 slices bacon', u'8 ounces cremini mushrooms, sliced', u' Kosher salt', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'8 ounces sauerkraut, rinsed', u'2 teaspoons fresh thyme, chopped', u'2 teaspoons paprika', u'1 1/4 cups chunky applesauce']
title: Mushroom-Apple Pierogies

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Spread mustard onto a warm, soft hot dog bun. Add cheese, hot dog, pastrami and top with sauerkraut.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons mustard', u'1 hot dog bun', u'1 to 2 slices Swiss cheese', u'1 Polish hot dog, steamed', u'3 ounces sliced premium pastrami', u'1/4 cup sauerkraut']
title: Pink's Polish Pastrami Reuben Dog

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Pass the pork, pork fat, and veal through a food grinder fitted with a coarse die. Place the meat in a large bowl and combine with the remaining ingredients, except the oil. Mix well by hand. Heat a teaspoon of oil in a small skillet, and cook about 2 teaspoons of the mixture to test the seasoning. Adjust seasonings, to taste.', u'With the sausage attachment on a mixer, stuff the casings, if being used. Twist and tie off to make 4-inch sausages. (Alternately, shape into patties.)', u'Heat a large pot of vegetable oil to 360 degrees F. With a sharp fork, prick each sausage twice, then carefully ease in batches into the hot oil. Cook until cooked through and golden brown, turning, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve with Polish Honey sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds pork loin or butt, removed from the bone and diced', u'1/2 pound pork fat', u'1/4 pound veal', u'1/2 cup dry red wine', u'1 head garlic, peeled and minced', u'1/4 cup finely chopped green onions', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'3/4 teaspoon Essence, recipe follows', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'2 feet hog casings, optional', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' Polish Honey Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'4 cups thinly sliced yellow onions', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 cup beef or chicken stock', u'6 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons Creole mustard, or other spicy whole grain mustard', u'2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar']
title: Polish Deep-Fried Garlic Sausage

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Coat a 3-quart saucepan with the oil and place over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add the vinegar and sugar; simmer, until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and remove from the heat.', u'Place a skillet over medium heat and coat with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Saut\xe9 the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes, until soft. Stir in the tomato paste, a splash of wine, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the prepared sweet and sour tomato sauce, mix to incorporate and then take it off the heat. Combine the ground meat in a large mixing bowl. Add the egg, the cooked rice, and the sauteed onion mixture. Toss the filling together with your hands to combine, season with a generous amount of salt and pepper.', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Remove the large, damaged outer leaves from the cabbages and set aside. Cut out the cores of the cabbages with a sharp knife and carefully pull off all the rest of the leaves, keeping them whole and as undamaged as possible, (get rid of all the small leaves and use them for coleslaw or whatever.) Blanch the cabbage leaves in the pot of boiling water for 5 minutes, or until pliable. Run the leaves under cool water then lay them out so you can assess just how many blankets you have to wrap up the filling. Next, carefully cut out the center vein from the leaves so they will be easier to roll up. Take the reserved big outer leaves and lay them on the bottom of a casserole pan, let part of the leaves hang out the sides of the pan. This insulation will prevent the cabbage rolls from burning on the bottom when baked. Use all the good looking leaves to make the cabbage rolls. Put about 1/2 cup of the meat filling in the center of the cabbage and starting at what was the stem-end, fold the sides in and roll up the cabbage to enclose the filling. Place the cabbage rolls side by side in rows, seam-side down, in a casserole pan.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Pour the remaining sweet and sour tomato sauce over the cabbage rolls. Fold the hanging leaves over the top to enclose and keep the moisture in. Drizzle the top with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Bake for 1 hour until the meat is cooked.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'1 1/2 quarts crushed tomatoes', u'2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 yellow onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u' Splash dry red wine', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 pound ground pork', u'1 large egg', u'1 1/2 cups steamed white rice', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 large heads green cabbage, about 3 pounds each']
title: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls (Galumpkis)

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Mix all ingredients, except vegetable oil together in a large mixer fitted with a dough hook for 11 to 12 minutes or until dough reaches 78 degrees F. Set dough aside to rise for 30 to 45 minutes.', u'Divide and round dough into golf ball-sized pieces, put onto sheet pan and proof until the balls grow to around the size of soft balls, about 30 to 45 minutes.', u'Preheat a fryer to 360 degrees F.', u'Deep fry in vegetable oil until golden brown. Cool. Using a piping bag fitted with a plain tip,  fill with your favorite preserves and top with powdered sugar.']
ingredients: [u'1 ounce melted butter', u'1 ounce lemon juice', u'1 ounce rum', u'1 quart water', u'1 quart eggs', u'1/2 quart sugared eggs yolks', u'1/2 ounce salt', u'4 1/2 ounces milk powder', u'1 pound granulated sugar', u'1 pound, 10 ounces shortening', u'1 pound cake flour', u'9 1/2 pounds high gluten flour', u'1 pound yeast', u' Vegetable oil, for deep frying']
title: Polish Pre-Lenten Jelly Doughnuts: Paczki

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, add filling ingredients and combine well. Set aside.', u'In a large bowl add both flours, baking powder and salt and mix well. In a separate bowl add the remaining dough ingredients and whisk until combined. Add wet ingredients to the dry ingredient using a wooden spoon to form a ball. Cut in half. (You can freeze dough for another time, if desired.)', u'Flour a work surface and roll dough about 1/8-inch thick. Use a 3-inch biscuit cutter to cut out 12 rounds from the dough.', u'Place a dollop of filling in the center of each dough round. Fold dough over filling to form a half moon. Press edges together with your thumb. Seal the edges using the flat tines of a fork.', u'Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a simmer. Add perogies and cook for about 2 minutes. Drain perogies.', u'Meanwhile, in a large skillet over high heat, melt half of the butter and add the onion.', u'Cook onions for 5 to 6 minutes until slightly caramelized. Add perogies and the remaining butter. Allow to saute for a few minutes, then add the scallions.', u'Remove to a platter and serve with sour cream.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups leftover mashed potatoes', u'1/2 cup smoked ham, diced', u'1/4 cup frozen sweet peas, thawed', u'1/2 cup shredded Gruyere', u'2 cups bread flour', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 egg, beaten', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 cup warm water', u'1 gallon salted water', u'1 small onion, sliced', u'1/2 stick butter', u'2 scallions, sliced', u' Sour cream, to garnish']
title: Smoked Ham Stuffed Perogies

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'Preheat grill. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Cut kielbasa into 3-inch lengths and butterfly lengthwise. Place on hot grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side turning frequently, charring all sides. Remove from grill. Transfer kielbasa to a baking sheet and place in oven to cook for another 5 to 6 minutes.', u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add butter and sugar. Allow sugar to cook to a golden brown color. Add onions and cook until caramelized. Stir in the sauerkraut and cook for 5 to 6 minutes until onions and sauerkraut are wilted and colored.', u'Remove kielbasa from oven and cut into 1-inch pieces. Add to pan of sauerkraut and onions. Toss together and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a platter, garnish with parsley and serve with Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds smoked Polska kielbasa', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 onion, sliced', u'3 cups sauerkraut, drained', u'3 tablespoons freshly chopped parsley leaves', u' Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup yellow mustard', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/4 cup Dijon mustard', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne', u'1 tablespoon prepared horseradish', u' Pinch salt', u' Pinch cracked black pepper']
title: Grilled Kielbasa with Sauerkraut and Onions

directions: [u'Remove the center core of each head of cabbage. Place in large pot of boiling water. Boil until soft, removing each leaf as it softens. Let leaves cool, then trim the thick rib on each leaf. Reserve 14.5 ounces of the cabbage cooking water.', u'Boil rice in a separate saucepot until half cooked. Drain and set aside.', u'In a large skillet, saute bacon and discard excess fat. Add the onion to the skillet and cook until lightly browned. Chop the bacon into small pieces and add back to the pan.', u'In a bowl combine beef, pork, partially cooked rice, pepper, salt, eggs, cooked onion-bacon mixture, paprika, and celery salt. Measure the mixture with medium sized ice-cream scoop to make each halupki the same size.', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'On each separate cabbage leaf, place 1 scoop of the meat mixture at the bottom of the leaf and roll, tightly tucking the sides to cover the mixture. Line the bottom of a roasting pan (not aluminum) with cabbage leaves that are too dark or to small to use for rolling. Place halupkis in roasting pan, making 2 layers.', u'Combine tomato soup, broth, chopped tomatoes, and reserved cooking liquid and pour over halupki. Cover and bake for 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Add more liquid, if needed.', u'They taste best the next day.']
ingredients: [u'2 large cabbage heads, coarse outer leaves removed', u'1 1/2 cups rice, uncooked', u'1/4 pound bacon strips, diced', u'2 medium onions, diced', u'2 pounds ground lean beef', u'2 pounds ground pork', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper, ground', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'4 eggs, beaten', u'1/4 teaspoon paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon celery salt', u'1 (14.5 ounce) can tomato soup', u'1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', u'1 can chopped tomatoes with chiles, optional']
title: Halupkis: Stuffed Cabbage

directions: [u'Make a well from the flour. Add eggs and about 1/2 cup of water. The amount of water will vary according to the weather. You want to make a stiff dough.  Divide it into 3 equal portions and knead until silky smooth.', u'Fillings: We usually make cheese and kapusta (sauerkraut), but you can use meat, potatoes, or even fruit.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3 heaping cups flour', u'3 eggs, beaten', u' Salt', u'1 stick butter', u'1 large onion, 1/4-inch dice', u'32 -ounce canned or fresh kapusta (sauerkraut), rinsed well to remove brine', u' Salt and pepper', u" Cheese filling (note: a traditional recipe would call for farmer's cheese, but we find it too dry)", u'1 pound ricotta', u'2 eggs', u' Salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar']
title: Pierogi

directions: [u'To make Pierogie Dough: Combine all ingredients and mix well. Knead dough on flat surface for approximately 5 to 7 minutes. Let dough rest for 30 minutes or refrigerate overnight; the dough can be kept in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.', u'Roll out dough into a thin sheet, approximately 1/4-inch thick. Then cut in circles: 2 inches for small pierogies and 3 1/2 inches for large pierogies. Fill circles with desired filling. Pinch the edges well and cook them in rapidly boiling water for approximately 10 minutes. Drain and serve immediately with butter. If you decide to store them, dip them in cold water, drain, and let them cool on a cookie sheet. When completely cool, store them in refrigerator.', u'To make Jalapeno Filling: Place potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Add salt, bring to a boil over high heat, and cook until potatoes are soft. When potatoes are done, melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft; you can continue cooking until onions are caramelized if you so desire. Drain the potatoes and mash them. Add the cooked onion and jalapeno and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Continue mashing until blended. Let filling cool. Use 1 tablespoon of filling to fill the circles of dough as directed above.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 egg', u'2 tablespoons margarine', u'3/4 cup lukewarm water', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 1/2 pounds Idaho potatoes, washed and peeled', u'3 cups cold water', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1/2 cup butter', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'2 tablespoons chopped jalapeno peppers', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Potato and Jalapeno Pepper Pierogies

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'To make the sauce, melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and chicken stock. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add the vinegar and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and adjust the seasoning, to taste.', u'Separate the cabbage leaves and remove the hard spine from each leaf. Spread on paper towels and pat dry. Set aside.', u'To make the stuffing, in a medium skillet melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring, until very wilted and starting to caramelize, about 5 minutes.  Add the garlic, and cook, stirring, until for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly.', u'Lay the cabbage leaves, rib side down, on a flat work surface. Remove rib or shave down leaf to make leaf easy to roll.', u'In a large bowl, combine the beef, pork, rice, eggs, Essence, salt, pepper, and cooked onions. Mix well with a heavy wooden spoon or your hands.', u'Line a large baking dish or roaster with remaining cabbage leaves.', u'One at a time, spoon the filling into the center of the cabbage leaves, about 1/4 cup in each, depending upon the size of the leaves. Roll each into a neat cylinder and place in a single layer in the baking dish. Repeat with the remaining ingredients, stacking the cabbage packages, as necessary. Pour sauce over the rolls, cover tightly with aluminum foil, and bake until the meat is cooked through and the rolls are tender, about 2 hours.', u'Remove from the oven and serve the rolls with any remaining sauce spooned over the top, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons butter', u'1 cup chopped yellow onions', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 (28-ounce) can chopped tomatoes and their juices', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', u'1 large head cabbage, cored and scalded in hot water until soft and easy to separate', u'2 teaspoons unsalted butter', u'1 cup chopped yellow onions', u'2 teaspoons chopped garlic', u'1 1/2 pounds ground sirloin', u'1/2 pound ground pork', u'1 1/2 cups par-boiled long-grain white rice', u'2 eggs, beaten slightly', u'2 teaspoons Essence, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper']
title: Cabbage Rolls

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Coat a 9 by 13-inch baking pan with butter or nonstick spray. Line the bottom of the pan with parchment paper.', u'For the cookie: Whisk the flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl.', u'Beat the butter and sugar in a large bowl, with an electric mixer, at medium-high speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and add the egg and vanilla extract. Beat well, and then scrape down the sides.', u'While mixing on low speed, add the dry ingredients in 3 batches. Scrape down the bowl between each addition, and mix until just blended.', u'Transfer the dough to the prepared pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Bake until light golden brown with spots of darker golden brown and darker edges, about 30 minutes. Cool completely, about 45 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, prepare the fruit: Whisk the cornstarch and sugar together in a small saucepan. Whisk in orange juice until mixture dissolves. Stir in the fruits and candied orange peel. Bring to a simmer over medium, stirring often; continue to cook, stirring until thickened into a compote, about 3 minutes more. You should be able to draw the spoon along the bottom of pan and see the pan with no liquid seeping back. Remove from heat and transfer to a bowl. Stir in the nuts and lemon zest.', u'Spread fruit evenly over the top of the cooled crust.', u'Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake mazurkas until golden brown around edges and fruit sets but is still slightly glossy and jewel-like, about 10 minutes. Cool in pan on rack.', u'Cut, using an oiled knife, into 24 bars. Serve.', u"Busy baker's tips: When double-wrapped, the cookie base keeps at room temperature for 3 days or frozen for 1 month. The fruit compote can be made up to 1 week ahead and refrigerated. Store completed cookies in an airtight container, layers separated with parchment paper, for up to 5 days.", u'Copyright (c) 2007 Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved']
ingredients: [u'2 cups  all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon fine salt', u'1 cup  unsalted butter, soft, but still cool', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 large  egg', u'1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'4 teaspoons cornstarch', u'4 teaspoons sugar', u'1 cup orange juice', u'1/2 cup dried  apricots, diced', u'1/2 cup dried dates, quartered', u'1/2 cup dried  cherries, each halved', u'1/2 cup dark or golden  raisins', u'3 tablespoons candied orange peel, diced', u'1/2 cup raw peeled pistachios', u' Finely grated zest of 1/2 lemon']
title: Mazurkas (Poland)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Cut the cabbage in half lengthwise and remove the core.  Peel a couple of the outer leaves away from the cabbage halves and discard.  Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.  Add the cabbage and cook for 20 minutes or until tender.  Remove from the water and cool completely.  Carefully divide into individual leaves (eight whole leaves are needed).  Set aside. In a large saute pan, over medium heat, melt the butter.  Add the meat.  Season with salt and pepper.  Brown the meat for 5 minutes. Add the onions.  Season with salt and pepper.  Continue to cook for 4 minutes, or until the onions are translucent.  Remove from the heat and turn into a mixing bowl.  Cool slightly.  Stir in the rice, egg and parsley.  Mix well.  Season with salt and pepper. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.   Place 1/2 cup of the meat and rice mixture in the center of each cabbage leaf.  Roll up each leaf tightly.  Place in a shallow baking pan, add the water and cover with foil.  Bake for 30 minutes.   In a saucepan, over medium heat, melt the butter.  Stir in the flour and cook for 4 minutes for a blonde roux.  Stir in the tomatoes, garlic and sugar.  Season with salt and pepper.  Continue to cook for 2 minutes.  Stir in the stock and the thyme.  Bring the liquid to a boil, reduce to a simmer and continue to cook for 15 minutes or until the sauce coats the back of a spoon. To serve, spoon the sauce in the center of each plate.  Arrange two of the stuffed cabbage leaves in the center of the sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 small whole white cabbage', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1/2 pound ground pork', u'1/2 pound ground beef chuck', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup chopped onions', u'2 cups cooked, long-grain white rice', u'1 egg', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped parsley leaves', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'2 tablespoons flour', u'1 cup peeled, seeded and chopped tomatoes', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u' Pinch of sugar', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme']
title: Golabki

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine flour and salt in an electric mixer for 30 seconds. In a large bowl, combine eggs, oil, and 3 cups of water. Put electric mixer on a slow speed and add sour cream and egg mixture to the flour mixture. Mix for about 2 1/2 minutes. At this point check the dough and make sure it is creamy and pliable, if it is too sticky, add a bit of flour, if it is not pliable add more water. When dough reaches desired texture, remove from the mixer and let rest on a floured table, covered with plastic wrap, for about 30 minutes.', u'After 30 minutes, begin working the dough with a floured rolling pin.
