Roll dough out to a rectangular shape that is 1 to 1 1/2-inches thick. Cut this into quarters. Take 1 sheet and roll out to 1/4-inch thickness. If dough begins to stick, sprinkle it with a bit of flour. Using a 2 to 3-inch cookie cutter, cut dough into circles.', u'Once circles are cut, roll the circles to 1/8-inch. Place 1 tablespoon of the desired filling in the center of each circle. Lightly wet 1/2 of the edge of the circle with water, fold over and crimp together.', u'Gently place pierogi into hot salted water that is just under boiling point, about 190 degrees F, and cook for 3 minutes or until pierogi float. Drain.', u'Melt butter in a large frying pan. Add pierogis and cook until golden brown. Serve with Sauteed onions, a dollop of sour cream and chopped chives.']
ingredients: [u'13 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup salt', u'4 eggs', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'4 cups cold water', u'8 ounces sour cream or cream cheese', u' Desired filling (mashed potato and cheddar cheese; mashed potato, mushroom and Swiss cheese; sauerkraut ? make sure that filling is not too watery)', u'3 tablespoons butter', u' Sauteed onions, for garnish', u' Sour cream, for garnish', u' Chives, for garnish']
title: Pierogis

directions: [u'Heat vegetable oil in a medium sized saute pan. Add the sliced onions to the pan and saute them in vegetable oil for approximately 3 minutes, or until they are tender. Add the sliced polish sausage and saute until each piece is heated through. Serve warm with spinach and risotto.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil, for sauteing', u'1 medium yellow onion, sliced', u'6 links Polish Sausage, sliced diagonally', u' Sauteed spinach, recipe follows', u' Mushroom risotto, recipe follows']
title: Sauteed Polish Sausage with Sweet Yellow Onions, Sauteed Spinach and Mushroom Risotto

directions: [u"In a large mixing bowl, add flour, salt, cream cheese, egg, butter, and milk. With your hands mix together until dough forms a ball. Turn out on a floured board and knead until smooth. You may add a little more flour to make the dough pliable. Divide dough into fourths. Put the pieces under a damp cloth, so it won't dry out. Roll the first piece to 1/4 inch of thickness and cut with a 3-inch cookie cutter or a glass. Put pierogi rounds under damp cloth while cutting the rest.", u'Filling: This may be made ahead of time! Mash hot potatoes. Saute onion in the butter and add this to the hot mashed potatoes along with the cheddar cheese, salt and pepper. You may add a little milk if too dense. The consistency should be a little thicker than mashed potatoes.', u'Assembly of pierogis: For each pierogi, place 1 tablespoon of potato mixture in the center of the dough circle. Fold over to form a half circle. Seal edges by pinching together with your fingers. I then take a fork and press all along the edges. Repeat with remaining dough filling.', u'Cooking pierogis: Fill a large pot half full with water and bring to a boil. Drop 5 or 6 pierogis in at a time. When they float to the top, cook for 1 minute. Place in a colander to drain. They will stick to paper towels. Repeat with remaining pierogis.', u'Frying pierogis: In a large frying pan saute onion in butter and remove onion to a separate bowl. Place pierogis in pan and cook for 2 mintues on each side. You may have to add more butter for frying. Remove and place in a covered casserole dish. When all pierogis are prepared, pour sauteed onion over the top. Serve with sour cream or applesauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'4 ounces cream cheese, room temperature', u'1 egg', u'1/2 teaspoon butter, softened', u'1/2 cup lukewarm milk', u'4 to 5 medium potatoes, peeled, boiled in water until fork tender', u'2 teaspoons butter', u'1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 medium onion, finely diced', u'1 large onion, roughly chopped', u'1 stick butter, plus extra for frying']
title: Pat's Potato Pierogis "Elegante"

directions: [u'Have ready a bowl of ice and cold water. Cut an X in blossom end of peaches. In a saucepan of boiling water blanch peaches 15 seconds and with a slotted spoon transfer to ice water to stop cooking. Peel peaches and cut each into 8 wedges. In a small bowl toss peaches with lemon juice. In an 8 to 9-inch heavy skillet cook sugar over moderately low heat, stirring slowly with a fork (to help sugar melt evenly), until melted and pale golden. Cook caramel, without stirring, swirling skillet, until deep golden, 5 to 6 minutes. Carefully add peaches and cream (mixture will vigorously steam and caramel will harden). Cook mixture, stirring frequently, until caramel is dissolved and peaches are tender, about 5 minutes. Cool peaches to warm and serve over ice cream.']
ingredients: [u'4 large ripe peaches', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'1 pint vanilla ice cream']
title: Peaches in Caramel Over Vanilla Ice Cream

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large mixing bowl, add the pork, beef and pork fat.  In a small mixing bowl, combine the remaining ingredients together.  Mix well.  Toss the meat with the seasoning blend and mix well.  Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Grind the meat twice in a meat grinder fitted with a 1/2-inch die.  A food processor could also be used.  Stuff the ground mixture into the casings to form 12-inch links. Prepare the smoker.  Place the sausages in the smoker and cook for 10 to 15 minutes.  Remove and cool completely. Prepare the steamer.  Place the sausages in the steamer and cook for 10 minutes.  Remove and cool completely.   Place the sausage back in the smoker and continue to smoke for 10 minutes.  Remove and cool completely.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds pork butt, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1/2 pound beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1/2 pound pork fat, cubed', u'1/2 cup chopped garlic', u'4 tablespoons paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon caraway seeds', u'1 teaspoon ground dried marjoram', u'1 teaspoon ground dried summer savory', u'1 pint container of 1 1/2-inch casings']
title: Kielbasa

directions: [u'Combine 5 cups water, the butter, the carrots and potatoes in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are tender. Add the pickles and continue to boil.', u'Meanwhile, whisk together the flour, sour cream and salt in a separate bowl. Add enough water to make a paste, then slowly, to avoid curdling, add the mixture to the soup to thicken. Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat. Add pickle juice, to taste.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons butter or margarine', u'5 medium carrots, shredded', u'2 large potatoes, cubed (about 2 cups)', u'3 large dill pickles, shredded', u'1 cup flour', u'1 cup sour cream', u' Salt', u' Pickle juice']
title: Dill Pickle Soup

directions: [u'Saute onions, and garlic in 1 tablespoon butter until translucent and set aside to cool. Mix beef with cooled onion mixture, eggs, bread crumbs, parsley, and mushrooms. Form into 4-ounce patties and saute in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter until golden brown on both sides and set aside. In saucepan melt 2 ounces of butter and add flour and cook over low heat for 1 minute until wet sand consistency. Begin to add stock 1/3 at a time whisking and bringing to simmer each time making sure there are no lumps. Add mushrooms and simmer for 1/2 hour. Place patties in a roasting pan and pour gravy over patties and bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 45 minutes. Garnish with grilled onions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces minced onion', u'1 ounce minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'2 pounds ground beef', u'4 eggs', u'8 ounces bread crumbs', u'4 ounces chopped flat leaf parsley', u'12 ounces cooked and diced button mushrooms', u'2 ounces butter', u'2 ounces flour', u'24 ounces veal stock', u'1 pound sliced button mushrooms', u'2 red onions, sliced 1/2-inch thick, grilled']
title: Salisbury Steak

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F.', u'Toss the potato wedges with the olive oil, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a bowl. Lay the potatoes on a baking sheet and cook until golden brown on each side, flipping halfway through, about 12 minutes per side. When both sides are golden and the potatoes can be pierced easily with a fork, the taters are done.']
ingredients: [u'2 russet potatoes, scrubbed and cut into 8 long wedges', u'3 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Roasted Potato Wedges

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Using a sharp knife, split the vanilla bean in half lengthwise.  With the back of the knife, scrape the pulp away from the bean.  Discard the bean.  In a saucepan, over medium heat, combine the milk, vanilla bean pulp, and 1/2 cup of the butter.  Bring to a boil.  Stir in the buckwheat and continue to cook until tender, about 20 to 25 minutes.  Remove from the heat and cool. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs and the sugar together.  Stir in the cooled buckwheat mixture, lemon zest and raisins.  Fold in the beaten egg whites.  Butter a shallow baking pan (8 by 8 by 2-inch, square) with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter.  Pour the buckwheat mixture into the prepared pan.  Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serve warm in individual serving bowls with cherry jam.']
ingredients: [u'1 vanilla bean', u'4 cups milk', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter', u'1 cup buckwheat', u'4 egg yolks', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon grated lemon zest', u'1/2 cup raisins', u'4 egg whites, beaten until stiff', u'1 cup cherry jam']
title: Buckwheat Pudding

directions: [u'For the stew: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place the pork, paprika, mushrooms, carrots, onions, peppers, salt and pepper in a roaster and roast 45 minutes.', u'For the potato pancake: Mix the onions, eggs, potatoes with their starch and some salt and pepper. Add the flour until the batter becomes thick but not too thick. Heat oil until hot in a pan. Spoon the batter into the pan and form a pancake. Fry on one side until brown, then flip and continue frying until both sides are brown, about 6 minutes.', u'Check the pork to make sure it is fully cooked. Strain the juice from the meat and vegetables, add to a pan and simmer over low heat. Slowly add flour into the juices to thicken the gravy.', u'Place the meat and vegetables on top of the potato pancake, cover with gravy and serve with sour cream.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups cubed pork butt', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'5 mushrooms, sliced', u'2 carrots, sliced', u'1 onion, chopped', u'1 green pepper, chopped', u'1 Hungarian pepper, chopped', u'1 jalapeno pepper, chopped', u' Salt and black pepper', u'1/4 cup ground onions', u'4 eggs', u'3 potatoes, peeled and ground, starch reserved', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 cup flour, plus more for thickening gravy', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' Sour cream, for serving']
title: Hungarian Pancake

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'In a small bowl, mix together jam and cream cheese until well incorporated. Set aside.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups lingonberry jam', u'4 tablespoons cream cheese, softened', u'2 tablespoons sliced mint', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 cup milk', u'1 tablespoon melted butter', u'2 eggs', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped mint leaves', u' Cooking spray', u'1 cup heavy whipping cream', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 teaspoon lemon extract', u'1/2 teaspoon lemon zest', u' Add all batter ingredients to a blender and blend well.']
title: Crepes with Lingonberry Jam

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'For the chicken: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Set a wire rack inside a baking sheet.', u'Heat the oil over medium heat in a heavy-bottomed skillet. Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge in the flour and shake off any excess. Fry the chicken in the oil until golden brown, 5 to 6 minutes a side. Set aside on the prepared baking sheet. Keep warm in the oven. Slice the chicken in half before assembling the sandwiches.', u'For the chicken jus: Add the oil into the same skillet from the chicken and saute the Italian seasoning, crushed red pepper, garlic and shallots until fragrant, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Deglaze with the white wine and bring to a simmer until the alcohol smell is diminished, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken stock and lemon juice and bring to a simmer again, about 10 minutes until the flavor intensifies. Keep warm for sandwich build.', u'For the peas and mushrooms: Heat half the oil in a heavy-bottomed skillet and saute the mushrooms without overcrowding or creating layers. You may have to do this in batches. Give the mushrooms one stir and let caramelize. Once one side is golden brown, season with salt and pepper, stir once and let cook until all sides are soft but golden. Remove to a plate. To the same skillet, add the remaining oil and the peas. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until warm but still very bright. Mix with the mushrooms and set aside.', u'For the sandwich build: On a nice fresh piece of split but hinged French roll, place a squirt of good mayo, 2 slices provolone, 2 Roasted Potato Wedges, 1 chicken breast, some mushroom and peas and top with hot giardiniera. Take the entire sandwich and either dunk in hot chicken jus or ladle on. Hold with one or two hands and bite hard.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (8 ounces each), butterflied', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 shallot, chopped', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 cup chicken stock', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 pound fresh button mushrooms, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound frozen green peas, thawed', u' Four 6-inch French hinged rolls', u' Mayo', u'8 slices provolone', u' Roasted Potato Wedges, recipe follows', u' Hot giardiniera', u'2 russet potatoes, scrubbed and cut into 8 long wedges', u'3 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Chicken Vesuvio Sandwich

directions: [u'Make the sponge by mixing ingredients in bowl and letting sit for 1/2 hour. ', u'In a standing mixer, fitted with a dough hook, add the sponge. Add in the flour, egg, egg yolks, salt, and sugar. Add any additional flour to make smooth dough. Place in oiled bowl, cover and set aside until doubled in volume. Punch down and let rise (covered) again. ', u'Punch down and roll out into a rough triangular shape that is about 1 1/2 feet and 1/2-inch thick. Paint with melted butter. Mix together sugar, cinnamon and hazelnuts. Sprinkle on. Roll up and press into well-buttered bundt pan. Let rise until doubled. ', u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. ', u'Bake for 40 minutes. Let cool then remove from pan. Cook together butter, sugar, honey, and liqueur. Paint on top. Sprinkle with nuts.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 envelope yeast (2 1/2 teaspoons)', u'1/2 cup milk', u'2 1/2 to 3 cups all purpose flour', u'1 egg', u'3 egg yolks', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u' Butter or vegetable oil or spray, for bowl', u'1/4 pound unsalted butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons melted, unsalted butter', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon cinnamon', u'1 cup toasted and chopped hazelnuts', u'1/4 cup butter', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/4 cup hazelnut liqueur', u'1/2 cup chopped, toasted hazelnuts']
title: Hazelnut Babka

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large bowl place the rice and cover with cold water. Using the palm of your hand, press down on the rice and swish it around in the water for 10 to 20 seconds. Pour off all water and repeat this process 3 or 4 times, or until the water does not turn cloudy. After the final rinse, drain the rice very well, then add the 1 3/4 cups plus 1 tablespoon of water and allow the rice to soak for half an hour in summer or for 1 hour in winter.', u"Nobu's tip: Place the rice and measured water in a heavy-bottomed 1 1/2 or 2 quart saucepan. (The saucepan should be deeper rather than wide, and should have a tight fitting lid.)", u'Place the saucepan over high heat, cover with the lid and cook until you see steam. As soon as you see steam coming out of the pot, turn off the heat and wait 7 minutes. After 7 minutes, turn the heat on high and count to 10. Turn off the heat, the rice will be perfect.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups seihakumai (Japanese polished white rice)', u'1 3/4 cups plus 1 tablespoon water']
title: White Rice, Japanese Style

author: Michael Symon
directions: [u'Saute shallots in half the butter until translucent add the rice and mix in with butter and shallots. Add the wine and cook over medium heat until it is absorbed stirring continuously, repeat the process with the 5 cups lobster stock adding 2 1/2 cups at a time. Remove from heat and add crab and mint and the remaining butter. Season with salt and pepper and let cool. Place 2 tablespoons in the center of each cabbage leaf and roll. Place stuffed cabbage in a hotel pan and cover with the remaining 16 ounces of stock and tomatoes. Cook in preheated 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Place on serving tray and garnish with mint.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces shallots minced', u'8 ounces butter', u'2 cups arborio rice', u'1 cup white wine', u'5 cups lobster stock, plus 16 ounces', u'2 pounds lump crab meat cleaned', u'4 tablespoons chopped mint, plus 2 tablespoons for garnish', u'24 large cabbage leaves stemmed and blanched', u'2 cups diced tomatoes peeled and seeded']
title: Stuffed Cabbage with Crab and Mint

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Place ingredients in order given on a warm, soft hot dog bun. Use caution when eating -- knife and fork recommended!']
ingredients: [u'1 (12-inch) jalapeno Polish dog', u'1/2 cup chili', u'1/4 cup grilled onions', u'1/4 cup chopped tomatoes', u'1/4 cup shredded lettuce', u'1/4 cup guacamole', u'1 soft hot dog bun']
title: Pink's Millennium Dog

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'In a large soup pot, heat the oil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-high, add the carrot, celery and onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for another 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Add the cabbage to the pot and cook, covered, stirring regularly to prevent burning, until softened, 6 to 8 minutes. Add the kielbasa and mustard and then add the chicken broth. Bring to a simmer and cook until the carrots are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.', u'In a bowl, mix together the butter and flour to form a buerre manier. Whisk the buerre manier into the soup and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup grapeseed oil', u'2 cups diced carrot', u'2 cups diced celery', u'2 cups diced yellow onion', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1 small head green cabbage, shredded', u'1 pound Polish kielbasa, diced', u'1/4 cup whole-grain mustard', u'3 quarts chicken broth', u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 ounces all-purpose flour', u' Kosher salt and black pepper']
title: Smoked Sausage and Cabbage Soup

directions: [u'Melt butter in a stockpot over medium heat. Add chopped onion, carrot, and celery. Saute until softened. Add flour. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring often. Add chicken broth and beer. Heat until it comes to a boil. Slowly add cheese while stirring until just boiling and smooth. Add half-and-half, salt, dry mustard, and Worcestershire sauce. Reduce heat to low and cook until soup has thickened. Cut smoked sausage into 1/2-inch pieces and place in a saucepan. Saute sausage over medium heat until heated through. It will probably take about 5 to 7 minutes. Add sausage to the soup, transfer to a large serving bowl and serve hot.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup butter', u'1 chopped medium sized yellow onion', u' At least 1/2 cup chopped carrot', u' At least 1/2 cup chopped celery', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 cups chicken broth', u'1 (12-ounce) beer of choice (recommended: Sierra Nevada Pale Ale or Blind Pig)', u'7 ounces extra-sharp Cheddar, shredded', u'7 ounces processed Swiss cheese, shredded', u'2 cups half-and-half', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u"1 pound smoked sausage (recommended: Otto's Smoked Polish Ring)"]
title: Otto's Beer Cheese Soup

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Smear a slice of black bread with the cream cheese, and top with the black cherry jam. Top with the second slice of bread and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 slices black bread*', u'1 to 2 tablespoons cream cheese', u'1 to 2 tablespoons best quality black cherry jam', u" *Cook's Note: Black bread can be found at speciality Polish bakeries and some supermarkets. Brown or rye bread can be substituted."]
title: Nigella's Hungarian Sandwich

directions: [u'Cut rhubarb into 1/2-inch pieces and macerate in 1/2 cup sugar for 1 hour. Meanwhile, puree strawberries with remaining 1/4 cup sugar. In a saucepan, cook rhubarb and orange juice, covered, until mushy.  Remove from heat and stir in strawberry puree.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound cleaned rhubarb', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 pints strawberries, hulled and pureed', u'2 cups orange juice', u'1/4 cup lemon juice', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup milk', u'1/2 cup cream', u'1/2 vanilla bean, scraped', u'3 egg yolks', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup buttermilk']
title: Strawberry-Rhubarb "Nothing" Soup: Zupa Nic

directions: [u'Fill a soup pot with 8 cups water set on medium-high heat.', u'In a pan, fry the chopped bacon. When it is done, take out and put into the water in the soup pot.', u'In the drippings of the bacon, fry the pork loin and then the onions. When brown, put them into the soup pot and bring to a boil. Add the crushed tomatoes, mushrooms, celery root, celery, carrots and some salt and cook for 15 minutes.', u'Next, add the potatoes, sausage, leeks, allspice, bay leaves Hungarian paprika and cook for another 15 minutes.', u'Add the pickles, garlic and seasoning if using, and let boil for 10 minutes. Add the dill and heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.  Guten Appetit!']
ingredients: [u'4 strips bacon, chopped', u'1 cup finely chopped pork loin', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'1 1/2 cups crushed tomatoes', u'1/2 cup finely chopped mushrooms', u'2 tablespoons shredded celery root', u'4 stalks celery, chopped', u'2 medium carrots, peeled and chopped', u' Salt and black pepper', u'3 cups cubed potatoes', u'1/2 cup chopped Polish sausage', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped leek', u'1 teaspoon allspice', u'1 teaspoon bay leaves', u'1 teaspoon Hungarian paprika', u'1 cup diced pickles', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon Eastern European seasoning, such as Vegeta, optional', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh dill', u'1 cup heavy cream']
title: Hangover Soup

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add the beer and onions and cook, stirring often and reducing the heat to low as the onions start to brown, until the onions are caramelized and all of the liquid has reduced to allow the sugars to brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.', u'In a large saute pan, heat the canola oil over medium heat. Split the links through the center just to open them up so they lay flat. Sear the links on the cut side until brown, about 5 minutes, then remove them from the pan. In the same pan, toast the buns again on the cut side until brown, a few minutes.', u'Spread the mustard onto the buns, then add the links. Top with the pickled peppers and caramelized onions. Finish with a small handful of watercress and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1/2 cup stout beer', u'1 Spanish onion, very thinly sliced', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 pound Polish kielbasa sausage link, cut into thirds', u'3 baguette portions (the length of the links), split through the center but not through the bottom', u'1/4 cup spicy whole-grain mustard', u'1/4 cup pickled sweet picante peppers, such as Peppadews', u'1 cup watercress']
title: Spicy Kielbasa Dog with Stout Onions

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Combine all ingredients in a Dutch oven. Bring to a simmer, over medium-low heat, cover, and cook for 1 hour, stirring a couple times.', u'Kielbasa:', u'Combine water and beer in a large pot. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Slip in sausages and cook 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Peppers:', u'Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. When oil is hot, add pepper slices, sprinkle generously with salt, and saute until wilted and lightly colored, about 8 minutes, stirring often.', u'Serve kielbasas with the kraut and peppers.']
ingredients: [u'1 head white cabbage, finely shredded', u'1 cup cider vinegar', u'3 cups water', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 tablespoon whole fennel seeds', u'2 quarts water', u'2 (12-ounce) bottles lager (recommended: Yuengling)', u'3 (1-pound) Polish-style sausage kielbasa, each cut into 4 pieces (recommended: Hillshire Farms)', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1 red pepper, seeded, cored, and sliced lengthwise into 1/2-inch strips', u'1 green pepper, seeded, cored, and sliced lengthwise into 1/2-inch strips', u' Salt']
title: Philly-style Kielbasa with Fennel Kraut and Peppers

directions: [u"If you haven't soaked the Porcini in advance (see note below) set combine Porcini and water in a saucepan and bring to a simmer; let soak for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain soaked Porcini, rinse them to remove grit; and chop them. Strain the soaking liquid through non-bleached paper towel or cotton cheesecloth-lined sieve; reserve for later. ", u'Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. When hot add chopped soaked Porcini and saute for a few seconds. Add the fresh mushrooms, cover and cook over very low heat until mushrooms are tender (if they begin to stick to the bottom of the pan, add a few spoonfuls of mushroom soaking liquid). Add reserved Porcini liquid and broth and bring to a simmer; add tortellini and cook, uncovered for 5 minutes or until tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper and portion out; garnish with chives. ', u'NOTE - to soak mushrooms in advance; cover 2 ounces of dried mushrooms with 1 quart of water; set in refrigerator overnight or for longer; remove soaked mushrooms and soaking liquid as needed.']
ingredients: [u'1 ounce dried Porcini or Polish mushrooms', u'2 cups warm water', u'1 teaspoon olive oil', u'4 ounces mixed wild and domestic mushrooms, trimmed and cut into thin slices', u'2 cups chicken broth', u'1 cup tortellini, stuffed with Porcini or plain cheese', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Fresh finely cut chives for garnish']
title: Tortellini in Porcini Broth

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, fold the cream cheese and adobo sauce together until the mixture is a uniform color. Transfer to a resealable plastic bag and refrigerate until ready to use.', u'Heat a grill pan to medium-high heat. Add the onions, drizzling with olive oil and seasoning with salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Cook, tossing, until the slices are tender and golden on the edges, 15 to 20 minutes. Add the sausages to the grill split-side down and grill, flipping once, until cooked through and charred, 8 to 10 minutes.', u'To assemble the hoagies, add a split sausage to the bottom piece of each bun. Remove the cream cheese mixture from the refrigerator and cut a hole in the corner of the bag. Press the bag to squeeze equal amounts of the mixture down the center of each sausage. Top with the grilled onions, a squirt of mustard and the bun tops.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces whipped cream cheese', u'1 tablespoon adobo sauce from canned chipotle peppers in adobo', u'1 sweet onion, halved and cut into slices (the size and shape of the fortune in a fortune cookie)', u' Olive oil, for drizzling', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 Polish sausages in casing (kielbasa), split lengthwise', u'4 hoagie buns, split', u' Yellow mustard, for topping']
title: Sunny's Spicy Seattle Hoagie

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Trim the excess skin from the duck or chicken and place on a lined baking sheet. Dry the trimmed skin in the oven, checking often, until crispy, about 15 minutes.', u'Add the skin to a food processor along with the breadcrumbs, oil and the 1/8 teaspoon thyme leaves and blend until uniform. Set aside. (This step can also be done while the cassoulet is stewing).', u'Heat the clarified butter over high heat in a heavy-bottomed saute or frying pan and, working in batches, sear the poultry, pork or lamb and sausage until they are caramelized, adding more butter if the pan gets dry. Remove the meats to a large roasting pan or deep broiler-proof baking dish as they are completed.', u'In the same pan you browned the meat in, saute the onions, carrots and celery until they are caramelized. Add the tomatoes, wine, and 5 cups water, deglazing the pan by scraping all the loose particles from the bottom of the pan.', u'Drain the beans and add them to the pan, along with the marjoram, parsley, bay leaves and 1/4 cup thyme. Bring the liquid to a boil.', u'Pour the beans and liquid over the meats in the roasting pan, cover the pan tightly with foil if no lid is available and bake until the meat is fork-tender and the beans have absorbed most of the liquid and are tender, about 3 hours.', u'Remove the meat from the pan, drain the liquid from the beans and vegetables and put it into a saucepan.', u'Add two cups of the cooked bean and vegetable mixture to the liquid and puree with an immersion blender or puree in a blender before adding to the liquid. This will thicken the liquid into a sauce.', u'Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Pour the liquid back over the remaining beans and vegetables, stirring to combine.', u'Preheat the broiler.', u'Slice the lamb or pork and lay it on the beans with the sausages and poultry legs. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture on top of the cassoulet and broil until the top is lightly browned.']
ingredients: [u'4 duck or chicken legs, cut into two pieces', u'1/2 cup breadcrumbs', u'1 teaspoon olive oil', u'1/4 cup fresh thyme leaves, chopped, plus', u'1/8 teaspoon leaves', u'2 tablespoons clarified butter, plus more as needed', u'3 pounds boneless lamb leg or pork shoulder', u'1 pound Polish or bratwurst sausage', u'1 1/2 cups large dice Spanish onions', u'1 1/2 cups large dice carrots', u'1 1/2 cups large dice celery', u'4 fresh tomatoes, large dice', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'5 cups water or chicken bouillon', u'1 pound navy beans, soaked in water overnight', u'1/4 cup fresh marjoram leaves, chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped', u'6 bay leaves', u' Salt and ground black pepper']
title: French Cassoulet

directions: [u'Blanch and refresh string beans in salted water.', u'In 1 tablespoon olive oil taken from the 1/2 cup, caramelize the minced shallot. ', u'Put shallot, mustard, vinegar, and vodka in a blender. Slowly drizzle in the remaining oil. Mix in sumakh, salt, and pepper. Serve over string beans (or asparagus). ', u'Optional: Garnish with a little chopped hard boiled egg and/or finely diced red bell pepper.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound string beans, trimmed, or 1 pound asparagus, peeled and trimmed', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1 large shallot, finely minced', u'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup Georgian or balsamic vinegar', u'2 tablespoons Polish vodka', u'1 tablespoon sumakh, see note', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 hard boiled eggs, finely chopped, optional', u'1 red bell pepper, finely diced, optional', u' Note: edible ground sumakh is available from Mid-Eastern or Russian markets or spice shop']
title: Cold String Beans with Vodka Vinaigrette

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Trim the excess skin from the duck or chicken and place on a lined baking sheet. Dry the trimmed skin in the oven, checking often, until crispy, about 15 minutes.', u'Add the skin to a food processor along with the breadcrumbs, oil and the 1/8 teaspoon thyme leaves and blend until uniform. Set aside. (This step can also be done while the cassoulet is stewing).', u'Heat the clarified butter over high heat in a heavy-bottomed saute or frying pan and, working in batches, sear the poultry, pork or lamb and sausage until they are caramelized, adding more butter if the pan gets dry. Remove the meats to a large roasting pan or deep broiler-proof baking dish as they are completed.', u'In the same pan you browned the meat in, saute the onions, carrots and celery until they are caramelized. Add the tomatoes, wine, and 5 cups water, deglazing the pan by scraping all the loose particles from the bottom of the pan.', u'Drain the beans and add them to the pan, along with the marjoram, parsley, bay leaves and 1/4 cup thyme. Bring the liquid to a boil.', u'Pour the beans and liquid over the meats in the roasting pan, cover the pan tightly with foil if no lid is available and bake until the meat is fork-tender and the beans have absorbed most of the liquid and are tender, about 3 hours.', u'Remove the meat from the pan, drain the liquid from the beans and vegetables and put it into a saucepan.', u'Add two cups of the cooked bean and vegetable mixture to the liquid and puree with an immersion blender or puree in a blender before adding to the liquid. This will thicken the liquid into a sauce.', u'Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Pour the liquid back over the remaining beans and vegetables, stirring to combine.', u'Preheat the broiler.', u'Slice the lamb or pork and lay it on the beans with the sausages and poultry legs. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture on top of the cassoulet and broil until the top is lightly browned.']
ingredients: [u'4 duck or chicken legs, cut into two pieces', u'1/2 cup breadcrumbs', u'1 teaspoon olive oil', u'1/4 cup fresh thyme leaves, chopped, plus', u'1/8 teaspoon leaves', u'2 tablespoons clarified butter, plus more as needed', u'3 pounds boneless lamb leg or pork shoulder', u'1 pound Polish or bratwurst sausage', u'1 1/2 cups large dice Spanish onions', u'1 1/2 cups large dice carrots', u'1 1/2 cups large dice celery', u'4 fresh tomatoes, large dice', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'5 cups water or chicken bouillon', u'1 pound navy beans, soaked in water overnight', u'1/4 cup fresh marjoram leaves, chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped', u'6 bay leaves', u' Salt and ground black pepper']
title: French Cassoulet

directions: [u'Heat a little clarified butter in a large pan. Add onion, sprinkling sugar over them to help them brown. Add garlic and cook for a few minutes. Stir the onions and garlic and place tripe pieces on top. Add tomatoes and 3/4 cup red wine and bring to a boil. Then add mushrooms and smoked beef, sausage, herbs and nutmeg. Season generously with salt and pepper. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.', u'After 1 hour, add remaining red wine and cook another 2 hours, until tripe is tender. Pour into warmed soup tureen and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Clarified butter', u'1 medium onion, sliced', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 clove garlic, crushed', u'2 pounds honeycomb tripe, par-boiled, cut into bite size portions', u'1 pound tomatoes, skinned, seeded, and cubed', u'1 3/4 cups dry red wine', u'4 ounces mushrooms, sliced', u'1/4 pound smoked beef, roughly sliced', u'1/2 pound Polish sausage, sliced into 1/2-inch rounds', u'1 bouquet garni (1 bay leaf, 2 teaspoons rosemary)', u'1/4 teaspoon nutmeg', u' Freshly ground salt, to taste', u' Freshly ground pepper, to taste']
title: Chuttletopf

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Combine 1 tablespoon soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil and brush onto chicken breasts. Arrange in a baking dish and bake until juices run clear, about 13 to15 minutes. Remove from oven, cool completely, and cut into 1/4-inch slices.', u'In a large bowl, combine Napa cabbage, red cabbage, carrot, scallions, water chestnuts, Mandarin orange and sliced chicken. In a separate bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons sesame oil, brown sugar and chili sauce. Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine. Divide among bowls and top each serving with 2 teaspoons toasted almonds.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce, divided', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil, divided', u'1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breasts', u'1/2 head napa cabbage, thinly shredded (about 6 cups)', u'1/4 head red cabbage, shredded (about 2 cups)', u'1 large carrot, shredded (about 2 cups)', u'3 scallions, trimmed and thinly sliced, greens included (about 1/2 cup)', u'1 (8-ounce) can sliced water chestnuts', u'1 (11-ounce) can Mandarin oranges in water, drained', u'1/3 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chili-garlic sauce or chili sauce', u'1/4 cup sliced almonds, toasted']
title: Chinese Chicken Salad

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler.', u'Tear the cabbage and slice the onions, and place in a large salad bowl. Crumble the noodles into a broiler pan, add the almonds, sesame seeds, and broil for 2 minutes, being careful not to scorch the sesame seeds. In a jar with a tight lid, combine the oil, sugar, vinegar, and salt with the contents of the seasoning pack. Cover the jar and shake well to blend the dressing. Pour the dressing over the salad, add the toasted sesame and almond, and toss to combine.']
ingredients: [u'1 head Napa or bok choy cabbage', u'3 green onions', u'1 (3-ounce) package ramen noodles with seasoning pack', u'1 (6-ounce) package slivered almonds', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt']
title: Chinese Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the broth, ginger, soy, wine, vinegar, sesame oil, sugar and salt in a soup pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Adjust the heat so the broth simmers and cooks to lightly flavor with ginger, about 10-15-minutes.', u'Add the carrots, and simmer until tender and cooked through, about 5 minutes. Just before serving, add the dumplings, cook for 3 minutes, stir in the scallions and spinach and cook until the greens wilt, about 1 minute. Divide among warm bowls and serve. Serve with chili sauce on the side if desired.', u'Optional- Cook the dumplings according to package directions for potstickers- Serve dumplings on the side of soup.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achiellos']
ingredients: [u'8 cups low-sodium chicken or mushroom broth', u'1 2 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and julienned or cut into match sticks', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce, preferably dark', u'1/4 cup Shaohsing rice cooking wine or pale dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar/or 2 tablespoons black vinegar', u'2 teaspoons dark sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Pinch of salt', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced on the bias- about 1 cup', u'24 frozen Chinese dumplings, pork, shrimp, or 1 pound package', u'3 scallions (white and green parts), thinly sliced', u'4 cups bag baby spinach', u' chopped cilantro (optional)', u' Asian chili paste (optional)']
title: Chinese Dumpling Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 teaspoon sugar and 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a large bowl. Add the steak and toss to coat; refrigerate until ready to cook.', u'Whisk the remaining 1 tablespoon each cornstarch and soy sauce, the oyster sauce and chicken broth in a small bowl; set aside.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the ginger, broccoli and the remaining 1 teaspoon sugar and stir-fry 3 to 4 minutes; transfer to a plate. Heat 1 more tablespoon peanut oil in the skillet, add the onion and stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook, turning gently, 2 minutes. Transfer the onion and tomatoes to the plate with the broccoli.', u'Reduce the heat to medium high; add the remaining 2 tablespoons peanut oil to the skillet. Add the garlic and steak and stir-fry 1 minute. Whisk the sauce mixture, then add to the skillet and simmer 1 minute. Return the vegetables to the skillet; cook until the meat is cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Serve with rice, if desired.', u'Per serving: Calories 404; Fat 24 g (Saturated 6 g); Cholesterol 45 mg; Sodium 1,055 mg; Carbohydrate 18 g; Fiber 4 g; Protein 30 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'4 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'5 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 pound flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'1 1/4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'4 thin slices peeled ginger', u'1 head broccoli, cut into florets', u'1 large onion, halved and sliced 1/2 inch thick', u'3 plum tomatoes, quartered lengthwise', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u' Cooked white rice, for serving (optional)']
title: Chinese Beef With Broccoli

author: Brian Boitano
directions: [u'Heat 2 tablespoons of canola oil in a wok over high heat.  Add the beaten eggs and fry until they are fully cooked.  Transfer them to plate. Add the remaining oil, ginger, garlic, carrot, and celery, and stir-fry for 2 minutes.  Add the sausage and half of the scallions and cook for 1 minute.  Add the cooked rice, soy sauce and rice wine vinegar.  Stir-fry until the rice is hot, about 2 minutes.  Stir in the reserved eggs and transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with the remaining scallions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup canola oil, divided', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'1 tablespoon chopped ginger', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 carrot, finely diced', u'2 stalks celery, finely diced', u'3 links Chinese sausage, sliced', u'1 small bunch scallions, sliced, divided', u'4 cups cooked white rice', u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar']
title: Fried Rice with Chinese Sausage

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place the chicken breasts on a sheet pan and rub with the skin with olive oil. Sprinkle liberally with salt and pepper. Roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until the chicken is just cooked. Set aside until cool enough to handle. Remove the meat from the bones, discard the skin, and shred the chicken in large bite-sized pieces.', u'Blanch the asparagus in a pot of boiling salted water for 3 to 5 minutes until crisp-tender. Plunge into ice water to stop the cooking. Drain. Cut the peppers in strips about the size of the asparagus pieces. Combine the cut chicken, asparagus, and peppers in a large bowl.', u'Whisk together all of the ingredients for the dressing and pour over the chicken and vegetables. Add the scallions and sesame seeds and season to taste. Serve cold or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'4 split chicken breasts (bone-in, skin-on)', u' Good olive oil', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 pound asparagus, ends removed, and cut in thirds diagonally', u'1 red bell pepper, cored and seeded', u'2 scallions (white and green parts), sliced diagonally', u'1 tablespoon white sesame seeds, toasted', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup good apple cider vinegar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'1/2 tablespoon honey', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon peeled, grated fresh ginger', u'1/2 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted', u'1/4 cup smooth peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Chinese Chicken Salad

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Heat 1-inch of canola oil in large saute pan, to 325 degrees F.', u'In a bowl mix the cream cheese, ricotta, and 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar with a whip, until thoroughly blended.', u'Beat egg and milk together. Place 1 1/2 tablespoons of cheese mix in center back of egg roll skin and place 4 to 6 raspberries in the center of cheese mixture.', u'Brush egg wash around edges of skin, fold left and right sides of skin in 1/2-inch, and then roll from back to front, insuring that the roll is sealed.', u'Place in oil and cook both sides until golden brown. Let drain on paper towels for 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Dust with cinnamon and sugar. Serve with whipped cream and raspberries, if desired.']
ingredients: [u' Canola oil, for frying', u'8 tablespoons cream cheese', u'3 tablespoons ricotta cheese', u'2 1/2 tablespoons powdered sugar (1 1/2 for mix, 1 tablespoon for garnish)', u'1 egg', u'3 tablespoons milk', u'10 thick egg roll skins', u'1 cup raspberries, fresh preferred', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon']
title: Chinese Cheesecake

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Place the pork in a bowl and sprinkle with the Chinese 5-spice powder, salt and white pepper. Add the grated ginger, breadcrumbs, finely chopped scallions, egg yolk, grated garlic and a drizzle of sesame oil. Mix together and roll into small meatballs. Dress in vegetable oil and roast until brown and golden, 15 to 18 minutes.', u'Heat a drizzle of vegetable oil in a soup pot. Stir in the sliced ginger, sliced garlic and chile peppers, followed by the chicken stock, 2 cups water, the bok choy and soy sauce. Simmer to flavor, cooking until the bok choy is tender-crisp, and then combine with the meatballs.', u'Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta to al dente. Combine the pasta with the sauce and meatballs, and serve in shallow bowls garnished with sesame oil, the thinly sliced scallions and crispy fried onions or fried noodles.', u"Cook's Note: For a make-ahead meal, cool and store the sauce and meatballs. Bring to room temperature before reheating to a low boil. Cook the pasta right before serving."]
ingredients: [u'12 ounces ground pork', u'1 teaspoon Chinese 5-spice powder (about 1/3 palmful)', u' Salt and white pepper', u'2 inches gingerroot, 1 inch grated and 1 inch sliced', u' Handful breadcrumbs', u'4 to 6 thin scallions, 1/2 minced, 1/2 finely chopped', u'1 egg yolk, beaten', u'1 to 2 large cloves garlic, 1/2 grated and 1/2 sliced', u' Sesame oil, for drizzling', u' Vegetable oil, for drizzling', u'1 to 2 red chiles (depending on your preferred level of heat), seeded and sliced', u'2 quarts chicken stock', u'3 cups shredded baby bok choy', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u' About 1/2 pound spaghetti', u' Fried onions, such as Durkee, or Chinese fried noodles, for garnish']
title: Chinese Spaghetti and Meatballs

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Remove tough stems from mushrooms and brush with damp towel to clean, Slice mushrooms. Chop chicken into small pieces.', u'Preheat a large skillet or wok to high.', u'Add oil to hot pan. Add chicken to the pan and sear meat by stir frying a minute or 2. Add mushrooms and cook another minute or two. Add salt and pepper to season, then garlic and ginger. Cook a minute more. Grate zest into pan, add bell pepper bits, chopped water chestnuts and scallions. Cook another minute, continuing to stir fry mixture. Add hoisin Chinese barbecue sauce and toss to coat the mixture evenly. Transfer the hot chopped barbecued chicken to serving platter and pile the quartered wedges of crisp iceberg lettuce along side. Add wedged oranges to platter to garnish. To eat, pile spoonfuls into lettuce leaves, wrapping lettuce around fillings and squeeze an orange wedge over.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups, 4 handfuls, fresh shiitake mushrooms', u'1 1/3 to 1 1/2 pounds thin cut chicken breast or chicken tenders', u'2 tablespoons light colored oil, such as vegetable oil or peanut oil', u' Coarse salt and coarse black pepper', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 inch ginger root, finely chopped or grated, optional', u'1 orange, zested', u'1/2 red bell pepper, diced small', u'1 small tin, 6 to 8 ounces, sliced water chestnuts, drained and chopped', u'3 scallions, chopped', u'3 tablespoons hoisin, Chinese barbecue sauce, available on Asian foods aisle of market', u'1/2 large head iceberg lettuce, core removed, head quartered', u' Wedges of navel orange -- platter garnish']
title: Barbecued Chinese Chicken Lettuce Wraps

directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine slaw, water chestnuts, orange segments, scallions, and chicken. Mix well.', u'Top with dressing and toss to coat. Enjoy!', u'PER SERVING (1/5th of recipe, 1 1/2 cups): 195 calories, 3g fat, 595mg sodium, 21g carbs, 4.5g fiber, 12.5g sugars, 22.5g protein']
ingredients: [u'1 (16-ounce) package (about 5 1/2 cups) dry broccoli cole slaw', u'1 (8-ounce) can (about 1 cup) canned sliced water chestnuts, drained', u'1 cup canned mandarin orange segments packed in juice (or light syrup), drained and chopped', u'1 cup chopped scallions', u'12 ounces cooked and chopped skinless lean chicken breast', u"3/4 cup low-fat sesame ginger dressing (recommended: Newman's Own Lighten Up!)"]
title: Scoopable Chinese Chicken Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the eggs with a pinch each of salt and pepper in a small bowl. Heat the peanut oil in a wok or large saucepan over high heat. Add the eggs and cook, undisturbed, until bubbles form on the surface and the bottom is set, about 1 minute.', u'Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring gently to break up the eggs, until the tomatoes begin to soften, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the chicken broth, 3 cups water, the scallions, sesame oil, soy sauce and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Partially cover and simmer 5 minutes.', u'Stir in the chicken, spinach and rice and warm through. Season the soup with salt and pepper.', u'Per serving: Calories 417; Fat 22 g (Saturated 5 g); Cholesterol 297 mg; Sodium 1,282 mg; Carbohydrate 27 g; Fiber 3 g; Protein 29 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'4 large eggs', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons peanut or vegetable oil', u'2 large tomatoes, halved and thinly sliced', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 bunch scallions, sliced', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken, skin removed', u'4 cups baby spinach', u'1 1/2 cups cooked rice (white, brown or wild)']
title: Chinese Chicken and Rice Soup

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'In a large pot of boiling water, blanch long beans for 2 minutes until slightly tender. Allow to cool.', u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add butter. Add scallions, ginger and garlic. Mix together. Add red pepper flakes and long beans. Allow to cook for a few minutes. Stir in chicken stock, honey and sesame oil. Season with salt and pepper, to taste, and add sesame seeds, if desired. Mix together.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound Chinese long beans', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'2 tablespoons sliced scallion', u'1 tablespoon freshly minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u' Pinch red pepper flakes', u'1/2 cup chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u' Salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, optional']
title: Glazed Chinese Long Beans

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u"This recipe makes 48 dumplings-a large batch. If you halve the recipe, use the whole egg, and, if it's more convenient for you, just use 2 boneless duck breast halves. If you have the patience to shape all of the dumplings, just freeze some of them; they will keep, tightly covered, for 2 weeks."]
ingredients: [u'4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups hot water', u'2 boneless duck breasts and legs with skin, put through meat grinder fitted with medium blade', u'1 cup finely chopped savoy cabbage', u'3 tablespoons freshly chopped scallions', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped chives', u'1 egg, lightly beaten', u'2 tablespoons chili paste', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup black vinegar', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon chili paste', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped mint leaves', u'1 tablespoon freshly chopped Thai basil leaves', u'1/2 habanero pepper, minced', u' Peanut oil, for cooking', u' Cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Lime wedges, for garnish']
title: Chinese-Style Dumplings

directions: [u'First mix cabbage and onions in a  large bowl, set aside.', u'Melt butter in a frying pan over  medium heat. Break noodles in small  pieces and brown along with sesame  seeds and almonds.  Cool and drain  on paper towels.', u'To make dressing, mix together all  ingredients and microwave to  dissolve the sugar. Let cool (about  20 minutes) before serving.   Dressing can be made a day ahead of  time.', u'Toss together all salad ingredients  and add dressing, just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1 large head Napa cabbage, chopped', u'5 green onions, diced', u'1/2 cup butter', u'2 packages ramen noodles (discard soup flavoring)', u'1/2 cup sesame seeds', u'1 small package sliced almonds', u'1 cup vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1/2 cup white vinegar', u'1 cup sugar']
title: Crunchy Chinese Salad

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.', u'Rub the ribs all over with the five-spice powder; then season generously with salt and pepper. Put the ribs in a single layer in a roasting pan and slow-roast until they are almost tender, about 2 hours.', u'Meanwhile make the glaze. In a large bowl combine the soy sauce, grapefruit juice, hoisin sauce, ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, chili, garlic and ginger in a saucepan. Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat. Cook until the sauce reduces and thickens then remove from the heat. Strain the sauce and reserve.', u'When the ribs are about 30 minutes away from being done, baste them with the teriyaki sauce. Cook until the meat pulls easily from the bone (about 1/2-inch of bone will show).', u'Just before serving, preheat the broiler. Baste the ribs again with the teriyaki sauce and brown them under the broiler for 5 to 8 minutes. (Keep a close eye on these guys - ribs go from perfectly crisp to perfectly burnt in seconds.) Separate the ribs with a cleaver or sharp knife, pile them on a platter, and pour on the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, chopped cilantro, and green onion before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 (4-pound) racks pork spareribs, trimmed of excess fat', u'1/2 cup Chinese five-spice powder', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 cup grapefruit juice', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1 fresh red chili, minced', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, whacked open with the flat side of a knife', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, for garnish', u' Chopped fresh cilantro and green onion, for garnish']
title: Chinese Spareribs with Teriyaki Glaze

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, mix together the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, oils and pepper flakes. Mix in the cucumbers and red bell pepper. Chill before serving']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u' Dash of sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'2 cucumbers, peeled, seeded and thinly sliced', u'1 small red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced into strips']
title: Chinese Cucumber Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring the broth, ginger, soy sauce, wine, vinegar, sesame oil, sugar and a pinch of salt to a boil in a soup pot over high heat. Lower the heat and simmer about 10 minutes. Add the carrots and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes.', u'Add the dumplings and cook until just tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in the scallions and spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 2 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and julienned', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce, preferably dark', u'1/4 cup Chinese Shaoxing rice wine, dry sherry or white vermouth', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Kosher salt', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced (about 1 cup)', u'1 pound frozen Chinese dumplings, pork or shrimp (about 24)', u'3 scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u'4 cups baby spinach']
title: Chinese Dumpling Soup

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Mix together the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, honey, five-spice powder, garlic, ginger and food coloring in a metal, non-reactive bowl. Pour the marinade into a large zip-top bag, reserving 1/2 cup on the side for basting later. Add the ribs to the bag and marinate, refrigerated, for at least 3 hours, though longer is better and overnight is ideal.', u'Heat a charcoal or gas grill to 275 degrees F for direct and indirect grilling.', u'Remove the ribs from the marinade (discard the marinade) and place onto a wire rack. Place the rack directly on the cooler side of the grill. Cook until the meat is very tender, basting with the reserved marinade 3 times during the cooking process, 2 to 3 hours.', u'Drizzle the ribs with honey, move them to the direct heat side and quickly char each rib to caramelize.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons dark brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons honey, plus a bit extra to finish', u'1 tablespoon five-spice powder', u'1 teaspoon granulated garlic', u'1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon red food coloring', u'2 racks spare ribs (8 to 10 pounds, St. Louis-style work best), individually sliced into single ribs']
title: Takeout-Style Chinese Spare Ribs

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the sesame oil, black soy sauce, balsamic, sugar, salt, and Chile Oil. Whisk to blend. Stir in half of the sliced scallions. Set aside in the refrigerator.', u'When the water boils, season with salt until the water tastes like seawater. Plunge the pasta in the boiling water and cook, 1 to 2 minutes, until al dente. Place a colander in the sink. Remove the pot from the heat and pour off most of the water into the colander, catching any pasta as the water pours out.', u'Remove the colander from the sink and fill the pot still containing the pasta with cold water. You want the pasta to cool quickly by being submerged in the cold water. This will assure a chewy texture.', u'Drain the pasta thoroughly in the colander, shaking it a few times to remove excess water covering the pasta. Spread a kitchen towel on a flat surface and turn the noodles onto the towel. Gently use a second towel to dry the noodles. Removing the excess moisture assures that the sauce will have its proper flavoring effect on the noodles. Any water from cooking the pasta dilutes the noodles and makes them taste more like water than anything else. Gingerly transfer them the bowl with the sauce. Use your hands to mix the pasta and the sauce, taking care that all of the pasta gets coated. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until ready to serve.', u'These noodles can marinate for a few hours or overnight before serving. Serve them cold, tossing them again in the sauce just before serving, and garnish with the remaining scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup sesame oil', u'7 tablespoons black soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u'4 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt, plus additional for cooking pasta', u'2 teaspoons Fresh Chile Oil, recipe follows', u'12 scallions, roots trimmed, green and white parts thinly sliced, divided', u'1 pound 1/16-inch long thin noodles, regular spaghetti, or fresh Chinese egg noodles', u'8 fresh red cayenne chile peppers', u'2 fresh red Scotch bonnet chile peppers', u'1 cup canola oil', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt']
title: Chinese Chilled Noodles

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Whisk together the vinegar, peanut butter, ginger, chipotle pepper puree, soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, and canola oil in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Combine cabbage, lettuce, carrots, snow peas, cilantro, and green onion in a large bowl. Add the dressing and toss to combine. ', u'Transfer to a serving platter and top with the shredded chicken, chopped peanuts, and mint. Drizzle with chili oil, if desired. Garnish with grilled lime halves.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons smooth peanut butter', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons chipotle pepper puree', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/2 head Napa cabbage, shredded', u'1/2 head romaine lettuce, shredded', u'2 carrots, shredded', u'1/4 pound snow peas, julienned', u'1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced green onion', u'2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken', u'1/2 cup chopped roasted peanuts', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves', u' Chili oil, optional', u' Grilled lime halves, for garnish']
title: Chinese Chicken Salad with Red Chile Peanut Dressing

directions: [u'Place a 14-inch nonstick saute pan over high heat. Add the chicken and dry-sear to lightly brown the chicken. Add the sake, soy sauce, 1/3 cup water, brown sugar, mirin, oyster sauce, ginger, star anise, dried chile and cinnamon stick and bring to a simmer. Cook, covered, about 12 minutes.', u'Uncover and simmer until the pan is almost dry, tossing frequently to coat the wings, 10 to 12 minutes. Skim off the fat if you like, and serve, garnishing with scallion shavings and sesame seeds. I like to emulsify the chicken fat into the sauce by turning up the heat at the last minute to boil the fat into the other liquids.']
ingredients: [u'16 whole chicken wings, flap segments removed and saved for stock', u'1/3 cup sake', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons brown sugar (If you like it sweeter, add more. You can check the flavor of the sauce at any time and I encourage you to do so.)', u'3 tablespoons mirin', u'3 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'4 large thin slices fresh ginger', u'2 cloves star anise', u'1 dried hot chile', u'1 cinnamon stick', u' Shaved green onions, for garnish', u' Sesame seeds, for garnish']
title: Grandmother's Chinese Chicken Wings

directions: [u'Remove turkey sausage from skins and combine with minced turkey in a food processor. Shell and de-vein shrimp and combine in food processor with turkey (if you do not have a food processor, you can chop shrimp into small pieces and hand mix with turkey).  Mix in finely chopped scallions, finely chopped cabbage, soy sauce, sesame oil, pepper, cornflour mixture and white wine.  Set on manual "pulse" control or on lowest chop setting and process for just a few seconds until shrimp is chopped coarsely into the turkey.  If the amount is too much for your food processor, mix in batches.', u'Set up dumpling wrapping area with a half full bowl of water, a clean surface to work on, a damp clean hand or kitchen towel, chopsticks, or small spoons and whoever is around to help you wrap the dumplings!', u'Set turkey mixture on wrapping area.  On your clean working area, place a few wonton wrappers flat down on surface (keep other wonton wrappers in plastic and they can dry out).  Using chopsticks or a teaspoon, place about a teaspoon of mixture onto the center of wrapper.  Dip a finger into the bowl of water and moisten one side of the dumpling wrapper with turkey mixture on it.  Pick up the parcel and with fingers, pinch the two opposite sides of the wonton wrapper together forming the parcel into the shape of a half-circle dumpling. If you are using square wrappers, you will have to pinch the square shape down into a half-circle shape.   Keep dumplings covered with damp cloth to keep them from drying out (do not have cloth dripping, it should be just damp to the touch). Meanwhile, in a large deep pasta pot, fill a little above half with water.  Bring to a boil.  Lower temperature so that the water is at a low boil, too high a boil can break the dumplings. Place dumplings in carefully and close to the water to prevent them from breaking.  Boil uncovered for about 10 to 12 minutes (checking to see if the inside is cooked).  Gently take out immediately with a strainer spatula.  They are ready to eat with a ginger scallion soy sauce!', u'The next day, you can make pot stickers by frying the left over dumplings.  Use a sweeter dipping sauce such as a plum or duck sauce for pot stickers.', u"The recipes for this program, which were provided by contributors and guests who may not be professional chefs, have not been tested in the Food Network's kitchens. Therefore, the Food Network cannot attest to the accuracy of any of the recipes."]
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound spicy turkey sausage or turkey breakfast sausage', u'1 pound minced turkey', u'4 ounces shrimp (optional)', u'6 green onions (scallions)', u'1/4 medium size Chinese cabbage, or equivalent amount baby cleaned spinach, or Chinese bok choy)', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon pepper', u'1/4 cup water with a teaspoon cornflour mixed (can use one egg, but will add cholesterol)', u'2 teaspoons white wine, or sherry', u'2 packets wonton wrappers, round if possible, or square, (about 50 per package)', u'1 bowl of water, half full', u'1 damp clean hand or kitchen towel']
title: Chinese Healthy Dumplings

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Place a pot of water on to boil for spaghetti. When it comes to a boil, salt the water and add pasta to cook to al dente. Heads up: reserve 1/2 cup cooking water just before draining.', u'Place pork in a mixing bowl. Add the egg to the bowl. Place rice cereal in food processor and pulse into a bread crumb like consistency. Add cereal crumbs to bowl.', u'Add salt, pepper, five-spice powder, 2 chopped scallions and 2 tablespoons soy sauce. Mix the meat balls thoroughly. Form 1 1/2-inch balls and coat with 1 tablespoon oil, scatter onto a baking sheet and roast 15 minutes.', u'When the meatballs are close to done and the pasta is in, heat a large skillet over high heat with enough vegetable oil to coat the bottom of the skillet, a couple of tablespoons. Add the snow peas, red pepper, remaining cut scallions, ginger and garlic, stir-fry 2 minutes add spinach and wilt, 1 minute. Add the remaining soy sauce, about 1/3 cup, and the sesame oil then drain, add in pasta cooking water and toss to combine so pasta can soak up sauce, about 1 minute. Garnish with sesame seeds and top with lots of meatballs.']
ingredients: [u' Salt', u'1 pound whole-wheat spaghetti', u'1 pound ground pork or chicken', u'1 egg', u'2 cups puffed rice cereal', u' Black pepper', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder, 1/3 palm full', u'8 scallions, 2 finely chopped, 6 cut into 2-inch lengths', u'2 tablespoons plus 1/3 cup tamari dark soy, divided', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', u'2 cups snow peas, thinly sliced on an angle', u'1 red bell pepper, very thinly sliced', u'2 inches ginger root, grated', u'4 cloves garlic, grated', u'1 pound triple washed spinach, leaves stripped of larger stems, coarsely chopped', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil, available on Asian foods aisle of market', u'3 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds, available on Asian foods aisle of market']
title: Chinese Spaghetti and Meatballs

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'For the sauce: Heat the sesame oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Raise the heat to medium-high and add the chicken stock, soy sauce, orange juice, brown sugar, vinegar, mirin, orange zest and pepper flakes. Simmer for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the cornstarch slurry and stir until the sauce is thickened. Keep warm.', u'For the chicken: With a mallet or a heavy pan, pound the chicken to an even 1/4-inch thickness. Add the chicken to a large resealable bag along with the soy sauce and ginger-garlic paste. Seal the bag and leave the chicken to marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes.', u'Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.', u'Beat the eggs in a wide, shallow bowl. In a large plate mix together the flour, granulated garlic and ground ginger. In another plate, mix together the panko and sesame seeds. Sprinkle all three dishes with salt and pepper. Dredge the chicken first in the flour, then in the egg and lastly in the panko.', u'Slick a large skillet with peanut oil and set over medium-high heat. In batches, fry the chicken until golden brown and cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side. As you go, keep cooked chicken warm in the oven on a wire rack set over a baking sheet.', u'Slice the chicken into thick strips and arrange on a serving platter. Drizzle chicken with the sauce and garnish with sesame seeds and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons Ginger-Garlic Paste', u'1/2 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons orange juice', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'4 teaspoons mirin', u'2 teaspoons grated orange zest', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch, mixed with 2 teaspoons water', u'4 chicken breasts, boneless, skinless', u'1 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons Ginger-Garlic Paste, recipe follows', u'3 eggs', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon granulated garlic', u'1 tablespoon ground ginger', u'2 cups panko breadcrumbs', u'1/4 cup sesame seeds', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Peanut oil', u' Sesame seeds, toasted, for garnish', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions, for garnish', u'1/2 cup garlic cloves, peeled', u'1/2 cup fresh ginger, broken into broken pieces', u'2 tablespoons canola oil']
title: General "Guy's" Chinese Chicken

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the turkey: In a 4 or 5-quart saucepan, combine the chicken broth, soy sauce, orange juice, garlic and ginger. Add the turkey, breast-side down, and bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover the pan and cook until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast registers 165 degrees F, 45 to 50 minutes. Let the turkey cool for 20 minutes. Using 2 forks, shred the meat into 2-inch pieces.', u"For the wontons: In a heavy, medium saucepan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat until a deep-fry thermometer registers 375 degrees F. (If you don't have a thermometer, a cube of bread should brown in about 4 minutes.) Add the wontons and fry until golden,  30 to 45 seconds. Drain on paper towels. Set aside.", u'For the dressing: In a medium bowl, whisk together the grapeseed oil, soy sauce, vinegar, maple syrup, orange juice, sesame seeds, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper until smooth. Season with additional salt and pepper, if needed.', u'For the salad: In a large salad bowl, toss together the almonds, romaine, iceberg lettuce, Napa cabbage, scallions and bell pepper. Add the dressing and the shredded turkey and toss until coated. Garnish with the fried wontons and serve.', u"Cook's Note: To toast the almonds, arrange them in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350 degree F oven until lightly toasted, 6 to 8 minutes. Cool completely before using."]
ingredients: [u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 cup orange juice', u'2 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed', u' One 2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely chopped', u' One 3 to 3 1/2-pound bone-in, skinless turkey half-breast', u'2 cups vegetable oil', u'10 wonton wrappers, cut into 1/2-inch-wide strips', u'1/3 cup grapeseed or vegetable oil', u'3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', u'2 tablespoons maple syrup', u'2 tablespoons orange juice', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u"1/2 cup sliced almonds, toasted (see Cook's Note)", u' One 1-pound head romaine, torn into 1-inch pieces', u'1/2 head iceberg lettuce, shredded', u'1/2 head Napa cabbage (8 ounces), shredded', u'3 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1/2 red bell pepper, stemmed, seeds and ribs removed, cut into 1/4-inch-thick strips']
title: Chinese Turkey Salad

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Slice the onion and put it into a slow cooker.', u'Season the short ribs with lemon pepper and garlic salt. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, brown all sides of the short ribs. When browned, place in slow cooker on top of sliced onions.', u'In a mixing bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the top of short ribs. Cover and cook on high setting for 3 to 4 hours or low for 8 to 9 hours.', u"Cook's Note: Five-spice powder is a blend of ground spices used extensively in Chinese cooking. It usually consists of cloves, cinnamon, fennel seed, star anise, and Szechuan peppercorns. It can be found in the spice section of the grocery store."]
ingredients: [u'1 large onion', u'4 pounds beef short ribs', u' Lemon pepper, to taste', u' Garlic salt, to taste', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 cups low-sodium beef broth', u'1 packet beefy onion soup mix', u'2 (14.5-ounce) cans tomatoes with green pepper, celery and onion', u'2 tablespoons five-spice powder']
title: Chinese Braised Short Ribs

directions: [u'Heat a large wok over high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil. When the oil is hot, add the ginger, garlic, and chili flakes and stir-fry just until they are aromatic, about 30 seconds. Scoop out the aromatics and set them aside.', u'Add the remaining oil to the wok. When it is hot, add the onion pieces and stir-fry until they turn glossy and bright, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Add the bok choy and the Chinese broccoli stem pieces. Stir-fry 1 to 2 minutes more.', u'Add the long beans and the 1-inch scallion pieces. Continue stir-frying until they are bright green and glossy, 1 to 2 minutes more.', u'Add the Napa cabbage and the Chinese broccoli leaves, along with about 1/3 cup of the hot stock and the reserved aromatics. Continue stir-frying until the vegetables are all tender-crisp, about 2 minutes more. Add the remaining stock, soy sauce, and cornstarch mixture and stir-fry until the vegetables all look lightly glazed with sauce, about 1 minute more.', u'Transfer the stir-fried vegetables to a heated serving dish. Garnish with the sliced scallions and sesame seeds and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons peanut oil or vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red chili flakes', u'1/2 red onion, trimmed and cut into 4 wedges, layers separated', u'2 heads baby bok choy, trimmed, cut lengthwise in quarters', u'1/4 pound Chinese broccoli, stems and leaves separated, each cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/4 pound Chinese long beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'6 scallions, trimmed, 5 cut diagonally into 1-inch pieces, 1 thinly sliced and reserved separately', u'1/4 head Napa cabbage, leaves cut crosswise into 1-inch-wide strips', u'2/3 cup good-quality chicken stock or broth, vegetable broth, or water, heated', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoons cornstarch, dissolved in 1 tablespoon cold water', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame seeds']
title: Stir-Fried Chinese Vegetables

directions: [u'In a bowl, whisk together the scallions, soy sauce, vinegar, gingerroot, vegetable oil, 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil, sugar, garlic paste, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. In a shallow dish, arrange the halibut fillets in 1 layer, pour the soy sauce mixture over them, and let the fish marinate, covered and chilled, for 30 minutes.', u'Arrange a steamer or baking rack in a wide deep kettle and add water to the kettle to reach just below the steamer rack. Put a plate, such as a glass pie plate, at least 1-inch smaller in diameter than the steamer on the rack and place the fish on top. Bring the water to a boil. Pour the marinade over the fish.', u'Steam the fish, covered, over the boiling water until it just flakes, about 12 minutes, and with oven mitts, remove the steamer from the wok. Transfer the fillets carefully to a heated platter and drizzle them with the remaining 1 teaspoon sesame oil and the sauce remaining on the plate.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup thinly sliced scallion', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice-wine vinegar (available at Asian markets) or white-wine vinegar', u'1 (1 1/2-inch) piece peeled fresh gingerroot, cut into very fine julienne strips', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon Asian sesame oil, plus 1 teaspoon for drizzling the fish', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 garlic cloves, minced and mashed to a paste with a pinch of salt', u'1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes, or to taste', u'4 (6-ounce) Pacific halibut fillets, skinned']
title: Steamed Halibut Fillets, Chinese Style

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the water and broth, salt, rice and butter in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on HIGH until the rice is soft and soupy, about 6 hours.', u'When ready to serve, remove the lid and stir in the ginger and scallions. Portion the soup into bowls and top with the shredded chicken and cilantro. Serve with chili paste on the side if desired.', u'Copyright 2007 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'6 cups water', u'4 cups chicken broth, low-sodium canned, or homemade', u'1 1/2 cups Arborio rice', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u' About 4 cups shredded cooked chicken (from 1 rotisserie chicken)', u'2 to 3 tablespoons grated peeled fresh ginger', u'3 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 medium bunch fresh cilantro, leaves torn or chopped', u' Asian chili paste, or sambal oelek, optional']
title: Chinese-style Rice Soup with Chicken and Ginger

directions: [u'Barbecued pork: Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a shallow baking pan with foil.  In a small bowl whisk together hoisin sauce, ketchup, soy sauce, garlic, and sugar.
