Put pork tenderloin in baking pan and coat with hoisin mixture. Roast pork in middle of oven 35 to 40 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted in center registers 160 degrees. Cool pork completely in baking pan.', u'Make garlic sauce while pork is cooling: In a small bowl stir together sauce ingredients until sugar is dissolved. Transfer pork to a cutting board and with a knife held at a 45 degree angle cut meat across grain into thin slices. Arrange pork, overlapping slices slightly, over noodles. Spoon garlic sauce over pork and sprinkle pork with coriander.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon ketchup', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'3/4 pound pork tenderloin', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon Asian chili oil, or 1 teaspoon Asian sesame oil plus hot pepper to taste', u'1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves, washed well, spun dry and torn']
title: Chinese Barbecued Pork with Garlic Sauce

directions: [u'Sprinkle your rolling surface with a handful of flour or cornmeal. Place dough directly in the middle of the surface. Roll dough out gently 1/4-inch thick, into either a 12-inch rectangle or circle. Brush both sides with olive oil and set aside until ready to grill.', u'Place dough in the center of the cooking grate, directly over the heat for one to three minutes, until the crust is well marked and browned. Flip dough and spread hoisin sauce evenly over cooked side of crust. Spread chicken, scallions, cilantro, and bell pepper evenly over crust. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Move to Indirect heat (for charcoal: the side of charcoal grill that has no coals. For gas: turn off burner directly under pizza). Cover grill and cook for 5 to 10 minutes, or until bottom is well browned, and cheese is fully melted.', u'Remove from grill, season with salt and pepper, and slice. Serve immediately']
ingredients: [u'1 (4-inch) ball prepared dough, at room temperature', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce (available in the Asian section of most grocery stores)', u'2 grilled skinless, boneless chicken breasts, diced or equivalent amount of store-bought BBQ chicken, or any left-over chicken,', u'4 scallions, finely sliced', u'2/3 lightly-packed cup cilantro leaves, stems removed before measuring', u'1/2 red bell pepper, seeds and membranes discarded, sliced into paper-thin strips', u'1 cup grated mozzarella', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Chinese Chicken Pizza with Hoisin Sauce

directions: [u'Make the sauce: Put the soy sauce, fish sauce, plum wine, sugar, garlic, jalapeno, ginger, lemongrass, and water in a bowl and stir together; set aside.', u'While you make the vegetables, pour enough oil to submerge the snapper into a wide, deep, heavy-bottomed pot. You will need at least a quart, depending on the width of the pot and the thickness of the fish. Heat the pot over medium-high heat to 370 degrees F.', u'Make the vegetables: Heat 2 tablespoons canola oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced ginger and sausage and cook until the sausage begins to give off its fat, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they begin to give off their liquid, adding more oil if necessary. Add the tomatoes, scallions, carrot, leek, and chile, and cook until just soft, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat, cover, and keep the vegetables warm.', u'Fry the fish: Score the snapper 4 times from top to belly, starting about 3 inches behind the head and making the last slash about 2 inches from the tail; take care not to cut into the flesh. When the oil is almost hot enough, dredge the snapper in the flour, shaking off any excess. Skewer the fish from head to tail with a metal skewer, curving the fish as needed. Slowly carefully add the fish to the pot and fry until cooked through and moist at the bone on the head end, approximately 10 to 15 minutes.', u'To serve: Spread some sauce onto a fish platter and place the fish on top; spoon the vegetables over the fish. Present at the table, cutting individual portions there, and garnishing with pea sprouts. Serve the extra sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup plum wine', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons crushed and minced lemongrass', u'1 cup water', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoons matchstick-thin slices fresh ginger', u'2 Chinese sausages, 1 to 2 ounces each, sliced into thin rounds (available from Chinese markets; dry chorizo can be substituted)', u'10 shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, caps thinly sliced', u'3 plum tomatoes, seeded and finely diced', u'2 scallions, white part only, sliced into thin rings', u'1 carrot, peeled and julienned', u'1 leek, white and light green parts, well washed and julienned', u'1 slice Thai bird chile (available in Chinese markets; other chili pepper can be substituted)', u' Vegetable oil, for frying, at least 1 quart', u'1 whole red snapper, 4 pounds, scaled and gutted (or substitute two (2-pound) snappers and shorten the cooking time)', u'1/2 cup instant flour (recommended: Wondra)', u' Fresh pea shoots, for garnish']
title: Crispy Red Snapper "Chinese Style"

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large soup or stockpot combine the chicken pieces, chicken necks, ginger, crushed scallions, smashed garlic and 4 quarts of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the chicken is fall-from-the-bone-tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Strain the liquid through a fine-mesh sieve and set the chicken pieces aside to cool. Skim and discard any foam or fat that has accumulated on the top of the broth and add water, if needed, to bring the volume back up to 4 quarts. Discard the chicken necks and other solids. Return the chicken broth to the soup pot and add the rice. Return the pot to a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook, stirring frequently, until the rice is completely broken down and the liquid has thickened to a porridge-like consistency, about 2 1/2 hours. (Note: take care during the last half hour of cooking that the soup does not scorch on the bottom. Reduce the heat if necessary and stir often.) The soup should be porridge-like consistency - but if it becomes too thick, add a bit of water as necessary. ', u'While the soup is cooking, remove the chicken meat from the bones once it has cooled and shred the meat into bite size pieces. Reserve. Discard skin and bones.', u'Heat 2 inches of oil in a medium saucepan and, when hot, fry the shallots until crispy, about 2 minutes. Remove from the oil and transfer to paper-lined plate to drain. Repeat the same process with the sliced garlic - it should cook in about 1 minute -- and set aside.', u'When the soup is ready, serve in shallow bowls, with small bowls of each garnish available so that guests can garnish their soup as desired -- with the crispy shallots, crispy garlic, chopped cilantro, sliced scallions, fish sauce, soy sauce and sesame oil each added to individual taste. Garnish each bowl with a lime wedge. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 frying chicken, cut into 8 pieces', u'1 pound chicken necks or wings, excess fat removed', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, sliced', u'3 scallions, root end trimmed, crushed with the heel of your knife', u'4 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed', u'1 cup long-grain white rice', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced shallots', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced garlic', u' Chopped fresh cilantro leaves, for serving', u' Sliced scallions, for serving', u' Fish sauce, for serving', u' Soy sauce, for serving', u' Sesame oil, for serving', u' Lime wedges']
title: Chinese Chicken Congee with Crispy Shallots, Crispy Garlic, and Sesame Oil

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Rub the pork all over with the five-spice powder and salt. Add the chicken broth, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, and red pepper to the slow cooker. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Add the scallions, garlic, ginger, the mushrooms, if using, and the meat, turning it a few times to coat. Cover the cooker, set it on HIGH, and cook for 4 hours. Set the cooker on LOW and cook until the meat is very tender, at least another 2 hours (6 hours total).', u'Transfer the pork to a platter, cover lightly, and let rest 15 minutes. Meanwhile, pour the cooking liquid into a measuring cup and skim off and discard the vegetables and fat that rise to the surface. Slice the meat and serve warm or at room temperature with noodles and the sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds trimmed pork shoulder', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'3 cups chicken broth', u'1 cup dark soy sauce', u'1/4 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'4 scallions, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 garlic head, halved', u'1 (2-inch) knob unpeeled fresh ginger, thinly sliced', u'8 dried shiitake mushrooms, optional', u' Hot cooked Chinese egg noodles, for serving']
title: Chinese Slow-Cooked Pork Shoulder

directions: [u'Place chicken in a shallow pot or non-stick pan with just enough water to keep it from burning. Season with salt and pepper. Cover, turn heat to medium and cook 5 minutes. Add peas to pan, cover and continue cooking 3 to 5 minutes more until chicken is tender and snap peas are blanched but still crunchy. Remove from heat, pour off liquid and let cool. ', u'Place sesame tahini and sesame oil in a large salad bowl, whisk in lime juice and stir until combined. Add soy sauce, ginger, sugar and chili paste. Taste and adjust seasonings. Add chicken, snap peas, cabbage, peppers, sprouts, scallions, carrots and cilantro. Toss until all ingredients are coated with dressing. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, sliced into strips', u' Water', u' Coarse salt and cracked pepper', u'1/2 pound sugar snap peas', u'1 1/2 pounds Napa cabbage, thinly sliced, about 1 small head', u'2 cups red cabbage, thinly sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and sliced thin', u'1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and sliced thin', u'1 1/2 cups sprouts', u'6 scallions, sliced thinly', u'5 ounces shredded carrots (1/2 a 10 ounce supermarket bag)', u'1 cup loosely packed, roughly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon sesame tahini or creamy peanut butter', u'1 teaspoon dark sesame oil', u'1/2 cup lime juice', u'6 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons grated ginger', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon chili paste']
title: Chinese Chicken Salad

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Place the pork loin on a rack over a roasting pan and fill the bottom with about 1-inch of beer. Season the pork generously with salt and pepper.', u'In a mixing bowl, combine the orange juice, honey, soy sauce, sherry, hoisin sauce, mashed black beans, fivespice powder, and garlic. Mix together well and coat the pork loin with this paste, rubbing it in well and using up all the mixture. Roast the pork for 15 minutes, then reduce the heat to 325 degrees and cook for 45 to 60 minutes more, basting every 15 to 20 minutes with the orangehoney mixture. When the pork is thoroughly cooked (it should register 165 degrees on a meat thermometer, and the juices run clear rather than pink), remove from the oven and rest for 5 minutes. Transfer to a warmed serving platter and surround with orange segments and watercress sprigs. Serve immediately, slicing the loin at the table.']
ingredients: [u'4 to 5 pound boneless pork loin, trimmed', u'1 bottle beer', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup orange juice', u'1/4 cup honey', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons sherry', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup cooked back beans, mashed with a fork', u'2 tablespoons FiveSpice powder', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'4 mandarin oranges or tangerines, peel and pith removed and cut into supremes', u'1/2 small bunch watercress, coarse stems removed']
title: Cuban Chinese Roast Loin of Pork

directions: [u'Combine the chicken, soy, sugar, sesame oil, scallions, cornstarch, ginger and sausage and let marinate refrigerated for at least 15 minutes.', u'In a clay pot (or saucepan), combine the rice, salt and oil. On high heat, saute briefly then add the stock to Fuji (1 1/4 inches above the rice).  Bring to a boil then reduce to medium heat and simmer until the stock has evaporated to the level of the rice. Add the chicken mixture, cover and cook in a preheated 350 degree F oven for 12 to 15 minutes. Stir well, cover, turn heat on high for only 1 minute then reduce heat to very low.  Cook for an additional 10 minutes, then turn heat off.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.', u'Plating: Serve rice pot family style with rice bowls and chopsticks.', u'Wine Suggestion: Percy McCoy Vineyards, Sonoma County, Chardonnay']
ingredients: [u'3 chicken thighs, boned, 1/2-inch dice, with the skin', u'1 tablespoon dark soy sauce', u'1/2 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1/2 cup sliced scallions', u'1/2 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 lapchang (Chinese sausage), 1/4-inch disks', u'3 cups Chinese long grain rice, washed until water is clear, drained', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'6 cups chicken stock']
title: Chicken and Chinese Sausage Rice Hot Pot

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'For the dressing: In a medium container with a sealable lid, add the duck sauce, mayonnaise and soy sauce. Stir (coffee stirrer!) and season with red chile flakes and a spritz of lemon juice.', u'For the salad: Add the chicken, slaw mix, lettuce and raisins. Seal the container and shake vigorously for a few seconds until everything is coated. Eat!']
ingredients: [u'2 take-out packets (1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon) duck sauce', u'2 take-out packets (1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon) mayonnaise', u'1 take-out packet (2 teaspoons) soy sauce', u'1 take-out packet (a pinch) red chile flakes, or to taste (get these from the pizza place!)', u'1 spritz lemon juice (a great way to use wedges from tea)', u'1 cup chopped (not shredded) cooked chicken breast (about 6 ounces)', u'1/2 cup loosely packed pre-washed slaw mix (savoy and red cabbage, carrots, etc.)', u'1/2 cup loosely packed pre-washed spring lettuce mix', u'1 tiny box (1 heaping tablespoon) golden raisins']
title: Sunny's Nunya Business Chinese Chicken Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl, combine the chicken, 4 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, and Asian spice blend. Toss to coat and let sit for 10 minutes.', u'In a separate bowl, combine the shrimp and water. Let sit for 15 minutes. Drain and roughly chop. In a large wok or saute pan, heat the oil over high heat. Add the beans and shallow fry until wrinkled, stirring, about 2 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels. Remove all but 1 tablespoon of the oil and add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 10 seconds.', u'Add the chicken and stirring constantly, cook until brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chopped shrimp, greens beans, cashews, hoisin, remaining 3 teaspoons of soy sauce, seasame seeds, sirachi, and red pepper flakes. Stir to coat, and cook for 1 minute.', u'Remove from the heat and serve immediately, garnished with green onions.', u'']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breasts, very thinly sliced 1/8-inch thick', u'7 1/2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'3/4 teaspoon Asian spice blend, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup dried shrimp', u'1/2 cup hot water', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 pound green beans, stem ends trimmed, cut into 3-inch lengths', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped cashews', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon lightly toasted white sesame seeds', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sirachi (roasted garlic-red pepper puree)', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u' Chopped green onions, garnish', u'1 tablespoon 5-spice powder', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground black pepper', u'3/4 teaspoon cayenne']
title: Emeril's Favorite Chinese Chicken with Green Beans

directions: [u'Mix the grapefruit, tomatoes, onion parsley, 1 1/ 2-ounce ginger, oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate until needed.', u'Remove all the fat from the sirloin and split the meat in half length-wise. Make an incision at one end of the "eye" and with steel, such as a skewer, make a tunnel hole through the meat without breaking the outer meat.', u'Mix remaining ginger with basil and garlic. Using the scallions as plungers, push the basil mixture with the scallions into the center of the sirloin.  Coat the outside of the meat with the five-spice powder.', u'Roast the sirloin to the desired temperature. Slice the meat into thin even pieces and arrange on a plate beside the grapefruit salad.']
ingredients: [u'3 grapefruit, peeled and sectioned', u'3 tomatoes, skinned and diced', u'2 medium red onions, sliced', u'1/ 2 bunch parsley, chopped', u'1 1/ 4 ounces plus 5 ounces ginger', u'2 1/ 2 cups black vinegar or soy sauce', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u'1 (4.5 pound) sirloin', u'5 ounces Thai basil, chopped', u'3 ounces garlic, minced', u'1 bunch scallions, trimmed and washed', u'1 tablespoon Chinese Five Spice powder']
title: Chinese Five Spice Sirloin

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'In a wok or large frying pan heat the oil over high heat until very hot. Add the bok choy and stir-fry until they begin to soften slightly, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the soy sauce, vinegar and sesame oil and cook until just done, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons canola oil', u'2 pounds baby bok choy', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds']
title: Sesame Stir-Fried Chinese Greens

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the stock, ginger, garlic and green onions in a large pot; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes. Soak the noodles in warm water until softened; drain. Cut into bite-size lengths. Cut the greens into bite-size pieces. Cut the scallops into thin slices. Cut the squid into rings. Cut the tofu into cubes. Arrange the noodles, seafood, vegetables and tofu on a large platter. Cover and chill until ready to cook. Reheat the broth to simmering. Set a Mongolian hot pot or electric wok in the center of a table. Pour the broth into the pot and adjust heat to a gentle simmer. The guests use chopsticks or Chinese wire strainers to cook the seafood, vegetables and tofu slices in the boiling water and then dip into the sauce of their choice. Any remaining greens can be added at the end with the noodles to make the soup. ', u'*Note: the success of this dish depends on starting with a full-flavored stock or broth.']
ingredients: [u'10 cups rich seafood or chicken stock*', u'1 tablespoon ginger, minced', u'1 tablespoon garlic, minced', u'6 green onions, chopped finely', u'4 ounces dried bean thread noodles, soaked and cut into bite-size pieces', u'1 pound leafy greens, such as spinach/bok choy/ Napa cabbage, chopped into bite-size pieces', u'8 sea scallops, sliced', u'4 small squid, cut into rings', u'1 (16 ounce) package soft tofu, drained and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'12 shrimp, peeled, deveined and butterflied', u'8 shucked oysters', u' Garlic Mustard, recipe follows', u' Ginger Soy Sauce, recipe follows', u'3 tablespoons garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'3/4 cup dried mustard powder', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'3/4 teaspoon cooking oil', u'2/3 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup ginger, minced', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'3/4 cup soy sauce']
title: Chinese Seafood Hot Pot

directions: [u'Heat a medium size saucepan, over medium heat.', u'Add canola oil and saute garlic, ginger, and green onion until fragrant and tender. Add the red pepper flakes. Mix the remaining ingredients in a separate bowl and add to the saucepan. Bring to a low simmer and cook for 10 minutes.', u'Preheat grill to medium-high heat.', u'Lightly season the salmon steaks with salt and pepper. Oil the grill with vegetable oil. Place the fish down for 4 to 5 minutes. Flip the fish over and brush with the barbecue sauce, continue cooking for another 4 to 5 minutes, until opaque throughout. Divide the baby spinach among 4 plates. Place the salmon steaks on top of the beds of spinach while still very hot. This will make the spinach wilt.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced green onion', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/2 cup orange juice', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'3/4 cup soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'4 (8-ounce) salmon steaks, 1-inch thick', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing', u'3 cups baby spinach']
title: Grilled Salmon with Chinese Barbeque Sauce

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Remove the head from the fish (or have your fishmonger do this) and cut the fish into 2-inch thick steaks. Put the rice flour on a plate and season it well with salt and pepper; dredge the fish pieces in the rice flour, shaking off any excess.', u'In a deep pot or a wok large enough to hold the fish, heat the vegetable oil to 350 degrees F. Carefully put in the fish and deep-fry until it is browned, crisp, and cooked through, about 12 to 15 minutes. Remove the fish pieces and drain them on paper towels; place them onto a platter.', u'Carefully drain all but 3 tablespoons of oil from the wok. Stir-fry the scallions, ginger, garlic, and chiles for about 2 minutes. Add the black beans and fry for another minute. Pour in the chicken stock, bring to a boil, and simmer until the sauce begins to thicken, about 10 minutes. In a small bowl mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons water making sure to get out all the lumps. Pour this slurry into the black bean mixture (it will thicken immediately) and cook for another 2 minutes. Pour the sauce over the fish pieces, garnish with cilantro leaves, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 (2 to 3 pound) whole red snapper, cleaned and scaled', u'1 cup rice flour', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'4 scallions, sliced thin', u'1 (1-inch) piece ginger, peeled and chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, sliced thin', u'1 serrano chile, sliced thin', u'1/2 cup fermented black beans*', u'2 cups low-sodium chicken stock', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons water', u' Cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' *Can be found at Asian markets and gourmet shops.']
title: Chinese Deep-Fried Fish with Spicy Black Bean Sauce

directions: [u'Melt chocolate and butterscotch separately in a double boiler over barely simmering water, or in the microwave at 50 percent power. ', u'In a medium bowl, combine the melted chocolate and butterscotch, and set aside. In another medium bowl, combine Chinese noodles, peanuts and raisins. Mix in the melted chocolate mixture. Drop the batter by heaping tablespoons onto waxed paper and refrigerate until set, about 20 minutes. Decorate cookies with sprinkles. ', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces semisweet chocolate chips, melted', u'12 ounces butterscotch chips, melted', u'1 (16-ounce) can Chinese noodles', u'1 (16-ounce) can unsalted dry roasted peanuts', u'1 cup raisins', u' Sprinkles, for decorating']
title: Kristy's Ancient Chinese Noodle Cookies

author: Jamie Oliver
directions: [u'Remove any blemished outside stalks from the greens. Put the spinach to one side so that you can add it to the wok or pan at the last minute, as it cooks very quickly. Prepare the rest of the Chinese greens; i normally cut the Chinese broccoli into strips and the bok choy into quarters. Plunge the greens into boiling water for about 1 1/2 minutes until just tender, and drain well.', u'Put the oil and the ginger into a very large, hot wok or other suitable pan and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the scallions and the rest of the ingredients apart from the seasoning. Stir, then add the spinach and toss so that everything is coated in sauce. The vegetables will sizzle and stir-fry. The oyster and soy sauce will reduce, just coating the greens. At this point season to taste. Stir-fry for a further minute and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'11 -14 ounces mixed Chinese greens -- bok choy, Chinese broccoli (gai larn), baby spinach', u'3 tablespoons walnut oil', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1/2 tablespoon thinly sliced ginger', u'4 scallions, finely shredded', u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 pinches of sugar', u' juice of 1 lime', u' salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Stir-Fried Chinese Greens with Ginger, Oyster and Soy Sauce

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.', u'Season the chicken breast on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat a large saute pan over high heat. When the pan is hot, add the oil and heat to almost smoking. Add the chicken, skin side down and cook for 4 minutes. The skin should be golden brown. Turn the chicken over and place in the oven. Roast until the chicken is just cooked through and the juices run clear, about 15 to 20 minutes. ', u'While the chicken is in the oven, prepare the greens.  Fill a very large bowl halfway full with ice water. Quarter the Napa cabbage lengthwise and remove the core. Thinly slice the cabbage widthwise and place in the ice water. Repeat this same process for the radicchio. Halve the romaine lettuce lengthwise and then thinly slice. Add to the water. Mix all of the greens well in the ice water and let sit for about 5 minutes. Drain. Place in a clean kitchen towel and dry well. Be careful not to bruise the greens. Refrigerate.', u'Remove the chicken from the oven and cool enough to handle. Remove the skin and slice the chicken. Discard the skin and bones. Roughly chop the sliced chicken and place in a large bowl. The chicken should still be warm. Add some of the vinaigrette and toss well. Add the greens and a little more vinaigrette and toss until everything is well coated.', u'Place a small mound of greens on 4 plates. Top each mound with a spring roll basket and lightly press to stabilize. Fill the baskets with more of the salad. Top with some of the fried springroll strips, a sprig of cilantro, peanuts, and a lime wedge.']
ingredients: [u'2 chicken breasts, bone-in with skin', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 head Napa cabbage', u'1 head romaine lettuce', u'1 head radicchio', u' Chinese Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u' Fried Springroll Baskets and Strips, recipe follows', u'1 cup chopped roasted peanuts', u' Cilantro sprigs', u' Lime wedges', u' *1 egg yolk', u'2 teaspoons dry Chinese mustard', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons light sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 tablespoons honey', u'6 large square eggroll wrappers', u' Peanut oil']
title: Chinois Chicken Salad with Chinese Mustard Vinaigrette

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large saute pan set over medium-high heat, place the soy sauce, sake, orange zest, garlic, ginger, green onion, sesame oil, orange juice, mirin, sugar and red pepper flakes. Bring the pan to a boil and stir occasionally until the sugar is dissolved and the liquid has reduced to a thick syrup, about 20 minutes. ', u'While the sauce is reducing, place the oil in a large 6-quart pot and bring to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl, season the cornstarch with the Asian Essence. Place the seasoned cornstarch in large, 1-gallon heavy-duty plastic bag and place the drumettes in the bag in batches. Shake the bag to coat the chicken, remove the chicken from the bag and place 8 to 10 pieces in the hot oil to fry. Fry in the oil stirring occasionally for 6 to 8 minutes. Remove from the oil, place in a clean large bowl. Continue this process until all the chicken has been fried. ', u'When all the chicken is fried and the sauce is reduced, use a spatula to pour the sauce over the chicken. Toss the chicken in the bowl to evenly coat with the glaze. Once all the chicken is coated, sprinkle it with the chives. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sake', u'1 teaspoon orange zest', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced green onion', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/4 cup orange juice', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'3 quarts peanut oil', u'1 cup cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons Asian seasoning', u'5 pounds drumettes', u'2 tablespoons minced chives']
title: Kicked Up Chinese Drummettes

directions: [u'Combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic powder, green onions and 4 cups water in a pot. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally. Let cool to room temperature. Combine the marinade and the pork belly in a pan, cover and marinate for 24 hours in the refrigerator.', u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Set the pan with the pork belly and marinade in the oven. Cook until tender, about 3 hours.', u'Remove the pan from the oven. Set a second pan directly on the pork belly and weight it with canned goods to compress the pork belly. Refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or until the pork belly is firm.', u'Crush the roasted peanuts in a food processor or with a mortar and pestle. Mix in the raw sugar. Set aside.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, white onions and preserved mustard greens. Saute for 2 minutes. Stir in the sweet soy sauce. Set aside.', u'Slice the pork belly into 3-inch-long blocks, and then cut into 1/2-inch-thick rectangles. Sear on both sides in a little oil until golden brown.', u'Set up a steamer and steam the gua bao until soft and fluffy.', u'Open up the steamed buns. Spread each with 1/2 tablespoon of the hoisin and then top with a slice of pork belly and 1 tablespoon of the preserved mustard green mixture. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of the crushed peanuts and some chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups soy sauce', u'2 cups brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons garlic powder', u'5 green onions', u'2 pounds pork belly, skin off', u'1/2 cup roasted peanuts', u'2 teaspoons raw sugar', u' Vegetable oil', u'1 clove garlic, crushed', u'1 tablespoon chopped white onion', u'1 head preserved mustard greens, chopped', u'2 tablespoons sweet soy sauce', u'3 teaspoons cilantro leaves, chopped', u'6 gua bao (pork belly buns)', u'3 tablespoons hoisin sauce']
title: Pork Belly Bao

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the leeks, garlic, ginger and jalapeno in a 7-quart slow cooker. Sprinkle in the flour and toss to coat. Nestle the meat in the vegetable mixture. Whisk the hoisin sauce, rice wine, soy sauce, brown sugar and 1/3 cup warm water in a bowl; pour over the meat.', u'Cover and cook on low, 7 1/2 hours. Remove the meat to a cutting board and thinly slice against the grain; remove and discard the garlic and ginger. Return the meat to the slow cooker along with the bok choy. Increase the heat to high and cook, uncovered, until the bok choy wilts, about 5 minutes. Serve with the rice.', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'4 leeks (white and light green parts only), trimmed, halved lengthwise and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'6 cloves garlic, unpeeled', u'4 thin slices ginger, unpeeled', u'1 red jalapeno pepper, seeded and thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 pounds beef chuck roast, trimmed', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup Shaoxing rice wine, mirin or dry sherry', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'4 heads baby bok choy, cut crosswise into 2-inch pieces', u'2 cups cooked white rice, for serving']
title: Slow-Cooker Chinese Beef and Bok Choy

directions: [u'In a bowl, mix together steak, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, black pepper, wine, chiles, and cornstarch. Let marinate at least 2 hours, but preferably refrigerated overnight.', u"Strain the beef and reserve marinade. In a very hot wok filled 1/4 with peanut oil,  'blanch' the beef for 5 seconds only. Set beef aside and pour off all but 2 tablespoons of oil.", u'Stir-fry the onions and bell peppers for 3 minutes then add back the beef and the reserved marinade. Bring to a boil and reduce by 50 percent, until thickened.', u'Stuff Hunan Beef in the Shao Bing and consume immediately.', u'Suggested beverage: Loose teas and Hartley Ostini "Hitching Post" Pinot Noir 1997', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 pound flank steak, sliced very thinly against the grain, on the bias', u'1 tablespoon garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon ginger, minced', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon coarse ground black pepper', u'1/3 cup Shaoxing wine', u'6 to 8 de-stemmed and crushed dry Thai bird chiles', u'1 tablespoon corn starch', u'1 red onion, sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, sliced', u'1 green bell pepper, sliced', u' Salt', u' Peanut oil, to cook', u' Shao Bing, recipe follows', u'2 cups vegetable oil', u'2 cups wheat flour, plus 2 cups, plus 2 pounds, plus more for rolling', u'1 teaspoon dry yeast', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u' Water (some warm for the sponge, 1 cup boiling, 1 cup cold)', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 cup sesame seeds', u' Salt and white pepper']
title: Hunan Beef and Peppers (Pop) and Sesame Shao Bing (Chinese Pita)

directions: [u'In a large bowl combine half of the crispy noodles, chicken, scallions, cashew nuts, corriander and the bell pepper. ', u'Make the dressing: In a small bowl whisk together the mustard mixture, soy sauce, vinegar, hoisin sauce, allspice, sugar, and salt and pepper to taste, add the oils in a stream, whisking, and whisk the dressing until it is emulsified. ', u'Toss the chicken salad with enough dressing to coat and mound it on a platter lined with the lettuce, and top with the sprouts and remaining crispy noodles']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups crispy chow mein noodles', u'3 cups shredded cooked chicken', u'1 bunch of scallions, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup dry-roasted unsalted cashew nuts', u'1 cup minced fresh coriander', u'1 red bell pepper, cut into julienne strips', u'1/2 teaspoon dry mustard, dissolved in 1/2 teaspoon water', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1 teaspoon ground allspice, or to taste', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons Asian sesame oil', u'1/4 cup corn oil', u'1/2 head of lettuce, shredded', u'1 bunch soybean sprouts']
title: Chinese Chicken Salad

directions: [u'Thread beef, chicken, shrimp, fishballs and scallops on wooden skewers and set aside. Combine water and chicken stock in an electric wok and bring to a boil. Add mung bean noodles, cabbage, bok choy and shiitake mushrooms. Place skewers in pot and cook according to individual taste.  Ladle broth into bowls with skewered meats and seafood and serve with condiments.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds flank steak, sliced thinly against the grain', u'2 pounds chicken breast, thinly sliced', u"1 pound large shrimp, U-15's peeled and de-veined (15 shrimp per pound)", u'20 fish balls', u'2 pounds bay scallops', u'3 packages soaked mung bean noodles', u'4 Shanghai cabbage, whole leaves', u'4 baby bok choy, whole leaves', u'1 napa cabbage large chopped', u'2 quarts chicken stock', u'1 pound shiitake mushrooms, de-stemmed', u' Boiling water', u' Samba Oelek', u' Peanut butter', u' Chinese sesame paste', u' Sesame oil', u' Oyster sauce', u' Rice wine vinegar', u' Shaoxing wine', u' Thin soy sauce', u'2 cups chopped scallions', u'2 cups chopped cilantro', u' Eggs (optional)', u' Electric wok to keep cooking liquid boiling', u' Small Chinese strainers', u' Rice bowls and side plates', u' Chopsticks', u' Chinese spoons', u' Spoons for all of the above condiments', u' Huge appetite', u'2 pounds Chilean sea bass or other fatty white fish', u'4 eggs, separated', u'1 teaspoon white pepper', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'3 minced Thai bird chilies', u'1/3 cup sliced scallions']
title: Chinese Fire Pot with Fish Balls

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large wok or pot, heat the vegetable oil to 400 degrees F.', u'Make 2 or 3 slashes diagonally across the flesh of each side of the fish.', u'In a small bowl, mash the black beans and garlic. Add the rice wine, oil, ginger, sugar, pepper flakes, and salt, and whisk to combine. Rub the mixture over the outside of the fish, rubbing onto the slashes.', u'In a shallow bowl, combine the cornstarch and flour. Dredge the fish in the mixture and shake to remove any excess. Carefully slide the flour-coated fish into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown, about 5 to 8 minutes, turning as necessary with tongs. Remove and drain on paper towels. ', u'To serve, arrange the fried fish on a platter with the red pepper sauce and rice. Garnish with the chopped green onions and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Peanut oil or vegetable oil, for frying', u'2 (1 1/2 to 2-pound) Petrole soles, scaled and eviscerated, head off', u'2 tablespoons Chinese fermented black beans, rinsed well and drained', u'4 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u' Red Pepper Dipping Sauce, recipe follows, accompaniment', u' Steamed white rice, accompaniment', u'1/4 cup green onions sliced on the bias, garnish', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon dark soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon dried red chile flakes', u'4 1/2 teaspoons peanut oil', u'2 tablespoons chopped green onions', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger']
title: Chinese Whole Fish with Black Bean Sauce

directions: [u"Separate the tenderloins from the breasts. Between sheets of plastic wrap, pound the thicker side of the breast to make it more even in thickness. Season the chicken with salt. Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Add the chicken breasts and tenderloins. Saute for about 4 to 5 minutes. You'll know to turn the chicken over when the top looks opaque (tenderloins may take only 2 to 3 minutes per side.) Saute on the other side 4 to 5 minutes or until the interior is cooked through. ", u'Remove the chicken to a plate. Deglaze the pan with the garlic and Chinese 5-spice powder and add the broth and hoisin mixture. Boil down covered until thick and glossy. Remove the skillet from the heat and whisk in the butter. Spoon the sauce over the chicken and sprinkle the scallions and cilantro on top.']
ingredients: [u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves', u'2 tablespoons Oriental sesame oil', u' Minced clove garlic', u'1 teaspoon Chinese 5spice powder', u'1/2 cup chicken broth mixed with 1 tablespoon Hoisin sauce, and 2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter', u'1 small scallion, thinly sliced', u' Chopped fresh cilantro', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Chinese Style Chicken

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Preheat your oven to 500 degrees F.', u'If you have whole chicken wings, cut off wingtips and cut the wings in half at the joint. Discard wingtips or freeze to make stock at a later time.', u'Place the wings in a large bowl. Sprinkle five-spice powder and cayenne on the wings, add a few pinches of salt and about 15 grinds of black pepper. Rub the mixture into all the wings until no more loose rub remains. Wash your hands.', u'Line the wing pieces up on a baking sheet so the side of the wing that has the most skin is facing up. Roast until cooked through, browned and crispy, about 25 minutes. Serve hot with Creamy Cilantro Dipping Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'40 chicken wing pieces or 20 whole chicken wings', u'2 tablespoons Chinese five- spice powder', u'3 teaspoons cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Creamy Cilantro Dipping Sauce, recipe follows']
title: Spicy Chinese Five-Spice Rubbed Chicken Wings with Creamy Cilantro Dipping Sauce

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Heat oil in a skillet or wok over high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and scallions and cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook for another minute. Add the cabbage and carrot and cook until the cabbage starts to wilt, about 2 minutes. Stir in the hoisin and oyster sauces; toss to coat the mixture. Remove from the heat and mix in the noodles, sprouts, and cilantro; season to taste with salt and pepper. The filling should be moist but not wet. Remove from heat and allow to cool.', u'Lay a spring roll wrapper on a flat surface on an angle so it looks like a diamond. Spoon 2 tablespoons of the filling near the bottom corner of the wrapper and fold up to enclose the filling. Fold in the 2 sides. Paint the top seam of the wrapper with beaten egg. Continue rolling up to form a tight cylinder. Pour about 1-inch of oil in a skillet or wok and heat to 350 degrees F. Fry the spring rolls, turning to cook all sides, until browned, about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels and keep warm. Serve with Mustard Dipping Sauce.', u'For the Mustard Sauce: Mix all ingredients together and stir until the sugar dissolves.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1/2 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 scallions, sliced thin', u'1 pound mixed wild mushrooms (such as chanterelle, crimini, oyster, shiitake)', u'2 cups shredded Napa cabbage', u'1 carrot, grated', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'2 ounces bean thread noodles, blanched and chopped', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 package spring roll wrappers', u'1 egg, beaten', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1/2 cup Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup hot water', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon sugar']
title: Wild Mushroom Spring Rolls with Chinese Mustard Dipping Sauce

author: Aida Mollenkamp
directions: [u'In a large bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, vinegar, and ginger until honey is dissolved. Whisking constantly, add oils in a slow stream until completely incorporated. Taste and adjust flavor, as desired.', u'Add turkey, toss to thoroughly coat, and let sit 5 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and toss again to combine. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons freshly grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 cups coarsely shredded cooked turkey', u'1/2 small head iceberg lettuce, halved lengthwise and thinly shredded (about 4 cups)', u'1/2 small head napa cabbage, cored, and thinly shredded (about 4 cups)', u'2 cups snow peas, cut into 1-inch pieces on bias', u'1 cup mung bean sprouts', u'1 medium red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded, and cut into matchsticks', u'1/3 cup thinly sliced scallions', u'1 medium carrot, peeled, halved lengthwise, and thinly sliced on the bias', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup sliced almonds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons white sesame seeds, toasted']
title: Chinese Turkey Salad

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. ', u'Rub the ribs all over with the five-spice powder; season generously with salt and pepper. Arrange the ribs in a single layer in a roasting pan and slow-roast for 2 1/2 hours. ', u'To prepare the teriyaki glaze: Meanwhile, in a pot, combine the soy sauce, grapefruit juice, hoisin sauce, ketchup, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, chile, garlic, and ginger over medium heat. Bring to a slow simmer and cook, stirring, until thickened, about 20 minutes. ', u"In the last 30 minutes of cooking, baste the ribs with the teriyaki sauce. When they are done, the pork will pull away from the bone and you will see about 1/2-inch of bone showing. Just before you're ready to eat, baste the ribs with the teriyaki sauce again and stick them under the broiler for 5 to 8 minutes to make the spareribs a nice crusty brown. (Keep a close eye on these guys - ribs go from perfectly crisp to perfectly burnt seconds.) Separate the ribs with a cleaver or sharp knife, pile them on a platter, and pour on the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, chopped cilantro, and green onion before serving."]
ingredients: [u'2 racks pork spareribs, 4 pounds each, trimmed of excess fat', u'1/2 cup Chinese five-spice powder', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, for garnish', u' Chopped fresh cilantro leaves and green onion, for garnish', u'1 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 cup grapefruit juice', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1 fresh red chile', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, whacked open with the flat side of a knife']
title: Chinese Spareribs #5 with Teriyaki Glaze

directions: [u'Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the broccoli and cook until bright green and tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.', u'Heat the canola and sesame oils in a large nonstick skillet set over medium heat. Add the onions, ginger, garlic and chiles and saute until the onions are soft, 3 to 5 minutes. Increase the heat to medium-high, add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a plate.', u'In a small bowl, whisk the cashew butter and tamari and pour into the skillet, stirring to remove any lumps. Add the chicken back in the pan, stir in the broccoli and cashews, and stir to heat through and completely coat with the sauce. Season with salt and pepper, then serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups fresh or frozen broccoli florets', u'4 teaspoons canola oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 cup 1/4-inch-thick half-moon slices onion', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger (about a 1-inch piece)', u'6 cloves garlic, minced', u'4 whole small dried chiles or 1/2 teaspoon chile oil', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut in 1-inch cubes', u'4 teaspoons cashew butter', u'3 tablespoons tamari', u'1/2 cup unsalted whole cashews', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Paleo Chinese Chicken and Broccoli

directions: [u'For the rainbow sesame slaw: Combine the jicama, bell peppers, snow peas, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, sesame seeds, soy sauce and sugar in a medium mixing bowl, tossing to combine. Set aside.', u'For the Sriracha lime mayo: Combine the mayonnaise, Sriracha, lime zest and juice in a small bowl. Set aside.', u'For the burger patties: Combine the chicken, scallions, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, lemongrass and garlic, gently mixing to incorporate. Divide the mixture into 6 patties and set aside. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat, and brush with the vegetable oil. Place the patties on the grill and cook, turning once until done, 6 to 8 minutes per side. During the last few minutes of cooking, baste each burger with 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce.', u'To assemble, spread about 1 tablespoon of the Sriracha lime mayo on each bun bottom and top. Place the patties on the bun bottoms, top with about 1/3 cup of the slaw, add the bun top and enjoy! These burgers are great served with sweet potato fries or sweet potato chips.']
ingredients: [u'2/3 cup julienned jicama', u'2/3 cup julienned bell peppers (red, orange, yellow or any combination)', u'2/3 cup snow peas, strings removed and julienned', u'1 1/2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'3/4 cup mayo', u' Zest and juice of 1 lime', u'2 tablespoons Sriracha', u'2 pounds ground chicken', u'1/3 cup scallions, sliced on the bias', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon minced lemongrass', u'6 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'6 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'6 good-quality hamburger buns with sesame seeds', u' Sweet potato fries or sweet potato chips, for serving, optional']
title: Chinese Chicken Burgers with Rainbow Sesame Slaw

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk 1/2 cup water, the hoisin sauce, honey, ketchup, soy sauce and sambal oelek in a medium bowl. Season the beef all over with the Chinese five-spice powder, salt and pepper. Combine the carrots and turnip in a 6- to 8-quart slow cooker. Add the beef and top with the hoisin mixture; turn to coat. Cover and cook on low until the beef is very tender, 7 1/2 hours.', u'Remove the vegetables to a bowl using a slotted spoon. Shred the beef with two forks; stir in the sauce to coat. Serve the beef with the vegetables and rice; top with scallions.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup honey', u'3 tablespoons ketchup', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sambal oelek (or other Asian chili sauce)', u'1 2 -pound boneless beef chuck roast, halved lengthwise', u'2 teaspoons Chinese five-spice powder', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'4 carrots, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 turnip, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u' Cooked white rice, for serving (optional)', u' Sliced scallions, for topping']
title: Slow-Cooker Chinese Barbecue Beef

directions: [u'Combine the marinade ingredients in a medium sized bowl, and soak the flank steak in the marinade for 1 hour.', u'In a hot wok over the highest heat, add 3 tablespoons of the oil and black bean sauce. Using the Chinese ladle, spread the bean sauce in the wok until nice roasted smell comes out. Add the beef and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Do not over cook! Remove the beef and set aside.', u'To the wok, add the remaining 3 tablespoons oil, the peppers, and the crushed garlic. Add the boiled noodles and the marinade for the beef and cook for 2 minutes. Add the bok choy and cook until wilted. Add the reserved beef and toss until heated through. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons mirin', u'6 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon dried chili peppers', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh lemongrass', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'2 tablespoons chopped green onion', u'1 teaspoon sesame seeds', u'1/2 pound flank steak, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices against the grain', u'3 tablespoons olive oil, plus 3 tablespoons', u'2 tablespoons Chinese black bean sauce', u'1 green pepper, stemmed, cored, and julienned', u'1 yellow pepper, stemmed, cored, and julienned', u'1 red pepper, stemmed, cored, and julienned', u' Crushed garlic, in the skin', u' I pack dry Chinese curly egg noodles, boiled according to the package directions', u'1 small bok choy cut into 1/2-inch slices']
title: Asian Flank Steak with Fried Chinese Noodles with Peppers

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. and line a shallow baking pan with foil.', u'In a small bowl whisk together hoisin sauce, ketchup, soy sauce, garlic, and sugar.  Put pork tenderloin in baking pan and coat with hoisin sauce mixture.  Roast pork in middle of oven 35 to 40 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted in center registers 160 degrees F.  Cool pork completely in baking pan.', u'In a small bowl stir together sauce ingredients until sugar is dissolved.', u'Transfer pork to a cutting board and with a knife held at a 45 degree angle cut meat across grain into thin slices.  Arrange pork, overlapping slices slightly.  Spoon garlic sauce over pork and sprinkle pork with coriander .']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon ketchup', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'3/4 -pound pork tenderloin', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon Asian chili oil, or 1 teaspoon Asian sesame oil plus Tabasco to taste', u'1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves, washed well, spun dry, and torn']
title: Chinese Barbecued Pork with Garlic Sauce

author: Alexis Hernandez
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u"Toss the first 6 ingredients together in a bowl, making sure the potato slices are evenly covered with the mixture. Spray 2 ramekins with cooking spray and gently press a handful of the potatoes into each one. Arrange the ramekins on a sheet pan and fill each cup 3/4 of the way with the cream mixture and cover the top with foil. Slide the pan into the oven and cook until the potatoes are cooked through, about 30 to 45 minutes. (Chef's Note: They are finished when a toothpick is inserted with zero resistance.) Remove the foil, add 2 tablespoons of the remaining cheese to each ramekin and cook until cheese is bubbling, about 4 to 8 minutes. Remove the gratins from oven and set aside.", u'Cabbage: In a medium skillet, over medium heat, add the bacon and cook until crispy, about 5 to 8 minutes. Remove the bacon to a plate, leaving 3 to 4 tablespoons of the fat in the skillet. Add the onions and saute for 5 to 7 minutes over medium-high heat. Stir in the cabbage, sugar, salt and black pepper and continue cooking for an additional 6 to 8 minutes. Add the red wine, toss the ingredients and cook covered with a lid until the liquid has almost completely evaporated, about 8 to 12 minutes. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and cook until it has almost evaporated as well, about 1 to 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and add the reserved bacon.', u'Chicken: Combine the first 5 ingredients in a medium bowl. Add the chicken breasts, toss to coat with the marinade and allow them to sit for 10 to15 minutes. In a saute pan over medium heat, add the chicken breasts and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on the show side and 6 minutes the other side, or until cooked through. Remove the chicken to a cutting board and top each breast with 1 tablespoon of butter. Cover with foil, allow them to rest for 5 minutes, then slice lengthwise.', u'To serve: Put a portion of the cabbage in the center of each dish. Arrange the chicken, on top of the cabbage. Run a knife along the inside of each ramekin, to loosen, and invert them onto the plates before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 to 3 Idaho potatoes, peeled and sliced 1/16-inch thick on a mandoline', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan or Gruyere, plus 4 tablespoons for topping, divided', u'2 teaspoons dried thyme or 2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme leaves', u'1 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Special equipment: 2 (3-ounce) ramekins', u'6 strips bacon, chopped', u'1 cup chopped Spanish onion, about 1 large onion', u'2 cups chopped red cabbage, about 1/2 head', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', u'1/2 cup red wine', u'1/4 cup balsamic vinegar', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 teaspoons Chinese five-spice powder', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', u'2 (6-ounce) chicken breasts, boneless and skinless', u'2 tablespoons butter, unsalted']
title: Chinese Five-Spice Chicken with Red Cabbage and Potato Gratin

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl, combine the pork, 4 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, and Essence. Toss to coat and let sit for 10 minutes.', u'In a separate bowl, combine the shrimp and water. Let sit for 15 minutes. Drain and roughly chop.', u'In a large saute pan or skillet, heat the oil over high heat. Add the beans and shallow fry until wrinkled, stirring, about 6 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels. Remove all but 1 tablespoon of the oil and add the pork mixture and stirring constantly, cook until brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 10 seconds. Add the chopped shrimp, greens beans, hoisin, remaining 3 teaspoons of soy sauce, sesame seeds, sri racha, and red pepper flakes. Stir to coat, and cook for 1 minute.', u'Remove from the heat and serve immediately.', u'']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces ground pork', u'4 1/2 teaspoons soy sauce, plus 3 tablespoons', u'1/2 teaspoon Essence, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup dried shrimp', u'1/2 cup hot water', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 pound Chinese long beans, stem ends trimmed, cut into 3-inch lengths', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/4 cup lightly toasted white sesame seeds', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sri racha (roasted garlic-red pepper puree)', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Emeril's Favorite Chinese Green Beans

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Mix the brown sugar, salt, pepper, five-spice powder, garlic powder, ground ginger and onion powder in a bowl, and then rub all over the pork. Place on a wire-racked baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and let it sit for 2 hours, or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.', u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F with the oven rack in the middle position.', u'Remove the plastic wrap and cover the pork with a layer of parchment paper. Then seal over the top with aluminum foil. Roast for 3 hours. Remove, uncover and drain any liquid fat. Return the pork to the oven and roast until the pork registers 200 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer and the pork is well browned, about 1 1/2 hours more. Transfer the pork to a large dish, cover with foil and let rest for 20 minutes.', u'Sandwich Build: Using two forks or your hands, pull apart the warm pork into shreds and chunks. Butter and griddle the rolls until golden brown. Place ample quantities of pork on the bottom buns, then top with Pickled Cukes and Carrots and Sweet-and-Hot Mustard Sauce or Sweet Chile Sauce if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'1 tablespoon ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'1 tablespoon garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon ground ginger', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 boneless pork butt or shoulder, fat cap scored deep (about 5 pounds)', u' Butter, for griddling', u"12 slider rolls, preferably King's Hawaiian", u' Pickled Cukes and Carrots, for serving, recipe follows', u' Sweet-and-Hot Mustard Sauce, for serving, recipe follows', u' Sweet Chile Sauce, for serving, optional', u'2 cups rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 cup shredded carrots', u'1 cup half-moon slices English cucumber', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 cup dried mustard', u'1/4 cup boiling water', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'1/4 brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon table salt', u'1 to 2 tablespoons crushed red pepper', u'1 tablespoon fresh grated ginger', u'1 clove garlic, grated']
title: Chinese BBQ Pulled Pork Sliders with Pickled Cukes and Carrots and Sweet-and-Hot Mustard Sauce

directions: [u'Deep fry long beans until they are wrinkled. Transfer to a stainless bowl and toss with sambal and sesame oil. Check for seasoning.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups Chinese long beans, cut into 3-inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon sambal', u'1/2 tablespoon sesame oil', u' Salt and black pepper']
title: Spicy Chinese Long Beans

directions: [u'Put the flour in a mixing bowl. Slowly add the boiling water and stir in 1 direction with a wooden spoon. When the flour absorbs the water and cools, knead the dough into a ball and then place it on a work surface dusted with flour. Knead for about 2 minutes, until the dough is thoroughly smooth. Place in a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and allow to rest for 30 minutes. ', u'On a flour-dusted work surface roll the dough into a 12-inch sausage and divide into 12 (1-inch) pieces. Flatten each piece with your palm, using more flour to dust if the dough is sticky. While working, cover the dough not in use with plastic wrap. Working with 2 pieces of dough at a time, wipe 1 side of each piece gently with sesame oil and place 1 flattened, oiled piece atop another. Roll them together into 7-inch rounds. The result is a 2-layer pancake. Repeat until 6 (2-layer) pancakes are made. ', u'Heat a wok over low to medium heat for 1 minute. Place a double pancake in the dry wok and cook for a minute, until it begins to bubble up. (The heat in the dry wok must be carefully controlled. If it is too high, the pancakes will burn.) Turn the pancake over and cook until a few brown spots appear. Remove from the wok and separate into 2 layers. You will have 2 pancakes, each browned lightly on 1 side and white on the other. Repeat until all the dough is used and you have 12 pancakes. ', u'Before serving, steam the pancakes in a stack for 5 to 7 minutes, until soft and hot. Brush the pancake with hoisin sauce, place the chicken slice in the pancake, add some scallion, and fold up the bottom to create an envelope closed on 3 sides but open at the top. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, enriched, bleached (recommended: Pillsbury Best) plus 1/2 cup for dusting', u'3/4 cup boiling water', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame oil', u' Hoisin Sauce, recipe follows', u' Cantonese Fried Chicken, recipe follows', u' White parts of 6 scallions, shredded into 2-inch lengths']
title: Chinese Pancakes: Bok Bang

directions: [u'Prepare the ducks. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Mix 1/4 cup of the rice vinegar with the honey and brush the ducks all over with this mixture.', u'Place the ducks in a roasting pan and roast them about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and pour off the accumulated fat. Give the ducks a quarter turn and return to the oven. Repeat this process for about 1 1/2 hours, or until the ducks are dark golden brown on all sides. Remember to pour off the rendered fat each time you turn them. When completely cooked, transfer the ducks to another pan and let them rest so that the fat continues to drain from the insides.', u'Meanwhile, in a saucepan, reduce the plum wine with the mint sprigs and orange peel to a glaze. Add the vinegar and reduce it by two thirds. Add the plum puree and reduce it by half, until the flavor is quite intense. Add the demi-glace and continue to reduce the mixture by half, or until it is thickened slightly and tastes delicious. Over very low heat whisk in the butter, a little at a time. Season the sauce, to taste, with salt and pepper. Strain the sauce and keep it warm.', u'Remove the breasts and legs from the duck. Place them on a grill or under a broiler or salamander until the skin is crispy.', u'Slice the duck breasts into medallions. Separate the legs and thighs; arrange half a duck attractively on each plate. Sauce the duck with the plum sauce. Decorate each plate with a scallion-filled Chinois Pancake.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3 Chinese ducks, preferably air-dried (about 4 pounds each)', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'1 cup plum wine', u'2 sprigs fresh mint', u'2 strips orange peel, about 1 inch by 2 inches', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 cup plum puree, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup duck or veal demi-glace*', u'4 tablespoons (2 ounces) unsalted butter', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground pepper', u' Chinois pancakes, recipe follows', u'1/2 pound Elephant Heart plums, halved and pitted', u'1/2 cup plum wine', u'1/4 cup raspberries, blueberries or fresh black currants', u'1/4 cup flour', u' Pinch salt', u'1 egg', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1/2 cup milk', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 scallion, thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon unsalted butter', u'6 small scallions, cut in half']
title: Chinese Duck with Plum Sauce and Chinois Pancakes

directions: [u'Bring a large stockpot of water to a boil. In a wok or deep, heavy saucepan, heat about 3 inches of peanut oil. (The oil must be very hot, about 375 degrees F.)', u'Make the sauce: In a large skillet or saute pan, heat the 2 tablespoons of peanut oil. Over medium-high heat, saute the garlic just until golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the sugar and continue to saute until the garlic begins to caramelize, 1 or 2 minutes longer. Deglaze the pan with the rice wine, rice wine vinegar, and soy sauce. Add the carrots, haricots verts, and 2 ounces of the green onion, reserving 1 ounce as garnish. Stir in the chili sauce and continue to cook until the sauce is reduced by half.', u'Meanwhile, add salt to the boiling water and cook the noodles until they are al dente. Drain the noodles well and stir them into the sauce until they are well coated.', u'Season the shrimp or calamari with salt and pepper and toss with the flour to coat lightly. Deep-fry the shrimp or calamari in small batches until golden, 1 or 2 minutes. (The easiest way to do this is to use a fine-mesh basket or strainer. Place the shrimp or calamari in the basket and gently ease the basket into the oil.) Drain on clean paper towels.', u'To serve, divide the noodles and vegetables among 4 large warm plates. Arrange the shrimp or calamari over and around each portion and garnish with the remaining green onions. Drizzle a little sesame oil over the noodles and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Oil for deep-frying', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'3/4 cup (4 ounces) sliced Double-Blanched Garlic, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 cup rice wine', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce', u'4 ounces carrots, peeled, trimmed, and cut into julienne (about 1 cup)', u'4 ounces haricots verts, trimmed, blanched, and refreshed (about 1 cup)', u'4 ounces green onions, trimmed and cut into strips (about 1 cup)', u'2 teaspoons Vietnamese chile sauce', u'12 ounces fresh Chinese egg noodles or thin spaghetti', u'1 pound large shrimp, cleaned and tails removed, or, 1 pound calamari, cleaned and cut into 1/4-inch rings', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' About 1/2 cup flour', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame oil', u'3 heads garlic', u' Kosher salt']
title: Crispy Shrimp or Calamari with Chinese Noodles and Spicy Garlic Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the flour, baking powder and salt together in a medium  bowl. Set aside.', u'Beat the butter and sugars in a large bowl using an electric mixer until well combined, about 3 minutes. Add the tahini, vanilla and egg and beat until light, about 3 minutes. Stir in the flour. Form the dough into two 12-inch logs that are 1 1/2 to 2 inches in diameter, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until very firm, 4 hours and up to overnight.', u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line two or three baking sheets with parchment paper.', u'Remove one log of dough from the refrigerator and slice into 1/4- inch-thick slices. Place the sesame seeds on a plate. Coat the cookies in sesame seeds by pressing them lightly into the seeds, and place them on the prepared baking sheets. Bake until lightly golden around the edges, about 12 minutes, rotating the baking sheets top to bottom and front to back halfway through cooking. Cool the cookies on the baking sheet for 10 minutes, and then transfer to a rack to cool completely. Repeat with the remaining log.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon fine salt', u'1 1/2 sticks (6 ounces) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'1/3 cup light brown sugar', u'1/4 cup tahini (ground sesame paste)', u'1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1 large egg', u'1/2 cup sesame seeds, white, black or a combination of both']
title: Chinese Sesame Cookies

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'For the dipping sauce: Combine all the dipping sauce ingredients in a bowl and let it sit while you make the pancakes. Remove the ginger and cilantro before serving.', u'For the pancakes: Put the egg, water, sesame oil, and salt into a blender and blend well. Add the flour and blend until smooth, it should be the consistency of heavy cream. Stir in the cilantro, scallion, and sesame seeds. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat; add 1 teaspoon peanut oil and spread it around the pan with a paper towel. Pour in half the batter, swirling and tipping the pan to get one thin layer over the bottom of the pan. Cook until set, about 2 minutes. Flip the pancake with a spatula and cook on the other side for about 1 minute. Place the scallion pancake on a platter and make another pancake with the remaining batter. Cut the pancakes into wedges or roll them up and cut them into pieces. Serve with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon hot chili paste, such as sriracha hot chili paste', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds', u'1 big slice fresh ginger, smashed', u'1/2 bunch fresh cilantro, leaves and stems', u'1 large egg', u'3/4 cup water', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup finely chopped scallion', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds', u' Peanut oil, for frying']
title: Scallion Pancakes

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.  Place the chicken breasts on a sheet pan, skin side up.  Rub the tops with olive oil and sprinkle liberally with salt and pepper.  Roast for 35 minutes, until cooked through.  Set aside until cool enough to handle.  Remove the meat from the bones and discard the skin and bones.  Shred the chicken in large bite-sized pieces and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and blanch the broccoli florets for 2 minutes.  Drain and immediately immerse in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking and set the color.  Drain and set aside.', u'Place the garlic, ginger, vegetable oil, tahini, peanut butter, soy sauce, sherry, sherry vinegar, honey, chili oil, sesame oil, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper and the cayenne pepper in a food processor fitted with a steel blade and puree until smooth.  Set aside.', u'Add a splash of olive oil to a large pot of boiling salted water and cook the spaghetti according to the directions on the package.  Drain the pasta in a colander, place it in a large bowl, and while still warm, toss with the sauce. Add the scallions, peppers, chicken and broccoli and toss well. Serve warm or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'3 whole (6 split) chicken breasts, bone-in, skin-on', u' Good olive oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 bunch broccoli, cut into florets and stems discarded', u'6 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh ginger, peeled and chopped', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup tahini (sesame paste)', u'1/2 cup smooth peanut butter', u'1/2 cup good soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dry sherry', u'1/4 cup sherry vinegar', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/2 teaspoon Asian hot chili oil', u'2 tablespoons dark toasted sesame oil', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', u'1 pound spaghetti', u'4 scallions, sliced diagonally (white and green parts)', u'1 yellow bell pepper, julienned', u'1 red bell pepper, julienned']
title: Szechuan Noodles with Chicken and Broccoli

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cook the rice as the label directs. Meanwhile, fill a large skillet halfway with water; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Set the bottom of a stackable bamboo steamer in the water. Sprinkle the scallion whites and 1 teaspoon ginger on a plate that will fit in the steamer basket; set the fish on top and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon white pepper. Set in the steamer basket; cover and cook 8 minutes.', u'Line another steamer level with parchment; add the bok choy and carrots and set on top of the fish basket. Cover and cook until the fish is cooked through and the vegetables are tender, about 7 more minutes.', u'Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat; add the chile, garlic, the remaining ginger and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, swirling the pan, until the garlic and ginger start browning, 2 minutes.', u'Remove the baskets. Drain any liquid from the fish; cut into 4 pieces. Drizzle the fish and vegetables with the chile oil and soy sauce; top with the scallion greens and season with white pepper. Serve with the rice.', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 cups white rice', u'3 scallions, thinly sliced (white and green parts separated)', u'2 tablespoons minced peeled ginger', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless center-cut mahi mahi fillet (1 1/2 inches thick)', u'1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper, plus more to taste', u'4 heads baby bok choy, halved lengthwise', u'2 carrots, sliced 1/4 inch thick', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 Fresno or red jalapeno chile pepper, sliced (remove seeds for less heat)', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce']
title: Steamed Mahi Mahi

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a cupcake pan with 24 regular-size cupcake liners.', u'Combine the granulated sugar, flour, buttermilk, 8 fluid ounces water, oil, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, baking soda, baking powder, salt and eggs in a mixer and whisk on speed 1 until all the ingredients are incorporated. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula and mix on speed 2 until the batter is lump free.', u'Fill the cupcake liners half full with the chocolate batter and bake for 25 minutes, rotating halfway through the bake time. Cool the cupcakes completely.', u'To assemble: Place the Chocolate, Orange and Clove Infused Ganache filling into a piping bag and squeeze a small amount of the filling into the centers of the cooled cupcakes. Also pipe a small circle of this ganache around the top edge of the cupcake (so you can see the filling even after it is frosted). Generously pipe the Chinese Spiced Tea Buttercream on top. Garnish with chocolate curls and orange sugar crystals.', u'This recipe was created by a contestant during a cooking competition. The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use, therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound granulated sugar', u'10 ounces all-purpose flour', u'8 fluid ounces buttermilk', u'4 fluid ounces canola oil', u'3 1/2 ounces cocoa powder, such as Valrhona', u'1/2 fluid ounce Madagascar bourbon vanilla extract', u'2 teaspoons baking soda', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon fine salt', u'2 eggs', u' Chocolate, Orange and Clove Infused Ganache Filling, recipe follows', u' Chinese Spiced Tea Buttercream, recipe follows', u' Chocolate curls, for garnish', u' Orange sugar crystals, for garnish', u'1 pound granulated sugar', u'4 ounces cocoa powder, such as Valrhona', u'2 ounces cornstarch', u'1/2 teaspoon fine salt', u'6 ounces dark chocolate, such as Valrhona', u'4 ounces unsalted butter', u'2 fluid ounces orange liqueur, such as Grand Marnier', u'1 tablespoon ground cloves', u'1/2 teaspoon orange oil', u'8 ounces granulated sugar', u'4 ounces egg whites', u'2 pounds unsalted butter, at room temperature', u"1 pound confectioners' sugar", u'3 tablespoons loose Chinese mandarin orange tea', u'1 tablespoon loose Chinese mandarin orange tea, ground in a food processor and sifted to remove larger pieces', u'1 tablespoon Madagascar bourbon vanilla extract']
title: Chocolate Cupcakes with a Chocolate, Orange and Clove Infused Ganache Filling and a Chinese Spiced Tea Buttercream

author: Aida Mollenkamp
directions: [u'Bring chicken broth to a simmer. Add a few splashes of soy sauce and hot sauce, to taste. Grate a little ginger into the broth. Stir to combine.', u'Crack 2 eggs in a measuring cup and lightly beat with a whisk.', u'Turn off the heat.  With a ladle, stir the broth in a circular motion to create a "whirlpool".  Slowly drizzle in the beaten eggs in a circular motion as well, without whisking or stirring them in. Let the eggs cook for about 1 minute. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Few cups of low-sodium chicken broth', u' Soy Sauce', u' Asian hot sauce, recommended: Srirachi', u' Fresh ginger', u' Eggs']
title: NO RECIPE RECIPE: Simple Egg Drop Soup

directions: [u'Pre-heat hot a large, thick skillet. Season the liver with salt and green peppercorn. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of butter and sear the liver until brown on both sides, about 8-10 minutes. I prefer my liver medium. Place livers on warm plates. Place skillet back on the heat, add shallots and brown, about 3-5 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper. Add figs and sautee for 1 minute. Deglaze with the vinegars and reduce by 50%. Whisk in butter and check for seasoning. Reserve in a water bath.']
ingredients: [u"4 each calf's liver", u'3 tablespoons clarified butter', u'3 minced shallots', u'4 black mission figs, cut into1/4 inch disks', u'1/2 cup Chinese vinegar', u'1/2 cup balsamic vinegar', u' Salt and coarse ground green peppercorn to taste']
title: Sauteed Calf's Liver with Fig-Chinese Vinegar Syrup

directions: [u'In a bowl, whisk together the scallions, soy sauce, vinegar, gingerroot, vegetable oil, 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil, sugar, garlic paste, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. In a shallow dish, arrange the halibut fillets in 1 layer, pour the soy sauce mixture over them, and let the fish marinate, covered and chilled, for 30 minutes.', u'Arrange a steamer or baking rack in a wide deep kettle and add water to the kettle to reach just below the steamer rack. Put a plate, such as a glass pie plate, at least 1-inch smaller in diameter than the steamer on the rack and place the fish on top. Bring the water to a boil. Pour the marinade over the fish.', u'Steam the fish, covered, over the boiling water until it just flakes, about 12 minutes, and with oven mitts, remove the steamer from the wok. Transfer the fillets carefully to a heated platter and drizzle them with the remaining 1 teaspoon sesame oil and the sauce remaining on the plate.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup thinly sliced scallion', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice-wine vinegar (available at Asian markets) or white-wine vinegar', u'1 (1 1/2-inch) piece peeled fresh gingerroot, cut into very fine julienne strips', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon Asian sesame oil, plus 1 teaspoon for drizzling the fish', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 garlic cloves, minced and mashed to a paste with a pinch of salt', u'1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes, or to taste', u'4 (6-ounce) Pacific halibut fillets, skinned']
title: Steamed Halibut Fillets, Chinese Style

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat 1 1/2 to 2 inches of oil to 350 degrees F in a wok large enough to hold the fish.', u'In a shallow bowl, combine the rice flour, Essence, salt, and pepper, and dredge the fish in the seasoned flour mixture until well coated on all sides. Shake to remove any excess flour. ', u'When the oil is hot, add the fish carefully to the wok; take care as it may splatter. Using a shallow ladle, ladle some of the hot oil over the top of the fish as it cooks in the wok. Cook until golden brown and cooked completely through, 12 to 15 minutes.
