Transfer the fish to a wire rack set over paper towels to drain briefly before serving. ', u'Cut the fish into portions and serve hot over the Stir Fried Rice and garnish with some of the Wokked Long Beans.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable or peanut oil, for frying', u'1 (2-pound) whole fish, such as striped bass, scaled and gutted', u'1 1/2 cups rice flour', u"1 1/2 tablespoons Emeril's Original Essence, recipe follows", u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Wokked Long Beans, for serving', u' Simple Stir Fried Rice, for serving', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'8 ounces ground pork', u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'3/4 pound long beans, washed, ends trimmed, cut into 4-inch lengths', u'3 tablespoons thinly sliced garlic', u'2 1/2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons chili sauce with bean paste', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'3/4 cup diced onion', u'1/2 cup diced carrot', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced green onion bottoms', u'6 cups cooked white rice', u'1/2 cup frozen peas', u'3/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons chopped green onion tops']
title: Chinese Style Wok-Fried Whole Fish with Wokked Long Beans and Simple Stir Fried Rice

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'In a sauce pot, heat 1 1/2 cups of the stock and 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil. Bring to a boil and stir in the rice. Lower the heat and bring to a bubble, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, about 18 minutes. Fluff with a fork and add the scallions.', u'Meanwhile, thinly slice the chicken or pork.', u'Trim the broccolini or broccoli and cut into 2-inch pieces or florets. Bring 2 inches of water to a boil in a shallow pot or deep skillet over medium heat. Salt the water and cook the broccolini or florets until tender-crisp, about 3 to 4 minutes. Drain.', u'Heat a large skillet over high heat while the broccolini cooks. Add 1/2 tablespoon of the oil and when it begins to smoke or ripple, add the chicken and brown it for 5 to 6 minutes, turning once, then transfer it to a plate. Add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil to the pan, stir in the ginger and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tamari, the marmalade, and the remaining 1/2 cup of chicken stock. Slide the chicken, broccolini, and cashews into the pan and stir to combine with the sauce. Simmer for another 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Scoop the chicken mixture into serving dishes, top with a scoop of rice, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups chicken stock', u'2 tablespoons canola, vegetable or other high-temperature cooking oil', u'1 cup white rice', u'1 small bunch scallions, thinly sliced on an angle', u'6 chicken cutlets or chicken thighs or 6 thin pork loin chops', u'1 large bundle broccolini or 1 head broccoli', u' Salt', u'1 1/2 inches fresh gingerroot, peeled and finely chopped or grated', u'2 to 3 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons tamari (aged soy sauce)', u'1/3 cup orange marmalade', u'1/2 cup roasted unsalted cashews']
title: Make Your Own Takeout Cashew Chicken or Pork with Orange Sauce and Scallion Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the vinegar, 1 tablespoon water, 1/2 tablespoon soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Add the jalapeno; set aside.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tofu and cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side; transfer to a cutting board. Add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook, stirring, until slightly wilted, about 1 minute. Add the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon water and a few grinds of pepper to the skillet. Cook until the mushrooms soften, about 2 minutes. Quarter each piece of tofu and transfer to a bowl; add the mushrooms and 2 tablespoons of the vinegar mixture and toss. Set aside.', u'Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook as the label directs, adding the broccolini during the last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain and rinse under cold water; transfer to a large bowl. Add the sesame oil; toss to coat.', u'Divide the noodles and broccolini among bowls. Top with the tofu, mushrooms and sprouts and drizzle with the remaining jalapeno-vinegar mixture. Sprinkle with the scallions.', u'Photograph by Ryan Liebe']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u' Kosher salt', u'1 red jalapeno pepper, halved and thinly sliced 1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 14 -ounce package firm tofu, drained, cut into 4 equal pieces and patted dry', u'8 ounces sliced shiitake mushrooms (about 4 cups)', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1 10 - to 12-ounce package Chinese egg noodles', u'1 bunch broccolini, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced']
title: Chinese Noodles with Tofu

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Dumplings: In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg white, sesame oil and arrowroot until frothy. Stir in the bell pepper, carrot, peas, chives, ginger, salt, and shrimp. Put 1/2 of the mixture in a food processor. Blend until the mixture forms a chunky paste. Return the paste to the bowl and combine it with the remaining vegetable mixture. Cut each egg roll wrapper into 4 equal-sized squares. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the mixture into the center of each piece of dough. Gather the sides of the egg roll wrapper around the filling leaving the top of the filling uncovered.  If necessary, use a little water to help secure the wrapper in place. Spray the bottom of a bamboo or stainless steel steamer with vegetable oil cooking spray. Working in batches, stand the dumplings, uncovered filling side up, in the steamer and cover. Steam until the shrimp turn pink and are cooked through, about 6 to 8 minutes.', u'Dipping sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, hot sauce and garlic. ', u'Arrange the dumplings on a platter and serve the dipping sauce alongside.']
ingredients: [u'1 egg white', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon arrowroot', u'1/2 red bell pepper, cored, seeded and diced into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1 medium carrot, peeled and diced into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup frozen petite peas, thawed', u'1/4 cup chopped chives', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled, deveined and cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'4 egg roll wrappers', u' Vegetable oil cooking spray', u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'3/4 teaspoon hot sauce (recommended: Sriracha)', u'1 garlic clove, minced']
title: Shrimp Siu Mai (Dumplings)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the chicken: Whisk the egg white, cornstarch and rice wine in a bowl. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.', u'Make the stir-fry sauce: Whisk 1/3 cup water, the oyster, hoisin and soy sauces, the rice wine and sesame oil in a bowl, then whisk in the cornstarch until dissolved.', u'Fry the noodles: Pull the noodles apart into sections. Heat 3/4 inch peanut oil in a medium saucepan until a deep-fry thermometer registers 380 degrees F. Working in batches, press the noodles into the oil with a spatula until they puff, 5 to 10 seconds. Drain on paper towels.', u'Make the stir-fry: Heat 2 tablespoons peanut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook, stirring, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons peanut oil to the skillet; when almost smoking, stir in the garlic, ginger, jalapeno and minced scallions, then add 1/2 teaspoon salt and the sugar and stir-fry 30 seconds. Add the mushrooms, water chestnuts and scallion pieces and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add the stir-fry sauce and chicken and cook 1 minute.', u'Make a bed of noodles on a platter and top with the chicken mixture. Serve the noodles and stir-fry with lettuce leaves and soy sauce for dipping.', u'Photograph by Andrew Mccaul']
ingredients: [u'1 large egg white', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine or dry sherry', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, diced', u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine or dry sherry', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 bundles cellophane noodles', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'4 tablespoons peanut oil', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon minced peeled ginger', u'1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', u'4 scallions; 2 minced, 2 cut into 1-inch pieces', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms,stemmed and diced', u'3/4 cup diced water chestnuts', u' Small lettuce leaves, for serving', u' Soy sauce, chili paste and/or hot mustard, for serving']
title: Almost-Famous Chicken Lettuce Wraps

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large bowl combine all of the ingredients apart from the chicken thighs. Whisk to combine. Add chicken thighs and toss to coat. Marinate for 15 minutes. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat, and place chicken thighs directly onto grill. Cook on each side for 4 to 6 minutes. Remove from grill and keep warm on a plate covered with foil. Serve with Chinese Fried Rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups rice wine', u'1 cup sake', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1 cup yuzu juice or ponzu', u'6 tablespoons sugar or honey, plus 1 tablespoon', u'1 (3 to 4-inch) piece fresh ginger, cut into coins', u'3/4 cup rice vinegar', u' Pinch red pepper flakes', u'1/2 teaspoon salt plus extra salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 chicken thighs', u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'3 cups cooked white rice', u'1/2 cup chopped green onions', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'3 eggs', u'1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped parsley leaves', u'2 cups stir-fry vegetables', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley leaves']
title: Yuzu and Mirin Marinated Grilled Chicken Thighs with Chinese Vegetable Fried Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Season chicken strips and add to pan. Brown chicken and remove to plate. Add red and green peppers and cook for 1 minute. Stir in pineapple chunks, juice, sugar, vinegar and chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Simmer until sauce begins to reduce. Stir in cornstarch mixture and bring liquid to a simmer. Stir in chicken strips and cook for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 boneless chicken breasts, sliced into strips', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 cup chopped red pepper', u'4 teaspoons cornstarch, mixed with 4 teaspoons water', u'1 cup canned pineapple chunks, drained with 1/2 cup reserved juice', u'3 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 cup chopped green pepper']
title: Sweet and Sour Chicken

author: Brian Boitano
directions: [u'Put the rack of spareribs into a large resealable plastic bag.  Pour in the hoisin sauce, close the bag and toss gently to coat.  Put the bag into a bowl and marinate the ribs in the refrigerator for 3 hours or up to overnight.', u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.', u'Put the ribs into a sheet pan along with all the marinade.  Cover the pan with aluminum foil, slide it into the oven and bake until the meat easily separates from the bone, about 2 hours.  Baste them every 30 minutes during the cooking process.  Remove the ribs from the oven and let them rest.', u'When cool enough to handle, pull the rib meat from the bones and coarsely chop.  Then, in a large bowl, toss the pork together with the cabbage and scallions.  If the mixture seems too dry, add in a bit more hoisin sauce.', u'For the dough:', u'Sprinkle the yeast over the warm water in a small bowl. After a few minutes, the yeast will begin to foam and bubble.', u'In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and baking powder.  Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the warm milk, canola oil, and the activated yeast. Work the dough to produce a shaggy mass. Turn it out onto a floured board or countertop and knead until the dough becomes smooth, soft, and pliable, about 5 to 10 minutes.  Put it into a lightly oiled bowl and turn it over once to coat.  Cover the bowl in plastic wrap and allow the dough to rise undisturbed for 40 minutes to 1 hour. The mass should double in volume.', u'For the assembly:', u'To form the buns, remove the dough from the bowl and roll it into 1 long rope.  Cut the rope into 12 equal portions.  Roll each piece and set them aside in a bowl.  Using a rolling pin, flatten each ball into 4-inch circles, leaving the center slightly thicker then its edges. Put a heaping tablespoon of the filling into the center of each disk and pinch the tops closed to seal.', u'Arrange the buns on a parchment lined sheet tray and cover them with a clean kitchen towel. Alternatively, place the buns into a large 3-level bamboo steamer lined with parchment paper, 4 buns per level. Allow the buns to rest for 10 minutes.', u'In the meantime, fill a bamboo or stainless steel steamer with water and bring it to a boil.  Cut 12 (4-inch) rounds from some parchment paper.  When ready to cook, place the buns on the parchment rounds and into the steamer.']
ingredients: [u'1 (1/2 to 1-pound) rack spareribs', u'3/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1 cup shredded cabbage', u'1 bunch scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 package active dry yeast', u'1/2 warm water', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for kneading', u'1 1/2 cups cake flour', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/2 cup warm milk', u'1 tablespoon canola oil, plus more as needed']
title: Pork Steamed Buns

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the beans and carrots and cook for 1 minute. Drain and put in a bowl of iced water until cool, about 1 minute. Drain and set aside. ', u'Return the water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Pat dry and set aside. ', u'In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over high heat. Add the noodles, ginger and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes until the noodles are lightly browned. Add the mushrooms, beans, carrots, and water chestnuts and cook for 3 minutes. Add the broth, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and honey. Bring the mixture to a boil and stir until slightly reduced and thick, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Transfer the chow mein to a large bowl and garnish with the green onions before serving.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces Chinese long beans or green beans, cut into 1/2 to 1-inch pieces to yield about 2 cups', u'2 large carrots, peeled, trimmed and cut into matchstick-size pieces', u'8 ounces fresh or dried chow mein noodles', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 (2-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'6 large shiitake mushrooms, thinly sliced', u'1 (8-ounce) can sliced water chestnuts, rinsed and drained', u'1/4 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce*', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 green onions, thinly sliced', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets']
title: Vegetable Chow Mein

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the star anise and peppercorns; cook, stirring, until toasted, about 10 seconds. Add the cilantro, scallions and garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add the soy sauce mixture and simmer over medium heat until slightly reduced, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl and let cool, then add the chicken and toss. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours.', u'Transfer the chicken to a rack set in a roasting pan (reserve the marinade). Refrigerate the chicken, uncovered, about 3 hours to dry out the skin.', u'Position a rack in the upper third of the oven; preheat to 400 degrees F. Pour 1/4 inch of water and the reserved marinade into the roasting pan. Roast the chicken 20 minutes. Baste with the pan juices, then reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F and continue roasting until the skin is glazed and a thermometer inserted into a breast registers 160 degrees F, 20 to 25 more minutes. Transfer the chicken (on the rack) to a board. Pour the pan juices into a skillet; simmer over medium-high heat until reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Drizzle over the chicken.', u'Photographs by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons Chinese rice wine', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 star anise pod, broken into points', u'1/2 teaspoon Szechuan peppercorns, crushed with a knife', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro (stems and leaves)', u'3 scallions, finely chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'2 quartered chickens (3 to 3 1/2 pounds each)', u' Whisk the soy sauce, rice wine, hoisin sauce and honey in a bowl; set aside.']
title: Hoisin-Glazed Roast Chicken

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Special equipment: eight 8-inch skewers', u'For the marinade and mop: Whisk together the ginger, garlic, soy sauce, vermouth, vinegar, sesame oil and sugar in a measuring cup. Pour 1/4 cup of the marinade into a small bowl, whisk in the hoisin sauce and set this basting sauce aside.', u'For the kebabs: Toss the remaining marinade with the pork in a medium bowl, cover and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.', u'Carefully thread onto a skewer 1 piece of pork, 1 snow pea folded over a water chestnut slice (the pea will crack on one side, but it will help hold in the water chestnut), a piece of red pepper and a piece of baby corn; repeat twice, then end with a piece of orange, skin side facing the last baby corn. Repeat with the remaining skewers and ingredients.', u'Prepare a grill for medium-high heat. Brush the skewers with the vegetable oil, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lightly oil the grill grates. Grill the skewers until the pork is cooked through and an instant-read thermometer registers 140 degrees F, 7 to 8 minutes per side. Brush the skewers with the mop, and continue grilling until the marinade caramelizes, about 1 minute.', u'Copyright 2014 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u' One 2-inch piece ginger, finely grated', u'1 large clove garlic, finely grated', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dry white vermouth', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1-inch chunks', u'1 cup snow peas (about 4 ounces)', u' One 8-ounce can sliced water chestnuts, strained', u'2 small red peppers, halved, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces', u' One 15-ounce can baby corn, strained and halved crosswise', u'1/2 navel orange, cut into 4 wedges, wedges halved', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for oiling the grill grates', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Chinese-Takeout Skewers

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Prepare the scallion garnish: Finely slice the scallions on an angle and drop them into a large bowl with ice and water - this will make the scallion threads curl up nicely so they look like ribbons. Set aside.', u'Wash green beans under cold running water.  Cut off the root ends and discard. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the beans and blanch until bright green, about 2 minutes. Shock in ice water then drain in a colander.', u'Heat a large wok over high heat.  Add the peanut oil, then add the shallots, garlic, ginger and chile. Stir the mixture around so it fries in the oil and gets fragrant, about 30 seconds.  Add the green beans and toss a couple of times to coat everything evenly. Saute for a couple of minutes so the beans get a little caramelization. Add the soy sauce and cook for 1 to 2 more minutes; the beans should still be nice and crisp. Transfer to a large platter and garnish with drained scallion curls.']
ingredients: [u'2 scallions, for garnish', u'1 pound green beans', u'2 tablespoons peanut or sesame oil', u'1 small shallot, finely chopped', u'3 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger', u'1/2 medium red chile, like jalapeno, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce']
title: Sauteed Green Beans with Soy, Shallots, Ginger, Garlic and Chile

directions: [u'Wash the inside and outside of the wok with hot water, using a stainless-steel scrubber and liquid dishwashing soap. Rinse with hot water. Dry the wok with paper towels, and then place over low heat 1 to 2 minutes until the pan is totally dry. Cut the chives into 2-inch pieces. ', u'Open the window and turn the exhaust fan on high. Heat the wok over high heat until a bead of water vaporizes with 1 to 2 seconds of contact. Swirl in the oil and add the chives. Reduce the heat to medium and stir-fry 5 minutes, pushing the mixture up the sides of the wok to the edge. If the mixture becomes dry, add additional tablespoons of oil. Remove from the heat. Cool. Discard the chives. The wok is seasoned and ready for cooking. ', u'Wash wok with hot water. Dry over low heat, 1 to 2 minutes. ']
ingredients: [u'1/2 bunch Chinese chives (about 7 ounces)', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil']
title: Hung Chong Chinese Chive and Oil Stir-Fry

directions: [u'For the iced tea: Pour 4 cups boiling water over teabags in a heatproof pitcher and allow to brew, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove teabags and add sweetener to taste. Stir in 6 cups ice cubes until melted. Keep refrigerated until ready to use. Makes two quarts.', u'For the marinade and mop: Whisk together the ginger, garlic, soy sauce, vermouth, sesame oil, vinegar and sugar in a measuring cup. Pour 1/4 cup of the marinade into a small bowl, whisk in the hoisin sauce and set this basting "mop" aside.', u'For the kebabs: Toss the remaining marinade with the pork in a medium bowl, then cover and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.', u'Carefully thread onto a skewer 1 piece of pork, 1 snow pea folded over a water chestnut slice (the pea will crack on one side, but it will help hold in the water chestnut), a piece of red pepper and a piece of baby corn; repeat twice, then end with a piece of orange, skin side facing the last baby corn. Repeat with the remaining skewers and ingredients.', u'Prepare a grill for cooking over medium-high heat. Brush the skewers with the vegetable oil, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lightly oil the grill grates. Grill the skewers until the pork is cooked through and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a piece registers 140 degrees F, 7 to 8 minutes per side. Brush the skewers with the mop, and continue grilling until the mop caramelizes, about 1 minute. Serve with iced tea.']
ingredients: [u'2 Family Size Tea Bags', u'2 quarts water', u' Sugar or sweetener, optional', u' One 2-inch piece ginger, finely grated', u'1 large clove garlic, finely grated', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dry white vermouth', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1-inch chunks', u'1 cup snow peas (about 4 ounces)', u' One 8-ounce can sliced water chestnuts, drained', u'2 small red peppers, halved, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces', u' One 15-ounce can baby corn, drained and halved crosswise', u'1/2 navel orange, cut into 4 wedges, wedges halved', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for oiling the grill grates', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Special equipment: eight 8-inch skewers']
title: Chinese-Takeout Skewers

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 425 degrees F. Coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Combine 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce and 1 teaspoon rice vinegar in a small bowl; set aside.', u'Combine the pork, panko, the remaining 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce, the scallion, ginger, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a medium bowl. With dampened hands, roll the mixture into twelve 1 1/2-inch meatballs; transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Bake, turning once, until browned and cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes per side. Remove from the oven and brush with the reserved hoisin sauce mixture.', u'Meanwhile, combine the cabbage, carrots and pineapple in a food processor. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons rice vinegar, the mayonnaise and 1/2 teaspoon salt and pulse until roughly chopped.', u'Spread mayonnaise on the bottom half of each bun, then fill with some shredded lettuce and a meatball. Serve with the pineapple salad.', u'Photograph by Andrew Purcell']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'12 ounces ground pork', u'2 tablespoons panko breadcrumbs', u'1 scallion (white and light green parts only), sliced', u'1 teaspoon grated peeled ginger', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 small head green cabbage, roughly chopped', u'2 small carrots, roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup chopped pineapple', u'1 tablespoon mayonnaise, plus more for the buns', u'12 mini potato slider buns, split', u' Shredded romaine lettuce, for serving']
title: Chinese Meatball Sliders with Pineapple Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and transfer to a serving dish. Combine and serve with prepared frozen spring rolls']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons (3 splashes) rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup dark tamari soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 scallion, finely chopped', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, a drizzle', u' Spring rolls, storebought and heated according to package instructions']
title: Dipping Sauce for Spring Rolls

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Wash the chicken under cold running water, pat dry and trim off any excess fat.  Cut the chicken into 1-inch cubes and put into a large mixing bowl. Add the marinade ingredients to the bowl and stir to combine. Set aside to marinate while you prepare the sauce.', u'To make the sauce: In a saucepan, add the sesame oil and set over low heat. Add the ginger and garlic and fry gently until fragrant, about 2 to 3 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the remaining sauce ingredients in a mixing bowl and stir well to dissolve the cornstarch. Gently pour into the saucepan with the fried ginger and garlic. Stir as you pour because the cornstarch will thicken up pretty quickly.  Keep warm over low heat.', u'In a heavy-bottomed pot or deep-fryer heat enough oil to come halfway up the sides of the pot, to 375 degrees F.', u'Fry the chicken, in small batches, until golden and crispy, about 5 to 6 minutes. Remove the chicken using a wire mesh strainer and drain on paper towels.  Season with a little salt, to taste. To serve, arrange the fried chicken on a platter and pour drizzle with the sauce.  Sprinkle with a generous amount of toasted sesame seeds and garnish with scallions and cilantro sprigs.']
ingredients: [u'3 boneless chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 pounds total)', u'6 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'4 tablespoons cornstarch', u'4 tablespoons water', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'3 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon ginger, minced', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon chili paste (recommended: Sambal Oelek)', u'2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons sherry vinegar', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u' Peanut oil, for deep-frying', u' Salt', u'3 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds, for garnish', u'2 to 3 tablespoons finely chopped scallions, for garnish', u'5 to 6 cilantro sprigs, for garnish']
title: Sesame Chicken

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat electric wok at medium high setting. Add oil and stir in scallions and garlic. Add chicken and toss to coat. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add broccoli or carrots and water. Cover and steam for 4 minutes. Stir in vinegar, soy sauce and ginger. Simmer mixture for 2 minutes. Add snow peas and toss to coat. Serve with rice']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 bunch scallions, cut in one inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon pre-minced garlic', u'1 package pre-cut chicken tenders', u'1 package pre-cut broccoli or carrots', u'3 tablespoons water', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon powder ginger or 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, chopped', u'1/4 pound snow peas, fresh or frozen']
title: No More Chinese Take-Out

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the mushrooms in a small bowl and cover with boiling water and soak until re-hydrated, about 20 minutes. Drain, squeeze dry, and cut mushrooms in quarters. Set aside.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil in a well-seasoned wok or large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Swirl to coat the pan. Pour in the eggs, swirl the pan so the egg forms a large thin pancake. (Lift the edge of the egg to allow any uncooked egg to run to the center.) As soon as the egg has set, turn it out of the pan onto a cutting board. Cool, cut into 1 inch pieces.', u'Wipe out the pan with a paper towel and heat the remaining peanut oil over high heat. Add the scallions and carrots and stir-fry for 1 1/2 minutes. Add the mushrooms, garlic, chile, and ginger, stir-fry for 1 minute more. Add the soy sauce, sesame oil and rice and stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the meat, peas, and reserved egg, cook, stirring until heated through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'8 dried shiitake mushrooms', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten with a pinch of kosher salt', u'4 scallions (white and green), thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup minced carrot', u'1 large clove garlic, minced', u' Pinch red chile flakes', u'1 teaspoon minced peeled fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'3 cups cooked long-grain rice', u'1 cup cooked meat cut in 1/2-inch cubes, such as pork, ham, beef, or chicken', u'1/2 cup frozen peas, defrosted in a strainer at room temperature', u' Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
title: Fried Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and broccoli slaw; cook, stirring, until the noodles are al dente and the slaw is tender, about 3 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water, then transfer to a large bowl. Add the sesame oil, season with salt and toss.', u'Meanwhile, spread out the tofu on a kitchen towel; lay another towel on top and press to remove as much water as possible. Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a Dutch oven or large deep skillet over high heat. Add the tofu and cook, turning, until golden, about 6 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate using a slotted spoon; season with salt.', u'Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in the pot. Add the scallions and ginger; stir-fry 30 seconds. Add the shiitakes; stir-fry3 minutes. Add the broth, soy sauce and tofu; season with pepper. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half, 3 to 4 minutes.', u'Whisk 3 tablespoons water and the cornstarch in a bowl; add to the pot and cook, stirring, until thickened. Add the noodles and toss to coat.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 8 -ounce package thin Chinese noodles', u'1 12 -ounce package broccoli slaw', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 14 -ounce package extra-firm tofu, drained and cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'6 scallions, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled ginger', u'2 5 -ounce packages sliced shiitake mushrooms', u'2 cups low-sodium mushroom or vegetable broth', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch']
title: Chinese Noodle-Vegetable Bowl

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl, stir together flour, pinch of salt, and boiling water. Add cold water, stir until dough forms. Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, about 10 minutes. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes. ', u'Divide dough in half, cut each half into 5 pieces and roll each piece into a small ball. ', u'On a lightly floured surface using a rolling pin, roll each ball into a 3-inch pancake. Brush 5 of the pancakes with sesame oil, top each with another pancake. Roll each pancake into an 8- inch pancake. ', u'Heat a dry heavy skillet. Cook each pancake, without browning, on both sides until blistered with several air pockets.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups flour', u' Pinch of salt', u'1/2 cup boiling water', u'2 tablespoons cold water', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u' Flour for rolling']
title: Moo Shu Pancakes

directions: [u'Lightly saute shallots, ginger, garlic and sugar in the sesame oil until shallots are translucent. Add chicken stock and soy sauce to the mixture. Reduce liquid by half over medium heat and then add the black beans. Simmer for 10 minutes. Place aromatics in the bottom of the steam basket, and then place the fish and the broccoli on top of the steam basket. Place the steam basket over the simmering pot of water until the fish is cooked. Drizzle the sauce over the fish and serve.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces Chilean sea bass fillet', u'3 bunches Chinese broccoli', u'1/3 cup shallots, brunoise', u'1/3 cup ginger, brunoise', u'1/3 cup garlic, brunoise', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1/2 cup fermented black beans, soaked and chopped', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'3/4 cup soy sauce', u'10 star anise', u'1 orange, zested', u'1/3 cup coriander']
title: Steamed Chilean Sea Bass with Chinese Broccoli, Asian Aromatics and Black Bean Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Boil the noodles according to package instructions. Drain in a colander in the sink and rinse under cold running water. Shake the colander to drain off excess water and pat the noodles dry with a towel. ', u'Heat 1/4 cup of the peanut oil in a large seasoned or non-stick skillet over high heat. Add the noodles, spreading them out to evenly cover the skillet, and fry, turning once, until golden brown and crispy, about 8 minutes. (Break the noodles up, by stirring, near the end of the cooking). Transfer noodles to a paper towel-lined plate and season with salt to taste. Set aside. Discard any excess oil and wipe out the pan.', u'Whisk together the chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, cornstarch, and sugar in a small bowl, and set aside. Season the chicken with the dark sesame oil, salt, and pepper, and set aside.', u'Heat the skillet over high heat. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons peanut oil until very hot. Add the ginger, garlic, and scallion and stir-fry, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the chicken and stir-fry, until lightly browned, about 1 1/2 minutes. Add the onion, celery, and mushrooms and stir-fry, until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add the water chestnuts and spread the ingredients to the outside of the pan to form a well in the center. Pour the chicken broth mixture into the well, bring to a boil, and stir to coat the chow mein mixture. Stir in the bean sprouts and remove from the heat. Season generously to taste with pepper.', u'Transfer chicken chow mein to a warm platter and top with the fried noodles. Serve immediately with rice. Pass more soy sauce at the table.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces dried chuka soba noodles, or other Chinese egg noodles', u'1/4 cup, plus 2 tablespoons peanut oil', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 cup chicken broth, homemade or low-sodium canned', u'3 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon dark soy sauce, plus more for the table', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 boneless, skinless chicken breast (about 6 ounces), cut into thin 2-inch-long strips', u'1 teaspoon dark Asian sesame oil', u'1 heaping tablespoon minced peeled fresh ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 scallion, white and green minced', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 medium yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'1 stalk celery, thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'10 dried shittake mushrooms, rehydrated, drained, and thinly sliced', u'1/3 cup thinly sliced canned water chestnuts', u'6 ounces fresh mung bean sprouts', u'3 cups cooked white rice, hot']
title: Chicken Chow Mein

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large saucepan or soup pot heat the oil over medium high heat until hot. Add 1 tablespoon of the garlic and 1 tablespoon of the ginger and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the 1/4 cup of sliced scallions and the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low so that the broth just simmers. Allow broth to simmer for at least 20 to 30 minutes while the wontons are being assembled.', u'In a small mixing bowl combine the remaining teaspoon of minced garlic, remaining tablespoon of chopped ginger, 3 tablespoons of finely chopped scallions, the pork, egg yolk, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil and crushed red pepper. Mix until thoroughly combined.', u'Working on a flat work surface, lay out a few of the wontons. (Keep remaining wonton wrappers covered with plastic wrap.) Fill a small bowl partially with cool water and set aside. Using a teaspoon measure, place a heaping teaspoonful of the meat filling in the center of each wonton. Using your fingers, lightly wet the edges of the wonton. Bring 2 opposite corners of the wonton together to form a triangle and enclose the filling, pressing edges firmly around the mound of filling to eliminate any air pockets and seal. Moisten opposite corners of the long side. Curl moistened corners toward each other, overlapping one on top of the other, and press the edges together to seal. You should now have a rounded stuffed wonton with a triangle poking up at the top. Assemble the remaining wontons in the same manner. When the wontons are all assembled, set aside.', u'Add the sliced bok choy, mushrooms, and bamboo shoots to the broth and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Using your hands or a slotted spoon, gently add the prepared wontons to the simmering broth. Increase the heat slightly so that the broth returns to a gentle simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally (very gently), until the wontons float and the pork filling is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh ginger', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced scallions, plus 3 tablespoons finely chopped', u'10 cups canned low sodium chicken broth', u'1/2 pound ground pork', u'1 egg yolk', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 teaspoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u' About 30 wonton wrappers, thawed if frozen', u'1 1/2 cups thinly sliced bok choy', u'1/2 cup sliced shiitake mushroom caps', u'1/4 cup sliced bamboo shoots']
title: Wonton Soup

directions: [u'At least 1 day before you plan to make the fried rice, place the rinsed rice in a heavy, medium-sized saucepan. Add 2 cups of cold water and salt, to taste. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, and cook at a gentle boil until the water has cooked down to the level of the rice. With a spoon (not a fork), stir the rice well. Cover, and reduce the heat to low. Continue to cook for about 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender. Fluff with a fork. Cool to room temperature before covering and refrigerating for 24 hours. ', u'Break up any clumps of the cold rice with your fingers and set aside. In a small bowl, stir together the oyster sauce and soy sauce and set aside. ', u'Coat a large, nonstick skillet with nonstick vegetable spray and set over medium-high heat. When the skillet is hot, add the eggs, swirling them around to make sure they coat the whole bottom of the pan. Cook, without stirring, and adjusting the heat as necessary, until the eggs are firm and cooked through but not yet starting to brown, lifting the skillet and tilting it so that the eggs cook evenly. Slide the eggs onto a plate and when they have cooled, cut into small pieces and set aside. ', u'Return the skillet to the burner and heat the oil over high heat. When it is hot, add the peas and scallions, and cook, stirring constantly, until the scallions are limp, about 1 minute. Stir in the rice, sauce mixture, eggs and roast pork until well mixed. Continue to cook, stirring, until the rice is heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Plate and drizzle with sesame oil, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups long-grain converted white rice, rinsed', u' Salt', u'1/4 cup oyster sauce', u'2 tablespoons light Japanese soy sauce', u'3 large eggs, beaten until just blended', u'2 tablespoons peanut or vegetable oil', u'1 cup frozen baby peas, thawed', u'2 or 3 scallions, thinly sliced, including some of the green tops, 1/3 to 1/2 cup', u'2 cups diced store bought roast pork, optional', u' Sesame oil, as needed']
title: Fried Rice with Egg

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.', u'If you have whole chicken wings, cut off wingtips and cut the wings in half at the joint. Discard wingtips or freeze to make stock.', u'Place the wings in a large bowl. Sprinkle five-spice powder and cayenne on the wings; add generous pinches of salt and about 15 grinds of black pepper. Rub the mixture into all the wings until no more loose rub remains. ', u'Line the wing pieces up on a baking sheet so the side of the wing that has the most skin is facing up. Roast until cooked through, browned and crispy, about 25 minutes. Serve hot with Creamy Cilantro Dipping Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'40 chicken wing pieces or 20 whole chicken wings', u'2 tablespoons Chinese five-spice powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Creamy Cilantro Dipping Sauce, recipe follows']
title: Spicy Chinese Five-Spice-Rubbed Chicken Wings with Creamy Cilantro Dipping Sauce

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Begin by blooming the gelatin. In a small bowl, add the water and slowly pour in the gelatin powder, stirring well until fully incorporated.  Set aside.', u'In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, add the coconut cream and milk. Stir well with a whisk to combine. Bring to a simmer then stir in the gelatin mixture. Once the mixture comes to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Spray an 8 by 8-inch nonstick square cake pan with a little nonstick spray (this will help hold down the plastic wrap).  Line the cake pan with plastic wrap (1 sheet across 1 way and another sheet across the other way, works well), leaving enough overhang so you can pick the jelly up from the pan. Give the coconut mixture a final whisk and pour it into the lined pan. Allow to cool slightly before putting it in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours or overnight.', u'To serve, remove the jelly from pan using the plastic wrap and invert it onto a cutting board.  Remove the plastic wrap and discard. Using a hot knife cut the jelly into 1 1/2-inch cubes. Serve in small bowls with chilled pineapple chunks, pineapple juice and maraschino cherries.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup warm water', u'4 sachets powdered gelatin (just shy of 4 tablespoons)', u'3 cups cream of coconut', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u' Nonstick cooking spray', u'2 cups canned pineapple chunks in sweetened juice', u'1/2 cup maraschino cherries with stems']
title: Coconut Jelly

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a heavy skillet. When the oil is hot, add the peanuts and fry for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring constantly. Drain. In a food processor, fitted with a metal blade, puree the peanuts and 2 tablespoons of the oil until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Remove and cool']
ingredients: [u'3 cups peanut oil', u'1 cup raw shelled peanuts', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Chinese Style Peanut Butter

directions: [u'Mix the sliced beef with soy sauce, cooking wine, and cornstarch and set aside. Heat the wok and 4 tablespoons of vegetable oil. Stir-fry the garlic and jalapeno pepper until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the beef and the sauce ingredients and stir-fry over high heat just until the beef is no longer pink on the outside, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the green onions during the last 1 minute of cooking.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound flank steak, sliced very thinly', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon cooking wine', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon sliced fresh garlic', u'1 teaspoon sliced jalapeno pepper', u'6 (1-inch) sections green onion', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil']
title: Szechuan Beef

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Place broth and cabbage in a large saucepan and set pan over medium-high heat. Bring to a simmer.', u'Meanwhile, in a food processor, combine pork, soy sauce and sesame oil. Pulse 3 or 4 times until the pork is finely minced but not a paste.', u'Arrange 16 wonton wrappers on a flat surface. Spoon filling onto the center of each wrapper, to within 1/4-inch of the edges (about 1 teaspoon per wrapper). Wet your fingers with water and pull up corners of the wontons to create individual "purses". Pinch the edges together (with wet fingers) to seal. ', u'Place stuffed wontons in simmering broth. Cook 5 minutes, until wontons are tender and translucent. Remove from heat and stir in scallions.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1 cup shredded cabbage', u'1/2 cup shredded or diced cooked pork', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'16 wonton wrappers', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions']
title: Wonton Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Whisk together soy sauce, honey, ginger, sesame oil and red pepper flakes in a small bowl. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead. Cover; chill. Just before serving stir in sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons orange blossom honey', u'2 teaspoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds']
title: Honey Soy Dipping Sauce (For Dumplings Or Potstickers)

directions: [u'In a wok or skillet, stir-fry the ginger and garlic in 2 tablespoons of oil until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add scallions, carrots, and red pepper and stir-fry over high heat for 2 minutes.', u'In a bowl, combine the chicken broth, soy sauce, and sugar. Add the Napa cabbage and broth mixture. Bring to a boil and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft. Add sesame oil, cool for at least 15 minutes, and strain. Fold in the minced shrimp.', u'Fill and roll the egg roll wrappers, using 1 tablespoon of filling for each roll. Working with 1 wonton wrapper at a time, place the wrapper with one corner of the diamond closest to you. Place 1 teaspoon of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Roll the corner closest to you over the filling. Brush the top corner with water. Fold in the sides of the wonton and continue rolling the egg roll up until it is closed. Press to seal, set aside, and continue with the remaining ingredients.', u'In a skillet set over moderately high heat, heat the remaining oil and saute the egg rolls until golden brown on all sides, using tongs to turn them. Serve when cool enough to eat, with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 -inch grated fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 scallions, sliced thinly', u'1 carrot, cut into 1-inch julienne strips', u'1 small red pepper, cut into 1-inch julienne strips', u'1 cup Napa cabbage, shredded', u'1/4 cup chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 to 2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'20 wonton wrappers covered loosely with a damp paper towel to prevent drying', u'10 shrimps, cooked and minced', u'1/3 cup lite soy sauce', u'1/3 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 to 2 teaspoons sesame oil', u' Pinch of red pepper flakes']
title: Egg Rolls

directions: [u'Whisk anchovy paste, soy sauce, sugar, broth and season with red pepper flakes. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable and sesame oils. Add peppers and scallion whites and stir fry or saute, stirring continuously for one minute. Add shrimp and saute for another minute. Add garlic and saute for 15 seconds until you get a good whiff of its aroma. ', u'Add liquid ingredients and peas, half of mint and basil leaves and simmer for a minute or two just until the shrimp are cooked through and the vegetables are tender but still crisp. ', u'Taste and season and transfer to a bowl; serve over rice, garnish with remaining mint, basil and green scallions rounds.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon anchovy paste', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 cup chicken broth', u' Dried red pepper flakes', u'1 tablespoon each vegetable and sesame oil', u'1 cup seeded red bell peppers, cut into 1inch squares', u'1 scallion, whites thinly sliced, greens, cut into rounds, kept separate', u'1 pound deveined peeled shrimp, halved', u'1 clove minced garlic', u'1 cup thawed frozen peas', u'1/4 cup each chiffonade of mint and basil leaves']
title: Shrimp and Vegetable Saute, Chinese Style

directions: [u'Boil the pasta until al dente, about 10 minutes. ', u'While the water is coming to a boil for the pasta and the pasta itself is cooking, cut the chicken into strips about 2 inches long and 1/4-inch wide. In the bottom of a mixing bowl combine the ', u'scallions, sesame oil, rice vinegar, chili paste and peanut butter. Whisk until smooth and season ', u'with salt and crushed red pepper. Add more of any ingredient to make it taste as you wish. ', u'Add the chicken. When the pasta is done, drain and rinse it under cold water to stop the cooking process and pat dry. Add the pasta to the bowl, toss the ingredients together and adjust the seasoning. ', u'Transfer the salad to a platter lined with spinach leaves (dressed or not as you wish with a vinaigrette or favorite salad dressing). Garnish with cucumbers, peanuts or cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound fettucine', u'12 ounces cooked chicken or smoked chicken', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced', u'2 to 3 tablespoons Oriental sesame oil', u'2 to 3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons Chinese chili paste with garlic', u'1/4 cup chunky peanut butter', u' Salt', u' Crushed red pepper', u' Spinach leaves as a bed for salad', u'2 Kirby cucumbers, peeled, seeded and grated for garnish', u' Chopped peanuts and/or cilantro leaves for garnish, optional']
title: Chinese Chicken Salad with Pasta

directions: [u'In a small bowl, stir together broth, vermouth, soy sauce, and sesame oil.', u'In a large skillet heat vegetable oil over moderately high heat until very hot. Add scallions, gingerroot, and shrimp, cook for 1 minute, and transfer to a platter. Add rice and cook until crispy. Add everything back to the pan, add the eggs, and cook until scrambled. Add the peas and cook, stirring for 2 to 3 minutes or until crispy. Add broth mixture and stir to mix well.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons dry white vermouth or white wine', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 cup chopped scallions', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh gingerroot', u'3/4 pound cooked and peeled medium shrimp, chopped', u'4 cups cooked long grain white rice, recipe follows', u'2 large eggs, beaten lightly', u'1 package defrosted frozen peas', u'1 1/3 cups long grain rice', u'1 to 2 tablespoons butter', u' Salt']
title: Shrimp Fried Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat. Add the mushrooms and 1/2 teaspoon sugar and saute until golden, 3 minutes. Add the broth and 2 teaspoons soy sauce. Mix the cornstarch with 1/4 cup water; stir into the skillet and boil until thickened, 2 minutes.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in another skillet over high heat. Add the onion and the remaining 1 teaspoon sugar and cook until tender, 4 minutes. Add the bacon and cook 2 minutes. Add the peas, half of the scallions and the remaining  1 1/2 teaspoons soy sauce; cook 1 more minute. Transfer to a bowl and combine with the beaten eggs.', u'Wipe out the skillet. Return to high heat and add 1/4 inch of vegetable oil. Add one-fourth of the egg mixture; spoon some of the hot oil on top and cook until puffy, 1 to 2 minutes. Flip and cook 1 minute, then drain on paper towels. Repeat to make 3 more omelets. Add the sesame oil to the mushroom gravy and pour over the omelets. Garnish with the remaining scallions.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for frying', u'6 ounces white mushrooms, trimmed and sliced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'3 1/2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1/2 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'6 ounces Canadian bacon, diced', u'1/2 cup frozen peas, thawed', u'1 bunch scallions, thinly sliced', u'6 large eggs, beaten', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil']
title: Egg Foo Yuong

directions: [u'Place 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large pan and cook onions and cabbage over- medium high heat just until tender. Remove from heat, drain excess liquid, and reserve.', u'Whisk the eggs in a bowl and mix in soy sauce, spices, drained cabbage mixture, and bamboo shoots.', u'Using a non-stick pan over medium-high heat, add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil and heat. Ladle about 4 ounces of the cabbage mixture into the hot pan, as you would for pancakes, and sprinkle the small shrimp evenly on top of each. Cook for about 3 minutes, or until edges start to brown and when jiggled, it slides in the pan. Flip and cook another 2 to 3 minutes until cooked through. Garnish with scallions.', u"Cook's Note: If Egg Foo Young becomes brown too quickly, finish it by baking in a preheated 350 degrees F oven for a few minutes."]
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons canola oil', u'1/4 cup yellow onion, chopped', u'2 cups shredded cabbage', u'6 eggs', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup sliced bamboo shoots', u'1/2 cup cooked small salad shrimp, or large dice medium cooked shrimp', u'2 tablespoons green onion tops, sliced, for garnish']
title: Shrimp Egg Foo Young

directions: [u'For the noodles: In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the noodles according to their package directions. Drain and set aside.', u'For the sauce: Combine the bouillon, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil and Sriracha in a large glass measuring cup or small bowl and set aside. This may look like a lot of sauce, but you have a lot of noodles and veggies to coat!', u'For the lo mein: Heat a wok over high heat. When hot, add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, half the garlic, half the ginger and half the scallions and saute 30 seconds. Add in the shrimp and cook until they just start to turn pink and curl up, about 2 minutes. Transfer the shrimp and aromatics to a plate and reserve.', u'In the same pan, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and add the remaining garlic, ginger and scallions. Saute 30 seconds, and then add in the mushrooms, celery, carrots and cabbage. Saute the veggies until they begin to brown and caramelize, 4 to 5 minutes.', u'Whisk the cornstarch into 2 tablespoons cold water. Once dissolved, add to the sauce. Add the sauce to the pan with the vegetables and bring to a simmer. Toss in the reserved shrimp, aromatics and noodles and serve!']
ingredients: [u' Salt', u'8 ounces dried Chinese egg noodles, or 1 pound fresh', u'1 packet chicken bouillon mix, such as Knorr, dissolved in 1 3/4 cups hot water', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon Sriracha chili sauce', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'1 small bunch scallions, white and green parts, sliced', u'1 pound small shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 cup thinly sliced white button mushrooms', u'2 stalks celery, thinly sliced', u'1 large carrot, shredded', u'1/4 head Napa cabbage, finely shredded', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch']
title: Shrimp Lo Mein

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Cut the eggplants in 1/2 lengthwise and then slice crosswise into wedges, no more than 1-inch wide.', u'Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high flame and add the oils; tilt the pan to coat all sides. When you see a slight smoke, add a layer of eggplant, stir-fry until seared and sticky, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove the eggplant to a side platter and cook the remaining eggplant in same manner, adding more oil, if needed.', u'After all the eggplant is out of the pan, add the green onions, ginger, garlic, and chile; stir-fry for a minute until fragrant. Add the broth. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch until the sugar and cornstarch are dissolved. Pour the soy sauce mixture into the wok and cook another minute, until the sauce has thickened. Put the eggplant back in the pan, tossing quickly, until the sauce is absorbed. Garnish with sesame seeds, Thai basil, and cilantro and serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 Asian eggplants, about 2 pounds', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 tablespoon dark sesame oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 green onions, white and green parts, sliced on a diagonal', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 fresh red chile, sliced', u'1/2 cup chicken broth', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, for garnish', u' Thai holy basil and fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Szechwan Eggplant Stir-Fry

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Toss the rice cereal, snap peas, chow mein noodles, almonds and sesame sticks together in a large bowl. Whisk the butter, soy sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, garlic, five-spice, pepper flakes and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a separate bowl. Pour the sauce over the snack mix and toss to coat well. Spread out on a rimmed baking sheet and bake until the mix is toasted and almost completely dry, 16 to 18 minutes, tossing about halfway through.', u'Remove from the oven and stir in the wasabi peas. Let cool completely, and then store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'3 cups crisp rice cereal, such as Rice Chex (about 3 ounces)', u'3 cups dried snap peas (about 3 ounces)', u'2 cups crunchy chow mein noodles (about 4 ounces)', u'1 1/2 cups roasted and salted almonds (about 7 ounces)', u'1 1/2 cups sesame sticks (about 4 ounces)', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'2 cloves garlic, finely grated', u'1/2 teaspoon Chinese five-spice', u' Pinch red pepper flakes', u' Kosher salt', u'1 1/2 cups wasabi peas (about 6 ounces)']
title: Chinese Take-Out Snack Mix

directions: [u'In a non-reactive bowl, prepare the marinade. Combine the rice wine, peanut oil, soy sauce, salt and cornstarch. Stir in the chicken pieces and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon rice wine', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'8 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breast, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice wine', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'4 dried red chiles remove stems and cut in halves', u'1/2 -inch piece ginger, peeled, thinly sliced, smashed', u'1 garlic, smashed', u'1 green onion, cut the white part into 1/2 -inch pieces, julienne the green parts', u'1/4 cup deep-fried peanuts', u'2 tablespoons chicken stock plus 1 tablespoon cornstarch, mixed together to make slurry']
title: Kung Pao Chicken

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Combine sauce ingredients in a small bowl; mix well.', u'With a vegetable peeler, remove 1-inch strips of the eggplant skin, leaving a 1-inch strip of skin in between. Cut the eggplant into fourths lengthwise, then cut each section crosswise into 3-inch pieces.', u'Pour enough oil into a 2-quart saucepan to fill 3 inches. Heat over medium heat to 350 degrees F. Deep-fry the eggplant batches until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain well on paper towels.', u'Place wok over a high heat until hot. Add 1 tablespoon of deep-frying oil and swirl to coat the sides. Add the garlic, ginger, dried chiles and green onion; cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add ground meat and cook, breaking up pieces with back of a spoon, until brown and crumbly. Add the sauce and bring to a simmer. Add the cooked eggplant and stir to coat. Scoop onto a warm serving platter. Serve, garnished with cilantro or green onions.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons chicken broth', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons Chinese black vinegar', u'2 teaspoons plum sauce', u'4 Chinese eggplants (about 1 pound), stems removed', u' Vegetable oil, for deep-frying', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'4 dried whole chile peppers', u'2 green onions, cut into 2-inch lengths', u'1/4 pound ground pork', u' Chopped cilantro leaves or sliced green onions']
title: Spicy Eggplant

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Cook soba noodles according to package directions. ', u'Meanwhile, heat the sesame oil in a large skillet. Add ginger and garlic and saute 1 minute. Add beef, scallions, snap peas and carrots and saute 1 minute. Add broth and soy sauce and bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes, until carrots are soft. Drain noodles and add to sauce. Toss together with cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces soba noodles', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'12 ounces grilled beef, cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'8 grilled scallions, chopped', u'1 cup snap peas', u'1/3 cup shredded carrots', u'3/4 cup reduced-sodium beef broth', u'1/4 cup reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Beef Lo Mein

directions: [u'Mix the flour with the spices. Dredge the trout and deep fry at 375 degrees until golden brown. Season with salt. Repeat process with the onions. On an oval plate, place a small mound of the long beans and top with trout. Encircle with sauce. Garnish with crispy onions.']
ingredients: [u'4 brook trout', u'2 cups rice flour', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon chile powder', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon ground fennel', u' Salt to taste', u'1 thinly sliced yellow onion', u'1 tablespoon minced lemon grass', u'3 sliced shallots', u'1/8 cup fish sauce', u'1 diced small pineapple', u'2 peeled and diced mangoes', u' Juice of 1 lime', u' Salt and black pepper to taste', u' Canola oil to cook', u'3 cups Chinese long beans, cut into 3-inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon sambal', u'1/2 tablespoon sesame oil', u' Salt and black pepper to taste']
title: Whole Crispy Brook Trout with Mango-Pineapple Sauce Spicy Chinese Long Beans

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Duck is notoriously a fatty bird, to diminish the fat and produce a crispy skin, begin by trimming the excess fat from the neck and body. Rinse the duck, inside and out, and pat dry thoroughly with paper towels. Combine the Chinese five-spice, sugar, and salt in a small bowl. Rub the spice mixture all over the duck, inside and out. Salt and five-spice powder makes a fragrant dry marinade, which draws some of the moisture from the duck so that the spices penetrate. Stuff the duck cavity with the aromatics: the ginger, garlic, green onions, and tangerine peel. Fold the wing tips back under the duck and tie the legs together with kitchen string. Poke the duck breast a few times, piercing the skin.', u'Place a roasting pan on the stovetop over 2 burners and fill with 2-inches of water, turn the heat to medium. Set a V-rack insert inside the pan and lay the duck on the rack, breast-side up. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Steam the duck for 45 minutes, checking the water level periodically. Steaming the duck first melts away some of the fat and shrinks the skin.', u'In a small saucepan combine the vinegar, honey, and soy sauce over low heat. Cook and stir for 5 minutes until thick. The duck will be lacquered with the sweet glaze, which caramelizes during roasting, making the skin crisp and brown.', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. ', u"Take the foil off the duck, remove the rack with the duck, and pour out the water and all the fat that has rendered out (this is great to use in other dishes like fried rice.) Put the rack with the duck back inside the roasting pan. Baste the duck with the vinegar mixture, until all the skin is completely coated in the glaze. Stick the whole thing in the oven. Roast the duck for 1 hour, basting periodically with any remaining glaze to set in a deep mahogany color. Tent the breast with some foil if it gets too dark. The legs will wiggle easily when it's done. Carve and serve."]
ingredients: [u'1 whole (4 to 5 pound) duck', u'1 tablespoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'5 big slices fresh ginger', u'4 garlic cloves', u'1/2 bunch green onions', u'1 tangerine,peel cut in big strips', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1/2 cup honey', u'1/2 cup soy sauce']
title: Chinatown Steamed and Roasted Duck

directions: [u'Soak shrimp in salty cold water for 20 minutes and rinse thoroughly. Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. Deep-fry the shrimp at 375 degrees for only 20 seconds, then drain. While the shrimp are deep-frying, coat the wok with oil and saute the scallions, garlic and ginger. Add the fried shrimp then season with salt and pepper. Stir-fry for 20 seconds and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Canola oil to cook and deep fry', u'1 1/2 pounds large U-15 shrimps (15 per pound), deveined, shell on!', u'1 cup scallions cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup sliced garlic', u'1/4 cup ginger, julienne', u'1/2 tablespoon kosher salt or sea salt', u'1/2 tablespoon ground pepper mix (black, green, red and Szechwan)']
title: Salt and Pepper Shrimp (Mom)

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Put the wood ears in a small bowl and cover with boiling water. Let stand for 30 minutes to reconstitute. Drain and rinse the wood ears; discard any hard clusters in the centers.', u'Heat the oil in a wok or large pot over medium-high flame. Add the ginger, chili paste, wood ears, bamboo shoots, and pork; cook and stir for 1 minute to infuse the flavor. Combine the soy sauce, vinegar, salt, pepper, and sugar in a small bowl, pour it into the wok and toss everything together - it should smell really fragrant. Pour in the Chinese Chicken Stock, bring the soup to a boil, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the tofu and cook for 3 minutes.', u'Dissolve the cornstarch in the water and stir until smooth. Mix the slurry into the soup and continue to simmer until the soup thickens. Remove the soup from the heat and stir in 1 direction to get a current going, then stop stirring. Slowly pour in the beaten eggs in a steady stream and watch it spin around and feather in the broth (it should be cooked almost immediately.) Garnish the hot and sour soup with chopped green onions and cilantro before serving.']
ingredients: [u'4 dried Chinese fungi (about 1 ounce), such as wood ears or cloud ears', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated', u'1 tablespoon red chile paste, such as sambal oelek', u'1/2 cup canned bamboo shoots, sliced', u'1/4 pound barbecued pork, shredded', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon ground white pepper', u' Pinch sugar', u'2 quarts Chinese Chicken Stock, recipe follows', u'1 square firm tofu, drained and sliced in 1/4-inch strips', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 1/4 cup water', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u' Chopped green onions and cilantro leaves, for garnish', u'1 (4-pound) whole chicken', u'1 bunch green onions, halved', u'4 garlic cloves, smashed', u'3 -inch piece fresh ginger, whacked open with the flat side of a knife', u'1 onion, halved', u'1 teaspoon whole white peppercorns', u' About 3 quarts cold water']
title: Hot and Sour Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'For the filling: In the bowl of a food processor, add the shrimp, ground pork, sesame oil, soy sauce, cornstarch, ginger, garlic, green onions, egg whites, lemon juice and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pulse the ingredients until smooth, 3 to 5 times. It should be somewhat chunky, not totally pureed. Put the filling into a bowl and fold in the water chestnuts.', u'To determine if the filling is seasoned well, make a small patty, about 2 tablespoons. Place a small saute pan over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon canola oil. Once heated, add the tester patty and cook on both sides until browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the pan and place onto a paper-towel-lined plate and taste. Adjust seasoning to the remaining filling if needed.', u'Prepare the dumplings according to desired assembly. Serve with Sesame-Soy Dipping Sauce.', u'1) Shu mai (steamed):', u'Line each tray of your bamboo steamer with cabbage leaves and cover with the lid. Bring 1 to 2 inches of water to a boil in a large, wide pan. Set the bamboo steamer over the pot. Continue to add water as needed.', u'Place a wonton wrapper on a clean surface and add about 2 teaspoons of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Brush the edges of the wrapper with water. Fold and pleat as you gather the wrapping around the filling, leaving the top of the filling uncovered. Gently tap the shu mai on your work surface, flattening the bottom and allowing it to stand upright and make a basket shape.', u'Put the shu mai in the cabbage-lined steamers and cover with the lid. Steam the dumplings until cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes.', u'2) Gyoza (pan-fried):', u'Place a wonton wrapper on a clean surface and add about 2 teaspoons of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Brush the edges of the wrapper with water. Take one edge of the wonton wrapper and fold it to the other side, creating a half moon shape. Then starting at one end of your half moon, make gentle folds, pleating and pressing the top side of the wrapper onto the bottom side as you work around the half moon.', u'Have about 1/2 cup water, a large skillet and a lid for the skillet handy. Heat the skillet with 1 to 2 tablespoons of canola oil over high heat. Once the skillet is hot, place the number of dumplings you want to cook smooth-side down in the skillet. Allow them to sear until the bottoms turn golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the water, immediately cover with the lid and let the dumplings steam for another 3 to 4 minutes.', u'3) Wontons (steamed):', u'Line each tray of your bamboo steamer with cabbage leaves and cover with the lid. Bring 1 to 2 inches of water to a boil in a large, wide pan. Set the bamboo steamer over the pot. Continue to add water as needed.', u'Place a wonton wrapper on a clean surface and add about 2 teaspoons of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Brush the edges of the wrapper with water. Take one edge of the wonton wrapper and fold it to the other side, creating a half moon shape. Then take the 2 ends of the half moon and fold them into each other, pressing the ends together to secure the shape, creating the wonton.', u'Put the wontons in the cabbage-lined steamers and cover with the lid. Steam the dumplings until cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds large peeled and deveined shrimp', u'1 pound ground pork', u'3 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'3 tablespoons peeled and grated fresh ginger', u'5 cloves garlic, smashed', u'4 green onions, chopped', u'4 egg whites', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' One 4-ounce can water chestnuts, minced', u' One 10-ounce package round wonton wrappers', u' Napa cabbage leaves, for lining the steamer', u' Canola oil', u' Sesame-Soy Dipping Sauce, for serving, recipe follows', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon peeled and grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 green onions, minced']
title: Shrimp and Pork Shu Mai Dumplings

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Whisk the hoisin, soy, mirin, sesame oil, garlic and ginger in a mixing bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Add the sliced chicken and toss to coat evenly. Marinate the chicken, covered, at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes.', u'Once 5 minutes of marinating time remains, heat a large wok or skillet over high heat and add 2 tablespoons of the canola oil to heat. Using a slotted spoon, strain the chicken add to the very hot wok or skillet. Cook, allowing it to brown, stirring occasionally, about 2 minutes. Add the red bell pepper and the onion slices, allowing them to soften, another minute. Next, add the cabbages and carrots and cook, stirring occasionally, until just browning, about 2 minutes. Push the chicken and vegetables to the side of the wok and stir in the mushrooms, bamboo shoots and water chestnuts. Remove from the heat and set aside, keeping warm.', u'Place a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add the remaining 1 tablespoon canola oil. Add the beaten eggs to the skillet, allowing to scramble, 2 to 3 minutes. Once cooked, break up the eggs with a rubber spatula and add to the chicken. Toss to combine.', u'Spread about 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce on each Chinese Crepes with Scallions. Top with some mu shu chicken, sesame seeds and scallions. Add cilantro leaves if desired. Roll up like a crepe and serve with Sriracha if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup hoisin sauce, plus more for serving', u'3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons peeled and minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, sliced', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 red pepper, seeded, membrane removed, julienned', u'1/2 yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'1/2 medium head green cabbage, finely shredded', u'1/2 large head Napa cabbage, finely shredded', u'1/2 medium head purple cabbage, finely shredded', u'1/2 cup julienned carrots', u'1 cup sliced button mushrooms', u'1/4 cup shaved bamboo shoots, drained', u'1/4 cup sliced water chestnuts, drained', u'4 eggs, beaten', u'2 recipes Chinese Crepes with Scallions, recipe follows', u'3 tablespoons toasted black sesame seeds', u'1 small bunch scallions, finely shaved', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for serving, optional', u' Sriracha, for serving, optional', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup rice flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 eggs', u'2 scallions, finely sliced', u' Nonstick cooking spray']
title: Mu Shu Chicken

directions: [u'For the dipping sauce: Combine the soy sauce, Sriracha and lemon juice in a bowl and set aside until ready to serve.', u'For the pork dumplings: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, sesame oil and scallions and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes (you just want to take the bite off of the raw ingredients, not saute them). Remove from the heat and allow to cool 1 minute.', u'Combine the cooked garlic, ginger and scallions with the pork, hoisin, soy sauce, five-spice powder and egg in a large mixing bowl.', u'Working with the dumpling wrappers, start with the floured surface facing down. Place 1 1/2 teaspoons of filling in the center of a wrapper. Wet the edge of the dumpling with water, using your finger, and fold the circle in half without sealing, like a taco. Pinch one end closed. Create pleats on one side using your thumb and forefinger, pressing against the other flat edge to seal as you go. Flatten the bottoms so they can get a nice pan fry on them. Repeat until all the dumplings are filled. Keep the dumplings on a lightly-floured sheet tray to keep them from sticking, and cover with a slightly damp towel to keep from drying out.', u'Heat the veggie oil over high heat in the same skillet. Working in batches, pan-fry the dumplings by placing them bottom-side down and frying until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Once the dumplings are golden brown, working carefully (it will splatter), pour 1/2 cup water into the skillet to cover the dumplings halfway. Immediately cover with a lid, leaving a small crack for steam to escape. Cook until the water has evaporated, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer the dumplings to a paper towel-lined plate to soak up excess oil and repeat the process with the remaining dumplings.', u"Cook's Note: This recipe makes a lot of dumplings; just keep extra in your freezer for a late night snack!"]
ingredients: [u'1 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 1/2 tablespoons Sriracha sauce', u' Juice of 3 lemons', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 small bunch scallions, white and green parts, chopped', u'12 ounces ground pork', u'3 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'1 egg', u'1 package round dumpling wrappers', u'1 tablespoon vegetable or peanut oil, for frying']
title: Pork Dumplings

author: Brian Boitano
directions: [u'For the shrimp: Heat the oil until it reaches 360 degrees F in wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.', u'Dredge the raw shrimp in the cornstarch.  Fry in batches, so as not to overcrowd the pan, until their exteriors crisp up, about 4 to 5 minutes. With a slotted spoon, remove the shrimp from the oil and put them onto a paper towel-lined plate to drain.', u'For the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, vegetable broth and cornstarch.  Set the bowl aside.', u'Heat the canola oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.  Add the onions, garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds.  Add the bell pepper and cook for another 30 seconds.  Pour in the prepared sauce and cook until the sauce thickens. Stir in the broccoli and water chestnuts and cook for 1 minute, then add the shrimp and fry for 1 minute more.  Transfer the shrimp with garlic sauce to a serving bowl and serve hot with cooked rice.']
