ingredients: [u'2 cups canola oil', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 cup cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 cup vegetable broth', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1/2 medium onion, sliced', u'3 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon chopped ginger', u'1/2 red bell pepper, chopped', u'2 cups broccoli florets, blanched', u'1 (8-ounce) can water chestnuts, drained', u'4 cups cooked white rice, for serving']
title: Shrimp with Garlic Sauce

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u"Cook the noodles in large pot of boiling unsalted water over medium heat until barely tender and still firm. Drain immediately and rinse with cold water until cold. Drain the noodles really well and transfer to a wide bowl; toss with the sesame oil so they don't stick together. Chill.", u'In a blender combine the peanut oil, ginger, garlic, chili paste, lime juice, brown sugar, peanut butter, vinegar, soy sauce, and hot water. Blend. Toss the noodles with the peanut sauce until well coated. Serve at room temperature or chilled; garnish with the sesame seeds, green onions, and cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces angel hair pasta', u'3 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, minced', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 teaspoon red chili paste, such as sambal', u'1 lime, juiced', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1/2 cup creamy peanut butter', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'6 tablespoons hot water', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds', u'2 green onions, thinly sliced on the diagonal', u' Fresh chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Cold Sesame Noodles

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the marinade: Whisk 2 tablespoons cornstarch, the rice wine, oyster sauce and 2 tablespoons water in a large bowl. Cut the tofu in half horizontally to make 2 large rectangles, then cut each rectangle into 4 squares. Add to the marinade and turn to coat.', u'Cook the peanuts in the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring, until lightly golden, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat and transfer the nuts to a bowl with a slotted spoon.', u'Drain the tofu, reserving the marinade; sprinkle both sides with the remaining 4 tablespoons cornstarch. Return the skillet to medium-high heat; add the tofu and cook until golden, 4 minutes per side. Remove to a plate. Add the ginger, garlic, chiles and 1 teaspoon salt to the skillet; stir-fry 30 seconds. Add the mushrooms and snap peas; stir-fry until crisp-tender. Whisk the marinade with 1 1/2 cups water, add to the skillet and stir until thick, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the tofu and nuts and heat through. If using dried chiles, remove before serving.', u'Per serving: Calories 556; Fat 38 g (Saturated 6 g); Cholesterol 0 mg; Sodium 664 mg; Carbohydrate 34 g; Fiber 8 g; Protein 25 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons cornstarch', u'3 tablespoons Chinese rice wine or dry sherry', u'1/3 cup oyster sauce', u'1 14 -ounce block firm tofu, drained', u'1 cup unsalted peanuts (preferably raw)', u'1/4 cup peanut oil or vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'8 whole dried arbol chiles (or 2 jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise)', u' Kosher salt', u'12 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, caps quartered', u'1 pound sugar snap peas, strings removed, halved crosswise']
title: Tofu and Peanut Stir-Fry

directions: [u'Make the Chile Sauce: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, mix well, and season with salt, to taste. Set aside', u'Make the Chicken and Rice: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (enough water to immerse the chicken). Stuff the cavity of the chicken with the scallion and ginger. Add the chicken to the boiling water, breast side-down. Lower the heat to a simmer just under boiling point and cook, covered, until just cooked through, about 40 minutes. ', u'Transfer the chicken to an ice water bath for about 5 to 6 minutes. (This is to arrest the cooking and will make the chicken skin crisp.) Drain. De-bone the chicken and cut into bite-sized pieces. Reserve the chicken stock, and keep hot. ', u'Heat the oil in a wok or saucepan over high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry until fragrant. Add the rice and stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes. Add enough of the hot reserved chicken soup to reach 1/2- inch above the top of the rice. Bring to the boil, add the salt, and lower the heat to low. When steam holes form in the rice, cover the wok, and steam until cooked, about 30 minutes.', u'Whisk 1/4 cup of the hot chicken stock into the chile sauce. ', u'Arrange the rice and poached chicken on a platter and drizzle with the chile sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 to 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh red chiles', u'5 cloves garlic, chopped', u' Salt', u'1 (2-pound) chicken', u'1 scallion, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'4 slices fresh, peeled ginger', u'6 tablespoon vegetable oil or olive oil', u'6 to 8 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'4 cups long-grain uncooked rice', u'1 teaspoon fine salt']
title: Hainanese Chicken Rice

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add eggs and cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until cooked through and scrambled. Remove eggs from pan and set aside.', u'To the same skillet over medium heat, add remaining 2 teaspoons oil. Add scallions, carrots and garlic and saute 2 minutes. Add rice and pork; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add black bean sauce and stir to coat rice. If the black bean sauce is overly thick, add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 5 minutes, until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and season, to taste, with salt and black pepper. Stir in cooked egg just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'4 teaspoons peanut oil, divided', u'2 large eggs', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions', u'1/2 cup carrots, diced or pre-shredded', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 cups leftover white rice', u'1/4 cup black bean sauce', u'1/4 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth, optional', u'1 cup diced cooked pork', u' Salt and ground black pepper']
title: Pork Fried Rice

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl, whisk together the egg white, 2 tablespoons of the cornstarch, 2 tablespoons of the wine, and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for up to 2 hours. ', u'To make the sauce, in another bowl, whisk remaining 1 tablespoon cornstarch with 1 tablespoon of the chicken stock until smooth. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons chicken stock, 1 tablespoon wine, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, the vinegar, and sugar and whisk to combine. Set aside until ready to finish the dish.', u'In a large wok or pot, heat enough oil to come 3 inches up the sides to 350 degrees F.', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade and carefully slide into the hot oil. Fry, turning, until golden brown and cooked through, about 2 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels. ', u'Discard all but about 1 tablespoon of the oil from the wok. (Alternatively, in a clean wok or saute pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat.) Add the chile peppers and stir-fry until nearly black. Add the garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes and 1/2 cup green onions. Stir-fry until fragrant, about 15 seconds. Add the chicken stock sauce, bring to a boil, and cook, stirring, until the sauce thickens, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat.', u'Arrange the chicken on a platter and pour the sauce over it. Garnish with the cashews and additional green onions. Serve with hot rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 large egg white', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch', u'3 tablespoons Chinese cooking wine, or dry sherry', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1/4 cup chicken stock', u'2 teaspoons white vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'12 dry red chile peppers', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/2 cup sliced green onions', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped lightly toasted cashews', u' Green onions, sliced on the bias, garnish', u' Hot steamed white rice, accompaniment']
title: General Tso's Chicken

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Fill a pot large enough to hold the lobster tails with water. Add the salt, pepper, celery, onion and thyme, and bring to a boil. Add the lobster tails. When the pot returns to a boil, remove the tails and set them aside. They will not be fully cooked but will finish cooking in the sauce.', u'Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook until soft. Add the wine and cook until it is reduced by half. Add the garlic, ginger, curry powder and red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute. Add the clam juice and cook until it is reduced by half, 5 to 6 minutes. Add the coconut milk, cream and soy sauce, and then bring to a simmer. Add the lobster tails to the pan. Reduce the heat to low, cover and cook for 5 to 6 minutes. Remove the lobster; set aside and keep warm. Turn the heat to medium-low and cook until the liquid is thickened and reduced by half, 6 to 8 minutes. Taste, and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper.', u'To serve, put a pile of jasmine rice onto a plate. Nestle a lobster tail next to the rice. Pour over some sauce and garnish with the Crispy Fried Spinach.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 stalks celery', u'1 large onion, peeled and cut in half', u'1/2 bunch fresh thyme', u'4 frozen lobster tails', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 shallots, finely chopped', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped ginger', u'1 teaspoon curry powder', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u' One 8-ounce bottle clam juice', u'1/2 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u' Steamed jasmine rice, to serve', u' Crispy Fried Spinach, for garnish, recipe follows', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' One 6-ounce bag fresh baby spinach', u' Kosher salt']
title: Sandra's Shanghai Lobster

directions: [u'In a food processor, puree fish with egg yolks until smooth. Add pepper, salt, sesame oil, fish sauce, and chilies; pulse processor a few times.  Transfer mousse to a large, chilled bowl and fold in the scallions. Using a mixer, lift the egg whites to a stiff peak. Gently fold in the egg whites with the mousse. Cook a very small portion either in boiling water or in a microwave oven to verify seasonings. Using wet hands, make small balls (1-inch in diameter). Quickly blanch in salted boiling water for only 2 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds flank steak, sliced thinly against the grain', u'2 pounds chicken breast, thinly sliced', u"1 pound large shrimp, U-15's peeled and de-veined (15 shrimp per pound)", u'20 fish balls', u'2 pounds bay scallops', u'3 packages soaked mung bean noodles', u'4 Shanghai cabbage, whole leaves', u'4 baby bok choy, whole leaves', u'1 napa cabbage large chopped', u'2 quarts chicken stock', u'1 pound shiitake mushrooms, de-stemmed', u' Boiling water', u'2 pounds Chilean sea bass or other fatty white fish', u'4 eggs, separated', u'1 teaspoon white pepper', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'3 minced Thai bird chilies', u'1/3 cup sliced scallions', u' Samba Oelek', u' Peanut butter', u' Chinese sesame paste', u' Sesame oil', u' Oyster sauce', u' Rice wine vinegar', u' Shaoxing wine', u' Thin soy sauce', u'2 cups chopped scallions', u'2 cups chopped cilantro', u' Eggs (optional)']
title: Chinese Fire Pot Fish Balls

directions: [u'Cut a stencil out of a plastic coffee can lid in the shape of a 3-inch disk. Whip the egg whites until stiff and chill. In a mixer, cream the butter, then add the sugar and continue mixing. Add the flour and blend in, then add the vanilla and blend again. Add the chilled egg whites and mix on low until well incorporated and the batter is smooth. With a small offset spatula, spread batter through the stencil so it is a circle onto a silpat or parchment paper, about 6 per cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350-degree oven until light golden brown, 7 to 8 minutes. Quickly remove the pan from the oven and one at time place a fortune across the center with a bit hanging out. Fold cookie circle in thirds over fortune with flaps only slightly overlapping each other. Turn over and bring opposing sides together and pinch. Let cool.']
ingredients: [u'2 egg whites, room temperature', u'6 tablespoons butter', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup flour, sifted', u'1/4 teaspoons vanilla extract']
title: Fortune Cookies

directions: [u'Mix rice wine and soy sauce in a large bowl and add cornstarch gradually while whisking constantly. Slice beef into thin pieces and place into bowl with marinade stirring to coat. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes.', u"Prepare garnish by heating 1 tablespoon of the oil in a saute pan, reserving the other 4 tablespoons. Add the Sichuan peppercorn and dry chili and cook until the chili turns dark red. (Do not allow it to turn black.) Remove the cooked peppercorn and chili to a cutting board and use the side a large chef's knife blade to smash it. Then chop it into pieces and transfer to a small dish. Keep the saute pan handy for the final touches. ", u'Prepare vegetables by washing and cutting celery, leeks, and lettuce into 3-inch lengths. Heat the 2 tablespoons of corn oil in a wok, add scallions and stir once. Add the celery, leeks, and lettuce and stir-fry for 20 seconds over high heat. Remove and place in a large shallow serving bowl.', u'To cook beef, heat the 1/4 cup corn oil in the wok and add ginger, scallion, and chili sauce. Cook until the oil turns red from the chili. Add wine, soy sauce and stock. When the mixture begins to boil, add marinated beef and gently stir to cook. As soon as beef is completely cooked, remove from wok and place beef over vegetables in serving bowl and pour sauce from wok over it.', u'Heat the remaining 1/4 cup of oil for the garnish in the saute pan, and when it begins to smoke slightly, pour the oil over the Sichuan peppercorns and chili in the small dish.', u'Serve everything immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons rice wine', u'1 tablespoon light soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1 pound beef loin strip steak (or fish fillets, or chicken breasts, or pork loin)', u'5 tablespoons corn oil, divided', u'2 tablespoons Sichuan peppercorns (available in Chinese markets)', u'1/2 cup dry small red chili', u'1/4 pound Chinese celery (or celery)', u'1/4 pound Chinese leeks (or leeks or scallions)', u'1/4 pound stem lettuce, romaine lettuce heart (or napa cabbage)', u'2 tablespoons corn oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped scallion', u'1/4 cup corn oil', u'1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced', u'2 tablespoons chopped scallion', u'1/4 cup hot chili sauce, Chinese (or Chinese hot bean paste)', u'3 tablespoons rice wine', u'3 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'2 cups chicken or beef stock']
title: Sichuan "Water Boiled" Beef

directions: [u'For the chicken marinade: In a mixing bowl, combine the chicken with the sesame oil, sugar, soy sauce and pepper. Toss to coat, cover, place in the refrigerator and let sit 1 hour.', u'For the stir-fry: Remove the chicken from the fridge. Add 1 cup cornstarch to a shallow baking dish and dredge each piece of chicken, shaking off any excess.', u'Fill a Dutch oven or high-sided saute pan with enough oil to completely submerge the chicken pieces. Heat over high heat until glossy and the temperature reaches 375 degrees F.  Deep fry the chicken until golden brown, about 3 minutes, adding your chicken in batches to avoid overcrowding and to keep your oil from dropping in temp too much. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate.', u'In a large saute pan, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger and cook until golden brown and fragrant, about 30 seconds. Next, add the rice wine, hoisin, oyster sauce, soy sauce, honey and the chili sauces; bring to a simmer.', u'In a glass measuring cup, mix the remaining 2 tablespoons cornstarch with 1/4 cup very cold water (make sure you water is cold to avoid lumps!), whisking until combined. Add the mixture to the sauce and simmer for an additional minute, until the sauce thickens. Adjust seasoning to taste.', u'Add in the fried chicken and toss to coat with the sauce. Add the lemon zest and juice. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and scallions.', u'Serve warm over rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'6 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon cracked black pepper', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons cornstarch', u' Vegetable or peanut oil', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'4 tablespoons Chinese Shoaxing rice wine', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon sambal chili sauce', u'1 tablespoon Thai chili sauce', u'1 lemon, zest and juice', u' Toasted sesame seeds, for garnish', u' Scallions, thinly sliced on an angle, for garnish', u' Rice, for serving']
title: Sesame Ginger Chicken

directions: [u'Combine soy sauce, sherry and hoisin sauce in a bowl. Add the pork, toss to coat evenly, cover, refrigerate and marinate for 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, soak the mushrooms in enough hot water to cover for 20 minutes. Drain and thinly slice. Set aside on a plate, along with the cabbage, carrot and scallions.', u'Heat a wok or large skillet over medium/high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil and swirl to coat. Pour in the eggs, swirling and tilting the wok to form a thin film. Cook just until the eggs are set and feel dry on top, about 1 minute. Transfer to a platter, let cool slightly and cut into 1 inch strips.', u'Return the wok to high heat, and swirl in the remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Add the garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry to release the aromas, about 1 minute. Add the pork and stirfry until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add the reserved mushrooms, cabbage, carrot, bean sprouts, and scallions, along with the chicken stock, and stir-fry another 2 minutes. Stir in soy sauce, sherry, sesame oil, and sugar, and cook, stirring until sauce boils, about 1 minute. Add egg strips and mix well. To serve, spread a small amount of hoisin sauce on a warm Mandarin Pancake. Spoon about 1/2 cup mu shu mixture in center of pancake, wrap like a burrito, folding the ends to close, and serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon dry sherry', u'1 teaspoon hoisin sauce', u'1/2 pound boneless lean pork, shredded', u'4 dried black mushrooms', u'2 cups finely shredded Napa cabbage', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'3 scallions, white and light green parts, slivered', u'1 cup bean sprouts', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten with 1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 teaspoons freshly grated ginger', u'3 tablespoons chicken stock', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon dry sherry', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Hoisin sauce', u'2 cups sifted flour', u'3/4 cup boiling water', u'1 to 2 tablespoons sesame oil']
title: Mu Shu Pork

directions: [u'In a metal pie plate or heatproof flat dish set on a round metal rack in a wok or in a steamer steam the sausage, covered, over boiling water for 20 minutes, transfer it with tongs to a cutting board, and cut it diagonally into 1/8-inch-thick slices. Mound the sausage in a large shallow serving dish and keep it warm, covered, in a preheated 250 degree oven. ', u'In a heated wok heat the oil with the ginger and salt over high heat until the oil just begins to smoke, add the broccoli, and stir-fry the mixture for 2 minutes. Drizzle the wine around the edge of the wok, stir-fry the mixture for 1 minute, or until the broccoli is bright green and crisp-tender, and transfer it to the dish, arranging it around the sausage.']
ingredients: [u'6 links of  Chinese sausage', u'2 tablespoons  peanut oil', u'1 (1/4-inch) slice of fresh ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 bunch broccoli, cut into 1 1/2-inch florets and the stems reserved for another use', u'1 tablespoon dry white wine']
servings: 6 servings as part of a Chines
title: Broccoli with Chinese Sausage

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Bring soup stock, grated ginger and soy sauce to a boil. In a small cup, make a slurry by combining the cornstarch and 2 tablespoons of chicken stock. Stir until dissolved. Slowly pour in the cornstarch mixture while stirring the stock, until thickened. Reduce heat to a simmer. Pour in the eggs slowly while stirring the soup in the same direction. The egg will spread and feather. Turn off the heat and add the green onions. Season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately']
ingredients: [u'4 cups prepared chicken stock, plus 2 tablespoons', u'1/2 teaspoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon  soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon  cornstarch', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'2 green onions, chopped, including ends', u' Salt and  white pepper, to taste']
title: Asian Egg Drop Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'To make the sauce, in a bowl, combine 1/4 cup of stock, the ketchup, sugar, juice, vinegar, soy, and 1/2 teaspoon of the pepper flakes. Set aside.', u'In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch with the remaining 2 tablespoons of stock and stir to dissolve. Set aside.', u'In a bowl, toss the shrimp with the ginger, garlic, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper flakes. Set aside for 10 to 20 minutes. ', u'Heat a large wok over high heat. Add the oil, swirling to coat the sides and bottom of the pan. Add the shrimp, garlic, and ginger and stir-fry until pink, about 2 minutes. Remove from the pan. Add the onions and peppers and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add the sauce and cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves. Add the cornstarch mixture and bring to a boil. Return the shrimp to the pan and add the pineapples, cherries, and green onions. Cook until the sauce is thick, about 1 minute.', u'Remove from the heat and serve over rice.']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons chicken stock or water', u'3 tablespoons ketchup', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons pineapple or orange juice', u'2 tablespoons vinegar', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'3/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1 pound shrimp', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons peanut or vegetable oil', u'1 cup thinly sliced onions', u'1 cup 1-inch chunks green bell peppers', u'1 cup pineapple chunks', u'12 maraschino cherries', u'6 tablespoons thinly sliced green onions', u' Hot white rice, accompaniment']
title: Sweet and Sour Shrimp

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Trim fat from the steak and cut into 1-inch cubes. Combine the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice wine/sherry, egg white and salt in a glass bowl. Add the beef and stir to coat. Marinate for 1 hour, covered in the refrigerator. ', u'Place peanut/corn oil in a wok, swirling to coat the sides, and place over high heat. Add the chilies and cook until they begin to darken. Add the garlic, ginger and Szechwan pepper; continue to cook to infuse the oil. Add the scallions and bell pepper. Remove the steak from the marinade and add it to the wok. Stir-fry the beef for 3 minutes until brown. Blend in soy sauce, rice wine, Chinese vinegar, sugar and chicken broth. Dissolve the cornstarch slurry and add it to the sauce, stirring, to thicken. Sprinkle in the peanuts and stir to coat. Serve over rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds boneless beef sirloin', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon rice wine or sherry', u'1 egg white, lightly beaten', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons peanut or corn oil', u'4 dried red chiles, split', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1/2 tablespoon grated ginger', u'1 teaspoon Szechwan pepper, toasted and crushed', u'2 scallions, cut in 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 red bell pepper, cut in pieces', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons rice wine or sherry', u'2 tablespoons Chinese black vinegar or balsamic', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 cup chicken broth', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water', u'1/3 cup roasted peanuts']
title: Kung Pao Beef

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Game Plan: Make the sauce while the noodles cook.', u'Bring a large pot of cold water to a boil over high heat. When the pasta water boils, salt it generously, add the spaghetti or noodles, and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Put the spaghetti in a large bowl and toss with the sesame oil.', u'To make the Peanut Sauce: In a blender drop in the garlic and ginger while the motor is running. When the chopping is complete, stop the machine and add the peanut butter, soy sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, and red pepper. Process until smooth, then--with the blender running--slowly pour in the water.', u'To serve, toss the spaghetti with the Peanut Sauce, then top with the cucumber, chicken, scallions, and peanuts.', u"Cook's Note: Toasted sesame oil delivers richness and intensity to our sesame sauce with just a drizzle. Maintain its punch by storing it in your refrigerator."]
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound spaghetti or Chinese egg noodles', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 garlic clove, peeled', u'1 (1-inch) piece peeled fresh ginger', u'1/2 cup smooth peanut butter', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'3/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 cup hot water', u'1 Kirby cucumber, halved and sliced', u'1 cup shredded cooked chicken', u'6 scallions (white and green parts), sliced', u'1/4 cup dry-roasted peanuts, chopped']
title: Sesame Noodles with Chicken

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'For the chicken: Mix together the hoisin, honey, soy, five-spice powder, crushed red pepper and sesame oil in a bowl. Pour half of marinade over the chicken in a plastic bag and marinate for 3 to 4 hours in the refrigerator, turning once halfway through. Reserve the remaining marinade.', u'For the pickled cabbage: Bring 1/2 cup water, the vinegar, sugar and salt to a boil until the sugar and salt are dissolved. Remove from the heat and add the carrots, crushed red pepper and cabbage. Stir to combine and let sit for at least 30 minutes. Pour into a bowl and let cool completely.', u'For the mustard: Whisk together the mustard powder, water, honey, oils and salt in a bowl until smooth.', u'For cooking and assembly: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium heat. Coat the grill with vegetable oil. Grill the chicken thighs until no longer pink in the middle and the internal temperature is 165 degrees F, 8 to 10 minutes per side. Let rest for 5 minutes, and then chop, toss with the marinade and coat in the sesame seeds.', u'Butter and grill the buns on both sides until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Place ample quantities of glistening chicken on the bottom buns, then a drained handful of pickled cabbage and carrots, and top with hot mustard.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/2 cup shredded carrots', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1/2 small head Chinese or napa cabbage, washed and thinly sliced (about 4 cups)', u'1/4 cup dried mustard powder', u'1/4 cup boiling water', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing grill', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', u' Unsalted butter, for rolls', u"12 to 16 slider rolls, preferably King's Hawaiian"]
title: Sweet and Sour BBQ Chicken Sliders with Pickled Chinese Cabbage and Carrots

directions: [u'In a wok, add 2 tablespoons of oil and quickly soft-scramble the eggs.  Remove the eggs. In the same wok, coat with oil and stir-fry garlic and ginger. Add white scallions and lapchang. Add rice and mix thoroughly.  Add soy sauce, white pepper and scrambled eggs. Check for seasoning.  Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Canola oil', u'3 eggs', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u'1 bunch chopped scallions, green and white separated', u'1 lapchang, diced (Chinese sausage), can substitute with 4 strips of cooked bacon', u'8 cups cooked, day-old long grain rice', u'3 tablespoons thin soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon white pepper', u' Salt to taste']
title: Traditional Mandarin Fried Rice

directions: [u'Combine all the ingredients, except sesame/vegetable oil, for the marinade in a bath solution and place cleaned duck in it overnight.', u'Hang dry and rest for at least 2 hours. Hang duck in smoking oven with hook on the upper neck.', u'Place the camphor wood, brown sugar, tea twigs, if available, on a pan at the base of the oven and heat oven to 350 degrees F. Some recipes call for tea leaves but tea leaves in the sugar/camphor mixture does not add that much tea flavor to the ducks. Roast the duck for approximately 40 minutes, but depends on size of duck, type of oven, etc. For best results for a crispy skin, the last 5 to 10 minutes should be at 400 degrees F, with a final basting of sesame/vegetable oil on the skin of the duck. Duck can be flashed in hot oil to finish, if timing for service is critical.', u'Cut and serve hot, with buns and sauce, optional.']
ingredients: [u'1 whole cleaned duck (preferably Peking where the breasts are larger)', u'1 large piece ginger root, crushed', u'1 bunch spring onions', u'1 tablespoon ground cloves', u'1 (6-inch) piece cassia cinnamon, preferably Chinese', u'1 Sichuan red peppercorns', u'1/2 cup maltose sugar or honey', u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'1 cup fine Chinese black tea (Darjeeling, Ceylon are fine substitutes)', u'1 tablespoon saltpeter (optional but in original recipes)', u' Water, enough to just cover duck in bath', u' Sesame /vegetable oil, for basting', u'1 pound of camphor wood (chips are fine) Other types of wood such almond can be used)', u'1 cup brown sugar', u'1 bag dried tea twigs, optional']
title: Tea Smoked Duck

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'To make the sauce, in a medium saucepan, combine the chicken broth and soy sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and water and stir until dissolved. Slowly add to the hot broth, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens. Add the oil and cayenne and remove from the heat. Cover to keep warm.', u'In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the oil. Stir well to combine.', u'In a wok or large skillet, heat 6 tablespoons of the oil over medium-high heat. Add the meat/vegetable/egg mixture and stir-fry for 4 minutes, so that the eggs set and it lightly browns. Remove from the heat and serve immediately with the warm sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 cup chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u' Pinch cayenne', u'1 cup shredded cooked chicken or pork', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup finely sliced celery', u'1/2 cup finely sliced yellow onions', u'1/2 cup finely sliced mushrooms', u'1/2 cup finely chopped green onions', u'1 teaspoon Essence, recipe follows', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Pinch cayenne', u'6 large eggs, beaten', u'6 tablespoons vegetable oil, for frying', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Egg Fu Yung

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine 1 tablespoon of the oyster sauce, the soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of the wine, sugar, pepper flakes and 1 teaspoon of the cornstarch, whisking to dissolve the cornstarch. Add the pork and toss to coat. Marinate for 15 to 30 minutes.', u'In another bowl, make the sauce by combining the remaining tablespoon oyster sauce, 1 teaspoon wine, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and the chicken broth, whisking to dissolve the cornstarch. Set aside.', u'Place a large wok over high heat until hot. Add the oil, swirling to coat the sides and bottom. Add the garlic and cook for 10 seconds. Add the pork and stir-fry until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add the onions and peppers and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the celery and the mushrooms and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the bean sprouts and water chestnuts, stir to mix well and cook until crisp-tender. Make a well in the center and add the sauce and chili paste. Cook, stirring, until the sauce boils and thickens and the pork is cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Remove from the heat and serve over noodles or white rice. Garnish with green onions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons Chinese cooking wine or dry sherry', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into thin strips', u'1/2 cup chicken stock or water', u'4 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 cup thinly sliced yellow onions', u'3/4 cup thinly sliced red bell peppers', u'3/4 cup thinly sliced celery', u'6 ounces fresh shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, wiped clean and thinly sliced', u'4 ounces mung bean sprouts, well rinsed and patted dry', u'1 (5-ounce) can water chestnuts, well drained and thinly sliced', u'1/2 teaspoon Chinese hot chili paste', u' Cooked egg noodles or white rice, accompaniment', u' Green onions, finely sliced, garnish']
title: Chop Suey

directions: [u'Heat a small, dry saucepan.  When  the saucepan is hot, add the  Szechuan peppercorns and, shaking  the pan constantly, toast until the  peppercorns are fragrant.  Remove  from the heat.  Place the  peppercorns in a spice grinder and  grind.  Season the chicken pieces  with the  peppercorns and salt and set aside. Heat a large wok over high heat.   When the wok is hot, add the oil.   Add the ginger, garlic and onions  and stir fry for 1 minute.  Add the  chicken, broccoli, peppers,  shiitake mushrooms, soy sauce,  sherry and chile paste.  Stir fry  until the chicken is cooked through  and the vegetables are cooked, but  al dente, about 5 minutes.  Add the  scallions and stir fry for 1 more  minute.  T']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon Szechuan peppercorns', u' Salt', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken, pounded thin and cut into 1-inch thick strips', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoons ginger, minced', u'1 tablespoon garlic, minced', u'1 cup onions, julienned', u'1 cup broccoli florets', u'1/4 cup green peppers, julienned', u'1/4 cup red peppers, julienned', u'1/4 cup yellow peppers, julienned', u'1 cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced', u'2 tablespoons thin soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon chile paste', u'1/4 cup scallions, cut thinly on the bias']
title: Spicy Szechuan Stir-Fry

directions: [u'In a pot bring the stock to a boil. Then remove the pot from the flame and add beaten egg whites steadily, beating them into the soup as you pour. Add the sliced scallions, stir in. Remove to a heated tureen and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups  chicken stock', u'3 large egg whites, beaten', u'3 scallion greens, trimmed, finely sliced']
title: Egg Drop Soup

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'In a small bowl combine the miso powder with 1 tablespoon of hot water to form a paste. Warm the honey in a microwavable bowl for approximately 1 minute or until hot (be careful, as it can burn quickly). Add the honey to the miso mixture. Put the fish into a resealable plastic bag and add the honey mixture. Seal the bag and refrigerate for up to 4 hours. ', u'Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil over medium heat. Add the Chinese long beans and blanch until tender, but not overcooked. Shock the beans in iced water, to stop the cooking and maintain their color. Drain and dry the long beans and either chop into 4 to 6-inch segments or form circles by wrapping the beans around themselves.', u'In a large skillet add the grapeseed oil and heat until smoking hot. Remove the fish from the marinade and sear in hot skillet until the flesh has an opaque color, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the fish from the pan to a large plate and reserve. ', u'For the sauce, using the same skillet, over medium heat, add the onion and saute until translucent, then add the chicken stock, ginger and lemongrass and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and strain the liquid, discarding the solids.', u'Return the liquid to a clean skillet, over medium heat. Add the raisins and reduce the liquid by half its volume. Stir in the butter cubes and whisk until the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and allow to rest until needed.', u'Heat a little grapeseed oil in a medium skillet, over medium heat, and add the long bean circles or strips and saute until golden brown.', u'To serve, arrange 2 long bean circles in the middle of each plate. Top the beans with a fish fillet and drizzle with the sauce. Garnish with cilantro and lemon.', u"Cook's Note: to make this dish extra special, you could make a horseradish relish to go on top."]
ingredients: [u'4 teaspoons dry miso powder', u'1 tablespoon hot water', u'1/4 cup lavender honey', u'6 (6-ounce) sea bass fillets, skinless and deboned', u' About 1/2 pound Chinese long beans', u'4 tablespoons grapeseed oil, plus more as needed', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped onion', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh ginger', u'1 stick lemongrass', u'1/4 cup golden raisins', u'1 stick cold unsalted butter, cubed', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Chopped fresh cilantro leaves and lemon wedges, for garnish']
title: Miso and Honey Glazed Sea Bass with Chinese Long Bean Salad

directions: [u'For the sauce: Add the vegetable stock, cornstarch, hoisin sauce, ketchup, soy sauce, vinegar and chili sauce to a medium bowl and stir to combine.', u'For the chicken: Place the chicken in a bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the potato flour or cornstarch and mix well to coat the chicken pieces.', u'Heat a wok over high heat until it starts to smoke and then add the peanut oil. Add the Sichuan peppercorns and dried chiles and fry for a few seconds, then add the chicken pieces and stir-fry for 2 minutes. As the chicken begins to turn opaque, add the rice wine or dry sherry. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, then pour in the sauce.', u'Bring the mixture to a boil, add the red pepper and cook until the meat is cooked through and the sauce has thickened and become slightly sticky in consistency, another 2 minutes. Add the scallions and cook for 1 minute. Toss in the cashews, then transfer to a serving plate and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'7 tablespoons cold vegetable stock', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon ketchup', u'1 tablespoon light soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Chinkiang black rice vinegar or balsamic vinegar', u'1 teaspoon chili sauce', u'2 skinless chicken breasts or 4 thighs, cut into 1/2-inch slices', u' Salt and ground white pepper', u'1 tablespoon potato flour or cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'2 tablespoons Sichuan peppercorns', u'4 dried red chiles', u'1 tablespoon Shaohsing rice wine or dry sherry', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into chunks', u'2 scallions, chopped into 1-inch lengths', u' Handful of dry-roasted cashews']
title: Kung Po Chicken

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. ', u'Divide ramen noodles evenly in center of each of the 4 pieces of aluminum foil. Stack the following ingredients on top of noodles, in this order: mushrooms, shrimp, onions, scallions, red pepper flakes, and salt. Pull sides and corners of pouch up to form a small basket shape leaving an opening at the top to pour in liquid. ', u'In small bowl, combine vegetable broth, mirin, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Distribute liquid evenly among packs. Press foil together, leaving a small opening to allow steam to escape. Place on cookie sheet and bake in oven for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 packages Ramen noodles', u'1/2 cup dried mushrooms, chopped', u'20 large raw shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 cup finely chopped onion', u'1/2 cup sliced scallions', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 quart vegetable broth', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'4 teaspoons sesame oil', u' Special equipment: 4 (18-inch) squares aluminum foil']
title: Ramen Shrimp Pouch

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Toss the chicken in a bowl with the egg white and  1/2 teaspoon salt. Let sit covered for 10 minutes. Mix 2 teaspoons vegetable oil into the ground rice cereal, rubbing it in with your fingers. Dredge the chicken strips in the cereal. Place the coated strips in one layer on a rack set in a baking sheet and coat lightly with the nonstick cooking spray. Bake until the chicken has an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 20 minutes. Let rest for 5 minutes, then cut into large bite-size pieces.', u'Heat the remaining teaspoon of oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic, ginger and dried chiles. Stir for a couple of minutes, then add the chicken broth, soy sauce, agave and vinegar. Mix the corn starch with 3 tablespoons water, and whisk into the sauce. Simmer gently for 8 to 10 minutes. The sauce should be thick, but pourable. Keep warm.', u'Put the broccoli florets in a microwave-safe bowl with 2 tablespoons water. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and microwave until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.', u'Divide the chicken and broccoli evenly among four plates and drizzle the sauce over the top. Serve the rice on the side. Garnish with the sliced scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1- by 4-inch strips', u'1 egg white, lightly beaten', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 ounces crispy rice cereal, such as Rice Chex, finely ground (rounded 1/2 cup)', u' Nonstick cooking spray', u'2 cloves garlic, cracked', u'2 ginger coins, cracked', u'2 dried red chiles, broken in half', u'3/4 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'2 1/2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons agave syrup', u'2 teaspoons distilled white vinegar', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'4 cups broccoli florets (about 10 ounces)', u'4 cups cooked brown rice, for serving', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced']
title: General Tso's Chicken

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 teaspoons sesame oil and the honey in a bowl. Toss in the chicken and marinate 20 minutes.', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade using a slotted spoon. Heat 2 teaspoons canola oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken in 2 batches, turning once or twice, until browned, 3 to 5 minutes (add 2 more teaspoons canola oil between batches). Transfer the chicken to a plate and wipe out the skillet.', u'Heat the remaining 2 teaspoons canola oil in the skillet. Add the scallions, reserving some of the green parts for topping. Add the ginger and garlic and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Whisk the broth, sugar, cornstarch, vinegar, chili paste and the remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce in a bowl; add to the skillet and cook, stirring, until thickened, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the remaining 2 teaspoons sesame oil.', u'Meanwhile, cook the snow peas in a steamer basket set over a few inches of boiling water until crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Return the chicken to the skillet with the sauce and heat through. Serve the chicken and snow peas over brown rice, if desired. Top with the sesame seeds and reserved scallion greens.', u'Per serving: Calories 390; Fat 17 g (Saturated 3 g); Cholesterol 90 mg; Sodium 700 mg; Carbohydrate 23 g; Fiber 3 g; Protein 35 g']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'4 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons honey', u'1 1/4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 3/4-inch chunks', u'6 teaspoons canola oil', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon grated peeled ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 1/4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'3 to 4 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon chili paste', u'4 cups snow peas, trimmed', u' Cooked brown rice, for serving (optional)', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds']
title: Sesame Chicken With Snow Peas

directions: [u'Cut the pork butt in half, then slice each half into 3/4-inch thick strips. (You should have about 12 strips). Place the pork in a nonreactive bowl. Combine the marinade ingredients in a small bowl and pour over the pork strips. Turn the meat to evenly coat, then cover, refrigerate, and marinate at least 3 hours or up to overnight, turning the meat occasionally. ', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Arrange a rack in a large roasting pan, and fill the pan with 1/4 inch of water. Remove the pork from the marinade and arrange on the rack. Roast for 45 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the honey and boiling water in a small bowl. After 45 minutes, brush the pork strips with the glaze, increase the oven to 425 degrees F, and roast for another 15 to 20 minutes, brushing with the glaze every 5 minutes. When pork is cool enough to handle, slice across the grain into 1/2-inch slices and arrange on a platter to serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds boneless pork butt', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon bean sauce', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1 teaspoon fivespice powder', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/4 cup boiling water']
title: Barbequed Pork

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the rice according to package directions, adding the cinnamon stick with the water. Fluff the rice, discard the cinnamon stick and set aside to cool.', u'Toss the shrimp with half of the ginger, 1 tablespoon of the sake, the vinegar and pepper flakes in a medium bowl. Let marinate 10 to 15 minutes. Mist a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat until very hot. Add the shrimp with the marinade and cook, stirring, until just opaque, 2 minutes. Transfer to a large plate and set aside.', u'Mist the same skillet and return to medium-high heat. Lightly beat the eggs and egg whites and add to the skillet. Cook until scrambled, breaking up with a spatula and transfer to the same plate as the shrimp.', u'Return the skillet to medium-high heat, mist with nonstick spray and add the snow peas, carrots, garlic, onions and remaining ginger. Cook, stirring, until softened and crisp-tender, 5 minutes. Transfer to the same plate as the shrimp and eggs.', u'Return the skillet to medium-high heat and add the vegetable oil. Add the cooled rice, toss with the oil and pack in the skillet in a firm layer. Cook, without stirring, until the bottom of the rice is browned and crusty. Stir the rice and pack it in another layer. Repeat the process until the rice is well toasted and browned, and stopping if the rice seems to be getting dry. Add back the shrimp, eggs and vegetables along with the remaining 1 tablespoon sake and soy sauce and toss well to combine. Remove from the heat and top with the sliced scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups jasmine rice', u'1/2 cinnamon stick', u'1 pound large peeled and deveined shrimp, halved lengthwise', u' One 1 1/2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced into matchstick pieces (about 1/4 cup)', u'2 tablespoons dry sake', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u' Cooking spray', u'2 large eggs', u'2 large egg whites', u'1 cup snow peas, halved', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced on an angle', u'2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 small red onion, halved and sliced root to stem', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced']
title: Lightened Shrimp Fried Rice

directions: [u'In a large heavy skillet heat the vegetable oil until it is hot but not smoking and in it stir fry the scallions, cabbage, and celery for 3 minutes, or until the cabbage is wilted. Add the sugar, broth, soy sauce, and sesame oil and simmer the mixture, covered, for 3 minutes. Stir the cornstarch mixture, stir it into the vegetable mixture, and bring the liquid to a boil. Stir in the pork and season to taste with red pepper flakes. Simmer until heated through and serve over noodles.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 scallions, trimmed and cut crosswise tinto 1/2-inch thick pieces', u'1 1/2 cups sliced Napa cabbage', u'1/4 cup sliced celery', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 cup chicken broth', u'1/2 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon Asian sesame oil', u'1/2 tablespoon cornstarch dissolved in 1 tablespoon cold water', u'1 cup cooked pork loin, cut into thin strips', u' Red pepper flakes, to taste', u'1/4 pound cooked vermicelli']
title: Pork Chow Mein

directions: [u'Combine the pork with the sesame oil, soy, and cornstarch. Let stand for 30 minutes. In a hot stockpot, add oil and sear the pork, stirring quickly then set aside. Add the chiles and ginger, and stir. Add the stock, sugar, bamboo and wood ear and bring to a boil. Season. While boiling, drizzle in the egg to form ribbons. Add the cornstarch and stir constantly to thicken. Add vinegar, soy, sesame oil, scallions and cilantro including the pork and check for seasoning. I love my soup tart and spicy so more vinegar and white pepper can be added. Add Tofu Fritters to each bowl of soup and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound pork shoulder, julienned', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil, plus 1 teaspoon', u'1 teaspoon thin soy sauce, plus 2 tablespoons', u'1 teaspoon cornstarch', u' Peanut oil, to cook', u'4 dried chiles, chopped', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'8 cups chicken stock', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 cup bamboo shoots, julienne (buy whole shoots and soak in water for 30 minutes, then cut)', u'1/2 cup dried wood ear, re-hydrated and julienned (definitely fresh if available)', u'2 eggs lightly beaten', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch, mixed with cold water to form a paste', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro', u' Salt and white pepper', u' Tofu Fritter, recipe follows', u'1 pound silken tofu', u'3 eggs, separated, whites beaten to stiff peaks', u'2 tablespoons sliced scallions', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 tablespoon minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons minced lap chong (Chinese sausage)', u' Salt and white pepper', u' Rice flour, to coat']
title: Traditional Szechuan-Style Hot and Sour Soup with Tofu Fritter

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cook the rice as the label directs. Spread out on a rimmed baking sheet and let cool.', u'Soak the lotus leaf in a roasting pan with warm water until pliable, about 1 hour. Soak the mushrooms in a bowl with 2 cups warm water until softened, about 30 minutes. Drain the mushrooms, reserving the liquid, and dice; discard the stems.', u'Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry the sausage until golden, about 3 minutes. Add the scallions and ginger and stir-fry 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Add the jicama and mushrooms and cook until just soft, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the mushroom soaking liquid, soy sauce and Worcestershire sauce; simmer, stirring, until the liquid is reduced, about 4 minutes.', u'Toss the rice, sesame oil and vegetable-sausage mixture in a large bowl. Center the lotus leaf in a microwave-safe pie dish. Mound the rice mixture in the center and pat firmly. Fold the leaf over to cover and secure with toothpicks. Cover the lotus leaf with a damp towel. Wrap the dish tightly with plastic wrap and microwave until warm, about 15 minutes. Unwrap and scoop out the rice.', u'Photographs by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'3 cups sushi rice', u'1 large dried lotus leaf', u'8 dried shiitake mushrooms', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'3 links dried Chinese sausage, diced', u'1 cup chopped scallions', u'3 tablespoons grated peeled ginger', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 cup diced jicama (about 1/2 medium jicama)', u'3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil']
title: Lotus Rice With Sausage

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'One day before you grill the duck, set the duck on a baking rack set over a baking sheet and store in the refrigerator uncovered to dry.', u'Heat grill to medium heat and set up rotisserie. Season duck with salt and pepper and skewer it onto the rotisserie rod. Place a drip pan under the duck to catch the rendered fat. Once the fat had begun to render off the duck, brush with the Hoisin Baste every 10 minutes. Cook the duck for 1 to 1 1/2 hours for medium-rare doneness. Remove from the grill and brush with more of the baste. Let the duck rest for 10 minutes before slicing into thin slices. ', u"Drizzle the oranges with peanut oil, Place oranges on the grill, flesh side down and grill until golden brown. Remove from the grill and cut each 1/2 into 1/4's.", u'Drain scallions. Place Hoisin Baste, 2 slices of duck and scallions onto each pancake. Squeeze grilled orange over the meat, roll and eat.']
ingredients: [u'1 Long Island duck, about 5 to 6 pounds', u' Salt and pepper', u' Hoisin Baste, recipe follows', u'2 oranges, halved', u'1 bunch scallions, cut into 3-inch pieces and soaked in ice water', u'8 Chinese pancakes or 6-inch flour tortillas, warmed', u' Peanut oil for drizzling', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 large red onion, coarsely chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'1 -inch piece peeled ginger, coarsely chopped', u'2 cups diced plum tomatoes', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon chile paste', u' Salt']
title: Rotisserie Duck with Hoisin Baste served with Grilled Oranges, Scallions and Pancakes

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'Place wok over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons sesame oil once hot add marinated tofu and cook for 2 minutes, then add mushrooms, carrots, bok choy, yellow pepper and scallions. Stir-fry vegetables quickly then add the soy sauce and oyster sauce. Stir well. Within 5 minutes stir-fry should be cooked. Once satisfied with texture place mixture on a serving plate. In the same wok add the remaining tablespoon of oil and add the lightly beaten eggs. Scramble the eggs then add the cooked rice. Stir and fry. Serve with tofu vegetable mixture.', u'For tofu marinade:', u'In a medium bowl add tofu, red chili flakes, soy sauce and rice wine vinegar. Stir making sure tofu is covered. Let tofu sit for 10 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons sesame oil, divided', u'1 package firm tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes, marinated, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup quartered white button mushrooms', u'1 medium carrot, julienned', u'1 baby bok choy, quartered', u'1/2 yellow pepper, sliced', u'3 scallions, sliced', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 teaspoons oyster sauce', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'2 cups short-grain rice, recipe follows', u'2 cups water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup short-grain white rice']
title: Tofu Stir-Fry with Fried Rice

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Using a sharp knife, cut the slab of ribs between the bones into individual ribs. Place in a stock pot or large soup pot and add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a steady simmer, and cook until the ribs are tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours, skimming the surface of any scum that rises to the top while cooking. Remove the ribs to a large bowl and set aside to cool completely. (Reserve the pork stock for another purpose.)', u'Combine the rice wine, soy sauce, hoisin, brown sugar, garlic, chile garlic sauce and five-spice powder and whisk to blend. Pour half of the marinade over the cooled ribs and toss to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate, stirring occasionally, for 2 hours or up to overnight. Reserve the remaining half of the marinade in a non-reactive container and refrigerate.  ', u'Preheat the broiler and position a rack in the upper third of the oven. ', u'To the remaining half of the marinade, add the honey and sesame oil and whisk to combine. Remove the ribs from the refrigerator and transfer to an aluminum foil-lined baking sheet. Brush with some of the remaining marinade-honey mixture and broil for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the ribs are crispy on the upper edges. Remove the ribs from the oven and turn to the other side, brush with some of the remaining marinade mixture and broil again for about 4 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 (4 pound) slab pork spareribs', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons Chinese rice wine', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'3 tablespoons packed brown sugar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 1/2 tablespoons chile garlic sauce', u'1 1/4 teaspoons Chinese five-spice powder', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sesame oil']
title: Szechuan Style Spareribs

directions: [u'Slice the pork into 1/4-inch-thick slices, then stack the slices and cut into 2-inch-long matchsticks. Put the matchsticks in a shallow bowl and add the garlic, 2 teaspoons of the rice wine, the cornstarch, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Stir to combine. ', u'Heat 14-inch flat-bottomed wok over high heat until a bead of water vaporizes within 1 to 2 seconds of contact. Swirl in the olive oil and add the pork, spread it around it in the wok. Cook undisturbed 20 seconds, letting the pork begin to brown. Then, using a metal spatula, stir-fry the pork until it is no longer pink, about 1 minute. Add the bean sprouts, then remaining 2 teaspoons rice wine, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and stir-fry 1 to 2 minutes or until the pork and bean sprouts are just cooked through.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces lean pork butt', u'2 teaspoons grated garlic', u'4 teaspoons Shao Hsing rice wine or dry sherry', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1/2 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'2 tablespoons golden olive oil', u'1 pound mung bean sprouts']
title: Walter Kei's Shanghai-Style Pork and Bean Sprouts

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, bring the stock to a simmer. Add 6 tablespoons of the green onions, the spinach, mushrooms, soy and white pepper. Return to a bare simmer and cook for 3 minutes. Stirring with a fork or chopstick, gradually add the eggs in a slow steady stream. Cook until the eggs are set, stirring to create shreds or ribbons of the eggs, 1 minute.', u'Remove from the heat. Ladle into bowls, garnish with the remaining 2 tablespoons of green onions, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups chicken stock', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced green onions', u'1/4 cup chiffonade spinach leaves', u'4 shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, wiped clean, and thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u' Pinch finely ground white pepper', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten']
title: Egg Drop Soup

directions: [u'Combine cabbage, scallions, and sesame seeds in a medium-size bowl. Mix vegetable oil, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar in a cup. Pour enough dressing over slaw to coat; refrigerate, covered, to blend flavors. Add more dressing, if needed.']
ingredients: [u'1 package (10 ounces) shredded cabbage', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon white vinegar', u'1/3 cup sugar']
title: Oriental Cabbage Slaw

directions: [u'Make the noodles: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles, stir and cook until al dente, 2 to 4 minutes. Drain, then rinse under cold water and transfer to a bowl. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon sesame oil and toss to coat.', u'Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking and add the peanut oil. Add the ginger, chiles and garlic and stir-fry 30 seconds; add the ground beef and cook, breaking up the meat with a spatula, until browned, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Combine the tahini and the remaining 1 teaspoon sesame oil in a small bowl. Add the cornichons to the wok. Stir in the tahini mixture, soy sauce, rice wine, vinegar and ground peppercorns; cook until the beef begins to crisp, 2 to 3 more minutes. Season with white pepper and remove from the heat.', u'Prepare the toppings: Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Combine the chili oil, sesame oil, soy sauce, ground peppercorns and chiles in a small bowl.', u'Divide the noodles among bowls and sprinkle the beef mixture evenly over each. Pour the hot broth over the noodles; top with the chili oil mixture, scallions and cilantro.', u'Photograph by Ralph Smith']
ingredients: [u' Sea salt', u'1 pound flat Asian wheat noodles (such as udon)', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 tablespoon finely grated peeled ginger', u'3 red Fresno chile peppers, seeded and finely chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'8 ounces ground beef', u'1 tablespoon tahini (sesame paste)', u'1/2 cup finely diced cornichons or sweet gherkins', u'1 tablespoon light soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon Chinkiang black rice vinegar or balsamic vinegar', u'1 teaspoon ground Sichuan peppercorns', u' Freshly ground white pepper', u'2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/4 cup chili oil', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame oil', u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon ground Sichuan peppercorns', u'3 red Fresno chile peppers, seeded and finely diced', u'2 large scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 small handful fresh cilantro, finely chopped']
title: Dan Dan Noodles

directions: [u'Thoroughly rinse the fish in cold water and pat dry. Put the fillets in a 9-inch shallow heatproof bowl. Drizzle the soy sauce, salt and pepper over the salmon. Sprinkle with the scallions and ginger. Cut the lemon in half crosswise. Cut half a lemon into 4 slices and put on the fish. Juice the remaining lemon and drizzle over the fish. ', u'Put a 1-inch-high steamer rack in a 14-inch-flatbottomed wok. Add water to a depth of 3/4 inch and bring to a boil over high heat. Carefully put the bowl on the rack, cover, and steam for 8 to 10 minutes. Test the fish for doneness by poking the thickest party with a chopstick or fork; the fish should flake. If not, steam 1 to 2 minutes or until the fish just flakes. Be sure to check the water level from time to time and replenish if necessary, with boiling water. Carefully remove the bowl from the wok. Drizzle the sesame oil over the fillets. ']
ingredients: [u'2 (1-pound) salmon fillets', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'2 scallions, cut into 4-inch pieces', u'4 slices ginger', u'1 lemon', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil']
title: Danny Chan's Steamed Salmon with Lemon

directions: [u'Heat a wok or large saute pan on high flame, add sesame oil, sausage and garlic and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add broccoli, cook additional 2 to 3 minutes and remove to a bowl. ', u'In same pan or wok add tofu, ginger and toss quickly for 30 seconds. Remove to bowl with sausage and broccoli. ', u'Reduce heat and add chili oil, garlic and soy sauce and whisk in mirin, miso, rice vinegar and season to taste. If heat is too high you may need more oil for consistency. ', u'Plate broccoli, tofu and sausage mixture on plate and drizzle warm vinaigrette on top. Garnish with scallion or chives.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'6 to 8 ounces Chinese sausage or smoked sausage, cut into 1/2-inch rounds', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1 head broccoli, cut into florets and stems sliced on a bias', u'3 to 4 pieces of firm tofu, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon chili oil (recipe follows)', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'2 tablespoons miso paste', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar']
title: Warm Broccoli and Tofu Salad with Grilled Chinese Sausage and Chili Miso Vinaigrette

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'In a small saucepan add edamame to salted boiling water. Cook for 1 minute. Drain edamame and run under cold water to cool them slightly and add them to a food processor. Using a microplane grate the ginger and add to food processor along with wasabi powder, lemon juice, salt, sesame oil and scallions. Process until a chunky consistency forms.', u"Working with 1 wonton wrapper at a time (cover remaining wrappers with a damp towel to prevent drying), spoon about 1 teaspoon edamame mixture in center of each wrapper. Moisten edges of dough with water; fold opposite corners to form a triangle, pinching points to seal. In a heat proof pan add about 2 inches oil and heat. When oil is hot add dumplings and fry until golden brown about 10 minutes. Fry off in batches making sure they don't touch in the oil so they won't stick. Remove with a slotted spoon or spider and place on paper towels to absorb the oil. Serve warm on a platter with soy sauce."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup shelled frozen edamame', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons wasabi powder', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more for salting water', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil, plus more if necessary', u'2 scallions, roughly chopped', u'24 wonton wrappers', u'2 cups water, plus more for sealing wontons', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1/2 cup soy sauce, for dipping']
title: Fried Edamame Dumplings

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Special equipment: a deep-fry thermometer', u'Heat 2 tablespoons of the peanut oil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Stir in the chiles, scallions, garlic and orange zest and cook, stirring, until the garlic has turned golden and the chiles brighten, about 1 minute. Add the sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, ginger and 3 tablespoons water. Bring to a boil and cook until the sugar dissolves completely and the sauce become fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Stir 2 teaspoons cornstarch into 1/4 cup cold water in a small bowl or measuring cup. Whisk the mixture into the boiling sauce until thickened, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat and cover to keep warm.', u'Fill a large Dutch oven halfway with peanut oil and heat over medium-high heat to 350 degrees F. Set a wire rack in a rimmed baking sheet and set aside. Beat the eggs in a large bowl with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Add the cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss with the egg mixture. Sprinkle in the remaining 3/4 cup cornstarch a little bit at a time until the cauliflower is well coated.', u'Fry the cauliflower in 3 batches; gently place the cauliflower in the hot oil and cook, keeping the pieces separated and adjusting the heat as necessary to keep the oil temperature at 350 degrees F, until light brown and crisp, about 6 minutes. Remove the cauliflower with a spider or slotted spoon and set on the prepared wire rack to drain briefly. Transfer the cauliflower to a large bowl while it is still hot and toss with the sauce to evenly coat. Transfer to a serving plate and top with scallions. Serve with the rice and orange slices.', u'Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons peanut oil, plus more for frying', u'3 whole dried red chiles', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced, plus more for sprinkling', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 strip orange zest, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'2 teaspoons plus 3/4 cup cornstarch', u'2 large eggs', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound cauliflower, cut into large florets or wedges (about 4 cups)', u' Steamed rice and orange slices, for serving']
title: General Tso's Cauliflower

directions: [u'TOFU MOLD: Build a wooden frame from finished 3/4-inch thick lumber. The open frame can be square (7-inches by 7-inches) or rectangular (8-inches by 6-inches) and have a height of 2-inches. Build a pressing board (removable top) from the same lumber. The dimensions of the top should be 1/2- inch smaller than the interior dimensions of the frame. Two cross pieces can be used to hold the board together in the event two or more pieces of lumber were used to make it. These cross pieces serve as handles to lift the board from the frame after the tofu is pressed. The cross pieces should be located one inch from the edge of the board. ', u'Soybean Milk: Use a blender to make soybean milk in batches of one cup of soaked soybeans to three cups of water. Each batch should run for at least 3 minutes. Put the coarse soybean milk into a large pot and heat to a slow simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Place a colander, covered with a clean kitchen towel, into a large pot or bowl. Pour the hot soybean milk into the towel to strain the soybean milk. A small amount of milk will drain via gravity; most must be forced out. This should be done when the milk has cooled. To do this, gather the edges of the towel to form a sealed ball. Tighten the towel edges like a screw. Use a spoon to scrape the outside of the ball to facilitate the flow. Make certain that the bean residuals are trapped inside the ball. Continue this process until the inside of the towel is nearly empty.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound soybeans, uncooked, washed and soaked, water changed', u' every few hours', u'2 quarts soybean milk', u'4 teaspoons magnesium chloride']
title: Homemade Tofu

directions: [u'In a bowl, sift flour. Slowly add water in a steady stream while mixing with a wooden spoon. Keep adding water until a ball is formed. With the same procedure, one can use a food processor with a metal blade. Let ball of dough >relax for about 30 minutes and cover with damp cloth. ', u'On a floured surface, roll out dough into a thin rectangle. Brush on oil mixture, cover with scallion and season with salt and pepper. Carefully roll dough like a sponge cake. Cut into 4 pieces. Take one piece and twist 3 times. Make a spiral out of this and roll again and flatten to achieve a 5 to 6 inch pancake. In a hot non-stick pan, coat with canola oil and pan sear both sides until golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve immediately with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'1 cup boiling water', u'1/2 cup sliced scallions', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u' Salt and black pepper to taste', u'1/2 cup ginger dipping sauce, recipe to follow', u'1/4 cup thin soy sauce', u'1/4 cup Chinese chinkiang vinegar', u'1/4 cup sliced scallions', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon sugar']
title: Scallion Pancakes with Ginger Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'In a blender or food processor, combine pineapple, juice, salted plums, brown sugar, vinegar, preserves, and garlic and process until smooth. Transfer to a small saucepan, and add the crushed red chile peppers. Bring mixture to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and use as a dipping sauce for Egg Rolls.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup canned crushed pineapple, drained', u'1/4 cup pineapple juice', u'1/3 cup mashed, seeded Chinese salted plums', u'1/4 cup brown sugar, lightly packed', u'3 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'3 tablespoons apricot preserves', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic', u'1 teaspoon crushed red chile peppers']
title: Plum Sauce

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a very large nonstick skillet or wok over a high heat. Add the scallions, ginger and shrimp and cook stirring frequently until the shrimp turn pink, about 1 1/2 minutes. Add the cabbage and continue cooking until it begins to soften, but is still somewhat crisp, about 2 minutes more. Transfer the shrimp-cabbage mixture to a bowl.', u'Heat the sesame oil in the same skillet or wok over a medium-high heat. Add the rice and cook stirring frequently, until heated through, about 3 minutes. Add the shrimp-cabbage mixture back to the skillet, stir in the soy sauce and sesame seeds and serve.', u'Nutritional analysis per serving (Serving size: 2 cups)', u'Calories 460; Total Fat 12 g; (Sat Fat 1.5 g, Mono Fat 4.5 g, Poly Fat 3.5 g) ; Protein 32 g; Carb 55 g; Fiber 7 g; Cholesterol 220 mg; Sodium 580 mg', u'Excellent source of: Protein, Fiber, Thiamin, Niacin, Vitamin B6, Vitamin B12, Vitamin C, Vitamin K, Copper, Iron, Magnesium, Manganese, Phosphorus, Selenium, Zinc', u'Good source of: Vitamin A, Folate, Pantothenic Acid, Calcium, Potassium']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'4 scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon peeled, grated fresh ginger', u'1 pound peeled, cleaned small shrimp', u'5 cups thinly sliced green cabbage, cut crosswise into 3-inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'4 cups very cold cooked brown rice', u'3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds']
title: Sesame Shrimp Fried Rice with Cabbage

directions: [u'Heat a wok or large heavy skillet over high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the peanut oil and swirl to coat the wok. Add the shrimp and stir-fry just until pink, about 2 minutes. Remove shrimp and reserve. Add eggs to wok and scramble until set, but still slightly runny. Remove from pan, breaking into bite-sized pieces, and wipe wok clean. ', u'Return wok to heat, add remaining 2 tablespoons peanut oil, and swirl to coat the wok. Reduce the heat to medium-high, add the onions, garlic, and ginger and stir-fry until onion is half-cooked, 1 minute. Add the red pepper and stir-fry until just tender but still crisp, about 2 minutes. Add the cold rice, quickly spreading it all over the wok and tossing it to heat through, then fry for about 5 to 7 minutes. (Add a little more oil if the rice is sticking.) When the rice is hot, add the peas and toss to heat through, about 1 minute. Add the pork, reserved shrimp, eggs, and salt, and stirfry to heat thoroughly, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve immediately on a large platter.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1/2 pound medium shrimp, shelled and deveined', u'2 eggs, beaten with 1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 bunch green onions, finely chopped', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 small red bell pepper, finely diced', u'3 cups cold cooked white rice, broken into separate grains', u'1/2 cup frozen organic peas, thawed', u'1/4 pound barbecued pork, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u' Salt']
title: Shrimp Fried Rice

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Fried or steamed rice, for serving', u'Whole cilantro leaves, for serving', u'Combine the diced chicken with the eggs, and the light soy sauce and season with salt and pepper. Remove the chicken to a medium bowl and add enough cornstarch to coat the chicken; it should form a sticky-like paste around the chicken. Cover the bowl and let rest for 1 hour in the refrigerator.', u'For the sauce:', u'Combine all the sauce ingredients, except the cornstarch slurry, in a large saucepan over medium heat and simmer until the sugar dissolves.', u'Heat the oil in a deep-fryer or heavy-bottomed pan to 350 to 360 degrees F. ', u'Carefully test the oil by dropping a single piece of chicken into it and cook for around 4 minutes. When the oil is hot enough, slowly add a few pieces of chicken at a time, until all the chicken is cooked. Remove the chicken from the oil to paper towels to drain.', u'Add a little more oil to a clean wok or skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot add the chiles and green onions to saute for around 1 minute. Add the already cooked chicken to the wok and toss around with the chiles so that all the chicken gets great flavor. At this point add the warmed sauce mixture, a few spoonfuls at a time, until all the chicken is coated but not soaking wet.', u'If the sauce is a little runny add the cornstarch slurry, a little at a time, to thicken the sauce. Remember you have to cook the sauce until bubbling after you have added the cornstarch. This normally takes a couple of minutes over low heat. Remove the chicken mixture from the wok to a serving bowl and serve immediately on fried or steamed rice. Garnish with whole cilantro leaves before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds chicken breast or thighs, cubed', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'3 tablespoons light soy sauce', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Cornstarch, as required', u'5 cups frying oil, canola or grapeseed', u'8 small dried red chile peppers', u'6 green onions, sliced', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup sake', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'6 1/4 cups chicken stock', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch slurry, (cornstarch and water mixed) for thickening the sauce']
title: General Tso's Chicken

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl toss the pork with the rice wine, soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, garlic, and ginger. Cover and marinate, refrigerated, for 2 to 4 hours. ', u'In a large wok or saute pan heat 2 tablespoons of the oil over medium-high heat. Add the eggs and quickly scramble. Remove the set eggs from the pan and set aside. ', u'Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in the work and add the drained pork strips. Stir fry over high heat until browned and cooked through, about 3 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients except the hoisin sauce and pancakes to the wok and stir-fry until wilted and well combined, about 2 minutes. Return the pork to the pan and stir to mix well and heat through. Add the eggs and mix well. Remove from the heat and place in a decorative bowl.  ', u'To serve, place 1 pancake on a plate and coat with 2 teaspoons of hoisin sauce. Top with the Mu Shu Pork filling, roll into a cylinder, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces pork loin or pork butt, trimmed, and cut into thin match-stick strips', u'2 tablespoons rice wine or dry vermouth', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 large eggs, beaten', u'2 cups thinly sliced bok choy', u'1/2 cup finely chopped green onions', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup bamboo shoots (rinsed and well drained if canned)', u'4 ounces wood ear or baby chanterelle mushrooms, stems trimmed and thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Hoisin Sauce', u' Mandarin Pancakes, recipe follows', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'1 cup boiling water', u' About 3 tablespoons sesame oil']
title: Mu Shu Pork in Pancakes

directions: [u'Rinse the rice 2 times in a bowl of cold water and drain.
