In a large ovenproof pot, combine the rice, sausages, chestnuts, sugar, soy sauce, dried scallops, gingko nuts, ham, dates, wine, and dried shrimp. Add a scant 3 cups of water, put in a steam oven, and cook until cooked through and soft, 30 to 45 minutes. Fold in the edamame. Taste and adjust the sugar, soy sauce, and salt. Let cool and then fold in the scallions. Stuff about 1/2 cup of the rice mixture into each quail.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups short grain glutinous rice', u'2 Chinese sausages, cut into rounds', u'1/4 cup roasted, peeled, and diced chestnuts', u'3 tablespoons sugar, more if needed', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons dried scallop, reconstituted in water', u'2 tablespoons gingko nuts', u'2 tablespoons cubed Chinese ham', u'1 tablespoon red dates, reconstituted in water', u'1 tablespoon shao xing cooking wine', u'1 teaspoon dried shrimp, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup edamame peas', u'2 tablespoons thinly sliced (on the bias) scallion greens', u'8 (4 ounce) boneless quail', u'1 scallion green, blanched, shocked, and squeezed dry', u'1/3 cup soybean oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon pulverized fresh ginger, or to taste', u'1 cup soybean oil', u'2 cups garlic chives, cut into 2-inch lengths', u' Salt', u' Soybean oil']
title: Whole Quail with Sticky Rice with Chinese Sausage

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a skillet over medium-high heat, heat the sesame and canola oil. Saute cabbage for 2 minutes. Add carrots and snow peas. Cook an additional 1 minute. ', u'Whisk together cornstarch and soy sauce until smooth. Stir into vegetable mixture. Cook until sauce comes to a boil and is slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool.', u'Lay the egg roll skins on a flat surface and lightly brush edges with water. Place 1/8 of the filling at one end of each skin, leaving a 1/4-inch border at the top and sides. Roll wrapper over filling, tucking in the ends after the first roll.  ', u'Heat 3-inches of peanut oil in a large, deep saucepan. When the oil is hot, about 350 degrees F, fry the egg rolls until golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the fryer and drain on paper towels. Season with Essence. ', u'To serve, slice each egg roll in half, diagonally and place on each serving plate. Combine dry mustard with water. Drizzle each egg roll with the hot mustard. Garnish with cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoon canola oil', u'1/2 head green cabbage, shredded', u'1 cup julienne carrots', u'1 cup julienne snow peas', u'1 tablespoon corn starch', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'8 egg roll wrappers', u' Peanut oil, for deep frying', u'1/4 cup dry mustard', u'1/4 cup water', u' Cilantro leaves, garnish']
title: Emeril's Vegetarian Egg Rolls

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, combine the sausage, green onions, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and garlic. Place 8 wonton wrappers on a clean surface and brush edges with water. Place 1 tablespoon of pork mixture in center of each wrapper. Gather edges of wrapper together over filling. Press edges of wrapper together, enclosing the filling completely. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.', u'Place a collapsible metal steamer rack in a large wide pot. Fill pot with 1/2-inch water. Spray steamer rack with nonstick spray. Bring water to a simmer. Working in batches, arrange dumplings on rack 1-inch apart. Cover pot with lid and steam dumplings until cooked thoroughly, about 8 minutes. Watch the water level and add more as needed. Transfer dumplings to a platter and serve with dipping sauces.']
ingredients: [u'1 (12-ounce) package pork sausage', u'2 green onions, minced', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon minced garlic', u'24 square wonton wrappers', u' Nonstick vegetable cooking spray', u' For dipping: soy sauce, hoisin sauce, chili garlic sauce, and hot Chinese-style mustard']
title: Oriental Pork Wrappers

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a wok-shaped skillet or large non-stick skillet over high heat. When pan is very hot, add oil, (it will smoke a bit) then, immediately add the snow peas, pepper, mushrooms, scallions, and bean sprouts. Stir fry for 1 minute to flavor the oil, then add the ginger and garlic, and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add the cooked noodles and toss with to combine. Add the soy sauce and toss the ingredients to coat noodles evenly with sauce. Transfer the lo mein to a serving platter and garnish with a drizzle of toasted sesame oil.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons (2 turns around the pan in a slow drizzle) vegetable or wok oil', u'1 cup (2 handfuls) snow peas, halved on a diagonal', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into match stick size pieces', u'1/2 pound assorted mushrooms (shiitake, straw, enoki, or oyster), coarsely chopped, if necessary', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced on a diagonal', u'2 cups (about 4 handfuls) fresh bean sprouts', u'2 inches fresh ginger root, minced or grated with hand grater', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 pound lo mein noodles or thin spaghetti, cooked to al dente and drained well', u'1/2 cup aged tamari soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil, several drops', u' Wok oil is infused with ginger and garlic and is widely available on the International Foods aisle of the market.', u' Cooked shredded pork, chicken, or small de-veined shrimp may be added to this dish in any combination.']
title: No-Pain Lo Mein

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'Have a deep-fryer preheated to 370 degrees F.', u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the sesame oil, pork and garlic. Allow to cook for a few minutes then add five-spice powder, black pepper, Thai basil and lime juice. Turn heat off and add broccoli slaw mix.', u'Lay egg roll wrappers out on a flat surface. Add about 2 to 3 tablespoons of the pork mixture and slaw mix to wrapper. Egg wash the sides of each egg roll wrapper. Roll egg roll wrapper over mixture, bringing in the sides and continue to roll until sealed. ', u'Fry until golden brown, about 2 to 4 minutes. Remove from oil onto paper towel lined platter and serve with Dipping Sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 pound ground pork', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u' Pinch five-spice powder', u' Freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 tablespoon freshly chopped Thai Basil leaves', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 bag store-bought broccoli slaw', u'6 egg roll wrappers', u'2 egg whites beaten with 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch, for egg wash', u' Dipping sauce, recipe follows', u' Mushroom stock', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'3 tablespoons freshly chopped scallions']
title: Pork Egg Roll with Broccoli Slaw

directions: [u'In a re-sealable plastic bag add, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chili garlic paste, 2 tablespoons cornstarch and mix thoroughly, then add chicken and marinate for 1 hour.', u'In a medium stock pot boil water and cook chow mein noodles until al dente, remove and shock in ice bath, shake dry and toss with 2 tablespoons oil to keep from sticking.', u'In a large saute pan or wok, heat 2 tablespoons oil to almost smoke point and add chicken, separating each peace upon entry. Cook until browned on all sides. Remove and hold warm.', u'In same wok, add 2 tablespoons oil. Heat until almost the smoke point, then add the onions, bell peppers, carrots and celery., Saute for 2 minutes then add mushrooms, peas and bean sprouts. Cook for 1 minute, then add chicken saute for 1 minute, add hoisin, 3 tablespoons soy sauce and sesame oil, toss and remove.', u'Heat a 12-inch nonstick saute pan, add 3 tablespoons oil, heat to almost smoke point, and add chilled chow mein noodles. Cook on one side until crispy light golden brown. Flip noodles and another 2 tablespoons of oil and cook other side. When done, remove and let drain on paper towels, while holding warm.', u'Mix 2 tablespoons cornstarch and chicken stock, and deglaze hot wok with mixture and let reduce by one-third. ', u'Place noodles on a rimmed serving platter, top with chicken and vegetable saute, and pour chicken reduction over top. Garnish with green onions.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup soy sauce, divided', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u'1 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons chili garlic paste', u'4 tablespoons cornstarch, divided', u'2 cups chicken breast, cut 1/4-inch slices, skinless', u'16 ounces chow mein noodles', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'1 cup 1/8-inch julienne white onion', u'1/2 cup 1/4-inch strips red bell pepper', u'1 cup 1/4-inch sticks cut carrot', u'1 cup 1/2-inch bias cut celery', u'1/2 cup 1/2-inch strips shiitake mushrooms', u'3/4 cup 1/2-inch strips snow peas', u'1 cup mung bean sprouts', u'3 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 1/2 cups low-sodium chicken stock', u'1/2 cup strips green onions']
title: Hong Kong Style Noodles with Chicken and Vegetables

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the garlic and ginger in a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Add the vegetable oil, tahini, peanut butter, soy sauce, sherry, sherry vinegar, honey, chili oil, sesame oil, and ground peppers. Puree the sauce.', u'Add a splash of oil to a large pot of boiling salted water and cook the spaghetti al dente. Drain the pasta in a colander, place it in a large bowl, and while still warm, toss with 3/4 of the sauce. Add the red and yellow bell peppers and scallions; toss well. Serve warm or at room temperature. The remaining sauce may be added, as needed, to moisten the pasta.']
ingredients: [u'6 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh ginger, peeled and chopped', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup tahini (sesame paste)', u'1/2 cup smooth peanut butter', u'1/2 cup good soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dry sherry', u'1/4 cup sherry vinegar', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/2 teaspoon hot chili oil', u'2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', u'1 pound spaghetti', u'1 red bell pepper, julienned', u'1 yellow bell pepper, julienned', u'4 scallions, sliced diagonally (white and green parts)']
title: Szechuan Noodles

directions: [u'Heat a heavy soup pot over high heat, add the oil, and heat until hot, about 20 seconds. Add the tomatoes and scallions, and stir-fry until fragrant, about 15 seconds. Add the soy sauce and rice wine or sake, and stir-fry over high heat for 20 seconds. Add the water and salt, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 2 minutes, skimming the surface to remove any impurities. Add the snow peas and stir.', u'Slowly add the cornstarch mixture and bring the liquid to a boil, stirring to prevent lumps from forming. Once slightly thickened, remove from the heat and slowly add the beaten eggs, pouring them in a thin stream around the edge of the pot. Carefully stir once or twice so that the eggs form thin streamers. Taste for seasoning and ladle into serving bowls.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 teaspoons canola or corn oil', u'2 medium tomatoes, cored and cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1/2 cup minced scallions, white part only', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3/4 cup rice wine or sake', u'5 cups water', u'1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', u'1/2 pound snow peas, ends snapped and veiny strings removed', u'2 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 6 tablespoons water', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten with 2 tablespoons water']
title: Vegetarian Egg Drop Soup

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Cook the white rice according to package directions. Reserve 2 cups cooked rice for the online round 2 recipe, Beef Fried Rice.', u'Thinly slice the chuck steak, about 1/4-inch thick, across the grain.  Cut the slices into 3-inch long strips.', u'Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.  Toss the beef in the cornstarch and shake off excess.  Fry the beef in 2 batches in the hot oil, turning once, until crispy and golden, about 2 minutes on each side. Remove the beef from the pan and set aside on paper towel lined plate.  Carefully drain the oil from the wok or skillet.', u'In a medium bowl add the marmalade, garlic, vinegar, ginger, soy sauce and orange juice and whisk until well combined.  Add to the wok, over high heat, and cook for 2 minutes.  Stir in the broccoli, reserving about 1 1/2 cups for round 2 recipe, Wonton Soup and online round 2 recipe, Beef Fried Rice. Cook the broccoli until slightly tender and the sauce is thick, about 3 to 5 minutes.  Stir in the beef, then transfer to a serving platter. Serve immediately with the white rice.  Reserve any leftovers for online round 2 recipe, Beef Fried Rice.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups white rice', u'1 1/4 pounds beef chuck steak', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'3/4 cup orange marmalade', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'2 tablespoons white vinegar', u'1 tablespoon peeled and chopped ginger', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/2 cup orange juice', u'1 head broccoli, cut into florets, stems sliced into 1/4-inch rounds']
title: Crispy Orange Beef with Broccoli

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring a pot of water to a boil. Pulse the sesame seeds in a mini food processor with 2 tablespoons sesame oil, 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt until powdery; set aside.', u'Prepare the stir-fry: Quarter, seed and finely dice the pickles and put in a bowl. In another bowl, mix the garlic, ginger, scallions, 1/2 teaspoon salt and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon sugar. Mix 1 tablespoon soy sauce and the broth in a third bowl. Mix the pork with 1 tablespoon soy sauce and 1/2 teaspoon salt in another bowl. Place the four bowls by the stove.', u'Place a large skillet over high heat. Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, then the pork, breaking it up with a wooden spoon, until cooked but not dry, 4 minutes. Transfer the meat to a bowl and toss with the remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce.', u'Add the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to the skillet; stir-fry the pickles for 1 minute. Add the garlic mixture and fry 30 seconds. Add the broth and boil until reduced by half, 4 minutes. Divide the broth among bowls and drizzle with the chili oil and vinegar.', u'Meanwhile, add the noodles and bok choy to the boiling water and cook until just tender, 2 minutes. Drain and toss with the remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil. Season with salt, then divide among the bowls. Top with pork and sprinkle with sesame powder. Serve with more sesame and chili oil.', u'Photograph by Sang An']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup sesame seeds, toasted', u'4 tablespoons toasted sesame oil, plus more for serving', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon sugar', u' Kosher salt', u'2 half-sour dill pickles', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled ginger', u'4 scallions, finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/4 cups low-sodium chicken broth or stock', u'8 ounces ground pork', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 to 4 teaspoons Chinese chili oil, plus more for serving', u'2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar', u'9 ounces dried Chinese egg noodles', u'1 medium head bok choy, sliced crosswise']
title: Dan-Dan Noodles

directions: [u'Preheat the oil to 360 to 375 degrees F in a deep-fryer or Dutch oven.', u'Cut 4 or 5 (2-inch) slits into the skin of the bass. In a large bowl, combine the rice flour, cornstarch, salt, pepper, Essence and five-spice powder. Season the fish with salt and pepper and dredge in the flour mixture. Drop into the hot oil and fry for 8 to 10 minutes until the fish is golden brown and cooked through.', u'Heat a large wok and add vegetable oil. When the oil is hot, add the spring garlic and bok choy. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes.  Toss vegetables with the sesame oil and the rice wine vinegar.', u'Serve the fish on top of the sauteed vegetables with the garlic chili sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1 (2-pound) black bass', u'1 cup rice flour', u'1 cup cornstarch', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup Essence, recipe follows', u'2 teaspoons five-spice powder', u'4 bunches spring garlic, sliced', u'4 small heads baby bok choy, split', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u' Garlic chili sauce, store bought', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u' Recipe from "New New Orleans Cooking", by Emeril Lagasse and Jessie Tirsch', u' Published by William Morrow, 1993.']
title: Chinese-Style Whole Fried Black Bass over Wok-Sauteed Bok Choy, Ginger, and Spring Garlic

directions: [u'In a large bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in the shaoxing. Mix in the oyster sauce, ginger scallions, pepper and sambal. Mix in the chicken and marinate for at least 2-hours, preferably overnight. In a hot wok coated with oil, add the garlic and shiitakes and stir-fry for 4 minutes until the mushrooms are soft. Set mushrooms aside and in the same wok, add the chicken and cook for 6 to 8 minutes. Add the stock and season with salt and pepper. Add the bok choy and cook another 3 minutes. Add back the shiitakes and the noodles. Completely coat and heat the noodles. Check for seasoning. ', u'Wine Suggestion: Morgon Beaujolais 1996']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1/4 cup shaoxing wine', u'1/2 cup oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1/4 cup sliced scallion whites, save green for garnish', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon sambal oelek', u'1 pound skinless chicken meat. I prefer the leg/thigh meat, but breast may be substituted', u' Canola oil to cook', u'6 cloves garlic sliced thin', u'2 cups shiitake mushrooms, quartered', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'4 heads baby bok choy, core out, sliced', u'1 pound blanched and refreshed lo mein noodles', u' Salt and pepper to taste']
title: Chicken, Bok Choy and Shiitake Chow Mein

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'Split boneless chicken in half. If too thick, pound out to make thinner.', u'In a medium bowl, mix together radish, carrots, bean sprouts, and scallions. Add Szechuan sauce.', u'In a small bowl, mix together five-spice, cayenne, salt and pepper. Season chicken breasts lightly with rub. Cut the chicken into strips.', u'In a large skillet over high heat, add the grapeseed oil. Once hot, sear the chicken breasts for 4 minutes on each side. Add butter and lemon to pan and baste the chicken for another minute. Remove chicken to a platter to let cool. Once cooled, dice or shred the chicken.', u'Place a spoonful of the vegetable mixture and the shredded chicken onto each leaf of lettuce. Roll and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 boneless skinless chicken breasts', u'1/4 cup shredded daikon radish', u'2 carrots, shredded', u'1/4 cup bean sprouts', u'3 stalks (1/2 cup) scallions', u'1/4 cup Szechuan sauce', u'1 tablespoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/2 teaspoon sea salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil, for frying', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 head Bibb lettuce leaves']
title: Spicy Szechuan Chicken Lettuce Wraps

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Mix together sauce ingredients and reserve.', u'Bring pasta water to a boil, salt water and cook spaghetti to al dente.', u'While pasta cooks, heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large, nonstick skillet over high heat. When oil ripples, add beaten eggs and scramble them to light golden brown, remove and reserve.', u'Season the meat with salt, pepper and coriander. Heat the remaining vegetable oil to a ripple, then add meat and stir-fry 4 minutes, push meat to the side and add ginger, garlic and veggies. Stir-fry veggies 2 minutes, then drain and add pasta and eggs back to skillet. Pour sauce over the spaghetti and toss to combine. Turn off pan. Toss 30 seconds and let the liquids absorb.']
ingredients: [u'3 rounded tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'3 tablespoons dark soy, eyeball it', u'3 tablespoons water, eyeball it', u'2 teaspoons hot sauce, eyeball it', u'1 pound spaghetti', u' Salt', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil, divided', u'2 large eggs, beaten', u'3 chicken breast cutlets, thinly sliced into strips', u'3 thin cut pork chops, thinly sliced into strips', u' Black pepper', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'2 inches fresh ginger, chopped or grated', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'6 scallions, cut into 3-inch lengths then sliced lengthwise', u'1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, cut into quarters, seeded, then sliced', u'1 small can sliced water chestnuts', u'2 cups fresh bean sprouts, 4 generous handfuls or 1/2 pound shredded cabbage, your choice']
title: Everything Lo Mein

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the noodles until al dente, about 8 minutes. Rinse under cold running water and drain well. Set aside.    In a small bowl, combine the rice wine, hoisin, and cornstarch. Add the beef, toss to coat, and marinate for 15 minutes. In another bowl, combine the dark soy, soy sauce and sugar, and stir well to dissolve the sugar.    Place a wok over a high heat and add 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil, swirling to coat. When hot, add the garlic, ginger, and minced green onions, and cook, stirring quickly, for 10 seconds. Add the beef and stir-fry for 3 minutes. Add the cabbage and stir-fry for 3 minutes. Transfer to a platter and return the wok to a high heat. Swirl the remaining tablespoon of peanut oil in the wok and once hot, add the noodles to the pan and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the sliced green onions and jalapeno and sauce and toss all for 1 minute. Add the beef and stir to heat through. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound fresh Shanghai noodles, or Japanese udon noodles', u'2 tablespoons Chinese rice wine', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 teaspoon cornstarch', u'12 ounces flank steak, sliced into 1/4-inch strips', u'3 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1/2 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon minced green onions, plus 1 cup cut-on-a-bias green onions', u'3 cups julienned Napa cabbage', u'1/2 teaspoon minced jalapeno']
title: Shanghai Fried Noodles

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.  Grease a cookie sheet thoroughly.', u'Whip the egg whites on low speed until light and foamy. Blend in the sugar and continue to beat until soft peaks form.', u'Pour in the melted butter, flour, salt, and extracts; mix until well combined. Drop a tablespoon of the batter onto the prepared cookie sheet. Using the back of a spoon, spread the batter evenly into very thin 3-inch rounds. Alternatively, use the lid of a jar with a 3-inch circle punched out as a template, pour the batter in the ring, and remove. Because you must work quickly to shape these cookies, bake just 3 at a time.', u'Bake for about 5 to 8 minutes or until the edges are a light golden color.', u'Remove the cookies with a spatula and place on a work surface. Lay a fortune in the lower middle of the cookie, and gingerly (they will be hot) fold in half to make a semi-circle. Bend the edges up toward each other to make a crescent. Drag the crease across the rim of a small measuring cup, with the ends facing down. Cool in mini muffin tins to hold shape until crisp. Repeat with remaining batter.']
ingredients: [u'2 egg whites', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'4 tablespoons melted butter, cooled', u'1/2 cup flour', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoons almond extract', u'1/2 teaspoon lemon extract', u'2 1/2 by 1/2-inch fortune strips']
title: Good-Fortune Cookies

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'A day before roasting, remove the giblets and neck from the cavity of the bird and discard. If necessary pluck any stray pinfeathers off the duck with tweezers. Trim the neck flap and excess fat from around the cavity. Rinse and dry the bird well. Set the duck on a rack on a baking sheet, and refrigerate, uncovered, for 24 hours.', u"Heat the oven to 300 degrees F. Pierce the duck's skin all over (including the back), every 1/2-inch, with a skewer or small knife. Season the cavity with salt and pepper and stuff with 3 strips of the orange zest and the onion. Set the duck on a rack in a roasting pan, and pour a cup of water in the pan. Roast the bird for 3 hours, removing the duck from the oven every hour to prick the skin again.", u'Meanwhile, make the glaze: Combine the remaining orange zest, molasses, honey, coriander, pepper, orange juice, vinegar, and garlic in a small saucepan. Heat, stirring, over medium-high heat until warm. Remove glaze from the heat and set it aside at room temperature while the duck cooks.', u'Remove the duck from the oven and carefully, pour off the excess fat from the pan. (If desired reserve this fat for frying potatoes or wilting greens.) Raise the oven temperature to 450 degree F. Return the duck to the oven and roast until crisp and brown, about 30 minutes more.', u"Let the duck rest at room temperature for 10 minutes before carving. Brush the duck's skin with glaze 4 to 5 five times during the resting period. Carve the duck and transfer pieces to warm serving platter. Serve the remaining glaze at the table to drizzle over the duck, if desired."]
ingredients: [u'1 Pekin duckling (Long Island), about 5 pounds', u' Six 1 by 3-inch strips orange zest', u'1 small onion, halved', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsulfured molasses', u'1 1/2 tablespoons honey', u'1/4 teaspoon coriander seeds, lightly crushed', u'8 whole black peppercorns, lightly crushed', u'2 tablespoons fresh orange juice', u'2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u'2 large garlic cloves, crushed and peeled', u' Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
title: Roast Duck

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine the garlic, ginger, vinegar, soy sauce, hoisin sauce and honey. Mix well and set aside until ready to use. Preheat a wok or a large skillet. Once it has reached a medium heat, add 1/2 of the peanut oil. Dredge the beef in the cornstarch, lightly shake off any excess cornstarch and add 1/2 of the beef to the pan. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add 1/2 of the broccoli to the pan and shake frequently. ', u'Add 1/2 of the sauce and stir to evenly coat the beef and broccoli. Cook until the sauce thickens about 5 minutes. Repeat the process with the other half of the ingredients. Serve immediately with steamed white rice. ', u'*It will be easier to slice the beef in thin strips if it has been partially frozen. ', u"Chef's Note: this may be able to be done in 1 batch if using a very large wok or skillet."]
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'4 teaspoons grated ginger', u'4 teaspoons Chinese black vinegar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 teaspoons hoisin sauce', u'3 teaspoons orange blossom honey', u'4 tablespoons peanut oil, divided', u'2 pounds beef flap steak, thinly sliced across the grain*', u'4 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 large heads broccoli, cut into florets and blanched', u'1 1/2 teaspoons red pepper flakes', u' Steamed white rice, for serving']
title: Stir-Fried Beef and Broccoli

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line two sheet pans with parchment paper.', u'Place the sirloin, pork, and veal in a large mixing bowl and lightly break up the meats with a fork and your fingertips. Add the bread crumbs, Pecorino, Parmesan, garlic, parsley, 2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Add the eggs, wine, and 3/4 cup water and combine lightly but thoroughly.', u'Measure out 2-ounce portions of the mixture (I use a rounded 1 3/4-inch ice cream scoop) and roll each lightly into a ball. Place one inch apart on the prepared sheet pans. Brush the meatballs with the olive oil.', u'Bake the meatballs for 25 to 30 minutes, until lightly browned. Pour the marinara into a large pot and bring to a simmer. Carefully add the meatballs and simmer for 10 minutes, until heated through.', u'To serve with polenta, spoon a puddle of creamy Parmesan polenta on one side of each dinner plate. Spoon 1 or 2 meatballs plus a puddle of tomato sauce on the other side, allowing them to combine in the center of the plate. To serve with spaghetti, distribute among shallow pasta bowls. Spoon the meatballs and sauce onto the pasta. Sprinkle with extra Parmesan and serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground sirloin', u'1/2 pound ground pork', u'1/2 pound ground veal', u'1 3/4 cups dry seasoned bread crumbs', u'1/2 cup freshly ground Italian Pecorino cheese (2 ounces)', u'1/2 cup freshly ground Italian Parmesan cheese (2 ounces), plus extra for serving', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 extra-large eggs, lightly beaten', u'3/4 cup dry red wine, such as Chianti', u'1/4 cup good olive oil', u"2 (32-ounce) jars good marinara sauce, such as Rao's", u' Creamy Parmesan Polenta (recipe follows) or cooked spaghetti, for serving', u'4 cups chicken stock, preferably homemade', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic (2 cloves)', u'1 cup yellow cornmeal, preferably stone-ground', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, plus extra for serving', u'1/2 cup creme fraiche', u'2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) unsalted butter']
title: Roasted Italian Meatballs

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Meanwhile, split the bread lengthwise, then pull out some of the bread from the inside. Drizzle 2 tablespoons each vinegar and olive oil on the bottom half. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Layer the cheese and meat on the bottom half of the bread. Drain the onion and pat dry. Top the meat with the onion, lettuce, pepperoncini (if using) and tomatoes. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons each vinegar and olive oil and sprinkle with the oregano. Season generously with salt and pepper.', u'Drizzle the cut side of the bread top with the remaining 1 tablespoon each vinegar and olive oil, then place on top of the sandwich. Cut into 4 pieces.', u'Per serving: Calories 663; Fat 50 g (Saturated 17 g); Cholesterol 93 mg; Sodium 1,988 mg; Carbohydrate 22 g; Fiber 2 g; Protein 31 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/2 large onion, thinly sliced', u'1 12 -inch loaf soft Italian bread', u'5 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 pound deli-sliced provolone cheese', u'1/4 pound deli-sliced Genoa salami', u'1/4 pound deli-sliced boiled ham', u'1/4 pound deli-sliced mortadella', u'1/4 pound deli-sliced capicola', u'1/2 head iceberg lettuce, finely shredded', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup sliced pickled pepperoncini (optional)', u'3 plum tomatoes, thinly sliced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano', u' Soak the onion slices in a large bowl of cold water, 15 minutes.']
title: Italian Subs

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the water and yeast in the bowl of an electric mixer and allow the yeast to bloom for about 5 minutes. Using a dough hook attachment, add the flour and sugar to the water and mix on low speed until a dough starts to form. Drizzle the oil and salt into the dough and beat on medium speed for 8 to 10 minutes, or until a smooth, firm, elastic dough is formed.', u'Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled bowl and spray the dough with a thin coating of cooking spray. Wrap the bowl with plastic wrap and set aside to proof in a warm, draft-free place for 11/2 hours or until doubled in size. Remove the plastic wrap, punch down and flatten the rounded dough with the heel of your hand. Roll the dough up tightly, sealing the seam well after each roll. The dough should be elongated and oval-shaped, with tapered and rounded (not pointed) ends.', u'Preheat the oven lined with a pizza stone to 425 degrees F. Alternately, an inverted baking sheet may be used in place of a pizza stone.', u"Place the dough on a baker's peel heavily dusted with semolina flour, or cornmeal, or alternately on an inverted baking sheet. Allow the dough to proof, loosely covered with a damp towel, for 30 minutes, or until doubled in size. Brush the dough with the egg white and sprinkle the sesame seeds over the top. Using a razor blade or sharp knife, score 3 (1/4-inch deep) slashes across the top of the dough at a 45 degree angle.", u'Spray the dough generously with water from a water bottle and place in the oven on the baking stone. Immediately close the oven and bake for 3 minutes. Open the oven door and spray the dough again with the water bottle. Close the oven door and bake for an additional 3 minutes before spraying the dough for a third time (the spraying of the dough will ensure a crisp golden brown crust). Bake the dough for 45 minutes, or until a hollow thud is heard when the bread is whacked with the bowl of a wooden spoon. Allow the bread to cool slightly before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups water, lukewarm', u'1 3/4 ounces cake yeast (1/3 cup)', u'5 3/4 cups bread flour', u'1 tablespoon dark brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 egg white, lightly beaten', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds']
title: Basic Italian Bread

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'For the salsa: In a medium bowl, add the tomatoes, onions, olive oil, basil, vinegar, salt, black pepper and chile flakes. Toss well, and set aside at room temperature.', u'For the provolone: Place the provolone rounds on a waxed-paper-lined baking sheet and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'In a medium bowl, combine the cornstarch and flour, then whisk in the club soda and salt until smooth, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'In a large Dutch oven, add 3 to 4 inches canola oil. Heat over medium heat until a deep-frying thermometer inserted in the oil reaches 375 degrees F.', u'Lightly dredge each piece of the provolone in flour. Working in batches, dip the provolone rounds into the batter, then shake off any excess and place in the hot oil. Fry until lightly browned and puffy on both sides, 2 to 3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove the provolone and season with some salt. Repeat for the remaining rounds of provolone.', u'Cut the crispy provolone into wedges and place on a large serving platter. Garnish with the parsley and serve with the Italian salsa spooned over the top or on the side for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups cherry tomatoes, quartered', u'1/4 cup finely diced sweet onion', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil', u'1 tablespoon white balsamic vinegar', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Pinch chile flakes', u' Canola oil, for frying', u' One 16-ounce log provolone, wax removed, sliced into 1/2-inch-thick rounds', u'1 cup cornstarch', u'1 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for dredging', u'2 cups cold club soda', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more for seasoning', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley']
title: Fried Provolone with Italian Salsa

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the dressing: In a blender, add the olive oil, mayonnaise, Parmesan, parsley, sugar, vinegar, black pepper, salt, red pepper flakes, garlic and lemon juice and blend until pureed.', u'For the salad: Put the romaine and iceberg greens in a large bowl and toss with the dressing. Top the salad with the pepperoncini, olives, tomatoes and onions. Sprinkle with Parmesan at the end.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan (pre-grated in a pack from the store)', u'1/4 cup minced fresh parsley', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon vinegar', u'2 teaspoons black pepper', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 clove garlic, pressed', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u'1 head romaine lettuce, roughly chopped', u'1/2 head iceberg lettuce, chunked', u'6 whole pepperoncini', u'1/2 cup whole black olives', u'1/2 cup whole red cherry tomatoes', u'1/2 small red onion, very thinly sliced into circles', u'1/3 cup grated Parmesan']
title: Quick Italian Salad

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt. Cook the pasta in the boiling water according to the package directions; do not overcook. Drain and rinse in cold water to cool. Toss in 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and set aside.', u'Put the chicken pieces in a large pot or Dutch oven and cover in the chicken broth. Bring to a boil, lower to a simmer and cook, covered, for 45 to 50 minutes.', u'Remove the chicken pieces from the pot, shred the meat and set aside. Discard the bones and skin. Skim the fat from the stock, then strain the stock and set aside.', u'In a new pot, add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and saute the bell peppers, celery, jalapenos, onion and oregano over medium heat until the vegetables are tender and golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes with their liquid and the reserved chicken stock and shredded chicken. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Add the cooked pasta and cream and stir to combine. Turn off the heat.', u'Serve with lots of Parmesan on the top--the more the better--and crusty Italian bread is good too.']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound ditalini pasta (a very short macaroni-type pasta)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 fryer chicken, cut into pieces', u'8 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'2 green bell peppers, diced', u'2 stalks celery, diced', u'2 fresh jalapenos, diced', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u' One 28-ounce can diced tomatoes', u'2 cups heavy cream', u' Parmesan shavings, for serving', u' Crusty Italian bread, for serving']
title: Italian Chicken Soup

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.', u'Place all of the ingredients into a blender carafe, cover and pulse until coarse crumbs form, about 2 minutes. Spread the crumbs evenly on 2 half sheet pans and bake until the crumbs just begin to brown and are crisp, about 5 minutes. Cool the crumbs on the pans for 15 to 20 minutes, and then transfer to an airtight container and store at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces stale bread, cut or torn into 1-inch pieces', u'1 tablespoon Italian seasoning', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt']
title: Homemade Italian Breadcrumbs

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the pasta and cook until just tender, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Drain pasta into a large mixing bowl.', u'Meanwhile, put the olive oil in a medium saute pan over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes. Add the onions and garlic, stirring to combine, and cook until the onions are soft and the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes more. Put the chicken mixture into the bowl with the cooked pasta. Add the canned tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine. Place the mixture in a buttered 8 by 8 by 2-inch baking dish. In a small bowl mix together the bread crumbs and the Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle over the top of the pasta mixture. Dot the top with small bits of butter. Bake until the top is golden brown, about 30 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup pastina pasta (or any small pasta)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/2 cup cubed chicken breast (1-inch cubes)', u'1/2 cup diced onion (about 1/2 a small onion)', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice', u'1 cup shredded mozzarella', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup bread crumbs', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan', u'1 tablespoon butter, plus more for buttering the baking dish']
title: Italian Baked Chicken and Pastina

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'For the meatballs: In a large bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, basil, parsley, milk, ketchup if using, tomato paste, salt, pepper, eggs, garlic and onions. Using a wooden spoon, stir to blend. Add the ground turkey and sausage meat. Using fingers, gently mix all the ingredients until thoroughly combined.', u'Using a 1-ounce cookie scoop or a small ice cream scoop, form the meat mixture into 1 1/2-inch balls (22 to 24 meatballs). Place the meatballs on a heavy nonstick baking sheet, spacing apart. Drizzle with olive oil and bake until cooked through, 15 minutes.', u'For the tomato sauce: Heat the olive oil in a large deep skillet with 2-inch-high sides over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, onions, salt and pepper. Cook for 5 to 6 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the basil, the fennel, oregano and crushed tomatoes. Bring to a simmer. Cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens slightly, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup basil. Adjust the seasoning with more salt and pepper if desired.', u'Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce and simmer until the meatballs are heated through, about 10 minutes. Thin the sauce with chicken stock, 1/4 cup at a time, if needed.', u'Serve with grated Parmesan alongside.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain breadcrumbs', u'1/2 cup finely grated Parmesan, plus more for serving', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh basil', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'1/4 cup whole milk, at room temperature', u'1 tablespoon ketchup, optional', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 large eggs, at room temperature', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'1 pound ground dark turkey meat', u'1 pound spicy Italian turkey sausage links, casings removed', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 large cloves garlic, smashed and peeled', u'1 large onion, finely chopped 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to season', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to season', u'3/4 cup chopped fresh basil', u'2 teaspoons finely ground fennel seeds', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u' Two 28-ounce cans crushed tomatoes', u'1/2 cup low-sodium chicken broth, optional']
title: Classic Italian Turkey Meatballs

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Toast fennel seed in medium sized, heavy saute pan over medium heat, constantly moving seeds around in pan until they start to turn light brown, about 5 minutes. Set aside to cool. Once cool, grind seeds and combine with salt, pepper, and chopped parsley in medium mixing bowl. Add pork and blend thoroughly. Refrigerate for 1 hour.', u'Using the fine blade of a grinder, grind the pork. After lubricating stuffer or stuffing attachment with shortening, load casing onto attachment, clipping end with a clothespin. Stuff meat into casings, trying to avoid air pockets. After stuffing is finished lay out on counter and tie off end. Pinch and twist to form 4-inch sausages. Wrap in parchment paper and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours. Store in refrigerator for use within 2 to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months. If freezing, wrap in aluminum foil. If using immediately, saute over medium heat in a heavy saute pan with 1/4-inch of water. Bring water to boil, put on lid and cook for 10 minutes. Remove lid and continue cooking over medium heat, turning every 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown. Sausage should reach an internal temperature of 150 to 156 degrees F.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 teaspoons fennel seed', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper', u'1 tablespoon chopped parsley leaves', u'2 pounds pork butt (2 1/2 pounds with bone), diced into 1/4-inch pieces', u'5 feet of 36 millimeter collagen casings (do not allow to get wet at any time)', u' Shortening, to lubricate nozzle of stuffer', u' Special equipment: meat grinder with stuffing attachment or manual stuffer']
title: Italian Sausage

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Mix the vinegar, lemon juice, honey, and salt in a blender. With the machine running, gradually blend in the oil. Season the vinaigrette with salt and pepper, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 head romaine lettuce, cut into bite-size pieces', u'1/2 head butter lettuce, cut into bite-size pieces', u'1/2 head iceberg lettuce, cut into bite-size pieces', u'1 cup rinsed canned red kidney beans, patted dry', u'1 cup rinsed canned garbanzo beans, patted dry', u'8 ounces salami, cubed', u'6 ounces Provolone, cubed', u'2 tomatoes, coarsely chopped', u' Red Wine Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Combine the first 8 ingredients in a large bowl. Toss with enough vinaigrette to coat. Season the salad with salt and pepper, to taste, and serve.', u' Yield: 6 to 8 servings', u' Prep Time: 15 minutes', u' Inactive Prep Time: none', u' Cooking Time: none', u'1/2 cup red wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1 cup olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Italian Antipasto Salad

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Whisk together the lemon juice, capers and Dijon mustard in a large bowl. While continuing to whisk, drizzle in the olive oil in a steady stream. Whisk in 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add the beans to the dressing and mash gently with a spoon. Add the tuna, flaking it with a fork into bite-size pieces. Toss lightly to coat. Top the tuna mixture with the arugula, treviso, endive, shaved fennel, parsley leaves and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Using your hands, toss the salad together, bringing the dressing up from the bottom of the bowl until everything is coated evenly.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons lemon juice, from 1 large lemon', u'1 tablespoon capers, drained and chopped', u'1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt', u' One 15-ounce can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed', u' One 6.35-ounce jar olive oil-packed tuna, drained', u'2 cups baby arugula', u'2 small treviso, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 Belgian endive, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 small bulb fennel, shaved on a mandoline or sliced thinly with a knife', u'1/2 cup fresh Italian parsley leaves']
title: Italian Tuna Salad

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Special equipment: a chafing dish, optional, and 70 to 80 frilly toothpicks', u'For the meatballs: Combine the ground beef, pork, breadcrumbs, Parmesan, ricotta, parsley, crushed red pepper, salt, garlic, eggs, milk and black pepper in a bowl. Mash with your hands until thoroughly combined. Form into small balls and place on a baking sheet. Set in the fridge for 1 hour.', u'Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the meatballs in batches until nice and deep golden, then move them to a plate.', u'For the sauce: Into the same skillet, add the garlic and onions and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the tomato sauce, parsley, tomato paste, sugar, salt, crushed red pepper and black pepper. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook for 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Add the meatballs back to the skillet and simmer another 15 minutes. Keep warm until serving.', u'Transfer to a chafing dish and serve with frilly toothpicks.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 pound ground pork', u'3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan', u'1/2 cup ricotta cheese', u'1/4 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 cloves garlic, grated on a rasp grater', u'2 whole eggs', u' Splash of milk', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup olive oil, for frying', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 onion, diced', u' Two 28-ounce cans tomato sauce', u'1/4 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, minced', u'3 tablespoons tomato paste', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Crushed red pepper, as needed', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Spicy Italian Meatballs

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'To make the meatballs: Stir the first 6 ingredients in a large bowl to blend. Stir in the cheese, beef and pork. Using 1 1/2 teaspoons for each, shape the meat mixture into 1-inch-diameter meatballs. Place on a baking sheet.', u'To make the soup: Bring the broth to a boil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and curly endive and simmer until the meatballs are cooked through and the curly endive is tender, about 8 minutes. Whisk the eggs and cheese in a medium bowl to blend. Stir the soup in a circular motion. Gradually drizzle the egg mixture into the moving broth, stirring gently with a fork to form thin stands of egg, about 1 minute. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.', u'Ladle the soup into bowls and serve. Finish soup with parmesan cheese if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 small onion, grated', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'1 large egg', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 slice fresh white bread, crust trimmed, bread torn into small pieces', u'1/2 cup grated Parmesan', u'8 ounces ground beef', u'8 ounces ground pork', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'12 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 pound curly endive, coarsely chopped (1 pound of escarole would be a good substitution)', u'2 large eggs', u'2 tablespoon freshly grated Parmesan, plus extra for garnish', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Italian Wedding Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Special equipment: a candy thermometer', u'Place the egg whites and 1/3 cup of the sugar in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. Beat on medium-high speed until the egg whites reach the soft peak stage.', u'Meanwhile, pour the remaining sugar and 1/3 cup water in a medium saucepan set over medium heat. Attach a candy thermometer to the side of the pan and bring to the soft-ball stage, without stirring, 240 degrees F.', u'The egg whites and syrup should be ready at about the same time. If one is ready before the other then you can remove the pan from the heat or stop whipping for a few minutes.', u'Continue to whip the egg whites on medium-high speed and slowly drizzle in the hot syrup, aiming the syrup between the side of the bowl and the beaters. Continue to whip until both the bottom of the bowl and the mixture are cool, 10 to 15 minutes. The mixture should be thick and will form firm peaks at this point. Beat in the salt. At this point you have an Italian meringue.', u'While still beating on medium-high, add the butter, a few pieces at a time. As the butter is added, the buttercream may appear to thin out some, but it will thicken into firm peaks once all of the butter is added. Beat in the vanilla extract. If the buttercream is still too loose, beat on high speed until thickened.', u'Use right away or refrigerate in an airtight container overnight. The buttercream may need to be beaten slightly to smooth out before using.', u'Copyright 2015 Television Food Network, G.P.  All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'4 large egg whites', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'16 ounces (32 tablespoons) unsalted butter, room temperature cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract']
title: Italian Buttercream

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper.', u'Pulse the almonds in a food processor until finely chopped, but not pasty. Stir together the nuts, flour, zest and salt in a large bowl.', u'Put the sugar, cream, corn syrup and butter in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until mixture comes to a rolling boil and sugar is completely dissolved. Continue to boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla, then pour mixture into almond mixture and stir just to combine. Set aside until cool enough to handle, 30 minutes.', u'Scoop rounded teaspoons (for 3-inch cookies) or rounded tablespoons (for 6-inch cookies) of batter and roll into balls. Place on prepared baking sheet, leaving about 3 to 4 inches between each cookie since they spread.', u'Bake 1 pan at a time, until the cookies are thin and an even golden brown color throughout, rotating pans halfway through baking time, about 10 to 11 minutes. Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to racks to cool. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 cups sliced, blanched almonds (about 5 ounces)', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u' Finely grated zest of 1 orange (about 2 tablespoons)', u'1/4 teaspoon fine salt', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'2 to 4 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped']
title: Florentines (Italy)

author: Michael Chiarello
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Heat 1/4 cup of the olive oil in a medium saute pan over medium heat and add the garlic. Saute 1 minute and then add the peppers and onions and saute until just soft. Let cool.', u'Whisk together the basil, parsley and eggs in a small bowl, and then add the salt and black pepper. Combine the Parmesan and breadcrumbs in another small bowl. Thoroughly combine the meat, herbs and eggs, Parmesan and breadcrumbs, the Worcestershire, vinegar and remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil together in a large bowl using your hands, making sure not to overmix. ', u'Pack the meat mixture into an oiled loaf pan, if you do not have a loaf pan, form the meat mixture into a loaf shape on an oiled oven tray or baking dish. Top with the marinara making sure to spread evenly over the top.', u'Bake for approximately 50 to 60 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer registers 160 degrees F in the middle of the meatloaf. Remove from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 teaspoons (about 6 cloves) chopped garlic', u'2 medium onions, diced', u'2 red peppers, seeded, small diced', u'1/2 cup chopped basil leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped parsley leaves', u'4 eggs', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 cups grated Parmesan', u'1 1/2 cups breadcrumbs', u'3 pounds ground beef', u'2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', u'2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u'1 cup marinara sauce']
title: Italian Meatloaf

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the lentils and cook until tender, stirring occasionally, about 18 to 20 minutes. Drain and let cool for 5 minutes. Place lentils and remaining salad ingredients in a large salad bowl.', u'For the Vinaigrette:', u'Place the lemon juice in a small bowl. Slowly add the oil, whisking constantly, until combined. Season with salt and pepper, to taste', u'Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss well.', u'Serves: 6; Calories: 480; Total Fat: 20 grams; Saturated Fat: 2 grams; Protein: 19 grams; Total carbohydrates: 61 grams; Sugar: 11 grams; Fiber: 14.5 grams; Cholesterol: 0 milligrams; Sodium: 173 milligrams']
ingredients: [u'1 pound green lentils (recommended: Sabarot)', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'1 cup halved seedless green grapes', u'1 cup halved seedless red grapes', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded and diced', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and diced', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped skinned and toasted hazelnuts', u'2 teaspoons lemon zest (from about 2 lemons)', u'1/3 cup fresh lemon juice (from 1 to 2 lemons)', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Italian Lentil Salad

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and set a rack in the middle of the oven.', u'Place jalapenos on a sheet tray and roast for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Turn broiler on medium.', u'Heat the oil in a medium saute pan. Add the sausage and cook for 5 to 7 minutes.  Add the onions, peppers, and garlic and cook to soften for about 5 minutes. Remove and place in a large bowl. Cool to room temperature, then add mascarpone, and Parmesan. Mix ingredients thoroughly and season with salt and pepper.', u'Place approximately 1 tablespoon of mixture into each jalapeno half, and top with 1/2 teaspoon of mozzarella cheese.', u'Place the sheet tray of stuffed peppers in oven and broil until mozzarella cheese melts.']
ingredients: [u'15 jalapenos, preferably red, cut in 1/2, seeded and deveined', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'2 pounds mild Italian sausage, casings removed', u'1/4 cup minced red onion', u'1/4 cup minced red bell pepper', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 cups mascarpone or cream cheese', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan, plus more for garnish', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese']
title: Italian Stuffed Jalapenos

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine the pork butt, garlic, paprika, fennel seeds, salt, pepper, cayenne, anise, parsley, and red wine in a large bowl and toss well to coat. Refrigerate covered overnight or up to 24 hours.', u'Pass the mixture through a meat grinder fitted with a medium die. (Alternately, transfer to a food processor in 2 batches and process until finely ground.) To test the seasoning, heat 1 teaspoon oil in a small skillet, and cook about 2 teaspoons of the mixture. Adjust seasonings, to taste.', u'Using the sausage attachment on a mixer, stuff the meat into the casings, if being used. Twist and tie off to make 4-inch sausages. Alternately, shape into patties. Cook sausage in usual manner, making sure the internal temperature of the sausage links reaches at least 150 degrees F. Uncooked sausage can be stored in the refrigerator up to 3 days or freeze and use within 3 months.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds well-marbled pork butt, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 1/2 teaspoons paprika', u'1 1/2 teaspoons toasted fennel seeds', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 tablespoon freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/2 teaspoon ground anise', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped Italian parsley leaves', u'3 tablespoons dry red wine', u' Pork casings, optional']
title: Homemade Mild Italian Sausage

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the meatballs: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and brush a baking sheet with olive oil. Pulse the bread in a food processor to make coarse crumbs. Transfer to a small bowl, add the milk and set aside to soak. Lightly beat the eggs in a large bowl, then add the beef, parsley, parmesan, garlic, 1 teaspoon salt and the red pepper flakes; mix with your hands to combine. Add the bread-milk mixture and mix until just combined (do not overmix).', u'Dampen your hands and shape the meat mixture into 4 large balls. Make an indentation in the center of each with your thumb and stuff with a mini mozzarella ball, then mold the meat around the cheese. Arrange the meatballs on the prepared baking sheet and bake until browned and firm, 25 to 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, make the sauce: Heat the olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring, until the garlic softens, about 1 minute. Add the tomatoes, 1 cup water, the basil sprigs and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until thickened, about 30 minutes.', u'Remove the meatballs from the oven and add to the sauce, spooning some of the sauce on top. Continue cooking, occasionally spooning the sauce over the meatballs, until tender and cooked through, about 6 minutes. Serve with ricotta and chopped basil.', u'You can form all of these meatballs a day ahead; cover and refrigerate until ready to cook.', u'Photograph by Christina Holmes']
ingredients: [u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for brushing', u'3 1/2 cups torn stale Italian bread (about 1/4 loaf)', u'1 cup whole milk', u'2 large eggs', u'2 pounds ground beef chuck', u'1 small bunch parsley, chopped(about 1 cup)', u'1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese', u'1 clove garlic, grated', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'4 mini mozzarella balls (bocconcini)', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 28 -ounce can crushed tomatoes', u'3 to 4 sprigs basil, plus chopped leaves for topping', u' Kosher salt', u' Ricotta cheese, for topping']
title: Jumbo Cheesy Italian Meatballs

author: Valerie Bertinelli
directions: [u'Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large saucepot over medium heat. Cook the sausage, breaking it up into small pieces, until browned and caramelized, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove the sausage to a paper towel-lined plate and reserve for the filling.', u'Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the pot and cook the onion until softened and translucent. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute (the tomato paste will turn a deep maroon color). Add the crushed tomatoes, sugar, bay leaves, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and a pinch of black pepper. Bring to a simmer, reduce the heat to low and cook for 30 minutes. Melt the butter into the sauce, remove the bay leaves and stir in 1/3 cup of basil. Remove the sauce from the heat and allow to cool to room temperature, 40 minutes.', u'For the filling: mix together the ricotta, reserved sausage, the remaining 1/3 cup basil, 1 1/2 cups mozzarella, 1 1/2 cups Parmesan, 1 teaspoon salt and pepper to taste. Fold in 1 cup of the cooled tomato sauce. Place the filling in a large piping bag and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the manicotti shells until they have softened slightly but still hold their tubular shape, 5 minutes.', u'Pour half of the tomato sauce into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Fill each shell with the ricotta mixture. Place the filled shells in the baking dish. Pipe any extra filling along the ends of the shells in the dish. Top with the remaining tomato sauce and sprinkle the remaining 1 1/2 cups mozzarella and 1 cup Parmesan over the top. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake until the sauce begins to bubble, 40 minutes. Remove the dish from the oven, remove the foil and turn the oven to broil. Put the manicotti back into the oven to broil until the cheese is browned and bubbling, 2 to 4 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.', u'Special equipment: a large piping bag']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 ounces bulk hot Italian sausage', u'4 ounces bulk sweet Italian sausage', u'1 cup chopped yellow onion', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u' Two 28-ounce cans crushed tomatoes', u'1 teaspoon granulated sugar', u'3 fresh bay leaves', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2/3 cup chopped fresh basil', u'2 cups ricotta', u'3 cups shredded low-moisture mozzarella', u'2 1/2 cups grated Parmesan', u' One 8-ounce package manicotti']
title: Manicotti with Italian Sausage

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u"For the meatballs, place the ground chicken, sausage, bread crumbs, garlic, parsley, Pecorino, Parmesan, milk, egg, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a bowl and combine gently with a fork. With a teaspoon, drop 1 to 1 1/4-inch meatballs onto a sheet pan lined with parchment paper. (You should have about 40 meatballs. They don't have to be perfectly round.) Bake for 30 minutes, until cooked through and lightly browned. Set aside.", u'In the meantime, for the soup, heat the olive oil over medium-low heat in a large heavy-bottomed soup pot. Add the onion, carrots, and celery and saute until softened, 5 to 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the chicken stock and wine and bring to a boil. Add the pasta to the simmering broth and cook for 6 to 8 minutes, until the pasta is tender. Add the fresh dill and then the meatballs to the soup and simmer for 1 minute. Taste for salt and pepper. Stir in the fresh spinach and cook for 1 minute, until the spinach is just wilted. Ladle into soup bowls and sprinkle each serving with extra grated Parmesan.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound ground chicken', u'1/2 pound chicken sausage, casings removed', u'2/3 cup fresh white bread crumbs', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic (2 cloves)', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1/4 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano', u'1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan, plus extra for serving', u'3 tablespoons milk', u'1 extra-large egg, lightly beaten', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons good olive oil', u'1 cup minced yellow onion', u'1 cup diced carrots (3 carrots), cut into 1/4 inch pieces', u'3/4 cup diced celery (2 stalks), cut into 1/4 inch pieces', u'10 cups homemade chicken stock', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1 cup small pasta such as tubetini or stars', u'1/4 cup minced fresh dill', u'12 ounces baby spinach, washed and trimmed']
title: Italian Wedding Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Pour the Prosecco and vodka into 2 Champagne flutes, diving equally. Spoon a scoop of sorbet into each flute. Sprinkle with mint and serve immediately']
ingredients: [u'1 cup chilled Prosecco (Italian sparkling white wine)', u'2 tablespoons chilled vodka', u'1/3 cup frozen lemon sorbet', u'1/4 teaspoon chopped fresh mint leaves']
title: Sgroppino (Italian Cocktail)

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'For the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and lightly flour three 9-inch cake pans.', u'Sift the flour and baking soda together and set aside.', u'With an electric mixer, cream the butter and shortening with the sugar until fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well between each addition. With the mixer on medium speed, add the flour and buttermilk alternately, beginning and ending with buttermilk. Add the vanilla, coconut and nuts, and stir well to incorporate.', u'In a separate bowl with clean beaters, whip the egg whites to stiff peaks. Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the batter, just until blended.', u'Pour the batter into the prepared pans and bake for 25 minutes. Test for doneness by touching the top of the cake with your finger. The cake is done if it bounces back up. Cool the layers on wire racks sprayed with cooking spray to prevent sticking.', u'For the frosting: With an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese with the butter on high speed until fluffy. Reduce the speed to medium and blend in the sugar and vanilla. Beat well until the frosting is smooth.', u'When the cake is completely cool, spread the frosting between the layers and on the sides and top of the cake. Sprinkle on the nuts.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, plus more for greasing', u'2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/2 cup vegetable shortening', u'2 cups sugar', u'5 large eggs, separated', u'1 cup buttermilk, well shaken', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 cup chopped pecans', u'1 cup sweetened shredded coconut', u' Cooking spray', u'8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter, at room temperature', u"1 pound confectioners' sugar", u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 cup chopped pecans']
title: Iced Italian Cream Cake

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 300 degrees F.', u'Combine all the seasoning ingredients in a medium jar.', u'Trim all the fat from beef round.  (I grind the trimmings), but you can cut them up into bite-size pieces and place on the bottom of a roasting pan. Sprinkle the trimmings with some of the seasoning mix. Place the roast beef on top of the trimmings and coat the beef well with more of the seasoning mix. Drizzle olive oil on top of the roast and pat the oil over the seasonings. Place into the preheated oven on lowest rack and roast approximately 1 1/2 to 2 hours, uncovered, until the internal temperature registers *130 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer. Remove from oven and let stand about 20 to 30 minutes before carving. This roast can be used for sandwiches, thinly cut or thickly cut and served with beef gravy, if desired.', u"*Cook's note: 1 1/2 to 2 hours (rare) 140 degrees F for medium, 160 degrees F for well.", u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup granulated garlic', u'1/4 cup granulated onion', u'1/2 cup dried basil', u'1/2 cup dried oregano', u'5 to 7-pound roast beef round', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil']
title: Italian Roast Beef

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add a tablespoon of olive oil and the beef. Cook, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until it is well browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then remove the beef and drain off the fat.', u'To the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and cook the peppers and onions until soft and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then add the garlic and cook for another minute. Add the tomato paste and cook for a minute or 2. Add the tomatoes, sugar, oregano and basil and bring to a simmer. Return the beef to the pan and simmer until the mixture is nice and thick, about 10 minutes. If it gets too thick, thin it with a little water. Remove from the heat and stir in the Parmesan and parsley. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper.', u'To serve: Spoon a nice portion of sauce over each of 4 slices of the Garlic Toast. Let the sauce cascade over the sides, then prop a second piece of Garlic Toast over to the side of each. Garnish with extra grated Parmesan and chopped parsley.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 1/2 pounds lean ground beef', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 red bell pepper, diced', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'5 cloves garlic, minced', u' One 6-ounce can tomato paste', u' One 28-ounce can crushed or diced tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon dried basil', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus extra for garnish', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley, plus extra for garnish', u' Garlic Toast, recipe follows, for serving', u'8 slices French bread', u'1 stick (8 tablespoons) butter, softened', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1/4 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Italian Sloppy Joes

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the macaroni and cook until al dente, according to the package directions. Drain in a colander, rinse with cold water and shake until very dry. Transfer the pasta to a large mixing bowl, drizzle 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over it and toss well to coat.', u'Add the chicken, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, peppers, salami, onions and parsley. Season with salt and toss well to combine.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and remaining 1/2 cup olive oil; pour it over the salad and toss well. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. For best flavor, let the salad stand at room temperature for about 30 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'3 cups dried elbow macaroni', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup cubed rotisserie chicken', u'1 cup diced English cucumber (about 1/3 cucumber)', u'1 cup halved cherry tomatoes', u'1/2 cup chopped pitted Nicoise olives', u'1/2 cup chopped roasted red peppers (about 1 whole)', u'1/2 cup 1/4-inch diced hard salami (about 4 ounces)', u'1/4 cup diced red onion (about 1/2 small)', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'4 ounces ricotta salata, grated, or crumbled feta cheese', u'1/3 cup red wine vinegar']
title: Italian Chicken Pasta Salad

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'For the dressing: Place the vinegar, honey, Italian seasoning, garlic and some salt and pepper in a blender or food processor. While the machine is running, slowly drizzle the olive oil until the dressing is combined and emulsified. Adjust the seasoning if necessary, or add more oil if you want it less acidic.', u'For the salad: Lay out the bacon in rows on the prepared baking sheet. Place in the oven on the upper rack and cook until crisp, 10 to 15 minutes. Once it is nice and crispy, chop it up for your salad.', u'In a large bowl, combine the bacon, pasta, gorgonzola, romaine, cabbage, iceberg, tomatoes and red onions. Add the dressing and toss together until all is well coated. Taste and adjust the seasoning.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed and chopped', u' Salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1 pound bacon', u'2 cups ditalini pasta, cooked al dente and cooled', u'1 cup crumbled gorgonzola', u'2 hearts romaine, chopped', u'1/4 small head red cabbage, chopped', u'1/4 head iceberg, chopped', u'1 to 2 large tomatoes, chopped', u'1/2 small red onion, minced']
title: Italian Chopped Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Rub the cut sides of the tomato along the coarse holes of a grater into a bowl; discard the skins.', u'Whisk in 1/4 cup water, the vinegar, lemon juice, dijon mustard, sugar, olive oil, garlic, oregano, basil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste.', u'Per serving (2 tablespoons): Calories 38; Fat 4 g (Saturated 1 g); Cholesterol 0 mg; Sodium 92 mg; Carbohydrate 1 g; Fiber 0 g; Protein 0 g', u'Photograph by Andrew McCaul']
ingredients: [u'1 medium tomato, halved', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons dijon mustard', u' Pinch of sugar', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 small clove garlic, minced', u'1/8 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/8 teaspoon dried basil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Light Italian Dressing

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Fill a large pot with 3 quarts of water and add the Old Bay seasoning and 1 tablespoon of salt. Bring to a boil, add the shrimp, lower the heat, and simmer for 3 minutes, until just firm. With a skimmer or slotted spoon, transfer the shrimp to a large bowl. Leave 2 cups of the poaching liquid in the pot and discard the rest.', u'Add the wine to the poaching liquid and bring to a boil. Add the scallops, lower the heat, and simmer for 2 minutes, until just cooked. With the skimmer, transfer the scallops to the bowl with the shrimp. Bring the poaching liquid back to a boil, add the calamari, and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes, until just cooked. Be careful not to overcook any of the seafood or it will be tough! With the skimmer, transfer the calamari to the bowl.', u"Bring the poaching liquid to a boil again, add the mussels, cover, and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes, until all the shells have opened, discarding any that don't open. Turn off the heat and set aside until the mussels in the broth are cool enough to handle. Remove the mussels from the shells and add to the bowl. Add 12 of the shells to the seafood and discard the rest. Set aside 1/2 cup of the poaching liquid, discarding the rest. Drain the seafood in a colander and put it all back into the bowl.", u'For the dressing, heat the olive oil in a medium (10-inch) saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic, oregano, and red pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute. (Be careful: Overcooked garlic will be bitter.) Add the tomatoes and cook over medium heat for 2 more minutes. Add the reserved poaching liquid, the limoncello, lemon zest, lemon juice, 1 tablespoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper and cook for 1 more minute. Pour the sauce over the seafood and toss gently. Add the fennel and parsley. Cut a lemon in half lengthwise, cut it thinly crosswise, and add it to the salad. Toss gently to combine and cover with plastic wrap. Chill for at least 3 hours or overnight.', u'To serve, sprinkle with 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and the juice of the remaining lemon. Taste for seasonings and serve cold or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon Old Bay seasoning', u' Kosher salt', u'1 1/2 pounds (16- to 20-count) peeled and deveined shrimp', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine', u'1 pound sea scallops, halved crosswise', u'1 pound cleaned fresh calamari, sliced crosswise in 1/2-inch-thick rings', u'2 pounds fresh mussels', u'1/2 cup good olive oil', u'4 teaspoons minced garlic (4 cloves)', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'3 plum tomatoes, seeds and pulp removed and medium-diced', u'1/3 cup limoncello liqueur', u' Grated zest of 1 lemon', u'1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (2 lemons)', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 small fennel bulb, trimmed, cored, and thinly sliced crosswise', u'1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, lightly packed', u'2 lemons']
title: Italian Seafood Salad

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'To make the meatballs, add the ground beef, grated Parmesan, 3 tablespoons of the parsley, the lemon juice, ground oregano, garlic, egg, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper to a bowl and mix together well. Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls.', u"In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the meatballs in batches, turning to brown all sides, 3 to 4 minutes per batch. No need to cook them all the way as they'll go back into the soup later. Remove them with a slotted spoon and set aside.", u'Now, grab some beef stock and pour it into a pot. Add some salt and pepper. Stir in the tomato paste--it adds so much yummy richness. Make a bouquet garni by adding the peppercorns, bay leaves and remaining 1/4 cup parsley to a piece of cheesecloth and tying it into a bundle using kitchen twine; drop it right into the soup. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 30 minutes.', u"Remove the bouquet garni, which now resembles a jellyfish with jaundice. Go ahead and discard it; it's lived a full life. Add the diced potatoes, carrots, celery and onions and the sliced cabbage. Finally, in go the browned meatballs. Let the soup simmer long enough for the vegetables to get slightly tender and the meatballs to cook all the way through, another 20 minutes or so.", u"You can sprinkle the soup with some freshly grated Parmesan if you'd like one last dose of decadence. Serve with crusty bread."]
ingredients: [u'12 ounces ground beef', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan, plus more for serving', u'1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons minced fresh parsley', u'2 teaspoons lemon juice', u'1/4 teaspoon ground oregano', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 large egg', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'7 cups low-sodium beef stock', u'2 heaping tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 teaspoon peppercorns', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 cup diced russet potatoes (not peeled)', u'3/4 cup diced carrots', u'3/4 cup diced celery', u'3/4 cup diced onions', u'8 ounces regular white cabbage, sliced', u'1 loaf crusty bread, for serving']
title: Italian Meatball Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Bechamel sauce:', u'In a 2-quart pot, melt 5 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
