ingredients: [u'1 recipe Basic Pizza Dough, recipe follows, or storebought refrigerated pizza dough from a can or tube', u'2 tablespoons yellow cornmeal', u'1 tablespoons olive oil', u'3/4 pound mild Italian sausage, remove from the casings', u'1 cup diced yellow onions', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'1/2 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh basil leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella', u'1 egg plus 2 teaspoons water, beaten together']
title: Spicy Italian Sausage and Cheese Bread

directions: [u'In a cast iron skillet, heat a small amount of olive oil. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add all the remaining vegetables, season with salt and pepper and bring to a simmer. Stir well and cover the pan. Let cook on a low flame for about 20 minutes, stirring often. Remove cover and continue to cook vegetables until tender and no cooking liquid remains in the skillet, about 15 minutes more. Adjust seasoning and serve hot, or cool down.']
ingredients: [u' Olive oil', u'1/4 pound fresh mushrooms, cleaned and sliced', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'4 Italian fryer peppers, sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, small diced', u'1 baby eggplant, sliced', u'2 ripe tomatoes, thinly sliced', u'2 medium zucchini, sliced', u'3 medium potatoes, diced', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Italian Giambotta

author: Michael Chiarello
directions: [u'Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the mushrooms and cook, without moving them, until brown on 1 side, about 1 minute. Continue to saute for another 1 to 2 minutes. Season mushrooms with salt and pepper and pour onto cookie sheet to cool. Set used pan aside.', u'In a separate, clean skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic. Cook until golden brown, about 1 to 2 minutes. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. In the pan where the mushrooms were, add 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add yellow squash. Cook until browned, about 1 to 2 minutes and drain onto same cookie sheet with mushrooms.', u'Place peppers in hot pan where squash was cooking, sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of thyme. When heated thoroughly, add peppers to waiting mushrooms and yellow squash. Add zucchini to the same pan, add remaining thyme, cook until browned, about 2 minutes. Pull both pans (onions and zucchini) off the heat, and add to cookie sheet with other vegetables.', u'In the former zucchini/mushroom pan, cook leeks to soften, about 2 minutes. In the other, bring the tomatoes to a simmer. Season the leeks with salt and pepper, to taste, and add spinach. When spinach is wilted, add cooked leeks to cooling vegetables on cookie sheet. Add basil to the tomatoes, then add tomatoes to cookie sheet. Stir gently, and top with Parmesan and serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 cups thinly sliced fresh wild or domestic mushrooms', u' Gray salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 onion, diced', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 pound yellow squash, cut into 1/4-inch dice, about 1 1/2 cups', u'1/4 cup diced red bell pepper, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh thyme leaves', u'1/2 pound zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch dice, about 1 1/2 cups', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced leek, white part only', u'3/4 cup peeled, seeded, and chopped vine-ripened tomatoes, about 1/2 pounds', u'1 cup loosely packed baby spinach, sliced', u'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh basil leaves', u'1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan']
title: Southern Italian Ratatouille

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place one scoop of ice cream in a glass dish and drown the ice cream in espresso. Add a generous splash of Frangelico and scatter shavings of dark chocolate over the top. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the hazelnuts over the chocolate and garnish with a Biscotti. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Vanilla ice cream', u' Freshly brewed hot espresso', u' Frangelico, hazelnut liqueur', u' Shavings of dark chocolate', u' Toasted hazelnuts, chopped', u' Biscotti', u' Pound cake, store-bought or homemade', u' Amaretto, almond-flavored liqueur', u' Swiss Chocolate ice cream', u' Toasted sliced almonds', u' Vin Santo, sweet Italian dessert wine, chilled, for dipping', u' Biscotti', u' Clementines', u' Chocolate covered salted caramels']
title: Three Italian Desserts

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat. Add the pasta cook it according to package directions.', u'While the pasta is cooking, in a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinaigrette, mayonnaise, and sugar.', u'Drain the pasta well, transfer to a large serving bowl, and let cool. Add the tomatoes, mushrooms, olives, green pepper, salt, to taste, and the black pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Sprinkle with the cheese, toss lightly, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more for seasoning', u'1 pound bow tie pasta', u'1 cup store-bought balsamic vinaigrette dressing', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 cups halved cherry tomatoes', u'1 (4-ounce) can sliced mushrooms, drained', u'2/3 cup pitted kalamata olives', u'1/2 diced green bell pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Grated Parmesan, for topping']
title: Paula's Italian Pasta Salad

directions: [u'In a small saute pan, add 1 tablespoon olive oil, onions, and garlic and cook until translucent. Remove and let cool. ', u'Tenderize flank steak with a meat mallet and cut into 1/4-inch pieces, approximately 5 by 8 inches long. Lightly season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.', u'Place carrots, red bell peppers, sun-dried tomato, and green onions in separate layers over the first 5 inches of the steak lengthwise. Top with garlic and onion mixture, then evenly coat with shredded mozzarella cheese and parsley.', u'Roll flank steak, starting with end that has vegetables, firmly without pushing out vegetables. Secure rolled steak with skewers.', u'To a rimmed plate stir the flour and Italian seasoning together and dredge the rolled flank steak, coating evenly.', u'Preheat oven to 300 degrees F.', u'In a medium saute pan heat 2 tablespoons olive oil and when hot add the rolled flank steak, searing on all sides for about 4 to 5 minutes until golden brown. Remove the flank steak from the pan and place on a baking sheet. Place in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 135 degrees F. on an instant-read thermometer. ', u'Place the saute pan back on burner and deglaze with the white wine. Stir, and reduce for 2 minutes, then add tomato sauce and chicken stock. Let mixture continue to reduce for 2 more minutes. Remove the steak from the oven and let rest. Slice on the bias 1/2-inch, shingle out, and top with sauce.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 cup onions, diced', u'3 tablespoons diced garlic', u'1 flank steak, about 2 pounds', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup thinly julienne carrots', u'1/2 cup roasted julienne red bell peppers', u'1/2 cup julienne oil packed sun-dried tomatoes', u'1/2 cup julienne green onions', u'3/4 cup shredded mozzarella', u'1/4 cup chopped parsley leaves', u'2 (6-inch) bamboo skewers', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons Italian seasoning', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'1 cup fire roasted tomato sauce', u'1/2 cup chicken stock']
title: Italian Flank Steak

directions: [u'Pulse first 5 ingredients in a blender or food processor until frothy. While the blender is running, trickle in the oils until the mixture emulsifies. Add salt and pepper, to taste.', u'For the Bruschetta Topping:', u'In a medium bowl, add all the ingredients and stir to combine. Set aside.  Allow to marinate for 1 to 12 hours.  If not using after 2 hours, cover and refrigerate. ', u'For the Marinara:', u'Add the oil to a medium saucepan over medium heat and stir in the onions, garlic, herbs and bay leaf. Saute until aromatic. Add the vinegar and wine and reduce by half. Stir in the diced tomatoes and water, bring to a simmer, and cook for 30 to 40 minutes. Adjust acidity with sugar, if necessary.', u'For the Fish:', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Lay the fillets out on a sheet pan, skin side down. ', u'In a small bowl combine 4 teaspoons of butter, the garlic, and parsley, and spread over each fillet.', u'Pour 1/4 cup of wine over the fillets and squeeze out the juice from the lemon wedges, making sure to put the used lemon skins on top of the fillets, for more flavor!', u'Put in the oven and bake for about 10 to 12 minutes, or until the flesh is white and firm.', u'While the fish is cooking, put a medium saute pan on high heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add the bruschetta mixture to the pan and saute until the juices are partially evaporated. Add the remaining 1/4 cup white wine and allow alcohol to burn off, about 2 minutes.', u'Remove the fillets from the oven and set aside until ready to serve.', u'Spoon about 1/2 cup of warm marinara sauce on the bottom of each plate and top with a fish fillet. Drizzle with the pan drippings, then top with the bruschetta mixture. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Garnish each plate with a generous portion of Parmesan cheese, chopped parsley and lemon wedges.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1 tablespoon freshly minced rosemary leaves', u'1/4 tablespoon freshly chopped thyme leaves', u'1 tablespoon freshly chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup balsamic vinegar', u'3/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3/4 cup olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 medium tomatoes, diced', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/2 cup diced onion', u'1/2 cup balsamic dressing (recommended: Lake Effect)', u'1/2 bunch freshly chopped basil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/2 cup small dice Spanish onion', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1/4 bunch freshly chopped parsley leaves', u'1/2 bunch freshly chopped basil leaves', u'1 bay leaf', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1/2 bottle red wine', u'1 (28-ounce) can diced tomatoes', u'1/4 cup water', u' Sugar, to taste', u'4 (12-ounce) skin-on haddock fillets', u'4 teaspoons butter, plus 1 tablespoon, room temperature', u'4 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons freshly chopped parsley leaves, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 cup white wine, plus another 1/4 cup for cooking and the rest for drinking', u'1 lemon, cut in wedges, plus more for garnish', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup grated Parmesan']
title: Italian Fish

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F and grease and flour 3 (9-inch) cake pans.', u'In the bowl of an electric mixer cream the shortening, butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolks 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift the flour, baking soda and salt together onto a sheet of waxed or parchment paper. With the mixer on low speed, add the sifted ingredients in batches alternately with the buttermilk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.', u'In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff, and gently fold into the prepared batter. Add the coconut, pecans and vanilla and fold into the batter. Divide the batter among the 3 prepared cake pans and bake for about 25 minutes, or until golden brown and a tester comes out clean when inserted into the middle of each cake. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for about 10 minutes before turning them out onto a wire rack to finish cooling. When the cakes are completely cool, stack the layers with the frosting and frost the sides and top.', u'While the cake is baking, prepare the frosting. In a large bowl combine the cream cheese, butter and vanilla and, using an electric mixer, beat until smooth and creamy. Add the sifted powdered sugar and mix until thoroughly combined. Add the nuts and fold together. Keep refrigerated until you are ready to frost the cake.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup shortening, room temperature', u'1 stick butter, room temperature', u'2 cups sugar', u'5 eggs, separated and at room temperature', u'2 cups flour', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup buttermilk, at room temperature', u'2 cups shredded coconut', u'1 cup finely chopped pecans or walnuts', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, at room temperature', u'1/4 cup butter, softened at room temperature', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 (16-ounce) box powdered sugar, sifted', u'3/4 cup finely chopped pecans or walnuts']
title: Italian Cream Cake (From Beth Lott's Mom)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Split the bread in half lengthwise. Top the bottom half with the mortadella, capicola, salami, prosciutto and provolone.', u'Toss the giardiniera in a bowl with the olives, peppers and olive oil. Tear out the soft center of the top bread half to make a shell. Pack the lettuce into the center of the bread and top with the giardiniera mixture. Carefully put the two sandwich halves together, pressing to keep the filling inside. Secure with small skewers and cut into pieces.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'1 14 -inch loaf Italian bread', u'1/2 pound sliced mortadella', u'1/4 pound sliced capicola', u'1/4 pound sliced Genoa salami or hot soppressata', u'1/4 pound sliced prosciutto', u'1/4 pound sliced aged provolone cheese', u'2 1/3 cups giardiniera (Italian pickled vegetables), drained and chopped', u'1 cup sliced pitted Cerignola olives (black and green)', u'1/2 cup chopped jarred Peppadew peppers', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 cups chopped romaine lettuce']
title: Italian Party Sub

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'In a pie plate or platter, combine the bread crumbs, Parmesan, thyme, basil, oregano, salt, garlic powder, and red pepper. Dip the chicken strips in the melted butter, then dredge them in the bread crumb mixture. Place the chicken strips in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Serve the chicken sticks hot with marinara sauce, or serve hot or cold with honey mustard.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup seasoned bread crumbs', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan', u'11/2 teaspoons dried thyme', u'11/2 teaspoons dried basil', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u' Pinch ground red pepper', u'8 boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1/2-inch strips', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) melted butter', u' Marinara sauce or honey mustard, for dipping']
title: Italian Chicken Sticks

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'To make the Chocolate Cookies, in a large bowl use an electric mixer to cream together the butter and sugar until light in color and fluffy. In another medium bowl stir together the flour, cornmeal or polenta, cocoa powder, baking powder, salt, and orange zest. Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and stir to combine using a wooden spoon. Place the dough on a sheet of plastic wrap. Press the dough into a 1-inch high round. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes and up to 1 day.', u'Roll out the dough to between 1/8 and 1/4-inch thick. Use a 1 3/4-inch round cookie cutter to cut out the dough. Bake on a heavy baking sheet for 15 minutes. Place the baking sheets on a wire rack to cool cookies.', u'Meanwhile, to make the Orange Filling, combine the butter, powdered sugar, orange zest, and salt in a medium bowl. Use an electric mixer to cream the ingredients together.', u'To assemble the cookie sandwiches, place about 1 teaspoon of the Orange Filling on a cookie. Top with another cookie and press the cookies together. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 day.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup unsalted butter, room temperature (2 sticks)', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 cup cornmeal or polenta', u'1/3 cup cocoa powder', u'1 1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 orange, zested', u'1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature (1 stick)', u'3/4 cup powdered sugar', u'1/2 orange, zested', u' Pinch salt']
title: Italian Chocolate Sandwich Cookie

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u"Fill a large bowl with ice water. Place another bowl inside so it's surrounded on all sides by the ice water. In a medium saucepan, bring water and sugar to a boil. When sugar has dissolved, remove from heat and add lime juice. Pour into bowl sitting in the ice bath to cool lime mixture, about 15 minutes. Pour mixture into a 10 by 12-inch baking dish that's sitting on a sheet tray and put in the freezer. After 1 1/2 hours, remove from freezer and scrape the ice with a fork, being sure to mix the softer center with the more frozen outer edges. Put back into the freezer for another 1 1/2 hours. Before serving, scrape again using the fork."]
ingredients: [u'3 cups water', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'1/2 cup lime juice']
title: Lime Italian Ice

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Lightly coat 2 (8-inch) cake pans with cooking spray; set aside. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, butter, buttermilk, egg whites, and extracts. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping down sides of the bowl as needed. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Fold in crushed pineapple, coconut, and 1 cup pecans.  Divide batter into 2 prepared cake pans. Bake in preheated oven for 31 to 36 minutes or until tester inserted in middle comes out clean.  Cool in pans for 10 minutes then turn out on to wire racks to cool completely.', u'In a small bowl, stir together remaining 1 cup pecans and frosting.  With a serrated knife, cut both cakes horizontally to make 4 layers.  Frost the top of each layer with 1/2 cup of frosting and stack on top of the next layer. Use remaining frosting to frost the entire outside of cake.  Slice and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 (18.25-ounce) box white cake mix (recommended: Betty Crocker)', u'1 stick butter, softened', u'1 1/4 cups buttermilk', u'3 egg whites', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract (recommended: McCormick)', u'1/4 teaspoon almond extract (recommended: McCormick)', u'1 (8-ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained (recommended: Dole)', u"1/2 cup sweetened flake coconut (recommended: Baker's)", u'2 cups chopped pecans, divided (recommended: Diamond)', u'2 (16-ounce) cans cream cheese frosting (recommended: Betty Crocker)']
title: Italian Wedding Cake

directions: [u'Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion; cook 3 minutes or until slightly soft. Add sausage links to pan; cook 12 - 14 minutes or until sausage is browned and almost cooked through.', u'Remove sausage links to cutting board and allow them to cool before coin slicing. Stir in carrots, parsnips, mushrooms, celery and Swiss chard into the Dutch oven. Add the barley, tomatoes, stock, wine, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Add sliced sausage to the pot. Stir to combine all the ingredients.', u'Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat and continue to simmer for up to 1 hour or until the barley is cooked.  Serve with crusty Italian bread.']
ingredients: [u'1 pkg. Johnsonville\xae Mild Italian Sausage links, coin sliced', u'2 tbsp. extra virgin olive oil', u'2 med. onions, coarsely chopped', u'4 med. carrots, cut into 1" chunks', u'4 small parsnips, cut into 1" chunks', u'8 oz. baby bella or white button mushrooms, halved', u'2 stalks celery, cut into 1" chunks', u'3 cups chopped swiss chard, stems removed, roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup barley, uncooked', u'1 28 oz. can Italian plum tomatoes (in juice)', u'1 14 .5 oz. can chicken stock', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'1 tsp. Italian seasoning', u'1/2 tsp. ground black pepper', u'1/2 tsp. salt']
title: Braised Italian Sausage Stew

directions: [u'Heat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Clean chicken, rinse with cold water and pat dry. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 1/3-cup olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. When oil is hot, carefully place chicken in pan using tongs. Breasts and thighs first, then the rest. Brown well on all sides, remove chicken from pan. Pour off all but a few tablespoons of oil. Return chicken to skillet and place uncovered in preheated oven for 25 minutes, turning chicken once or twice.', u'Heat 2 cups of canola oil to 350 degrees F.', u'While chicken is cooking have potatoes peeled, wedged, rinsed and dry.  Carefully add wedges into hot oil, about 4 at a time. Avoid crowding. Fry potatoes until golden and remove and let drain on paper towel and reserve for later.', u'For the last 5 minutes of cooking for the chicken, add the cooked potatoes, garlic, oregano and wine to skillet, return to oven.', u'Remove skillet from oven to stove top after the 5 minutes, add parsley and gently turn with a spoon.', u'Remove chicken to a large platter, arrange potatoes atop the chicken and pour the pan juices over all.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 fryer chicken, about 2 to 3 pounds, cut into 8 pieces (2 wings, 2 breasts, 2 legs, 2 thighs)', u'2 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/3 cup olive oil', u'2 cups canola oil, for frying', u'3 large Idaho or russet potatoes, peeled and cut into thick wedges', u'2 clove garlic, peeled and mashed', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'2 tablespoons chopped parsley leaves']
title: The Italian Village Chicken Vesuvio Recipe

directions: [u'In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat and saute the onion until fragrant and translucent. Add the Italian sausage meat, breaking it up with the back of a wooden spoon and brown it until no longer pink, about 10 to 12 minutes. Drain the excess fat from the sausage meat, and set aside to cool. ', u'In a large mixing bowl stir together the drained and squeeze-dried spinach, ricotta, 1 1/2 cups Parmesan, eggs, cooled Italian sausage and onion mixture, salt, and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.', u'Place the oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the fresh pasta rectangles for 1 minute and remove with a slotted spatula. Set aside. ', u'In a 9 by 13-inch baking dish, spread 2 cups tomato sauce. Working with 1 pasta rectangle at a time, spread 6 tablespoons filling along one edge and roll the pasta sheet up tightly, leaving the ends open. Repeat until you have 8 cannelloni.', u'Arrange the prepared cannelloni, seam-side down, in a single layer in the baking dish. Spoon the remaining 2 cups tomato sauce evenly over the cannelloni. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup grated Parmesan over top.', u'Bake the cannelloni for 20 minutes and let it stand for 10 minutes before serving.', u'Serve the cannelloni with extra tomato sauce from the baking dish and garnish with fresh basil.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 medium yellow onion, diced', u'8 ounces sweet Italian sausage, casings removed or bulk sausage meat', u'1 (10-ounce) box frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry', u'1 (15-ounce) container ricotta cheese', u'1 1/2 cups plus 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese', u'3 large eggs', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Fresh Pasta Dough, rolled out and cut into 6 by-7-inch rectangles, recipe follows', u'4 cups Simple Tomato Sauce, recipe follows', u' Fresh basil, for garnish', u' Fresh Pasta Dough', u'2 cups flour', u'3 eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil', u' Simple Tomato Sauce', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 medium yellow onion, diced', u'3 garlic cloves, peeled and sliced', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh basil or 1 tablespoon dried basil', u'2 (28-ounce) cans diced tomatoes', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Italian Sausage, Spinach, and Ricotta Cannelloni

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a small bowl, mix together the jam, mustard and rosemary. Lay out the slices of bread. Divide the mustard mixture evenly over the 8 slices of bread and spread almost to the edges. Put a slice of cheese on each piece of bread, followed by 2 slices of prosciutto. Put together 2 of the bread slices for each sandwich.', u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs. Add the heavy cream and salt and whisk to combine.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil to the pan and heat for 1 minute. Working with one sandwich at a time, dip both sides of the sandwich in the batter and place directly into the hot pan. Repeat with the remaining sandwiches. Cover with a lid and allow to cook until the first side is golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the lid, flip each sandwich and continue to cook on the remaining side until golden brown and the cheese is melted, approximately another 4 minutes. (Or cook in batches if needed.)', u'Sprinkle one side of each sandwich with powdered sugar and serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup seedless red raspberry jam', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary', u'8 slices brioche bread', u'8 thin slices Swiss cheese', u'16 thin slices prosciutto cotto', u'4 large eggs, at room temperature', u'3/4 cup heavy cream, at room temperature', u'1/8 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 tablespoons powdered sugar']
title: Italian Monte Cristo

directions: [u'In a bowl combine the pork, curing salt, black pepper, fennel seeds, garlic, sugar and cayenne pepper. Mix to make sure seasonings are well distributed throughout the pork. Freeze for 30 minutes.', u'To prepare the forcemeat, pass the mixture through a meat grinder using the large hole plate. Transfer to an electric mixer, using the paddle on the lowest speed, and mix for 1 minute. Increase the speed to medium and slowly add the stock and mix for 2 minutes. Switch to high speed and mix for 30 seconds.', u'To form the sausages, place about a cup of forcemeat in a 12 by 16-inch piece of plastic wrap. Shape into a 1 1/2 by 8-inch sausage and wrap with the plastic to a tight roll. Tie both ends by forming a knot. Wrap again in aluminum foil. Repeat the process until all forcemeat is used.', u'In a large saute pan bring court bouillon to a simmer. Poach the prepared sausages for 10 minutes or until firm to the touch. Allow to cool and unwrap sausages. In a cast iron pan, over high heat, saute the sausages in olive oil until nicely browned. Slice and serve with honey mustard and minced onion.']
ingredients: [u'5 pounds pork butt, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 3/4 ounces curing salt (salt peter)', u'2 teaspoons black pepper', u'2 tablespoons fennel seeds, toasted', u'1/4 cup chopped garlic', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cayenne pepper', u'3/4 cup chicken stock, iced', u' Court bouillon, for poaching', u' Olive oil, for sauteing', u' Honey mustard, to taste', u' Minced onion, to taste']
title: Sweet Italian Fennel Sausage

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Rinse steak under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Place in large resealable bag. Add salad dressing, 1/2 cup pasta sauce, and garlic to bag. Gently massage to mix marinade. Marinate in refrigerator for 1 to 8 hours.', u'In a small saucepan combine remaining pasta sauce, wine, and seasoning. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and keep warm.', u'Remove steak from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking and bring to room temperature. Preheat grill to medium-high. Just before cooking, clean and oil grate.', u'Remove steak from bag and discard marinade. Place steak on grill. Cook for 6 to 7 minutes per side. Serve hot with warm sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds flank steak', u'1/2 cup light Italian salad dressing', u'1 1/2 cups tomato basil pasta sauce', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1/4 cup Chianti red wine', u'1 teaspoon Italian seasoning']
title: Italian Beef

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the crostini: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Arrange the baguette slices in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Mix the oil, garlic, oregano and fennel seeds in a small bowl. Brush the oil mixture over the top of the baguette slices. Sprinkle lightly with pepper. Bake the baguette slices until lightly toasted but still slightly soft, 12 to 15 minutes.', u'For the fondue: Mix together the beer and mustard in a small bowl. Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add the sausage, onions, fennel seeds, salt and pepper. Break the sausage into smaller pieces with a wooden spoon and cook until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in the flour. Add the beer mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Gradually add the Cheddar, fontina and Parmesan, stirring constantly, until the cheese is melted and smooth. Keep warm over low heat. If the fondue becomes too thick, gradually stir in extra beer, 1 tablespoon at a time.', u'Serve the fondue with the crostini.']
ingredients: [u' Eighteen 1/3-inch-thick baguette slices, cut diagonally', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh oregano', u'2 teaspoons fennel seeds, crushed using a mortar and pestle or place in a zip top bag and crush with a rolling pin', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup beer, such as a brown ale, pale ale or lager, at room temperature, plus extra, as needed', u'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 pound sweet Italian sausage, casings removed', u'1 medium onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'2 teaspoons fennel seeds, crushed using a mortar and pestle or place in a zip top bag and crush with a rolling pin', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups packed coarsely grated extra-sharp white Cheddar (about 8 ounces)', u'2 cups packed coarsely grated fontina (about 8 ounces)', u'1/2 cup finely grated Parmesan']
title: Beer and Italian Sausage Fondue

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Cook the bacon in a medium pot over medium heat for about 2 minutes. Add the sausage and cook with the bacon until browned, about 5 minutes more. Add the onions and Essence and cook, stirring often, until the onions are softened, about 5 minutes. ', u'Add the crushed red pepper and garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the bay leaves, tomatoes, and chicken stock and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer for about 30 minutes. Season, to taste, with salt and black pepper. Stir in the cilantro, ladle into warm soup bowls, and serve with crusty bread.']
ingredients: [u'4 slices bacon, diced', u'2 pounds Italian sausage, removed from casings and crumbled', u'2 cups finely chopped red onions', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Essence, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 bay leaves', u'8 cups chopped, seeded tomatoes', u'6 cups chicken stock', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Crusty bread, for serving']
title: Italian Sausage and Tomato Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a heavy small skillet over medium heat. Crack the egg into the skillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and cook until the white is firm and the yolk is almost set, about 4 minutes. Season with salt.', u'Meanwhile, toast the bread until golden brown. Rub the garlic over the toast. Sprinkle with the Parmesan. Spoon the drained marinara sauce over the Parmesan. Top with the egg. Place the open-faced sandwich on a plate and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 large egg', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 slice rustic white bread (1/2-inch-thick)', u'1 garlic clove', u'1 tablespoon grated Parmesan', u'1/4 cup warm Simple Tomato Sauce, recipe follows, or store-bought chunky marinara sauce, drained of excess liquid']
title: Italian Egg Sandwich

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Combine the ground turkey, ricotta, pesto, parmesan, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a large bowl. Mix with your hands until just combined. Form into 24 small meatballs (about 1 tablespoon each); transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Broil until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a medium Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic, Italian seasoning and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring, until the onion is softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth, 2 cups water, the escarole and ditalini. Cover and bring to a boil, then partially uncover and reduce the heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook until the pasta is al dente, about 10 minutes.', u'Add the meatballs and simmer, uncovered, until warmed through, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle each serving with olive oil and sprinkle with parmesan and parsley.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground turkey', u'1/4 cup part-skim ricotta cheese', u'1/4 cup pesto', u'1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese, plus more for topping', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling', u'1 onion, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 head escarole (about 1 pound), tough outer leaves removed, roughly chopped', u'4 ounces ditalini pasta (about 3/4 cup)', u' Chopped fresh parsley, for topping']
title: Italian Wedding Soup

author: Michael Chiarello
directions: [u'Divide ice cubes between 4 tumblers. Garnish each glass with 1 orange slice and 2 maraschino cherries.', u'In a pitcher, blend the bourbon, vermouth and bitters and pour into tumblers.', u'Note: If you like your cocktails to be a bit sweeter, you can stir 3 teaspoons of sugar into the pitcher before pouring the drinks.']
ingredients: [u'16 ice cubes', u'4 orange slices', u'8 maraschino cherries', u"10 ounces Kentucky bourbon whiskey (recommended: Maker's Mark)", u'4 ounces vermouth', u'3 ounces Italian bitters (recommended: Campari)', u'3 teaspoons sugar, optional']
title: Michael's Italian Manhattan

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Lay the puff pastry sheets out on a flat work surface. Split the sausage casings lengthwise and turn the mild sausage meat out onto 1 pastry sheet and the hot sausage meat out onto the other pastry sheet. Gently pat the meat out to fit the pastry sheets, being careful to leave a 1/2-inch strip bare on both long sides of each sheet. Top with 3 tablespoons of Romano and 5 basil leaves per sheet. Starting with 1 of the bare strips, roll the pastry tightly around the filling. The bare strip on the far end will stick to itself.', u'Place the rolls in the freezer for at least 1 hour; they should be just frozen enough to make slicing easy. (The recipe can be made to this point 1 week in advance.) Slice the rolls into 1/2-inch pieces, place on baking sheets and place in the oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove and let cool 5 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed', u'3 mild sausage links', u'3 hot sausage links', u'6 tablespoons grated Romano', u'10 fresh basil leaves']
title: Italian Sausage Rolls

directions: [u'In a large sauce pot (8-quart size minimum), heat 1/4 cup of the olive oil on a very low flame. Add the diced onion and cook slowly until it has turned translucent. Do not brown the onion, but allow it to almost melt away. Add the garlic cloves and very lightly cook them in the oil until golden before adding the tomatoes and all their juices. Add salt and pepper to taste, and the basil leaves and set the heat on low. Allow the tomatoes to cook at very low heat for at least 2 hours before adding the meat.', u'Make the meatballs: mix the ground beef and veal together in a large bowl. Combine the bread and milk and mash together to form a paste; add the bread to the ground meat. Add the eggs, garlic, parsley, cheese, salt, and pepper to the meat mixture and combine all the ingredients using your fingers to mix uniformly, but do not over mix or the meat will dry out when cooked. Pick up 2 tablespoons of the mixture and roll it into a ball shape, between the palms of your hands. Do this until you have used all the meat. This should yield approximately 24 meatballs.', u"Place the remaining olive oil in a heavy skillet and heat over medium flame. Add the meatballs in 1 layer and brown on all sides before removing. Do this to the remaining meatballs until all are browned to a caramelized color. After all the meatballs have been browned and removed from the skillet, add the sausage links and brown well, following the same method as the meatballs. When all the meat has cooked, add to the tomato ragu, which has been cooking for 2 hours and cook an additional hour. Serve the tomato ragu over rigatoni pasta cooked to manufacturer's directions. Serve the meats on another plate as a second course."]
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 medium onion, finely diced', u'2 cloves garlic, peeled, left whole', u'2 quarts San Marzano plum tomatoes, peeled and passed through a food mill or processor', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'12 to 15 fresh basil leaves', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 pound ground veal (or ground pork may also be added)', u' Several pieces of day old bread, crust removed, about 3 slices', u'1/4 cup milk', u'2 whole eggs', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', u'1/4 cup chopped Italian parsley leaves', u'1/3 cup grated Parmesan', u' Salt and pepper', u' Rigatoni, cooked', u'2 pounds Italian pork sausage with fennel seeds', u' Salt and pepper']
servings: 6 to 8 servings as a first course
title: Italian Ragu with Meatballs and Sausage

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'Line 2 heavy large baking sheets with parchment paper. Using an electric mixer, beat the butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt in a large bowl until fluffy. Beat in the egg. Add the flour and mix just until a dough forms.', u'Fit a pastry bag with a large star tip, and fill the pastry bag with the cookie dough. Pipe the dough onto the prepared baking sheets into stars, spacing 1-inch apart. If desired, press about 4 miniature chocolate chips into the center of each star at this point. Bake the cookies until they are pale golden around the edges and on the bottom, about 15 minutes. Cool the cookies for 5 minutes. Using a metal spatula, transfer the cookies to a rack and cool completely. ', u'When the cookies have cooled, spoon approximately 1/4 teaspoon of preserves atop the flat side of 1 cookie. Press a second cookie onto the preserves. Repeat with the remaining cookies and preserves. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Store between sheets of waxed paper in an airtight container at room temperature.)', u"Cook's Notes: Alternately, the cookies can be made into thumbprint cookies. To do so, refrigerate the dough until it is cold, about 2 hours. Roll 2 teaspoons of dough for each cookie into 1-inch-diameter ball. Place the cookies on the baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart. Make a deep indentation in the center of each cookie by pressing the back of a teaspoon into the cookies. Fill each indentation with 1/2 teaspoon of strawberry or raspberry preserves or chocolate chips, and bake as directed.", u'A chilled chocolate ganache may be used in place of the preserves to fill the indentations in these cookies. To do this, do not fill the indentations before baking the cookies. While the cookies bake, make the ganache by mixing equal parts of warm cream and chocolate until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth, then chill the ganache. Once the cookies have baked and cooled, and the chocolate ganache is cold and firm but still spreadable, spoon or pipe the chilled ganache into the empty indentations on the cookies.']
ingredients: [u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 large egg', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup miniature chocolate chips, optional', u'1/2 cup strawberry, raspberry or other fruit preserves']
title: Italian American Cookie Sandwiches

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'Using a serrated knife, slice about 1 inch off the top crust of the Italian bread. Carefully tear out the insides of the loaf, leaving about 3/4-inch of bread to form a shell. Put the loaf on the prepared baking sheet, drizzle inside with some olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Bake until slightly crispy, about 10 minutes. Cool on a baking rack while you make the eggs. Preheat the broiler.', u'Heat the 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the sausage and cook, breaking it up with a wooden spoon, until golden brown. Remove the sausage to a paper-towel-lined plate.', u'Add the onion and the green and red peppers to the skillet; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 minutes. Reduce the heat slightly, then add the chiles, sausage, parsley and basil; toss to combine. Stir in the eggs and about two-thirds of the provolone and cook, stirring, until the eggs just begin to set, less than 1 minute.', u'Pour the egg mixture into the bread shell and top with the Parmesan and the remaining provolone. Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the eggs are just cooked through, about 3 minutes. (You can use a cake tester to check--insert it into the eggs to see if it comes out with raw egg on it.)', u'Transfer to a cutting board, let set for 1 or 2 minutes, and then slice into 4 to 6 wedges.']
ingredients: [u'1 round loaf good-quality Italian bread', u' Olive oil, for drizzling, plus 2 tablespoons', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces loose sweet Italian sausage', u'1 small Spanish onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'2 jarred Calabrian chiles, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'2 tablespoons torn fresh basil', u'10 large eggs, whisked until frothy', u'6 ounces grated provolone', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan']
title: Italian Egg Bread Bowl

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt water and cook pasta to a chewy al dente, about 8 minutes.', u'In a nonstick skillet, brown and crumble the sausage. Drain cooked crumbles on paper towel lined plate. Return pan to heat and add extra-virgin olive oil, butter, garlic and mushrooms. Season liberally with salt and pepper. Saute 3 to 5 minutes, until mushrooms are lightly golden.', u'Preheat broiler to high.', u'To mushrooms, add flour and stir, cooking 2 minutes. Whisk in stock, then stir in cream. Bring cream to a bubble, then stir in 2 cups of 4 cheese blend. When cheese has melted into sauce, add tomatoes. When sauce comes to a bubble, remove from heat and adjust seasonings, adding hot sauce if desired.', u'Combine cheese sauce with sausage and pasta, transfer to baking dish, casserole or oven safe serving platter. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup of 4 cheese blend and the grated Parmesan over the top and brown under hot broiler.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ziti rigate, penne rigate or cavatappi (ribbed, hollow corkscrews)', u'1 pound Italian bulk sweet sausage', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'3 or 4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'12 crimini mushrooms, sliced', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 (10-ounce) sack, 2 1/2 cups, shredded Italian 4 cheese blend, available on dairy aisle', u'1 can diced tomatoes, drained well', u'1 teaspoon hot sauce (recommended: Tabasco), optional', u'1/2 cup Parmesan, a couple of handfuls']
title: Italian Mac-n-Cheese

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the doughnuts: In a medium saucepan, combine the butter, water, sugar, and salt over medium heat. Bring to a rolling boil, stirring occasionally. Boil for 10 seconds. Remove the pan from the heat and add the flour. Using a wooded spoon, quickly stir the mixture until all the flour is fully incorporated and forms a thick dough. Return the pan to the heat and stir continuously for 2 minutes. Scrape the mixture into a stand mixture fitted with a paddle attachment. With the machine running on medium speed, add the eggs and egg yolk, 1 at a time until fully incorporated. Beat the mixture for 4 to 5 minutes until thick and glossy. Add the lemon zest and beat until smooth. Refrigerate the dough for 15 minutes.', u'For the glaze: In a medium bowl, whisk together the cream, coffee liqueur, and espresso powder until smooth. With a wooden spoon, gradually stir in the powdered sugar until smooth. If the glaze is too thick, stir in the water, 1/4 teaspoon at a time.', u"In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan, pour in enough oil to fill the pan about a third of the way. Heat over medium heat until a deep-frying thermometer inserted in the oil reaches 375 degrees F. (If you don't have a thermometer a cube of bread will brown in a couple of minutes.)", u'Using a small ice cream scoop or 2 small spoons, carefully drop scoops (about 1 tablespoon) of the dough into the oil. (Do not crowd the pan,) Cook for 3 to 3 1/2 minutes, turning occasionally, until the zeppole are golden and puffed. Drain on paper towels. Repeat until all of the dough has been used. When the zeppole is cool enough to handle, dip the top halves in the glaze.', u'Using a hand grater, grate the chocolate, if using, over serving plates. Place 3 to 4 zeppole on each plate and garnish with fresh raspberries, if using. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces (1 stick) unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'3 eggs', u'1 egg yolk', u'2 teaspoons lemon zest (from 1 lemon)', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1/4 cup whipping cream', u'1 tablespoon coffee liqueur (recommended: Kahlua)', u'2 teaspoons espresso powder', u'2 cups powdered sugar', u' Water, as needed', u'1 (3-ounce) chocolate bar, optional', u'1 cup raspberries, optional']
title: Coffee-Glazed Italian Doughnuts (Zeppole)

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'For the crostini: Lay the baguette slices on a baking sheet. Brush with the oil and then sprinkle with the salt, garlic powder and some fresh pepper. Bake for 15 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through. Remove the crostini from the oven and set aside. Turn the oven to broil.', u'For the dip: In medium bowl, combine the ricotta with salt and pepper to taste. Mix until fully combined, then transfer to an 8-by-8-inch pan, spreading the mixture evenly across the bottom. Set aside.', u'In a large pan with a lid, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions, and sweat for 3 to 5 minutes. Add the halved grape tomatoes, chicken stock and garlic and bring to a boil; cover and reduce the heat to low. Cook until the tomatoes have softened and the mixture has thickened, about 15 minutes.', u'While the tomatoes are cooking, add the sausage to a saute pan over high heat. Break up sausage with a wooden spoon and cook it through. When the sausage is finished, spoon it directly over the ricotta and spread it out evenly.', u'When the tomatoes are done, spoon them over the sausage layer. Top the tomato layer with the sliced pepperoncini, marinated artichokes and roasted peppers. Place the halved ciliegine on top.', u'Place the dip under the broiler and broil on high heat until the cheese has browned slightly, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Remove the dip from the broiler and top with the basil. Serve immediately with the crostini.']
ingredients: [u'1 baguette, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups ricotta', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'2 cups grape tomatoes, halved', u'1/2 cup chicken stock', u'5 cloves garlic, chopped', u'12 ounces spicy Italian sausage, casings removed', u'1/2 cup sliced pepperoncini, drained', u' One 12-ounce jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped', u' One 12-ounce jar roasted red peppers, drained and chopped', u' One 8-ounce container fresh mozzarella ciliegine, drained and cut in half', u'8 leaves basil, cut into chiffonade']
title: Italian Seven-Layer Dip

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.', u'Beat the egg whites until stiff. Set aside.', u'In a large bowl, cream together the butter, oil and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Mix in the egg yolks, vanilla and coconut.', u'In a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking soda and baking powder. Alternate adding the buttermilk and dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Mix until just combined, and then fold in the egg whites.', u'Pour evenly into the prepared pans and bake until a toothpick comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Then turn the cakes out onto cooling racks and allow to cool completely.', u'For the frosting: In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, butter, vanilla and powdered sugar. Beat until light and fluffy. Stir in the pecans and coconut.', u'To assemble: Cut each cake in half lengthwise so you are left with 4 layers. Spread the first layer with frosting and top with blueberries. Repeat the cake, frosting and blueberry layers until you have 4 layers of cake. Arrange more blueberries around the edge of each layer for structure.']
ingredients: [u'5 eggs, separated', u'1 stick butter', u'1 cup vegetable oil', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'1 cup sweetened flaked coconut', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 cup buttermilk (or 1 cup milk mixed with1 teaspoon white vinegar)', u' Two 8-ounce packages cream cheese', u'1 stick butter', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 pounds powdered sugar', u'1 cup chopped pecans', u'1 cup sweetened flaked coconut', u'1 1/2 pints or 3 small containers blueberries']
title: Billie's Italian Cream Cake with Blueberries

directions: [u'Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'Bring the stock to the boil in a large saucepan and add the cabbage, cavolo nero and/or kale. Cook for a few minutes until softened (you may have to do this in 2 batches). Remove the cabbage to a large bowl, leaving the stock in the pan.', u'Toast all but 5 of the bread slices on a hot griddle pan or in a toaster, then rub them on 1 side with the garlic halves, and set aside. ', u'Next, heat a large 4-inch-deep ovenproof casserole-type pan on the stove top, pour in a couple of glugs of olive oil and add your pancetta and anchovies. When the pancetta is golden brown and sizzling, add the rosemary and cooked cabbage and toss to coat the greens in all the lovely flavors. Put the mixture and all the juices back into the large bowl. ', u"Place 4 of the toasted slices in the casserole-type pan, in 1 layer. Spread over 1/3 of the cabbage leaves, sprinkle over a 1/4 of the grated fontina and Parmesan and add a drizzle of olive oil. Repeat this twice, but don't stress if your pan's only big enough to take layers - that's fine. Just pour in all the juices remaining in the bowl and end with a layer of untoasted bread on top. Push down on the layers with your hands. ", u'Pour the stock gently over the top until it just comes up to the top layer. Push down again and sprinkle over the remaining fontina and Parmesan. Add a good pinch of salt and pepper and drizzle over some good-quality olive oil. Bake in the preheated oven for around 30 minutes, or until crispy and golden on top. ', u"When the soup is ready, divide it between your bowls. Melt the butter in a frying pan and quickly fry the sage leaves until they're just crisp and the butter is lightly golden (not burned!). Spoon a bit of the flavored butter and sage leaves over the soup and add another grating of Parmesan. Such a great combo! ", u'"Our agreement with the producers of "Jamie at Home" only permit us to make 2 recipes per episode available online.  Food Network regrets the inconvenience to our viewers and foodnetwork.com users"']
ingredients: [u'3 quarts good-quality chicken or vegetable stock', u'1 Savoy cabbage, stalks removed, outer leaves separated, washed and roughly chopped', u'2 big handfuls cavolo nero and/or kale, stalks removed, leaves washed', u' and roughly chopped', u' About 16 slices stale country-style or sourdough bread', u'1 clove garlic, unpeeled, cut in 1/2', u' Olive oil', u'12 to 14 slices pancetta or bacon', u'1 (4-ounce) can anchovy fillets, in oil', u'3 sprigs fresh rosemary, leaves picked', u'7 ounces fontina cheese, grated', u'5 ounces freshly grated Parmesan, plus a little for serving', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Couple large knobs butter', u' Small bunch fresh sage, leaves picked']
title: Italian Bread and Cabbage Soup with Sage Butter

author: Valerie Bertinelli
directions: [u'To make the dressing: Combine the olive oil, vinegar, goat cheese, shallot, 1/4 teaspoon salt and some freshly ground black pepper in a jar. Tightly close the lid and shake until thoroughly combined. Set aside.', u'To make the salad: Combine the spring mix, romaine, tomatoes, radishes, pecans and goat cheese in a large bowl. Pour over the dressing and toss to combine. Adjust seasoning as needed. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/2 cup red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon crumbled goat cheese', u'1/2 small shallot, minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'5 ounces spring lettuce mix', u'1 head romaine, chopped (about 4 cups)', u'2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 cup sliced radishes', u'1 cup pecans', u'3 tablespoons crumbled goat cheese']
title: Italian Flag Salad

directions: [u'Cover the bottom of a 10 quart pot with olive oil and set over medium heat. Add short ribs, oxtails, country style spare ribs and beef neck bone and brown them with 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon granulated onion, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder. Cook until both sides of meat are browned. Remove meat to a bowl and set aside. In the same pan add the sausage and ground beef. When ground meats are cooked through, drain grease and oil from pan. If there are any large pieces of the ground meats, break them up or pulse in a food processor. Add to bowl with other meats, set aside. Pour 1/4 cup olive oil into pot and saute onions, Italian parsley, garlic, shallots, jalapeno peppers, and pesto. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, 1/2 teaspoon granulated garlic and 1/2 teaspoon granulated onion. When onions are limp, add all of the reserved meats. Over medium heat, add 2 cups red wine. While this mixture is cooking, in a separate saute pan, add 1/4 cup olive oil and over medium heat saute mushrooms. Raise heat to medium high and add 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 granulated garlic, 1/2 teaspoon sugar. When mushrooms are browned add them to meats along with the tomato puree, tomato sauce and stock. In a food processor pulse stewed tomatoes with tomato paste until smooth and add them to the pot. Add allspice, Italian seasoning, 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 teaspoon granulated garlic, 1 teaspoon granulated onion. The gravy must cover the meat and come close to the top of the pot. Reduce heat to the lowest simmer and cook uncovered for approximately 4 to 5 hours. Stir occasionally to keep from sticking to the bottom of the pan. When meat on oxtail is tender, take all of the whole meats out of the pot, leaving the ground meats in. To complete gravy, add 1 tablespoon granulated garlic, fresh basil and cream sherry.  Serve the meat with gravy and pasta. Remove the rest of the gravy from the heat and let cool for 2 hours at room temperature then divide into pint containers and freeze.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup olive oil, divided', u'4 beef short ribs, 1/2 to 3/4 pound', u'6 oxtails, about 1/2 pound', u'1/2 pound country style spare ribs', u'1 prime rib or beef neck bone, about 1/2 pound', u' Salt to taste', u' Pepper to taste', u'2 1/2 teaspoons granulated onion, divided', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder, divided', u'2 links Italian sausage, 1 sweet and 1 hot, casings removed', u'1 1/2 pounds unseasoned pork sausage', u'1 pound ground beef', u'3 large onions, finely chopped', u'1 bunch Italian parsley, stems removed, finely chopped', u'12 cloves of garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons minced shallot', u'2 jalapeno peppers, stems and seeds removed, minced', u'1/2 cup pesto, made without cheese or pine nuts (available frozen)', u'2 cups of good red wine', u'10 cremini mushrooms, sliced', u'10 button mushrooms, sliced', u'2 portobello mushrooms, sliced', u'2 tablespoons plus 1/2 teaspoon sugar, divided', u'106 ounces tomato puree', u'106 ounces tomato sauce', u'6 cups chicken stock', u'3 1/2 cups tomatoes, peeled, chopped and stewed, can use canned', u'1 (6-ounce) can tomato paste', u' Water to cover', u'2 whole allspice berries', u'1 tablespoon Italian seasoning', u'1 tablespoon fresh basil, minced', u'3 tablespoons cream sherry']
title: Italian Gravy

author: Valerie Bertinelli
directions: [u'Stir together the oil, vinegar, oregano, salt and some pepper in a small bowl. On a work surface, spread out the bread and brush the oil and vinegar mixture onto all of the slices.', u'Layer half of the bread slices with the red peppers, salami, prosciutto, mortadella, cucumber slices, basil and pepperoncini. Top with the remaining bread slices. Using a serrated knife, cut away the crusts from each sandwich. Cut each sandwich into thirds. Place them on a tray and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 teaspoons red wine vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' One 14- to 16-ounce loaf Italian bread (from a bakery), sliced into 24 thin slices', u'1/3 cup roasted red peppers', u'1/3 pound thinly sliced salami', u'1/3 pound thinly sliced prosciutto di Parma', u'1/3 pound thinly sliced mortadella', u'1/2 cucumber, peeled if waxy, thinly sliced', u' Fresh basil leaves, as needed', u'4 to 5 pickled pepperoncini, sliced']
title: English and Italian Finger Sandwiches

directions: [u'1.  Cook sausage links according to package instructions; drain, cut into 1/2-inch pieces and set aside.  ', u'2.  In a skillet, heat oil over medium heat and saute garlic and red pepper until crisp-tender.  ', u'3.  Add prepared sausage, pasta, and marinara sauce; cook and stir until heated through.  ', u'4.  Sprinkle with parsley.  ', u'5.  Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 package (19 ounces) Johnsonville Italian Mild Sausage links', u'1 package (16 ounces) rigatoni pasta, cooked and drained', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 large sweet red bell pepper, chopped', u'1 jar (24 ounces) marinara sauce', u'2 tablespoons chopped Italian parsley']
title: Johnsonville Italian Sausage Rigatoni

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large saute pan or pot, cook the sausage over medium-high heat until the fat is rendered and the sausages start to brown, about 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Remove all but 2 tablespoons of fat from the pan.', u'To the fat remaining in the pan, add the onions and garlic and cook, stirring, over medium-high heat until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the fennel seeds, salt, and red pepper, and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 20 to 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes and their juice, the tomato paste, oregano, and cooked sausage and cook, stirring, until thick and fragrant, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the heat and adjust the seasoning, to taste.', u'Meanwhile, in a pot of salted water, cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and toss in the pot with the sauce. Stir in the ricotta salata and basil. Serve immediately and garnish with Parmesan cheese at the table.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound hot Italian sausage, removed from casings and crumbled', u'1/2 pound sweet Italian sausage, removed from casings and crumbled', u'1 1/2 cups sliced red onions', u'1 1/2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'3/4 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1 (28-ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, crushed by hand, with their juice', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano', u'1 pound dry penne, ziti or mostaccioli', u'1 1/2 cups fresh ricotta, or crumbled or coarsely grated fresh ricotta salata', u'6 tablespoons chopped fresh basil leaves', u' Grated Parmesan, for garnish']
title: Hot and Sweet Italian Sausages in Tomato Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Stir together the bourbon, sweet vermouth and Aperol. Pour into 4 rocks glasses filled with ice. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.']
ingredients: [u'10 ounces (1 1/4 cup) bourbon or rye', u'3 ounces sweet (1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons) vermouth', u'2 ounces (1/4 cup) Aperol', u' Ice', u'4 maraschino cherries']
title: The Little Italy (Manhattan with Aperol)

directions: [u'Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Cream shortening and margarine until even consistency. Add sugar and vanilla, cream until even. Add egg yolks 1 at a time, creaming after each addition. ', u'In a separate bowl, mix the maraschino cherry juice and buttermilk. ', u'In a separate bowl, mix the flour, salt, and baking soda. ', u'Add half of the wet ingredients to the creamed mixture and then mix into the dry ingredients. Repeat with the other half of ingredients. ', u'Fold in coconut. ', u'Beat egg whites to stiff peaks and fold into the mixture. ', u'Divide mixture between 2 greased floured layer pans and bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely before icing.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup solid vegetable shortening', u'1/2 cup margarine', u'2 cups sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'5 eggs, separated', u'1/2 cup maraschino cherry juice', u'1 cup buttermilk', u'2 cups flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'2 cups coconut flakes', u'4 ounces margarine', u'4 cups powdered sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'8 ounces cream cheese', u'3/2 cups pecans, broken and toasted']
title: Italian Creme Cake

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.', u'Mix the flour, baking powder and salt in a small bowl and set aside.', u'In a large bowl, whisk the butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until combined. Add in the whole egg, egg yolk and almond and vanilla extracts. Mix until incorporated.', u'Slowly fold the flour mixture into the sugar-egg mixture with a rubber spatula until even. Fold in the chocolate chips, pistachios and cherries.', u"Divide the batter into about 1/4 cup balls and space about 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Rotate the sheets 180 degrees, switch racks and then bake until slightly golden brown, an additional 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool, and eat on Christmas morning with a hot cup of coffee and amongst piles of wrapping paper and elated pajama'd kids."]
ingredients: [u'2 cups plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon table salt', u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) salted butter, melted', u'1 cup light brown sugar', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1 large egg plus 1 large egg yolk', u'1 teaspoon almond extract', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 cup semisweet chocolate chips', u'1 cup chopped pistachios', u'1/2 cup dried cherries']
title: Italian Spumoni Cookies ("Spumookies")

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Wrap the bay leaf, rosemary, and fennel seeds in a cheesecloth bag. Set the sachet aside. Heat the oil in a very large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped fennel and shallots and saute until the fennel is tender, about 6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the tomatoes with their juices, the wine and fish broth. Stir in the tomato paste. Add the sachet. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until the flavors blend, about 10 minutes.', u'Add the clams to the cooking liquid. Cover and cook until the clams open, about 6-8 minutes (discard any clams that do not open). Using tongs, transfer the clams to a bowl. Repeat with the mussels. Add the potatoes to the cooking liquid and simmer until they are almost tender, about 10 minutes. Add the fish, shrimp, and corn. Simmer until the fish and shrimp are just cooked through, and the corn is heated through, about 5 minutes. Return the clams and mussels to the soup. Stir in the parsley. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.', u'Ladle the soup into bowls and serve with the Garlic Toasts with Red Pepper Aioli.']
ingredients: [u'1 bay leaf', u'1 large fresh rosemary sprig', u'1 tablespoon fennel seeds, coarsely crushed', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 fennel bulb, chopped', u'3 large shallots, chopped', u'1 (28-ounce) can diced tomatoes in juice', u'1 1/4 cups dry white wine', u'3 cups fish broth or bottled clam juice', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'8 small littleneck clams, scrubbed', u'1 pound mussels, scrubbed, debearded', u'1 russet potato, about 8 ounces, peeled, cut into 3/4-inch cubes', u'1 1/2 pounds assorted firm-fleshed fish filets such as halibut, salmon, or tuna, cut into 1 1/4 inch chunks', u'1 pound uncooked large shrimp, peeled, deveined', u'2 corn cobs, quartered crosswise', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley leaves', u' Garlic Toasts with Red Pepper Aioli, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'12 (1/2-inch thick) slices ciabatta bread', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 garlic cloves', u'2 garlic cloves', u'1/2 cup roasted red bell peppers, drained, patted dry', u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Italian Seafood Boil

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, generously salt the water, and boil the potatoes until tender, approximately 30 to 40 minutes. Drain and let stand until cool enough to handle. Peel potatoes, if desired, and cut into 1-inch chunks. Place cut potatoes in a large bowl. Sprinkle parsley and green onions over potatoes. Make the sauce by mixing the rest of the ingredients together in another bowl; then pour sauce over the potatoes. Stir well. Let stand all day, or at least for 4 hours, stirring every hour. Do not refrigerate. Serve at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'14 or 15 large red potatoes (about 5 pounds)', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1/2 cup chopped green onions', u'3 large cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 heaping teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1 scant tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1 cup olive oil', u'1/2 cup tarragon vinegar']
title: Italian Potatoes

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Toast nuts in a small pan then cool.', u'Beat whipping cream and sugar until it forms soft peaks. Crush half of the meringues in a large food storage bag with the hazelnuts and then divide evenly among 4 small dessert cups. Place hazelnut chocolate spread in a medium bowl. Warm the spread in the microwave until loosened and smooth, test after 40 seconds on high. Stir and repeat, if necessary, until loose.', u'Divide berries evenly among dessert cups. Fold a small amount of whipped cream into hazelnut chocolate spread mixture until well combined. Fold in the remaining whipped cream. Divide the completed mixture among the cups and top each dessert cup with whole remaining meringues, 3 per cup.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup chopped hazelnuts, toasted', u'2 cups whipping cream', u'2 round tablespoons sugar', u'24 store bought prepared meringue cookies, available in plastic tubs at your market', u'1/2 cup hazelnut chocolate spread (recommended: Nutella)', u'1/2 pint raspberries']
title: Individual Italian Meringue Trifle

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, sausages and onions and cook until lightly brown.', u'Add the crushed San Marzano tomatoes and 1/2 can water, bring to a simmer. Add the tomato puree, 1/2 can of water and simmer again. Repeat with the tomato sauce, again adding 1/2 can of water and bring the sauce to a simmer. Add the tomato paste and cook through.', u'Add the basil, parsley, marsala wine, pepper, salt and sugar into the pot and stir. Simmer for 2 to 3 hours, stirring frequently.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'8 cloves fresh garlic, minced', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'3 to 4 fresh Italian sausages, casings removed', u' One 28-ounce can San Marzano tomatoes, crushed by hand', u' One 28-ounce can tomato puree', u' One 28-ounce can tomato sauce', u' One 8-ounce can tomato paste', u'1 cup fresh basil, roughly torn', u'1 cup fresh parsley, chopped', u'1 cup marsala wine', u'1 1/2 tablespoons freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar']
title: DeFalco's Authentic Italian Tomato Sauce

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Combine the flour, baking soda and 1 teaspoon salt in the bowl of an upright mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment. Add the butter and mix on low speed until incorporated, about 2 minutes. With the machine running, slowly add 10 to 12 tablespoons water until the mixture forms a dough around the hook. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead for 5 minutes until smooth. Cut the dough into 4 equal pieces. Form into disk shapes and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. ', u'Place a grill pan over medium-high heat or preheat a gas or charcoal grill. On a lightly floured work surface, roll out each piece of dough into an 8-to-10-inch circle, about 1/8-inch thick. Brush each circle with the extra-virgin olive oil and grill for 4 minutes each side. Remove the piadina from the grill to cool slightly. ', u'Combine the ricotta cheese and lemon zest in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Spread each piadina with 1/2 cup of the ricotta mixture. Sprinkle the fontina cheese evenly over the ricotta cheese. Arrange 2 prosciutto slices on top of the cheeses. Cut each piadina into 8 wedges and transfer to a serving platter. Garnish with the chopped basil.']
ingredients: [u'3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus extra for dusting', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt, plus extra for seasoning', u'1 stick butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces, at room temperature', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 pound whole milk ricotta cheese', u'2 teaspoons lemon zest (from about 2 small lemons)', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'6 ounces fontina cheese, shredded (about 2 cups)', u'4 ounces prosciutto, thinly sliced', u'1 cup chopped fresh basil']
title: Italian Flatbread (Piadina) with Fontina and Prosciutto

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Wash the capon (actually a castrated male chicken) under cold running water, and soak for 1 hour in a pan of cold water in which 1/4 cup kosher salt has been dissolved. Drain and rinse again, using paper toweling to dry the bird inside and out.', u'Season the capon inside and out with a generous amount of salt and pepper. Put half the rosemary and thyme and all of the chopped garlic inside the cavity of the capon, along with some of the onion, carrot and celery. Tie the legs of the capon together to aid in even roasting and place, breast side down in a roasting pan. Rub the remaining herbs on the outside of the capon, drizzle all the olive oil over the capon, scattering the rest of the vegetables (except the potatoes) in the pan along with the capon. Place the roasting pan into the oven and roast the capon for 20 minutes on its breast, before turning onto its back for an additional 20 minutes. When the capon has roasted for 20 minutes on its back, add the potatoes and continue roasting for an additional hour or until the bird is thoroughly cooked (a meat thermometer registers 165 degrees F at the leg joint). Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper and remove from the oven, allowing the capon to rest for 15 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1 (6 to 7-pound) whole, fresh capon chicken (a roasting chicken may be used)', u'1/4 cup dry rosemary leaves', u'1/4 cup dry thyme leaves', u'1/4 chopped garlic', u'3 medium onions, diced', u'3 carrots cut into rounds', u'2 celery stalks, chopped', u'3 pounds small potatoes, peeled', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Italian Roast Chicken with Potatoes

directions: [u'In a saucepan over medium-high heat, heat enough oil to cover the potatoes to frying temperature (325 to 350 degrees F), and add the potato rounds. Turn them over when they begin to stick to the pan, and fry until the potatoes are browned and crispy on the outside. (The potatoes can also be cooked in a deep fryer for 3 to 5 minutes.) Set the potatoes aside, and turn the heat down to medium.', u'Add the hot dogs, onions and peppers to the remaining oil in the saucepan. Let them cook together and exchange flavors until the hot dogs are done and the onions and peppers are beginning to brown.', u"To build The Single: Cut the bread into quarters. Starting at the point of one wedge, slice open through the soft middle of the bread, not across the crust and not completely in half. You should be able to peel open the bread just enough to make a pocket for the dog. Mustard can be added to the inside of the bun. Place one dog on the bottom, then pile with the onions, peppers and about half a potato worth of rounds. If the toppings are overflowing the bun, you're doing it just right. Ketchup and sprinkled red pepper flakes can be added on top. Have a fork handy!", u"To build The Double: Cut the bread in half. Slice open a pocket in the middle of the half-moon. Put 2 hot dogs on the bottom and double everything, especially the potato rounds - about 1 potato's worth can fit on top!", u'This recipe was provided by a professional chef or restaurant and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking oil, suitable for frying', u'2 medium potatoes, cut into 1/4 to 1/2-inch rounds', u'4 all-beef hot dogs', u'1 medium onion, sliced', u'1 green or red pepper, sliced', u'1 medium round loaf of bread, from pizza dough or Italian bread', u' Mustard', u' Ketchup', u' Red pepper flakes']
title: Italian Style Hot Dogs

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bake the potatoes until soft, about 1 hour.', u'Meanwhile, in a large soup pot, brown the bacon over medium heat. Add the carrots, celery and onions. Season with salt and pepper and cook until the vegetables are translucent, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the chicken, thyme and broth; bring to a simmer and skim any foam that rises to the top. Reduce the heat and barely simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 40 minutes. Discard the thyme. Remove the chicken and let cool. Pull off the meat and shred into bite-sized pieces; cover and set aside. Season the broth with salt and pepper.', u'Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the breadcrumbs and cook, stirring, until toasted, about 3 minutes; set aside. Halve the baked potatoes and scoop the flesh into a bowl; mash with a fork and season with salt and pepper. Sift the flour over the potatoes and add the toasted crumbs, parmesan and nutmeg; lightly knead to make a firm dough. Roll into 1/2-inch-wide cylinders; cut into 1/2-inch pieces and round the edges to make oval-shaped gnocchi. Bring the soup to a boil and drop in the gnocchi. Cook until they float to the top, 1 to 2 minutes; transfer the gnocchi to warm bowls with a slotted spoon.', u'Beat the eggs with a fork; use the fork to "paint" ribbons of egg across the soup. Let set, about 30 seconds. Stir in the chicken meat, parsley, basil and spinach; season with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup over the gnocchi. Serve with lemon wedges and more Parmesan.', u'Photograph by Yunhee Kim']
ingredients: [u'2 medium baking potatoes (about 1 1/4 pounds)', u'4 strips bacon, thinly sliced', u'2 carrots, sliced into 1/2-inch rounds', u'2 stalks celery, sliced into 1/2-inch pieces', u'24 pearl onions, peeled', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground white pepper', u'1 3 - to 4-pound chicken', u'1 small bunch fresh thyme, tied with string', u'8 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/4 cup breadcrumbs', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish', u' Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg', u'2 large eggs', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh parsley', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh basil', u'3 cups loosely packed spinach leaves', u'1 lemon, cut into wedges']
title: Italian Chicken Soup with "Toasted" Parmesan Gnocchi

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Arrange sliced meats on a large platter. ', u'Slice cheeses as desired, or leave in wheels or wedges.', u'Drizzle with olive oil, if desired, and sprinkle with freshly ground pepper.', u'Arrange on the large antipasti platter with peppers and asparagus. Garnish with fresh oregano sprigs.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound coppa, thinly sliced', u'1/2 pound mortadella, thinly sliced', u'1/2 pound salami, sliced', u'1/2 pound bresaola, thinly sliced', u'1/2 pound Montasio cheese', u'1/2 pound fresh Italian goat cheese', u'1/2 pound Piave Vecchio cheese', u'1 (at least 1/2 pound) wedge Castelmagno cheese', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, optional', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' Fresh oregano sprigs, for garnish']
title: Italian Meats and Cheeses Platter

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Combine the syrup, lemon juice, lemon zest, and mint in a small pitcher. Place in the refrigerator to chill.', u'Shave the ice by placing 2 to 3 cups crushed ice at a time in a food processor and running the machine until the ice is finely shaved. Store shaved ice in a large re-sealable plastic bag in the freezer for up to 1 day.', u'Place 1 1/2 cups of crushed ice in a serving dish.  Pour 3 to 4 tablespoons of the syrup mixture over the ice. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups raspberry syrup (recommended: Torani)', u'3/4 cup lemon juice', u'1 lemon, zested', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh mint leaves', u'5 pounds crushed ice (about 6 ice trays)']
title: Italian Ice

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Arrange the bacon slices side by side on a parchment-lined baking sheet; bake until crisp, 15 to 18 minutes. Drain on paper towels.', u'Meanwhile, place the bananas in a small bowl and mash with a fork until smooth. Fold in the mascarpone until combined.', u'Spread a thick layer of chocolate-hazelnut spread on 4 bread slices, then top each with 3 bacon slices.
