Spread the banana-mascarpone mixture on the remaining 4 bread slices, then place on top to make 4 sandwiches.', u'Spread butter on both sides of the sandwiches. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches if necessary, cook the sandwiches on each side until GBD-golden brown and delicious.']
ingredients: [u'12 slices bacon', u'2 bananas', u'1 cup mascarpone cheese', u'6 tablespoons chocolate-hazelnut spread', u'8 thick slices crusty white bread', u' Salted butter, for the bread']
title: The Italian Elvis

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u"Season the chicken liberally with salt and pepper, poultry seasoning, and grill seasoning. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a medium skillet and brown the chicken a few minutes on each side to put some of it's flavor and drippings into the pan then transfer to oven and roast 15 minutes more or until juices run clear. Meanwhile, add 1 more tablespoon olive oil to the pan and cook pancetta or bacon, if using, until crisp. Add onions, garlic and rosemary, cook 5 minutes then add the vinegar, sugar, Worcestershire, tomato sauce and 1/2 cup chicken stock, reduce heat to low and let sauce simmer 5 minutes more.", u'Bring remaining 1 1/2 cups stock and milk to a boil, whisk in polenta and season with salt and pepper. Whisk polenta 2 to 3 minutes until it thickens, stir in butter and cheese, remove from heat.', u'Remove chicken from oven and turn in barbecue sauce. Fill shallow bowls with polenta Top with chicken, spoon extra sauce over chicken and garnish with some torn basil leaves.']
ingredients: [u'4 bone-in chicken thigh and leg or chicken breasts', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons poultry seasoning', u'2 teaspoons grill seasoning', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 thick cut slices pancetta or bacon, chopped', u'1 medium red onion, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, grated or finely chopped', u'1 to 2 sprigs fresh rosemary, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup balsamic vinegar', u'3 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1 cup tomato sauce', u'2 1/2 cups chicken stock', u'1 1/2 cups milk', u'1 cup quick cooking polenta', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1/2 cup grated Parmiginao-Reggiano', u' Torn fresh basil leaves']
title: Italian Barbecued Chicken with Polenta

directions: [u'Cut the hoagie roll open in half lengthwise. Spread 1 tablespoon of the mayo on each half of the hoagie. Layer on the meat and cheese across the length of the bottom half of the hoagie: pastrami, capicola, pepperoni and mozzarella. Layer the onion, tomato, lettuce and relish across the meat and cheese. Sprinkle the salt, pepper and oregano across the mayo on the top half of the hoagie. Drizzle the sunflower oil and vinegar over the vegetables. Place the top half on top of the hoagie on the veggie side. Eat and enjoy!']
ingredients: [u' One 8-ounce hoagie roll', u'2 tablespoons vegan mayonnaise', u'2 ounces vegan pastrami', u'2 ounces vegan capicola', u'2 ounces vegan pepperoni', u'2 ounces vegan mozzarella cheese', u'1/8 red onion, sliced thin', u'4 thin slices tomato', u'1/3 cup shredded lettuce', u'2 tablespoons sweet pepper relish', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon oregano', u'2 tablespoons sunflower oil', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar']
title: Vegan Italian Cold Cut Sandwich

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'For the oil: Combine the oil, red pepper flakes, garlic and salt, and allow to marinate for up to 30 minutes. This can be done while the oven preheats.', u'For the balsamic reduction: Combine vinegar, garlic, oregano, thyme and salt in a saucepan. Cook on medium heat until it reduces by half and becomes syrup-like, about 10 minutes, then strain.', u'For the sub: Preheat oven to 550 degrees F. Preheat a pizza stone in the oven on the middle rack.', u'Roll the pizza dough into a thin 12-inch round on a floured pizza peel. Place on the pizza stone in the oven and bake until slightly puffed and browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and add the fontina, prosciutto, mortadella and capicola evenly on top of the dough. Finish with the balsamic reduction and torn basil leaves. Serve with the side of chile oil.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 clove garlic, grated', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup balsamic vinegar', u'3 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 spring oregano', u'1 spring thyme', u' Pinch salt', u' One pound store-bought pizza dough, room temperature', u'6 slices fontina, such as Stella Fontinella', u'6 slices shaved prosciutto', u'6 slices shaved mortadella', u'6 slices capicola', u'1 cup fresh basil leaves, torn, for garnish']
title: Pull and Peel Italian Sub

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'1. Heat the oil in a Dutch oven set over medium heat. Add the onion and crushed red pepper flakes and cook until the onions begin to soften, 5 minutes. Meanwhile, tie the parsley sprigs, lemon zest, and fennel tops together. Add the herb bundle, broth, 2 cups of water, and, if using, the cheese rind. Bring to a very gentle simmer and simmer until the chicken is just cooked through, about 8 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a cutting board and set aside until cool enough to handle. Remove the meat from the bones in large strips, and set aside. ', u'2. Meanwhile, add the sliced fennel, carrots, and celery to the broth and season with salt, to taste. Continue to simmer until the vegetables are just tender, 5 minutes. Stir in the noodles and cook until just al dente, about 5 minutes. Stir in the reserved chicken, baby spinach, and Parmesan until the chicken is heated through and the spinach is wilted. Discard the herb bundle and cheese rind. Stir in lemon juice, to taste. Ladle the soup into serving bowls and serve with additional Parmesan for passing.', u'Copyright 2010 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved', u'Nutritional analysis per serving, 2 1/3 cups ', u'Calories 261; Total Fat 6g (Sat Fat 1.5g, Mono Fat 3g, Poly Fat 1g); Protein 31g; ', u'Carb 23g; Fiber 4g; Cholesterol 54mg; Sodium 402mg']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 onion, chopped', u' Pinch crushed red pepper flakes', u'6 whole sprigs, plus 1 tablespoon chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'6 (3-inch) strips lemon zest, cut from 1 lemon', u'1 small head fennel, thinly sliced (2 cups), fennel tops reserved', u'1 1/2 pounds bone-in chicken breasts, skin removed', u'8 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u' A 2-3 inch piece Parmesan rind, optional', u'2 carrots, sliced (1 cup)', u'2 stalks celery, sliced (1 cup)', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups, whole-wheat extra-wide noodle style pasta, 2 3/4 ounces (recommended: Ronzoni Healthy Harvest) **recommend just using 2 3/4 -ounce weight', u'3 cups baby spinach', u'2 tablespoons grated Parmesan, plus extra for passing', u' Lemon juice']
title: Hearty Italian Chicken and Vegetable Soup

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Arrange pie tins on serving platter. Warm hazelnut spread for 40 seconds on high in microwave. Spread 1/4 of the spread into each little pie crust and cool 1 minute. Place 1 large scoop coffee ice cream in each tin to fill pies. Top pies with whipped cream and garnish pies with chocolate covered espresso beans.', u'Serve with coffee and anise liqueur (recommended: Sambuca).']
ingredients: [u'4 mini graham cracker pie crusts in tins, available on baking aisle', u'2/3 cup milk chocolate hazelnut spread (recommended: Nutella)', u'1 pint coffee ice cream', u'1 canister real whipped cream, from dairy aisle', u' Chocolate covered espresso beans, for garnish']
title: Mini Italian Mud Pies

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the dressing: Mince the garlic with a knife and then sprinkle about 1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon of salt on it and mash it into a paste with a fork. Chop the parsley, chives and basil very finely and add to the garlic.', u'In a bowl, combine the garlic mixture, mayonnaise, sour cream, Parmesan, cayenne, paprika and Worcestershire, tasting frequently and adjusting the seasonings as needed. Chill for a couple of hours before serving. Thin with a little milk before using if desired.', u'For the salad: To assemble, layer chunks of the iceberg lettuce on a platter. In lines, lay on the grated cheese, shredded carrots and cucumber slices, and sprinkle the sunflower seeds over the top. Drizzle on the dressing and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 to 2 cloves garlic', u' Salt', u'2 tablespoons fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1 tablespoon fresh chives', u'3 fresh basil leaves', u'1 cup (real) mayonnaise', u'1/2 cup sour cream', u'1/3 cup grated Parmesan', u' Cayenne pepper, as needed', u' Paprika, as needed', u' Worcestershire sauce, as needed', u'2 iceberg heads, cut into chunks', u'1/2 cup grated Cheddar', u'2 carrots, shredded', u'1 cucumber, sliced', u'1/4 cup sunflower seeds']
title: Salad Bar Salad with Creamy Italian Dressing

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Place frozen spinach in a strainer and run under hot water until thawed. Squeeze all of the water out and place in a large bowl. In a large saute pan, cook the ground round until browned. Drain meat, reserving 2 tablespoons fat in the pan, and place meat in the same bowl with the spinach. Stir in the cream cheese until blended with the meat and spinach. Saute the chopped onions in the reserved meat fat until transparent. Transfer onions to the bowl with the other ingredients and stir to combine. Add grated cheese, salt, and pepper, to taste, and combine. Let mixture cool and then add the eggs. The filling can be made up to 1 day in advance and refrigerated until ready to use.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Cook pasta shells in boiling, salted water until al dente. Drain and cool to the touch.  Stuff the shells with the meat mixture. Place shells in a large baking pan and cover with tomato sauce. Cover with foil and bake for approximately 1 hour. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 packages frozen, chopped spinach', u'3 pounds ground round', u'2 (8-ounce) packages cream cheese, softened', u'2 large onions, chopped', u' Grated Parmesan', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 jumbo eggs', u'1 (1-pound) package jumbo pasta shells', u'2 cups tomato sauce (your own or ready-made)']
title: Northern Italian Pasta Shell Stuffing

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Make the pie crust by sifting the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt into a large bowl. Add the butter and shortening and, using your hands or a pastry blender, work the fat into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. In a small bowl whisk together the eggs and vanilla and add to the crumb mixture. Work the mixture with your hands, adding only as much milk as is needed to form a dough. Work only until the dough just comes together; do not overwork. Divide the dough into two portions, one slightly larger than the other, and wrap both portions in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Remove the larger portion of dough from the refrigerator and, on a lightly floured surface using a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to a thickness of 1/8-inch. Fit the dough into the bottom of a 9 1/2-inch deep dish pie pan. Trim the edges so that an inch hangs over the sides and refrigerate. Roll out the second portion of dough to a thickness of 1/8-inch and transfer to a baking sheet and refrigerate, wrapped in plastic, while preparing the filling.', u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u'In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the ricotta cheese with the sugar until combined. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the orange zest, cinnamon, chocolate, and pine nuts and stir to combine.', u'Pour the filling into the pastry-lined pie pan. Using your fingers, lightly moisten the edges of the pastry with a bit of cool water. Place the second portion of pastry over the top of the pie and cut the edges to match those of the bottom crust. Press edges together then fold inward to make a raised edge. Crimp the edges decoratively using either your fingers, a fork, or a crimping tool. Make several small slits in the top of the pastry to allow steam to escape while baking.', u'Bake the pie for 1 hour, or until the pastry is light golden brown and the filling is just set. If the edges of the pie begin to get too brown, shield them with a piece of aluminum foil wrapped around the pie.', u'When the pie is set, remove it from the oven and allow to cool on a wire rack. Serve the pie either slightly warm, at room temperature, or chilled.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups flour', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 stick cold, unsalted butter, cut into cubes', u'1/4 cup vegetable shortening', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'2 to 3 tablespoons cold milk', u'1 1/2 pounds ricotta cheese, drained well', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'5 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon finely grated orange zest', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 cup finely chopped semisweet chocolate', u'1/4 cup lightly toasted pine nuts or almonds']
title: Italian Easter Pie

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'For the calamari: Combine the calamari and buttermilk in a large glass container. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Drain and rinse. Transfer to a mixing bowl and set aside.', u'For the Venetian vinaigrette: Combine the vinegar, garlic, lemon zest and juice in a medium mixing bowl. Whisk in the oil slowly to emulsify. Once thickened, whisk in the parsley, cilantro, oregano and scallions. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate in an airtight container until ready for use (or up to 48 hours).', u'For the court bouillon: Place 12 cups cold water, the celery, carrot, onion, parsley, thyme, bay leaves, chili, lemon and black peppercorns into a large stockpot fitted with a fine mesh colander attachment. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Poach by placing the calamari and the shrimp into the colander and simmering until the calamari is firm and the shrimp is pink, about 3 minutes. Remove to a mixing bowl and set aside. Poach the clams until the shells open, 4 to 6 minutes.', u'Transfer the clams to the already poached shellfish, discarding any unopened shells. Add the sliced tomato to the shellfish. Toss with two-thirds of the vinaigrette, season and refrigerate until chilled, about 10 minutes.', u'For the salad: Gently toss the arugula and fennel in a large mixing bowl with the remaining vinaigrette to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a large serving dish. Arrange the marinated seafood atop the salad. Garnish with the diced tomatoes, scallions, lemon wedges and fennel fronds around the platter.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound calamari tentacles and tubes, cleaned and cut into 1-inch rings', u'2 cups buttermilk', u'3 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u'2 large cloves garlic, minced', u' Juice and zest of 1 lemon', u'1 cup canola oil', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 cup fresh parsley leaves', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon roughly chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'2 scallions, roughly chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 medium carrot, unpeeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 onion, skin on, halved and quartered', u'4 sprigs fresh parsley', u'4 sprigs fresh lemon thyme', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 dried red chile', u'1 lemon, thinly sliced', u'1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns', u'1 pound U21/25 tail-on shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 pounds littleneck clams, scrubbed, beards removed', u'1 1/2 cups halved and thinly sliced tomato', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'8 ounces lightly packed Israeli arugula, washed and trimmed', u'1 small fennel bulb, trimmed, fronds reserved and sliced thin', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 plum tomato, seeded and finely diced', u'2 scallions, sliced on the bias', u'1 lemon, cut into wedges']
title: Chilled Italian Seafood Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"Mix the ground meats, ricotta, parsley, panko crumbs, onion, pecorino, bacon, garlic, milk, thyme, egg, salt, Worcestershire, and black pepper, to taste, in a large bowl. Mix until just combined; don't overmix. The mixture will be pretty soft. ", u'Using your hands, gently form mixture into 1 tablespoon small meatballs (about the size of ping pong balls). Put them on a large plate or pan; cover and refrigerate at least an hour or up to 24 hours.', u'Heat the oil in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add about 1/3 the meatballs and cook, turning occasionally, until well browned on all sides, about 6 minutes. Transfer the meatballs to a plate and repeat with the remaining meatballs.', u'Drain off the oil and wipe out the skillet. Return the meatballs to the skillet and pour in the marinara sauce. Bring to a boil, lower the heat, cover, and simmer until the meatballs are cooked through, about 15 minutes. ', u'Serve the meatballs, skewered on a platter with a dollop of the sauce and a fresh leaf of basil. They can be serve warm or at room temperature.', u'The meatballs can be stored, covered, in the refrigerator for 3 days, or frozen for up to 6 weeks.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound ground pork', u'3/4 pound ground turkey', u'4 ounces (1/2 cup) whole milk ricotta', u'1/3 cup minced flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1/3 cup panko bread crumbs', u'1/2 medium onion, grated (about 1/2 cup)', u'3 tablespoons finely grated pecorino', u'1 slice bacon, finely minced', u'2 large cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons milk', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh thyme or lemon thyme', u'1 large egg, beaten', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'2 dashes Worcestershire sauce (about 1/2 teaspoon)', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 to 3 cups homemade or quality jarred marinara sauce', u' Small fresh basil leaves']
title: Italian Cocktail Meatballs with Herbs and Ricotta

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. ', u'Place garlic heads on aluminum foil and lightly spray each head with 2 sprays olive oil cooking spray. Wrap aluminum foil around the garlic to form a tight package. Roast for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and place whole heads of garlic in a food mill. (Adding the whole garlic heads eliminates the step of removing the pulp from the cloves because the food mill squeezes the pulp out.) Process the garlic until smooth. Transfer garlic pulp to a bowl. Add the fresh herbs and sour cream and stir until completely blended. Slowly add buttermilk, adding just enough to give the dressing a consistency that is easy to pour. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Chill for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.', u'Just before serving, toss salad greens with dressing.']
ingredients: [u'2 heads garlic, tops sliced off', u'4 short sprays of 100 percent extra-virgin olive oil cooking spray', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs (any combination of parsley, basil, oregano and thyme leaves)', u'4 ounces light sour cream', u'1/4 cup buttermilk', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'12 cups salad greens, washed and dried']
title: Creamy Italian Dressing

directions: [u'Soak the porcini mushrooms in 1 cup of hot stock until softened, about 30 minutes. Strain the liquid through a coffee filter or a sieve lined with a double layer of cheesecloth. Trim any hard bits from the mushrooms. Set aside the mushrooms and liquid separately.', u'Season the beef with salt and pepper. In a large casserole, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium high heat until hot but not smoking. Brown the beef on all sides, about 15 minutes total. Transfer the beef to a plate. Pour off browning fat. Add pancetta, onions, carrots, and celery, stirring, until they are golden. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Stir in bay leaves, rosemary, parsley, and tomato paste. Add the wine and simmer until it is reduced by half, about 20 minutes. ', u'Add the beef, tomatoes, porcini mushrooms, mushroom liquid, and enough beef stock to come 2/3 up the side of the beef. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook at a gentle simmer for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, until the meat is tender. Turn the roast every 30 minutes or so.', u'Transfer the meat to a cutting board and cover with aluminum foil to keep warm. Skim off any fat from the surface of the liquid. Strain the liquid, pressing on the solids with a spoon to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard the solids and return the strained sauce to the pot. Bring to a boil and let cook uncovered for a few minutes to further reduce and thicken the liquid. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Slice the roast and serve with the sauce and soft polenta.']
ingredients: [u'1 ounce dried porcini mushrooms', u'2 cups beef stock', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 (4-pound) beef eye of round', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 tablespoons pancetta, chopped', u'1 finely chopped onion', u'1 finely chopped carrot', u'1 finely chopped celery stalk', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary', u'1/4 cup tightly packed parsley leaves, chopped', u'3 tablespoons tomato paste', u'5 cups red wine', u'1 (28-ounce) can whole tomatoes, drained and crushed']
title: Stracotto di Manzo (Italian Pot Roast)

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Blend the lemon juice, lemon peel, honey, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper in a blender. With the machine running, gradually blend in the oil. ', u'Toss the lettuce, endive, olives, parsley, and basil in a large bowl with enough dressing to coat. Season the salad with more salt and pepper, to taste, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons grated lemon peel', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'1 teaspoon salt, plus more for seasoning', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more for seasoning', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1 head romaine lettuce, coarsely chopped', u'4 Belgian endives, thinly sliced crosswise', u'1 cup pitted kalamata olives, halved', u'1 cup (lightly packed) fresh Italian parsley leaves, coarsely chopped', u'3/4 cup (lightly packed) fresh basil leaves, torn into bite-size pieces']
title: Italian Greens and Herb Salad

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Combine the Lillet and Aperol in a champagne flute. Top off with prosecco and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces Lillet Blanc', u'1/2 ounce Aperol', u' Prosecco, chilled']
title: The Gentle Italian

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Put the potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, salt the water, and cook 5 minutes. Drain.', u'Heat the EVOO in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 2 minutes. Remove to a cutting board with a slotted spoon, then chop and reserve.', u'Add the potatoes and rosemary to the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Cook until browned and crisp, 5 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl and top with the garlic and cheese.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds medium white- or yellow-skinned potatoes, cut into 1-inch-thick wedges', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 cup EVOO', u'3 large cloves garlic, crushed', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary', u' Freshly ground pepper', u' Grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano, for serving']
title: Italian-Style Skillet Potatoes

author: Scott Conant
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place the sugar in a food processor and process until it is finely ground. Divide the sugar in half. Combine one half with the flour, leavening agent and salt and place in a sifter.', u'Combine the egg whites, 1/3 cup room temperature water, cream of tartar and vanilla. Place in the bowl of the standing mixer. Start on slow for 2 minutes, and then increase the speed to medium. Slowly add the remaining sugar to the egg whites and continue to mix.', u'Once the egg whites are at medium peaks, remove the bowl from the mixer and sift over the flour mixture a little at a time as you fold it together. When completely combined, transfer to a 10-inch ungreased angel food cake pan. Transfer to the oven and bake for 35 minutes.', u'Remove from the oven and invert while still in the pan. Let cool for at least an hour upside down.', u'Insert a knife around the edges and remove from the pan. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 cup cake flour', u'2 teaspoons "Lievito Pane Degli Angeli" (Italian brand of leavening agent plus flavoring for baked goods)', u' Pinch salt', u'12 egg whites, at room temperature', u'1 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
title: Italian Angel Food Cake

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the soup: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the shallots and season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until tender, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add the potatoes, chicken broth, and arugula. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until the potatoes are very tender, about 15 minutes. In batches, ladle the mixture into a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Return the soup to the saucepan and whisk in the cheese, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Let the soup cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour until ready to serve. Before serving, adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'For the croutons: Place an oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'In a small bowl, toss together the bread, oil, and salt until coated. Spread in a single layer on a small baking sheet. Bake until golden, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes.', u'To serve: Ladle the soup into small bowls. Garnish with croutons and cherry tomatoes.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 large or 4 small shallots, thinly sliced', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, plus extra for seasoning', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus extra for seasoning', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 1/2 pounds (about 2 medium) russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 3/4-inch pieces', u'3 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 cup arugula', u'1/2 cup mascarpone, at room temperature', u'2 (1/2-inch thick) slices sourdough or multi-grain bread, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'8 cherry or grape tomatoes, quartered']
title: Italian Vichyssoise

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Trim all crusts from bread. Spread 4 slices with herb soft cheese. Top each cheese covered slice with 2 slices each of prosciutto, 3 leaves of arugula, thinly sliced tomatoes seasoned with a pinch of salt. Place a completed layer a top another, making 2 stacks each 2 layers high. Set the final trimmed bread slices in place, making 2 triple-decker sandwiches. Thinly slice and salt the radishes. Pierce a couple of thin slices of radish on each toothpick as you place 4 toothpicks in each sandwich. Cut each sandwich into 4 equal parts, cutting the sandwich across evenly on each side. The yield will be 8 triple-decker, square-shaped, "club" finger sandwiches, 2 per portion.']
ingredients: [u'6 slices thin cut white bread (recommended: Pepperidge Farm Thin White Sandwich Bread)', u'1 cup soft, spreadable herb cheese (recommended: Alouette)', u'8 slices prosciutto di Parma', u'12 leaves fresh arugula or basil (spicy vs. sweet)', u'2 plum tomatoes, thinly sliced', u' Salt', u'2 radishes, thinly sliced', u' Toothpicks']
title: Italian Club Finger Sandwiches

directions: [u'Let cream cheese and goat cheese soften at room temperature. Mix cheeses together with minced garlic. Line a casserole dish with plastic wrap. Put 1/3 of the cheese mixture in the dish, spreading it evenly to the sides. Next, layer ingredients in the following order: the sun-dried tomatoes, 1/3 cheese mixture, pesto, and remaining cheese in the same manner. Cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least 1 hour.', u'To serve, turn upside down on a platter. Serve with crackers.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces cream cheese', u'6 ounces goat cheese', u'2 cloves fresh garlic, minced', u'6 ounces pesto', u'8 ounces sun-dried tomatoes, chopped*', u' *Note: if you use dehydrated tomatoes ? add a little water to them and allow them to rehydrate slightly.']
title: Italian Layered Dip

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'Place the meat in a mixing bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Trim the crusts off the bread and place in a small bowl, cover with milk and soak to soften. Squeeze the milk from the bread and crumble as you add it to the meat. Then add the eggs, cheese, parsley, grated onion and garlic, and mix to combine. Form into a loaf about 4 inches high and put on the baking sheet. Spray with olive oil.', u'Mix the ketchup with the balsamic drizzle and Worcestershire. Season with pepper. Spread about 1/3 cup of the ketchup mixture over the top of the meatloaf. Bake until cooked through, about 1 hour.', u'To reheat, slice the meatloaf 1 1/2 inches thick and put in a pot of warmed chicken stock. Serve the meatloaf hot or cold on thick-sliced Italian white bread with the remaining ketchup mixture and the lettuce, tomato, onions, mozzarella and basil.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds ground beef, pork and veal (a meatloaf mix)', u' Kosher salt and ground black pepper', u' Three 1-inch slices good-quality stale white bread', u' Milk, for soaking bread', u'2 eggs', u' A couple handfuls grated Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped', u'1/4 cup grated onion', u'3 to 4 cloves garlic, grated or finely chopped', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'1 cup ketchup', u'2 tablespoons store-bought balsamic drizzle (or reduce 1/4 cup vinegar and 1 tablespoon brown sugar in a small pot to about 2 tablespoons of drizzle)', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u' Chicken stock, for warming', u' Italian-American crusty white bread, for serving', u' Toppings: lettuce, tomato, red onion, thinly sliced fresh mozzarella and torn fresh basil leaves']
title: Italian Meatball Meatloaf Sandwiches

author: Michael Chiarello
directions: [u'In a bowl, whisk together the olive oil. sherry vinegar, chili powder and parsley and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Slice fennel into wedges and wash cherry tomatoes. Roll salami slices into batons.', u'Drain all jarred ingredients well. Arrange all items as desired on a large platter. Serve slightly chilled or at room temperature with bread and/or crackers.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'3 tablespoons sherry vinegar', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley leaves', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 large fennel bulb', u'1 pint cherry tomatoes', u'1/2 pound salami, sliced', u'1 can pitted black olives, drained', u'1 jar (5 ounces) pimiento-stuffed Spanish olives, drained', u'1 jar (12 ounces) baby kosher dill pickles, drained', u'1 jar pickled onions, drained', u'2 jars (6.5 ounces each) marinated artichoke hearts', u'1 jar (7.5 ounces) pepperoncini', u'1 tin (2 ounces) anchovies with capers', u'1 box artisan crackers or loaf of Italian bread']
title: Italian Relish Tray

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat griddle to medium.', u'In a food processor pulse chop the salad and olives into a fine relish. Spread 4 slices of bread with relish and top each with 2 slices cheese and 4 more slices of bread. Butter the outside of the sammies with softened butter and grill until golden on both sides, 4 to 5 minutes total. Cut and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup giardiniera (Italian hot vegetable salad), drained', u'1/4 cup salad olives (green olives with pimiento)', u'8 slices good quality crusty white bread, 1/2-inch thick slices', u'8 slices deli cut provolone cheese', u'4 tablespoons softened butter']
title: Italian Grilled Cheese

directions: [u"Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Cream butter in a bowl. Gradually add confectioners sugar and salt. Beat until light and fluffy. Add almonds and vanilla. Blend in flour gradually and mix well. Shape into crescents using about 1 teaspoon for each cookie. Place on ungreased cookie sheets, and bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Do not brown. Cool slightly, then roll in the extra confectioners' sugar."]
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups unsalted butter', u'3/4 cup confectioners sugar, plus 1/3 cup, for rolling', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 cups finely ground blanched almonds', u'5 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'3 cups sifted all-purpose flour']
title: Italian Wedding Cookies

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'For the tomato sauce: Heat the olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the tomato paste, cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoes, basil, thyme, 1 cup water, and some salt and pepper. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Keep warm.', u'For the meatballs: Soak the panko in the milk for 10 minutes. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef and pork, Parmesan, parsley, garlic, some salt and pepper and the soaked panko. Mix well to combine; do not overwork. Form into eight 2-inch balls.', u'Set a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil. Sear the meatballs on all sides until golden brown, 6 to 7 minutes.', u'Remove the thyme sprigs from the tomato sauce; add the meatballs to the sauce. Spoon some sauce over the meatballs, then top them with slices of mozzarella. Transfer to the oven and bake until the cheese is bubbly and the meatballs are cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.', u'To assemble the sliders, load one meatball onto each bun. Top with a basil leaf and secure the bun top with a bamboo skewer. Serve on a large platter with extra sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, sliced', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u' One 28-ounce can crushed fire-roasted tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil', u'2 sprigs fresh thyme', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup panko breadcrumbs', u'1/4 cup milk', u'8 ounces ground beef', u'8 ounces ground pork', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 pound fresh buffalo mozzarella, sliced', u'8 soft Hawaiian buns', u'8 leaves fresh basil', u'8 bamboo skewers']
title: Italian Meatball Sliders with Red Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line 1 baking sheet with foil and another with parchment.', u'Toss the sausages with 1 tablespoon of the oil on the foil-lined baking sheet, and bake, flipping the sausages halfway through, until lightly browned and fully cooked, about 30 minutes. Let cool.', u'Lower the oven temperature to 350 degrees F. Toss together the provolone and mozzarella in a medium bowl. Make a slit down the length of each sausage, cutting about halfway through, and fill each with 1 teaspoon pesto, 2 pepper strips and 1 scant tablespoon of the cheese mixture; reserve any remaining cheese mixture.', u'Open the tube of dough, find the seam and carefully unroll the dough on a lightly floured surface. Cut 6 strips 1 1/4 inches by 12 inches. Wrap 1 strip around a stuffed sausage link, coiling the strip from 1 end of the link to the other, leaving a 1/4-inch space between dough turns and leaving the ends of the sausage slightly exposed. Repeat with the remaining dough strips and sausages, setting the finished rolls at least 1 inch apart on the parchment-lined baking sheet.', u'Brush the rolls with the remaining tablespoon of oil. Sprinkle the tops with the reserved cheese mixture. Bake until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool for a few minutes before cutting each roll into 4 pieces with a serrated knife. Serve warm with warm marinara sauce on the side.', u'Copyright 2015 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'6 sweet Italian sausage links (about 1 1/2 pounds)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'5 tablespoons shredded provolone', u'5 tablespoons shredded mozzarella', u'2 tablespoons prepared pesto', u' Twelve 1/2-inch-wide strips roasted red pepper (about 3 ounces)', u' One 11-ounce tube refrigerated French bread dough', u' All-purpose flour, for dusting', u' Jarred marinara sauce, warm, for serving']
title: Italian Sausage-and-Pepper Pigs in Blankets

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large, heavy pot or Dutch oven, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and leeks. Cook, stirring, until the onions are soft and lightly golden, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the pumpkin, salt and bay leaves and saute until starting to soften. Add the chicken broth and herbs. Stir to mix. Bring to a boil, and then reduce the heat to medium and cook, uncovered, for 20 to 25 minutes, or until pumpkin is tender and broth is just beginning to thicken slightly. Once the pumpkin is tender, discard the herbs and puree the soup using an immersion blender.', u'In a medium saute pan, brown the sausage. Using a slotted spoon remove the sausage from the pan and drain on paper towel. Top the soup with the sausage. Garnish with the cheese and serve with warm crusty bread.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 cups chopped yellow onions', u'1 leek, washed and sliced into rounds', u'3 pounds fresh pumpkin flesh, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'3 bay leaves', u'8 cups chicken broth', u'1 sprig sage', u'2 to 3 sprigs parsley', u'1 sprig thyme', u'1/2 to 3/4 pound fresh sweet Italian sausage, crumbled Freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, for garnishing']
title: Pumpkin Soup with Sage and Sweet Italian Sausage

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat the oven to 325 degrees F. Toast bread 7 to 8 minutes.', u'Place the beans in food processor with tahini, garlic, rosemary, the juice of 1 lemon and some salt. Turn processor on and stream in a little olive oil, process until smooth, adjust salt and transfer to a small serving bowl, garnish with toppings if you wish (on its own it is still delish), surround the hummus with toasts for spreading.']
ingredients: [u'1 loaf sesame semolina or crusty baguette, bakery sliced', u'1 (15 to 18-ounce) can white beans, rinsed and drained', u'3 tablespoons sesame tahini paste', u'2 cloves garlic, grated or minced', u'3 sprigs rosemary, leaves finely chopped', u'1 lemon', u' Salt', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Coarsely chopped green or black olives', u' Chopped parsley and basil leaves', u' Chopped roasted red peppers', u' Chopped hot pickled vegetables - giardiniera']
title: Italian Hummus

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat about 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the chile and garlic and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and cool a couple of minutes.', u'Halve the bread across horizontally and toast or char.', u'Halve the tomato across horizontally and rub the flesh vigorously into the toasted surface of the bread and season with salt, to taste.  If you are garnishing with anchovies skip the salt.  Dress the tomato bread with chile oil and garnish with capers, olives and anchovies, if using. Cut into serving portions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small red chile, chopped or thinly sliced', u'1 large clove garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 round loaf crusty bread with or without sesame seeds', u'1 large ripe tomato', u' Salt', u'2 tablespoonfuls capote capers or sliced caper berries', u' A scant handful pitted black olives, coarsely chopped', u'8 thin anchovy fillets, drained, optional']
title: Italian Style Tomato Bread

directions: [u'1.  In a skillet, cook sausage, onion and garlic until pork is no longer pink and onion is tender; drain.  ', u'2.  Add marinara sauce and oregano; simmer for 5 minutes.  ', u'3.  In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, \xbc cup Parmesan and spinach.  ', u'4.  In a greased 13-in. x 9-in. x 2-in. baking dish, spread 1 cup meat sauce.  ', u'5.  Arrange 3 noodles over sauce.  ', u'6.  Spread one-fourth of the ricotta cheese mixture over the noodles, top with 1 cup of meat sauce.  ', u'7.  Sprinkle with \xbd cup mozzarella cheese.  Repeat process 3 times.  ', u'8.  Top with remaining Parmesan cheese.  ', u'9.  Bake, uncovered, at 350\xb0F for 40-45 minutes.  ', u'10. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.  ', u'11. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 package (16 ounces) Johnsonville Italian Ground Sausage (or links, decased)', u'12 lasagna noodles, cooked and drained', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 jar (24 ounces) marinara sauce', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'2 cartons (15 ounces, each) ricotta cheese', u'1 egg, beaten', u' \xbd cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided', u'2 cups fresh spinach, chopped', u'2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese']
title: Johnsonville Italian Sausage Lasagna

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Put the tortillas onto a baking sheet and top each with tomatoes and olives. Sprinkle some cheese on top of each pizza and bake for 10 minutes. ', u'Garnish each pizza with torn basil leaves and season with pepper. Allow pizza to cool for a few minutes then slice each tortilla into 4 wedges.']
ingredients: [u'4 whole-wheat tortillas (6- inches in diameter)', u'2 medium tomatoes, seeded and chopped', u'1/4 cup coarsely chopped pitted calamata olives', u'1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan', u'2 tablespoons fresh basil leaves', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
servings: 2 as a main course, 4 as an appetizer
title: Italian Tortilla Pizza

directions: [u'Create an Italian herb baste by mixing together the olive oil, Italian seasoning, parsley, basil, shallots, garlic, and Parmesan in a bowl.', u'Preheat a grill to medium, using mesquite wood. Coat the halibut in the Italian herb baste and place fish on the grill. Grill, turning often to avoid burning, until fish is opaque and a knife slides in easily.', u'Remove from heat and serve halibut with fresh vegetables and a starch of choice.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons dried Italian seasoning', u'1 tablespoon fresh Italian parsley leaves', u'2 tablespoons fresh basil leaves', u'1/4 cup finely chopped shallots', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1/2 cup grated Parmesan', u'4 halibut steaks or fillets']
title: Italian Halibut

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Place the coffee ice cube in a rocks glass. Add the coffee liqueur, vodka and amaretto and stir the mixture to combine. Slowly pour the half-and-half over the ice cube. The half-and-half will stay layered on top, forming a white layer on top of the black. Finish with a dash of cinnamon if using. Stir together before drinking.', u'Cook Notes: To make the coffee ice cubes, simply freeze coffee in large silicone ice cube molds.']
ingredients: [u'1 large coffee ice cube', u'1 ounce coffee liqueur, such as Kahlua', u'1 ounce vodka', u'1/2 ounce amaretto', u'1 ounce half-and-half, chilled', u' Dash of cinnamon, optional']
title: Black and White Italian Cocktail

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Cook the sausage according to the directions on the package and cut it into 1-inch rounds. Cut the basil leaves lengthwise into thirds.', u'Put an olive half about 1/3 of the way down onto a skewer. Then add 1 strip of basil, folding so it fits nicely on the skewer. Follow with 1 grape tomato and a round of sausage. Position everything on the end of the skewer so the skewer can stand up on its sausage end.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces Italian style poultry sausage*', u'8 large basil leaves', u'12 pitted calamata olives, halved', u'24 grape tomatoes', u'24 (6-inch) wooden skewers']
title: Italian Style Sausage Skewers

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a large Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken, and cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Add onion and carrot, and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in zucchini, diced tomatoes, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes. Top each serving with grated Parmesan, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces (about 1 3/4 pounds)', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1 cup sliced carrots (about 3 small)', u'2 1/2 cups sliced zucchini (about 2 medium)', u'2 (14.5-ounce) cans diced tomatoes with basil, garlic, and oregano', u'2 (14.5-ounce) cans chicken broth', u' Grated Parmesan, optional']
title: Italian Chicken and Vegetable Soup

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Through the feed opening of a running blender add, 1 at a time, the vinegar, garlic, oregano, thyme, parsley, salt, and pepper. Then, leaving the blender running, gradually add the olive oil in a thin stream. Season, to taste, with salt and pepper.', u'Gently toss together the greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, and carrots with enough of the dressing to coat. Serve family style with the remaining salad dressing on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 garlic cloves, lightly crushed and quartered', u'1 teaspoon fresh oregano leaves (from 3 or 4 small sprigs or 1 or 2 large sprigs)', u'1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves (from 3 or 4 small sprigs or 1 or 2 large sprigs)', u'1 teaspoon fresh parsley leaves (from 3 or 4 small sprigs or 1 or 2 large sprigs)', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'6 cups mixed greens (organic mesclun mixture such as mache, arugula, chicory) soaked and dried in a salad spinner', u'2 large tomatoes, cut into wedges', u'2 English cucumbers, peeled and sliced', u'2 large carrots, peeled and sliced into rounds']
title: Top Brass Tossed Salad with Italian Dressing

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Special equipment: a smoker box and metal or wooden skewers', u'Heat a grill to medium-low heat. Use a 2-stage fire or indirect heat setup on your gas grill. Add the soaked applewood chips to a smoker box and place the box directly onto the heating element or coals. Once plumes of smoke appear, place the sausage links over the indirectly heated side of the grill and smoke for about 1 hour, flipping halfway through. The internal temperature of the sausages when tested with a meat thermometer should read 160 degrees F at this point. Move the sausages to the hot side of the grill and give them a char on the outside for 3 to 5 minutes per side.', u'Meanwhile, skewer the onion quarters on metal or wooden skewers. Place the bell peppers and onions on the hot side of the grill and cook until charred on all sides, 20 to 30 minutes. Set aside until cool enough to handle.', u'Remove the majority of the skin and all of the seeds and stems of the peppers and give them a rough chop along with the charred onions. Place both into a food processor along with the olive oil and garlic and blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Top a roll with a hot sausage followed by a nice smear of the smoked pepper spread, a sprinkle of ricotta salata and a couple of slices of pepperoncini. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' About 2 cups applewood chips for smoking, soaked in water for at least 30 minutes', u'8 links sweet Italian sausage', u'1 yellow onion, peeled and quartered', u'4 red bell peppers', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 clove garlic', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 fresh sausage or hoagie rolls', u'1 cup grated ricotta salata cheese', u'4 pepperoncini, sliced']
title: Smoked Italian Sausage Hoagie

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Roast the bell pepper over a gas flame, turning with tongs, or broil until the skin is blackened. Transfer to a bowl, cover and let cool. Peel, seed and chop the pepper.', u'Heat the EVOO in a Dutch oven or other heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and pancetta and cook until well browned. Add the ground pork, thyme, fennel seeds, garlic, chile peppers, onions, oregano and roasted red peppers and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Deglaze with the wine, stirring and scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon. Add 2 to 3 cups chicken stock and simmer for a few minutes to allow the flavors to combine.', u'Bring 2 cups chicken stock and the milk to a low boil in a saucepan. Whisk in the polenta and cook, whisking, until thick but pourable, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the butter and then the cheese, stirring until melted. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Ladle the polenta into shallow bowls and hollow out the center. Fill with the chili and top with more cheese. Garnish with parsley.', u"Cook's Note: The chili can be covered and refrigerated for a make-ahead meal. Reheat over medium heat, and prepare the polenta before serving."]
ingredients: [u'1 large red bell pepper', u'2 tablespoons EVOO', u'8 ounces bulk hot Italian sausage or 5 ounces coarsely grated Calabrese salami', u'4 ounces pancetta, finely diced', u'1 pound ground pork', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'3 to 4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 mild or 2 hot fresh red chile peppers, seeded and very finely chopped', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'1 sprig fresh oregano, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'1/2 cup dry red wine', u'4 to 5 cups chicken stock', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1 cup quick-cooking polenta', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 cup grated pecorino, plus more for serving', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, for garnish']
title: Italian Pork Chili with Polenta

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'On a small cutting board, lay down a piece of plastic wrap, about 2 feet long. Stack the provolone cheese in the center in a roughly 5-inch area. Layer the sopresetta on top of the provolone followed by layers of salami, basil leaves, prosciutto, and mozzarella. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap, place in refrigerator, a 1/2 hour, with a heavy plate on top to press mixture together. ', u'In a large salad bowl, toss together lettuces, pepperoncini, peppadew and olives.', u'In a small bowl combine balsamic vinegar, oregano, parsley, thyme, garlic, salt and pepper. Slowly whisk in oil to incorporate.', u'Remove cheese and meat stack from refrigerator and slice it into 2 1/2-inch strips that are 1/4-inch thick. Add dressing to salad and toss. Decorate top with meat and cheese pressed slices. Garnish with Parmesan.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces sliced provolone cheese', u'5 ounces very thinly sliced sopresatta', u'5 ounces very thinly sliced salami', u'1/2 cup fresh basil leaves', u'5 ounces very thinly sliced prosciutto', u'6 ounces sliced mozzarella cheese', u'3 cups 1-inch pieces iceberg lettuce', u'3 cups 1-inch pieces romaine lettuce', u'2 cups 1/4-inch julienned strips radicchio', u'1 cup 1/4-inch julienned strips endive', u'1/2 cup pepperoncini, cut in thirds', u'1/2 cup peppadews, quartered', u'1/2 cup black olives, quartered', u'1/3 cup balsamic vinegar', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme leaves', u'1 teaspoon finely minced garlic', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 tablespoons grated Parmesan']
title: Italian Stallion Salad

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a large heavy braising pot, over medium heat cook pancetta until crispy and golden. Remove to a paper-towel lined plate to drain. Add the spareribs to the pancetta fat and brown well on both sides.', u'Remove ribs to a baking sheet and bake until tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Add the sausage to the pot and brown both sides. Add the peppers, onion and garlic. Cook until translucent, then deglaze with wine. Simmer for a couple of minutes, then add tomatoes. Bring back to a simmer, and add the cooked pork ribs, parsley, basil, chili flakes and salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Simmer on low to medium heat, covered, for another 1 1/2 hours.', u'Serve over pasta, and garnish with pancetta, green onions and Parmesan.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 pound pancetta, diced', u'3 pounds pork spareribs, denuded, cut into individual ribs', u'2 pounds Italian sausage, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'2 cups red bell peppers, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'2 cups diced yellow onion', u'1/4 cup diced garlic', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'4 cups whole San Marzano tomatoes', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley leaves', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh basil leaves', u'1 teaspoon red chili pepper flakes', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound radiatore pasta, cooked al dente', u'1 bunch sliced green onions', u'1/2 cup finely grated Parmesan']
title: Braised Pork Ribs and Italian Sausage

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Combine the sugar with 3 cups of water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Remove from the heat and add the lemon juice. Pour the mixture into 3 ice cube trays and set aside to cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes. Place the trays in the freezer to harden, 4 to 8 hours depending on your freezer.', u'When ready to serve, add the ice cubes and the lemon peel to a food processor and pulse until the ice is fluffy and broken down. Serve with a straw and a spoon, and be prepared to be whisked away to the summer streets of Chicago.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'1 cup fresh lemon juice', u' Peel of 1 whole lemon, pith removed']
title: Italian Lemonade

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a medium mixing bowl combine the ground beef, ground pork, eggs, 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, 2 teaspoons of the garlic, 3/4 teaspoon of the Italian Essence, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, 1 pinch of crushed red pepper and mix until thoroughly combined.', u'Divide the meat mixture into tablespoons and roll into smooth balls in your hands. Set rolled meatballs aside on a plate or other flat surface.', u'In a 4 1/2 quart soup pot or large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium high heat until hot. Add half of the rolled meatballs and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 4 minutes. Transfer the browned meatballs to a plate and set aside. Brown the remaining meatballs in the same manner and set aside.', u'Add the chopped onion and celery to the pot and cook, stirring, until vegetables are soft, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the remaining teaspoon of minced garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato paste, tomatoes and their juices, beef broth, 3 cups water, remaining 1/4 teaspoon of Italian Essence, remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt, remaining pinch of crushed red pepper and stir to combine. Return the meatballs to the soup pot and bring the soup to a boil. Reduce the heat so that the soup just simmers and cook for 30 minutes.', u'Using a spoon, carefully skim any fat that has accumulated on the top of the soup and discard. Add the ditalini to the hot soup, stir well, and cook for 15 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through. Stir in the chopped basil and serve the soup in wide bowls, garnished with additional grated Parmesan, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound ground beef', u'1/4 pound ground pork', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'1/3 cup finely grated Parmesan, plus more for garnishing soup if desired', u'1/4 cup Italian bread crumbs', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', u'1 teaspoon Italian Essence', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 pinches crushed red pepper', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'1/4 cup chopped celery', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 (14.5-ounce) can whole tomatoes, crushed with your hands, with their juice', u'3 1/2 cups beef stock or two 14 ounce cans low sodium beef broth', u'1/2 cup ditalini or other small pasta shape for soups', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil leaves']
title: EJ's Simple Italian Meatball Soup

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'In a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, eggs, breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, herbs, garlic, onion, ketchup, Worcestershire. Mix well, gradually adding the milk (if it seems too moist, add bread crumbs until it is a consistency that will form a loaf without flattening. Spray a large baking or roasting pan with a non-stick spray and press the meatloaf out. Layer cheese slices and ham, covering the center line of the meatloaf, then close it together and tuck in the ends, forming a loaf which is oblong. Criss-cross the bacon strips to cover the loaf. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until the meat thermometer registers 160 degrees F. ', u'Let rest 15 minutes, then cut and serve. Gravy is optional.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds ground beef', u'2 eggs', u'1 cup bread crumbs (up to 1 1/2 cups)', u'1 cup grated Parmesan', u'1 tablespoon Italian seasoning', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'2 tablespoons fresh chopped parsley leaves', u'2 cloves garlic, minced or pressed', u'1 onion, diced', u'1/2 cup ketchup', u'1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce', u'1 cup milk', u'8 slices cheddar', u'8 slices baked ham', u'8 slices bacon']
title: Italian Stuffed Meatloaf

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Toss the chicken, bell peppers, onion, parsley, almonds, and capers in a large bowl with enough vinaigrette to moisten. Season the chicken salad with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Arrange 1 large lettuce cup and 1 small lettuce cup on each plate, overlapping slightly. Spoon the chicken salad into the lettuce cups. Drizzle more vinaigrette over the salads. Sprinkle with the Parmesan and serve.', u'Do-Ahead Tip: The chicken salad can be prepared 4 hours ahead and refrigerated. Just before serving, spoon the salad into the lettuce cups.']
ingredients: [u'10 cups coarsely shredded cooked chicken (from about 3 purchased roasted whole chickens)', u'2 cups roasted red and yellow bell peppers, drained, patted dry, and coarsely chopped', u'1 1/4 cups paper-thin slices red onion', u'3/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley leaves', u'3/4 cup slivered almonds, toasted', u'1/2 cup drained capers', u'1 1/2 cups (about) Red Wine Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'24 butter lettuce leaves (from about 3 large heads)', u'1 (4-ounce) piece Parmesan, shaved with vegetable peeler']
title: Italian Chicken Salad in Lettuce Cups

author: Valerie Bertinelli
directions: [u'In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, vinegar, olive oil, horseradish, red pepper flakes, Italian seasoning, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add the cabbage, scallions, carrots, fennel and parsley; toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let stand in the refrigerator for 15 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'1/3 cup white wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'1 tablespoon prepared horseradish', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon Italian Seasoning, recipe follows', u'10 cups very thinly sliced green cabbage (about 1/2 large head)', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced', u'3 medium carrots, grated', u'1 large bulb fennel, trimmed, halved and sliced paper thin on a mandoline', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'3 tablespoons dried basil', u'3 tablespoons dried marjoram', u'3 tablespoons dried oregano', u'3 tablespoons dried parsley', u'1 tablespoon granulated garlic', u'1 teaspoon dried rosemary', u'1 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes']
title: Italian Fennel Coleslaw

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Frittata: In a nonstick 10-inch skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown and crispy, about 6 to 8 minutes.', u'While the pancetta is cooking, in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, whipping cream, salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the cooked pancetta and stir once to incorporate. Cook the egg mixture, without stirring, until the eggs are almost set and the bottom is golden brown, about 5 to 6 minutes. Slide the frittata onto a dinner plate and invert back into the skillet until cooked through, about 3 to 4 minutes longer. Transfer the frittata to a cutting board and cut into 4 wedges.', u'Mayonnaise: In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise and chives until smooth.', u'To assemble the sandwiches: Divide the mayonnaise mixture and spread it evenly over 1 side of each bread slice. Arrange the arugula, a slice of cheese and 2 tomato slices on 4 of the bread slices. Lay the frittata wedges on top of the tomatoes. Cover with the remaining bread slices and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'4 ounces thinly sliced pancetta, diced', u'6 large eggs, at room temperature', u'1/4 cup whipping cream', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh chives', u'8 (1/2-inch-thick) slices rosemary-olive bread', u'2 cups arugula', u'4 slices provolone cheese', u'8 slices tomato, about 2 medium tomatoes']
title: Italian Club Sandwiches

directions: [u'Make the Filling: In a bowl, combine the figs with 4 tablespoons of brandy and let soak overnight or up to 4 weeks. ', u'In a food processor, combine the soaked figs, the remaining 2 tablespoons brandy, and all the remaining filling ingredients. Process until chopped and well combined. (Alternatively, run all the ingredients through a meat grinder. Some Italian women bring their filling ingredients to the butcher and have him grind it for them.) Keep chilled until ready to use.', u'Make the Pastry: In a food processor, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt and pulse to mix. Add the butter and pulse until it looks like fine crumbs. In a small bowl, whisk together the 2 eggs and milk. While the motor in running, pour the liquid through the feed tube until just combined and a dough is formed. Form the dough into a disk and chill 30 minutes.', u'On a floured work surface, roll out the dough 1/8-inch thick. With a sharp knife or pizza cutter, cut out large (3-inch long) almond shaped pieces from the dough. Transfer the pieces to a sheet pan; then chill. ', u'To form the cookies, have ready the filling, the chilled dough pieces, the egg wash with a pastry brush, and a sharp knife. Paint the edges of the dough pieces with egg wash and place 1 teaspoon of filling shaped into an oval in the center of half the pieces. Top each with a second piece of dough and carefully pinch the edges together to seal. Trim the excess dough from around the edges. ', u"Make each dough package look like a bird or fish, by shaping and cutting decorative lines. You can split 1 end to look like a tail, carve rows of lines to look like feathers or fins, cut a curved line for the gills or beak opening, and a hole for the eye. (There are many different shapes they're made into, such as wreaths, slippers, and crescents.) Re-chill the cookies", u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'Brush the cookies with the egg wash. Bake the cookies until lightly golden brown, about 20 minutes. ', u'Meanwhile make the Icing: In a bowl, whisk together all the ingredients. ', u"Toss the cookies with the icing while they're still hot and sprinkle with the colored sprinkles, or leave them plain. The icing makes the cookies look like porcelain when they're done."]
ingredients: [u'8 ounces dried figs, chopped', u'6 tablespoons brandy', u'1 (8-ounce) jar honey', u'2 ounces raisins', u'2 ounces dates', u'2 ounces dried cherries', u'2 ounces citron or candied pineapple', u'1 cup walnut pieces, toasted', u'1 cup whole, blanched almonds, toasted', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'2 pinches ground clove', u' Rind of 1 lemon (remove any white pith)', u' Rind of 1 orange (remove any white pith)', u'2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'3/4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'8 tablespoons butter, chilled and cut into small pieces', u'3 eggs (1 whisked with 1 teaspoon water, to make an egg wash)', u'1/4 cup milk', u"1 cup confectioners' sugar", u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 to 2 tablespoons milk', u' Colored sprinkles, or small dots']
title: Fig-Stuffed Cookies: Cuccidati Italian

author: Giada De Laurentiis
categories: [u'Beans And Legumes', u'Side Dish', u'Baked Beans']
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Cook the pancetta in a heavy large oven-safe pot over medium heat until crisp, about 8 minutes. Add the onions and garlic, and saute until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Mix in the beer, tomato sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, molasses, mustard, salt, and pepper. Stir in the beans. Bring to a simmer. Transfer to the oven and bake, uncovered, until the bean mixture bubbles and thickens slightly, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces thinly sliced pancetta, chopped', u'2 onions, chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 cup dark beer', u'1 cup tomato sauce', u'1/3 cup dark brown sugar', u'1/4 cup balsamic vinegar', u'3 tablespoons mild-flavored molasses', u'6 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'4 (15-ounce) cans cannellini beans, drained']
title: Italian-Style Baked Beans

directions: [u'1/3 cup olive oil']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced or minced', u" Scant teaspoon Emeril's Italian Essence or other dried Italian herbs", u' Scant teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon hot sauce', u'1 large ripe tomato, cut into wedges', u'2 cups Italian Olive Salad, recipe follows, or store-bought Italian olive salad', u'8 large boiled shrimp, peeled and coarsely chopped, optional', u'1/2 bunch asparagus, blanched until crisp-tender, chilled', u'12 flat anchovies', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese', u'1 quart large pimiento-stuffed green olives, drained and slightly crushed', u'1 1/2 cups large Greek black olives, drained and pitted', u'1 1/2 cups extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 cups vegetable oil', u'1 cup pickled cauliflower, drained', u'1/4 bunch celery, sliced diagonally', u'2 medium carrots, peeled and thinly sliced diagonally', u'1/2 cup pepperoncini, drained and left whole', u'1/3 cup cocktail onions, drained', u'1/4 cup small capers, drained', u'6 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons Italian seasoning', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon celery seeds']
title: New Orleans-Style Italian Salad

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Bring 2/3 cup of cream and espresso to a simmer in a heavy medium saucepan. Remove from the heat. Add the chocolate and stir until the chocolate melts and the sauce is smooth. ', u'Beat the remaining 1 cup of cream, adding powdered sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, and almond extract in a large bowl until soft peaks form. Scoop the ice cream into bowls. Top with the warm fudge sauce, whipped sweetened cream, and nuts.', u"Click here to see how it's done."]
ingredients: [u'1 2/3 cups whipping cream', u'1/3 cup freshly brewed espresso', u'12 ounces semisweet chocolate chips', u'3 tablespoons powdered sugar', u'1 teaspoon almond extract', u'1 quart vanilla ice cream or gelato', u'1/2 cup slivered almonds, toasted and coarsely chopped']
title: Italian Hot Fudge Sundae

directions: [u'For the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a muffin pan with 24 cupcake liners.', u'In a very large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add the milk, shortening, Champagne and vanilla. Beat on low to medium speed for about 30 seconds, or until just combined. Scraping the bowl constantly, beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Add the egg whites and beat for 2 minutes.', u'Fill the cupcake liners half full with batter and bake until the center springs back when touched, about 12 minutes. Cool before frosting.', u'For the buttercream: Put the egg whites in the large mixing bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Put 1 1/2 cups sugar and 1/2 cup water in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil over medium to high heat. Bring to a soft ball stage (240 degrees F), 4 to 7 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, whip the egg whites at high speed until soft peaks form. With the motor running, gradually add the remaining 1/2 cup sugar, continuing to whip until medium peaks form.', u'When the sugar water reaches 240 degrees F, raise the speed to high and gradually add in the sugar water to the egg whites in a thin stream to avoid cooking the egg whites. Leave the mixer on high for 2 minutes, and then reduce the speed to medium until the mixture has cooled to room temperature, 5 to 8 minutes.', u'Once cooled, add the butter in increments, scraping the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Add in the vanilla and whip.', u'Pipe the buttercream on top of the cooled cupcakes.', u'This recipe was created by a contestant during a cooking competition. The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use, therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups all-purpose flour', u'3 cups white sugar', u'5 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 2/3 cup milk', u'1 cup shortening', u'1/2 cup Champagne', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'8 egg whites', u'2 cups sugar', u'8 large egg whites', u'4 cups (2 pounds) unsalted butter, cubed, at room temperature', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract']
title: Champagne Cupcakes with Italian Buttercream

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Heat the oil to 350 to 365 degrees F.', u'Combine all ingredients, except the rolling sugar, with an electric mixer until smooth. Drop by tablespoons into hot oil. Fry fritters until cooked thorough and golden brown, about 6 to 8 minutes. ', u'Remove from oil with tongs and drain on a cookie sheet lined with paper towels. While still very hot, roll each ball in granulated sugar. ', u'Serve warm or at room temperature. ', u'You can also add diced apples, bananas, or any other fruit to the recipe.']
ingredients: [u' Oil, for deep frying', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 pound ricotta cheese', u'2 eggs', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Pinch ground nutmeg', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'1 to 2 cups granulated or cinnamon sugar, for rolling']
title: Spingi: Italian Donut Fritters

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u'To make the marinade, mix the lemon juice, oil, vinegar, chile flakes, oregano, garlic and sprinkle with salt and pepper in a small bowl. In a plastic bag or airtight container, add the chicken pieces, potatoes, carrots and onions. Add the marinade to bag, toss well to coat evenly, and refrigerate 1 to 10 hours.', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u"Place the potatoes, carrots and onions in a single layer in a large glass baking dish. Transfer the chicken and place on top of the vegetables. Drizzle all the marinade from the bag over the chicken. Roast the chicken until it's cooked through, or an instant-read thermometer registers 165 degrees F, about 40 minutes. Cover the chicken and let rest for 5 minutes before serving."]
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons lemon juice', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon chile flakes', u'1/8 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 1/2 pounds chicken thighs and drumsticks', u'6 small red potatoes, quartered (about 1 1/2 pounds)', u'3 carrots, peeled, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 onion, cut into 1-inch pieces']
title: Italian Marinated Chicken with Red Potatoes

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine 1/2 cup of the chili sauce with the water. Add the oats, egg, chili powder, Worcestershire, and mix well. Add the decased sausage and the ground turkey or beef. Add the bell pepper, onion and corn and mix well. Divide the meat mixture in half. Lay half the meat mixture in a lightly greased 9 x 5 x 3" loaf pan. ', u'Create a shallow indent in the meat allowing the edges to rise along the edge of the pan. Layer the provolone and the spinach leaves on top of the meat along the center, staying about 1/2 inch away from the edges. Cover completely with the 2nd half of the meat mixture forming a domed top and sealing the edges. ', u'Bake uncovered for 50 minutes. Spread the remaining 1/4 cup chili sauce over the top of the loaf and bake until a meat thermometer inserted in the center of the loaf registers 165 degrees F. About 15-20 minutes longer. Allow the loaf to stand for 5-10 minutes before slicing.']
ingredients: [u'1 19 oz pkg Johnsonville Mild Italian Sausage, decased', u'3/4 lb ground beef or turkey', u'3/4 cup chili sauce', u'1/4 cup water', u'3/4 cup rolled oats', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1 tbsp chili powder', u'1 tbsp worcestershire sauce', u'1 small sweet Red bell pepper, finely chopped (ok to use green bell)', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'1 cup fresh or defrosted frozen corn kernels', u'1 cup fresh baby spinach leaves', u'3 slices provolone cheese']
title: Italian Sausage Market Meatloaf

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Butter an 8-inch square baking pan. Whisk the muffin mix and chili powder in a large bowl to blend. Mix in the milk and eggs. Stir in the tomatoes. Spread the batter in the prepared pan. Bake until the corn bread is firm to the touch and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into squares and serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 tablespoon butter', u'2 (8 1/2-ounce) packages corn muffin mix (recommended: Jiffy)', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2/3 cup whole milk', u'2 large eggs, stirred to blend', u'1/2 cup drained oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped']
title: Spicy Italian Corn Bread

directions: [u'In large a rondeau or heavy bottomed pot over medium-low heat, add butter and olive oil, then sweat onion, celery and garlic until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add sausage, and allow it to cook through, stirring often. Add spinach and toasted croutons. Mix well then add chicken stock, cream and parsley. Cook until thickens. Add cheese and season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Allow stuffing to cool.', u'']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces unsalted butter', u'2 ounces extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for searing', u'1 Vidalia onion, thin julienne', u'1 cup diced celery', u'4 cloves garlic, split in 1/2 and sliced paper thin', u'1 pound sweet Italian sausage, removed from casing', u'8 ounces baby spinach', u'1/2 cup croutons', u'3 cups chicken stock', u'3 ounces heavy cream', u'1/2 bunch flat-leaf Italian parsley, chopped', u'1 1/2 cups grated Parmigiano-Reggiano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 (8-ounce) bone-in center cut pork chops, frenched, marinated in extra-virgin olive oil, sliced shallots and Italian herbs']
title: Italian Sausage Stuffed Pork Chop

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Place an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 450 degrees F.', u'Unroll the crust on a lightly floured work surface. Using floured fingertips, seal any tears in the dough. Sprinkle the dough very lightly with flour. Using the bottom paper to lift, turn the dough over into 9-inch-diameter ceramic or glass pie dish. Peel off the remaining sheet of paper. Trim the dough overhang to 3/4 inch. Fold the overhang under and form a smooth top edge. Crimp the edge decoratively. Pierce the bottom and sides of the crust all over with a fork. Chill the crust at least 10 minutes.', u'Bake the crust until deep golden around the top edge and light golden on the bottom, about 10 minutes. Set aside to cool.', u'Reduce the oven temperature to 375 degrees F.', u'Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pancetta cook until brown and crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to paper towels to drain and cool, reserving the pancetta drippings in the skillet.', u'Add the zucchini, shallots and garlic to the skillet. Saute over medium heat until the zucchini is just barely tender, tossing occasionally, 5 to 6 minutes. Cool the zucchini slightly, about 10 minutes.', u'In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and cream. Add the cheese, basil, cooled pancetta, mustard, salt, pepper, nutmeg and cooled zucchini mixture. Whisk to blend. Pour the custard into the cooled pie crust.', u'Bake the quiche until the sides are slightly puffed and brown and the center is set, 35 to 40 minutes. Cool on a rack 20 to 30 minutes, and then serve warm or let cool completely and serve at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u' One 9-inch frozen uncooked pie crust, thawed', u' All-purpose flour, for dusting', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 ounces thinly sliced pancetta, chopped into 1/4-inch pieces', u'2 medium zucchini, ends trimmed, halved lengthwise, cut into thirds and then 1/4-inch pieces', u'2 large shallots, chopped (1/2 to 2/3 cup)', u'1 large clove garlic, finely chopped', u'4 large eggs, at room temperature', u'1 cup heavy whipping cream', u'1 cup (4 ounces) coarsely grated fontina cheese', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil', u'1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated or ground nutmeg']
title: Cheesy Italian Bacon Pie

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place the clams in a large bowl and cover with cool tap water. Salt the water well and let the clams sit for 20 minutes to an hour to purge them of sand and grit. Drain and scrub the shells well under cold running water.', u'Set a large roasting pan across two burners. Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and garlic and saute for 2 to 3 minutes, or until softened. Add the chile, fennel and sausage, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally to break up the sausage.', u'Once the sausage is nicely browned, deglaze the pan with the white wine. Add the clams and stir everything together until well combined. Arrange the tomatoes on top, add the thyme, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer the pan to the oven and cook until the clams pop open and the cherry tomatoes are roasted and juicy, 10 to 12 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the linguine until al dente. When the clams are done, return the roasting pan to the stovetop over high heat. Simmer to reduce excess liquid and to open any clams that are still closed (stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon also helps).', u'Taste sauce and season with salt as needed.', u'Drain the pasta and transfer it directly into the roasting pan. Add the butter, lemon zest and juice, and the parsley. With tongs, toss everything together to coat the pasta in the sauce.', u'Serve topped with plenty of grated pecorino if using.']
