ingredients: [u'36 littleneck clams', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 yellow onion, diced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 medium red chile, such as red jalapeno or red Fresno, finely sliced', u'2 teaspoons fennel seeds', u'1/2 pound spicy Italian sausage, casings removed', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups grape tomatoes', u'3 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves picked', u'1 pound linguine', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons butter, cold, cubed', u' Zest and juice of 1/2 lemon', u'1/4 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped', u' Pecorino Romano, grated, for serving, optional']
title: Pasta with Clams, White Wine and Spicy Italian Sausage

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Mix chicken with garlic, parsley, cheese, fennel seeds, pepper, and salt. Form 6 large, thin patties, 4 to 5 inches, or 12 small patties, 2 to 3 inches. Preheat a large, nonstick skillet and fry sausage in extra-virgin olive oil, 3 or 4 minutes on each side over medium to medium- high heat.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/3 to 1 1/2 pounds ground chicken breast', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'3 tablespoons chopped parsley leaves', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan, Parmigiano-Reggiano or Romano', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds, 1/3 palm full', u'1 teaspoon coarse black pepper, 1/3 palm full', u'3/4 teaspoon salt, eyeball it', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the pan']
title: Sweet Italian Chicken Sausage Patties

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Pop the corn and place in a bowl. Place butter and spices in a small cup or bowl and place in microwave oven and melt, 10 to 15 seconds on high. Stir and pour mixture over the popped corn. Sprinkle the corn with cheese and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 sack reduced fat natural flavor microwave popcorn, cooked to package directions', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder or granulated garlic', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1/3 cup grated Parmigiano, eyeball it']
title: Zippy Italian Popcorn

directions: [u'For the marinade: Bring the vinegar, garlic, sugar, salt, oregano, fennel seed, black pepper, and 2 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Boil for 5 minutes. Let cool. Place the brisket in a large baking dish and cover with the marinade. Let rest, covered, overnight in the refrigerator.', u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u'For the brisket: Smear with the tomato paste and place in a clean large baking dish. Cook, covered, for 5 hours. The meat should easily come apart. Cool.', u'Slice the brisket against the grain in 1/8-inch thick slices. Reserve the jus separately. Keep the brisket slices warm in the jus.', u'Remove the insides of the rolls and smear with horseradish mayonnaise, to taste. Put 2 slices cheese, 2 to 3 roasted tomatoes, and a handful of pepperoncini on each roll. Place in the oven to crisp the rolls and melt the cheese. Meanwhile, cook the eggs to over-easy. Place 2 eggs on each roll. Top with about 4 ounces brisket and drizzle with some jus. Wrap and slice in half. Buen gustaio!']
ingredients: [u'2 cups red wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup minced garlic', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons dried oregano', u'2 tablespoons fennel seed', u'1 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 (12 to 15 pound) brisket', u'1 cup tomato paste', u'8 seeded rolls, halved', u' Horseradish mayonnaise, for serving', u'16 slices sharp provolone', u'16 to 24 Roasted Tomatoes, recipe follows', u' Pepperoncini, for serving', u'8 eggs', u' This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.', u'2 Jersey tomatoes, cut into eights', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon oregano', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1/2 tablespoon sugar']
title: Paesano - Italian Beef Brisket with Fried Egg

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Combine all ingredients and dress with red wine vinegar, then extra-virgin olive oil, salt and pepper, all to your taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 hearts romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1/4 pound hot ham, sliced', u'1/4 pound Genoa salami, sliced', u'1/4 pound deli provolone cheese, chopped', u' Hot pepper rings, a couple of fork fulls', u' Cracked green olives, 1/2 cup', u'1 tomato, chopped', u'2 ribs celery, chopped', u' A few leaves basil, torn', u' Red wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons, eyeball it', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Italian Chef Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Whisk the marmalade or jam together with vinegar and oil, streaming extra-virgin olive oil in. Add shredded radicchio to salad bowl along with peppers and onions. Toss to combine the salad and season the slaw with salt and pepper, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons orange marmalade or apricot jam', u'3 tablespoons red wine vinegar, eyeball it', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it', u'2 large heads radicchio, shredded (5 to 6 cups)', u'1 red bell pepper, quartered lengthwise then thinly sliced', u'1/2 red onion, thinly sliced', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Italian Slaw Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, place the sausages and cook, stirring, until well browned, about 6 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Add the olive oil to the fat remaining in the pan and when hot, add the onions, bell peppers, oregano, salt, and pepper, reduce the heat to medium, and cook, stirring, until the vegetables are soft and slightly caramelized, about 15 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant and soft, 1 minute. Return the sausages to the pan and cook, stirring, until warmed through and well blended, 1 1/2 to 2 minutes.', u"Arrange the sausages on a platter and pass with small plates, or serve on bruschetta as a passed hors d'oeuvre.", u'']
ingredients: [u"1 (12-ounce) package Emeril's Kicked Up Smoked Sausages or other smoked sausages, sliced into rounds", u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 large yellow onion, peeled and sliced about 1/4-inch thick', u'1 large green bell pepper, cored, seeded and sliced about 1/4-inch thick', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u' Bruschetta, recipe follows, optional accompaniment']
title: Italian-style Sausages, Onions and Peppers

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'1 sack chopped romaine lettuce, 10 ounces1/2 cup special black pitted olives from the fancy olive bins near the deli1 roasted red pepper, sliced 24 slices pepperoni12 grape tomatoes\xa0Italian Blender Dressing:3 splashes red wine vinegar, about 3 tablespoons 2 tablespoons green salad olives with red pimento and juice6 leaves fresh basil, torn upHandful flat-leaf parsley leaves, 2 to 3 tablespoons 3 big spoonfuls grated Parmigiano-Reggiano or Romano A few grinds black pepper1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it\xa0']
title: A Nice Italian Girl's Salad

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Place eggplant in a large shallow baking dish. Mix together the soy sauce, sherry, sesame oil, and garlic in a small bowl. Pour the marinade over the eggplant and let marinate at room temperature for 1 hour. Preheat grill. Season the eggplant with salt and pepper to taste and grill on each side for 3 minutes, basting occasionally with the remaining marinade. Serve topped with the toasted sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'4 Japanese eggplant, halved lengthwise', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dry sherry', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'3 cloves garlic finely minced', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted lightly']
title: Grilled Japanese Eggplant

directions: [u"This approach with salmon works equally well on fresh halibut or sea bass.  We serve the resulting fish hot or at room temperature either as the center of the plate or as part of a salad.  If you're using salmon, try marinating and grilling the skin separately to use as a garnish.", u'Season salmon with salt and set aside.', u'Combine marinade ingredients, except lemon slices, in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature.  Add lemon and pour cooled marinade over fish and marinate refrigerated for 2 to 4 hours. Turn fish occasionally.', u'To serve:  Grill or broil on both sides until just done, approximately 4 to 5 minutes per side.  Be careful not to overcook.  Salmon should still be translucent in the center.  Serve with Soba Noodle Salad on the side.']
ingredients: [u'4 (5-ounce) salmon fillets', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sake or dry white wine', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons chopped green onion', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh ginger', u'1 small lemon, thinly sliced', u' Soba Noodle Salad (recipe follows)']
title: Japanese Style Grilled Salmon

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Season the pork with salt. Mix the rice wine and 1 teaspoon ginger and spread on the pork. Stack the pork and set aside.', u'Peel, quarter and seed the cucumbers; cut into 4-inch spears. Toss with the sugar and vinegar. Toast the pepper flakes with 1 tablespoon salt in a skillet over medium heat, about 4 minutes; set aside.', u'Beat the eggs with 1/2 cup water in a shallow bowl. Put the panko and cornstarch in 2 separate shallow bowls. Dredge each piece of pork in cornstarch, dip in egg, then coat with the panko. Heat 1/4 inch of peanut oil in a large skillet over high heat. Fry the pork in batches until golden, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Drain on a paper-towel-lined plate.', u'Sprinkle the cucumbers with some of the spiced salt. Mix the tonkatsu sauce and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon ginger in a bowl. Serve the pork with the cucumbers and sauce.', u'Per serving: Calories 419; Fat 19 g (Saturated 5 g); Cholesterol 170 mg; Sodium 1,388 mg; Carbohydrate 29 g; Fiber 1 g; Protein 30 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 pound thin-cut boneless pork chops or cutlets, trimmed', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons Chinese rice wine, sake or sherry', u'1 1/2 teaspoons finely grated peeled ginger', u'2 medium cucumbers', u'1/2 to 1 teaspoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons red pepper flakes', u'3 large eggs', u'2 cups panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)', u'3/4 cup cornstarch', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'1/4 cup tonkatsu sauce (a sweet-spicy Japanese dipping sauce, sold near the soy sauce; or make your own by mixing 2 tablespoons each ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and sugar with 1 tablespoon water.)']
title: Japanese-Style Crispy Pork

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat a charcoal grill or kamado-style ceramic charcoal cooker for direct grilling over high heat.', u'Whisk together the miso, mirin, sugar and 2 tablespoons water until combined.', u'Brush the cut-side of the eggplant with the oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill the eggplant, cut-side down, until lightly golden brown, about 4 minutes. Turn the eggplant over, brush with some of the glaze and continue grilling for 2 more minutes. Brush with more glaze, flip over and grill until the cut-side is caramelized, about 4 minutes. Remove to a platter, cut-side up, and sprinkle with mint.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup white miso (also called shiro miso)', u'1/4 cup cup mirin', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'6 Japanese eggplants, halved lengthwise', u'1/4 cup canola oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Chopped fresh mint, for garnish']
title: Miso Glazed Grilled Japanese Eggplant

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'In a bowl that will take the crabmeat later, whisk together the mirin, wasabi, rice vinegar, sesame oil and salt. Then remove around 4 teaspoons to another big bowl that will fit your salad in later.', u'To the first, more generous amount of dressing, add the finely chopped chile and then the crabmeat, and fork through to mix thoroughly.', u'To the small amount of dressing in the other bowl, add the lime juice and then the salad leaves and toss well to mix before arranging on 4 plates.', u'Spoon a quarter of the mixture into a regular metal kitchen third-cup measure, squishing down to get it all in, then take it over to a salad-lined plate and unmold in the center of it. Just turn over, tap and the crabmeat should fall out. Continue with the remaining 3/4 of the crabmeat and the 3 other plates.', u'Using a rounded half spoon measure, scoop out curls or humps of avocado and dot around on top of the salady bits. Spritz with a little lime juice.', u'Sprinkle the chopped chives over the 4 mounds of crab and take the plates to the table.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1/2 teaspoon wasabi paste', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u' Few drops sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon Maldon/kosher salt or 1/4 teaspoon regular salt', u'1 long red chile pepper, deseeded and finely chopped', u'1 1/4 cups crabmeat', u' Approximately 1 teaspoon lime juice', u'5 cups rocket salad', u'1 ripe avocado', u'1 to 2 teaspoons chopped chives']
title: Crab and Avocado Salad with Japanese Dressing

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large bowl place the rice and cover with cold water. Using the palm of your hand, press down on the rice and swish it around in the water for 10 to 20 seconds. Pour off all water and repeat this process 3 or 4 times, or until the water does not turn cloudy. After the final rinse, drain the rice very well, then add the 1 3/4 cups plus 1 tablespoon of water and allow the rice to soak for half an hour in summer or for 1 hour in winter.', u"Nobu's tip: Place the rice and measured water in a heavy-bottomed 1 1/2 or 2 quart saucepan. (The saucepan should be deeper rather than wide, and should have a tight fitting lid.)", u'Place the saucepan over high heat, cover with the lid and cook until you see steam. As soon as you see steam coming out of the pot, turn off the heat and wait 7 minutes. After 7 minutes, turn the heat on high and count to 10. Turn off the heat, the rice will be perfect.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups seihakumai (Japanese polished white rice)', u'1 3/4 cups plus 1 tablespoon water']
title: White Rice, Japanese Style

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a large soup pot bring the water to a boil along with the dried mushrooms, ginger, and garlic. Adjust the heat to a gentle simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Turn off the heat and let steep, 30 more minutes.', u'While the broth steeps: Melt the butter over high heat in a large nonstick skillet, add the sliced fresh mushrooms and cook until crisp and brown, about 10 minutes. Season the mushrooms with salt and pepper, to taste, and distribute them evenly between 4 soup bowls.', u'Put the eggs in a small saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, turn off heat, cover, and let cook until almost soft boiled, 3 to 4 minutes. Immediately rinse the eggs with cold water and set aside.', u"Strain the broth. Reheat and season with the sherry, soy sauce, and salt to taste. Distribute noodles, enoki mushrooms, if using, and scallions evenly in each soup bowl. Crack a soft-boiled egg into each bowl (to maintain the eggs' shape, take care to peel them carefully, or use as small spoon to free them from the shell). Ladle 2 cups of hot broth into each bowl. Sprinkle gomashio or shansho pepper over the soup, if desired, and serve immediately.", u'Copyright 2004 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'10 cups water', u'2 ounces dried mixed mushrooms, such as porcini or shitake, about 2 cups', u'10 coin-sized pieces of fresh ginger', u'5 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 pound fresh mixed mushrooms, such shitake caps or cremini, sliced', u' very thin', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'4 large eggs', u'1/4 cup medium-dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'8 ounces cooked udon noodles (or somen, buckwheat/soba, or ramen noodles)', u'1 to 2 ounces enoki mushrooms, optional', u'4 scallions, green part only, thinly sliced on the bias', u' Gomashio or sansho pepper, for seasoning']
title: Japanese Mushroom Egg Noodle Soup

directions: [u'Bring a saucepan of water to a boil and cook the Buckwheat noodles a few minutes. Drain and refresh under cold running water. Hold noodles in a bowl with cold water until ready to serve. Mix ginger, scallion and anchovy paste and set aside. In a small saucepan bring soy sauce, Mirin  and vinegar to taste, to a boil. Mix this warm liquid into ginger, scallion and anchovy paste and  season to taste with sugar, salt and pepper. Transfer this to 4 small dipping bowls. Drain noodles and portion out into 4 small bowls; top each portion with some julienned carrot. Toast sheet of Nori over an electric burner or place in a hot cast iron or heavy skillet and cook until crisp and crumble it over the soba and carrot. Dip noodles in sauce, and enjoy.']
ingredients: [u'7 to 8 ounces Japanese Buckwheat noodles', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'3 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1/2 teaspoon anchovy paste, or to taste', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup Mirin or dry sherry', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u' Pinch of sugar', u' Pinch of salt', u'1/4 cup finely julienned carrot', u'1 sheet of Nori']
title: Chilled Japanese Soba with Dipping Sauce

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.  ', u'Wash and dry the eggplant, then cut lengthwise in half.  With a paring knife, slightly core out some of the seeded area.  Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and put on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes.', u'While the eggplants are baking, combine the shrimp with the rice vinegar, agave, red bell peppers and snow peas in a large bowl. Set aside.', u'In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, Sriracha, sweet chili sauce, lime zest and lime juice.  Set aside.', u'After the eggplants have roasted, carefully fill them with the shrimp mixture.  Put them back in the oven until the shrimp are opaque and cooked through, about 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Remove the eggplant from the oven to a serving platter. Drizzle with the Sriracha mayonnaise and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 small Japanese eggplants (about 6 inches)', u'1 teaspoon olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound shrimp (21 to 25 count) cleaned, deveined and diced', u'1/3 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon agave syrup', u'1/2 cup seeded and 1/4-inch diced red bell pepper', u'1/4 cup diced snow peas', u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons Sriracha hot chili sauce', u'1 teaspoon sweet chili sauce', u'1 lime, zested and juiced']
title: Japanese Eggplants with Sriracha Shrimp

directions: [u'Mix all the ingredients for the sauce. Add the chopped tomato, cilantro and onion. Season the tuna very well with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add the vegetable oil. When the oil is hot, sear the tuna for 30 seconds on each side. Remove from heat and slice the tuna into 1/4-inch slices. To serve, neatly arrange the tuna slices and avocado slices on a plate and drizzle the sauce over the tuna.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 tomato, finely chopped', u'8 cilantro sprigs, finely chopped', u'1 red onion, finely chopped', u'4 (6-ounce) fresh tuna fillets', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper', u'4 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'2 avocados, sliced 1/4-inch thick']
title: Seared Tuna with Japanese Salsa

directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine ingredients until well blended.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon  rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon light  sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger']
title: Thai Japanese Dressing

directions: [u'Prepare udon noodles according to package directions, drain.', u'In a steamer pot, add clams, cooking sake, and regular sake. Steam until the clams open up. Strain, reserving clams and liquid separately. Set aside.', u'In a saucepan, heat olive oil and butter. Add onion, ginger, garlic, and hot pepper flakes. Saute for 2 minutes. Add the cooking sake and simmer for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, parsley and salt to taste. Simmer an additional 5 minutes.', u'Add whipping cream and simmer 3 minutes. Add reserved clam juice and simmer an additional 3 minutes. Toss the sauce over the noodles and garnish with the steamed clams.']
ingredients: [u'1 package udon noodles', u'1 pound littleneck clams', u'1/4 cup cooking sake', u'3/4 cup regular sake', u'3 tablespoons light olive oil', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1/2 small yellow onion, chopped', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon hot pepper flakes', u'1/4 cup cooking sake', u'2 small seeded and chopped tomatoes', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped flat-leaf parsley', u' Salt to taste', u'1/2 cup whipping cream', u'1/2 cup clam juice (from the steamed clams)']
title: Udon Noodles with Japanese Clam Sauce

directions: [u'In a saucepan over medium heat, add the chicken broth, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger and bring it to a simmer. Add the noodles and cook for 1 minute.  Add the beef and vegetables and cook for another 2 minutes. Divide the noodle mixture between 2 bowls and serve hot, garnished with the sliced scallion.']
ingredients: [u'2 (14.5-ounce) cans reduced sodium chicken broth', u'1/4 cup reduced sodium soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'1/4 -inch piece peeled fresh ginger, finely chopped', u'1/2 pound noodles reserved from the Hibachi Steak recipe', u'2 cups reserved steak and vegetables from Hibachi Steak recipe', u'1 scallion, sliced']
title: Online Round 2 Recipe - Japanese Noodle Bowl

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the soybeans in the top of a steamer set over a pot of simmering water. Steam until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and toss with the sesame oil and kosher salt. Serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound frozen soybeans', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt']
title: Edamame (Japanese soybeans cooked in the pod)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine the rice vinegar, minced chiles, salt, and mirin in a glass bowl. Add the sliced scallops and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Add the green onion and sesame seeds, gently stirring to mix.', u'Arrange the cucumber slices on each of 4 plates. Spoon the scallop mixture on top of the cucumbers and garnish with the julienned chiles. Drizzle with soy sauce and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons minced takanotsume chile, or other hot red chile, plus 1 takanotsume chile, or other hot red chile, julienned', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon mirin', u'1 pound fresh, sushi-grade sea scallops, sliced crosswise into rounds as thinly as possible', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped green onions', u'1 teaspoon toasted black sesame seeds', u'1 cup peeled, seeded, and thinly sliced cucumber', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce']
title: Peruvian-Japanese Scallop Ceviche

directions: [u'Just before rolling sushi, toast the nori by passing the shiny side over a high flame. The color of the nori will change from brownish black to dark green. (Without toasting, the nori will be gummy and hard to chew.) Cut toasted nori sheets in half crosswise. ', u'Lay a 1/2 a sheet of the nori, shiny side down on a counter. Combine the rice vinegar and water in a bowl, and moisten your hands with this hand vinegar to keep the rice from sticking to your hands as you work. Spread about 1 cup of the sushi rice on 3/4 of the nori closest to you, in a layer about 1/4 inch thick, spreading it to the edges. Lay 1/4 of the pickle slices across the center of the nori. Roll gently, using the fingers and palms of both hands. Eat immediately, without cutting, and serve the soy sauce as a dipping sauce. Yield: 4 servings, 4 rolls ', u'VARIATION: CONES ', u'As a variation, roll the nori, rice and ingredients into a cone shape and serve with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups sushi rice, cooked', u'4 takuan, Japanese pickles, cut into thin strips', u'2 sheets nori seaweed', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons water', u' Soy sauce, for dipping']
title: Japanese Pickle Roll (Handroll, Temakisushi)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine all ingredients. Use as batter for meats and vegetables']
ingredients: [u'1 cup of flour', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 1/2 cups of seltzer water', u' Salt']
title: Tempura Batter

directions: [u'Put oil in a pan. Put the salmon filets in and flip to coat. Rub with garlic and ginger. Mix together remaining ingredients, except broth, in a separate bowl. Pour half of the mixture over the salmon. Cook over medium heat, covered, for 5 minutes. Turn salmon and add the rest of the mixture. If it needs more liquid, add broth 1/4 cup at a time. When salmon is opaque all the way through, remove from heat. Remove salmon from skin. Pour liquid over linguini then place chunks of salmon on top. Garnish with slivered pickled ginger.', u'The recipes for this program, which were provided by contributors and guests who may not be professional chefs, have not been tested in the Food Network?s kitchens. Therefore, the Food Network cannot attest to the accuracy of any of the recipes.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'4 salmon fillets, skin on', u'2 to 3 cloves garlic, grated with a Japanese ginger grater', u'2 -inch piece of shoga (ginger), grated', u'2 naganegi, or 1 bunch scallions', u'1/4 cup shoyu (soy sauce), more or less', u'1/4 cup sake', u'1/8 cup mirin', u' Pepper', u'1 pound linguini, cooked', u' Dashi (fish broth) or chicken broth']
title: Japanese Salmon Over Linguine

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the vinegar and sugar together in a small bowl and set aside.', u"Combine the rice, water, and 1 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan with a tight-fitting lid. Wrap the pan's lid tightly with a small kitchen towel and cover the saucepan. (Make sure the towel's edges are folded up well away from the heat.) Bring to a boil, lower the heat to low, and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes.", u"Remove the rice from the heat (don't uncover) and set aside for 10 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a large bowl. Add the vinegar mixture and toss with the rice, using a wooden spoon. Spread it out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Fan the rice continuously with a fan or magazine until cooled. Cover the rice with a damp towel.", u'Pour about 1 inch of water into a large saucepan and set up a collapsible steamer inside. Bring the water to boil, put the carrots and mushrooms in the steamer, cover, and steam until tender, about 6 minutes. Transfer the carrots and mushrooms to a large bowl, add the remaining 2 teaspoons salt, sesame oil, and sesame seeds, and stir to combine. Let cool.', u'When the vegetable mixture has cooled, add the cucumber, pickled daikon, lime juice, and lime zest and toss to combine. Add the rice and, using a rubber spatula, lightly mix with the vegetable mixture.', u'Set a small bowl of water beside you. Lightly wet your hands and form the vegetable rice into 12 small football-like shapes. Stuff the rice into the tofu pockets and press the sides together. Stuff a few tuffs of radish sprouts in the sides, if using. Stand the tofu packages up on a serving platter and sprinkle with the sansho. Serve with pickled ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.', u"Cook's Note: Sansho is Japanese-style Sichuan pepper, available at Asian and health food stores. It's a fragrant, lemony pepper that's literally zippy on the tongue, but without spicy heat. We use it to finish a variety of dishes, from soups to rice to meats.", u'Copyright 2005 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 cup short-grained sushi rice', u'1 cup plus 1 tablespoon water', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 medium-small carrot, diced', u'3 ounces shiitake mushrooms (about 9), stemmed and diced', u'1/2 teaspoon dark sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'1/2 kirby cucumber, peeled, seeded, and diced', u'1 ounce Japanese yellow pickled daikon (about a 2-inch-long piece), diced', u'1 teaspoon freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1/4 teaspoon finely grated lime zest', u'12 prepared deep-fried tofu pockets (inari-age), patted dry on paper towels and opened', u' Daikon radish sprouts, for garnish, optional', u" Ground sasho pepper, as needed (see Cook's Note)", u' Serving suggestions: Pickled ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce']
title: Japanese Vegetable and Rice Stuffed Tofu: Inari Sushi

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Put the kombu in a 4-quart saucepan, cover with the water and soak for 30 minutes.  ', u'Set the saucepan over medium heat until the water reaches 150 to 160 degrees F and small bubbles appear around the sides of the pan, 9 to 10 minutes. ', u'Remove the kombu from the pan.  Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil, 5 to 6 minutes.  Reduce the heat to low and add the bonito flakes.  Simmer gently, stirring frequently, for 10 minutes. ', u'Strain the liquid through a fine mesh strainer lined with muslin or several layers of cheesecloth. Reserve the bonito flakes for another use.', u'Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Use within 1 week or freeze for up to a month.']
ingredients: [u'2 (4-inch) square pieces kombu', u'2 1/2 quarts water', u'1/2 -ounce bonito flakes or katsuobushi, about 2 cups']
title: Dashi

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'To make the mushrooms, toss caps with olive oil, ginger, and salt, to taste. Place the mushrooms in a roasting pan and roast in the oven for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove the mushrooms from pan, cool, add soy sauce, and set aside.', u'In a medium size mixing bowl, combine the root beer, hoisin, vinegar, mirin, and shallots. Using a wire whisk, beat while slowly adding the oil a thin stream. Set aside.', u'To prepare the fish, preheat a saute pan and add the peanut oil. Season the fish with salt and pepper and place in the pan. Saute for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until fillet just becomes opaque. Set aside and keep warm.', u'To serve, place fish in the center of each plate. Top with 4 mushroom caps each and drizzle the vinaigrette over the fish.']
ingredients: [u'16 shiitake mushrooms, stems removed', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 -ounce fresh ginger, peeled and sliced thinly', u' Salt', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/4 cup root beer, flat', u'1 tablespoon hoisin', u'2 tablespoons white balsamic vinegar', u'1 tablespoon mirin, boiled 10 seconds and cooled', u'1 teaspoon minced shallots', u'1/2 cup peanut oil', u'4 (5-ounce) Japanese yellowtail fillets', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Japanese Yellowtail with Ginger Roasted Shiitake Mushrooms and Root Beer Hoisin Vinaigrette

directions: [u'As the risotto finishes cooking, stir in the uni puree to coat the risotto. Set aside and keep warm.', u'Remove the "foot" of the scallops and pat them dry. Season scallops with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a small saute pan over medium-high heat. Add scallops and sear until golden brown on 1 side. Turn scallops over and sear on the other side until golden brown and just cooked through in the middle. Remove from the heat and keep warm.', u'To serve, place risotto in a bowl and top with scallops. Carefully position a piece of uni on each of the scallops. Garnish with ikura and drizzle with truffle vinaigrette.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup prepared risotto cooked in dashi', u'2 tablespoons uni puree (reduced cream with ratio of 1-ounce uni to 1 1/2 cups cream)', u'2 (10/20 count) scallops, preferably "dayboat" or Japanese', u' Salt and white pepper', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 pieces fresh uni', u'1 teaspoon ikura (salmon roe)', u'1 teaspoon truffle vinaigrette (either store-bought or homemade), or sherry vinaigrette finished with white truffle oil']
title: Uni Risotto with Seared Japanese Scallops, Truffle Vinaigrette and Ikura

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the turnip, potatoes, all but 2 tablespoons of the chopped red onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are slightly softened, about 3 minutes; remove to a plate.', u'Melt 2 tablespoons butter in the pot. Sprinkle in the flour and curry powder; cook, stirring, 1 minute. Gradually whisk in the broth until smooth. Return the potato mixture to the pot; add the peas and carrots and the sugar. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium. Cover and simmer 10 minutes; uncover and simmer 5 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Season the steak with salt and pepper. Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steak; cook 4 minutes per side. Let rest 5 minutes, then slice against the grain. Serve with the curry and rice. Top with the reserved red onion.', u'Per serving: Calories 493; Fat 19 g (Saturated 10 g); Cholesterol 75 mg; Sodium 166 mg; Carbohydrate 54 g; Fiber 4 g; Protein 27 g', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 large turnip, peeled and cut into small cubes', u'2 Yukon gold potatoes (about 12 ounces), cut into small cubes', u'1 red onion, chopped', u' Kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 cup frozen peas and carrots', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1 12 -ounce flank steak', u' Cooked white or brown rice, for serving (optional)']
title: Japanese Beef Curry

directions: [u'Equipment: 12 wooden skewers for skewering the chicken and vegetables', u'To make the marinade: In a saucepan whisk together the soy sauce, Sherry, sugar, ginger, and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, lower the heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Let the marinade cool. (The marinade can be made in advance, and refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.)', u"To make the skewers: On each skewer alternate 3 pieces of chicken with 2 scallion lengths and 2 water chestnuts. (Skewer the water chestnuts carefully so they don't split; and begin and end with the chicken.) Arrange the skewers in a large shallow baking dish and pour the marinade over the chicken and vegetables. Marinate at room temperature, turning once, for 30 minutes. (The skewers can be marinated up to overnight.)", u'Arrange an oven rack about 4 inches from the broiler and preheat.', u'Arrange the skewers on a foil-lined baking sheet, reserving the marinade. Broil the skewers, basting occasionally for the first 6 minutes. Continue broil, turning occasionally, until the chicken is just cooked through, about 10 minutes. Discard any remaining marinade. Transfer the skewers to a platter and serve with the lemon wedges and mustard. ']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup dry Sherry', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon minced, peeled fresh ginger', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 skinless boneless chicken thighs, cut into 36 (1 1/2-inch) pieces', u'2 bunches scallions (about 10), the white and pale green parts cut into 24 (1 1/2-inch) lengths', u'24 canned whole water chestnuts, rinsed and drained', u' Lemon wedges, as needed', u' Mustard, preferably Chinese-style, as needed']
title: Japanese Chicken, Water Chestnut, and Scallion Yakitori

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'Pour the whisky and soy sauce into a liquor glass, pour a side shot of pickle brine and serve with a pickle wedge. Sip or shoot the whisky, then immediately after swallowing, sip or shoot the pickle brine and then take a bite of the pickle wedge.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 ounces Japanese whiskey, such as Suntory Yamazaki', u'1/4 ounce aged or naturally fermented soy sauce', u"1 ounce pickle brine, such as McClure's", u' Pickle wedge, for garnish']
title: Japanese Pickleback

directions: [u'Combine ingredients in a saucepan on medium heat until the sugar is dissolved.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 tablespoons sweet rice wine', u'1 tablespoon, plus 2 teaspoons brown sugar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'1/2 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon water']
title: Teriyaki Sauce

directions: [u'Rinse the chicken, cut off any excess fat and pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle the chicken with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and the pepper. Using a sharp knife, score the chicken, especially in fibrous parts of the meat. Use the point of the knife to poke small holes in the chicken, then cut the chicken in bite-size (1 1/2-inch) pieces.', u'In a mixing bowl combine the chicken, sake, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, soy sauce and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Mix well, rubbing the marinade into the chicken. Marinate for 2 hours in the refrigerator.', u'Add the egg slowly to the chicken while mixing with your hands. Add the cornstarch and lightly toss to coat the chicken. In a medium saucepan heat the vegetable oil over medium heat until a deep-frying thermometer reads 335 degrees F. Fry the chicken, a few pieces at a time, until golden brown, about 10 minutes (the internal temperature of the meat should be 165 degrees F). Shake off any excess grease. Cool and reserve the oil for another use. Plate the chicken and garnish with lemon wedges to serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'1 tablespoon sake', u'1 teaspoon grated garlic', u'1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon usukuchi soy sauce', u'1 egg, beaten', u'3 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 cups vegetable oil', u'1 lemon, cut into wedges']
title: Japanese Fried Chicken (Chicken Karaage)

directions: [u'Clean the mushroom caps and remove stems. In a saucepan, combine the sake, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and add the mushrooms. Simmer for 7 minutes. Remove mushrooms and use in a salad immediately, or cool and use later with grilled meats.']
ingredients: [u' (Recipe Courtesy of Jack Czarneki)', u'30 fresh shiitake caps', u'2/3 cup good-quality sake', u'4 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'2 2 tablespoons mirin', u'2 2 tablespoons sugar']
servings: 4 as side dish or in salad
title: Shiitake Japanese Style

directions: [u'Heat the chicken stock in a medium saucepot and keep warm.', u'Coat a straight-sided pan with the vegetable oil and set over medium heat. Add the ginger and scallion whites and cook until aromatic, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the rice, sprinkle with salt and cook for a minute or two to toast the rice. Deglaze with the sake and cook for about a minute to allow the alcohol to burn off. Add a few ladles of hot stock to the rice, just enough to cover, and cook, stirring constantly, until the rice has absorbed the stock. Add a few more ladles of stock and repeat. You will do this 4 to 6 times, until all of the stock is absorbed and the rice is cooked through but still has a nice bite to it. The whole process should take about 20 minutes.', u'Once the rice is cooked, stir in the shrimp and edamame and let the heat of the rice gently cook the shrimp. Once the shrimp have turned opaque, stir in the miso paste. Beyond this point, do not let the risotto boil; miso tastes bitter if it boils. Check the seasoning and adjust the salt as needed. Add the mirin, lemon zest and juice and scallion greens and gently fold in the crabmeat.', u'To plate, spoon a generous amount of risotto into a serving bowl, drizzle with a little sesame oil, add a splash of soy sauce and top with some nori.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups chicken stock', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons finely minced ginger (about one 1-inch piece)', u'5 scallions, sliced, white and green parts separated', u'2 cups Arborio rice', u' Kosher salt', u'1/3 cup sake', u'8 ounces small-medium shrimp, halved lengthwise (I like to use rock shrimp or Laughing Bird shrimp if available)', u'3/4 cup frozen shelled edamame, thawed', u'2 tablespoons white miso', u'1/4 cup mirin', u' Zest and juice of 1 lemon', u'8 to 12 ounces jumbo lump crabmeat, picked through for shells', u' Toasted sesame oil, for garnish', u' Soy sauce, for garnish', u' Toasted shredded nori, for garnish']
title: Japanese Seafood Risotto

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'In a large plastic resealable bag, add the soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and grated ginger and mix until the sugar is dissolved. Put the chicken thighs into the bag with the marinade. Seal and refrigerate at least 2 hours or as long as overnight.', u'Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium heat.', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade and set aside. Put the marinade in a pot over medium heat and reduce by half.  Oil the grill grates with canola oil, arrange the chicken on the grill, skin-side down and cook for 8 minutes per side.  Brush the chicken liberally with the reduced marinade before turning.  (Reserve 1 piece of chicken for the Round 2 Recipe. Chicken Pot Stickers.)', u'In a medium pot combine the rice, sliced ginger, salt and 3 1/2 cups of water.  Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and cover.  Let cook until the rice has absorbed all the water and is fluffy, about 15 to 20 minutes.', u'While the chicken is cooking, put the scallions on the grill, reserve 1 uncooked scallion for Round 2 Recipe "Chicken Pot Stickers".  Cook until wilted, about 2 minutes per side. (Reserve 2 grilled scallions for Round 2 Recipe "Chicken Pot Stickers")', u'Transfer the rice to a serving platter, discarding the sliced ginger.  Top with the cooked chicken, garnish with grilled scallions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup reduced sodium soy sauce', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 (1-inch) piece peeled, fresh ginger, divided use, 1/2 grated the other half thinly sliced', u'2 pounds skin-on boneless chicken thighs', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'2 cups conventional white rice', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3 1/2 cups water', u'2 bunches scallions, ends removed']
title: Chicken Teriyaki with Ginger Rice

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u"In a large bowl, add rice and cover with lots of water. Stir rice in water with your hands, then pour off most of the water, and agitate 10 to 15 times by quickly moving your hand back and forth, swishing rice against side of bowl. Rinse the rice several more times, until the water that drains off of the rice is almost clear. Transfer the rice to a colander and let drain for 1 hour, undisturbed. Transfer the rice to a rice cooker, add the water, cover, and cook as directed by manufacturer's directions.", u'While the rice is cooking, bring rice vinegar to a boil in a small saucepan, and then remove from the heat. Add sugar and salt and stir until dissolved. Allow to cool to room temperature.', u'When rice is done, allow cooked rice to remain in rice cooker for 10 minutes. Transfer rice to a large shallow mixing bowl (traditionally a wooden tub, called a hangiri), so that rice forms a mound in the center of the bowl. Using a diagonal slicing motion, gently cut into rice with a wooden paddle (called a kijakushi), and pour cooled vinegar mixture over top of rice. "Cut" rice several times to evenly distribute vinegar mixture, then allow to cool. Gently turn rice over from time to time with paddle so that rice cools evenly. You might want to consider using a fan if time is of the essence. When rice has cooled to body temperature, it is ready to use for sushi rolls. Rice can be kept at the proper temperature by placing it in an insulated container such as a small ice chest, covered with a damp kitchen towel.']
ingredients: [u'3 3/4 cups Japanese rice, such as Nishiki (or 5 rice maker cups)', u'3 3/4 cups water (or 5 rice maker cups)', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'4 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt']
servings: enough rice for at least 7 lar
title: Mitsuko's Perfect Sushi Rice

directions: [u'Wash then boil the okra in a saucepan of boiling water until almost tender but still firm. Drain and put in refrigerator to cool. When ready to eat, slice okra into 1/4-inch rings, put in small mixing bowl and then add bonita flakes. Stir and add shoyu to moisten and to taste and add a touch of toogarashi, depending on how spicy you like it. Best eaten with Japanese rice.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound okra', u'1 package katsuobushi (shaved bonito fish)', u' Pinch of toogarashi (red pepper flakes)', u' Shoyu (soy sauce) to taste']
title: Maxanne's Japanese Okra

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Place the rice into a mixing bowl and cover with cool water. Swirl the rice in the water, pour off and repeat 2 to 3 times or until the water is clear.', u'Place the rice and 2 cups of water into a medium saucepan and place over high heat. Bring to a boil, uncovered. Once it begins to boil, reduce the heat to the lowest setting and cover. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.', u'Combine the rice vinegar, sugar and salt in a small bowl and heat in the microwave on high for 30 to 45 seconds. Transfer the rice into a large wooden or glass mixing bowl and add the vinegar mixture. Fold thoroughly to combine and coat each grain of rice with the mixture. Allow to cool to room temperature before using to make sushi or sashimi.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sushi or short grain rice', u'2 cups water, plus extra for rinsing rice', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt']
title: Sushi Rice

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Peel and slice cucumbers into very thin slices. Sprinkle sliced cucumber slices with salt and let stand a few minutes. Squeeze out excess moisture. Combine vinegar, sugar, and soy in a bowl and mix well. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber slices and mix well. Serve in individual dishes.', u'May add Wakame (seaweed), crab, and shrimp.']
ingredients: [u'1 large English cucumber, or 2 to 3 Japanese cucumbers', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 drop soy sauce']
title: Sunomono

directions: [u'In a wok, heat 3 ounces of peanut oil. Add beef strips and stir-fry quickly, just to brown meat. Season with soy sauce and sugar, then remove and set aside.', u'Clean the wok, and heat the remaining 3 ounces of peanut oil. Add scallions, onions, mushrooms, tofu, spinach, and bamboo shoots. Stir-fry quickly, about 2 minutes. Add mirin and noodles and return cooked meat to the mixture. Stir-fry an additional minute or just until hot and well-incorporated.', u'Remove from wok and serve at once on a preheated dinner plate.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces peanut oil, plus 3 ounces', u'1 1/2 pounds beef top round, trimmed and cut into julienne', u'4 ounces soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'10 scallions, washed, trimmed and cut into 1-inch strips', u'10 ounces peeled and julienned Spanish onion', u'10 ounces mushrooms, washed, stems trimmed and thinly sliced', u'1 pound tofu, cut into small dice', u'10 ounces spinach, washed, stemmed and cut chiffonade', u'8 ounces bamboo shoots, julienned', u'10 ounces mirin (available in Asian markets)', u'1 1/2 pounds shirataki noodles, cooked, cooled and cut into thirds']
title: Japanese Beef and Vegetables: Sukiyaki

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Special equipment: 6-inch wooden skewers, soaked in cold water for at least 1 hour', u'Whisk together the radish puree, mirin, sake, oil, soy and hot sauce in a large bowl. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 and up to 8 hours.', u'Preheat a charcoal grill or kamado-style ceramic charcoal cooker for direct grilling over high heat.', u'Using 2 skewers for each chicken thigh, thread the edges of the meat onto the skewers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill until charred and cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board.', u'Whisk together the oil, rice vinegar, soy, lime juice and sugar in a large bowl and season with pepper. Pour some over the mizuna, toss to coat and mound in a large shallow serving bowl. Toss the noodles with the remaining dressing and mound in the center of the mizuna.', u'Cut the chicken thighs in half down the middle between the skewers to make kebabs. Arrange the skewers spoke-like around the mizuna, chicken toward the center, drizzle with additional hot sauce and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup pureed daikon radish', u'1/3 cup mirin', u'1/3 cup sake', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u' Few dashes hot sauce, such as Tabasco, plus more for serving', u'2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 tablespoons canola oil', u'4 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons lime juice', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'8 ounces rice noodles, cooked according to directions, shocked in cold water and drained well', u'8 ounces mizuna']
title: Chicken Yakitori

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'To make the teriyaki sauce, heat the rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, and scallions to boiling over medium heat. Let cook for 7 minutes, then whisk in cornstarch slurry and cook for another 3 minutes or so, to allow to thicken. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.', u'Arrange the chicken cubes in a shallow nonreactive container such as a glass baking dish. Season with salt and pepper and rub into the chicken. Pour the sake over the chicken and then pour in the teriyaki sauce. Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. ', u"Begin soaking about 12 bamboo skewers in water so they won't burn on the grill.", u'Heat the grill and thread alternate pieces of chicken and leeks on the skewers. Each skewer should have approximately 3 pieces of chicken, and each serving will consist of 3 skewers. Grill over indirect heat until the chicken is tender but not dry, about 5 to 10 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fresh ginger root, coating scraped off with the tip of a spoon and finely minced', u'2 tablespoons sliced scallions, white and tender green parts only (1 or 2 scallions)', u'1/4 cup cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water', u'2 pounds boneless chicken breasts, cut into cubes', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup sake', u'12 bamboo skewers', u'2 leeks, white parts only, soaked in salt water to remove grit and sliced on the bias into 1-inch lengths']
title: Chicken Yakitori with Scallions (Traditional Style Japanese Kebabs)

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Whisk together the miso, mirin, vinegar, soy sauce, green onions, ginger, and sesame oil in a small bowl. Place the salmon in a baking dish, pour the marinade over, and turn to coat. Cover and marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.', u'Heat grill to high. Remove the fish from the marinade and season with salt and pepper. Grill the salmon, skin side down, with the cover closed, until golden brown and a crust has formed, about 3 to 4 minutes. Turn the salmon over and continue grilling for 3 to 4 minutes for medium doneness. Drizzle with a little yuzu juice, if desired, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup white miso (fermented soybean paste)', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'2 tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar', u'2 to 3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons minced green onions', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'4 salmon fillets, 8 ounces each', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Yuzu juice, for drizzling, optional']
title: Miso-Ginger Marinated Grilled Salmon

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Wrap the block of tofu in 2 layers of paper towels and lay on a plate.  Invert a second plate on top of the tofu and weigh down with a 28-ounce can.  Leave for 20 minutes then cut the tofu into 1/4 to 1/2-inch cubes.', u'Heat the dashi in a 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat.  When the dashi reaches 100 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer, ladle 1 cup into a small bowl. Add the miso, and whisk until smooth. ', u'Bring the remaining dashi to a bare simmer, approximately 10 minutes.  Add the miso mixture and whisk to combine. Return to a slight simmer, being careful not to boil the mixture. Add the tofu and scallions and cook for another minute or until heated through.  Remove from the heat, ladle into soup bowls and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'12 -ounce block firm silken tofu', u'2 quarts dashi', u'6 tablespoons dark or red miso', u'2 tablespoons light or white miso', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced']
title: Miso Soup

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Whisk the cake flour and rice flour together in a medium glass bowl and divide it in half. Set aside.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a 5-quart Dutch oven over high heat until it reaches 375 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer.', u'Once the temperature reaches 365 degrees F, whisk the egg, seltzer water and vodka, in a medium mixing bowl and divide it in half.  Put half of the mixture in the refrigerator to reserve.  Pour half of the liquid mixture into half of the dry mixture and whisk to combine, about 10 to 15 seconds. Some lumps may remain. Set the glass bowl in a larger bowl lined with ice.', u'Dip the sweet potatoes into the batter using tongs, drain for 2 to 3 seconds over the bowl, and then add to the hot oil. Adjust the heat to maintain between 375 and 400 degrees F.  Fry 6 to 8 pieces, at a time, until puffy and very light golden, about 1 to 2 minutes Remove to a cooling rack lined with 3 layers of paper towels set over a half sheet pan. Sprinkle with salt, if desired.  Repeat the same dipping and frying procedure with the green beans and parsley leaves.  Put the fried vegetables on a serving platter and serve the as an appetizer while preparing the seafood.', u'Whisk together the remaining halves of dry and liquid batter ingredients as above and repeat dipping and frying with the shrimp and fish fillets.  Sprinkle with salt, if desired, transfer the fish to a serving platter and serve immediately.', u"Cook's Note: Tempura may be held in a 200 degree F oven for up to 30 minutes, though texture is compromised."]
ingredients: [u'5 ounces unbleached cake flour', u'5 ounces white rice flour', u'1 1/2 quarts vegetable oil', u'1 large egg, beaten', u'1 1/2 cups cold seltzer water', u'1/2 cup vodka', u'5 to 6 ounces sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1/8-inch thick slices', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 pound fresh green beans, trimmed', u'8 stems flat-leaf parsley', u'1/2 pound shrimp, 31 to 35 count, head and tail-on, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 pound tilapia fillets, cut into 1-inch pieces', u' Ice']
title: Tempura

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Put a large skillet over medium-high heat and add half of the oil. When the oil is hot, add the vegetables and stir-fry until the vegetables are almost done, about 5 minutes. While the vegetables are cooking, heat a second skillet over high heat and add the remaining oil.', u'Cut the steak into small cubes, and stir-fry until browned on all sides, about 4 to 5 minutes.', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat. Separate the egg roll wrappers into 2 piles.  Roll each pile up into a log. Slice the log into thin strips about 1/4-inch thick and separate them into individual noodles. Put half of the noodles into the boiling water and cook for 3 minutes. Drain and add to a serving bowl or platter. (Reserve the remaining noodles for the Online Round 2 Recipe, Japanese Noodle Bowl.)', u'In a small bowl combine the soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and cornstarch and set aside.', u'Add the steak, along with any accumulated juices, to the pan with the vegetables. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the vegetables and cook until the sauce has thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the butter.  (Reserve 2 cups for the Online Round 2 Recipe, Japanese Noodle Bowl).', u'Top the cooked noodles with the steak and vegetable mixture and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 large carrot, thinly sliced', u'1 zucchini, thinly sliced', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'1 (8-ounce) package sliced mushrooms', u'1 1/2 pounds top round steak', u'1 pound egg roll wrappers', u'1/2 cup reduced sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'2 teaspoons chopped garlic', u'1 teaspoon cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons butter']
title: Hibachi Steak

directions: [u'For the dashi: Combine the kombu with 6 cups cold water in a medium pot and slowly bring to a simmer over medium heat, about 10 minutes; do not boil or the kombu will turn bitter. Just as the water reaches a simmer, remove and discard the kombu and add the bonito flakes. Heat to just shy of a boil, remove from the heat and set aside to steep for a few minutes. Strain into a bowl and discard the bonito flakes.', u'For the ramen broth: Wipe out the pot, add the oil and set over medium-high heat. Add the reserved shrimp shells and scallion whites. Cook, stirring, until the shells are brown all over, 4 to 5 minutes; the shells should make a crackling sound as they toast and brown. Add the dashi and shiitakes and bring to a simmer. Cook for 30 minutes, then strain the broth, reserving the shiitakes. Return the broth to the pot, stir in the mirin and seafood seasoning and set over low heat until ready to serve. You should have about 3 cups of broth. Stem and slice the shitakes and set aside.', u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat and cook the ramen noodles according to package instructions. Drain and rinse the noodles with cold water to remove surface starch and stop the cooking. Leave to drain.', u'Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 5 minutes, then transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Pour half of the bacon fat from the pan into a small container to save for frying the noodles. Raise the heat to medium-high, add the shrimp and corn to the remaining bacon fat in the skillet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute until the shrimp are cooked through, about 4 minutes. Remove the shrimp and corn to a plate, then add the reserved bacon fat to the skillet. Let the skillet get good and hot before adding the ramen noodles. Cook, stirring minimally, until the noodles are crispy and charred in places, about 3 minutes.', u'Divide the noodles among four bowls. Top with shrimp, corn, bacon, sliced shiitakes, scallion greens and shredded nori. Ladle ramen broth into the bowls and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Two 6-by-7-inch pieces kombu (dried kelp; about 3/4 ounce), rinsed', u'1 1/2 ounces bonito flakes', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'12 ounces large shrimp (16/20), peeled and deveined, sliced in half lengthwise, shells reserved', u'4 scallions, greens thinly sliced, whites left whole', u'8 dried shiitake mushrooms (about 3/4 ounce)', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'2 teaspoons seafood seasoning, such as Old Bay', u'15 ounces fresh ramen noodles (you could use dry in a pinch)', u'4 ounces thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/2-inch strips', u'2 ears corn, kernels removed or 1 cup frozen corn, thawed', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' Shredded nori, for garnish']
title: Roasted Shrimp, Corn and Bacon Ramen

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Squeeze the lemon juice over the avocado to prevent browning.', u'Cover a bamboo rolling mat with plastic wrap. Cut nori sheets in half crosswise. Lay 1 sheet of nori, shiny side down, on the plastic covered mat. Wet your fingers with water and spread about 1/2 cup of the rice evenly onto the nori. Sprinkle the rice with sesame seeds. Turn the sheet of nori over so that the rice side is down. Place 1/8 of the cucumber, avocado and crab sticks in the center of the sheet. Grab the edge of the mat closest to you, keeping the fillings in place with your fingers, and roll it into a tight cylinder, using the mat to shape the cylinder. Pull away the mat and set aside. Cover with a damp cloth. Repeat until all of the rice has been used. Cut each roll into 6 pieces. Serve with pickled ginger, wasabi and soy sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Juice of 1/2 lemon', u'1 medium avocado, peeled, pitted, and sliced into 1/4-inch thick pieces', u'4 sheets nori', u'1/2 batch sushi rice, recipe follows', u'1/3 cup sesame seeds, toasted', u'1 small cucumber, peeled, seeded, and cut into matchstick-size pieces', u'4 crabsticks, torn into pieces', u' Pickled ginger, for serving', u' Wasabi, for serving', u' Soy sauce, for serving', u'2 cups sushi or short grain rice', u'2 cups water, plus extra for rinsing rice', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt']
title: California Roll

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves, about 5 ounces each', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'1 cup panko crumbs or unseasoned dry bread crumbs', u'1 cup grated Parmesan', u'2 cups canned or jarred tomato sauce', u'2 teaspoons wasabi paste', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon fresh cilantro leaves, chopped']
title: Panko Parmesan Crusted Chicken with Wasabi Tomato Sauce

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Before cooking the rice, rinse several times in running water until the water runs clear.  Drain in a colander for about 1 hour.  Cook on the stovetop or in an electric rice cooker according to package directions.', u'In a small saucepan over low heat, combine vinegar, sugar and salt.  Stir gently to dissolve salt and sugar.  Cool to room temperature.', u'While the rice is still warm, transfer to a large non-reactive bowl. Gradually drizzle the vinegar mixture over the rice, fanning the rice as you go.  Use a rice paddle to mix gently without mashing the grains.  Keep the rice covered with a damp cloth at room temperature until ready to make sushi.  Do not refrigerate.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups short-grain white rice', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt']
title: Sushi Rice

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Preheat broiler.', u'Rinse fish fillets and pat dry with paper towels. Combine miso, brown sugar, sesame oil and mirin and stir well until brown sugar is fully dissolved.', u'Brush about 2 tablespoons miso glaze on each fish fillet. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 1 hour. Place fish under broiler for 3 to 4 minutes, or until top is slightly charred and glaze has caramelized. Remove fish from oven and brush with remaining glaze. Lower oven to 375 degrees F. Cook an additional 5 to 6 minutes, until fish is flaky but not overcooked.', u'If desired, serve with toasted sesame seeds and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'6 (6-ounce) black cod fillets, or regular cod fillets', u'1/3 cup low-sodium blond or white miso', u'1/4 cup dark brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons mirin (Japanese cooking wine)', u' Toasted sesame seeds and scallions, for garnish, optional']
title: Miso Glazed Cod

directions: [u'Combine all ingredients except eggplant and salt and pepper in a saucepan and bring to a simmer. Let cool. Preheat grill. Season eggplant with salt and pepper to taste and brush with miso sauce. Grill for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, basting with marinade.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons miso', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 tablespoon sake', u'2 tablespoon water', u'1/4 cup orange juice', u'1/4 cup lime juice', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh ginger', u'4 Japanese eggplant, sliced lengthwise', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Grilled Japanese Eggplant with Citrus Miso Sauce

directions: [u'Combine the shoyu, honey, pepper flakes, and sesame oil in a zip-top bag and shake it all together. Then add the chicken. Let the chicken marinate refrigerated overnight, or at least 1 hour. ', u'After marinating take the chicken out of the bag and dry it off with paper towels.', u"Beat the egg, add the water and garlic powder, to taste. Don't be afraid of the garlic here, but don't go vampire hunting either.", u'Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium/medium-high heat. Be sure to watch the oil, if it begins to smoke - turn it down a notch.', u'Dredge the chicken in the rice flour, then egg, followed by the panko. Place the cutlet into the pan and fry for 5 to 8 minutes on each side. The panko should be crispy and golden brown. Place on a drying rack and finish frying the other pieces. ', u'I like to serve this with sunomono and potato-mac salad.', u'This is easily a 30 minute meal.']
ingredients: [u"3/4 cup Aloha shoyu (it's the best, the only really)", u'2 tablespoons honey', u' Pinch red pepper flakes (only as much as you would feed your lone goldfish)', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 package chicken breast cutlets (4 to 6 pieces)', u'1 egg', u'2 tablespoons water', u" Garlic powder (make sure it's powder NOT garlic salt)", u'1/2 cup peanut oil (more if you use a large frying pan)', u'1 cup mochiko (rice flour)', u'1 package panko (Japanese bread crumbs)']
title: Where's the Beach? Chicken Katsu

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In small bowl, whisk together the miso, water, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and salt. While whisking constantly, gradually add the peanut and sesame oils until you have a creamy dressing. Use now or store covered, in the refrigerator, for up to 3 days.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup white miso paste', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon water', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons light soy sauce', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u' Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
title: Miso-Sesame Dressing

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Place 2 pots of water on to boil: 1 pasta pot with a few inches of water in it, 1 medium sauce pan with 1 1/2 cups of water in it. Cover both pots and bring all the water to a boil. ', u'When the smaller pot of water comes to a boil, stir in rice and return water to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Place a colander over the pot and add the edamame to it. Place the pot cover over the edamame nesting it in the colander. Steam the edamame 5 minutes, then remove them to 2 small bowls, salt them and cover bowls with plastic or foil to keep warm. Set colander aside and return pot lid to rice, stirring rice before replacing the lid. ', u'While the edamame are steaming, before removing them to the bowls, you have a pocket of time to work with. Add 1/2 cup, a couple of handfuls of Napa cabbage to the second pot of water. Blanch the shredded cabbage 1 minute and remove with a spider or tongs to paper towels to drain and cool. Chop shredded blanched cabbage. Combine meat, chopped salad shrimp, sake, ginger, 1 scallion, 1 tablespoon tamari, sesame oil, black pepper and cooled, chopped cabbage in a bowl. Place 2 teaspoons of filling on each won ton wrapper. Wet your fingertips to help seal won ton wrappers. The gyoza should look like small half moons. ', u'Place 1 or 2 Napa cabbage leaves into the bottom of the colander. The leaves will prevent your dumplings from sticking to the surface of colander. Arrange dumplings on Napa leaf in colander and steam over second larger pot of simmering water. Place large pot lid over the colander to trap the steam. Dumplings need to steam 10 to 12 minutes. While you are working on this, go back and forth with the edamame as necessary per above directions.', u'While dumplings work, slice the fillet steaks thinly across the grain. Toss with seasoning and teriyaki or tamari and sherry. Heat a nonstick skillet over high heat. Add oil and the meat and stir-fry. When meat browns at edges, add scallions and cook 2 minutes more, stirring frequently.', u'Use remaining raw shredded Napa cabbage as a bed to serve your dumplings on. Plate all of your items on little dishes and in small bowls.', u'Mix dipping sauce of tamari, mustard and vinegar for the gyoza and set out alongside dumplings. ', u'Warm or cold sake, leftover from cooking, is the perfect beverage and chilled navel oranges or tangerines make a refreshing end to this meal.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup short grain rice', u'2 cups edamame, soybeans, from the frozen vegetables section of large markets', u'1 1/2 cups shredded Napa cabbage plus 1 large whole leaf', u' Coarse salt', u'1/4 pound ground pork', u'1/4 cup 300 count baby shrimp, a handful, chopped', u'1 tablespoons sake, or a splash mirin may be substituted', u'1 inch fresh ginger, minced', u'1 scallion, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon tamari dark aged soy, available on Asian food aisle of market', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u' A few grinds black pepper', u'12 gyoza or won ton wrappers', u'2 fillet of beef steaks, 1 inch thick, 6 ounces each', u'1 teaspoons steak seasoning or salt and pepper', u'1/3 cup teriyaki sauce or 1/4 cup tamari dark soy mixed with 2 tablespoons dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon light oil: wok oil, peanut oil or vegetable oil', u'4 scallions chopped on an angle into 1 inch pieces', u'3 tablespoons tamari dark soy, eyeball it', u'1 teaspoon hot sweet mustard, from Asian foods aisle or other prepared mustard', u'2 teaspoons rice wine or white vinegar']
title: Passport to Japan: Edamame, Gyoza, Rice and Teriyaki Beef

directions: [u'Arrange the meat slices and vegetables separately on large round platters.', u'Fill the casserole or fondue pot about 2/3 full with chicken stock and bring to a boil.', u'Each eater picks up meat and vegetables and "swishes" (shabu shabu) back and forth in the pot until cooked to desired doneness.', u'Dip meat and vegetables in dipping sauces.', u'When foam rises to the top, skim it off with a ladle or spoon. The broth can be eaten as a soup after meat has been eaten.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds prime quality, well-marbled beef, cut into paper-thin slices, each slice measuring 8 by 3 inches (freezing the meat for 20 minutes will facilitate slicing meat)', u'12 shiitake mushrooms, trimmed and wiped clean, halved, if large', u'6 long onions, or 8 to 10 scallions, cut diagonally into 1 1/2-inch lengths', u'2 cakes tofu, cut into 1 1/2-inch squares', u'6 leaves Napa or Chinese cabbage, shredded', u'1 cup grated giant white radish', u'1/2 cup minced scallion', u'1 1/2 quarts chicken stock', u' Soy-Ginger Sauce, recipe follows', u' Ponzu', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup mirin (sweet Japanese rice wine)', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'2 green onions, finely chopped', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon hot red pepper flakes']
title: Shabu-Shabu

directions: [u'Wash the rice until the water rinses clear. Drain the rice in a colander and let it stand for 30 minutes. Place the rice in a pot or rice cooker, and add 4 cups of water or follow the instructions on a rice cooker. Bring the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cover the pot. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove the cover, place a damp towel over the rice, and let cool for 10 minutes.', u'You can find sushi vinegar prepared at a grocery story or you can easily make it by pouring the vinegar, sugar and salt into a pan under low heat until the sugar and salt are dissolved. If you like sweeter vinegar, just add more sugar.', u'Pour sushi vinegar over cooked rice and mix it gently. You can do this in a wooden bowl for making sushi rice or in your rice cooker by turning off the cooker and pouring the vinegar and mixing gently and evenly and leaving it until it cools down to room temperature. The lid should remain open.', u'Cover a makisu (sushi rolling mat) with plastic wrap. Place half of a sheet of the seaweed over the plastic on the mat. Place a handful of rice across the seaweed and spread it evenly over the seaweed. Toss the imitation crab with the mayonnaise in a small bowl. Place some of the imitation crab meat meat along the center of the rice. Add some cucumber and avocado along the center of the rice. Using the mat and plastic wrap, roll the rice around the filling and press lightly to seal. Remove the mat and plastic wrap and sprinkle the roll with sesame seeds. Cut the sushi roll into bite sized pieces. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.']
ingredients: [u'3 1/3 cups rice', u'5 1/3 tablespoons vinegar', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons salt', u'10 sheets seaweed, halved', u'1/2 pound imitation crab, cut into long, thin pieces', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded, and julienne', u'1 avocado, peeled, seeded, and cut into long, thin pieces', u' Sesame seeds']
title: California Rolls

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Mix soy sauce, sugar, stock, and mirin together in a bowl. Arrange meat and vegetables on a large platter. Heat an electric skillet to 375 degrees F. ', u'Add oil to the skillet and heat. Brown meat in the oil, adding sugar slowly. Move the meat to the corner of the skillet when well browned. Add other vegetables, keeping each separate. Add sauce and cover. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Uncover and turn all ingredients while cooking 2 minutes more. Serve on small plates.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 cup soup stock', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1 pound thinly sliced beef meat', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 medium onions, sliced', u'4 ounces yam noodles (shirataki)', u'1 cup sliced bamboo shoots', u'2 stalks celery, sliced', u'1 cup soaked, rinsed and sliced shiitakes', u'1 cube tofu, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 bunch green onions, cut into 2-inch lengths', u'2 leaves Napa cabbage, sliced', u'2 tablespoons oil']
title: Sukiyaki

author: Masaharu Morimoto
directions: [u'Preheat a casserole type of large pan. Place the fat piece to oil the pan.', u'When the fat melts, place slices of wagyu beef to sear them lightly. ', u'Add mirin, sake, soy sauce and sugar.', u'Add tofu, Nappa cabbage, shiitake mushrooms, and scallion.', u'Pour in half of the dashi. When dashi boils, add enoki mushrooms and chrysanthemum leaves.', u'When the leaves wilt, it is ready to serve. ', u'* In Japan sukiyaki is cooked on the dining table, and each person uses chopsticks to pick up the ingredients from the pan as they are cooked. Therefore, all the ingredients are not put into the pan at once, but little by little.']
ingredients: [u'1 piece of Wagyu fat', u'12 oz of Saga wagyu beef thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup sake', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'8 oz firm tofu diced 1" X 1"', u'2 cups Nappa cabbage, cut into 1" pieces', u'12 fresh shiitake mushrooms', u'1 Tokyo scallion, or scallion, cut 1 1/2" long', u'1 cup Dashi', u'1 bunch Enoki mushrooms', u'2 bunches chrysanthemum leaves, or water cress', u'1 pack of yam noodles (shirataki) drained and rinsed, or substitute bean-noodles']
title: Saga Wagyu Sukiyaki

directions: [u'Place a nori sheet lengthwise on a bamboo rolling mat, shiny-side down. Position the sheet about 1-inch from the edge of the mat closest to you and leave some of the bamboo mat exposed on either side of the nori sheet. Wet your hands in cool water and take a handful of sushi rice. Place the rice in the center of the nori and use your fingers to spread the rice evenly over the nori. Be sure to leave a 3/4-inch strip of nori uncovered on the far side. Place tuna strips and some julienne vegetable, cucumber or avocado along the center of the rice. Be careful not to overfill the nori. Place your fingertips over the fillings to hold them in place. Then, use your thumbs to lift up the edge of the bamboo rolling mat closest to you. Begin rolling the mat away from you, while applying pressure to the fillings to keep the roll firm. Roll the mat over slowly until it covers the rice and the near and far sides of rice join, still leaving the 3/4-inch strip of nori, rice-free, exposed. While holding the bamboo mat in position, apply pressure to the roll with your fingers to make the roll firm. Slice the roll in half, then cut both rolls twice to make 6 equal sized pieces. Repeat this process with the salmon and various fillings, nori and rice.']
ingredients: [u'5 sheets nori', u'2 cups sushi rice, recipe follows', u'2 ounces sushi-grade tuna, cut into1/4 by 1/2 by 3-inch strips', u'2 ounces sushi-grade salmon, cut into1/4 by 1/2 by 3-inch strips', u'1 hot house cucumber, julienne', u'1 carrot, peeled and julienne', u'1/2 avocado, thinly sliced']
title: Sushi Rolls

directions: [u'Clean the mushroom caps and remove stems. In a saucepan, combine the sake, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and add the mushrooms. Simmer for 7 minutes. Remove mushrooms and use in a salad immediately, or cool and use later with grilled meats.']
ingredients: [u'30 fresh shiitake caps', u'2/3 cup good-quality sake', u'4 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'2 2 tablespoons mirin', u'2 2 tablespoons sugar']
servings: 4 as side dish or in salad
title: Shiitake Japanese Style

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a glass baking dish combine the teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, ginger and garlic. Add the salmon cubes and toss to coat. Let sit for 10 minutes. Heat oil in large skillet or wok until it is just smoking. ', u'Stir in the mushrooms and toss to cook quickly. Add the salmon and continue to toss and cook for another 1 minute. Add cooked broccoli and toss to coat. Pour in the remaining marinade from the salmon and sprinkle in the sesame seeds. Serve immediately with rice.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup teriyaki sauce', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon fresh ginger, finely chopped', u'1 clove garlic, finely chopped', u'1 pound salmon filet, skinned and cut into 1 1/2" cubes', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'10 ounces mushrooms, sliced', u'1 head broccoli, cut into florets, boiled for 2 minutes and cooled in ice water', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds']
title: Teriyaki Salmon Stir-Fry

author: Masaharu Morimoto
directions: [u"Make the rice. Combine the rice and 3 1/4 cups water in a rice cooker and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions. A rice cooker is the best way to get perfect sticky-firm rice, but if you don't have one, just use a saucepan.", u'Fold in the vinegar. Combine the vinegar, sugar and 1 teaspoon salt in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Transfer the cooked rice to a large wooden bowl (traditionally, a wooden tub). Drizzle a quarter of the vinegar mixture over a wooden spoon or spatula onto the rice. Fold the rice gently with the spoon to cool it and break up any clumps; be careful not to smash the grains. Fold in the remaining vinegar mixture and let the rice sit 5 minutes.', u'Spread the rice. Cover a bamboo sushi mat with plastic wrap. Place a half nori sheet rough-side up on the mat. Moisten your hands and scoop a handful of rice, slightly larger than a lemon, onto the nori. Press the rice to spread it evenly up to the edges of the nori, moistening your fingers as you go. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.', u"Prepare the vegetables. Peel the cucumber and slice into matchsticks. (Morimoto cuts the entire cucumber into a paper-thin sheet, then quickly slices it into strips-but he's had some practice.) Thinly slice the avocado, tomato and red onion; peel the tough ends of the asparagus.", u"Add the filling. Carefully flip over the nori so it's rice-side down on the mat with the short end facing you. Spread a bit of wasabi paste in a line about one-third of the way up the nori-it's spicy, so use it sparingly.
