Arrange a few pieces each of lettuce, cucumber, avocado, tomato and onion in a tight pile in the lower third of the sheet. It's OK if the vegetables hang over the edges of the nori.", u'Roll the sushi. Roll the sushi away from you with your hands, tucking in the vegetables as you go. Remove the mat from under the roll and place it on top. Press the roll into a compact rectangular log, using the mat to help you.', u'Slice the roll. Cut the sushi roll into 4 to 6 pieces. Repeat with the remaining nori, rice and vegetables. Serve with pickled ginger and more wasabi.', u'Photography by Rick Lew']
ingredients: [u'3 cups short-grain Japanese rice, rinsed', u'1/3 cup rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u' Salt', u'10 nori sheets (dried seaweed), halved', u' Sesame seeds, for sprinkling', u'1 cucumber', u'1 avocado', u'1 plum tomato, seeded', u'1 small red onion', u'20 asparagus spears, trimmed and blanched', u' Wasabi paste, for spreading and serving', u'1 romaine lettuce heart', u' Pickled ginger, for serving']
title: Vegetable Sushi

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine sake and vodka in a cocktail shaker with the chipped ice and shake well. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with a slice of Japanese cucumber.']
ingredients: [u'2 .5 ounces dry sake', u'1 -ounce vodka', u' Chipped ice', u'1 Japanese cucumber, cut into 1/4-inch rounds, for garnish']
title: Ice Cold Saketini

directions: [u'Cook the rice the day before, spread on a sheet pan, and refrigerate overnight.', u'Separate the rice grains by gently rubbing with the palms of your hands, then chop rice coarsely, this is the domyoji.', u'Make 3 cuts across inner curve of shrimp, 1/2-inch apart. (This prevents shrimp from curling when cooked.) Coat the shrimp in flour and shake off any excess. ', u'Dip shrimp into the egg whites and then into the coarse rice. (Be sure that the rice adheres firmly.)', u'In a wok, heat oil over moderate heat to 350 degrees F. Deep-fry shrimp until golden. Drain well on absorbent paper and place on a sheet pan-well spread out-into a preheated 450 degree F oven for 3 to 4 minutes to finish cooking process. Serve immediately.', u'Add green peppers to the wok and fry until tender. Remove and drain well. ', u'To serve, arrange 4 shrimp on green pepper strips on a preheated plate and sprinkle with ajishio seasoning, garnish with a lemon slice, and serve with sweet and sour sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 pounds Japanese rice', u'40 (16/20) shrimp, peeled and deveined', u' Seasoned flour, as needed', u'7 egg whites, lightly beaten', u' Peanut oil, as needed', u'2 (8-ounce) green bell peppers, washed, seeded and sliced into 1/2-inch wide strips', u' Ajishio, as an accompaniment', u'2 lemons, sliced, as an accompaniment', u' Sweet and sour sauce, as an accompaniment']
title: Japanese-Style Deep-fried Shrimp coated with Rice: Domyoji Age

directions: [u'In a large pot, bring dashi just to a boil, then add the salt, soy sauces, sugar and mirin. Stir to dissolve, then bring the broth back to a gentle boil, and add the chicken pieces. Simmer until the chicken is tender, about 10 minutes, skimming any foam. Add the onions, mushrooms, and cabbage and simmer another 2 to 3 minutes. ', u'Meanwhile, bring a large pot of unsalted water to a rapid boil. Add the noodles, bring back to a boil, and cook, stirring occasionally, until they just begin to soften, about 3 minutes. Drain noodles in a colander and rinse under cold running water while rubbing noodles to remove surface starch. Serve immediately, placing noodles in individual warm, deep bowls. Ladle hot broth over the noodles, and arrange pieces of chicken, onions, and mushrooms on the noodles. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups dashi', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'3 tablespoons each: dark soy sauce and light soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces', u'6 green onions, cut into 2-inch lengths and halved lengthwise', u'6 to 8 fresh shiitake mushroom caps, crisscrossed on top with knife', u'1/4 head Napa cabbage cut into 1-inch squares', u'1 pound fresh, refrigerated or frozen udon noodles']
title: Udon with Chicken and Scallions (Tori Nanba Udon)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a food processor, pulse a half sheet of nori (dried seaweed) into fine flakes; combine with 1 tablespoon each granulated orange peel (from the spice aisle) and ground black pepper, 2 teaspoons each dried minced garlic, sesame seeds, poppy seeds and flaky salt, and 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper.', u'Photograph by Ralph Smith']
title: Shichimi Togarashi

directions: [u'Bamboo shoots: Rinse the bamboo shoot removing any debris. Place shoot in a pot and boil for 5 minutes. Peel away the outer layer to reveal the tender inner shoot. Thinly slice the shoot, diagonally', u'Sansho Leaf Sauce: Place the miso and sugar in a microwaveable container, microwave on high for 15 to 20 seconds or until the sugar has dissolved or you may also place in a small pot and dissolve on stove top. Rinse and pat dry the sansho leaves. Place leaves in a mortar and pestle and grind until pulpy. Add the vinegar and continue to grind the leaves until smooth. Add the miso paste and the 1/2 cup of sake. Place the bamboo shoots around a plate and pour the sansho leaf sauce over the shoots. Add extra sansho leaves, as garnish.']
ingredients: [u'1 medium-sized fresh bamboo shoot', u'3 1/2 ounces (100 grams) white miso', u'1 tablespoon granulated sugar', u'3 1/2 ounces (100 grams) young sansho tree leaves', u'3 to 4 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup sake']
title: Japanese Bamboo Shoots with Sansho Leaf Sauce: Takenoko no Kinome Ae

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a large soup pot over medium heat add the scallion white parts, ginger, garlic, and sesame oil. Cook for 1 minute and add 8 cups water. Rinse the kombu and add it to the pot along with the bonito flakes. Bring it to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes - do not let it boil. Remove the kombu and set it aside. Add the dried mushrooms and miso to the pot and let it simmer gently for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the mushrooms are hydrated and tender. Add the bok choy and simmer until it is tender, about 10 minutes. Add the tofu and cook for another 5 minutes. Ladle into bowls and garnish with the reserved green parts of scallions. You can also top it with slices of the Campfire Pan-Roasted Chicken and garnish with the Crisp Soba Noodles.']
ingredients: [u'1 bunch scallions, sliced thin, white and green parts separated', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'8 cups water', u'3 (6-inch) pieces dried kelp (kombu)', u'1/4 cup bonito flakes', u'3 ounces dried shiitake mushrooms', u'1/2 cup light miso', u'1 pound baby bok choy, cut in quarters', u'8 ounces firm tofu, cut into cubes']
title: Hearty Shiitake Mushroom and Miso Soup

directions: [u'To make the sauce, combine the wasabi powder and water in a saucepan and let bloom for 5 minutes. Add 3/4 cup ponzu, the sake and grated ginger and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the sauce is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, place the fish and asparagus in a large baking dish. Pour the remaining ponzu sauce and the oil over the fish and asparagus and turn to coat evenly. Let stand for 10 minutes.', u'In a small frying pan, toast the sesame seeds over medium heat, shaking the pan frequently, until lightly colored, 3 to 4 minutes. Immediately pour onto a plate to cool. Place a grill pan over medium heat until hot. Lift the asparagus from the marinade, place in the pan and cook, turning occasionally, until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Transfer the asparagus to a plate and cover with aluminum foil, shiny side down, to keep warm. Lift the fish from the marinade and place in the grill pan. Cook, turning once, until it turns opaque and just begins to flake, 2 to 3 minutes on each side.', u'To serve, divide the rice among 4 bowls. Top with a piece of fish and some asparagus. Pour 1/4 cup of the sauce over the fish in each bowl. Garnish each serving with the sesame oil, green onions, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger and sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon wasabi powder', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1 1/4 cups Homemade Ponzu Sauce, recipe follows, or purchased ponzu sauce', u'1/4 cup sake', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger', u'1 pound center-cut salmon fillet, cut into 4 equal pieces', u'12 ounces asparagus, ends trimmed', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 teaspoons sesame seeds', u'4 cups warm Sushi Rice, recipe follows', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'3 green onions, chopped', u'1 avocado, pitted, peeled, and cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 English cucumber, cut into matchstick-sized strips', u'1/4 cup sliced pickled ginger', u'1 lemon, zested', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup fresh lemon juice', u'6 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon minced green onion', u'2 cups short-grain rice', u'2 cups water', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'3/4 teaspoon salt']
title: Grilled Salmon Sushi-Rice Bowl

directions: [u'Bring 3 quarts of water to a boil and cook the udon about 6 minutes, or until tender but not mushy. If the starch from the noodles looks like it is about to boil over, lower the heat slightly. Drain the udon in a colander, rinse under cold running water, drain again, and set aside.', u"In the same, pot bring the 6 cups water, the tamari, and ginger to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer the broth simmer 10 minutes. Remove ginger with slotted spoon. Stir in the tofu and half of the scallions and cook 1 minute, or just to heat through. Place the miso in a bowl, then remove about 1/2 cup of the broth and stir it into the miso to dilute it and prevent lumping. Pour the mixture into the broth. Remove the pot from the heat so the miso doesn't boil. Stir in the sesame oil. Place the udon in large soup bowls and ladle some of the very hot soup over it. Garnish with the remaining scallions.", u'Note White miso is a sweet, mellowtasting variety that is actually yellowish tan in color. Miso can be purchased in natural foods stores.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces udon (Japanese wheat noodles), or linguine', u'6 cups water', u'1/4 cup tamari soy sauce', u'1/2 cup roughly sliced gingerroot (keep skin on)', u'1/4 pound firm tofu, cut into 1/2inch cubes', u'2 scallions, very thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup white (sweet) miso (see Note)', u'1 tablespoon Asian ental sesame oil']
title: Ginger-Miso Soup with Noodles

directions: [u'Combine wasabi and water to make a paste. Using a blender or a mixing bowl with a whisk Add remaining ingredients except oil and onion, blend until well combined or whisk well. Emulsify in oil by pouring it slowly into the blender while running or mixing bowl while mixing. Stir in onion and set aside.', u'For the Hibachi Slaw:', u'Using a mandoline or with a knife, cut the carrots and daikon to a matchstick size. Using your knife, cut red pepper into the same shape as the daikon and carrot. Cut the chives in the same manner. Toss all together with pea sprouts. Season with salt and pepper and 1 tablespoon dipping sauce.', u'For the Beef:', u"*Cook's Note: Kobe beef can be difficult to find. It may not be something you can find at your local butcher. If this cannot be found, I suggest using a prime cut of beef. In the restaurant we use a whole kobe prime rib. This, however requires a lot of butchery. For home use I suggest using the beef tenderloin. You can ask your butcher for a cleaned center cut of the beef tenderloin. ", u'In the restaurant, we serve raw slices of kobe beef with a hibachi. The customers then cook the beef at the table on a hot stone. For home use, I suggest cutting the beef tenderloin into quarters lengthwise. Season them well with salt and pepper, to taste. Then quickly sear them on all sides in a very hot saute pan with cooking oil. Let the meat rest for 2 to 3 minutes. Then slice across the loin into very thin slices. Enjoy with the Dipping Sauce and Slaw.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons wasabi powder', u'1 1/2 tablespoons water', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 -ounce chili sauce (recommended: Mae Ploy Sweet Chili Sauce)', u'3 1/4 ounces soy sauce', u'1 -ounce white vinegar', u'1 teaspoon lime juice', u'1 3/4 ounces canola oil', u'1/2 -ounce chopped green onion', u'2 ounces carrot, peeled and cut into matchsticks', u'2 ounces daikon root, cut into matchsticks', u'2 ounces red pepper, cut into matchsticks', u'1 -ounce fresh chives, cut into matchsticks', u'1 -ounce pea sprout, cut into matchstick size', u'1 tablespoon Dipping Sauce', u"1/2 pound Kobe beef, see Cook's Note*", u' Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u' Hibachi Slaw, recipe follows']
title: Kobe Beef with Dipping Sauce and Hibachi Slaw

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a small bowl, mix together tuna with mayonnaise and red pepper sauce.  Cut nori sheet in half and place it on bamboo mat, shiny side down.  Dampen your fingers in water.  Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the seaweed, do not cover completely.  Leave a 1-inch margin at the ends uncovered to seal the roll.  Lay 2 tablespoons spicy tuna across rice.', u'To roll; slowly fold the end of the mat closest to you over the filling and tuck it in.  Use medium pressure to create a compact tube.  Remove the mat from around the roll, press in the loose ends and place it on a cutting board, seam side down.  Using a wet, sharp knife, slice the roll in half then into 6 equal pieces.  Garnish with radish sprouts. Serve with wasabi, soy sauce and pickled ginger.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup fresh, raw tuna, cubed', u'2 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'2 dashes red pepper sauce', u' Nori seaweed', u' Prepared sushi rice', u'1 bunch radish sprouts']
title: Spicy Tuna Roll

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, chile paste, hot chile oil, and sesame oil and stir to combine.  ', u'Place 1 piece of toasted seaweed on top of a sushi roller (makisushi), with the short end closest to you. Using lightly wet fingers, press enough rice onto the seaweed to completely cover the seaweed, and press firmly so that rice adheres to seaweed. Turn seaweed over so that rice side now faces down. Arrange strips of tuna on top of seaweed, with the tuna strips running vertically in line with the short side of the seaweed, about 1/3 of the way into the seaweed sheet. ', u'Spread a small amount of wasabi on the tuna, then sprinkle with sliced scallions. Using the sushi roller as a guide, carefully begin rolling the seaweed up, pressing as tightly as possible so that the roll is firm and compact. Once the roll is completely rolled, reposition roll on sushi roller and press again. Sprinkle sesame seeds on a flat surface and lightly roll in seeds to coat. Allow roll to sit for a few seconds before slicing with a sharp, damp knife. ', u'Cut roll into 6 or 8 pieces and serve with dollops of sauce spooned on top, or alongside for dipping. Repeat with remaining ingredients.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons hot chile paste', u'1 teaspoon hot chile oil', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'4 sheets toasted seaweed (yakinori)', u' Prepared sushi rice (at least 3 cups cooked rice), recipe follows', u'1/2 pound sushi-quality fresh tuna, cut into 1/2-inch wide strips', u' Wasabi paste', u'2 tablespoons finely sliced scallions', u'3 tablespoons toasted black sesame seeds', u'3 3/4 cups Japanese rice, such as Nishiki (or 5 rice maker cups)', u'3 3/4 cups water (or 5 rice maker cups)', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'4 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt']
title: Emeril's Inside-Out Spicy Tuna Roll with Special Sauce

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Make the dipping sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Set aside to allow the flavors to develop.', u'Butterfly the shrimp by cutting down the back, being careful not to cut all the way through. Open the shrimp like a book and rinse well with cold water.', u'Make the Tempura batter: Put 1 cup of rice flour in a bowl and pour in the seltzer. Stir with a whisk to get out all the lumps. Add the egg yolk and blend it in well. The batter should be the consistency of heavy cream. Flavor with sesame oil, if using.', u'Heat about 2 inches of vegetable oil to 375 degrees F in a wok or deep fryer. Dry the shrimp well. Dust the shrimp in flour to soak up any remaining moisture, shake off excess. Dip the shrimp into the batter one by one. Drop 4 or 5 pieces at a time in the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pan. Fry until golden brown, turning once, about 3 minutes. To keep the oil clean between batches, skim off the small bits of batter that float in the oil. Remove the fried shrimp from the oil and drain on paper towels; season them with salt. Serve with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sake', u'1 tablespoon hot chili sauce (recommended: Srirachi Hot Chili Sauce)', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 cup rice flour, plus 1 cup for dusting', u'1 cup cold seltzer water', u'1 egg yolk', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil, optional', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' Kosher salt']
title: Shrimp Tempura with Soy Sake Dipping Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Mix together vinegar, sugar, and salt. ', u"Rinse the rice in colander and drain. Put the rice and water in medium saucepan with a tight fitting lid. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to very low and simmer, tightly covered. (For a good seal wrap the pan's lid tightly with a small kitchen towel and cover the saucepan. Make sure the towel's edges are folded up well away from the heat.) Cook until all the water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove the rice from the heat (don't uncover) and set aside for 10 minutes. ", u'Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a large bowl. Add the vinegar mixture and toss with the rice, using a wooden spoon. Spread it out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Fan the rice continuously with a fan or magazine until cooled. Cover the rice with a damp towel.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 cups short-grained sushi rice', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'4 sheets toasted nori', u'1 kirby cucumber or 1/2 regular cucumber, seeded and cut into matchsticks', u'1 carrot, cut into matchsticks', u'1 small yellow bell pepper, stemmed, seeded and cut into matchsticks', u'4 scallions, trimmed and cut into matchsticks', u'1 (4-inch) piece daikon, peeled, and cut into matchsticks (or pickled daikon or 6 red radishes)', u'1/2 firm-ripe Hass avocado, peeled, thinly sliced lengthwise, sprinkled with lemon juice', u' Soy sauce', u' Special equipment: Bamboo sushi mat']
title: Vegetable Sushi Rolls for All Ages

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat grill to medium. Whisk together the mirin, sake, soy sauce, pineapple juice, 6 tablespoons sugar or honey, and ginger in a medium saucepan and cook on the grates of the grill until the sugar has melted and the mixture has thickened slightly, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and let the sauce cool completely.', u'Whisk together the rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon sugar, red pepper flakes, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl. Add the cucumbers and stir to combine. Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.', u'Heat grill to medium. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper. Place the chicken on the grill, skin side down, and grill until golden brown and slightly charred, about 4 to 5 minutes. Brush with some of the teriyaki sauce, turn over, and continue grilling and brushing with the sauce every few minutes until cooked through, about 25 more minutes. Transfer to a platter with the marinated cucumbers and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups mirin', u'1 cup sake', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1 cup pineapple juice', u'6 tablespoons sugar or honey, plus 1 tablespoon', u'1 (3 to 4-inch) piece fresh ginger, cut into coins', u'3/4 cup rice vinegar', u' Pinch red pepper flakes', u'1/2 teaspoon salt plus extra salt and freshly ground black pepper, for seasoning', u'2 English cucumbers, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'4 bone-in chicken breasts', u'4 drumsticks', u'4 chicken thighs']
title: Teriyaki Chicken with Pickled Cucumbers

directions: [u'In a small saucepan simmer sauce ingredients, stirring until sugar is dissolved, until reduced to about 1/2 cup and cool to room temperature in a metal bowl set in a large bowl of ice and cold water. In a baking dish large enough to just hold salmon steaks in 1layer marinate salmon in sauce, turning to coat, 15 minutes.', u'Preheat broiler. Line broiler pan and rack with foil. Arrange fish on rack in a single layer, not touching each other, brush with melted butter or margarine, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Just how long fish should be broiled can only be estimated by size and shape. For a 1/2-inch cut steak, the steak should be 2-inches away from the heat and you should cook the first side 3 minutes and 3 to 5 minutes on the second side.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin or medium dry Sherry', u'2 1/2 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons peeled, chopped fresh gingerroot', u'2 (1/2-thick) salmon steaks']
title: Salmon Teriyaki

directions: [u'Keeping the tuna very cold, toss gently with the scallion, cucumber and a bit of sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. In another bowl whisk the soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, ginger, garlic and Ginger Oil until well blended. Add to the fish mixture and toss to dress well. ', u'Cut the nori into 1 1/2-inch rounds and mound the tartare mixture by the teaspoonful onto the nori rounds. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately. Alternatively it can be served on an ice cold plate lined with lettuce leaves and garnished with marinated seaweed and sesame seeds, as an appetizer.', u'Note: To make Ginger Oil, combine lots of ginger scraps and canola oil in a small saucepan. Heat oil slightly, about 3 to 5 minutes over medium heat, then remove from the heat. Let steep for a couple of hours or up to a day, and strain.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound #1 grade Ahi, cleaned and diced finely', u'10 scallions, white and light green parts, finely minced', u'1 cup peeled, finely diced European or Japanese cucumber', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon finely grated ginger', u'1 clove very fresh garlic, minced', u'3 tablespoons Ginger Oil (see Note)', u'1 package toasted nori', u'1/2 cup toasted sesame seeds']
title: Tokyo Tuna Tartare

directions: [u'Arrange chicken, skin side up, in a single layer in a shallow dish. Combine soy sauce, mirin, sugar, garlic, and ginger; pour over chicken. Marinate in refrigerator, turning once or twice, for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Heat grill. Remove chicken from marinade. Place on grill, and cook, basting with marinade, about 12 to 15 minutes, turning once. Let cool and slice in thin strips.', u'Dress the romaine and julienne vegetables with the aioli and place on the bottom 1/3 of the tortilla. Top with the sliced chicken and the pineapple. Fold over the edges and snuggly roll up your burrito, dig in and smile!']
ingredients: [u'2 boneless chicken breasts', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 garlic clove, chopped', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 heart of romaine, chiffonade', u' Julienne vegetables (carrots, zucchini, peppers, and/or scallions)', u' Soy-Ginger Aioli, recipe follows', u' Burrito size tortilla, flavored or unflavored', u' Small strips pineapple', u'2 egg yolks', u'1 teaspoon lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon finely minced ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon finely minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon Japanese chile powder', u'1 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon salt']
title: Chicken Teriyaki Wrap

directions: [u'Wash the rice until the water rinses clear. Drain the rice in a colander and let it stand for 30 minutes. Place the rice in a pot or rice cooker, and add 4 cups of water or follow the instructions on a rice cooker. Bring the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cover the pot. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove the cover, place a damp towel over the rice, and let cool for 10 minutes.', u'You can find sushi vinegar prepared at a grocery story or you can easily make it by pouring the vinegar, sugar and salt into a pan under low heat until the sugar and salt are dissolved. If you like sweeter vinegar, add more sugar.', u'Pour sushi vinegar over cooked rice and mix it gently. You can do this in a wooden bowl for making sushi rice or in your rice cooker by turning off the cooker and pouring the vinegar and mixing gently and evenly and leaving it until it cools down to room temperature. The lid should remain open.', u'Buy fresh fish at a fish market or a Japanese grocery store, make sure to ask the clerk if the fish is good for eating raw. Only purchase sushi-grade fish. With salmon, be sure to cover fish with salt and leave for 1 hour. Then, rinse off salt and put it into the freezer. Once frozen, defrost and use for sushi. Slice the fish very thinly into bite-sized pieces.', u'Hand-mold fingers of rice and place a thin slices of fish on the top.']
ingredients: [u'3 1/3 cup short-grain sushi rice, rinsed', u'4 cups water', u'5 1/3 tablespoons sushi vinegar, or 5 1/3 tablespoons rice vinegar, 5 tablespoons sugar and 3 tablespoons', u' Salt', u'1 (4 to 6 ounce) piece sushi-grade tuna or salmon']
title: Nigiri Sushi

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, season with salt and pepper, to taste and saute for 2 minutes. Add edamame and saute for 4 minutes until edamame are heated through and onions are tender. (Reserve leftover Sauteed Edamame for online Round 2 Recipe "Bowtie Pasta with Edamame.)', u'Use the leftovers from this recipe to make (Web Exclusive) Round 2 Recipe: Edamame with Pasta.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'2 teaspoons chopped garlic', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 (10-ounce) bag frozen shelled edamame, thawed']
title: Sauteed Edamame

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Sweat shallots and ginger in the oil in a large saucepan. Stir in flour and cook until it looks like wet sand. Whisk in stock and water. Add miso paste, soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, sesame oil and chili flakes. Bring to a simmer and cook 20 minutes. Add corn and tofu and cook 10 minutes longer. Add snow peas or frozen peas and cook until vibrant green. Season, to taste, with salt.']
ingredients: [u'4 shallots, minced', u'2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and thickly sliced', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 quart chicken stock', u'4 cups water', u'1/4 cup miso paste', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoons fish sauce', u' Sugar, to taste (about 1 tablespoon)', u'1 teaspoon dark sesame oil', u' Dash chili flakes', u'5 ounces frozen corn kernels', u'1 package firm tofu', u'2 big handfuls snow peas (or frozen peas if snow peas are too expensive)', u' Salt']
title: Miso and Corn Soup

directions: [u'In a bowl whisk together soy sauce, gingerroot, honey, sherry, vinegar and the garlic paste. Add the salmon and let it marinate in the soy mixture, turning it once, for 5 minutes. Transfer the salmon, reserving the marinade in a small saucepan, to the oiled rack of broiler about 6 inches from the heat and cook for 5 minutes. While the salmon is cooking, boil the reserved marinade until it is reduced by half. Brush the salmon with some of the marinade, turn it, and brush it with the remaining marinade.  Broil the salmon for 5 minutes more, or until it is springy to the touch and just cooked through, transfer it to a cutting board.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon minced peeled fresh gingerroot', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons medium-dry sherry', u'2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u'2 garlic clove, minced and mashed to a paste with 1 teaspoon salt', u'2 pounds salmon steaks']
title: Teriyaki-Style Salmon

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large saucepan, combine the konbu and water and heat over medium-low heat almost to the boiling point. Remove the konbu just before the mixture comes to a boil and discard. Add the bonito flakes and allow to steep for 10 seconds, or just until the mixture comes to a boil.', u'Turn off the heat and skim any foam that has come to the surface of the liquid. Allow the mixture to stand for 2 minutes, then strain through a fine mesh sieve or cheesecloth. Discard bonito flakes and return the dashi to the saucepan over low heat. Add the reserved lobster body and shells to the dashi and allow to steep for 5 minutes. Remove and discard shells and body.', u'Quickly rinse or wipe off the mushrooms to remove any loose sand or dirt, then add the mushrooms to the dashi and allow to steep over low heat until the mushrooms are softened, about 10 minutes. Remove the mushrooms and, when cool enough to handle, slice them crosswise into thin slivers, and return them to the dashi. Add the lobster meat and continue to cook until heated through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the soy sauce, white and brown misos, and scallions and combine well. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 ounce konbu (kelp), about 2 or 3 squares', u'4 cups water', u'1/2 cup katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes)', u'3 large dried black kikurage (wood ear mushrooms)', u' Cooked lobster meat from 1 (1-pound) lobster, in bite size pieces (shell and body reserved)', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons saikyo (sweet white miso)', u'1 tablespoon akamiso (brown miso)', u'3 tablespoons finely sliced scallions']
title: Emeril's Favorite Miso Soup

directions: [u'Sprinkle the salmon fillet with salt and let stand for 2 hours. ', u'Meanwhile, wash the rice thoroughly in cold water 30 to 60 minutes before cooking and let drain in colander. Place rice and water in a heavy, tightly covered saucepan over medium-high heat. When water just begins to boil, turn the heat to high and let it come to a vigorous boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook until all the liquid is absorbed by the rice, about 12 to 13 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the rice stand, covered, for 10 to 15 minutes. Using a flat wooden spoon or rice paddle, fluff the rice with a cutting motion. Stretch a towel under the lid and cover tightly to keep warm until ready to use. ', u'Toast the nori sheets over a high gas flame, and cut crosswise into 1-inch wide strips, or use pretoasted nori. ', u'Mix the bonito flakes with the soy sauce. Rinse the salt off the salmon, pat dry, and grill for 3 to 5 minutes. Use a fork to break the salmon into small pieces. ', u'Wet your hands with salted water to keep the rice from sticking to your hands. Cup one hand and place a handful of rice, about 1/2 cup, in your hand. Make an indentation in the rice and tuck in one of the fillings: a teaspoon of soaked bonito flakes, a few flakes of salmon, or a few pieces of pickled plum. Close the rice over the filling and mold it into a triangular shape. Mold the rice firmly, pressing just hard enough to hold it together. Set the rice triangle down on one of its sides and cover the top peak with a strip of nori, shiny side out, like a roof. You can also make cylindrical shapes and wrap the nori around the middle. Sprinkle sesame seeds over the rice shapes. These are great lunch treats.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound salmon fillet', u'4 cups uncooked, short-grain rice', u'5 3/4 cups water', u'2 sheets dried nori seaweed, or pretoasted nori sheets', u'2 large pickled plums, pits removed and coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup dried bonito flakes', u'1 1/2 teaspoons dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons black sesame seeds, toasted']
title: Onigiri (Rice Balls)

directions: [u'Cook the rice \x96 1 part rice to 2 parts water. This can be done in a rice cooker, steamer, or pot according to package directions. When rice is cooked, spread the rice on a large baking sheet and sprinkle with sushi vinegar. Mix well, but do not break the rice grains. Chill the rice to room temperature.', u'Heat a deep fryer or a large pot halfway filled with oil to 360 degrees F.', u'Season the shrimps with salt, dust them with flour, and roll them in eggs then in panko. Fry the breaded shrimps to golden brown. Remove to a paper towel lined plate.', u'Place the nori on a cutting board, spread sushi rice on the back side (non glossy side), sprinkle black sesame seeds over rice. Place the rice side down on a bamboo mat that has been covered with plastic wrap. Place 2 shrimps, 2 strips of avocado, strip of cucumber and some wasabi on the center. Roll. (good luck!) Cut the roll in to 8 pieces (this you need better than just good luck!). ', u'Pour Sesame Ginger sauce on serving plate, then place sushi over the sauce. Sprinkle the sauce with some crushed red pepper flakes.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups Japanese rice', u' Sushi vinegar', u'8 large shrimps, peeled, cleaned, tail-on and pressed by hand to make them straight.', u' Salt', u' Flour', u'2 eggs, beaten', u' Panko (Japanese bread crumbs)', u'4 large sheets of nori cut 2/3 size', u' Black sesame seeds', u'1 avocado, cut in 8 strips', u'1/2 hot house cucumber, peeled, seeded and cut into 4 long strips (the length of nori)', u' Wasabi paste', u' Ginger Sauce, recipe follows', u' Red pepper flakes, for garnish', u'2 golf ball-size ginger pieces, peeled and sliced', u'4 tablespoon roasted sesame seeds', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'4 tablespoons sushi vinegar', u'2 to 4 tablespoons water', u'1/2 lemon, juiced']
title: Crunchy Shrimp Roll with Ginger Sauce

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Boil the edamame according to package directions. Strain and place in a serving bowl. Juice 1 lemon and pour over the top of the beans. Sprinkle with salt and pepper blend. Serve garnished with lemon slices.']
ingredients: [u'1 package frozen edamame (soybeans), in shell', u'2 lemons', u'1 tablespoon salt and pepper blend']
title: Salted Lemon Edamame

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Chop the chicken into small pieces. Slice the 2 grilled scallions and combine them with the chopped chicken. Slice the uncooked scallion and set aside for garnish.', u'Put the wrappers onto a clean work surface and put 1 teaspoon of the chicken into the center. Dip a finger into some water and moisten the edges of the wonton. Fold the wrapper over and pinch the edges together, making 3 or 4 pleats. Repeat with remaining ingredients.', u'Heat a large nonstick skillet with canola oil over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the wontons in 1 layer. Let cook until the bottoms are browned, about 2 to 3 minutes, then add 2 tablespoons water.  Quickly cover and cook until the wrappers are tender, about 3 minutes.', u'Whisk together the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and 2 tablespoons water in a small bowl. Stir until the sugar has dissolved and set aside.', u'Arrange the pot stickers on a serving platter, garnish with the reserved sliced scallions and serve with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Reserved chicken, from Chicken Teriyaki recipe', u'3 scallions, reserved from Chicken Teriyaki recipe, 1 uncooked, 2 grilled', u'12 round wonton wrappers', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1/4 cup reduced sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon cider vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar']
title: Round 2 Recipe - Chicken Pot Stickers

directions: [u'Combine ingredients in a saucepan on medium heat until the sugar is dissolved.', u'To make glaze: Mix 1/2 tablespoon cornstarch with 1 tablespoon water. Heat sauce on medium high heat and add cornstarch water mixture. Simmer until thickened.', u'Note: This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 tablespoons sweet rice wine', u'1 tablespoon, plus 2 teaspoons brown sugar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'1/2 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon water']
title: Teriyaki Sauce

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Cut each spring onion in half lengthwise, then cut each length in half into 2 pieces, about 4 inches long.  Set aside.', u'Trim ends of asparagus spears so that just 4 inches of the floret end remains.  Set aside.', u'Lay out beef slices on a work surface, like tall rectangles.  Place a green and a white portion of onion and 1 piece of asparagus across the bottom of the beef rectangles.   Roll each portion tightly into a cylinder; secure each portion with 1 or 2 toothpicks.', u'Brush each roll with teriyaki sauce.  ', u'Preheat the grill, grill pan or broiler. Grill or broil for 3 minutes. Turn over and baste each portion again with teriyaki sauce. Cook for another 3 minutes.', u'Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3 spring onions, root trimmed off', u'12 frozen asparagus spears, defrosted', u'12 beef sandwich slices (1/8 thin, about 4 by 6-inches)', u'1/4 cup teriyaki sauce, store-bought']
title: Beef Negimaki

directions: [u'In a 12-ounce glass add ice, almond syrup, lemon juice, and bitters. Fill up with grape juice and seltzer water. Garnish with pineapple.', u'Sells for 10 to 15 cents.']
ingredients: [u'1 -ounce cracked ice', u'1 -ounce orgeat (almond) syrup', u'2 dashes "solution of phosphate" or citric acid (lemon juice will work)', u'2 dashes angostura bitters', u'4 ounces grape juice', u' Seltzer water', u' Slice pineapple, for garnish']
title: Japanese Thirst Killer Phosphate

directions: [u'Clean the mushroom caps and remove stems. In a saucepan, combine the sake, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and add the mushrooms. Simmer for 7 minutes. Remove mushrooms and use in a salad immediately, or cool and use later with grilled meats.']
ingredients: [u'30 fresh shiitake caps', u'2/3 cup good-quality sake', u'4 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'2 tablespoons sugar']
servings: 4 as side dish or in salad
title: Shiitake Japanese Style

directions: [u'Soak bamboo skewers in cold water for 10 minutes, then drain. Place soy sauce, sake, sugar, ginger and chives in a screw-top jar and shake well to mix.', u'Trim chicken breasts of any fat and membranes and cut into bite-sized cubes, about 1 1/2 inches. Place chicken cubes in a shallow glass or ceramic dish, pour marinade over cubes, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.', u'Preheat a stovetop grill pan, broiler (grill), or barbecue.', u'Cut scallions into 2-inch lengths. Drain chicken, and thread cubes onto skewers alternately with scallions. Brush chicken and scallions with olive oil and cook until golden, about 5 minutes per side.', u'Serve hot with soy sauce for dipping.', u'(Can be assembled 2 hours ahead. Then cook and serve.)']
ingredients: [u'10 bamboo skewers', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sake or dry sherry', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon peeled and grated fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons snipped chives', u'2 pounds chicken breast fillets', u'12 scallions (shallots/spring onions), dark green tops removed', u' olive oil, for brushing', u'1/2 cup soy sauce, for dipping']
title: Chicken Yakitori

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'To cook the sushi rice \x96 wash rice well, drain and let stand for 30 minutes in colander. When cooking rice, for 1 cup of rice add just a little less than 1 cup water in a rice cooker. 45 minutes after rice has been started, remove into a big mixing bowl (plastic or wood is best, metal is also OK) to speed the cooling process. Add 1-ounce of sushi su seasoning and mix well into rice. Let stand to cool. Periodically turn your rice to cool evenly. Do this for about 20 to 30 minutes, then cover.', u'Place a full sheet of nori (rough side up), on the bamboo rolling mat. Cover the whole sheet except for about 7/8-inch at far end with rice, pressing rice with damp hands into an even layer. Sprinkle sesame seeds on rice from left to right. Place bands of Unagi, cucumber, and kaiware sprouts across leading edge of nori. Roll closest edge to you, up and away from you, very carefully tuck in the roll and continue until you reach the bare end, to seal your roll. Make sure when rolling all ingredients are tightly secured, this will help to keep ingredients intact when cutting. Compress the roll with the bamboo mat. You may shape your roll making it slightly oval or squared off. To serve, slice into 12 even slices. Place Unagi glaze on plate or serve as side dish. Fan out sushi on plate, garnish with pickled ginger and wasabi. Serve with soy sauce.', u'Sushi hints: Nori has 2 sides, 1 rough and 1 smooth and shiny. The rough side holds the rice better and the smooth side is more presentable on the outside. Also, water is your best friend when making sushi. Keep you hands wet when handling rice so the rice will not stick to your hands. This is important when slicing or cutting sushi rolls, keep your knife wet at all times so the knife can glide through the rice.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces sushi rice', u' Sushi Su seasoning, recipe follows', u'1 full sheet nori (roasted seaweed)', u'1 -ounce cucumber, julienned', u'1/2 -ounce Kaiware (daikon sprouts), juilienne', u'4 ounces Unagi (broiled fresh water eel)', u'1 pinch sesame seeds', u'1 ounce Unagi Glaze, recipe follows', u' Gari (pickled ginger), to taste', u' Wasabi (Japanese horseradish), to taste', u' Soy Sauce, to taste', u' Special Equipment: Makisu (bamboo rolling mat)']
title: Unagi Roll (Broiled fresh water Eel)

directions: [u'In a large pot over high heat, bring water to boil for noodles.', u'In a large straight-sided frying pan over medium-high heat, whisk together all ingredients except fish and noodles. Bring to boil; reduce to simmer. Add tilapia fillets, cover, and poach for 10 minutes.', u'Add udon noodles to rapidly boiling water and cook for 6 to 8 minutes for thin udon and 10 to 12 minutes for thicker udon. Serve udon in a bowl with miso broth. Top with poached tilapia and chopped scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1 (32-ounce) container vegetable broth', u'3 tablespoons miso paste', u'1 cup sake or white wine', u'3 1/2 ounces fresh shiitake mushrooms, stems removed and sliced', u'3 scallions, sliced diagonally into 1/2-inch pieces, plus chopped scallions, for garnish', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 pound tilapia fillets', u'12 ounces udon noodles']
title: Udon Noodles with Miso Poached Tilapia

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'2 cups sake, cold2 cups plum wine1/4 cup maraschino cherry juiceMaraschino cherries, for garnishCucumber slices, for garnishIce\xa0']
title: Plum Sake

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'Sift first 3 ingredients over a large mixing bowl. Add 1/2 cup of chilled club soda and mix with chop sticks or fork. Add the rest of the club soda and mix. Be careful not to over mix. The lumps give the tempura batter its unique texture. Over moderately high heat fill a deep pan or wok with about 3 inches of vegetable oil. Add vegetables sparingly to the batter making sure they are covered. Place vegetables 1 at a time in the oil and fry until batter has turned golden brown about 1 minute. Repeat until all vegetables have been cooked. Serve with soy sauce for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup club soda, chilled', u' Vegetable oil', u'1 red pepper, cut into large chunks', u' Large handful green beans, trimmed', u'1 medium zucchini, sliced on a bias', u'1/2 cup soy sauce, for dipping']
title: Tempura Vegetables with Soy Sauce

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce and sesame oil. To the noodles, add green onions, bean sprouts, carrots, cucumber, cashews, cilantro, sesame seeds, and the soy mixture and mix thoroughly.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'4 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 pound soba noodles, cooked until tender and refreshed in ice water', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced green onions, cut on the bias', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced carrots', u'1/2 cup cucumber, peeled, seeded, and thinly sliced', u'1 cup lightly crushed toasted cashews', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 tablespoons black sesame seeds']
title: Emeril's Cold Noodle Salad

directions: [u'Tear up the mint (not too small) into a martini shaker. Crush the mint. Not too much that the mint will be in small pieces, just enough to get the aroma and flavor out. Squeeze in the lime juice. Add a teaspoon of simple syrup. Add ice 2/3rds of the way up the shaker. Add very dry sake. Add plum wine. Shake vigorously. Pour into a tall glass.']
ingredients: [u'8 shiso (Japanese) mint leaves', u'1/2 lime, juiced', u'1 teaspoon simple syrup', u'3 ounces very dry sake', u'1 ounce plum wine']
title: Sake Mojito

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Place water in sauce pan over high heat in medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Add rice, stir. Cover rice and reduce heat to low. Cook rice 18 minutes or until tender.', u'Preheat coals for tabletop hibachi or preheat grill pan over medium high to high heat.', u'Combine sherry, sugar, dark soy and oil in a shallow dish. Turn cut chicken and scallions in marinade and let stand 10 minutes. Wash hands.', u'Combine ginger and soy, oil and sesame oil in a second shallow dish for the beef. Cut raw meat against the grain in thin strips. Thread strips on to skewers, reserving several skewers for chicken, set into ginger and soy mixture. Season meat lightly with steak seasoning blend and turn in ginger and soy to coat. Set meat aside. Wash hands.', u'Toast sesame seeds in a small skillet over moderate heat until they pop and are lightly toasted. This process will develop the flavor of the sesame fully. Combine the sesame seeds with five-spice powder and grill seasoning blend on a piece of wax paper or on a plate. Coat tuna with a scant drizzle of oil and sesame oil to help seeds and spices adhere to fish. Coat fish pieces in sesame and spices. ', u'Cook chicken pieces and scallions in a single layer over hot coals or on hot grill pan for 3 or 4 minutes on each side. Transfer chicken and scallions to a serving plate and set several bamboo skewers on the edge of the plate for spearing meat and scallions.', u'Place beef skewers on hot grill surface and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side in a single layer, turning once. Transfer to a serving plate.', u"Cook fish on hot grill surface 1 to 2 minutes on each side and transfer to a serving plate. Tuna will be rare. Serve with several skewers on plate's edge for spearing.", u'Transfer pickled watermelon rind, pickled ginger and pickled onions to ramekins and place along side grilled meats and fish for condiments. Serve with hot rice and extra soy sauce for dipping. Kiwis, tangerines and Asian pears are a nice offering of fresh fruit to round out this light menu.']
ingredients: [u'2 3/4 cups water', u'1 1/2 cups white short grain rice', u'3 tablespoons dry sherry', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup Tamari dark aged soy sauce, available on the Asian foods aisle', u'2 tablespoons light oil, such as wok oil or vegetable oil, eyeball it', u'1 pound chicken breast tenders, cut in half on an angle', u'5 scallions, cut in 1/2', u'3 inches fresh ginger root, minced or grated with hand grater or microplane tool', u'1/4 cup tamari dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons light oil, such as wok oil or vegetable oil, eyeball it', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 1/4 pounds beef sirloin, 1 1/2 inches thick', u' Steak seasoning blend or fresh ground black pepper', u'1 package, minimum 40 count, 8-inch bamboo skewers', u'3 tablespoons sesame seeds, 2 palmfuls', u'1 tablespoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'2 tablespoons steak seasoning blend, preferred brand Montreal Steak Seasoning by McCormick', u'2 Ahi steaks, 8 ounces each, cut into 1 by 3-inch pieces', u' Light oil, such as wok oil or vegetable oil, for drizzling', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u' Pickled watermelon rind, 1 jar, 14 to 18 ounces', u' Pickled onions, 14 to 18 ounce jar', u' Pickled ginger, 1 small glass jar, 10 to 12 ounces', u' Fresh Fruit Selection', u' Kiwis, 3 each', u' Tangerines, 3 each', u' Asian pears, 3 each, washed']
title: Japanese Style Barbecue Party: Chicken Yakitori, Beef with Ginger and Soy, 5 Spice and Sesame Seared Ahi

directions: [u'Crust the rack of lamb and cook to desired temperature. Cut rack into 4 chops. Toss beans with oil, salt and pepper and place on center of plate in a triangle. Place puree in center of triangle. Place 4 chops around the puree in a circle. Sprinkle plate with red pepper bruniose and mustard seeds. Finish plate with both lamb and yogurt sauce. Garnish with sweet potato chips sticking up from the puree.']
ingredients: [u'4 each rack of baby lamb, frenched and cleaned', u'1/4 pound yellow wax beans, blanched', u'1/4 pound green beans, blanched', u'1/4 cup hazelnut oil', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u'1 pound sweet potato puree (recipe follows)', u'2 tablespoons mustard seeds', u'1 red pepper, bruniose', u'1 cup peppercorn crust (recipe follows)', u'1 cup natural lamb jus (recipe follows)', u'1 cup goats yogurt sauce (recipe follows)', u'4 sweet potato chips, for garnish', u'1/4 cup white peppercorns', u'1/4 cup black peppercorns', u'1/4 cup green peppercorns', u'1/4 cup pink schezuan peppercorns', u'1 cup bread crumb', u' Fresh grind all peppercorns and mix with bread crumb.', u'1/2 cup shallots', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 teaspoon white peppercorns', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 cup red wine', u'1 quart good quality lamb stock', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Pepper Crusted Rack of Lamb with Puree of Japanese Sweet Potato

directions: [u'Combine the sourdough bread crumbs and Dungeness crab meat, set aside.  Combine remaining ingredients, except olive oil, and mix thoroughly.  Gently fold in the crab and bread crumb mixture.  Shape into patties approximately 1/2-inch thick. Heat olive oil in a non-stick saute pan.  Cook crab cakes over medium heat to a golden brown about 2 to 3 minutes.  Set aside.']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces sourdough bread crumbs', u'6 ounces Dungeness crab meat', u'1 whole egg, slightly beaten', u'1 tablespoon Maui onion, finely diced', u'1 tablespoon parsley, coarsely chopped', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u'2 tablespoons mayonnaise', u' Olive oil, for sauteing', u'1 cup Japanese cucumber, peeled and julienned', u'1/4 cup Maui onion, julienned', u'1 cup machj lettuce (or other seasonal ?soft? lettuce)', u'3 tablespoons Champagne vinegar', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u' Flower petal confetti (optional garnish)', u'1/2 cup red wine vinegar', u'3/4 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon dry tarragon', u' Salt and pepper, to taste']
title: California Crab Stack on Japanese Pickled Cucumber-Mache Salad Dressed with Tarragon Dijon Dressing

directions: [u'Blanch asparagus in 2 batches in a large saucepan of boiling salted water 1 minute. Transfer to a colander and rinse under cold running water to stop cooking. Drain well and pat dry. ', u'Whisk together mayonnaise, soy sauce, sugar, lemon juice, and wasabi paste until sugar is dissolved. ', u'Serve asparagus with dip.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds thin to medium asparagus, trimmed', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'4 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons wasabi paste']
title: Asparagus with Wasabi-Mayonnaise Dip

directions: [u'Combine the dressing ingredients in a mixing bowl and set aside. ', u'Cut the tofu into 1 inch cubes and arrange on individual plates. Cover with the dressing and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy oil', u'1 tablespoon white sesame seeds', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped cilantro', u'1 generous tablespoon finely grated fresh ginger', u'2 green onions, finely sliced', u' Salt to taste', u'2 blocks of tofu (about 20 ounces), drained on paper towels']
title: Cold Tofu Salad

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a mixing bowl, lightly beat egg yolk and pour in ice water, slightly mix.  Add the flour all at once, stroke a few times with a fork just until ingredients are loosely combined.  The batter should be somewhat lumpy.   Yield: 4 servings']
ingredients: [u'1 egg yolk', u'1 cup ice water', u'1 cup rice flour', u'1/2 cup mirin or sake', u'1/2 cup Tamari soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 cup grated daikon radish', u'1 teaspoon ginger, grated', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1 tablespoons sesame oil, for flavoring frying oil', u'1 cup flour, for dusting', u'1/2 pound large shrimp, cleaned, tails on', u'1/2 pound scallops', u'1 cup broccoli florets', u'1 sweet potato, peeled and sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'2 carrots, peeled and sliced diagonally in strips', u'4 ounces Chinese green beans, ends trimmed', u'4 ounces mushrooms', u'5 stalks asparagus, ends trimmed', u'1 red bell pepper, cut in strips', u'2 Japanese eggplants, halved and cut into 1/4-inch slices']
title: Tempura

directions: [u'In a bowl whisk together the soy sauce, the gingerroot, the honey, the sherry, the vinegar, and the garlic paste. Marinate chicken in the soy mixture, turning once, for 20 minutes. Transfer the chicken, reserving the marinade in a small saucepan, skin side down, to the oiled rack of a broiler and broil it under a preheated broiler about 6 inches from the heat for 5 minutes. While the chicken is cooking boil the reserved marinade until it is reduced by half. Brush the chicken and broil for 6 to 8 minutes more, or until it is just cooked through, transfer it to a cutting board, and cut it on the diagonal into 1/2 - inch thick slices.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon minced peeled fresh gingerroot', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon medium-dry Sherry', u'1 tablespoon white-wine vinegar', u'1 garlic clove, minced and mashed to a paste with 1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 boneless whole chicken breast (about 1 pound) with the skin on, halved']
title: Teriyaki-Style Chicken

directions: [u'Combine the dashi, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar in a saucepan and bring just to a boil. Stir in the bonito flakes and immediately remove from the heat. Wait about 10 seconds for the flakes to get thoroughly soaked, and then strain. Let liquid cool to room temperature. Serve with cold soba noodles for dipping, along with scallions, grated daikon, quail eggs and natto if you have a taste for it.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 cups dashi or light chicken stock', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons mirin', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 ounce dried bonito flakes', u' Cooked, cold soba noodles', u' Thinly sliced scallions', u' Grated daikon', u' Quail eggs', u' Natto (optional)']
title: Noodle Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Lay out the sheet of nori on a sushi mat, shiny side down. Top with the Sushi Rice and spread in an even layer, leaving 1/2-inch at the bottom end. Make a small channel in the center of the rice across the nori strip. Lay the tuna, wakame and carrot in the channel. Using the sushi mat as a guide, fold the nori over the filling and roll into a cylinder. Slice into pieces.']
ingredients: [u'1 sheet nori paper', u'2 to 3 ounces Sushi Rice, recipe follows', u'2 ounces sushi grade raw tuna pieces, cut into strips', u'1/2 -ounce wakame (seaweed salad)', u'1/4 -ounce carrot, julienned', u'1 sheet nori paper', u'2 to 3 ounces Sushi Rice, recipe follows', u'2 ounces sushi grade raw salmon pieces, cut into strips', u'1/2 -ounce cucumber, julienne', u'1/4 -ounce carrot, julienne', u'6 ounces uncooked, matured short-grain rice', u'8 ounces cold water', u'1 to 2-inch strip dried kelp, wiped clean', u'1 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon caster sugar (superfine granulated sugar)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt']
title: Sushi

directions: [u"Wash rice at least 3 times or until water is clear. Fill rice cooker with water to about 1-inch over rice or use Mt Fuji method. I highly recommend a rice cooker -- there's a reason more than 2 billion people in Asia use them. Slowly heat vinegar, mirin and sugar until very hot but not boiling. Fold in 'su' (vinegar and sugar) with the hot rice, add enough so that the rice has a tart/sweet taste. Rice should be shiny, not mushy. Carefully clean inside rim of bowl with damp cloth, cover and let rest for 30 minutes."]
ingredients: [u'4 cups sushi rice (Calrose/short grain)', u' Water up to Mount Fuji, see below', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup gari (pickled ginger) julienne', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame seeds', u'1/4 cup chopped green scallions', u' Soy syrup', u' Wasabi oil', u'1/2 tablespoon honey', u'1/2 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'1/2 tablespoon canola oil', u'1/2 pound fresh picked crab', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro', u'1/4 cup chopped flat leaf parsley', u'1/4 cup basil chiffonade', u'1 shallot, minced', u' Salt and white pepper to taste', u'4 sheets of yaki-nori', u'2 cups rice flour', u'1/2 tablespoon togarashi or chili powder', u'1 quart cold club soda water', u'8 large butterfly shrimp, peeled and de-veined', u'1 package daikon sprouts', u'4 sheets of yaki-nori, cut in half', u'8 scallion fans', u' Wasabi oil', u' Salt and white pepper to taste', u'1/2 cup wasabi powder', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Water', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'2 cups thin soy sauce', u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'1 lime juiced']
title: Master Sushi Rice

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Cut green beans into 2-inch pieces on an angle. Place in a skillet. Add water, salt, to taste and cook beans 5 minutes, then drain beans. Place the skillet back on stove and add vegetable oil. Heat pan over high heat until oil smokes. Add the beans and red peppers and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add the soy and sesame oil and transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with sesame seeds and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound green beans - look for trimmed, raw packaged beans in your produce department', u' Salt', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons tamari aged soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds']
title: Sesame-Soy Green Beans and Peppers

directions: [u'Combine all ingredients in a bowl and let stand 24 hours. Strain through a cheesecloth and store up to 3 months in a cool, dark place, or in the refrigerator.']
ingredients: [u' Juice of 4 lemons', u'1/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 cup dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons tamari sauce', u'3 tablespoons mirin', u'1/3 -ounce dried bonito flakes', u'2 -inch square giant kelp (konbu)']
title: Ponzu Sauce for Dipping

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'Put a large skillet or a wok over medium-high heat and brush it with a little oil. When the pan is hot, add the zucchini slices in 1 layer and cook until they are lightly browned, about 1 minute. Turn them over and cook for another minute. Remove them to a plate.', u'Brush the pan with some more oil and add the onions, squash, scallion whites, ginger, and chile pepper. Give them a good stir and cook until they begin to soften, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons of soy sauce and 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar. Add the edamame, cook for another minute. Remove them to another plate.', u'Brush the pan with some more oil and add the mushrooms and garlic. Cook until the mushrooms start to release their juices and add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated and remove them to a plate.', u'Carefully wipe out the pan and brush it with some more oil. Add the scallops and cook them until they are nicely browned on both sides, about 1 to 2 minutes per side. Add the sake and cover the pan to steam the scallops and cook them through, about another 2 to 3 minutes.', u'To serve: Divide the zucchini and lay them across each of 2 plates in a neat diagonal row. Divide the squash edamame mixture into 2 even, neat piles on the zucchini. Cut the scallops in half horizontally to make 2 even rounds. Lean the scallops seared sides up on the pile of the squash edamame mixture. Top each pile with a piece of mushroom. Garnish with the scallion greens and drizzle with the remaining soy sauce and rice wine vinegar.']
ingredients: [u' Soybean oil', u'1 medium zucchini, thinly sliced on the bias', u'1/2 white onion, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup julienned butternut squash', u'3 scallions, cut on an extreme bias, whites and greens separated', u'1 teaspoon grated ginger', u"1 bird's eye chile, thinly sliced", u'4 tablespoons soy sauce, divided', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup shelled and cooked edamame', u'1 large or 2 small matsutake mushrooms, cut into quarters', u'1 clove garlic, smashed and finely chopped', u'4 jumbo dry diver sea scallops', u'2 tablespoons sake']
title: Teppenyaki Scallops

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the rice in a strainer and rinse under cold running water until the water is fairly clear, about 5 minutes. Shake the water out and allow the rice to dry in the strainer for 15 minutes.', u'Put the rice in a pot with exactly 3 cups of water and cook covered over high heat until it starts to foam, about 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Turn off the heat and sprinkle with 1/4 cup mirin. Replace the lid and allow the rice to steam for 15 minutes. Place in a bowl and cool to room temperature.', u'To prepare the sushi, place a bamboo sushi roller flat on a table with the bamboo reeds horizontal to you. Sprinkle lightly with water. Place 1 nori sheet on top, smooth side down, and moisten lightly with mirin. With damp hands, press 1 1/4 cups rice flat on top of the nori, leaving 1 1/2-inch edges on the top and bottom, but pressing all the way to the sides. Make sure the rice is pressed even and smooth.', u'Spread 1/4 teaspoon of wasabi paste in a horizontal stripe near the lower edge of the rice. Over the wasabi, lightly sprinkle the red onions in a horizontal stripe. Place strips of carrots in a horizontal stripe, on top of the wasabi and onions, and follow by piling the red and yellow peppers, scallions, and cucumbers on top, making a tight, straight bundle of vegetables. Place 1 layer of pickled ginger slices on top.', u'To roll the sushi, pick up the near edge of the bamboo roller and hold it with the nori, then pull them up and over the vegetable bundle until the nori reaches the rice on the other side. Press the roller to make a round bundle, then roll the bundle to the far edge of the nori and press again to make a round bundle. (The nori should totally enclose the rice and vegetables in a round tube, but the ends will have rice and vegetables sticking out.) Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients. Keep the rolls under a damp towel and refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, slice off the ends with a very sharp knife and slice each roll into 8 equal pieces.', u'Meanwhile, for the sushi dipping sauce, combine the wasabi powder and water to make a paste. Mix in the red pepper flakes, ginger, scallions, vinegar, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Serve the sushi at room temperature with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 pounds sushi rice (2 3/4 cups)', u'3 cups water', u'1/4 cup mirin, plus additional for moistening nori', u'5 sheets nori (1 package)', u'4 teaspoons wasabi powder, mixed with 2 teaspoons water', u'1/2 cup small-diced red onion', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'1 red bell pepper, julienned', u'1 yellow bell pepper, julienned', u'1 scallion, julienned (green part only)', u'1 hothouse cucumber, seeded and julienned', u'1 (10-ounce) jar pickled ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon wasabi powder', u'1/4 teaspoon water', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon minced pickled ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced scallion (green part only)', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons good soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon dark sesame oil']
title: Vegetable Sushi

directions: [u'Combine the dashi, usukuchi, mirin and kombu in a pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add the salt and katsuobushi, and immediately turn off the heat and strain into a nabe (hot pot) or medium saucepan. Add the udon and bring back to a boil. Reduce the heat and add the chicken and shitake mushrooms. Cook for 1 minute.', u'Crack the egg into center of soup. Ladle the soup over the egg until it turns white. Remove the nabe from the heat and add the kamaboko and blanched spinach.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups dashi soup stock', u'2 tablespoons usukuchi soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1 piece kombu', u'1 pinch sea salt', u'1 handful katsuobushi', u'8 ounces cooked udon', u'1/4 cup cubed chicken', u'2 shiitake mushrooms', u'1 egg', u'2 slices kamaboko', u'1 bunch spinach, blanched']
title: Nabe Yaki Udon

author: Jamie Oliver
directions: [u'Put the water in a pan and add the dried seaweed. Simmer over a medium heat for about 10 minutes. Pull out the kombu when the water starts to boil. To enhance the flavour you can add some dried bonito flakes 5 minutes before taking the kombu out. It is important not to let the water and kombu boil. Strain the broth, discarding the kombu and bonito flakes.', u'Place the beef between 2 sheets of cling film and bash with the back of a knife until it is very thin. Slice the beef into thin strips and place on a serving plate.', u'Bring the broth to the boil. Add the shiitake mushrooms, followed by the enoki mushrooms, then the tofu and finally the watercress. Serve this pan of boiling broth at the table immediately and get your guests to cook their beef by dipping it in the broth with chopsticks.', u"Give each guest a bowl of rice and a bowl for their broth, and a small dish of the ponzu dipping sauce. Don't forget the sake or Japanese beer.", u'(c) Jamie Oliver 2003']
ingredients: [u" Shabu shabu is one of Japan's most popular dishes and is a glorified fondue. It consists of paper-thin slices of raw beef and raw vegetables, cooked by each diner at the table in a pot of hot broth. The name comes from the sound that is made as the meat is swished through the broth: 'swish swish.'", u'2 cups (1 pint) cold water', u"3 ounces (85 grams) dried 'kombu' seaweed*", u'1 cup dried bonito flakes, optional*', u'8 ounces (225 grams) sirloin beef, sliced thinly', u'4 ounces (115 grams) shiitake mushrooms', u'4 ounces (115 grams) enoki mushrooms, stalks removed', u'4 ounces (115 grams) tofu, cut into chunks', u'1 bunch watercress, trimmed', u' Cooked sticky white rice', u'1 jar ponzu-joyu dipping sauce*', u' *Available at Asian grocery shops']
title: Shabu Shabu

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Make the dipping sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Set aside to allow the flavors to develop.', u'Prepare the shrimp: Butterfly the shrimp by cutting down the back, being careful not to cut all the way through. Open the shrimp like a book and rinse well with cold water.', u'Make the Tempura batter: Put the flour in a bowl and whisk in the seltzer to get out all the lumps. Add the egg yolks and blend it in well. Flavor with sesame oil and a pinch of salt. The batter should be the consistency of heavy cream.', u'Time to fry: Heat about 2 inches of peanut oil to 375 degrees F in a wok or deep skillet. Dry the shrimp and vegetables well. Dust them with flour to soak up any remaining moisture and shake off the excess. Dip them into the batter one by one. Drop 4 or 5 pieces at a time in the hot oil, do not overcrowd the pan. Fry until golden brown, turning once, about 3 minutes. To keep the oil clean between batches, skim off the small bits of batter that float in the oil. Remove the fried shrimp and vegetables from the oil and drain on paper towels; season them with salt. Serve with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled with tails on', u'1 cup rice flour, plus 1 cup for dusting', u'1 cup cold seltzer water', u'2 large egg yolks', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u' Kosher salt', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'2 red bell peppers, sliced into strips', u'2 avocados, peeled and sliced thick', u'1 lemon, sliced very thin', u'12 green beans', u'8 shiitake mushrooms, halved', u'4 scallions']
title: Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura

directions: [u'Equipment: 12 wooden skewers for skewering the chicken and vegetables', u'To make the marinade: In a saucepan whisk together the soy sauce, Sherry, sugar, ginger, and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, lower the heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Let the marinade cool. (The marinade can be made in advance, and refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.)', u"To make the skewers: On each skewer alternate 3 pieces of chicken with 2 scallion lengths and 2 water chestnuts. (Skewer the water chestnuts carefully so they don't split; and begin and end with the chicken.) Arrange the skewers in a large shallow baking dish and pour the marinade over the chicken and vegetables. Marinate at room temperature, turning once, for 30 minutes. (The skewers can be marinated up to overnight.)", u'Arrange an oven rack about 4 inches from the broiler and preheat.', u'Arrange the skewers on a foil-lined baking sheet, reserving the marinade. Broil the skewers, basting occasionally for the first 6 minutes. Continue broil, turning occasionally, until the chicken is just cooked through, about 10 minutes. Discard any remaining marinade. Transfer the skewers to a platter and serve with the lemon wedges and mustard. ']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup dry Sherry', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon minced, peeled fresh ginger', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 skinless boneless chicken thighs, cut into 36 (1 1/2-inch) pieces', u'2 bunches scallions (about 10), the white and pale green parts cut into 24 (1 1/2-inch) lengths', u'24 canned whole water chestnuts, rinsed and drained', u' Lemon wedges, as needed', u' Mustard, preferably Chinese-style, as needed']
title: Japanese Chicken, Water Chestnut, and Scallion Yakitori

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a deep-fryer or large Dutch oven, pour oil to a depth of 4-inches. Heat over medium heat until a pea-size drop of batter floats but does not swell, about 350 degrees F.', u'In a medium bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, the water, and the egg. Whisk lightly until ingredients are combined (batter will be slightly lumpy). In a shallow dish, pour remaining flour. Dredge shrimp in flour and then dip into the batter. Fry in batches for 2 to 3 minutes per batch, turning to brown on all sides.', u"Cook's Note: When placing shrimp into oil, hold by tail and allow to fan out before starting to fry.", u'Remove from oil and drain on a cooling rack over a baking sheet. Serve hot with tempura sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'2 pounds large shrimp, peeled with tails on', u'3 cups all-purpose flour, sifted and divided', u'2 cups water', u'1 egg', u' Tempura Sauce, for dipping, recipe follows', u'2 cups water', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sweet rice wine', u'1 tablespoon seafood stock']
title: Crispy Tempura Battered Shrimp

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a food processor blend the garlic, ginger, rice wine, sugar, cornstarch, egg white, and soy sauce. Add the shrimp, pulsing the motor, until mixture is paste-like but not completely smooth. Transfer to a bowl.  Stir in jicama and scallions. ', u'Heat peanut oil in a deep saucepan over moderately high heat until it registers 350 degrees F on deep-fat thermometer. While oil is heating, divide shrimp spread among bread slices (about 2 tablespoons per slice), spreading evenly to edges of bread. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, pressing gently to stick. ', u'Fry 2 bread slices, shrimp sides down, until shrimp is browned, about 1 minute. Turn over and fry until undersides are golden, about 30 seconds. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Fry remaining slices in same manner. Cut each toast diagonally into 2 triangles. Garnish with cilantro sprigs. Drizzle with Wasabi Sauce and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 cloves garlic', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped peeled fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon rice wine or medium-dry sherry', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 large egg white', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 pound rock shrimp', u'1/4 cup diced (1/8-inch) peeled jicama', u'2 scallions (white and green parts), thinly sliced', u' About 6 cups peanut oil, for frying', u'12 very thin slices firm white sandwich bread, crusts discarded', u'1/4 cup sesame seeds', u'24 cilantro sprigs, for garnish', u' Wasabi Sauce, recipe follows']
title: Shrimp Toast with Wasabi Sauce

directions: [u"Make chicken stock by cooking chicken breasts in 8 cups boiling water and 2 teaspoons salt. Cook in boiling water for 10 minutes, (add dried scallops here if you like) then lower heat and cook for about 30 minutes. While making stock, wash and drain all vegetables. Cut mizuna into 2 strips (you won't need much of this-just to add green color). Slice the kamaboko fairly thin. Put a few mochi into toaster and toast until puffy.", u'Remove chicken from stock onto a plate. While chicken is cooling, strain the soup in either cheesecloth or some kind of cloth to strain* to a clean pot. Add the carrots and daikon and cook until tender (about 10 to 15 minutes). (Shred 1 breast of chicken and add to broth. Save the rest to make chicken salad or whatever for another time.) Check flavor and add salt if needed.  Just before serving, put mizuna in soup just to parboil-must be crunch/crisp. Put toasted mochi in a bowl, pour the soup over mochi, then put several slices of kamaboko on top and serve.', u'*I prefer using old restaurant linen because it strains better!']
ingredients: [u'4 skinless chicken breasts', u'2 to 4 dried scallops (optional)', u'1 1/2 cups  carrots, peeled and sliced into 2-inch strips', u'1 1/2 cups daikon, peeled and sliced into 2-inch strips', u'1 cup mizuna', u'1 package red  kamaboko (fish cake) (I prefer brand name Yamasa)', u'1 package mochi (pounded rice cake)', u' Salt to taste']
title: June's Ozoni

directions: [u"Wash rice at least 3 times or until water is clear.  Fill rice cooker or casserole with water to about 1-inch over rice or use Mt Fuji method.  I highly recommend a rice cooker - more than 2 billion people use them in Asia for a reason.  Slowly heat vinegar, mirin and sugar until very hot but not boiling.  Fold in 'su' (vinegar and sugar) with the hot rice, add enough so that the rice has a tart/sweet taste.  Rice should be shiny, not mushy.  Carefully clean bowl with damp cloth, cover and let rest for 30 minutes.", u'*"MT FUJI" note: The Mt. Fuji method is a way to determine the correct amount of water for any quantity of rice. First wash the rice till the water runs clear to wash away all the starch. Then you put it in the pan, put your hand flat on top of the rice, and fill the pot with water until it reaches the first knuckle of your index finger (knuckle nearest your palm). It always works, no matter what the size of your hand.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups sushi rice (Calrose/short grain)', u' Water, up to Mount Fuji (see below)', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup sugar']
title: Master Sushi Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a saucepan heat the dashi and whisk in the miso pastes. Bring to a simmer and add the tofu, scallions, and mirin, if using. Remove from the heat and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 to 5 cups dashi, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons brown miso paste, plus more to taste', u'2 tablespoons white miso paste, plus more to taste', u'6 ounces firm tofu, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 scallions, white and green, thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'2 tablespoons aji mirin (sweetened rice wine), optional', u'6 cups cold water', u' One 12-inch long piece of kombu, wiped with a damp cloth', u' One .88-ounce/25 grams package shaved dried bonito flakes', u' Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
title: Miso Soup

directions: [u'For the dipping sauce: Mix together the ponzu, mirin, soy sauce and ginger in a small bowl. Add sambal oelek to taste. Set aside half of the sauce for brushing on the fish as it grills.', u"For the fish: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium heat and brush with oil so the fish doesn't stick. Brush the fish on both sides with dipping sauce and grill for 20 to 25 minutes, flipping and brushing with sauce every 5 minutes. When done, the fish should be crispy and nicely charred and the flesh cooked through. The best way check for doneness is to insert the tip of a knife or a cake tester into the flesh, then pull it out and hold it to your wrist; it should feel warm. When it does, you're ready!", u'Mix the grated daikon and shiso in a small bowl.', u'Serve the fish with the dipping sauce and daikon mixture on the side. If you like, add some of the daikon mixture to the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup ponzu', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'4 teaspoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons grated ginger', u' Sambal oelek (an Asian chili paste)', u'2 hamachi collars (about 1/2 pound each)', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing', u' One 2-inch piece daikon radish, peeled and finely grated', u'2 or 3 shiso leaves, chopped, optional']
title: Grilled Hamachi Collar with Ponzu Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Cook noodles in a large pot of boiling water until just tender, about 5 minutes, then drain in a colander. Rinse under cold water to stop cooking, then drain well.  While noodles are cooking, stir together vinegar, oil, soy sauce, sugar, and salt until sugar is dissolved.  Toss noodles with dressing, mint, and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces dried soba noodles (Japanese buckwheat noodles)', u'1/3 cup rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 1/4 teaspoons sugar', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1 1/2 cups thinly sliced scallions (1 1/2 bunches)']
title: Mint and Scallion Soba Noodles

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Mix together vinegar, sugar, and salt.', u"Rinse the rice with cool water in a colander; drain. Put the rice and water in a medium saucepan with a tight fitting lid. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to very low and simmer, tightly covered, (For a good seal, wrap the pan's lid tightly with a small kitchen towel and cover the saucepan. Make sure the towel's edges are folded up well away from the heat.) Cook until all the water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove the rice from the heat (don't uncover), and set aside for 10 minutes.", u'Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer to a large bowl. Add the vinegar mixture and toss with a wooden spoon. Spread the rice out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Fan the rice continuously with a fan or magazine until cooled. Cover the rice with a damp towel.', u'To assemble rolls:', u'Place the sushi mat with the slats running crosswise directly in front of you on a clean work space. Lay a sheet of nori shiny-side down and lined up with the closest edge of the mat.
