Light moisten fingers with water, and evenly press about 1/4 of the rice onto the nori, with 1 1/2-inches uncovered at the far edge. Line up the fillings about an inch from the closest near edge, evenly across the rice. Leave 1 inch of rice uncovered at the far edge.', u'Beginning with the near edge of the mat, tightly roll up the nori, rice, and fillings into a cylinder. Firmly tug on the rounded mat over the roll as you pull on the far edge of the mat to tighten the roll. Open the mat, dab unsealed edge of nori with a bit of water and roll the sushi forward to seal. Transfer the sushi to a plate and cover with damp paper towels. Repeat with remaining rice and fillings.', u'Cut each sushi roll, crosswise, into 8 pieces with a sharp wet knife.', u'Serve with bowl of soy sauce for dipping.', u'Copyright 2005 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 cup short-grained sushi rice', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'4 sheets toasted nori', u'1 kirby cucumber or 1/2 regular cucumber, seeded and cut into matchsticks', u'1/2 firm-ripe Hass avocado, peeled, thinly sliced lengthwise, sprinkled with lemon juice', u'8 large cooked shrimp, peeled and cut in 1/2, lengthwise', u' Soy Sauce', u' Equipment: Bamboo sushi mat']
title: Shrimp Sushi Rolls

directions: [u'Cut tuna into 1-inch cubes and place them in a bowl with Spicy Mayo. Mix well. Place soy paper on sushi mat. Lay ohba shiso mint to cover the middle section of soy paper and out both ends for a decorative effect. Layer avocado, tuna mix, seedless cucumber and shredded carrot in that order. Wet the top edge of the soy paper with water. Roll firmly with a gentle pressure over the sushi mat. Take the roll out of the sushi mat and cut into 4 pieces.  Serve with soy sauce and wasabi paste.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces sushi grade tuna', u'1/4 cup Spicy Mayo, recipe follows', u'1 sheet of soy paper (Japanese market)', u'3 to 4 (depends on the size) ohba shiso mint leaves (Japanese mint)', u'1/2 avocado, thinly sliced', u'4 slices seedless cucumber', u' Handful shredded carrot', u' Soy and Wasabi, as condiments']
title: Spicy Tuna Soy Roll

directions: [u'Make tempura batter by whisking the rice flour with the soda water until a pancake batter consistency is achieved.  Wrap each oyster with shiso leaf and skewer.  Dip each one in the batter and deep fry at 400 degrees until golden brown.  Season with salt and place on a platter lined with lettuce leaves.  Dot each with umeboshi.', u'Wine Suggestions: "J" Sparkling Wine, Sonoma County Kelham/Craig, Sauvignon Blanc, Oakville, Napa Valley, 1998 Wakatake, Daiginjo "Onikoroshi, Sake']
ingredients: [u'1 cup rice flour', u'1/2 quart cold soda water', u'1 dozen shucked Maryland oysters', u'12 shiso leaves', u' Salt', u'1 head red leaf lettuce', u'1 tablespoon chopped Japanese pickled plum, umeboshi']
title: Shiso Tempura

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Cut nori sheet in half and place it on bamboo mat, shiny side down.  Dampen your fingers in water.  Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the seaweed, do not cover completely.  Leave a 1-inch margin at the ends uncovered to seal the roll.  Lay crabmeat, avocado and cucumber lengthwise.  Sprinkle with sesame seeds.', u'To roll; slowly fold the end of the mat closest to you over the filling and tuck it in.  Use medium pressure to create a compact tube.  Remove the mat from around the roll, press in the loose ends and place it on a cutting board, seam side down.  Using a wet, sharp knife, slice the roll in half then into 6 equal pieces. Serve with wasabi, soy sauce and pickled ginger.']
ingredients: [u' Nori seaweed', u' Prepared sushi rice', u' Crab meat, cut in pieces', u' Avocado, peeled and cut in fine pieces', u' Cucumber, peeled, seeded and cut in fine strips', u' Sesame seeds, toasted']
title: California Roll

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'Place a blender onto the counter and add all 4 of the tomatoes and 1/2 cup of the vegetable stock. Cover and blend altogether until the tomatoes are completely pureed. Add the remaining vegetable stock and pulse for a few more seconds to combine. ', u'Place mixture into a saucepan or stove-top safe fondue pot, add the sliced ginger and roughly chopped cilantro, cover and place on medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil.', u'While the sauce is heating, take the seafood out of the refrigerator and begin to arrange the fish on a plate.', u'As soon as the sauce has come to the boil, transfer the pot onto the heat station on the table, and continue to keep the mixture at boiling point. If the liquid seems to have reduced just add more vegetable stock.', u'Take a skewer and a piece of fish, skewer the fish and dip it into the sauce. Wait just a few seconds and taste with dipping sauces. ', u'Serve the seafood dippers with Lemon Mayonnaise and Ginger Cream']
ingredients: [u'4 large tomatoes, seeds removed', u'4 cups vegetable stock', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, sliced', u'2 tablespoon roughly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1/2 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 pound salmon tail, sliced thinly', u'1/2 pound scallops, sliced in 1/2', u' Lemon Mayonnaise, for serving, recipe follows', u' Ginger Cream, for serving, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 large lemon, zested and juiced', u'2 hands fresh ginger, chopped into 1/2-inch pieces, skin on', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise']
title: Savory Tomato Shabu Shabu with Seafood Dippers

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl combine sauce ingredients and set aside.  Place oil in a deep fat fryer or heavy saucepan and heat until a deep fry thermometer registers 375 degrees.  Meanwhile, in a bowl sift together flour and cornstarch. Then add eggs, ice, club soda, pinch of salt and stir just to pull together, not to mix completely. Dredge the vegetables and shrimp in flour and dip into the flour mixture.  Carefully drop into the fryer and cook until golden. Serve with the sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound flour, (3 cups)', u'1/2 pound cornstarch, (1 1/2 cups)', u'3 eggs', u'1 1/2 to 2 cups crushed ice', u'1/2 cup club soda', u' Pinch of salt', u'2 Shiitake mushroom caps', u'4 thin slices of carrot', u'1 zucchini, sliced', u'2 whole scallions', u'1 sweet potato, sliced', u'4 large tail-on shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 tablespoons flour, for dredging', u'3 cups oil', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 1/2 teaspoon sherry', u'1 1/2 teaspoon rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon thinly sliced green onions', u'1 tablespoon water']
title: Tempura

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'To make the "dashi" soup stock, in a large saucepan, combine the konbu and vegetable stock and heat over medium-low heat almost to the boiling point. Remove the konbu just before the mixture comes to a boil and discard. ', u'Remove from the heat and skim any foam that rises to the surface. Let stand for 2 minutes. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a saucepan. Keep warm over low heat. ', u'Add the mushrooms and soy sauce to the dashi and steep until mushrooms are tender, about 10 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, and when cool enough to handle, slice thinly. Return to the liquid. Add the miso pastes and cook over low heat, stirring to dissolve. Add the scallions and tofu and cook until warmed through, about 3 minutes.', u'Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 ounce konbu (kelp), about 2 or 3 squares', u'4 cups vegetable stock, recipe follows', u'3 large dry wood ear mushrooms, wiped clean', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons white or yellow miso paste', u'1 tablespoon brown miso paste', u'1/4 cup finely sliced scallions', u'4 ounces tofu, cut into 1/2-inch cubes']
title: Miso Soup with Vegetable Stock and Tofu
Pepper Crusted Rack of Lamb with Puree of Japanese Sweet Potato

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Blanch the udon noodles according to the package instructions and then shock in cold water. Set aside as you prepare the rest of the dish.', u'In a small saute pan, combine the soy sauce with the sesame oil, garlic, ginger, green onion, and sugar. Bring to a boil and reduce to a glaze, about 4 minutes. Set the glaze aside until needed.', u'Combine the shiitake mushrooms and dashi with the water in a 2-quart saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook until the mushrooms are soft and pliable, about 20 minutes.', u'Strain the broth and return to the pan. Rinse the mushrooms under cold water to cool, and slice thinly. Return the sliced mushrooms to the pan, and set over a low flame to keep warm while you prepare the fish.', u'Lightly season the fish with salt and white pepper, and brush with the glaze. Wrap in a banana leaf and place in a bamboo steamer. Steam the fish until cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes.', u'To serve the dish, divide the noodles among 4 Asian-style soup bowls, and pour 1 cup of the broth in each bowl. Unwrap the banana leaves, being sure to pour any accumulated juices into the soup bowls for added flavor, and place the steamed fish in the bowl with the noodles. Garnish with the green onions and cilantro and serve immediately while hot.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces udon noodles', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced green onion', u'4 tablespoons sugar', u'1 cup dried shiitake mushrooms', u'1/4 cup dashi', u'4 1/2 cups water', u'4 (6-ounce) portions fresh cod, striped bass, or other firm-fleshed white fish', u' Salt', u' White pepper', u'4 pieces banana leaves (each long enough in which to completely wrap the fish)', u'2 tablespoons biased cut green onion tops, for garnish', u' Fresh chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Banana-Leaf Wrapped Steamed Fresh Cod with Udon Noodles in a Mushroom Dashi Broth

directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Fill a medium bowl with water and add ice.  Add the lobster tails to the boiling water and boil until just cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.  With tongs, transfer the lobster to the ice water; retain the cooking water.  When cool, drain the lobster tails, crack the shells, and remove the meat.  Quarter the meat and set aside.', u'Return the water in the pot to a boil. Add the shrimp, and cook until just done, 3 to 5 minutes.  Check the shrimp after 3 minutes; they must not overcook.  Drain the shrimp and transfer immediately to the ice water.  When cold, drain on paper towels and peel.', u'In a small bowl, combine the wasabi, soy sauce, lemon juice, and sugar and whisk to blend.  Whisk in the oil to make a light emulsion. In a large bowl, combine the crabmeat, lobster meat, shrimp, mizuna, and tomatoes.  Add the dressing, season with the salt and pepper, and toss to blend.', u'Divide the salad among 4 plates.  Garnish with the daikon sprouts and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 fresh lobster tails', u'12 large shrimp, deveined', u'2 tablespoons freshly grated wasabi, or 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish mixed with 2 teaspoons wasabi past', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/3 cup canola oil', u'1/4 pound lump crabmeat, picked over', u'4 cups mizuna or tatsoi lettuce, or 2 cups mesclun plus 2 cups watercress', u'4 plum or 2 large tomatoes, sliced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 ounces daikon sprouts, for garnish']
title: Wasabi Seafood Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and, when hot, add 1 tablespoon oil. When the oil is hot, add the peppers and saute until the skins blister and they are somewhat softened, about 1 to 2 minutes. Season the peppers with 1 teaspoon of the tamari and transfer to a plate. Cover and set aside while you prepare the beef.', u'Cut the beef into 8 slices. Place each slice of beef between 2 pieces of parchment paper and, using a mallet, pound until thin, approximately 1/4-inch thick. Season each slice with salt and pepper on both sides and divide the julienned red bell pepper and enokitake mushrooms among each piece of beef. ', u'Tightly roll the vegetables into each slice and tie with kitchen string in 3 places so that they do not unroll during cooking. Quickly rinse the skillet with hot water or wipe clean with a paper towel. ', u"Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet and, when hot, add half of the beef rolls and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate and set aside, covered, while you cook the remaining beef rolls. Add the sake, mirin, sugar, and 1 1/3 cups water. Bring to a boil, then return the beef rolls to the skillet. Don't overcook the beef, it should still be pink inside when cut. Transfer the beef rolls again to the platter, and set aside, covered. Increase the heat to high, and continue to cook the sauce until it thickens, about 2 minutes. Add the remaining tamari and return the beef rolls to the skillet to coat with the sauce. Remove the kitchen string from the rolls and cut each roll into 3 or 4 diagonal slices before serving, with extra sauce ladled over the top."]
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 medium green bell pepper, cored and stems removed, cut into 1-inch thick slices', u'2 1/2 tablespoons tamari, divided', u'1 1/2 pounds beef sirloin, cut into 8 thin slices', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 red bell pepper, peeled and julienned', u'1 package enokitake mushrooms, stem ends removed', u'6 tablespoons sake', u'6 tablespoons mirin', u'6 tablespoons sugar']
title: Rolled Beef with Vegetables: Gyuniku No Yasaimaki

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook until tender, about 7 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold running water. Drain and transfer to a large bowl. Toss with 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil, cover and refrigerate.', u'In the bowl of a food processor, combine 2 tablespoons of the green onions, the jalapenos, garlic, and ginger, and process on high speed. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of sesame oil, the peanut butter, soy sauce, chicken stock, cilantro, fish sauce, sherry, lime juice, sugar, and pepper flakes. Toss the sauce to taste with the noodles.', u'To serve, toss the noodles with the chicken strips, bell pepper, cucumber, peanuts, and remaining 2 tablespoons of green onions, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces dried soba noodles, or other buckwheat noodles', u'3 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions (green tops only)', u'1 jalapeno, seeded, stem removed, and minced', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced gingerroot', u'1/2 cup creamy peanut butter', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup chicken stock', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon Sherry', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper', u'1 whole skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into strips and lightly poached, and chilled', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded and chopped', u'2 tablespoons chopped roasted unsalted peanuts']
title: Cold Peanut, Chicken, and Soba Noodle Salad

directions: [u'Heat a wok over high heat.  Add the canola oil.  Add the ginger and onions and saute until translucent, about 3 to 4 minutes.  Add the garlic and the fermented black beans and cook for another 1 minute.  Add the hoisin sauce, rice wine and chicken stock.  Bring to a simmer and let cook for 5 minutes for flavors to combine.  Combine the cornstarch and water to make a slurry.  Whisk the slurry into the mixture and let simmer for 3 minutes.  Add the clams and cover.  Cook, covered, for 3 minutes, or until the clams begin to open.  Remove the cover and add the bell peppers, snow peas and jalapenos.  Toss the mixture together until all of the clams open.  Remove from heat and garnish with scallions and  cilantro.  Discard any unopened clams.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoons chopped ginger', u'1/2 cup julienne onions', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup fermented black beans, chopped', u'1 tablespoon Hoisin sauce', u'1/2 cup Chinese rice wine', u'1 1/2 cups chicken stock', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons water', u'4 dozen manila clams, cleaned', u'1 cup julienne red bell peppers', u'2 cups julienne snow peas', u'2 jalapenos, seeds and stem removed and julienned', u'4 scallions, sliced thin on the bias', u'2 tablespoons cilantro, for garnish']
title: Stir Fried Clams and Vegetables in Black Bean Sauce

directions: [u'Heat a saute pan over high heat. Add enough oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pan. Add the sea scallops and sear until golden brown on both sides, about 30 seconds to 1 minute per side. Be careful not to overcook! Remove from the heat and slice the scallops in half horizontally.', u'With moist hands, pick up a golf ball-sized ball of rice. Gently squeeze the rice in your right hand to form a rectangular block with rounded edges and sides. Apply some pressure to the rice while forming it into a sturdy base for the scallops. Top each formed piece of rice with a small bit of wasabi and top it off with half of a scallop. Garnish each piece with a few daikon sprouts and serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 sea scallops', u' Vegetable oil', u'1 cup sushi rice, recipe follows', u' Wasabi', u' Daikon sprouts, for garnish']
title: Seared Scallops Sushi

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'8 mini (31/2 to 4-inch) bamboo spoons (see www.montessoriservices.com/store)', u'In a small bowl combine salt, sugar, togarashi, and pulverized nori. Stir in tuna to coat, cover and refrigerate about 2 hours to lightly cure. Divide into 8 even portions and place on flat bamboo spoons. Drizzle with ginger soy syrup.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon togarashi (Japanese 7-spice)', u'1 teaspoon nori (from about 1 seaweed sheet used to wrap sushi, such as from a package of 10 yakinori), pulverized', u'4 ounces ahi tuna (sashimi or sushi grade) finely diced into 1/16th-inch cubes', u"1 tablespoon Ming Tsai's Ginger Soy Syrup, recipe follows", u' Grapeseed oil (as needed to lightly coat pan)', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic (about 6 to 9 garlic cloves)', u'2 tablespoons peeled minced fresh garlic root (about a 1 1/2 to 2-inch piece)', u'1 bunch scallions (white and tender green parts only), sliced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup naturally brewed soy sauce', u'1 cup honey', u'2 limes, juiced']
title: Nori-Cured Ahi Tuna on Bamboo Spoon

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Mix together vinegar, sugar, and salt.', u"Rinse the rice in colander and drain. Put the rice and water in medium saucepan with a tight fitting lid. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to very low and simmer, tightly covered. (For a good seal wrap the pan's lid tightly with a small kitchen towel and cover the saucepan. Make sure the towel's edges are folded up well away from the heat.) Cook until all the water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove the rice from the heat (don't uncover) and set aside for 10 minutes.", u'Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a large bowl. Add the vinegar mixture and toss with the rice, using a wooden spoon. Spread it out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Fan the rice continuously with a fan or magazine until cooled. Cover the rice with a damp towel.', u'Meanwhile, beat the eggs with a teaspoon of water and a pinch of salt. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat, add the vegetable oil. Pour in the eggs, tilting the skillet as you add the eggs to make an even coating. Cook eggs until set. Invert eggs onto a cutting board and cut into strips.', u'To assemble rolls:', u'Place the sushi mat with the slats running crosswise directly in front of you on a clean work space. Lay a sheet of nori shiny-side down and lined up with the closest edge of the mat. Lightly moisten fingers with water, and evenly press about 1/4 of the rice onto the nori, with 1 1/2-inches uncovered at the far edge. Line up the fillings about 1-inch from the closest near edge, evenly across the rice. Leave 1-inch of rice uncovered at the far edge.', u'Beginning with the near edge of the mat, tightly roll up the nori, rice, and fillings into a cylinder. Firmly tug on the rounded mat over the roll as you pull on the far edge of the mat to tighten the roll. Open the mat, dab unsealed edge of nori with a bit of water and roll the sushi forward to seal. Transfer the sushi to a plate and cover with damp paper towels. Repeat with remaining rice and fillings.', u'Cut each sushi roll, crosswise, into 8 pieces with a sharp wet knife.', u'Serve with bowl of soy sauce for dipping.', u'Copyright 2005 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 1/2 cup short-grained sushi rice', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'4 sheets toasted nori', u'2 large eggs', u' Kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon vegetable oil', u'1 carrot, cut into matchsticks', u'1 small yellow bell pepper, stemmed, seeded and cut into matchsticks', u'1/2 firm-ripe Hass avocado, peeled, thinly sliced lengthwise sprinkled with lemon juice', u' Soy Sauce', u' Equipment: Bamboo sushi mat']
title: Sushi Rolls for All Ages

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Prepare the rice 1 hour before the meal.', u'Beat 1 of the eggs in a bowl and dredge the pork cutlets in it and then into the bread crumbs.', u'Fry them in hot oil until golden and tender, drain on paper towels. Slice the cutlets on the bias into 1/2-inch strips.', u'Bring the dashi, mirin, and soy sauce to a boil in a pot. Then add the sliced green onion, and simmer until soft. Half fill 2 deep bowls with the rice. Arrange 1 sliced cutlet on the rice in each bowl to look like it is intact.', u'Whisk the eggs in a bowl then pour slowly over the onion into the dashi in the pot. When the egg is nearly set, stir once. Ladle half of the egg mass on top of the pork in each bowl.', u'Then ladle more broth among the bowls. You may not need to use it all. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups cooked short-grain white rice (rinse well before cooking to remove the starch)', u'3 eggs', u'2 (4-ounce) boneless pork chops', u'1 cup panko bread crumbs {Japanese}', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1 cup dashi stock', u'1/2 cup mirin (sweet rice cooking wine)', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'2 green onions sliced into 1-inch pieces']
title: Katsudon

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the grill. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Season the chicken breast with 1 tablespoon of sesame oil, salt and pepper. Place the chicken on the grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Remove from the grill and cool completely. In a saucepan, heat the remaining sesame oil. Add the garlic, ginger and chili paste. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in the sugar and continue to cook for 1 minute. Stir in the hoisin, vinegar, peanut butter and water. Mix well. Bring the mixture to a simmer and remove from the heat. Cool the sauce completely. Add the noodles to the water and cook until tender, about 4 to 4 1/2 minutes, stirring the noodles constantly with chop sticks. Drain and rinse the noodles under cold water, using your fingers to separate the noodles while cooling. Toss the noodles in the peanut dressing. Slice the chicken, very thin, on the bias. Add the sliced chicken, peanuts and green onions to the pasta. Mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve the noodles cold.']
ingredients: [u'2 chicken breast, boneless and skinless (about 6-ounces each)', u'3 tablespoons sesame oil', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon chili paste', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup smooth peanut butter', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 pound Soba noodles', u'1/2 cup chopped toasted peanuts', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions, (green part only)']
title: Cold Soba Salad

directions: [u'Arrange the meat attractively on a round platter, so that each slice can be easily picked up with chopsticks or a fondue fork. Arrange vegetables on a second platter. ', u"Fill a hot pot or nabe pot 2/3 full of dashi set on a burner on the table. Each diner picks up a piece of meat from the serving platter and swishes it around in the simmering broth until the red meat becomes pink, or cooked to the degree desired. Diners may alternate between meat and vegetables. The tofu breaks easily, so be careful when adding it to the pot. Diners eat from the pot, dipping the food into the dipping sauces which are placed in individual cups at each person's place."]
ingredients: [u'2 pounds prime quality beef, cut into paper thin slices, about 8 by 3-inches', u'12 shiitake mushrooms, wiped, trimmed and crisscrossed on cap with a knife', u'6 green onions, sliced diagonally into 2-inch lengths', u'1/4 pound spinach, washed and stems trimmed', u'1 block of tofu, about 10ounces, cut into cubes', u'1/2 pound canned bamboo shoots, whole, washed, cut into 1/4-inch slices', u'2 quarts basic dashi, recipe follows, or light beef stock', u'3 quarts cold water', u'3 ounces giant kelp, (kombu)', u'3 ounces dried bonito flakes', u'2 cups basic dashi', u'2 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u' White vinegar to taste', u' Combine the dashi, soy sauce, and mirin in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Let boil for a few minutes to reduce by 1/3, then remove from heat and cool. Stir in vinegar to taste. Pour sauce into individual cups.']
title: Shabu Shabu with Dipping Sauces

directions: [u'Combine all and reduce at a simmer until a syrup consistency is achieved, about a 60 to 70 percent reduction. Let cool.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups thin soy sauce', u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'1 lime juiced']
title: Soy Syrup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl combine wasabi with 1 tablespoon of water and allow to sit for 20 minutes.  Then add 1 tablespoon of the rice wine vinegar, light oil, and sesame oil. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Thinly slice the tuna into small rectangles, and toss with the pickled ginger and the soy sauce. Toss the cucumber slices with the remaining rice wine vinegar. Using a 2-inch diameter biscuit ring as a mold, begin building your composed salad. Place the biscuit cutter in the center of a salad plate. Place 6 of the slices of cucumber into the cutter and press to fit.  Divide the tuna and place 1/2 of it into the cutter on top of the cucumber slices. Top with a dollop of the wasabi dressing. Remove the cutter carefully. Drizzle the plate with more dressing. Garnish the entire plate with sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces top grade tuna', u'1 teaspoon wasabi powder', u'2 tablespoon rice wine vinegar, in all', u'1/4 cup light oil', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon thinly sliced pickled ginger', u'12 thin cucumber slices, peeled', u'1/2 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1/2 cup seaweed salad', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Composed Tuna Timbale

directions: [u'Fill mixing glass with ice. Add the ingredients, stirring with a bar spoon. Strain into a chilled, stemmed cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon grass and raspberries.']
ingredients: [u'1 .5 oz. Absolut Citron', u'1 .5 oz. Sugei Sake', u'2 oz. sweet and sour', u'1 oz. Chambord', u' Lemon grass and raspberries (garnish)', u' Ice']
title: Tokyo Ginza Cocktail

directions: [u'Prepare a medium fire in a charcoal grill with a cover, or preheat a gas grill to medium.']
ingredients: [u'2/3 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup sake', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons finely grated ginger, with juices', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon wasabi paste', u'1/4 cup prepared Japanese sesame dressing', u'1/4 cup prepared ponzu sauce (citrus-soy sauce)', u'6 cups baby spinach', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 tablespoon sake', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons miso', u'2 1/2 pounds ground chuck', u'1/3 cup sliced green onion', u'2 teaspoons finely grated ginger, with juices', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons coarsely ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon sea salt', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing on the grill rack', u'6 sesame seed buns, split']
title: Mirin Glazed Burgers with Sesame-Ponzu Spinach and Wasabi-Ginger Mayonnaise

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat oil to 375 degrees in electric fryer or in a large, deep heavy pan on stove top. Roll vegetables in flour and shake off excess. Dip vegetables into batter and carefully place in oil to fry. Remove from oil when golden brown. Place on paper towels to drain. Serve with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil', u' Zucchini, sliced into 1/2-inch slices', u' Broccoli florets', u' Flour', u' Carrots, 1/4-inch dice', u' Cauliflower florets', u' Tempura batter', u'2 scallions, sliced', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon ginger, grated']
title: Vegetable Tempura

directions: [u'Over a double boiler, combine miso, sugar, sake, and mirin and whisk until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and let cool. Refrigerate for a few hours so that marinade is cold and add black cod fillets or fillet pieces. Marinate for 24 to 48 hours in refrigerator.', u'Remove from marinade and scrape off most of marinade that is coating the fish. Preheat oven to broil (oven should be very hot and heat should be coming from the top down). Place fish on a greased foil-lined baking sheet. Place baking sheet approximately 6 inches away from top heating element. Broil 7 to 10 minutes, until browned. Depending on the thickness of the fish, fish should flake away; otherwise, bake an additional few minutes.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup white miso', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 sake', u'6 tablespoons mirin', u'6 to 8 black cod fillets or fillet pieces']
title: Miso Marinated Blackened Cod

directions: [u"Trim chicken of any excess fat or sinew. Slice, across grain, into 3 by 1/2 inch strips. Stir marinade ingredients together in a medium bowl. Add chicken strips and toss to evenly coat. Set aside at room temperature, uncovered, 30 minutes. It's important not to marinate any longer, or the acid in the lemon will break down the fibers of the chicken. ", u'Meanwhile, prepare the salad. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Tear watercress into bitesized pieces and toss with dressing. Divide salad among 6 serving plates. Thinly slice avocado halves into strips lengthwise and arrange on salad. Reserve in refrigerator. ', u'To cook chicken, heat a large dry castiron skillet over high heat 15 minutes. (Yes, 15 minutes.) Heat peanut oil for frying. Lift chicken strips from marinade, one at a time, and add to pan, standing as far away as possible to avoid splatters. Fry until dark golden brown and crisp, about 1 minute per side. Arrange about 8 hot chicken strips on each salad in a spoke pattern. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'6 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', u'1/2 cup sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u' Juice of 1/2 lemon', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons freshly grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper', u'5 large bunches watercress, stems removed, leaves washed and well dried', u'2 ripe avocados, halved, seeded, and peeled', u'1/2 cup peanut oil for frying']
title: Warm Shredded Chicken Salad

directions: [u'Make the broth: In a saucepan bring the water to a boil. Stir in the dashi and simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes. Stir in the soy sauce and the sugar and simmer the broth for 5 minutes. Strain the broth through a fine sieve into a heatproof bowl and pour it back into the pan.', u'In a kettle of salted boiling water cook the noodles for 3 to 5 minutes, or until they are al dente, being careful not to overcook them, drain them in a colander, and rinse them under cold water.', u'Add the carrots to the broth and simmer them, covered, for 5 minutes. Stir in the spinach and the tofu and simmer the soup for 1 minute. In a small bowl stir together well 1/2 cup of the soup broth and the miso and pour the mixture back into the pan. Divide the noodles among 6 large bowls, ladle the soup over them, and sprinkle each serving with some of the scallions.']
ingredients: [u'7 cups water', u'1 tablespoon instant dashi', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 pound dried soba* (buckwheat noodles)', u'2 carrots, sliced thin', u'1/2 pound spinach, coarse stems discarded and the leaves washed well, spun dry, and cut crosswise into 1 1/2-inch-wide strips', u'8 to 10 ounces firm tofu (preferably silken), cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'3 to 4 tablespoons miso* (fermented bean paste), or to taste, if desired', u'2 scallions, minced', u' *available at Japanese markets']
title: Soba Soup with Spinach and Tofu

directions: [u'Sear the rib-eye steak to medium rare. In a small bowl, combine all of the remaining ingredients and mix well. Remove the meat from the pan, and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice the meat very thinly. To serve, plate the sliced steak and top with the salad mixture.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces rib-eye steak', u'2 small jicama, peeled and julienned', u'2 red onions, julienned', u'2 cucumber, peeled, seeded, and julienned', u'4 tablespoons soy sauce', u'6 tablespoons orange juice', u'4 tablespoons hot pepper sauce', u'4 tablespoons rice vinegar']
title: Beef Tataki

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine all ingredients for tempura sauce in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature before serving.', u'Heat oil in a fryer to 340 degrees F.', u" In a large bowl beat egg yolk with water until thoroughly combined. Quickly stir in flour and cornstarch or potato flour, using as few strokes as possible to combine. It's o.k. if there are still a few lumps in the batter. Refrigerate the batter for 30 minutes.", u"*Nobu's tip: all tempura batter ingredients should be at room temperature when mixed. After the batter is mixed it should be refrigerated for 30 minutes before using.", u'Working in batches, quickly dip the green beans in the batter and, using tongs, transfer to the hot cooking oil. Cook until crisp and light golden brown, about 1 to 2 minutes. Using tongs or a slotted spoon, transfer to a draining rack or plates covered with paper towels to drain. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons mirin (sweet cooking wine)', u'1/2 cup dashi', u'5 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'6 cups cooking oil', u'1 egg yolk', u'1 cup water', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons cornstarch or potato flour', u'1 1/2 pounds green beans, washed and ends trimmed']
title: Green Bean Tempura

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Place the rice in a pot, with a lid and fill with 3 cups water. Stir to moisten the rice, then drain and repeat until the water runs clear. When all excess starch and impurities have been removed in this way, let the rice stand to completely drain for 15 minutes. In the meantime, wash and dry the pot to have it ready to cook the rice. Return the cleansed rice to the pot and add 2 1/3 cups water.  Cover and bring to a vigorous boil over medium-high heat. Do not remove the lid during any stage of the cooking process. Reduce heat to medium and let cook for 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and let cook for 15 minutes, still leaving lid undisturbed. Remove rice from heat and let stand with lid still on pot for 5 more minutes.', u'While the rice is cooking, make the vinegar mixture.  In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, salt, and miso over medium heat, stirring until the ingredients are integrated.  Remove from heat and set aside to cool.', u'Separate the grains of rice with a wooden spatula and transfer to a shallow bowl, preferably wooden. Stir in enough of the vinegar to make the rice stick together in clumps when you squeeze some in the palm of your hand. Do not add too much vinegar mixture; it is better to have some left over than to over-moisten the whole batch of rice.', u'Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel and allow to cool to room temperature before using in a sushi recipe.', u"Note: This sushi rice recipe can be used in conjunction with the recipes for the elements of the Bento Box of sushi hors d'oeuvres made on the episode which included: Traditional Osaka Style Sushi, Rice Balls, Maki, and Nigiri Sushi.", u'Yield: 6 3/4 cups vinegared sushi rice for use in sushi recipes, enough for approximately 6 servings of sushi depending on the recipe']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 cups short grain Japanese rice (use only rice known as Gohan - rice of the plant variety Japonica - which is very sticky)', u'2 1/3 cups water', u'3/8 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'3/8 cup miso (soybean paste)']
servings: 6 3/4 cups sushi rice, enough for 6 servings of sushi
title: Sushi Rice

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u"Heat the nori enough to make it supple, at about 325 degrees F for 3 minutes. Place a sheet of nori on the bamboo mat with the wider part along the rolling edge of the mat. Spread 1/2 cup of the rice over the surface of the nori, leaving about 1/2-inch of nori on the furthest edge uncovered so you will be able to seal the roll. Press the rice down firmly but gently. Place a dab of wasabi - about 1/4 teaspoon - on your finger and spread a thin ribbon of wasabi from left to right along the centerline of the rice. On top of the line of wasabi, lay a length each of fish, cucumber, and scallion. Begin rolling the edge of the bamboo closest to you, using the mat to press down on the sushi roll firmly but gently as you roll. The nori should stick to itself when the roll is complete; if it doesn't, use the cornstarch slurry to moisten it. Dip a knife in vinegared water and cut the roll into 6 even slices. Repeat for each maki. Arrange the rolls cut side up on a plate and top each roll with 1/4 teaspoon tobiko.", u"Note: This recipe can be used in conjunction with the other recipes for the elements of the Bento Box of sushi hors d'uvre made on the episode which also included: Traditional Osaka Style Sushi, Rice Balls, and Nigiri Sushi. Also refer to the Sushi Rice recipe as needed."]
ingredients: [u'12 sheets nori (seaweed) approximately 5 by 7-inches', u'6 cups prepared vinegared sushi rice', u'1 tablespoon prepared wasabi', u'1/2 pound sushi grade salmon, cut into 12 (7-inch) long by 1/4-inch thick strips', u'1 English cucumber, peeled, seeds removed, and sliced into 12 (7-inch) long by 1/4-inch thick strips', u'6 scallions, white and tender green parts only, cut into 12 (7-inch) lengths', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch dissolved in 1 tablespoon water', u' Vinegared water, in which to dip knife', u'3 teaspoons tobiko (flying fish roe)', u' Special equipment: A bamboo sushi mat']
title: Sushi Roll: Maki

directions: [u'Place a half sheet of nori horizontally in front of you on your mat.  Place rice on left third of nori, leaving border of nori all around.  Place filling ingredients vertically across middle of rice.  Fold near corner of nori over to begin folding into cone shape.  Continue to roll until cone is formed.', u'Serve with pickled ginger, wasabi and soy sauce as condiments.', u'']
ingredients: [u' Sushi rice, recipe follows', u' Nori', u' Carrot, julienned', u' Orange and red bell peppers, julienned', u' Cucumber, julienned (Chinese B without seeds, or regular is also ok)', u' Asparagus', u' Avocado', u' Scallions, julienned', u' Black sesame seeds', u' White sesame seeds', u' Black sesame seeds/salt combination', u' (c. Television Food Network, G.P.)', u'3 1/3 cups short grain rice', u'4 cups water, plus 1/4 cup water', u'6 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 teaspoons salt']
title: Vegetarian Hand Rolled Sushi (Temaki)

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Boil noodles according to package directions. Drain and cool. In a medium to large bowl, combine noodles, shallot, carrot, pepper, basil, mint, and cilantro. Combine all dressing ingredients, season with salt to taste, add to noodle mixture, and toss lightly.', u'Snap off Bibb lettuce leaves and wash and dry. To serve, scoop spoonfuls of noodle salad into the lettuce leaves.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces soba noodles, or whole-wheat spaghetti', u'1 large shallot, very thinly sliced', u'1 1/2 cups shredded carrot', u'1 red pepper, julienne', u'1/3 cup shredded fresh basil leaves', u'1/3 cup shredded fresh mint leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon walnut oil (or canola oil)', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon finely minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon chili flakes', u'1/2 teaspoon lime zest', u'1 teaspoon lime juice', u'1/2 teaspoon fish sauce, or 1 teaspoon low-sodium soy sauce', u' Salt', u'6 large Bibb lettuce leaves']
title: Soba Noodle-Vegetable Salad

directions: [u'Squeeze the lime juice into a martini shaker. Add ice 2/3rds of the way up the shaker. Add lychee infused sake. Shake vigorously. Place a lychee fruit in a martini glass.', u'Strain the cocktail into the glass. Pour the pomegranate juice gently into the martini glass for a floating effect.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 lime, juiced', u'3 ounces lychee infused sake', u' Lychee fruit', u'1 ounce Pomegranate juice']
title: Saketini

directions: [u'With a sharp knife, cut tuna fillet crosswise at a slight angle and into slices about 1/4 inch thick. Wrap in a clean kitchen towel and set aside. Cut the cucumber into narrow strips about 4 inches long. Mix the sushi rice with the sesame seeds. ', u'Just before rolling sushi, toast the nori by passing the shiny side over a high flame. The color of the nori will change from brownish black to dark green. (Without toasting, the nori will be gummy and hard to chew.) Cut toasted nori sheets in half crosswise. ', u'Lay a 1/2 a sheet of the nori, shiny side down, on a bamboo rolling mat. Combine the rice vinegar and water in a mixing bowl, and moisten your hands with this hand vinegar to keep the rice from sticking to your hands as you work. Spread about 1 cup of the sushi rice on 3/4 of the nori closest to you, in a layer about 1/4 inch thick, spreading it to the edges. Smear a thin line of the wasabi across the center of the rice, and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of chili oil. Lay 1/4 of the cucumber strips and 1/4 of the tuna slices evenly along the wasabi. ', u'To roll, hold the line of ingredients in place with fingertips, and use thumbs to push up and turn the end of the bamboo mat so that the edge of the nori is lifted up and meets the far edge of the sheet. Correct the shape by gently but firmly pressing the bamboo mat around the roll for about 30 seconds to shape it. Make 3 more rolls. ', u'Use a wet knife to cut each roll into 1-inch rounds. Arrange sushi on a platter or individual plates and garnish with the vinegared ginger.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounce tuna fillet, without skin', u'1 Japanese cucumber (or 1/2 Western variety, peeled and seeded)', u'4 cups sushi rice, cooked', u'1 tablespoon white sesame seeds, toasted', u'2 sheets nori seaweed', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons water', u' Bamboo mat', u'1 tablespoon finely grated wasabi horseradish', u'2 teaspoons spicy chili oil', u' Sweet-vinegared ginger, well drained, for garnish']
title: Spicy Tuna Roll with Cucumber

directions: [u'Place a half sheet of nori horizontally in front of you on your mat. Place rice on left third of nori, leaving border of nori all around. Place filling vertically across middle of rice. Fold near corner of nori over to begin folding into cone shape. Continue to roll until cone is formed.', u'Serve with pickled ginger, wasabi and soy sauce as condiments', u'']
ingredients: [u' Sushi rice', u' Nori', u' Avocado', u' Carrot', u' Eggplant (grilled Japanese)', u' Tofu (made crisp by frying)', u' Tomato', u' Cucumber (Chinese-without seeds, or regular is also ok)', u' Asparagus', u' Aburage (inari tofu skins)', u' Wilted spinach', u' Bell peppers, julienned', u' Scallions, julienned', u' Snow peas, julienned', u' Black sesame seeds', u' White sesame seeds', u' Black sesame seeds/salt combination', u' (c. Television Food Network, G.P.)', u'3 1/3 cups short grain rice', u'4 cups water, plus 1/4 cup water', u'6 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 teaspoons salt']
title: Hand Rolled Sushi (Temaki)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place rinsed rice into the cooker and cover by 1-inch of cold water. Turn on the rice cooker. (Check the box for the exact time.) When small steaming bubbles form on the surface of the cooking rice, turn off the machine and allow to sit for 20 minutes. Gently fold in the rice wine vinegar. Allow to cool completely before you start working with it.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups Kohurosa rice, glutinous rice, rinsed under cool water', u' Cold water to cover the rice in the steamer by 1-inch', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar']
title: Sushi Rice

directions: [u'Remove leg and thigh bone from each chicken leg, leaving meat and skin intact. Season with salt and pepper and refrigerate until mousse is ready. Grind the chicken breast meat twice through a meat grinder and place in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process with the egg white until mixture is smooth, then place in a bowl over ice. When mixture is thoroughly chilled, beat in whipping cream 1/2 cup at a time. Season with salt, pepper, soy sauce, and brandy. To test for flavor, poach a small spoonful of the mousse in simmering water. Taste and adjust seasoning and consistency. Add the drained seaweed. ', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lay the chicken legs out skin side down and place 1/2 cup of mousse in the center of each. Wrap each leg around mousse and place close together in a 2 inch deep pan for poaching. Heat the chicken stock to boiling and pour over all the legs. Cover pan with foil. Bake 30 to 40 minutes, or until chicken and mousse are cooked through. Transfer chicken to a platter, reserving the chicken stock. Remove skin and cover with a damp towel. Keep warm until serving time. ', u'Strain the reserved chicken stock into a saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce to 1 cup. Add cream, soy sauce, and lemon juice, and return to a boil. Thicken sauce with cornstarch and keep warm. ', u'Fry rice noodles in small batches in vegetable oil and drain well. ', u'To serve, line individual plates with crispy fried rice noodles and top with a piece of chicken. ', u'Spoon sauce over top and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'6 chicken legs and thighs (attached)', u'3/4 pound chicken breast meat, skinless and boneless', u'1 egg white', u'1 to 1 1/2 cups whipping cream', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons brandy', u'1/2 cup drained seaweed (soaked in water and squeezed dry)', u'3 cups wellseasoned chicken stock', u'3/4 cup whipping cream', u' Soy sauce to taste', u' Juice of half a lemon', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 1/4 cup water', u' Rice noodles', u' Vegetable oil for frying', u' Toasted sesame seeds, for garnish']
title: Mai Fun City Chicken

directions: [u'Slice the yellowtail very thinly and fan out on a plate.', u'Brush the minced garlic over the sashimi evenly. Sprinkle the ginger, scallions, and jalapeno evenly over the fish. Drizzle the soy sauce, yuzu, and ponzu evenly over the fish. ', u'Heat a small saucepan over high heat. Carefully add the olive oil to the extremely hot pan and heat until it just begins to smoke, about 30 seconds. Remove from the heat and carefully pour over the fish. The hot oil will sear the outside of the fish.', u'Garnish with a lemon wedge and julienned daikon.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces fresh premium yellowtail (belly, if available)*', u'1/2 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 -ounce fresh ginger, finely julienne', u'1 1/2 tablespoons thinly sliced scallions', u'1 tablespoon finely diced red jalapeno', u'1 tablespoon finely diced green jalapeno', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon yuzu juice (Japanese citrus)*', u'1 tablespoon ponzu sauce (Japanese citrus vinegar)*', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 lemon wedge, for serving', u' Julienned daikon radish, for serving*', u' *These items can be found at specialty Japanese stores']
title: Yellowtail Sashimi with Diced Chiles

directions: [u'Pour sake and water into a large frying pan or wok and bring to boil. Once boiled, turn down heat and simmer. Cook pork slices 1 at a time.  Remove each slice and cool in a strainer. Place cool pork slices on a plate and refrigerate while making dipping sauce. Serve with Miso Dipping Sauce and Soy Sauce Dipping Sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sake', u'2 cups water', u'10 1/2 ounces (300 grams) thinly sliced pork or beef', u' Miso Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u' Soy Sauce Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 1/2 ounces (70 grams) red miso', u'4 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon ground sesame seeds', u'1 tablespoon Japanese mustard (Karashi)', u'1/4 cup sake', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped ginger', u'1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons chopped green onion', u'1/4 cup sake']
title: Sake Pork Shabu Shabu

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Cut the fish into thin slices (1/8-inch) against the grain. Using the outside perimeter of the oshibako as a template, place it on top of the sliced fish and cut the edges of the fish to fit inside the box.', u'First put a sheet of nori inside the oshibako, and top with the first layer of fish. Then evenly spread a layer of 1-ounce of snow crab. Follow with a layer of 1 teaspoon tobiko, then 1 teaspoon mayonnaise, and a layer of 1 cup sushi rice. Finish with another layer of fish. Then press the oshibako lid to compress and mold the sushi.', u'Invert to remove and cut into 6 even pieces crosswise and in half lengthwise to yield 12 pieces. Repeat process for 3 more times to yield 48 rectangular sushi. Keep sushi cold until ready to serve.', u"Note: This recipe can be used in conjunction with the other recipes for the elements of the Bento Box of sushi hors d'oeuvres made on the episode which also included: Rice Balls, Maki, and Nigiri Sushi. Also refer to the Sushi Rice recipe as needed."]
ingredients: [u'1 pound sushi quality tuna, salmon, yellowtail, or snapper', u'4 sheets nori (seaweed) approximately 5 by 7 inches', u'4 ounces cooked snow crab claws, split from shell', u'4 teaspoons tobiko (flying fish roe)', u'4 teaspoons mayonnaise', u'6 cups cooked vinegared sushi rice', u' Special equipment: An oshibako (the wooden box which presses and molds the ingredients into the rectangular shape)']
title: Osaka Style Sushi

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Heat oil in a fryer to 340 degrees F.', u"In a large bowl beat the egg with the seltzer water until thoroughly combined. Quickly stir in the rice flour and the cake flour using as few strokes as possible to combine. It's acceptable if there are still a few lumps in the batter. Refrigerate the batter for 30 minutes.", u'Place the all-purpose flour in a medium bowl and set aside as the tempura batter chills.', u'Working in batches, quickly dip the green beans in the all-purpose flour, shaking off any excess, then roll in the tempura batter, allowing the excess to drain off, and transfer to the hot cooking oil using tongs. Cook until crisp and light golden brown, about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Serve immediately with the dipping sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u'6 cups cooking oil', u'1 large egg', u'1 cup ice cold seltzer water', u'1/2 cup rice flour', u'1/2 cup cake flour', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 pound green beans, washed and ends trimmed', u' Tempura Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 cups water', u'3 inches kombu', u'2 ounces bonito flakes', u'3 tablespoons mirin (sweet cooking wine)', u'5 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sugar']
title: Tempura String Beans with Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Saute onion, fennel, garlic, ginger, red chili flakes in blended oil. Add konbu sheets and deglaze with mirin. Reduce for 5 minutes. Add rice vinegar, stock, soy, bonito flakes and simmer. Strain ingredients until all liquid is drained. In a large mixing bowl, place miso and begin to drizzle liquid (as if making a vinaigrette). When reached consistency, add yuzu to desired flavor (this process can be achieved in a blender too).']
ingredients: [u'1 onion, diced', u'1 fennel, diced', u'4 garlic cloves, sliced', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u' Pinch red chili flakes', u' Blended oil', u'2 konbu sheets', u'1 cup mirin', u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'1 cup vegetable stock', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1 cup packed bonito flakes', u'3/4 cup miso', u'1/4 cup yuzu']
title: Yuzu Miso

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a deep saucepan, heat canola oil to 375 degrees F.', u'In a medium bowl, toss cucumbers with rice vinegar, set aside.', u'In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine about 1 tablespoon canola oil and the ginger. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add heavy cream and lime juice, boil until reduced by half. Fold in crabmeat, season mixture with salt, set aside. ', u'Place flour on a plate. Season the rockfish with salt and lightly dredge in flour, shaking off the excess.', u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat about 1 tablespoon canola oil. Add rockfish, skin side down, just until skin is crisp, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook to brown other side, about 1 to 2 minutes. Remove fillets to a cutting board, cut fillets in half horizontally. Top half the pieces with the crab mixture and sandwich back together. Wrap portions individually in waxed or parchment paper.', u'Place on a baking sheet and bake until fish is cooked through and crab stuffing is hot, about 5 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, dip crabs in Tempura Batter and fry until lightly brown and crispy, about 3 minutes, drain quickly on paper towel and cut in half.', u'To serve: On the bottom of the plate, place a few cucumber slices. Drizzle with Yuzu Glaze. Remove rockfish from waxed paper and sprinkle sides with some of the Nori Flakes. Place rockfish over cucumber, plate soft shell crab next to fish. Sprinkle with scallions and chilies. Sprinkle with remaining Nori Flakes and stick a Toasted Nori Triangle in each crab half. ']
ingredients: [u'1 quart peanut oil, for frying', u' Canola oil, as needed', u'1 seedless cucumber, thinly sliced', u'1/2 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped ginger', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 lime, about 2 tablespoons', u'8 ounces jumbo lump crabmeat, picked over', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'6 (5-ounce) wild rockfish fillets, skin on', u'6 soft shell crabs, cleaned', u' Tempura Batter, recipe follows', u' Yuzu Glaze, recipe follows', u' Nori Flakes, recipe follows', u'1/2 bunch scallions, green part only, thinly sliced', u'2 fresh red chiles, thinly sliced, seeded', u' Toasted Nori Triangles, recipe follows']
title: Pan Seared Wild Rockfish and Soft Shell Crab Tempura with Ginger and Yuzu Glaze, Cucumber and Toasted Nori

directions: [u'Boil and mash potatoes.  Add salt and cornstarch to thicken.  Mix the onion with the beef, add salt and pepper and saute.  Strain the juice from the saute. Form potatoes into balls.  Stuff potatoes with meat so the potato is half full.  Wrap the dumplings and brush them with egg yolk.  Sprinkle non-flavored bread crumbs over the dumplings and bake them in a preheated 480 degree oven for 15 minutes or until they brown.']
ingredients: [u'3 potatoes', u' Salt', u' Cornstarch', u' Onions, chopped', u'1 pound ground beef', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'2 to 3 egg yolks']
title: Potato Dumplings

directions: [u'This recipe offers a quick and delicious way to use leftover rice. Of course, markets sell pre-seasoned sushi vinegar, but it is easy and much better to make it yourself so you can control the amount of sweetness and tartness.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups cooked short-grain white rice', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sushi vinegar, recipe follows', u'3 cups Dashi, recipe follows', u'1 teaspoon light-colored soy sauce', u'2 eggs, beaten', u"2 teaspoons grated fresh wasabi (* Chef's Note)", u'1 tablespoon shredded nori (kizami nori)', u'3 or 4 sprigs mitsuba leaves, minced, or chopped scallions or chives, for garnish', u'1/2 cup sake-mash vinegar (akazu), or regular white wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup salt', u'1 piece dashi kombu, 4 by 6-inches', u'4 cups filtered spring water', u'1/2 cup loosely packed bonito flakes']
title: Sushi Rice Risotto

directions: [u'Combine all the ingredients in the cup of a hand-held blender. Blend until smooth']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon yuzu juice', u'4 tablespoons mirin', u'1 tablespoon wasabi powder', u'2 tablespoons wasabi mustard', u'2 tablespoons soft tofu', u'1/2 cup assorted radish slices 1/16-inch thick. Use American red, diakon, watermelon radish, etc.', u'2 tablespoons fresh mint leaves', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons fresh radish sprouts', u'1 1/2 tablespoons yuzu juice', u'1 1/2 tablespoons mirin', u'1/4 cup wasabi-yuzu', u'16 slices raw tuna, approximately 1-ounce each', u' Coarse sea salt to garnish']
title: Sliced Raw Tuna with Wasabi-Yuzu

directions: [u'Heat the dashi to a simmer in a saucepan. Add the mushrooms and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes. Soften the miso in a small bowl by mixing it with a few tablespoons of hot dashi. Pour the softened miso into the saucepan. Heat the soup, being careful not to boil, and add tofu.  Pour into individual soup bowls and garnish with the green onions.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups dashi', u'1/2 cup sliced shiitake mushrooms', u'4 tablespoons red miso', u'10 ounces tofu, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u' Chopped green onions, for garnish', u'3 quarts cold water', u'3 ounces giant kelp, (kombu)', u'3 ounces dried bonito flakes']
title: Miso Soup with Tofu and Mushrooms

directions: [u'Thoroughly wash and dry lettuce. Break into bitesized pieces and place in a large salad bowl. Julienne carrot, cucumbers, and radish, and toss with greens. ', u'Whisk dressing ingredients together in a bowl. Toss with salad just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'6 small heads limestone lettuce or other greens', u'1 large carrot, peeled', u'2 pickling cucumbers or kirbies, peeled', u'1 small daikon radish', u'2 tablespoons Thai fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Pernod', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh ginger']
title: Limestone Lettuce with House Dressing

directions: [u'For the sushi rice: Wash the rice several times until the water runs clear.  Cover the rice with cold water and soak for 20 minutes.  Drain and place the rice in a rice cooker.  Add 3-3/4 cups water.  Cover and cook until the water is absorbed.  While the rice is cooking, combine the rice wine vinegar, mirin and sugar in a small saucepan and cook over low heat until the sugar is dissolved.  Remove from the heat.  When the rice is cooked, remove from the cooker and place in a large wooden bowl.  Using a rubber spatula, fold in the vinegar and sugar mixture.  When the vinegar mixture is folded in, cover the bowl with a damp towel and let rest for 30 minutes.', u'For the sambal aioli: In the bowl of a food processor or blender, combine the lemon juice, sambal, garlic and egg yolks and process until combined.  With the processor running, slowly drizzle in the canola oil to create an emulsion.  If the aioli needs to be thinned out after all of the oil has been added, thin with a little water or lemon juice.  Season with salt and pepper.', u'*RAW EGG WARNING ', u'Food Network Kitchens suggest caution in consuming raw and lightly-cooked eggs due to the slight risk of Salmonella or other food-borne illness. To reduce this risk, we recommend you use only fresh, properly-refrigerated, clean, grade A or AA eggs with intact shells, and avoid contact between the yolks or whites and the shell. ', u'To make the Tempura Shrimp Maki Roll: Preheat a fryer to 360 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine the rice flour, all-purpose flour and salt.  Add the club soda until the consistency of pancake batter is achieved.  Butterfly the shrimp by slicing lengthwise down the back.  Dip the shrimp in the tempura batter and then place in the fryer and fry until golden brown, about 3 minutes.  Remove from the oil to a paper towel-lined plate.', u'On a sushi mat, lay down 1 piece of the nori, shiny side down.  Spread the sushi rice on one half of the nori, about 1/4-inch thick.  Spread about 1 tablespoon of the sambal aioli over the rice.  In the center of the rice, lay down 1/4 cup of the cucumber and a few strip of red bell pepper in a line that reaches from one side of the nori to the other.  Top the cucumber with 3 pieces of the tempura shrimp.  Sprinkle 1/4 cup of the wasabi tobbiko over the shrimp.  Roll the sushi up, using the sushi mat.  To seal the roll, use a little water along the edge of the nori.  Cut the roll into 6 pieces.  Repeat this procedure 3 more times to create 4 rolls.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups short grain rice', u'3 3/4 cups water', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons mirin', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon sambal', u'1 teaspoon garlic', u'3 egg yolks*', u'1 cup canola oil', u' Salt', u' Pepper', u'1/2 cup rice flour', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups club soda', u'12 medium sized shrimp, peeled, deveined with tail removed', u'4 sheets nori', u' Sushi rice', u' Sambal aioli', u'1 cup julienne cucumber', u'1/2 cup julienne red bell pepper', u'1/2 cup wasabi tobbiko']
title: Tempura Shrimp Maki Roll with Sambal Aioli and Wasabi Tobbiko

directions: [u'Combine the vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan and heat just to dissolve the sugar. Remove from heat and pour vinegar mixture into a bowl to cool. Set aside. ', u'Place rice in a heavy bottomed pot, and add water and kelp. Cover and heat over medium high heat just until the boiling point. Remove the kelp and cover again. After 30 seconds, lower the heat and simmer 12 to 13 minutes, or until all the water has been absorbed. ', u'Turn off the heat and let the rice stand, covered, for 10 to 15 minutes. Turn rice into a wide, shallow wooden bowl. Using a flat wooden spoon or rice paddle, spread the hot rice in a thin layer. Toss rice with horizontal cutting strokes to keep grains from separating or getting mashed. While tossing, sprinkle rice with vinegar mixture. While fluffing the rice, cool it quickly with a hand fan. The tossing and fanning will take about 10 minutes. For easy handling, use vinegared rice before it becomes cold. Cover the bowl with a damp cloth to keep warm.']
ingredients: [u'4 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'3 cups short-grain rice, washed', u'3 1/4 cups water', u'3 inch square giant kelp (konbu), optional']
title: Sushi Rice

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Slice fish across the grain into thin (1/8-inch thick) medallions about 1 1/2-inches in diameter. Place a sheet of plastic wrap in the palm of your hand and lay a piece of fish on it. Put 1 rounded tablespoon sushi rice on the fish, gather up the edges of the plastic, and twist to form the combination into a ball.', u'Keep sushi cold until ready to serve.', u"Note: This recipe can be used in conjunction with the other recipes for the elements of the Bento Box of sushi hors d'oeuvres made on the episode which also included: Traditional Osaka Style Sushi, Maki, and Nigiri Sushi. Also refer to the Sushi Rice recipe as needed."]
ingredients: [u'1 pound sushi quality tuna, salmon, yellowtail, snapper', u'1 1/2 cups prepared vinegared sushi rice']
title: Rice Balls

directions: [u'In a deep, wide dish or pie plate, combine the soy sauce, honey, garlic and ginger. Add the tofu and let it marinate for at least an hour, turning it over half way through. ', u'Cook the rice according to the package. In a large glass or ceramic bowl, combine the rice vinegar and sugar. Add the hot rice in fourths, stirring the mixture well after each addition. Stir in the scallions and sesame seeds, mix well. ', u'For each roll, place a sheet of nori on a piece of wax paper so that the bottom edge of the nori lies along the bottom edge of the paper. Moisten your hands with cold water and place a handful of rice in the center of the nori, spread it out in a thin layer to fill the sheet evenly. Add more rice if necessary. Place 2 strips of tofu across the center of the nori, so they run the entire width of the sheet. Place a portion of the carrots on top of the tofu, some spinach over that, finishing with some sprouts (use about a fifth of each filling ingredient). Start rolling the nori from the bottom by gripping the nori and the wax paper, and using the paper to help you make a tight roll. ', u'Let the nori rest, seam side down, while you repeat the remaining procedure with the remaining rice and nori. You should have 5 rolls. To serve, wet the blade of a serrated knife and cut rolls into rounds about an inch thick. Serve at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons honey', u'1 teaspoon grated garlic', u'1 tablespoon grated peeled fresh ginger', u'1 pound extra-firm tofu, cut into 1/4-inch-wide strips', u'2 cups short-grain  brown rice', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon extra-fine  sugar', u'2 scallions, white part only, minced', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'5 sheets nori (available in Asian-specialty sections)', u'1 cup finely shredded carrots', u'10 fresh spinach leaves, steamed and squeezed dry', u'1 1/2 cups  alfalfa sprouts']
title: Nori Rolls

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a large roasting pan with cooking spray.', u'Season salmon with salt and black pepper and place in roasting pan. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, rice wine and miso paste. Brush mixture all over salmon in pan. ', u"In a large bowl, combine potatoes, oil, garlic, rosemary, and salt and black pepper to taste. Toss to coat potatoes. Arrange potatoes alongside salmon (or on a separate baking sheet if there's not enough room). ", u'Roast salmon and potatoes 20 to 25 minutes, until fish and potatoes are fork-tender.', u'Serve 4 of the salmon fillets with the cilantro sprinkled over top and all of the potatoes on the side. Reserve remaining salmon for salad.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'6 salmon fillets (about 5 ounces each)', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon rice wine (mirin)', u'1 tablespoon miso paste', u'4 Yukon gold potatoes, cut into 2-inch chunks', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons freshly chopped rosemary leaves', u'1/4 cup freshly chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Roasted Miso Salmon with Lemon and Cilantro with Rosemary Roasted Yukons

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Boil wonton skins in a large pot of water until al dente and drain well, Lay the wonton skins out on a waxed paper surface.', u'Heat the oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F or as instructed by the manufacturer for similar foods.', u'Heat the grapeseed oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers, add the pork and season with salt and pepper. Cook until it begins to brown, stirring often. Spoon off any excess fat from the pan and add the scallions, ginger, and soy sauce. Cook until flavors are well integrated.  Remove from heat and let rest.', u'Create a slurry in a small bowl by gradually whisking 2 tablespoons water into the cornstarch.', u'Spoon 1 teaspoon of the cooked pork mixture onto each of the wontons. Fold each over to enclose and seal the edges shut with the cornstarch slurry.', u'Add the filled wontons to the basket of a deep fryer in batches to keep them from being overcrowded and possibly sticking together. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown and drain on paper towels.', u'Serve warm with soy sauce.', u'Note: In the episode this dish was used as part of the bento box of 5 cooked tasting size entrees in conjunction with Miso Glazed Pink Cod; Chicken Yakitori with Scallions; Shrimp Tempura;  and Korokee.']
ingredients: [u'72 round wonton skins (approximately 3-inches in diameter)', u'2 to 3 liters canola oil, as needed for deep frying', u'1 tablespoon grapeseed oil', u'3/4 pound ground pork', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 scallions, white and tender green parts only, sliced thinly on the bias', u'1 tablespoon peeled minced fresh ginger root', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce, plus more for serving, warmed', u'2 tablespoons water', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch']
title: Pork Pot Stickers: Gyoza

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the sesame oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the sesame seeds and cook, stirring, until golden, about 1 minute. Stir in the rice, then add 1 3/4 cups water; bring to a boil and cook until most of the water evaporates, about 8 minutes. Cover, reduce the heat to low and cook until tender, about 12 more minutes; remove from the heat and let stand until ready to serve.', u'Meanwhile, preheat the broiler. Thread the pork onto 4 long metal skewers, leaving space between each piece; season with salt and pepper. Place the asparagus on a baking sheet and toss with the vegetable oil and ponzu sauce. Push the asparagus to the side of the pan and add the pork skewers.', u'Broil the pork and asparagus, turning once or twice, until the pork is browned and cooked through and the asparagus is charred in spots, 8 to 10 minutes. Divide among plates and drizzle the pork with the pan juices; serve with the sesame rice and lemon wedges.', u"Tip:: Ponzu sauce is a tangy Japanese condiment. If you can't find it, use low-sodium soy sauce and a splash of lemon juice. ", u'Per serving: Calories 568; Fat 22 g (Saturated 6 g); Cholesterol 90 mg; Sodium 455 mg; Carbohydrate 57 g; Fiber 5 g; Protein 35 g', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'1 1/4 cups jasmine or basmati rice', u'1 1/2 pounds boneless pork loin, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 bunches asparagus, trimmed', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup ponzu sauce', u' Lemon wedges, for serving']
title: Pork Kebabs With Sesame Rice

directions: [u'In a medium pot, bring sake to a boil and cook for 5 minutes.', u'Add black cod, ginger slices, burdock root and mountain potato. Then add regular soy and sugar and cook with a lid right over the fillet, not over the pot. This lid must be slightly smaller than the rim of the pot so that steam can evaporate through the gap. ', u'When the vegetables and black cod are cooked through, remove them from the pot and boil the sauce until thickened slightly and reduced.', u'Add mirin for glazing. Then add tamari soy.', u'Place the fillet on a plate, garnish it with cooked vegetables. Pour the sauce over them. ', u'Garnish with white scallion, shredded ginger and kinome on top.']
ingredients: [u'36 ounces sake', u'1 (7-ounce) black cod fillet', u'6 slices peeled ginger root, plus shredded ginger, for garnish', u'3 thick pieces burdock root', u'3 thick pieces Japanese mountain potato', u'3 ounces regular soy sauce', u' Pinch Japanese premium white sugar', u'1 ounce mirin', u'1 ounce tamari soy sauce', u' White scallion, for garnish', u' Kinome (available at Japanese markets), watercress or mint leaves could be substituted']
title: Black Cod Cooked with Sake

directions: [u'Slice halibut as described in above recipe and arrange on plates. ', u'Prepare the vinegar mixture in above recipe, adding the mitsuba, and coat the fish. Proceed with remaining recipe above, using grated daikon in place of sprouts and scallions in place of the red onion. Serve immediately with ponzu sauce alongside the halibut for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound skinless, boneless halibut', u'1 bunch mitsuba, finely chopped', u'1/3 cup daikon radish, grated', u'6 scallions, white and light green parts, finely minced', u' Ponzu sauce, for dipping (recipe follows)', u' Juice of 4 lemons', u'1/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 cup dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons tamari sauce', u'3 tablespoons mirin', u'1/3 ounce dried bonito flakes', u'2 inch square giant kelp (konbu)']
title: Marinated Halibut

directions: [u'Wipe konbu with a damp cloth to clean. ', u'In a stock pot, place konbu and cold water over medium heat. Just before the water begins to boil (DO NOT BOIL!) pull off heatand let stand 5 minutes. ', u'Remove konbu, and bring back to heat. Again, right before stock begins to boil, remove from heat and add the bonito flakes. When flakes sink to the bottom, strain through cheesecloth or a fine mesh strainer. Dashi can hold in the refrigerator for 2 weeks.']
ingredients: [u'1 piece konbu (approximately 5 by 6 inches)', u'1 cup bonito flakes', u'5 cups cold water']
title: Dashi

directions: [u'Combine foie gras, eggs, chicken stock, and salt and pepper in a mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Mix until fine then strain into 4 small serving dishes. Steam in dishes for 10 minutes. ', u'In a small saute pan, sear the duck breast, skin side down for 4 minutes. Remove from the pan, let cool slightly, and slice thinly. Coat both sides of the duck slices with cornstarch. ', u'In a saucepan, combine dashi broth, mirin, light soy sauce, soy sauce, and sugar and bring to boil. Using cooking chopsticks or tongs, lightly cook the duck breast in boiling teriyaki sauce, maybe 5 seconds per slice. Place 2 or 3 pieces of duck on top of each of the steamed foie gras dishes. ', u'Thicken the teriyaki sauce with cornstarch and water, if necessary, and then pour over duck. Finish with wasabi.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces foie gras', u'3 eggs', u'1 1/2 cups chicken stock', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 duck breast', u' Cornstarch', u'7 ounces dashi broth, recipe follows', u'1 ounce mirin', u'1/2 ounce light soy sauce', u'1/2 ounce regular soy sauce', u'1/2 ounce sugar', u'2 to 3 ounces cornstarch, mixed with water to make a slurry', u'2 teaspoons fresh wasabi', u'1 (1 1/2-inch) piece kombu (dried kelp)', u'4 cups water', u'1/4 cup katsuo (dried bonito flake)']
title: Foie Gras Doufu

directions: [u'In a saucepan, combine the water and kombu. Bring to a simmer, uncovered, over medium heat. Remove the kombu and discard. Bring the liquid to a boil, add the bonito flakes and immediately remove the pan from the heat. Let the dashi sit undisturbed for 2 minutes. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a medium bowl. Discard the bonito flakes. Use now or store covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups cold water', u' One 12-inch long piece of kombu, wiped with a damp cloth', u'1 package shaved dried bonito flakes (0.88-ounce/25 grams)']
title: Dashi

directions: [u'Make the Rice: Wash rice well by rinsing 2 to 3 times without breaking the rice. Cook the rice a rice cooker according the manufacturer\x92s instructions. While the rice is still hot, transfer it to a bowl and add the vinegar. Using a rubber spatula or wooden paddle, mix the rice until well coated with the vinegar, slightly cooled and glossy, about 5 to 6 minutes. Transfer the rice to a parchment paper-lined sheet pan, cover with a tea towel, and let cool for 30 minutes. ', u'To make the Filling: Finely chop the tuna and transfer to a bowl. In another bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and Shriracha (add more Shriracha, if desired). Gently mix together the tuna and mayonnaise mixture. ', u'To make the Sushi Roll: Fold the nori sheets in 1/2 and break them apart. Working with 1/2 a sheet at a time, lay it on the bamboo mat shiny side-down. Spread an even layer of rice (not too thick) on the nori, and sprinkle lightly with the sesame seeds. Flip the nori over, and arrange the tuna mixture across the middle of the sheet, forming a horizontal line. Put about 20 pieces of kaiware evenly on top of the tuna line (make sure the sprouted ends face towards the ends of the roll, jutting out from the sides). Roll the nori over the tuna by lifting the near end over the top and rolling to meet the far end; then use the sushi mat to press the roll together. Repeat to make 4 rolls. ']
ingredients: [u'2 cups short-grain sushi rice', u'1/2 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'8 ounces fresh tuna, preferably big-eye or yellow-fin', u'2 teaspoons Asian mayonnaise (recommended: Kewpie brand)', u'2 teaspoons Shriracha (Thai-style hot sauce)', u'2 sheets unsalted nori (Japanese dried seaweed)', u' Toasted sesame seeds, as needed', u'1 bunch kaiware (daikon radish sprouts)', u' Special Equipment: Bamboo sushi mat wrapped in plastic wrap']
title: Ichi-Roll

directions: [u'Cut tofu into four slabs and place on a thin cotton towel or piece of cheesecloth to drain. Slice salmon fillet into eight slices, each about 3/4inch thick. Place two salmon strips skin side together in a round, yin yang patty and place on top of each piece of tofu. ', u'In a small saucepan, bring to a boil the soy sauce, mirin, rice wine vinegar, ginger, and black pepper. Remove from heat and reserve. ', u'Place a rack above boiling water in a large pot with a cover. Place tofu/salmon on rack in steamer, surround it with the spinach, and steam, covered, for 4 to 6 minutes. ', u'To serve, place a tofu/salmon in each of four shallow bowls and arrange hot spinach around edges. Pour soy mixture over each and sprinkle with scallions and sesame seeds. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 (14ounce) package firm tofu', u'1 (1 pound) skinless, boneless salmon fillet', u'1/4 cup light soy sauce', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1/4 cup unseasoned rice wine vinegar', u'1 (1/2inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated finely', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound fresh spinach, washed and stemmed', u'3 scallions, washed and sliced thinly on the bias, for garnish', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds, for garnish']
title: Steamed Salmon and Spinach with San Bai Su

directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine the rice flour and 1/2 cup soda water. Stir until blended. Combine the flour, baking powder and cornstarch. Sift into a medium bowl. Stir in the remaining 2 1/2 cups soda water, salt and cayenne. Lastly add the rice flour mixture. Allow to rest in the refrigerator at least 1 hour before use. Check the consistency of the batter by dipping a piece of vegetable and cook in a preheated deep fryer at 350 to 375 degrees F. Additional soda water may be needed to adjust thickness.']
