ingredients: [u'1/4 cup rice flour', u'3 cups soda water, divided', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'1/2 cup cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 teaspoon cayenne', u' Assorted vegetables and seafood (scallops, broccoli, mushrooms, eggplant, squash, onions, scallions, asparagus, shrimp) all vegetables should be sliced thin so they fry quickly.', u' Hot Chinese Mustard Sauce, recipe follows', u' Sesame Scallion Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u"2 tablespoons Chinese dry mustard (or Colman's English Mustard Powder)", u' Pinch turmeric', u'2 teaspoons water', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup pickled ginger liquid', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon chili oil', u'1 tablespoon roasted (dark) sesame oil', u'1 cup peanut oil', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'1/4 cup lemon juice', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon wasabi', u'2 tablespoons roasted (dark) sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons minced scallions or green onions']
title: Tempura

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise, mustard, soy sauce, lemon juice, and horseradish and stir to combine well. Set aside.', u'Hold one sheet of seaweed in your hand and with the other hand (fingers should be damp) scoop a small handful of rice and press onto seaweed, leaving 2 of the diagonal corners free of rice (these will be the top and bottom of the handroll). Lay 2 pieces of soft-shell crab, several slices of avocado, and some of the cucumber on top of the rice, and sprinkle with scallions and baby cress. Carefully begin rolling the roll, ice cream cone-fashion. If the roll does not stay closed on its own, you can either wet one edge or place a few stray pieces of rice to act as a "glue". Serve immediately, with some of the sauce spooned over the top. Repeat with remaining ingredients.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons Creole mustard', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons prepared horseradish', u'4 sheets toasted seaweed (yakinori)', u' Tempura-fried soft-shell crab, cut into 8 pieces, recipe follows', u'1/2 avocado, sliced lengthwise', u'1/2 cucumber, peeled, seeded and sliced into thin batons', u' Prepared sushi rice (at least 3 cups prepared rice), recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons finely sliced scallions', u'1/2 cup baby cress', u'4 large soft-shell crabs', u' Dash Essence, recipe follows', u'1 beaten egg', u'2/3 cup flour', u'1/2 cup cornstarch', u'1 cup cold soda water', u' Salt and pepper', u'3 3/4 cups Japanese rice, such as Nishiki (or 5 rice maker cups)', u'3 3/4 cups water (or 5 rice maker cups)', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'4 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Soft-Shelled Crab Hand Roll

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Around the table, set each place with 1 small bowl and 1 pair of chopsticks.', u'In a large pot, combine the stock, green onions, ginger, and garlic and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and keep warm.', u'Arrange the beef and vegetables on a large platter. Cover and chill until ready to cook.', u'At serving time, pour stock into a shabu-shabu cooker, close lid, and fill chimney with glowing coals. (Alternately, use a table-top cooker or electric frying pan.) Place in the center of the table within easy reach of everyone. Keep the stock simmering throughout the meal, adding more as necessary.', u"To serve, remove the lid on the shabu-shabu cooker. In turn, each guest picks up ingredients with a pair of chopsticks and holds in the boiling stock until just done.   The cooked ingredients then are dipped in the individual's sauce bowl and eaten with rice.", u'Note: Care should be taken not to overcook meat and vegetables. Steak should be pale pink when cooked and vegetables tender but still crisp.', u'When all the meat and vegetables are eaten the stock is ladled into the individual bowls and served as soup. The bowls should be lifted to the lips, Japanese fashion, rather than using a spoon.', u'']
ingredients: [u'8 cups beef or chicken stock', u'1 3/4 cups finely chopped green onions', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 pound highly marbled beef sirloin, thinly sliced', u'1 small white Chinese cabbage, cut into bite-size pieces', u'1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, wiped clean and stems trimmed', u'12 thin asparagus spears, tough ends removed', u' Steamed white rice', u' Sesame Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'3 tablespoons sesame paste', u'1/2 cup shoyu (Japanese soy sauce)', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes']
title: Shabu Shabu with Sesame Dipping Sauce (Japan)

directions: [u'Cut the nori in half lengthwise. Place one half on the rolling mat. Wet fingers and palms with rice vinegar and place about 1/2 cup rice on nori, spreading it evenly and flat, and leaving a blank strip at the top of the nori about 1/2-inch wide. (Optional: Smear a line of wasabi evenly across the rice a little below the center.) Place fillings of choice evenly across the rice a little below the center (or on the line of wasabi). Lift the end of the mat closest to you, and press down on the rolling mat to stabilize. Roll the mat almost one complete turn, making sure it does not become part of the roll and that the nori goes under the rice. Roll in the shape of a cylinder. ', u'Cut each roll into 4 or 6 equal slices, dampening the cutting knife between each slice by running it across a cloth dampened with rice vinegar.']
ingredients: [u' Sushi Rice', u' Nori', u' Avocado', u' Carrot', u' Eggplant (grilled Japanese)', u' Tofu (made crisp by frying)', u' Tomato', u' Cucumber (Chinese-without seeds, or regular is also ok)', u' Asparagus', u' Aburage (inari tofu skins)', u' Wilted spinach', u' Bell peppers, julienned', u' Scallions, julienned', u' Snow peas, julienned', u' Black sesame seeds', u' White sesame seeds', u' Black sesame seeds/salt combination', u' (c. Television Food Network, G.P.)', u'3 1/3 cups short grain rice', u'4 cups water, plus 1/4 cup water', u'6 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 teaspoons salt']
title: Basic (Thin) Rolls (Hoso-Maki)

directions: [u"Wash rice at least 3 times or until water is clear. Fill rice cooker with water to about 1-inch over rice. I highly recommend a rice cooker -- there's a reason more than 2 billion people in Asia use them. Slowly heat vinegar, mirin and sugar until very hot but not boiling. Fold in 'su' (vinegar and sugar) with the hot rice, add enough so that the rice has a tart/sweet taste. Rice should be shiny, not mushy. Carefully clean inside rim of bowl with damp cloth, cover and let rest for 30 minutes."]
ingredients: [u'4 cups sushi rice (Calrose/short grain)', u' Water up to Mount Fuji (see below)', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup gari (pickled ginger) julienne', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame seeds', u'1/4 cup chopped green scallions', u' Soy syrup', u' Wasabi oil', u'1/2 tablespoon honey', u'1/2 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'1/2 tablespoon canola oil', u'1/2 pound fresh picked crab', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro', u'1/4 cup chopped flat leaf parsley', u'1/4 cup basil chiffonade', u'1 shallot, minced', u' Salt and white pepper to taste', u'4 sheets of yaki-nori', u'2 cups rice flour', u'1/2 tablespoon togarashi or chili powder', u'1 quart cold club soda water', u'8 large butterfly shrimp, peeled and de-veined', u'1 package daikon sprouts', u'4 sheets of yaki-nori, cut in half', u'8 scallion fans', u' Wasabi oil', u' Salt and white pepper to taste', u'1/2 cup wasabi powder', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Water', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'2 cups thin soy sauce', u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'1 lime juiced']
title: Sushi 202

directions: [u'Bone snapper and slice the fish fillets into thin sashimi slices and arrange flat on a plate. Puree sea urchin with a hand blender or a small bar blender.', u'With a tablespoon, pour the following liquids around and over the sashimi; ginger juice, soy sauce, yuzu juice, lemon juice, truffle oil, sea urchin, and spicy sesame oil. Garnish with fresh truffles, Japanese herbs, and droplets of scallion oil.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 (2 1/2 pound) whole snapper (or opakapaka or Thai sea bream)', u'1/4 cup sea urchin', u'2 ounces ginger juice', u'2 ounces soy sauce', u'2 ounces yuzu juice', u'2 ounces lemon juice', u'2 ounces truffle oil', u'1 ounce rayu (spicy sesame oil)', u'1 fresh truffle, julienne (optional)', u' Japanese herbs (beni tate, baby shiso, baby negi)', u'2 ounces scallion oil, recipe follows', u'1 bunch green onions', u'1 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons ginger juice', u' Salt']
title: Sashimi of Snapper with Sea Urchin and Truffles

directions: [u'Bring stock to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer.  Add miso and stir until heated through.  Pour into individual bowls.  Divide tofu cubes and sliced scallions among the bowls and serve at once.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups vegetable stock', u'8 ounces yellow miso', u'4 ounces low-fat firm tofu, diced', u'3 scallions']
title: Miso Soup

directions: [u'Chop the tops off the chile peppers and shake out the seeds. Peel the daikon radish, and puncture one end deeply in several places with an ice pick or chopstick. Force the peppers into the holes, then set aside for 5 minutes to let the chiles soften. ', u'Grate the stuffed daikon over a bamboo mat or cheesecloth, and squeeze out some of the moisture. Set aside for garnish. ', u'Wash and parboil the cabbage leaves in a large pot of water for 2 to 4 minutes, or until tender. Drain, salt lightly and pat dry. Lay the leaves on a bamboo mat and roll to form a tight cylinder. Press for a few minutes, then unwrap and cut into 1 1/2inch rounds. Refrigerate until ready to arrange the platter. ', u'Cut off the root cluster of the mushrooms. Separate each bunch into thirds and tie each bundle with a gourd strip. Parboil the carrots briefly and plunge into cold water. Drain and set aside. ', u'Arrange all of the ingredients on a large platter, decoratively placing the fish and other ingredients, and balancing the color. ', u'Place the kelp in a donabe casserole and fill 2/3 full of water. Bring just to the boiling point and remove the kelp. Begin by placing some of the fish into the pot. ', u'After 2 or 3 minutes, place some of each remaining ingredient in pot. When ingredients are cooked, diners should remove them with chopsticks and dip them into ponzu sauce and daikon. Season to taste with chopped scallions and DaikonPepper garnishes. Keep adding and cooking remaining ingredients. ', u'When all of the fish and vegetables are eaten, diners can drink the remaining broth.']
ingredients: [u' Daikon Pepper Garnish', u'2 to 3 dried chile peppers', u'4 -inch length of daikon', u'6 leaves Napa cabbage', u'6 4 -inch strips dried gourd, softened in boiling water', u'2 bunches enoki mushrooms', u'2 blocks of tofu, cut into chunks', u'1 bunch edible chrysanthemum leaves, washed and trimmed', u'1 carrot, peeled and cut into rounds (or decorative stamps)', u'1 bunch watercress, washed', u'1/2 pound snow peas, blanched and halved diagonally', u'2 1/2 pounds firm white fish fillets with skin, such as snapper or bream, cut into 2inch pieces', u'4 inch square giant kelp (konbu), wiped with a damp towel to clean', u'6 scallions, finely chopped, for garnish']
title: Fish One-Pot

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'To make the dashi (Japanese soup stock): Combine the water, kelp, and bonito flakes in a 4-quart saucepan and place over medium-low heat. Allow the water to slowly come to a simmer; this should take about 10 minutes. Turn off the heat immediately just as the stock reaches a boil. Let the stock sit for 1 to 2 minutes and then strain out the solids. Reserve 2 quarts of the dashi to use in the future as a base for soups and stews (it will keep for 1 week in the refrigerator or frozen for several months), and the remaining quart to prepare the miso soup.', u'Pour the dashi into a wok and place over medium heat. Whisk the miso into the dashi, stirring until smooth. Toss in the mushrooms. ', u'Lightly coat the bottom of a 12-inch bamboo steamer with non-stick cooking spray. Season both sides of the fish fillets with salt and pepper; lay them side by side in the steamer, skin-side up. Cut the ginger lengthwise in strips and put it on top of the fish so the flavor can permeate; put the cilantro on top. Nestle the bok choy in the steamer, side by side, and cover with the bamboo lid. Set the steamer inside the wok, and steam for 15 to 20 minutes until the fish is cooked. Carefully remove the bamboo steamer and add the udon noodles and green onions into the soup. Cook for 1 minute or until the noodles are tender.', u'To serve: Ladle the miso soup into 2 wide shallow bowls, scoop the noodles into the soup and lay the bok choy and fish on top of that. Garnish with more cilantro and sprinkle lightly with the chili-sesame salt and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 quarts cold water', u'3 (6-inch) pieces dried kelp (kombu), wiped of dirt', u'1 1/2 cups dried bonito flakes', u'2 tablespoons light miso', u'8 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, halved', u'2 (6-ounce) center-cut black sea bass fillets, skin on', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger', u'1 handful fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish', u'2 heads baby bok choy, halved lengthwise', u'1 pound fresh udon noodles', u'2 green onions, white and green part, chopped', u' Several shakes chili-sesame salt']
title: Black Bass in Miso Soup with Udon and Shiitakes

directions: [u'In a heavy-gauged pot on medium to high heat add the grapeseed oil. When a light haze rises from the pan, add all of the crab. The blue crabs contain water so you must cook them until this liquid has evaporated. Then add the butter. Allow the milk solids to fall and when the butter stops foaming add the vegetables and cook until translucent. Add the coriander seed and brown lightly. Add the tomato paste and chopped tomato and cook, stirring frequently, for 4 minutes. Deglaze with the white wine, scraping up any bits sticking to the pan. Add the water and chicken stock. Bring up to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Add the bay leaf and thyme cook an additional 10 minutes. Press the whole mixture into a strainer. The broth should have small pieces of the vegetables from the cooking of the crab. Check and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Divide evenly and garnish each with some of the crab, pickled ramps, sauteed shiitakes and creme fraiche.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil', u'6 fresh blue crabs, cut in 1/2', u'1 stick unsalted butter', u'1/2 fennel bulb', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1 shallot, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 teaspoon coriander seed', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'2 tomatoes, chopped', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'1 cup water', u'3 cups chicken stock', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 fresh thyme sprig', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 -ounce jumbo lump crabmeat, picked over', u'1 teaspoon pickled ramps or shallots, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon sauteed shitakes', u'1 teaspoon creme fraiche', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 cup wine vinegar', u'1 cup water', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1 teaspoon pink peppercorns', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 pound ramps', u' Kosher salt']
title: Chesapeake Bay Blue Crab Hot Pot

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Slice amberjack fillets on the bias into 1/4-inch thick slices. Serve on a plate, arranged decoratively with accompaniments and garnishes alongside.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound sushi-quality amberjack fillets', u' Soy sauce, for dipping', u' Wasabi, for dipping', u' Pickled ginger, as an accompaniment', u' Mizuna or other decorative greens, for garnish']
title: Amberjack Sashimi

directions: [u'*Available at Asian markets and some specialty foods shops and supermarkets. ', u'To make negimaki: Remove "tenders" from chicken, if necessary. Pound breast halves\u201a 1/2-inch thick between 2 sheets of plastic wrap. On a work surface arrange 1 breast half, smooth side down, with a long side facing you and put 1 scallion (or 2 if very thin) lengthwise on chicken. Roll chicken around scallion and tie with kitchen string at 1-inch intervals. Trim scallion flush with chicken. Make 7 more rolls in same manner. ', u'Mince garlic and in a shallow baking dish just large enough to hold rolls in 1 layer stir together garlic, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil. Add rolls, turning them to coat. Marinate negimaki, covered and chilled, at least 4 hours and up to 1 day. ', u'To make sauce: Coarsely chop bell pepper and in a blender puree with white vinegar. Transfer mixture to a small saucepan and stir in sugar, red pepper flakes, and salt, to taste. Simmer sauce 5 minutes and cool. Sauce may be made 1 week ahead and chilled in an airtight container. ', u'Spread sesame seeds on a sheet of waxed paper. Remove negimaki from marinade, letting excess drip off, and roll in sesame seeds to coat. In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over moderate heat until hot but not smoking and cook negimaki in 2 batches, turning them occasionally, until cooked through, about 10 minutes, adding remaining tablespoon vegetable oil to skillet as necessary. Transfer negimaki as cooked to a cutting board and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices, discarding string. ', u'Push skewers through sesame seed--coated edge of slices. Serve negimaki warm or at room temperature with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'8 small boneless skinless chicken breast halves (about 2 1/2 pounds total)', u'2 bunches scallions', u'1 garlic clove', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons Asian sesame oil', u'1 red bell pepper', u'3/4 cup distilled white vinegar', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u' Salt', u'1/3 cup black* or white sesame seeds', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u' About 65 (6-inch) wooden skewers']
title: Chicken Negimaki with Spicy Red Pepper Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Wash rice, soak in water for 30 minutes, remove rice and dry. Toast rice in a pan over medium heat with spices until rice is dry. Process in a blender until rice is 1/3 its original size.']
ingredients: [u'4 pieces Wagyu, 2-inches long and 1/4-inch thick', u'2 cups rice', u'1/2 cinnamon stick', u'1/2 piece star anise', u'1 piece dry citrus peel', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon toban jan', u'2 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fermented sweet rice, strained', u'1 tablespoon sake/shaoxing wine mix 50/50', u' Drizzle of sesame oil', u'1 pinch chicken bouillon', u'4 ounce filet of Wagyu', u' Grated fresh wasabi', u' Soy sauce']
title: Wagyu Two Ways

directions: [u'Put the water in a large saucepan. Add 3/4 of the scallions, reserving the rest. Add the mushrooms, ginger and carrot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, cover, and turn the heat down to medium-low. Simmer until the vegetables are soft, about 30 minutes. ', u'Strain the broth through a fine sieve. Remove the mushrooms from the sieve and reserve. Discard the remaining vegetables. Return the broth to the saucepan over low heat. Thinly slice the mushrooms and add them to the broth along with the remaining scallions. Stir in the miso thoroughly, never allowing the mixture to boil. Stir in the tofu. Serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups water', u'6 scallions, including  greens, chopped', u'6 dried  shiitake mushrooms', u'6 wafer-thin slices peeled fresh  ginger', u'1 large carrot, peeled and thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons yellow or red miso', u'1/2 cup cubed firm tofu']
title: Mild Miso Soup

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Special equipment: 6-inch wooden skewers, soaked in cold water for at least 1 hour', u'Preheat a charcoal grill or kamado-style ceramic charcoal cooker for direct grilling over high heat.', u'Thread one strip of fish per skewer, brush with oil on both sides and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill until slightly charred on both sides and still rare in the middle, about 30 seconds per side. Serve on platters with the dipping sauces in small bowls.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound skinless salmon fillet, sliced into 1-inch-thick strips', u'1 pound skinless tuna loin, sliced into 1-inch-thick strips', u'1 pound yellowtail fillet, sliced into 1-inch-thick strips', u' Canola oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Garlic-Lime Aioli, recipe follows', u' Spicy Ponzu, recipe follows', u' Orange-Ginger Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed to a paste with salt', u' Zest and juice of 1 lime', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon chile-garlic sauce', u' Pinch sugar', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'2 tablespoons peeled and finely grated fresh ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon red chile flakes', u'1 1/2 cups fresh orange juice', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon grated orange zest', u'1/4 teaspoon grated lime zest', u'1 large scallion (white and green part), thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon toasted white sesame seeds']
title: Seared Tuna, Yellowtail and Salmon with Three Dipping Sauces

directions: [u'Pat the fillets thoroughly dry with paper towels. Slather the fish with Nobu-style miso and place in a non-reactive dish or bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Leave to steep in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 days.', u"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Preheat a grill or broiler. Lightly wipe off any excess miso clinging to the fillets but don't rinse it off. Place the fish on the grill, or in a broiler pan, and grill or broil until the surface of the fish turns brown. Then bake for 10 to 15 minutes.", u'Arrange the black cod fillets on individual plates and garnish with hajikami. Add a few extra drops of Nobu-style miso to each plate.', u'']
ingredients: [u'4 black cod fillets, about 1/2 pound each', u'3 cups Nobu-style Miso, recipe follows', u'1 stalk hajikami', u'1/2 cup sake', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'1/4 cup water', u'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 1/2 cups white miso']
title: Black Cod With Miso

directions: [u'Combine the soy sauce, vinegar, scallions, sugar, ginger, sesame oil, and pepper flakes in a bowl. Whisk well to blend. Reserve 1/4 cup and set aside. Pour the rest into a plastic bag with a resealable closure. Add the skirt steak and seal. Marinate in the refrigerator, turning the bag often, for at least 4 hours or overnight.', u"Fill a large deep saucepan to a depth of about 2 inches with vegetable oil. Heat over medium-high heat until a deep-fat thermometer reads 375 degrees F. (Alternatively, use an electric deep-fat fryer) Pull apart the clusters of noodles into clumps of about 10 strands each. Working in batches, fry the noodles, turning once, until they puff up and turn white, about 10 seconds. Use a slotted spoon or a spider (a slotted spoon designed like a spider's web used for deep-frying) to transfer to paper towels to drain.", u'Remove the skirt steak from the marinade and pat dry with paper towels. (The drier the beef, the better it will sear.) Working in batches, heat half the oil in a large skillet over high heat until almost smoking. Season the meat with salt and pepper. Place in the skillet and reduce the heat to medium-high. Cook until seared on the outside and rare to medium-rare on the inside, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a platter, cover loosely with foil, and let rest for 5 minutes. Repeat with the remaining oil and skirt steak. Cut into very thin slices, holding the knife at an angle and cutting against the grain. Toss with the reserved 1/4 cup sauce in a large bowl until well coated.', u'Crumble the fried noodles and mound on individual serving plates. Top with equal portions of the beef and garnish with chopped scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'3 scallions, white and 2 inches of the green parts, finely chopped, plus additional chopped scallions for garnish', u'2 tablespoons firmly packed brown sugar', u'1 (2-inch) piece fresh ginger, finely chopped', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Asian toasted sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons hot red pepper flakes', u'1 1/2 pounds skirt steak, in two pieces', u' Vegetable oil, for deep-frying the noodles plus 3 tablespoons for sauteing the beef', u'1 1/2 ounces cellophane noodles (bean threads)', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Korean Beef

directions: [u'Cut off any excess fat from the short ribs then thinly slice the beef and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Place in a large bowl or in a plastic resealable bag.', u'In a blender or food processor, blend the soy sauce, mirin, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, scallions and ginger. Pour half of the sauce over the short ribs, ensuring all the beef is covered. Seal tightly and marinate the short ribs in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 24 hours.', u'Place the other half of the marinade in a pan and reduce over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is thick. Place in a serving bowl and reserve to drizzle on the tacos.', u'For the slaw: Place the cabbage, daikon, cilantro and scallions together in a medium to large bowl.', u'For the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, soy sauce, mirin and Sriracha. Slowly whisk in the olive oil. Place the dressing in the fridge until ready to use.', u'For the taco assembly: Heat your griddle to high. Flash cook the meat while simultaneously caramelizing the marinade. Place your short ribs on the griddle. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 3 minutes, then wrap the meat in foil and set aside.', u'Grill up your tortillas. Flip after 45 seconds. Grill for another 45 seconds and remove.', u'On the grilled tortillas, pile some Korean slaw, dressing, beef, reserved and reduced marinade and extra Sriracha to taste. Then, chow down.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds beef short ribs, off the bone', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup dark brown sugar', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'6 cloves garlic', u'6 scallions', u'2 teaspoons peeled and grated fresh ginger', u'3 cups roughly chopped Napa cabbage', u'1 cup matchstick-size daikon slices', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'6 scallions, diced', u'2 limes, juiced', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'2 tablespoons Sriracha', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Twelve to fifteen 6-inch yellow corn tortillas or flour tortillas', u' Sriracha, for serving']
title: Korean Bulgogi Taco Recipe

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Whisk together the soy, vinegar, honey, chili paste, ginger and garlic in a bowl and divide the mixture in half.  Add 1 half to a large baking dish, then add the chicken, turning to coat.  Cover and let the meat marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or up to 8 hours.  Add the green onions, sesame oil, black pepper and sesame seeds to the remaining half of the mixture. Reserve it as a dipping sauce for the finished chicken. ', u'Light a grill, making sure to include a zone of indirect heat.', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade and put it over the charcoal, skin side down. Grill until the skin is golden brown and crisp, about 10 minutes. Relocate the chicken to the indirect heat zone, lower the cover and grill until cooked through.  Remove the chicken from the grill to a cutting board and carve.  Arrange the chicken on a serving platter and serve wrapped in tortillas, if desired, with dipping sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 heaping tablespoon Korean chili paste (recommended: Kochi Chang)', u'2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger', u'6 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 green onion, thinly sliced', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 teaspoons toasted sesame seeds', u'1 (3-pound) chicken, butterflied, cut into parts', u'4 (6-inch) flour tortillas, warmed']
title: Korean Grilled Chicken

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak the noodles in warm water to soften, 5 to 10 minutes, then drain and snip into pieces with kitchen shears.', u'Meanwhile, combine the soy sauce, 3 tablespoons sesame oil, the garlic, brown sugar and vinegar in a bowl. Put the beef in another bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons of the soy sauce mixture.', u'Heat 2 teaspoons sesame oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add the onion and 1 teaspoon salt and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add the beef and stir-fry until just cooked through. Transfer to a bowl.', u'Rinse and wipe out the skillet, return to the heat and add 2 teaspoons sesame oil. Add the mushrooms and carrots; stir-fry 3 minutes. Add the noodles and 2 tablespoons of the soy sauce mixture and stir-fry 1 minute; add 1/3 cup water and cook until the noodles are just tender, 3 minutes. Transfer to the bowl with the beef.', u'Wipe out the skillet, return to the heat and add the remaining 2 teaspoons sesame oil. Add the spinach and the remaining soy sauce mixture and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add to the beef and toss.', u'Per serving: Calories 616 ; Fat 30 g (Saturated 7 g); Cholesterol 45 mg; Sodium 1,558 mg; Carbohydrate 69 g; Fiber 7 g; Protein 23 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 5 -to-6-ounce package cellophane noodles', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'5 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/3 cup brown sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', u'12 ounces skirt steak, sliced 1/4 inch thick against the grain', u'1 yellow onion, cut into 1/4-inch wedges', u' Kosher salt', u'10 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems removed', u'1 cup shredded carrots (from about 3 carrots)', u'6 cups baby spinach (about 10 ounces)']
title: Korean Beef Noodles

directions: [u'Sprinkle brown sugar over beef and mix well to evenly coat. Let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes while preparing marinade. In a bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients. Transfer beef into a large sealable freezer bag (you may need 2). Add marinade, press out excess air from bags, and seal. Turn bag over several times to ensure beef is evenly coated. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours but preferably overnight. ', u'Heat gas or charcoal grill to medium-hot. Drain excess marinade off beef. Grill short ribs, turning once, to desired doneness, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Garnish with thinly sliced green onions, if desired. Serve whole pieces as a main course or cut into smaller pieces, using kitchen shears, for a starter or party nibble.', u'* NOTE: Korean-style short ribs can be found at most Asian markets. The cut, also known as "flanken," refers to a strip of beef cut across the bone from the chuck end of the short ribs. Unlike American and European-style short ribs, which include a thick slice of bone-in beef, Korean-style short ribs are cut lengthwise across the rib bones. The result is a thin strip of meat, about 8 to10 inches in length, lined on 1 side with 1/2-inch thick rib bones. The thin slices make for fast cooking on the grill.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'5 pounds Korean style beef short ribs*', u'1 cup brown sugar, packed', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/4 cup mirin (rice wine)', u'1 small onion, peeled and finely grated', u'1 small Asian pear, peeled and finely grated', u'4 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 green onions, thinly sliced (optional)']
servings: 4 to 6 servings as a main course
title: Kalbi (Korean Barbequed Beef Short Ribs)

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Place the chicken wings on a baking sheet and cook in the oven for 35 minutes.', u'In a medium saute pan over medium heat, add the 2 tablespoons of canola oil and the ginger. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the sherry, vinegar, sesame oil, honey, and soy sauce and chili garlic sauce and continue to cook for 2 more minutes. Remove from heat.', u'In large sauce pot or fryer, heat 3-inches of the canola oil, or enough to prevent wings from touching the bottom of the pan, to 350 degrees F. Add the chicken wings to the oil and cook for about 3 minutes, or until crispy and golden brown. Remove the chicken wings from the oil and drain on paper towels.', u'Add the wings to the sauce. Garnish with chopped scallions and sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'1 to 2 pounds chicken wings (about 12 whole wings) 1st and 2nd joint, no tips', u'2 tablespoons canola oil, plus more for frying', u'3 tablespoons grated ginger', u'1/4 cup sherry', u'1/4 cup white vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup chili garlic sauce', u' Chopped scallions, for garnish', u'3 tablespoons sesame seeds, for garnish']
title: Korean Chicken Wings

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, the brown sugar and garlic in a shallow dish. Add the steak and turn to coat. Let marinate at room temperature, 20 minutes.', u'Brush a large grill pan with vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat. Remove the steak from the marinade (do not pat dry) and grill 2 to 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer to a cutting board; let rest 5 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, toss the scallions with 2 teaspoons sesame oil. Grill, turning, until charred, about 4 minutes; transfer to the cutting board and cut into 1-inch pieces. Slice the steak against the grain; toss with any collected juices.', u'Whisk the mayonnaise and gochujang in a small bowl. Toss the kimchi, pear and the remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil in another bowl. Lightly char the tortillas over a gas burner, about 20 seconds per side (or microwave as the label directs). Serve the steak and scallions in the tortillas with the greens, spicy mayonnaise and kimchi-pear mixture.', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 1 -pound skirt steak, cut crosswise into thirds', u' Vegetable oil, for the grill pan', u'1 bunch scallions', u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons gochujang (Korean chile paste) or Sriracha,', u' plus more to taste', u'1 cup kimchi, cut into strips', u'1 firm pear, finely chopped', u'12 6 -inch corn tortillas', u'2 cups mixed Asian greens (2 ounces) or other lettuce']
title: Korean Beef Tacos

directions: [u'For the pickled radish cubes: Combine the rice vinegar, water, superfine sugar and salt in a large bowl, whisking until the sugar and salt are dissolved. Add the radish cubes and toss to coat. Leave at room temperature, covered, for 24 hours. Then refrigerate.', u'For the pre-coating: In a large bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, salt, baking powder and pepper. Add the chicken and toss well until evenly coated in all areas. Transfer the chicken to a rack, shaking the chicken well to get rid of any excess coating. Let rest, uncovered, for 1 hour.', u'For the gochujang sauce: Combine the brown sugar, chile paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger and garlic in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Lower to a simmer and allow to cook over low heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Set aside.', u'For the sweet soy sauce: Heat the soy sauce, brown sugar, mirin, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, chile flakes and garlic in a saucepan over medium heat until the sugar has dissolved; allow to simmer for 3 minutes. Mix the cornstarch with 1 1/2 tablespoons water and whisk into the sauce. Bring to a boil, and then remove from the heat and set aside.', u'For the batter: Pour enough oil into a 6-quart Dutch oven to reach a depth of 2 inches. Heat the oil over medium-high heat until a deep-fry thermometer inserted in the oil reads 350 degrees F.', u'In a large bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, matzo meal, flour, chile flakes, salt, garlic granules, onion granules and baking powder. In a smaller bowl, whisk together the water, vodka and chile paste. Just before frying, whisk the wet mixture into the dry mixture. The consistency should be relatively thin and runny.', u'Working in 2 batches, dip each piece of chicken into the batter, letting excess batter drip off. Suspend the chicken in the oil for a couple of seconds for it to set before letting it slip completely into the oil, otherwise the chicken will fall and stick to the bottom of the pot. Fry the chicken until golden brown and cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes per batch. Transfer to a wire rack to drain as done.', u'Serve with the sauces on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup (113 grams) rice vinegar', u'1/2 cup (113 grams) water', u'1/2 cup (113 grams) superfine sugar or caster sugar', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt or sea salt', u'1 pound (about 500 grams) daikon radish, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/4 cup (32 grams) cornstarch or corn flour', u'2 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt or sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'10 grinds black pepper', u'2 chicken drumsticks, 2 thighs and 4 wings with tips (bone in, skin on)', u'80 grams dark brown sugar', u'70 grams Korean chile paste (gochujang)', u'30 grams soy sauce', u'15 grams rice vinegar', u'14 grams sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon grated ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, grated', u'250 grams soy sauce', u'100 grams dark brown sugar', u'60 grams mirin', u'30 grams rice vinegar', u'6 grams sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon grated ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon Korean chile flakes (gochugaru)', u'2 cloves garlic, grated', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch or corn flour', u' Oil, for frying', u'1/2 cup (70 grams) cornstarch or corn flour', u'1/4 cup (34 grams) fine matzo meal', u'1/4 cup (35 grams) all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile flakes (gochugaru)', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt or sea salt', u'2 1/2 teaspoons garlic granules', u'2 1/2 teaspoons onion granules', u'1/4 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 cup (237 grams) water', u'1/3 cup (75 grams) vodka', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile paste (gochujang)']
title: Ultimate Korean Fried Chicken

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Wrap beef in plastic wrap and freeze until firm (but not rock hard). Once firm, slice beef thinly across the grain. Place in baking dish. In a small skillet toast sesame seeds. To create marinade, in small bowl combine scallions, garlic, vinegar, water, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil and pepper. Stir well. Pour marinade over beef. Let sit for 30 minutes', u'In separate skillet heat oil. Add ginger and garlic and cook until aroma is released. Add carrots and 1/4 cup water. Simmer until carrots are tender, about 2 minutes. Add snow peas and simmer until tender, about 2 minutes.', u'Remove beef from baking dish and grill until brown around edges, about 30 seconds per side. Add vegetables to beef. Stir and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with boiled white rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound beef tenderloin, boneless', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'3 scallions, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 teaspoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons water', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon pepper', u'2 tablespoons oil', u'1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced', u'1 tablespoon garlic, minced', u'3 carrots, peeled and sliced on diagonal', u'1/4 cup water', u'1/4 pounds snow peas']
title: Korean Grilled Beef (Bulgogi)

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the sauce: Combine the sugar, tamari, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil and ginger in a small bowl. Whisk until the sugar is dissolved. Set aside.', u'For the noodles: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and stir to help submerge them. Cook until the noodles are just barely cooked, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Using kitchen shears or a clean pair of scissors, cut the noodles into approximately 8-inch lengths. Set aside.', u'Heat the grapeseed oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the oyster and shiitake mushrooms and cook, stirring often with a wooden spoon, for about 5 minutes, or until the mushrooms are beginning to brown. Add the shallots and 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook until fragrant, another 2 minutes. Add the red pepper, garlic and scallions to the pan, reduce the heat to medium-high and cook for an additional 3 minutes, or until the peppers are beginning to soften. Add the kale and the cooked noodles and saute another 3 minutes, stirring often to coat the noodles in the oil and to wilt the kale. Add the sauce and toss to coat. Top with sesame seeds if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup tamari or soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons grated ginger', u' Kosher salt', u'12 ounces sweet potato vermicelli, cellophane noodles or angel hair pasta', u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil', u'4 ounces oyster mushrooms, sliced into 1-inch pieces', u'4 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, caps quartered', u'1 large shallot, chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, cut into 1/4-inch strips', u'2 cloves garlic, peeled and coarsely chopped', u'3 scallions, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'6 leaves kale, cut into 1-inch pieces', u' Sesame seeds, toasted, for garnish, optional']
title: Vegetarian Korean Noodles (Japchae)

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'For the Korean pulled pork: Remove the pork from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking.', u'Whisk together the soy sauce, gochujang, hoisin, ketchup, vinegar, honey, sesame oil, five-spice powder and pepper until smooth. Rub the pork with the marinade, cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to 24 hours.', u"Prepare the Caja China according to manufacturer's directions. Cook until the pork reaches 190 degrees F, 3 to 3 1/2 hours. Remove the pork, place in a baking pan, tent with foil and let the pork rest for 20 minutes. Reserve the juices for the BBQ sauce.", u'For the Korean BBQ sauce: Heat the oil in a medium high-sided saute pan. Add the shallots and cook until soft. Whisk in the reserved juices from the pork, the chicken stock, ketchup, gochujang, honey, soy sauce and five-spice powder and cook until slightly reduced. Remove from the heat, add the vinegar and sesame oil.', u'For the Asian slaw: Whisk together the vinegar, honey, sesame oil, and soy sauce until the honey is dissolved. Add the peas, carrots, cabbage and sesame seeds. Toss to combine; season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until cold, at least 1 hour.', u'For serving: Using tongs, pull the pork into bite-size bits. Toss with the BBQ sauce. Mound some slaw on the bottoms of the buns. Top with the pork and the top bun.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup low sodium soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons gochujang (or more if you want it spicier)', u'3 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'3 tablespoons ketchup', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons clover honey', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons Chinese five-spice powder', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated', u'5 pound pork butt, trimmed of excess fat', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 shallots, finely diced', u'1 cup low sodium chicken stock', u'1/2 cup ketchup', u'2 tablespoons gochujang', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon honey (or sugar)', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce', u'4 ounces snow peas, julienned', u'1 large carrot, julienned', u'1/2 head Napa cabbage, finely shredded', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Soft sesame hamburger buns']
title: Korean Pulled Pork Sandwich with Asian Slaw

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'Set up a fryer, or heat 2-inches oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan, fitted with a high-heat thermometer, to 360 degrees F.', u' To make the filling: Use cheesecloth to squeeze water out of tofu by tightly wringing and squeezing with your hands, or place tofu in a colander lined with 2 damp paper towels and press down with a heavy bowl or pot on top to squeeze moisture out. Pour tofu into a mixing bowl, add remaining filling ingredients and use hands to mix well. Fill a small bowl with water. Place 1 to 2 teaspoons of filling in the center of a dumpling wrapper. Wet the outer edge and fold to make a half-circle. Pinch dough together to seal, pushing air out as you work. Repeat process until the remaining dumplings are all assembled. In batches, deep-fry dumplings until golden, about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels. Transfer dumplings to a serving platter or bowl and serve with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1/2 pound firm tofu, broken up', u'6 ounces ground beef 1/2 cup (7 ounces) bean sprouts, finely chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup diced carrot, (about 1 small)', u'1 scallion, finely chopped', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil 1 teaspoon hot sauce', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'40 round dumpling (potsticker/gyoza) wrappers', u' Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup soy sauce 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted', u'2 teaspoons unseasoned rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes']
title: Korean Yaki Mandu

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Put the sushi rice on to cook following the package instructions or in a rice cooker following its instructions.', u'Cut the tentacles out of the squid bodies, then slice the calamari into rings and put them in a bowl with the tentacles and the 2 tablespoons rice wine. Leave for 15 minutes, then strain, reserving the liquid in a bowl.', u'To this bowl add the Korean pepper paste, soy sauce, sugar, and few dashes of sesame oil, and stir to combine.', u"Put a wok or large, heavy-based frying pan over medium heat and, when it's hot, add the 2 teaspoons peanut oil.", u'Add the sliced corn and scallions and stir-fry for 2 minutes', u'Add the drained squid and stir-fry for another until the squid turns opaque, about 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Add the sauce and stir-fry for 30 seconds or so, until piping hot. Divide the calamari between 2 bowls of the sushi rice and serve', u'Freeze Note', u'Fresh squid can be cut into rings and frozen with the tentacles for up to 3 months, in a resealable bag with as much air as possible squeezed out. But first check with your fish seller or supermarket that the squid has not been previously frozen. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator, on a plate to catch drips.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup sushi rice', u'5 to 6 ounces (6 baby) squid', u'2 tablespoons rice wine', u'2 tablespoons Korean gochujang paste', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u' Few dashes Asian sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons peanut or other flavorless oil', u' Large handful fresh baby corn, or green beans, cut into 1/2-inch chunks', u'6 thin or 3 large scallions, sliced']
title: Korean Calamari

directions: [u'In a plastic bag combine all ingredients except the tuna. Mix the marinade in the bag until combined and add the tuna, coating it completely. Seal the bag, refrigerate, and let the tuna marinate for 1 to 2 hours, turning it occasionally.', u'Preheat a grill, or broiler with rack in the top position.', u'Brush the grill with vegetable oil. Discard the marinade and grill the tuna (or broil it on a rack set in a baking pan) for 3 minutes on each side until medium rare.', u'Serve immediately.', u'Note: Swordfish can also be prepared this way.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup light soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seed oil', u'1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds tuna steak (1 inch or thicker), cut into 4 portions']
title: Tuna Grilled Korean-Style

directions: [u'Heat wok over medium-high heat, add 2 ounces of oil and stir-fry meat until brown, mashing with a fork to break into small pieces. Drain off fat and set meat aside. Wash pan and dry thoroughly.', u'Heat 1 ounce of oil over high heat for 1 minute. Add onions and saute for 2 to 3 minutes or until limp. ', u'Add cabbage and continue to cook, stirring frequently, for another 2 to 3 minutes or until cabbage is crisp-tender.', u'Add bean sprouts, scallions, and tofu, mix well and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more.', u'Remove pan from heat and pour cooked mixture into a colander to drain excess liquid.', u'In a large bowl, combine meat, vegetables, hoisin, salt, and pepper and mix well.', u"Place 1 wonton skin on a flat surface. Cover remaining skins with a slightly damp kitchen towel (not terry cloth) so they won't dry out. Brush the edges of skin with a beaten egg. Place about 1 teaspoon of filling mixture just above the center of skin. Fold skin in half over filling to form a triangle and press edges together to seal. Repeat with remaining skins.", u'Fill and preheat fryer to 375 degrees F. and deep-fry dumplings until golden brown. Serve immediately with vinegar-soy dipping sauce. ', u'For vinegar-soy sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Stir to dissolve sugar.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 pound ground beef', u'3 ounces vegetable oil', u'3 ounces minced Spanish onion', u'3 ounces shredded cabbage', u'2 ounces roughly chopped bean sprouts', u'1 scallion, finely chopped', u'4 ounces firm tofu, mashed to a fine consistency', u'1 1/2 tablespoons hoisin', u'1 1/2 tablespoons salt', u' Dash pepper', u'24 wonton skins', u'1 egg beaten', u' Oil, for frying', u'8 tablespoons soy sauce', u'6 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons green onion, finely chopped', u'2 teaspoons sesame seeds, toasted']
title: Korean Dumplings: Mandu

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Make the sauce by combining the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, crushed red pepper and sesame seeds in a small bowl, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Set aside while you make the pancakes.', u'In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, water, and eggs and mix gently until just combined. Add the shrimp, green onions zucchini, carrot, garlic, and salt and fold together briefly just to combine. ', u'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and, when hot, coat with 2 teaspoons of the vegetable oil. Add 1/4 of the pancake batter and use a spoon to spread into a 6 to 8-inch circle, trying to get the filling ingredients as evenly spread out as possible. Cook until the pancake about 4 minutes. Once the pancake has begun to set and is golden brown on the bottom, flip the pancake to the other side, pressing with a spatula to compress ingredients. Cook until golden brown on the second side, about 2 minutes longer, transfer to a warm plate and cover loosely with foil to keep warm while you prepare the remaining pancakes. ', u'Once all of the pancakes have been cooked, cut into wedges and serve warm, sprinkled with the chives and with the dipping sauce in small bowls for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'2 teaspoons lightly toasted sesame seeds', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'2 eggs', u'1/2 pound finely chopped shrimp', u'3 ounces green onions, trimmed, quartered lengthwise, and cut into 2-inch lengths', u'1 small zucchini, cut into fine julienne', u'1 small carrot, cut into fine julienne', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'8 teaspoons vegetable oil', u' Chives, for garnish, optional']
title: Korean Green Onion and Shrimp Pancakes

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. ', u'Begin by preparing the Korean-style glaze. Combine the glaze ingredients and simmer gently over low heat for approximately 3 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved.', u'Season both sides of the filet mignon generously with salt and pepper. In a large heavy, ovenproof skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat until almost smoking. Place the steaks in the hot pan and cook until well seared on 1 side, about 3 minutes. Turn the steaks over; there should be a nice crust on top. Then transfer the pan to the oven. Roast for 10 to 12 minutes until the steaks are cooked medium-rare (add 4 more minutes for medium). With 1 minute to go, brush steaks with the glaze.', u'When done remove the steaks and brush again with remaining glaze. Transfer to a platter and cover loosely to let rest for 5 minutes and keep warm.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup turbinado (raw) sugar', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Sriracha (hot) sauce', u'2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'2 (5-ounce) filet mignon steaks', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil']
title: Korean-style Filet Mignon

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Pierce the steak a few times with a fork. Toast the sesame seeds in a skillet over medium heat until golden, shaking the pan, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate to cool.', u'Combine the sesame seeds, garlic, cola, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Add the steak and onion wedges, turning to coat. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.', u'Remove the steak and onion wedges from the marinade with a slotted spoon and transfer to a baking sheet. Heat a grill pan over high heat. Grill the onion wedges and peppers, turning, until charred, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a platter. Grill the steak until charred, 4 to 5 minutes per side for medium rare. Add to the platter.', u'Photograph by Tina Rupp']
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 to 2 pounds skirt steak, trimmed and cut crosswise into 4-inch pieces', u'3 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 cup cola', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 large white onion, cut into 2-inch-thick wedges', u'2 to 3 banana or Cubanelle peppers']
title: Grilled Korean-Style Skirt Steak

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u"Wrap the pork tenderloin in several sheets of plastic wrap and place in the freezer for 40 minutes. (This is to make it easier to thinly slice, so make sure it doesn't freeze completely.)", u'In a medium mixing bowl, combine the soy sauce, sugar, 2 teaspoons of the sesame oil, green onion, garlic, and ginger. Whisk together until the sugar dissolves.', u'Take the pork out of the freezer and unwrap on a clean cutting board. Slice the pork into thin strips, about 1/4-inch thick, 1/4-inch wide, and 2 1/2 inches long. Place the pork strips in the soy marinade, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.', u'In a small mixing bowl, combine the Sriracha hot chili sauce, the honey, and the remaining 2 teaspoons of sesame oil. Stir to combine. Set aside.', u'When the pork has marinated, take the bowl out of the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for 15 minutes.', u"Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Using a slotted spoon, remove the pork from the marinade and carefully place in the skillet. (Be careful that the drippings don't splatter out of the pan.) Cook the pork, stirring constantly with tongs or a wooden spoon, 4 to 5 minutes, until the pork is cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the sesame seeds.", u'To serve, spoon several tablespoons of rice into the center of a lettuce leaf, taco-style. Top with a few pork strips and drizzle with a few drops of the chili mixture. Roll up and eat!']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin, trimmed', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'4 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1/2 cup chopped green onions', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons Sriracha hot chili sauce', u'4 teaspoons honey', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'1 1/2 cups cooked jasmine rice', u'1 head Boston, Bibb, or butter lettuce, leaves separated, washed, and patted dry']
title: Korean-Style Pork Wraps with Chili Sauce

directions: [u'Preheat a grill.', u'Combine soy sauce, sugar, green onions, sesame seeds, sesame oil, and ko chu jang with ribs and marinate for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Grill over charcoal barbecue grill.', u'Note: Adjust sweetness or spiciness by adding more or less of either sugar or ko chu jang sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/8 cup sliced green onion', u'1 tablespoon white sesame seeds', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons ko chu jang (Korean hot pepper sauce)', u'1 1/2 pounds short ribs (have your butcher cut 1/8-inch thick slices of short ribs, bone attached)']
title: Korean Style Barbecue Short Ribs

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'In a shallow dish, combine grill seasoning, dark soy, a tablespoon honey, 1 teaspoon of the hot pepper flakes, half of the chopped garlic, sesame oil, scallions and a drizzle of vegetable oil.  Coat the flank steak in the mixture and let it stand 10 minutes.', u'Preheat indoor electric grill, stove top grill pan or outdoor grill to medium high. When the grill pan or grill is screaming hot, add meat and cook 5 minutes on each side for medium rare, 7 to 8 minutes on each side for medium well doneness.', u'Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, cabbage and peppers. Season with salt and stir fry 2 or 3 minutes. Add a drizzle of honey, about 1 tablespoon, hot pepper flakes and garlic and toss to combine with cabbage. Add sauerkraut and mix in, heating it through 1 minute. Turn off heat.', u'To serve, let meat rest 5 minutes for juices to redistribute. Thinly slice the meat on a heavy angle against the grain (the lines in the meat). Pile the slaw up and top with sliced Korean steak and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons grill seasoning blend (recommended brand McCormick Montreal Steak Seasoning)', u'1/4 cup Tamari dark soy', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 teaspoons hot red pepper flakes, divided', u'4 large cloves garlic, chopped, divided', u'2 teaspoons toasted (dark) sesame oil, eyeball it', u'2 scallions, finely chopped', u' Vegetable oil, for drizzling plus, 2 tablespoons, twice around the pan', u'2 pounds flank steak', u'1 pound bok choy or Napa cabbage, trimmed and shredded with a knife', u'1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'1 cup sauerkraut (it will taste like kim chee when combined with hot pepper flakes)']
title: Korean Barbecued Flank Steak on Hot and Sour Slaw Salad

directions: [u'Score ribs every 1/2-inch along the length and width of the bone, making sure not to cut too deep so the meat will stay attached to the bone.', u'Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl to make the marinade. Pour the marinade over the ribs and push the sauce into the cuts so it gets all the way down to the bone. Turn the ribs over face down in the marinade and cover for a minimum of 2 hours or refrigerate overnight for a stronger flavor.', u'Remove ribs from the marinade and barbecue over a charcoal grill. Serve ribs with Cucumber Kimchi, steamed rice, and green Korean peppers. Enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'4 large short ribs', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sesame seeds', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon sake (recommended: Han Soju)', u' Cucumber Kimchi, recipe follows, optional', u'5 small pickling cucumbers', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 cups water', u'1 pound Chinese turnips, some julienned and some cut into circles', u'1/4 cup julienned carrot', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 scallions, julienned', u'3 hot red peppers, seeded and minced', u'1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 cup chicken stock']
title: Korean-style BBQ Short Ribs

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare ribs according to photo below. Place the ribs in one layer in a large non-reactive baking dish, pour in the Korean BBQ Marinade, and turn the ribs to coat. Cover and refrigerate. Marinate for 2 to 8 hours (longer makes the ribs too salty).', u'Prepare an outdoor grill with a high-heat fire.', u'Remove the ribs from the marinade. Brush the grill grate lightly with oil. Place the ribs on the grill meaty side down and cook, turning as needed, until well browned but still pink inside, about 10 to 12 minutes. Set ribs aside to rest for 5 minutes. Serve with Cucumber Kimchee.', u'Cucumber Kimchee:', u'A day before serving, halve the cucumbers crosswise, set them upright on the cut end, and slice lengthwise into quarters, stopping about 1/2 inch from the cut end. Mix the scallions, garlic, ginger, sugar, salt, and red pepper and stuff about a tablespoon of the mixture into each cucumber. Put the cucumbers in a small non-reactive baking dish, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight.']
ingredients: [u'6 pounds beef short ribs, cut crosswise into twelve 2 1/2-inch squares (ask your butcher to cut the ribs for you)', u' Korean BBQ Marinade, recipe follows', u' Vegetable oil, for grill', u'4 Kirby cucumbers', u'4 scallions (white and green parts), thinly sliced', u'5 cloves garlic, chopped', u'3 tablespoons grated peeled fresh ginger', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons crushed red pepper, ground', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'4 large cloves garlic, peeled and chopped (about 2 tablespoons)', u'2 tablespoons finely grated peeled fresh ginger', u'4 scallions (white and green), thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Korean Short Ribs with Cucumber Kimchee

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat grill. Combine sugar, soy sauce, sake, garlic, scallions, ginger and sesame oil in a mediumsize flat dish. Add the steak and coat well with the marinade. Let marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes, turning once. Remove meat from marinade and grill on each side for 2 to 3 minutes, for mediumrare. Remove from grill, cover and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice thinly against the grain.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sake', u'4 large cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'3 scallions, white part only, minced', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped ginger', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 pound skirt steak, trimmed and cut into 4 portions', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Korean-Style Marinated Skirt Steak with Grilled Scallions and Warm Tortillas

directions: [u'Special equipment: a taco shell mold', u'For the taco shells: Pour enough canola oil in a heavy pot or deep fryer for the wonton wrappers to be submerged completely when frying. Heat the oil until a deep-fry thermometer inserted in the oil registers 375 degrees F.', u'Using a taco shell mold, fry the wonton wrappers in the oil until crispy, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels and allow to cool fully before using.', u'For the scallion slaw: Rinse the scallions thoroughly with cold water. Prepare a bowl of ice water, add the scallions and soak for 5 minutes. Drain thoroughly.', u'Combine the scallions, rice vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, chile flakes and sesame oil and let marinate for 20 minutes.', u'For the bulgogi marinade: Add the garlic and onions to a food processor and process until thoroughly combined. Add the soy sauce, red wine, sesame oil, black pepper, pears, pineapple cubes and 1 1/2 cups water and process until thoroughly combined.', u'Add the rib eye to a bowl, pour over the bulgogi marinade and allow the beef to marinate for at least 10 minutes.', u'Heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat until hot. Remove the beef from the marinade, letting any excess marinade drip back into the bowl. Add the beef to the pan and cook until well done, about 5 minutes. (This is very important to allow the flavors of the marinade to develop completely.)', u'Peel the pear and slice it into thin half-moons. Place a layer of the kimchee and then the beef into each taco shell. Garnish with the scallion slaw and sliced pears.']
ingredients: [u' Canola oil, for frying', u'12 round wonton wrappers', u'1 cup fine julienne scallions', u'1/2 cup brown rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile flakes', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'12 cloves garlic', u'3 onions, cut into chunks', u'1 1/2 cups soy sauce', u'1 cup red wine', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'2 pinches black pepper', u'2 Korean pears or Gala apples, cored and cut into chunks', u'1 pineapple, peeled, cored and cubed', u'1 pound beef rib eye, sliced thinly', u'1 Korean pear or Gala apple', u'1 cup prepared kimchee, drained well and minced']
title: Korean Beef Bulgogi Tacos with Kimchee Slaw

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat a grill or grill pan to high.', u'Combine the sesame oil and salt in a small bowl and set aside.', u'Thinly slice the scallion greens into 3-inch-long julienne. Stir together the soy sauce and rice vinegar in a small bowl. Add the scallions, toss and set aside.', u'Lightly oil the grill and rub the grates with one of the onion rounds. Place the onions on the grill and grill until slightly charred and softened, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Move the onions off to the side to keep warm. Grill the rib-eye slices until browned and cooked to the desired doneness, about 2 minutes per side.', u'To eat, dip a piece or two of the rib-eye into the seasoned sesame oil and then place in a lettuce leaf along with some grilled onions. Top with some marinated scallions and consume like a taco.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 bunch scallions, green part only', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'1 onion, sliced into 1/2-inch rounds', u'1 pound thinly sliced rib-eye steak (you can find this at Korean markets)', u'1 small head green leaf lettuce, leaves separated']
title: Korean BBQ Beef

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Place a wire rack in a rimmed baking sheet and set aside. Fill a large Dutch oven halfway with oil and heat over medium-high heat to a temperature of 350deg;F. ', u'Whisk together the honey, sriracha, soy sauce, lime juice and sesame oil in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the sauce comes together, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside. ', u'Whisk together the cornstarch, flour, 1\xbe cups cold water, 2 teaspoons salt and \xbc teaspoon pepper in a large bowl until smooth. Add the chicken and toss until completely coated. ', u'Lift the chicken pieces out of the batter one at a time, letting the excess batter drip back into the bowl, and gently place in the hot oil; try to keep the pieces separated. Fry in batches until golden, adjusting the heat as necessary to keep the oil temperature at 350\xb0F, about 8 or 9 minutes per batch. Remove the chicken with a spider or slotted spoon and set on the rack on the baking sheet to drain. While the wings are still hot, toss them in the honey sauce to evenly coat. Transfer them to a dutch oven and serve with sesame seeds and scallions scattered over the top. ', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u' Canola or peanut oil*, for frying', u' \xbd cup honey', u' \xbd cup sriracha', u' \xbc cup soy sauce', u' Juice of \xbd lime (about 1 tablespoon)', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 cup cornstarch', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 pounds chicken wings (14 to 16 pieces), split and tips removed', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, for garnish', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced on an angle, for garnish']
title: Game Day Korean-Style Chicken Wings

directions: [u'Put the beef in a large mixing bowl, and add all the marinade ingredients. Toss to make sure the beef is well coated. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'In a medium bowl, mix together the tomato sauce and tomato paste until smooth. Stir in the kimchee liquid from the container, the oregano, parsley, garlic, paprika, fennel and red pepper flakes. Transfer the mixture to a saucepan, put over medium-low heat and simmer to blend flavors. Let simmer for about 20 minutes.', u'Preheat an indoor grill pan, but if not available, use a large skillet coated with sesame oil instead. Put a sheet of aluminum foil on the heated pan, and grill the beef, onion and mushrooms on the foil. Cook the beef until evenly browned, about 3 minutes on each side.', u'Roll out the pizza dough on a floured work surface, and transfer to a 17-inch baking sheet. Spread the dough with some of the pizza sauce in an even layer. Cut pieces of kimchee with scissors and sprinkle on top. Add some sliced fontina, and top with some meat. Repeat with the other piece of pizza dough. Put the baking sheets in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes.', u'In a squeeze bottle mix the hoisin sauce, hot sauce and Korean red pepper paste.', u'While pizzas are still hot, sprinkle each with chopped green onions and drizzle with sauce from the squeeze bottle. Cut into squares and serve with a side of kimchee.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds rib-eye, sliced paper thin', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1 kiwi, juiced', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup cola', u'2 tablespoons black sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 stalks green onions, julienned', u'1 (15-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'1 (6-ounce can tomato paste', u'1/4 cup chopped Kimchee, liquid reserved', u'1 tablespoon ground oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried parsley', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon ground paprika', u'2 pinches fennel seed', u'1 pinch crushed red pepper flakes', u' Sesame oil', u'1/4 onion sliced', u'4 fresh mushrooms, sliced, optional', u'2 ready-made whole-wheat pizza crusts', u' Flour, for rolling pizza dough', u'2 packages pre-sliced fontina cheese', u'1 stalk green onion, chopped, for garnish', u'1/3 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/3 cup hot sauce (recommended: Sriracha)', u'1/3 cup Korean red pepper paste (recommended: Gochujang)']
title: Korean BBQ Pizza

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Remove any silver skin from the surface of the short ribs, and then make 2 cuts across the grain, through the meat down to the bone. (See how-to photo.) Put the ribs in the slow cooker.', u'Whisk together the broth, soy, sugar, ginger, chili paste, sesame oil, garlic, and scallion whites. Pour over the ribs. Cover and cook on HIGH for 6 hours.', u'About 30 minutes before serving, put the rice noodles in a bowl with hot water to cover. Soak until tender and pliable, about 30 minutes.', u'Skim any fat that may collect on top of the beef broth and discard.', u'Divide the noodles among 6 large shallow bowls and ladle the broth over top. (Cut the meat from the ribs if desired.) Divide the meat evenly among the bowls. Garnish as desired with the carrots, cucumber, cilantro, lime and the remaining green parts of the scallion and more chili paste, if desired.', u'Copyright (c) 2007 Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved']
ingredients: [u'12 English-cut short ribs (about 6 pounds)', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons finely grated peeled fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons Korean red chili paste or sambal oelek, plus more for serving', u'2 tablespoons dark (toasted) sesame oil', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 bunch scallions (white and green parts, separated), thinly sliced', u'10 to 12 ounces medium-thick rice noodles (also called rice sticks or jantaboon)', u'1 carrot, finely grated', u'1 small Kirby cucumber, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup cilantro leaves, torn', u'2 limes, cut into wedges']
title: Slow Cooked Korean-Style Short Rib Soup

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'"Korea is like New Orleans - it\'s hard to find a bad plate of food," Sunny says. "You can walk into any corner place and you\'re guaranteed to get something new, flavorful, spicy." Also on her must-eat list: bibimbap, the classic Korean dish of rice topped with meat, vegetables, fermented chile paste and an egg yolk. "It\'s what people always get at a Korean place," Sunny says. "The colors are crazy." She sampled several versions of bibimbap around Seoul, including one that she swears could have fed six hungry people. Here\'s her own take on the dish']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds boneless beef rib-eye steak', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons packed light brown sugar', u' Pinch of red pepper flakes', u'1 clove garlic, finely grated', u'1/2 teaspoon finely grated peeled ginger', u'1/4 cup grated Vidalia or other sweet onion (use the largest holes on a box grater)', u'1/4 cup applesauce', u'2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 cups shredded or julienned carrots', u'1 pound shiitake or mixed wild mushrooms, stemmed and sliced', u' Kosher salt', u'1 bunch spinach, stemmed and chopped', u'1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar', u'4 to 6 tablespoons gochujang (fermented chile paste)', u'6 cups cooked white rice, hot', u'2 cups thinly sliced red cabbage (use a mandoline if you have one)', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced on the bias', u'4 cups bean sprouts', u'1/4 cup kimchi, thinly sliced or chopped', u'4 large egg yolks']
title: Simple Seoul Bibimbap

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'For the beef and marinade: Slice the partially frozen tenderloin as thin as possible using an extremely sharp knife; aim for 1/4-inch thickness.', u'In a food processor, combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, vegetable oil, red chile flakes, garlic, apples, ginger, onions and few grinds of black pepper. Cut 4 of the scallions into quarters and add to the food processor. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large resealable plastic bag. Add the sliced beef, and then squeeze out as much air as possible. Let marinate at room temperature for 1 hour.', u'Preheat a grill, grill pan or electric tabletop grill to medium-high heat. Remove the beef slices from the bag, shaking off any excess marinade. Cut the remaining scallions into 4-inch pieces.', u'When you are ready to eat, place the scallions on the grill, add the beef slices and cook the beef for 1 minute per side and the scallions until slightly charred. Remove to a platter.', u'For the lettuce wraps: Fill a lettuce leaf with some of the meat, carrots, sprouts, radishes, kimchi and grilled scallions. Serve with the hot sauce and Sesame Soy Dipping Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound beef tenderloin, trimmed and frozen for 4 hours', u'2 cups soy sauce', u'1 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon red chile flakes', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 red-skinned apple, cored and quartered', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated', u'1/2 Vidalia onion, cut in chunks', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 bunch scallions', u'8 to 12 leaves Bibb lettuce', u' Grated carrots, for serving', u' Bean sprouts, for serving', u' Sliced radishes, for serving', u' Kimchi or sliced spicy pickles, for serving', u' Sriracha hot sauce, for serving', u' Sesame Soy Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sesame seeds']
title: Sunny's Sweet and Spicy Korean BBQ

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Stir together the soy sauce, chili sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, vinegar, grated ginger and grated garlic in a small bowl. Reserve 2 tablespoons for the vegetables and then stir in the hoisin sauce. Set half aside for serving with the cooked pork chops and stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons water.', u'Sprinkle the pork chops on both sides with 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper for all 4 chops. Place the pork chops and onions on a lightly oiled grill. Grill until the pork chops are just slightly pink near the bone, 6 minutes on the first side and 4 to 5 minutes on the second side. Grill the onions until they are soft. Start brushing both the pork and the onions with the hoisin sauce mixture about halfway through grilling. Transfer the pork chops to a cutting board to rest for about 5 minutes and the onions to a bowl.', u'Put the bok choy in a large bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave until the center core has softened and can easily be pierced with the tip of a sharp knife, 3 to 5 minutes. Season the bok choy with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper and grill until charred, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Add to the bowl with the onions and gently toss with the reserved 2 tablespoons ginger sauce. Serve the pork chops with the grilled vegetables and the reserved hoisin sauce mixture on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon chili garlic sauce, such as Sriracha', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon peeled and finely grated fresh ginger', u'1 clove garlic, grated', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'4 bone-in pork chops (about 3 pounds)', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 red onion, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'4 to 6 baby bok choy, halved lengthwise (about 1 pound)']
title: Grilled Korean-Style BBQ Glazed Pork Chops with Red Onions and Baby Bok Choy

directions: [u'Marinade: Stir together marinade ingredients and reserve one fourth of marinade for sauce. Marinate steak, then broil: Put steak and remaining three fourths of marinade in a glass dish, turning steak to coat, and marinate at room temperature, turning once, 30 minutes. While steak is marinating, cut apples and mango into 1 by 1/4 -inch sticks. Toss together with juice and chili sauce and season with salt. Preheat broiler. Broil steak on rack of a broiler pan 2 to 3 inches from heat until slightly charred, 2 to 3 minutes on each side for medium meat. Let steak stand 5 minutes. Cut crosswise into 1/4 -inch thick slices, then halve slices crosswise. Toss beef in reserved marinade with salt and pepper to taste and divide among lettuce leaves. Top with fruit and sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'1/3 cup chopped scallion', u'1/4 cup 2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon Asian sesame oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoon Asian chili sauce', u'1 3/4 pound skirt steak', u'2 small red apples such as Gala', u'1 firm-ripe mango, peeled and pitted', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoon Asian chili sauce, or to taste', u'60 (3 to 4- inch) long Bibb lettuce leaves', u' Toasted sesame seeds']
title: Korean Beef Barbecue
