author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make this spicy Korean condiment, then turn it into fried rice or serve it with your steak: Pulse 3 chopped red jalapenos, 4 garlic cloves, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons chopped ginger, 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes and 2 tablespoons each fish sauce and salt in a food processor. Cut 1/2 head napa cabbage and 6 scallions into 2-inch pieces; toss with the jalapeno paste. Refrigerate at least 4 hours.', u'Photograph by Tina Rupp']
title: Kimchi

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Season the beef with salt and pepper.  In a mixing bowl, combine the oil, soy sauce, garlic and ginger.  Season with crushed red pepper to taste.  Place the meat in a shallow bowl.  Pour the marinade over the meat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.  Remove and bring to room temperature.  Preheat the hibachi.  Remove the meat from the pan, reserving the marinade.  Place the marinade in a saucepan, over medium heat.  Bring to a boil and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until the mixture reduces by 3/4.  Remove, set aside, and keep warm.  Grill the meat for a couple of minutes on each side, for medium rare. To serve, spoon the rice in the center of each plate.  Lay the strips of meat around the rice.  Drizzle the sauce over the meat.  Garnish with chives.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound beef flank steak, sliced into 1/2-inch slices', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup sesame oil', u'2 cups soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh ginger', u' Crushed red pepper, to taste', u'2 cups cooked white long grain rice', u'1 tablespoon snipped chives']
title: Korean Bulgogi

directions: [u'Stir together 3/4 cup soy sauce, sherry, sugar, 1 1/2 tablespoons garlic, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, and red pepper flakes in a 13 by 9 by 2-inch baking dish until sugar is dissolved, then add steaks, turning to coat. Marinate steaks, turning once, 1 hour. ', u'Prepare grill for cooking. ', u'Stir together cilantro, vegetable oil, lime juice, remaining 3 tablespoons soy sauce, remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons garlic, remaining 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil, and chile if using. ', u'When fire is medium-hot (you can hold your hand 5 inches above rack 3 to 4 seconds), grill steaks on a lightly oiled rack 3 to 4 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Let steaks stand on a cutting board 5 minutes, then top with some sauce and cut crosswise into 3/4-inch-thick slices.  Serve remaining sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/4 cup medium-dry sherry', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons plus 1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon Asian sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'6 (1-inch-thick) boneless beef top loin (strip) steaks, about 3/4 pound each', u'3/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro (including roots and stems)', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1/2 teaspoon minced seeded fresh habanero or serrano chile (optional)', u'1 (4-inch-long) fresh hot red chile, chopped (optional)']
title: Grilled Korean-Style Steaks with Spicy Cilantro Sauce

directions: [u'For the pulled pork: Rub the pork butt with the salt and brown sugar in a shallow pan. Cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours.', u'Preheat the oven to 225 degrees F. Pour out and discard the excess liquid from the pan. Roast the pork, uncovered, until the internal temperature reaches 180 degree F, about 6 hours.', u'While the pork is roasting, make the quick pickles, kimchi slaw and Korean BBQ sauce.', u'For the quick pickles: Cut the cucumber into 1/8-inch-thick slices and mix with the salt, sugar and chile flakes in a bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use', u'For the kimchi slaw: Roughly chop the kimchi and mix with the mayonnaise in a bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use.', u'For the Korean BBQ sauce: Blend the garlic, ginger, soy sauce, gochujang, brown sugar, vinegar, sesame oil, black pepper, red pepper flakes and onions together in a food processor until well combined.', u'Remove the pork from the oven and pull into shreds with a fork while still hot. Put the pork in a large bowl, pour over the Korean BBQ sauce and mix well.', u'To prepare the sandwiches: Put some shredded pork on a roll, top with some kimchi slaw and finish with some quick pickles. Repeat with the remaining rolls and serve.']
ingredients: [u' One 6-pound boneless pork butt', u'1/2 cup kosher salt', u'1/2 cup light brown sugar', u'1 European cucumber', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Pinch of dried chile flakes', u'1 cup store-bought or homemade kimchi, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'1/2 cup minced garlic', u'1/2 cup minced fresh ginger', u'1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1/4 cup gochujang (Korean red chile pepper paste), or similar like Sriracha', u'1/4 light brown sugar', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon red chile pepper flakes', u'1 small white onion, minced', u"12 potato rolls, such as Martin's, or any soft rolls", u'1 head napa cabbage', u'1/2 cup kosher salt', u'1/3 cup Korean red pepper powder', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 ounces minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons granulated sugar']
title: Dirty South Korean Pulled Pork Sandwich

directions: [u'Add 1/3 cup of shaved ice into a large metal bowl and add the Simple Syrup. Next, drain the juice out of the fruit cocktail and pour the fruit, grain powder and then add the red bean paste into the bowl.', u'Now add another layer of shaved ice into the bowl. Even out the ice and add the kiwi, mochi rice cakes, strawberries and banana. Then add a scoop of both the strawberry and vanilla ice cream. Pour the milk over the dessert and then the strawberry syrup. Then add the whipped cream, drizzle with hot fudge chocolate syrup and top it with the rainbowy puffs cereal. And finally you add the cherry on top!', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.', u'Simple Syrup:', u'Add equal parts sugar and water to a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat until the sugar has dissolved, around 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and cool.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups shaved ice', u'3 tablespoons Simple Syrup, recipe follows', u' One 15-ounce can fruit cocktail', u'1 cup mixed grain powder', u'1 cup Asian red bean paste', u'1/2 cup sliced kiwi', u'1/2 cup colorful mochi rice cakes', u'1/2 cup fresh strawberries, sliced', u'1/2 banana, sliced', u'1 scoop strawberry ice cream', u'1 scoop vanilla ice cream', u'5 tablespoons milk', u'5 tablespoons strawberry syrup', u'1 cup whipped cream', u'5 tablespoons hot fudge chocolate syrup', u'1 cup rainbowy puffs cereal', u'1 maraschino cherry']
title: Pat Bing Soo (Korean Shaved Ice)

directions: [u'Heat a grill pan over high heat for 2 minutes and place the beef slices onto the surface for 1 minute per side. Remove immediately and set aside', u'Whisk the hoisin, ketchup, barbecue sauce, nam pla, soy sauce, ginger, vegetable oil, scallions and cilantro together in a large bowl. Add the grilled beef and refrigerate at least 1 hour to let the flavors blend. ', u'Remove from the refrigerator and thread one piece of beef onto a 6" bamboo skewer. Repeat with the remaining beef, set onto a decorative platter and garnish with chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1 (3 pound) beef tenderloin trimmed and sliced to 1/2-inch thickness', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'1/4 cup prepared barbecue sauce', u'1 tablespoons nam pla', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1 (2-inch) piece ginger, grated', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped scallion', u'1 tablespoon chopped cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish']
title: Korean BBQ Beef Skewers

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a small saucepan over medium heat add the vinegar, water, sugar, and turmeric. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Remove from heat and allow it to cool.', u'Meanwhile, peel the daikon radish and slice into 1/4-inch thick rounds. (If your daikon is very large, slice the rounds into semicircles.) Place in a colander with salt and mix well. Place the colander over a bowl and let drain for 1 hour. Rinse the salt off with a couple of changes of water and dry the daikon well. Put into a sterilized glass jar. Pour the cooled brine through a coffee filter (or a cheesecloth lined strainer) into the jar to cover the radish slices. Refrigerate at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. Will keep for about 2 weeks.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'1 cup water', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 pound daikon radish', u'1/4 cup kosher salt']
title: Sweet Pickled Daikon Radish

directions: [u"*Cook's Note: This can be done in a regular bowl or a hot stone bowl. If it's in a hot stone bowl, the rice becomes crunchy because it's still cooking.", u'Put cooked rice in large slightly shallow bowl. Place bulgogi (with juices from cooked meat) and veggies on top of rice but place separately so you can see each ingredient beautifully placed on rice. Put egg on top. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and drizzle with sesame oil and soy sauce. ', u'When ready to eat, mix all ingredients together with some gochuchang paste, to taste. The bibimpap should be moist and not dry. Add more sesame oil and gochuchang paste, to taste.']
ingredients: [u' Steamed white rice', u' Bulgogi, recipe follows', u'1 carrot, julienned', u' Cooked bean sprouts, sauteed in a little sesame oil or peanut oil and seasoned with salt', u' Cooked spinach, sauteed in a little sesame or peanut oil and seasoned with salt', u'4 shiitake mushrooms, thinly sliced and sauteed in peanut oil and seasoned with salt', u'1 egg, cooked over easy', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'1 tablespoon dark sesame oil', u' Soy sauce, to taste', u' Gochuchang Paste, recipe follows']
title: Bibimbap

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a saucepan over medium-high heat, add soy sauce, mirin, sake, water, brown sugar, pear, ginger, and garlic. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for about 20 minutes. Puree in a blender and allow to cool. Place the sliced tenderloin and the butterflied shrimp in separate shallow dishes. Pour the puree over them, cover, and allow to marinate for 20 minutes.', u'Combine the chili paste, sesame oil, sesame seeds, and scallions. Place the short ribs meat side down on a cutting board. With a sharp knife slice between the bone and the meat but do not cut all the way through. Open like a book and carefully run the knife in the opposite direction to cut the meat in half, again not going all the way through. You should now have a long flat piece of meat, about the thickness of the bone. You can grill the short ribs in large pieces or cut the meat into smaller bite-sized pieces. Place the short ribs and lamb chops in separate shallow dishes and toss with the spicy marinade. Cover and marinate for 20 minutes.', u'Heat the grill, a grill pan, a cast iron skillet, or an electric tabletop grill. Grill the meats and shrimp until they are cooked to your liking. Serve as you cook them accompanied by a platter of mixed lettuce leaves, mint leaves, shiso or basil leaves, and sliced hot peppers, as well as small bowls of soy sauce and hot sauce. Also serve the Quick Spicy Kimchee, Sweet Pickled Daikon, and Cool Sesame Cucumbers in their own dishes.', u'Take a lettuce leaf in your hand. Put 1 or 2 pieces of meat or shrimp and top this with any combination of the condiments. Wrap the lettuce around the meat and eat out of hand.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup low sodium soy sauce', u'1 cup mirin*', u'1 cup sake', u'1 cup water', u'1/2 cup light brown sugar', u'1 Asian pear, chopped (substitute a regular pear or an apple)', u'1 (1-inch) piece ginger, sliced', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 pound beef tenderloin, sliced thin', u'1 pound large shrimp, cleaned, peeled, and butterflied', u'2 tablespoons hot chili paste (recommended: Srirachi Hot Chili Paste)', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'3 scallions, sliced thin', u'1 1/2 pounds beef short ribs', u'8 baby lamb chops', u' *Japanese cooking wine, can be found in Asian and gourmet shops', u' Mixed lettuce leaves', u'1 bunch fresh mint', u'1 bunch fresh shiso or basil', u'2 to 3 fresh red hot peppers', u' Soy Sauce', u' Hot sauce or hot chili paste', u' Quick Spicy Kimchee, recipe follows', u' Sweet Pickled Daikon, recipe follows', u' Cool Sesame Cucumbers, recipe follows']
title: Mixed Korean Grill with Two Marinades: Bulgoki

directions: [u'Cut off any excess fat from the short ribs then thinly slice the beef and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Place in a large bowl or in a plastic resealable bag.', u'In a blender or food processor, blend the soy sauce, mirin, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, scallions and ginger. Pour half of the sauce over the short ribs, ensuring all the beef is covered. Seal tightly and marinate the short ribs in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 24 hours.', u'Place the other half of the marinade in a pan and reduce over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is thick. Place in a serving bowl and reserve to drizzle on the tacos.', u'For the slaw: Place the cabbage, daikon, cilantro and scallions together in a medium to large bowl.', u'For the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, soy sauce, mirin and Sriracha. Slowly whisk in the olive oil. Place the dressing in the fridge until ready to use.', u'For the taco assembly: Heat your griddle to high. Flash cook the meat while simultaneously caramelizing the marinade. Place your short ribs on the griddle. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 3 minutes, then wrap the meat in foil and set aside.', u'Grill up your tortillas. Flip after 45 seconds. Grill for another 45 seconds and remove.', u'On the grilled tortillas, pile some Korean slaw, dressing, beef, reserved and reduced marinade and extra Sriracha to taste. Then, chow down.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds beef short ribs, off the bone', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'1/2 cup dark brown sugar', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'6 cloves garlic', u'6 scallions', u'2 teaspoons peeled and grated fresh ginger', u'3 cups roughly chopped Napa cabbage', u'1 cup matchstick-size daikon slices', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'6 scallions, diced', u'2 limes, juiced', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'2 tablespoons Sriracha', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Twelve to fifteen 6-inch yellow corn tortillas or flour tortillas', u' Sriracha, for serving']
title: Korean Bulgogi Taco Recipe

directions: [u'Heat a large cast-iron pan, and add the vegetable oil. Once the oil is hot, add the mushrooms and some salt and pepper and cook until golden brown. Transfer the mushrooms to a plate, and refrigerate.', u'Put the bean sprouts in a tall plastic container, add some salt and 4 tablespoons of the lime juice and refrigerate.', u'Before you cook the eggs, gather all the ingredients and start building your bowls: Add 1 teaspoon of the sesame oil into each of 4 bowls, and spread it around with a plastic spatula. Distribute the quinoa evenly among the bowls, and continue with the nori, lettuce, sesame seeds, kimchi and tofu. (I like to keep everything separated near the edge of the bowl.)', u'Once the bowls are filled, heat a large nonstick pan over medium heat, add enough oil to coat the whole pan and add the eggs. Cook to desired doneness (I prefer mine sunny-side up, so the yolks can coat all the ingredients). Once the eggs are cooked, season with salt and pepper, and place 1 egg in the middle of each bowl. Garnish with green onions and cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for cooking eggs', u'1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, caps sliced', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound bean sprouts', u' Juice of 2 limes', u'4 teaspoons sesame oil', u'2 cups cooked red quinoa (season with salt, cook in a rice cooker in a ratio of 2 water to 1 red quinoa, and refrigerate)', u'1 pack toasted nori sheets', u'1 head organic baby lettuce, picked, washed and dried', u'2 tablespoons toasted white sesame seeds', u'1 cup kimchi, sliced', u'4 ounces soft tofu', u'4 large eggs', u'1 bunch green onions, thinly sliced, for garnish', u' Leaves from 1/2 bunch cilantro, for garnish']
title: Korean Quinoa Bowl

directions: [u'For the pineapple soy-glazed short ribs: Combine the pineapple juice, lemon-lime soda, mushroom soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, lemon juice, brown sugar, honey, garlic, sesame oil and sriracha in a medium mixing bowl. Add the ribs and marinate for 20 minutes at room temperature.', u'Heat a grill pan over high heat. Strain the short ribs, reserving the marinade. Cook the ribs on the grill pan until dark caramelized grill marks appear, about 1 1/2 minutes on each side. Cut the ribs in between each bone to create square pieces.', u'Strain the reserved marinade through a fine mesh strainer and cook in a saute pan over high heat until reduced by half, about 6 minutes. Set aside for serving.', u'For the fried rice: Add the jasmine rice and 3 cups of water to a medium saucepot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat to medium low and let simmer until cooked, about 15 minutes.', u'Heat a saute pan over high heat. Add the sesame oil, carrots and onions and cook until caramelized and dark brown. Add the garlic and cook until dark brown. Add the soy sauce and cook, scraping up the bits from the bottom of the pan, until the soy sauce is reduced by half. Add the kimchi and eggs and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are scrambled and fluffy. Add the scallions and peas.', u'For the kimchi slaw: Combine the red cabbage, green cabbage, kimchi, rice wine vinegar, honey, mayonnaise and black sesame seeds in a medium bowl, using your hands to mix the ingredients until evenly distributed. Leave the mix out until ready to plate. Strain out excess liquid before serving.', u'To serve, spoon the fried rice on each plate in a 4-by-1-by-1/2-inch line. Layer 4 to 5 short ribs on top of the fried rice in a cascading fashion. Top the meat with the strained slaw. Finish with a drizzle of reduced marinade and sprinkle with some sesame seeds and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups pineapple juice', u'1 1/2 cups lemon-lime soda, such as Sprite', u'1 1/2 cups mushroom soy sauce', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'5 lemons, juiced', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1/4 cup honey', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons sriracha', u"15 Korean-style short rib pieces (see Cook's Note)", u'1 1/2 cups jasmine rice', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1/4 cup diced carrots', u'1/4 cup diced Spanish onions', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/2 cup mushroom soy sauce', u'1 1/2 cups kimchi', u'2 large eggs', u'1/2 cup sliced scallions, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 cup peas', u'1/2 cup shredded red cabbage', u'1/2 cup shredded green cabbage', u'1/4 cup kimchi, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 tablespoon mayonnaise', u'1 teaspoon black sesame seeds, plus more for garnish']
title: Korean BBQ Short Ribs

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Whisk the cola, cilantro, soy sauce, sesame oil, vinegar pepper and garlic in a large baking dish. Add the pork and turn to coat. Cover the baking dish and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours and up to 8 hours.', u'Prepare the grill for indirect grilling, with part of the grill at high heat. Remove the pork from the marinade 30 minutes before grilling to take the chill off.', u'Grill the pork until charred, about 3 minutes. Flip the pork and grill for another 3 minutes. Both sides of the pork should be nicely charred. Move the pork to indirect heat, cover the grill, and cook for about 5 minutes until a meat thermometer inserted in the pork registers 150 degrees F. Remove the pork from the grill and set aside, loosely tended with foil, about 10 minutes.', u'Cut the pork, against the grain, into thin strips. Fill the lettuce leaves with some of the pork, a drizzle of the Gojuchang Sauce and top with the Quick Kimchi.']
ingredients: [u' One 12-ounce can cola, such as Coke', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', u'8 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 1/2 pounds pork shoulder steak, no more than 3/4-inch thick, not trimmed', u' Boston lettuce leaves, for serving', u' Gojuchang Sauce, recipe follows', u' Quick Kimchi, recipe follows', u'1 head napa cabbage, halved and shredded thinly', u'1/3 cup rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon gochujang sauce', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 teaspoon grated ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, knife pureed', u'2 serrano chiles, seeded and chopped', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'4 green onions, sliced', u'2 tablespoons gochujang sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons honey', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame seeds', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 green onions, halved lengthwise and thin sliced crosswise']
title: Pork Shoulder Lettuce Wraps with Kimchi

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Remove outer leaves from cabbage. Cut cabbage in quarters and remove the tough inner core. Slice across sections into 1/2-inch slices. Put into a colander, add salt, and mix well. Place over a bowl and let drain, covered, until wilted, about 2 hours.', u'In a large bowl combine the vinegar and sugar and stir to dissolve. Add the chili paste, ginger, garlic, and scallions and stir. Rinse the salt off the cabbage with a couple of changes of water. Dry well and add to the vinegar mixture; stir well to combine. Put into a sterilized glass jar and pack the cabbage down; add enough water to cover. Close the jar and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. This is spicy and gets spicier the longer it sits - add or subtract chili paste to your taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 head Napa cabbage, about 1 to 1 1/2 pounds', u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons hot chili paste (recommended: Srirachi Hot Chili Paste)', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, grated', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 scallions, finely sliced']
title: Quick Spicy Kimchee

author: Monterey Salka
directions: [u'Special equipment: a deep-fry thermometer', u'Soak the chicken in the buttermilk for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, fill a large Dutch oven halfway with oil and heat slowly to 375 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer. Line a plate with a paper towel. Combine the flour, garlic powder, ground ginger, onion powder, chili powder and 4 teaspoons salt in a large shallow dish. Remove the chicken from the buttermilk, let the excess drip off and then dredge in the spiced flour mixture. Fry the chicken until golden and cooked through, about 7 minutes. Drain on the lined plate. (Bring the oil back to 375 degrees F, then lower the heat to hold at temperature.)', u'In a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, green cabbage, red cabbage, celery, onion, radish, mirin, sesame oil, lime zest and juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Let sit.', u'In a small bowl, stir together the sambal oelek, agave nectar and tomato paste, and brush onto the chicken.', u'Stir together the mayonnaise, miso, ginger and fish sauce in another small bowl. Set aside.', u'Bring the oil back to 375 degrees F if necessary. Separate the wonton skins and fry until crispy, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with furikake.', u'Smear the miso mayonnaise on the tortillas and top with the slaw and some chicken. Wrap and serve with wonton chips on the side. Garnish with micro cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced into strips', u'2 cups buttermilk', u' Oil, for deep-frying', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'2 tablespoons ground ginger', u'2 tablespoons onion powder', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 cups soy sauce', u'1/2 cup shredded green cabbage', u'1/2 cup shredded red cabbage', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced celery', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced red onion', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced radish', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u' Zest and juice of 2 limes', u'1/2 cup sambal oelek', u'1/4 cup agave nectar', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons white miso', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon fish sauce', u' Half 14-ounce package wonton skins', u'4 tablespoons furikake seasoning', u'4 flour tortillas', u' Micro cilantro, for garnish']
title: Korean Fried Chicken Wraps

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Light a grill to high heat.', u'Combine the soy sauce, sesame oil, 1 teaspoon honey, garlic, ginger and 2 tablespoons canola oil in a baking dish.  Add the mushrooms, turn to coat and let them marinate at room temperature for 15 minutes. ', u'Brush the zucchini with 2 tablespoons of canola oil and season them with salt and black pepper, to taste. Grill until slightly charred on both sides and just cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Remove and cut them crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. At the same time, grill the mushrooms until golden brown on both sides and just cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.  Remove and cut them into thin strips. ', u'Whisk together the rice vinegar, lime juice, mustard, 1 tablespoon honey and 1/4 cup canola oil in a large shallow bowl and adjust the seasonings with salt and pepper, to taste. Add the warm, cooked rice and toss to coat.  Arrange the mushrooms, zucchini, bean sprouts and carrots over the top and garnish with cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon honey plus 1 tablespoon', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon grated ginger', u'4 tablespoons canola oil, plus 1/4 cup', u'2 large shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded', u'2 small zucchini, halved lengthwise', u' Salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 1/2 cups long-grain rice, cooked according to package instructions', u'1 handful bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup carrots, julienned', u' Cilantro leaves, torn, for garnish']
title: Bibimbap Salad

directions: [u'Make the spicy slaw: Stir the vinegar, sugar, sambal oelek and salt together in a large bowl until the sugar is dissolved. Add the red cabbage, mix well, cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or (preferably) overnight.', u'Marinate the chicken: Whisk together the soy sauce, sugar, gochujang, ginger and sesame oil in a large bowl. Add the chicken strips and mix thoroughly. Cover the bowl and marinate for at least 1 hour or (preferably) overnight.', u'Make the sriracha aioli: Mix the mayonnaise and sriracha until combined. Taste for spiciness and add more sriracha if needed.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat, add the chicken and saute, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, 7 to 8 minutes.', u'Warm the tortillas in a griddle or wrapped in damp paper towels in the microwave. Place the warmed tortillas on plates (double them if using store-bought tortillas). Divide the sauteed chicken among the tortillas, top with sriracha aioli, and then some slaw.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups distilled white vinegar', u'1/3 cup sugar or agave nectar', u'1/4 cup sambal oelek chile paste', u'1 1/2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 small head red cabbage, halved, cored and shredded', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons sugar or agave nectar', u'2 tablespoons gochujang (Korean chile paste)', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1/2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced crosswise', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u"32 corn tortillas (if using handmade tortillas, you'll only need 16)", u'1 cup heavy-duty mayo (no wimpy stuff)', u'1/4 cup sriracha chile sauce, plus more if necessary']
title: Pak Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Chicken) Tacos with Spicy Slaw and Sriracha Aioli

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Set a large Dutch oven over high heat. Coat the pan with some canola oil. Sprinkle the short ribs pieces all over with salt and pepper. Add them to the pot and brown well on both sides, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Add the garlic and ginger to the pan and saute until fragrant. Then add the red bean paste, mirin, vinegar, sugar and sambal.Mix well to coat the ribs, and then add the chicken stock and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, and then reduce the heat and simmer, partially covered, until the ribs are tender, 30 to 35 minutes.', u'When the ribs are tender, transfer them from the braising liquid to a platter. Add the rice to the pot of braising liquid and stir well. Bring back to a boil, and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Arrange the short rib pieces back on top of the rice in an even layer, and then cover the pot and simmer for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes the liquid will have evaporated and the rice should have puffed up. Remove the lid and cook over medium heat for the last 5 minutes to crisp up the bottom.', u"Serve family style directly from the pot (like a paella or bibimbop) and top with Guy's Homemade Kimchi and garnish with scallions."]
ingredients: [u' Canola oil', u'3 pounds short ribs (cut across the bone in strips), each piece 3/4-inch thick (6 pieces total)', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, minced', u'1/2 cup Korean red bean paste', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'2 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons sambal (chili garlic sauce)', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken stock', u'3 cups long grain white rice', u" Guy's Homemade Kimchi, for garnish, recipe follows", u' Scallions, sliced on the bias, for garnish', u'1 head napa cabbage (about 3 pounds)', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sambal (chili garlic sauce)', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon peeled and grated fresh ginger', u' Freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 cup julienne carrot', u'1 cup julienned daikon', u'2 scallions, cut on the bias into 1-inch-long ribbons']
title: Seoul-ful Ribs with Rice

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Toast sesame seeds until golden in a hot dry nonstick skillet. Set aside to cool. Mix the ground turkey with the remaining ingredients in a medium size bowl, add 2 tablespoons sesame seeds. Form a small meatball sized patty and saute on stove top; taste and adjust spices and herbs. Make a loaf out of the meatloaf mixture, season with salt and pepper. Prepare a roasting pan by spraying with cooking spray. Place the meatloaf in the roasting pan and roast in the oven for about 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 155 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer. Remove from oven and allow the meatloaf to sit for 15 minutes to absorb all the juices and flavors.', u'While the meatloaf is sitting combine the ingredients (including the remaining 2 tablespoons of toasted sesame seeds) for the dipping sauce and whisk to combine all the flavors and to dissolve the honey.', u'Slice the meatloaf into 1-inch slices and drizzle the dipping sauce over it.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'3 pounds ground turkey', u'1 cup chopped scallions', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons fresh grated ginger', u'1/2 cup sesame oil', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro', u'2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u' Fine sea salt', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/2 cup chopped scallions', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup white vinegar', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 teaspoon chili powder']
title: Turkey Meatloaf with Korean Flavors

directions: [u'MARINADE: Cut meat across the grain into very thin slices and then narrow strips. Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, pepper or chili, sesame seeds and green onions.  Marinate beef at least 3 hours, refrigerated.  Remove beef from the marinade.   Cook to desired doneness.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds lean beef tenderloin', u'1/2 cup light soy sauce', u'1/4 cup dark soy sauce', u'1/2 cup water', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped green onion', u'3 teaspoons crushed garlic', u'2 teaspoons finely minced ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons white sesame seeds, toasted and ground', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil']
title: Bulgogi

directions: [u'In a pot, combine the water, ginger, and cinnamon and let simmer for 1/2 hour.  Remove from heat and strain the liquid.  Stir in the sugar and persimmons.  Cool and let sit in the refrigerator overnight.  Serve well chilled with a teaspoon of pine nuts floating in each cup.']
ingredients: [u'2 quarts water', u'1/2 cup fresh ginger, sliced thin', u'3 cinnamon sticks', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'1 cup dried persimmons, sliced', u'1/2 cup pine nuts']
title: Persimmon Punch (Soo Jeung Ga)

directions: [u'In a medium bowl, stir together the garlic, gochujang, mirin, soy sauce, ginger and sesame oil. Add the pork and let marinate at room temperature for about 30 minutes or cover and refrigerate up to overnight.', u'Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Spread the cut sides of the rolls with the butter. Toast the rolls cut-side down, gently pressing on them so the centers toast as well, until lightly golden, about 1 minute. Transfer the rolls to the oven to keep warm.', u'Wipe out the skillet and return it to the stove. Add the vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat. Add the pork and cook, stirring occasionally, until the meat is cooked through and golden and lightly charred in spots, about 5 minutes. Add the onion, mushrooms and chiles and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions and mushrooms have softened slightly, about 2 minutes. Divide the mixture into 2 mounds in the skillet and top each mound with half the cheese. Cover the skillet and cook just until the cheese melts, about 1 minute.', u'Scoop each mound onto a roll, sprinkle with some scallions, sesame seeds, gochugaru and pickled jalapenos.']
ingredients: [u'2 cloves garlic, grated or minced', u'1 tablespoon gochujang (Korean chile paste)', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon grated peeled fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'10 ounces thinly sliced skinless pork belly', u' Two 6-inch soft Italian rolls, split', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 small onion, thinly sliced', u'4 button mushrooms, thinly sliced', u'2 fresh Korean green chiles or jalapenos, seeded and thinly sliced on an angle', u'4 ounces sliced provolone cheese', u'1 scallion (spring onion), thinly sliced on an angle', u' Roasted sesame seeds', u' Gochugaru (Korean chile flakes)', u' Pickled sliced jalapenos, drained']
title: Spicy Pork Belly Cheesesteak

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, water, egg and salt. Stir in the chopped kimchi. Heat a 9-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil and swirl to coat the bottom of the pan. Pour half of the batter into the pan to form a pancake. Cook on the first side until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Using a large spatula, flip the pancake and cook on the reverse side until golden brown. Remove to a plate and repeat with the remaining batter. Cut the pancakes into wedges and serve with soy sauce for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup flour', u'1 cup cold water', u'1 egg, room temperature', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup kimchi, chopped', u'1/4 cup grapeseed oil', u' Soy sauce, for dipping']
title: Kimchi Pancake

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Place cabbage and green onions in a large bowl. In a blender, combine vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chili flakes, and sugar, blending until smooth. With the motor running, slowly add the oil. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.  Pour the dressing over the cabbage and gently toss. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 3 days before serving to let the cabbage wilt and the flavors meld.']
ingredients: [u'1 head Napa cabbage, finely shredded', u'4 green onions, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1/4 cup red chili flakes, plus more to taste', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: "Kimchee" Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut the bacon crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces. Toast the sesame seeds in a large skillet over medium heat until golden, shaking the pan, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Cut the nori sheets in half with shears, then cut into 1/2-inch-thick strips.', u'Heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and stir-fry until almost cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain the kimchi, reserving the liquid. Raise the heat to high and stir-fry the kimchi until browned, 7 to 8 minutes. Add the rice, the reserved kimchi liquid, the sesame oil and half of the nori strips. Continue to cook, turning and flattening the rice mixture with a spatula until it starts to form a golden crust, about 8 minutes. (For more of a crust, remove the pan from the heat, cover and set aside 10 minutes.)', u'Transfer the fried rice to a serving dish and sprinkle with the remaining nori strips and the toasted sesame seeds.', u'Photograph by Tina Rupp']
ingredients: [u'6 to 8 slices thick-cut bacon', u'3 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'3 nori sheets (dried seaweed)', u'3 cups kimchi', u'4 1/2 to 5 cups cooked medium-grain white rice, chilled', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil']
title: Kimchi Fried Rice

directions: [u'In a large mixing bowl combine the panko, sesame seeds, and chile flakes. Season the prawns with salt and pepper and coat well with the flour. Dip the flour-coated prawns into the egg and then the panko mixture. ', u'Prepare a fryer or medium heavy pot one-third full with the oil and heat over high heat to 350 degrees F. Add the prawns to the oil and fry until golden and crispy. Remove the prawns and drain on paper towels, sprinkle with salt.', u'On an oval plate, place a small mound of rice topped with the kimchi. Place two of the prawns over the kimchi and drizzle with the Aioli. Garnish with the sliced scallions.', u'Beverage: Gewurtztraminer']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups panko', u'1/4 white sesame seeds', u'1/4 cup Korean chile flakes', u'8 to 12 large prawns, peeled and de-veined, tails intact, head on', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 cup all-purpose', u'3 whole eggs, beaten with 2 tablespoons cold water', u' Canola oil, for frying', u'1 cup cooked and seasoned brown rice', u' Kimchi, recipe follows', u' Aioli, recipe follows', u'5 scallion greens, thinly sliced on the bias', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'2 medium sized cucumbers, seeds removed and cut in half lengthwise', u'1 cup red onion, thinly sliced', u'1 cup carrots, peeled and thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons fresh ginger, thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon garlic, chopped', u'1/8 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile flakes', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper', u'2 cups rice wine vinegar', u'2 egg yolks*', u'3 tablespoons Korean chile paste', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon garlic, chopped', u'3/4 cup canola oil', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar']
title: Sesame Fried Head-on Prawns with Cucumber Kimchi and Korean Chile Aioli

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Slice the cucumber into thin rounds. Put them into a bowl and toss them with the soy sauce, sesame oil, sesame seeds, mint leaves and salt, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 regular or English cucumbers', u'2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds', u'1/2 bunch fresh mint, leaves only', u' Kosher salt']
title: Cool Sesame Cucumbers

directions: [u'Cut the tofu into rectangles and sprinkle with a little salt. Steam, saute or even microwave the tofu, just to heat it up.', u'Heat a saute pan over high heat for 30 seconds. Add the sliced pork belly and cook for about 5 minutes, until cooked through. Add the kimchee, onion, jalapeno, green onion, garlic, sugar, oyster sauce, chile flakes, corn syrup and soy sauce. Saute for 3 minutes.', u'Plate the tofu like dominoes and top with the kimchee-pork belly mixture. Drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with sesame seeds.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 package firm tofu', u' Salt', u'150 grams pork belly, thinly sliced (slice thicker if preferred)', u'12 ounces fermented kimchee, chopped', u'1 cup sliced onion', u'1 jalapeno, sliced', u'1 green onion, cut into 2- to 2 1/2-inch pieces', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed garlic', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon oyster sauce', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile flakes', u'2 teaspoons corn syrup', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame seeds']
title: Tofu with Pork Belly and Kimchee

directions: [u'Whisk together the vinegar, soy, dashida, sugar, gochuchang, and sesame oil in a large bowl. Add the cucumber and onion and stir until combined. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and let marinate at least 1 hour before eating.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup distilled vinegar or rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u' Dash of dashida (dried soup stock made from essence of seafood or beef)', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons gochuchang paste, plus more to taste, recipe follows', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'4 Korean or kirby cucumbers, thinly sliced', u'1 small white onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted', u'4 tablespoons gochuchang (available at Korean grocers)', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil']
title: Oi Moochim (Seasoned Cucumber)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut each radicchio through the core into 4 even wedges. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. Place the radicchio, cut-side down, in the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Sear the radicchio until the bottoms brown and wilt slightly, about 3 minutes. Turn the wedges over and sear the other sides, about 2 minutes more. Transfer the radicchio to a plate. Add the balsamic vinegar to the pan and boil until syrupy and reduced by about half, about 1 minute. Return the radicchio to the pan and toss to glaze with the balsamic syrup. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Divide the radicchio among 4 plates. Using a vegetable peeler, shave large pieces of cheese over the top. Serve warm.', u'Copyright 2004 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'2 large heads radicchio, about 8 ounces each', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup balsamic vinegar', u'1 to 2 ounce chunk of pecorino or Parmesan']
title: Seared Radicchio with Balsamic and Parmesan

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Sprinkle the watermelon rind with the salt and toss to combine. Set aside for 30 minutes until the moisture has drawn out. Drain the rind and pat dry on a paper-towel-lined baking sheet.', u'Add 1 cup of the watermelon flesh, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, ginger and onion to a food processor. Pulse until combined. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the Korean chili flakes. Add the drained watermelon rind and the scallions and toss to combine. Transfer to a jar and let it rest for at least 12 hours before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 seedless watermelon, rind removed, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces, flesh reserved', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1/2 cup fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'6 cloves garlic', u'1 inch piece fresh ginger, peeled', u'1/2 medium onion', u'1 cup Korean chili flakes', u'1 bunch scallions, sliced']
title: Watermelon Kimchi

directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame seeds, garlic and ginger. Add the beef and stir to coat. Cover and marinate for 30 minutes.', u'In a bowl, stir together the vinegar, granulated sugar, salt and gochugaru. Add the cucumber and stir to coat. Cover and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.', u'Remove the meat from the marinade and transfer the marinade to a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat and cook until reduced by half.', u'Heat the oil in a large skillet set over medium heat. Add the beef and cook, stirring, until just cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the beef to the reduced marinade and stir to coat.', u'Shape the rice into a skull shape and place on a large platter. Use the cucumber slices to create eyes, a nose and mouth on the skull. Place the beef at the base of the skull to serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 cups soy sauce', u'3/4 cup dark brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'1 teaspoon grated garlic', u'1 teaspoon grated ginger', u'1 boneless rib-eye steak, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon gochugaru or crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 English cucumber, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'3 cups cooked white rice']
title: Scare-rean Skull (Korean Beef Bulgogi and Cucumber Kimchi)

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'In a colander in the sink, sprinkle cabbage with salt and toss to combine. Let sit about 1 1/2 hours or until cabbage wilts. Rinse several times with cold water and drain well. Squeeze out any excess water. Combine cabbage with carrots, radish and green onions. In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, water, vinegar, garlic, honey and chile peppers. Place cabbage mixture in a clean glass jar or glass bowl (about 1 quart or larger). Pour liquid over cabbage and place in refrigerator or cool dark place for 24 hours.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 medium head napa cabbage, uncored, roughly chopped (about 1-inch strips)', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 cup julienned (matchstick) carrot', u'1 cup julienned (mathstick) daikon radish', u'2 green onions, split in 1/2, cut in 2-inch sections', u'3/4 cup tamari soy sauce', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/4 cup apple cider vinegar', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'4 dry hot chile peppers, split lengthwise and seeds removed']
title: Kim-Chee - K's way

directions: [u'Score the meat, if necessary, and place between two pieces of plastic wrap, pound lightly with meat pounder, lightly, to tenderize. Slice the meat on the diagonal into thin strips. Place the meat in a shallow non-reactive baking dish.  In a large bowl combine the marinade ingredients and pour them over the meat, mixing well. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.  Preheat the grill. Remove the meat from the marinade. Over high heat grill for 1 to 2 minutes on each side, until meat is nicely browned. Alternately, the meat may be cooked in a very hot frying pan. Wrap a few pieces of beef in a lettuce leaf and all or any of the garnishes. Eat at once.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds sirloin or flank steak', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons Asian (dark) sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons rice wine or sherry', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'4 scallions, minced', u'1 -inch piece of fresh ginger, peeled, crushed and finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 head red leaf lettuce, separated into leaves, washed and dried', u' Julienned scallions mixed with chopped red leaf lettuce, red pepper flakes, sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, black pepper', u' Sliced green chilies', u' Whole peeled and sliced garlic cloves', u' Daikon julienned with vinegar, pickled radish, carrot, julienned', u' Bean paste', u' Pepper paste', u' White rice']
title: Bulgogi (Korean Barbecued Beef)

directions: [u'To make the marinade, stir together marinade ingredients and reserve 1/4 of marinade for sauce. Put steak and remaining marinade in a glass dish turning steak to coat, and marinate at room temperature, turning once, 30 minutes. While steak is marinating, cut apples and mango into 1 1/4-inch sticks.  Toss together with juice and chili sauce and season with salt. Preheat broiler.  Broil steak on rack of broiler pan 2 to 3 inches from heat until slightly charred, 2 to 3 minutes on each side for medium meat. Let steak stand 5 minutes. Cut crosswise. Toss beef in reserved marinade with salt and pepper to taste and divide among lettuce leaves. Top with fruit and sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'1/3 cup chopped scallions', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon Asian sesame oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons Asian chili sauce', u'1 3/4 pounds skirt steak', u'2 small red apples such as Gala', u'1 firm-ripe mango, peeled and pitted', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoon Asian chili sauce, or to taste', u' Salt', u'60 (3 to 4-inch long) Bibb lettuce leaves', u' Toasted sesame seeds']
title: Korean Barbecued Beef

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak, drain and rinse the rice in a strainer until the water runs clear and is not cloudy. Combine the rinsed rice with 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then over and turn the heat down to low. Cook, undisturbed, until the water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and let sit, covered, for another 15 minutes. Uncover and fluff the rice with a fork. Stir in 1 tablespoon sesame oil, the sesame seeds, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, the vinegar, sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Let cool completely (the rice can be refrigerated up to 1 day ahead).', u'Combine the baby spinach with 1 tablespoon water in a microwave-safe bowl. Cover and microwave until wilted, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain and toss with the remaining sesame oil and soy sauce. Set aside.', u'Preheat a waffle iron to medium-high. Generously brush the top and bottom of the waffle iron with sesame oil. Stir the 2 beaten eggs into the cooled rice. Evenly spread about 1/2 cup of the rice mixture in the waffle iron. Close and cook until the rice is golden in spots and can be easily lifted out with a spatula, 4 to 6 minutes. Repeat with the remaining rice mixture. Transfer to two plates and set aside.', u'Lightly brush the waffle iron bottom with more sesame oil. Crack the remaining 2 eggs right onto the waffle iron and keep the iron open. Sprinkle the eggs with salt. Cook until the whites are set and the yolk is still runny, 4 to 5 minutes. Serve an egg on top of each rice waffle.', u'Top with the spinach, kimchi, gochujang paste and sesame seeds.', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup short-grain rice (sushi rice)', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, plus more for brushing waffle iron', u'1 tablespoon toasted white sesame seeds, plus more for garnish', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon rice wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Kosher salt', u'4 ounces baby spinach (about 6 cups)', u'4 large eggs, 2 beaten', u'1/2 cup kimchi', u' Gochujang paste, for serving', u' Special equipment: waffle iron (preferably Belgian style)', u" Cook's Note: Gochujang paste can be found at specialty Asian markets."]
title: Waffled Bibimbap

directions: [u'With the back of a knife, pound each slice of beef lightly to tenderize it.  In a bowl combine the remaining ingredients.  The mixture should have thick consistency.  Add the marinade to the meat and mix well with your hands, making sure each piece is coated.  Cover with plastic and let sit for at least 1 hour.', u'Cook the beef in one layer on a tabletop hibachi.  The meat should be well done, and the outside caramelized.  In a bowl, combine sugar and kochujang.  Pour sesame oil over the mixture.  Serve the beef with green leaf lettuce and the kochujang mixture.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds sirloin, sliced across the grain on the diagonal bias', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 scallions, chopped', u'1 onion, chopped', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons honey', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon kochujang (Korean red pepper paste)', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 head green leaf lettuce']
title: Bulgogi (Barbecued Beef)

directions: [u'Defrost the rice cakes slowly in the refrigerator; then soak in water for about 4 hours.', u'Remove and discard the core and outer leaves of the cabbage and trim the leaves of the tough membranes.  Blanch the cabbage in boiling, salted water for 1 minute until wilted, then shock in ice water.  Roughly chop the cabbage and transfer to a food processor.  Pulse until well chopped.  Squeeze out excess water and transfer to a large bowl. Blanch the soy bean sprouts in the same boiling, salted water for 1 minute and shock in ice water.  Transfer to a food processor and pulse until well chopped.  Squeeze out the excess water and add to the cabbage.  Stir in the chopped tofu.  Transfer the mixture to a cheesecloth lined sieve, place a weighted plate on top of the mixture, and let stand over a bowl in the refrigerator for 2 hours to remove excess water.', u'Transfer the vegetable mixture to a large bowl and add the scallions, garlic, ground meat, salt, and sesame oil.  Mix well.', u'To assemble the wontons, place a teaspoon of the filling in the center of a gyoza wrapper.  Brush the edges with water and pinch the edges to seal.  Repeat with the remaining filling and wrappers. ', u'To make the broth, combine the flank steak and the water in a pot and let simmer for 1 hour.  Remove the meat.  When cool enough to handle, slice the beef thinly against the grain.  Add the salt, soy sauce, and wonton soup base, to the broth.  Drain the rice cakes, add them to the broth, and let simmer for 5 minutes.  Add the wontons and sliced beef and let simmer for about 10 minutes more.', u'Garnish with the scallions, egg and nori.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups sliced, frozen rice cakes', u'1/4 cabbage (about 1/2 pound)', u'1/2 pound mung bean sprouts', u'1 cup firm tofu, chopped', u'3 scallions, green tops removed', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 pound ground lean sirloin', u'1/3 pound ground pork tenderloin', u'1/2 tablespoon salt', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 package gyoza wrappers', u' Black pepper', u'3/4 pound flank steak', u'3 quarts water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1 envelope wonton soup base', u'1 scallion sliced thinly on the diagonal', u'1 beaten egg, cooked in one layer and julienned', u'1 sheet nori (seaweed) cut into 2-inch long julienne']
title: Rice Cake Soup with Wontons (Duk Kook)

directions: [u'In a food processor, add chile paste, garlic, ginger, vinegar, sugar, soy and black pepper. Blend well than drizzle in the oils. While still running, add the scallions and cilantro. Check for seasoning. It should not be salty since salt is added right before grilling. Remove 1/2 cup of the marinade and reserve for sauce. In a dish, completely coat the hanger with remaining marinade and let marinate overnight. On a hot, oiled grill, season hanger with salt and grill, about 8 minutes for medium-rare.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup Korean chile bean paste (gochu-jan)', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup thin soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon coarse ground black pepper', u'1 cup canola oil', u'1/4 cup sesame seed oil', u'1 cup chopped scallions', u'1/3 cup chopped cilantro', u'3 pounds hanger steak, sinew removed', u' Sliced green scallions, for garnish', u' Fried shallots, for garnish (optional)', u'1/2 cup of above marinade', u'1/2 teaspoon of salt', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u' Mix all in a bowl.', u'4 cups rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'2 English cucumbers (hothouse), 1/8-inch half moon slices', u'2 large red onions, 1/8-inch slices', u'1/2 cup sliced garlic', u'1/4 cup Korean chile flakes (gocho-karu)', u'4 halved Thai bird chiles, de-seeded', u'1 cup scallions, 1/2-inch pieces', u' Canola oil to cook', u'4 large whole eggs', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons chopped scallions', u'6 cups cooked jasmin rice, cooled and broken up (usually day old)', u'1/2 pound picked bean sprouts', u'2 tablespoons thin soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sesame seed oil', u' Salt and black pepper to taste']
title: Grilled Marinated Hanger Steak Bulgogi-Style

directions: [u'Slice Spam into 6 slices. Dredge in flour, then dip in egg wash and press into panko. Pan-fry in butter until golden brown. Serve on Kim Chee Fried Rice and top with Truffleyaki Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 can Spam', u' Flour, for dredging', u'2 eggs mixed with 1/2 cup water', u'2 cups panko bread crumbs', u'2 tablespoons butter, for frying', u' Kim Chee Fried Rice, recipe follows', u' Truffleyaki Sauce, recipe follows']
title: Sam's Spam Schnitzel with Truffleyaki Sauce over Kim Chee Fried Rice

directions: [u'Make the pancakes:  In a bowl, combine the flour, egg whites, water, and salt and stir until the batter is smooth.  To a heated non-stick pan, add the oil.  Drop in tablespoons of batter to form thin pancakes about 3-inches in diameter.  Fry lightly on both sides.  Transfer to a plate.  Using a 3-inch ring mold or cup, cut the pancakes into a perfect circle.', u'Make the fillings:  In a bowl, combine the beef, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, scallion, honey, and black pepper.  Saute the mixture in a pan until the beef is cooked through, about 5 minutes.  Set aside.', u'Poach the shrimp in salted water, about 3 minutes.  When cool enough to handle, julienne the shrimp.  Set aside.', u'Poach the chicken in salted water until cooked through, about 10 minutes.  When cool enough to handle, shred the chicken.  Add salt and pepper to taste.  Set aside.', u'Blanch the spinach for about 1 minute and then quickly transfer to an ice bath.  Squeeze excess water from the spinach and julienne.  In a bowl, combine the spinach with 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil, salt and pepper to taste.  Set aside.', u'Squeeze excess water from the shiitake mushrooms, remove the stems and discard, and julienne the mushroom caps.  To a heated pan, add 1 tablespoon sesame oil.  Add mushrooms, salt and pepper to taste and saute until mushrooms are soft, about 1 minute.  Set aside.', u'Add another tablespoon sesame oil to the pan with the carrots, salt and pepper to taste.  Saute until the carrots are slightly cooked but not completely soft, about 1 minute.  Set aside.', u'Add a pinch of salt and pepper to the whites and yolks and stir to combine.  To a heated non-stick pan on moderately low heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil.  Pour the egg whites into the pan and swirl the pan around to form a thin layer with the egg whites.  Once the eggs have cooked through, turn them out onto a plate.  Repeat the process with the yolks.  Let cool, then julienne the whites and yolks.  Set aside.', u'When ready to serve, place each filling into a compartment of the kujolpan dish, with the pancakes in the center compartment.  Alternatively, pile the pancakes in the center of a large platter and arrange the 8 fillings around the pancakes.  To eat, take a pancake and fill it with any combination of fillings to taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup flour', u'2 egg whites', u'1 cup water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon oil', u'1/4 pound sirloin steak, trimmed and cut into very thin strips', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/2 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 garlic clove, finely chopped', u'1 scallion, minced', u'1 teaspoon honey', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 chicken breast', u'1 pound spinach', u'3 tablespoons sesame oil, or more to taste', u'8 dried shiitake mushrooms, hydrated', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'2 eggs, separated into whites and yolks, beaten', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil']
title: Kujolpan (Nine Section Appetizers)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large, non-reactive bowl, combine 1/2 cup soy sauce, the minced garlic, 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil, 1 teaspoon of the mirin, and the red pepper flakes. Add the meat toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally. ', u'Preheat the grill. Mix the remaining 1/4 cup soy sauce with remaining 1 teaspoon of sesame oil. Add the green onions (scallions), and garlic, and toss to combine. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the remaining teaspoon of mirin, the chili powder and sesame seeds. ', u'Remove the steak from the marinade and pat dry. Grill for 1 minute on each side for medium-rare.', u'Lay the lettuce leaves on a flat work surface and rub the mirin mixture on the insides of the leaves. Set aside.', u'Lay several slices of cooked steak in center of each leaf, drizzle with about 1 tablespoon of the seasoned green onions (scallions), and top with 2 garlic slivers. Fold the lettuce over the steak and wrap tightly. Repeat with the remaining ingredients and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons mirin', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'2 pounds sirloin or flank steak, sliced thinly on the bias', u'1/2 cup julienned green onions (scallions)', u'2 teaspoons hot red chili powder', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', u'40 very thin slices garlic', u'20 large green or red lettuce leaves']
title: Banja Gui: Barbecued Beef in a Lettuce Wrapper (Korea)

directions: [u'In a large pot of boiling, lightly salted water, blanch spinach for about 2 minutes, until just tender. Drain well. Pat the spinach dry with a towel or squeeze dry with hands. Chop spinach into large pieces. In a large bowl combine sugar, soy and sesame oil. Add spinach add toss to coat. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve warm or chilled.Yield: 4 servings', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 pound baby spinach, washed', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'1 pound fiddlehead ferns', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted']
title: Pibimbap

directions: [u'For the steak: In a resealable plastic bag, combine the brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, fish sauce and garlic. Add the steak, toss to coat and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.', u'For the fries: Preheat a deep fryer to 375 degrees F. Line a sheet pan with a cooling rack or paper towels.', u'In a large bowl, combine 1 cup of the rice flour and the all-purpose flour. Add the soda water and whisk to combine. In a separate dish, combine the remaining 1 cup rice flour and 1 tablespoon salt. Working a few at a time, dredge the potatoes in the rice flour then the tempura batter. Shake off any excess batter and carefully place the fries in the fryer; cook until golden brown and tender, about 8 minutes. Transfer the fries to the prepared sheet pan and season with salt. Set aside, and repeat for the remaining fries.', u'Preheat a grill or grill pan to high heat and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Remove the steak from the marinade and brush with some canola oil. Place on the grill and cook for about 5 minutes per side. Transfer the steak to a sheet pan and finish cooking in the oven until medium rare, 7 to 10 minutes. Transfer the steak to a cutting board and rest for at least 5 minutes, tented with foil.', u'For the slaw: In a large bowl, combine the carrots, scallions and cabbage. In a separate bowl, combine the agave, vinegar, gochugaru, sesame seeds, fish sauce and salt. Add enough dressing to lightly coat the vegetables. Reserve the remaining dressing for another use.', u'Slice the steak, and then serve with the kimchi slaw and tempura fries.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u' One 1 1/4-inch-thick boneless New York strip steak (about 1 pound)', u' Canola oil, for brushing', u'2 cups rice flour', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 cups soda water', u' Kosher salt', u'4 russet potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch-thick fries', u'2 carrots, julienned', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced on the bias', u'1/2 small head Napa cabbage, thinly sliced crosswise', u'1/4 cup agave', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 to 2 tablespoons gochugaru', u'1 to 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt']
title: Bulgogi-Style Steak with Kimchi Slaw and Tempura Fries

directions: [u'In a bowl, soak the vermicelli in hot water for 15 minutes.  Drain the noodles, drop into a pot of boiling water for 30 seconds, and then rinse in cold water.  Cut the noodles with kitchen shears.', u'Heat a large pan.  Add 2 tablespoons sesame oil.  Add the onion, carrot, red bell pepper, scallions, mushrooms, garlic, sugar, salt and pepper.  Let cook for a few minutes, stirring, until the vegetables are cooked but still a little crisp.  Transfer the vegetables to a bowl.  To the pan add 1 more tablespoon sesame oil.  Add the noodles, spinach, salt and pepper.  Let cook for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring.  Add to the vegetables with 1 tablespoon soy sauce and 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds and combine.', u'Transfer to a platter.  Serve hot or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound Asian vermicelli noodles', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 onion, julienned', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'1 red bell pepper, julienned', u'3 scallions, cut into 1-inch lengths', u'1/2 cup dried wood ear mushrooms', u'2 cloves minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 pound spinach, stems discarded', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds']
title: Jap Chae (Stir Fried Glass Noodles with Vegetables)

directions: [u'In a large jar or large container, combine all ingredients, except red bell pepper cover, and let sit at room temperature for 2 days.  Serve cold with the red pepper garnish.  The kimchi may be stored, chilled, for up to 1 week.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound Chinese radish, sliced into 2 by 1/2 by 1/8-inch slices', u'1 1/2 quarts water', u'2 large or 3 small cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 dried red pepper', u'1/2 tablespoon salt', u'2 scallions, sliced into 2-inch pieces', u'1/2 cup red bell pepper, julienned for garnish']
title: Water Kimchi (Mul Kimchi)

directions: [u'In a large pot of boiling salted water blanch spinach for 1 to 2 minutes and refresh. Squeeze water out firmly but do not wring. Lightly toss spinach to separate stems and leaves, and place in a bowl.', u'In a hot dry skillet, toast sesame seeds until they begin to pop. Reserve a teaspoon of toasted seeds for garnish. Transfer the rest of the seeds to a spice grinder or mortar and pestle. Grind until smooth. Pour into a bowl, if necessary, and add sugar, soy sauce and dashi. Mix well and pour over spinach. Toss to coat. Garnish with reserved seeds.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound spinach', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons  soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons dashi (recipe above)']
title: Spinach with Sesame Dressing

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Wrap pork tenderloin in plastic wrap, and place in freezer until firm but not frozen, about 20 minutes. Remove plastic and slice very thin.', u'In a medium nonmetallic bowl, whisk together seasoned salt, soy sauce and black pepper. Add pork slices and let marinate for 5 minutes. Heat a large saute pan on high. Add oil and cook pork until cooked through, 3 minutes. Remove to a platter with rice and lettuce cups.', u'In a small bowl mix together onions, rice wine vinegar, and chili flakes. Set aside.', u'In assembly-line fashion, lay out in separate bowls on a platter, the onion marinade, sliced garlic, sliced jalepeno, Sriracha sauce, miso paste and cabbage. ', u'To serve, place onto a lettuce leaf, 1/2 teaspoon of sriracha, 1/2 teaspoon miso paste, 3 pieces of pork, 3 tablespoons of rice, 2 slices of garlic and jalapeno, 2 tablespoons of cabbage, and 1 teaspoon of green onions with rice wine vinegar. Roll up. Repeat with remaining lettuce leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound pork tenderloin', u'1 teaspoon seasoned salt', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 cups cooked short-grain rice', u'8 outer whole leaves from head iceberg lettuce', u'1/2 cup diced green onions', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon red chili flakes', u'3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced to equal 3 tablespoons', u'2 jalepenos, thinly sliced to equal 3 tablespoons', u'3 tablespoons Sriracha hot sauce', u'3 tablespoons dark miso paste', u'1 cup thinly sliced green cabbage']
title: Garden of Good and Evil Bulgogi

directions: [u'In a bowl, whisk together the flour, water, and egg whites until the batter is smooth.  Stir in the clams, scallions, and salt.  To a heated pan, add the oil.  Scoop 2 tablespoons of the batter into the pan to form pancakes about 3-inches in diameter.  Let cook for about 3 minutes per side until golden.', u'To make the sauce, combine all sauce ingredients.  Serve the pancakes immediately with the sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup flour', u'1/4 cup rice flour', u'2 egg whites', u'1 cup water', u'1/2 cup fresh cherrystone clams, chopped', u'2 bunches scallions (white parts only), cut into batons', u'2 tablespoons serrano or green Thai-bird chilies, sliced', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons oil', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1 clove garlic, chopped', u'2 teaspoons chopped scallion', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper']
title: Clam and Scallion Pancakes (Jogae Pa Jon)

directions: [u'In a bowl, soak the roots in water overnight, rinse, and squeeze dry.  Tear the roots into long, thin strips, using a paring knife.  Rub 1 tablespoon salt into the roots using your hands to remove the bitterness of the roots.  Rinse with water and squeeze out excess water.  In a bowl, combine the roots with the remaining ingredients.  Mix well.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup dried toraji (bellflower roots)', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon Korean red pepper powder', u'1/2 teaspoon kochujang (Korean red pepper paste)', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'1 teaspoon vinegar', u'1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds']
title: Toraji Namul (Bellflower Root Salad)

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the gochujang, chile powder, sugar, sesame oil, vinegar, salt and 1 teaspoon cold water. Pull apart the leaves of the bok choy and wash and dry well. Add the bok choy to the bowl with the dressing and toss gently to coat. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 teaspoon gochujang (Korean chile paste)', u'1/4 teaspoon Korean chile powder or red pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon rice wine vinegar', u'1/8 teaspooon kosher salt', u'2 to 3 heads baby bok choy', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame seeds, toasted']
title: Spicy Sesame Bok Choy

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the wings: Place the wings in a resealable plastic bag. To the wings, add the sesame oil, soy sauce and lime juice. Seal the bag and mix the wings around to coat in the marinade. Place in the refrigerator and marinate for 3 hours.', u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Spread the wings on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.', u'For the sauce: While the wings are baking, combine the honey, chili paste, soy sauce, sesame oil, lime juice and garlic in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk until smooth. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and cook until the mixture has thickened, about 5 minutes.', u'Remove the wings from the oven and brush with the sauce. Using a metal spatula, toss to coat well. Return the tray to the oven and cook an additional 5 to 10 minutes or until glazed and cooked through. Toss the cooked wings to coat well and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds chicken wings, split and tips discarded', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon lime juice, from 1 lime', u'3 tablespoons clover honey', u'1 tablespoon Korean chili paste', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons lime juice', u'1 clove garlic, peeled and smashed']
title: Sticky Baked Chicken Wings

directions: [u'Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring now and then, until the onions begin to soften and just begin to brown, about 10 minutes. Turn the heat to high and add the kimchi and cook for 2 or 3 minutes until it begins to crisp on the edges. Add the soy sauce and rice and stir thoroughly to combine. Cook until the rice is warmed through and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Transfer the rice to a warm, shallow bowl and set aside.', u'Wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel and add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan and return it to the stove set over high heat. Crack the egg into the skillet, sprinkle it with a pinch of salt and immediately cover the pan with a lid. Cook until the egg white is cooked through and the yolk is barely set. Slip a spatula underneath the egg and transfer it on top of the rice. Scatter the scallion over the dish and sprinkle with the chili powder. Eat immediately, being sure to break the yolk and let is act like a sauce over the rice.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 cup finely chopped yellow onion', u'1 small garlic clove, finely minced', u' Coarse salt', u'1/2 cup finely chopped very sour kimchi', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1 cup day-old cooked rice, at room temperature', u'1 very good egg', u'1 scallion, white and light green parts only, very thinly sliced', u'1 generous pinch coarse Korean chili powder']
title: Kimchi Fried Rice with Fried Egg

directions: [u'In a 16-ounce cocktail shaker, add the basil leaves and the strawberry puree. Muddle until the basil leaves are broken into pieces.  Add the ice cubes, then add the soju, lime juice, sweet and sour mix and strawberry syrup.  Shake vigorously.  Strain the drink into a 7-ounce chilled martini glass and serve cold.']
ingredients: [u'7 basil leaves with stems', u'1 -ounce strawberry puree', u'1 cup ice cubes', u'2 1/2 ounces soju (Korean vodka)', u'1/2 -ounce lime juice', u'1/2 -ounce sweet and sour mix', u'1/2 -ounce strawberry syrup']
title: Strawberry Basil Martini

directions: [u'Put the pork skin in a large pot and cover with water by 4 inches. Boil the skin for 2 hours.', u'Drain the skin, return to the pot and cover with cold water. Drain again. Once cool enough to handle, stack the skin between kitchen towels and put in the refrigerator until thoroughly chilled.', u"Scrape any remaining fat off the skin using a spoon (or other utensil with a good scraping edge). It's important to get as much fat off the skin as possible. Cut into rectangles approximately 2 inches by 1/2 inch. Dehydrate on the lowest temperature setting for 48 hours. The skin should look like brownish hard plastic.", u'Heat oil to 375 degrees F in a deep-fryer or in a heavy pot. Fry the skin until puffed, 30 seconds to a minute. Remove the pork rinds to a paper towel-lined bowl and season with Chile Lime Salt.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds raw pork skin', u' Grapeseed oil or other neutral-flavored oil, for frying', u' Chile Lime Salt, for serving, recipe follows', u' Special equipment: a dehydrator; a deep fryer or heavy pot', u'1 cup kosher salt', u'4 tablespoons lime juice', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile flakes', u'1/2 tablespoon Cajun blackening seasoning', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u' Zest from 4 limes']
title: Pork Rinds with Chile Lime Salt

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'Special equipment: metal or wooden skewers', u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the pineapple juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, vegetable oil, gochujang and garlic. Pour into a large resealable plastic bag and add the pork, moving the bag around to ensure the marinade coats all of the pork. Seal the bag and refrigerate for 1 1/2 hours.', u'After 1 1/2 hours, remove the bag with the meat from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. If using wooden skewers, soak in water at this point.', u'Heat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.', u"Remove the pork from the marinade and discard the marinade. Thread 5 to 6 pork cubes on each skewer. Season the pork on all sides with a pinch of salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Grill and flip to cook on all sides until cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Serve immediately with Sunny's Baked Pineapple Rice (or cover with aluminum foil until serving)."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup pineapple juice', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup packed brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon gochujang (Korean chili paste)', u'1 clove garlic, grated on a rasp grater or finely minced', u'1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1-inch cubes', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u" Sunny's Baked Pineapple Rice, recipe follows, for serving", u'1 cup jasmine rice, rinsed', u'4 pineapple rings, cut into chunks', u'1/2 cup coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u' Freshly cracked black pepper', u'1/4 cup toasted almond slivers', u'2 scallions, white and green parts, finely chopped']
title: Sunny's Pork Kebabs and Baked Pineapple Rice

directions: [u'In a large bowl, mix flour and chile. Whisk in soda water until a pancake batter consistency is achieved. Completely coat the crab in the batter. Lightly drop in 350 degree F oil and fry for 4 to 5 minutes until golden brown. Season with salt and drain on paper towels.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups rice flour', u'1 teaspoon korean chile flakes (kucho karo)', u'1 quart cold soda water', u'4 cleaned soft shell crabs, primes or hotels', u'4 mini baguettes or hoagies, lightly toasted', u'2 cups rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons korean chile flakes', u'1/2 tablespoon salt', u'1/2 tablespoon sugar', u'1 small head Napa cabbage, 1/2-inch slices (about 6 cups)', u'2 medium carrots, peeled, 2-inch fine julienne', u'12 cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 1/16-inch']
title: Soft Shell Po-Boy with "Kimchi" Slaw

directions: [u'Pre-heat a grill very hot. In a skillet coat lightly with oil and  on high heat, saute the pepper and lapchong until soft, about 4 minutes. Fold in rice and add the scallions, cilantro and oyster sauce. Season and check. Stuff the squid tubes using a pastry bag or plastic bag with the tip cut off. Oil the grill and season the tubes with salt and chile. Mark the tubes, and roll them around so that all sides cook evenly, about 5 minutes total. Be careful not to overcook the squid as it will get tough. Let rest 1 minute then slice into one inch pieces, like sushi.']
