ingredients: [u'1 red bell pepper fine diced', u'2 each lapchong, fine diced (may substitute with sausage)', u'2 cups cooked sushi rice', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'12 each medium sized squid tubes', u' Salt, to taste', u'1 tablespoon chile powder (Korean or ancho)', u' Canola oil to cook', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 each serrano chiles, minced', u'1 tablespoon rinsed, minced fermented black beans', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 egg yolks', u'1 cup canola oil', u' Salt and black pepper to taste']
title: Grilled Stuffed Calamari 'Sushi' with Black Bean Aioli

author: Sunny Anderson
directions: [u'Special equipment: a deep-frying thermometer and a waffle iron', u'For the chicken: In a large bowl, whisk the buttermilk, gochujang and 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Pour into a resealable plastic bag and add the chicken. Seal and massage the bag to coat the chicken; refrigerate overnight or for at least 4 hours.', u'In a large bowl, mix the flour, cornstarch, a pinch of salt and a few grinds of pepper. Remove the marinated chicken from the bag and shake off the excess marinade. Drop all of the chicken into the flour mixture and toss to coat. Let rest, refrigerated, for 1 hour. Toss again, then rest for 30 minutes in the refrigerator, followed by 30 minutes at room temperature.', u'In a cast-iron pan or deep fryer, add about 2 inches peanut oil and heat to 375 degrees F. Toss the chicken one last time, then shake off the excess flour. In batches, add the chicken gently to the oil and fry until cooked through and the juices run clear, 12 to 16 minutes. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate and sprinkle with a pinch of salt. Repeat with the remaining chicken.', u'For the waffles: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.', u'In a large bowl, sift together the flour and baking powder. Add the salt and 2 tablespoons of the sugar. In a medium bowl, whisk the egg yolks until smooth, then add the milk, vegetable oil and almond extract. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Pour in the liquid ingredients and gently stir the batter with a wooden spoon until just combined. Be careful not to overmix. In a large bowl, whisk the egg whites until foamy. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and beat until soft peaks form. Gently fold the whites into the batter.', u"Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions. Lightly coat the top and bottom of the iron with cooking spray.", u"Pour about 1/2 cup to 2/3 cup batter into the waffle iron. Cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes depending on the manufacturer's instructions. Transfer to a serving platter and keep warm in the oven. Repeat with the remaining batter. Serve the waffles warm with the fried chicken and maple syrup."]
ingredients: [u'2 cups buttermilk', u'1/2 cup gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste), slightly melted to loosen', u' Kosher salt and coarsely ground black pepper', u'4 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs', u'4 whole (drum, flat and tip) bone-in, skin-on chicken wings', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup cornstarch', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'6 large eggs, separated', u'3 1/2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 teaspoon almond extract', u' Cooking spray, for spraying the waffle iron', u' Maple syrup, for serving']
title: Sunny's Spicy Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Waffles

directions: [u'To prepare the ogo: Blanch the ogo in a pot of boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes. Drain ogo and rinse under cold, running water. Soak ogo in ice water for 5 minutes, to seal in flavor and crunchiness. Drain well and place in a large bowl.', u'Add Fresh Lemon Dressing, garlic, chile paste, and soy sauce, and mix well.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ogo', u'3/4 cup Fresh Lemon Dressing, recipe follows', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon Korean chile pepper paste', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 cup lemon juice, strained', u'2 cups water', u'1/2 cup distilled vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon white pepper', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon grated lemon rind', u'1 1/4 cups sugar']
title: Ogo (Seaweed) Salad with Fresh Lemon Dressing

directions: [u'Whisk together all the marinade ingredients in a large baking dish. Add the ribs and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight; it is best if marinated overnight. ', u'Heat grill to high. Remove short ribs from marinade and grill short ribs until slightly charred and tender and cooked to desired degree of doneness. Serve short ribs with white rice and kimchee.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 Korean pear or Asian pear, grated with juices', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped garlic', u'1/2 small white onion, grated or sliced', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon ground red pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'2 green onions, thinly sliced', u'1 (20-ounce) bottle lemon-lime soda, optional (recommended: Sprite or 7-Up)', u'4 pounds short ribs', u' Cooked white rice, for serving', u' Prepared kimchee, for serving (available at Korean grocers)']
title: Kalbi (Marinated Short Ribs)

directions: [u'Two to three hours in advance, combine the water, salt, sugar, soy sauce, peppercorns, ginger, anise, and bay leaves in a cooler large enough to hold the turkey and stir to mix. Taste the brine, it should taste like sweet ocean water. Adjust salt and or turkey to taste. Add the turkey, if it is not covered, add more water and adjust seasoning accordingly. Fill the cooler with ice packs and cover.', u'Fry in 375 degree F oil until cooked through 10 to 12 minutes depending on piece. Remove the turkey and season with the same chile salt used for the fries. ', u'Note: If you would like to do some of the cooking in advance, heat oil to 345 degrees F and blanch the turkey for 10 minutes. Later when ready to serve, heat the oil to 375 degrees F and finish cooking until a meat thermometer registers 170 and the skin is crisp and golden.', u'Plating: Arrange the turkey in the center of the plate, stick spears out of the turkey with the cranberry syrup in a small separate bowl. Sprinkle with chile salt, garnish with fried sage leaves. Dip in cranberry syrup, and enjoy.', u'Serve the turkey, if desired, with sweet potato fries and garnish with sage leaves that have been fried at 375 degrees F for 1minute until crisp and translucent, not brown.']
ingredients: [u'1 (12 to 15 pound) small turkey (cut with a cleaver: leg/thigh/ breasts cut into 3 parts)', u'8 cups water', u'2/3 cup kosher salt', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons toasted Szechwan peppercorns', u'2 tablespoons toasted black peppercorns, plus freshly ground black pepper', u'10 1/4 inch thick slices fresh ginger', u'4 star anise', u'4 bay leaves', u'2 bunches sage, leaves picked from stems', u' Cranberry syrup, recipe follows', u' Sweet potato Fries, recipe follows', u' Cranberry Dipping Sauce', u'1 large red onion, jullienned', u'2 tablespoons ginger, finely chopped', u'3 cups cranberries', u'1 orange, zested and juiced', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 cups cranberry juice, sweetened', u'1/2 cup sugar, or less, to taste', u' Salt and pepper', u' Sweet Potato Fries', u'3 large sweet potatoes, cut into spears', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon Korean chile flakes', u'1 teaspoon ginger powder', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u' Canola oil, for frying']
title: Asian-Spiced Fried Turkey with Sweet Potato Fries and Cranberry Syrup

directions: [u'In a large resealable bag, combine the ginger, half of the green onions, the garlic, jalapeno, orange zest and juice, teriyaki sauce and short ribs. Swirl around a few times to cover the ribs in the marinade. Marinate for at least 3 hours and up to overnight in the refrigerator. Midway thru, swirl the ribs again to ensure the marinade covers all.', u'Prepare a grill for medium-high heat. Remove the ribs from the marinade and shake off any excess liquid; reserve the remaining marinade for the sauce. Grill the ribs until well caramelized and cooked to desired doneness, 5 to 7 per side. Remove to a serving platter.', u'Meanwhile, pour the marinade from the bag into a saucepan. Bring to a rapid boil over high heat and boil until reduced by half, at least 5 minutes.', u'Pour the sauce over the grilled ribs. Sprinkle with the remaining green onions, and garnish with sesame seeds and orange slices. Serve with kimchi.']
ingredients: [u' One 4-inch piece fresh ginger, cut into matchsticks', u'4 green onions, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 jalapeno, seeded and chopped', u'1 orange, zested and juiced, plus orange slices, for serving', u' One 10-ounce bottle teriyaki sauce', u'2 pounds Korean-style short ribs (beef chuck flanken cut into 1/3- to 1/2-inch-thick slices across the bones)', u' Toasted sesame seeds, for garnish', u' Kimchi, for serving']
title: Dad's Hawaiian-Style Beef Short Ribs

directions: [u'In a large mixing bowl, combine the panko, red pepper flakes, parsley, salt and pepper. ', u'Dip each breast into the flour, then the eggs, and then the panko mixture. ', u'Fill a fryer or medium heavy pot 1/3 full with the oil, heat over high heat to 350 degrees F. Add the coated breasts and allow them to cook through, about 8 to 10 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'4 boneless chicken breasts', u'6 cups panko crumbs', u'2 tablespoons Korean red pepper flakes', u'1 bunch parsley, leaves only, chopped', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'3 whole eggs, beaten with 2 tablespoons cold water', u' Salt and pepper', u' Canola oil, for frying', u'4 leaves red leaf lettuce', u'4 slices tomato', u'4 small pain de campagne', u'1 jalapeno, chopped', u'1 serrano chile, chopped', u'1 dried Thai bird chile, ground', u'1 teaspoon Korean red pepper flakes', u'1/2 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 egg yolk*', u'1 1/2 cups canola oil', u' Sugar, to taste', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'3 baking potatoes, like russets, washed, and thinly sliced', u' Canola oil, for deep frying', u' Salt']
title: Panko Crusted Chicken Sandwich with Four Chile Aioli

directions: [u'For the garlic mixture: Place the oil and garlic in a shallow frying pan. Mix until combined and the oil just covers the garlic, adding more oil as necessary. Cook over medium heat until the oil begins to bubble and the garlic turns golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Immediately remove from the heat and drain off the oil. Set the garlic aside and let cool.', u'For the BBQ marinade: Combine the pear puree, sugar, soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice wine, pepper, schichimi togarashi and 5-spice powder in a 2-quart saucepan and mix thoroughly with a whisk. Cook over high heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the prepared garlic mixture, lower the heat and simmer until slightly thickened, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the onion and scallion. Let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, remove any excess fat and sinew from the ribs. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes and transfer to a 4-quart container.', u'Slowly pour the cooled BBQ marinade over the ribs and mix until thoroughly coated. Marinate the ribs in the refrigerator at least 8 hours.', u'Drain the ribs and onion of excess BBQ marinade through a sieve or strainer. Heat the oil in a frying pan over high heat, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the ribs and onion and cook, mixing often to prevent burning, until caramelized and cooked to desired doneness, 2 to 3 minutes for medium-rare, 3 to 5 minutes for medium. Serve on rice, bread or salad.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more if needed', u'8 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup Asian pear puree (preferably from Korean Shingo pears)', u'2 heaping tablespoons Chinese yellow rock sugar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine', u'1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon shichimi togarashi (Japanese 7-spice powder)', u' Pinch 5-spice powder', u'1 medium yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'1 inch scallion, sliced', u'2 pounds uncut boneless short ribs', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil']
title: 7-Spice Garlic BBQ Short Ribs

directions: [u'Fill a large bowl with cold water and soak the arugula to remove any dirt and sand. Once clean, pat the greens dry and place in a large mixing bowl. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with the vinaigrette, just enough to coat the greens. Equally divide the arugula and place into 4 shallow bowls. Arrange 3 shrimp on top of the greens and garnish with the jicama, corn, tomatoes, and fried wonton wrappers.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound arugula', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u' Chile-Lime Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u' Grilled Tamarind Shrimp, recipe follows', u'1 medium jicama, peeled and julienned', u'3 ears grilled corn, kernels only', u'1 pint pear tomatoes, halved', u'10 square wonton wrappers, thinly sliced and deep fried', u'1/2 cup sesame oil', u'1 cup lime juice', u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon fresh ginger, minced', u'2 tablespoons Korean chile flakes', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 1/2 cups canola oil', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'12 medium shrimps', u'1/2 package of tamarind', u'1/2 cup mirin', u'2 cups hot water', u'2 tablespoons molasses', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon sriracha']
title: Arugula Salad with Grilled Tamarind Shrimp and Chile-Lime Vinaigrette

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'In a small bowl, combine the egg yolks, chile paste, and salt. Rub on the venison loin and marinate, refrigerated, for 2 hours. ', u'Remove venison from marinade and coat with spice crumb mixture. Heat olive oil in pan. Sear presentation side of venison, then flip, and place in oven for 10 minutes. Slice to serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound venison', u'2 egg yolks', u'1 tablespoon Korean chile paste (available in Japanese grocery stores)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup bread crumbs', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon ginger powder', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon Korean chile powder', u'1/2 teaspoon white pepper', u'1 teaspoon nori seaweed', u'3 tablespoons olive oil']
title: Spiced Venison

directions: [u'For the cucumber kimchi: Combine the cucumbers, garlic, soy sauce, carrots, sesame oil, vinegar, sugar, sesame seeds, chile paste and chile flakes in an airtight container. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours.', u'For the marinade: Combine the Asian pears, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, scallions, carrots, bell peppers, ginger, brown sugar and cilantro in a baking dish or large shallow bowl. Add the steak and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 12 hours.', u'Cook the rice according to the package directions. Keep covered to retain heat and set aside.', u'Cut each lettuce head in half and remove the root end. Pick off several leaves and stack them to form a bowl. Set 12 portions aside.', u'Heat the canola oil in a frying pan or flat top grill to medium high heat. Remove the steaks from the marinade and, cooking in batches if necessary and turning once, sear until thoroughly cooked and the meat reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees F. Set the steaks aside to rest before slicing very thin.', u'To serve: Scoop some rice into a lettuce bowl. Top with some sliced steak and cucumber kimchi. Garnish with some sesame seeds, cilantro and scallions. Repeat with the remaining ingredients to make a total of 12 bowls.']
ingredients: [u'4 cucumbers, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'3/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup julienned carrots', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons white vinegar', u'4 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'1 tablespoon Korean chile paste', u'1 tablespoon Korean red chile flakes', u'2 to 3 Asian pears, chopped', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sesame oil', u'6 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 cup sliced scallions', u'1/4 cup julienned carrots', u'1/4 cup julienned red bell peppers', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh ginger', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped', u' Six 6-ounce rib-eye steaks', u'6 cups Jasmine rice', u'2 to 3 heads butter or iceberg lettuce', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u' Sesame seeds, for garnish', u' Fresh cilantro, for garnish', u' Scallions, chopped, for garnish']
title: Gangnam Bowls

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'For the kimchi slaw: Combine the Napa cabbage, kimchi, cilantro, sesame seeds, mint, rice vinegar and soy sauce in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.', u'For the orange-glazed short ribs: Lay the short ribs out on a baking sheet, drizzle with 2 tablespoons of the oil and season with the cumin, five spice, salt and pepper. Let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes.', u'Combine the orange juice, ginger and garlic in a small saucepan, season with salt and pepper and cook until reduced to about 1/2 cup of glaze, about 30 minutes. Stir in the honey, strain into a bowl and let cool slightly. Discard the ginger and garlic.', u'Heat a nonstick pan with the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat until it begins to shimmer. Add the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the whites set and the yolks are slightly firm, about 2 minutes. Flip the eggs over and continue to cook for about 40 seconds longer. Transfer to a warm plate and reserve. Trim if desired.', u'Heat a grill pan over high heat. Lay the ribs on the grill pan and cook until golden brown and just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side, brushing with the orange glaze several times. Trim the bones and set aside.', u'For the kochujang glaze: Whisk together the kochujang, honey and vinegar. Set aside.', u'To serve: Put 2 ribs in the center of each lettuce wrap, top with some kimchi slaw and an egg and drizzle with the kochujang glaze. Garnish with more toasted sesame seeds, chopped mint and cilantro, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup Napa cabbage, finely shredded', u'1/2 cup kimchi, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 cup sesame seeds, lightly toasted, plus more for garnish', u'6 leaves fresh mint, chopped, plus more for garnish', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u"1 1/4 pounds Korean-style beef short ribs (see Cook's Notes)", u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground Chinese five spice', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups fresh orange juice', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, coarsely chopped', u'1 head garlic, halved crosswise', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'6 large eggs', u' Butter lettuce leaves, for serving', u"1/2 cup kochujang (see Cook's Notes)", u'2 tablespoon clover honey', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar']
title: Orange-Glazed Shortribs with Kimchi Slaw

directions: [u'Special equipment: 8 souffle cups; a deep fryer and deep-fry thermometer', u'For the ramen bun: Cook the ramen noodles as instructed on the package. Drain the excess water. In a large bowl, mix together the egg, package of ramen spice seasoning and the noodles until combined and the noodles are coated well.', u'Evenly divide the noodles among 8 souffle cups. Allow them to set in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.', u"Heat a saute pan over medium-high heat. Add enough oil to coat the pan's surface. Tap the souffle cups upside down to release the ramen noodles and sear the patties on both sides until golden brown.", u'For the kimchi ketchup: combine the ketchup and Korean chili paste in a bowl, mix to combine and set aside.', u'For the beef patty: Heat a grill to medium-high heat. Combine the beef, cilantro, chili sauce, ketchup, soy sauce and cumin in a bowl.  Form the mixture into four 4-ounce rounds, and grill to desired doneness.', u'For the potato chips: Thinly slice the potatoes and keep them in a bowl of cold water until ready to fry. Preheat the oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees F. Remove the potato slices from the water and pat dry. Fry the potatoes until they start to turn tan in color, then transfer to a paper towel and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Once the chips are cool, fry them a second time until golden brown. Drain on a paper towel and season with salt.', u'For the sriracha aioli: Combine the mayonnaise, sriracha, honey and paprika in a bowl and set aside.', u'To serve: Place a beef slider on a ramen bun. Top with some kimchi ketchup, pickled ginger and a second bun. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Serve with the potato chips and sriracha aioli for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'2 packages ramen noodles, plus 1 package ramen spice seasoning (reserve the remaining seasoning for another use)', u'1 large egg', u' Canola oil, for cooking', u'3 cups ketchup', u'1 cup Korean chili paste', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro stems, chopped (reserve the leaves for another use)', u'1/2 cup sweet chili sauce', u'3 tablespoons ketchup', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons cumin', u'2 Idaho potatoes', u' Canola oil, for frying', u' Salt', u'2 cups mayonnaise', u'1/2 cup sriracha', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon smoked paprika', u' Pickled ginger, for serving']
title: Ramen Sliders and Kimchi Ketchup with Potato Chips and Sriracha Aioli

directions: [u'For the garlic mixture: Place the oil and garlic in a shallow frying pan. Mix until combined and the oil just covers the garlic, adding more oil as necessary. Cook over medium heat until the oil begins to bubble and the garlic turns golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Immediately remove from the heat and drain off the oil. Set the garlic aside and let cool.', u'For the BBQ marinade: Combine the pear puree, sugar, soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice wine, pepper, schichimi togarashi and 5-spice powder in a 2-quart saucepan and mix thoroughly with a whisk. Cook over high heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the prepared garlic mixture, lower the heat and simmer until slightly thickened, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the onion and scallion. Let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, remove any excess fat and sinew from the ribs. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes and transfer to a 4-quart container.', u'Slowly pour the cooled BBQ marinade over the ribs and mix until thoroughly coated. Marinate the ribs in the refrigerator at least 8 hours.', u'Drain the ribs and onion of excess BBQ marinade through a sieve or strainer. Heat the oil in a frying pan over high heat, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the ribs and onion and cook, mixing often to prevent burning, until caramelized and cooked to desired doneness, 2 to 3 minutes for medium-rare, 3 to 5 minutes for medium. Serve on rice, bread or salad.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more if needed', u'8 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup Asian pear puree (preferably from Korean Shingo pears)', u'2 heaping tablespoons Chinese yellow rock sugar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine', u'1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon shichimi togarashi (Japanese 7-spice powder)', u' Pinch 5-spice powder', u'1 medium yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'1 inch scallion, sliced', u'2 pounds uncut boneless short ribs', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil']
title: 7-Spice Garlic BBQ Short Ribs

directions: [u'Mix the tuna with 3 tablespoons Ghost Pepper Sauce and the mayonnaise. In a separate bowl, mix the crabmeat with the remaining 3 tablespoons Ghost Pepper Sauce, habanero powder and sliced habanero peppers.', u'Wet your hands with water, and then press the Sushi Rice onto the seaweed paper evenly, about 1/4-inch thick. Sprinkle the sesame seeds and some habanero powder over the rice. Flip over so the seaweed paper is facing up. Add the tuna mixture and shrimp tempura down the center of the seaweed. Place the seaweed paper onto a bamboo sushi mat and roll the seaweed paper tightly. Remove the mat and add the crab mixture on top of the roll. Place a piece of plastic film over the roll and, with the sushi mat, press it over the plastic film and roll to make certain the crab is pressed onto the roll. Remove the mat and gently remove the plastic film. Cut the roll into 8 pieces.', u'To serve, place the sushi roll onto a serving plate and drizzle Ghost Pepper Sauce over and around the roll. Top the roll with the micro cilantro and sprinkle the pop rock candy around the roll.', u'Warning: Consumption of raw or undercooked shellfish may substantially increase the risk of foodborne illness.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces ahi tuna, minced', u'6 tablespoons Ghost Pepper Sauce, plus more for drizzling, recipe follows', u'1 teaspoon mayonnaise', u'3 ounces lump crabmeat', u'1/3 teaspoon habanero powder, plus more for sprinkling', u'2 habanero peppers, sliced', u'2 pieces 21/25 shrimp tempura (you can find at any Asian market), deep-fried', u'7 ounces Sushi Rice, recipe follows', u'1 sheet seaweed paper (nori)', u'1 teaspoon sesame seeds', u' Micro cilantro, for garnish', u'1 teaspoon pop rock candy, for garnish', u'5 habanero peppers, cut into small pieces', u'2 ghost chile peppers, cut into small pieces', u"4 tablespoons hot sauce, such as Frank's", u'3 tablespoons hot sauce, such as Tabasco', u'3 tablespoons Sriracha chili sauce', u'2 tablespoons Korean chili paste', u'2 tablespoons sambal olek chili sauce', u'2 teaspoons chili powder', u'1 teaspoon ichimi (Japanese chili powder)', u'1 teaspoon lemon pepper seasoning', u'1 teaspoon lime juice', u'1 teaspoon spicy sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon fried shallots', u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'7 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup sushi rice']
title: Fire Breathing Dragon Roll

directions: [u'Rhubarb-Birch Syrup: Heat a medium skillet over high heat. Add the butter, swirl to coat the bottom of the pan. Add the onion and rhubarb and saute until soft, 4 to 6 minutes. Add the birch syrup, wine, and lemon juice. Stir, season with salt and pepper and cook until the liquid is reduced by 1/2, about 8 to 10 minutes (should have a syrupy consistency). Adjust seasoning.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 small red onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 cup rhubarb, peeled, finely diced', u'4 tablespoons birch syrup', u'1 cup white wine', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh ginger', u'2 pounds Alaskan mussels, scrubbed, beards removed', u'4 Thai bird chiles, stemmed, and minced', u'1 tablespoon Korean chile flakes', u'2 cups fiddlehead ferns, blanched', u'1/2 teaspoon Korean chile flakes', u'3 tablespoons chopped chives', u'2 pounds potatoes from Alaska, unpeeled, washed, and halved', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons olive oil']
title: Spicy Wok Stirred Blue Mussels with Rhubarb-Birch Syrup and Alaskan Potatoes

directions: [u'Special equipment: a chinois strainer', u'For the pork belly: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u"Heat the vegetable oil in a Dutch oven or deep saute pan over high heat. Season the pork belly with salt and pepper on all sides and sear until golden brown on all sides, about 8 minutes. Add the celery, onion and carrot around the sides of the pork belly and let them begin to heat for another 2 or 3 minutes. Pour in the pork stock (or chicken stock if you don't have pork), cover, and cook in the oven until the pork is tender, about 2 hours. Let cool in the braising liquid until cold all the way through. When completely cooled, cut into 4 equal rectangular pieces and set aside for plating.", u'For the bamboo rice: Saute the ginger and shallot with the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the rice and saute for another 30 seconds. Add the salt, pepper and 1 1/4 cups water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until the rice is tender, 20 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.', u'For the cucumber kimchi: Mix together the garlic, sugar, ginger, red pepper, fish sauce, soy sauce and salt in a large bowl and let sit for 2 hours. Fold in the cucumber, carrot and cilantro.', u'For the sweet soy ginger jus: Saute the ginger and jalapeno in a medium saucepan over medium heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the sugar, red wine and balsamic vinegars, ketchup, soy sauce and orange zest. Stir to combine and cook until reduced by half. Mix the cornstarch with 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl to make a slurry; whisk it into the reduction. Add the sweet soy and mix thoroughly. Strain through a chinois strainer.', u'To finish the dish: Crisp the pork belly on all sides in a saute pan over medium high-heat, then glaze the belly with the sweet soy ginger jus, adding just enough to coat. Slice the belly in 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place 1/2 cup of the bamboo rice in the middle of each plate. Fan the sliced pork belly on top of the rice and top with a good pinch of the cucumber kimchi. Sprinkle ground, toasted macadamia nuts on top if desired and drizzle the sweet soy ginger jus around the plate. Sriracha can be dotted around the plate to finish if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 1/2 pounds pork belly', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 stalks celery, chopped', u'1 yellow onion, chopped', u'1 carrot, chopped', u'2 quarts pork or chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', u'1 tablespoon minced shallot', u'1 teaspoon olive oil', u"1 cup bamboo rice (see Cook's Note)", u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'10 cloves garlic, sliced thin', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 1/4 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'1 1/4 tablespoons Korean red pepper', u'1 tablespoons Asian fish sauce', u'1 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 English cucumber, sliced thin', u'1 carrot, julienned on a mandolin', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh ginger', u'1/4 jalapeno, rough chopped', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'5 1/4 ounces red wine vinegar', u'2 3/4 ounces balsamic vinegar', u'1 1/3 tablespoons ketchup', u'1 1/3 tablespoons soy sauce', u' Zest of 1/3 orange', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 cup sweet soy sauce', u' Ground, toasted macadamia nuts, for sprinkling', u' Sriracha, for serving']
title: Sweet Soy Ginger Glazed Pork Belly with Bamboo Rice and Cucumber Kimchi

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the rice noodles as the label directs.', u'Meanwhile, place a large pot over high heat. Poke the meat all over with a fork to tenderize it and season with salt and pepper. Sear the meat until charred but still rare, 2 to 3 minutes per side, then transfer to a plate. Add the onion and ginger to the pot; cook about 4 minutes. Add the broth, 3 cups water, the star anise and cinnamon, reduce the heat and simmer about 20 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, thinly slice the scallions and jalapenos (remove seeds for less heat) and tear the cilantro. Thinly slice the meat against the grain. Drain the noodles.', u'Add the fish sauce to the broth and boil 5 minutes. Discard the ginger, star anise and cinnamon stick. Remove and slice the onion. Divide the noodles among 4 bowls; top with the broth, beef, scallions, cilantro, bean sprouts, jalapenos and onion.', u'Per serving: Calories 334; Fat 4 g (Saturated 1 g); Cholesterol 34 mg; Sodium 961 mg; Carbohydrate 51 g; Fiber 2 g; Protein 22 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces rice noodles', u'12 ounces lean beef sirloin, fat trimmed', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 large onion, halved', u'1 4 -inch piece ginger, unpeeled, halved', u'3 cups low-sodium beef broth', u'5 star anise pods', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'4 scallions', u'2 jalapeno peppers, preferably red and green', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro', u'2 to 4 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts']
title: Vietnamese Noodle Soup

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'In a large Dutch oven or stock pot, bring to a simmer the chicken stock, chicken breasts, chicken wings, scallions, garlic, cinnamon sticks, star anise and ginger. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Once the chicken breasts are cooked, remove them, set aside and shred when cooled. Continue to simmer all the other ingredients for 30 minutes. Then strain the broth through a colander to remove the solids and spices.', u'Add the mushrooms, fish sauce and noodles to the strained stock. Simmer until noodles are still al dente, 4 to 5 minutes. Scoop some of the noodles into individual bowls. Top with some of the shredded chicken. Ladle lots of broth into each bowl. Garnish with the bean sprouts, jalapenos and fresh mint, and serve with fish sauce, hoisin sauce, Sriracha and lime wedges. Oh my.']
ingredients: [u'1 gallon low-sodium chicken stock', u'3 bone-in, skin-on chicken breasts', u'4 chicken wings', u'5 scallions, cut in half', u'4 cloves garlic', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'2 whole star anise', u'1 inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and cut into coins', u'1/4 cup dry shiitake mushrooms, rehydrated in warm water for 30 minutes and thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 packages ramen noodles (just the noodles)', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts', u'1 jalapeno, thinly sliced', u' Couple sprigs each fresh mint and Thai basil', u' Fish sauce', u' Hoisin sauce', u' Sriracha', u' Lime wedges']
title: Vietnamese Chicken Noodle Soup

author: Adam Gertler
directions: [u'Combine the bouillon, chili sauce, honey, oil, shallots, vinegar and lime leaves and whisk together to form a uniform paste. Reserve some paste for brushing, and place the rest in a resealable plastic bag. Toss the chicken wings in the paste in the bag and allow to marinate for 30 minutes to 1 hour.', u'Build a hot charcoal fire on one side of the grill. Set the chicken wings on the grill opposite of the hot coal side. Cover the grill and cook until the wings are just about cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. Rotate the wings halfway through for even cooking.', u'To finish the wings, brush with the reserved paste and grill directly over hot coals until charred slightly.', u'Transfer to a platter and top with cilantro leaves and peanuts.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup chicken bouillon powder (weird I know, but it works)', u'1/2 cup Vietnamese chili sauce (Sriracha works too)', u'1/2 cup honey', u'1/2 cup cooking oil', u'1/2 cup pureed shallot (onion works fine too)', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'20 kaffir lime leaves, finely chopped', u'24 whole jumbo chicken wings', u'1 cup cilantro leaves', u'1 cup roasted peanuts, chopped']
title: Vietnamese Lime Chicken Wings

directions: [u'Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the half the onion and all the garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until both begin to soften, about 7 minutes. Add the salt (if using), black pepper, sugar, chopped ginger and chicken. Cook over medium-high heat until the sugar melts and the onion mixture and chicken begin to brown, about 15 minutes. ', u'Add the remaining onion, the chili peppers, lemon grass, curry powder, soy sauce, fish sauce and coconut milk. Stir, reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and cook until the chicken is no longer pink at the center, about 10 minutes. Remove the lid and simmer (adjusting the heat if necessary) until the sauce thickens and the chicken is tender, about 10 minutes more.', u'Serve warm garnished with coconut shavings if desired. This dish tastes even better the next day!']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 large onion, halved and sliced', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt, optional', u'2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'3 pounds boneless chicken (thighs or breasts), diced', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh hot red chili peppers', u'4 stalks lemongrass, green tops removed then pale ends finely chopped*', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons fish sauce', u'4 ounces unsweetened coconut milk', u' Shaved fresh coconut, for garnish, optional', u" *Cook's Note: Lemongrass is available at Asian markets and specialty produce stores"]
title: Vietnamese Coconut Lemongrass Chicken

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'For the pickled vegetables: Heat the vinegar, sugar and salt in a small pot until the sugar and salt are dissolved. Pour the hot vinegar mixture over the daikon, carrots and cucumbers. Let steep for at least an hour.', u'For the spicy mayonnaise: Mix the mayonnaise, Sriracha and sesame oil together. Adjust the heat by either adding more Sriracha or mayonnaise.', u'For the pork: Heat the canola oil in a straight-sided skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until slightly softened, 4 to 6 minutes. Add the ginger and garlic and cook another 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the pickling liquid from the pickled vegetables and cook until reduced by half, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chicken stock, fish sauce, hoisin sauce and black pepper and stir to combine. Simmer until reduced slightly and thickened, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the ground pork, breaking up the meat with the back of a wooden spoon or spatula, and cook until the pork is cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.', u'For the sandwich build: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Heat the rolls for 5 minutes, to crisp the crust and soften the interior. Slice the rolls open, but keep them hinged. Schmear desired amount of spicy mayo on the bottom roll, place some pork on top of that, top with some pickled vegetables, fresh jalapenos, cilantro leaves, and finish with the chopped peanuts. Grab with two hands, eat whole and close your eyes while enjoying this first class ticket to Saigon.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups white distilled vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'2 cups julienned daikon radish (cut into strips or run through a mandoline)', u'1 cup julienned carrots', u'1/2 English cucumber, partially peeled in sections to leave some skin on, cut into half moons', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'1 to 2 tablespoons Sriracha', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 large yellow onion, 1/4-inch dice (about 2 cups)', u'1 heaping tablespoon peeled and finely grated ginger', u'8 cloves garlic, minced', u'2/3 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'2 pounds ground pork', u' Six 8-inch hoagie rolls', u'2 fresh jalapenos, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 cup fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup salted roasted peanuts, chopped']
title: Vietnamese Pork Sandwich

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the vinegar, sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1 teaspoon salt and the ginger in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes. Let cool.', u'Transfer half of the vinegar mixture to a large bowl and add the carrots and daikon; cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.', u'Transfer the remaining vinegar mixture to a shallow baking dish; stir in the lemongrass, shallot, soy sauce and fish sauce. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours, flipping the chicken halfway through.', u'Preheat a grill to medium high and brush the grates with vegetable oil. Remove the chicken from the marinade, scraping off the lemongrass and shallot; season with salt. Grill the chicken until well marked and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Remove to a cutting board.', u'Drain the carrots and daikon; stir in the cilantro. Cut the chicken thighs in half. Toast the bread on the grill and spread the mayonnaise on both sides; sandwich with the sliced cucumber, chicken, carrot mixture and jalapeno. Serve with Sriracha.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'1/2 cup sugar', u' Kosher salt', u'1 2 -inch piece peeled fresh ginger, sliced', u'2 carrots, cut into matchsticks (about 1 cup)', u'1/2 small daikon radish, cut into matchsticks (about 1 cup)', u'4 stalks lemongrass, finely chopped', u'1 shallot, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'4 large skinless, boneless chicken thighs (1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds)', u' Vegetable oil, for the grill', u'1 cup fresh cilantro', u'1 loaf soft French bread, split and cut into four 6-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise, preferably Japanese (such as Kewpie)', u'2 Persian or other small cucumbers, thinly sliced', u'1 jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced', u' Sriracha, for serving']
title: Grilled Vietnamese Chicken Sandwiches

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine 1/4 cup water with the brown sugar, soy sauce, fish sauce, lemongrass, garlic and shallot in a shallow dish. Add the pork chops and turn to coat. Let marinate 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, cook the rice as the label directs, adding the grated ginger to the water.', u'Preheat the broiler. Remove the pork chops from the marinade; transfer to a broiler pan (reserve the marinade). Broil until the pork is charred and cooked through, 6 minutes. Transfer the marinade to a skillet; add 1/4 cup water and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 3 minutes.', u'Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the mint and cucumber; season with salt and pepper. Serve the pork with the rice and pan sauce.', u'Photograph by Ryan Dausch']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons packed brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh lemongrass (or 1 tablespoon grated lemon zest)', u'2 cloves garlic, grated', u'1 shallot, finely chopped', u'4 thin bone-in pork chops (about 4 ounces each)', u'1 cup jasmine rice', u'1 2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and grated (about 2 tablespoons)', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh mint', u'2 Persian cucumbers, diced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Vietnamese Pork Chops with Ginger Rice

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Cut the hen into 8 pieces and discard any excess fat. Rinse chicken bones and necks with cold water and place in a stockpot. Add the water and ginger and bring to a boil. Skim any foam that rises to the surface. Reduce the heat to a low simmer and cook for 3 hours; do not allow the liquid to boil to ensure a clear broth.', u'Remove and discard the hen and bones. Strain the broth through a fine mesh sieve or chinois lined with cheesecloth. Return the broth to a large soup pot and continue to simmer until reduced to a volume of 2 1/2 or 3 quarts. Season with salt, to taste, and keep hot while you assemble the remaining ingredients.', u'Prepare the rice vermicelli according to package directions. Once done, transfer to a colander and drain well. Rinse well under cold running water. Drain thoroughly before using. (The noodles may be prepared up to this point 2 hours ahead of serving.)', u'When ready to serve the soup, for each serving ladle 2 cups of the hot broth into a large soup bowl. Quickly dip the cooked noodles in the remaining hot broth to rewarm, then place a handful of noodles in each bowl. Divide the sliced chicken breast between the bowls, laying the slices over the top of the noodles. Serve the soup immediately, with the fresh cilantro, basil, mint, bean sprouts, lime wedges and jalapeno peppers in baskets on the table for each person to garnish their own soup, as desired. Add chili sauce or fish sauce, to taste, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 stewing hen, about 5 pounds', u'2 pounds chicken bones or chicken necks', u'4 quarts cold water', u'1 ounce fresh ginger, crushed', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 pound rice vermicelli (bun)', u'1 whole cooked chicken breast (2 halves), thinly sliced', u'8 to 12 fresh cilantro sprigs, for garnishing soup', u'4 to 8 fresh basil sprigs, for garnishing soup', u'4 fresh mint sprigs, for garnishing soup', u'2 cups fresh bean sprouts, for garnishing soup', u'2 limes, cut into wedges, for garnishing soup', u'2 to 3 sliced fresh jalapeno, Serrano, or Thai chile peppers, for garnishing soup', u' Sriracha chili sauce, for serving', u' Fish sauce, for serving']
title: Pho Ga (Vietnamese Chicken Noodle Soup)

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, stirring with spoon, combine the chile, garlic, sugar, vinegar, lime juice, fish sauce, oil, onion, and black pepper, set aside for 1/2 hour. In a large bowl combine cabbage, carrot, chicken breast, and mint, tossing with tongs.  Pour cabbage mixture over the dressing, tossing with tongs, slowly and patiently so everything is coated.  Add salt, to taste.  Serve on a flat plate with mint for garnish.']
ingredients: [u'1 Thai chile, seeded and minced', u'1 large garlic clove, peeled, minced', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons rice vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons lime juice', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Vietnamese or Thai fish sauce (nuoc nam or nam pla)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 medium onion, finely sliced', u' Freshly grated black pepper', u'7 to 8 ounces white cabbage, shredded', u'1 medium carrot, shredded, julienned, or grated', u'7 ounces cooked chicken breast, shredded, or cut into fine strips', u'1 bunch mint, plus extra for garnish, leaves roughly chopped', u' Salt']
title: Vietnamese Chicken and Mint Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Wash chicken breasts and pat dry. Combine all ingredients for the filling in a bowl, mix well and cover. Marinate for about 1 hour at room temperature. Preheat a grill. Grill chicken in pieces (cut to preference) until golden brown on both sides and cooked through. ', u'Soak the wrappers, 1 at a time, in warm water until softened. Remove from the water and pat dry. Fill each wrapper with the chicken and all of the toppings. Roll the wrapper once over the filling. Tuck in the ends and roll completely. Press to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.', u'Serve with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'26 ounces skinned, boneless chicken breasts', u'5 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 stalks lemongrass, minced', u'1/2 cup soybean oil', u'1 tablespoon sesame seed oil', u' Fresh black pepper', u'10 large rice paper wrappers', u'1 package rice noodles, soaked in warm water until softened and drained', u'1 head romaine lettuce, cut into 3/4-inch lengths', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded and cut into thin strips', u'1/2 cup pickled daikon, chopped', u'3 carrots, peeled and sliced thinly', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'1 bunch basil, cleaned and leaves picked', u'1 bunch mint , cleaned and leaves picked', u'1/2 bunch parsley, cleaned and leaves picked', u' Dipping Sauce, recipe follows']
title: Vietnamese Burrito

directions: [u'In a large stockpot, bring 6 quarts water to a boil. Place the bones and beef chuck in a second pot and add water to cover. Bring to a boil and boil vigorously for 5 minutes. Using tongs, carefully transfer the bones and beef to the first pot of boiling water. Discard the water in which the meat cooked (this cleans the bones and meat and reduces the impurities that can cloud the broth). When the water returns to a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer. Skim the surface often to remove any foam and fat. Add the charred ginger and onions, fish sauce and sugar. Simmer until the beef chuck is tender, about 40 minutes. Remove 1 piece and submerge in cool water for 10 minutes to prevent the meat from darkening and drying out. Drain, then cut into thin slices, and set aside. Let the other piece of beef chuck continue to cook in the simmering broth.', u'When the broth has been simmering for about 1 1/2 hours total, wrap the star anise and cloves in a spice bag or piece of cheesecloth and add to the broth. Let infuse until the broth is fragrant about 30 minutes. Remove and discard both the spice bag and onions. Add the salt and continue to simmer, skimming as necessary, until ready to assemble the dish. The broth needs to cook for at least 2 hours. (The broth will taste salty but will be balanced once the noodles and accompaniments are added.) Leave the remaining chuck and bones to simmer in the pot while you assemble the bowls.', u'To serve, place the cooked noodles in preheated bowls. (If the noodles are not hot, reheat them in a microwave or dip them briefly in boiling water to prevent them cooling down the soup.) Place a few slices of the beef chuck and the raw sirloin on the noodles. Bring the broth to a rolling boil; ladle about 2 to 3 cups into each bowl. The broth will cook the raw beef instantly. Garnish with yellow onions, scallions, and cilantro. Serve immediately, inviting guests to garnish the bowls with bean sprouts, herbs, chiles, lime juice, and black pepper.']
ingredients: [u'5 pounds beef marrow or knuckle bones', u'2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 2 pieces', u'1 (3-inch) piece ginger, cut in half lengthwise and lightly bruised with the flat side of a knife, lightly charred', u'2 yellow onions, peeled and charred', u'1/4 -cup fish sauce', u'3 ounces rock sugar, or 3 tablespoons sugar', u'10 whole star anise, lightly toasted in a dry pan', u'1 tablespoon sea salt', u'1 pound dried 1/16 inch wide rice sticks, soaked, cooked and drained', u'1/3 pound beef sirloin, slightly frozen, then sliced paper-thin across the grain']
title: Vietnamese "Pho" Rice Noodle Soup with Beef

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Place the garlic, cilantro, jalapeno, honey, lime juice, fish sauce and salt in the bowl of a food processor and process until almost smooth. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add the noodles and cook for 2 minutes. Drain, rinse well with cold water and drain again. In a large bowl, combine the sauce, noodles, carrots, cucumber, mint and napa cabbage. Toss well and garnish with peanuts.']
ingredients: [u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 cup chopped cilantro', u'1 jalapeno pepper, chopped', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 pound dried rice vermicelli', u'2 carrots, julienned', u'1 cucumber, halved, peeled, seeded and sliced into thin halfrounds', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1/2 cup finely shredded napa cabbage', u'1/4 cup chopped dryroasted nuts']
title: Vietnamese Rice-Noodle Salad

directions: [u'To make dressing: In a pint jar, combine the garlic, gingerroot, lime juice, sugar, peanut oil, nuoc mam, and hot pepper flakes, if using. Shake well. Set aside.', u'To make the salad: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the water, bouillon cube, and peanut oil to a boil. Add the couscous in a stream. Remove from the heat. Stir once. Cover and let stand until the couscous is tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Set aside to cool. Mix with half of the cilantro, half of the mint, and half of the peanuts.', u'In a large bowl, combine the carrots, cucumber, onions, cabbage, and remaining cilantro and mint. Add the dressing and toss thoroughly.', u'Spoon equal portions of couscous onto 6 dinner plates. Top with the vegetable mixture and the shrimp. Garnish with remaining peanuts, cilantro, and mint leaves. Serve at room temperature.', u"Cook's Note: To cook the shrimp, rinse them under running water. In a medium saucepan, bring 4 cups water and 2 bay leaves to a boil. Add the shrimp, and cook until they are just pink, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain and let cool. Discard the cooking liquid and bay leaves. Shell and devein the shrimp."]
ingredients: [u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1 teaspoon minced gingerroot', u'6 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 tablespoons nuoc mam (Southeast Asian fish sauce, available at Asian markets)', u'1 teaspoon hot pepper flakes', u'1 1/3 cups boiling water', u'1 extra-large fish bouillon cubes (available at Asian markets)', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1 cup couscous', u'20 sprigs fresh cilantro, finely chopped (about 2 tablespoons)', u'30 fresh mint leaves, finely chopped (about 2 tablespoons)', u'1/2 cup (about 4 ounces) salted, dry-roasted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u'2 medium carrots, peeled and shredded', u'1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded, and shredded', u'6 green onions, green tops included, finely sliced', u'1/2 head Napa cabbage, finely shredded', u'8 ounces medium shrimp, cooked and coarsely chopped, see note*', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Fresh mint leaves, for garnish']
title: Vietnamese Couscous Salad

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a 1-gallon resealable freezer bag, combine the garlic, lemon grass, habaneros, shallots, fish sauce, ginger, sugar and turmeric. Mix all the ingredients around in the bag, then add the fish and seal the bag. Shake to coat the fish in the marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours.', u'Cook the rice noodles according to package directions. Quickly rinse in cool water, drain well and divide among 4 serving bowls.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. When hot, add the fish along with its marinade. Remove the lemon grass and discard. Sprinkle the fish with the salt and cook, undisturbed, for 4 minutes. Flip the fish pieces over to lightly brown the other side, and cook another minute or so. Toss gently with a rubber spatula until all of the fish is cooked and the shallots are beginning to brown. Scatter the scallions, basil, cilantro and mint over the top. Spoon the fish over the rice noodles. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 cloves garlic, sliced', u'4 stalks lemon grass, trimmed, pounded and halved lengthwise', u'2 habanero chiles, minced', u'1 large or 2 small shallots, sliced', u'2 tablespoons Asian fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1 pound red snapper fillet, skin removed, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'3 ounces rice vermicelli noodles', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh basil', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1/2 cup sliced scallions']
title: Vietnamese Red Snapper with Noodles

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'To make the Vietnamese Dressing, simply mix all the ingredients together. This will keep very well in a tightly sealed jar in the refrigerator for at least a week.', u"To make the salad, marinate the shrimp in 1/2 cup of the Vietnamese Dressing. While this is going on, soak the noodles in freshly boiled water according to packet instructions. Once re-hydrated, refresh the noodles in cold water, then drain. Put the sugar snaps and bean sprouts into a colander and pour over freshly boiled water from a kettle. Rinse them with cold water and drain well, just shaking the colander, so they're not actually wet.", u'In a large bowl, mix the marinated shrimp with the drained noodles, scallions, sugar snaps, and bean sprouts. Dress with 2 tablespoons more of the Vietnamese Dressing; add more dressing, to taste, if desired.', u'Sprinkle over the chopped cilantro and toss everything together well before arranging onto a large plate.', u'Per serving: Calories 307; Total Fat 5 grams; Saturated Fat 0.5 grams;  Protein 18 grams; Total Carbohydrate 49 grams; Sugar: 8 grams; Fiber 2 grams; Cholesterol 115 milligrams; Sodium 1588 milligrams']
ingredients: [u'2 cloves garlic, minced or crushed', u'2 fresh long red chiles, seeded and finely diced or julienned', u'2 tablespoons finely minced fresh ginger', u'4 tablespoons fish sauce (nam pla)', u'1 lime, juiced', u'4 tablespoons water', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons groundnut oil', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'8 ounces cooked small shrimp', u'6 ounces glass noodles', u'4 ounces sugar snap peas', u'4 ounces bean sprouts', u'3 scallions, sliced into thin circles', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves, to garnish']
title: Vietnamese Shrimp and Glass Noodle Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Soak the red onion, carrots and radishes in ice water for 5 minutes, then drain. Split each roll in half lengthwise to make 4 pieces. Transfer to the oven to toast.', u'Whisk 1/4 cup mayonnaise, the lime juice, honey, cornichons and brine, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Add the chicken, onion, carrots, radishes and chopped cilantro and toss. Mix the chile sauce and the remaining 1/4 cup mayonnaise in a small bowl.', u'Spread each piece of bread with some chile mayonnaise, then top with the chicken salad and cilantro leaves.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/2 small red onion, thinly sliced', u'2 medium carrots, shaved into ribbons with a vegetable peeler', u'4 radishes, thinly sliced', u'2 crusty hoagie-style rolls', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice (from about 4 limes)', u'2 teaspoons honey', u'2 tablespoons chopped cornichons or gherkins, plus 1 tablespoon brine from the jar', u' Kosher salt', u'3 cups shredded rotisserie chicken (from 1 small chicken)', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus cilantro leaves for topping', u'1 tablespoon Asian chile sauce (such as Sriracha)']
title: Open-Face Vietnamese Chicken Sandwiches

directions: [u'Prepare the grill or heat a grill pan on the stovetop.', u'In a small bowl combine the chili powder, cayenne, ginger, coriander, salt and pepper.  Rub the squid bodies and tentacles with the spice mixture.', u'Place the squid bodies on the grill and weigh them down with a clean brick wrapped in foil or a large heavy skillet. Grill for 1  to 1 1/2 minutes per side. Remove the object weighing down the squid and cook for an additional 30 seconds, turning occasionally.  Transfer the grilled squid bodies to a platter.  Place the tentacles on the grill and cook for about 2 minutes, or until they are brown and crispy, rolling them around your tongs as they cook so that they brown evenly.  Remove from the grill.  Slice the grilled squid bodies into 1/2-inch rings and if necessary cut the tentacles into bite-size pieces.', u'In a bowl whisk together the lime juice, honey, nuoc nam, garlic and chili pepper.  Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.  Add the sliced grilled squid and toss to coat.  Add the sprouts, bell pepper and toss to combine.   Sprinkle the chopped mint and peanuts over the mixture and toss to combine.  Arrange the lettuce on a platter and top with the squid mixture.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1 teaspoon cayenne', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u' Salt and freshly cracked pepper, to taste', u'1 pound medium sized squid, including tentacles, cleaned', u'1/4 cup lime juice', u'2 teaspoons honey', u'1 tablespoon nuoc nam, Vietnamese fish sauce, available at Asian specialty stores, or to taste', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh red or green chile pepper of your choice', u'3/4 cup mung bean sprouts', u'1 red bell pepper, julienned', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped unsalted roasted peanuts', u' Green leaf or Bibb leaf lettuce']
title: Vietnamese Grilled Squid Salad

directions: [u'Let the broth simmer, uncovered, skimming occasionally. After 4 hours, remove the spice bundle, onion, bay leaves and ginger from the pot and discard. Remove the oxtails from the pot and set aside. Let the broth continue to simmer. When the meat is cool enough to handle, pull the meat from the bones. Set the meat aside and return the bones to the broth. Continue simmering, uncovered, until the broth is rich and flavorful, about 1 hour. Taste the broth and add more salt or fish sauce as needed.', u'Meanwhile, soak the rice noodles in cold water for at least 20 minutes. Arrange the sliced scallions, cilantro, parsley, basil, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and chiles on a platter in separate piles.', u"Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the drained rice noodles. Give the noodles a quick stir and cook until tender but firm, about 1 minute. Rice noodles can quickly become gummy, so don't let them overcook. Drain the noodles. Warm 6 large bowls by rinsing them with hot water and divide the noodles among the bowls. ", u'Just before serving, return the broth to a full boil. Arrange the slices of raw filet and pieces of cooked oxtail meat over the noodles in each bowl. Carefully ladle the boiling broth over all; the raw beef should be submerged in the broth. Serve immediately, along with the platters of garnish.']
ingredients: [u'4 pounds Oxtails; cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch pieces and trimmed of fat', u'3 -inch piece of ginger, unpeeled', u'1 large onion, halved and unpeeled', u'1/3 cup nuoc mam (fish sauce)', u'8 whole star anise', u'5 whole cloves', u'3 -inch cinnamon stick', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'3 bay leaves', u'1 pound 1/4-inch rice noodles', u'2 bunches scallions, sliced thin', u'1/2 cup tightly packed fresh cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup parsley, roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup basil, approximately, whole fresh plants (minus roots) if possible', u'1 1/2 cups mung bean sprouts', u'3 large limes, cut into wedges and seeds removed', u' Red chile paste or sliced fresh hot chilies (optional)', u'3/4 pounds filet mignon, trimmed of fat and sliced very thin']
title: Pho (Vietnamese Beef & Rice-Noodle Soup)

directions: [u'Put the condensed milk into a coffee cup. Place the filter on top of the cup. Unscrew the filter, add the coffee grounds, and screw the filter back on. Pour in enough boiling water to fill the filter. Close the lid and let the coffee slowly drip into the cup. Remove the filter and stir the coffee and milk together. Pour the coffee mixture into a glass of ice and stir to chill. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 to 3 teaspoons sweetened condensed milk', u'2 to 3 teaspoons medium-fine ground French roast coffee', u' Boiling water, as needed', u' Ice cubes, as needed', u' Equipment: Single-cup Vietnamese-style coffee filter']
title: Vietnamese-Style Iced Coffee

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place chicken and 5 quarts of water into a large stock pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Skim the foam that rises to the top. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, add the ginger, 3/4 of the onions and garlic. Cook until chicken is cooked through, about 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a plate and allow to cool. When cool enough to handle, remove the meat from the bones. Return the bones to the pot and continue to simmer until the broth has reduced by half, about 1 1/2 hours. Reserve the chicken meat on the side. ', u'Soak the wood ear mushrooms in a bowl of warm water until soft, about 30 minutes. Drain, slice and set aside. Heat peanut oil in a 12-inch skillet, over medium heat. Thinly slice the remaining onions, add to the pan and cook until translucent, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the shitake mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are soft, about 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook until just pink, about 1 minute. Remove from the pan and set aside. ', u'In a medium size saucepan, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add the rice, reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until rice is al dente (tender but still a little firm) about 8 minutes. Drain the rice in a colander and rinse under cold water until cool. Set aside.', u'Strain the chicken broth into a medium pot, discarding the bones and vegetables. Add the drained rice, shredded chicken, and wood ear mushrooms; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until rice is very soft, about 10 to 12 minutes. Rinse tapioca in cold water, and then add to soup. Continue to simmer the soup, stirring frequently, until the tapioca turns transparent and soup begins to thicken, about 30 minutes longer. ', u'Add the shrimp, onion and shiitake mushroom mixture to the soup, season to taste with salt and freshly ground white pepper, and simmer for another 2 or 3 minutes. Ladle into warm bowls and garnish with scallions, cilantro and basil and a dash of fish sauce, all to taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 (4-pound) chicken', u'5 quarts water', u'3 tablespoons ginger, minced', u'3 small yellow onions, peeled and halved', u'2 garlic cloves', u'4 dried wood ear mushrooms', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and sliced', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled, deveined and halved lengthwise', u'1 cup jasmine rice', u'1/4 cup small tapioca pearls', u'2 scallions, sliced thinly on a bias, for garnish', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish', u'1/4 cup chiffonade fresh basil leaves, for garnish', u' Vietnamese fish sauce (Nuoc nam), for garnish']
title: Vietnamese Rice Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a small bowl combine the pork, shallots, garlic, sugar, fish sauce and pepper. Stir to combine well, cover, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to overnight. Transfer to the freezer for 30 minutes, or until the mixture is partially frozen. ', u'Place the rice in a small skillet and heat over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until rice is toasted, golden brown and fragrant. Transfer to a plate to cool. When cool, place rice in a coffee grinder and process to a fine powder. Measure 3 tablespoons of the powder and set aside. Save any remaining powder for another purpose or discard.', u'Transfer the partially frozen meat mixture to a food processor and process to a completely smooth but stiff paste. Add the pork fat to the processor and process until smooth or finely chopped. Add the roasted rice powder and pulse several times to combine the mixture. Do not over process or the mixture will become sticky.', u'Preheat a grill to medium-low.', u'Transfer the meat mixture to a small bowl. Lightly oil your hands. Divide meat mixture into heaping 1 1/2 tablespoonfuls and roll each into a smooth ball. Recoat your hands with oil, as necessary. Thread the meatballs onto the bamboo skewers, fitting as many as you can on each skewer.', u'Coat the grill lightly with oil and grill the skewered meatballs, turning occasionally, until cooked through, 20 to 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds lean pork meat, such as loin, trimmed of any gristle or membranes and cut into small dice', u'1/2 cup finely chopped shallots', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'4 teaspoons sugar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (Nuoc Nam)', u'1 1/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'5 tablespoons short-grain glutinous rice, such as sushi rice', u'4 ounces pork fat, cubed', u' Vegetable oil', u'6 to 8 (8-inch) bamboo skewers, soaked in warm water for at least 30 minutes']
title: Vietnamese BBQ Pork Meatballs (Nem Nuong)

directions: [u'Bring water to a boil in each of the 3 large pots. Salt the water as it reaches a boil. In another pot of boiling, salted water, add the chicken. Reduce the heat and simmer until cooked through, about 6 to 8 minutes. Chill fully in an ice bath and drain. Slice into thin strips and place in a bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use.', u'Leaving the shrimp in their shells, drop them into 1 pot of boiling, salted water and cook for about 4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon to an ice bath until fully chilled. Peel each shrimp, discarding the shells, and slice in half down the length of the shrimp so that you have 2 flat, identical crescent-shaped pieces. Place in a bowl and refrigerate until ready to use.', u'Drop the bean thread noodles into the third pot of boiling salted water and cook until done, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drain and cool under cold, running water. When cooled, sprinkle with a little sesame oil, to taste. Toss the noodles until they are all lightly coated with the sesame oil. Place in a bowl and refrigerate until ready to use. When ready to assemble the rolls, line up all of the components?the chicken, shrimp, noodles, lettuce, cucumbers, carrots, mint, and basil, in their own containers?on the work surface or table.', u'Fill a large, flat bowl with warm water, making sure it is large enough to fit the rice paper wrappers. Lay a clean towel on the workspace in front of you. Carefully dip the round wrapper into the water, just to get it wet all over, trying not to crack it. It will still be slightly hard. Remove it from the water and lay it onto the clean towel, where it will continue to soften.', u'Layer a small amount of each of the ingredients on the bottom 1/3 of the wrap. Start with a few strips of chicken, then 2 to 3 pieces of shrimp, then some noodles, then some lettuce, then some slices of cucumber, followed by some shreds of carrot, and then a pinch each of mint and basil. Fold up the bottom 1/3, fold in the sides and roll up the rest of the length to make an egg roll shape. Set aside and continue with the rest of the ingredients until all of the rice wrappers are used.', u'Serve with soy sauce for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'3 large pots, filled 3/4 of the way with water', u'3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', u' Ice bath, for chilling the blanched ingredients', u'1 pound medium shrimp', u'8 pounds bean thread noodles (glass noodles)', u' Sesame oil, to taste', u'1/2 head iceberg lettuce, shredded', u'2 cucumbers, peeled, seeded and julienned', u'1 pound carrots, peeled and grated', u'1 bunch fresh mint, leaves washed, picked and sliced thinly', u'1 bunch fresh basil, leaves washed, picked and sliced thinly', u'1 package large round rice paper wrappers', u' Soy Sauce, for dipping']
title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Arrange salad bar ingredients in serving dishes and bowls as you prep them: romaine, baby mixed greens, bean sprouts, daikon radishes, carrots, scallions, cucumbers, tomatoes, red onions, mint leaves, basil leaves, nuts and sweet almond or anise "croutons".', u'Heat a grill pan over medium high heat. ', u'Combine soy and oil in a shallow dish. Add chicken and turn to coat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Drizzle fish with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill chicken 3 minutes on each side. Cut chicken into strips on an angle and pile onto a serving plate. Grill fish 4 to 5 minutes on each side, until opaque. Squeeze lime over the fish and break into chunks as you transfer it to a serving plate.', u'Combine all ingredients, except oil, for peanut dressing in a blender. Blend for 30 seconds, then open lid and continue dressing by streaming in oil. Transfer dressing to a serving dish and sprinkle the dressing with a spoonful of nuts from your salad bar to garnish the dish. ', u'For garlic dressing, whisk vinegar, jelly, garlic, black pepper and chili oil together. Stream in vegetable oil while continuing to whisk. When the oil is incorporated, transfer dressing to a small dish to serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 hearts Romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1 sack (10 ounces) mixed baby greens', u'2 cups fresh bean sprouts, any variety', u'1 cup thinly sliced daikon or red radishes', u'2 cups shredded carrots, available prepped in plastic bags in produce case', u'8 scallions, sliced on the bias', u'1/2 seedless cucumber, sliced in 1/2 lengthwise, thinly sliced', u'1 pint yellow or red grape tomatoes', u'1 red onion, quartered and thinly sliced', u'1 bunch fresh mint leaves, trimmed', u'1 bunch fresh basil leaves, trimmed', u'2 (2-ounce) packages chopped nuts, found on baking aisle', u"8 slices almond toast or anisette toast, (recommended: Stella D'Oro) cut into 1-inch pieces", u'1/4 cup tamari dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, eyeball it', u'4 to 8 thin cut chicken cutlets, depending on size', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound mahi mahi', u'1 ripe lime', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar or rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup white grape juice concentrate or apple juice concentrate', u'3 tablespoons peanut butter', u'2 inches fresh ginger root, grated', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped nuts (from salad bar)', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar or rice wine vinegar', u'1/3 cup pepper jelly, available on condiment aisle', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons hot chili oil', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil']
title: Thai-Vietnamese Salad Bar Supreme

directions: [u'Soak vermicelli in water 15 minutes; drain and squeeze out water. Bring a pot of water to a boil. Place vermicelli in sieve and lower into water; remove after 5 seconds. Cool and divide into 12 portions.', u'Soak one rice paper in lukewarm water until pliable, about 5 minutes. Work with only 1 paper at a time and blot dry before assembling.', u'To assemble: Place 1 paper on a clean kitchen towel, leaving 1-inch of the rice paper uncovered on the edge closest to you. Place 1 lettuce leaf on the sheet. Cover with 1 portion of vermicelli, and top with a portion of the cucumbers, carrots, chicken, scallions, and mint leaves. Fold the paper once over the filling, starting from the bottom, then fold in the sides and continue rolling tightly to the end. Keep rolls covered with a damp towel. Serve with Spicy Peanut Sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces dried rice vermicelli', u'12 sheets banh trang rice papers or spring roll wrap 8- inches round', u'12 leaves Boston lettuce, ribs removed (substitution: oak leaf lettuce)', u'1 small cucumber, peeled, halved lengthwise, seeded and thinly sliced in half moons', u'3 medium carrots, peeled and julienned', u'8 ounces boneless skinless cooked chicken breast', u'3 scallions, cut into 1-inch long pieces and julienned', u'24 large mint leaves', u' Spicy Peanut Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons red curry paste', u'1 tablespoon shrimp paste (substitution: fish sauce)', u'1 1/2 cups unsalted roasted peanuts, finely ground', u'1/4 cup palm sugar (substitution: granulated sugar)', u'2 cups unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/2 cup tamarind concentrate', u'3 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'1/2 cup packed fresh Thai basil leaves, minced', u'1/2 cup packed fresh cilantro leaves, minced']
title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls with Spicy Peanut Sauce

directions: [u'To make the Pickled Daikon and Carrot, combine the daikon, carrot, vinegar, and sugar in a bowl, tossing well to coat. Set aside to marinate. ', u'Prepare a medium-hot fire in a charcoal grill with a cover, or preheat a gas grill to medium-high. If a grill is unavailable, simply heat a grill pan over medium-high heat on your stovetop.', u'To make the Patties, combine the pork, garlic, diced chiles, ginger, fish sauce, soy sauce, five-spice powder, sugar, and lime zest and juice in a bowl, mixing well to incorporate. Divide the mixture into 6 portions and form into round patties. ', u'Brush the grill rack with vegetable oil. Place the patties on the rack and grill for 6 to 7 minutes per side, until cooked through. Turn the patties 90 degrees halfway through cooking on each side, to attain grill marks. ', u'Spread the cut side of each bun half with 1/2 tablespoon butter and grill until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. ', u'Spread 1 tablespoon of the mayonnaise on the cut side of each bun bottom and 1 tablespoon of the pate on the cut side of each bun top. Place the cucumber and chile slices on the bun bottoms and top with burger patties. Drain the carrot and daikon pickles and pile a generous amount atop each patty. Add the cilantro sprigs and the pate-smeared bun tops. Enjoy!', u"Cook's note: These burgers can also be served on baguettes, if preferred, in which case, the patties should be formed into oblong shapes. Hamburger buns are a bit softer and easier to manage, which is why I've chosen them for this recipe. If available, buy a peppercorn pate, which adds a great hint of black pepper to the burger. For serving, burgers can be halved and skewered for a beautiful presentation and manageability. They go well with sweet potato french fries or taro chips!", u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups julienned daikon', u'1 1/2 cups julienned carrot', u'3/4 cup distilled white vinegar', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 pounds ground pork', u'6 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 jalapeno chiles, seeded and diced', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (nuoc nam)', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'2 to 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, for brushing the grill rack', u'6 good quality sesame-seed kaiser rolls, split', u'6 tablespoons salted butter, softened', u'6 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'6 tablespoons spreadable pork or liver pate', u'1/2 English cucumber, peeled and thinly sliced', u'2 jalapeno chiles, thinly sliced', u'18 fresh cilantro sprigs']
title: Vietnamese Bistro Burger

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Rinse the wings under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Set aside in a large bowl while you prepare the marinade. Combine the garlic, shallots, ginger, scallions, lemongrass, brown sugar, fish sauce, lime juice and peanut oil in a food processor and process until smooth.', u'Pour the marinade over the wings and place in a large resealable plastic bag. Refrigerate overnight.', u'Preheat a grill to medium. Remove the wings from the marinade; reserve the marinade to brush the wings while they cook. Place the wings on the grill, season with 1 teaspoon salt and cook, turning every few minutes and basting with the marinade for the first 18 or so minutes. Continue to grill the wings until cooked through, 8 to 10 more minutes.', u'Place the wings on a serving platter and garnish with the peanuts and cilantro.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds chicken wings, split at the joint, tips removed', u'2 tablespoons roughly chopped garlic', u'1/4 cup chopped shallots', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh ginger', u'3 tablespoons chopped scallion whites', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped lemongrass bottoms', u'3 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 cup dry-roasted peanuts, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Emeril Lagasse's Grilled Vietnamese-Style Chicken Wings

directions: [u'In a bowl, mix the pork with the  garlic, scallion, 1/2 teaspoon of  the sugar, 1 1/2 tablespoons nuoc  mam, the egg and the cornstarch.  Leave the mixture in the  refrigerator for 30 minutes.  Meanwhile, prepare a charcoal fire.', u'When you are ready to cook the  pork, shape the mixture roughly  into 6 ping-pong sized balls.  Lightly oil a steamer tray and  steam the pork balls for 5 minutes.  Transfer the partially cooked pork  balls to a hot grill fire. Cook for  10 minutes, turning occasionally so  all sides of the balls get golden  brown. Remove the pork balls from  the fire, cut them in half, and  return them to the fire, cut side  down. Grill them for 5 more  minutes. Remove the pork and when  it is cool enough to handle, cut it  in shreds roughly 1 1/2 inches  thick. Reserve.', u'Bring a few quarts of salted water  to the boil. Plunge the shrimp into  the boiling water and turn the heat  off. Remove the shrimp form the  water when just cooked (2 to 3  minutes). In a bowl, mix together  the remaining 2 tablespoons of fish  sauce and the remaining tablespoon  of sugar.
