When the shrimp are cool  enough to handle, peel them and  slice them in half the long way  (cutting each shrimp into 2 thin,  C-shaped pieces). Reserve the  shrimp and fish sauce sugar  mixture.', u"Submerge 1 sheet of banh trang in a  basin of warm water for 2 to 3  seconds, then remove it  immediately. Try to dip all of it  into the water simultaneously and  handle it carefully so it  doesn't tear. Place the sheet  on a dry towel.", u'Roll the sheet right on the towel:  About 1-inch above the lower edge  of the sheet, spread out 1/8  cup of shredded lettuce. Leave a 1  1/2-inch gap between the left edge  of the sheet and the lettuce and  the same between the right edge of  the sheet and the lettuce. Define a  rectangle with the lettuce that is  about 5 inches wide and 3 inches  long toward the center of the  sheet. Now evenly top the lettuce  rectangle with 1/8 of the bean  sprouts, 1/8 of the shredded carrot  and 1/8 of the peanuts. Evenly  distribute 1/8 of the grilled pork  shreds over the rectangle. Tear 5  to 6 mint leaves, and an equal  amount of cilantro and distribute  those over the rectangle. Top  everything with a few sprinkles of  nuoc mam.', u'Carefully pick up the right edge of  the sheet and fold it toward the  center of the filling. Make sure  the folded sheet is even and  uncreased. Do the same with the  left edge of the sheet. The  rectangle of filling should now be  covered by the folded sheet with the  left and right edges meeting each  other at the center of the  rectangle. Pick up the bottom edge  of the sheet and start rolling away  from you, making sure to tuck the  filling in tightly as you roll.  When you have rolled about halfway  to the top of the sheet, dip the  shrimp halves in the reserved fish  sauce-sugar mixture. Place 2 shrimp  halves along the cylinder that you  have half-rolled and keep on  rolling until a fully rolled  cylinder has been formed. Place it  under a damp towel. Repeat the  process 7 more times to make 7 more  rolls. Serve immediately or cover  the rolls with damp towels and']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound fatty ground pork', u'2 medium cloves garlic, finely minced', u'1 thin scallion, finely minced', u'3 1/2 tablespoons nuoc mam Vietnamese fish sauce, plus extra for sprinkling', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 egg, beaten', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'8 medium-sized shrimp, about 1/4 pound', u'8 square sheets banh trang, 8 1/2 inches per side', u'1 cup shredded lettuce', u'1/2 cup mung bean sprouts', u'1/2 large carrot, shredded', u'4 teaspoons chopped dry-roasted peanuts', u'1 large bunch fresh mint', u'1 large bunch fresh cilantro']
title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls with Shrimp and Ground Pork

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheated a grill to medium-high heat.', u'In a resealable plastic food storage bag, combine the scallions, minced chile pepper, garlic, 1 tablespoon of the sugar, black pepper, fish sauce, and lime juice and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add the pork, turn to coat evenly, and seal. Allow to marinate, turning occasionally, at least 6 hours and up to overnight, in the refrigerator. Remove the pork from the marinade. Pat the pork dry and brush all over with the vegetable oil. Place on the grill, turning often, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center registers 145 to 150 degrees F, 18 to 20 minutes. Remove the pork from the grill and allow to rest prior to slicing.', u'In a small nonreactive saucepan combine the vinegar, remaining 3 tablespoons of sugar, crushed red pepper, and salt and bring to a boil, stirring until sugar and salt are dissolved. Remove from the heat and cool slightly. ', u'Cut the French bread into 4 pieces, about 6-inches long. Cut each piece in half lengthwise. If the bread is very dense, remove some of the inner bread by pinching pieces to hollow bread slightly.  Place the bread halves on the grill to toast.  Transfer the slightly cooled vinegar mixture to a nonreactive mixing bowl and add the carrots and daikon. Place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes and up to overnight. Spread both sides of the toasted bread liberally with mayonnaise. Slice the pork into rounds and divide evenly between the bottoms of each sandwich.  Top with cucumber slices, pickled carrot and daikon mixture, and sliced peppers to taste.  Garnish with cilantro leaves then place the top of the sandwich over all. Cut each sandwich in half, serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 scallions, minced', u'1 fresh red or green chile pepper, seeded and minced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'4 tablespoons sugar, divided', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons lime juice', u'1 pork tenderloin, about 1 1/2 pounds, trimmed', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 baguette', u'2 carrots, peeled and thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'1 cup thinly sliced daikon', u'2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u' Mayonnaise', u'1/2 English cucumber, peeled and thinly sliced', u'3 jalapeno or serrano peppers, seeded and thinly sliced', u' Fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Vietnamese-Style Marinated and Grilled Pork Poboy (Banh Mi)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the broth: Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 450 degrees F. Toss the beef shanks, onions, ginger and garlic with the vegetable oil on a rimmed baking sheet and season generously with salt. Roast, turning once halfway through, until the meat and vegetables are slightly charred, about 30 minutes. Transfer to a large pot.', u'Meanwhile, toast the cinnamon sticks, star anise pods and peppercorns in a small skillet over medium heat, shaking the pan, 5 minutes.', u'Add the beef broth, 2 quarts water, the toasted spices and the fish sauce to the pot with the beef shanks. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook, skimming off any foam that rises to the top, until the meat is tender, 1 hour to 1 hour, 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer the beef shanks to a cutting board; strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve into another large pot. (The broth can be made up to 2 days ahead; let cool, then refrigerate in a covered container.)', u'Shred the meat from the shanks with two forks, discarding any bits of cartilage, then stir back into the broth. Discard the bones.', u'Cook the noodles as the label directs. Divide the broth and shredded meat among bowls, then add the noodles and roast beef. Top with the bean sprouts, basil, jalapenos and red onion; serve with hoisin sauce and/or Sriracha.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'2 beef shanks with meat on them (about 2 1/4 pounds total)', u'3 large yellow onions, halved', u'1 6 -inch piece ginger, halved lengthwise', u'1 head garlic, halved crosswise', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'4 star anise pods', u'3 tablespoons black peppercorns', u'3 quarts low-sodium beef broth', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'1 pound flat rice noodles', u'8 ounces deli-sliced roast beef, torn into pieces', u'4 cups bean sprouts', u'1 large bunch Thai basil or mint, leaves torn', u'2 jalapeno peppers (red and/or green), thinly sliced', u'1 large red onion, thinly sliced', u' Hoisin sauce and/or Sriracha (Asian chile sauce), for serving']
title: Beef Pho

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the grill.', u'In a large non-stick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until just beginning to color, about 6 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Remove from the heat.', u'Press three star anise into the flesh of the halved onions and place on the grill. Grill until blackened, about 8 minutes. Remove from the heat.', u'Add the bones to a large stockpot and cover with water by 2 inches and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes, skimming the top to remove any foam that forms on the surface. Add grilled and Sauteed onions, and the remaining ingredients, stir well, and simmer partly covered for at least 6 and up to 10 hours, adding more water as needed to keep the bones covered by 1-inch. Strain through cheesecloth or a fine mesh strainer. Remove meat from bones and set aside. Discard everything but the meat from the bones and the broth.', u'Meanwhile, bring a pot of water to a boil, and heat enough vegetable oil in a large saucepan to come 4 inches up the sides. Add half of the noodles to the water and boil until just tender, then drain in a colander. Add the remaining noodles to the hot oil and fry briefly until golden brown and crisp, then transfer to paper towels to drain.', u'To make the Pho, bring the soup to a simmer, as needed, and add the fish sauce. Transfer to a large tureen or pot that can be placed on the table and kept warm. Drain the boiled noodles in a colander and divide among 6 soup bowls. Divide the remaining ingredients and the reserved meat from the bones among the bowls and ladle the broth over each portion at the table. Garnish with lime wedges and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'2 cups sliced yellow onions, plus 1 yellow onion, halved', u'3 star anise pods, plus 1 piece star anise', u'2 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed', u'5 pounds meaty beef bones', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh gingerroot', u'1 cinnamon stick, broken in half', u'2 tablespoons whole black peppercorns', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'12 ounces rice vermicelli noodles', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/2 pound beef sirloin, very thinly sliced', u'1 cup thinly sliced yellow onion', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'4 small red chiles, sliced', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced green onions (green tops only)', u' Lime wedges, as garnish']
title: Emerilized Banh Pho Bo: Vietnamese Beef Noodle Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Rinse the wing pieces under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Set aside in a large bowl while you prepare the marinade. Combine the garlic, shallots, ginger, green onions, lemongrass, brown sugar, fish sauce, lime juice and peanut oil in the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth. Pour the marinade over the chicken wings and place in a plastic resealable food storage bag. Refrigerate overnight.', u'Preheat the grill to medium and remove the wings from the marinade. Reserve the marinade to brush the wings while they cook. Place the wings on the grill and season with the salt, and cook, turning over every few minutes and basting with the marinade for the first 18 minutes or so. Continue to cook the wings until cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes more.', u'Place the chicken on a serving platter and garnish with the chopped peanuts and chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3 to 3 1/2 pounds wings, separated at the joints, wing tips reserved for another purpose', u'2 tablespoons roughly chopped garlic', u'1/4 cup chopped shallots', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh ginger', u'3 tablespoons chopped green onion bottoms', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped lemongrass bottoms', u'3 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons lime juice', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup dry-roasted peanuts, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Grilled Vietnamese-style Chicken Wings

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'For the pickled carrots: In a large bowl, whisk together the sugar, vinegar, and salt until dissolved. Add the carrots, toss to coat and allow to pickle for about 2 hours.', u'For the pork: Combine the soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, five-spice powder, garam masala, black pepper, garlic and shallots in a re-sealable plastic bag. Seal and shake until well dissolved. Add the pork to the bag, massage the marinade into the pork and marinate for 1 hour.', u"When you're ready to cook the pork, grab a large cast-iron skillet. Place the pan over high heat until it is smoking. Using a pair of tongs, pull each pork chop out of the marinade, shake off the excess and place it in the pan. Don't crowd the pan - no meat should be touching! You want the meat to sear, not steam.", u"After about 2 minutes, flip each chop; it should be a caramel brown color. Cook another minute on the other side and remove from the pan. If you're cooking in batches, cook the remaining chops.", u'Slice the chops into thin strips.', u"For the sandwiches: Warm the tortillas up over an open flame so they become soft and pliable. I also like to char them a little! If you don't have a gas stove, warm them in a pan over medium heat, or pop them in a microwave for 10 to 15 seconds. Smear a little mayo down the middle of the tortilla. Then, pile a little layer of pickled carrots, some cucumber slices, a few sprigs of cilantro, some mint leaves, pork chop strips, a few slices of chiles a and squeeze of fresh lime juice over the top. Wrap, and secure with toothpick. Wrap in parchment paper if you're taking them to the beach, or just eat right away if you're not!"]
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup distilled white vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'4 cups shredded carrots (10 ounces)', u'1/4 cup soy sauce (I use gluten-free low-sodium tamari)', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon five-spice powder', u'1 teaspoon garam masala, store-bought or homemade, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cloves garlic, crushed', u'1 small shallot, minced (about 3 tablespoons)', u'1 pound (1/2-inch thick) boneless center-cut pork loin chops', u'4 flour tortillas (gluten-free alternative: brown rice tortillas, or use small corn ones and make these as tacos!)', u' Mayonnaise, as needed', u'1 English cucumber, sliced thinly on the bias', u'1 bunch fresh cilantro', u'1 bunch fresh mint', u'4 Fresno chiles, or jalapeno peppers, sliced thinly', u'2 limes, each cut into 4 wedges', u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 2 tablespoons of seeds)', u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'4 large black cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 1 tablespoon of seeds), optional', u"3 large cinnamon sticks (if you have the kind you get at Indian stores, it's about 3 tablespoons of cinnamon bark bits)"]
title: Banh-mi Wrap: Vietnamese Grilled Pork Wrap with Pickled Carrots and Mint

directions: [u'Soak the rice papers a few at a time in hot water. Have a towel ready to work on and to take up some of the extra moisture.', u'Have your fillings ready and seasoned.', u'Roll a variety of salad rolls (some just chicken, just vegetable, some combos, etc.) until all filling and wrappers are used.', u'Arrange the garnishes on a platter along with the fresh salad rolls and the nuoc cham dipping sauce.', u'Tradition has it that the guests using a lettuce leaf as a cup will garnish his or her own salad roll as they choose and dip into nuoc cham.']
ingredients: [u'24 rice paper sheets (available in Chinatown)', u'1 cup fish sauce', u'4 tablespoons lime juice', u'1 teaspoon garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons chili', u'4 tablespoons water', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon ginger', u'2 tablespoons lemongrass', u'1/2 tablespoon garlic', u'2 tablespoons lime', u'1 tablespoon chili paste', u'1 tablespoon hoisin', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 small napa cabbage, fine chiffonade', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded and finely julienned', u'2 red peppers, finely julienned', u'1 carrot, finely julienned', u'2 tablespoons ginger, minced', u'2 to 3 tablespoons cilantro, chopped', u'2 to 3 tablespoons mint, chopped', u'2 to 3 tablespoons nuoc cham', u'4 ounces shredded chicken breast', u'4 ounces sliced beef sirloin tip', u'4 ounces coarsely chopped shrimp', u'12 to 16 small lettuce leaves', u'10 to 12 sprigs of mint', u'10 to 12 sprigs of cilantro', u'1 cucumber, cut into small spears', u'1/2 cup mung bean sprouts', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'10 to 12 chiles (preferably fresh Thai Bird)', u'10 to 12 lime wedges']
title: Vietnamese Salad Rolls with Chicken, Shrimp and Beef

directions: [u'Make the slaw: In a small saucepan, combine the water, sugar, and vinegar and bring to a boil. Transfer the vinegar mixture to a bowl and cool. Add the carrot and daikon, mix well, and season with salt. Set aside to marinate for 30 minutes or store in the refrigerator up to overnight.', u'Meanwhile, make the seasoned pork: Heat the oil in small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until soft. Add the pork, seasoning, garlic, and pepper and cook, stirring, until just cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the heat and set aside covered with foil to keep warm.', u'Make the sandwiches: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Slice the baguettes open lengthwise, and slather the insides with mayonnaise. Arrange the baguettes on a baking sheet and bake until hot and crusty about 5 minutes. Remove the baguettes from the oven and immediately fill each with some of the seasoned pork. In each sandwich, arrange 2 slices each of the pork roll and salami, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, 1/2 tablespoon cilantro, 1 slice cucumber, ground pepper, and chili oil, if using. Serve immediately with the slaw on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup water', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup distilled white vinegar', u'1/2 cup julienned carrot', u'1/2 cup julienned daikon radish', u' Kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped onion', u'6 ounces ground pork', u'1 tablespoon roast pork seasoning mix, available in Asian markets', u' Pinch garlic powder', u' Pinch ground black pepper', u'4 (10-inch) baguettes', u' Mayonnaise, as needed', u'8 thin slices Vietnamese-style pork roll (cha lua), or bologna', u'8 slices Vietnamese-style salami, or ham or turkey', u'4 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro sprigs', u'1/4 medium English cucumber, cut lengthwise into 4 slices', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' Asian-style chili oil, to taste, optional']
title: Vietnamese-Style Sandwich: Banh Mi

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Season the shoulder with salt and pepper.  Place on a baking sheet and roast  for 1 hour. Reduce the temperature to 300 degrees F and continue to cook for 3 hours, or until  the meat falls off the bones.  Remove from the heat and cool completely.  In the cup of a blender, combine the egg, lime juice, mustard, chili paste, and sesame oil.  Season with salt and pepper.  Process until smooth. With the blender running, slowly drizzle in the oil and blend.  The mixture will be thick. Season with salt and pepper.  Remove, cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.  The mixture will keep for up to 2 days.  Slice the roast pork.  To assemble, slice the bread in half.  Spread the chili mayo over both halves of bread. Layer the pork over one half of the bread, set the other half aside.  Continue layering with the carrots, cucumbers, scallions, cilantro and jalapeno.  Place the remaining half on top and press slightly. Slice the sandwich into individual pieces and serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 pound bone-in pork shoulder', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 large egg', u'2 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon Creole or other whole grain mustard', u'1 tablespoon chili paste', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 cup vegetable oil', u'1 loaf French bread (about 24 inches long)', u'2 cups julienne carrots', u'2 cups julienne cucumbers, (peeled and seeded)', u'1 cup chopped scallions (green onions)', u'1 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 medium fresh jalapeno, thinly sliced']
title: Vietnamese Style Poor Boys

directions: [u'In a large mixing bowl, combine the sugar, fish sauce, honey, and  pepper. Mix until the sugar has dissolved. Add the bashed spring onion, garlic, and sliced pork neck.', u'Coat the pork well then enclose the flavours with the vegetable oil. Let the mixture marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight, for a better result.', u'Preheat a grill on medium to high heat. Thread the pork onto the skewers and char grill on medium to high heat for 1 to 2 minutes on each side, or until brown and cooked through.', u'Divide the cooked vermicelli noodle among 4 to 6 bowls, add the mint, perilla leaves, Vietnamese mint, cucumber, and bean sprouts, then add 1 to 2 pork skewers to each bowl.', u'Dress each bowl with 2 tablespoons of dipping fish sauce, a teaspoon of spring onion oil, and sprinkle fried Asian shallots and crushed peanuts on top. ', u'To make the dipping fish sauce: Combine the fish sauce, vinegar, sugar, and water in a saucepan and place on medium heat. Stir well and cook until just before boiling point is reached, then allow to cool. To serve, finely chop the garlic and chile and stir through with the lime juice.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'6 spring onions (white part only), finely sliced, and pounded in mortar and pestle to a paste', u'2 cloves garlic, finely diced', u'18 ounces pork neck, finely sliced across the grain into 1/8-inch thick pieces', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'9 ounces cooked rice vermicelli noodle', u'5 fresh mint leaves, sliced', u'5 fresh perilla leaves, sliced', u'5 fresh Vietnamese mint leaves, sliced', u'1 Lebanese cucumber, halved and sliced', u'2 handfuls bean sprouts', u'4 tablespoons spring onion oil', u'1/2 cup Dipping Fish Sauce, recipe follows', u'4 tablespoons fried red Asian shallots*', u'4 tablespoons crushed roasted peanuts', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets.', u' Special equipment: 12 bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 20 minutes or 12 wooden chopsticks sliced half way down the middle', u' Dipping Fish Sauce', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 ounces or 1/2 cup water', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 chile, chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice']
title: Char Grilled Pork Neck with Vermicelli Noodles: Bun Thit Nuong

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the pork: Mash the garlic into a paste with the flat side of a knife. Transfer to a large bowl and stir in the lemongrass, shallots, brown sugar, fish sauce, soy sauce, vegetable oil and  1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add the pork and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight.', u'Make the sauce: Whisk the lime juice, fish sauce, granulated sugar,  1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 cup water in a small bowl. Stir in the carrot, chile sauce and garlic.', u'Preheat a grill to high. Brush the grill with vegetable oil. Remove the pork from the marinade and grill until well marked, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes, then cut into strips. Arrange the pork and lettuce on a platter; set out the herbs, cucumber, jalapeno and fried shallots for fixings. Assemble the lettuce wraps and serve with the carrot sauce and shrimp chips.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh lemongrass', u'2 shallots, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup packed light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for brushing', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds thin boneless pork chops', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons granulated sugar', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon grated carrot', u'1 teaspoon Asian chile sauce, such as sambal oelek', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 head Boston lettuce, leaves separated', u'1/2 bunch mint', u'1/2 bunch basil', u'1/2 bunch cilantro', u'1 English cucumber, thinly sliced', u'1 red jalapeno pepper, seeded and thinly sliced', u'1 cup prepared fried shallots, scallions or onions', u'1 bag Asian shrimp chips']
title: Grilled Pork Lettuce Wraps

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a blender, mix the lime juice, soy sauce, rice syrup, vegetable and sesame oils, garlic, and ginger on high speed for 10 seconds. ', u'In a bowl, combine the radishes and carrots with 1/2 cup of the lime juice mixture. Toss and refrigerate for 15 minutes. ', u'Cut each baguette in half lengthwise without cutting all the way through. Scoop out about 1/2-inch of the soft dough inside both sides of the bread. Spread each side with the lime juice mixture and top with the baked catfish. Drain the shredded vegetables and arrange on top of the fish. Lay the cilantro and peppers over the vegetables. Cover with the top piece of bread, pressing down to seal.  Slice each sandwich on the bias into 2-inch thick pieces, getting about 15 mini-sandwiches per baguette.']
ingredients: [u'11/2 cups fresh lime juice', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'1/3 cup rice syrup (available in Asian markets), or honey', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u'3 cups grated peeled daikon radish', u'3 cups grated peeled carrots', u'2 long French bread baguettes, about 30-inches each', u'5 baked catfish fillets, recipe follows', u'1 cup fresh cilantro, stems trimmed', u'3 jalapeno or serrano chile peppers, thinly sliced', u'5 catfish fillets, halved', u'2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon ginger, minced', u'1 teaspoon garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon lime zest', u' Cayenne']
title: Catfish Banh Mi: Vietnamese Catfish Po-Boy

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Meanwhile, combine the sugar and 2 tablespoons hot water in a large bowl and stir until dissolved. Stir in the lime juice, garlic, chile and fish sauce; transfer 2 tablespoons of the dressing to a medium bowl and whisk in the vegetable oil. Add the shrimp and toss to coat; set aside.', u'Add the rice noodles to the boiling water and cook as the label directs; drain, rinse with cold water and shake off the excess liquid. Add the noodles to the bowl with the remaining dressing; add the lettuce, carrots, cucumber and herbs and toss to coat.', u'Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the shrimp until charred and cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Arrange over the noodles; serve with lime wedges.', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/3 cup fresh lime juice (from 4 limes), plus wedges for serving', u'2 large cloves garlic, grated', u'1 red Thai bird or serrano chile pepper, thinly sliced', u' (remove seeds for less heat)', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'12 ounces large shrimp (about 16), peeled and deveined, tails intact', u'1 8 .8-ounce package thin rice noodles', u'1/2 head red leaf lettuce, thinly sliced', u'2 large carrots, grated (about 2 cups)', u'1/2 English cucumber, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced', u'1 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro and/or mint']
title: Rice Noodle Salad with Shrimp

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Prepare the rice vermicelli according to package directions and transfer to a colander to drain. Rinse well with cold running water. Drain thoroughly before using. (The noodles may be prepared up to this point 2 hours ahead of serving.)', u'In a small skillet heat the peanut oil over high heat and add the shallots. Cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown and crispy. Transfer to a paper lined plate to drain. Reduce the heat to low and remove all but 2 tablespoons of the oil from the pan. Add the chopped green onions to the skillet and cook, stirring constantly, until soft but do not allow to brown, about 1 minute. Transfer green onions to a small bowl and set aside to cool to room temperature.', u'Divide the drained vermicelli, lettuce, bean sprouts, and cucumber evenly among 6 deep soup bowls. Top with the meatballs, spearmint leaves, and cilantro. Garnish with the peanuts, crispy shallots, and sauteed green onions. Drizzle generously with Nuoc Cham Sauce and serve immediately, with chopsticks and more Nuoc Cham sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound rice vermicelli (bun)', u'1/2 cup peanut oil', u'4 shallots, thinly sliced', u'6 green onions, sliced crosswise on the diagonal', u'2 cups thinly sliced crispy lettuce, such as romaine or iceberg', u'2 cups bean sprouts, rinsed well and patted dry', u'1 medium cucumber, peeled, halved lengthwise, and thinly sliced', u'1 recipe Vietnamese BBQ Pork Meatballs, recipe follows, warmed and thinly sliced', u'1 cup fresh spearmint leaves, shredded', u'1 cup fresh cilantro leaves, shredded', u'1/2 cup finely chopped unsalted roasted peanuts', u' Nuoc Cham Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 1/2 pounds lean pork meat, such as loin, trimmed of any gristle or membranes and cut into small dice', u'1/2 cup finely chopped shallots', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'4 teaspoons sugar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (Nuoc Nam)', u'1 1/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'5 tablespoons short grain glutinous rice, such as sushi rice', u'4 ounces pork fat, cubed', u' Vegetable oil', u'6 to 8 (8-inch) bamboo skewers, soaked in warm water for at least 30 minutes', u'2 small garlic cloves, minced or crushed', u'1 small fresh red chile pepper, seeded and minced', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup Nuoc Nam (Vietnamese fish sauce)', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 to 2 tablespoons finely shredded carrot']
title: Vermicelli Salad Bowl with Vietnamese BBQ Pork Meatballs

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, and kelp. Cover and let sit for 12 to 24 hours. Strain the soy mixture. Add the oil, honey garlic, black pepper and cayenne to the strained mixture, and whisk to combine.', u'In a large bowl, toss the jicama, cabbage, carrots, mint, and chili with dressing to taste. Fold in the grapefruit segments, being careful not to break, adding more dressing as needed. Top with the candied pecans, and serve.', u'Yield: 6 servings']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons soy sauce', u'8 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'3/4 -inch square piece Konbu (dried kelp)', u'1 cup grape seed oil', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1 (1-pound) jicama, peeled and julienned', u'1/2 pound red cabbage, finely sliced', u'1 large carrot, peeled and julienned', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1 fresh Thai chile, thinly sliced, or Serrano chile', u'2 ruby red grapefruits, peeled and segmented', u' Candied Pecans, recipe follows', u'2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'1/2 cup pecan pieces', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/8 teaspoon salt']
title: Vietnamese Grapefruit and Jicama Salad in a Ponzu Dressing with Candied Pecans

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Place the chicken breast-side up in a high-sided pot that fits the chicken snugly. Fill the pot with cold water to about 1 inch above the chicken and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.', u'While waiting for the water to boil, cut the ginger into very thin rounds, peel and quarter 1 of the onions and add them and 1 tablespoon salt to the pot.', u'Once the water reaches a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook, skimming and discarding any scum that floats to the surface of the poaching liquid, until an instant-read thermometer inserted between the breast and thigh of the chicken reads 165 degrees F, 30 to 35 minutes. (To take the temperature, use a pair of sturdy tongs to carefully lift the chicken out of the hot poaching liquid and insert the thermometer between the breast and thigh.)', u'While the chicken is cooking, core the white and purple cabbages, very thinly slice them into ribbonlike strands and place the sliced cabbage in a large bowl; set aside.', u'Fill a second large bowl a little more than halfway with equal parts ice and water, and use the tongs to add the cooked chicken to it; reserve the pot and poaching liquid. Leave the chicken in the ice water to cool completely, about 10 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, peel, halve and very thinly slice the remaining onion, and place it in a small bowl. Add the vinegar, oil, 1 teaspoon of the sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Use your hands to gently massage the vinegar mixture into the onions until they begin to wilt slightly. Let the marinated onions sit at room temperature for at least 15 minutes and up to overnight.', u'Discard the ice water, but keep the chicken in the bowl. Remove and discard the skin. Shred the chicken into large bite-size pieces; set aside.', u'Add the chicken carcass to the poaching liquid, and return it to a simmer. Cook for 30 minutes, skimming off any fat and/or scum that floats to the surface. Strain the poaching liquid over a large bowl; discard the solids. Let this flavorful broth cool completely, and reserve it for another purpose. (It can be frozen in an airtight container for up to 3 months.)', u'While the broth is cooking, make the dressing: Cook the remaining sugar and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has completely dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove to a small bowl and let cool slightly.', u'While the sugar mixture is cooling, finely grate the garlic, halve and juice the limes (about 1/2 cup of juice total) and slice the chiles into thin rounds. Whisk the fish sauce into the cooled sugar mixture; add the garlic, lime juice and chiles.', u'To assemble the salad, add the chicken, marinated onions (and any residual liquid) and lime dressing to the cabbage bowl. Tear the mint and basil leaves into the bowl, and gently toss to combine. Season with additional fish sauce if needed. Let the salad sit for 15 minutes so the flavors can marry, then transfer to a large platter. Place the peanuts and fried shallots in separate piles beside the salad. Just before serving, gently toss together the salad, peanuts and fried shallots and any liquid that has accumulated at the bottom of the platter (the liquid has a lot of great flavor). Serve with the fried shrimp chips.', u'Copyright 2014 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u' One 5-pound whole chicken', u' One 2-inch piece fresh ginger', u'2 medium red onions', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 large head of white cabbage (from about a 3-pound head)', u'1/2 small head purple cabbage (from about a 2-pound head)', u'3 tablespoons distilled white vinegar', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'6 cloves garlic', u'6 limes', u'2 red Thai bird chiles', u'1/3 cup Asian fish sauce', u'1 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1 cup fresh Thai basil leaves', u'1/2 cup roasted salted peanuts', u'1/2 cup store-bought fried shallots or onions', u' Fried shrimp chips, for serving']
title: Vietnamese Chicken Salad (Goi Ga)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a small bowl, soak the mung beans in warm water until they are softened, about 30 minutes. Drain the beans and transfer them to a blender. Add the coconut milk and puree until very smooth. Add the rice flour, sugar and turmeric; season with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Refrigerate the crepe batter for 1 hour.', u'In a bowl, combine the pork and shrimp with the fish sauce, garlic, sugar and black pepper. Let stand for 15 to 20 minutes. ', u'In another bowl combine the scallions, bean sprouts and mushrooms. Divide the mixture into 6 small, separate mounds and place them on a clean work surface.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil in a skillet. When hot, add the pork and shrimp mixture and saute for 2 minutes. Remove to a platter. ', u'In a wok or a 10-inch nonstick omelet pan, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium heat. When the oil is very hot, stir the rice batter well and pour 1/2 cup of the batter into the hot pan; tilt and swirl the pan to coat with a thin layer of batter on bottom and partially up the sides. Scatter the crepe with 1 of the vegetable mounds, 4 slices of the pork, and 4 pieces of shrimp. Reduce the heat and cook until the bottom of the crepe is golden and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes. Using a spatula, loosen the crepe from the bottom of the pan and gently fold in half. Slide the crepe onto an ovenproof plate or platter and keep warm in a low oven. Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients. ', u'To serve, place a crepe on a plate and serve with bowls of the lettuce leaves, mint leaves, cilantro leaves, basil leaves, Pickled Cucumber, Carrot and Daikon, and the Spicy Vietnamese Dipping Sauce, so that guests can garnish their crepes, to taste.', u'Pickled Vegetables']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup dried yellow mung beans', u'2 cups coconut milk', u'1 cup rice flour', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 pound boneless pork loin, cut into 1/4-inch slices', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled, deveined, and halved lengthwise', u'1 1/2 tablespoons nuoc nam (Vietnamese fish sauce)', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'1 pack enoki mushrooms', u' Vegetable oil, as needed', u' Red leaf lettuce, mint leaves, cilantro leaves, and basil leaves, for serving', u' Pickled Cucumber, Carrot and Daikon, for serving, recipe follows', u' Spicy Vietnamese Dipping Sauce, for serving, recipe follows', u'1 1/4 cups rice wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 carrots, peeled and thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'1 cucumber, peeled and thinly sliced', u'1 cup thinly sliced daikon', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons chili paste or 1 chopped red chile', u'2 to 3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 to 2 tablespoons lime juice', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced scallion']
title: Banh Xeo Vietnamese "Crepe"

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'To make the dressing, in a medium bowl whisk the warm water with the sugar until thoroughly combined. Add the fish sauce, lime juice, rice vinegar, garlic and red pepper flakes, and whisk to combine. Cover and set aside at room temperature for 1 hour.', u'To make the salad, bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil. Add the asparagus and cook until fork tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain and refresh in a bowl of ice water. Drain.', u'In a bowl, cover the noodles with hot water and soak until softened, about 3 minutes. Drain the noodles and cook in the boiling water until tender, 1 minute. Drain noodles and refresh in cold water. Drain.', u'In a bowl, toss the noodles with 1/2 cup of the dressing. Divide among 4 plates. Add the asparagus, crabmeat, and green onions to the bowl, and toss with 1/4 cup of the dressing. Arrange on top of the noodles. Garnish each serving with cilantro sprigs, chopped peanuts, and a drizzle of the remaining dressing.', u'Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup warm water', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup Asian fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 pound asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1/2 pound rice-stick noodles, cut into 4 inch-pieces', u'1/2 pound lump crabmeat, picked over for cartilage', u'4 green onions, cut into 2-inch pieces and julienned', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro sprigs', u'2 tablespoons chopped peanuts']
title: Vietnamese-French Crabmeat and Asparagus Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the salmon: Whisk the grapeseed oil, ginger, garlic, shallot, lemongrass, lime juice, fish sauce, brown sugar, a pinch of salt and 1/2 cup water in a medium bowl. Place the salmon on a rimmed baking sheet and pour the marinade on top. Turn the salmon so the marinade coats both sides. Cover and refrigerate, 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, make the carrot-sesame dressing: Whisk the fish sauce, rice vinegar, Sriracha, sesame oil, brown sugar, lime juice and a pinch of salt in a medium bowl until the sugar dissolves. Add the carrot, scallions and 1/4 cup water; stir to combine. Set aside.', u'Preheat a grill to medium high. Remove the salmon from the marinade, wiping off any excess. Brush the grill grates with grapeseed oil. Brush the skin side of the salmon generously with grapeseed oil, then place on the grill skin-side down. Cover and cook until the skin is crisp and the salmon is nearly cooked through, about 8 minutes. Uncover and cook until the salmon is just cooked through, about 5 more minutes. (Do not flip the fish.)', u'Transfer the salmon to a platter and spoon the carrot-sesame dressing on top.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil, plus more for brushing', u'1 tablespoon grated ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 small shallot, minced', u'1 stalk lemongrass, finely chopped', u' Juice of 2 limes', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar', u' Kosher salt', u'2 sides wild salmon, skin on (1 3/4 to 2 pounds each)', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon Sriracha', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons packed light brown sugar', u' Juice of 1 lime', u' Kosher salt', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'3 scallions, chopped']
title: Vietnamese Grilled Salmon

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler to high. Split the baguette or rolls and brush both sides lightly with butter. Broil until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes.', u'Remove from the broiler and spread both sides with mayonnaise. Toss the scallions, carrot and cucumber in the dressing. Stack the sandwiches with fish, the tossed vegetables, herbs, watercress and chili sauce, if desired.', u'This dish is made using leftovers from Thai Red Curry Mahi Mahi Salad.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achiellos']
ingredients: [u'1/2 baguette, cut into 2 pieces, or 2 ciabatta rolls', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'2 scallions, sliced lengthwise and cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1/2 carrot, shredded or julienned', u'1/2 Kirby cucumber, julienned', u'1 tablespoon leftover Thai salad dressing', u'2 leftover Thai Red Curry Mahi Mahi fillets', u'1/2 bunch fresh cilantro or mint', u'1/2 bunch watercress, woody stems removed', u' Asian chili sauce (optional)']
title: Mahi Mahi Banh Mi (Vietnamese Sandwiches)

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise with the mustard. Toss the herb salad mix in a separate small bowl with the extra-virgin olive oil, lemon juice and some salt and pepper.', u'Slather both cut sides of the bread with the mayonnaise-mustard mixture. On one slice of bread, layer on the meatloaf slices, pickles and then the salad. Top with the second slice of bread, slice and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup Dijon mustard', u' Handful of mixed herb salad', u'2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 teaspoon lemon juice', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u' One 8-inch loaf French bread, sliced open, untoasted', u' Two 1/2-inch-thick slices meatloaf', u' Assorted pickles, such as carrots, cucumbers and/or turnips, for topping']
title: Vietnamese-Style Meatloaf Sub

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the instant espresso powder in a small bowl with 1/2 cup of hot water. Stir and let the espresso dissolve completely, then allow to cool completely. Pour into an ice cube tray and freeze until completely set, at least 2 hours and up to overnight.', u'Put the coconut ice cream and sweetened condensed milk in the blender, then add the espresso ice cubes. Blend until the mixture is completely combined and smooth, about 2 minutes. (Stop the blender as needed and use a spoon to help evenly disperse the ingredients as they blend.) Pour into a tall glass and top with whipped cream and toasted shredded coconut if using.', u'Copyright 2015 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 teaspoons instant espresso powder', u'1 1/2 cups coconut ice cream (about 5 large scoops)', u'1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk', u' Sweetened whipped cream, for serving', u'1 teaspoon toasted sweetened shredded coconut, optional']
title: Vietnamese Iced Coffee Milkshake

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'For the broth: Place a large colander in the sink. Place the oxtails, marrow bones, beef shin and pork hocks in a large (at least 8-quart) pot. Cover with cold water and bring to a boil over high heat. Let boil for a few minutes, then remove from the heat. Scoop out the bones and meat into the colander and discard the water. Wash the pot. Rinse off the bones and meat and put them back into the pot. Fill with fresh cold water to cover by 1 inch. Add the yellow onion halves and 1 tablespoon salt. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Periodically skim the foam and some, but not all, of the fat. Simmer until the meats are tender but not falling apart, 1 to 1 1/2 hours, then remove the beef shins and pork hocks. (Do not remove the oxtails or pork neck bones at this stage, if using.) When the meats are completely cool, wrap them in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.', u'Meanwhile, cut the tops off of the lemongrass stalks, about 6 inches from the base, and discard. Smash 6 of the bottom stalks with a meat pounder to bruise and open up the lemongrass. For the remaining 4 stalks, peel off 2 or 3 layers until you reach the smoother, more tender core. Quarter the peeled stalks lengthwise and then slice thinly across. Reserve the sliced lemongrass for the satay.', u'Add the bruised lemongrass stalks to the broth and continue to simmer until the broth has reduced by about 10 percent from its original amount, about 1 more hour, then strain the broth into a clean pot. If using, pick the meat from the cooled oxtail and pork neck bones (save the beef shins and pork hocks for later) and reserve; discard the bones, onion and lemongrass.', u'Bring the shrimp paste and 2 cups water to a simmer in a small saucepan, then let simmer for 5 minutes. Skim off the foam. Remove from the heat and let sit for 15 minutes for the fine solids to settle to the bottom. Pour the shrimp water into the large pot of stock, leaving the fine solids behind.', u'For the satay: Heat the vegetable oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the annatto seeds and let the seeds infuse the oil and turn it red, about 1 minute. Scoop out the seeds with a spoon and discard. Add the shallots to the annatto oil and cook until starting to brown, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic, chile flakes and the reserved chopped lemongrass and cook until the garlic starts to brown, about 3 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons fish sauce, 4 teaspoons sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir to incorporate and then cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is sticky and thickened slightly to the texture of loose jam. (The satay is done when a spoon dragged across the bottom of the skillet leaves a trail and the oil begins to separate from the solids.) Turn off the heat and remove half of the satay for serving. Add about 1 cup of the broth to the remaining satay in the skillet and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 5 minutes to infuse, then strain back into the pot with the broth.', u'Add the remaining tablespoon fish sauce, teaspoon sugar and 2 teaspoons salt to the broth. Simmer for 15 minutes for the flavors to meld. Add the pork hocks back into the simmering broth to re-warm, and slice the beef shin meat . Before serving, taste the broth and add more seasoning, if necessary.', u"Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles according to the manufacturer's instructions. Drain very well, and divide among 8 bowls. Top each bowl with a pork hock, if using, some slices of shin, some oxtail and pork neck meat, if using; top with scallions, white onion and cilantro. Pour hot broth into the bowls to completely cover the noodles.", u'Serve with the reserved satay and suggested garnishes on the side.', u'Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'5 pounds oxtail and/or beef marrow bones', u'1 pound boneless beef shin (or flank steak)', u'2 pounds pork hocks (not smoked), cut crosswise 1-inch thick (or pork neck bones )', u'1 yellow onion, peeled and halved through the root', u' Kosher salt', u'10 stalks lemongrass', u'2 teaspoons shrimp paste', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons annatto seeds', u'1/3 cup minced shallots', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons chile flakes', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce, plus more to taste', u'5 teaspoons sugar, plus more to taste', u' Salt', u"2 pounds thick round rice noodles (see Cook's Note)", u'4 scallions, sliced', u'1 medium white onion, very thinly sliced and soaked in ice water for 20 minutes', u'1 cup cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u' Serving suggestions: bean sprouts, Thai basil leaves, very thinly sliced red cabbage, lime wedges']
title: Bun Bo Hue (Vietnamese Beef and Pork Noodle Soup)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the chicken breasts in a medium saucepan and add enough water just to cover. Add 1 tablespoon of the lime juice, 1 tablespoon of the fish sauce, 1 tablespoon of the rice vinegar, and the reserved cilantro stems and bring just to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, partially covered, for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and allow the chicken to sit in the poaching liquid for 45 minutes. Remove the chicken from the liquid and allow it to cool completely. Transfer the chicken to an airtight container and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, at least 2 hours and up to overnight.', u'In a non-reactive bowl combine the remaining lime juice, fish sauce, rice vinegar, the sugar, chiles, garlic, red pepper, and wasabi, if using, and stir until the sugar is dissolved. ', u'In a large bowl combine the cilantro leaves, onion, cabbage, carrots, mint leaves, and Thai basil leaves and toss to combine. Add 1/3 of the lime-chile mixture and toss. Let stand for 10 minutes, refrigerated, before serving.', u'Divide the salad evenly among 4 plates. Thinly slice the chicken breasts against the grain and divide evenly among the top of the salads. Garnish with the scallions, peanuts and crispy shallots and serve immediately, with the remaining lime-chile sauce on the side for dressing salads, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts', u'7 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'5 tablespoons fish sauce', u'6 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'3/4 cup cilantro leaves, shredded (stems reserved separately), about 1/2 bunch cilantro', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 serrano chiles, stemmed, seeded and finely chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1 teaspoon grated wasabi, optional', u'1/2 red onion, very thinly sliced', u'4 cups very thinly sliced cabbage', u'3 cups julienned carrots', u'1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, shredded', u'1/4 cup fresh Thai basil leaves, shredded', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'1/4 cup finely chopped roasted salted peanuts', u' Crispy Shallots, recipe follows', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'2 large shallots, thinly sliced', u' Salt']
title: Vietnamese Crispy Carrot and Cabbage Salad with Sliced Chicken and Chile-Lime Marinade

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk together the rice wine vinegar and 1 tablespoon of the sugar in a mixing bowl until the sugar dissolves. Add the grated carrot and stir to combine. Season with salt and reserve.', u'Combine the remaining sugar and 1/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and simmer until the sugar dissolves, about 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and add the fish sauce, garlic, lime zest and juice and a pinch or 2 of red pepper flakes. Spoon out a 1/4 cup of the sauce to baste the pork chops and reserve the rest to serve with the rice bowls.', u'Heat an outdoor grill or large cast-iron grill over medium-high heat. Whisk together the 1/4 cup sauce and the oil and brush liberally all over the pork chops. Place the pork chops on the grill and cook until the pork is warmed through and charred on both sides, about 5 minutes total. The pork chops might stick a bit to the grill but that is okay - just use a pair of tongs to gently pull away as needed. Transfer to a cutting board and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Cut each pork chop off the bone and thinly slice against the grain.', u'To serve, divide the rice among 4 large bowls. Toss the carrots with the cilantro. Top each bowl with a few slices of the pork, divide the carrot salad among the bowls and top with the rest of the sauce. Stir to combine and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'5 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 large carrot, peeled and grated (about 2 cups)', u' Kosher salt', u'3 to 4 tablespoons fish sauce', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u' Zest and juice of 2 limes', u' Crushed red pepper flakes', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 bone-in smoked pork chops, 1-inch thick (about 1 1/2 pounds total)', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u'4 cups cooked long grain rice, warm']
title: Vietnamese Grilled Smoked Pork Chop Rice Bowls

directions: [u'Saute the garlic, onion and ginger in hot oil.  Add chicken and cook until browned.  Add fish sauce and water.  Bring to boil.  Reduce heat, cover and simmer until chicken is tender, about 30 minutes.  Add papaya and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.  Add pepper leaves and cover.  Let simmer for 2-3 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Salt to taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 tbsp vegetable oil', u'3 cloves garlic, crushed', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'2 tbsp ginger, chopped', u'3 -4 lb chicken, cut in pieces', u'2 tbsp patis (fish sauce)', u'4 cups water', u'1 green papaya, peeled and cubed', u'1 1/2 cups pepper leaves or spinach']
title: Chicken Tinola

directions: [u'Place 2 whole chickens and 1 teaspoon salt in a large stock pot with enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil and skim any impurities. Reduce to medium heat. Add onions, peppercorns, and ginger to stockpot. Skim as needed to clear impurities. Simmer for 3 hours. Strain broth. Adjust seasonings with fish sauce, salt, sugar and white pepper as needed. ', u'To make dumplings: Soak dried wood ear mushroom in hot water for 15 minutes and then mince. Chop cabbage and sprinkle with salt to drain excess liquid. Lightly saute scallions, ginger, and shallot in vegetable oil until translucent and let cool. ', u'Add shallot, scallions, jicama, wood ear, garlic, cabbage and cilantro to meat mixture. Add fish sauce and black pepper. Adjust as needed. Test mixture by dropping a small amount in a pot of boiling water and cooking through. Remove from the water, taste, and adjust seasoning, if necessary, before wrapping in dumpling.', u'Place about 1 teaspoon of the chicken and shrimp mixture in the center of a dumpling wrapper. Lightly wet the edges of the dumpling with water. Fold over the wrapper and press to seal. Repeat with remaining filling and wrappers.', u'Assembly: Peel and julienne baby ginger. Cook dumplings right before service, in boiling, salted water for approximately 3 minutes, or until they float to the surface. Heat the broth in a large pot. Add the cooked dumplings and finish with cilantro, scallions and baby ginger. ', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'2 whole chickens', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3 onions, quartered', u'1 teaspoon black peppercorns', u'1 (4-inch) piece ginger root, peeled and smashed', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u' Sugar', u' White pepper', u'1/4 cup wood ear mushrooms', u'1/4 cup chopped cabbage', u'1/2 pound shrimp, ground', u'3/4 pound chicken, ground', u'2 scallions, minced', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 shallot, minced', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup peeled and chopped jicama', u'2 cloves garlic, mashed', u'1/2 cup cilantro, minced', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 package dumpling wrappers', u' Baby ginger, julienne', u' Cilantro, chopped', u' Scallions, julienne']
title: Vietnamese Style Chicken Dumpling Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Using a sharp knife, cut 24 meatballs into thin slices. Divide the meatball slices evenly among the 4 bottom halves of bread. Top each sandwich bottom with 1 sliced green onion, sliced Vietnamese Pickled Carrots and sliced peppers, to taste. Sprinkle with Nuoc Cham Sauce and then spoon more Nuoc Cham Sauce, to taste, over the top cut portions of the bread. Spread bread with mayonnaise, if desired. Place the sandwich tops over the meatballs and serve the sandwiches, cut in half if desired. Place any remaining Nuoc Cham in a small bowl and pass at the table, if desired. Garnish with fresh sprigs of cilantro and mint, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 recipe Vietnamese BBQ Pork Meatballs, recipe follows', u'4 (6-inch) portions French bread, cut in 1/2 lengthwise', u'4 green onions, thinly sliced on the diagonal', u' Vietnamese Pickled Carrots, recipe follows', u'4 jalapeno and/or serrano or Thai chiles, thinly sliced', u' Nuoc Cham Sauce, recipe follows', u' Good quality mayonnaise, optional', u' Fresh cilantro sprigs, for garnish, optional', u' Fresh mint sprigs, for garnish, optional', u'1 1/2 pounds lean pork meat, such as loin, trimmed of any gristle or membranes and cut into small dice', u'1/2 cup finely chopped shallots', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'4 teaspoons sugar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (Nuoc Nam)', u'1 1/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'5 tablespoons short-grain glutinous rice, such as sushi rice', u'4 ounces pork fat, cubed', u' Vegetable oil', u'6 to 8 (8-inch) bamboo skewers, soaked in warm water for at least 30 minutes', u'3 medium carrots, peeled and thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 small garlic cloves, minced or crushed', u'1 small fresh red chile pepper, seeded and minced', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup Nuoc Nam (Vietnamese fish sauce)', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 to 2 tablespoons finely shredded carrot']
title: Vietnamese BBQ Pork Meatball Po'boy

directions: [u'Put the rice in a medium pot with 3 cups of water. Gently swirl your fingers in the pot to allow the starch to separate from the grains. Once the water becomes white, tilt the pot over the sink to drain out the water. Be careful not to let your rice go into the sink. Repeat this process twice more. With each time, the water will get less cloudy. The idea is not to get rid of all the starch, just enough so that the rice will not be too sticky or too dry when cooked. After you have drained the rice the third time, add remaining 1 3/4 cup clean water. Swirl you fingers in the pot once to ensure the rice is leveled and place the lid on the pot. Cook the rice over medium heat, stir the rice with a wooden spoon a few times, then let rest, covered, for 5 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup long-grain jasmine rice (yields 3 cups cooked)', u'10 3/4 cups water']
title: Jasmine Rice

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. To the meat, add half of the granulated sugar, half of the brown sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon pepper and 1 tablespoon of oil. Next, combine the remaining sugars, vinegar, wine, soy sauce and fish sauce in a bowl. Taste and add salt and pepper, if needed.', u'Divide the meat into 2 portions. Place 2 large skillets over the highest heat possible and add 1 tablespoon of oil to each skillet. When the oil begins to smoke, add 1/2 the meat in 1 layer to each pan. Let sit until a brown crust forms, and turn to brown the other side. Browning should take approximately 2 to 3 minutes total. Set aside, drain 1 skillet of excess oil and lightly wipe down with a paper towel.', u'In that skillet, add 2 tablespoons of oil over high heat. When the oil begins to smoke add the onion, bell pepper and jalapeno with a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook stirring often until lightly caramelized, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and green onions and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes. While the onion mixture is finishing cooking, place the 4 baguettes in the oven for 1 to 2 minutes until lightly toasted and warmed through. Add the beef and vinegar mixture to the onions, and stir to combine. Taste and add additional salt and pepper, if desired. Keep warm while you assemble the sandwich.', u'To assemble each sandwich, spread 1 scant tablespoon of aioli on both sides of the baguette. On the bottom half, add a small handful of watercress, then 1/4 of the meat mixture, top with a small handful of cilantro, some julienne bell pepper, a few slices of cucumber, and a few slices of jalapeno. Enjoy and serve along with 2 lime wedges (which are meant to be squeezed over the meat right before eating), Crispy Fried Onion Strings, and additional aioli in a ramekin for dipping - and enjoy!', u"*Cook's Note: You can ask your butcher to thin slice your rib-eye steak for you. Or, you can freeze your steak for 20 minutes in the freezer (which makes it easier to slice), then slice it on the bias yourself."]
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds very thinly sliced rib-eye steak*, trimmed of any excess fat, at room temperature', u'1 tablespoon granulated sugar, divided', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar, divided', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'5 tablespoons canola oil, divided', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup white wine', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 large red onion, medium dice', u'1 large red bell pepper, medium dice', u'1 jalapeno (stemmed, seeded, ribs removed), small dice', u'2 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'4 green onion stalks, diced', u'4 (6 to 7-inch) baguette rolls, split', u' Fire-Roasted Jalapeno Aioli, recipe follows', u'1 large bunch or package baby watercress', u'1 bunch fresh cilantro sprigs', u'1 red bell pepper, stem, seeds and ribs removed, julienne cut', u'1 English cucumber, peeled and cut on diagonal into 1 1/4-inch rounds', u'2 jalapenos, sliced very thin (optional, but recommended)', u' Crispy Fried Onion Strings, recipe follows', u'1 large lime, cut into 8 wedges', u' (Makes enough for 4 sandwiches, plus extra for dipping Onion Strings)', u'4 large jalapenos', u'4 cloves garlic, papery outer layer still attached', u' Dash cayenne pepper', u'1/2 cup packed cilantro leaves', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 lime, zested', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh cracked black pepper', u'2 cups mayonnaise', u' Canola oil, for frying', u'4 cups rice flour', u'4 large red onions, sliced paper-thin', u' Fine salt', u' Freshly cracked black pepper', u' Bunch chives, minced']
title: Vietnamese 'Shaking Beef' Sandwich with a Fire-Roasted Jalapeno Aioli, Watercress and Crispy Fried Onion Strings

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut the tops off the lemongrass stalks, about 6 inches from the base. Bruise the tops with something heavy, like a meat mallet, and reserve for the broth. Peel off 2 or 3 of the woody outer layers from the base stalks until you reach the smoother, more tender core. Roughly chop the stalks and put in a food processor along with the garlic and shallots. Pulse about 20 times until everything is finely chopped, but not a paste.', u'Heat the vegetable oil over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add the chopped lemongrass mixture and cook until soft and starting to brown, about 6 minutes. Add the crushed red pepper and stir for 1 minute. Add 2 tablespoons fish sauce, 4 teaspoons sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture has thickened slightly, a spoon dragged across the pan leaves a trail and the oil is starting to separate from the solids. Remove all but 2 tablespoons of the lemongrass mixture from the pan and reserve.', u'Add the beef broth, 4 cups of water, and the bruised lemongrass tops to the saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cook until it tastes like lemongrass, 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a boil. Turn off the heat and add the vermicelli noodles. Cook, stirring periodically, until tender, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain very well and divide among 4 large soup bowls.', u'Add the remaining tablespoon fish sauce, 1/2 teaspoon sugar and 3/4 teaspoon salt to the beef broth. Remove the lemongrass tops. Add the steak slices and gently simmer until no longer pink, about 2 minutes.', u'Top each bowl with slices of cooked beef, the white onion and cilantro. Pour hot broth into the bowls to completely cover the noodles.', u'Serve with the reserved lemongrass-chile mixture and suggested garnishes on the side.', u'Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'4 stalks lemongrass', u'6 cloves garlic, roughly chopped', u'2 medium shallots, quartered', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons crushed red pepper', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce, or more to taste', u'4 1/2 teaspoons sugar, plus more to taste', u' Kosher salt', u'4 cups low-sodium beef broth', u'12 ounces vermicelli rice noodles', u'8 ounces boneless top blade steak, connective tissue removed, meat sliced thinly across the grain', u'1/2 small white onion, thinly sliced and soaked in ice water for 20 minutes', u'1/2 cup packed cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u' Serving suggestions: bean sprouts, mint leaves, basil leaves, thinly sliced red cabbage, lime wedges']
title: Shortcut Bun Bo Hue (Vietnamese Beef and Pork Noodle Soup)

directions: [u'Set out the ingredients of your choice on one or more plates or shallow bowls to accompany any meal.']
ingredients: [u' Asian or sweet basil leaves', u' Mint leaves', u' Coriander sprigs', u' Leaf lettuce (one or more kinds), separated into leaves', u' Small scallions, trimmed', u' Small lime wedges', u' Bird chiles, whole or minced', u' Cucumber slices or chunks', u' Bean sprouts, raw or briefly parboiled and drained', u' Carrot and Daikon Pickled Salad, recipe follows', u' Pickled Bean Sprout Salad, recipe follows', u'1/2 pound carrots, peeled', u'1/2 pound daikon radish, peeled', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 pound mung bean sprouts (about 6 cups loosely packed)', u'5 large scallions or 8 smaller ones, trimmed, smashed flat with the side of a cleaver, sliced lengthwise into ribbons, and then cut crosswise into 2 to 3-inch lengths', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'4 cups water']
title: Vietnamese Herb and Salad Plate

directions: [u'Bring the coconut milk and 1 cup water to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, stir in the tapioca pearls, sugar, and salt, and cook until tapioca pearls are translucent, about 30 minutes. Add banana or fresh corn kernels and cook for 10 minutes more.', u'Divide among 4 bowls, garnish each with a sprinkle or 2 of sesame seeds, and serve hot, at room temperature, or chilled.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup canned unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 cup water', u'1/4 cup tapioca pearls', u'1/2 cup sugar', u' Pinch coarse sea salt', u'1 1/2 ripe bananas, peeled and diced, or 1 cup fresh sweet yellow corn kernels', u' Toasted sesame seeds']
title: Sweet Banana and Coconut Milk Soup: Che Chuoi

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Wrap each roll in foil and bake until crisp on the outside, about 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, toss the carrot, cucumber, vinegar and 2 teaspoons fish sauce in a bowl; set aside, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes. Combine the mayonnaise, Sriracha and the remaining 1 teaspoon fish sauce in a small bowl. Beat the eggs in a medium bowl.', u'Unwrap the rolls; spread the bottom buns with the mayonnaise mixture and top with the pate.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the eggs and cook, stirring, until just set, about 3 minutes; divide among the rolls. Add the basil and carrot-cucumber salad to the sandwiches and drizzle with some of the vinegar mixture from the salad bowl. Serve with potato chips; sprinkle the chips with vinegar and drizzle with Sriracha.', u'Per serving: Calories 525; Fat 30 g (Saturated 8 g); Cholesterol 467 mg; Sodium 1,218 mg; Carbohydrate 39 g; Fiber 3 g; Protein 22 g', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'4 kaiser rolls, split open', u'1 carrot, thinly sliced', u'1 Persian cucumber, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon seasoned rice vinegar, plus more for the chips', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'2 to 3 teaspoons Sriracha (Asian chile sauce), plus more for the chips', u'8 large eggs', u'4 ounces country pate or liverwurst', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup fresh basil', u' Potato chips, for serving']
title: Vietnamese Egg Sandwiches

directions: [u'Combine beef, garlic, ginger, cinnamon and 2 quarts water. Bring to a boil, skim off scum. Reduce heat to low and simmer gently until meat is tender, about 45 minutes. Continue skimming and keeping level of liquid constant by replenishing with fresh water. Meanwhile,  rinse and chop the cilantro. When meat is tender, remove garlic, cinnamon and ginger.  Add  noodles and simmer until tender, about 5 minutes.  Remove soup from heat, stir in salt, lime juice, bean sprouts, pepper and cilantro. Adjust seasoning and serve piping hot.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 pound boneless sirloin, fat removed and cut into fine julienne', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 -inch piece ginger, peeled', u'1 stick cinnamon', u'2 quarts water', u'1 large bunch cilantro', u'1/4 pound vermicelli or capellini broken into 2-inch lengths', u' Salt, to taste', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 cups fresh bean sprouts', u'1/2 teaspoons dried red pepper flakes']
title: Beef and Noodle Soup "a la Vietnamese"

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the pork tenderloin in a bowl with the shallot, garlic, fish sauce, sugar, black pepper, and oil, if using, and turn to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate, turning occasionally, at least 1 hour and up to overnight in the refrigerator. ', u'Preheat a grill to high. Grill the tenderloin, turning occasionally, until just cooked through and an instant-read thermometer registers an internal temperature of 145 degrees F. Transfer tenderloin to a plate and set aside to cool to room temperature before proceeding. Once cooled, slice tenderloin into 1/8-inch thick slices and set aside, covered and refrigerated, until you are ready to assemble the spring rolls. ', u'Prepare the rice vermicelli according to package directions and strain in a colander. Run under cold running water until cool and set aside to drain.', u'Assemble the rolls 1 at a time: Dip 1 spring roll wrapper into lukewarm water and quickly transfer to a clean kitchen towel. (Wrapper will soften within seconds.) Lay 4 shrimp halves in a horizontal line across the center of each wrapper and top with a few tablespoons of cooked (well-drained) vermicelli. Top the vermicelli with 1 or 2 slices of cucumber, 2 tablespoons or so of the shredded romaine, 4 mint leaves, 2 sprigs of cilantro, and 4 basil leaves. Place a few sticks of carrot julienne along the top of the filling ingredients and top with 2 slices of pork. Carefully pull the lower edge of the wrapper up and over the filling. Fold the 2 sides inward over the filling and press to seal. Work carefully so as not to tear the wrapper. Once both sides are folded inward over the filling, roll the spring roll upwards so that the filling is tightly contained and roll up to seal. Set the spring roll aside on a plate, covered with a damp paper towel or damp clean kitchen towel. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling. Once you have assembled all of the spring rolls, serve them immediately \x96 either at room temperature or slightly chilled, with the Peanut Sauce on the side for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound pork tenderloin, trimmed', u'1 shallot, finely chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Peanut or olive oil, optional', u'1/2 pound fine rice vermicelli (bun)', u'12 (10-inch) rice paper wrappers (banh trang)', u'1 pound boiled shrimp, sliced in 1/2 lengthwise', u'1 medium cucumber, halved lengthwise and then thinly sliced on the diagonal', u'1 1/2 cups thinly shredded romaine lettuce', u'48 mint leaves', u'24 cilantro sprigs', u'48 Thai basil leaves', u'1 carrot, cut into julienne', u' Peanut Sauce, (Nuoc Leo), recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 teaspoon chili paste', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons chicken stock or water', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons peanut butter', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/4 cup unsalted roasted peanuts, finely chopped', u'1 fresh red Thai chile pepper, seeded and thinly sliced, optional', u' Sriracha sauce, for garnishing, optional']
title: Pork and Shrimp Spring Roll (Goi Cuon) with Peanut Sauce (Nuoc Leo)

directions: [u'If using dried rice vermicelli, place it in a bowl and cover with lukewarm water. Let stand until pliable, about 20 minutes. Bring a pot of hot water to a boil. Drain and divide the rice vermicelli into 4 equal portions. Place 1 portion at a time in a sieve and lower it into the boiling water. Untangle the noodles with chopsticks and boil until tender but firm, about 3 seconds. Remove, drain, and place in a large bowl. Repeat this step until you have 4 individual servings. If using fresh bun, there is no need to boil them.', u'Divide the noodles among 4 bowls. Scatter some lettuce, carrot, cucumber, and mint over each bowl. Drizzle with nuoc cham and toss well.', u'']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces dried rice vermicelli or 1 pound fresh bun', u'8 romaine lettuce leaves, ribs removed, julienned', u'2 carrots, peeled and julienned', u'1/2 cucumber, peeled, seeded, and thinly sliced into crescents', u'12 large mint leaves, julienned', u' Nuoc Cham, as needed, recipe follows', u' Fish Dipping Sauce: Nuoc Cham', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup lime or lemon juice', u'1 large clove garlic, minced', u"1 or more bird's eye or Thai chiles, seeded and minced", u'1 shallot, peeled, thinly sliced, and rinsed (optional)']
title: Rice Vermicelli: Bun Thit

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Put 2 cups hot water in a large bowl and add the noodles. Soak them until softened but slightly resilient, 20 to 30 minutes. Drain them and pat dry on paper towels. Put in a bowl and cover.    Fill a large bowl with hot water. Place a clean kitchen towel next to the bowl. Submerge 1 rice paper wrapper in the water and soak it until softened, about 1 minute. Carefully remove the rice paper from the water and lay it flat on the towel.    In the center of the sheet, layer 4 lettuce pieces, about 20 sprouts, 4 shrimp halves, arranged side by side in a row, 4 mint leaves, 4 cilantro sprigs, and one-eighth of the carrots. Pull the bottom up over the filling, fold over the sides, and roll up like an egg roll. Place seam-side-down on a plate and repeat the process with the remaining rice papers and filling.    Serve immediately, with the Hot Mustard Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 (1-ounce) skeins mung bean noodles or cellophane noodles', u'8 (8 1/2-inch) round rice paper wrappers', u'8 small romaine lettuce leaves, rinsed, patted dry, ribs removed, and torn into bite-size pieces', u'1 -ounce alfalfa or radish sprouts', u'32 cooked medium shrimp halves', u'32 fresh mint leaves', u'32 sprigs fresh cilantro', u'1 large carrot, peeled and shredded', u' Hot Mustard Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/3 cup dry Chinese hot mustard', u'1/4 cup water', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u' Pinch salt']
title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls with Hot Mustard Sauce

directions: [u'Combine the lime juice, fish sauce, sugar and chiles in a large bowl. Set aside.', u'Place the oyster sauce, soy sauce and beef in a medium bowl and toss to coat the meat evenly.', u'Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and stir until fragrant, about 5 seconds. Add the beef and quickly stir-fry it until just charred on the edges, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add to the bowl with the lime sauce.', u'Add the pineapple slices, if using, Asian basil and red onion to the beef mixture. Spread the watercress and tomatoes in an attractive manner on a serving platter. Arrange the beef mixture and all its juices on the watercress and serve immediately (if desired, with a warm baguette or steamed rice to soak up the juices).', u'Note: Another way of presenting bo luc lac is to omit the lime dressing completely and serve the beef with a dipping salt mixture made with 1 1/2 tablespoons sea salt, 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, and 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 Thai bird chiles or 1/2 serrano chile, chopped', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'2/3 pound beef sirloin or flank steak, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 to 3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 cloves garlic, sliced', u'1/4 ripe pineapple (about 1/2 cup), cut into bite-sized slices about 1/4-inch thick (optional)', u'1/2 cup Asian basil leaves, cut in half', u'1/4 red onion, thinly sliced lengthwise', u'3 cups watercress, washed, picked over, and torn into bite-sized sprigs', u'1 ripe tomato, cut into thin wedges']
title: Shaking Beef (Bo Luc Lac)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine the soy sauce, 1 tablespoon of water, and sugar in a small bowl. ', u'Heat the oil in a frying pan over high flame. Drop the leeks in the oil and cook, stirring for 30 seconds. Add the cauliflower. Add remaining tablespoon of water and cover, turn heat to medium and cook for 2 minutes. Uncover and add the straw mushrooms and sauce. Cook, stirring often, for 2 more minutes. Serve over steamed rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 cup cauliflower florets, sliced thinly lengthwise', u'1 leek (about 6 ounces), white part only, sliced thinly horizontally', u'1/2 cup straw mushrooms', u'1 cup hot steamed rice']
title: Vietnamese Style Cauliflower with Straw Mushrooms

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'For the pickle: Combine the carrot, chile, rice wine vinegar, fish sauce, sugar, brown sugar and sambal in a pint container. Shake to combine. Let sit for 1 hour.', u'For the broth: Coat a small stockpot with canola oil and bring to medium heat. Add the garlic, ginger and scallions, and sweat until aromatic, 5 to 6 minutes. Add the chicken stock, fish sauce, star anise and cinnamon. Bring to boil, then reduce to simmer and cook for 15 minutes.', u'Place chicken breasts in the broth and poach until cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes. When fully cooked, remove from broth and slice thinly on the bias. Set aside. Strain the broth.', u'Blanch and shock in an ice water bath first the sugar snap peas and then the noodles. Set aside.', u'To assemble: Place the noodles in a bowl and top with chicken. Garnish with sugar snap peas, pickled vegetables, chopped peanuts, basil and mung beans. Gently pour broth into the bowl. Add a squeeze of lime juice and enjoy!']
