ingredients: [u'1 carrot, julienned', u'1 Fresno chile, sliced', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1/2 tablespoon sambal', u' Canola oil, for pan', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u' One 2-inch piece ginger', u'4 scallions, chopped', u'1 gallon chicken stock', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'3 whole star anise', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'3 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves', u'1 cup sugar snap peas, julienned', u'1/2 package rice stick noodles', u'1/2 cup roasted salted peanuts, chopped', u'1 bunch Thai basil', u'2 cups mung bean sprouts', u'1 lime, juiced']
title: Chicken Pho

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"These crunchy Vietnamese-style rolls are healthy and light, and the addition of rice makes them filling. They're gluten-free, but anyone -- even adults -- will love them."]
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup rice vinegar, plus 1 to 2 tablespoons', u'1 tablespoon sugar, divided', u'2 cups shredded, cooked chicken (from a rotisserie or other leftover chicken)', u'1 medium-large carrot, shredded (about 1 cup)', u'12 (8 1/2-inch) rice paper wrappers (See note)', u'1/3 English cucumber or 1 kirby cucumber, peeled, julienned, about 1 cup', u'4 scallions (white and green parts) finely chopped (about 1/2 cup)', u'1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, basil or cilantro', u' About 12 Boston lettuce leaves', u'1/2 cup cooked brown or white rice', u'1/2 cup chunky peanut butter', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons water']
title: Chicken Summer Rolls

directions: [u'In a bowl, mix the pork with the  garlic, scallion, 1 1/2 tablespoons  of nuac mam, 1/2 teaspoon sugar,  egg, and cornstarch.  Leave in  refrigerator for 1/2 hour.   Meanwhile, prepare the charcoal  fire (or heat indoor grill).', u'When grill is heated, shape the  pork mixture into 6 balls. Lightly  oil a steamer tray and steam balls  for 5 minutes.  Transfer partially  cooked balls to a hot grill fire.   Cook for 10 minutes, turning  occasionally, so all sides of the  pork balls get golden brown.   Remove pork balls from fire, cut  them in half, and return them to  fire, cut side down.  Grill for 5  minutes.  Remove pork and, when  cool enough to handle, cut in  shreds roughly 1 1/2 inches long  and 1/4-inch thick. Reserve.', u'Bring a few quarts of salted water  to a boil.  Plunge the shrimp into  the boiling water then turn the  heat off.  Remove shrimp from water  when just cooked (about 2 to 3  minutes).  In a bowl, mix 2  tablespoons fish sauce and  remaining tablespoon of sugar.   When shrimp are cool enough to  handle, peel and slice them in half  the long way (cutting the shrimp  into 2 thin, C-shaped pieces).   Reserve shrimp and fish sauce  mixture.', u"Dip one sheet of banh trang into a  basin of warm water, keep it  submerged for 2 to 3 seconds, then  remove it immediately from the  water. Try to dip all of it into  the water simultaneously, and  handle it carefully so it doesn't  tear.  Place the sheet on a dry  towel.    About 1-inch above the lower edge  of the sheet, spread out 1/8 cup of  shredded lettuce.  Leave a 1  1/2-inch gap between the left edge  of the sheet and the lettuce, and a  1 1/2-inch gap between  the right  edge of the sheet and the lettuce.   Define a rectangle with the lettuce  that's about 5 inches wide and 3  inches in the other direction  (towards the center of the sheet).   Now evenly top  the lettuce  rectangle with 1/8 of the bean  sprouts, 1/8 of the carrots and 1/8  of the peanuts.  Evenly distribute  1/8 of the pork over the rectangle.  Tear 5 to 6 mint leaves and an  equal amount of cilantro, and  distribute over the rectangle.  Top  everything with a few sprinkles of  nuoc mam.", u'Carefully pick up the right edge of  the sheet, and fold it leftward  toward the center of the filling.   Make sure the folded sheet is even  and uncreased everywhere.  Do the  same with the left edge of the  sheet.  The rectangle of the  filling should now be covered by  the folded sheet.  Pick up the  bottom edge of the sheet, and start  rolling away from you, towards the  top edge, making sure to tuck the  filling in tightly as you roll.  When you have rolled about halfway  to the top of the sheet, dip the  shrimp halves in reserved fish  sauce/sugar mix. Place 2 shrimp  halves along the cylinder that you  have half-rolled, and keep on  rolling until a fully rolled  cylinder is formed.  Place under a  wet towel. ', u'Repeat process 7 more times. Serve  immediately, or cover rolls with  wet towels and save at room  temperature for several hours.   Serve with Vietnamese peanut sauce.', u'*Banh trang, or Vietnamese spring  roll wrappers, come in both round  and square shapes.  The square is  easier to work with when making  summer rolls.  The product I us']
ingredients: [u'1/2 pound fatty ground pork', u'2 medium  cloves garlic, finely minced', u'1 thin scallion, finely minced', u'3 1/2 tablespoons nuoc mam (plus extra for sprinkling)', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 egg, beaten', u'1 tablespoon  cornstarch', u'8 medium shrimp, about 1/4 pound', u'8 square sheets of banh trang, 8 1/2 inches per side*', u'1 cup shredded lettuce', u'1/2 cup  mung bean sprouts', u'1/2 large carrot, shredded', u'4 teaspoons chopped dry-roasted peanuts', u' One large bunch fresh  mint', u' One large bunch fresh  cilantro']
title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls with Shrimp and Ground Pork

directions: [u'In a 2 quart saucepan bring broth, ginger, star anise, and cinnamon to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. ', u'With a very sharp knife cut sirloin across the grain into very thin slices. ', u'In a large bowl soak noodles in hot water to cover 15 minutes, or until softened and pliable. ', u'While noodles are soaking, bring a kettle of salted water to a boil for noodles. Drain noodles in a colander and cook in boiling water, stirring 45 seconds, or until tender. Drain noodles in a colander. Set aside. ', u'Strain broth into saucepan and bring to a boil. Stir in fish sauce, salt and pepper. Add sirloin and sprouts and cook 30 to 45 seconds, or until sirloin changes color. Skim any froth from soup. ', u'To serve, divide noodles into 4 bowls. Ladle soup over noodles. Sprinkle scallion greens, cilantro, chilies and basil over soup and serve with lime wedges']
ingredients: [u'6 cups beef broth', u'1 (1/4-inch thick) slice ginger', u'2 whole star anise*', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'1/2 pound piece boneless beef sirloin, trimmed of any fat', u'3 ounces dried flat rice noodles*', u'1/4 cup Asian fish sauce*', u'1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts, rinsed and drained', u'1/8 cup minced scallions', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro sprigs, washed and finely chopped', u'1 small thin fresh red or green Asian chilie, sliced very thin', u'1/2 cup fresh basil leaves', u' Lime wedges for garnish', u' *Available at Asian Markets']
title: Pho Bo (Hanoi Beef Noodle Soup)

directions: [u'Toast mung beans lightly in a pan. Transfer to a bowl and soak in water to soften.', u'For the cilantro lime dipping sauce:', u'Add the garlic cloves, fresh ginger, chili paste, cilantro, soy sauce, lime juice and pulp, water, and sugar, 1 ingredient at a time through the feed opening of a running blender. Allow "sauce" to rest for 10 minutes before tasting and adjusting seasoning with salt and pepper, as needed. Pour into individual dipping bowls.', u'Assemble the table salad by arranging the lettuce, cucumber, bean sprouts, mint, basil, cilantro, rau ram, and saw leaf herb in separate mounds on a serving platter.', u'Prepare the filling for the crepes by tossing the bean sprouts, cilantro leaves, and scallions together.', u'To cook the crepes, drain the mung beans and combine in a blender with coconut milk, water, rice flour, sugar, salt, and turmeric. Puree until smooth, and then strain into a small pitcher. Heat a crepe pan with a small amount of oil, and pour a thin layer of batter into the hot pan. When the crepe is cooked though and the down side is crisp, add the filling (bean sprouts, cilantro and scallions), fold the crepe in half and transfer to a serving plate. Serve crepes with table salad and dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup dried split yellow mung beans', u'12 ounces coconut milk', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 cup rice flour', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'4 cloves garlic', u'3 ounces fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced (a 1 1/2 to 2-inch piece ginger root)', u'3 tablespoons chili paste (blended hot chili peppers, garlic, oil and salt)', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro with stems', u'1 cup soy sauce', u' Juice and pulp from 2 freshly squeezed limes', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/2 cup sugar', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'10 leaves red leaf lettuce or green leaf lettuce', u'1 English cucumber, skin on, chopped', u'1 cup bean sprouts, trimmed of roots', u'1 cup mint leaves', u'1 cup Thai basil', u'1 cup cilantro leaves', u'1 cup rau ram leaves (Vietnamese cilantro)', u'1 cup chopped saw leaf herb (Ngo Gai, Thorny Coriander, or Tabasco parsley)', u'3 cups bean sprouts', u'1 cup cilantro leaves', u'1 bunch scallions, minced']
title: Saigon Crepes with Vietnamese Table Salad and Cilantro Lime Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Peel off and discard the tough, old outer layers (called bracts) of the banana blossom. Use a Japanese mandolin with the thinnest setting and cut into fine julienne strips; immediately plunge into large bowl of cold water and the white vinegar. When ready to prepare the salad, remove the julienne strips and shake off the tiny white buds (chopped up baby buds). Rinse and drain. Squeeze dry of the excess water. Place 4 cups well packed strips into a bowl. Add the white vinaigrette and toss for a few seconds. Pour off the excess liquid.', u'In a separate bowl, toss the shredded chicken with salt, pepper, and lime juice. Add the grapefruit, rau rum, and chili fish sauce and mix together thoroughly.', u'To serve, mound the salad equally onto 4 separate plates. Top each salad with 1 tablespoon crispy shallot flakes and 1 tablespoon chopped peanuts. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 small banana blossoms, or 4 cups well-packed finely julienned banana blossom strips', u'2 tablespoons white vinegar', u'4 tablespoons White Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u'2 cups shredded, poached chicken breast', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon pepper', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', u'1 ruby red grapefruit, sectioned and each segment torn into thirds, optional', u'2 teaspoons chopped rau rum (Vietnamese mint), or regular mint', u'6 tablespoons chili fish sauce', u'4 tablespoons crispy shallot flakes', u'4 tablespoons chopped roasted peanuts']
title: Banana Blossom Salad
Vietnamese Beef Grilled in Grape Leaves: Bo la Lot

directions: [u'Whisk together the sugar, water, fish sauce, and lime juice in a bowl until the sugar is completely dissolved. Add the garlic, chile, and shallot, and let stand for 30 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup lime or lemon juice', u'1 large clove garlic, minced', u"1 or more bird's eye or Thai chiles, seeded and minced", u'1 shallot, peeled, thinly sliced, and rinsed (optional)']
title: Fish Dipping Sauce: Nuoc Cham

directions: [u'To make the dipping fish sauce: Combine the fish sauce, vinegar, sugar, and water in a saucepan and place on medium heat. Stir well and cook until just before boiling point is reached, then allow to cool. To serve, finely chop the garlic and chile and stir through with the lime juice. ', u'For the salad: In a large bowl combine the green papaya, pork belly, sliced mint, sliced basil, sliced perilla leaves, sliced cilantro, and dipping fish sauce and mix well.', u'Turn the salad out onto a serving platter and arrange the prawns on top of the green', u'papaya salad.', u'Garnish with fried Asian shallots, peanuts, garlic chips, and sliced chile.']
ingredients: [u' Dipping fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 ounces or 1/2 cup water', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 chile, chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u' Salad', u'1 green papaya, peeled and finely julienned, (about 6 ounces)*', u'7 ounces cooked pork belly, thinly sliced', u'5 fresh green mint leaves, finely sliced', u'5 fresh Asian basil leaves, finely sliced*', u'5 fresh perilla leaves, finely sliced*', u'5 fresh coriander (cilantro) leaves, finely sliced', u'7 ounces cooked medium-size tiger prawns (shrimp), peeled, deveined and halved lengthwise', u'1 tablespoon fried red Asian shallots*', u'1 tablespoon crushed roasted peanuts', u'1/2 teaspoon fried garlic chips', u'1 chile, sliced', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets.', u" Cook's Note: Submerge the julienne green papaya in cold water for 4 minutes, then", u' drain. This keeps the crisp texture of the green papaya.']
title: Green Papaya Salad with Prawn and Pork: Goi Du Du Tom Thit

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Cut the meat into 1-inch cubes.  Place in a large mixing bowl.  In a small mixing bowl, combine the fish sauce, water, cornstarch, sugar, baking powder and sesame oil.  Season with black pepper.  Whisk well and add  the beef.  Toss well.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Remove from the refrigerator and place in the bowl of a food processor, fitted with a metal blade.  Process until smooth.  To test, bring a small pot of water to a boil, add a teaspoon of the mixture to the water and cook for about 1 minute.  Remove from the water, taste and adjust seasoning.  Roll the rest of the mixture into individual balls, about 1 tablespoon for each ball.   In a saucepan, bring the beef stock to a boil.  Add the meat balls, stirring occasionally.  When the meat balls start to float, cook for an additional 5 minutes.  Stir in the green onions, Nuoc Cham and black pepper.  Ladle into individual bowls and serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds boneless beef round', u'6 tablespoons fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'6 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 quarts beef stock', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions', u'2 teaspoons Nuoc Cham, recipe follows', u' Recipe courtesy of Emeril Lagasse, 1999', u'1 small fresh chile pepper', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'3 teaspoons sugar', u'1 fresh lime', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'3 tablespoons water']
title: Beef Balls

directions: [u'If using pork fat, bring a small saucepan of water to a boil. Add the pork fat and cook just until the edges turn translucent, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and drain the pork on paper towels. Coarsely chop the fat and set aside. If using egg white, start with step 2.', u'Heat the oil in a small saucepan over moderate heat. Add the onion and shallots and saute until slightly wilted, about 1 minute. Transfer onion mixture (not the juice) to a bowl and add the fish sauce, salt, sugar, garlic, white pepper, cornstarch, baking powder, and pork fat. Add the shrimp and toss well.', u'Transfer the shrimp mixture to a food processor and process until almost smooth but still lumpy. Transfer the paste to a bowl, scraping the work bowl clean. Stir in the scallions. (If the paste is not cold, refrigerate at this point to stiffen it.)', u"Quarter the sugarcane pieces lengthwise, or halve them if they're small. Wet your hands with cold water. Place 2 tablespoons of the shrimp paste in the middle of your palm. Place a piece of the sugarcane on top and mold the paste around it. (The paste should be about 1/4 inch thick and about 2 1/2 inches long). Gently press the paste against the stick so that the edges are sealed. Set the shrimp stick aside on an oiled plate. Repeat with the remaining sugarcane and paste.", u'Oil a steamer basket and place the sugarcane sticks in a single layer. (If necessary, steam in several batches.) Steam until the shrimp paste turns pink, 2 to 3 minutes. You can make this dish in advance up to this point. To finish, grill or broil the shrimp sticks until the paste is hot inside and slightly charred around the edges. Serve immediately with some lettuces, mustard leaves, and herbs, rice vermicelli and dipping sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 (2-ounce) piece pork fat, or 1 egg white', u'2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup chopped yellow onion, drained of excess water', u'3 shallots, minced', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1/4 teaspoon sea salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 pound raw medium shrimp, peeled, deviened and patted extremely dry', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'1 (20-ounce can) 4-inch long sugarcane, drained', u'1/2 pound small dried bun or rice vermicelli, cooked', u' Vietnamese Bean Dipping Sauce or Vietnamese Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u' Vietnamese Dipping Sauce: Nuoc Cham', u'3 Thai bird chiles or 1 serrano chile, or to taste', u'1 clove garlic, sliced', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2/3 cup warm water', u'1 1/2 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'5 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons finely shredded carrots for garnish, optional']
title: Grilled Shrimp on Sugarcane

directions: [u'Bring the water to a rolling boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add the tapioca pearls and stir to separate. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the tapioca becomes translucent, about 20 minutes. Add the coconut milk, sugar and salt and stir well.', u'Five minutes before the end of cooking time, peel the bananas and cut them in half lengthwise. Cut each piece again into 4 pieces. Add them to the pan and cook until just soft. At this point the tapioca pearls should be clear and cooked. ', u'Remove from the heat and transfer to individual dessert bowls. Garnish with the peanuts and serve hot or at room temperature. (The pudding will thicken as it cools.)']
ingredients: [u'3 cups water', u'1/3 cup tapioca pearls (1/16 inch wide)', u'1 cup unsweetened coconut milk (preferably Mae Ploy brand)', u'1/3 cup sugar, or to taste', u' Pinch salt', u'3 ripe but firm bananas', u'2 tablespoons chopped roasted peanuts']
title: Grandmother's Banana Stew with Tapioca Pearls (Chuoi Chung)

directions: [u'To make the spring rolls, cut the tuna into pieces 2cm wide and 10cm long. Spread each piece of tuna very lightly with the wasabi paste and roll the tuna in the coriander and parsley. Wrap each piece of tuna in a spring roll wrapper, using a little water to seal the ends. Deep fry the spring rolls in hot roll wrapper, using a little water to seal the ends. Deep fry the spring rolls in hot oil for 30 to 45 seconds or until lightly golden. Drain on absorbent paper. Combine the lime juice and soy and place in small dipping bowls to serve with the tuna rolls and an Asian green salad.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound piece sashimi tuna', u'1 tablespoon wasabi paste', u'2 tablespoons coriander leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped parsley', u'8 spring rolls wrappers', u' Oil for deep frying', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce']
title: Rare Tuna Spring Rolls with Lime and Soy

directions: [u'Make the batter: place the rice flour, coconut milk, water, turmeric, sugar, salt, curry powder and scallions in a bowl and stir well to blend. Set aside.', u'Make the filling: Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add 1/4 each of the onion, the pork and the shrimp and stir until fragrant, about 15 seconds. Whisk the batter well, and ladle about 2/3 cup into the pan. Swirl so the batter completely covers the surface. Neatly pile about 1 cup bean sprouts and 1/2 cup mushrooms on one side of the crepe, closer to the center than to the edge. Reduce the heat slightly, cover the pan and cook until the edges pull away from the sides of the pan, about 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low. Uncover and cook until the crepe is crisp and the pork and shrimp are done, another 2 to 3 minutes. Slip a spatula under the crepe to check on the bottom of the crepe. If it?s not brown, cook for another 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Lift the side of the crepe without the bean sprouts and mushrooms and fold it over the covered side of the crepe. Using a spatula, gently slide the crepe onto a large plate. Wipe the pan clean and make the remaining crepes in the same way. Be sure to oil the pan before beginning the next crepe.', u'To serve, place the crepes, Vietnamese Dipping Sauce and some lettuces, mustard leaves, and herbs on the table. To eat, tear a piece of the banh xeo and wrap the lettuce or mustard leaves and herbs. Roll into a packet, then dip into the sauce and eat.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 cups rice flour', u'1/2 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 1/3 cups water', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground turmeric', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon curry powder (Recommended: Vietnamese GoldenBells brand)', u'3 scallions cut into thin rings', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/4 yellow onion, thinly sliced (1/2 cup)', u'4 ounces pork shoulder or chicken breast, thinly sliced', u'12 medium raw shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'4 cups bean sprouts', u'2 cups sliced white mushrooms, lightly Sauteed and drained', u'1 cup Vietnamese Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u' Vietnamese Dipping Sauce: Nuoc Cham', u'3 Thai bird chiles or 1 serrano chile, or to taste', u'1 clove garlic, sliced', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2/3 cup warm water', u'1 1/2 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'5 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons finely shredded carrots for garnish, optional']
title: Sizzling Saigon Crepes

directions: [u'For the sauce: Pound the garlic and chile in a large mortar with a pestle until pasty. Whisk in the fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, and 1 cup water until the sugar dissolves. Transfer to a serving bowl for dipping.', u'For the banh xeo: Whisk the flour together with the scallion, salt, turmeric and 1/4 cup cold water in a bowl until completely smooth. Set aside.', u'Heat a well-seasoned 9-inch carbon steel skillet over high heat until smoking hot. Add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan generously and swirl to lightly coat the sides too. Add the shrimp and bacon, and cook, stirring and tossing, until the shrimp start to curl but before they become completely opaque, about 1 minute.', u'Whisk the batter again to mix in any flour that has settled on the bottom and ladle a spoonful into the pan. Swirl the pan to coat the bottom and an inch or so up the sides with a thin layer of the batter. Repeat two more times. Let the batter set, about 30 seconds.', u"Drizzle the egg over the crepe and swirl the pan to evenly coat the crepe with egg. The crepe should have released from the sides of the pan; squirt oil between the crepe edges and the pan. Gently shake the pan to keep everything moving. Poke a hole in the crepe with a fork or spoon to keep it from bubbling up-- you want a flat crepe. Oil should be sputtering at the edges of the crepe. If it isn't, add more.", u'Cook the crepe, oiling and shaking until the egg has set on top and the bottom of the crepe is dark brown around the edges and in speckles on the bottom. Pile the bean sprouts on one half and fold the other half over with a spatula. Hold the folded omelet against one side of the pan and tilt the oil out the other side into a heat-safe bowl. Discard.', u'Lift the omelet out of the pan with the spatula and immediately serve with the shrimp and bacon, lettuce and shiso leaves, herbs and nuoc cham. Tear off a piece of omelet with a bunch of bean sprouts and tuck it into a lettuce leaf with a shiso leaf and some bacon and shrimp. Pluck a few fresh herb leaves of basil, cilantro, dill and mint, and stuff them in there too. Then roll it up and dip into the nuoc cham. Eat. Repeat.']
ingredients: [u'1 clove garlic, peeled', u"1/4 red Thai bird's eye chile", u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup Thai rice flour', u'1 small scallion, very thinly sliced', u' Pinch fine sea salt', u' Pinch ground turmeric', u' Vegetable oil', u'5 small (26/30 count) shrimp, shelled and deveined', u'1 strip thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 large egg, beaten', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'8 green and red lettuce leaves', u'4 shiso leaves', u' Fresh basil leaves', u' Fresh cilantro leaves', u' Fresh dill sprigs', u' Fresh mint leaves']
title: Traditional Banh Xeo with Nuoc Cham Sauce

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Place garlic, chile, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, and oil in a mini food processor and process until smooth. Place beef in a small baking dish, pour the marinade over, and turn to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.', u'Preheat the grill to medium-high. Remove the beef from the marinade and season it with salt and pepper. Grill meat until charred and cooked to medium-rare doneness, about 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from grill and let rest 10 minutes before slicing into 1/4-inch thick slices.']
ingredients: [u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 Thai bird chile, chopped', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'2 to 3 tablespoons honey', u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'1 1/2 pounds beef tenderloin', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Papaya Dressing, recipe follows', u'1 shallot, peeled and finely chopped', u'2 Thai bird chiles, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'8 large red romaine lettuce leaves, cut into strips', u'1 bunch watercress', u'1 large green papaya, peeled and thinly shredded', u'2 carrots, peeled and thinly shredded', u'1/4 cup chopped roasted peanuts, for garnish', u' Chopped cilantro, for garnish']
title: Grilled Steak and Papaya Salad

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 225 degrees F.', u'Season both sides of the duck with the salt, sugar, coriander, paprika, and cinnamon. Add the peppercorns and the seasoned duck to the rendered fat, making sure the duck is submerged. Cover the pan with foil and place and cook for about 4 to 6 hours, until fork tender.', u'For the quick carrot pickle:', u'Place a medium pot over medium heat and add the sugar, shallot, garlic, jalapeno, bay leaf, salt, coriander seeds, peppercorns, white wine vinegar, and water. Bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Add the carrots, and bring back to a simmer. Allow to simmer until the carrots are al dente, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.', u'For the aioli:', u'Whisk the egg yolks, garlic and lime juice together. Whisk in 1/3 to 1/2 cup liquid duck fat. Add the lime zest and season with hot sauce, and salt, to taste.', u'For assembling:', u'Remove the duck from the oven. Carefully remove from the fat and place skin-side down onto a cast iron pan over high heat to crisp the fat, about 2 minutes. Strain the fat and reuse it a couple more times, if desired. Remove the duck from the pan and shred with fork.', u'Slice the slider rolls in half. Place some of the pickled carrots onto the bottom of the bun. Top the carrots with some of the shredded duck. Spoon some of the aioli and cilantro leaves over top and cover with the slider lids and skewer.']
ingredients: [u' Duck Confit', u' Rendered duck fat from 1 duck, at warm temperature, plus more fat (chicken, duck, bacon, oil, etc.) as needed', u'4 duck legs and thighs', u' Salt', u' Pinch sugar', u'2 teaspoons whole coriander', u'1 teaspoon sweet smoked paprika', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'2 teaspoons peppercorns', u' Quick Carrot Pickle', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 shallot, peeled and trimmed', u'1 clove garlic, peeled and trimmed', u'1 jalapeno', u'1 bay leaf', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1 teaspoon peppercorns', u'1 cup white wine vinegar', u'1 cup water', u'2 carrots, peeled and julienned', u' Aioli', u'2 egg yolks', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u' Zest and juice of 2 limes', u'1/3 to 1/2 cup liquid duck fat', u' Hot sauce, to taste', u' Salt', u' Assembling', u'4 to 6 slider rolls', u'1 cup freshly picked cilantro leaves']
title: Duck Confit Sliders, Banh Mi Style

directions: [u'Add all ingredients into a large bowl and mix to thoroughly combine.  Form 4 ounce patties and grill until well done. Place 2 patties into lightly toasted soft French bread cut with a hinge along with lettuce, a generous helping of pickled vegetables, and cilantro mayonnaise.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground pork', u'1 shallot, minced', u'1 stalk lemongrass (outer husk removed), sliced paper thin', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u' A dash Asian five-spice powder', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' French bread, for serving', u' Lettuce, for serving', u' Pickled vegetables, for serving, recipe follows', u' Cilantro mayonnaise, for serving, recipe follows', u'10 radishes, thinly slices', u'5 to 7 carrots, julienned', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon hot sauce (recommended: Sriracha)', u' Dash sugar', u' Salt', u'1 bunch cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u'1 cup mayonnaise']
title: Cabbagetown Market- Banh Mi Sandwich

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine 6 cups of water, the ginger, lemons, lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, bay leaves, green onions, garlic, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Season the shrimp with the Essence and place in the boiling water. Let cook for 2 minutes, remove the pan from the heat and allow the shrimp to steep in the boiling liquid. After 2 minutes, remove the shrimp from the pan using tongs or a slotted spoon and allow them to cool at room temperature. Once cool enough to handle, cut the shrimp in half lengthwise and reserve until ready to assemble the rolls.   For the rolls: Fill a large bowl with hot water. Place a clean kitchen towel next to the bowl. Submerge 1 rice paper wrapper in the water and soak it until softened, about 1 minute. Carefully remove the rice paper from the water and lay it flat on the towel.    In the center of the sheet, layer 2 tablespoons of the Napa cabbage, 5 or 6 enoki mushrooms, 2 tablespoons of grated carrots, 4 shrimp halves arranged side by side in a row. Place 2 mint leaves and 2 cilantro sprigs over the shrimp and fold the bottom of the wrapper over the filling. Fold both sides inward over the filling, then roll up in egg roll fashion. Place seam side down on a plate and repeat the process with the remaining rice papers and filling ingredients. Once all the wrappers have been assembled, cut each spring roll in half on the bias so that you have 32 pieces. Place the spring rolls on a platter and serve with the dipping sauce at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 (2-inch) piece ginger, peeled and thinly sliced', u'2 lemons, halved and juiced', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'4 bay leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped green onions (green and white parts)', u'2 teaspoons chopped garlic', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'32 medium shrimp, peeled and deveined (about 1 pound)', u'2 teaspoons Essence, recipe follows', u'16 (8-1/2 inch) round rice paper wrappers', u'2 cups shredded Napa cabbage', u'1 package enoki mushrooms', u'2 cups carrots, peeled and coarsely grated', u'32 fresh mint leaves', u'32 sprigs fresh cilantro', u' Spring Roll Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u'1 1/4 cups granulated sugar', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 lemon, zested and juiced', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 teaspoons Thai fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 tablespoon grated carrots', u'1 tablespoon chopped cilantro']
title: Shrimp Summer Rolls

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place rice in bowl and add enough water to cover by 2 inches. Allow to soak for at least 3 hours and up to overnight. Drain the rice in a colander and transfer it to a traditional bamboo sticky rice steaming basket, or another steaming vessel such as a colander or strainer that can sit above boiling water inside of another pot. Add water to the pot and bring to a boil. Add steaming basket with rice and cover. Steam rice for 30 to 45 minutes, until soft and sticky. (The length of time required to cook the rice will depend on how long the rice was soaked, longer soakings require less steaming time.) Remove the pot from the heat, uncover, and fluff with a fork. Keep it warm and fluff it again right before serving.', u'In a small sauce pan, place the dried shrimp and 1 cup cold water, and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Dice the shrimp and place in a bowl and set aside.', u'In a dry saute pan, brown the Chinese sausage until brown on all sides. Remove and place in the bowl with the shrimp. ', u'In the same saute pan, heat the 2 teaspoons oil and fry the pork chops until brown on both sides. Remove the pork chops and place in the bowl with the shrimp. ', u'Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large wok over a high flame. Add the scallions and quickly cook for 3 minutes or until softened. Then add the pork, shrimp, and sausage, and fry for 1 minute, stirring well, then add the fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, and black pepper. Continue cooking for 3 minutes. ', u'Re-fluff your rice and place in a large bowl. Add the meat mixture to the rice, and, mix together. Press this mixture into a 8-inch  round baking pan. It can then be turned out onto a serving platter and cut into 8 wedges. Sprinkle with chopped green onions and a drizzle of Nuoc Cham.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sweet or glutinous rice', u'1/3 cup dried shrimp', u'1/2 pound Chinese sausage diced 3/4-inch pieces (available in Chinese Markets, no substitute)', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'1/4 pound boneless pork chops, 2 thin pieces, at least', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions, plus extra for garnish', u'1 -teaspoon fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon thin soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u' Black pepper', u' Nuoc Cham, recipe follows', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 fresh hot chile pepper (about 1 1/2-inch long), finely chopped', u'1/2 lime', u'1/4 -cup fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon sugar', u'5 tablespoons water']
title: Xoi Thap Cam: Sweet Rice with Meat, Shrimp, and Sausage

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the sauce: Grind the peanuts in a food processor. Heat the vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook 1 minute. Add the fish sauce and cook 1 more minute. Add the ground peanuts and cook, stirring, about 4 minutes. Sprinkle in the sugar and cook 1 to 2 more minutes. Stir in the coconut milk, chicken broth and hoisin sauce. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until thick, about 20 minutes. Let cool.', u'Make the rolls: Fill a saucepan with water and season with salt. Add the vinegar, sugar and peppercorns and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the shrimp and simmer until pink, 2 minutes. Drain and run under cold water. Peel the shrimp, then halve lengthwise and devein. Cover and chill.', u'Cook the rice noodles as the label directs, then drain. Cut the cucumber and scallions into matchsticks and toss with 1 teaspoon salt in a bowl. One at a time, soak a rice paper wrapper in warm water until pliable, 30 seconds, then lay on a cutting board and pat dry. Arrange 3 shrimp halves across the middle of the wrapper; top with some noodles, herbs, cucumber, scallions and lettuce. Fold the bottom of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll up into a tight bundle. Cut in half; serve with the peanut sauce.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup unsalted peanuts', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons red curry paste', u'2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/2 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'6 black peppercorns', u'12 medium shrimp (unpeeled)', u'1 ounce rice vermicelli', u'1 cucumber', u'3 scallions', u'8 8 -inch-round rice paper wrappers', u'1/2 bunch mint', u'1/2 bunch basil', u'1/2 bunch cilantro', u'4 Boston lettuce leaves, torn']
title: Shrimp Summer Rolls

directions: [u'Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large nonstick pan over moderate heat. In a bowl, combine the eggs and a pinch of salt and beat well. When the pan is hot, pour in half the beaten eggs and quickly swirl to cover the bottom of the pan. Cook until firm, about 1 minute. Flip the egg crepe and cook another minute. Transfer the crepe to a plate. Repeat with the remaining egg batter. When the crepes are cool enough to handle, cut into thin strips and set aside.', u'Heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of oil in a large pan over high heat. Add the shallot and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the soy sauce, jicama, carrot, water and the remaining salt. Cook, uncovered,  until the vegetables are soft, about 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer the vegetables to a dish. ', u'Combine the hoisin sauce and chili paste in a small bowl and set aside. Set up a work station by placing the ingredients in the order in which they will be needed: rice papers, egg strips, lettuce, jicama mixture, tofu, hoisin mixture, basil, peanuts.', u'Fill a large bowl with hot water. Cover a cutting board with a damp towel and place it next to the bowl. Working with 2 rice paper rounds at a time, dip one, edge first, into the hot water and turn to wet it completely, about 10 seconds. Lay the round down on the towel. Repeat with the other round and place it next to the first. (This allows you to work with one while the second rests.)', u'Neatly place on the bottom third of the first round a few strips of egg crepe, 1 piece of lettuce, 2 tablespoons jicama mixture (no juice), 2 pieces of tofu, 1/2 teaspoon hoisin sauce mix, 2 or 3 basil leaves and a sprinkling of peanuts. Make sure the filling is neatly stacked. Fold the bottom edge over the filling, tuck in the sides, and roll into a cylinder. A perfect bo bia is about 1 inch wide and 4 inches long. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Serve the rolls whole or cut in half.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 eggs', u'1 teaspoon sea salt', u'2 tablespoons chopped shallots', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 jicama, peeled and cut into matchstick strips (about 2 cups)', u'1 carrot, peeled and cut into matchstick strips (about 1 cup)', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/4 cup hoisin sauce', u'1 tablespoon ground chili paste (or to taste)', u'1 head green-leaf lettuce, washed, drained, and cut into 1-inch-by-3-inch pieces', u'1 (6-ounce) piece tofu, pan seared and cut into thin strips', u'2/3 cup Asian basil leaves', u'1/3 cup chopped roasted peanuts', u'24 (6- or 8-inch) dried rice paper rounds, plus extras']
title: Salad Rolls with Jicama, Peanuts and Basil (Bo Bia Chay)

directions: [u'In a bowl stir together all dressing ingredients until sugar is dissolved. Chill dressing, covered, 1 hour. Shell and devein shrimp. In a large saucepan of salted boiling water cook shrimp with lemon 2 minutes, or until just cooked through. In a colander drain shrimp and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Halve shrimp lengthwise.', u'Halve cucumber lengthwise and seed. Cut cucumber halves and scallions crosswise into 2 1/2 inch pieces and cut pieces lenghtwise into julienne strips.', u'In a bowl soak noodles in hot water to cover 15 minutes to soften. While noodles are soaking, in a 6-quart kettle 31/2 quarts salted water to a boil. Drain noodles in colander and cook in boiling water 45 seconds, or until just tender. Drain noodles in colander and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Drain noodles well and with scissors cut into 4-inch lengths.', u'Divide noodles, shrimp, vegetables, and dressing among 4 bowls and sprinkle with herbs and peanuts. To serve, pull herbs from sprigs and toss with noodles.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup Asian fish sauce', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'3 large garlic cloves, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'1 pound large shrimp (16 to 20)', u'1/2 lemon', u'1 English cucumber', u'4 scallions', u'1/2 pound rice-stick noodles', u'1 cup fresh mint sprigs', u'1/2 cup fresh coriander sprigs', u'2 tablespoons chopped peanuts']
title: Rice-Stick Noodle Salad with Vietnamese Shrimp

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a bowl combine the noodles, ground pork, onion, mushrooms, garlic, shallots, crabmeat, and black pepper, and set aside. ', u'Cut the round wrappers into quarters and place on a flat surface. With a pastry brush, paint the beaten egg over the entire surface of each of the pieces. Before filling, wait for the egg mixture to take effect, softening the wrappers, this takes about 2 minutes. ', u'When the wrapper is soft and transparent, place 1 teaspoon of the filling near the curved side, in the shape of a triangle. Fold the sides over to enclose the filling and continue to roll all the way up until all the wrappers are filled. ', u'In a large frying pan add oil, and place the spring rolls into the cold oil. Slowly heat, frying for 20 to 30 minutes. Turn them occasionally until they are golden on all sides. Serve with Carrot Salad and Fresh Herb, Lettuce, and Cucumber Salad.']
ingredients: [u'1 ounce noodles, soaked in warm water for 20 minutes, drained and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/2 pound ground pork', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'1 -tablespoon tree ear or cloud ear mushrooms, soaked in warm water for 30 minutes, thoroughly rinsed, drained and finely chopped', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon chopped shallots', u'3 ounces crabmeat, cleaned', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'10 sheets round banh trangs (dried rice wrappers available at Vietnamese or specialty markets)', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'2 cups peanut oil', u' Carrot Salad, recipe follows', u' Fresh Herb, Lettuce, and Cucumber Salad, recipe follows', u'1 cup grated carrots', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 teaspoon white vinegar', u' Pinch salt', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'5 tablespoons nouc cham, recipe follows', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 fresh hot chile pepper (about 1 1/2-inch long), finely chopped', u'1/2 lime', u'1/4 -cup fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon sugar', u'5 tablespoons water', u'3 cups bibb lettuce leaves', u'1 cup picked mint leaves', u'1 cup picked cilantro leaves', u'1 cup cucumber slices, cut into semicircles']
title: Spring Rolls

directions: [u'In a mixing bowl, rub the pork ribs with salt.', u'In a large pot, bring 2 quarts of water to the boil.', u'In a medium-size clay pot, add the ginseng, lotus seeds, goji berries, black prune, lilly petals, longon, white vegetable root, pearl barley, and raisins, followed by the pork ribs.', u'Pour water in the clay pot until it reaches 2-inches above the level of the pork, about 1 1/2 to 2 cups water. ', u'With the lid on, carefully place the enclosed clay pot into the simmering water making sure the hot water is level with the top of the clay pot. Put the lid on and simmer for 3 hours.', u'Carefully remove the clay pot from the simmering water and serve with steamed jasmine rice.']
ingredients: [u'11 ounces short spare ribs, chopped into bite-size pieces', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon dried ginseng*', u'1 teaspoon dried lotus seeds*', u'1 teaspoon dried goji berries*', u'1 teaspoon dried black prune*', u'1 teaspoon dried lilly petals*', u'1 teaspoon dried longon*', u'1 teaspoon dried white vegetable root*', u'1 teaspoon pearl barley', u'1 teaspoon dried raisins', u' Steamed jasmine rice, for serving', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian and Indian markets and online.']
title: Pork Spare Ribs Slow Braised In Medicinal Broth: Suong Non Tiem Thuoc Bac

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Stem the chile.  Split the chile in half, remove and discard the seeds and membrane.  Finely chop the chile.  Combine the chopped chile, garlic and sugar in a mortar.  Pound the mixture into a paste.  Remove the zest and pith from the lime, and discard.  Add the lime to the chile mixture.  Mash well.  Add the fish sauce and the water.  Mix well.  Serve as a seasoning agent instead of salt and pepper.']
ingredients: [u'1 small fresh chile pepper', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'3 teaspoons sugar', u'1 fresh lime', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'3 tablespoons water']
title: Nuoc Cham

directions: [u'To assemble the rolls, cut 6 sheets of rice paper in half. Fill a large bowl with warm water and dip 1 whole sheet of rice paper in the water until it softens then lay flat on a plate. Dip a half sheet of rice paper in the water and lay it vertically in the middle of the round sheet. This will strengthen the roll, preventing the filling from breaking through.', u'In the middle of the rice paper, place 3 pieces of prawn in a horizontal line approximately 1 1/2-inches from the top. Below the prawns add some perilla leaves, pork, lettuce, mint, and vermicelli.', u'To form the roll, first fold the sides into the center over the filling, then fold the bottom of the rice paper up and over. Roll from bottom to top to form a tight roll, and just before you complete the roll add 2 pieces of garlic chives so that they stick out at one end. ', u'Serve 2 rolls per person with dipping fish sauce.', u'To make the dipping fish sauce: Combine the fish sauce, vinegar, sugar, and water in a saucepan and place on medium heat. Stir well and cook until just before boiling point is reached, then allow to cool. To serve, finely chop the garlic and chile and stir through with the lime juice.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces dried vermicelli noodles, cooked according to package directions', u'18 sheets (8 1/2-inch) rice paper', u'18 cooked small tiger prawns (shrimp), peeled and sliced in half lengthwise', u'1 bunch fresh perilla leaves*', u'4 ounces cooked pork neck, finely sliced', u'1 cup firmly packed shredded iceberg lettuce', u'1 bunch fresh mint sprigs', u'1 bunch fresh garlic chives', u' Dipping Fish Sauce, recipe follows, to serve', u' Dipping Fish Sauce', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 ounces or 1/2 cup water', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 chile, chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice']
title: Soft Rice Paper Rolls with Prawns and Pork: Goi Cuon

directions: [u"For the marinade, pound the garlic, sugar, and shallots in a mortar into a paste. Add the fish sauce, sesame seeds, black pepper, sesame oil, and lemon grass. (The lower third of the stalk of lemon grass should be sliced thinly, then minced, before adding to the mortar. It's best to mince in a food processor)."]
ingredients: [u'2 garlic cloves', u'1 tablespoon granulated sugar', u'3 shallots', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'1 tablespoon raw sesame seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon Asian sesame oil', u'2 stalks fresh lemon grass', u'1 pound boneless top round', u'1/2 pound rice sticks', u'1 cup shredded cucumber', u'2 cups shredded lettuce', u'1/4 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro', u'10 roasted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u'1 fresh or dried hot red chile, shredded', u' Cilantro sprigs, for garnish', u'1 clove garlic', u'1/2 fresh hot red chile', u'2 heaping teaspoons granulated sugar', u'1/4 fresh lime', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'2 1/2 tablespoons water']
title: Barbecued Beef with Lemon Grass and Noodles

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Combine the water, sugar, vinegar and spices for the pickled vegetables in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Pour hot liquid, using a strainer to remove seeds, over shredded vegetables and let sit for half an hour or more. Refrigerate in a non-reactive airtight container if prepared in advance.', u'Using a mortar and pestle, grind the garlic, chili pepper, and sugar into a smooth paste. Add the lime juice and the Vietnamese fish sauce (if using the sambal sauce add it at this time) to the paste and stir. Add the water, to taste. Set aside.', u'To make the noodle "patties", bring a pot of water to a boil and add the noodles. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, and then drain in a colander. Pat the noodles dry, place in a large bowl, and sprinkle with the rice flour. Toss to thoroughly combine. Lightly oil your hands, then, working 1 at a time, gather a small amount of noodles and shape into small nests about 2  to 3 inches wide. Repeat until you have at least 24 patties. (Any remaining noodles should be discarded.) Prepare a steamer and line with waxed paper. When the steamer water is boiling, steam the patties, patting them down to compress with a spatula, for 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate to cool slightly before serving.', u'To grill the shrimp, heat a grill pan or the grill to medium-high heat. Season the shrimp with salt and pepper. Lightly grease the pan or the grill with peanut oil and place the shrimp on the grill. Cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until the shrimp are just cooked through. Set the cooked shrimp aside, in a warm spot or lightly covered while assembling the rest of the dish. ', u'In a small saucepan, heat 1 cup of peanut oil. Add the shallots in batches and fry to a golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Season the shallots with salt as soon as they come out of the oil. ', u'To eat the noodles, take a lettuce leaf, add the noodle "patty", spoon a little nuoc cham over noodles, add the pickled vegetables, herbs and sprouts, shrimp and shallots. Roll up to dip into the nuoc cham and then eat with your hands. Serve with hoisin sauce and sriracha sauce on the side for diners to season their rolls, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup water', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 pinch salt', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'2 carrots, shredded', u'1 small daikon radish, shredded', u'1 bunch scallions, trimmed and quartered lengthwise', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 fresh red chili pepper or 1 teaspoon sambal sauce', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 lime, juiced, or more to taste', u'2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (nuoc nam)', u'2 tablespoons water or more to taste', u'3 1/2 ounces Vietnamese rice vermicelli', u'4 tablespoons rice flour', u'1 head red or green leaf lettuce, washed and separated', u'1 bunch cilantro, washed and trimmed', u'1 bunch opal basil, washed and trimmed', u'1 bunch mint', u'1/4 pound bean sprouts', u'2 pounds medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Peanut or vegetable oil', u'1 cup peanut oil', u'5 to 6 shallots, peeled and sliced into thin rounds', u' Salt', u' Hoisin sauce, for serving, optional', u' Sriracha sauce, for serving, optional']
title: Vietnamese Style Rice Noodle "Patties" with Nuoc Cham, Lettuce and Herb Basket, Pickled Vegetables and Crispy Shallots

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large non-tick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until just beginning to color, about 6 minutes. Add the lemongrass, cilantro root and garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the lobster bodies, star anise, water, carrots, ginger, cinnamon and peppercorns and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes, skimming the top to remove any foam that forms on the surface. Remove stock from the stove and strain through a fine strainer. Place in a new stockpot and bring to a simmer.', u'Meanwhile, bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the noodles to the water and boil until just tender, then drain in a colander. ', u'To assemble the Pho, bring the soup to a simmer, as needed, and add the fish sauce. Drain the boiled noodles in a colander and divide among 4 soup bowls. Divide the remaining ingredients among the bowls and ladle the broth over each portion at the table. Garnish with lime wedges, mint and bean sprouts and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'2 cups sliced yellow onions', u'2 tablespoons chopped lemongrass', u'2 teaspoons chopped cilantro leaves', u'2 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed', u'2 pounds lobster bodies and shells', u'1 star anise pod', u'8 cups water', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced', u'1 1/2 tablespoons chopped fresh gingerroot', u'1 cinnamon stick, broken in 1/2', u'2 tablespoons whole black peppercorns', u'12 ounces rice vermicelli noodles', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3/4 pound chopped lobster meat, from the tails and claws', u'1 cup thinly sliced green onion, white and green parts', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 small green chiles, sliced', u'2 small red chiles, sliced', u' Lime wedges, for garnish', u' Mint, for garnish', u'1 cup bean sprouts, for garnish']
title: Lobster Pho

directions: [u'Whisk together the sugar, water, fish sauce and lime or lemon juice in a bowl until the sugar is completely dissolved. Add the garlic, chili and shallot (if using), and let stand for 30 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup lime or lemon juice (about 3 limes or 2 lemons)', u'1 large clove garlic, crushed, peeled and sliced or minced', u"1 or more bird's eye or Thai chilies, seeded, and sliced or minced", u'1 shallot, peeled, thinly sliced, rinsed and drained (optional)']
title: Nuoc Cham (Fish Dipping Sauce)

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Put 2 cups hot water in a large bowl and add the noodles. Soak them until softened but slightly resilient, 20 to 30 minutes. Drain them and pat dry on paper towels. Put in a bowl and cover. ', u'Combine 4 cups water, the ginger, lemon, soy sauce, sugar, bay leaves, green onions, garlic, salt, black pepper, and cayenne in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Season the shrimp with the Essence and add to the boiling water. Boil for 2 minutes, and then remove the pan from the heat and allow the shrimp to sit in the hot liquid for 2 minutes, or until cooked through. Using tongs or a slotted spoon, remove the shrimp from the water and let cool. ', u'When the shrimp are cool enough to handle, cut in 1/2 lengthwise. Fill a large bowl with hot water. Place a clean kitchen towel next to the bowl. Submerge 1 rice paper wrapper in the water and soak it until softened, about 1 minute. Carefully remove the rice paper from the water and lay it flat on the towel. In the center of the sheet, layer 1/8 of the soaked noodles, 4 lettuce pieces, about 20 sprouts, 4 shrimp halves arranged side by side in a row, 4 mint leaves, 4 cilantro sprigs, and 1/8 of the carrots. Pull the bottom up over the filling, fold over the sides, and roll up like an egg roll. Place seam side down on a plate and repeat the process with the remaining rice papers and filling. Serve immediately with your favorite dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces mung bean noodles or cellophane noodles', u'1 (2-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced', u'1 lemon, halved', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'4 bay leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped green onions (green and white parts)', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'16 large shrimp, peeled and de-veined', u'2 teaspoons Essence, recipe follows', u'8 (8 1/2-inch) round rice paper wrappers', u'8 small romaine lettuce leaves, rinsed, patted dry, ribs removed, and torn into bite-size pieces', u'1 ounce alfalfa or radish sprouts', u'32 fresh mint leaves', u'32 sprigs fresh cilantro', u'1 large carrot, peeled and shredded', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Shrimp Summer Rolls

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a roasting pan place all the ingredients in the oil and bake for 25 minutes.', u'Remove from oven, transfer into a large pot, and add 1 gallon of cool water. Bring to a simmer. Once at a simmer, add the cilantro, basil, and jalapenos and simmer for 20 minutes.  Remove from heat and strain.  Stir in the sambal, soy sauce, sesame oil and salt, to taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound cremini mushrooms, roughly chopped', u'1 whole carrot, peeled and diced', u'1 yellow onion, peeled and diced', u'2 stalks celery, diced', u'2 thumb-sized pieces fresh ginger, diced', u'1 stalk lemongrass, pounded with the back of knife, then roughly chopped', u'4 tablespoons canola oil', u'1/2 bunch fresh cilantro, leaves roughly chopped', u'1 bunch sweet basil, leaves roughly chopped', u'3 jalapenos, roughly chopped', u'2 heaping tablespoons sambal oelek', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1 tablespoons sesame oil', u' Salt, to taste', u'1/4 cup sambal oelek', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup apple cider vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', u' Eggplant', u' Carrot', u' Red pepper', u' Shiitake mushrooms', u' Fresh spinach', u' Snow peas', u' "Dragon" noodles, fresh ramen, lo mein, or buckwheat', u' Lime wedges, for garnish']
title: Pho Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat a wok of peanut oil for frying.  In a separate wok, heat the vegetable oil.  When the oil is hot, add the sausage.  Stir-fry for 3 minutes.  Add the onions and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes.  Add the cabbage and the shrimp.  Season with nuoc cham and black pepper.  Stir-fry for 1 minute.  Remove from the heat and cool completely.  Stir in the green onions. Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a 10-inch saute pan and remove from the heat.  Submerge each spring roll wrapper, one at a time, in the hot water.  Move the wrappers around in the water until they become soft and pliable, about 10 to 15 seconds.  Remove from the water and lay on parchment paper.   Spread 1 tablespoon of the shrimp mixture evenly over each spring roll wrapper.  On top of the shrimp mixture, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the sprouts.  Top the sprouts with 1 tablespoon of the carrots, 1 tablespoon of the cilantro, and 1 tablespoon of the mint.  Fold two sides of the wrapper toward the center and then roll like a jelly roll, pressing the edges together to seal.  Repeat until all 8 rolls are done.  Fry until crispy, about 2 to 3 minutes.  Remove and drain on paper towels.  Serve with Nuoc Cham sauce.', u'']
ingredients: [u' Peanut oil for frying', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 pound Chinese sausage, finely chopped', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup minced yellow onions', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1/4 pound Bok Choy, shredded', u'1/2 pound medium shrimp, peeled, deveined and chopped', u' Nuoc Cham sauce, recipe follows', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon chopped green onions', u'16 rice papers or spring roll wrappers', u'1 cup bean sprouts', u'1 cup match-stick carrot strips', u'1 cup packed cilantro leaves', u'1 cup packed fresh mint leaves', u' Recipe courtesy of Emeril Lagasse, 1999', u'1 small fresh chile pepper', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'3 teaspoons sugar', u'1 fresh lime', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'3 tablespoons water']
title: Spicy Shrimp Spring Rolls

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the noodles in a large bowl.  Cover with warm water and allow to sit for 20 minutes.  Drain and pat dry.  In a wok, over medium heat, add the oil.  When the oil is hot, add the shallots, peas, mushrooms, garlic and bean sprouts.  Season with the fish sauce and black pepper. Stir-fry for 1 minute.  Add the crabmeat.  Season with the fish sauce and black pepper.  Continue to stir-fry for 2 minutes.  Add the noodles and green onions.  Stir-fry for 1 minute.  Remove and serve on a large platter.']
ingredients: [u'1 package (3 1/2 ounces) of cellophane noodles', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons chopped shallots', u'1 cup thinly sliced snow peas', u'1 -ounce of dried tree ear mushrooms, reconstituted in water', u'2 teaspoons chopped garlic', u'1 cup bean sprouts (packed)', u' Fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 pound fresh crab meat, cartilage removed', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions']
title: Stir-Fried Crabmeat with Cellophane Noodles

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the fryer. In a small mixing bowl, add the noodles.  Season the noodles with sesame oil, soy sauce, salt, green onions and black pepper.  Mix thoroughly. Bring water to a boil in a 10-inch saute pan and remove from the heat. Submerge each spring roll wrapper, 1 at a time, in the hot water, moving it around in the water until soft and pliable, 10 to 15 seconds.  Remove and lay on the parchment paper.   In another small mixing bowl, combine the crabmeat, mayonnaise, and chili paste.  Mix well.  Season with salt and pepper. Place 1 tablespoon of the noodle mixture over the crab mixture.   On top of the noodles, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the sprouts.  Top the sprouts with the 1 tablespoon of the papaya, 1 tablespoon of the carrots, 1 tablespoon of the cilantro, and 1 tablespoon of the mint.  Fold 2 sides of the wrapper toward the center about 1/4-inch, then roll each like a jelly roll, pressing the edges together to seal. Fry half of the spring rolls until golden.  Remove and drain on paper towels. Season with salt. Repeat with remaining spring rolls. Slice each roll in half diagonally.  Serve the rolls on a large platter with the spicy peanut dipping sauce.  Garnish with chives.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces Chinese cellophane or glass noodles, cooked', u' Dash sesame oil', u' Dash soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon chopped green onions', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'8 rice papers or spring roll wrappers', u'1 pound jumbo lump crabmeat, picked over for cartilage', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons chili paste', u' Salt', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup julienne papaya', u'1/2 cup julienne carrots', u'1/2 cup packed cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup packed fresh mint leaves', u'1 cup Peanut Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'10 large garlic cloves, peeled', u'2/3 bunch fresh coriander leaves and upper stems', u'1/2 cup unseasoned peanut', u'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon thin soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u' Dash Chinese rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon hot chili oil']
title: Fresh Crab Springrolls

directions: [u'Start by soaking the mushrooms in hot water until soft. Steam the escargot for 10 minutes. Spoon out the meat and mince. Wash the shells and set aside. Mix ground meat, mushrooms, escargot, dill, and pepper. Add the salt, sugar, and chili.', u'Take the outer leaves of lemongrass and fold them in half. Tuck the lemongrass leaves into the shell, leaving some leaves sticking out. Fill the shell with the meat mixture, making sure the meat is pressed down onto the lemongrass leaves. Steam for 10 minutes and serve hot.  ']
ingredients: [u'5 dried shiitake mushrooms', u'6 escargot, in shells', u'3 ounces ground pork or chicken', u'2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 pinch salt', u'1 pinch sugar', u'1 teaspoon red chili flakes', u'5 stalks lemongrass']
title: Steamed Snails with Lemongrass

directions: [u'Cook the pork in boiling salted water until it?s done but still firm enough for slicing, about 30 minutes.', u'While the pork is cooking, bring another small pot of water to a boil. Add the shrimp and cook until they turn pink, about 3 minutes. Rinse under running water and set aside to drain. When cool enough to handle, peel, de-vein, and cut in half lengthwise. Refresh in cold water and set aside.', u'Remove pork from the heat and drain. When it is cool enough to handle, slice into thin slices, about 1 by 2 1/2 inches. Place on a small plate and set aside.', u'Set up a salad roll "station." Line a cutting board with a damp kitchen towel. Fill a large bowl with hot water and place it nearby. (Keep some boiling water handy to add to the bowl.) Arrange the ingredients in the order they will be used: the shrimp, pork, rice vermicelli, bean sprouts, mint and lettuce.', u'Working with 2 rice paper rounds at a time, dip 1, edge first into the hot water and turn it to wet completely, about 10 seconds. Lay the round down on the towel. Repeat with the second rice paper and place it alongside the first. This allows you to work with 1 while the second is being set.', u'Line the bottom third of the rice paper round with 3 shrimp halves, cut side up, and top with 2 slices of pork. Add 1 tablespoon rice vermicelli, 1 tablespoon bean sprouts, and 4 to 5 mint leaves. (Arrange the ingredients so the rolls will end up being about 5 inches long and 1-inch wide.) Halve a lettuce leaf lengthwise along the center rib. Roll up in 1 piece and place on the filling. (Trim if it?s too long.) While pressing down on the ingredients, lift the bottom edge over the filling, then fold in 2 sides. Roll into a cylinder about 1 1/2 inches wide and 4 to 5 inches long. If the paper feels thick, stop three-quarters of the way and trim the end piece. (Too much rice paper can make the rolls chewy.) Repeat with the remaining rice papers and filling.', u'To serve, cut rolls into 2 or 4 pieces and place them upright on a plate. Serve with the sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 pound pork shoulder, untrimmed, cut into 2 pieces', u'12 medium raw shrimp, unpeeled', u'4 ounces bun (rice vermicelli or rice sticks), boiled for 5 minutes, rinsed and drained, see Cook?s Note', u'1 cup bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup mint leaves', u'1 small head red-leaf lettuce, leaves separated and washed', u'8 (12-inch) dried rice papers, round, plus extras', u'1/2 cup Vietnamese Bean Dipping Sauce, for serving, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup fermented whole soybeans', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/3 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons chopped yellow onion', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon ground chile paste, or to taste, as an accompaniment', u'1 tablespoon chopped roasted peanuts, for garnish, recipe follows', u'1 cup raw, shelled peanuts, skin removed']
title: Rice Paper Wrapped Salad Rolls

directions: [u'Combine the lemongrass, soy sauce, chiles, chile flakes, turmeric, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Add the tofu cubes and turn to coat them evenly. Marinate for 30 minutes.', u'Heat half of the oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderately high heat. Add the onion, shallot and garlic and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the onions are soft, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.', u'Wipe the pan clean and heat the remaining oil over moderate heat. Add the tofu mixture and, using chopsticks or wooden spoons, turn so it cooks evenly, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the onion mixture and cook, uncovered, for another 2 to 3 minutes. Add half the peanuts and all the pepper leaves.', u'Remove from the heat and transfer to a serving plate. Garnish with the remaining peanuts and serve immediately with steamed rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 lemongrass stalks, outer layers peeled, bottom white part thinly sliced and finely chopped (about 1/4 cup)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons chopped Thai bird chiles or another fresh chile', u'1/2 teaspoon dried chile flakes', u'1 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'12 ounces tofu, drained, patted dry and cut into 3/4-inch cubes', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 yellow onion, cut into 1/8-inch slices', u'2 shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'4 tablespoons chopped Roasted Peanuts, recipe follows', u'10 pepper leaves, shredded, or 2/3 cup loosely packed Asian basil leaves', u'1 cup raw, shelled peanuts, skin removed']
title: Spicy Lemongrass Tofu

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the beef bones and oxtails in a large stockpot, cover with water.  Bring the liquid up to a boil and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and drain.  Rinse the pot and bones.  Return the bones to the pot and cover with 6 quarts of water.  Bring the liquid up to a boil and skimming often to remove the foam.  When the foam stops rising to the surface, add 3 quarts of water and return to a boil.']
ingredients: [u'5 pounds beef bones with  marrow, cleaned and soaked overnight', u'5 pounds oxtails, cut into small pieces', u' Water to cover']
title: Pho Stock

directions: [u'Char the onions, shallots, and ginger, directly over a gas burner or under the broiler, about 5 to 6 minutes. Tie the charred vegetables, star anise, garlic cloves, and cinnamon stick in a damped cheesecloth.  Add the spice bag and parsnips to the simmering broth.  Season the broth with salt and pepper.  Simmer the liquid for 1 hour. Add the tripe and tendons to the broth and simmer uncovered for 5 hours.  Two hours after adding the tripe, add the flank steak and brisket.']
ingredients: [u'2 onions, unpeeled, halved and studded with cloves', u'3 shallots unpeeled', u'4 ounces whole fresh ginger, unpeeled', u'8 star anise', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'5 medium parsnips cut into 2-inch chunks', u' Salt', u'1 pound tripe and tendons', u'1/2 pound  flank steak', u'1/2 pound beef brisket', u' FINISHING PHO', u'1 pound beef sirloin, sliced paper-thin', u'3 green onions, sliced thinly on the bias', u'2 tablespoons  chiffonade of  cilantro', u'2 medium onions, julienned', u'1 cup  fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'1 pound 1/4-inch wide dried  rice noodles, soaked in warm water for 30 minutes and drained', u' fresh ground black pepper', u'2 cups fresh  bean sprouts', u'3 fresh jalapeno pepper, julienned', u'2 limes, cut into wedges', u'1 bun', u' Chinese basil, chiffonade']
title: Charring the Vegetables and Finishing the Pho

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a wok over high heat and stir-fry the garlic until fragrant and lightly golden, about 1 minute. Add the water spinach, season with pepper, and stir-fry until wilted, about 3 minutes. Add the bean curd, stir-fry until it is evenly distributed, then cover and cook until done, 2 to 3 minutes more.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups vegetable oil', u'1 large clove garlic, peeled and minced', u'1 pound water spinach, stems trimmed, washed, drained, and halved crosswise', u' Freshly ground, black pepper', u'1 tablespoon preserved bean curd or fish sauce']
title: Stir Fried Water Spinach

directions: [u'Gently place the eggs in a pot and just cover with water. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium-low heat and cook until soft-boiled, about 5 minutes (about 2 minutes for quail eggs.) Rinse under cold water and allow to cool completely. Carefully shell the eggs intact. Make a caramel by combining the sugar and 1/4 cup water in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. When the sugar is melted and turns a rich gold, about 8 minutes, remove the pot from the heat and stir in the coconut juice and fish sauce (or 3 cups water and the soy sauce.) Reduce the heat to low and stir until the sauce is completely smooth. Add the pork shanks, turning them to coat evenly on all sides. Add the scallions, ginger, garlic, chilies, star anise, and five-spice powder, and simmer, covered, turning shanks occasionally, until the meat is fork tender, about 4 hours. With a ladle, skim off the fat and add the eggs. Continue simmering, ladling sauce over the eggs occasionally, until the eggs turn golden and cooked through, about 5 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'4 to 6 chicken or duck eggs or 12 quail eggs', u' Water to cook eggs, plus 1/4 cup water for caramel', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'3 cups young coconut juice (if using fish sauce)', u'1/2 cup fish sauce or thin soy sauce', u'2 (2-pound) pork shanks, bone in and with rind', u'5 scallions, trimmed, halved, and white bulbs lightly crushed', u'3 large cloves garlic, peeled and lightly crushed', u'3 or more dried red chilies', u'5 star anise', u'1/2 teaspoon five-spice powder']
title: Braised Pork Shank in Coconut Juice

directions: [u'Stir together the fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, and oil until the sugar is completely dissolved. Add the lemongrass, shallot, garlic and pork and mix to coat the meat evenly. Allow to marinate at room temperature for 20 minutes or refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight.', u'Slide 2 to 4 slices of pork onto each skewer so the meat is flat with the skewer going through the slices several times. Grill over a barbecue (make sure that the flames have subsided and the coals are red with white ashes). Alternatively, heat a well-oiled grill pan or non-stick skillet over high heat and, working in batches, cook the skewers until the edges crisp, about 1 minute per side. Remove the skewers from the grilled pork.', u'Divide the grilled pork among the bowls of rice vermicelli. Sprinkle peanuts and drizzle nuoc cham over each serving. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 stalks lemongrass, outer leaves and tops removed, root ends trimmed, and stalks finely grated', u'1 large shallot, finely chopped', u'2 large cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 pound pork tenderloin, thinly sliced', u'16 bamboo skewers, soaked for 20 minutes and drained', u'1 recipe Rice Vermicelli: Bun Thit, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup chopped unsalted roasted peanuts', u' Nuoc cham, as needed, recipe follows', u' Fish Dipping Sauce: Nuoc Cham', u' Recipe courtesy Corinne Trang, Authentic Vietnamese Cooking, Simon & Schuster, 1999', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1/3 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup lime or lemon juice', u'1 large clove garlic, minced', u"1 or more bird's eye or Thai chiles, seeded and minced", u'1 shallot, peeled, thinly sliced, and rinsed (optional)']
title: Grilled Lemongrass Pork Tenderloin Skewers: Suon Nuong Xa

directions: [u'Melt 1/2 cup sugar with 3 tablespoons water in a saucepan over medium-low heat, occasionally swirling the pan, until the sugar starts to bubble and turn golden brown, about 7 minutes. Remove from the heat and divide the syrup among 8 (1/2) cup ramekins so the bottoms and sides are covered with the syrup. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees. Meanwhile, whisk the remaining sugar, coconut milk, whole milk, and eggs in a bowl until the sugar is completely dissolved. Divide the mixture among the ramekins. Create a water bath by filling a baking dish halfway with water. Place the ramekins in it and bake until the custards set, about 35 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool in the water bath. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate and least 12 hours. To serve, loosen  the sides with a knife and invert custard onto plates so the caramel is on top, drizzling any remaining caramel on the plates around the custard. Serve chilled garnished with a mint leaf.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup sugar, divided in half', u'3 tablespoons water', u'2 cups canned unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 cup whole milk', u'6 large eggs', u'8 fresh mint leaves, equal size']
title: Coconut Creme Caramel

directions: [u'Mix soy sauce, mirin, 1 teaspoon of the sesame oil, garlic, ginger, sugar, vinegar, and chile paste in a small bowl.', u'Heat the broth in a medium saucepan. Add the soy sauce mixture, the chicken, and the vegetables and bring to a boil. Simmer for two minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Add the remaining 1 teaspoon sesame oil. Taste and adjust seasonings.', u'Pour over prepared Chinese noodles. Garnish with cilantro and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons mirin', u'1 teaspoon dark sesame oil, plus 1 teaspoon', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'4 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon Vietnamese chile paste', u'8 cups chicken broth', u'12 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut crosswise into thin strips', u'4 cups chopped Chinese vegetables or Napa cabbage', u'1 (5-ounce) package rice noodles, prepared according to packing directions', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'6 scallions, thinly sliced on the bias']
title: Asian Chicken Noodle Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a small saucepan over high heat. Add the garlic and ginger and cook over high heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Whisk in the sherry, hoisin sauce, ketchup, chile-garlic sauce, soy sauce, and sesame oil and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 tablespoons finely grated peeled fresh ginger', u'1/2 cup dry sherry', u'1/2 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/2 cup ketchup', u'1 1/2 teaspoons Vietnamese chili-garlic sauce', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons dark sesame oil']
title: Sweet & Sour BBQ Sauce

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Dry Roast the spices in a saute pan over medium-high heat until you can smell the perfume from the spices. Once the spices have been roasted for a bit, then add the heavy cream. Remove from heat and steep 1 hour. Strain out the spices.', u'Reheat the strained cream and pour the warm cream over the chocolate. Stir with a spatula to mix the chocolate completely until melted and combined. Once the chocolate is uniform in texture, add the butter and stir until well combined.', u'Pour into another bowl and allow to cool to room temperature. Place in a pastry bag and form little blobs onto a tray. Refrigerate until firm to the touch. Remove and roll to desired form.']
ingredients: [u'50 grams (scant 2 ounces) Vietnamese cinnamon chips', u'2 tablespoons ancho chili powder', u'15 grams (1/2-ounce, about 2 tablespoons) whole allspice berries', u'1 liter (about 4 cups) heavy cream', u'700 grams (1 pound 9 ounces) 60 percent dark chocolate, uniformly chopped', u'300 grams (11 ounces) milk chocolate, uniformly chopped', u'40 grams (1.5 ounces about 3 tablespoons) butter, room temperature, cut into uniform pieces']
title: Chocolate Truffles

directions: [u'Place rice noodles in a large pot of boiling water, stir. Add shrimp. Cook until noodles are al dente and shrimp is just cooked, about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes. Lift out the shrimp, set aside to cool. Drain and rinse noodles.', u'When shrimp is cool enough to handle, cut into small pieces. Place in a non-reactive salad bowl with noodles, carrots, cabbage, basil and cilantro. Toss to combine.', u'To prepare rice paper wrappers: Fill a large pan or bowl with hot tap water. Dip 1 rice paper wrapper into water, lift out, and drain briefly. Set on a flat surface.', u'To assemble salad rolls: Place 1/2 cup filling in the center of each wrapper. To roll salad rolls, think diapering a baby the old fashioned way - with cloth diapers minus the diaper pins! Pressing down on filling, fold the bottom of each wrapper over filling, then fold in sides; roll tightly. Press edges to seal; if rice paper is too dry to form a proper seal, moisten unsealed edges with a little water. Set rolls on a platter and cover with a damp towel.', u'To serve, cut rolls crosswise in 1/2; stand pieces upright. Dip in Ginger Lime Dipping Sauce.']
