ingredients: [u'1/4 pound rice stick noodles', u'1/2 pound peeled and deveined shrimp', u'2 cups shredded carrots', u'2 cups shredded Napa cabbage', u'1/2 cup loosely packed, roughly chopped basil leaves', u'1/2 cup loosely packed, roughly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 small cucumber, peeled, seeded, and grated', u'1 package Vietnamese rice sheets', u' Ginger Lime Dipping Sauce, recipe follows']
title: Salad Rolls

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Bring water to a boil and cook rice noodles according to package directions. Drain, rinse and cool (makes about 2 cups).', u'Line up ingredients in small bowls before beginning to make rolls. Fill a large bowl or saucepan with very warm water. Place a rice paper round in the hot water. Soak for between 30 seconds and 1 minute, or until rice round is pliable and pattern on the round is barely visible. Remove and place on a clean, slightly damp kitchen towel.', u'Place 2 basil leaves on the inner edge of the rice round, about 1-inch from the edge and leaving about 1-inch on each side. Top with approximately 1/4 cup cooked rice noodles. Place 2 shrimp halves on top. Top with about 2 tablespoons carrots, then 2 leaves of mint. Fold 1 piece of lettuce leaf and place on top of pile. Bring the edge over filling and tuck underneath. As you continue to roll, fold in the sides. Finish rolling, repeat with the other rolls, and reserve under a damp cloth or paper towel. When ready to serve, slice in half and serve, cut ends up, with dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces Vietnamese or Thai rice noodles', u'6 rice paper rounds', u'1/4 cup, or 12 fresh Thai basil leaves (or regular basil leaves), rinsed and dried', u'6 medium shrimp, cooked and halved', u'1/2 cup shredded carrot', u'1/2 cup, or 12 whole large fresh mint leaves, rinsed and dried', u'3 red-leaf lettuce leaves, leaves, spines removed, leaving 6 halves', u' Vinegar dipping sauce, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons warm water', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon chili sauce (recommended: Sriracha)', u'1 tablespoon lime juice', u'1 teaspoon fish sauce or low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon finely shredded carrot', u'1 scallion, thinly sliced']
title: Soft Asian Summer Rolls with Sweet and Savory Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Soak the noodles in hot water to cover and let stand, about 30 minutes, until soft. ', u'Peel the shrimp, reserving the shells. Cut them in half lengthwise, then toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt and the sesame oil, and refrigerate.', u'Bring the stock to a boil with galangal, garlic, and lemongrass. Turn the heat to low and simmer for 35 minutes. Add the shrimp shells and simmer for another 15 to 20 minutes, skimming if necessary. Strain the stock and bring to a boil. Turn heat to low and simmer with the shallots and chiles. Simmer for 15 minutes and add 2 teaspoons of salt, the fish sauce, and the sugar. Continue to simmer.', u'Meanwhile, drain the noodles well and divide among four to eight bowls. Then add the shrimp to the simmering broth. Turn off the heat and stir in the fresh herbs and lime juice.', u'Divide the soup among the soup bowls, sprinkle over the black pepper, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'8 -ounces dried rice noodles (flat, fettuccine-shaped)', u'1 pound medium shrimp', u' Salt', u' Few drops sesame oil', u'2 quarts chicken stock, preferably fresh', u'6 thin slices fresh galangal or fresh ginger', u'6 garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 stalks lemongrass (bottom third only, sliced thinly on the bias)', u'5 shallots, sliced', u'4 small serrano chile peppers, coarsely shredded, including seeds', u'1/4 cup Thai or Vietnamese fish sauce', u'3 teaspoons sugar', u'1/4 cup whole fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup lightly chopped Asian basil leaves', u'1/3 cups freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
servings: Makes 4 main dish or 8 small s
title: Hot and Sour Shrimp Soup with Noodles and Thai Herbs

directions: [u'Place the jalapeno, ginger, fish  sauce, sugar, lime juice and  coconut milk in a blender and puree  until smooth. ', u'In a large bowl, toss the mixture  with the tuna slices. Mix in the  remaining ingredients. Divide among  8 plates and serve immedi']
ingredients: [u'1 jalapeno chili, seeded and minced', u'2 tablespoons grated fresh gingerroot', u'3 tablespoons Thai or Vietnamese fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 cup freshly squeezed lime juice', u'14 ounces unsweetened coconut milk (available in cans)', u'1 1/2 pounds fresh tuna, cut into broad slices about 1/4-inch thick, sashimi grade', u'1/2 purple onion, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons minced scallions', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped chives', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Tuna Ceviche with Coconut Milk and Ginger

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Put the cellophane noodles, vegetables, cilantro and peanuts in a large bowl; toss with sesame oil and lime juice to give the filling some flavor; season with salt and pepper. ', u"Pour 3 cups of hot, not boiling water in a large shallow bowl. One at a time, immerse the rice paper wrappers in the hot water for 10 seconds to soften, then place on a slightly damp towel. The rice paper is very delicate, don't soak them any longer or they will break apart. Keep them covered while you work to prevent them from drying out and curling. ", u'To form the rolls, lay a rice paper wrapper on a flat surface. Grab a small amount of the cellophane and vegetable mixture and lay it across the bottom third. Use less filling than you think you should, if you overstuff the wrapper it will tear. Carefully fold the bottom of the wrapper up to cover the filling. Fold in the left and right sides, then tuck and roll it over once.  Lay 2 mint leaves on top, then tuck and roll it over to close the whole thing up like a tight cigar. The mint leaves should show through the transparent rice paper. Arrange the finished rolls on a platter and cover with a damp towel.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces Vietnamese cellophane noodles, cooked according to package directions', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'2 carrots, julienned', u'1 large beet, julienned', u'1 fresh red chile, cut in circles', u'2 handfuls fresh cilantro, hand-torn', u'3/4 cup chopped unsalted peanuts', u'2 teaspoons dark sesame oil', u'1 lime, juiced', u' Sea salt', u'20 (8-inch) round rice paper wrappers', u'40 mint leaves', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/4 cup hot water', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon red chili paste, such as sambal']
title: Summer Rolls with Sweet Chili Dipping Sauce

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u"To make the aioli: Place the red pepper on an open flame or grill. Turn to blacken on all sides. When fully charred, remove to a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let pepper cool, until you can handle it comfortably. Using your fingers, remove blackened skin to reveal the red color underneath. (A paper towel will wipe off what you can't remove with your fingers.) Coarsely chop the pepper and place it in the bowl of a food processor. Add the yolks, garlic, vinegar, chili paste, and salt to taste. Puree until the mixture is homogeneous. While the machine is running VERY slowly drizzle in the oil, until incorporated. Check the aioli for texture and flavor. If it's too thick, add a few drops of water to thin it down, or on the flip side if it's too thin add more oil. The desired outcome is a fairly thin aioli. Check the flavor and add more salt or chili paste, if desired. Refrigerate until ready to use.", u"To cook the mussels: In a pot, large enough to accommodate all the mussels, generously coat with olive oil. Add the onions and bring to a medium-high heat, stirring frequently. Cook the onions until they are very soft and aromatic but have no color. Add the garlic, thyme and bay leaf and cook for another 2 to3 minutes. Stir to be sure the garlic doesn't burn. Add the mussels and stir to coat with the oil. Add the wine and cover the pot. Steam the mussels for 5 to 6 minutes or until all the shells open. If some shells don't open, cook them for a little longer. Sometimes the freshest mussels are the most stubborn to open. Remove the mussels that don't open after longer cooking. When in doubt, throw out.", u'While the mussels are steaming, grill or toast the slices of bread. ', u'Serve the mussels in individual bowls with lots of the juice from the bottom of the pot. Generously drizzle each bowl with the aioli. Garnish with toast. (You may want to have more toasted bread on hand to sop up the delicious liquid!)', u'*RAW EGG WARNING', u'Food Network Kitchens suggest caution in consuming raw and lightly-cooked eggs due to the slight risk of Salmonella or other food-borne illness.  To reduce this risk, we recommend you use only fresh, properly-refrigerated, clean, grade A or AA eggs with intact shells, and avoid contact between the yolks or whites and the shell.']
ingredients: [u'1 red pepper', u' *2 egg yolks', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1 to 2 tablespoons Vietnamese chili paste (recommended: Sambal Oelek)', u' Salt', u'1 1/2 cups canola oil', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 small onions, finely diced', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves', u'1 bay leaf', u'3 pounds mussels, debearded and rinsed', u'1 bottle dry white wine', u'4 slices baguette, cut on the bias']
title: Steamed Mussels with Spicy Red Pepper Aioli

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In the center of a 6-inch square piece of cheesecloth, place the lemongrass, ginger, chilies and lime leaves. Draw up the sides to form a pouch and tie with kitchen twine.', u'In a large pot, combine the stock, mushrooms, fish sauce, and sachet in a large pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the shrimp, coconut milk, and cilantro, and simmer until the shrimp are cooked, 3 to 4 minutes.', u'Remove from the heat and discard the sachet. Season, to taste, with salt or additional fish sauce. Serve with jasmine rice.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup chopped fresh lemongrass, tough outer leaves removed', u'2 tablespoons peeled and thinly sliced fresh ginger', u'5 small Thai chiles, stemmed and lightly crushed', u'4 Kaffir lime leaves, crushed', u'3 cups shrimp stock or fish stock', u'1 cup fresh shiitake mushrooms, sliced', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'3 tablespoons Thai nam pla, or Vietnamese nuoc nam (fish sauce), or more to taste', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 1/2 cups coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', u' Salt', u' Steamed jasmine rice, accompaniment, recipe follows', u' Steamed Jasmine Rice: Khao Suoy', u'2 cups jasmine rice, other long-grain white rice can be substituted', u'3 cups water']
title: Shrimp Coconut Soup with Ginger and Lemongrass

directions: [u'In a large pot, heat oil until hot and brown chicken pieces on all sides. Remove chicken temporarily.', u'In the same frying pan, add the onions and stir until soft and slightly brown. Add the tomato paste and salt, and stir well.', u'Add all the prepared vegetables and fish sauce to the pot. Return the chicken to the pot and add just enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, stir, and reduce heat to medium. Simmer for approximately 30 minutes. Check the vegetables to avoid overcooking, removing them in a bowl as they are done.', u'When all the vegetables are cooked and removed from the stew, add the peanut butter or "tigadege", 1 tablespoon at a time to make sure it is well dissolved in the broth. Add the Scotch bonnet pepper, if using and simmer until broth thickens, about 20 to 30 minutes.', u'Return all the vegetables to the pot and simmer 5 minutes more. Serve over white rice.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup peanut or vegetable oil', u'1 (3-pound) chicken, cut in eighths', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 large tomato, chopped', u'1/2 pound potato (1 large one)', u'1 small cabbage, cut in 1/2-inch pieces (or 6 Brussels sprouts)', u'1/2 pound carrots, peeled and cut into small chunks', u'1 small butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (or 6 patty pans, cut in half)', u'3 tablespoons Thai or Vietnamese fish sauce', u'1/2 cup peanut butter or "tigadege" (roasted peanut paste)', u'1 Scotch bonnet pepper, whole, optional', u' Steamed white rice, for serving']
title: Chicken and Vegetable Stew in Peanut Butter Tomato Sauce: Mafe

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine soy paste, soy sauce, sesame oil, peanut butter, and garlic chili sauce and set aside briefly.', u'For the rice, bring 2 1/2 cups water to a boil in a saucepot and add rice, salt and butter. Return to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover and let simmer 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes.', u'In a wok heat 2 or 3 cups water to boiling and blanch carrots, broccoli, and celery for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside briefly, then rinse and dry wok.', u'In the same wok, heat grapeseed oil over medium-high heat and saute onion until translucent. Add blanched carrots, broccoli, and celery, as well as snow peas, bell pepper and diced pineapple (reserving the pineapple slices). Stir in mixture of soy/sesame/peanut butter/chili sauce. Cook vegetables until tender stirring frequently.', u'Lay slices of pineapple on serving plates. Top with rice and then top with stir-fried vegetables. Sprinkle with parsley leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup soy paste', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons Vietnamese garlic chili sauce', u'2 1/2 cups water', u'1 cup brown rice', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 pound carrots, peeled and sliced julienne', u'4 heads broccoli, broken into florets', u'2 stalks celery, diced', u'1 tablespoon grapeseed oil', u'1 medium onion, medium diced', u'1/2 pound snow peas', u'1 large red bell pepper, stem and seeds removed and medium diced', u'1 fresh pineapple, peeled, core removed, bottom half sliced crosswise into 1/4-inch thick slices and the rest medium diced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley']
title: Vegetable Stir-Fry

directions: [u'Bring a large stockpot of water to a boil. In a wok or deep, heavy saucepan, heat about 3 inches of peanut oil. (The oil must be very hot, about 375 degrees F.)', u'Make the sauce: In a large skillet or saute pan, heat the 2 tablespoons of peanut oil. Over medium-high heat, saute the garlic just until golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the sugar and continue to saute until the garlic begins to caramelize, 1 or 2 minutes longer. Deglaze the pan with the rice wine, rice wine vinegar, and soy sauce. Add the carrots, haricots verts, and 2 ounces of the green onion, reserving 1 ounce as garnish. Stir in the chili sauce and continue to cook until the sauce is reduced by half.', u'Meanwhile, add salt to the boiling water and cook the noodles until they are al dente. Drain the noodles well and stir them into the sauce until they are well coated.', u'Season the shrimp or calamari with salt and pepper and toss with the flour to coat lightly. Deep-fry the shrimp or calamari in small batches until golden, 1 or 2 minutes. (The easiest way to do this is to use a fine-mesh basket or strainer. Place the shrimp or calamari in the basket and gently ease the basket into the oil.) Drain on clean paper towels.', u'To serve, divide the noodles and vegetables among 4 large warm plates. Arrange the shrimp or calamari over and around each portion and garnish with the remaining green onions. Drizzle a little sesame oil over the noodles and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Oil for deep-frying', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'3/4 cup (4 ounces) sliced Double-Blanched Garlic, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 cup rice wine', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce', u'4 ounces carrots, peeled, trimmed, and cut into julienne (about 1 cup)', u'4 ounces haricots verts, trimmed, blanched, and refreshed (about 1 cup)', u'4 ounces green onions, trimmed and cut into strips (about 1 cup)', u'2 teaspoons Vietnamese chile sauce', u'12 ounces fresh Chinese egg noodles or thin spaghetti', u'1 pound large shrimp, cleaned and tails removed, or, 1 pound calamari, cleaned and cut into 1/4-inch rings', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' About 1/2 cup flour', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame oil', u'3 heads garlic', u' Kosher salt']
title: Crispy Shrimp or Calamari with Chinese Noodles and Spicy Garlic Sauce

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Trim away fat from steak. Slice across the grain into 1/4-inch thick slices. Slice steak again across the grain for matchstick pieces of steak. Set aside.', u'Add 2 tablespoons of oil to a hot wok or large skillet over high heat. Add carrots and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Remove carrots and set aside.', u'Add enough oil to coat the bottom of the wok or skillet. Once hot, add beef strips and stir-fry for 8 to 10 minutes, or until beef is dark and crispy. Be careful as beef will splatter for the first 3 to 4 minutes while it loses its moisture.', u'Remove beef from skillet and drain out all oil, except for 1 tablespoon, if desired. Add scallions and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add carrots and beef back to skillet. Stir-fry for another 30 seconds. Add stir-fry sauce, sherry, and chili-garlic sauce. Stir-fry for another 30 to 60 seconds. Garnish with green scallions and serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound sirloin steak, rinsed and patted dry', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1 cup shredded carrots', u'2 scallions, white part, thinly sliced lengthwise; greens cut on the diagonal, for garnish', u'1/4 cup stir-fry sauce (recommended: Kikkoman)', u'1 tablespoon dry sherry', u'1 tablespoon Vietnamese chili-garlic sauce']
title: Szechwan Crispy Beef

directions: [u'Prepare a medium-hot fire in a charcoal grill with a cover, or preheat a gas grill to medium high.', u'For the Dressing: combine the mayonnaise, basil, cilantro, green onions, and lime juice in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate.', u'For the Patties: combine the fish sauce, jaggery, and chili sauce in a medium bowl. Add the pork, peanut butter, ginger, garlic, and star anise and blend loosely with a fork. Form into 6 equal patties the approximate dimensions of the rolls, making a slight depression in the middle of the patties to compensate for the tendency to bulge during cooking.', u'Brush the grill rack with oil. Grill the patties with the grill top closed for 4 minutes. Turn and grill until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the patties registers 160 degrees F, about 4 minutes longer.', u'During the last 2 minutes of grilling the patties, place the rolls, cut side down, on the grill to toast.', u'To assemble the burgers: spread the roll bottoms with a thin layer of dressing, followed by a lettuce leaf. Add the patties and top with generous dollops of the dressing. Add the roll tops.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh Thai basil leaves', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 green onions, finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup Vietnamese fish sauce (nuoc mam)', u'4 teaspoons jaggery (palm sugar) or brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon sriracha or other Asian hot chili sauce', u'2 pounds freshly ground pork', u'1/4 cup chunky peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon ground star anise', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing the grill rack', u'6 French rolls, split', u'6 interior butter lettuce leaves']
title: Grilled Pork Burgers Indochine

directions: [u'*Cooks Note: if using reserved cooked steak, there is no need to cook it again. Just slice it thinly and use.', u'Season flank steak with salt and pepper and 1/4 cup lime juice. Heat oil in a 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Add flank steak and cook to medium rare, turning once, about 6 to 7 minutes per side. Remove to a cutting board and let rest.', u'In a large, non-reactive salad bowl, whisk together remaining lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, chili paste and cilantro. Add cucumber, mango and lettuce leaves to dressing. Toss until combined. Divide among 5 serving dishes. ', u'Slice flank steak very thin and divide slices among the salads. Place over greens. ']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 pound flank steak or reserved cooked flank steak from broiled flank steak recipe *see cooks note', u' Coarse salt', u' Cracked pepper', u'1/2 cup lime juice divided', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon Vietnamese chili paste', u'1/2 cup loosely packed, roughly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded and thinly sliced', u'1 mango, peeled, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks', u'1 large head butter lettuce, washed and spun dry']
title: Hot and Sour Beef Salad

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Prepare the lollipops: With a knife or kitchen shears, cut the skin and tendons around the bottom (the narrow end) of each drummette. Use a paring knife to scrape the meat from to bottom toward the top of the bone to form a lollipop shape; make sure the bone is scraped completely clean.', u'Make the brine: To a saucepan, add 1 1/2 cups water and the vinegar, honey, salt, soy sauce, peppercorns, pepper flakes, garlic, star anise, bay leaf and ginger. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Pour the brine into a large bowl and add 1 1/2 cups ice to cool it down quickly. Add the chicken lollipops to the brine, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 1 hour. Remove the chicken and pat dry.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Prepare the dry rub: In a large bowl, combine the five-spice powder, garlic, ginger, mustard, paprika, salt and cayenne. Mix well to blend. Set aside 1 tablespoon of the rub for later use in sauce, then add the chicken and coat thoroughly with the rub.', u'Arrange the chicken on a baking sheet, transfer to the oven and cook for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the skin begins to turn golden. (This helps render some of the fat, so the drummettes fry up nice and crispy.) Remove from oven and set aside.', u'While the drummettes are cooking, prepare the sauce: To a medium saute pan, add the sweet soy sauce, vinegar, fish sauce, honey, pepper flakes and 2 tablespoons water. Bring to a simmer over medium heat; cook until the sauce has reduced by a third or so, about 10 minutes. Stir in the reserved tablespoon of the dry rub and keep warm while you fry the wings.', u'Fill a large, heavy pot with 2 to 3 inches of oil, and heat to 350 degrees F over medium-high heat. Working in batches, fry the chicken wings in the oil until brown and crispy, 6 to 7 minutes. With a spider or slotted spoon, remove the fried chicken to a large mixing bowl. Add the sauce to the chicken and toss to coat.', u'Transfer the chicken lollipops to a serving platter and garnish with the red pepper, scallions, cilantro and sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'24 chicken wing drummettes', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon black peppercorns', u' Pinch red pepper flakes', u'3 cloves garlic, skin-on, smashed', u'2 star anise', u'1 bay leaf', u' One 1-inch piece ginger, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'1 tablespoon Chinese five-spice powder', u'1 tablespoon granulated garlic', u'1 tablespoon ground ginger', u'1 tablespoon dry mustard', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/2 cup sweet soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u' Peanut oil, for deep-frying', u'2 tablespoons finely diced red pepper', u'2 tablespoons finely sliced scallions, cut on the bias', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted']
title: Spicy Asian Chicken Lollipops

directions: [u'Spread the hot leftover rice in a thin layer on a sheet pan and place in a 200 degree F oven overnight or until dry and crispy. Let the rice continue to dry at room temperature for another day for best results. ', u'Break the rice into large chunks and deep fry at 375 degrees F until they puff up and float, approximately 1 minute. Drain on paper towels and set aside.', u'Grate the persimmons on the large hole of a cheese grater, add the remaining ingredients, and adjust seasoning. ', u'Let sit for 5 minutes before serving to let flavors blend. Serve the rice crackers with the dip. Best if eaten within 4 hours.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups boiled white rice (still hot)', u'3 firm fuyu persimmons', u'2 tablespoons dried shrimp, soaked in warm water and chopped', u'1/2 lime, minced (flesh, peel and all)', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 small jalapeno pepper, minced with seeds', u'1/2 bundle Vietnamese mint or cilantro leaves']
title: Thai-Style Rice Crackers with Persimmon Sambal

directions: [u'In a large 12-inch saute pan, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Salt and pepper both sides of the fish. Sprinkle the mustard seeds evenly on the skin side of the fish. Dust skin of each filet with a scant amount of flour. Saute the fish, skin side down, until golden brown. Flip the fish over adding more oil as necessary. Remove from the heat. Paint the skin with a smear of Dijon mustard. Sprinkle each fillet with one tablespoon of fresh bread crumbs and one tablespoon of whole butter. Set fish on a small sheet pan. Preheat broiler. Place the fish under the broiler until the crumbs are nice and brown and the fish is cooked just through. Spritz with lemon. ', u'Place the fillet of fish on a plate. Serve with a piece of bacon and a spoon of the braising liquid. A spoon of the chutney goes well on the bacon. Spoon a couple tablespoons of the fish sauce and some All English, All American frites (french fries, gaufrettes, etc.).']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup clarified butter, grapeseed oil, or olive oil', u' Salt and pepper', u'4 (7-ounce) fillets of haddock, skin on', u'1 tablespoon mustard seed', u' Flour for dusting', u'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup fresh bread crumbs', u'4 tablespoons softened butter', u'1 whole lemon', u' Tender bacon, recipe follows', u' Chutney, recipe follows', u' Fish sauce, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 1/2 to 2 inches of fresh bacon or pork belly', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 quart water', u'3/4 cup Vietnamese fish sauce, Nan Pla', u'2 haddock carcasses', u'1 small halibut bone', u'1 leek, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 stalk celery, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'3 sprigs of parsley', u'6 peppercorns', u'3 tablespoons grapeseed oil or olive oil', u'1 cup white wine', u' Approximately 3 cups of water', u'1/3 cup heavy cream', u'8 tablespoons whole butter', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u' Spritz of lemon']
title: Haddock Caught Off Gloucester with Tender Bacon and Coleman's Mustard Chutney

directions: [u'Make marinade: Thinly slice lower 6 inches of lemongrass stalks, discarding remainder of stalks. In food processor or blender finely grind together sliced lemongrass and garlic. Add remaining marinade ingredients and blend well.', u'In a large resealable plastic bag combine marinade and steak and seal bag, pressing out excess air. Marinate steak, chilled, turning bag once or twice, at least 4 hours or overnight.', u'In a large bowl soak noodles in hot water to cover 15 minutes, or until softened and pliable.', u'Prepare grill (or preheat broiler). Bring a kettle of salted water to a boil for noodles.', u'Discard marinade and grill steak on an oiled rack set 5 to 6 inches over glowing coals 3 to 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare. (Alternatively, steak may be broiled on rack of a broiler pan about 3 inches from heat, same amount of time.) Transfer steak to a cutting board and let stand 5 minutes.', u'   While steak is cooking, drain noodles in a colander and cook in boiling water 30 seconds to 1  minute, or until just tender. In a colander drain noodles and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Drain noodles well.', u'In a large bowl toss noodles with herbs and half of nuoc cham. Divide cucumber among 4 bowls or plates and top with noodles. Sprinkle each serving with 1 to 1 1/2 teaspoons rice powder. Thinly slice steak on the diagonal and divide among noodles, mounding it. Sprinkle chilies over each serving and garnish with herb sprigs. Serve remaining nuoc cham on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 stalks fresh lemongrass, outer leaves discarded and root ends trimmed', u'6 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 tablespoons Asian fish sauce (preferably nuoc mam)', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'4 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 teaspoon Asian sesame oil', u'1 pound to 1 1/4 pound skirt steak or flank steak', u'1/2 pound dried rice-stick noodles (rice vermicelli)', u'1/2 cup fresh basil leaves (preferably Thai Basil), washed well and spun dry', u'1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, washed well and spun dry', u'1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves, washed well and spun dry', u' About 1 cup nuoc cham (Vietnamese lime sauce), recipe follows', u'1 pound seedless (European) cucumber, halved lengthwise and cut diagonally into 1/4 inch thick slices', u' About 2 tablespoons toasted rice powder, recipe follows', u'2 to 4 small thin red or green Asian chilies (1 to 2 inches long) or Serrano chilies, seeded and sliced very thin (wear rubber gloves)', u' Thai basil, mint, or coriander sprigs']
title: Grilled Lemongrass Beef and Noodle Salad

directions: [u'Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook until it is tender but still firm to the bite, about 3 to 4 minutes. Drain the pasta and rinse it under cold water to cool it completely. Drain the pasta again, pat it dry and add it to the mixing bowl. ', u'Finely shred the cabbage and grate or finely chop the carrots. Roll the basil leaves up into tight cylinders and cut across them to create fine shreds and add them to the mixing bowl. Toss the salad with the dressing and adjust the seasoning if necessary.']
ingredients: [u' Salt', u'8 ounces angel hair pasta or capellini', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup rice or white wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon dried red pepper flakes', u'2 tablespoons Nuoc nam (bottled Vietnamese fish sauce), optional', u'3/4 to 1 pound boneless smoked chicken or turkey breast', u'1/2 small head Napa or Chinese cabbage, cored', u'2 carrots, peeled', u'1/2 cup (packed) washed basil leaves']
title: Asian Chicken Slaw with Pasta

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Special equipment: a wok and a hot pot bowl with burner', u'For the hot pot broth: Rinse the chickens really well before making the broth. Make sure you rinse out the cavities as well as the outsides to remove as much blood as possible.', u'In a large pot, combine the chickens and 16 cups ice water. Bring to a boil and then immediately reduce the heat to a low simmer. Simmer the broth for 3 hours.', u"Trim the lemongrass stalk, then bruise it by hitting it with the back of a chef's knife, down the length of the stalk. Add to the broth along with the onions, tamarind paste, chile paste, palm sugar, garlic and ginger and simmer for an additional hour.", u'Season the broth with salt and pepper. Add the lime juice and additional chile paste if you want a spicier broth. Strain out the solids and reserve the chicken meat for another use.', u'For the braised oxtail: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Sprinkle the oxtail with the salt and pepper and dredge in the flour.', u'Heat a wok over high heat and add the oil. Working in batches, sear the oxtail pieces until browned. Transfer to an oven-safe casserole dish and fill the casserole dish with enough of the beef broth to cover the oxtail pieces three-quarters of the way. Cover with aluminum foil and place in the oven. Cook until the oxtail is tender, 3 to 4 hours. Allow the oxtail to cool in the braising liquid. Keep the oven temperature at 350 degrees F.', u'For the Vietnamese meatballs: In a large bowl, mix together the beef, pork, onions, scallions, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, soy sauce, salt and pepper. Form 2- to 3-ounce meatballs from the mixture and arrange them on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake the meatballs until fully cooked through, 30 to 45 minutes.', u'For the noodles: Bring 16 cups water to a boil and add the egg noodles. Cook until tender, then drain and rinse in cold water.', u'For plating, arrange the tofu, cabbage, carrots, daikon, watercress, Thai basil and egg noodles around the rim of a large hot pot bowl. Quarter 5 Vietnamese meatballs and add to the rim; add 4 to 6 pieces of oxtail to the rim. Fill the center of the bowl with the hot pot broth and serve family-style over a portable burner.']
ingredients: [u' Three 3-pound whole chickens', u'1 stalk lemongrass', u'1 pound onions, roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup tamarind paste', u'2 tablespoons chile paste, plus more if needed', u'2 tablespoons palm sugar or brown sugar', u'5 cloves garlic', u' One 1- to 2-inch piece fresh ginger', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Juice of 2 limes', u'8 large pieces oxtail (about 3 pounds total)', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup grapeseed oil', u'8 cups beef broth', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 pound ground pork', u'1/2 cup minced onions', u'2 tablespoons chopped scallions', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon chopped lemongrass', u'1 tablespoon light soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound thin fresh egg noodles', u'8 ounces firm tofu, sliced', u'2 cups shredded napa cabbage', u'2 cups julienned carrots (matchsticks)', u'2 cups shredded daikon', u'1 bunch watercress, trimmed', u'1/2 bunch Thai basil']
title: Oxtail Hot Pot

directions: [u'To prepare the salad, place the onion, papaya, and carrots in a bowl and mix well. In another bowl, combine the chile sauce, garlic, sugar, fish sauce, vinegar, and lime juice. Adjust the seasoning. Pour the chile sauce mixture over the papaya mixture and toss well. Add the cilantro and mint and toss well. Garnish with the peanuts.', u'Squeeze any excess moisture out of the shrimp. In a small pan, heat the 1 tablespoon peanut oil and 2 teaspoons of the sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and saute for 3 to 4 minutes, until pink and starting to curl. Drain the shrimp in a colander and set aside. Bring a saucepan filled with water to a boil. Place the rice noodles in a bowl and pour the boiling water over them. Allow to soak for 5 minutes, until softened. Drain and set aside.', u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.', u'Mix together the shrimp, rice noodles, carrot, mayonnaise, remaining 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil, vinegar, sesame seeds, chile sauce, and salt. Add the cilantro and mix well.', u'To prepare the lumpia, lay a wrapper on a clean work surface with the point facing you. Spread 2 tablespoons of the shrimp mixture evenly on the bottom one-third of each lumpia wrapper. Brush all 4 edges with the egg wash. Fold the bottom up over the filling and fold in the sides toward the middle. Starting at the bottom, roll up to form a tiny bundle. Repeat with the remaining filling and wrappers. Brush with peanut oil.', u'Place the lumpia on a baking sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes, until golden brown.', u'To serve, place 1/2 cup of the salad on each plate. Cut the lumpia in half diagonally. Stand 4 pieces of lumpia, point up, on each plate around the salad.']
ingredients: [u'1 red onion, sliced', u'2 green papayas, seeded, peeled and shredded', u'2 carrots, peeled and shredded', u'2 teaspoons Vietnamese garlic-chile sauce', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1/4 cup chopped peanuts, for garnish', u'2 pounds peeled rock shrimp', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil, plus extra for brushing', u'2 1/2 teaspoons Asian sesame oil', u'1 (4-ounce) package Japanese rice noodles', u'1/2 cup peeled and shredded carrot', u'3/4 cup good-quality mayonnaise', u'1 teaspoon rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds', u'2 teaspoons Vietnamese garlic-chile sauce', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'12 (7-inch-square) lumpia wrappers', u'1 egg beaten with 1 tablespoon water, for egg wash']
title: Rock Shrimp Lumpia with Green Papaya Salad

directions: [u'Cut 1/4 pound of the tuna against the grain into 12 thin slices. Finely chop the other 1/2 pound for the tartare. ', u'To prepare the tartare base, combine all the ingredients and mix well. Add the chopped fish and stir lightly to combine.', u'To prepare the crispy wontons, in a saucepan, pour in the oil to a depth of 1-inch and heat to 375 degrees. Add the wonton skins and fry, turning once, for 8 to10 seconds on each side, until light golden brown. Keep the wontons flat by using tongs to uncurl them. Using a wire skimmer, transfer to paper towels to drain. Allow to cool.', u'In a bowl, combine all the ingredients for the dressing and mix well.', u'To assemble, first roll the tuna slices up into rose-shaped bundles. Reserving 2 tablespoons of the radish sprouts, stack in the following order: wonton skin, 1/6 of the tartare mixture, shiso leaf, wonton skin, 1/6 of the smoked salmon, radish sprouts, wonton skin, 2 tuna rolls.', u'Sprinkle the top of the each napoleon with the reserved radish sprouts. Drizzle 3 tablespoons of the dressing around each plate. Garnish with pickled ginger and tobiko.', u'To serve, cut through the entire stack with a knife, and smash the layers together with a fork to blend the flavors.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound sashimi grade tuna', u'2 tablespoons good quality mayonnaise', u'1 teaspoon Vietnamese garlic-chili sauce', u'2 tablespoon chopped green onion, white and green parts', u'2 teaspoons tobiko (flying fish roe)', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Peanut oil, for frying', u'18 (3-inch-square) wonton skins', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons wasabi paste', u'2 teaspoons ground toasted sesame seeds', u'1 bunch radish sprouts', u'8 shiso leaves', u'1/4 pound smoked salmon, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup sliced pickled ginger, for garnish', u'1 tablespoon tobiko (flying fish roe), for garnish']
title: Sashimi Napoleon

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, combine the sambal oelek, lime juice, olive oil, sugar, garlic, ginger, mirin, fish sauce and sesame oil. Whisk well to combine. Allow the marinade to sit at room temperature for at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours.', u'Place the shrimp in a 1-gallon resealable plastic bag, and add all but 1 /2 cup of the marinade to the bag. Allow the shrimp to marinate at room temperature for 1 hour.', u'Preheat a grill to medium-high and oil the grill.', u'Place the shrimp on the grill and cook until they are just cooked through, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes per side. Transfer the cooked shrimp to a large bowl. Add the reserved 1/2 cup marinade, the cilantro and the mint and toss well to combine. Transfer the shrimp to a large serving bowl or platter, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sambal oelek (ground fresh chili paste)', u'1/2 cup freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup minced garlic', u'1/4 cup minced fresh ginger', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (nuoc nam)', u'2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'3 pounds large shrimp (about 30 shrimp), peeled and deveined, head and tail segments intact', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, roughly chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh mint, roughly chopped']
title: Sambal Shrimp

directions: [u'In a medium bowl, combine the sambal oelek, lime juice, olive oil, sugar, garlic, ginger, mirin, fish sauce and sesame oil. Whisk well to combine. Allow the marinade to sit at room temperature for at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours.', u'Place the shrimp in a 1-gallon resealable plastic bag, and add all but 1 /2 cup of the marinade to the bag. Allow the shrimp to marinate at room temperature for 1 hour.', u'Preheat a grill to medium-high and oil the grill.', u'Place the shrimp on the grill and cook until they are just cooked through, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes per side. Transfer the cooked shrimp to a large bowl. Add the reserved 1/2 cup marinade, the cilantro and the mint and toss well to combine. Transfer the shrimp to a large serving bowl or platter, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups sambal oelek (ground fresh chili paste)', u'1/2 cup freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup minced garlic', u'1/4 cup minced fresh ginger', u'1/4 cup mirin', u'2 tablespoons Vietnamese fish sauce (nuoc nam)', u'2 tablespoons dark sesame oil', u'3 pounds large shrimp (about 30 shrimp), peeled and deveined, head and tail segments intact', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, roughly chopped', u'2 tablespoons fresh mint, roughly chopped']
title: Sambal Shrimp

directions: [u'Put coconut into a plastic bag and drop the bag onto a hard surface to split the coconut and catch the liquid. Remove the outer shell and discard. Finely grate 1 cup of fresh coconut. Thinly shave the remaining coconut into moon shaped pieces. Toast shavings lightly and set aside for garnish.', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Drop live lobsters into a pot of boiling water and cook for only 5 minutes. Remove the lobsters from the water and plunge them into a large bowl or pot filled with iced water to stop the cooking. The lobsters should be cooked early in the day so the lobsters have time to reabsorb their wonderful juices.', u'In a 2 quart saucepan, add the oil and butter. Remove the claws and tails from all the lobsters. Set aside. Remove the outer shell from 3 of the lobsters. Saute the 6 lobster bodies over medium high heat until a little bit colored. Leaving some of the shells on will give your sauce a pink cast.', u'Add the shallots, chile, and lemongrass. Cook gently until tender. Deglaze the pan with white wine. Add grated coconut and ginger. Add enough cold water to barely cover the lobster bodies. Add curry paste or curry powder. Let sauce simmer slowly for 20 to 30 minutes until reduced, showing a little "body".', u'Add heavy cream and let sauce reduce slightly. Add lime juice and lime zest. Add salt and pepper, to taste. Finish with 2 tablespoons of butter for silkiness.', u'Strain sauce. Take approximately 1/2 of the solids and puree in blender with some liquid. Add pureed solids back to sauce. Set aside.', u'Remove claw meat from their shells. Split the tail, removing all the shell carefully from the tail, except the last segmet of shell connected to the actual tail flippers.', u'Skewer the 2 segments of the tail with 1 claw and 1 piece of scallion in between. You will have 6 skewers.', u"Beat the egg whites with the 2 tablespoons of cold water to thin out. Dip each skewer lightly into the egg white mixture. Very delicately, sprinkle water chestnut flour all over the lobster. Don't pack on too much.", u'Bring a large pot of peanut oil to 350 degrees. Fry 2 skewers at a time. They will only take approximately 2 to 3 minutes to crisp. Remove skewers from the oil and drain. Place in barely warm oven while the other skewers cook.', u'To serve, place finished skewers on plate with your delicate salad leaning against the lobster. Spoon the curried coconut sauce around the plate and garnish with toasted coconut "moons".', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 small coconut', u'6 (1-pound) lobster culls', u'2 tablespoons oil, plus 2 tablespoons butter', u'2 diced shallots', u'1 small fresh chile, seeds removed and diced', u'2 stalks lemongrass, sliced thinly', u'1 cup white wine', u'1 heaping tablespoon freshly grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon Thai yellow or red curry paste, or 1 tablespoon Madras curry powder', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'2 to 3 limes, juiced, plus the zest of 1 lime', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 scallions, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'3 egg whites', u'2 tablespoons cold water', u'1/2 cup water chestnut flour', u' Peanut or corn oil, for frying', u'6 (10-inch) wooden skewers, soaked for 30 minutes', u' Green Papaya and Mint Salad, recipe follows', u'2 green papayas, thinly sliced', u'1 bunch wild mint, chopped', u'3 bunches Upland cress or 2 bunches watercress', u'1 daikon, julienned', u'1 carrot, julienned', u'1 small cucumber, sliced thinly', u'12 scallions, cut into thin rounds', u' Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons Nam Pla (Vietnamese fish sauce)', u'1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons oil of your choice']
title: Crispy Lobster Skewers with Green Papaya and Mint Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Put the ham hocks in a large saucepan and add 12 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer uncovered, for 2 hours. Remove the pan from heat and drain the ham hocks in a colander.  ', u'When the ham hocks are cool enough to handle, remove the skin, and discard along with the bones. Coarsely chop the meat, which should yield about 1 1/4 cups. Put the chopped ham in a large mixing bowl. Add the goat cheese and blend with a fork, then add the green onions, olive oil, parsley, garlic, salt, and black pepper. Stir to mix well. ', u'Lay 12 won ton wrappers on a flat work surface and place a cup of water nearby. Place a generous teaspoon of the meat mixture in the middle of each wrapper. With a fingertip, rub a bit of water along the 4 edges of the wrapper and fold in half, pressing down on the outer edges to seal. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and meat mixture. (The filled won tons can be covered tightly with plastic wrap and kept refrigerated for 2 hours before frying.)', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large, heavy pot or electric fryer, to 350 degrees F. Add the won tons, about 10 to 12 at a time, and fry, stirring occasionally, until they float to the top and are golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove the fried won tons with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel line baking sheet.  Serve immediately, alone or with dipping sauce of choice.']
ingredients: [u'2 large smoked ham hocks (about 2 pounds)', u'6 ounces goat cheese, crumbled', u'1/4 cup minced green onions (green and white parts)', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'36 won ton or egg roll wrappers', u'6 cups vegetable oil, for deep-frying', u' Dipping sauces, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup grated carrots', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon Vietnamese or Thai fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon crunchy peanut butter', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/3 cup dry Chinese hot mustard', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u' Pinch salt']
title: Ham Hock and Goat Cheese Won Tons

directions: [u'In a rectangular dish, large enough to hold the 2 duck halves, mix the marinade ingredients together. Liberally rub the duck on all sides and inside the cavity with the mixture. Cover and place in the refrigerator for 4 hours to marinate.', u"Prepare a fryer filled with coconut or peanut oil, preheat to 225 degree F. Wipe off all the mixture and 'braise' the duck in the oil. Duck should be completely submerged. Remove the duck after 1 hour, it should be fully cooked. Heat the fryer to 400 degree F oven degrees and fry the duck again to color and crisp up.", u'On a large oval platter, place a large mound of the Root Vegetable Mash in the center. Place duck on top and garnish with Warm Exotic Fruit Salsa and Sambal Oil.', u'Beverage: Chilled Chinon']
ingredients: [u'1 (5 to 6) pound duck, halved lengthwise, washed and dried', u'1 cup kosher salt', u'1 cup ground palm sugar', u'10 shallots, halved and sliced', u'5 cloves of garlic, minced', u'5 kaffir lime leaves, 1/16 inch ribbon', u'3 stalks lemongrass, white part only, minced', u'2 tablespoons, ginger, minced', u'6 Thai bird chiles, minced', u'2 tablespoons coarse ground black Indonesian peppercorns', u'2 tablespoons coarse ground coriander seeds', u'2 tablespoons coarse ground fennel seeds', u'2 tablespoons Thai or Vietnamese fish sauce', u'1 bunch cilantro', u'2 quarts coconut oil or peanut oil, or a mixture of both', u' Root Vegetable Mash, recipe follows', u' Warm Exotic Fruit Salsa, recipe follows', u' Sambal Oil, recipe follows', u'1 1/2 pounds total taro, potatoes, cassava, yams, and other root vegetables, peeled and cut into 2-inch cubes (the cassava should be cut into 3-inch cubes because it cooks more quickly)', u'12 cloves garlic, peeled', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'1 cup sliced scallions', u'1 cup cream', u' Salt and black pepper', u'1 medium onion, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 Thai bird chile, minced', u'1 tablespoon minced lemongrass, white part only', u'1 pineapple, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'1 mango, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'1 papaya, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/2-inch dice', u' Grapeseed oil, to cook', u' Salt and black pepper', u'3 tablespoons sambal oelek', u'1/8 cup coconut or peanut oil', u'1 teaspoon naturally brewed soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sliced scallions']
title: Balinese Duck 'Confit' with Root Vegetable Mash and Warm Exotic Fruit Salsa

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a pot over medium to medium high heat. Add extra-virgin olive oil, 3 turns of the pan, and the turkey meat. Season the meat with: chili powder, grill seasoning, cumin, Worcestershire and hot sauce. Break up the meat with the back of a wooden spoon into small crumbles.', u'Chop the onion, reserving 1/4 of it for topping the chili. Brown meat 5 minutes, then add onions and chopped bell peppers and cook 10 minutes more. Add beer and deglaze the pan, scraping up the drippings and cooking off the alcohol. Add tomato sauce and barbecue sauce and bring to a bubble. It using corn kernels add them now. Let chili simmer 10 minutes. Adjust seasonings and heat level to your taste. Remove from heat and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the pan', u'2 1/2 pounds ground turkey (85 percent lean) or ground turkey breast (99 percent lean), 2 packages', u'4 tablespoons dark chili powder, 2 palm fulls', u'2 tablespoons grill seasoning blend, any brand, 1 palm full', u'1 tablespoon cumin, 1/2 palm full', u'2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', u'1 to 3 tablespoons hot sauce, medium to extra-spicy', u'1 large onion, quartered', u'2 large peppers, any color combination, red, green, purple, yellow or orange, chopped', u'1/2 bottle beer (the alcohol cooks out), about 1 cup', u'1 (14-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'1/2 cup smoky barbecue sauce', u'2 cups corn kernels, optional', u' Pretzel Rods', u' Yellow, Red or Blue Corn Tortilla Chips, any flavor', u' Black Bean Tortilla Chips', u' Polenta Chips, Plain or Guacamole flavor', u' Pita Chips, Plain or Spicy flavors', u' Yukon Gold, Red Bliss or Blue Potato Chips, any flavor', u' Shredded Cheeses: smoked white sharp cheddar, such as Cabot brand, pepper jack, chipotle Cheddar, 5 peppercorn Cheddar, Monterey jack', u' Sliced canned jalapenos, drained', u' Salsas', u' Sour cream', u' Chopped raw onion', u' Chopped green olives and pimentos', u' Chopped cilantro leaves', u' Diced tomatoes']
title: Indian Summer Turkey Chili

directions: [u'Put flour, baking powder, and salt  in a large bowl.  Mix well, add  warm water and stir until dough  begins to ball up.  On a lightly  floured surface knead dough.  Do  not over-work the dough.  After  working dough, place in a bowl and  refrigerate for 1/2 to 1 hour.', u'Heat oil to 350 degrees in a frying  pan or kettle.  Lightly flour  surface and pat and roll out  baseball size pieces of dough.  Cut  hole in middle with a knife (so the  dough will fry flat) to 1/4-inch  thickness and place in oil and cook  until golden brown and flip over  and cook opposite side until same  golden brown.  Dough is done in  about 3 minutes depending on oil  temperature and thickness of dough.', u'After fry bread is done top with  favorite topping or, chile and  cheese first, then cover with  lettuce and tomatoes, onions, green  chile and you have an Indian Taco.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 cups warm water', u' Oil, for frying']
title: Indian Fry Bread

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"In a large bowl, whisk together the turmeric, cayenne, 1 teaspoon salt and 3 tablespoons oil. Gently, drop in the cubes of paneer and gently toss, taking care not to break the cubes if you're using the homemade kind. Let the cubes marinate while you get the rest of your ingredients together and prepped.", u'Thaw the spinach in the microwave in a microwave-safe dish, 5 minutes on high, then puree in a food processor until smooth. Alternatively, you can chop it up very finely with your knife.', u'Place a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, and add the paneer as the pan warms. In a couple of minutes give the pan a toss; each piece of paneer should be browned on one side. Fry another minute or so, and then remove the paneer from the pan onto a plate.', u"Add the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil to the pan. Add the onions, ginger, garlic and chile. Now here's the important part: saute the mixture until it's evenly toffee-coloured, which should take about 15 minutes. Don't skip this step - this is the foundation of the dish! If you feel like the mixture is drying out and burning, add a couple of tablespoons of water.", u"Add the garam masala, coriander and cumin. If you haven't already, sprinkle a little water to keep the spices from burning. Cook, stirring often, until the raw scent of the spices cook out, and it all smells a bit more melodious, 3 to 5 minutes.", u'Add the spinach and stir well, incorporating the spiced onion mixture into the spinach. Add a little salt and 1/2 cup of water, stir, and cook about 5 minutes with the lid off.', u'Turn the heat off. Add the yogurt, a little at a time to keep it from curdling. Once the yogurt is well mixed into the spinach, add the paneer. Turn the heat back on, cover and cook until everything is warmed through, about 5 minutes. Serve.', u"*Cook's Note: Paneer is very easy to make at home, and my recipe is quick, easy, and delicious. I also think homemade has a better texture than anything store-bought. If you'd like to buy it, this cheese is available in better supermarkets as well as specialty Asian markets."]
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne', u' Kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons plus 1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u"12 ounces paneer, (Indian cheese, either store-bought or made from my recipe, recipe follows), cut into 1-inch cubes, see Cook's Note*", u'1 (16-ounce package) frozen chopped spinach', u'1 medium white onion, finely chopped', u'1 (1-inch thumb) ginger, peeled and minced (about 1 tablespoon)', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u"1 large green serrano chile, finely chopped (seeds removed if you don't like it spicy!)", u'1/2 teaspoon store-bought or homemade garam masala, recipe follows', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 cup plain yogurt, stirred until smooth', u' Cheesecloth', u'8 cups whole milk', u"1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice, plus more as needed, see Cook's Note*", u"3 large cinnamon sticks (if you have the kind you get at Indian stores, it's about 3 tablespoons of cinnamon bark bits)", u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 2 tablespoons of seeds)', u'4 large black cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 1 tablespoon of seeds), optional']
title: Saag Paneer: Spinach with Indian Cheese

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Line a large colander with a large double layer of cheesecloth, and set it in your sink.', u'In a large wide pot, bring the milk to a gentle boil over medium heat, stirring frequently to avoid burning the bottom (a nonstick pot works really well for this purpose). This will take a little while so be patient!', u"Add the lemon juice and turn the heat down to low. Stirring gently, you should almost immediately see the curds (white milk solids) and whey (the greenish liquid) separate. Don't fret, this is perfect!", u"*Cook's Note: If the milk doesn't separate juice some more lemons and add another tablespoon or two. Boost the heat again and the milk should separate. Stir in a motion that gathers the curds together rather than breaks them up.", u'Remove the pot from the heat and carefully pour the contents into the cheesecloth-lined colander. Gently rinse with cool water to get rid of the lemon flavor. At this point, you could squeeze out some of the liquid, and serve with some honey and some nuts, almost like a fresh ricotta!', u'Grab the ends of the cheesecloth and twist the ball of cheese to squeeze out the excess whey. Tie the cheesecloth to your kitchen faucet and allow the cheese to drain for about 5 minutes.', u'Twisting the ball to compact the cheese into a block, place it on a plate with the twisted part of the cheesecloth on the side (this will ensure your block of cheese is nice and smooth!) and set another plate on top. Weigh the second plate down with cans of beans or a heavy pot. Move to the refrigerator and let it sit about 20 minutes.', u'Unwrap your beautiful disc of homemade cheese! You did it! You can now use this in any number of traditional Indian dishes, like saag paneer.']
ingredients: [u' Cheesecloth', u'8 cups whole milk', u"1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice, plus more as needed, see Cook's Note*"]
title: Paneer: Homemade Indian Cheese

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'In a large nonstick saute pan over medium heat, combine the cooked rice and milk. Heat until the mixture begins to boil. Decrease the heat to low and cook at a simmer until the mixture begins to thicken, stirring frequently, approximately 5 minutes.', u'Increase the heat to medium, add the heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom and continue to cook until the mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5 to 10 minutes. Use a whisk to help prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once the mixture just begins to thicken, remove from the heat and stir in the raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup cooked long grain or basmati rice', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'3/4 cup coconut milk', u'2 ounces sugar, approximately 1/4 cup', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1 1/2 ounces golden raisins, approximately 1/3 cup', u'1 1/2 ounces chopped unsalted pistachios, approximately 1/3 cup']
title: Indian Rice Pudding

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the flours and salt in a bowl. Make a well in the center, add 1/2 cup warm water and 1 tablespoon olive oil and mix to make a sticky dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until soft and pliable, about 5 minutes. Brush a bowl with olive oil and place the dough in it. Cover and let rest about 30 minutes.', u'Divide the dough into 6 even balls. On a floured surface, roll each ball into an 8-to-9-inch round, then layer between parchment paper.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. One at a time, lightly brush each dough round with oil and place in the pan. Cook until bubbly on top and charred on the bottom, 1 to 2 minutes, then flip and cook 1 more minute. Remove from the skillet, brush with more oil and season with salt. To reheat, wrap the flatbreads in a damp paper towel and microwave 45 seconds. ', u'Photograph by Marcus Nilsson']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup whole-wheat flour', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing']
title: Indian Flatbreads

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'In a large skillet, warm the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until golden. Add the garlic and ginger, and saute for another minute. Stir in the coriander, paprika, garam masala, cumin and cayenne, if using and cook for 1 minute.', u'Add the beef, breaking up lumps with a spoon, and saute until the meat is no longer pink. Add the tomatoes, 1 cup of water and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle in the fresh English peas. Stir well and simmer, partially covered, about 10 minutes or if using frozen peas, add them now, and cook another 5 minutes, partially covered.', u'Stir in the vinegar and chopped cilantro. Garnish with torn cilantro leaves and serve with warm chapatis or pita bread.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 medium onion, finely diced', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 (1-inch thumb) fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon store-bought or homemade garam masala, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne, optional', u'1 pound ground beef', u'2 medium tomatoes, chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup shucked fresh English peas or 1/2 cup frozen peas, thawed', u'2 teaspoons malt vinegar or apple cider vinegar', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus a few extra leaves for garnish', u'4 chapatis or pitas, warmed', u"3 large cinnamon sticks (if you have the kind you get at Indian stores, it's about 3 tablespoons of cinnamon bark bits)", u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 2 tablespoons of seeds)', u'4 large black cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 1 tablespoon of seeds), optional']
title: Kheema: Indian Ground Beef with Peas

directions: [u'Brown the beef in saute pan over medium-high heat. Add taco seasoning, to taste. Add refried beans. Mix well and set aside.', u'For the Frybread: Mix flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, and powdered milk. Add lard or margarine and mix. Add water to make dough soft. Refrigerate until use. Dough will keep several days.', u'In a heavy skillet, heat 3/4-inch of oil to 375 degrees F.', u'Pat or roll out dough into about 6 (1/4 to 3/8-inch thick) rounds. Slide into hot oil. Puncture once or twice. Fry until golden brown. Flip the dough over and fry other side to golden brown. Take out and drain on paper towels.', u'Spoon some meat onto hot bread and top with your choice of the following: cheese, tomatoes, onions, green chiles, olives, salsa, and sour cream.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground chuck or sirloin', u' Taco seasoning', u'1 cup refried beans', u'3 cups flour', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon powdered milk', u'1 tablespoon lard or margarine', u'1 1/2 cups warm water', u' Vegetable oil', u' Grated cheese, as an accompaniment', u' Chopped tomatoes, as an accompaniment', u' Chopped onions, as an accompaniment', u' Chopped green chiles, as an accompaniment', u' Chopped olives, as an accompaniment', u' Salsa, as an accompaniment', u' Sour cream, as an accompaniment']
title: Indian Taco

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Cut the chicken breasts roughly into 2 by 2-inch pieces. Mix together the yogurt, garlic, ginger, cardamom, curry powder, chili flakes, coriander, paprika, honey, salt, and pepper until thoroughly combined. Add chicken pieces to yogurt mixture, cover, and refrigerate at least 1 hour or as long as overnight. Bring to room temperature before cooking.', u'In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent. Stir in tomato paste until evenly distributed and then add the half-and-half. Slide in the chicken and marinade, stir well, and bring mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat so that the liquid remains at a low simmer. Cook about 15 minutes until chicken is no longer pink in the middle but still tender and moist. Serve immediately over basmati rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts', u'1 cup whole milk plain yogurt', u'3 large cloves garlic, pressed', u'1 -inch piece ginger, grated', u"8 cardamom pods, cracked with the back of a chef's knife", u'1 tablespoon curry powder', u'1/2 teaspoon dried red chili flakes', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon sweet paprika', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'20 grinds black pepper', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, cut into medium dice', u'3 tablespoons tomato paste', u'2 cups half-and-half', u' Basmati rice, for serving']
title: Indian-spiced Chicken

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Begin by setting a large, heavy-based pot over medium heat. Grind the cloves, fennel, cumin, coriander, and turmeric in a spice grinder. Add oil to the hot pot and pour in the spices. Throw in cinnamon sticks, bay leaves, curry leaves, and chilli. Toast for 2-3 minutes until golden and aromatic - be careful, the leaves will splatter a little. While they are toasting, add onion, garlic and ginger to the food processor and pulse until finely chopped.', u'Season cubed lamb with salt and pepper then add to the pot of oil and spices. Brown all over, about 5-7 minutes.Add onion puree and sweat a little to remove some of the moisture - about 8 minutes. Stir with a wooden spoon as you go. Now add fresh tomatoes and cover slightly with lid.  Reduce heat and simmer for 40 minutes until the lamb is tender. Remove the lid and skim fat off the surface. Fold in the yogurt and simmer for a further 5 minutes.  Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and scallions serve with steamed basmati rice and raita.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cloves', u'1 1/2 tablespoon cumin seed', u'11/2 tablespoon fennel seed', u'1 1/2 tablespoon coriander seed', u'1 1/2 tablespoons turmeric', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'2 fresh bay leaves', u'10 fresh curry leaves', u'3 pounds boned shoulder lamb, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 fresh red chili', u'2 medium onions, roughly chopped', u'5 cloves garlic, peeled', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'5 large fresh tomatoes', u'1/2 cup plain unsweetened natural yogurt', u'1/2 bunch fresh cilantro, roughly chopped', u'1 scallion, cut into strips', u'6 cups steamed basmati rice']
title: Southern Indian Lamb Curry

directions: [u'Season chicken with 1 tablespoon of salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the ghee. Stir-fry the onions until glossy. Season with the remaining 2 tablespoons salt, 2 teaspoons black pepper and sugar. Continue to stir-fry until soft but do not allow to brown.', u'Add the garlic, ginger, jalapeno, bay leaf, and garam masala. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes until spices bloom and become aromatic.', u'Add the reserved seasoned chicken pieces, tomatoes, tomato paste, potatoes, and 4 cups of chicken stock. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. When mixture comes to a boil, lower to a simmer and cook until chicken pieces are done, about 30 minutes. Add more chicken stock as necessary. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and sugar.']
ingredients: [u'1 whole chicken, skin removed, cut into 12 pieces', u'3 tablespoons salt, divided', u'4 teaspoons ground black pepper, divided', u'1/4 cup ghee or clarified butter', u'4 cups sliced onions', u'3 -4 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons minced green jalapeno chili', u'1 bay leaf', u'2 tablespoons Garam Masala, recipe follows', u'4 cups diced tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'4 cups boiling potatoes, 2-inch cubes', u'6 cups chicken stock, divided', u'1 tablespoon black peppercorns', u'1/2 tablespoon whole cloves', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon cardamom seeds', u'3 tablespoons cumin seeds', u'3 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'4 (3-inch) cinnamon sticks', u'1/4 cup dried red chiles', u'1/2 tablespoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1/2 cup turmeric']
title: North Indian Chicken Curry

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'I thought that this was the only way to make an omelet until I had the French and American kinds. It\'s funny; we like ours thin and lightly browned, whereas the classic American version is fluffy and pale yellow. This almost reminds me of a Spanish frittata; you can eat a quarter of it with a small salad and it makes a satisfying light lunch. My mum usually makes this for lunch when she\'s got a heavy dinner planned. It\'s one of my dad\'s favorites! This is also apparently one of those things that you can get at the train stations in India: jump onto the platform, grab a hot "railway omelet" and speed walk to work where you can nosh away in peace. Bliss!']
ingredients: [u'6 eggs', u'3/4 cup finely minced red onion', u"1 serrano chile, minced, seeds removed if you don't want it spicy", u'2 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro leaves', u'3/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'3/4 teaspoon paprika', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoon canola oil']
title: Indian Omelet

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"In a large glass, dissolve the dry yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar with 3/4 cup warm water (about 100 degrees F). Let it sit on your counter until it's frothy, about 10 minutes.", u'Meanwhile, sift the flour, salt, remaining 1 teaspoon of sugar and baking powder into a large, deep bowl.', u"Once the yeast is frothy, add the yogurt and the olive oil into the glass, and stir to combine. Pour the yogurt mixture into the dry ingredients and add the kalonji and fennel seeds, if using, and gently mix the ingredients together with a fork. When the dough is about to come together, use your hands to mix. It will feel like there isn't enough flour at first, but keep going until it transforms into a soft, slightly sticky and pliable dough. As soon as it comes together, stop kneading. Cover the dough with plastic wrap or a damp tea towel and let it sit in a warm, draft-free place for 2 to 4 hours.", u"When you're ready to roll, make sure you have two bowls on your counter: one with extra flour in it, and one with water. The dough will be extremely soft and sticky-this is good! Separate the dough into 6 equal portions and lightly roll each one in the bowl of extra flour to keep them from sticking to each other.", u"Shape the naan. Using a rolling pin, roll each piece of dough into a teardrop shape, narrower at the top than at the bottom. It should be 8 to 9-inches long, 4-inches wide at its widest point and about 1/4-inch thick. Once you've formed the general shape, you can also pick it up by one end and wiggle it; the dough's own weight will stretch it out a little. Repeat this method with the rest of the dough. (If you're making the gluten-free version, you'll have better luck pressing the dough out with your fingertips, than rolling.)", u"Warm a large cast-iron skillet over high heat until it's nearly smoking. Make sure you have a lid large enough to fit the skillet and have a bowl of melted butter at the ready.", u'Dampen your hands in the bowl of water and pick up one of your naans, flip-flopping it from one hand to the other to lightly dampen it. Gently lay it in the skillet and set your timer for 1 minute. The dough should start to bubble.', u"After about 1 minute, flip the naan. It should be blistered and somewhat blackened, don't worry - that's typical of traditional naan! Cover the skillet with the lid and cook 30 seconds to 1 minute more.", u'Remove the naan from the skillet, brush with a bit of butter and sprinkle with a little coarse sea salt. Place the naan in a tea towel-lined dish. Repeat with the rest of the naans and serve.', u"Cook's Notes:", u'* If you would like to make this gluten-free, you can substitute in 2 1/4 cups of a gluten-free all-purpose flour mix for the regular flour, plus 1 1/4 teaspoons of xanthum gum.', u'**The kalonji and fennel seeds are not traditional, but I love the burst of onion and mild licorice flavor they add. You can find them pretty cheaply at your local Indian market.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon active dry yeast', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u"2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for rolling, see Cook's Note*", u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'1/8 teaspoon baking powder', u'3 tablespoons plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u"1 teaspoon kalonji (nigella seeds), optional, see Cook's Note**", u"1 teaspoon fennel seeds, optional, see Cook's Note**", u' Melted butter for slathering on the finished naans', u' Coarse sea salt for sprinkling']
title: Naan: Indian Oven-Baked Flat Bread

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, bring the rice, milk, and cardamom to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly with a heat-safe spoonula to help keep the milk from burning.', u'Reduce the heat so that the milk is gently simmering and cook for 45 to 50 minutes, stirring often. The rice should be tender and the milk will have reduced by half, giving a porridge-like consistency.', u'Add the sugar, rosewater or vanilla, and pistachios. Stir and turn off the heat. Serve either warm or chilled, garnished with extra pistachios. Goes well with fresh fruit too.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup basmati rice', u'6 cups whole milk', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon rosewater, or 1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3 tablespoons minced unsalted pistachios or almonds, plus extra for garnish']
title: Indian Rice Pudding

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a medium skillet or saute pan combine the turmeric, chili flakes, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cloves, ginger, garlic powder, mustard seeds, pepper, allspice, and cinnamon and cook, shaking the pan frequently, until spices are fragrant and just beginning to smoke. Remove from the heat, transfer to a shallow plate and allow to cool completely. Transfer to a coffee grinder or spice mill and process until very finely ground. Reserve 6 tablespoons of the spice mixture separately and transfer the remainder to an airtight container and save for another purpose.', u'In a mixing bowl combine the chicken, 2 tablespoons of the curry powder, 1 teaspoon of the salt and 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil and set aside, covered, for 20 minutes.', u'In a large Dutch oven, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, and, when hot, add the chicken pieces and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown on all sides, about 8 minutes. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, thyme, hot pepper if using, and remaining 4 tablespoons curry powder and cook, stirring, until the vegetables are soft, about 4 minutes. Add the chicken broth, coconut milk, and brown sugar and bring to a simmer. Add the remaining teaspoon of salt, and cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is very tender and falling from the bone and the sauce has reduced enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 1 1/2 hours. Stir in the cilantro and adjust seasoning, if necessary.', u'(Note: traditionally, curried chicken roti is eaten with the chicken still on the bones. If you prefer otherwise, at this point you can remove the chicken from the sauce and remove the meat from the bones and then return the meat to the sauce before serving.)', u'Serve the chicken and sauce ladled into the center of the roti breads, then fold both sides over the filling. Fold the top and bottom ends over the sides to form a neat square package, and serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons ground turmeric', u'1 tablespoon crushed dried chili flakes', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 tablespoon coriander seeds', u'1/2 tablespoon ground cloves', u'1/2 tablespoon ground ginger', u'1/2 tablespoon garlic powder', u'1/2 teaspoon yellow mustard seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1 chicken, cut into 8 pieces', u'2 cups chopped onion', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 sprigs fresh thyme', u'1/2 hot pepper, such as Scotch bonnet or serrano, seeded and finely chopped, or to taste', u'2 cups chicken broth', u'1 can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 recipe West Indian Bread for Roti, recipe follows, breads kept covered and warm', u'4 cups all purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil, plus more for cooking roti', u'1 cup water']
title: West Indian Curried Chicken Roti

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Place a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat and heat until just beginning to smoke.', u'Rub the corn with olive oil, then carefully lay into the pan. Cook until charred in patches all the way around and golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes, turning every 5 minutes. Remove and let cool.', u'For the dressing: Meanwhile, whisk together the lime juice, cumin, cayenne, cardamom, chaat masala and salt and black pepper to taste.', u'Slice the kernels off the cobs and tumble into a big bowl. Add the tomatoes, mint and cilantro. Toss with the dressing, and taste for seasoning. Serve!']
ingredients: [u'3 large ears corn, husks and silk removed', u' Olive oil', u'1/4 cup freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u' Big pinch ground cardamom', u' Big pinch chaat masala', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup halved cherry or sugarplum tomatoes', u'1 or 2 sprigs fresh mint, leaves thinly sliced', u' Small handful fresh cilantro, leaves and soft stems rustically ripped into bite-size pieces']
title: Indian Street Corn Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the ginger, chile, onion, cumin and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a mini food processor and pulse to make a thick paste. (Or finely chop and mash with the flat side of a knife.) Mix the yogurt, lime juice, cilantro and a pinch of salt in a bowl. Cover and chill until ready to use.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ginger-chile paste and cook, stirring, until most of the liquid has evaporated and the mixture is slightly toasted, about 5 minutes. Stir in the chicken, carrots, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 cup water and continue to cook, stirring, until the sauce is thick and the chicken is heated through, about 2 more minutes. Season with salt.', u'Spoon one-quarter of the chicken filling down the middle of each piece of bread. Drizzle with some of the yogurt sauce and roll up. Serve with chips.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
