ingredients: [u'1 1 -inch piece ginger, peeled', u'1 serrano chile pepper, halved, seeded and roughly chopped', u'1/2 small onion, roughly chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 cup low-fat plain yogurt', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken, skin removed', u'2 medium carrots, shredded', u'4 pieces naan bread or pocketless pita, warmed', u' Potato chips, for serving (optional)']
title: Indian Chicken Wrap

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F and line a baking sheet with foil. Set aside 2 tablespoons cilantro leaves for the rice. Puree the remaining cilantro leaves and stems, the serrano, garlic, 1/4 cup water, the lemon juice, 2 tablespoons coconut, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a blender until smooth, adding up to 2 tablespoons more water if needed.', u'Toss the chicken thighs with half of the cilantro sauce on the prepared baking sheet; arrange skin-side up. Season generously with salt and pepper. Roast until the skin is crisp and the chicken is cooked through, about 25 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the curry powder, turmeric and a few grinds of pepper; cook, stirring, until toasted, 30 seconds. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until well coated, 1 to 2 minutes. Add 1 1/2 cups water and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes.', u'Fluff the rice with a fork. Stir in the cashews, the remaining 2 tablespoons coconut and the reserved 2 tablespoons cilantro. Serve with the chicken; top with the remaining cilantro sauce.', u'Per serving: Calories 780; Fat 47 g (Saturated 13 g); Cholesterol 190 mg; Sodium 530 mg; Carbohydrate 43 g; Fiber 2 g; Protein 43 g', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'1 large bunch cilantro (leaves and tender stems)', u'1 serrano chile pepper (remove seeds for less heat)', u'1 clove garlic', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u'1/4 cup sweetened shredded coconut', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'8 skin-on, bone-in chicken thighs (about 21/2 pounds)', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 teaspoon curry powder', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 cup jasmine rice', u'1/4 cup salted roasted cashews']
title: Indian Chicken with Cashew Rice

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Put ham hock in a stockpot and add the water. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Add House Seasoning and seasoned salt to water as hock simmers. Add more water as needed (up to 2 more cups as the meat cooks). Add the butter beans, 2 tablespoons butter, and hot sauce and return the liquid to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and cook over low heat for 20 minutes, or until the beans are done. Remove butter beans and reserve liquid. In a skillet, saute bacon until crisp. Add corn, okra, and a small amount of liquid from the butter beans and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add parsley and chicken base; cover and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add fresh tomatoes and remaining 4 tablespoons butter at the last minute. Simmer until tomatoes are heated through.']
ingredients: [u'1 ham hock, about 1/2-pound', u'2 quarts water', u'1/2 teaspoon House Seasoning , recipe follows', u'1/4 teaspoon seasoned salt', u'1 (16-ounce) package frozen green butter beans or use fresh, if desired', u'2 tablespoons butter, plus 4 tablespoons', u'1/2 teaspoon hot sauce, or 1 small hot pepper', u'6 slices bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 (16-ounce) package frozen shoe-peg corn (use fresh if you can get it)', u'2 cups sliced okra', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1 teaspoon chicken base', u'4 fresh tomatoes, cut into chunks']
title: Indian Succotash

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Butter a 9 x 5 x 3 inch Pyrex loaf pan. ', u'Combine the milk and cornmeal in a medium stainless or enamel saucepan. Cook over moderate heat, whisking constantly, until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low and continue stirring until it is as thick as oatmeal. ', u'Add the sugar, brown sugar, molasses, salt, butter, cloves and 2 cups of the half and half. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture back to a boil and transfer to the prepared loaf pan. ', u'Place inside a larger pan and pour in boiling water until it rises halfway up the sides of the loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour, stirring once after the first half hour. ', u'Press the grated ginger against a fine sieve or squeeze it in a square of cheesecloth to extract 1 or 2 tablespoons of juice. After the pudding has baked for 1 hour, add the ginger juice and the remaining cup of half and half and stir to mix. Bake for an additional hour, stirring again after half an hour. Serve immediately in small bowls or cups, or store in the refrigerator and reheat, stirring, over low heat.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups milk', u'1/2 cup yellow cornmeal', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup brown sugar, firmly packed', u'1/2 cup molasses', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/4 teaspoons ground cloves', u'3 cups half and half', u' One 3inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated']
title: Indian Pudding

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the cucumber, 1/4 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a medium bowl; toss to coat. Stir in the yogurt and set aside. Combine the chutney, chopped jalapeno, cilantro and lime juice in a separate bowl; stir to combine.', u'Season the chicken on both sides with the remaining 1 3/4 teaspoons garam masala and a generous pinch each of salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, then add the olive oil. Add the chicken and cook until browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, 2 to 3 more minutes. Reduce the heat to medium and add 1/4 cup water. Cover and cook until the chicken is cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, warm the naan in the oven on a baking sheet. Slice the chicken and divide among the naan. Top with the chutney mixture, red onion, sliced jalapeno and more cilantro. Serve with the cucumber mixture.', u'Photogrpah by Ryan Dausch']
ingredients: [u'1 seedless cucumber, thinly sliced', u'2 teaspoons garam masala', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/3 cup plain Greek yogurt', u'1/2 cup mango chutney', u'1 red jalapeno or Fresno chile pepper (1/2 chopped, 1/2 sliced; remove seeds for less heat)', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for topping', u' Juice of 1 to 2 limes', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 3 medium)', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 pieces naan bread', u'1/4 small red onion, thinly sliced']
title: Indian Chicken Tacos

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"There are entire shops dedicated to this snack mix in India, and it's one of our treasured snacks.  The last time I was in India, we all walked to a neighborhood pub, ordered a pitcher of beer, and chowed down on a big bowl of Chewda. It usually consists of chickpea flour noodles, flattened flakes of dried rice, peanuts and seasonings. Here's my Americanized version. Careful.  Once you start... it's really hard to stop!", u"Christina Perozzi from beerforchicks.com pairs this with a Reissdorf Kolsch from Koln (or Cologne), Germany. It's a crisp, dry and light ale. It has a depth of flavor without getting too big like a lager would."]
ingredients: [u'2 cups corn cereal (recommended: Corn Flakes)', u'2 cups puffed rice cereal (recommended: Rice Krispies)', u'1/4 cup shelled, skinless peanuts', u'1/4 cup pepitas (pumpkin seeds)', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 teaspoon brown or black mustard seeds', u'8 to 10 fresh curry leaves, optional', u'1/2 green serrano chile, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u' Small handful plantain chips, optional', u'2 tablespoons golden raisins', u' Kosher salt']
title: Indian Snack Mix (Chewda)

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Pour the flour and salt into a large bowl. Slowly pour water into the flour, moving your other hand through the flour in circular motions, until it starts to come together.  Then, either in the bowl or on your counter (which you might want to lightly flour to prevent sticking), knead the dough for about 10 minutes. The dough should be soft and pliant.', u'Return the ball of dough to the bowl and rub the surface of the dough with a little oil to keep it from drying out. Cover with plastic wrap or a damp cloth and allow to rest about 30 minutes.', u"When you're ready to make chapatis, assemble your tools: a small, flat bowl of whole wheat flour, a small bowl of olive oil or melted butter with a small spoon in it, and a paper towel-lined plate or container for the finished breads.", u'Heat a flat griddle or cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, on a lightly-floured surface, work the ball of dough into a long log. Cut into 12 equal pieces by cutting it in half, and then half again. Cut each of the quarters into 3 equal pieces. Return to the bowl and cover with a damp towel to prevent them from drying out.', u"To roll the chapatis: Roll a piece of dough between your palms to form a ball, and then flatten with your palm. Dunk this puck in the bowl of flour, and then roll until it's a 4-inch circle. Spoon about 1/4 teaspoon of oil in the center of the circle, and spread it out almost to the perimeter of the circle using the back of the spoon. Fold the circle in half, then in half again, so it forms a triangle. Seal the edges, and dunk in flour again if it's sticky.", u"Start rolling, turning the triangle a quarter turn after each roll, until it's about 6-inches wide, with an even thickness. After some practice you'll be able to roll the chapati and rotate it without picking it up; I do this by weighing down a little on my right hand and pushing the chapati around that way.", u"Test the griddle by sprinkling a little flour on it; if it turns brown immediately, it's ready. Flapping the chapati between your hands to remove any excess flour, slap the chapati onto the griddle. It should start darkening almost immediately.", u"When small bubbles start to form, spread a little oil over the surface of the chapati, then flip. It should start to puff up. Spoon a little oil over this side too, and when it's puffed up a little more, flip. Press down on the edges of the chapati with your spatula or (if you're brave!) with a dry rag. This will seal the edges and encourage the entire chapati to puff up. If you spot any holes, press down on those too so the air doesn't escape. Allowing the air to stay inside the whole chapati makes it flaky and light. But don't fret if your first few don't puff up; it takes practice! It will still taste delicious.", u'Remove to your container. Repeat with the remaining dough, and serve the chapatis hot.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups whole wheat flour, plus more for rolling', u' Big pinch fine sea salt', u'1 cup water', u'1/4 cup olive oil, vegetable oil, melted butter, or ghee']
title: Indian Whole Wheat Griddle Breads: Chapatis

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Whisk the yogurt until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients, plus a little freshly ground black pepper if you like. Stir, chill, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups plain whole milk or low-fat yogurt', u'2 cups grated English or Persian cucumber (unpeeled)', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'4 sprigs fresh mint, leaves only, minced finely', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons golden raisins', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Indian Cucumber and Yogurt Salad: Cucumber Raita

author: Jamie Oliver
directions: [u'This is a beautiful fresh Indian-style salad with a zingy crispness that goes wonderfully with spicy lamb. The dressed carrots can be served on their own with some added apple or celery for extra sweetness and crunch.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 pounds good-quality coarsely ground lamb', u'2 teaspoons garam masala', u' Sea salt', u'1 pound carrots (mixed colors if possible), peeled', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u' A small bunch fresh cilantro, leaves picked', u' A small bunch fresh mint, leaves picked', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'3 shallots or 1 small red onion, peeled', u'1 lemon, zested and juiced', u'1 heaped teaspoon freshly grated ginger', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u' Naan bread', u' Yogurt', u' Lemon halves']
title: Indian Carrot Salad

directions: [u'Serving suggestion: Butter pecan or maple walnut ice cream.', u'Special equipment: 6 to 8-cup ceramic baking dish or ovenproof ceramic bowl ', u'Preheat oven to 275 degrees F. ', u'Put cornbread cubes in baking dish. Whisk together milk, egg, molasses, ginger, and a pinch of salt and pour over bread. Let stand 5 minutes. ', u'Bake on a baking sheet in middle of oven until edge of custard is just set and center is still wobbly, 40 to 45 minutes. Cool pudding until warm (it will continue to set as it cools).']
ingredients: [u'4 medium corn muffins or 8 corn toaster cakes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (5 cups)', u'2 2/3 cups whole milk', u'4 large eggs', u'4 tablespoons molasses', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger', u' Pinch salt']
title: Indian Cornbread Pudding

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a small bowl combine mint, cilantro, lemon and lime juices, olive oil, curry powder, yogurt, garlic, salt and pepper and mix well. Place the chicken in a large plastic bag and pour the marinade over the chicken. Squeeze the excess air from the bag and seal. Marinate for 3 hours, refrigerated. ', u'Season, and place the marinated breast on the grill or in your broiler. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until firm, but still springy.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon chopped mint', u'1 tablespoon chopped cilantro', u'2 tablespoons lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon lime juice', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 teaspoon curry powder', u'1/4 cup plain yogurt', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u' Salt and pepper', u'3 pounds chicken breast, skinless, boneless']
title: Indian Chicken

directions: [u'Whisk the chickpea flour, cornstarch, baking powder, cumin seeds, cayenne and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a bowl. Add 2/3 cup water and whisk until smooth. Add the onion, chickpeas, spinach and ginger to the batter and mix to combine.', u'Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a deep heavy-bottomed pot until a deep-fry thermometer registers 325 degrees. Working in batches, drop heaping tablespoonfuls of batter into the oil (do not crowd the pan). Cook until lightly golden, about 2 minutes, turning as needed. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a paper-towel-lined plate. Cool slightly, then gently press each fritter into a small disk, about 1/3 inch thick.', u'Return the fritters to the hot oil and fry until crisp and golden brown, about 1 more minute. Season with salt and serve with chutney.', u'Photograph by Kate Sears']
ingredients: [u'1 cup chickpea flour (available at Middle Eastern, Indian or health-food stores), or all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'1/4 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 onion, finely chopped', u'1 cup canned chickpeas, drained, rinsed and roughly chopped', u'1 10 -ounce box frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled ginger', u' Vegetable oil, for deep-frying', u' Mango chutney, for serving']
title: Indian Spinach-and-Chickpea Fritters

directions: [u"In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat just until it comes to a boil then immediately turn off the heat. Place the cornmeal in a large bowl. Add the hot milk and mix lightly. Sift together 1 cup of flour, the sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Stir the melted butter and the egg into the cornmeal mixture. Stir the flour mixture into the cornmeal mixture and mix well. If the dough doesn't hold together, add more flour 1 tablespoon at a time. The dough should be firm enough to handle, but keep it soft by using as little flour as possible.", u'Place the dough in a bowl, cover, and refrigerate 30 minutes. Flour your hands and turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Using your hands, roll into logs 1-inch in diameter. Using a knife, cut into 1 1/2-inch lengths.', u"Meanwhile, heat the oil in a deep fryer (or at least 2 inches of oil in a deep, heavy pot) to 350 degrees F. (Do not overheat, or the doughnuts will not cook through.) Working in batches to avoid crowding the pot, fry the dough nuts, turning occasionally, until golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels, sprinkle lightly with confectioners' sugar, and serve immediately."]
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups whole, 2 percent fat, or 1 percent fat milk', u'2/3 cup yellow cornmeal', u'1 cup flour, plus more, as needed', u'1 1/2 cups granulated sugar', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon nutmeg', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/3 cup (5 1/3 tablespoons) unsalted butter, melted', u'1 egg, beaten', u' Vegetable oil, for deep-frying', u" Confectioners' sugar"]
title: Indian Doughnuts

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat the EVOO in a Dutch oven or chili pot over medium-high heat. Add the meat, then crumble and brown. Add the garlic, chiles, onions, ginger, chili powder, coriander, cumin, turmeric and some salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes, then add the tomato paste and stir a minute more. Add the stock and simmer for the flavors to combine, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool and store for a make-ahead meal.', u'Stir together the yogurt and Sriracha and store in a airtight container in the refrigerator.', u'When ready to eat, reheat the curry chili over medium heat, adding more stock or water if needed, while you bake the sweet potato fries.', u'For the fries: Place a rack in upper third of the oven and preheat to 450 degrees F. Cut the sweet potatoes into fairly thin fries, 1/4-inch thick, and arrange on baking sheet. Spray with the cooking spray and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 7 to 8 minutes, then switch on the broiler and broil until brown and crispy at edges, 15 to 20 minutes, turning once.', u'Melt the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. When it foams, add the garlic and swirl for a minute. Toss the fries with the butter and cilantro in large bowl using tongs.', u'To serve, arrange the fries on a platter or individual plates. Ladle the chili over the fries and top with the spicy yogurt, mint and scallions, and pass the limes for squeezing on top.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons EVOO', u'2 pounds ground lamb or chicken', u'2 large cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 chile peppers, such as Fresno, jalapeno or finger peppers, seeded and finely chopped', u'1 onion, finely chopped', u'1 inch ginger root, grated or 1 teaspoon dried ginger powder', u"1 tablespoon chili powder, such as Gebhardt's", u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground turmeric', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'1 cup plain Greek yogurt', u'2 to 3 tablespoons Sriracha', u'3 sweet potatoes (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)', u' Natural nonstick cooking spray', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro or parsley, finely chopped', u' Chopped fresh mint leaves', u' Scallions', u' Lime wedges']
title: Indian Curried Chili and Oven Fries

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Make the pastry by combining the flour and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and then rubbing 4 tablespoons of the ghee into the flour until well combined and mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the pastry comes together to form a ball, about 10 tablespoons. Knead the dough lightly and then form into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to rest for at least 1 hour.', u'While the dough is resting, make the filling. Heat the remaining ghee in a medium skillet and add 3/4 cup of the onion. Cook until the onion is lightly caramelized, about 6 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon of the ginger, 1 tablespoon of the garlic, 1 of the chiles, coriander, garam masala, cumin seeds, turmeric, and cinnamon and cook until the spices are fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the meat, 1 1/4 teaspoons of the remaining salt, 1/8 teaspoon of pepper and 1/4 cup hot water, cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until the meat is very tender and the water has been absorbed, about 25 minutes. Add 3 tablespoons of the cilantro and set aside to cool completely.', u'While the filling is cooking, make the dipping sauce by combining the mint, remaining cilantro, remaining chopped onion, remaining ginger, remaining 1/4 teaspoon garlic, remaining green chiles, remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt, sugar, lemon juice, and 3 to 4 tablespoons water in the bowl of a processor and process until a fine, smooth puree is formed. (Stop to scrape down the sides of the bowl as necessary.) Set aside, refrigerated, until ready to serve the samosas. (Taste and season with additional salt and sugar, to taste, if necessary.)', u'Divide the samosa dough into 10 portions and roll each piece of dough into a ball. On a lightly floured surface, use a rolling pin to roll each ball of dough into a circle about 5 inches in diameter (use a small bowl or the rim of a saucer and a sharp paring knife to trim the edges of the dough to form neat circles.) Cut each circle in half. Lightly moisten half of the straight edge of each half circle then bring the edges together to form a cone shape and press together to seal. Carefully spoon about 2 heaping tablespoons of the filling into the dough cone and push downward to compress the filling. Moisten the top edges with a bit of water and press together to seal. Repeat with the remaining portions of dough and filling.', u'When you are ready to fry the samosas, heat a deep-fryer or a large saucepan filled with at least 2 inches of oil to about 340 degrees F. Fry the samosas, a few at a time and stirring to promote even cooking, until golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. (Note: these will float to the surface of the oil long before they are ready to be removed - make certain to cook them until the pastry is crispy and golden brown.) Remove using a slotted spoon and transfer to a paper-lined plate to drain. Repeat until all samosas have been fried. Serve immediately, with the fresh mint dippng sauce and/or your favorite chutney.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 3/4 teaspoons salt, divided', u'6 tablespoons ghee or clarified butter or oil, divided', u' Cold water as needed, usually about 10 tablespoons', u'1 cup minced onion, divided', u'4 teaspoons minced fresh ginger, divided', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/4 teaspoon minced fresh garlic, divided', u'3 hot green chiles, such as serrano, seeded and finely minced, divided', u'1 1/4 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 1/4 teaspoons garam masala', u'1 1/4 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 1/3 pounds ground lamb', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided', u'1/4 cup freshly chopped cilantro leaves, divided', u'3 cups fresh mint leaves', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice', u' Oil, for frying']
title: Indian Lamb Samosas with Fresh Mint Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Wash rice by rinsing in cold water. Then soak in cold water for about 30 minutes. Drain.', u'In a large nonstick saute pan over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Add onion and cook, stirring, until onion is tender. Add garlic, and saute for about a minute. Add cardamom, coriander, cinnamon, cloves and ginger. Saute for another minute and add the rice. Saute until rice is translucent and begins to brown. Add water, bay leaf and salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, partly covered, for about 10 minutes. Most of the water will evaporate and steam holes will show through rice.', u'Add peas, but do not stir. Cover tightly and let simmer for 5 minutes more. Turn off the heat and let sit for 5 to 10 minutes, covered.', u'Prepare the raita: In a bowl whisk together the yogurt, cucumber, mint, cumin, chili powder and salt and pepper.', u'Uncover the pilaf, season with salt and pepper. Remove bay leaf, cloves and cinnamon stick. Turn pilaf out onto a serving platter and pour half of the raita over rice. Pass remaining raita.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups basmati rice', u'1 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 onion, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'8 green cardamom pods', u'1 teaspoon crushed coriander seeds', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'8 cloves', u'1/2 teaspoon powdered ginger', u'4 cups water', u'1 bay leaf', u' Salt to taste', u'2 cups fresh green peas', u' Ground pepper', u'2 cups yogurt', u'1 cucumber, peeled, seeded and minced', u'3 tablespoons chopped mint, or to taste', u'3/4 teaspoon ground roasted cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon chili powder', u' Salt and pepper to taste']
title: Basmati Rice Pilaf with Indian Spices and Raita

directions: [u'In a large saucepan bring the water to a boil. Add the dahl, tomatoes, okra, carrots, potatoes, tumeric, salt and tamarind paste or lemon juice. Stir and bring back to a boil. Reduce the heat slightly and cook until the dahl is tender--approximately 30 minutes; add more water if necessary.', u'Meanwhile, in a heavy skillet, heat the oil and lightly fry the ground cilantro and cumin over a medium heat. Add the mustard seeds, chile and curry leaves and fry for 2 minutes, covering the skillet as the seeds pop. Add the fried spices to the cooked dahl and vegetables. Add the sambhar masala and mix well.', u'The stew can be prepared up to 2 hours in advance.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups water', u'1 cup masur dahl (red lentils) or mung dahl (yellow lentils)', u'2 tomatoes, cut into large chunks', u'5 -6 large okra, halved lengthways', u'2 carrots, cut into large chunks', u'2 potatoes, cut into large chunks', u'1 tablespoon tumeric', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'2 teaspoons tamarind paste or 1 tablespoon lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon cilantro seeds, ground', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds, ground', u'1 tablespoon black mustard seeds', u'1 -2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped', u'6 -8 dried curry leaves', u'1 tablespoon sambhar masala']
title: South Indian Spicy Lentil Stew

directions: [u'In a bowl, combine the lemon juice, lemongrass, garlic, ginger, jalapeno, onion, cilantro and coconut milk.  Mix well and season with salt and pepper.  This mix can be made ahead of time and brought in a resealable plastic bag.  Season the mackerel with salt and pepper.  Place the mackerel into the marinade and marinate for 15 minutes.  Remove the fish from the marinade and place on the grill, skin side up.  Grill for 4 minutes per side, basting often with the marinade.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'2 tablespoons minced lemongrass', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon, ginger, minced', u'1 jalapeno chile, finely diced', u'1 small onion, finely diced', u'2 tablespoons cilantro, chopped', u'1/4 cup coconut milk', u'1/4 cup canola oil', u' Salt', u' Pepper', u'4 mackerel fillets, skin on']
title: Indian Spiced Grilled Mackerel

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Set a 14-inch saute pan over medium heat. Add the ghee and toast the mustard seeds and cumin until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the onions, chiles, ginger and garlic and saute, stirring occasionally, until the onions are slightly caramelized, about 6 to 8 minutes. Add the tomato paste to the pan and cook for 2 minutes more. Pour the diced tomatoes into the pan and cook until reduced by about half, 3 to 4 minutes. Raise the heat to high, and add the coconut milk. Cook the coconut milk until reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Season the shrimp with 1 1/2 teaspoons of the salt. Add the shrimp to the pan, stirring often, and cook until curled and pink, about 5 minutes. Add the chopped cilantro and season with the remaining salt. Serve the shrimp over steamed basmati rice.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup ghee or vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons mustard seeds', u'2 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'1 1/2 cups finely chopped red onion', u'4 to 6 green chiles, seeded and finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes', u'1 (13.5-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 1/2 pounds medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Steamed basmati rice, for serving']
title: Indian-Inspired Shrimp with Coconut, Chiles and Tomato

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a medium pot with extra-virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 2 to 3 minutes. Grind the chickpeas and onion in food processor. Add to pot and cook 5 minutes to sweeten onion. Season the chickpeas with cumin, cardamom, turmeric, salt and pepper. Stir in stock, then tomatoes. Simmer soup 5 to 10 minutes to combine flavors. Serve with a dollop of yogurt and warm pita for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the pan', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 cans chickpeas, drained', u'1 small onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin, 2/3 palm ful', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 cups chicken or vegetable stock', u'1 (28-ounce) can fire roasted tomatoes', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u' Warm pita, any flavor or variety, toasted']
title: Indian Spiced Chickpea and Fire Roasted Tomato Soup

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Rinse the pigeon peas in a couple changes of water.', u'In a large soup pot, combine the squash, drained pigeon peas, tomato, coconut, turmeric, cumin, and enough stock to cover. Bring to a boil, and then simmer, covered, 20 minutes. Remove the cover and simmer another 10 minutes.', u'To temper: In a small skillet, warm the canola oil until shimmering. Add the mustard seeds and when they stop popping, add the red pepper flakes, garlic, and salt. Swirl the skillet so the contents cook evenly, and cook another 10 seconds. Then pour the contents of the skillet into the soup, along with the salt. Spoon a ladleful of soup back into the skillet (it will sizzle, be careful!), and pour back into the soup pot. Finish with the honey, lime juice, and cilantro. Adjust the seasonings, to taste, and enjoy a little Indian summer in the middle of your winter!']
ingredients: [u'1 cup yellow split pigeon peas (toor dal)', u'1 pound butternut squash, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 2 1/2 cups)', u'1 Roma tomato, diced', u'1/2 cup fresh, frozen, or dried shredded coconut', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'4 cups vegetable stock or water, or enough to cover', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 teaspoon brown or black mustard seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1/2 cup minced fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Indian Summer Stew: Butternut Squash, Coconut, and Lentil Stew

directions: [u'In a nonstick skillet set over moderately high heat, warm the oil until hot.  Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes.  Add the veal, beef, and salt and pepper to taste, and cook, stirring, until no longer pink. Add the garlic, tomatoes, gingerroot, Garam Masala, and chilies, and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes.  Add the peas and continue to cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes more, or until flavors blend. Stir in the lemon juice and cilantro and correct seasoning, adding more salt if necessary.  Either transfer to a bowl and serve with warm rotis or tortillas or spoon Keema down center of bread and roll up like a burrito.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 onion, minced', u'8 ounces ground veal', u'8 ounces ground lean beef', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste', u'2 large cloves garlic, minced', u'2 firm, ripe tomatoes, diced', u'1 tablespoon minced gingerroot, or 1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 teaspoon Garam Masala', u'1 teaspoon minced fresh hot green chilies, or to taste', u'3 cups frozen peas', u'1 lemon, juiced, or to taste', u'2 to 3 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro, or to taste', u' Indian flatbreads (rotis) or tortillas, as an accompaniment']
title: Keema (Indian Spiced Ground Veal and Beef with Peas)

directions: [u'To make the pudding: Place the milk in a large, heavy wok or skillet and bring to a boil over high heat. Continue to boil, stirring, 2 to 3 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring and scraping the bottom and sides of the wok often, until the milk is reduced by at least 3/4, about 45 minutes. You should be left with about 2 cups of condensed milk. (It should have a few lumps.)', u'Mix in the sugar, cardamom seeds, ground pistachios and food coloring, if using, and cook, stirring, until the sugar melts and thins down the pudding, and then the pudding thickens again, 5 to 7 minutes.', u'Transfer to traditional kulfi molds or disposable 5 1/2-ounce plastic souffle cups. Cover and place in the freezer until completely frozen, at least 4 hours.', u'To serve, dip each mold in hot water about 10 seconds, run a knife around the inside of the mold and transfer immediately to a dessert plate. Serve whole or cut into smaller pieces, garnish with chopped pistachios, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 gallon whole milk', u'1/4 cup sugar, or to taste', u'1/2 teaspoon ground green cardamom seeds', u'1/4 cup ground pistachios', u'1 to 2 drops green food coloring, optional', u'1/4 cup blanched pistachios, coarsely chopped']
title: Indian Ice Cream with Pistachios: Pista Kulfi

directions: [u"(Chef's Note: This recipe was inspired by my recent trip to Malaysia in August 2009. I went to visit my father's parents in Penang, the city in which my father was born and raised. Although I'm of Chinese background, my father often integrates Malaysian flavors in his cooking. One of his most popular dishes is his yellow curry, which is a staple of Malaysian Indian food. His traditional curry is rather time-intensive and laborious. I decided to take a simpler approach, making the traditional Malaysian Indian flavors more accessible to my grad student schedule.)"]
ingredients: [u' Canola oil, as needed', u'1/2 red pepper', u'1 jalapeno', u'1/4 red onion, thickly sliced', u'2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more as needed', u'1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more as needed', u' Freshly cracked black pepper, as needed', u'1/4 cup curry powder, plus more as needed*', u'3 medium cloves garlic, grated', u'1 (1-inch) piece ginger, peeled and grated', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon garam masala, optional', u'1 pound ground beef, 85 to 88 percent lean', u'2 green onions, chopped', u'2 teaspoons ketchup', u'1 teaspoon brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1/2 cup homemade or good quality mayonnaise, recipe follows', u'10 mint leaves, chopped', u'2 green onions, chopped', u'1 reserved grilled jalapeno, seeded (from burger recipe)', u'2 cloves garlic, grated', u'1 teaspoon curry powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u"1 cup fried onion snacks (recommended: French's Fried Onions)", u'1 tablespoon garam masala', u'4 brioche rolls (if brioche is not available, you can use a sweet and sturdy roll, such as a Portuguese hard roll)', u'1/2 English cucumber, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds, about 16 pieces total', u'1 package pre-washed baby lettuce mix', u' A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.', u'1 egg yolk*', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1/8 teaspoon sugar', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 tablespoon white wine vinegar', u'1 cup canola oil']
title: Malaysian Indian Curry-Spiced Beef Burgers

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Crumble 1/2 piece naan into coarse crumbs; transfer to a 6-quart slow cooker. Add the red onion, potatoes, chile and cilantro stems. Arrange the chicken thighs in a single layer over the vegetables and sprinkle with the garam masala, 3/4 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Dot with the butter and add the cinnamon stick. Pour the tomato sauce over the top. Cover and cook on low, 7 hours.', u'Uncover and switch to the warm setting or turn off. Gently stir in the heavy cream, breaking the chicken into large chunks; let stand 10 minutes. Stir in the cilantro leaves and season with salt. Serve with the remaining naan.', u'Photograph by Ryan Dausch']
ingredients: [u'3 pieces naan bread', u'1 red onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 pound baby red-skinned potatoes, halved or quartered if large', u'1 Fresno chile or red jalapeno pepper, halved lengthwise, seeded and sliced', u'1 small bunch cilantro, leaves and tender stems separated, chopped', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs (about 6)', u'1 tablespoon garam masala', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into pieces', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'1 15 -ounce can tomato sauce', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u' Kosher salt']
title: Slow-Cooker Indian Butter Chicken

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'To make the dough, sift the flour and salt into medium bowl. Add 1 tablespoon of the clarified butter and rub the mixture between the palms of your hands to evenly distribute, letting the fat-coated flour fall back into the bowl. Continue until the flour is evenly coated. Add 6 tablespoons of the water, mix, and work until the dough comes together. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 4 minutes into a firm dough. Cover with a kitchen towel and let rest for 30 minutes.', u'To make the filling, in a large saute pan or skillet, heat the remaining 1/4 cup of clarified butter over medium-high heat. Add the coriander seeds and cook, stirring, for 10 seconds. Add the onions and ginger, and cook, stirring, until starting to caramelize, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, chile peppers, garam masala, salt, turmeric, and cayenne, and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 30 to 45 seconds. Add the potatoes and cook, stirring until the potatoes start to color and become dry, about 3 minutes. Add the peas and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and add the cilantro and lemon juice. Stir to combine, then adjust the seasoning, to taste. Let sit until cool enough to handle.', u'On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough for 1 minute. Divide into 2 equal portions and roll each into a 1/2-inch thick rope. Cut each into 8 equal parts and roll into smooth balls. Place each ball on the floured surface and roll into a thin circle, about 6-inches in diameter. Cut each circle in half (2 semi-circles). Spoon about 2 teaspoons of filling in the center of each semi-circle. Brush the edges with water and fold the dough over the filling. Press the edges together to seal. Place on a baking sheet and repeat with the remaining ingredients.', u'Preheat the oil in a large pot to 350 degrees F. Add the pastries in batches and cook at 300 degrees F, turning, until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon ghee, clarified butter or vegetable oil, plus 1/4 cup, plus extra, for frying', u'6 to 8 tablespoons ice water', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander seeds', u'1/2 cup chopped yellow onions', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 hot green chile peppers, minced', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne', u'2 large baking potatoes, like russets, about 1 1/2 pounds, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch dice, and boiled until just tender', u'1/2 cup par-cooked and drained green peas', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice']
title: Samosas: Fried Indian Vegetable Pastries

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', u"Mix the peanuts, pecans, coconut, oil, coriander cumin, garam masala and salt together and pour onto the baking sheet. Toast for 40 minutes, rotating the baking sheet halfway through for even baking. Remove from the oven and allow it to cool. If you're taking them to the beach, make little parchment cones and pour some nuts into each one!"]
ingredients: [u'1 cup unsalted roasted peanuts', u'1 cup chopped pecans', u'4 tablespoons shredded coconut (either fresh or the unsweetened desiccated kind)', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons garam masala, store-bought or homemade, recipe follows', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 2 tablespoons of seeds)', u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'4 large black cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 1 tablespoon of seeds), optional', u"3 large cinnamon sticks (if you have the kind you get at Indian stores, it's about 3 tablespoons of cinnamon bark bits)"]
title: Newspaper Nuts: Indian Spiced Nuts with Coconut

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed casserole or pan over low heat and fry the sliced onion sprinkled with some salt until it begins to soften. Add the chile and ginger strips and stir every now and again while cooking for about 1 minute.', u'Add the chili flakes, the turmeric, cumin, coriander and ginger. Stir well and let cook for about 1 minute or so. Pour in the coconut milk, stock, sugar and tamarind paste. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil over medium-low heat and add the cauliflower first, then the broccoli. Cook for 10 minutes, then add the green beans and baby corn.  Check the vegetables after about 5 minutes or so to see if they are tender, letting them cook for longer if needed.', u'Once they are tender add the sugar snaps and season to taste, to taste. When the sugar snap peas are hot, serve generously sprinkled with the herbs of your choice. Transfer the curry to a serving bowl. Serve with some plain rice or some warmed Indian flatbread on the side for dunking.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons garlic oil', u'1 onion, peeled, halved and cut into half moons', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'1 green chile seeded and finely chopped', u'3/4 -inch chunk fresh ginger, peeled and cut into fine strips', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed chiii flakes', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 (13.5-ounce) can coconut milk', u'1 quart vegetable stock', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon tamarind paste', u'12 ounces cauliflower, broken into florets (about 3 1/2 cups)', u'12 ounces broccoli, broken into florets (about 3 1/2 cups)', u'2 ounces green beans, trimmed and halved (large handful)', u'4 ounces baby corn, halved (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'6 ounces sugar snap peas (about 2 cups)', u'2 tablespoons chopped dill or coriander, or mixture of both']
title: South Indian Vegetable Curry

directions: [u'In a saucepan combine the rice and water, bring to a boil, stirring, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.  Add 2 cups of the milk, the sugar, raisins, cashews or pistachios, cardamom seeds, and cinnamon, and simmer, stirring often, for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until rice is tender and mixture creamy.  Add additional milk if necessary.  Pudding may also be served chilled.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup short grain Indian or Italian (Arborio) rice', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'2 to 3 cups milk', u'1/2 cup sugar, or to taste', u'1/4 cup golden raisins', u'1/4 cup raw cashews or shelled pistachios, chopped fine', u' Seeds from 4 cardamom pods', u' Ground cinnamon, to taste']
title: Warm Indian Rice Pudding

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler. Make shallow cuts in the chicken thighs with a sharp knife. Toss the chicken with the lemon juice and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt in a large bowl.', u'Pulse 2 tablespoons yogurt, the vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato paste, coriander, cumin, 11/2 teaspoons paprika and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a food processor to make a paste. Toss the chicken in the mixture and let marinate 15 minutes.', u'Place the chicken on a foil-lined broiler pan. Broil, turning once, until slightly charred and a thermometer inserted into the center registers 165 degrees F, 5 to 6 minutes per side.', u'Meanwhile, combine the remaining 1/2 cup yogurt and 1/4 teaspoon paprika, the cilantro and a pinch of salt in a bowl. Top the chicken with the yogurt sauce and serve with rice, if desired.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'8 skinless, boneless chicken thighs (about 2 1/2 pounds)', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons plain yogurt', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/2 small red onion, roughly chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and roughly chopped', u'4 teaspoons tomato paste', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 3/4 teaspoons hot paprika', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u' Cooked rice, for serving (optional)']
title: Chicken Tandoori

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u"Chef's Note: You can replace the turmeric and masala powder with curry powder", u"In a large cooking pot, heat the oil and add the chopped onions, frying until golden brown. Stir in the turmeric and masala powder (or curry powder), garlic and chiles, mix well and cook for a couple of minutes to integrate flavors. Add the lamb and sear on all sides. Sprinkle the flour over the meat using a sifting motion, spoon in tomato paste, then gradually add the stock (or water) stirring constantly while doing so. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer over low heat until meat is tender, about 1 hour. Check the pot often and stir so the curry doesn't burn. If the sauce is thickening too fast during this cooking time, add water to retain the consistency and to prevent burning. (If you prefer, once you have added the stock or water and the sauce is a good smooth consistency, you may transfer to a covered roasting pan and finish in the oven at 350 degrees F until the meat is tender.) In the last 30 minutes of cooking time, stir in the potatoes.", u'While the lamb curry is in its last 1/2 hour, bring 5 cups of water to a boil, add rice and salt, reduce heat, cover and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit 5 minutes.', u'Spoon rice onto serving plate, top with lamb curry and garnish with fresh cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup grapeseed oil', u'3 medium onions, diced small', u'4 teaspoons turmeric', u'6 teaspoons masala powder', u'8 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 to 2 chiles, diced small (your choice)', u'5 pounds lean lamb, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 (6-ounce) can tomato paste', u'1 1/2 quarts vegetable stock or water', u'3 medium sized potatoes, peeled and diced small', u'2 cups rice', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Indian Style Lamb Curry

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Place the squash cut side up on a parchment lined sheet pan. Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Invert to the cut side down, and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Place in the oven and roast until the skin is golden brown and the squash is tender, about 50 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Once cool enough to handle, use a spoon to scoop the squash out of its skin and set aside until ready to use.', u'Set a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and once hot, about 30 seconds, add the curry powder and toast, stirring continuously for 1 minute. Add the onions, carrots, celery, ginger and garlic to the pan and saute, stirring occasionally, until lightly caramelized, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the chicken stock and reserved squash to the pan and bring the stock to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook the soup for 15 to 20 minutes, or until all the vegetables are softened.', u'Remove the soup from the heat and process with an immersion blender (or in batches using a bar blender) until smooth. Season with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and a pinch of pepper. Add the cream and chopped cilantro to the soup and keep warm as you make the croutons.', u'Spread the butter on both sides of the sandwich bread. Set a 10-inch saute pan over medium-low heat. Place the bread in the pan and saute until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from the pan and allow to cool. Once cool enough to handle, spread 1/4 cup of the paneer on 1 side of both slices of bread. Use a knife to cut diagonally across the bread to make 2 triangles. Cut each triangle diagonally again to make a smaller triangle. Reserve for plating the soup.', u'To make the turmeric oil, combine the extra-virgin olive oil with the turmeric and stir until combined.', u'To plate the soup, place 1 cup of the soup in each of 6 warmed soup bowls. Float a crouton in the center of the soup, place a sprig of cilantro on top of the paneer, and drizzle a teaspoon of the turmeric oil around the crouton.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds butternut squash, halved and seeds removed', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus a pinch', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 tablespoon Madras curry powder', u'3/4 cup chopped onion', u'1/2 cup chopped carrot', u'1/4 cup chopped celery', u'1/4 cup minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'3 1/2 cups chicken stock', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons butter, room temperature', u'2 slices thin sandwich bread, crusts removed', u'1/2 cup paneer cheese, recipe follows', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'8 sprigs cilantro, for garnish', u'4 quarts whole milk', u'4 tablespoons distilled white vinegar']
title: Curried Butternut Squash Soup with Paneer (Indian Cheese) Croutons and Turmeric Oil

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"This is the most important part: Wash the rice! Place the rice in a large bowl and fill with fresh, room temperature water. Swirl your hand through the water and the rice; the water will go cloudy. That's all the starch that we're trying to remove in order to have individual grains of rice, not the sticky kind that's popular in Chinese and Japanese cuisine. (According to traditional Indian wisdom, this also makes the rice easier to digest because so much of the starch has been removed). Once you've swirled your hand around for a minute or so, pour off the water, taking care not to lose any rice. Repeat this washing process until the water runs clear. Usually, this takes 3 or 4 changes of water.", u'Fill up the bowl 1 more time and let the rice soak for 30 minutes.', u'At the end of 30 minutes, drain the rice. Fill a medium saucepan with 1 3/4 cups water, add a pinch of salt, and bring to a boil.', u'Add the rice, stir, and wait until the water comes back to a full boil. When it does, turn the heat down as low as it can go, and then cover. Cook for 15 minutes.', u'At the end of 15 minutes, cut the heat. Let the rice sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork; you should see that every grain of rice has grown a little longer and is separate from its brothers and sisters. Well done!']
ingredients: [u'1 cup basmati rice', u'1 3/4 cups water', u' Large pinch salt']
title: Simple Basmati Rice

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Mix the Ginger-Garlic Paste, coriander, turmeric, and 1/2 cup water in a small bowl. This is a simple wet masala (spice mix). Set aside.', u"In a large pot, warm the oil over medium-high heat until shimmering but not smoking. Add the serrano pepper, wait 30 seconds, and then add the cumin seeds and wait until they're done spluttering.", u'Add the wet masala (careful, it will also splutter). Cook until the paste thickens, deepens in color slightly, and oil oozes out of the perimeter of the masala, about 2 minutes.', u'Add the cauliflower and potatoes, stirring to coat the vegetables with the masala. Season with salt and add 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook over medium heat 10 to 15 minutes. Then, remove the lid, stir, and cook until the cauliflower and potatoes are cooked through, about 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons Ginger-Garlic Paste, recipe follows, or 2 teaspoons grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 cup water, divided', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 large serrano pepper, split down the middle leaving halves attached', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1 small head cauliflower, cut into small florets', u'1 russet potato, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes (similar size to cauliflower)', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons freshly minced cilantro leaves, to garnish', u'1/2 cup cloves garlic, whole', u'1/2 cup fresh ginger, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch slices', u'1/4 cup canola oil']
title: Cauliflower and Potatoes: "Aloo Gobi"

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat the grill to high.', u'Brush the nectarines with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill, cut side down until lightly golden brown, about 3 minutes. Turn the nectarines over and grill until just cooked through, about 2 minutes longer. Remove from the grill and coarsely chop. ', u'Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a medium saucepan on the grates of the grill. Add the onion and cook until soft. Add the chile, garlic, ginger and mustard seeds and cook for 1 minute. Add the vinegar and sugar and cook until the sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens slightly. Stir in the nectarines and cook for 1 minute, season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl, cool, and stir in the raisins, coconut and mint. Let cool to room temperature before serving.', u'For the skewers:', u'Heat the grill to high. Combine the coriander, cumin, mustard seeds and black peppercorns in a small skillet on the grates of the grill and grill until lightly toasted, about 1 1/2 minutes, stirring a few times; transfer to a coffee grinder and process until finely ground and place in a bowl. Add the ancho, turmeric, garlic, ginger, 1/4 cup canola oil and vinegar and whisk until it forms a paste. If the mixture is too dry, add a few tablespoons of water to loosen it to a paste. ', u'Place lamb in a large bowl, add the curry paste and toss to coat each piece of lamb. You can grill immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 hours to allow the flavors to intensify.', u'Skewer 2 pieces of lamb onto 2 skewers so that the meat lays flat on the grill. Season both sides of the lamb with salt and grill until golden brown and slightly charred on both sides and cooked to medium-rare doneness, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Drizzle with olive oil and serve with pita bread and chutney.']
ingredients: [u'4 nectarines, halved and pitted', u' Canola oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 serrano chile, finely diced', u'1 clove garlic, finely chopped', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, grated', u'1 teaspoon whole mustard seeds', u'1/2 cup white wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1/4 cup golden raisins', u'3 tablespoons unsweetened coconut', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh mint leaves', u'1/4 cup coriander seeds', u'2 tablespoons cumin seeds', u'2 teaspoons brown mustard seeds', u'1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', u'2 teaspoons ancho chili powder', u'2 teaspoons turmeric', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, finely grated', u'1/4 cup canola oil', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 pounds boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1-inch dice', u'6 -inch wooden skewers, soaked in cold water for 20 minutes', u' Kosher salt', u' Olive oil, for drizzling', u'4 pita breads, with pockets']
title: Indian Curry Lamb Skewers with Mint-Grilled Nectarine Chutney with Pita

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F. Grease a shallow 2- to 2 1/2-quart baking dish with butter.', u'Pudding: In a medium saucepan, combine the milk and butter and warm over low heat until the butter melts. In a medium bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together a little of the milk mixture and the molasses and then whisk this into the cornmeal mixture. Add the entire cornmeal mixture to the pan and whisk until the ingredients are fully integrated. Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes.', u'Whisk the eggs in a medium bowl. Gradually whisk in some of the cornmeal mix to temper the eggs. Pour everything back into the saucepan and gently whisk in the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and raisins. Remove from the heat. Pour into the baking dish and bake until it looks like a slightly moist version of corn bread or a steamed pudding, 2 hours.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups whole milk', u'1/2 stick butter, plus a little additional butter for greasing the baking dish', u'1/2 cup cornmeal', u'2 tablespoons all purpose flour', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 cup blackstrap molasses', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/2 cup golden raisins', u' Vanilla ice cream, for serving', u'6 Braeburn, Rome or Empire apples, washed, dried, peeled and cored', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup firmly packed light-brown sugar', u' Zest of 1/2 lemon and the juice of 1 lemon', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger']
title: Indian Pudding

directions: [u'Brown the ground beef in a saute pan. Divide equally onto 6 fry bread rounds. Top with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. Great served with salsa and green chile!', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds ground beef', u'6 round fry bread pieces, recipe follows', u'1/2 pound Cheddar cheese, grated', u'1 head lettuce, shredded', u'3 tomatoes, chopped', u'1 onion, chopped', u' Salsa, optional', u' Green chile, optional', u'2 cups unsifted all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup dry milk solids', u'2 teaspoons double-acting baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons lard, cut into 1/2-inch bits, plus 1 pound lard, for deep frying']
title: Tewa Tacos (AKA- Indian Tacos)

author: Claire Robinson
directions: [u'Preheat a stovetop grill pan to medium-high heat. Grill the corn, turning frequently, until evenly browned, 10 to 12 minutes. In a small bowl, stir together the yogurt, honey, lime juice, and curry until smooth. ', u'Transfer the corn to a cutting board, cut them in half crosswise and serve immediately with a drizzle of curry yogurt, a sprinkling of salt and pepper, and squeeze of fresh lime, if desired. Corn can also be refrigerated and served cold.']
ingredients: [u'4 large ears corn, shucked and cleaned', u'1 (7-ounce) container Greek yogurt', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 lime, juiced, plus wedges for serving', u'1 teaspoon curry powder', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper']
title: Indian Corn with Curry Yogurt

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Put all of the ingredients for the sauce in food processor and process until smooth. Transfer to a small serving dish and reserve. ', u'Put the red onion rings in a small bowl and separate the rings. Add the lime juice and drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Add the lamb to a mixing bowl along with the garlic, chile, ginger, spices, cinnamon, and salt and pepper, to taste. Mix to combine. Form the meat mixture into 4 sections and make 2 slider-size patties form each portion, 8 (3-ounce) burgers in total, thinner at the center and thicker at the edges.  ', u'Heat a large skillet or a griddle pan with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil over medium-high heat.  Add the burgers and cook a few minutes on each side.  ', u'Put a few leaves of spinach on each of the bun bottoms and add the burger. Top with the onions and green sauce. Cover with the bun tops and serve.', u' * Toast and grind your own coriander and cumin if you have a coffee grinder or spice mill.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain Greek yogurt', u' A handful cilantro leaves', u' A handful mint leaves', u'1 clove garlic, peeled and grated or mashed into paste', u' Pinch salt', u'1 lime, juiced', u'4 (1/2-inch thick) slices small red onion', u'1 lime, juiced', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 pounds ground lamb', u'2 large cloves garlic, grated or finely chopped', u'1 red or green chile, finely chopped', u'1 -inch piece ginger, grated or minced', u'1 teaspoon (1/3 palmful) turmeric, ground cumin, ground coriander, smoked sweet or sweet paprika, granulated onion or onion powder*', u' Pinch ground cinnamon', u' Baby spinach leaves', u'8 soft potato rolls or slider rolls (recommended: Pepperidge Farm)']
title: Indian Lamb Burgers with Green Raita Sauce and Red Onions

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the tomatoes, shallot, garlic, vinegar, water, and a sprinkling of salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, and then turn down to a simmer, cooking about 5 minutes. Add the brown sugar. Cook another 5 minutes. Remove the saucepan from the heat. ', u'In a small saute pan, heat the olive oil until shimmering. Add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds and cook until they start popping. Pour the contents of the pan into the tomato chutney. Caution: it will splutter so be careful. Stir and season with salt, and pepper, to taste. ', u'Slice the baguette into 1/4-inch rounds. Place the slices on a large baking sheet and toast in the oven for 5 to 10 minutes, or until lightly golden. ', u'Serve a small wedge of cheese on each toast with a dollop of chutney. Enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'2 pints cherry tomatoes', u'1 shallot, minced', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup malt vinegar', u'1/4 cup water', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 heaping teaspoon black or brown mustard seeds', u'1 heaping teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1 large wedge Tallegio cheese (about 10 to 12-ounces)', u'1 French baguette']
servings: 18 to 24 toasts (depending on size of baguette)
title: Tallegio Toasts with South Indian Tomato Chutney

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Spray a 4-quart slow cooker with cooking spray; set aside.', u'In a large mixing bowl, whisk together pudding mix, corn muffin mix, and 3 cups of milk until thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes; set aside.', u'In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients. Stir into pudding mixture until well combined. Transfer to slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 1 hour. Turn slow cooker to low and stir. Cover and continue cooking for 1 more hour. Stir, cover and cook for 1 hour more.', u'Serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'1 (3.4-ounce) box instant butterscotch pudding', u'1 (8.5-ounce) box instant corn muffin mix', u'3 cups milk', u'3 eggs, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup dark or robust molasses', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground ginger']
title: Indian Pudding

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Toss the shrimp with 1/2 teaspoon garam masala in a medium bowl; season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over high heat. Add the shrimp in a single layer and cook until the edges are golden, about 30 seconds per side. Remove to a plate with a slotted spoon; set aside.', u'Add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pot, then add the onion and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is lightly browned, 3 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste, the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons garam masala and the cilantro. Cook, stirring to coat, 30 seconds. Stir in 3 1/4 cups water and the potatoes. Cover, bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes, then uncover and add the cauliflower. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the cauliflower is tender, about 10 minutes.', u'Stir in the shrimp and peas; simmer 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Top each serving with more cilantro. Serve with the naan.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 teaspoons garam masala', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 onion, diced', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'3 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for topping', u'2 small russet potatoes (about 8 ounces each), peeled and diced', u'1 small head cauliflower, cut into florets (about 4 cups)', u'2 cups frozen peas, thawed', u'2 pieces naan or other flatbread, warmed and cut into wedges']
title: Indian Shrimp with Cauliflower

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add spices and cook until fragrant. Add yogurt, half-and-half, thawed spinach with its liquid, and drained chickpeas. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until heated through. ']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, diced', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon curry powder', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 cup whole milk plain yogurt', u'3/4 cup half-and-half', u'2 (10-ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed', u'1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed']
title: Indian Spinach and Chickpeas

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat the ghee in a medium Dutch oven over medium heat until it begins to shimmer.  Add the onion and cook until soft and lightly golden brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in the ginger, chile and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato paste, paprika, and garam masala and cook for 1 minute.  Add the tomatoes, honey, to taste, the chile de arbol or cayenne and 1/2 cup of water and cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.  ', u'Stir in the heavy cream, bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens.  Add the chicken to the sauce and cook for a few minutes, just to heat through. Serve over basmati rice pilaf with peas and garnish with cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons ghee or canola oil', u'1 medium yellow onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated', u'1 serrano chile, finely diced', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'2 teaspoons smoked Spanish paprika', u'2 teaspoons garam masala', u'1 (28-ounce) can plum tomatoes, pureed until smooth', u' Honey', u'1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon chile de arbol or cayenne powder (depending on how spicy you like it)', u'1/2 cup water', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup heavy cream', u' Chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 red onion, cut into thin rings and soaked in ice water', u'1 1/2 cups basmati rice', u'1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 1/4 teaspoons black mustard seeds', u'1/2 cup finely diced yellow onion', u'6 cardamom pods', u'4 whole cloves', u'1 (3-inch) cinnamon stick', u'2 1/4 cups simmering water', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', u'3/4 cup frozen green peas']
title: Masala Sauce

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-heat.  Add onions and garlic and cook until soft, about 4 to 5 minutes.  Add ginger and continue cooking for 2 minutes.  Add spices and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.  Add tomatoes and their juice, water, brown sugar, tamarind paste and serano and stir to combine.  Cook for 30 to 40 minutes, or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Remove  from heat, add cilantro and place in a food processor, process until smooth.   Season with salt and pepper, to taste.  Let cool.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large Spanish onion, coarsely chopped', u'6 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon cardamom', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 large can plum tomatoes and juices', u'1 cup water', u'1/4 cup light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons tamarind paste', u'1 serrano pepper, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup coarsely chopped cilantro', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'4 racks pork ribs (3 pounds each)', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Indian-Spiced Bbq Ribs

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Place butter in medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring butter to boil. This takes approximately 2 to 3 minutes. Once boiling, reduce heat to medium. The butter will form a foam which will disappear. Ghee is done when a second foam forms on top of butter, and the butter turns golden. Approximately 7 to 8 minutes. Brown milk solids will be in bottom of pan. Gently pour into heatproof container through fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth. Store in airtight container being sure to keep free from moisture. Ghee does not need refrigeration and will keep in airtight container for up to 1 month.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound butter']
servings: Slightly less than 1 pound of ghee
title: Ghee

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'For the marinade: In a large bowl, mix together the marinade ingredients. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Marinate at least 30 minutes, or in the refrigerator up to overnight.', u"For the sauce: When you're ready to make the curry, place a large skillet over medium heat and add the olive oil and butter. When the butter has melted, add the Ginger-Garlic Paste and serrano peppers. Saute until lightly browned around the edges. Add the tomato paste and cook until the tomato has darkened in color, about 3 minutes. Add the garam masala and the paprika and saute for about 1 minute to draw out their flavors.", u'Add the tomatoes, salt, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, turn down to a simmer, and cook until thickened, about 20 minutes. You may need more water depending on how much liquid the tomatoes give off.', u"Meanwhile, fire up your grill. When it is nice and hot, lightly brush it with oil. Place the chicken on the grill, shaking off some of the excess marinade. Cook until it's charred, about 2 minutes on each side. (Don't worry that the chicken will still be a little uncooked, it finishes cooking in the sauce).", u'Pour the sauce into a blender or food processor, or use an immersion blender, and process until smooth. Pour back into the skillet and bring back up to a boil. Add the chicken and fenugreek leaves, if using. Take the heat down to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the cream and stir through. Garnish with minced fresh cilantro, and serve over rice, with naan, or a crusty piece of bread!']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain yogurt, whisked until smooth', u'3 tablespoons Ginger-Garlic Paste, recipe follows (or 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger and 3 cloves garlic put through a garlic press or finely minced)', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, poked with a fork, and cut into large bite-sized chunks', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'1/3 cup Ginger-Garlic Paste, recipe follows (or 6 cloves garlic and 2-inch thumb ginger minced)', u"2 serrano peppers, minced (seeds removed if you don't want it spicy)", u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'2 teaspoons paprika', u'8 Roma tomatoes, diced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 to 2 cups water', u' Oil, for grilling', u'1 tablespoon dried fenugreek leaves (optional)', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u' Minced fresh cilantro, for garnish', u' Cooked rice, naan, or crusty piece of bread, for serving', u'1/2 cup cloves garlic, whole', u'1/2 cup fresh ginger, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch slices', u'1/4 cup canola oil']
title: Chicken in Creamy Tomato Curry: Chicken Tikka Masala

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Begin by making the sauce: Warm the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat, until it shimmers. Add the ginger, garlic and serrano pepper. Saute until the ginger and garlic brown a little. Add the garam masala and paprika and saute for 30 seconds. Stir in the tomato sauce and water.  Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, until thickened, about 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile for the turkey, in large skillet, warm 2 tablespoons of oil. When shimmering, add the pistachios and raisins. Cook until the raisins swell up and the pistachios toast slightly. Remove from the pan and set aside.  ', u'Return the pan to medium heat, add 1 to 2 more tablespoons of oil, and warm until shimmering. Add the cumin seeds and allow them to sizzle for about 10 seconds, or until some of the sizzling subsides.  Stir in the onions and bell pepper; saute until softened and starting to brown.  Add the serrano pepper. Saute for another couple of minutes, seasoning with a little salt. Stir in the turkey, breaking up the big lumps. Cook until opaque, about 5 minutes.  ', u'Meanwhile, your sauce should be ready.  Pour the sauce into the skillet with the turkey. Stir and bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until the mixture has thickened slightly, about 10 minutes.', u'Once the turkey is cooked and the sauce has thickened a little, remove the serrano pepper (unless you want to eat it whole, like my Dad does!). Add the honey, half-and-half, pistachios and raisins. Stir through and taste for seasoning. Before serving, garnish with fresh cilantro.', u'Toast the buns, fill with the turkey mixture and serve.  Eat (with your hands!) and enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 serrano chile, seeded and finely minced (save the other half for the turkey)', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1 (15-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'1 cup water', u'3 to 4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u' Small handful shelled pistachios, about 1/4 cup', u' Small handful raisins, about 1/4 cup', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 large white onion, finely diced', u'1 red bell pepper, seeds and membrane removed, finely diced', u"1/2 serrano chile, seeds intact (don't chop it up unless you like things spicy!)", u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound ground turkey', u'1/2 teaspoon honey', u'1/4 cup half-and-half', u' Small handful chopped fresh cilantro (soft stems included)', u'4 to 6 hamburger buns']
title: Sloppy Bombay Joes

directions: [u'Preheat the grill to 400 degrees F.', u'Heat the pan over medium-high heat and add the oil. Saute the garlic for 1 minute.', u'Add in the greens and saute until wilted. Add in the curry powder and continue to cook the greens until they start to get soft. Remove from heat and set aside.', u'Cut the dough into 2 (8-ounce) pieces. Stretch the dough out on a lightly floured surface with your hands. When the grill is at a consistent 400 to 450 degrees F (no hotter than 450), lightly brush the grill with olive oil. Place dough directly onto the grill surface. Close the grill cover and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. About 2 minutes in, open the grill and pop the air bubbles with a fork. The bottom should be brown with some charred spots but not burned or underdone. Close lid and continue cooking. Remove from grill and place on a work surface with the cooked/grilled side up.', u'Lower the heat on the grill to medium-low heat so that the cheese has time to melt and the bottom does not burn.', u'Spread equal amounts of the mozzarella and fontina on each pizza. Divide the cooked greens on top of the cheese. Place a few dollops of crumbled goat cheese over the top of the greens, then sprinkle with the crumbled paneer.', u'Lightly oil grill once more and carefully place pizzas, cheese side up, onto the grill.', u'Close the lid and let it cook slowly for another 5 to 10 minutes to allow the cheese to melt and so that the bottom does not burn. When the cheese is completely melted and the bottom is a nice even brown with some charred spots, remove from the grill to a cutting board, slice and serve.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 to 2 tablespoons canola oil', u'3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 large bunch greens, coarsely chopped (Swiss chard, spinach, or any combination - I used Swiss chard and removed the stems)', u'1 bunch fresh mustard greens, coarsely chopped', u'1 to 2 teaspoons hot curry powder (can use more, depends on how spicy you like it)', u' Homemade pizza dough or 1 (16-ounce) store-bought dough', u' Olive oil, for grill', u'8 ounces fresh mozzarella, shredded', u'3/4 cup shredded fontina cheese', u'1/2 cup goat cheese, crumbled', u'1/2 cup crumbled paneer']
title: White Pizza with Indian Spiced Greens

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F. Using 2 sheet trays, line 1 with a cooling rack and the other lined with parchment. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with a little olive oil, thyme leaves and salt and pepper, to taste. Put the potatoes on the sheet tray lined with the parchment. ', u'In a small bowl, combine the butter, ground cardamom, orange zest, ginger, salt and pepper, to taste. Stir together with a spoon until well mixed.', u"Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Poke a small opening in the clear membrane between the skin and the flesh of the chicken breast. Glide your index finger through the opening, loosening the skin from the flesh, without removing it completely. You're creating a big pocket in which the butter will sit! Repeat with the other chicken breasts. ", u"Put a spoonful of the butter mixture through the opening you made in the skin of the chicken breast. Once it's in there, smooth out the butter by gliding your finger over the skin, until it's evenly distributed. Repeat with the other breasts. Arrange the chicken breasts on the sheet tray lined with the cooling rack. Wash your hands thoroughly.", u'If you wish, drizzle the skin with a little oil, for extra crispy skin. Season with salt, to taste. Put the potatoes and the chicken into the oven, and roast, turning the pans once halfway through the cooking time and stirring the potatoes, about 30 minutes. Relax, sip a glass of wine, and bask in the crackling sounds of butter and comforting smell of the roasted chicken!', u'Chicken is ready when an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast, but not touching the bone, registers about 160 degrees F. Remove the pans from the oven and tent with foil. Allow them to rest about 5 minutes. Transfer the chicken and potatoes to a serving platter and serve.']
