ingredients: [u'1 pound small red new potatoes', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves stripped', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup butter, softened but not melted', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1 large orange, zested', u'2 teaspoons grated ginger', u'4 airline chicken breasts, on the bone, skin intact']
title: I Ain't Chicken Chicken: Crispy Roasted Chicken Breasts with Orange and Cardamom

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"Cook's Note: You should be able to find all of these at your friendly neighborhood Indian market, gourmet market or an online source.", u'Add the green cardamom seeds, cloves, black cardamom seeds and cinnamon sticks to a spice/coffee grinder and grind until fine. Store in an airtight container away from direct sunlight.', u"Most garam masalas contain cardamom, cinnamon, cloves and black peppercorns. Some folks add cumin and coriander, but I don't like the earthy flavour they add. And in fact, if you buy yours at the supermarket, it will not only contain cumin and coriander, it will also contain a bunch of other things. HOWEVER, it probably won't contain very much cardamom, cloves or cinnamon. That's because... those are the expensive ones! So what you're buying is a lot of stale filler!", u"I have nothing against it in a pinch, or if you're just starting out and don't know if this spice blend is for you... but if you can't find it at the supermarket, or if you're ready for the real thing, try my version. I don't use black peppercorns, but if you like, you can add a teaspoon or so. It doesn't take very long to make a batch; the only thing that's annoying about it is getting all the little black seeds out of the green cardamom pods. Use a pestle to crush the little beauties open, and discard the husks, or simply buy the seeds."]
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 2 tablespoons of seeds)', u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'4 large black cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 1 tablespoon of seeds), optional', u"3 large cinnamon sticks (if you have the kind you get at Indian stores, it's about 3 tablespoons of cinnamon bark bits)"]
title: Aarti's Hot (not heavy!) Homemade Garam Masala

directions: [u'Heat the cumin, garam masala and cardamom in a dry pan, over low heat, until fragrant, about 1 to 2 minutes. Add the onion powder and garlic then transfer the mixture to a bowl. Add the yogurt, paprika, curry powder, cilantro, salt and pepper.', u'Thread 4 cubes of lamb on each skewer, alternating with scallion pieces and leaving about 1/3 of the skewer as a handle. Arrange them in a shallow glass baking dish and pour the yogurt mixture over them, (turn to coat if needed). Allow to marinate for 1 hour to overnight, in the refrigerator. Brush the grill with an oiled paper towel and preheat it to medium-high. Arrange the skewers at angle for nice grill marks and grill 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium-rare, 5 to 6 minutes per side for medium. Transfer the skewers to a serving platter and garnish with lime wedges and cilantro.', u'Serve with basmati rice with cilantro or orzo with spinach and butter and a side of raita (yogurt sauce with vegetables), if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon cumin powder', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u' Seeds from 3 cardamom pods (1/2 teaspoon ground in mortar and pestle)', u'1 teaspoon onion powder', u'3 tablespoons bottled minced garlic or 8 cloves minced', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons sweet paprika', u'3 tablespoons Indian curry powder', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves, plus leaves for garnish', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt or Hawaiian sea salt', u'2 teaspoons cracked black pepper', u'1 pound boneless leg of lamb, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'4 wooden skewers (soaked for 2 hours in water) or 4 metal skewers', u'4 to 5 scallions, cut into 1-inch pieces', u' Basmati rice with cilantro (or orzo with spinach and butter), for serving', u' Lime wedges and a side of raita (yogurt sauce with vegetables), for serving']
title: Grilled Tandoori-Style Lamb Skewers

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Toss the chicken breasts in 1 cup tandoori marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to overnight.  ', u'In a saute pan, heat the vegetable oil, and cook the chicken for about 7 minutes per side, until cooked through. Alternately, you can also grill the chicken. Remove the chicken from the pan and pour the remaining 1 cup of marinade into the pan and bring to a gentle simmer. Stir in the honey and turn off the heat. Toss the salad greens with some olive oil, a squirt of lemon juice and salt, and pepper, to taste. Serve each chicken breast over a bed of greens and top with the heated tandoori sauce.', u'To make the Marinade:', u"Put the chiles, fenugreek seeds, coriander seeds, cloves, seeds from cardamom pods (Cook's Note: Crush the pods to open, remove the seeds and throw away the hulls.), paprika, and cinnamon in a saute pan over medium heat until fragrant and toasty, about 5 minutes. Stir to avoid burning. Pour the mixture into a coffee or spice grinder and grind to a fine powder.", u'Throw the garlic and ginger into a food processor or blender and pulse until finely minced, then add the yogurt, oil, and lime juice. Process the mixture until as smooth as possible. Add the spice powder and process again. Season the mixture with salt, and pepper, to taste. Keep the marinade in the refrigerator until ready to use. ', u"Cook's Note: If you are going to use the marinade immediately include the lime juice. If you are using the marinade at a later time, use lime zest instead so that the yogurt doesn't curdle."]
ingredients: [u'2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', u"2 cups Aarti's Tandoori Marinade, recipe follows, divided", u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'4 cups mixed salad greens', u' Olive oil, to taste', u' Lemon juice, to taste', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'2 chiles de arbol', u'3 tablespoons fenugreek seeds', u'1 tablespoon coriander seeds', u'5 cloves', u' Seeds from 4 green cardamom pods', u' Seeds from 1 black cardamom pod', u'3 tablespoons paprika', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'8 cloves garlic', u'1 (2-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled', u'4 cups plain yogurt (recommended: full fat)', u'1/2 cup peanut oil', u' Juice of 2 limes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Aarti's Easy Tandoori Chicken

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'In a medium pan, bring the water, all of the spices and the ginger to a boil over medium heat.  Turn off the heat and allow it to steep for 15 minutes.', u'Bring the mixture back to a boil, then add the tea.  Turn the heat off, and allow it to steep for 3 to 5 minutes depending on how strong you like your tea.  Stir in the honey and add milk to your liking.  Strain it into a bowl or pitcher and serve!']
ingredients: [u'2 cups water', u'1 (1-inch) piece cinnamon stick', u'4 green cardamom pods, smashed', u'4 whole cloves', u'1/2 star anise', u'2 quarter-sized coins fresh ginger', u'2 scant teaspoon black tea leaves (recommended: Taj Mahal) or black tea of choice', u'2 teaspoons honey, or more to taste', u' Whole milk or half-and-half']
title: Chai

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Peel and dice the mango and puree in the blender. Add the rest of the ingredients and puree until the ice is crushed and the drink is frothy. Serve in tall glasses with additional ice, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'2 ripe, sweet mangos', u'1 1/2 cup plain nonfat yogurt', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 cups ice (1 tray of ice)']
title: Mango Lassi

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Place all ingredients in a container with an airtight lid. Shake to combine. Store in a cool dry place for up to 6 months. When ready to use, grind and add to dishes according to taste.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons whole cumin seeds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons whole cardamom seeds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons whole coriander seeds, toasted', u'1/4 cup ground turmeric', u'1 tablespoon dry mustard', u'1 teaspoon cayenne']
title: Curry Powder Blend

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'To make the marinade, toast the cloves, whole chiles, both types of cardamom seeds, coriander seeds, fennel seeds and fenugreek seeds in a cast-iron skillet until fragrant, 3 minutes or so, shaking the pan. Then, pour the spices into a spice grinder and grind them until you get a fine powder.', u'In large bowl, whisk together the spice mixture you just made with the yogurt, oil, malt vinegar, salt, ground cinnamon, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, garlic and ginger until well combined. It should smell amazing! Taste and adjust with more salt if it needs it.', u"Reserve 1/3 cup of the marinade and set aside; you're going to make a sauce out of this reserved marinade.", u'Prick the chicken thighs with a fork. Add the thighs to the rest of the marinade, and toss to coat. Marinate at least 1 hour in the fridge, and at most overnight.', u"When you're ready to cook, line a baking sheet with foil, and turn your broiler on. Place each chicken thigh on the baking sheet, making sure each one is coated with the marinade, but isn't swimming in it. Cook the chicken thighs under the broiler until starting to blacken, about 5 minutes. Then turn the oven to 350, and cook until a meat thermometer inserted in the meatiest part of the thigh registers 160 degrees F, another 10 minutes. Remove from the oven.", u'While the chicken is cooking, pour the reserved marinade into a small saucepan, along with 1/2 cup water and the honey. Bring to a gentle boil over medium-low heat, whisking all the time. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Remove from the heat and pour into a small bowl or gravy boat for serving.', u'Serve the chicken thighs on a platter with a fresh squeeze of lime and a drizzle of the sauce.']
ingredients: [u'5 cloves', u"2 dried guajillo chiles (if you can't find these, then use 2 chiles de arbol, and more paprika for color)", u'2 green cardamom, husks discarded, seeds retained', u'1 black cardamom, husk discarded, seeds retained', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds', u'1 cup whole fat plain yogurt', u'1/4 cup peanut or canola oil', u'2 tablespoons malt vinegar or lime juice', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u' Pinch cayenne pepper', u'8 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 -inch thumb ginger, peeled and minced', u'1 packet boneless skinless chicken thighs (1 1/2 pounds usually)', u'1 teaspoon honey', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Couple of extra limes, for garnish']
title: Tandoori Chicken

directions: [u'Mix all dry ingredients together. Add 8 ounces of the warm water and mix just until blended. Add the remaining water, a little at a time, until a soft, but not sticky, dough develops. Cover and allow to rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.', u'Tear into 2-ounce balls and roll out flat to about 10 inches in diameter and 1/4-inch thick. Heat the corn oil in a heavy-bottomed pot or deep fryer to 350 degrees F. Gently place the pieces of dough in the corn oil and cook on each side until golden brown. ', u'When done, carefully remove the flat breads from the oil and drain on absorbent paper towels. ', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'13 ounces flour', u'2 tablespoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons dry milk powder', u'10 fluid ounces warm water', u' Corn oil, as needed']
title: Indian Flat Bread

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Whisk together the yogurt, spices, garlic and ginger in a large baking dish. Add the chicken and turn to coat in the mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours and up to 24 hours. ', u'Preheat the broiler. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper or aluminum foil and brush with some of the ghee.  Remove the chicken from the marinade, and wipe off excess marinade. Brush the breasts with ghee and season both sides with salt and pepper, to taste. Arrange on the baking sheet in an even layer. Broil until golden brown on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. ', u'Remove the chicken from the heat and to a cutting board.  Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes and cut it into 1-inch thick slices. Transfer the chicken to a platter and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups whole milk Greek yogurt', u'3 tablespoons ancho chili powder', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'2 teaspoons ground fennel', u'2 teaspoons ground turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1 teaspoon ground chile de arbol or cayenne powder', u'1 teaspoon ground black pepper, plus more for seasoning', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh ginger', u'6 boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u' Salt', u'1/2 cup melted ghee']
title: Chicken Tikka Masala

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"Make the cheese: Line a colander with a double layer of damp cheesecloth; put in the sink. Bring the milk to a simmer in a wide nonreactive pot over medium heat, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon. Remove from the heat and stir in the yogurt, lemon juice and 2 teaspoons salt. Continue to stir gently until large curds form and separate from the whey, 1 to 2 minutes. Strain through the cheesecloth-lined colander, discarding the whey. Gather the ends of the cheesecloth and twist to squeeze out any excess whey (run the sides of the bundle under cool water if it's too hot to handle). Tie the ends of the cheesecloth around a wooden spoon handle and lay the spoon over the colander, letting the bundle dangle; let drain, 10 minutes.", u'Untie the bundle and twist the cheesecloth again, squeezing out any more whey. Lay the bundle on its side on a plate. Top with another plate and weigh it down with a large can. Refrigerate until a firm cake forms, about 1 hour; unwrap and refrigerate in an airtight container until ready to use, or up to 2 days.', u'Fry the cheese: Cut the cheese into 3/4-inch cubes. Toss in the flour until well coated, shaking off any excess. Heat about 1/2 inch vegetable oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Carefully add the cheese and fry, turning occasionally, until golden brown, 2 to 4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Season lightly with salt and set aside.', u'Make the spinach: Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Working in batches, cook the spinach until just tender, about 30 seconds. Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a bowl of salted ice water. Drain and squeeze dry, then chop and set aside.', u'Pulse the ginger, garlic, jalapeno, coriander, cumin, turmeric and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a food processor until finely chopped. Whisk the yogurt, 1/4 cup water and 1 teaspoon salt in a small bowl.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons butter and the vegetable oil in a wide pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until deep golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add the ginger mixture and cook, stirring, until toasted, about 5 minutes (add a splash of water if the mixture is sticking). Reduce the heat to medium low; add 1/2 cup water and scrape up any browned bits, then add the cooked spinach and stir until heated through, about 4 minutes. Stir in the yogurt mixture and simmer gently until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Add the fried cheese and the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and cook, stirring, until heated through, about 1 minute. Season with salt.', u'Photograph by Anna Williams']
ingredients: [u'6 cups whole milk', u'1 cup plain 2 percent Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' Kosher salt', u'2 pounds baby spinach', u'1 2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and roughly chopped', u'4 cloves garlic', u'1/2 jalapeno pepper (seeded for less heat)', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'3/4 cup plain 2 percent Greek yogurt', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped']
title: Saag Paneer

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Line a plate with paper towels. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat. When the butter stops foaming, add the paneer cubes and brown well on 2 sides, about 4 minutes total. Remove to the lined plate and reserve. Wipe out the skillet with a paper towel.', u'Have a lid nearby for the skillet. Add another 2 tablespoons butter to the skillet over medium-high heat, then add the onion and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until the onion is browned and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger, curry powder and garam masala and stir together, 1 minute. Add the grated tomato and stir for another minute. Add the chopped spinach, heavy cream, 1/4 cup water, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and a few grinds of pepper. Cover and cook over medium-low, 8 minutes. Add the remaining tablespoon butter and carefully fold in the paneer cubes. Simmer for an additional 2 minutes to warm the paneer through.', u'Serve with steamed basmati rice or Indian flatbread.', u'Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'8 ounces store-bought paneer or queso fresco, cut into 3/4-inch cubes', u'1 medium yellow onion, diced small', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'5 cloves garlic, finely grated', u'2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and finely grated', u'3/4 teaspoon curry powder', u'3/4 teaspoon garam masala', u'1 large tomato, about 8 ounces, halved and grated on the large holes of a box grater', u'2 boxes (10 ounces each) frozen chopped spinach, defrosted and drained', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u' Serving suggestion: steamed basmati rice or Indian flatbread']
title: Shortcut Palak Paneer

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Remove from the heat, add the tea bags and let steep for 5 minutes. Remove the bags, stir in the milk and honey and chill in a pitcher for at least 1 hour. Serve over ice.']
ingredients: [u'8 chai tea bags', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/3 cup honey', u' Ice cubes']
title: Chai Ice Tea

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'Preheat a cast-iron grill pan over medium-high heat.', u'Add the coriander, cumin, fennel, fenugreek and mustard seeds to a spice grinder and pulse to a powder; transfer to a medium bowl and stir in the salt. Reserve a pinch for the vegetable stew.', u'Toss the lamb with the remaining spice mixture to coat, then thread onto skewers. Coat the pan with olive oil. Sear the skewers on all sides until the lamb is cooked to the desired doneness. Remove from the heat and serve with Roasted Vegetable Stew and Frizzled Brussels.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds, toasted', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds, toasted', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds, toasted', u'1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds, toasted', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds, toasted', u'2 teaspoons salt', u' Half a lamb loin, cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks', u' Olive oil, for coating the pan', u' Roasted Vegetable Stew, recipe follows', u' Frizzled Brussels, recipe follows', u'1/2 eggplant (the bottom half), partially peeled, cut into 1-inch pieces', u' Olive oil', u' Salt', u' Crushed red pepper', u'1/4 head cauliflower, cut into bite-size pieces', u'1/2 onion, sliced', u'1/2 bulb fennel, cut into julienne strips', u'4 plum tomatoes, coarsely chopped', u' Half a 15.5-ounce can chickpeas', u'1/2 cup vegetable stock, or more as necessary', u'2 curry leaves', u'1 teaspoon ground asafetida', u'1/2 teaspoon nigella seeds', u' Pinch Indian Spice Blend, see above', u'2 to 4 Brussels sprouts, separated into leaves', u' Olive oil', u' Pinch salt', u' Small pinch nigella seeds']
title: Lamb Loin with Indian Spice Blend and Roasted Vegetable Stew with Frizzled Brussels

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Make the sauce: Heat the vegetable oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the ginger, garlic and chile pepper and cook until the ginger and garlic brown a little, about 1 minute. Add the garam masala and paprika and cook 30 seconds. Add the tomato sauce and 1 cup water, stir and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, prepare the sloppy joes: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the raisins and pistachios and cook, stirring occasionally, until the raisins swell up and the pistachios toast slightly, about 1 minute. Remove from the skillet and set aside.', u'Return the skillet to medium heat and add the remaining 1 to 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. Add the cumin seeds and let sizzle about 10 seconds, then add the onion and bell pepper and cook until softened and starting to brown, about 5 minutes. Add the chile pepper and cook 2 more minutes, seasoning with salt. Add the turkey, breaking up the big lumps, and cook until opaque, about 5 minutes.', u'Add the prepared sauce to the turkey-and-onion mixture in the skillet. Stir and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until the mixture thickens slightly, about 10 minutes.', u'Remove the whole chile pepper (unless you want to eat it, like my dad does!) and stir in the honey, half-and-half, raisins and pistachios. Taste for seasoning. Stir in the cilantro right before serving.', u'Toast the buns and fill with the sloppy joe mixture. Eat with your hands!']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 serrano chile pepper, seeded and minced', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1 15 -ounce can tomato sauce', u'3 to 4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u' Small handful (about 1/4 cup) raisins', u' Small handful (about 1/4 cup) shelled pistachios', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1 large white onion, finely diced', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and finely diced', u"1 serrano chile pepper (don't chop it unless you like things spicy!)", u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound ground turkey', u'1/2 teaspoon honey', u'1/4 cup half-and-half', u' Small handful fresh cilantro (soft stems included)', u'4 sesame buns']
title: Bombay Sloppy Joes

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Remove the prawn heads. In a medium saucepot, bring the prawn heads, shells and 5 cups of water to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer 20 minutes. ', u'Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onions, garlic, ginger, and jalapeno, and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 8 to 10 minutes.', u'While the vegetables cook, break the arbol chiles and ancho chile into pieces (remove the seeds, if you prefer less heat and spice), then grind in a spice grinder to a fine powder. Set aside. ', u'Crush the tomatoes with your hands. ', u"Add the turmeric, garam masala, and 2 teaspoons of the ground chile powder to the skillet. Reserve the remaining chile powder for another use. Saute the mixture for 30 seconds, then add the crushed tomatoes and 1/4 cup of the reserved tomato juice. Cook the mixture, stirring, until thickened and most of liquid is cooked out. Cook's Note: This sweetens the tomatoes and helps bring all the flavors together.", u'Strain the prawn shells from the water and discard the shells. The water is now a prawn stock. Add 2 cups of the prawn stock to the tomato mixture and bring the mixture to a simmer. The remaining prawn stock can be cooled and frozen for future use. Simmer the tomato mixture, uncovered, for 10 minutes. ', u'Add the prawns to the skillet and cook, stirring gently, until just cooked through, about 4 minutes. Reduce the heat to low, then add the heavy cream and fresh dill. Let the mixture simmer, for 2 minutes more, stirring gently. Season with salt, and pepper, to taste. Serve the masala with warm naan.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound large head-on prawns, shelled, deveined, heads and shells reserved', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large red onion, diced', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'1 small jalapeno, seeded and finely chopped', u'2 dried arbol chile, stemmed', u'1 dried ancho chile, stemmed', u'1 (14-ounce) can peeled tomatoes in juice, drained, liquid reserved', u'3/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon garam masala', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill', u' Naan bread, for serving']
title: South o' the Border Prawn Masala

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'In large bowl, mix the yogurt, ginger, garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Poke chicken with a fork, then add to marinade. Fold to cover and marinate at least 30 minutes, at most refrigerated overnight.', u'For the sauce:', u"When you're ready to make the curry, place a large skillet over medium heat, and add the butter and olive oil. When butter has melted, add the garlic, ginger, and serrano pepper. Saute until lightly browned around the edges.", u'Add the tomato paste and cook until the tomato has darkened in colour, about 3 minutes. Add the paprika and garam masala, and saute for about 1 minute to draw out their flavours.', u'Add the tomatoes, salt, and water. Bring to a boil, then turn down the heat to a simmer, and cover. Cook for 20 minutes. Take the pan off the fire, and allow the sauce to cool for 5 minutes.', u"Meanwhile, fire up your broiler, and cover your broiler pan in foil. Pull the chicken thigh chunks out of the marinade and place on the sheet. Place under the broiler, and cook about 7 minutes on each side, until charred and cooked through. Cook's Note: Don't worry if the chicken is still a little uncooked, but very charred on the outside; you can finish cooking the chicken in the sauce.", u'Pour sauce into a blender or food processor, and process until smooth. Pour back into the pan, and bring back up to a boil. Add the chicken and fenugreek leaves, if using. Reduce heat to a simmer, and cook, covered, for about 10 minutes.', u'Add cream and stir through. Garnish with minced fresh cilantro if you like, and serve over rice, with naan or a crusty piece of bread!']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain yogurt, whisked until smooth', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, put through a garlic press or finely minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into large bite-size chunks', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'6 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 -inch thumb ginger, peeled and minced', u"2 serrano pepper, minced (seeds removed if you don't want it spicy)", u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'2 teaspoons paprika', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'8 Roma tomatoes, diced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'2 cups water', u'1 tablespoon dried fenugreek leaves, optional', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, minced', u' Serving suggestion: Cooked rice, warm naan bread or crusty bread.']
title: Chicken in Creamy Tomato Curry: Chicken Tikka Masala

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over high heat. Arrange the chicken thighs and legs on a tray in a single layer and season them with salt, to taste. Turn the pieces on their other side and season again. When the oil begins to smoke lightly, carefully add the chicken to the oil. Do not overcrowd the pan. Resist the temptation to move or turn the pieces. Allow them to brown on their first side, about 3 to 5 minutes. Use metal tongs to turn the chicken pieces to sear their second side, about 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a tray and set it aside.', u"In the same skillet, add the cumin seeds and chili flakes, stirring rapidly to give them a quick toast, about 10 to 15 seconds. Add the onions, ginger and garlic and stir to combine. Season the ingredients with salt, to taste, then add the tomatoes, cinnamon, and bay leaves. Allow the mixture to cook and all the flavors to come together, about 10 minutes.  Add the chicken back to the pan, keep the heat low and continue cooking until the chicken is cooked through, 30 to 45 minutes. (Chef's note: If the sauce becomes overly thick or begins to stick to the bottom of the skillet, feel free to add some water, about 1/2 cup at a time.)", u'When the chicken is cooked through, remove and discard the cinnamon sticks and bay leaves. Taste for seasoning and transfer to a serving bowl. Serve alongside the braised cabbage, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons canola oil', u'6 chicken thighs', u'6 chicken legs', u' Kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon whole cumin seeds', u'2 teaspoons chili flakes', u'1 large white onion, peeled, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 large ginger knob, peeled and grated', u'6 garlic cloves, peeled and halved lengthwise', u'1 (28-ounce) can whole, peeled tomatoes', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'4 fresh or dried bay leaves', u' Water, as needed']
title: Braised Chicken Thighs and Legs with Tomato

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u"Cut the mango flesh away from the pit. The pit is shaped similar to an obelisk, so you'll end up with 2 large pieces and 2 smaller pieces from each mango. Roughly chop the flesh.", u'In a saute pan heat the oil and add the chile flakes. Be careful not to burn the chile, just toast to flavor the oil. Add the onions and sweat until soft. Add the ginger and bell pepper and saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Finally add the mango and cook for 1 more minute.', u'In a separate bowl, combine the pineapple juice, vinegar, sugar, and curry powder. Add this mixture to the pan. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a bare simmer and reduce for about 30 minutes, stirring frequently. Season with salt and pepper. Add the raisins and the nuts and transfer to another container over an ice bath. I used a mild yellow curry powder, but if you want it hotter go for red.']
ingredients: [u'4 pounds fresh mangos, ripe but not too soft, peeled', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon chile flakes', u'2 1/2 cups medium dice red onion', u'1/4 cup minced fresh ginger', u'1 cup small dice red bell pepper', u'8 ounces unsweetened pineapple juice', u'4 ounces cider vinegar', u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons curry powder', u' Kosher salt and fresh ground white pepper', u'1/2 cup raisins or golden raisins', u'1/2 cup toasted, roughly chopped macadamia nuts']
title: Mango Chutney

author: Jamie Oliver
directions: [u'Put all the ingredients into a blender and blend for 2 minutes, then pour into individual glasses, and serve. Feel free to try salt and cardamom seeds. The lassi can be kept refrigerated for up to 24 hours']
ingredients: [u'9 fluid ounces (255 milliliters) plain yogurt', u'4 1/2 fluid ounces (130 milliliters) milk', u'4 1/2 fluid ounces (130 milliliters) canned mango pulp or 7 ounces (200 grams) from 3 fresh mango, stoned and sliced', u'4 teaspoons sugar, to taste, or feel free to try salt and cardamom seeds']
title: Mango Lassi

directions: [u'Preheat the grill to 400 degrees F.', u'Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until just translucent, about 2 minutes, Add in the chile, garlic and the garam masala, stirring constantly for a minute or so until the mixture becomes fragrant. Add the tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes have softened slightly, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer to a bowl. Stir in the lime juice and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper, to taste, and mix until well combined. Reserve.', u'Cut the dough into 2 (8-ounce) pieces. Stretch the dough out on a lightly floured surface with your hands. When topping is ready and grill is at a consistent 400 to 450 degrees F (no hotter than 450), lightly brush the grill with olive oil. Place dough directly onto the grill surface. Close the grill cover and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. About 2 minutes in, open the grill and pop the air bubbles with a fork. The bottom should be brown with some charred spots but not burned or underdone. Close lid and continue cooking. Remove from grill and place on a work surface with the cooked/grilled side up.', u'Lower the heat on the grill to medium-low so that the cheese has time to melt and the bottom does not burn.', u'Spread half of the tomato mixture on each pizza, then evenly divide the cheese over the tomato mixture.', u'Lightly oil the grill once more and carefully place the pizzas, tomato/cheese side up, onto the grill.', u'Close the lid and let it cook slowly for another 5 to 10 minutes to allow the cheese to melt and so that the bottom does not burn. When the cheese is completely melted and the bottom is a nice even brown with some charred spots, remove from the grill to a cutting board, slice and serve.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 to 2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 cup finely chopped white onion', u'2 to 3 serrano chiles with seeds, sliced (can use more depends on how spicy you want it)', u'2 cloves finely chopped garlic (about 2 teaspoons)', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'2 cups grape tomatoes or other, coarsely chopped and seeded', u'1 to 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped cilantro leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Homemade pizza dough or 1 (16-ounce) store-bought dough', u' Olive oil, for grill', u'8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, shredded']
title: Indian Spiced Tomato Margherita Pizza

directions: [u'Heat a dry small skillet over moderately high heat until it is hot and in it toast the spices in batches if necessary, stirring frequently and covering the skillet when the mustard seeds begin to pop, for 2 to 3 minutes, or until they are several shades darker and fragrant, being careful not to let them burn. In a mortar with a pestle or in an electric coffee grinder grind the toasted spices to a powder and transfer the powder to a jar with a tight-fitting lid. The garam masala keeps, covered and chilled, for 1 month']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'1 tablespoon cuminseed', u' Seeds from 10 cardamom pods', u'2 teaspoons mustard seeds', u'2 teaspoons fenugreek', u'2 teaspoons black peppercorns', u'1 heaping teaspoon whole cloves', u'3 -inch cinnamon stick, broken in half']
title: Garam Masala North Indian Dried Spice Mixture

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. ', u'Put half the milk into a saucepan over low heat. Whisk in the cornmeal and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, stir, and cook the cornmeal for 15 minutes over a very low flame. Stir frequently to keep smooth. ', u'Combine the syrup, molasses, rum and spices in a small bowl to ensure even distribution of flavorings throughout the pudding. ', u'Stir the butter into the cornmeal, add the remaining ingredients, trying to combine as uniformly as possible. Pour the pudding into a buttered 3 quart baking dish, pour the remainder of the cold milk on top of the pudding and bake for 1 1/2 hours. Allow to cool and it will set up and tighten.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups whole milk', u'1 cup yellow cornmeal', u'1/2 cup maple syrup', u'1/2 cup molasses', u"1/4 cup dark Meyer's rum", u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground ginger', u'8 tablespoons butter', u'1 teaspoon salt']
title: Indian Pudding

directions: [u'Scrub the potatoes and bake them in a 400 degree oven for one hour or until done. ', u'While the potatoes are baking, prepare the filling. Saute the onion and carrots in the oil or ghee until they are tender, for about 10 minutes. Add the bell pepper and spices and continue to saute for another minute or two, stirring. Add a little water to the pan to prevent sticking, cover it, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the bell pepper is just tender. Stir in the cream cheese and add salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. ', u'When the potatoes are baked and cool enough to handle, make a lengthwise cut in the top of each one and scoop out a least half of the contents. If you are using large potatoes, cut them in half lengthwise and scoop them out, leaving about 1/2 inch of potato clinging to the skin. Mash the scoopedout potato and then add it to the vegetablecream cheese mixture. Lower the oven heat to 350 degrees. Fill the potato shells with this mixture and place them in an oiled baking dish. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. ', u'Serve topped with Spicy Yogurt Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'4 medium or 2 large baking potatoes', u'1 cup chopped onions', u'3/4 cup diced carrots', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil or ghee', u'3/4 cup chopped red or green bell pepper (1 medium)', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom', u' Pinch of ground cloves', u'4 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', u' Spicy Yogurt Sauce (see below)']
title: North Indian Baked Stuffed Potatoes

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Make the shrikhand: Line a large bowl with a double layer of cheesecloth. Pour the yogurt onto the cheesecloth, gather the corners of the cloth and tie into a bundle. Then tie the bundle onto a wooden spoon. Lay the spoon across the top of a pot so the bundle hangs in the pot; drain in the refrigerator overnight.', u"Empty the thickened yogurt into a bowl; whisk until very smooth. Stir in 1/2 cup superfine sugar, the cardamom, nutmeg and saffron (if using). Taste and add more sugar, if desired. Shrikhand is supposed to be slightly tart. If it's not, add some or all of the sour cream.", u'Stir most of the raisins and pistachios into the shrikhand; sprinkle the remainder on top. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour.', u'Make the pooris: Mix the flour and salt in a large bowl. Rub 1 tablespoon vegetable oil into the flour; make a well in the center and gradually pour in 2/3 cup water. Mix with your hands until the dough forms a ball, then knead on a clean surface until smooth but still slightly tacky, about 5 minutes. Cover with a damp cloth and let rest, 30 minutes.', u'Divide the dough in half; roll each portion into a 1/16-inch-thick round. Cut out about 20 circles using a 2 1/2-inch round cookie cutter.', u'Heat 2 inches vegetable oil in a large saucepan until a deep-fry thermometer registers 350 degrees F. Line a colander with paper towels. Fry the pooris in batches until golden brown, 1 minute per side. Remove with a slotted spoon; drain in the colander. Serve the hot pooris with the cold shrikhand.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'6 cups whole-milk Greek yogurt', u'1/2 to 3/4 cup superfine sugar', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u' Pinch of saffron threads (optional)', u'1/2 cup sour cream (optional)', u'1/4 cup golden raisins', u'1/4 cup chopped pistachios', u'2 cups whole-wheat flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil, plus more for deep-frying']
title: Shrikhand and Pooris

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine the yogurt, herbs, cucumber, lime zest and juice. Season with salt and pepper.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups whole-milk Greek yogurt', u' Zest and juice of 1 lime', u'1 English cucumber, quartered lengthwise and chopped into 1/4-inch-thick pieces', u'3 tablespoons chopped cilantro', u'3 tablespoons chopped mint', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Cucumber Raita

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Special Equipment:  Chimney starter, newspaper, vegetable oil, 4 pounds natural lump charcoal, and metal skewers', u'Combine 1 tablespoon of the garam masala, 1 teaspoon of the salt, cumin, coriander, and pepper in a 1-gallon resealable bag. Seal and shake the bag to combine.  Add the lamb and shake to coat.  Add the yogurt to the bag, seal and squish to coat. Refrigerate the bag in a leak proof container for 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.', u'Spritz 4 to 5 pieces of newspaper with vegetable oil and put in the bottom of a charcoal chimney starter.  Fill the chimney with half of the charcoal and light the newspaper.', u'When the charcoal is lightly covered with gray ash, carefully pour it onto the bottom grate of a kettle grill and spread evenly.  Top with the remaining unlit charcoal, spreading evenly so as not to suffocate the lit charcoal.  Set the second grate in the kettle and cover until ready to cook.', u'Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a 12-inch straight sided saute pan over medium-high, until it shimmers and almost begins to smoke.  Add the onion and remaining teaspoon of salt, and cook until the onion is browned around the edges, 11 to 12 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the garlic, ginger and chile. Cook, stirring constantly, until the onions have softened and browned completely, approximately 7 minutes.  Sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of garam masala and stir several times to coat.', u'Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until they have reduced slightly and deepened in color, 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Remove the lamb from the yogurt mixture, leaving as much yogurt on the meat as possible.  Thread the pieces of lamb, 1/4-inch apart, onto the skewers. Grill until the yogurt has slightly charred or blackened, about 2 minutes on each side.  Remove the lamb from the skewers.  Add the lamb and coconut milk to the tomato mixture and stir to combine and heat through.  Transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with mint or cilantro and serve over basmati rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons garam masala, divided, recipe follows', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted, ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted, ground coriander', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds lamb leg sirloin, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 cup plain whole milk yogurt', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 medium serrano chile, seeded and minced', u'1 (28-ounce) can diced tomatoes', u'1 cup coconut milk', u' Fresh mint or cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons cardamom seeds', u'2 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds', u'1 tablespoon brown mustard seeds', u'2 tablespoons black peppercorns', u'20 cloves', u'1 dried arbol chile stemmed, seeded and crumbled', u'1 (2 1/2-inch) cinnamon stick, broken in 1/2', u'1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg']
title: Lamb Tikka Masala

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'For the raita: Mix the cucumber, mint, garlic, and yogurt together in a large bowl with plenty of salt and pepper, to taste. Cover and chill.', u'For the potatoes: Fill a large pot with cool water and put over high heat. Add the potatoes and a hefty dose of salt. Bring to a boil, and then simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Once the potatoes are cooked, drain and push them through a potato ricer. Heat the canola oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Once shimmering, add the panch puran seasoning. Cook the seasoning blend until fragrant and the spices begin to pop, about 30 seconds. Add the onion and saute until tender and lightly browned. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the potatoes and flatten them with a spatula, cook about 5 minutes, stirring and flattening a few times, until the bottom gets a little crispy. Season the potatoes with salt, and pepper, to taste, and keep warm until ready to serve. ', u"Meanwhile, in a food processor, combine the parsley, mint, shallot, lemon zest, and garlic and pulse until finely minced. Add the mixture to a bowl with the ground lamb, baking soda and lots of salt and pepper, to taste. Knead until the mixture turns sticky, looks like a piece of knitted fabric, and holds its shape. Pull off a small ball of meat and shape into a fat cylinder. Thread a skewer through the middle lengthwise, and smooth the meat down the skewer until it's even all the way down. Repeat with rest of the meat mixture. Put the kebabs on an oiled baking sheet and drizzle with a little more oil. Combine the pomegranate molasses, lemon juice and mustard in a small bowl. Set aside.", u'Light a grill or heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.', u'Arrange the kebabs on the hot grill, turning every 2 to 3 minutes, generously brushing with the pomegranate mixture. Cook the kebabs until browned, about 6 minutes.', u'Transfer the kebabs to a serving platter and serve with the potatoes and raita on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 Persian cucumbers, sliced 1/4-inch thick (about 1 1/4 cups)', u'6 sprigs fresh mint, leaves picked and minced (about 1/4 cup)', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 cup Greek yogurt', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound new potatoes', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoons panch puran spice blend or Bengali five spice blend*', u'1 medium red onion, thinly sliced', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian and Indian markets.', u'1/2 bunch fresh parsley, leaves picked (about 2 cups)', u'4 sprigs fresh mint, leaves picked (about 1 cup)', u'1 shallot, roughly chopped', u' Zest and juice of 1 Meyer lemon', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Olive oil, for greasing and drizzling', u'2 tablespoons pomegranate molasses*', u'1 teaspoon stone-ground mustard', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian and Indian markets', u' Special Equipment: 12 (10-inch) bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes']
title: Ground Lamb Kofto Kebabs with Pomegranate Glaze, Bengali-Spiced Potatoes and Persian Cucumber Raita

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place all of the ingredients, except for the turmeric and ground red pepper in a saute pan, over medium heat. Cook until dark toasted, about 12 minutes. Remove and cool. Place the toasted ingredients in a spice grinder and process to powder consistency. Add the turmeric and red pepper. Mix well.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'2 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'1 teaspoons fenugreek seeds', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1 teaspoon yellow mustard seeds', u'2 teaspoons white peppercorns', u'6 whole cloves', u'2 tablespoons turmeric', u'2 teaspoons ground red pepper']
title: Yellow Curry Powder

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Mix 1 teaspoon each ground ginger, paprika and ground coriander with 1/2 teaspoon each ground cumin and turmeric. Brush 4 ears of corn with vegetable oil, sprinkle with the spices and grill, turning, about 12 minutes; season with salt. Serve with yogurt mixed with salt and cilantro. ', u'Photograph by Kate Sears']
title: Curried Corn

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'Preheat a grill to high. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne, salt, pepper, to taste, lemon juice, lemon zest, yogurt, garlic and ginger root until well incorporated. Add chicken and evenly cover with marinade. Cover with plastic wrap refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. ', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade and put on the grill. Cook for 6 to 7 minutes on each side, turning frequently. Baste with remaining marinade while cooking. Lower heat to low and cover with grill lid. Continue to cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 18 to 20 minutes. Put the grits on a serving platter. Remove the chicken from the grill and serve on top of the grits. ', u'Grits:', u'In a heavy-bottomed large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the butter. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the milk and cream and bring to a boil. Whisk in the grits, then lower the heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until thick and tender, about 35 to 40 minutes. Add the Parmesan, lemon juice, salt, pepper and chives. Stir well. Keep warm until ready to use.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon smoked paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cayenne', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 lemon, zested and juiced', u'1/2 cup yogurt', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger root', u'1 (3 to 4 pound) chicken, cut into 8 pieces', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1/2 onion, diced', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 1/2 cups milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup stone-ground white corn grits', u'1/2 cup grated Parmesan', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon cracked black pepper', u'3 tablespoons chopped chives']
title: Big Daddy's Tandoori Chicken

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 300 degrees F.', u'Place milk in a saucepan and slowly sprinkle the cornmeal over it and whisk in. Cook on medium heat for 20 minutes, whisking occasionally to make sure it\'s not burning or sticking on the bottom of the pan. Whisk in the molasses, salt, ginger or lemon, and butter and pour into an 8-cup buttered casserole (or "pudding") dish. Bake for 1 1/2 to 2 hours until set. Serve with cream, whipped or poured.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups milk', u'1/3 cup yellow cornmeal', u'1/2 cup molasses or 1/4 cup molasses plus 1/4 cup dark corn syrup', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon grated ginger or lemon rind', u'1 tablespoon butter', u' Cream, as an accompaniment']
title: Indian Pudding

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.  Add onions and garlic and cook until soft, about 4 to 5 minutes.  Add ginger and continue cooking for 2 minutes.  Add spices and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.  Add tomatoes and their juice, water, brown sugar, tamarind paste and serrano and stir to combine.  Cook for 30 to 40 minutes, or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat, add cilantro and place in a food processor, process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.  Let cool.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large Spanish onion, coarsely chopped', u'6 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon cardamom', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 large can plum tomatoes and juices', u'1 cup water', u'1/4 cup light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons tamarind paste', u'1 serrano pepper, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup coarsely chopped cilantro', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'4 racks pork ribs (3 pounds each)', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Indian-Spiced Bbq Ribs

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Bring water to a boil, turn off heat add tea bags and steep until tea is dark, about 5 minutes. Remove bags, add mango nectar and add sugar, to taste. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Place in pitcher and add mint leaves. Pour over ice and garnish with mango slices.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 quarts cold water', u'6 high quality black tea bags', u'2 cups mango nectar', u' Sugar', u'1/4 cup fresh mint leaves', u' Thinly sliced mango']
title: Mango Iced Tea

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'For the marinade and chicken: In a bowl, blend the yogurt, lemon juice, cayenne, cumin, gingers, cinnamon, salt as needed and pepper. Once well mixed, add the chicken and allow the meat to marinate for at least 30 minutes. Do not over marinate.', u'For the sauce: Melt the butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Saute the garlic and jalapeno for 1 minute. Season with cumin, salt and paprika. Stir in the tomato puree, heavy cream and sour cream. Simmer on low heat until the sauce thickens, about 20 minutes.', u'Prepare a grill to medium-high heat.', u'Thread the chicken on the skewers. Grill the chicken on the first side for 3 to 4 minutes, then flip and repeat cooking on the second side. Once cooked on the second side, brush both sides with the prepared sauce. Allow the sauce to warm and then serve, garnishing with greens of choice.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon ginger juice', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u' Salt', u'1 teaspoon white pepper', u'2 pounds chicken, breasts and thighs, diced small', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons jalapeno or Scotch bonnet pepper, seeded and finely diced', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon sea salt or kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon smoked paprika', u'2 cups tomato puree', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup sour cream', u' Chopped green onions and cilantro, for garnish', u' Special equipment: fourteen to sixteen 6-inch skewers']
title: Chicken Tikka Masala

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut chicken into 1 inch cubes. In large skillet saute chicken in oil and butter until golden brown. Remove to plate and cover with tin foil. In same skillet add onion and saute until soft. Add carrots and stir. Add curry, cinnamon and cumin. Stir to coat. Add flour, stir, and let cook for 30 seconds. Add stock and stir until thick. Return chicken to the skillet and simmer until carrots are tender, about 20 minutes. Add peas and cream. Stir well and cook until hot. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over rice', u'For the rice: Cook Basmati rice according to package directions']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds chicken, boneless and skinless', u'2 teaspoons cumin', u'4 teaspoons flour', u'2 tablespoons oil', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 cup frozen peas, thawed', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'2 carrots, peeled and sliced on diagonal', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'1 1/2 tablespoons curry powder', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon']
title: Chicken Curry

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.', u'In a small saucepan, combine the tomato paste, mango chutney, minced garlic, and water over medium heat, until well combined. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes and then remove the saucepan from the heat and set aside.', u'In a small bowl, combine the mozzarella, paneer, red pepper flakes, cilantro, green onion, ground cumin and extra-virgin olive oil. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Add more red pepper flakes if you like it spicy!', u'Arrange the naans on a cookie sheet. Divide the tomato-mango chutney sauce evenly among the naans, spreading to coat the top. Evenly divide the cheese mixture among the naans. Throw in the oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until crisped around the edges. ', u'Meanwhile, tear the prosciutto into small pieces. When the pizzas are ready, top them with the fresh prosciutto. Cut each naan into 4, and serve!']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup tomato paste', u"2 tablespoons sweet mango chutney (recommended: Patak's Sweet Mango Chutney)", u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1/2 cup water', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese', u'1/2 cup crumbled paneer cheese*', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 large green onion, finely chopped', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cumin', u' A glug extra-virgin olive oil', u"4 frozen naan bread (recommended: Trader Joe's)*", u'4 slices prosciutto, torn', u' *Can be found at specialty Indian markets.']
title: Mango Chutney, Prosciutto and Paneer "Pizza"

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'For the spice blend: Combine the turmeric, coriander, cumin, paprika, dry mustard, cardamom and cinnamon.', u'For the chicken: Place the chicken (except for the wings) in a shallow dish and dress with half the spice blend, the garlic, lime juice and some salt and pepper. Cover and let marinate for 1 hour.', u'Place the chicken wings in a small pot, cover with water and season with salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a low simmer and poach for 30 minutes.', u'For the vindaloo: Heat the vegetable oil in a large, deep skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, bay leaves, chile pepper, ginger, onions and the remaining curry spice blend. Season with salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until softened, 7 to 8 minutes. Add the tomatoes and about 1 cup of the wing stock and bring to boil. Slide in the chicken and partially cover with the lid or foil, allowing some steam to escape. Reduce the heat to a simmer and poach the chicken in the sauce, about 30 minutes.', u'For serving: Meanwhile, prepare the rice according to the package directions. Heat the naan on a griddle pan with a splash of water, then brush with melted butter.', u'Serve the vindaloo with choice of garnishes over the rice, and the naan on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1 rounded tablespoon ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons hot paprika', u'1 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 whole chicken, cut up into thighs, legs, wings and 2 pieces of breast, skin removed except for the wings', u'2 to 3 large cloves garlic, finely chopped', u' Juice of 2 limes', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons vegetable or peanut oil', u'4 large cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 fresh bay leaves', u'1 Fresno or other moderate-heat red chile pepper, seeded and finely chopped', u' One 2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated or minced', u'1 onion, chopped', u' Salt', u'1 can petite diced tomatoes', u'1 1/2 cups jasmine rice', u' Naan bread and melted butter, for brushing', u' Chopped toasted peanuts or almonds', u' Chopped fresh mint', u' Chopped fresh cilantro', u' Lime wedges']
title: Vindaloo for Chicken or Lamb

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'For the chicken and marinade: Sprinkle the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Combine the yogurt with the paprika, coriander, cumin, cayenne, lemon zest, cinnamon, garlic and ginger in a mixing bowl. Mix together well then pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add chicken pieces and shake around to coat all the pieces evenly. Place in the refrigerator and marinate for 1 hour.', u'Heat a grill to high. Wipe down the grates with an oil-blotted paper towel to create a nonstick surface. Remove the chicken from the marinade and wipe off any excess. Grill the chicken pieces until well-marked, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove to a plate and set aside.', u'For the sauce: Set a Dutch oven over medium heat. (Alternatively, you can cook in a pressure cooker. Simply cut the cooking time in half and cook over medium heat with medium pressure.) Coat with the  oil and add the butter. Add the garlic and onions. Cook until translucent and fragrant, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the tomato paste, paprika and garam masala. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes to toast the spices and cook the tomato paste. Add the crushed tomatoes, vinegar and grilled chicken pieces. Stir well and simmer until the chicken is tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Finish the sauce with the heavy cream. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the cilantro.', u'Wine paring for meal: dry Riesling or sparkling wine']
ingredients: [u'1 whole chicken (3 to 4 pounds), cut into 10 pieces', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons smoked paprika', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon lemon zest', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u' One 1-inch piece ginger, peeled and grated', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 large onion, sliced', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'1 tablespoon smoked paprika', u'2 teaspoons garam masala', u' One 14.5-ounce can fire-roasted diced tomatoes, such as Muir Glen', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Chicken Tikka Masala

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Heat the canola oil, in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, until shimmering. ', u'Add the onions, garlic, ginger and carrots, if using, and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Saute until onions are softened and slightly brown around the edges, about 5 minutes. ', u'Add the turmeric, garam masala and paprika, quickly stirring for about 20 seconds to keep the spices from burning. Stir in the tomatoes and ketchup, and taste for seasoning; add more salt and pepper, if needed. ', u'Add hot dog rounds, stirring to cover them with the tomato mixture. Add 1/4 cup water if the mixture is too dry. Cover and simmer over medium-low heat 15 minutes.', u'Taste and season accordingly. Remove from heat, stir in cilantro and transfer the mixture to a serving bowl. Serve!']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 large onion, diced', u'4 garlic cloves, peeled and thinly', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'1 handful shredded carrots, optional', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/4 teaspoon garam masala', u'1/2 teaspoon smoked Spanish paprika', u'1 large tomato, diced', u'2 tablespoons ketchup', u'1 (12-ounce) package hot dogs, sliced about 1/16-inch thick (recommended: Hebrew National)', u'1/4 cup water, if necessary', u' Handful cilantro leaves, minced']
title: Hot Dogs a la Rose

directions: [u'Start by making the lime pickle puree. Place the lime pickle, lemon juice, olive oil, and water in a blender and blend until smooth.', u'Clean Swiss chard by removing tough stems and then thoroughly rinsing in cold water to remove all sand and grit. Blanch the chard in salted boiling water until very tender, remove and shock in very cold water. Remove from water and squeeze the cooked chard until most of the water is removed.  ', u'In a hot pan, add bacon and allow some of the fat to render out then add shallots and butter and sweat shallot until they?re translucent. Add the pickled ramps and Swiss chard and heat. While stirring the chard, add the lime pickle puree and lemon zest. Cream the ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.', u'To make the onion soubise, add the butter, Vidalia onion, and salt and pepper to a non-reactive pan. Cook slowly, uncovered, until onions are tender and the liquid from the onions and butter has reduced.', u'To make the sauce, add butter to a hot pan and cook it until it is melted but before it browns. Add the tomato, salt and pepper. Finish with lemon juice.', u'Season skate with salt and pepper and place skin side down in a smoking pan with the corn oil. Place a flat weighted object or your hands on the fish until it?s flat. Adjust heat to a medium-low and cook until the skate is three-quarters cooked. Season top of the fish with salt and pepper, flip, and continue to cook for a few more seconds.', u'Plating: Place some Swiss chard in the center of the plate.  Place skate on the chard and, alternating skate and chard, layer in a high pile. Drizzle the sauce over the fish, top with a small pile of onion soubise, and garnish with chives.']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces Patak?s mild lime pickle', u'1 1/2 ounces lemon juice', u'1 -ounce extra virgin olive oil', u'1/4 -ounce water', u'4 bunches Swiss chard', u'1/2 -ounce bacon, julienned', u'1 tablespoon minced shallots', u'1/2 -ounce butter', u'4 pickled ramps, sliced', u'1 teaspoon lemon zest', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'4 ounces butter', u'4 ounces tomato, seeded, peeled, and finely diced', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'2 ounces lemon juice', u'2 ounces butter', u'1 Vidalia onion, julienned', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'4 skate fish (about 8 to 9 ounces each), on the bone, skin-on, and ?wingtips? removed', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'1 -ounce corn oil']
title: Sauteed Skate with Indian Lime Pickle

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Warm the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until nearly smoking.', u'Keep your lid handy. Add the mustard seeds and the cumin seeds; they should start enthusiastically popping upon contact with the oil, so cover the pot until the spluttering subsides, about 30 seconds.', u'Add the onions and saute until soft and just starting to brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger, and saute until the garlic is soft, about 2 minutes longer.', u"Add the turmeric, garam masala and paprika. Stir and cook about 30 seconds. Then add the vinegar (standing back so you don't inhale the fumes!) and cook 1 minute more.", u'Add the tomatoes, molasses, 1/2 teaspoon of salt and lots of freshly ground black pepper. Stir, bring to a boil, then cook at a generous simmer about 10 minutes until thickened. You can puree it if you like. Set it aside to cool and then jar. Store in the refrigerator.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons canola or grapeseed oil', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1 medium red onion, finely diced', u'3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 (1-inch thumb) ginger, peeled and minced', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon store-bought or homemade garam masala, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 cup apple cider vinegar', u'1 (14 1/2-ounce can) diced tomatoes', u'2 tablespoons molasses', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u"3 large cinnamon sticks (if you have the kind you get at Indian stores, it's about 3 tablespoons of cinnamon bark bits)", u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 2 tablespoons of seeds)', u'4 large black cardamom pods, shelled, husks discarded (about 1 tablespoon of seeds), optional']
title: Ketchup Chutney

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'In a small skillet, over medium-high heat, toast the cumin seeds, cinnamon bark, cloves, and peppercorns until fragrant, about a minute or so. Pour into a spice grinder, and process until powdered.', u"In a small food processor or blender, combine the toasted spice mix and rest of the wet masala ingredients. Process until smooth. Place a large, preferably nonstick pot over high heat, and add oil. When the oil is shimmering, add the onions and serrano pepper. Stirring frequently, saute onions until golden brown, about 12 minutes. Cook's Note: Don't let them burn! Turn the heat down to medium-high if they're starting to burn.", u"Add the ground wet masala, taking care because it will sizzle wildly, and steam up your glasses if you wear them. Stir quite vigorously, and turn down heat if it's bubbling too furiously. Don't wash the food processor cup yet. Keep stirring, with short pauses, until most of the liquid has evaporated and the masala comes together as one mass, about 2 minutes. Also, you may see little droplets of oil on the perimeter of the masala. That's a good sign!", u'Quickly add the meat, and stir, coating the meat in the masala. Stir and cook about 5 minutes until the meat browns.', u'Remember that dirty food processor vessel? Fill it with 1 cup of hot water (from the tap is fine), swirl it around so it picks up any leftover masala, and pour that into the pot. Add 1 teaspoon salt, stir and bring the curry to a boil, then turn it down to a simmer. Cover and cook 30 minutes. Then cook with the lid ajar for another 15 minutes, to thicken the gravy slightly.', u'Check the meat at the end of the cooking time; it should be tender, and not chewy at all. Adjust salt if you like, and serve over rice over with chapatis (whole wheat griddle bread).']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds boneless beef top sirloin steak, trimmed of all excess fat, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'2 (1-inch) pieces cinnamon bark', u'6 cloves', u'4 peppercorns', u'1 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoon paprika', u"1/2 teaspoon cayenne, more if you're feeling feisty!", u'6 cloves garlic, peeled and roughly chopped', u'1 -inch thumb fresh ginger, peeled and roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup apple cider vinegar', u'3 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 medium red onion, very thinly sliced', u'1 serrano pepper, sliced in half', u' Kosher salt', u' Serving suggestion: Cooked rice and chapatis (whole wheat griddle bread)']
title: Goan Beef Curry with Vinegar: Beef Vindaloo

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prick the potatoes all over with a fork and microwave until tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Peel the potatoes, then transfer to a large bowl and mash with a fork until almost smooth. Mix in the cottage cheese, peas, curry powder, 2 tablespoons flour and 2 teaspoons salt. Let cool to room temperature.', u'Heat about 2 inches vegetable oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat until a deep-fry thermometer registers 375 degrees F. Meanwhile, whisk the eggs in a shallow bowl. Put 1 cup flour in another bowl and the panko in a third bowl. ', u'Form the potato mixture into about 24 golf ball-size portions, then gently flatten into 2-inch patties. Dredge each patty in the flour, shake off any excess, dip in the eggs, then dredge in the panko, turning to coat. Fry the patties in batches until golden, turning as needed, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate using a slotted spoon. Serve with chutney.', u'Photograph by Andrew Mccaul']
ingredients: [u'2 medium russet potatoes', u'1 cup 4% cottage cheese', u'1/2 cup frozen peas, thawed', u'2 teaspoons Madras curry powder', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u' Kosher salt', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'4 large eggs', u'2 cups panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)', u' Mango or tomato chutney, for serving']
title: Curried Potato Fritters

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'In a large bowl, beat the eggs until slightly frothy. (If you are not in a hurry, you can go the extra mile: Separate the eggs and beat the egg yolks in one  bowl, the egg whites in another, until very frothy. Gently fold the yolks into the whites. This will make a much lighter omelet!)', u'Carefully stir in the onion, chile, cilantro, turmeric and paprika and add couple of generous pinches of salt and a few grinds of pepper.', u'Heat the oil in a medium (10 to 12 inch) non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Keep a heatproof spoonula (a curved, spoonlike spatula) at the ready. When the oil starts to shimmer, pour in the egg mixture.', u'Using your spoonula, stir the egg mixture in small circular motions to distribute the onions, chile and cilantro evenly around the pan. This also helps move some of the uncooked egg down to the surface of the hot pan. Sprinkle the potato chips (if using) evenly over the top.', u"Reduce the heat to medium, cover the pan, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Meanwhile, grab a plate that's as big as your pan.", u"Check your omelet. It's all right if it's not fully cooked, but it shouldn't be super-runny. If it is, cover the pan and cook for 1 minute more. Slide the omelet, cooked side down, onto the plate. Then, holding the plate from underneath, place your pan over the plate and flip the omelet back into the pan. The omelet should land with its uncooked side down. Cook, uncovered, for another minute.", u'Slide the omelet onto a serving plate, cut it into 4 wedges and serve with fresh cilantro leaves on top!', u'Smaarti Tip', u"Don't omit the serrano chile even if you don't like spicy foods. Scrape out the seeds and use just the flesh; that slight bitterness really makes this omelet sing.", u'Photograph by Matt Armendariz']
ingredients: [u'6 large eggs', u'3/4 cup minced red onion (about 1/2 medium onion)', u'1 small serrano chile, seeded and minced', u' Small handful fresh cilantro, minced (about 2 tablespoons), plus extra leaves for garnish', u'3/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'3/4 teaspoon paprika', u' Kosher salt and freshly', u' ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons vegetable, canola or grapeseed oil', u' Small handful coarsely crushed potato chips (about 1/4 cup; optional)']
title: Indian Omelet

directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, combine fennel seed, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon stick, ginger root, peppercorns and water. Boil for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and steep for 10 minutes. Add the tea, bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer 5 minutes.', u'Strain mixture, discard spices and return the tea to the saucepan. Stir in the brown sugar and milk. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon fennel seed', u'6 green cardamom pods', u'12 whole cloves', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'1 (1/4-inch) piece ginger root, peeled and thinly sliced', u'6 black peppercorns', u'7 cups water', u'2 tablespoons Darjeeling tea', u'4 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1 cup milk']
title: Chai Tea

directions: [u'In a large pot, heat the ghee and stir-fry the onions just until wilted, do not brown. Add the garlic, jalapeno, cumin, lentils, ginger, Garam Masala, salt, pepper, sugar and bay leaf. Saute for 1 to 2 minutes, until the herbs and spices bloom (aromatic). Add the tomatoes and deglaze with the vinegar. Add the chicken stock, bring to a boil and then lower to a simmer and cook until lentils are tender, stirring occasionally. Taste and adjust seasoning with cumin, salt, pepper and sugar.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup ghee or clarified butter', u'1 1/2 cups diced onions', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 jalapeno peppers, cored, seeded and minced', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds, toasted and crushed', u'2 cups orange lentils', u'2 tablespoons finely minced ginger', u'2 tablespoons Garam Masala, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 bay leaf', u'3/4 cup diced tomatoes', u'1/2 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'8 cups chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon black peppercorns', u'1/2 tablespoon whole cloves', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon cardamom seeds', u'3 tablespoons cumin seeds', u'3 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'4 (3-inch) cinnamon sticks', u'1/4 cup dried red chiles', u'1/2 tablespoon freshly grated nutmeg']
title: Dal

directions: [u'Cut fillets crosswise into strips 2-inches wide. Rub fish with mixture of lemon juice and oil, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees.', u'In medium frying pan, over medium high heat, fry onion in oil until edges are nicely browned. Add garlic, ginger, and green chile, and stir over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, spice mixture, fennel seeds, and salt, and fry, stirring constantly until tomato pieces break down to form a lumpy paste. Add coconut milk and simmer about 5 minutes until a thick, rich sauce is formed.', u'Arrange fish in an oiled baking/serving dish large enough to hold fish in a single layer. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Pour sauce over fish, cover tightly with aluminum foil, and return to oven for 15 to 20 minutes until fish is opaque.', u'Garnish with chopped cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds thick fish fillets or steaks, halibut, cod or salmon', u'4 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 cups finely chopped onion', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced green chile, serrano, Thai or jalapeno', u'1 cup chopped fresh tomatoes', u'6 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper, cayenne', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds, coarsely ground with mortar and pestle', u'1 1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup canned unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro, for garnish']
title: Fish Baked in Coconut Milk

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Heat the ghee in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-low heat. Add the onions, ginger, and garlic and cook slowly until the onions are very soft, about 15 minutes. Add the tomato paste, curry powder, cinnamon stick, and chiles and give it a good stir; season with salt and pepper. Pour in the coconut milk and chicken stock and bring it back to a simmer; cook until the sauce has thickened, about 20 minutes. Add the tomatoes, chicken, cilantro, and half the lemon juice; continue to simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 to 15 minutes. Taste and adjust the seasoning with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Garnish with cilantro and mint leaves.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons Ghee, recipe follows', u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'1 -inch piece ginger, peeled and finely chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'2 tablespoons Curry Powder, recipe follows', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'1 to 3 dried red chiles', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 (15-ounce) cans unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'4 tomatoes, seeded and chopped', u'6 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch strips', u'1/4 cup cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' Mint leaves, for garnish', u'1 pound unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds', u'1 tablespoon cardamom seeds', u'1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon whole cloves', u'2 dried red chiles, broken in pieces, seeds discarded', u'2 tablespoons turmeric']
title: Spicy Chicken Coconut Curry

directions: [u'Combine everything in a mixing bowl except the crabmeat, lobster, and panko. Taste the mixture for seasoning. Gently fold in crabmeat and lobster, careful not to break up crabmeat too much. Fold in panko, adding enough so that the mixture is not too tight.', u'Cook 1 crab cake and taste. Adjust the seasoning if necessary.', u'Form into 2 1/2-ounce cakes. Saute on both sides until golden brown.']
ingredients: [u'1 egg', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 tablespoon whole grain mustard', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u'2 tablespoons Javin curry blend, may vary if using Madras curry', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'1/4 cup red bell pepper, diced', u'1/4 cup yellow bell pepper, diced', u'1/4 cup red onion, chopped', u'2 tablespoons parsley, chopped', u'1 cup panko bread crumbs', u'1/2 pound crabmeat, jumbo lump', u'1/2 pound spiny lobster, cooked and chopped', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: West Indian Curried Crab and Lobster Cakes

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'For the wet masala: In a small skillet over medium-high heat, toast the cumin seeds, cinnamon bark, cloves, and peppercorns until fragrant, about 1 minute. Pour into a spice grinder and process until powdered. In a small food processor or blender, combine the toasted spice mix and the rest of the wet masala ingredients. Process until smooth.', u"Place a large (preferably nonstick) pot over high heat and add the oil. When the oil is shimmering, add the onions and serrano pepper. Stirring frequently, saute the onions until golden brown, about 12 minutes. Don't let them burn! Turn the heat down to medium-high if they're starting to burn.", u"Add the ground wet masala, taking care because it will sizzle wildly and steam up your glasses, if you wear them. Stir quite vigorously and turn down the heat if it's bubbling too furiously. Don't wash the food processor bowl yet. Keep stirring, with short pauses, until most of the liquid has evaporated and the masala comes together as one mass, about 2 minutes. Also, you may see little droplets of oil on the perimeter of the masala. That's a good sign!", u'Quickly add the meat and stir, coating the meat in the masala. Stir and cook about 5 minutes until the meat browns.', u'Remember that dirty food processor bowl?  Fill it with 1 cup of hot water (from the tap is fine), swirl it around so it picks up any leftover masala, and pour that into the pot.
