Add salt and pepper, stir, bring the curry to a boil, and then turn it down to a simmer. Cover and cook 30 minutes. Then cook with the lid ajar for another 10 minutes to thicken the gravy slightly. Check the meat at the end of the cooking time; it should be tender and not chewy at all. Adjust the salt if you like, and serve over rice or with chapatis (whole wheat griddle bread).']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'2 (1-inch) pieces cinnamon bark', u'6 whole cloves', u'4 whole black peppercorns', u'1 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoons paprika', u"1/2 teaspoon cayenne (more if you're feeling feisty!)", u'1 heaping tablespoon Ginger Garlic Paste, recipe follows, or 6 cloves garlic, peeled and roughly chopped and 1-inch thumb fresh ginger, peeled and roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup apple cider vinegar', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 medium red onion, sliced very thinly', u'1 serrano pepper, sliced in half', u'2 pounds boneless beef top sirloin, trimmed of all excess fat, cut into 1-inch cubes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup cloves garlic, whole', u'1/2 cup fresh ginger, peeled, 1/2-inch slices', u'1/4 cup canola oil']
title: Goan Beef Curry with Vinegar: Beef Vindaloo

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Put all ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Serve in tall glasses and enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain whole milk yogurt', u'1/4 cup sugar, optional, depending on the sweetness of the mango', u'4 mangos, peeled and diced (or about 2 cups frozen mango chunks, thawed)', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'2 teaspoons chile powder', u' Large pinch cayenne pepper', u'1/2 to 1 cup water, depending on how juicy the mangoes are', u' Pinch kosher or sea salt']
title: Mango-Chile-Lime Lassi

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Slice the apples into halves. Slice the halves lengthways into smaller pieces, roughly 1/4-inch width. Place the apple pieces and finely chopped onion into a saucepan with all the other ingredients. Heat the mixture until it is simmering quickly. Cook the mixture for 45 minutes, or until the chutney has thickened slightly and the fruit has become soft.', u'Spoon the mixture into sterilized jars and screw the lids onto the jars tightly. Allow to cool before storing in a cool, dark place.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound 8 1/2 ounces (750 grams) Granny Smith apples, peeled and cored', u'9 ounces (250 ounces) dried cranberries', u'1 onion, finely chopped', u'12 fluid ounces (350 ml) apple cider vinegar', u'7 ounces (200 grams) sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'2 teaspoons salt']
title: Christmas Chutney

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'To wash or not to wash rice? In the case of basmati, no matter what my preparation is, I always wash it. It cleans out any small particles and it also rids the rice of any starch on the grain. This starch makes the rice gummier when cooked.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups basmati rice', u'4 cups cold water', u'2 teaspoons whole cumin seeds', u'3 cardamom pods, lightly crushed, black seeds reserved, pods discarded', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'12 black peppercorns', u'2 bay leaves', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus 3 tablespoons, cut into slices, optional', u'1 large red onion, peeled and finely diced', u' Kosher salt']
title: Basmati Rice Pilaf

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Prepare rice to package directions. For spicy rice, toast coriander, cumin and mustard seeds in the bottom of a medium saucepan in 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil. When seeds pop and you can smell seasonings, add water and prepare rice as directed.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil in a large, deep nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken and lightly brown. Remove chicken. To same pan, add garlic, ginger and onions and saute together for 3 to 5 minutes. Add flour and cook 1 to 2 minutes. Add chicken broth to the pan and bring to a bubble. Add curry paste and mincemeat and reduce heat to medium low. Add chicken pieces back to the pan. Taste and add a little salt, if you feel it necessary. Simmer curry 5 to 10 minutes.', u'Assemble your toppings in small dishes. Serve curry in shallow bowls with scoops of rice or spiced Basmati. Garnish with any or all of your toppings.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon each coriander seeds, cumin seeds, mustard seeds', u'2 cups basmati rice, prepared according to package directions', u'3 tablespoons vegetable or canola oil, 3 turns of the pan', u'1 1/3 to 1 1/2 pounds chicken breast tenders, diced', u'2 to 4 cloves garlic, minced, mild to extra spicy', u'1 to 2 inches fresh ginger root, minced or grated, mild to extra spicy', u'1 large yellow skinned onion, peeled and chopped', u'1 can chicken broth, about 2 cups', u'2 tablespoons curry paste, mild or hot', u'1/3 to 1/2 cup mincemeat', u' Coarse salt', u'2 tablespoons flour', u'4 scallions, chopped', u'1 cup toasted coconut', u'1/2 cup sliced almonds or Spanish peanuts', u'1 cup prepared mango chutney', u'1 /4 cup finely chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Chicken Curry in a Hurry

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Place the mango, jalapeno, mayonnaise, lime zest and juice, cilantro and a pinch of salt in a blender. Blend until smooth. Transfer to a small mixing bowl and season with additional salt if needed. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use.', u'Fill a large Dutch oven halfway with oil and heat to 350 degrees F.', u'While the oil heats up, cut the kielbasa sausage into 3 equal pieces, each about 6 inches long. Cut each piece in half lengthwise. Use a pair of kitchen shears to cut off the pointed end of each skewer. Carefully insert 1 skewer a little more than halfway through each sausage piece. If a piece of your kielbasa is curved, carefully straighten it out before inserting the skewer. Place on a large plate and reserve.', u'Prepare the pancake batter according to the package directions, adding the cornstarch, cornmeal and garam masala. Pour enough of the pancake batter into a pint glass to fill about three-quarters of the way. Reserve the remaining batter to fill the glass as needed. Dip 2 sausage skewers into the batter, covering completely. Carefully place them in the oil and fry until the batter is cooked through and golden brown, about 3 minutes, flipping occasionally. Do not fry more than 2 sausages at a time because they will start to stick together. Transfer the fried "corn dogs" on to a paper-towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil. Season liberally with salt. Dip and fry the remaining sausage skewers.', u'Serve immediately with the mango dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup roughly chopped ripe mango', u'1/2 jalapeno, seeded if desired, roughly chopped (about 2 tablespoons)', u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u' Zest and juice of 2 limes', u'2 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh cilantro', u' Kosher salt', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' One 14-ounce package kielbasa sausage', u'2 cups of your favorite prepared "Just Add Water" buttermilk pancake mix', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'1/3 cup course-ground cornmeal', u'2 tablespoons garam masala', u' Special equipment: six 8-inch wooden skewers']
title: Indian-Inspired Corn Dogs with Mango Dipping Sauce

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Filling: In a small saucepan, add the potato and enough cold water to cover. Add a generous pinch of salt and bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat and simmer until tender, 12 to 15 minutes.', u'In a second small saucepan, bring 4 cups water to a simmer and add a generous pinch of salt, bay leaves, 1 teaspoon coriander seeds, peppercorns, chili flakes, and chicken breast. Simmer until cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes.', u'Mash the potato and finely shred the chicken and put into a large bowl. Combine with mango, lime juice, chipotle sauce, remaining coriander seeds, cumin, cilantro, and salt and pepper, to taste. Mixing with a spoon or your hands, until well incorporated. Taste for seasoning and adjust, if necessary. Set aside.', u'Samosas: Roll the puff pastry out slightly, to flatten the seams. Using a paring knife to trace a 7-inch ring mold or bowl, cut the dough into 8 (7-inch wide) rounds. Cut each into 2 semicircles.', u'Put a tablespoon or so of the filling in the center of a semicircle. Have a small bowl of water handy. Dip your finger in the water and run it along the edges of the semicircle. Arrange the samosas so the flat side is facing away from you. Grab the left corner and fold it over the dough in a triangular motion, so that this corner lands on the bottom right side of the filling. Do the same with the other corner. ', u'Squeeze bottom shut, and fold over, sealing with water. If you like, seal using a fork. Repeat with remaining dough and filling. Arrange the 8 samosas on a lightly greased baking sheet.', u'In a small bowl, whisk the egg and 1 teaspoon water with a fork until thoroughly combined. Brush the tops of the samosas with the egg wash.', u'Bake for 15 minutes at 425 degrees F, then turn heat down to 375 degrees F and bake for 10 more minutes. You can flip them over just before you turn the heat down, if you like.', u"Chutney: In a food processor, whiz together the mint, cilantro, ginger, lime juice and water until it all comes together as a sauce. There'll probably still be little bits of leaf in the sauce, but I like how those taste, so no worries. Pour the chutney into a bowl.", u"In a small pan, over medium heat, warm the oil until it shimmers. Add mustard seeds; they should sizzle. Immediately cover with a lid until they stop spluttering. Make sure they don't burn! If they do, start over. No big deal. I do it all the time! Immediately add the seeds and oil to the chutney. It will sizzle so stand back. Once you've poured in all of the oil, you can even spoon a little chutney into the pan (cue sizzling again!) so that you pick up all that lovely oil. Pour into the bowl with the chutney.", u'Serve samosas hot, with the chutney... and bask in gratitude for the great ideas we all come up with, for our sensitive taste buds and for the blessing of good friends!']
ingredients: [u'1 large russet potato', u' Water', u' Salt', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 1/2 teaspoons coriander seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns', u'1/2 teaspoon red chili flakes', u'3 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breast', u'1 mango, peeled, pitted and finely diced', u' Juice of 1/2 lime', u'5 tablespoons chipotle sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds', u' Big handful cilantro leaves, minced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 packages puff pastry, thawed', u'1 egg', u'1 teaspoon water', u'1 cup mint leaves', u'1/2 cup cilantro leaves and soft stems', u'1 tablespoon fresh ginger, chopped', u'1/2 lime, juiced, plus more to taste', u' About 1/4 cup water', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil or olive oil', u'1 teaspoon brown mustard seeds', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup buttermilk', u'1/4 cup vegetable/canola oil', u' Big pinch salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ajwain seeds, optional']
title: Baked Samosas with Mint Chutney

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat oil in large skillet and stir in butter to melt. Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Cook thighs skin side down until golden brown. Flip chicken and continue to cook until golden brown. Remove chicken to a plate. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Stir in curry, cayenne, cinnamon and cumin and cook until aromas are released. Stir in carrots and toss to coat. Add chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Place chicken thighs back into skillet and stir in broccoli. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes to cook chicken. Stir in cream and peas. Season to taste. Serve with basmati rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'6 chicken thighs', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 cup chopped onion', u'3 teaspoons curry powder', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon cumin', u'2 carrots, peeled and sliced on diagonal', u'1 1/2 cups low sodium chicken stock', u'1 cup broccoli florets', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'3/4 cup frozen peas']
title: Curried Chicken Thighs

directions: [u'To prepare the marinade: in a food processor, using a metal blade, combine the yogurt, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, black pepper, salt, honey, Garam Masala, and Green Aromatics. Process until well blended. Add the cilantro leaves and continue to process until pureed and well blended. ', u'Arrange the lamb chops in a non-reactive pan. Pour prepared marinade to coat both sides of the chops. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator. Season the lamb chops with salt and pepper. Cook over hot grill to desired doneness. Serve with Cilantro Mint Chutney.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups yogurt', u'1/2 tablespoon cumin seeds, toasted and cracked', u'1/2 tablespoon coriander seeds, toasted and cracked', u'1/2 tablespoon ground black pepper', u'1/2 tablespoon salt', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 teaspoons Garam Masala, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup Green Aromatics, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup cilantro leaves', u'2 racks of lamb, trimmed, cut into chops (or 16 lamb chops)', u' Cilantro Mint Chutney, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon black peppercorns', u'1/2 tablespoon whole cloves', u'1 tablespoon plus 1/2 teaspoon cardamom seeds', u'3 tablespoons cumin seeds', u'3 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'4 (3-inch) cinnamon sticks', u'1/4 cup dried red chiles', u'1/2 tablespoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1 cup chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup chopped ginger', u'1 teaspoon red chile flakes', u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'1 cup chopped scallions', u'6 ounces coconut milk', u'3 cloves garlic', u'4 ounces yogurt', u'1 ounce honey', u'1 tablespoon Garam Masala', u'2 cups cilantro leaves', u'1 1/2 cups mint leaves', u' Salt', u' Black pepper', u' Sugar']
title: Lamb Tandoori

directions: [u'Special equipment: a spice grinder and grill pan', u'For the chicken curry: Toss the chicken thighs with the lemon juice and some salt in a large bowl. Set aside for 30 minutes.', u'Toast the cashews (including some for garnish) in a small saucepan over low heat and set aside. Dry roast the coriander, cumin, cardamom, peppercorns and cloves in a small skillet over low heat. Let them cool before grinding them in a spice grinder. Set aside.', u'Add the onions, garlic and ginger to a blender and puree until smooth. Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion mixture and the bay leaves to the oil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion mixture is golden brown, about 15 minutes.', u'Fill a medium saucepan with water and bring it up to a boil. Score the bottom of each tomato with a paring knife and drop them in the hot water for 15 seconds. Remove from the water and peel off the skins. Place the peeled tomatoes in a blender and puree until smooth. Add them to the onion mixture along with the cayenne, cinnamon, turmeric, marinated chicken thighs, toasted and ground spice mixture and some salt. Turn the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes begin to turn into a smooth, loose paste and the oil begins to separate from the mixture. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, about 20 minutes more.', u'Add the cream, 1 cup of cashews and some salt to a blender and puree until smooth. Add the cashew cream to the chicken and tomato mixture and stir to incorporate. Keep warm until ready to serve.', u'For the onion bread: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'Place the chopped onions on a baking sheet and roast in the oven until slightly browned, less than 5 minutes. Mix in the chiles if using, and set aside.', u'Combine the flour and 1/4 teaspoon of salt in a large mixing bowl. Add the ghee and just enough water until a dough forms. Start to knead and punch the dough, adding more water if necessary. The dough should be smooth and soft. Use your hands to form the dough into 6 to 8 medium balls. Take one dough ball at a time and roll it into a 3- to 4-inch disc on a floured surface. Spoon some of the onion and chili mixture into the center along with a pinch of cilantro, if using, and some more salt. Fold the dough over on itself, bringing the edges together to form a half circle. Sprinkle some more flour on the board and roll the stuffed dough into a 6- to 8-inch disc.', u'Heat 1 or 2 teaspoons of ghee in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Fry the bread in batches until the bottom is evenly browned; add 1 or 2 more teaspoons of ghee and flip to brown the other side, less than 2 minutes per side.', u'To serve: Chop the reserved toasted cashews. Divide the chicken curry among bowls and top with the cashews. Serve with the hot onion bread.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' Kosher salt', u'1 cup cashews, plus more for garnish', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'6 cardamom pods', u'5 black peppercorns', u'4 whole cloves', u'2 large onions, chopped', u'3 to 4 cloves garlic', u' One 2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for brushing', u'2 bay leaves', u'5 roma tomatoes', u'1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 pint heavy cream', u'1 large onion, finely chopped', u'1 green chile, finely chopped, optional', u'2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u' Kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon ghee (clarified butter) or vegetable oil, plus more for frying', u' Chopped fresh cilantro, optional, plus leaves for garnish', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Chicken Curry

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a glass-measuring cup, combine the yeast and sugar. Add the water and stir well. Let rest until foamy, about 5 minutes. Sift together the flour and salt into a large bowl. Make a well in the center of the flour and pour the yeast mixture and oil into the center. Mix together with your fingers until a smooth dough forms, working in a small amount of additional flour as needed. Knead for 3 minutes.', u'Oil a small bowl with the remaining butter or oil. Place the dough into the bowl, turning to coat, and let rest until doubled in size, about 1 hour.', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Divide the dough into 6 pieces and gently roll into 6 circles on a lightly floured surface. Bake on a baking stone, or a lightly greased baking sheet, until just golden brown and puffed, about 12 minutes.', u'Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon dried active yeast', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 cup warm water, about 110 degrees F', u'1 cup all-purpose flour, plus more as needed while kneading', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup clarified butter or vegetable oil, plus 1 teaspoon']
title: Naan Bread

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'With a fork, prick holes in the chicken pieces. Using a knife, cut diagonal slices 1-inch apart, and 1/2-inch deep into the larger pieces. Place the chicken in a baking dish.', u'In a blender, combine the oil, onion, garlic, ginger, pepper, and process on high speed to a paste. Add the paprika, salt, cumin, turmeric, coriander, garam masala, and cayenne, and process until well blended. Add the yogurt and lemon juice, and process to a smooth sauce, scraping down the sides to combine all the ingredients. Pour the marinade over the chicken. Turn to coat evenly, rubbing the marinade into the holes and slits. Cover tightly with plastic wrap, refrigerate for at least 4 hours, and up to 24 hours, turning occasionally.', u'Preheat a grill.', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade. Place on the grill and cook for 8 to 10 minutes on the first side. Turn, baste as needed, and cook on the second side for 8 to 10 minutes. Turn and continue cooking, as necessary until the chicken is cooked through, but still tender, about 25 to 30 minutes. (Alternately, bake in a preheated 425 degrees F oven on a baking sheet for 35 minutes.)']
ingredients: [u'1 (4 to 4 1/2 pound) chicken, cut into 8 pieces, skin removed', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup chopped white onion', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'2 tablespoons chopped ginger', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped serrano or jalapeno pepper, stem and seeds removed', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'11/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/2 cup plain yogurt', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice']
title: Grilled Tandoori Chicken

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.', u'Combine the yogurt with the spices and zest of lime in a large bowl.', u'Cut the chicken into large chunks and season liberally with salt and pepper. Add to the yogurt mixture and toss to coat evenly. Put a small wire rack on a baking sheet or a slotted broiler pan. Arrange the chicken on the rack or slotted pan and roast until charred at the edges and juices run clear, about 15 minutes.', u'Combine the apple, tomatoes and scallions in a serving bowl. Add the lime juice, oil, and salt and pepper, to taste, and toss to combine.', u'Transfer the chicken to a serving platter and serve with apple-tomato topping and warm bread.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup Greek yogurt', u'1 tablespoon turmeric, a palmful', u'1 tablespoon coriander', u'1 tablespoon smoked paprika', u'1/2 tablespoon ground cumin, 1/2 a palmful', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom, 1/3 palmful', u'1 lime, zested', u'2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 green apple, peeled, cored and thinly sliced into matchsticks', u'2 plum tomatoes, seeded and very thinly sliced lengthwise', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons olive or vegetable oil', u'4 pieces naan bread, plain or flavored, store-bought, warmed']
title: Almost Tandoori Chicken

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Make the garam masala: Put the cinnamon sticks, cloves, and green and black cardamom seeds in a spice grinder and pulse until finely ground. Store in an airtight container, away from direct sunlight, up to 6 months.', u'Make the nuts: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Mix the peanuts, pecans, coconut, vegetable oil, cumin, coriander, 2 teaspoons of the garam masala and 1 teaspoon salt in a bowl and pour onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake 40 minutes, rotating halfway through for even baking. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. (If you want, serve the nuts in little parchment-paper cones!)', u'Photograph by Kang Kim']
ingredients: [u'3 large cinnamon sticks,', u' broken into pieces', u'3 tablespoons whole cloves', u'2 tablespoons green cardamom seeds (from 1/4 cup green pods)', u'1 tablespoon black cardamom seeds (from 4 black pods)', u'1 cup unsalted roasted peanuts', u'1 cup roughly chopped pecans', u'1/4 cup unsweetened coconut flakes', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u' Kosher salt']
title: Indian-Spiced Nuts With Coconut

directions: [u'Rinse goat meat well, rub lime juice over it (from 1/2 whole lime), place meat in a bowl, then add salt, black pepper, Scotch bonnet, thyme, allspice, curry powder, scallions, onion and garlic. Leave to marinate for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator, longer would be ideal. Heat the oil in a skillet until it is very hot, and saute the meat until golden brown. Then add the marinade, tomatoes and coconut milk, if using, and simmer for approximately 3 more minutes. Add water, reduce heat and allow to simmer for 2 to 3 hours stirring occasionally until meat is tender.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds goat meat (or lamb) without bones', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 Scotch bonnet pepper (any color), seeded and minced', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice (dry pimento berries)', u'3 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 whole scallions, sliced', u'1 onion, sliced', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 tomatoes, diced', u'1/2 cup coconut milk (optional)', u'7 cups water']
title: Curry Goat

directions: [u'Put the split mung dal, turmeric, water and salt into a pot large enough to hold them and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer about 40 minutes. The dal should become somewhat soft and porridge-like. Set aside.', u'Place the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, peppercorns and chilies in a dry saute pan and toast them until they become quite fragrant. After allowing the spices to cool, grind them in a spice or coffee grinder until fine.', u'Place the oil in a saute pan and add the garlic and shallots. Cook over high heat until softened and just beginning to brown. Add the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add the ground spices and cook for 1 minute. Add the mixture to the cooked dal and simmer for about 10 minutes over low heat. Taste for seasoning, adding more salt if needed.', u'Serve with rice and celery leaves.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup split mung dal', u'2 teaspoons turmeric', u'5 cups water', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'2 teaspoons coriander seeds', u'3 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds', u'1 teaspoon black peppercorns', u'5 dried red chilies', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons minced shallots', u'1 cup coconut milk', u' Cooked basmati rice, for serving', u' Celery leaves, for serving']
title: My Dal

directions: [u'Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Add ghee and enough water until a nice soft dough forms; not too dry. Allow to rest for 10 minutes and cut dough into 8 or 10 parts and form balls. Again, let dough rest for 2 minutes. ', u'Make a well in the center of a ball, put 3 to 4 teaspoons of filling in the whole, and pinch, closing the well. Repeat with rest of the balls. Tuck extra dough under, put on floured board, and roll out into 8 to 10-inch disks. Brush top with melted ghee or vegetable oil. ', u'Heat a griddle to a medium heat and brush with ghee or vegetable oil. Cook dough on 1 side for about 2 minutes, brush top with ghee or vegetable oil and flip disk to cook the other side for about 1 minute. Serve warm.']
ingredients: [u'3 1/3 cup all purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons ghee, recipe follows, or vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u' Water', u' Chickpea Filling, recipe follows', u'1 pound unsalted butter, cut into chunks', u'1 1/2 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil', u'3 garlic cloves, chopped', u' Pinch saffron', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cumin seeds, toasted and ground', u'2 cups chickpeas, cooked', u'1/2 cup water', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper']
title: Roti

directions: [u'Put the oil in a large frying pan and set over medium heat. When it is hot, put in the potatoes and fry them until they are golden and almost tender, about 10 minutes. Lift the potatoes out with a slotted spoon, and drain on paper towels. Turn the heat to medium-high, put in the cauliflower florets, and fry for 3 to 4 minutes, until they are golden brown. Lift the cauliflower out with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Turn the heat off. Remove all the oil from the frying pan except for 2 tablespoons (the extra oil can be drained and reused). Turn the heat to medium-high and put in the ginger. Stir for 10 seconds. Now return the potatoes and cauliflower to the pan. Turn the heat down to medium. Put in the turmeric, salt, cayenne, cumin, and coriander. Stir gently to coat the vegetables with the spices. Add 3 tablespoons of water.  Stir once and cover the pan. Turn the heat down to low and cook very gently for 4 minutes. Add the cilantro and toss gently. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u' Peanut or canola oil, for shallow frying', u'1 pound boiling potatoes, peeled and cut into thick 2 by 1 by 1-inch fries', u'1 head cauliflower (1 3/4 pounds), cut into delicate florets', u'1 tablespoon peeled finely chopped fresh ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'3/4 to 1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'3 tablespoons water', u'2 to 3 tablespoons coarsely chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Aloo Gobi (Punjabi-style Cauliflower and Potatoes with Ginger)

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Put the lentils in a strainer and rinse them under running water. Add them to a bowl, cover with water and let soak for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.', u'In a medium saucepan, combine 2 cups of water, the onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, chile, if using, and the lentils. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.  Skim any scum from the surface. DO NOT ADD SALT YET; it will toughen the lentils, thereby lengthening their cooking time. Lower the heat, cover the pot with a lid and gently simmer until the lentils are tender, almost translucent, and almost falling apart, about 30 to 40 minutes.', u'Whisk the lentils, releasing its natural starch, and mash some them so the mixture becomes thick. Add salt, to taste.', u'Tempering oil (bagaar): In a small bowl, combine the cumin and mustard seeds. In another bowl, combine the spice powders. Have all the ingredients ready because this will move very fast!', u"In a small skillet, over a medium-high flame, warm 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. Once the oil is shimmering, add seeds and immediately cover so you don't get covered in spluttering oil and seeds! Add the spices. They should sizzle and bubble a little - that's the blooming and it's exactly what you want. Don't let them burn. The mixture should bloom for about 30 seconds, no more.", u"Pour the oil mixture into the lentils, standing back so you don't get hurt when the mixture splutters again. Stir to combine. Transfer the lentils to a serving dish and garnish with cilantro."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup masoor dal red lentils, picked through for stones', u'2 cups water', u'1 onion, diced', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 (1/2-inch) piece ginger, peeled and minced', u'2 medium tomatoes, diced', u'1 serrano chile, sliced in 1/2, optional', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon black mustard seeds', u' Generous 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika or bafaat powder', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u' Handful chopped fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Mum's Everyday Red Lentils

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Season the chicken with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Whisk the garlic, ginger, chile pepper, paprika, coriander, tomatoes and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a 4-to-6-quart slow cooker. Add the chicken and stir to coat.', u'Cover and cook on high, 4 hours, adding the heavy cream and frozen peas during the last 15 minutes of cooking. Serve over rice; top with cilantro.', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, finely grated', u'1 2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and finely grated', u'1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely diced', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 15 -ounce can crushed tomatoes', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 cup frozen peas', u' Basmati rice, for serving', u' Chopped fresh cilantro, for topping']
title: Chicken Tikka Masala

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Put the ginger, garlic, cumin, coriander, and chili into a food processor, or into a mortar and pestle, and blend to a paste. Add the ground almonds and water and then blend again, set aside.', u'Heat the oil in a large pan and add the chicken pieces - in batches so they fry rather than stew - and cook them just long enough to seal on both sides, then remove to a dish.', u'Add the spices and turn them in the oil. Add the onions and cook them until softened and lightly browned, but keep the heat gentle and stir frequently, to avoid sticking. Pour in the blended paste, and cook everything until it begins to colour. Add the yogurt, half a cup at a time stirring it in to make a sauce, then stir in the stock, cream, and sultanas.', u'Put the browned chicken back into the pan, along with any juices that have collected under them, and sprinkle over the garam masala, sugar, and salt. Cover and cook on a gentle heat for 20 minutes, testing to make sure the meat is cooked through.', u"It's at this stage, that I like to take the pan off the heat and leave it to cool before reheating the next day.", u"So either now, or when you've reheated it, pour into a serving dish and scatter with the toasted flaked almonds."]
ingredients: [u'1 (1-inch) piece ginger, peeled', u'4 cloves garlic, peeled', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1/2 teaspoon dried chili flakes', u'4 tablespoons ground almonds', u'1/2 cup water', u'5 cardamom pods, bruised', u'1 cinnamon stick, broken in half', u'2 bay leaves', u'4 cloves', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 pounds boned chicken thighs, each cut into 2', u'2 onions, finely chopped', u'1 cup Greek yogurt', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup sultanas (golden raisins)', u'1 teaspoon garam masala', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 cup flaked almonds, toasted, to garnish']
title: Mughlai Chicken

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'This is my favorite Indian bread. It can be used like a utensil, soaking up sauces and as a "cooling" element for hot foods. It is also pretty simple to make. It is traditionally made with Chapati flour, a whole-wheat flour with a fine, powdery substance, but bread flour works as well.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups chapati or bread or whole-wheat or all-purpose flour, plus extra for kneading and rolling', u'1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast', u'2 tablespoons melted unsalted butter, slightly cooled, plus 2 teaspoons', u'3/4 cup whole milk yogurt', u'1 tablespoon warm water', u' Canola oil, as needed']
title: Naan

directions: [u'A wonderful candy-like sweet that tastes like marzipan with the added richness of ghee. It has a firm texture like fudge will keep for 2 to 3 days in an airtight container.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 pound almond paste, broken up to facilitate melting', u' Ghee, prepared from 8 ounces (2 sticks) unsalted butter, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup sliced or slivered almonds, chopped finer']
title: Almond Burfi

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Puree the chopped onion in a food processor with the ginger, garlic, coriander, cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 cup water.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until golden, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the spice paste and cook, stirring, until slightly dry, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the chicken and cook until opaque, breaking up the meat. Mix the yogurt with 1/4 cup water, add to the pan and simmer over medium-low heat until the meat is cooked through, 2 to 3 more minutes. Add the peas and cilantro and season with salt.', u'Meanwhile, heat another skillet over high heat. Brush the pitas with oil, season with salt and toast in the skillet, about 1 minute per side. Divide the chicken mixture among the pitas. Top with more yogurt and cilantro. Garnish with cashews and/or hot sauce, if desired.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 large red onion; 1/2 chopped, 1/2 sliced', u'1 1 -inch piece ginger, peeled and thinly sliced', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1/2 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil, plus more for brushing', u'3/4 pound ground chicken', u'1/4 cup plain low-fat yogurt, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 cup frozen peas, thawed', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish', u'4 pocketless pitas', u' Chopped cashews and/or hot sauce, for garnish (optional)']
title: Chicken Korma

directions: [u'To make the spice blend: Stir the ingredients together in a small bowl and set aside. ', u'To make the sauce: Melt the butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring frequently, until the pieces just begin to turn gold, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, tomato paste and spice blend, and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly to prevent burning. The spices will be fragrant. Add the tomato sauce and diced tomatoes and stir will. Add the chicken pieces, spoon the sauce over the top and bring to a simmer. Turn the heat to low and cook, uncovered, until the chicken is warmed through and the sauce is flavorful, about 10 minutes. Stir frequently. Remove the chicken to a serving dish and cover to keep warm. ', u'Shake any excess water from the peas. Add the peas and cream to the sauce in the pan, stir well and heat through. Do not boil. Spoon the sauce over the chicken. Serve with rice and warmed pita bread. ', u'Variation: If you prefer shreds of chicken to whole pieces, remove the skin from the chicken and pull the meat into large chunks by hand. Add to the pan along with the garlic, tomato paste and spice blend. Cook for 3 minutes and then add the tomato sauce and continue with the recipe. Serve over basmati rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon garam masala seasoning', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'1 large onion, chopped (about 1 cup)', u'2 teaspoons jarred minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'1 (15-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'1 (14 1/2-ounce) can diced tomatoes in juice', u'1 skinless rotisserie chicken, boned out and pulled into 1 1/2 by 1/2-inch chunks', u'1 (10-ounce) box frozen peas, placed in a colander and run under hot water to thaw', u'1/3 cup heavy whipping cream', u' Hot basmati rice, for serving', u' Pita bread, warmed according to package directions, for serving']
title: Butter Chicken (Indian Chicken in Tomato Cream Sauce)

directions: [u'In a large microwave safe pot with a lid, mix together the curry paste and oil. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Add the chicken to the pot and stir. Cover with the lid and microwave on medium for 8 minutes. ', u'Add the basil, cilantro, coconut milk, and soy sauce and season with salt and pepper. Give it a good stir, cover it, and microwave on medium for 4 minutes. Stir it again, cover, and let it rest for 3 or 4 minutes. Serve over steamed rice, garnished with paprika and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons Indian curry paste', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips', u'1/2 bunch basil, leaves chopped', u'1/2 bunch cilantro, leaves chopped', u'2 (13.5-ounce) cans coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' Steamed rice, to serve', u' Paprika, for garnish', u'1 scallion, thinly sliced, for garnish']
title: Microwave Chicken Curry

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'In a large saute pan, melt 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add the cumin, caraway and coriander seeds and toast them slightly for 30 seconds. Do not let them brown.', u'Immediately add half of the cabbage and season with the salt. Toss and stir to wilt and to combine with the spices. Add the remaining cabbage and if necessary, reseason with salt and allow it to continue wilting. Stir in the poblano, toss and cook over medium heat, stirring from time to time, about 10 to 15 minutes. Taste for seasoning.', u'Stir in the vinegar and orange juice and toss to blend. Taste for seasoning.', u'Lower the heat and add the cilantro. Stir to combine and remove the pan from the heat. Arrange it on a serving platter and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus 1/2 stick', u'2 teaspoons whole cumin seeds', u'2 teaspoons whole caraway seeds', u'2 teaspoons whole coriander seeds', u'2 small heads savoy cabbage, cored, leaves thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt, plus more for seasoning', u'1 poblano pepper, washed and cut into thin rounds, including seeds', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'4 oranges, juiced', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Braised Cabbage

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Put all ingredients in a blender and whir until frothy. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup fresh pre-cut or canned mango', u'1 cup non-fat vanilla yogurt', u'1/2 cup mango nectar', u'1 cup vanilla vodka', u' Ice']
title: Mango Lassi Cocktail

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Combine all of the ingredients in a bowl, reserving some pomegranate seeds for garnish. Add a squeeze of pomegranate juice from the husks of the seeded pomegranate at the end.', u'Stir everything together, and serve in a bowl scattering the reserved pomegranate seeds over as a garnish.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups natural yogurt', u'3 scallions, finely chopped', u'1 pomegranate, to give 1/2 cup pomegranate seeds', u' Scant 1/2 teaspoon salt']
title: Pomegranate Raita

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine mango, yogurt, nectar, rum and a few cups of crushed ice in a blender and blend until smooth and frothy. Sweeten with simple syrup, if needed. Divide among 4 glasses and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 ripe mangoes, peeled, pitted and chopped', u'2 cups Greek yogurt', u'1/2 cup mango nectar', u'1/2 cup white rum', u' Crushed ice', u'2 to 4 tablespoons simple syrup, depending on sweetness of mangoes']
title: Mango-Yogurt-White Rum Smoothie

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"Grab a large nonstick skillet, pour the olive oil into it and pop it over medium-high heat until the oil is shimmering. Carefully lay the paneer into the pan and cook until golden brown on one side, 1 or 2 minutes (don't be too hasty to flip it though). If it doesn't release from the pan easily, then wait another 30 seconds because it hasn't browned enough.", u'When the paneer is browned on both sides, remove it to a plate.', u'Add the shallot and garlic; saute until the shallots are soft.', u'Add the dates, chicken stock, cinnamon stick and red pepper flakes. Stir together, and then return the paneer to the pan. Make sure the liquid is at a gentle simmer. Cover and cook about 5 minutes.', u'Check for seasoning. Depending on the chicken stock you used, you may or may not need to add salt and pepper.', u'Remove the paneer to a plate and pour the sauce over top. Sprinkle with lemon zest, lemon juice, parsley and almonds. Serve immediately with a big chunk of naan or bread!']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'12 ounces paneer, (Indian cheese, either store-bought or made from my recipe, recipe follows)', u' sliced into 1/2-inch-wide "fingers"', u'1 shallot, minced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'4 dates, pitted and chopped', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'1 cinnamon stick', u' Hefty pinch of red pepper flakes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Zest of a lemon', u' Juice of half a lemon', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'2 tablespoons slivered almonds, toasted', u' Naan, for serving', u' Cheesecloth', u'8 cups whole milk', u"1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice, plus more as needed, see Cook's Note*"]
title: Spicy Paneer Fingers with Dates and Almonds

directions: [u'Heat a heavy non-stick pan over high heat.  Add the lamb and 3 tablespoons of oil.  Sear the meat, turning and tossing, until nicely browned all over.  Transfer meat to a plate.  Add the remaining 2 tablespoons oil and the onion to the pan and cook, stirring often, until the onions are browned, about 15 minutes.  Stir in the ginger, garlic, cumin, coriander, red pepper, paprika, and turmeric and cook for 3 minutes.  Add the tomato puree, meat, salt, and enough water to fully cover the meat, about 1 1/2 cups.  Bring contents to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 1 1/2 hours or until the meat is cooked and very tender.  Fold in the spinach and garam marsala.  Serve sprinkled with cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds of lean, boneless leg of lamb, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces', u'5 tablespoons of light vegetable oil', u'2 cups finely chopped onion', u'1 tablespoons of grated or crushed fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1/2 teaspoon ground red pepper', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 cup tomato puree', u' Coarse salt to taste', u'1 cup packed chopped cooked spinach, fresh or frozen', u'2 teaspoons garam masala (see recipe), homemade or store-bought', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves and tender stems']
title: Lamb with Spinach Sauce (Saag Gosht)

directions: [u'In a saucepan combine the rice and water, bring to a boil, stirring, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.  Add 2 cups of the milk, the sugar, raisins, cashews or pistachios, cardamom seeds, and cinnamon, and simmer, stirring often, for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until rice is tender and mixture creamy.  Add additional milk if necessary.  Pudding may also be served chilled.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup short grain Indian or Italian (Arborio) rice', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'2 to 3 cups milk', u'1/2 cup sugar, or to taste', u'1/4 cup golden raisins', u'1/4 cup raw cashews or shelled pistachios, chopped fine', u' Seeds from 4 cardamom pods', u' Ground cinnamon to taste']
title: Warm Indian Rice Pudding

directions: [u'In a large heavy-bottomed pan, preferably with a nonstick surface, heat 2 tablespoons oil over high heat. When oil is very hot add chicken, a few pieces at a time, and sear until browned on all sides, about 4 minutes. Using a slotted spoon remove chicken to a plate and continue until all pieces are browned. ', u'Add remaining oil and onions to pan, reduce heat to medium-high and fry 30 minutes until light brown, stirring constantly to prevent burning. Add garlic and ginger and fry 5 minutes. Add cinnamon and cardamom and fry 2 minutes, until spices are puffed and beginning to brown. Add turmeric and cayenne and stir rapidly 15 seconds. Return chicken to pan and stir in tomatoes, salt and 2 cups boiling water. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook about 45 minutes, until chicken is tender and gravy has thickened. Check frequently, and add a little water if sauce is evaporating too quickly. Turn off heat and let dish rest, covered at least 1 hour, preferably 2. When ready to serve, reheat, fold in cumin and cilantro, and adjust seasonings if needed.']
ingredients: [u'2 3 -pound chickens, cut into serving-size pieces, skinned', u'10 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'6 cups thinly sliced onions', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped garlic', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped ginger', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'8 cardamom pods', u'1 tablespoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon cayenne', u'2 cups canned crushed tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon ground roasted cumin seeds or ground cumin', u'3 to 4 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Chicken Curry (Adapted from Julie Sahni Classic Indian Cooking)

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Whizz all of the ingredients together in blender.  Pour into serving glasses and garnish with small basil leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup (2 percent) Greek-style yogurt', u'2 tablespoons sugar, or to taste', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup water', u' Pinch salt', u'2 cups strawberries, fresh or frozen and thawed', u'2 to 3 leaves fresh basil, plus more for garnish', u' Generous pinch freshly ground black pepper']
title: Strawberry-Basil Yogurt Cooler - Lassi

directions: [u'To prepare each chicken: Rinse under cold water and remove all the skin. With a sharp knife, make 3 deep incisions in each breast, 3 in each thigh and 2 on each drumstick. Then with a butcher knife, cut each chicken into quarters. First, cut the chicken in half down the middle. Second, cut the legs off where the thigh meets the body. Lastly, remove each breast, keeping the wings attached. Place the pieces of chicken on a large plate.', u'To prepare the spice rub: In a small bowl, combine the salt, chili powder and lemon juice to make a thick paste. Rub the paste evenly over the chicken legs and breasts. Set the chicken aside for 15 minutes to let the flavors absorb.', u'To prepare the tandoori sauce: In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, heavy cream, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, garam masala, and saffron. Whisk everything together until it is well mixed. Rub the sauce evenly over the chicken legs and breasts, thoroughly covering the chicken. Cover and place in the refrigerator to marinate for 4 hours.', u'Preheat an oven or charcoal grill to 350 degrees F.', u'To prepare the garnishes for the dish: Wash and drain the salad greens and slice the onion and the lemon.', u'Remove the chicken from the refrigerator. Skewer the legs starting from the drumstick end, through to the thigh so that the leg is spread out straight for even roasting. Skewer the breasts starting from the wing, through the breast so that the wing is spread out straight for even roasting.', u'If cooking the chicken in an oven, place the chicken in a shallow roasting pan lined with foil to catch the drippings. If cooking the chicken on a grill, place the chicken directly on the grill with a pan underneath it to catch the drippings. Roast for 10 minutes, then remove and baste with the melted butter and drippings from the bottom of the pan. Return the chicken back to the heat and roast for another 30 to 40 minutes, or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork, basting a couple more times during cooking.', u'To serve: Arrange 1 leg and 1 breast on each plate, with mixed salad greens, a lemon wedge, and onion slices in the middle.']
ingredients: [u'2 (2 1/2-pound) whole chickens', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon red chili powder', u'4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'6 tablespoons plain yogurt', u'7 tablespoons heavy cream', u'2 1/2 tablespoons ginger paste', u'2 1/2 tablespoons garlic paste', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder*', u'1 teaspoon saffron', u'1/2 pound mixed salad greens', u'1 lemon, cut into 4 wedges', u'1 small onion, sliced', u'4 tablespoons melted butter, for basting', u' *Garam Masala can be found at specialty Indian markets.']
title: Tandoori Chicken

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Begin by preparing the dough. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, salt and oil and mix with your fingers until it resembles coarse bread crumbs. Add water and mix with both hands until fully combined and mixture holds as a ball. Turn out onto a clean flat surface and knead for 10 minutes until the dough becomes smooth. Flatten into a disc shape and set back in bowl and cover with plastic wrap to rest for 30 minutes while you prepare the filling.', u'Set a large, heavy-based pot over medium-high heat and add vegetable oil.  Add spices and stir until just fragrant - this lightly toasts the spices and forms the spicy base of the filling mixture. Add ground chicken and saute until slightly coloured. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and sweat.  Add chickpeas and spinach then simmer for 10 minutes until liquid has evaporated and all the flavours have come together. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside and allow to cool (you can pour it out onto a flat platter to speed up the cooling process. ', u'Return to the dough and divide it up into 4 equal parts. Working with one piece at a time roll into a nice ball then using a rolling pin roll out into discs. Cut in half down the middle to form two half-circles. Working with one half at a time, rub a little water around the edges using your finger. Form a cone by folding along the straight edge overlapping the seam. Gently pinch at the fold to secure. Holding the cone in your hand fill with 2 tablespoons of filling. Seal the top by bringing the edges together and crimping with your fingers or a fork. Do this with the rest to make 8 samosas.  (note: you can freeze them at this point if you wish).', u'Heat vegetable oil to 360 degrees F in a large heavy-based pot.  Fry the samosas in batches (so as to not to over-crowd the pot) until puffy and golden. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.  Season with salt and serve with Raita.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'6 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'6 tablespoons warm water', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon ground red chili powder', u'1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', u'4 tablespoons curry powder', u'1 pound ground chicken', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'2 cloves of garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'1 cup of canned cooked chickpeas, washed and drained', u'1 cup frozen spinach', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u' Raita, see below for a link to the recipe']
title: Chicken and Spinach Samosas

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, add the water, cloves, cinnamon sticks and cardamom. Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat and cover. Allow to steep for 10 minutes. Strain the liquid, return it to the pan and reheat. Add the black tea bags, let them steep for a few minutes, and then add the orange peels and zest. Add the milk and stir in the honey. Pour into mugs and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups water', u'6 cloves', u'4 cinnamon sticks', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'4 black tea bags', u' Peels from 1/2 orange', u'1/2 orange, zested', u'1 cup milk', u'3 tablespoons honey']
title: Orange Spiced Chai

directions: [u'Heat oil in a large deep frying pan adding chopped onions and fry for 4 to 5 minutes on a medium heat until the onions are slightly brown. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for a further 1 or 2 minutes. Add the salt, turmeric and ground cumin.', u'Turn up the heat and further cook for another 1 minute then add the chicken. It is very crucial that spices are mixed within the pan at this point and stirred to ensure that the chicken cooks with texture and flavor. Add water after stirring the chicken into the spices. Turn down the heat slightly and stir in the garam masala and cream cook for a further 5 minutes. Serve sprinkled with green coriander.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 onion, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon julienned ginger', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 pound chicken, cooked', u'1 cup water', u'1 1/2 teaspoons garam masala, or to taste', u'1/4 pint heavy cream', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped coriander']
title: CHICKEN KORMA

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, stir together all ingredients and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes stirring frequently until the pudding is thick and creamy. Serve warm or at room temperature. Garnish, as desired, with additional blueberries or a sprinkle of cinnamon.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup cooked rice', u'1 cup milk', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 cup dried blueberries, plus more for garnish']
title: Instant Rice Pudding with Cinnamon, Cardamom and Blueberries

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a large straight-sided skillet over medium-high heat. Add the cumin seeds and red chiles and cook, stirring, until the fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the coriander, ginger, garlic, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until dark and fragrant, about 3 minutes more. Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until somewhat soft, about 3 minutes. (You can make the sauce up to this point a day ahead.)', u"When ready to serve, heat the sauce over high heat. As soon as it starts to bubble on the edges, add the shrimp and cook, stirring, until the shrimp turns opaque. Lower the heat, gradually stir in the yogurt, and gently heat it through. (Don't bring it to a boil or the yogurt may separate.) Season with salt and pepper, transfer to a serving platter, and sprinkle with the cilantro and green chiles. Serve."]
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds', u'2 to 3 dried red chiles, such as arbol', u'2 medium onions, sliced', u'3 tablespoons ground coriander', u'2 tablespoons minced peeled, fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'6 medium plum tomatoes, diced', u'1 1/2 pounds medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 cup whole-milk yogurt, divided', u' Cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Chopped fresh green chiles, for garnish']
title: Punjabi-Style Masala Shrimp

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Combine the lentils, garlic, chile, ginger, onions, tomatoes and enough water to cover in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring the mixture to a boil, and then lower the heat and simmer until the lentils are tender, 30 to 45 minutes. Whisk the cooked lentils to release some of their starch and break them down further.', u'Warm the oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook until they are sizzling and spluttering. Stir in the paprika and turmeric. Pour the seasoned oil onto the lentils (be prepared for a big sizzle). Stir to combine; sprinkle with salt and a small drizzle of honey. Ladle into soup bowls and garnish with cilantro, a drizzle of yogurt, lemon or lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup red lentils, washed and soaked for 1 hour, drained', u'2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 green serrano chile, split and seeded', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'1 large tomato, diced', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u' Kosher salt', u' Honey, for drizzling', u' Optional garnishes: chopped fresh cilantro, yogurt, lemon or lime wedges']
title: Red Lentil Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the apricots and lemon zest in the 2 cups of cold water. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the garam masala, and toast, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the onion and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is tender and translucent, about 6 minutes.', u'Stir in the rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until it begins to brown, about 4 minutes. Stir in the water along with the apricots, lemon zest, the remaining 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, wrap a clean dish towel around the saucepan lid, and cover saucepan. Cook for 10 minutes, set aside for 5 minutes undisturbed, then remove lid and fluff with a fork. Mound the pilaf on a serving platter or in a shallow bowl, tear the mint over, and top with the nuts.', u'Game Plan: Toast the nuts while the rice cooks.', u"Cook's Note: Wrapping the lid with a dish towel keeps the steam in the pot, encourages the rice grains to stay separate, and absorbs condensation that would otherwise collect on the lid and drip back into the pan."]
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup chopped dried apricots', u'2 wide strips lemon zest', u'2 cups cold water', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon garam masala (an Indian spice blend)', u'1 medium onion, diced', u'1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 cup basmati rice, lightly rinsed and drained', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 bay leaf', u'1/3 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1/4 cup toasted unsalted pistachios or cashews']
title: Basmati Rice Pilaf with Apricots

directions: [u'Wash and dry chicken pieces properly. Put the chicken pieces in a medium sized saucepan. Add salt to taste, green chilies, peppercorns, and water and place on stove on high heat. Once the water starts to boil, reduce heat to low and cook chicken until tender and the liquid has evaporated. If the chicken sticks and is not cooked add a little more water.', u'While the above is being done, in a separate "karahi", which is an Indian/ Pakistani Wok, (or you can use a Chinese wok also) add the olive oil, tomatoes, some salt and red chili powder (around one teaspoon for medium hot or two teaspoons for hot). Cook on medium heat until the tomatoes are tender and reduced to a sauce like consistency. Add the cooked chicken pieces to the sauce. Reduce heat to very low so that the sauce absorbs and coats the chicken pieces. Add the julienned ginger and green chilies to the chicken. Simmer for around five minutes.', u'Before serving sprinkle on chopped cilantro and serve in the Karahi, with hot pita bread or any available Indian bread from the market.', u'The dish is best eaten fresh off the stove with "Dal" as an accompaniment.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds of boneless chicken cut into medium size cubes (can use chicken with bones, but cut into very small pieces, about 3 inches in length)', u' Salt to taste', u'4 green chilies, coarsely chopped (any kind, preferably the thin long ones)', u'10 whole black peppercorns', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil or any vegetable oil', u'2 pounds of fresh red tomatoes, coarsely chopped', u' Red chili powder to taste', u'2 -inch piece of fresh ginger julienned', u' Chopped cilantro for garnish']
title: Chicken Karahi

directions: [u'In a large saucepan set over moderate heat, warm the oil until hot, add the onions and pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes.  Add the garlic, tomatoes, gingerroot, cumin seeds, Garam Masala, lemon pepper, and dried red pepper flakes, if desired, and simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.  Add the beans and salt and pepper to taste, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes more.  Stir in the lemon juice and cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 cup minced onions', u'1 green bell pepper, diced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'4 firm, ripe tomatoes, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'2 teaspoons minced gingerroot, or 1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1 teaspoon Garam Masala', u'1/2 teaspoon lemon pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon dried red pepper flakes, or to taste (optional)', u'2 cups drained kidney beans (19-ounce can)', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste', u'1/2 lemon, juiced, or to taste', u'3 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro']
title: Rajma (Vegetarian Chili)

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'1 (14-ounce) can pizza crust']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons butter, melted', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin seed', u'1/2 teaspoon poppy seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame seeds']
title: Naan-Style Flatbread

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'On a baking sheet with sides, add the chicken thighs, olive oil, ground coriander and salt and pepper, to taste, and toss to coat. Roast the chicken in the oven until cooked through, about 30 minutes, and an instant-read thermometer registers 160 degrees F when inserted into the thickest part of the thigh. ', u"Meanwhile, in a large, deep saute pan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the onions, garlic, ginger and a sprinkling of salt. Saute until the onions are soft and translucent. Add the tandoori masala powder and saute a couple minutes until you can really smell the spices. Don't let the onions brown or stick to the bottom of the pot. Stir in the tomato sauce, molasses, lemon juice, vinegar and brown sugar. Simmer until thickened, about 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste, and stir in the chopped cilantro. (Sauce can be made a day ahead and reheated to serve.) If the sauce gets too thick, stir in a few tablespoons of water until the desired consistency is reached.", u'Remove the chicken from the oven to a cutting board and allow it to rest for a few minutes. Slice into 1/2-inch strips and toss it into the sauce. Keep warm.', u'To serve, arrange the hot blini on a serving platter and top with the tandoori chicken. Garnish with scallions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 small onion, finely diced', u'2 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon minced freshly peeled ginger', u'2 tablespoons tandoori masala powder', u'1 (15-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'2 tablespoons molasses', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u' Blini, recipe follows', u' Sliced scallions, garnish', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'1 1/2 cups ricotta cheese', u'3 large eggs', u'1/4 cup milk', u'4 scallions, finely chopped', u' Butter, for cooking blini']
title: Scallion Blini with Chicken in Tandoori BBQ Sauce

directions: [u'Cook rice according to package directions. ', u'Meanwhile, using a fork, pull chicken meat from bone in shreds. Transfer chicken to a medium saucepan. Add chick peas, tomatoes, sour cream, curry powder, and cumin and mix well. Set pan over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Simmer 5 minutes to heat through. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro. Season, to taste, with salt and black pepper. Serve chicken curry over rice. Garnish with cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups quick-cooking white or brown rice', u'2 roasted chicken breast halves', u'1 (15-ounce) can chick peas, drained', u'1 (15-ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', u'1/2 cup lowfat sour cream', u'1 1/2 teaspoons curry powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus 1/2 cup, for garnish', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Chicken Curry with Chick Peas and Tomatoes

directions: [u'1. Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat.  Add the onions and chiles and lower the heat.  Cook, stirring frequently, for about 10 minutes, or until the onions are golden brown and well caramelized.', u'2. Stir in the ginger and lemongrass and saute for 2 minutes.  Add the potatoes and stir to combine.  Stir in the black cumin and turmeric.  When the spices are well incorporated, stir in the coconut milk and the half-and half.  Add salt and remove from the heat.', u'3. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.', u'4. Place the chicken in a Dutch oven or another large heavy ovenproof casserole.  Pour the coconut mixture over the top of the chicken.  Cover and bake for about 1 hour, or until the chicken is very tender.', u'5. Serve, family style, with basmati rice, a green salad, and warm Indian breads.', u'Note: In India, the chiles would be left in the finished dish, but if you are concerned about them being eaten, remove them before serving.', u'Wine suggestions: Qupe Syrah Louis M. Martini Red Zinfandel']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'1/4 cup finely chopped onions', u'4 dried cayenne chiles', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh lemongrass', u'2 cups diced peeled cooked potatoes', u'1 tablespoon toasted black cumin seeds, ground', u'1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'6 ounces coconut milk', u'6 ounces half-and-half', u' coarse salt, to taste', u' Two 2 1/2-pound whole chickens, cut into serving pieces']
title: Chicken with Coconut Milk, Lemongrass, and Ginger

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 500 to 550 degrees F, as high as it goes. Cover a baking sheet with foil and set a baking rack on top if you have one - not necessary but use it if ya got it. ', u'Place yogurt in shallow dish and combine with ginger, 3 cloves grated garlic, chili powder, coriander, paprika, turmeric, cardamom, cumin and 2 tablespoons oil. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and coat in sauce. Arrange on baking sheet and roast 20 to 25 minutes until juices run clear.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 1 clove grated garlic. Pulse chop the chick peas in food processor then add to garlic oil and season with salt and pepper. Mash with chicken stock and tahini and reduce heat to low. ', u'Combine red onion, bell peppers, chopped hot peppers, to taste, 2 tablespoons hot pepper pickle juice, cilantro leaves, lime juice. Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and season with salt and pepper.', u'Wedge the remaining lime, reserve. ', u'Warm and crisp pitas in hot oven last few minutes chicken is roasting.  ', u'Serve chicken with lime wedges to squeeze over top. Serve mashed chick peas alongside. Top the chicken with pepper salad. Cut pitas in half and pass at table.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup Greek yogurt', u'2 inches grated ginger root', u'4 cloves garlic, grated, divided', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2 teaspoons coriander', u'1 teaspoon smoked paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'3 tablespoons plus some for drizzling extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u'3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut across in 1/2', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cans chick peas, drained', u'1/2 cup chicken stock', u'1/4 cup tahini paste', u'1 small red onion, very thinly sliced or 1/2-inch dice', u'1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced or 1/2-inch dice', u' Hot banana pepper rings, drained and chopped plus 2 tablespoons juice', u' Handful fresh cilantro leaves, chopped', u'1 lime, juiced, plus 1 lime, for garnish', u'4 pita breads']
title: Tandoori Chicken with Mashed Chick Peas and Pepper and Onion Salad

author: Aida Mollenkamp
directions: [u'In a small bowl, mix together 1/4 cup oil, garam masala, ginger, garlic, and 1 tablespoon salt. Place chicken in a large baking dish or plastic bag, loosen the skin from the breast and legs of the chicken and, using your hands, spread a good part of the mixture underneath. Rub the remaining mixture inside the chicken cavity and over the skin. Tie the legs together with kitchen twine. Loosely cover, refrigerate, and let marinate 30 minutes or up to 12 hours.', u'Arrange the rack in the center of the oven and heat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Remove chicken from marinade, let any excess drip off, and reserve marinade. Let chicken sit at room temperature while oven warms up, about 30 minutes.', u'When the oven is heated, place potatoes, squash, and onions in bottom of a roasting pan, drizzle with any remaining marinade, remaining 1/4 cup oil, remaining 1 tablespoon salt, and season well freshly ground black pepper. Toss to coat. Place chicken, breast side up, on top of vegetables and roast until skin becomes brown and vegetables are starting to get tender, about 1 hour. Brush yogurt on chicken and continue roasting until chicken is well browned, juices run clear when inner thigh is pierced with a knife, legs move easily in the joint, and a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest portion of the thigh registers160 to 165 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer, about another 40 to 50 minutes. Let chicken rest at least 10 to 15 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup peanut oil', u'4 teaspoons garam masala', u'1 (2-inch) piece ginger, sliced', u'8 medium garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 (4 to 5 pound) whole chicken', u'1 1/2 pounds red potatoes, halved', u'1 pound butternut squash, large dice', u'1 medium red onion, large dice', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup plain whole milk yogurt']
title: Garam Masala Chicken with Roasted Vegetables

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the rice: Place the rice in a sieve and rinse under cold running water until the water runs clear. Set aside.', u'Melt the butter in a medium saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, over medium-high heat. Add the golden raisins, almonds, turmeric, cumin seed, coriander seed, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick and cook, stirring, until toasted and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until toasted, about 1 minute more. Add the water and salt and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer, (wrap the lid tightly with a kitchen towel), cover, and steam until the rice is tender, 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and let rest, covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, make the vegetables. Melt the butter in a medium straight-sided skillet with a tight-fitting lid, over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add the garlic and ginger and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the golden raisins, almonds, coriander seed, cumin seed, and cardamom and cook, stirring, until toasted and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in the cauliflower, green beans, potatoes, carrots, and salt. Raise the heat to high, pour in the water, and cook, covered, for 4 minutes. Uncover and cook, stirring, until the vegetables are tender and most of the water has evaporated, about 1 1/2 minutes more.', u'Add the rice to the vegetable mixture and, using a rubber spatula, stir to combine. Season with salt to taste. Divide the vegetable-rice mixture among plates and top with some of the toasted coconut and almonds. Serve immediately.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cups basmati rice', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons golden raisins', u'2 tablespoons blanched, sliced almonds', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/4 teaspoon whole cumin seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon whole coriander seeds', u'3 whole cardamom pods', u'1 cinnamon stick, broken in half', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/4 small yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon peeled, minced fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons golden raisins', u'2 tablespoons blanched, sliced almonds', u'1 1/2 teaspoons whole coriander seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon whole cumin seeds', u'5 whole cardamom pods', u'1 cup small cauliflower florets', u'3 ounces green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'3 small new potatoes (about 6 ounces), peeled and quartered', u'1 medium carrot, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2/3 cup water', u'2 tablespoons toasted shredded coconut', u'2 tablespoons toasted blanched, sliced almonds', u' Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
title: Vegetable Biryani

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'For the beef: Mix the garlic, garam masala, salt, and pepper with enough oil to make a paste. Rub the paste all over beef and marinate for 1 hour. Preheat a grill or grill pan and preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.', u'Sear the meat on the grill, sear all sides. Transfer the meat to a roasting pan and finish in the oven until, a thermometer reads an internal temperature of 145 degrees F for medium. Allow the beef to rest before slicing.', u'For the tomato sauce: Meanwhile, in a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon canola oil until shimmering. Add the garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the garam masala, cooking another 30 seconds, then add the tomato puree, brown sugar, vinegar, and Worcestershire. Season the mixture with salt, and pepper, to taste. Add water and simmer 20 minutes, or until the flavors deepen and the sauce thickens.', u'For the rice: Wash the rice in 4 changes of water, until the water is relatively clear. Soak the rice for 30 minutes, and then drain. ', u'In large pot, add 2 tablespoons oil and warm over medium heat until oil shimmers. Add the caraway seeds and toast for 1 minute. Add the onions, sauteing until golden brown. Drain the rice. Add to pot and toast, stirring every now and then, until the grains are separate and glistening with oil. Add the water, season with salt and pepper, and bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer, covered, until cooked, about 15 minutes.', u'Warm the tortillas over an open flame or in a pan. Slice the beef into thin slices. Construct the tacos with a little rice, some meat, some sauce, a sprig of fresh cilantro, and 2 slices of jalapeno.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons minced fresh garlic', u'3 tablespoons garam masala powder', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', u'3 to 4 tablespoons canola oil, plus more if needed', u'1 (2 to 3-pound) beef tri-tip', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'3 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon garam masala', u'1 (32-ounce) can tomato puree', u'1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'1 cup water', u'1 1/2 cups basmati rice', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 teaspoons caraway seeds', u'1 small onion, minced', u'3 cups water', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'1 package corn tortillas', u' Bunch fresh cilantro sprigs', u'2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and thinly sliced']
title: Indian Spiced Tri-Tip Tacos with Caraway Basmati Rice and Tangy Tomato Sauce

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Heat the canola oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Crush the cumin seed with the coriander seed and add to the pan. Add the curry powder, ginger, and garlic to the pan. Cook these spices, stirring until the oil colors and the spices are fragrant. Add the cauliflower florets to the pan and toss to coat.', u'In a lidded plastic container, combine the water, rice wine vinegar, cider vinegar, sugar, and pickling salt. Shake to combine.', u'Once the cauliflower is slightly tender, add it to a glass jar. Pour the pickling liquid over the cauliflower, filling to the top of the jar. Cool, chill, and store the pickles for 1 week to allow the flavors to develop thoroughly.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 teaspoon cumin seed', u'1 teaspoon coriander seed', u'2 teaspoons curry powder', u'1 teaspoon fresh ginger, minced', u'1 whole clove garlic, smashed', u'1 head cauliflower, cut into florets', u'1 cup water', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup cider vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon pickling salt']
title: Hurry Curry Cauliflower

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Pre-heat oven to 325 degrees F.  ', u'Butter and lightly sugar 4 ramekins (approximately 6-ounce size).  In a mixer, combine yolks, buttermilk, juice and zest and beat until well combined.  Reduce the speed to low and slowly add sifted flour, sugar and salt until just combined.  Beat egg whites with a whisk attachment until you get stiff peaks then combine the two mixtures by gently folding them together, a little at a time.  Divide evenly amongst ramekins then bake in a water bath - set ramekins in a roasting tray and fill with water halfway up the sides of the ramekins.', u'Bake in the oven for 60 minutes until the top springs back when gently pressed and the cakes have a nice light golden color.  Allow to cool slightly, then carefully invert onto a plate.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'2/3 cup superfine sugar', u'2 eggs, separated', u'2/3 cup reduced fat buttermilk', u'1/2 tablespoon blood orange zest', u'1/2 tablespoon ruby grapefruit zest', u'1 tablespoon blood orange juice', u'1 tablespoon ruby grapefruit juice', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'16 round ginger snap cookies', u' pinch of salt', u'1/2 stick unsalted butter, room temperature', u'2 tablespoons molasses', u'1 large egg white', u'1/4 cup lightly packed light brown sugar', u'2 cups packed light brown sugar', u'1/2 stick unsalted butter', u' A double pinch of Kosher salt', u'1/3 cup heavy cream']
title: Indian Summer Citrus Pudding with Ginger Snaps and Salted Caramel
