author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a food processor combine the onion, garlic, jalapeno, garam masala, cumin, and cloves. Process to make a chunky paste.', u'Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion mixture, curry powder, and 1/4 cup water. Let fry 4 to 5 minutes.', u'Add chicken pieces, potatoes, and salt to taste. Add water to cover, up to 3 cups, and bring to a boil. Simmer until the chicken and potatoes are cooked through, about 30 minutes. Serve over rice.']
ingredients: [u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'6 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 jalapeno, chopped', u'1 tablespoon garam masala', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'2 to 4 cloves', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'1/14 cup water', u'1 chicken, cut into 8 pieces', u'4 medium potatoes, peeled and diced', u' Kosher salt', u' Steamed white rice, for serving']
title: Spicy Chicken Curry

directions: [u'Bring water or stock and butter to boil. Add rice slowly, stirring constantly. Bring back to boil to a boil, reduce heat, simmer and stir gently once more. Cover and simmer for 9 minutes or just until rice begins to stick to the bottom of saucepan. Remove from heat, fluff with fork and let rest uncovered for 5 to10 minutes to allow rice to "dry". Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 cups water or vegetable stock', u'1 (8 ounce) package Jasmine Blend Indian Harvest rice', u'1 teaspoon butter']
title: Indian Harvest Jasmine Blend Rice

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Shell the cardamom: Gently crack open the green and black cardamom pods with a mortar and pestle (or crush them on a cutting board using a heavy pan). Remove the seeds and discard the husks.', u'Grind the spices: Finely grind the cardamom seeds, cinnamon sticks and cloves in a spice or coffee grinder. Store in an airtight container away from direct sunlight for up to 1 year.', u'Photograph by Coral Von Zumwalt']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup green cardamom pods', u'4 black cardamom pods', u'3 large cinnamon sticks, preferably Ceylon, broken into pieces', u'2 tablespoons whole cloves']
title: Garam Masala

directions: [u'To make the dough: Mix the salt and flour in a medium bowl or a food processor. With a pastry blender, incorporate the butter until crumbs have formed. Add the water a few tablespoons at a time, until you can form a ball. Knead the dough for about 5 minutes. Let it rest for about 15 minutes more. You can prepare the dough in advance and refrigerate it. ', u'To make the filling: Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and set aside. ', u'If using fresh carrots, chop and simmer in water, to cover, in a small pot. Add the corn and peas to barely cook. Set aside to cool. ', u'Heat the oil in a pan and fry the onion until golden. Add the garlic, ginger, and chile and cook for 2 minutes. Add the garam masala, turmeric, chile powder, and salt and cook 2 minutes more. ', u'In a bowl combine the mashed potatoes, the onion and spice mixture, carrots, peas, corn, lemon juice, and chopped coriander. Mix well. ', u'To assemble the samosas: Divide the dough into 9 equal size balls. On a floured surface, roll each ball into a 5-inch circle. Cut each circle in half. ', u'Brush the straightedge side with a little water, fold it in half, and align the two straight sides so they overlap to form a cone shape. Squeeze the edges together to make a tight seal. Place approximately 1 generous tablespoon of filling inside each cone, leaving the top edge clean. Moisten the inside top rim of the cone and press the edges together to make another tight seal. Place the samosas on a tray until ready to fry. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling. ', u'Heat approximately 3 inches of vegetable oil in a deep saucepan. Fry several samosas at a time, being careful not to crowd them. When 1 side turns golden brown, flip it over to brown on the other side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with chutney.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 1/4 cups self-rising flour', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) butter, cut in small pieces', u'9 tablespoons water', u'1 1/2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks', u'1 cup fresh or frozen mixed peas, corn, and carrots', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh ginger', u'1/2 habenero chile, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon garam masala spice blend', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 teaspoon red chile powder', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves', u' Vegetable oil, for frying']
title: Spiced Potato-stuffed Pastries: Samosas

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Marinate the meat sprinkled with salt, pepper and paprika in the lime juice for 1 hour.', u'Heat the oil in a Dutch oven, then add the coriander, cumin, turmeric and cardamom and stir until very fragrant, 1 minute. Next add the garlic, sweet and hot peppers, ginger, onions and some salt and pepper. Soften for 5 minutes partially covered, and then add the passata, stock, chutney, bay leaf, cinnamon stick and diced tomatoes. Simmer over low heat, about 1 hour. Remove the bay and cinnamon.', u'Add the marinated meat to the sauce and simmer to tender. Wilt the spinach into the sauce. Serve, or cool and store in the refrigerator or freezer for a make-ahead meal.', u'Serve the curry with naan bread and/or over rice with a dollop of yogurt for mixing in. Garnish with cilantro and scallion slices.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable, grapeseed or peanut oil', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander, a palmful', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin or cumin seed, a palmful', u'2 teaspoons turmeric, 2/3 palmful', u'2 cardamom pods, split, or 1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced or chopped', u'2 sweet red bell peppers, seeded and chopped', u'2 hot chile peppers, such as Fresno chiles, sliced', u' One 1-inch piece ginger root, grated', u'1 onion, finely chopped', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups passata or tomato sauce', u'1 cup chicken stock', u"1/2 cup mango chutney, such as Patak brand Major Grey's", u'1 large fresh bay leaf', u'1 small cinnamon stick', u' One 15-ounce can diced tomatoes', u'1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken, boneless leg of lamb or beef sirloin, cubed into bite-size pieces', u'2 limes, juiced', u'1 teaspoon sweet paprika', u'12 ounces farm spinach (bundles), stemmed and cleaned, coarsely chopped', u' Grilled naan bread and/or basmati rice', u' Plain Greek-style yogurt', u' Cilantro leaves', u' Thinly sliced scallions']
title: Hot and Sweet Pepper Curry Sauce with Chicken, Lamb or Beef

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Poke several holes in the bag of frozen vegetables and microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes or until thawed. Set aside.', u'In medium mixing bowl, whisk together yogurt and cornstarch. Set aside.', u'Heat oil in a 10-inch, non-reactive saute pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin seeds, fennel seeds and mustard seeds, cover pan with a splatter screen, and cook, stirring occasionally, until they begin to pop. Once they begin to pop, turn the heat down to medium, and add turmeric, onion powder, coriander, cinnamon, garlic, and chiles. Saute until garlic turns golden brown in color, approximately 3 to 5 minutes. Gently add the vegetables, sugar, salt and pepper, if desired, and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until vegetables are heated through. Remove vegetables from heat, pour into bowl with yogurt mixture, and stir to combine. Remove chiles if desired, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 (1-pound) bag mixed frozen vegetables', u'2/3 cup plain yogurt', u'1 teaspoon cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon onion powder', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground coriander', u'1/8 teaspoon freshly ground cinnamon', u'2 medium cloves garlic, crushed', u'3 dried red chiles, stems and seeds removed if less heat is desired', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u' Black pepper, optional']
servings: 2 main course servings or 4 as side dish
title: Vegetable Curry

directions: [u'Peel apples and cut into quarters. Remove cores, roughly chop, and reserve. ', u'Heat oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add mustard seeds, cover and cook until popping stops. Reduce heat and add onion, red bell pepper, and salt. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until onions are translucent. Stir in garlic, serrano chile, ginger, and allspice, and cook an additional minute. ', u'Add remaining ingredients, including reserved apples. Cook, uncovered, over moderate heat, until mixture is soft and aromatic, about 40 minutes. Chill before serving.']
ingredients: [u'4 green apples', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon mustard seeds', u'1 onion, diced', u'1 red bell pepper, cored and diced', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 teaspoons pureed garlic', u'1 to 2 serrano chiles, diced with seeds', u'1 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/4 cup raisins', u'1 cup packed brown sugar', u'3/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1 cup water']
title: Spicy Apple Chutney

directions: [u'Combine milk and half and half in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over low heat. Remove from heat and transfer to a clean bowl. Set aside to cool to 115 degrees F. Add yogurt and vigorously whisk. ', u'Cover bowl with plastic, then wrap well with heavy towels or a blanket. Set aside in a warm place for 6 to 8 hours, or longer according to taste. The longer yogurt sits, the more acidic it will become. Store in sealed containers in refrigerator.']
ingredients: [u'1 quart milk', u'1 cup half and half', u'1 tablespoon plain yogurt']
title: Homemade Yogurt

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Warm olive oil in a medium saucepan. Add rice and onion. Stir until rice is well coated and translucent around edges, about 2 minutes. Add water and salt. Stir, cover, reduce heat to low and cook 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let rest, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff rice. Then gently mix in remaining ingredients.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 cup white basmati rice', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'2 cups water', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/4 cup sliced apricots', u'2 tablespoons chopped currants', u'1/4 cup sliced almonds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Bollywood Basmati

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'For the mango salsa, combine mango, onion, red and green bell peppers, chives, lemon juice, honey, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a nonreactive bowl and chill.', u'Bring chicken stock to a boil in a medium saucepot. Add rice, salt, butter and Italian seasoning. Return to a boil, cover and let simmer for 20 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let stand for an additional 5 minutes covered before removing lid.', u'In a separate large wok or heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat the oil over medium high heat, add the onions and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Lower the heat to medium, stir in the curry powder and flour to combine with the onions and let cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in the vegetable stock and let cook for 10 minutes to make sure the curry powder begins to lose its grittiness. Then add fresh ginger, garlic, carrots, cauliflower, and broccoli, mix well and cook for 10 minutes.', u'Add the zucchini, edamame, corn, okra and tomato paste, tomatoes with their juice, leek, jalapeno, and salt and pepper, to taste. Bring slowly to a boil, then simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.', u'Place some rice in the middle of a serving dish and spoon vegetable curry over. Top with mango salsa.']
ingredients: [u'1 mango, diced small', u'2 teaspoons diced red onion', u'2 teaspoons diced red bell pepper', u'2 teaspoons diced green bell pepper', u'1 teaspoon chopped chives', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons honey', u'1 teaspoon rice wine vinegar', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'1 cup white rice', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning or 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano and 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme and 1/2 teaspoon dried parsley', u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil', u'1 large white onion, diced', u'1 tablespoon Madras curry powder', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'3 cups vegetable stock', u'1 ounce fresh ginger root (about 1 1/2-inch piece)', u'2 cloves garlic, lightly crushed with the side of a knife blade and minced', u'2 carrots, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch slices', u'1 head cauliflower, separated into florets', u'1 head broccoli, separated into florets', u'1 yellow squash, cut into 1/4-inch thick slices', u'2 zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch thick slices', u'1 (6- ounce) package edamame (Japanese lima-type beans)', u'1 (6-ounce) package fresh frozen corn', u'1 (6-ounce) package frozen okra, defrosted and sliced crosswise into 1/4-inch pieces', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 (14 to 16-ounce) can chopped tomatoes', u'1 leek tender white and green parts only, soaked in salt water and agitated to remove grit, sliced on the bias into 1/4-inch thick strips', u'1 jalapeno pepper, stem and seeds removed and sliced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Hi-Wire Hot Vegetable Curry with Mango Salsa Sambal

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Season entire hen with salt, including the cavity. Push the wings back and rub the garam masala over the entire hen. Place on a lightly oiled baking rack set over a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Brush with some of the glaze and reduce the heat to 375 degrees F and continue baking until just cooked through, about 10 to 15 minutes longer or until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the leg registers 160 degrees F. Remove from the oven, brush with the remaining glaze, and let rest 5 minutes before serving. Alternatively, you can sear the hens in an oven-safe saute pan over medium-high heat and then transfer pan to the oven to finish cooking.']
ingredients: [u'4 cornish hens, washed and patted dry', u' Salt', u'6 tablespoons garam masala', u' Maple-Tamarind Glaze, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 shallots, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon minced or grated fresh ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon red chili flakes', u'1/2 cup homemade chicken stock', u'1 teaspoon black peppercorns', u'1 cup pure maple syrup', u'1 tablespoon tamarind paste', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Garam Masala Rubbed Cornish Hen with Maple-Tamarind Glaze

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Place chicken breasts and flour in zip-top bag. Shake until chicken is coated with flour. Remove from bag, shaking off excess flour and set aside.', u'Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. When oil is hot, add the chicken breasts and fry until golden brown on both sides. Remove chicken to a plate and set aside.', u'Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook until soft. Add the garam masala, tomatoes, soup, coconut milk, and salt and pepper to taste and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a  simmer and return the chicken breasts to the pan. Simmer for 15 minutes, then add the frozen peas. Return to a simmer and cook for an addition 10 minutes.', u'Serve hot with white rice.', u"Cook's Note: Garam masala is a traditional Indian blend of spices and is available in the spice section of the grocery store."]
ingredients: [u'4 chicken breast halves without skin', u'1/3 cup all-purpose flour, for dredging', u'2 tablespoons canola oil1 onion, chopped', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon garam masala seasoning, plus 2 teaspoons', u'1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', u'1/2 cup cream of chicken soup, condensed', u'1 cup light coconut milk', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 cup frozen peas', u' Cooked white rice, to serve']
title: Chicken Masala

directions: [u'Slice tomatoes into 6 wedges each. Reserve in a large bowl with scallions and serrano chiles. ', u'In a saucepan bring vinegar to a boil. Add sugar and salt, and cook until dissolved, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and reserve. ', u'Measure ginger, garlic, mustard seeds, cracked peppercorns, cumin, cayenne, and turmeric onto a plate and place near stove. In another saucepan heat oil until smoking. Add spices and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until aromas are released, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vinegar mixture. ', u'Immediately pour over reserved vegetables. Mix well, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate a minimum of 3 days.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds tomatoes, peeled and cored', u'1 bunch scallions, white and green, sliced diagonally', u'5 serrano chiles, with seeds, sliced diagonally', u'3/4 cup white vinegar', u'1/4 cup palm or dark brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon coarse salt', u'2 tablespoons freshly grated ginger', u'2 tablespoons pureed garlic', u'1 tablespoon black or yellow mustard seeds', u'1 tablespoon cracked black peppercorns', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'3/4 cup olive oil']
title: Pickled Tomatoes

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"In a small skillet, toast the fennel and coriander seeds for a couple of minutes until they're fragrant and slightly darker, about 2 minutes. Don't walk away from the pan! They'll burn! Remove from the pan and throw into a coffee/spice grinder. Grind to a fine powder.", u'Meanwhile, make the yogurt sauce: Mix the yogurt with the 1/2 cup finely chopped mint leaves and a generous pinch of salt. Chill in the fridge.', u"Throw the peas, edamame, ground spices, shallot, garlic, remaining whole mint leaves, olive oil, and salt into a food processor. Whizz it up and puree until smooth. It won't get completely smooth because of the edamame, but process until it is as smooth as possible.", u'Scrape into a big bowl and stir in the flour. The mixture will still be pretty soft. Not to worry!', u"Pour enough oil into a large cast iron skillet so that it's 1/4-inch deep. Heat over medium heat until shimmering. Meanwhile, with wet hands, shape the pea mixture into 12 small patties the size of a golf ball, and then gently drop into the oil. Fry until the bottoms are dark caramel brown, about 2 minutes, and then carefully flip over. Brown the other side, and then remove from the pan and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.", u'Serve warm in a pita bread pocket stuffed with the fresh veggies and a spoonful of the yogurt sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'1/2 cup lightly packed fresh mint leaves, finely chopped, plus 3/4 cup whole leaves', u' Kosher salt', u'1 cup frozen peas, thawed and drained', u"1 cup frozen edamame, thawed and drained (if you can't find these, or don't like them, substitute with an extra cup of peas)", u'1 large shallot, peeled and roughly chopped', u'1 clove garlic, peeled', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Generous 1/4 cup chickpea flour (besan, available at Indian stores; regular flour is a fine substitute)', u' Canola oil, for frying', u'2 large pitas, halved', u'2 large vine-ripened tomatoes, cut into large dice', u'1 large English cucumber, sliced into 1/8-inch rounds']
title: Fried Pea and Mint Patty Sandwiches: Pea-lafels

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Set a 4 or 5-quart saucepan over medium heat and add the ghee. While the ghee is heating, season the chicken with the garam masala and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Once the ghee is hot, add the chicken and cook, turning often, until golden brown and fragrant, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside to cool. ', u'While the chicken is cooling, add the onions, carrots and celery to the hot pan and saute until lightly caramelized, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger and apples to the pan and saute until the apples are caramelized, about 7 to 8 minutes. Add the potatoes, sweet potatoes, and lentils to the pan, along with 4 cups of the chicken stock. Raise the heat to high and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook the soup until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Add the reserved chicken, the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, the pepper, remaining 2 cups of chicken stock, zucchini, squash, spinach, coconut milk, and tomatoes. Continue to cook the soup at a simmer until the lentils and chicken are both tender, 10 to 15 minutes longer. Remove from the heat and stir in the cider vinegar. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. To serve the soup, place 1/4 cup of the rice in a warmed bowl, and pour 8 ounces of the soup over the rice, garnish with a tablespoon of the cashews, and 2 teaspoons of the cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons ghee or clarified butter', u'1 1/2 pounds diced boneless, skinless chicken thighs', u'2 tablespoons garam masala', u'1 3/4 teaspoons salt', u'2 cups small diced onions', u'1/2 cup small diced carrots', u'1/2 cup small diced celery', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u'2 cups peeled, cored and diced Granny Smith apples', u'1 cup peeled and diced Yukon gold potatoes', u'1 cup peeled and diced sweet potatoes', u'1 cup dried red lentils', u'6 cups chicken or beef stock', u'3/4 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup diced zucchini', u'3/4 cup diced yellow squash', u'1 cup tightly packed baby spinach', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 cup peeled, seeded and chopped tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', u'3 cups steamed white basmati rice', u'1/2 cup toasted, finely ground cashews', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Emeril's Mulligatawny Soup

directions: [u'In a large skillet, heat the oil over moderate heat until it is hot but not smoking; cook the mustard seeds, covered, stirring occasionally, until the popping subsides. Add the gingerroot and the turmeric and cook the mixture, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add the cauliflower, stirring to coat it with the oil, and 1/2 cup water and steam the mixture, covered, adding more water a few tablespoons at a time if it evaporates, until the cauliflower is just tender, about 6 to 10 minutes. Season the cauliflower mixture with the lemon juice, salt, and pepper and stir in the coriander, if using.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons yellow mustard seeds or black mustard seeds (available at East Indian markets and some specialty foods shops)', u'2 teaspoons grated peeled fresh gingerroot', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 large head cauliflower (about 1 3/4 to 2 pounds), cut into in small 1-inch florets', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander, optional']
title: Cauliflower with Ginger and Mustard Seeds

directions: [u'In a large skillet, toast the cumin, coriander, and cardamom over low heat until you smell the spices, about 1 minute. Grind the spices finely in a spice grinder. Add oil to the skillet, and heat over medium-high until the oil is very hot or smoking. Add the chicken and season with salt and pepper. Let the chicken brown before stirring; and brown evenly on each side. Add the curry powder, chili powder, cinnamon, tomatoes, onion, garlic, ginger, coconut milk, and white wine. Bring to a boil, and then simmer over low heat until the sauce thickens, about 1 hour. Season with salt and pepper, to taste, and add the cilantro.', u'Ladle the masala over a bed of basmati rice. Lightly spray the uncooked poppadum with vegetable spray on both sides and cook in the microwave on high until poppadum is puffed and crisp, about 45 seconds. Serve with mango chutney on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1 teaspoon cardamom pods', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 whole chicken breast, cut into cubes', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon curry powder', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'1/2 cinnamon stick', u'2 large tomatoes, diced', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u'2 cloves garlic, diced', u'1 teaspoon fresh ginger, chopped', u'1/3 cup coconut milk', u'1/3 cup white wine', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 cup cooked basmati rice', u'2 uncooked Indian poppadum', u'2 ounces prepared mango chutney']
title: Chicken Bhuna Masala

directions: [u'Beat yogurt until smooth and gradually stir in iced water. Season with salt and pepper.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup yogurt', u'3 cups iced water', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u'1/2 cup yogurt', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 cups iced soda', u'1 cup pureed mango']
title: Lassis (Yogurt Drinks)

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Whisk together the oil, mustard seeds, jalapeno, ginger, and turmeric in a small bowl.', u'Place cauliflower in a medium baking dish and toss with the flavored oil and season with salt. Roast until lightly golden brown and just tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon black mustard seeds', u'1 jalapeno, finely diced', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 head cauliflower, cut into florets', u' Salt']
title: Oven Roasted Cauliflower with Turmeric and Ginger

directions: [u'In a small food processor (mini-chopper), combine the garlic, ginger, and 1 tablespoon water and puree to a paste. ', u'Heat the oil in a stew pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the coriander, cumin, cardamom, allspice, cloves, cinnamon stick, and bay leaf and cook, stirring constantly, until toasted and fragrant and the cinnamon stick unfurls, about 30 seconds. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic-ginger paste, curry powder, and jalapeno and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and fragrant, about 1 minute. ', u'Add the tomato and cook, stirring, until the oil begin to separate and there is a distinctive crackling sound as the ingredients "re-fry" in the oil, about 6 minutes. ', u'Add the vegetables, season with salt and pepper and stir to combine.', u'Add the coconut milk and enough water to just cover the vegetables. Bring to a boil, lower the heat, and simmer, covered, until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Using a slotted spoon transfer the vegetables to a bowl. Bring the broth to a boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced to a sauce-like consistency. If using the chicken, add and reheat. Return the vegetables to the sauce and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a platter and garnish with the cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'5 cloves garlic', u'1 (3-inch) chunk peeled, fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon water, plus more as needed', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'6 green cardamom pods', u'4 whole allspice', u'3 whole cloves', u'1 (3-inch) long cinnamon stick, broken in 1/2', u'1 bay leaf, preferably fresh', u'1 medium yellow onion, sliced', u'2 teaspoons Madras-style curry powder', u'1/2 jalapeno, or more to taste', u'1/2 cup whole, peeled, canned tomatoes (with puree), roughly chopped', u'8 cups mixed 1-inch-cut vegetables, such as cauliflower, potatoes, green beans, or eggplant', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u' About 2 cups (1-inch cubed) cooked chicken, preferably thigh or leg (optional)', u' Cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Serving suggestion: Basmati rice and chutney']
title: Vegetable Curry (with Chicken, if You Want)

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'To remove the flesh of the mango, cut the flesh away from the pit in 2 large pieces. Use a paring knife to cut through the flesh (but not through the peel) in a crisscross grid pattern. Use your thumbs to press against the skin side and pop the mango cubes up. Cut across the bottom, along the peel and add the cubes to the blender.', u'Peel ginger. Grate ginger finely into bowl. Use fingers to squeeze juice out of gratings. Discard juiced gratings.', u'Put ginger and remaining ingredients in the blender and blend until thick and smooth.', u"If you don't have a blender you can still make the drink: Just whisk everything but the ice together in a mixing bowl. Fill glasses with ice and pour the mixture on top."]
ingredients: [u'2 mangos', u'1 -inch piece of ginger', u'2 (8-ounce) containers vanilla yogurt', u'1 handful of ice cubes', u'2 tablespoons honey']
title: Ginger Mango Lassi

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak 1 1/2 cups basmati rice in cold water, 15 minutes; drain. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add 2 teaspoons cumin seeds; cook 30 seconds. Add 1 chopped onion and cook, stirring, 5 minutes. Add 2 1/4 cups water, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, the rice and 3 strips lemon zest. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook over low heat, 15 minutes. Let stand off the heat, 10 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds, and lemon juice to taste.', u'Photograph by Anna Williams']
title: Lemon-Cumin Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a small food processor (mini-chopper), combine the garlic and ginger and puree to a paste. ', u'Heat the oil in a stew pot or Dutch Oven over medium-high heat. Add the cloves, cardamom, allspice, cinnamon stick, and bay leaf and cook, stirring constantly, until dark and fragrant and the cinnamon stick unfurls, about 30 seconds. Add the onion and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic-ginger paste, curry powder, and jalapeno and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and fragrant, about 1 minute. ', u'Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Add the tomato and chicken and cook, stirring, until the oil begin to separate and there is a distinctive crackling sound as the ingredients "re-fry" in the oil, about 6 minutes. Continue to cook, stirring, until the chicken is lightly browned, about 7 minutes more. ', u'Add the water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to maintain a simmer, cover, and stew for 15 minutes. Uncover and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and tender and the liquid thickens into a sauce, about 30 minutes more. Transfer chicken curry to a serving bowl and serve with rice and chutney.']
ingredients: [u'5 cloves garlic', u' One 3-inch chunk peeled, fresh ginger', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 heaping teaspoon whole cloves', u'10 green cardamom pods', u'8 whole allspice', u'1 cinnamon stick, broken in half', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 medium yellow onion', u'2 teaspoons Madras-style curry powder', u'1/2 jalapeno, or more to taste', u'3 pounds mixed skinless, bone-in chicken thighs and drumsticks (separated)', u'1/2 cup whole, peeled, canned tomatoes (with puree), roughly chopped', u'2 cups cold water', u' Serving suggestion: Basmati rice and chutney']
title: Chicken Curry

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat oil in a medium saucepan. Add onion, garlic and ginger and cook until soft. Add the drained rice, salt and pepper and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.', u'While the rice is cooking, heat the remaining tablespoon of oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the cashews and cook until lightly golden brown. Drain on paper towels.', u'Place coconut milk and water in a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer. Add the hot liquid to the rice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover and cook for about 15 to 20 minutes. When the rice is cooked, remove from the oven and fold in the green onion, and coconut. Spoon the rice onto a platter and garnish with the toasted cashews.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons peanut oil, plus 1 tablespoon for the cashews', u'1 medium yellow onion, peeled, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 clove garlic, chopped', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 cups basmati rice, rinsed several times in cold water and drained well', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup raw cashews, halved', u'2 cups unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 cups water', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced green onion', u'1/4 cup grated fresh coconut']
title: Coconut-Cashew Basmati Rice Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat grill pan or indoor electric grill to high.', u'Combine yogurt, curry paste, lemon juice, and cilantro in a shallow dish. Add chunks of chicken and coat evenly in yogurt sauce. Lace meat onto metal skewers. When you are about 10 minutes away from eating, place chicken on hot grill and cook 5 or 6 minutes on each side, until charred at edges and chicken meat is firm.', u'Place a small heavy skillet on stovetop over high heat. When pan is very hot, add whole tomatoes. Pan roast the tomatoes until charred on all sides. Place the tomato sauce and charred fresh tomatoes in a food processor. Return skillet to heat and toast mustard and coriander seeds and crushed red pepper until they pop. Add seeds and flakes to food processor with a few pinches coarse salt. Pulse grind tomato mixture into a chunky chutney and transfer to a small bowl.   When you remove chicken from grill, add flat bread to blister and warm it through. Slide chicken off skewers on to a serving dish. Set bowl of tomato chutney with a serving spoon along side. Pile chicken into or onto flat bread with tomato chutney to top. Potatoes with cumin are a perfect side to this meal.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'1 rounded tablespoon mild curry paste', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' A handful (3 tablespoons) cilantro leaves, finely chopped', u'2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast meat, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', u'3 plum tomatoes', u'1/2 cup tomato sauce or tomato puree', u'1 teaspoon mustard seed', u'1 teaspoon coriander seed', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u' Coarse salt', u' Packaged flat breads, sold near packages pita bread in market', u' Serving suggestion: Potatoes with Cumin, recipe follows', u'2 pounds white-skinned potatoes, peeled and diced into small cubes', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'2 tablespoons (2 turns around the pan) peanut or vegetable oil', u'1 small sweet onion, chopped', u' Coarse salt']
title: Chicken Tikka Kebabs with Charred Tomato Chutney and Warm Flat Bread

directions: [u'In a large frying pan, heat 1 teaspoon ghee and pasta over medium heat until all pieces have lightly brown and give off a toasted aroma. Set aside. ', u'In a 3 quart heavy saucepan, heat milk and water on medium high. As soon as the mixture boils, reduce heat to medium and add fried pasta. Continue to simmer for 6 minutes, or until pasta is well cooked. Add sugar and simmer 15 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent sticking. When the mixture is done, it will have a creamy consistency. ', u'While the milk simmers, in the frying pan used for the pasta, fry the raisins and cashews in 2 teaspoons of ghee until lightly browned. ', u'Add the fried raisins and nuts and the cardamom to the milk, stir, and remove from the heat. Cover and chill for a few hours or more. ', u'Serve warm, reheating if necessary.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon Ghee or unsalted butter, recipe follows, plus 2 teaspoons unsalted butter', u'1 cup angel hair pasta, broken into 3/4-inch pieces', u'4 cups whole milk', u'2 cups water', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup golden raisins (sultanas) or dark raisins', u'1/2 cup broken raw cashew nuts', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'8 ounces (2 sticks) butter']
title: Vermicelli Payasam

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a glass baking dish or nonreactive mixing bowl combine curry paste with garlic and half of onion. Add pork, turn to coat thoroughly and set aside to marinate for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over low heat and gently saute remaining onion. Drain pork, reserving marinade. Turn up heat and add pork, a few cubes at a time, tossing until browned on all sides. Saute for 5 minutes, then add tomatoes and reserved marinade. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Serve over hot rice, garnished with cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup curry paste (recipe follows)', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 1/2 cups chopped onions', u'1 pound pork, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'4 tablespoons canola or neutral vegetable oil', u'1 cup peeled, seeded and diced tomato (tomato concasse)', u' Salt and pepper', u'4 cups cooked white rice', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, for garnish', u'2 teaspoons coriander seeds', u'2 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'2 teaspoons mustard seeds', u'2 teaspoons ground cloves', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and chopped', u'1/3 cup white vinegar']
title: Pork Vindaloo

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Cut cucumber in half lengthwise and grate into a medium mixing bowl. Add yogurt, sour cream, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon Greek seasoning. Stir to combine.', u'Season with salt and pepper.', u'Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve with toasted pitas chips.']
ingredients: [u'1 medium hot house cucumber', u'1 cup fat-free plain yogurt', u'1 cup fat-free sour cream', u'1 tablespoon lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons Greek seasoning, divided', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u"4 whole-grain pita pockets (recommended: Thomas' Sahara)"]
title: Cucumber Yogurt Dip with Pita Chips

directions: [u'Put the oil in a large, wide pot and set over medium-high heat. When very hot, put in the chile, onions and garlic. Stir and fry until the onions turn medium brown. Add the tomato. Stir and fry for 2 minutes. Now put in the spinach and salt. Cover, allowing the spinach to wilt. Stir, turn the heat to medium, cover again, and cook for 25 minutes. Uncover, add the garam masala, and stir. Cook, uncovered, another 5 to 6 minutes, or until almost no liquid is left is left at the bottom of the pan. Turn up the heat during this period, if needed.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup peanut or canola oil', u'1 to 2 hot fresh green chiles, very finely chopped', u'2 medium onions, peeled and very finely chopped', u'3 garlic cloves, peeled and very finely chopped', u'1 ripe tomato (4 ounces), peeled after dropping into boiling water for 15 seconds, and then peeled and finely chopped', u'3 pounds spinach, cut crosswise into very fine strips', u'1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', u'1 teaspoon garam masala']
title: Spinach with Tomato (Saag)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a medium pot over medium heat with extra-virgin olive oil. Add rice and toast for 1 to 2 minutes. Add 3 cups chicken stock and the bay, lemon zest, turmeric, coriander, cumin and cardamom. Cover pot and bring rice to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer rice 18 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork, remove bay leaf and add butter. Toss to coat the rice evenly.', u'While rice cooks, make the vegetables. Heat a deep nonstick skillet over medium-high heat with 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil. Add onion, garlic, eggplant and bell pepper. Cover and cook stirring occasionally 7 to 8 minutes until tender. Uncover and add the tomatoes, chick peas, salt, pepper, curry paste and remaining 1 cup chicken stock. Simmer 6 to 7 minutes longer. Mix scallions into rice and top with vegetables. Garnish with cashews.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'1 1/2 cups basmati rice', u'4 cups chicken stock, divided', u'1 bay leaf, fresh or dried', u'1 lemon, zested', u'1 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom, optional', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 medium eggplant, peeled and chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1 (14-ounce) can fire roasted diced tomatoes, drained', u'1 (15-ounce) can chick peas, drained', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 rounded tablespoons mild or hot curry paste', u'2 scallions, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped roasted cashews']
title: Lemon Rice and Eggplant-Chick Pea Curry

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Place the tamarind paste in the boiling water and set aside while preparing the other ingredients.', u'Combine the fish sauce, palm sugar, and rice wine vinegar in a small bowl and set aside.', u'Place the rice stick noodles in a mixing bowl and cover with hot water. Set aside while you prepare the remaining ingredients. Once the other ingredients are measured out into separate bowls, drain the water from the noodles and set them aside. Cut the tofu into 1/2-inch wide strips, similar to French fries.', u'Press the tamarind paste through a fine mesh strainer and add to the sauce. Stir to combine.', u'Place a wok over high heat. Once hot, add 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil. Heat until it shimmers, then add the tofu. Cook the tofu until golden brown, moving constantly, for no longer than 1 minute. Remove the tofu from the pan to a small bowl and set aside.', u'If necessary, add some more peanut oil to the pan and heat until shimmering. Add 2/3 of the scallions and then the garlic, cook for 10 to 15 seconds. Add the eggs to the pan; once the eggs begin to set up, about 15 to 20 seconds, stir to scramble. Add the remaining ingredients in the following order and toss after each addition: noodles, sauce, cabbage, shrimp, and 2/3 of the bean sprouts and peanuts. Toss everything until heated through, but no longer than 1 to 2 minutes total. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with the remaining scallions, bean sprouts, and peanuts. Serve immediately with the ground chile peppers and lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'1 -ounce tamarind paste', u'3/4 cup boiling water', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons palm sugar', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'4 ounces rice stick noodles', u'6 ounces Marinated Tofu, recipe follows', u'1 to 2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 cup chopped scallions, divided', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 whole eggs, beaten', u'2 teaspoons salted cabbage', u'1 tablespoon dried shrimp', u'3 ounces bean sprouts, divided', u'1/2 cup roasted salted peanuts, chopped, divided', u' Freshly ground dried red chile peppers, to taste', u'1 lime, cut into wedges', u'6 ounces extra-firm tofu, not silken', u'1 1/2 cups soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder']
title: Pad Thai

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a wok. Add the garlic and stir-fry until golden brown. Add the meat and shrimp and keep stirring until the shrimp changes color. Remove the shrimp to prevent overcooking and set aside.', u'Add the noodles. They will stick together so stir fast and try to separate them. Add a little water, stirring a few times. Then add the Pad Thai sauce, and keep stirring until everything is thoroughly mixed. The noodles should appear soft and moist. Return the cooked shrimp to the wok.', u'Push the contents of the wok up around the sides to make room to fry the eggs. If the pan is very dry, add 1 more tablespoon of oil. Add the eggs and spread the noodles over the eggs to cover. When the eggs are cooked, stir the noodles until everything is well mixed-this should result in cooked bits of eggs, both whites and yolk, throughout the noodle mixture.', u'Add chiles, peanuts, garlic chives and bean sprouts. Mix well. Remove to a platter. Serve with raw bean spouts and a few drops of lime juice. ', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus extra as needed', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'1 tablespoon dried shrimp, optional', u'1/2 cup sliced pork', u'1/2 cup whole shrimp, shelled and deveined', u'1 tablespoon (shredded) preserved radish', u'1/4 pound medium-size dried rice noodles (soaked 60 minutes in cold water and drained)', u' Water', u'5 tablespoons Pad Thai sauce, recipe follows', u'2 large eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon ground hot chiles, or more to taste', u'2 tablespoons ground roasted peanuts', u'1/2 cup sliced garlic chives or green onion', u'2 cups bean sprouts, rinsed, plus more for garnish', u'1 wedge lime', u'1 cup tamarind juice', u'1 cup palm sugar plus 3 tablespoons', u'1 cup water', u'1/2 cup fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons salt']
title: Kuay Tiaw Pad Thai

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and curry paste and cook, stirring, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth, coconut milk and fish sauce; cover and bring to a boil.', u'Add the bell peppers and noodles and simmer, uncovered, until the noodles are al dente, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken and simmer until just cooked through, about 3 more minutes. Stir in the lime juice and cilantro. Add more fish sauce and lime juice, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 onion, thinly sliced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons green curry paste', u'6 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 15 -ounce can coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce, plus more to taste', u'2 red bell peppers, thinly sliced', u'4 ounces thin rice noodles, broken into pieces', u'2 small skinless, boneless chicken breasts (about 1 pound), very thinly sliced crosswise', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, plus more to taste', u'1 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Thai Chicken Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a large saucepan, bring the coconut milk, chicken broth and curry paste to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the carrot, red pepper, onion, corn, chile, basil, lime leaves and fish sauce. Bring to a simmer, cover the pan and cook for 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.', u'Add the shrimp, snap peas and half of the noodles (reserve the remaining noodles for frying). Simmer, uncovered, until the shrimp are cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove and discard the lime leaves and basil sprigs.', u'Pour the canola oil into a large, wide saucepan fitted with a deep-fry thermometer. Heat the oil to 350 degrees F. Add the reserved noodles and fry them until crispy, about 20 seconds. Drain on paper towels.', u'Ladle the curry into four bowls. Garnish with cilantro and peanuts and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Two 15-ounce cans coconut milk', u'1 cup low-sodium chicken broth or clam juice', u'1/4 cup yellow curry paste, such as Mae Ploy', u'1 medium carrot, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch-thick rounds', u'1 small red bell pepper, cored, seeded and chopped into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1 small onion, chopped', u' One 15-ounce can baby corn, drained, rinsed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 Thai chile or serrano chile, stemmed and thinly sliced', u'5 sprigs Thai basil, with stems', u'3 Thai lime leaves', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'4 ounces snap peas, halved', u'8 ounces fresh thin rice noodles', u'4 cups canola oil or safflower oil', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/3 cup lightly salted peanuts, chopped']
title: Thai Curry

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil and turn off the heat. Add the rice noodles and let them soften, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drain. (Reserve 1 cup cooked noodles for Online Round 2 Recipe Summer Rolls.)', u'In a wok or a large skillet over high heat, add 1 tablespoon oil. When it is hot, add the eggs and cook until they are firm. Remove them from the pan and let them cool a bit. Roughly chop them and set aside.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, soy sauce, fish sauce, chile sauce, lime juice, garlic, and broth. Set side.', u'Add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the pan along with the carrots, scallions, and bean sprouts and stir fry 1 minute. Add the reserved eggs and sauce, stirring to coat everything completely. Cook for another minute. Serve garnished with peanuts and cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1 (16-ounce) package rice noodles', u'2 tablespoons canola oil, divided', u'2 large eggs, beaten', u'1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon chile sauce', u'1 tablespoon lime juice', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup chicken broth', u'1 carrot, grated', u'4 scallions, sliced thin (reserve 1 scallion for Round 2 Recipe Coconut Chicken Soup)', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'1/4 cup peanuts, coarsely chopped, for garnish', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro, roughly chopped, for garnish']
title: Pad Thai

directions: [u'In a blender or food processor, mix the peanut butter, coconut milk, agave nectar, lime juice, soy sauce, garlic powder, to taste, and red pepper flakes, to taste together until the texture is smooth and loose.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup peanut butter', u'1 (8-ounce) can coconut milk', u'1/2 cup agave nectar', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u' Garlic powder', u' Red pepper flakes']
title: Thai Peanut Sauce

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, water, peanut butter, and chili paste until smooth.', u'Heat a large wok over medium-high heat, and add canola oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and ginger and let cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the vegetables, chicken, and shrimp, and stir-fry until chicken and shrimp are browned and cooked through, about 2 minutes. Add noodles and toss to coat.', u'Add peanut/spice paste, brown sugar and cider vinegar and toss to distribute. Cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.', u'Spread chopped romaine on a platter. Serve pad Thai on top of lettuce and garnish with mung bean sprouts, lime, cilantro and chopped peanuts.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1 tablespoon creamy peanut butter', u'1 teaspoon Asian chili paste, such as sambal oelek', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1/2 cup julienned mixed vegetables (carrots, yellow squash, zucchini)', u'4 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breast or thigh, sliced into strips', u'12 medium to large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/4 pound medium-wide rice noodles, soaked in warm water until softened and drained', u'1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon cider vinegar', u' Chopped Romaine lettuce, for garnish', u' Mung bean sprouts, for garnish', u' Lime wedges, for garnish', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Chopped peanuts, for garnish']
title: Pad Thai with Chicken and Shrimp

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the chicken and marinade: Mix the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, grated ginger, Sriracha, rice wine vinegar and grated garlic in a large bowl or resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken strips and marinate, refrigerated, for 2 hours.', u'Heat a grill pan over high heat.', u'Remove the chicken strips from the marinade and grill until cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with the peanuts and cilantro.', u'For the lettuce and fillings: Set out the lettuce, bean sprouts, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers and rice noodles on the serving platter.', u'To assemble, use the butter lettuce leaves to contain the chicken and fillings. Add some chili and hoisin sauce, then roll them up and eat!']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup hoisin sauce', u'1/3 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon Sriracha', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'3 cloves garlic, grated', u'2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips', u'2 tablespoons chopped peanuts', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'8 butter lettuce leaves', u'1 cup bean sprouts', u'1 cup thinly sliced red cabbage', u'1 cup julienned carrots', u'1 cup cucumber slices', u'1 cup cooked thin rice noodles', u'1/3 cup sweet chili sauce', u'1/3 cup hoisin sauce']
title: Thai Lettuce Wraps

directions: [u'For the sauce: In a medium bowl, combine all of the sauce ingredients, whisk until thoroughly combined and set aside.', u'For the chicken: Cook the whole wheat linguine al dente according to box directions. Drain and rinse under cold water and spray lightly with olive oil cooking spray so it does not stick and set aside.', u'Coat a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and add onions. Cook until translucent and beginning to brown, about 5 to 10 minutes. Add the chicken, season with salt and pepper and stir in curry powder. Saute chicken until lightly brown. Add the peanut butter and allow it to melt to coat the chicken.', u'Add the roasted red peppers, water chestnuts and scallions and season with salt and pepper as you like. Saute for a few minutes just to release flavor.', u'Pour the coconut curry sauce over the chicken and vegetables and stir gently. Cook just until warmed through and thickened a bit, about 3 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, as needed. Garnish with chopped mint and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges, if desired.', u"SUZY'S SERVING OPTIONS: (Serves four or more \x96 can be doubled easily)", u'Family Style \x96 Put linguine in a large deep platter or decorative bowl and pour mixture over the top. Toss gently with tongs. Garnish with fresh lime juice, and chopped scallions or herbs.', u'Low Carb Diets \x96 On a large dinner plate place Boston lettuce leaves in a fan covering the entire plate. Place 1/4 of the chicken mixture on top and drizzle with fresh lime juice and garnish with scallions. The sauce will form a natural salad dressing for the lettuce.', u'Individual Plates: Each serving is 2 oz. dry pasta and 1/4 of the chicken mixture. Garnish it with fresh lime juice, a lime wedge and scallions or herbs. Serve it on a small exotic plate for added presentation.', u'NOTE: You may substitute shrimp or tofu for the chicken and it is equally delicious!!']
ingredients: [u'1 (13.5-ounce) can light coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon Thai curry paste', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u' Dash cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces high-fiber whole wheat linguine, (recommended: DeCecco)', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'1 vidalia onion, chopped', u'1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast, fat removed, cut into small pieces', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 tablespoons peanut butter', u'1 cup thinly sliced roasted red peppers', u'1 cup thinly sliced water chestnuts', u'1 cup scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u' Chopped fresh mint and cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Lime wedges, for serving']
title: Coconut Curry Thai Chicken

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Bring the stock to a boil over medium heat in a soup pot. Add the lime leaves, chiles, garlic, ginger and lemongrass. Lower the heat to medium-low; cover the pot and gently simmer to let the spices infuse the broth, about 10 minutes.', u'Uncover the pot and stir in the chicken, coconut milk, mushrooms, fish sauce, sugar and lime juice. Simmer to heat the chicken through, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into a soup tureen or individual serving bowls. Garnish with the cilantro. Be careful to avoid chewing the lemongrass, ginger or lime leaves.', u"Cook's Note: Lemongrass imparts a delicate citrusy flavor and aroma, but if you can't find lemongrass, use equal parts lemon peel and ginger. Kaffir lime is gently limey with lots of aroma, but you can substitute lime peel if you can't find it."]
ingredients: [u'4 cups chicken stock', u'3 kaffir lime leaves, fresh or dried, hand torn', u'2 small Thai chiles, halved lengthwise', u'2 cloves garlic, crushed', u' One 3-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and cut into 4 chunks', u'1 stalk lemongrass (white part only), cracked open with the flat side of a knife', u'1 1/2 cups shredded cooked chicken', u' One 13-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u' One 8-ounce can straw mushrooms, rinsed', u'2 tablespoons Thai fish sauce (nam pla)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u' Juice of 4 limes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish', u'1 whole free-range chicken (about 3 1/2 pounds), rinsed, giblets discarded', u'2 carrots, cut in large chunks', u'3 celery stalks, cut in large chunks', u'2 large white onions, quartered', u'1 head of garlic, halved', u'1 turnip, halved', u'1/4 bunch fresh thyme leaves', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns']
title: Thai Coconut Chicken Soup

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Cook the noodles according to the package directions.', u'In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, sherry, cornstarch, brown sugar, ginger, chili paste, garlic and the juice of half the lime. Pour a third of the marinade into a bowl with the sliced beef and toss to coat. Reserve the rest of the marinade for later.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high to high heat. When it is very hot, throw in the onions and cook for a minute or so. Add the bell peppers and jalapenos. Cook for a minute, tossing until the peppers have brown/black bits but are still firm. Remove the vegetables to a plate.', u'Into the hot skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of oil. Add the meat mixture, evenly distributing it over the surface of the skillet. Allow to sit for 45 seconds, then turn with tongs. Cook for another 30 seconds, then add the onions and peppers back into the skillet. Reduce the heat to low. Pour in the remaining marinade and stir. Allow to simmer on low for a few minutes; the sauce will slowly thicken. Turn off the heat.', u'Drain the noodles, then add half of them to the stir-fry. Toss and add more noodles as desired. Stir in some very hot water if needed to thin the sauce.', u'Top with basil and cilantro leaves and serve immediately with a squeeze of the remaining lime half.']
ingredients: [u'1 package pad Thai rice noodles or linguine', u'1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons sherry', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons packed brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon red chili paste or a few dashes red chili oil', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 lime, halved', u'1 pound flank steak, sliced very thin against the grain', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium yellow onion, sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, cored and sliced into rings', u'1 tablespoon diced fresh jalapeno or 1 teaspoon diced hot pepper', u' Fresh basil leaves, for garnish', u' Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Thai Beef with Peppers

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large wok or saute pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the shallots, bell peppers, carrots, and garlic, and stir-fry until soft, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the curry paste and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stirring, add the fish sauce and sugar, then the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Simmer until thickened slightly, about 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, until pink and just cooked through, about 2 minutes.', u'Remove from the heat and stir in the basil and cilantro.', u'Serve over jasmine rice, garnished with cilantro sprigs.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1/2 cup chopped shallots', u'1 large red bell pepper, cut into strips', u'2 medium carrots, trimmed and shredded', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'3 tablespoons Thai Red Curry Paste, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons palm sugar or light brown sugar', u'1 (14-ounce) can coconut milk', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'3 tablespoons chopped Thai basil leaves', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Cooked jasmine rice, accompaniment', u' Sprigs fresh cilantro, garnish']
title: Thai Shrimp Curry

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a kettle, bring the water to a boil. Place the tea in a teapot or glass container. Pour the water over the tea and let steep until bright orange in color, 3 to 5 minutes. Strain into a clean container, such as a pitcher (or, if in tea bags, remove the bags). Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Let cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.', u'Fill 6 tall glasses with crushed ice and add tea to 3/4 full. Add 1 tablespoon cream and 1 tablespoon condensed milk to each glass.', u'Serve with iced-tea spoon so guests can swirl the mixture themselves.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups water', u'1 cup Thai tea', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'6 tablespoons cream', u'6 tablespoons condensed milk']
title: Thai Iced Tea

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u"Soak the dried rice noodles in cool or lukewarm water for 30 minutes, or until they're limp but still firm to the touch; later cooking in the wok will soften them more. Drain the noodles thoroughly in a colander and set aside while preparing the other ingredients.", u'In a small bowl, mix the fish sauce, tamarind juice, and sugar; stir well to melt the sugar. Taste and adjust flavors to the desired combination of salty, sour, and sweet.', u'Heat a wok over medium-high heat until it is smoking hot. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil and quickly stir-fry the shrimp until they turn pink and are almost cooked through; 1 to 2 minutes. Remove the shrimp to a plate and cover to keep warm.', u'Add the remaining oil to the wok and toss in the garlic, shallots, and chile; stir-fry for 30 seconds. Push the garlic and shallots to 1 side of the wok and pour the egg into the center. Scramble the egg lightly until set, breaking it up into pieces with a spatula. Add the drained noodles to the wok, stirring and tossing quickly with 2 spatulas to separate the strands. Pour in the fish sauce mixture, tossing well to coat the noodles and keep them from sticking (if the noodles are still too firm, drizzle with 1 to 2 tablespoons of water to help them cook.)', u'When the noodles are in good shape, toss in 1/2 of the bean sprouts and peanuts; save the remaining for garnish. Continue to stir-fry, to combine. Return the shrimp to the wok and toss the pad thai together to warm everything through. Serve the pad thai on a platter, pile the remaining bean sprouts and peanuts on 1 side of the dish and garnish with the lime wedges and cilantro. Squeeze lime juice over each portion before eating.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces dried wide rice noodles', u'1/4 cup fish sauce (nam pla)', u'3 tablespoons tamarind juice', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 1/2 pounds large shrimp, peeled with tails on', u'4 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'2 shallots, sliced', u'1 fresh red chile, sliced', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup chopped unsalted roasted peanuts', u'1 lime, cut into small wedges', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Stir-Fried Thai Noodles: Pad Thai

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Rinse and pat the meat dry.  Place in a sealable plastic bag or small glass dish. In a medium bowl combine 1 tablespoon of the lime juice, soy sauce, canola oil, brown sugar, garlic, ginger and red curry paste. Pour half the mixture into the bag with the meat. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons lime juice to the bag. Seal tightly, and marinate meat in refrigerator at least 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Reserve the rest of the mixture refrigerated, to dress the salad.', u'Spray grill or grill pan with cooking spray and preheat. Grill steak until medium-rare, about 5 minutes per side, depending on desired doneness. Let rest until room temperature then slice thinly against the grain.', u'Combine lettuce, sliced shallot, cilantro, basil and beef in a salad bowl, reserving a few shallots for garnish. Add the reserved dressing and toss to coat. Divide salad among 4 plates and garnish with reserved sliced shallots.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound top-round London broil or flank steak, about 1 to 1 1/2-inches thick', u'3 tablespoons lime juice, divided', u'3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 tablespoon brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced ginger', u'1 1/4 teaspoons red curry paste or chili-garlic sauce', u'1/2 head red-leaf lettuce, torn (about 6 cups)', u'3 shallots, thinly sliced (about 1/2 cup), divided, for garnish', u'1/2 cup cilantro leaves, rinsed and dried', u'1 cup basil leaves, sliced into ribbons']
title: Grilled Thai Beef Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak the noodles in a bowl of warm water until soft enough to separate, about 10 minutes. Mix the fish sauce, sugar, chili sauce and lime juice in a separate bowl. When the noodles are soft, drain and return to the bowl. Put the bowls and other ingredients next to the stove (this dish cooks quickly).', u"Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until very hot. Add the vegetable oil, then add the shrimp and stir-fry until pink, about 2 minutes. Transfer the shrimp to a bowl using a slotted spoon; leave the oil in the pan. Add the garlic and tofu to the pan; stir-fry until just golden. Add the noodles and 1/4 cup fish-sauce mixture; stir-fry until the noodles absorb the sauce, about 3 minutes. Add up to 1/4 cup water if the noodles seem dry, but don't let them become mushy.", u'Add the radishes, scallions and 1/4 cup peanuts; toss to combine. Stir in the remaining fish-sauce mixture. Taste and adjust seasoning (you can add more water, lime juice or fish sauce).', u'Return the shrimp to the pan and heat through, about 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a platter; top with bean sprouts, jalapenos and the remaining 1/4 cup peanuts. Serve with lime wedges.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces flat Thai rice noodles', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/4 cup raw or turbinado sugar', u'1 to 2 tablespoons hot Asian chili sauce (sambal oelek or sriracha)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, plus lime wedges for garnish', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1 pound large shrimp, butterflied with the shells on', u'4 large cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 12 -ounce package extra-firm tofu, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'6 radishes, cut into thin strips', u'4 scallions, halved lengthwise and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/2 cup roasted salted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'2 jalapeno peppers (red and green), seeded and thinly sliced into strips']
title: Shrimp Pad Thai

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'For the Thai salad: In a large serving bowl, toss the cabbages, cucumber, edamame, carrots and green onions.', u'For the sweet lime-cilantro dressing: Put the oil, cilantro, sugar, garlic, lime juice, salt and pepper in a large blender and blend until smooth.', u'Top each serving of salad with 2 tablespoons of the sweet lime-cilantro dressing and 2 slices of avocado for garnish.']
ingredients: [u'1 head Napa cabbage, shredded', u'1 head red cabbage, shredded', u'1 large cucumber, julienned', u' One 10-ounce bag shelled edamame, cooked', u'2 carrots, peeled and grated', u'2 green onions, finely sliced', u'2 cups olive oil', u'1 1/2 cups finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 cup sugar', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u' Juice of 2 limes', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon pepper', u'1 avocado, peeled and finely sliced']
title: Ty's Thai Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Place the pork in the freezer about 10 minutes to make it easier to slice. Soak the noodles in very hot water until just tender, about 10 minutes; drain. Snip the noodles with scissors into shorter lengths. Cut the frozen pork crosswise into 1/4-inch-wide strips.', u'Puree the cilantro, lime zest and juice, ginger, garlic, jalapenos, shallots, fish sauce, brown sugar and 1 tablespoon water in a food processor until smooth, scraping down the processor as needed.', u'Heat 3 tablespoons peanut oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add half the cilantro mixture and stir-fry 1 minute. Add the pork and stir-fry until no longer pink, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the pork with a slotted spoon to a plate. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon peanut oil to the skillet; add the green beans and stir-fry until tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the noodles, pork and 2 tablespoons of the remaining cilantro mixture. Cook, tossing with tongs, until heated through, about 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining cilantro mixture to taste.', u'Per serving: Calories 553; Fat 24 g (Saturated 6 g); Cholesterol 60 mg; Sodium 1,210 mg; Carbohydrate 61 g; Fiber 3 g; Protein 22 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 pound thin boneless pork chops, fat trimmed', u'8 ounces wide Thai rice noodles', u'1 cup fresh cilantro (leaves and stems)', u' Finely grated zest and juice of 1 lime', u'2 slices peeled ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'3 red jalapeno peppers, seeded and roughly chopped', u'2 shallots, roughly chopped', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'4 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1/4 pound green beans, split lengthwise and cut into pieces']
title: Thai Pork and Noodles

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat grill to high. Heat the oil in a heavy Dutch oven on the grates of the grill until shimmering. Add the lemongrass, curry paste, wine, coconut milk, fish sauce, and lime juice and bring to a simmer, whisking. Add the mussels, cover the pot, and let steam until opened. During the last minute of cooking, add the cilantro and basil. Serve from Dutch oven into individual bowls, discarding the lemongrass.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'1 stalk lemongrass, crushed', u'3 tablespoons Thai red curry paste', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'1 can unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce (nam pla)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 1/2 pounds mussels, debearded and scrubbed', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro stems, plus 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'4 tablespoons chopped Thai basil or Italian basil leaves']
title: Thai Red Curry Mussels

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Season chicken breast pieces with Thai seasoning; set aside.', u'Spray a large nonstick skillet with olive oil cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat. Add seasoned chicken, onion, garlic and mushrooms. Saute until chicken is just cooked, about 8 to 10 minutes. Add the green beans, chicken stock, coconut milk and lemon zest. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the beans are cooked al dente, about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve hot garnished with cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'2 teaspoons Thai seasoning', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'1 cup yellow onion, diced', u'1 teaspoon crushed garlic', u'1/2 (8-ounce) package fresh sliced white mushrooms', u'1 (16-ounce) package frozen cut green beans, thawed (recommended: Birds Eye)', u'1/4 cup low-sodium chicken broth chicken stock', u'1 (14-ounce) can lite coconut milk (recommended: A Taste of Thai)', u'1 lemon, zested', u' Freshly chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Thai Chicken

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with foil or parchment.', u'In a food processor, whizz up the lime juice, cilantro, mint, fish sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, red pepper flakes, pepper, and oil.', u'Cut 4 to 5 slits on each side of the fish, almost down to the bone.', u'Divide the cilantro paste in half. Rub 1 portion of the paste all over fish, especially into the slits and the cavity of the fish. Reserve the other half for serving.', u'Take a large piece of foil and form a loose ball. Stuff it into the cavity so that you can make the fish "sit" on the baking sheet, belly facing down, ridge of the fish\'s back facing the ceiling. It\'ll look as if the fish is swimming on the baking sheet!', u'Bake until the eyes turn solid white and the flesh flakes easily, 15 to 20 minutes, depending on the size of the fish.', u'Taste the leftover marinade, and add juice from the other half of the lime. Serve marinade on the side with the fish.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon lime juice (about half a lime, save the other half for later)', u'1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro (leaves and soft stems)', u'1/2 cup loosely packed fresh mint leaves', u'1 teaspoon fish sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon light brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 (3 pound) whole striped bass, scales, fins and innards removed']
title: Thai Roasted Green Fish

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'For the ribs and legs: Combine the cilantro, brown sugar, honey, soy sauce, fish sauce, garlic, chile peppers, ginger and the white part of the lemongrass in a blender or food processor. Puree until a fairly smooth, thick sauce forms.', u'Put the pork ribs and chicken drummers in a large resealable plastic bag or shallow plastic storage container and slather the marinade over the meat. Add the lime slices and the top part of the lemongrass to the bag and refrigerate for 1 to 4 hours.', u'For the sweet and sour sauce: Combine 1/2 cup water, the sugar and ginger in a small pot. Bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve the sugar, then simmer for a couple of minutes to infuse the syrup with the ginger. Pour the syrup into a small bowl and let cool. Remove the ginger, then stir in the vinegar, cilantro, mint, Sriracha, fish sauce, chile pepper and lime juice.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Arrange the ribs in an even layer in a baking dish, and add the marinade and lime slices. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 1 hour. Remove the baking dish from the oven and add the drumsticks. Cover and bake for 30 more minutes.', u'Raise the oven temperature to 425 degrees F. Uncover the baking dish and bake until the ribs and drumsticks are deeply browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and drizzle with about half the sweet and sour sauce. Top with the nuts and scallions. Serve with rice and Thai Cucumbers. Pass the remaining sweet and sour sauce at the table.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup fresh cilantro leaves and tender stems', u'1/2 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1/4 cup honey', u' About 1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u' About 2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'4 cloves garlic, cracked from skin', u'2 serrano chile peppers, seeded and chopped', u'1 Fresno chile pepper, sliced', u' One 2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated', u'2 pounds pork loin ribs, cut into single bones', u'8 chicken drummers (drumsticks), skinned', u'1 stalk lemongrass, white part chopped', u'1 lime, sliced', u'1/3 cup superfine sugar', u' One 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced', u' About 3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint', u'2 tablespoons Sriracha', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 Fresno chile, finely chopped', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'1/2 cup dry-roasted cashews or peanuts, finely chopped', u'1 bunch scallion tops, thinly sliced (reserve the whites for the Thai Cucumbers, recipe follows)', u' Jasmine rice, for serving', u' Thai Cucumbers, recipe follows, for serving', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons superfine sugar', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'1 carrot, grated', u'1 seedless cucumber, peeled and thinly sliced', u'1 bunch scallion whites, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1 Fresno chile pepper, seeded and finely chopped']
title: Thai Ribs and Legs

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Bring the stock to the boil over medium heat in a saucepan. Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chiles. Lower the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes to let the spices infuse the broth.', u"Uncover and add the fish sauce, sugar, and mushrooms. Simmer for 5 minutes. Toss in the shrimp and cook for about 8 minutes until they turn pink. Remove from the heat and add the lime juice, green onions, and cilantro. Taste for salt and spices; you should have an equal balance of spicy, salty, and sour. It's a good idea to tell your guest's that the lemongrass and lime leaves are for flavor only and should be avoided when eating the soup."]
ingredients: [u'2 quarts chicken broth', u'2 stalks fresh lemongrass, sliced on a bias in 2-inch pieces', u'4 kaffir lime leaves', u'1 -inch piece fresh galangal or ginger, sliced', u'2 red chiles, sliced', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce, such as nam pla', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 (8-ounce) can straw mushrooms, rinsed and halved', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled with tails on', u'2 limes, juiced', u'2 green onions, sliced', u'1 handful fresh cilantro, chopped']
title: Hot and Sour Thai Soup: Tom Yum Goong

author: Jamie Oliver
directions: [u'Place the chicken in a large heavy-based saucepan, and add the tamarind, ginger, chopped chiles, onion, lemongrass and garlic. Finely slice the coriander stalks and add to the pan, keeping the leaves until later.', u'Cover with water to the top and weight the chicken down with a heavy lid or a smaller pan that fits inside the cooking pan. Bring to the boil and slowly simmer for 1 hour to 1 hour and 30 minutes. Once cooked, remove the chicken and pull off the meat using a fork.', u'Mash up the sauce and add the coconut milk and a lug of fish sauce. Put the rice noodles in a bowl, pour over boiling water and leave to stand for 3 minutes. Mix the coriander leaves with the finely sliced chile.', u'Drain the noodles, place some in the bottom of each serving bowl, and dress with soy sauce to season. Pile the chicken on top, then pour over the strained sauce. Pile the chile and coriander mix on top and drizzle with olive oil.']
ingredients: [u'1 (4 pound/2 kilogram) free range or organic chicken', u'7 ounces (200 grams) tamarind*, broken up', u'1 piece ginger, sliced', u'2 red chiles, seeds removed, 1 chopped and 1 finely sliced', u'1 red onion, skin on, sliced', u'2 sticks lemongrass, bashed, bruised and roughly chopped', u'1 bulb garlic, cut in 1/2', u'1 large bunch fresh coriander', u'1 (400 ml) can coconut milk', u'8 ounces (225 grams) rice noodles', u' Thai Fish Sauce*', u' Soy sauce', u' Drizzle olive oil', u' * Found in Asian markets']
title: Thai Chicken Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a wok or large saute pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the eggplant, onions and bell pepper and cook until softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the curry paste, lime leaves, and fish sauce, and cook, stirring, for 15 seconds. Add the coconut milk and shrimp stock and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer until thickened, 3 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup of Thai basil and remove from heat.', u'Season to taste with salt. Garnish with remaining 1/4 cup Thai basil. Serve with rice and lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 cups diced eggplant (1/2-inch dice)', u'1/2 cup chopped white onions', u'1 cup thinly sliced green bell peppers', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 to 4 tablespoons Thai green curry paste, depending on desired degree of heat', u'6 Kaffir lime leaves, or 1 tablespoon finely grated lime zest', u'2 tablespoons nam pla (Thai fish sauce)', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 cup shrimp stock, fish stock or bottled clam juice', u'1 1/2 pounds medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 cup chopped Thai basil (if unavailable use 1/2 Italian basil, 1/2 mint)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Steamed white rice, accompaniment', u'8 lime wedges, garnish']
title: Thai Green Curry Shrimp

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Form pizza crust on pizza pan or cookie sheet. Top with duck or plum sauce - spread it around like you would pizza sauce. Sprinkle the pizza with some crushed red pepper flakes then top with cheese and peppers. Bake until golden and bubbly, 15 to 17 minutes. ', u'Preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
