Combine vegetable oil, soy sauce and peanut butter with hot sauce and grill seasoning. Use the microwave to loosen up peanut butter if it is too cold to blend into sauce, 10 seconds ought to do it. Add chicken and coat evenly with mixture. Let stand 10 minutes then grill chicken cutlets 2 to 3 minutes on each side, until firm. Slice chicken into very thin strips.  ', u'While chicken cooks, mix honey and vinegar and add the cucumber. Turn to coat evenly. ', u'Top the hot, cooked pizza with chicken, scallions, sprouts and cilantro. Drain cucumbers and scatter over the pizza. Garnish pizza with peanuts, cut into 8 wedges and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pizza dough, any brand', u'1/2 cup duck sauce or plum sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 package (2 cups) shredded provolone or Monterey Jack cheese', u'1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 rounded tablespoonful peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons hot sauce', u'2 teaspoons grill seasoning (recommended: Montreal Steak Seasoning) eyeball it', u'4 chicken breast cutlets, 1/2 pound', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar or cider vinegar', u'1/4 seedless cucumber, peeled and cut into matchsticks', u'4 scallions, chopped', u'1 cup bean spouts, a couple of handfuls', u' Palm full cilantro leaves, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped peanuts, 2 ounces']
title: Thai Chicken Pizza

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Skim the thick creamy top off the can of coconut milk and put it into a large saucepan or casserole with the curry paste, over medium heat. Let it sizzle and, using a fork, whisk or wooden spoon, beat cream and paste together until combined. Still beating gently, add the rest of the coconut milk, fish stock, fish sauce, sugar, lemongrass, lime leaves (if using) and turmeric. Bring to a boil and then add the pumpkin. Cook on a fast simmer until the pumpkin is tender, about 15 minutes, although different sorts of pumpkins can vary enormously in the time they take to cook; some squash can take a little as 5 minutes.', u"As I mentioned, you can cook the curry up until this part in advance, maybe leaving the pumpkin with a tiny bit of bite to it (it will soften and cook as the pan cools). Either way, when you're about 5 minutes from wanting to eat, get ready to cook the seafood.", u"So, to the robustly simmering pan, add the salmon and shrimp (if you're using frozen shrimp they'll need to go in before the salmon). When the salmon and shrimp have cooked through, which shouldn't take more than 3 to 4 minutes, stir in any green vegetable you're using - sliced, chopped or shredded as suits - and tamp down with a wood spoon. When the bok choy is wilted, or other green vegetable is cooked, squeeze in the juice of half a lime, stir and taste and add the juice of the remaining half if you feel it needs it. Take the pan off the heat and pour the curry into a large bowl, and sprinkle over the cilantro; the point is that the cilantro goes in just before serving. Serve with more chopped cilantro for people to add their own bowls as they eat, and some plain Thai or basmati rice."]
ingredients: [u'1 (14-ounce) can coconut milk (about 1 2/3 cups)', u'1 to 2-tablespoons yellow (or red) Thai curry paste', u'1 1/2 cups fish stock (I use boiling water and concentrated fish bouillon; cubes will do)', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce (recommended: Nam Pla)', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u"3 lemongrass stalks, each cut into 1/3's and bruised with the flat of a knife", u'3 lime leaves, stalked and cut into strips, optional', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'2 1/4 pounds pumpkin or butter nut squash, peeled and cut into large, bite-sized chunks', u'1 pound 2 ounces salmon fillet, preferably organic, skinned and cut into large, bite-sized chunks', u'1 pound 2 ounces peeled raw shrimp', u' Bok Choy or any other green vegetables of your choice', u'1/2 to 1 lime, juiced or more to taste', u' Cilantro, for garnish']
title: Thai Yellow Pumpkin and Seafood Curry

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Soak the rice sticks in enough hot water to cover by 1 inch for 15 minutes.', u'Bring 1/2 gallon of water to a boil in a large pot set over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Add the shrimp and cook until just firm, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove the cooked shrimp to a cutting board and cool for 3 minutes. When cool enough to handle, peel, devein, and coarsely chop. Set aside.', u'Return the water-soy sauce to a boil. Drain the rice stick noodles and add to the hot soy-water. Cook until tender, approximately 3 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, whisk the lime juice, remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce, chili paste, and sugar together in a medium mixing bowl.', u'Drain the noodles in a colander. Add the noodles to the lime juice mixture, toss, and set aside while preparing the vegetables.', u'Toss the cucumber, carrot, cilantro, and mint together in a small bowl. Transfer any unabsorbed liquid from the noodles to the cucumber mixture and toss to combine.', u'Cut the noodles into small 1 to 2-inch pieces with kitchen shears.', u'Fill a pie dish with warm water. Dip 1 rice paper wrapper into the water for 10 seconds, then transfer to a cutting board until the wrapper is pliable and slightly tacky, approximately 1 minute.', u'Place 1/4 cup of the vegetable mixture on the bottom 1/3 of the wrapper nearest to you. Spoon 2 tablespoons chopped shrimp on top of the vegetables. Top with 1/4 cup noodles. Bring the bottom edge of the wrap tightly over the filling, and then fold in the 2 sides. Finish rolling from bottom to top until the entire wrapper is rolled. Be careful not to tear the rice paper. Place on a parchment-lined half sheet pan and cover with a damp tea towel. Repeat with the remaining wrappers until the filling is gone. Wrap each roll in a lettuce leaf and serve with Soy Ginger Dipping Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'5 ounces thin rice stick noodles', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce, divided', u'1 pound unpeeled large shrimp', u'3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1 tablespoon sambal chili paste', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 large cucumber, unpeeled, seeded, and cut into matchsticks', u'1 large carrot, peeled and grated', u'3/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped', u'3/4 cup fresh mint, chopped', u'12 (8 1/2-inch) round rice paper wrappers', u'12 leaves Bibb, Boston, or other soft lettuce', u' Soy Ginger Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons finely grated ginger', u'2 tablespoons chopped green onion', u'2 medium cloves garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil']
title: Thai Shrimp Spring Rolls

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak the rice noodles in a bowl of warm water until pliable but not too soft, about 30 minutes. Drain.', u'Run a vegetable peeler along the length of the carrot and zucchini to create noodle-like ribbons. Keep the two separate and set aside.', u'Mix together the fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, oyster sauce and Sriracha in a small bowl. Remove 1 teaspoon of the sauce and toss with the shrimp, let sit at room temperature.', u'Heat 1 teaspoon of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Scatter the shrimp in one layer in the skillet. Sear for 1 minute, then remove to a plate.', u'Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, red pepper slices, carrot ribbons and soaked noodles; stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the sauce and 1/2 cup water; stir until the noodles have softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the zucchini ribbons, bean sprouts, scallions and reserved shrimp. Stir-fry for another minute. If the noodles look too dry, add a little more water.', u'Divide evenly among four plates. Sprinkle with peanuts. Serve with lime wedges, Sriracha and fish sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces dried pad thai rice noodles', u'1 medium carrot', u'1 medium zucchini', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon fish sauce, plus more for serving', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, plus lime wedges for serving', u'2 teaspoons light brown sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons oyster sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon Sriracha, plus more for serving if desired', u'1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled, tails removed, deveined and halved lengthwise', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon vegetable oil', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'3 green scallions, cut into 2-inch pieces, thick pieces halved lengthwise', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped roasted unsalted peanuts']
title: Pad Thai

directions: [u'Blend all soup ingredients together in a high-speed blender, in batches if needed. Blend until the pumpkin is completely pureed and the soup has a silky texture.', u'To serve, pour soup into warm soup bowls. Place 2 teaspoons of marinated portobellos in the middle of each bowl. Decorate each soup with coconut cream, cilantro, and scallion slices.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3 cups coconut water', u'3 .5 ounces (100 grams) coconut meat', u'10 .5 ounces (300 grams) sugar pie pumpkin, seeded and cubed into 1-inch squares', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 black peppercorns, plus additional freshly ground pepper, to taste', u' Pinch chopped garlic (partial clove with center removed)', u'3/4 teaspoon red curry paste, or more to taste', u'2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/3 cup almond milk', u'1 recipe Marinated Portobello Mushrooms, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup coconut cream', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 tablespoon shoyu (Japanese soy sauce)', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1/2 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 portobello mushroom, gills removed, cut into small dice']
title: Thai Pumpkin Soup

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u"To make the sauce: In a bowl, pour the boiling water over the brown sugar and stir to dissolve. Add the lime juice, fish sauce, rice vinegar, and sriracha and stir. Place the leftover turkey in the pad Thai sauce and let it absorb the flavors while prepping the rest of the dish. Next, prepare the pasta: cook the linguine one minute less than the manufacturer's directions. Drain, and set aside.", u'Heat the oil in a wok or large saute pan over high heat until very hot, almost smoking. Add the onions and stir fry 1 minute. Add the garlic and stir. Then add the eggs and cook for 30 seconds, stirring. Add the linguini and turkey with sauce and cook, stirring for a few minutes. Remove from heat and toss in grated carrot, peanuts, cilantro, bean sprouts and scallion. Serve with lime wedges, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup boiling water', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'2 limes, 1 juiced and 1 cut into wedges for serving', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sriracha hot sauce', u'1 1/2 cups shredded or cubed cooked turkey', u'8 ounces linguini, broken in half', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 yellow onion, sliced', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 eggs, slightly beaten', u'1 large carrot, grated', u'1/2 cup chopped peanuts', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'3 scallions, cut into 3/4-inch pieces']
title: Turkey Pad Thai

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine the noodles with water to cover. Soak until just tender, about 45 minutes, then drain.', u'In a small bowl, combine the fish sauce, vinegar, and sugar, and stir until the sugar dissolves. Set aside. Season the shrimp and pork with cayenne.', u'In a wok or large saucepan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add the shrimp and pork and cook until the shrimp are just cooked through and the pork is brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate and cover to keep warm.', u'Add the eggs and cook, stirring, until just set, about 45 seconds. Add the sprouts, onions, fish sauce mixture, and noodles, and cook, stirring, until warmed through. Add the shrimp and pork, and peanuts, and cook for 30 seconds. Transfer to a serving platter and toss with the cilantro and lime juice. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces dried rice noodle sticks', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 pound peeled and de-veined raw shrimp, halved lengthwise', u'1/4 pound ground pork', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 large eggs', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'2 cups sliced green onions', u'1/4 cup chopped roasted unsalted peanuts', u'1/4 cup minced fresh cilantro', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice']
title: Pad Thai

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a blender combine the lime juice, fish sauce, shallot, chiles, sugar and garlic and blend until smooth. Set aside for 15 minutes to allow flavors to blend.', u'In a medium non-reactive mixing or salad bowl, combine the papayas, carrots, mint leaves and chopped cilantro. Add the dressing and toss to combine thoroughly. Garnish with the cilantro leaves and chopped peanuts. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon Thai fish sauce', u'1/4 cup minced shallot', u'3 Thai bird chiles or Serrano chiles, seeded and finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons coconut-palm sugar or golden cane sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 medium-large green papayas, peeled, seeds removed, and shredded or julienned (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)', u'2 carrots, peeled and shredded or julienned', u'2 tablespoons chiffonade fresh mint leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus 1/3 cup leaves, for garnish', u'1/2 cup finely chopped peanuts, for garnish']
title: Spicy Thai Green Papaya Salad

directions: [u'Heat a grill to medium-high heat.', u'Put the shrimp into a glass bowl. Whisk the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl and pour 1/2 to 2/3 if it over the shrimp. (Reserve the remaining marinade to brush on the shrimp during grilling.) Allow the shrimp to marinate for only 8 to 10 minutes or the lime juice will begin to "cook" the shrimp.  Grill the shrimp, approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side while brushing with the reserved marinade. I use a silicone brush. Remove the shrimp from the grill to a platter and serve garnished with lime wedges.', u'Cook\'s Note: When "fanned", the tails of the shrimp will curl up like a scorpion as they cook. Way cool for presentation! The shrimp can be served on Grilled Bok Choy Salad, if desired. Serve 3 shrimp per person for an appetizer course or 6 for an entree salad (odd numbers look better).']
ingredients: [u'12 large raw shrimp (wild U-10 or 15/20 count) peeled, deveined and cut in "fan" shape (similar to butterfly)', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice (from1 small lime), plus lime wedges for garnish', u'1 teaspoon Thai chili sauce (recommended: Sriracha) or more, to taste', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons bottled minced garlic or 6 fresh cloves, minced', u'2 tablespoons ketchup', u'1 Thai chile, sliced thin or habanero or Scotch bonnet', u'1/4 cup canola or olive oil', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame oil', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'4 to 5 grinds black pepper']
servings: 4 servings for appetizer, 2 servings for entree
title: Grilled Thai Chile Garlic Shrimp

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'For the chicken: Combine all the ingredients in a nonreactive bowl and let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes. Prepare a grill pan to medium-high heat and place the chicken thighs on the pan, cooking for 4 minutes per side.', u'For the noodles: In a medium saute pan over medium heat, add the canola oil. Add the ginger, lime zest and juice, garlic, red pepper flakes and chicken stock. Stir all to combine and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the curry paste, seasoned rice vinegar and scallions. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes.', u'Place the noodles in a large serving bowl along with the carrots and crushed peanuts and toss well to combine. Add the cilantro chicken and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs (about 1 pound)', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/4 cup cilantro leaves', u'2 limes, 1 zested and 2 juiced', u'2 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 -inch chunk ginger, peeled and grated (about 1 tablespoon)', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 cup chicken stock', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon Thai green curry paste', u'1 tablespoon seasoned rice vinegar', u'3 scallions, white and green parts, chopped, for garnish', u'1 pound spaghetti, cooked al dente and sprayed with canola oil spray', u'1 carrot, shredded', u'1/4 cup crushed roasted peanuts']
title: Cilantro Chicken and Spicy Thai Noodles

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the celery, mushrooms and curry powder; cook, stirring, until the curry powder is toasted, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth, coconut milk, 1 tablespoon fish sauce and 1 cup water and bring to a simmer.', u'Add the green beans and bell pepper to the pot, reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the vegetables are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add the dumplings and cook until tender, about 4 minutes. Stir in the lime juice. Season the soup with salt and add more fish sauce to taste, if desired. Top with sliced scallions and serve with lime wedges.', u'Per serving: Calories 400; Fat 26 g (Saturated 15 g); Cholesterol 50 mg; Sodium 914 mg; Carbohydrate 28 g; Fiber 5 g; Protein 18 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'3 stalks celery, sliced', u'4 ounces shiitake mushrooms, sliced', u'1 tablespoon curry powder', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 cup coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce, plus more to taste', u'4 ounces green beans, roughly chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, chopped', u'1 pound frozen Asian-style dumplings or pot stickers', u' Juice of 1 lime, plus lime wedges for serving', u' Kosher salt', u' Sliced scallions, for topping']
title: Thai Dumpling Soup

directions: [u'Heat a wok and coat with vegetable  oil. Add shallot and saute until it  begins to turn brown.  Add ginger,  chilies, lemon grass and lime and  saute until fragrant.  Add fish  sauce and scrape up any brown bits.   Add chicken stock, reduce heat and  simmer for 20 minutes.  Through a  fine sieve into a saucepan, strain  out solids. Bring broth back to a  boil and add shrimp and enoki  mushrooms. Cook until shrimp turn  pink. Season and drop cilantro  sprigs in soup be']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 shallot, peeled and sliced', u'1 (2-inch piece) ginger, sliced', u'2 fresh serrano chiles seeded, sliced (wear gloves)', u'4 stalks lemon grass, white part sliced', u' Juice and coarse zest of 1 lime', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'8 cups chicken stock', u'1 pound medium/large shrimp, shelled', u'1/4 pound enoki mushrooms', u' Salt and white pepper, to taste', u' Garnish: cilantro sprigs']
title: Thai Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, bring the water, sugar and star anise pods to a boil. Remove the pan from the heat and add the tea bags. Allow the tea to steep and cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Discard the star anise pods and the tea bags and whisk in the condensed milk. Pour into a large pitcher and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until ready to serve.', u'To serve: Pour the tea into 4 ice-filled glasses. Garnish with fresh mint leaves and serve.']
ingredients: [u'5 cups water', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'5 whole star anise pods*', u'8 black tea bags', u'3/4 cup sweetened condensed milk', u' Ice', u' Mint leaves, for garnish', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets']
title: Thai Iced Tea

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut off the corn kernels; set aside. Combine the cobs, 1 cup potatoes, 1/2 cup scallions, 1 tablespoon ginger, the garlic, peppercorns and 5 cups water in a pot. Smash the lemongrass, if using, and add to the pot. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 25 to 30 minutes.', u'About 10 minutes before the broth is finished, melt the butter over medium-high heat in a separate pot. Add the remaining 1 cup potatoes, season with salt and cook until slightly soft, 5 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon ginger and the jalapeno; cook 1 minute. Add the corn kernels; cook until the vegetables are just tender, 3 to 4 minutes.', u'Strain the broth, pressing out as much liquid as possible; discard the solids. Add 2 cups of the strained broth to the potatoes and corn; bring to a boil, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the coconut milk, basil and mint; season with salt. Stir until simmering. Remove from the heat and add the radishes, cilantro and lime juice. Top with diced tomato and the remaining 1/4 cup scallions and serve with lime wedges.', u'', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'4 ears corn', u'2 cups diced red-skinned potatoes (about 12 ounces)', u'3/4 cup chopped scallions', u'2 tablespoons grated peeled fresh ginger', u'4 cloves garlic, smashed', u'8 black peppercorns', u'1 stalk lemongrass, cut into thirds (optional)', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u' Kosher salt', u'1 red jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', u'1 13 .5-ounce can coconut milk', u'8 fresh basil leaves', u'8 fresh mint leaves', u'4 radishes, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro', u' Juice of 1/2 lime, plus lime wedges for garnish', u'1 tomato, seeded and diced']
title: Thai Corn Chowder

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.', u'Combine the pork, shrimp, lemongrass, sesame seeds, lime juice, chiles, ginger, garlic, basil, cilantro, mint, soy sauce, fish sauce, breadcrumbs and eggs in a large mixing bowl and mix by hand until thoroughly incorporated. Drizzle the olive oil into a 9 by 12-inch baking dish, making sure to evenly coat the entire surface.', u'Roll the mixture into round, golf ball size meatballs, making sure to pack the meat firmly.', u'Place the balls into the oiled baking dish such that all the meatballs are lined up evenly in rows and are touching each of their 4 neighbors in a grid.', u'Roast until firm and cooked through, about 20 minutes. Allow the meatballs to cool about 5 minutes before removing from the baking dish.', u'Garnish with shaved carrots and chopped roasted peanuts. Serve with Peanut Dipping Sauce.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground pork', u'1 pound peeled and deveined shrimp, ground or chopped finely', u'2 tablespoons minced lemongrass', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'1 lime, juiced', u'2 Thai chiles, minced', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'3/4 cup fresh Thai basil leaves, chopped', u'3/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves, chopped', u'1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup breadcrumbs', u'2 eggs', u' Olive oil', u' Carrot shavings, for garnish', u' Chopped roasted peanuts, for garnish', u' Peanut Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 cup chunky peanut butter', u'1/2 teaspoon grated ginger', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'1/4 cup hot water', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Thai Meatballs

directions: [u'Place chicken breast into a 2 quart saucepan with water (the water should cover the chicken breasts), the kosher salt and half of the lemongrass. Bring to a boil and lower to a simmer for 20 minutes. Remove chicken and cool completely. When cooled chop into 1/2 inch cubes and reserve in refrigerator.', u'Saute garlic, remaining lemongrass and chili powder in oil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. Next, toss together the celery, onions, mint, basil and cilantro. Combine chicken with sauteed garlic mixture and the salad components, Add salt, lime juice and honey to taste and place on the lettuce to serve.', u'Note: If you want to make lettuce rolls, then leave a few leaves whole and remove the stiff vein from the lower portion of the leaves. Roll chicken salad up in lettuce leaves for a delicious salad wrap.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds boneless chicken breast', u'3 cups water', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'2 stalks lemongrass, minced', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons Thai chili powder', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'4 stalks celery, finely chopped', u'2 red onions, finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh mint', u'1 tablespoon coarsely chopped Thai basil leaves or regular fresh basil', u'1 tablespoon coarsely chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'1 head romaine lettuce, washed and chopped* see note']
title: Thai Chicken Salad

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a bowl of hot water, soak the dry rice noodles until softened, about 30 to 45 minutes. Drain and set aside.', u'In a medium mixing bowl, whisk the sesame oil and cornstarch. Add the pork and toss well.', u'In a small mixing bowl, whisk the fish sauce, lemon juice and sugar. Set aside.', u'Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Pour in half the peanut oil and heat (but do not bring oil to smoking point). Add pork and cook until cooked through, about 2 minutes. Remove pork and set aside.', u'Reheat wok or skillet and pour in the remaining peanut oil. Add the garlic, crushed red pepper flakes and green onions. Cook until soft and fragrant, about 1 minute. Slowly add the eggs, stirring constantly. Once cooked, add the drained noodles, fish sauce mixture and cooked pork. Toss until combined.', u'Transfer the Pad Thai to a serving platter and top with bean sprouts, peanuts, lime wedges and cilantro leaves. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces medium, dry rice stick noodles', u'1 tablespoon dark sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'1 pound pork loin, thinly sliced strips', u'1/4 cup Thai fish sauce', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup peanut oil, divided', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'1/2 tablespoon crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste', u'3/4 tablespoon green onions, thinly sliced', u'3 eggs, beaten', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup roasted peanuts, finely chopped', u'1 lime, cut into wedges', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Pad Thai with Pork

directions: [u'To make the Dressing: Mix together all the ingredients and chill.', u'To make the Salad: Mix together all the ingredients (except the sesame seeds) in a large bowl. Just before serving, toss the dressing with the salad and top with the sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1/2 tablespoon crushed pepper, or to taste', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 teaspoon sesame seeds', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups leftover beef (steak, brisket, etc.), thinly sliced', u'1 head iceberg lettuce, shredded', u'1/2 cup mung bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup shredded carrots', u'1/2 cup cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, julienned', u'1/2 red or yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons fresh mint leaves, chopped', u' Sesame seeds, for garnish']
title: Cold Thai Beef Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat a grill to medium high. Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook as the label directs. Drain and rinse under cold water. Set aside in a colander to drain thoroughly.', u'Whisk the lime juice, 3 tablespoons water, the sugar, sambal oelek and fish sauce in a large bowl. Add the cucumber, onion, watermelon and noodles. Season with salt and pepper and toss; set aside.', u'Season the steak with salt and pepper. Brush the grill with vegetable oil. Grill the steak until marked, about 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes, then thinly slice.', u'Add all but a few tablespoons cilantro to the noodle salad and toss. Top with the steak and the remaining cilantro.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/2 8 -ounce package rice vermicelli noodles', u'1/4 cup lime juice (from about 3 limes)', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons sambal oelek (Asian chile sauce)', u'1 teaspoon fish sauce', u'1 English cucumber, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced', u'1 red onion, thinly sliced', u'4 cups cubed watermelon', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds skirt steak, cut into 4 pieces', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro']
title: Thai Noodle-Steak Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the noodles in a medium bowl with hot water to cover. Soak until tender, about 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Whisk the sugar with the fish sauce and vinegar in a small bowl.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium heat until hot and add 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil. Pour in the eggs, tilting the skillet as you pour to make a thin, even coating of egg. Cook until just set, about 45 seconds. Invert the eggs onto a cutting board and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Set aside.', u'Add another 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil to the same skillet and heat over high heat. Add the shrimp, 1/2 teaspoon of the pepper flakes, and salt, to taste. Stir-fry until the shrimp are pink and just cooked through, about 1 1/2 minutes. Transfer to a plate.', u'Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons peanut oil over high heat. Add the garlic, shallots, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes and stir-fry until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add the tofu and cook about 2 minutes more. Add the noodles and cook, tossing, until lightly coated with the garlic mixture, about 1 minute. Add the fish sauce mixture and large scallion pieces and heat through. Stir in the cooked egg and shrimp, 1 cup of the sprouts, and the 1/3 cup peanuts and toss until hot. Divide the Phad Thai among plates and top with the remaining sprouts, additional peanuts, and chopped scallions. Serve immediately with the lime wedges and Sri Racha.', u'Copyright \xa9 2003 Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces medium-thick flat rice noodles', u'2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon Southeast Asian fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'2 large eggs, beaten with a pinch of salt', u'12 ounces peeled and deveined medium shrimp', u'3/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u' Kosher salt', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 cup cubed firm tofu (about 6 ounces)', u'5 scallions (white and green parts), 3 cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 2 chopped', u'1 1/4 cups mung bean sprouts', u'1/3 cup salted roasted peanuts, chopped, plus additional for garnish', u' For serving: Lime wedges, Sri Racha sauce (Thai hot chili sauce)']
title: Shrimp Phad Thai

directions: [u'Bring 4 cups of the water to a boil in a large sauce pot over medium heat. Add the chicken breast, reduce the heat and simmer until cooked through, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the pot to a cutting board or bowl and set aside until cool enough to handle. Shred the chicken with a fork and set aside.', u'Bring the remaining 4 cups of water to a boil in a large sauce pot over medium heat. Add peas and cook for 30 seconds. Remove peas from pot with a slotted spoon and divide them between the serving bowls. Add the noodles to the pot and cook for 6 minutes. Drain and add noodles to the peas in the serving bowls.', u'Heat the grapeseed oil in a large sauce pot over medium-high heat. Add the shallots, curry paste, madras curry powder, turmeric, coriander and garlic to the pot and saute for 1 minute. Add the chicken broth to the pot, and bring to a boil. Stir in the light coconut milk and almond milk, then reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the shredded chicken, palm sugar, lime juice and fish sauce and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the spinach leaves and cook for 30 seconds. Ladle the chicken mixture over the noodles and peas in the serving bowls. Stir some chopped cilantro, green onions and chiles into each bowl.', u'Top with chopped peanuts a lime wedge. Garnish with a sprig of cilantro and serve.', u'Bon apetit!', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups water', u'1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast', u'1/2 pound snow peas, trimmed and cut crosswise in half', u'1 (5 3/4-ounce) package pad Thai noodles or wide rice noodles', u'1 tablespoon grapeseed or coconut oil', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced shallots', u'2 teaspoons red curry paste', u'1 1/2 teaspoons madras curry powder', u'1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon ground coriander', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'6 cups chicken broth', u'1 cup light coconut milk', u'1 cup unsweetened almond milk', u'2 tablespoons palm sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 cups fresh spinach leaves, torn in 1/2', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus 8 sprigs, for garnish', u'1/2 cup julienne green onions, white and light green', u'4 Thai red chiles, seeded and chopped', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped toasted peanuts', u'8 lime wedges']
title: Thai Curry Chicken Noodle Soup

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a grill pan over high heat. Toss chicken with soy and oil and grill 6 minutes on each side.', u'Combine cucumber, sprouts, carrots, scallions, basil, mint and sesame with a generous sprinkle of sugar and vinegar. ', u'Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar and cayenne together. Stream in vegetable oil.', u'Slice cooked chicken on an angle. Toss with veggies and herbs.', u'In a very hot nonstick skillet or over a gas burner heat tortillas 15 seconds on each side.', u'Pile chicken and veggies in wraps and drizzle liberally with spicy peanut sauce before wrapping and rolling.']
ingredients: [u'3 (6-ounce) chicken breasts', u'1 tablespoon tamari', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon grill seasoning', u'1/2 seedless cucumber, peeled, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced on an angle', u'2 cups fresh bean sprouts', u'1 cup shredded carrots, available in pouches in produce department', u'3 scallions, sliced on an angle', u'12 leaves basil, chopped or torn', u'3 tablespoons chopped mint leaves (4 sprigs)', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar or white vinegar', u' Salt', u'1/4 cup room temperature chunky peanut butter, soften in microwave if it has been refrigerated', u'2 tablespoons tamari', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar or white vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 (12-inch) flour tortilla wraps']
title: Thai Chicken Wrap with Spicy Peanut Sauce

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat grill to high. Brush both sides of tofu and chicken with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill the tofu on each side for 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly charred, remove, and cut into thin slices. Grill the chicken for 4 minutes per side or until slightly charred and just cooked through, remove, and cut into thin slices. ', u'Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a medium saucepan on the grates of the grill or side burner on the grill. Add the shallots and garlic and cook until soft. Add the ancho powder and cook for 10 seconds. Add the tamarind mixture, vinegar, fish sauce, brown sugar, and peanut butter and bring to a boil. \xa0Place the cooked noodles, tofu, and chicken in a large bowl. Pour the boiling sauce over the noodles and toss gently until until combined. Fold in the green onion, cilantro, and bean sprouts and top with the chopped nuts. Serve with grilled limes on the side.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces extra-firm tofu', u'2 (8-ounce) boneless, skinless, chicken breasts', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil, plus more for brushing', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 shallots, finely chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon ancho chili powder', u'1/4 cup tamarind paste, reconstituted in 1/4 cup water', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1/4 cup creamy peanut butter', u'1 pound Thai rice noodles, soaked in hot water for 15 minutes and drained', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced green onion', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u'4 ounces bean sprouts', u'1/4 cup cashews, toasted and coarsely chopped', u'2 limes, halved and grilled']
title: Grilled Tofu and Chicken Pad Thai

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Thinly slice the chicken into strips and sprinkle with grill seasoning.', u'Heat a large skillet to screaming hot. Add vegetable oil, then chicken. Cook chicken 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the ginger, garlic, peppers, cabbage and carrot mix and scallions and stir-fry another 2 minutes. Add plum sauce to glaze the mixture, toss 1 minute, then add basil and wilt leaves. Add fish sauce and turn to coat. Transfer cooked chicken and vegetables to a bowl. Place spoonfuls of chicken into a piece of lettuce with cucumber and fold lettuce over to eat, like small tacos.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound thin cut chicken breast meat, available packaged in meat case of market', u' Grill seasoning (recommended: Montreal Seasoning by McCormick)', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan', u'2 tablespoons minced ginger root', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 large red bell pepper, seeded and very thinly sliced', u'1 cup packaged shredded cabbage and carrot mix', u'3 scallions, chopped on an angle', u'1/2 cup plum sauce', u'2 cups basil leaves, loosely packed', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1/2 head iceberg lettuce, cut into half again', u'1/2 seedless cucumber, chopped']
title: Thai Glazed Chicken Lettuce Wraps

directions: [u'Soak noodles in hot water until slightly limp; drain and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine fish sauce, soy sauce, tamarind juice, vinegar, sugar, and radish; stir until sugar is dissolved and then set aside. Prepare and measure all of the other ingredients before beginning to cook.', u'Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. When oil is hot, working quickly, add garlic and shrimp and toss with wooden spoons until shrimp are about halfway done. Add cayenne pepper and paprika and toss to combine. Add noodles and radish mixture and toss well. Add bean sprouts and tofu and toss. Add peanuts and garlic chives and toss. When shrimp is just cooked through and all the ingredients are heated through, remove from heat. Garnish with shredded eggs and lime wedges, if desired. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 (14-ounce) package medium dried rice noodles', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoon good-quality soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons tamarind juice', u'1/2 cup white vinegar, or rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 cup preserved ground radish', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil, for frying', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 1/2 pounds large shrimp, peeled, with tails on', u'1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'4 cups bean sprouts', u'8 ounces tofu cake, fried, cut into small cubes', u'1 cup finely ground raw peanuts, roasted (should be raw and then roasted)', u'1 bunch garlic chives, chopped', u'3 eggs, beaten, cooked, rolled up, and shredded', u' Lime wedges, optional, for garnish']
title: Pad Thai

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Combine the water and cardamom pods in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Turn off the heat, add the tea bags and stir gently. Steep for 10 minutes, then remove the tea bags. Add the sugar and condensed milk and stir with a wooden spoon until all of the sugar is dissolved. Allow to cool.', u'Remove 1 1/2 cups of the cooled tea mixture from the saucepan and pour this into an ice cube tray. Freeze for at least 4 hours. Strain and refrigerate the remaining tea.', u'When ready to serve, divide the tea ice cubes between four glasses. Fill the glasses with the chilled tea mixture, leaving a little extra space at the top. Top each glass off with 2 tablespoons of the half-and-half. Serve garnished with a slice of candied ginger, a stalk of lemon grass or a mint sprig, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'7 cups filtered water', u'7 cardamom pods, smashed', u'10 bags black tea', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'3/4 cup sweetened condensed milk', u'1/2 cup half-and-half', u'4 pieces candied ginger or 4 stalks lemon grass or 4 mint sprigs (optional)']
title: Thai Iced Tea

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce heat and place all ingredients into the pan to infuse for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Fill glass with ice and pour tea about 2/3 full then pour sweetened condensed milk to fill the glass. Mix well. Serve and enjoy.']
ingredients: [u'4 cups water', u'6 black tea bags', u'2 pieces orange peel', u'4 star anise', u'4 whole cardamom', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'4 whole cloves', u'1 can sweetened condensed milk']
title: Thai Iced Tea

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'In the bottom of a medium bowl, combine vinegar, sugar, oil. Add daikon, cucumber, bell pepper, pepper flakes. Toss and combine. Cover and chill until ready to serve.', u'When ready to serve, tear basil into pieces and add to salad. Toss salad to incorporate basil and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons light oil, such as canola or safflower', u'1 pound daikon radish, peeled and thinly sliced', u'1 English or seedless cucumber, thinly sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and very thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'20 fresh basil leaves']
title: Thai Cucumber and Radish Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Fill a cocktail shaker or small pitcher with ice. Add the rum, lemongrass syrup, and lime juice. Cover and shake vigorously, or stir, until combined and chilled, about 30 seconds. (In general, by the time the shaker mists up the drink is ready.) Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime on the rim or the lemongrass spear in the drink. Serve. ', u'Copyright (c) 2004 Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 ounces coconut rum', u'1 1/2 ounces Fresh Lemongrass Syrup, recipe follows', u'1 ounce freshly squeezed lime juice (about 1 juicy lime)', u' Very thin slice lime or spear of a fresh lemongrass frond, for garnish']
title: Thai Coco Cocktail

author: Janet Johnston
directions: [u'Put the sliced strip steak and red Thai curry powder in a resealable container and shake until the meat is thoroughly coated. Refrigerate for 30 minutes, to marinate.', u'Meanwhile soak all the noodles in cold water for 30 minutes. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium heat. When the water comes to a boil add the noodles and cook for 3 minutes.', u'While the noodles are cooking, heat the vegetable oil in a wok, over medium-high heat. Using a pair of tongs, remove the noodles from the boiling water and allow them to drain of any water over the top of the pot, and then carefully put them into wok and stir. Crack 2 unbeaten eggs directly into the wok along with the garlic, and stir until the egg is incorporated. Push the noodles to the rear portion of the wok and add the seasoned strip steak. Sear the meat for 1 minute, then turn and sear the other side for 1 minute. Mix the noodles back into the center of the wok along with the meat, and then add the sweet chili sauce, oyster sauce, tamarind, sugar, and a generous pinch of salt.  Cook for 2 minutes, stirring.  Stir in the basil and chives and remove from heat. Divide the noodles into 2 to 3 portions on serving plates. Garnish each serving with carrots, cabbage, sprouts, chopped peanuts, wedges of lime and spicy chili sauce, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'5 ounces strip steak, cut into 1/2-inch thinly sliced strips', u'1/2 tablespoon red Thai curry powder', u'1 (7-ounce) package rice stick noodles', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'2 eggs', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 cup Asian sweet red chili sauce', u'3 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'1 tablespoon tamarind paste', u'1 generous pinch salt', u'1 1/2 tablespoons white sugar', u'4 basil leaves, chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped chives', u'1 cup shredded or julienned carrots', u'1 cup thinly sliced purple cabbage', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'1 cup chopped peanuts', u'1 lime, cut into 6 wedges', u' Spicy chili sauce, optional (recommended: Sambal Oelek)']
title: Janet's Pad Thai

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Special equipment: tea sock', u'Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Place tea in a tea sock, add to the boiling water, remove from the heat, and let steep for 5 to 10 minutes, depending on how strong you like your tea. Strain the tea into a pitcher and stir in the condensed milk. Fill 4 highball glasses with crushed ice, pour in the tea, and stir to chill. Add more sweetened condensed milk, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups water', u'6 tablespoons Thai tea', u'1/2 cup sweetened condensed milk, or more to taste', u' Crushed ice']
title: Thai Iced Tea

directions: [u'To make the Green Curry Paste: In a food processor, combine the peppers, shallot, lemon grass and fresh ginger, and pulse to roughly chop. Add in anchovy paste, spices and oil and puree to form a paste.', u'In a large heavy pan over medium-high heat, add the oil and 3 tablespoons of the green curry paste. Stir rapidly for 1 minute, then slowly add the coconut milk. Stir for 2 minutes and bring to a boil. Add in the peppers and onions, then reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes.  ', u'In a large measuring cup, combine lime juice, fish sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Slowly pour into simmering coconut mixture. Add in the chicken pieces and bring to a low boil. Simmer for 25 minutes, adjusting with additional curry powder, curry paste, and salt, if needed.', u'To serve: Serve rice in individual bowls, top with curry, then garnish with your choice of toppings.', u'Spicy Pear Chutney:']
ingredients: [u'2 serrano peppers, seeds removed', u'2 Anaheim peppers, seeds removed', u'1 shallot', u'1 lemongrass stalk, about 5 inches, after trimming, roughly chopped', u'1 (2-inch) knuckle ginger, chopped', u'1 teaspoon anchovy paste', u'1 tablespoon hot curry powder', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1/2 tablespoon ground turmeric', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cloves', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'3 tablespoons green curry paste', u'2 (14-ounce) cans coconut milk', u'2 small red bell peppers, sliced into 2 by 3/4-inch pieces', u'1 small poblano pepper, sliced into 2 by 3/4-inch pieces', u'2 small red onions, sliced in half rings', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice', u'5 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced across grain into bite-sized pieces', u'1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces', u'2 cups jasmine rice, cooked', u'1/2 pound bacon, cooked and crumbled', u'3 Roma tomatoes, seeds removed and diced', u'1 bunch green onions, thinly sliced', u'1/3 cup diced red bell pepper', u'2 eggs, hard-boiled and diced', u'1/3 cup raisins', u'1/2 cup dry roasted and salted peanuts', u'1/2 cup coconut, toasted', u'1 cup Spicy Pear Chutney, recipe follows', u'5 ripe Bosc pears, cut in 1/2 and cored', u'5 garlic cloves, peeled, smashed', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1/3 cup brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon cloves', u'2 teaspoons red pepper flakes', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 lemon, juiced (about 2 tablespoons)', u'1/3 cup maple syrup', u'1 red onion, diced', u'1/2 serrano pepper, seeded and minced', u'3 tablespoons minced shallot', u'3 tablespoons finely minced fresh ginger', u'1/3 cup apple cider vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves', u'1/2 cup dried cranberries']
title: Thai Green Curry Chicken

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a wok or a large frying pan. Add the garlic and ginger, and saute until golden brown. Add the shrimp and cook for 1 to 2 minutes until pink, tossing from time to time. Remove and set aside in a bowl.', u'Heat 1/2 tablespoon of oil in the same pan and add the eggs. Stir to scramble the egg into small pieces, remove and set aside with the shrimp.', u'Heat the remaining oil in the pan and add the soy sauce, fish sauce, rice wine, red pepper flakes, and brown sugar. Stir briefly, add the drained noodles, and cook for 5 minutes.', u'Add the bean sprouts, chopped scallions, and cilantro. Mix well and continue to cook until noodles are heated through. Season, if necessary, with a little more soy sauce or fish sauce, sprinkle in lime zest and juice, and serve while hot!']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', u'1 tablespoon garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon ginger, minced', u'16 large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 egg, lightly beaten', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon red crushed pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon brown sugar', u'7 ounces rice noodles, soaked in warm water for 10 to 15 minutes then drained', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'3 scallions, sliced', u'1 cup freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 lime, zested and juiced']
title: Shrimp Pad Thai

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Whisk together the vinegar, sugar, sea salt and lime juice in a bowl until the sugar and salt have dissolved. Add the carrots, cucumbers and scallions, and toss to combine. Transfer the mixture to a plastic food storage container and refrigerate until ready to serve. Add the mint and chile pepper just before serving, and toss to combine.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons superfine sugar', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'1 carrot, grated', u'1 seedless cucumber, peeled and thinly sliced', u'1 bunch scallion whites, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1 Fresno chile pepper, seeded and finely chopped']
title: Thai Cucumbers

directions: [u'Heat a grill to medium.', u'Using a mortar and pestle, crush garlic cloves, peppercorns, coriander, lemongrass, and Thai chiles into a chucky paste. Using a large spoon, transfer the paste to a large mixing bowl. Add the chicken and the remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight.', u'Put the chicken on the grill, skin side down, and brush with the marinade. Grill for about 15 minutes then flip the chicken over and brush with the marinade. Grill the second side for about 15 minutes.  Discard the marinade. When the chicken is cooked and tender transfer it to a serving platter and serve with warm dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'10 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon black peppercorns', u'1 tablespoon coriander', u'1 stalk lemongrass, trimmed and cut into small segments', u'2 red or green Thai chiles', u'1/2 fresh chicken, quartered', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons yellow curry powder', u'1/2 can coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u' Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup rice vinegar', u'1/3 cup brown sugar', u'2 large garlic cloves or 4 small, minced', u'2 teaspoons Thai red chili sauce or Sriracha', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce']
title: Thai BBQ Chicken

author: Dzintra Dzenis
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the noodles according to the package directions for al dente. Drain the noodles, then transfer to a large bowl and toss with the sesame oil. Set the noodles aside.', u'In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and chiles. Add the cubed chicken to the marinade, toss gently to coat the chicken. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'For the dressing: In a small saucepan, whisk together the peanut butter, ginger, garlic, sugar, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and chile oil, and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat. ', u'Pour the warm dressing over the cooked noodles, and toss to coat evenly. Set the noodles aside until ready to serve.', u'In a heavy skillet, heat the grapeseed oil over medium-high heat, when the skillet just begins to smoke, add the chicken cubes and sear on all sides until they are browned. Saute the chicken cubes over medium heat until they are fully cooked, about 5 minutes. ', u'Thread the chicken pieces and orange segments alternately on the skewers,', u'To serve the skewers, toss the noodles with the diced chile peppers and chopped cilantro. Sprinkle the chicken skewers with the sliced green onions. Serve the noodles with the chicken skewers and enjoy hot or cold!']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound udon noodles or linguine pasta', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1/4 cup light soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'4 Thai chiles, halved lengthwise, and seeds removed', u'4 chicken breasts, cut into bite-size cubes', u'1/2 cup creamy peanut butter', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon chile oil', u'2 tablespoons grapeseed oil', u'1 orange, rind removed, flesh segmented', u'6 wooden skewers', u'2 Thai chiles diced, seeds removed', u'1 small bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', u'1 bunch spring onions, thinly sliced', u' Special equipment: 6 wooden skewers']
title: Spicy Thai Noodles with Ginger Peanut Dressing

directions: [u'Soften the noodles according to the package directions (noodles usually need to soak in warm water for about 15 minutes), and drain. Set aside.', u'Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the oil, add the basil leaves and fry just until crisp, about 1 minute. Lift leaves out with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Add 1 more tablespoon of oil to wok. Add the tofu, chicken or shrimp, salt and paprika, and stir-fry until cooked through and browned, about 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in the eggs and scramble, while shredding them with a spoon, until egg is just set. Transfer everything from wok to a bowl. Wipe out the wok.', u'Reheat wok and add remaining tablespoon oil. Add the garlic and stirfry until aromas are released, about 10 seconds. Add the vinegar, fish sauce, palm or brown sugar, and heat through. Add the drained noodles and toss until the noodles have absorbed most of the sauce, about 3 minutes. Add the red chile paste, dried shrimp, ground peanuts, bean sprouts, and reserved tofu, chicken or shrimp and eggs, and toss thoroughly.', u'Transfer the mixture to a platter. Garnish with reserved fried basil leaves, mint leaves, scallions and lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces flat rice noodles', u'1/2 bunch purple basil, leaves whole, stems removed (or any fresh basil)', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'3 ounces firm tofu, diced', u'1 boneless, skinless whole chicken breast, cut into strips, or 1 pound peeled, deveined shrimp', u' Salt', u'1 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'3 eggs, beaten', u'3 garlic cloves, pureed', u'1/4 cup white vinegar', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons palm sugar or brown sugar', u'1/2 to 1 teaspoon roasted chile paste or red pepper flakes', u'1 tablespoon dried shrimp', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped dry-roasted peanuts', u'1 cup bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup mint leaves', u'2 scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u'2 limes, cut into wedges, for garnish']
title: Pad Thai

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'*Available in the Asian section of most supermarkets', u'**Steam or microwave 5 cups of washed baby spinach for 2 minutes', u'In a large saute pan, heat the oil over moderate heat. Add the shallots and cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the curry paste and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the chicken broth, coconut milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt and simmer until reduced to 2 cups, about 5 minutes.', u'Season the halibut with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Arrange the fish in the pan and gently shake the pan so the fish is coated with the sauce. Cover and cook until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 7 minutes.', u'Arrange a pile of steamed spinach in the bottom of 4 soup plates. Top with the fish fillets. Stir the cilantro, scallions, and lime juice into the sauce and season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Ladle the sauce over the fish and serve with rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'4 shallots, finely chopped (about 3/4 cup)', u'2 1/2 teaspoons red curry paste*, or 2 teaspoons curry powder', u'2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/2 cup light coconut milk', u'1/2 teaspoon salt, plus 1/4 teaspoon, plus more for seasoning', u'4 (6-ounce) pieces halibut fillet, skin removed', u' Steamed spinach**', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 scallions, green part only, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups cooked brown rice, for serving']
title: Thai-Style Halibut with Coconut-Curry Broth

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook 3 minutes, until soft. Add snap peas and carrots and cook 2 minutes. Add turkey and cook 1 minute, until golden brown on all sides.', u'In a medium bowl, whisk together broth, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and pepper flakes. Add mixture to pan and bring to a simmer. Add rice and stir to combine. Remove from heat and stir in basil. Season, to taste, with salt and black pepper.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 pound sugar snap peas', u'1/2 cup shredded carrots', u'1 cooked turkey tenderloin, cubed (about 2 to 3 cups)', u'3/4 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar (regular or seasoned)', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper or crushed hot chili flakes', u'1 cup regular rice, cooked according to package directions', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped basil leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Thai Turkey and Rice

directions: [u'Soak the noodles in hot water to cover and let stand, about 30 minutes, until soft. ', u'Peel the shrimp, reserving the shells. Cut them in half lengthwise, then toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt and the sesame oil, and refrigerate.', u'Bring the stock to a boil with galangal, garlic, and lemongrass. Turn the heat to low and simmer for 35 minutes. Add the shrimp shells and simmer for another 15 to 20 minutes, skimming if necessary. Strain the stock and bring to a boil. Turn heat to low and simmer with the shallots and chiles. Simmer for 15 minutes and add 2 teaspoons of salt, the fish sauce, and the sugar. Continue to simmer.', u'Meanwhile, drain the noodles well and divide among four to eight bowls. Then add the shrimp to the simmering broth. Turn off the heat and stir in the fresh herbs and lime juice.', u'Divide the soup among the soup bowls, sprinkle over the black pepper, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'8 -ounces dried rice noodles (flat, fettuccine-shaped)', u'1 pound medium shrimp', u' Salt', u' Few drops sesame oil', u'2 quarts chicken stock, preferably fresh', u'6 thin slices fresh galangal or fresh ginger', u'6 garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 stalks lemongrass (bottom third only, sliced thinly on the bias)', u'5 shallots, sliced', u'4 small serrano chile peppers, coarsely shredded, including seeds', u'1/4 cup Thai or Vietnamese fish sauce', u'3 teaspoons sugar', u'1/4 cup whole fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup lightly chopped Asian basil leaves', u'1/3 cups freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
servings: Makes 4 main dish or 8 small s
title: Hot and Sour Shrimp Soup with Noodles and Thai Herbs

author: Serena Palumbo
directions: [u'In a blender or food processor, mix the peanut butter, coconut milk, agave nectar, lime juice, soy sauce, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes, to taste, together until the texture is smooth and loose.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup peanut butter', u'1 (8-ounce) can coconut milk', u'1/2 cup agave nectar', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u' Red pepper flakes']
title: Thai Peanut Sauce

directions: [u'Mix together the bell peppers and rice wine vinegar and marinate for 1 hour and up to a day in the refrigerator.', u'In a heavy-bottomed Dutch oven over medium heat, add the vegetable and sesame oils. Add the shallots, garlic and ginger and saute for 10 minutes, stirring frequently to avoid burning. Add the tofu by crumbling into small pieces and saute for 15 minutes more.', u'In the meantime, whisk together the hot sauce, salt, fish sauce, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce and hoisin and add to the tofu. Cook until the sauce thickens, 10 to 15 minutes. Turn off the heat and add the chopped Thai basil. Taste and adjust the seasoning, if necessary.', u'To serve, spoon the tofu mixture onto a piece of lettuce and top with the marinated peppers, cashews, scallions, the chiffonade Thai basil and a couple dots of plum sauce. For more heat, add a few drops of hot sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 red bell peppers, diced', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'2 shallots, minced', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 tablespoons grated ginger', u'4 packages extra-firm tofu, pressed on a wire rack for at least 1 hour and up to 24', u'1 tablespoon Asian hot sauce, such as Sriracha', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon hoisin sauce', u'1 1/2 cups Thai basil, chopped', u' Salt', u'1/2 cup Thai basil, cut in chiffonade', u'2 cups cashews, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced scallions', u'3 heads green leaf lettuce, cleaned and trimmed', u' Plum sauce, for serving']
title: Thai Basil Tofu Lettuce Cups

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u'In a large ovenpoof skillet over medium-high heat, add all of the marinade ingredients. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by half. Add the eggplant and mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes.', u'Put the pan into the oven and cook until the eggplant and mushrooms are soft and caramelized, about 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons soy sauce', u'4 tablespoons sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons unseasoned rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons corn oil', u'2 tablespoons hot water', u'6 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons minced scallion', u'1 tablespoon finely minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon finely minced fresh ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon red chili flakes', u'1 bunch Thai basil, leaves roughly chopped', u'2 Japanese eggplants, sliced 1/2-inch thick on the bias', u'1/2 cup oyster mushrooms, torn into pieces', u' Toasted sesame seeds, for garnish']
title: Sesame Roasted Eggplant (Thai)

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u"Bring 2 cups of water to the boil. Put the stock, shallot, garlic, lime leaves, and ginger in a saucepan, cover and let it bubble away at a moderate to high heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until you have a thickish, softish mess at the bottom of the pan. Check to make sure it isn't either burning or just getting too dry for comfort, and add a bit of boiling water if it is. Meanwhile, put the mussels in a sink filled with ice-cold water. Chuck away any that don't sink and then, as you remove them, make doubly sure by chucking away any that don't shut when you tap then sharply. I wouldn't expect you to have to throw many away, so don't worry unduly. ", u'Add the chile pepper to the mixture in the pan. After about 30 seconds, or just long enough to get them out of the sink, add the mussels and then throw over them 1/2 cup boiling water, and then the lime juice, mirin, and fish sauce mixed together. Cover, give the pan a shake, and leave on a high heat for about 3 minutes, by which time the mussels should have steamed open. Add half the coriander, shake again, and pour into a noodle bowl. Sprinkle over the remaining coriander and eat.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup light stock, such as vegetable, chicken, fish or dashi', u'1 shallot, minced', u'2 garlic cloves, sliced or minced', u'3 kaffir lime leaves, chopped or shredded, or 1 (4-inch) piece lemon grass, minced', u'1/2 -inch piece ginger, minced', u'20 mussels (about 12 ounces), (preferably cultivated, or cleaned and bearded)', u'1 fresh chile pepper, red or green, seeded and chopped or sliced finely', u'1/2 cup boiling water', u'1 tablespoon lime juice', u'1 tablespoon mirin', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh coriander']
title: Thai-Flavored Mussels

directions: [u'In a plastic re-sealable bag, combine black pepper, salt, paprika, cumin, brown sugar, cayenne pepper, allspice, 2 teaspoons of ginger, and the chopped parsley. Add flank steak and coat evenly. Seal bag and refrigerate for 1 to 12 hours. ', u'Grill for 8 to 10 minutes. Allow meat to rest 10 minutes before slicing. ', u'In a small non-reactive bowl, combine sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, and sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves. Add remaining ginger and jalapeno. In a wok pan, combine dressing and scallions. ', u'Cook 1 to 2 minutes. Add cabbage and carrot and toss until heated through, about 3 to 4 minutes. ', u'Remove from heat and add cilantro.', u'Combine sliced flank steak and cabbage slaw and serve on warm pita wraps.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons coarse salt', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'1/2 teaspoon cumin', u'1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon allspice', u'2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger, plus 1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley', u'1 1/4 pound flank steak', u'1 tablespoon light sesame oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 jalapeno, grated', u'3 scallions, thinly sliced', u'8 cups Napa cabbage, thinly sliced', u'1 carrot, shredded', u'1 cup cilantro, roughly chopped', u'6 to 8 pita wraps, warmed']
title: Thai Steak Wrap

directions: [u'For the sauce: In a medium bowl, combine all of the sauce ingredients, whisk until thoroughly combined and set aside.', u'For the chicken: Cook the whole-wheat linguine al dente according to box directions. Drain and rinse under cold water and spray lightly with olive oil cooking spray so it does not stick and set aside.', u'Coat a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and add onion. Cook until translucent and beginning to brown, about 5 to 10 minutes. Add the chicken, season with salt and pepper and stir in curry powder. Saute chicken until lightly brown. Add the peanut butter and allow it to melt to coat the chicken. ', u'Add the roasted red peppers, water chestnuts and scallions and season with salt and pepper as you like. Saute for a few minutes just to release flavor.', u'Pour the coconut milk sauce over the chicken and vegetables and stir gently. Cook just until warmed through and thickened a bit, about 3 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, as needed. Garnish with chopped mint and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'1 (13.5-ounce) can light coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon Thai curry paste', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u' Dash cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces high-fiber whole-wheat linguine, (recommended: DeCecco)', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'1 Vidalia or other sweet onion, chopped', u'1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast, fat removed, cut into small pieces', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 tablespoons peanut butter', u'1 cup thinly sliced roasted red peppers', u'1 cup thinly sliced water chestnuts', u'1 cup scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u' Chopped fresh mint and cilantro leaves, for garnish', u' Lime wedges, for serving']
title: Coconut Curry Thai Chicken

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Heat a wok over high heat and add 2 tablespoons of butter. Once melted, toss in bananas and add the 1/4 cup of sugar. Cook down sugar and add the sesame seeds and the lime juice. Stir together and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons butter', u'4 fresh, firm bananas, peeled and cut into 1 to 2-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon black sesame seeds', u'1 lime, juiced']
title: Thai Fried Bananas

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a large saucepan or wok at high heat. Stir in the chopped garlic and cook until it is golden brown. Add the Thai chile pepper and stir well.', u'Add the ground chicken and cook it just halfway done. Reduce the heat to medium and add the mushrooms, fish sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, sweet soy sauce, and chicken stock. Mix well.', u'When all the ingredients are cooked, add the red bell pepper and the Thai holy basil. Mix well and season to taste with salt. Serve over steamed jasmine rice.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 to 2 tablespoons chopped Thai chile pepper', u'8 ounces ground chicken breast', u'1/2 cup sliced white mushrooms', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'1/2 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 tablespoon sweet soy sauce (optional)', u'1/3 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 cup sliced red bell pepper (optional)', u'1/2 cup Thai holy basil (Ga-Prao)', u' Salt', u' Steamed jasmine rice']
title: THAI HOLY BASIL CHICKEN: PUD GA-PRAO GAI SAP

directions: [u'To make Sauce 1: In a small saucepan, combine all the ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce slightly and set aside to cool. Reserve.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons lime juice', u'3 tablespoons tamarind paste', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1/2 cup palm sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt']
title: Shrimp Pad Thai

author: Ted Allen
directions: [u'Pickle the cucumbers: In a small saucepan, heat the sugar, salt, vinegar and 1/4 cup water over medium-high heat until the sugar and salt dissolve; remove from the heat. Put the cucumber, chile and red onion in a medium bowl and pour the hot brine over them. Let cool, then add the cilantro. Chill.', u'Make the beef skewers: In a medium bowl, mix the soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, fish sauce, mirin, garlic, ginger, brown sugar, sesame seeds and red pepper flakes. Pour half of the mixture into a serving bowl, add the lime juice and reserve as a dipping sauce. Put the beef cubes in a zip-top bag and pour in the remaining marinade. Seal the bag and massage the marinade into the meat. Put in a bowl and refrigerate 1 to 2 hours.', u'Preheat a grill to high. Drain the meat, discarding the marinade. Thread the cubes onto skewers (1 to 4 per skewer), separating each cube with a piece of scallion. Grill directly over the coals, turning once, until nicely charred, about 3 minutes per side.', u'Sprinkle with sliced scallions. Serve warm or cold with the reserved marinade for dipping and the pickled cucumber and chiles on the side.', u'Soak wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes to keep them from burning on the grill.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar (unseasoned)', u'1/2 Asian cucumber, peeled, halved lengthwise, seeded and thinly sliced', u'1 small hot red or green chile, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'4 teaspoons rice vinegar (unseasoned)', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons mirin', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 teaspoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar', u'4 teaspoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'2 teaspoons red pepper flakes or Thai chili paste', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'1 pound sirloin, rib-eye or New York strip steak, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'2 scallions (white and light green parts), cut into 1-inch lengths, plus additional, sliced for garnish']
title: Thai Beef Skewers With Pickled Cucumbers

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'For the rice: Combine the rice, water, and salt in a small saucepan. Bring the water to a boil. Cover the pan and reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 15 minutes.', u'For the shrimp: Place the shrimp shells in a small saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and turn off the heat. Let the shells steep in the water.', u'Coat a large, straight-sided saute pan with vegetable oil. Bring the pan to medium-high heat. Add the garlic and red curry paste. Quickly add the coconut milk and stir to combine. Toss in the lime leaves. Add the fish sauce, brown sugar, lime zest, and juice. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer.', u'Strain the shrimp shell water through a strainer into a bowl. Measure out 1 cup and add it to the pan. Cook until the mixture has thickened to the consistency of heavy cream. Add the shrimp and mushrooms and cook until the shrimp turn pink, 3 to 4 minutes.', u'Fluff the cooked rice with a fork. Spoon the rice into a bowl and spoon the shrimp mixture over top. Top with mung bean sprouts, diced pineapple, and cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup jasmine rice', u'2 cups water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined, shells reserved', u' Vegetable oil', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed and finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon Thai red curry paste', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 kaffir lime leaves', u'1 tablespoon Thai fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons brown sugar', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'4 shiitake mushrooms, julienned', u'1/2 cup mung bean sprouts, for garnish', u'1/2 cup fresh pineapple, cut into 1/2-inch dice, for garnish', u' Cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Thai Red Curry Shrimp with Jasmine Rice

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the ginger, garlic and chiles and stir-fry until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the curry paste and ketchup and fry until slightly browned, 3 to 4 more minutes. Add the lime juice and 3 cups water, cover and bring to a boil.', u'Add the clams; cover and steam until they open slightly, about 3 minutes. Add the mussels; cover and steam until they open slightly, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the bell pepper and half of the cilantro and basil. Cook, covered, until the pepper is crisp-tender, about 2 minutes.', u'Transfer the clams and mussels to serving bowls and ladle the broth on top. Sprinkle with the remaining cilantro and basil and garnish with lime. Serve with crusty bread, if desired.', u'Per serving: Calories 216; Fat 10 g (Saturated 1 g); Cholesterol 38 mg; Sodium 489 mg; Carbohydrate 18 g; Fiber 2 g; Protein 17 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 3 -inch piece ginger, peeled and finely chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 to 2 Thai chile peppers or jalapenos, seeded and chopped', u'2 tablespoons Thai red curry paste', u'1/2 cup ketchup', u' Juice of 2 limes, plus lime wedges for serving', u'16 littleneck clams, scrubbed', u'1 3/4 pounds mussels, scrubbed', u'1 small red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', u'3/4 cup fresh cilantro', u'3/4 cup fresh basil', u' Crusty bread, for serving (optional)']
title: Clams and Mussels in Thai Curry Sauce

directions: [u'In a large bowl, add the coconut milk, honey, hot sauce, scallions and lime zest and juice. Whisk well to combine. Drizzle in the sesame oil and taste for seasoning; add salt and pepper if necessary. Add the fruit and nuts to the bowl and toss well to combine. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup light coconut milk', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'1 teaspoon Thai hot sauce, such as Sriracha', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u' Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups diced mango', u'2 cups diced pineapple', u'2 tablespoons unsalted peanuts']
title: Thai Fruit Salad

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u"For the mac 'n' cheese: Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot. Salt generously, and then add the pasta and cook to box instructions, usually 6 to 7 minutes. Drain.", u'In another large pot, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Whisk in the flour and continue whisking until it deepens in color and releases a light toasted aroma, about 1 minute.', u'Whisk in the Thai red curry paste, and when fully combined, pour in the milk and cream (or all milk, if using). Bring to a boil, whisking constantly, and then turn down to a simmer. Simmer until the mixture thickens, whisking occasionally, about 5 minutes.', u'Off heat, whisk in the cheeses and stir until melted. Add the pasta and toss to combine.', u'Turn your broiler on.', u'For the crumb topping: Toss the panko with the melted butter and season with salt and pepper.', u"To assemble: Pour the mac 'n' cheese into a broiler-safe casserole dish, sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture, and broil until browned, about 1 minute."]
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound elbow macaroni', u'5 tablespoons butter', u'5 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 (4-ounce) jar Thai red curry paste', u'2 cups whole milk', u'2 cups cream (alternatively, use 5 cups whole milk instead of both milk and cream)', u'8 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, grated', u'8 ounces Cheddar cheese, grated', u'3/4 cup panko bread crumbs', u'2 tablespoons butter, melted', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Thai Red Curry Mac 'n' Cheese

directions: [u'In a large bowl soak the noodles in cold water to cover for 30 minutes, or until they are softened, and drain them well. In a small bowl stir together the fish sauce, the ketchup, the vinegar, the brown sugar, and the cayenne.', u'In a wok or non-stick skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over moderate heat until it is hot but not smoking, add the eggs, and cook them, stirring, until they are scrambled and just cooked through. Transfer the eggs to a bowl and break them into pieces with a spoon.', u'In the wok or a large heavy skillet heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil over moderately high heat until it just begins to smoke and in it stir-fry the garlic and the shallots until the mixture is golden. Add the shrimp and stir-fry the mixture 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimp are just cooked through. Add the ketchup mixture, the noodles, 2 cups of the bean sprouts, the scallions, and the water and cook the mixture, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the noodles are tender and the excess liquid is evaporated. Add the egg, toss the mixture well, and mound it on a platter.', u'Sprinkle the noodle mixture with the peanuts and the red pepper flakes and arrange the remaining 1 cup bean sprouts around it. Garnish the dish with the chiles, the coriander sprigs, and the lime wedges.']
