ingredients: [u'3/4 pound dried flat rice noodles* (about 1/4 to 1/2-inch wide)', u'3 tablespoons Asian fish sauce such as naam pla*', u'3 tablespoons ketchup', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons firmly packed brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne, or to taste', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'3 large eggs, beaten lightly', u'8 garlic cloves, minced', u'4 shallots, minced (about 1/2 cup)', u'3/4 pound medium shrimp, peeled, deveined, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'3 cups fresh bean sprouts, rinsed and spun dry', u'4 scallions, halved lengthwise and cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces', u'3/4 cup water', u'1/3 cup crushed roasted peanuts (use a rolling pin)', u'1/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u' Small fresh red chiles, optional', u' Fresh coriander sprigs, optional', u' Lime wedges', u' *available at Asian markets']
title: Pad Thai

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.  Divide the shrimp among 6 small ramekin dishes and set aside.', u'In a small bowl, mix the garlic, tomatoes, onions, chili paste, and salt and pepper, to taste. Divide the mixture between the 6 ramekin dishes over the shrimp. In a saucepan, over medium-high heat, blend both the oils and heat to 325 degrees F. When the oil reaches the proper temperature, pour it evenly into the ramekin dishes. Bake in the oven until the shrimp turn pink, about 6 to 8 minutes. To finish, slice the bread on a bias, about 1-inch thick.  Remove the ramekins from the oven and serve immediately with the bread on the side for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'30 (16/20) jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'1/2 cup halved grape tomatoes', u'1/2 cup diced red onion', u'2 tablespoons Thai chili paste, or more to taste', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup grapeseed oil', u'1 cup vegetable oil', u'1 loaf baguette or French bread']
title: Thai Spicy Shrimp

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Place a rack in a roasting pan. Mix the butter, chopped garlic, curry paste, 3 teaspoons ginger, the zest of 2 limes and the juice of 1 lime in a bowl.', u'Season the chicken with salt. Loosen the skin and rub the curry butter underneath. Place skin-side up on the rack and pour about 1/2 cup water into the pan. Roast until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crisp, 20 to 25 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, mix the crushed garlic with the remaining 1 teaspoon ginger, the zest of 1 lime and juice of 2 limes. Whisk in the vegetable oil. Shave the carrots into ribbons with a vegetable peeler and toss with the dressing. Add the cilantro and 1/2 teaspoon salt and toss. Serve the chicken with the carrot-ginger salad.', u'Per serving: Calories 407; Fat 20 g (Saturated 7 g); Cholesterol 126 mg; Sodium 235 mg; Carbohydrate 16 g; Fiber 4 g; Protein 41 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'3 garlic cloves; 2 chopped, 1 crushed', u'4 teaspoons Thai green curry paste (available in the international aisle)', u'4 teaspoons finely chopped peeled ginger', u' Grated zest and juice of 3 limes', u'4 skin-on, bone-in chicken breasts (2 to 2 1/2 pounds)', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 pound carrots', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Thai Chicken with Carrot-Ginger Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler to high. Line a broiler pan with foil and lightly oil.', u'Skim 2 tablespoons cream from the top of the coconut milk (reserve the milk to flavor rice as a side dish, if desired). Fry the coconut cream in a small skillet over medium heat until glossy, about 2 minutes. Stir in the curry paste and cook until fragrant, 2 minutes. Spread the mixture over the fish in the broiler pan; broil until browned and just cooked through, about 15 minutes. Cut the fish into 4 pieces.', u'Whisk the lime juice, sugar, 2 tablespoons water and fish sauce in a bowl until the sugar dissolves. Stir in the chili sauce and garlic.', u'Arrange the lettuce, watercress, cucumber, scallions, pepper, herbs, nuts and lime wedges with 4 pieces of fish on a platter; drizzle with the Thai salad dressing. (Or save 2 fillets and some dressing to make Mahi Mahi Banh Mi.)', u'Photograph by Antonis Achiellos']
ingredients: [u'1 13 .5-ounce can coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon red curry paste', u'1 1/4 pounds skinned mahi mahi fillet, dark flesh trimmed', u'1/3 cup fresh lime juice, plus lime wedges for garnish', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon Asian chili sauce', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 head Boston lettuce, leaves separated', u'1 bunch watercress, woody stems removed', u'1 Kirby cucumber, thinly sliced', u'3 scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u'1 red or yellow bell pepper, stemmed, seeded and thinly sliced', u'1 bunch fresh cilantro or mint', u'1 handful roasted peanuts or cashews']
servings: 4 (or 2, with leftovers for Mahi Mahi Banh Mi)
title: Thai Red Curry Mahi Mahi Salad

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the sausage and stir-fry for 3 minutes, breaking it up as it cooks. Add the onion and celery and stir-fry for 5 more minutes. Add the chicken stock, bring to a boil, decrease the heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the bamboo shoots, mushrooms, and coconut milk. Simmer for 2 more minutes. Add the lime juice and taste for salt and pepper. Serve garnished with green onions and cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1/2 pound Thai Chicken and Turkey Sausage, removed from casings', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced celery', u'6 cups chicken stock', u'6 bamboo shoots, diced', u'10 medium-sized fresh mushrooms, sliced', u'1/2 cup coconut milk or condensed milk', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup chopped green onions or scallions, white and green parts', u' Cilantro leaves']
title: Thai Sausage Soup

directions: [u'Noodles: Soften in water according to directions on package - normally 30 to 45 minutes in cool water. Drain and set aside.', u'Pad Thai: Heat wok over high heat, add 2 tablespoons of the oil. When the oil is shimmering, add the basil and fry until crisp. Transfer the basil to a paper towel. Meanwhile, add 1 tablespoon of oil to wok, then add shrimp and tofu and stir-fry until the shrimp begins to become opaque, about 2 minutes. Add the eggs and scramble quickly. Transfer the mixture to a plate and wipe out the wok with a clean, dry cloth.', u'Heat the wok and add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and habenero pepper and cook for 20 seconds. Add the fish sauce and brown sugar and heat through. Add the noodles and toss until the noodles have absorbed most of the sauce. Add peanuts, bean sprouts and reserved tofu, shrimp, and eggs and toss. ', u'Transfer mixture on a serving platter. Garnish with lime, basil and mint. ']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces flat rice noodles', u' Olive oil', u'4 ounces basil leaves left as whole, stems removed', u'1 pound, peeled and deveined shrimp', u'4 ounces firm tofu, cubed', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon habenero pepper, minced', u'1/2 cup fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons, finely chopped lightly salted peanuts', u'1/2 cup bean sprouts', u'1/ cup mint leaves', u'2 limes, cut into wedges']
title: Shrimp Pad Thai

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Place the shrimp in a large, 1-gallon re-sealable food storage plastic bag. Place the rest of the ingredients (coconut milk through salt) in a non-reactive medium bowl and whisk to combine. Pour the marinade over the shrimp and seal in the bag. Allow to marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes, turning the bag occasionally to ensure even marinating. Soak bamboo skewers in warm water while you marinade the shrimp.', u'Preheat the grill to medium-high. Remove the shrimp from the marinade and skewer 4 per skewer and set aside. Brush the grill lightly with a bit of vegetable oil and place the shrimp on the grill. Cook the shrimp for 3 minutes, basting with the marinade as it cooks, then turn and cook for an additional 3 minutes, while basting, on the second side. Serve while hot.']
ingredients: [u'24 jumbo shrimp, peeled and deviened', u'2 cups coconut milk', u'1/2 cup lime juice', u'1/4 cup Thai fish sauce', u'4 tablespoons sriracha sauce', u'1 tablespoon tamarind paste', u'1 tablespoon lime zest', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'6 (6 or 8-inch) bamboo skewers', u' Vegetable oil, for oiling grill']
title: Thai Marinated, Skewered and Grilled Jumbo Shrimp

directions: [u'Place tamarind in a bowl, cover with the boiling water and let sit until softened. Press the pulp through a sieve into a bowl and discard seeds and solids.', u'Combine orange juice, tamarind pulp, vinegar, honey, basil and salt and pepper in a blender and blend until smooth. Strain the mixture through a mesh strainer. Return to the blender, with the motor running, slowly add 6 tablespoons of the oil and blend until emulsified.', u'Heat remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large nonstick saute pan over high heat. Season shrimp on both sides with salt and pepper and add to the pan. Stir in the tamarind glaze, turn the shrimp over and continue cooking until shrimp is cooked through and glazed.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons tamarind pulp', u'1 cup boiling water', u'1/4 cup fresh orange juice', u'3 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1/4 cup fresh Thai basil leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'1 pound shrimp (21-25) size, shelled and deveined', u'12 ounces dried flat rice noodles (1/4-inch wide; sometimes called pad Thai or banh pho)', u'3 tablespoons tamarind (from a pliable block)', u'1 cup boiling water', u'1/2 cup light soy sauce', u'1/4 cup packed Muscavado light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons hot sauce (recommended: Sriracha)', u'1 1/2 cups peanut or vegetable oil', u'4 large shallots, sliced crosswise into 1/4-inch thick slices', u'1 (14 to 16-ounce) package firm tofu, rinsed, patted dry and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'4 large eggs', u'1/4 teaspoons salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1 bunch scallions, green and pale green parts, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'4 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'2 cups bean sprouts (1/4 pound)', u' Thai basil leaves', u' Cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup roasted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u' Lime wedges']
title: Shrimp Pad Thai

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, water, fish sauce, and sugar; set aside.  Heat the oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and chile flakes, and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until pink but still translucent in the middle, about 2 minutes. Transfer the shrimp to a medium bowl with a slotted spoon. Add the onion, pepper, and chile to the skillet, and stir-fry until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Return the shrimp to the pan along with the soy sauce mixture. Bring to a boil, and stir-fry until the sauce glazes the shrimp, about 1 minute more. Add the tomatoes and stir until coated with sauce, about 15 seconds. Remove pan from the heat, stir in the basil, mint, and lime juice. Transfer to a serving dish, serve immediately.', u'Copyright 2003 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon water', u'2 teaspoons Southeast Asian fish sauce', u'4 teaspoons light brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 tablespoon grated, peeled, fresh ginger', u'1/2 to 1 teaspoon red chile flakes', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 medium red onion, cut in 1-inch dice', u'1 medium yellow pepper, seeded, cut in 1-inch dice', u'1 jalapeno chile, thinly sliced into rounds', u'2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved', u'3/4 cup torn fresh basil leaves', u'1/4 cup torn fresh mint leaves', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice', u' Serving suggestion: Jasmine rice']
title: Thai Shrimp Stir-fry with Tomatoes and Basil - Slimmed

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Place noodles in a large bowl and cover with the boiling water. Allow noodles to soak for 5 minutes, drain, and rinse with cold, running water for 30 seconds. Drain well and set aside.', u'In a small bowl, combine the fish sauce, vinegar, sugar, red pepper, coconut milk, and if desired, the tamarind concentrate, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.', u'Heat the sesame and peanut oils in a wok or large saucepan over medium-high heat. Just before the oil is smoking, add the shrimp and cook until pink, stirring constantly. Add the tofu, mushrooms, bean sprouts, carrots, red bell pepper, garlic, and reserved noodles, and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes. ', u'Pour the sauce mixture into the wok and toss until combined. Cook until the mixture is steaming and most of the liquid has evaporated. Add the peanuts and green onions and cook an additional 30 seconds. ', u'Remove the wok from the heat and season with the lime juice and cilantro. Serve hot with Sriracha, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'7 ounces medium rice stick noodles', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons palm sugar or dark brown sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'1/4 cup coconut milk', u'1 teaspoon tamarind concentrate, optional', u'1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'12 ounces medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1 cup diced firm tofu', u'1 cup sliced shiitake mushroom caps', u'1 cup mung bean sprouts', u'2 large carrots, cut into matchstick-sized strips', u'1/2 cup matchstick-sized red bell pepper strips', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/2 cup roasted, unsalted peanuts, roughly chopped', u'1/2 cup diagonally sliced green onions', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u' Sriracha (Thai hot sauce), for serving']
title: Shrimp and Vegetable Pad Thai

directions: [u'Cook shrimp in a 4-quart saucepan of boiling salted water until just cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes, then drain in a colander and cool. ', u'Cut peel and white pith from limes with a sharp knife and discard. Cut lime segments free from membranes, then finely chop enough segments to measure 1/4 cup. Mince enough lemongrass from bottom 6 inches of stalks to measure 2 tablespoons total. ', u'Stir together chopped lime, minced lemongrass, lime juice, bell pepper, scallions, chiles, fish sauce (to taste), sugar, and salt until sugar is dissolved. Toss shrimp, tomatoes, and cucumbers with dressing and top with herbs.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound large shrimp in shell (21 to 25 per pound), peeled', u'2 limes', u'3 small fresh lemongrass stalks, 1 or 2 outer leaves discarded', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup finely chopped red bell pepper', u'3 scallions, sliced crosswise 1/4-inch thick', u'2 (3-inch) fresh green chiles such as Thai or serrano, minced (including seeds)', u'3 to 4 teaspoons Asian fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 pounds beefsteak tomatoes, cut into 1-inch wedges', u'3/4 pounds cucumbers, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/2 cup loosely packed fresh Thai anise basil leaves', u'1/2 cup loosely packed fresh Thai lemon basil leaves', u'1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves']
title: Thai-Style Tomato and Shrimp Salad

directions: [u'Cover noodles with boiling water. Soak 20 minutes or until soft but not fully "cooked". Drain and set aside.', u'In a small non-reactive bowl whisk together lime juice, water, fish sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, cayenne, and oil. Set aside.', u'Add oil, garlic, shallots and shrimp to 12-inch, non-stick skillet. Turn heat to medium high and cook until shrimp is mostly pink about 3 to 4 minutes. Add eggs, stir and scramble until just moist.', u'Add noodles, fish sauce mixture, peanuts, sprouts and scallions. Using a pair of tongs or 2 large spoons, toss until noodles are evenly coated.', u'Add the cilantro. Cook tossing constantly until noodles are tender and sauce has thickened slightly, about 3 to 4 minutes more. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces rice stick noodles', u'1/3 cup lime juice', u'1/3 cup water', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne', u'2 teaspoons roasted peanut oil', u'2 cloves garlic, finely minced', u'1 shallot, finely minced', u'1/2 pound peeled and deveined shrimp, cut into small pieces', u'2 eggs, lightly beaten', u'1/4 cup roasted, unsalted peanuts, roughly chopped', u'4 cups bean sprouts', u'1 cup thinly sliced scallions, about two small bunches', u'1 cup loosely packed cilantro leaves']
title: Pad Thai

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'In a large pot over high heat, bring 6 cups water to a boil. Remove from the heat and add the tea bags. Steep for 10 minutes, remove the tea bags, and let cool. Pour into a clean container and chill.', u'Fill 4 tall glasses with ice. Pour the tea three-quarters of the way up and top each with sweetened condensed milk. Serve garnished with an orange slice. For the adults, top with vodka.']
ingredients: [u'4 tea bags, black or orange pekoe', u'1 (12-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', u'1 orange, sliced, for garnish', u'4 ounces orange vodka (optional)']
title: Thai Iced Tea

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'To prepare the sauce, simmer the chicken broth, onion, ginger, lemon grass, lime leaves, and lime juice together until the liquid is reduced by half. Then, add fish sauce, coconut milk, curry paste, and paprika; cook for 10 minutes.', u'Season the rice flour with salt and pepper, lightly dredge the shrimp in the flour; tap off excess. Heat peanut oil in a skillet until very hot. Add the coated shrimp to the hot oil and cook about 2 minutes each side. Add the mussels, asparagus tips, and shiitakes. Cook for 2 minutes just until heated through. Strain the sauce over the shellfish and vegetables. Poach the Udon noodles in hot salted water, drain and place in a warm bowl. Add the shellfish sauce. Top with pea tendrils, herbs, cashews, and sprouts.']
ingredients: [u'1 quart chicken broth, low sodium', u'1/2 white onion', u'1 (2-inch) piece fresh peeled ginger', u'2 stalks lemon grass, white part only, cracked open', u'4 kaffir lime leaves, fresh or dried*', u'2 limes, juiced', u'2 tablespoons Thai fish sauce*', u'1 (13-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon Thai red curry paste*', u' Pinch paprika', u' Rice flour, for dredging', u'1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'2 dozen mussels, steamed', u'1 bunch asparagus, tips only', u'8 ounces shiitake mushroom caps, sliced', u'1 pound fresh Udon noodles', u'12 pea tendrils', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped mint leaves', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup chopped cashews', u' Daikon sprouts, for garnish']
title: Shrimp and Mussel Thai Noodle Bowl

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'Soak the noodles in a shallow dish covered in water until pliable, about 10 minutes. Mix the fish sauce and sugar in a small bowl and reserve.', u'Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a high-sided skillet or wok and add the tofu. Fry the tofu until golden brown on all sides. Remove to paper-towel-lined plate to drain.', u'In the same pan, add the shallots and saute until translucent, about a minute. Crack in the egg and break up while stirring together. Mix in the reserved fried tofu, fish sauce and sugar mixture and noodles.  If the noodles are not coated enough in the sauce, stir in a couple more tablespoons of fish sauce. Add in the green onions and saute for another 30 seconds. Add the bean sprouts and remove from the heat. Top with crushed peanuts, radishes, limes and chili powder.']
ingredients: [u' One 14-ounce package dried thin rice noodles', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce, or more as needed', u'1 tablespoon white sugar', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'1 block firm tofu, pressed and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'2 shallots, minced', u'1 egg', u'1 bunch green onions, sliced', u'1 bunch bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup crushed peanuts', u'1 bunch radishes, cut into slices', u'2 limes cut, into wedges', u' Chili powder']
title: Pad Thai

directions: [u'In a large saute pan, over high heat combine the oil and butter. Saute the shrimp until they are just pink, about 3 to 4 minutes, and season with salt and pepper. To serve, place 1/4 cup of the Thai Spiced Eggplant in the center of a plate. Arrange 3 of the sauteed shrimp on top and nap with 1/4 cup of the sauce. Garnish with chiffonade of basil leaves.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons cooking oil', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'12 large shrimp, peeled, deveined, tail on', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Thai Spiced Eggplant, heated, recipe follows', u' Thai Red Curry Sauce, heated, recipe follows', u' Basil leaves, chiffonade', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil', u'4 -inch piece ginger skin on, sliced and smashed', u'1 large lemon grass, white part only, about 4-inch piece, smashed', u'1 (2-inch) piece galangal, peeled and chopped', u'2 dried red Thai chiles', u'2 teaspoons cumin powder', u'1 teaspoon sweet paprika', u'2 teaspoons red Thai curry paste', u'1/4 cup tomato concassee', u'2 cups unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 to 3 tablespoons lime juice', u'2 to 3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/2 cup Kaffir lime leaves', u'1 cup Thai basil leaves', u' Salt and sugar, to taste', u'1 Globe eggplant, or 4 Chinese eggplants', u'2 tablespoons peanut oil, divided', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 teaspoon minced jalapeno', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced white onion', u'1/4 cup tomato concasse', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 tablespoon cumin powder', u'1/2 tablespoon coriander powder', u' Salt and ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon chiffonade cilantro', u'1 tablespoon chiffonade Thai basil']
title: Sauteed Shrimp with Thai Spiced Eggplant and Thai Red Curry Sauce

directions: [u'In a large heatproof bowl pour boiling water to cover over the noodles and let them stand for 10 minutes.  Drain the noodles and arrange them on a platter or divide them among 6 plates.  In a bowl combine the chicken, the carrot and the cucumbers.', u'Make the dressing:  Mince and mash the garlic to a paste with the salt. In a blender blend together the soy sauce, the lime juice, the sugar, the peanut butter, the red pepper flakes and the garlic paste, with the motor running add the oil in a stream, and blend the dressing until it is emulsified.', u'Pour half the dressing over the chicken mixture, toss the salad well, and arrange it in the center of the noodles.  The salad may be made 1 day in advance and kept covered and chilled. Just before serving top the salad with the peanuts.  Serve the remaining dressing separately.  Serve the salad at room temperature or chilled.']
ingredients: [u'4 1/2 to 5 ounces cellophane noodles (bean threads, available at Asian markets and many supermarkets)', u'3 pounds chicken breasts, poached, skin and bones discarded, and the meat torn into thin shreds (about 4 cups)', u'1 cup finely grated carrot', u'2 cucumbers, peeled, seeded and chopped', u'4 large garlic cloves', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon peanut butter', u'1 1/4 teaspoons dried hot red pepper flakes', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/3 cup coarsely crushed roasted peanuts, or to taste']
title: Thai Chicken Salad with Cellophane Noodles

directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine ingredients until well blended.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon  rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon light  sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger']
title: Thai Japanese Dressing

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Arrange salad bar ingredients in serving dishes and bowls as you prep them: romaine, baby mixed greens, bean sprouts, daikon radishes, carrots, scallions, cucumbers, tomatoes, red onions, mint leaves, basil leaves, nuts and sweet almond or anise "croutons".', u'Heat a grill pan over medium high heat. ', u'Combine soy and oil in a shallow dish. Add chicken and turn to coat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Drizzle fish with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill chicken 3 minutes on each side. Cut chicken into strips on an angle and pile onto a serving plate. Grill fish 4 to 5 minutes on each side, until opaque. Squeeze lime over the fish and break into chunks as you transfer it to a serving plate.', u'Combine all ingredients, except oil, for peanut dressing in a blender. Blend for 30 seconds, then open lid and continue dressing by streaming in oil. Transfer dressing to a serving dish and sprinkle the dressing with a spoonful of nuts from your salad bar to garnish the dish. ', u'For garlic dressing, whisk vinegar, jelly, garlic, black pepper and chili oil together. Stream in vegetable oil while continuing to whisk. When the oil is incorporated, transfer dressing to a small dish to serve.']
ingredients: [u'3 hearts Romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1 sack (10 ounces) mixed baby greens', u'2 cups fresh bean sprouts, any variety', u'1 cup thinly sliced daikon or red radishes', u'2 cups shredded carrots, available prepped in plastic bags in produce case', u'8 scallions, sliced on the bias', u'1/2 seedless cucumber, sliced in 1/2 lengthwise, thinly sliced', u'1 pint yellow or red grape tomatoes', u'1 red onion, quartered and thinly sliced', u'1 bunch fresh mint leaves, trimmed', u'1 bunch fresh basil leaves, trimmed', u'2 (2-ounce) packages chopped nuts, found on baking aisle', u"8 slices almond toast or anisette toast, (recommended: Stella D'Oro) cut into 1-inch pieces", u'1/4 cup tamari dark soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, eyeball it', u'4 to 8 thin cut chicken cutlets, depending on size', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound mahi mahi', u'1 ripe lime', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar or rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup white grape juice concentrate or apple juice concentrate', u'3 tablespoons peanut butter', u'2 inches fresh ginger root, grated', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped nuts (from salad bar)', u'3 tablespoons white vinegar or rice wine vinegar', u'1/3 cup pepper jelly, available on condiment aisle', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons hot chili oil', u'1/2 cup vegetable oil']
title: Thai-Vietnamese Salad Bar Supreme

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt the water, add the pasta, and cook to al dente.', u'Place the basil, 3 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds, tamari, garlic, lime juice, and chile into a food processor. Pulse into a paste. Drizzle in the extra-virgin olive oil. Pour the pesto into a large bowl and add a splash of starchy cooking water. Drain the pasta, add to the sauce, and toss to combine. Drizzle with sesame oil, garnish with scallions and the remaining 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds.']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound rice pasta, penne or wide noodles', u'1 cup packed fresh basil leaves', u'5 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted, divided', u'2 tablespoons tamari', u'2 large cloves garlic, pasted', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 Fresno chile, seeded', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u' Toasted sesame oil, for drizzling', u' Thinly sliced scallions, for garnish']
title: Thai-Style Pesto with Rice Pasta

directions: [u'Heat a couple of tablespoons of vegetable oil over high heat. Add shrimp and toss 2 minutes then add the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, scallions, salt and pepper and cook 3 to 4 minutes more tossing constantly. Stir in curry paste, roasted red pepper and coconut milk and reduce heat to low. Simmer a few minutes then stir in peas to heat through.', u'In a sauce pot bring chicken stock, butter and the lime zest to a boil. Add couscous and stir. Turn off heat, cover pot and let stand. Add basil and the lime juice to the pot and fluff with a fork.', u'Serve couscous topped with a layer of chopped lettuce then a few ladles of red curry shrimp. Garnish with chopped peanuts.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable or other light oil, eyeball it', u'1 1/2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined with tails removed', u'6 ounces, about 1/3 pound, shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and thinly sliced', u'3 cloves garlic, grated or finely chopped', u'1 -inch ginger root, peeled and grated or finely chopped', u'4 scallions, chopped into 1-inch pieces, whites and greens', u' Salt and pepper', u'2 tablespoons mild or hot red curry paste', u'2 roasted red peppers, sliced', u'1 cup "light" or unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 cup frozen peas', u'1 1/2 cups chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u'1 1/2 cups couscous', u'1 cup shredded fresh basil leaves', u'2 cups chopped iceberg lettuce, 1/2 small head', u'1/2 cup chopped peanuts, for garnish']
title: Thai Shrimp Curry with Chopped Lettuce and Basil-Lime Couscous

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the squash, onions and bell peppers, and cook, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the curry paste and lime leaves, stir to combine, and cook for 1 minute. Add the fish sauce and sugar, and stir to combine. Add the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the mussels, cover, and cook, shaking the pan occasionally, until the mussels open, about 5 minutes. Discard any mussels that do not open. Stir in 1/4 cup of basil and remove from heat. ', u'Allow to sit, covered, for 1 minute before serving. Discard any mussels that have not opened. Spoon into individual bowls or 1 large bowl. Garnish with the remaining 1/4 cup basil. Serve with rice and lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 cups peeled butternut squash, 1-inch diced', u'1/2 cup chopped white onions', u'1 cup thinly chopped red bell peppers', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'2 to 4 tablespoons Thai red curry paste, depending on desired heat level', u'6 Kaffir lime leaves, or 1 tablespoon finely grated lime zest', u'2 tablespoons nam pla (Thai fish sauce )', u'1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 pounds small mussels, scrubbed and bearded, broken or open mussels discarded', u'1/2 cup chopped Thai basil leaves', u' Steamed jasmine rice or long-grain rice, accompaniment', u'8 lime wedges, garnish']
title: Emeril's Thai Mussels with Squash

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Cucumber stick, for garnish']
ingredients: [u'1 cup sugar', u'1 cup water', u'3 sprigs cilantro', u'3 sprigs mint', u'3 sprigs basil', u'1/4 stalk crushed lemongrass', u'1 large cucumber, peeled and diced', u'2 cups water', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'2 ounces Infused Simple Syrup', u'2 ounces Cucumber Juice', u'1 1/2 ounces citrus vodka', u' Ice', u' Lemon slice, for garnish']
title: Thai Cucumber Lemonade

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the lime juice, vegetable oil, curry paste, fish sauce and garlic in a large bowl. Add the shrimp; toss to coat. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 1 hour. Meanwhile, soak ten 8-inch bamboo skewers in water at least 30 minutes; drain. Thread the shrimp onto the skewers, rubbing any excess marinade on the shrimp; set aside.', u'Preheat a grill to medium high. Puree the coconut milk, 2 cups basil, the jalapeno and a pinch of salt in a blender, about 30 seconds. (Do not over-blend or the coconut milk might separate.) Set aside.', u'Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the scallion whites and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the rice, 1/2 cup water, the coconut milk-basil puree and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a simmer, stirring and scraping the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon to prevent the rice from sticking. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, 15 to 17 minutes. Remove from the heat and keep covered.', u'Meanwhile, brush the grill grates with vegetable oil. Grill the shrimp skewers until well marked and just cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Fluff the rice with a fork, stir in the scallion greens and season with salt. Combine the bean sprouts, peanuts and remaining 2 cups basil. Top the lettuce leaves with the bean sprout mixture and shrimp skewers. Serve with the rice and lime wedges.', u'Photograph by Con Poulos']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice (from about 3 limes), plus wedges for serving', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil, plus more for the grill', u'3 tablespoons Thai red curry paste', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 cloves garlic, grated', u'1 1/2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined (tails intact)', u'1 13 .5-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u'4 cups fresh basil leaves', u'1/2 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'4 scallions, thinly sliced (white and green parts separated)', u'1 1/2 cups jasmine rice', u'2 cups roughly chopped bean sprouts', u'1/2 cup chopped peanuts', u' Bibb lettuce leaves, for serving']
title: Thai-Style Basil Shrimp with Basil-Coconut Rice

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Pound the lemongrass stalk with the back of a knife to break the cell walls. Cut the stalk in half or thirds lengthwise to fit comfortably in a small saucepan.', u'Bring a small saucepan with a little over 2 cups water to a simmer, and add the lemongrass. Remove it from the heat and allow it to steep, 10 to 15 minutes. Strain and chill the lemongrass water completely. Discard the lemongrass solids.', u"In a blender, combine the coconut water, lychees, lemongrass water and salt and let it go until the concoction is smooth; depending on how large your blender is, you might have to do this in batches. Taste for seasoning, chill and serve; you can strain it if you don't like pulp.", u"*Cook's Notes: Lemongrass is available at Asian markets and specialty produce stores.", u'**Lychee is available in the international aisle of some supermarkets, and at Asian markets.']
ingredients: [u'1 stalk lemongrass, brown outer leaves, green tops and root tip removed*', u'32 ounces coconut water (I recommend Zico!)', u'1 (8-ounce) can lychees, drained and lightly rinsed**', u' Pinch kosher or sea salt']
title: Thai Agua Fresca: Coconut-Lychee-Lemongrass Cooler

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Mix 1/4 cup lime juice and 1 tablespoon each fish sauce and olive oil; season with salt and sugar. Toss half of the dressing with shaved carrots, sliced red onion and cilantro. Lightly mix 6 ounces ground pork with a big pinch of kosher salt. Form into a ball, then shape into a 3/4-inch-thick patty; make an indentation in the center. Preheat a grill to high; brush the grates and burger with canola oil. Season the patty with salt and grill about 4 minutes per side, basting with the remaining dressing. Serve on a roll with mayonnaise, chili sauce and the slaw.']
title: Thai Pork Burger

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Combine the carrots, ginger, shallots, soy sauce, vinegar, water, sugar, and vegetable oil in a blender and puree until dressing becomes a slightly thick sauce. Season with the salt.', u'Break the Iceberg wedges a bit to open them up and pour the dressing over top. Finish with cilantro and chile.']
ingredients: [u'2 medium carrots, peeled, ends trimmed and sliced', u'2 -inch piece ginger, peeled and roughly chopped', u'2 shallots, peeled and sliced', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 tablespoon superfine sugar', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 large head Iceberg lettuce, quartered and cored', u' Freshly chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish', u'1 large red Thai chile, seeded, deveined and thinly sliced, for garnish']
title: Iceberg Lettuce with Carrot Ginger Soy Dressing with Cilantro and Red Thai Chiles

directions: [u'For the Thai saute shrimp: Mix the shrimp, Thai chili garlic sauce, mai poi, basil, garlic, onion, paprika, parsley and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Let the shrimp marinate in the sauce, about 1 hour.', u'Meanwhile for the Asian slaw: Whisk the mayonnaise, vinegar, garlic, ginger, canola oil and sesame oil in a bowl. Mix the mayonnaise mixture with the jicama, red pepper, yellow pepper, radish, cilantro and green onions. Chill the slaw in the refrigerator, about 30 minutes.', u'Heat the canola oil in a saute pan. Remove the shrimp from the marinade, reserving the marinade. Cook the shrimp until golden brown on both sides. Add the leftover marinade to the pan and stir until it thickens to a sauce consistency.', u'Place the rice in the center of a plate. Place the shrimp around the rice and drizzle the sauce over the shrimp. Place the Asian slaw on top of the rice. Garnish with Thai basil, cilantro and green onion.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'8 raw shrimp, peeled, deveined and tail on', u'1 teaspoon Thai chili garlic sauce', u'1 teaspoon mai poi sauce (Thai sweet chili sauce)', u'1/4 teaspoon chopped fresh Thai basil, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly chopped garlic', u'1/4 teaspoon green onion, chopped, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly chopped parsley', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 ounces mayonnaise', u'1/4 ounce rice wine vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly chopped garlic', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly chopped ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon canola oil', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame oil', u'1/2 ounce jicama, sliced', u'1/2 ounce red pepper, sliced', u'1/2 ounce yellow pepper, sliced', u'1/2 ounce daikon radish, sliced', u'1/4 teaspoon cilantro, chopped, plus more for garnish', u'1/4 ounce green onion, sliced', u'1 teaspoon canola oil, for cooking shrimp', u'1/2 cup cooked jasmine rice, for serving']
title: Thai Saute Shrimp with Asian Slaw

directions: [u'Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan. Slice the cooked chicken into 1/4-inch pieces. Add the chicken and the vegetables to the pan and cook until heated through. Add the Peanut Sauce to the pan and toss well until the sauce is warmed through. ', u'In a large bowl, combine the chicken and vegetable mixture with the Rosemary Quinoa and toss until combined. Serve, garnished with cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'2 ounces (1/4 cup) extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breast, baked', u'2 ounces broccoli florets', u'2 ounces red cabbage, shredded', u'2 ounces carrots, julienned', u'2 ounces red onion, chopped', u'1/2 cup Peanut Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 cup Rosemary Quinoa, recipe follows', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 red bell peppers', u'10 ounces natural peanut butter', u'8 ounces brown rice syrup', u'1 1/3 cups tamari (can be found at specialty Asian markets)', u'2 1/3 cups hot water', u'1 lime, juiced', u'6 drops lemongrass concentrate', u'6 drops ginger concentrate', u'2/3 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 gallon hot water', u'1/4 tablespoon sea salt', u'1 quart grain quinoa, rinsed (can be found at specialty organic markets)', u'1/2 cup diced red pepper', u'1/2 cup diced red onion', u'1 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels, cooked or defrosted', u'1/2 bag frozen green peas, thawed', u'1/2 cup Rosemary Vinaigrette Dressing, recipe follows', u'1/2 tablespoon Herbamare (can be found at specialty organic markets)', u'3/4 cup apple cider vinegar', u'1/2 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 3/4 cups distilled water', u'3/8 cup Dijon mustard', u'3/8 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 1/2 ounces fresh rosemary leaves, minced', u'3/8 tablespoon sea salt', u'1/2 cup essential balance oil (can be found at specialty organic markets)', u'1/4 tablespoon xantham gum (can be found at specialty organic markets)']
title: Thai Express Bowl with Chicken

directions: [u'Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Can be stored in the refrigerator until ready for use.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 medium Napa cabbage, cored and fine julienne', u'1/2 medium green cabbage, cored and fine julienne', u'1/2 medium red cabbage, cored and fine julienne', u'2 carrots, peeled and fine julienne', u'1 bunch mint leaves, picked', u'1 bunch Thai basil leaves, picked', u'1 bunch cilantro leaves, picked', u'2 cups canola oil', u'3 large shallots, peeled and finely sliced', u'2 stalks lemongrass, white part only, minced', u'2 to 3 Thai bird chiles, de-stemmed, minced', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'1/2 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'1/4 cup toasted sesame seeds, to garnish', u'2 choice sirloins (8 to 9 ounces each), or similar cut of beef', u'2 jalapenos chiles, roughly chopped', u'2 serrano chiles, roughly chopped', u'1 tablespoon sambal', u'4 large shallots, peeled and roughly chopped', u'4 garlic cloves', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'2 cups soy sauce', u'1 cup rice wine vinegar', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste']
title: Thai Marinated Beef Cabbage Salad with Warm Shallot Vinaigrette

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut the pineapple into bite size wedges or slices. ', u'Put the salt, cayenne pepper, mint, cilantro, and limes into small bowls. Squeeze a bit of lime juice onto the fruit. Then lightly dip the pineapple into a little salt and as much cayenne as you like and finish with the mint and cilantro. ', u"Cook's Note: For true Southeast Asian taste add a little bowl of fish sauce to your options of dippers. ", u'Copyright 2004 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 a ripe pineapple, peeled and cored', u' Kosher salt', u' Cayenne pepper', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u' Lime wedges']
title: Thai-style Pineapple Snack

directions: [u'Heat a grill to medium.', u'Cut the peppers and eggplant lengthwise into quarters and put into a large mixing bowl. ', u'Add the garlic and coriander, to a mortar and pestle, and crush them into a chunky paste. Transfer the paste to the mixing bowl with the vegetables. Add the remaining ingredients and toss to coat well. Put on the hot grill and cook for about 5 to 7 minutes on each side.']
ingredients: [u'2 red bell peppers', u'2 yellow bell peppers', u'2 Chinese eggplants', u'6 cloves garlic', u'1 tablespoon whole coriander', u'2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon olive oil']
title: Thai-Style Grilled Vegetables

directions: [u'Bring water to a boil in a saucepan, add the tea leaves and remove pan from the heat. Gently stir the tea leaves to submerge them in the water. Let the tea steep for 5 minutes, or until it turns a brilliant orange and has a strong taste with no bitterness. Pour the tea through a coffee filter or fine mesh strainer into a pitcher. Add the sugar to the hot tea and stir well to dissolve completely. Set aside to cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate until ready to serve, or for up to 1 week. ', u'To serve, fill tall glasses with crushed ice, add tea to fill about 3/4 of each glass, then pour about 1/4 cup of evaporated milk or half-and-half over the ice in each glass. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups water', u'1 cup Thai tea leaves', u'3/4 cup sugar, or as needed', u' Crushed ice', u'1 1/2 cups evaporated milk or half and half']
title: Thai Iced Tea

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Coat 6 muffin-pan cups with nonstick cooking spray and set aside. ', u'Pulse the scallions, cilantro, lemongrass, and garlic 8 to 10 times in a food processor fitted with the chopping blade (or in an electric blender) until finely chopped. ', u'Scrape into a large bowl, add the turkey, rice, 1/2 cup each of the coconut milk and peanut sauce, and the sesame oil ad mix thoroughly with your hands. ', u'Pack the turkey mixture into the muffin-pan cups and bake until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a loaf registers 170 degrees F, 30 to 35 minutes. ', u'Meanwhile, make a sauce by whisking the remaining coconut milk with the remaining peanut sauce and the sugar. ', u'To serve, unmold the loaves onto a heated platter and garnish with a sprig of cilantro, if desired. Pass the sauce \x96 either at room temperature or slightly warmed. ']
ingredients: [u'6 medium scallions, trimmed and chunked (include some green tops)', u'1/3 cup packed fresh cilantro sprigs', u'1 (5-inch) stalk lemongrass, cleaned and thickly sliced, or the zest of 1/2 medium lemon, removed in strips with a vegetable peeler', u'2 medium garlic cloves', u'1 pound ground turkey (preferably a 50 to 50 mix of light and dark meat)', u'1/2 cup instant brown rice (right out of the box)', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened low-fat coconut milk', u'3/4 cup Thai peanut sauce', u'2 teaspoons Asian toasted sesame oil', u'1 tablespoons raw (turbinado) sugar', u'6 fresh cilantro sprigs, optional']
title: Little Thai Turkey Loaves

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a large saute pan or saucepan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring, until soft, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger, and chile peppers, and cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 minute. Add the stock, lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add the mussels and bring to a boil. Cover and cook, shaking the pan, until the mussels open, about 2 minutes. Add the coconut milk, cilantro and mint, and stir well to combine. Cook until the coconut milk is warmed through, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat and serve in deep bowls. Serve with French bread.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1/2 cup very thinly sliced yellow onions', u'1 tablespoon thinly sliced garlic', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger', u'2 serrano chile peppers, or to taste, seeded and minced', u'1 cup fish or shrimp stock', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 1/2 pounds New Zealand Green Shell Mussels, well rinsed in several changes of water, beards removed, any open mussels discarded', u'1 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u' Chopped cilantro leaves', u' Chopped mint leaves', u' French bread, as accompaniment']
title: Thai-style New Zealand Green Shell Mussels

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'For the red curry paste: In a food processor, combine the cilantro, oil, ginger, lemongrass, coriander, cumin, shrimp paste, garlic, red chiles, lime leaf, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper. Pulse to a consistent paste.', u"For the curry: Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook, stirring well, until aromatic, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons oil to the pot and increase the heat to high. Sprinkle the flank steak with a pinch of salt, then add it to the pot; cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the steak and add the onions and peppers; cook until tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the coconut milk, bring to a gentle boil, then add the curry paste back to the pot; stir well. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 15 minutes. (If the coconut milk breaks and separates, don't worry: it will come back together to a smooth consistency.) Add the chicken broth and fish sauce, and continue simmering until the sauce has a nice, gravy-like consistency, 12 to 15 minutes. Return the beef to the pot and finish with the cilantro, basil, mint and lime juice. Taste and adjust the seasoning.", u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh cilantro leaves and stems', u'2 tablespoons neutral oil, such as canola', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon roughly chopped lemongrass (from root end)', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon shrimp paste', u'10 cloves garlic', u'8 medium red chiles, such as Fresno', u'4 small shallots, halved', u"1 Sri Lankan (kaffir) lime leaf, torn into pieces (see Cook's Note)", u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 tablespoons canola oil', u'2 pounds flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain', u' Kosher salt', u'1 yellow onion, thinly sliced into strips', u'1 green bell pepper, sliced into strips', u'1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips', u' Two 14-ounce cans coconut milk', u'1 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'3 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh Thai basil', u'1 tablespoon roughly chopped fresh mint', u' Juice of 2 limes']
title: Spicy Thai Red Beef Curry

directions: [u'Prepare rice noodles according to package instructions.', u'Combine the lime juice, sugar, fish sauce and chili paste to make the Thai shrimp sauce. Pour Thai shrimp sauce into a 10-inch non-stick pan. Turn heat to medium high and bring to a boil. Add the shrimp, and reduce heat to medium low. Cook until shrimp is tender, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add cilantro to sauce. Taste and adjust seasonings, pour over noodles.']
ingredients: [u'5 ounces rice noodles', u'1/2 cup lime juice', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon chili paste', u'1 pound small shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/2 cup loosely packed cilantro leaves']
title: Thai Shrimp

directions: [u'Prepare a medium-hot fire in a charcoal grill with a cover, or preheat a gas grill to medium-high.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 Asian pear, peeled and cut into thin matchsticks', u'1 medium carrot, peeled and cut into thin matchsticks', u'1/2 cup roasted and salted peanuts', u'1/2 cup fresh basil leaves', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons unsweetened shredded coconut', u'2 tablespoons roasted peanut oil', u'1/4 teaspoon sea salt', u'1/3 cup quartered cherry tomatoes', u'1 (14-ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 lime, zest grated', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'1 teaspoon Thai red curry paste', u'2 pounds coarsely ground chicken thighs', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh basil leaves', u'1/2 cup panko (Japanese bread crumbs)', u'2 teaspoons sea salt', u' Vegetable oil, for brushing on the grill rack', u'6 seeded hamburger buns, split']
title: Coconut Basil Chicken Burgers with Thai Peanut Pesto

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine rice and vegetables in a large bowl. Add the vinaigrette and stir to combine. Let the salad sit at room temperature for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with desired herbs.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups cooked brown rice', u'2 carrots, grated', u'1 cup pea pods, thinly sliced on an angle', u'1 small red onion, halved and minced', u'6 green onions, thinly sliced on an angle', u' Citrus-Thai Basil Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u' Chopped fresh cilantro, Thai basil, and/or mint leaves, for garnish']
title: Brown Rice Salad with Citrus-Thai Basil Vinaigrette

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'I love the bouncy sweetness of scallops, and although you might think the equal sweetness of the peas would be too much alongside, the deep flavour of cilantro and chilies and the sharpness of lemongrass miraculously provided by the Thai green curry paste, make it a zingy and yet still comforting accompaniment. This is a real treat of a supper, both for the eater and the cook.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound (3 1/2 cups) frozen petits pois or peas', u'1 to 2 tablespoons Thai green curry paste', u'1/3 cup creme fraiche or sour cream', u' Salt', u'2 teaspoons peanut or other flavourless oil', u'2 teaspoons butter', u'6 big scallops (such as sold in shell by fishmongers) or 10 to 12 small bay scallops (such as sold in packages in the supermarket), preferably diver-caught', u' Juice of a lime', u'1 to 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or Thai basil']
title: Scallops with Thai-Scented Pea Puree

directions: [u'Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.', u'Salad: Peel back the corn husks, but do not remove them completely. Carefully pick off and discard the wispy silk threads that are attached to the corn. Pull the husks back over the ears and tie the ends closed with kitchen twine.  Soak the corn in large bowl of cold water for 10 minutes.  Drain the water, shake off the excess and put them on the grill for 15 minutes, turning every 3 to 4 minutes until the corn is tender.  Remove them from the grill and let the ears cool to room temperature.', u'Vinaigrette: While the corn is cooling, prepare the dressing.  Puree all the ingredients, except the canola oil, in a blender or food processor.  After the mixture is well incorporated, slowly drizzle in the canola oil while the processor is still running. Blend for 30 seconds, then transfer the dressing to a bowl.', u'Assembly: Once the corn has cooled, cut the kernels off the cobs into a medium bowl and discard the cobs. Add the red onion and grape tomatoes and mix to combine.  Drizzle in 1/2 cup of the Thai Basil Vinaigrette Dressing while lightly tossing the salad together.  Reserve the remaining dressing. Gently stir in the basil leaves. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste, and add more dressing, if desired.  Serve slightly chilled on serving plates, using a slotted spoon to keep excess liquids in the bowl.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'8 large ears corn', u' Kitchen twine', u'1 small or 1/2 large red onion, finely chopped', u'2 cups grape tomatoes, quartered lengthwise', u'4 to 5 large Thai basil leaves, roughly chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1/2 cup chopped Thai basil leaves', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup lime juice', u'1/4 cup orange juice', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 teaspoons freshly grated ginger', u'1 teaspoon lime zest', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh cracked black pepper', u'1/4 cup canola oil']
title: Grilled Corn and Tomato Salad with Thai Basil Vinaigrette Dressing

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Peel the tough outer layers of the lemongrass to expose the inner pale yellow layer. Trim 2-inches from the bottom, cutting away the bulb. Slice until the tops become tough. Add the pieces to a small pot over medium heat and add the stock and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a simmer and allow to reduce by half. Strain, reserving liquid.', u'Into a food processor add the cooked lemongrass, chilies, shallot, garlic, ginger, sugar, cilantro, mint, cumin, coriander, tamari, pepper, lime juice, and salt (if not using the fish sauce). Process into a paste.', u'Heat the oil in a wok or large saute pan over high heat; add the chicken and brown. Remove to a plate. Add a drizzle more oil and stir-fry the bell peppers and onions for 2 minutes. Stir in the paste for 1 minute, and then add the reserved liquid and stir. Return the chicken to the pan. Serve stir-fry on a bed of shredded lettuce.']
ingredients: [u'1 stalk lemongrass', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'2 jalapeno chilies, seeded and coarsely chopped', u'1 Fresno chile, chopped', u'1 large shallot, chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, peeled', u'1 -inch piece ginger, grated or minced', u'1 tablespoon dark brown sugar', u' A handful fresh cilantro leaves', u' A handful fresh mint leaves', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1/3 palmful', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/3 palmful', u'2 tablespoons tamari or 1 tablespoon fish sauce', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 limes, juiced', u' Kosher salt (if not using fish sauce)', u'2 tablespoons high-temperature cooking oil', u'1 1/2 pounds thinly sliced chicken', u'1 sweet red bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'1 sweet yellow onion, thinly sliced', u'1 large head iceberg lettuce, well chilled, cored, quartered, and very thinly shredded']
title: Thai Green Chile Stir Fry on Bed of Shredded Lettuce

directions: [u'Place all salad ingredients in large bowl, toss lightly and set aside.  For the dressing, whisk vegetable and sesame oils, soy sauce, garlic, lemongrass, and ginger briskly in a bowl until creamy.  Add broth, lemon juice, and pepper and again whisk until creamy. Drizzle dressing over salad and toss gently.  Taste for salt, adjust as needed, and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound roast beef (from deli counter), thinly sliced', u'1 (10-ounce) bag European salad mix (iceberg, romaine, escarole, endive, and radicchio)', u'1 (14-ounce) can bean sprouts, well drained', u'1 (10-ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chilies, well drained', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh basil (no substitute; measure loosely packed)', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons Asian roasted sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 large garlic clove, finely minced', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh lemongrass or 1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'1/2 cup chicken broth', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Salt, to taste']
title: Thai Beef Salad

directions: [u'In a large bowl, mix the rice, coconut, green onion, basil, cilantro, chili sauce, 1 tablespoon lime juice, and zest from 1 lime. Place chicken between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound to even thickness. Place equal amounts of rice mixture on each breast half. Wrap chicken around filling, securing with toothpicks. In a glass pie plate, mix together flour, zest of 1 lime, salt and pepper. In another plate, mix coconut milk, and 2 tablespoons lime juice. In third plate, mix together peanuts, panko, black and white sesame seeds. Roll chicken breasts, 1 at a time, first in flour mixture, then in coconut milk mixture and finally in peanut mixture, coating well. In shallow baking pan, arrange chicken, seam side down and place in 350 degree F oven. Bake 30 minutes or until juices run clear.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 cup jasmine rice, cooked', u'1/2 shredded coconut', u'2 green onions, finely sliced', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh Thai basil leaves', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons Thai chili sauce', u'2 limes, juiced and zested, divided', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'1 (14-ounce) can coconut milk', u'1 cup chopped roasted peanuts', u'3/4 cup panko crumbs', u'1/4 cup white sesame seeds, toasted', u'1/4 cup black sesame seeds, toasted', u'3/4 cup chunky peanut butter', u'1/4 cup seasoned rice vinegar', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 Thai chili, finely minced', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup freshly chopped basil leaves', u'1 napa cabbage, finely sliced', u'1 English cucumber, coarsely grated', u'1 carrot, grated', u'1/2 red onion, finely diced', u'1/2 English cucumber, thinly sliced', u'1 lime, wedged', u' Cilantro sprigs']
title: First Place Winner: Thai-Inspired Stuffed Chicken Breast and Slaw

directions: [u'To make the marinade: using a food processor, grind the ingredients into a paste the consistency of thin yogurt. Reserve small amount for basting and transfer the remaining marinade to a glass bowl. Add the cleaned and trimmed chicken wings. Toss liberally, cover with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator overnight. ', u'To grill the wings, shake off the excess marinade and grill the wings over medium heat for approximately 5 minutes per side, or until crispy. Brush them frequently with the reserved marinade, and be careful not to burn the wing tips. The wings should have a crispy texture with a deep mahogany color when done. ', u'Serve with the Thai Peanut Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups coconut milk', u'1 medium onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 tablespoons crushed garlic', u'2 teaspoons ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoons red pepper flakes', u'1 teaspoon ground galangal (or 1/2 teaspoon freshly grated ginger)', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'20 chicken wings, jointed', u' Thai Peanut Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup unsalted roasted peanuts', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil, plus more to taste', u'2 fresh Thai chiles or other small chiles', u'1 1/2 -inch-thick slice fresh ginger', u'4 garlic cloves', u'1/3 cup canned unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'4 teaspoons fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u' Pinch salt (add to taste, as fish sauce can be very salty)', u'1/2 cup finely minced cilantro leaves and stems']
title: Grilled Coconut Wings with Thai Peanut Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Saute ginger, onion, chiles and lemon grass until soft. Deglaze pan with fish sauce. Add chicken stock and lime leaves. Simmer and reduce the liquid by 20 per cent. Add vinegar, basil and pepper. Check for seasoning. Strain the soup. Add sauteed shiitakes and fresh enoki mushrooms. Ladle soup in soup plates. Garnish with shrimp toast and scallions.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup peeled ginger julienned', u'1 sliced onion', u'4 Thai bird chiles', u'3 stalks lemon grass, white part only, sliced', u'1/4 cup 3 Crab fish sauce', u'6 cups chicken stock', u'6 kaffir lime leaves', u'3/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup Thai basil leaves', u'1 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'2 cups Sauteed sliced shiitake mushrooms', u'1 cup enoki mushrooms', u'1/4 cup sliced scallion', u'1/2 cup chopped scallions, green part only', u'2 cups shrimp, chopped', u'1 cup napa cabbage', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 whole egg', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions', u'1/4 cup chopped cilantro', u'1/2 cup finely diced jicama', u' Salt and white pepper to taste', u'6 slices of dried bread with the crust removed', u'1/4 cup sesame seeds', u' Canola oil']
title: Thai Hot & Sour Soup with Shrimp Toast

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Heat a small frying pan over medium-high heat. Add enough oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pan. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper and cook until cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Cut into small cubes. ', u'Warm peanut sauce and coconut milk in medium saucepan. Whisk together the cornstarch and water and then add to the peanut sauce. Bring to a boil to thicken and then remove from the heat and cool.', u'Roll out the pizza dough and press into a 10-inch pizza pan.', u'Spread the peanut sauce over the pizza dough. Put peanuts, half of scallions, chicken and 1 cup of bean sprouts on crust. Sprinkle cheese, remaining scallions, and bean sprouts on top. Bake until cheese is melted and crust is browned, about 15 to 20 minutes.']
ingredients: [u' Vegetable oil, to saute', u'1 boneless, skinless chicken breast', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 (6-ounce) jar ready-made Thai peanut sauce', u'1 (16-ounce) can coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1 (12-ounce) ready-made pizza crust', u'1 cup unsalted peanuts, chopped', u'5 scallions, chopped', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'2 cups mozzarella, shredded']
title: Thai Pizza

directions: [u'In a large bowl, whisk together the dijon and juice. Drizzle in oil. Add the tomatoes and onion and season. Check for seasoning. Can be stored in an air tight container for up to 4 hours before serving. Right before serving, toss with the basil leaves.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons dijon mustard', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u'1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil', u'4 large ripe tomatoes, mixed colors, 1 " large dice', u'1 small red onion, 1/4" dice', u'1 cup picked thai basil leaves', u' Salt and black pepper to taste']
title: Thai Basil-Tomato Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Peel the shrimp, reserving the heads and shells. Refrigerate the shrimp until ready to use. In a saucepan, over medium heat, combine the reserved heads and shells, onions, lemons, bay leaf and water. Season with salt. Bring the liquid to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain and set aside. Season the shrimp with salt. Toss the shrimp with the curry paste. In a saucepan, over medium heat, add the oil. When the oil is hot, add the onions. Season with salt. Saute for 2 minutes. Add the peppers, garlic and seasoned shrimp. Saute for 2 minutes. Add the reserved shrimp stock. Bring the liquid to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the coconut milk. Adjust the seasonings. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil. Ladle into serving bowls and serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds medium shrimp', u'1 small yellow onion, quartered', u'1/2 fresh lemon', u'1 bay leaf', u'5 cups water', u' Salt', u'2 to 3 tablespoons Masamam Curry Paste, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup minced onions', u'1 roasted red pepper, small diced', u'1/2 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'2 tablespoons coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons chiffonade fresh Thai basil leaves', u" Recipe adapted from Adriana's Spice Caravan: Storey Communications, Inc. 1997", u'2 fresh lemon grass stalks', u'12 small dried red chili peppers, seeded', u'1 (1-inch) piece fresh galangal, chopped or 4 slices dried', u'2 red onions, chopped', u'12 garlic cloves', u'2 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'1 tablespoon cardamom seeds', u'2 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'1/2 cinnamon stick', u'1 teaspoon cloves', u'1 teaspoon ground mace', u'1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', u'1 teaspoon shrimp paste', u'4 bay leaves']
title: Thai Curry and Shrimp Soup

directions: [u'Cut chicken into small bite-size pieces. In 12-inch nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add chicken; sprinkle with taco seasoning mix. Cook 5 to 7 minutes, stirring frequently, until chicken is no longer pink in center. Remove from heat; cover to keep warm.', u'Meanwhile, in small microwavable bowl, mix peanut sauce, red curry paste, lime juice and sugar. Microwave uncovered on High 30 to 40 seconds or until warm. Stir thoroughly until all of the curry paste is dissolved.', u'Heat tortillas by placing 1 at a time in 10-inch nonstick skillet or on hot nonstick griddle on medium-high heat 3 to 5 seconds, turning once.', u'To assemble each wrap, spoon about 1/2 cup chicken mixture down center of 1 tortilla. Top with sour cream, cheese, lettuce and onion. Drizzle with generous 1 tablespoon curry-peanut sauce. Fold 2 sides of tortilla to the middle; secure with toothpick. Serve warm.', u'High altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change.', u'Domino is the registered trademark of American Sugar Refining, Inc. Yonkers, NY 10750', u'C and H is a registered trademark of C and H Sugar Company, Crockett, CA']
ingredients: [u'1 3/4 pound boneless skinless  chicken breasts', u'1 tablespoon  peanut oil', u'1 package (1.25 oz) Old El Paso(r) 40 percent less-sodium taco seasoning mix', u'1/2 cup bottled peanut sauce', u'1 teaspoon red curry paste', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 tablespoons Domino(r) or C and H(r)  Granulated Sugar', u'1 package (11.5 oz) Old El Paso(r)  flour tortillas for  burritos (8 tortillas)', u'1/2 cup  sour cream', u'2 cups shredded  Monterey Jack cheese (8 ounces)', u'2 2/3 cups finely shredded  lettuce', u'1/2 cup very thinly sliced red onion', u' Decorative toothpicks, if desired']
title: Thai-Style Mexican Chicken Wraps

directions: [u'For the Thai Paste: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spread the cashews on a baking tray and roast until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Cool.', u'In a small pan, cook the ginger in the plum wine until the wine evaporates. With a mortar and pestle or in a blender, puree all of the Thai Paste ingredients. Reserve.', u'For the Salad: In a medium bowl, combine the papaya, onion, cilantro, and jalapeno. In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, vinegar, and honey. At serving time, toss the dressing with the salad and season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Raise the oven temperature to 450 degrees F. Season the pork medallions with salt and pepper and flatten slightly with a cleaver or a heavy plate. In an ovenproof skillet, heat the peanut oil. Over high heat, brown both sides of the medallions. Transfer to the oven and roast until medium rare, about 15 minutes. Remove the medallions to a plate and keep warm.', u'Pour the grease from the skillet and deglaze the pan with port. Pour in the stock and cook over high heat until the sauce thickens slightly. Whisk in 1/4 cup of the Thai paste and season, to taste, with salt, pepper, and lime juice. Keep warm.', u'Cut each medallion into slices. Pour a little sauce into the center of 4 warmed plates and arrange slices of the pork on 1 side of the sauce. Mound a little salad in each radicchio leaf, set alongside the slices of pork, and garnish with a few cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces (3/4 cup) unsalted raw cashews', u'1 -ounce peeled, fresh ginger', u'1/2 cup plum wine', u'1/4 cup peanut oil', u'1/2 cup sliced green onions', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro leaves', u'6 garlic cloves', u'1 chile pepper, jalapeno or red serrano, cored, seeded, and coarsely chopped', u'1 1/2 tablespoons turmeric', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 tablespoon sesame oil', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', u'1 tablespoon cumin', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon coarse salt', u'1 or 2 papayas or mangoes (12 ounces each), peeled, seeded, and diced', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u'1/4 cup cilantro leaves', u'1/4 jalapeno pepper, cored, seeded, and chopped fine', u'2 limes, juiced', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', u'1 teaspoon honey', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground white pepper', u'4 radicchio leaves', u'1 1/2 pounds pork loin, cut into 4 (6-ounce) medallions', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1/2 cup port', u'1 cup veal stock', u' Lime juice']
title: Pork Loin with Thai Sauce and Papaya Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Lay the lettuce leaves across a large platter. Arrange the cucumber, mango slices and shallots over the lettuce.', u'In a blender, combine the lime juice, shallots, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, cilantro, chiles, and peanut oil. Blend on high speed until well combined and the sugar is dissolved.', u'In a bowl, toss the shrimp with the Essence, salt, palm sugar, and cayenne to coat. Heat a wok or large, heavy, skillet over high heat. Add the oil and when very hot, add the shrimp and sear until cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from the pan.', u'Arrange the shrimp decoratively over the greens and mango and drizzle with the dressing. Garnish with the mint and green onions and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 head bibb lettuce, cored and leaves separated, washed and spun dry', u'1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded and thinly sliced', u'1 mango, peeled, seeded and sliced', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons sliced shallots', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons Palm sugar, or light brown sugar, plus more to sprinkle on shrimp', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons packed chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 teaspoons minced Serrano chilies', u'1/2 cup peanut oil', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled', u'4 teaspoons Essence, recipe follows', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Pinch cayenne', u'1/4 cup chiffonade fresh mint, garnish', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped green onions, garnish']
title: Seared Shrimp Salad with Thai Palm Sugar Dressing

directions: [u'Coat a saute pan with canola oil  and saute galangal, onion, chiles,  lemon grass and kaffir until soft  about 5 minutes. Add shiitakes and  cook 3 minutes. Season and deglaze  with fish sauce. Let reduce by 50  percent then add chicken stock.  Simmer and reduce by 20 percent.  Add juice and check for seasoning.  Add noodles, basil and scallions to  heat. Meanwhile, preheat skillet  and coat with oil. Season scallops  with salt and chile powder. Pan  sear both sides brown, about 3  minutes a side.', u'PLATING Ladle broth (lemon grass, kaffir  and all) and top with 3 scallops.  Garnish']
ingredients: [u'4 slices peeled galangal or ginger', u'1 sliced red onion', u'4 Thai bird chiles, de-stemmed, halved', u'3 stalks lemon grass, white part only, large slices, cut on the bias', u'6 kaffir lime leaves, sliced', u'2 cups shiitake mushrooms, sliced', u'1/3 cup 3 Crab fish sauce', u'8 cups chicken stock', u'3 limes, juiced', u'1 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'1 pound rice stick noodles, soaked in cold water for 1 hour', u'1/2 cup Thai basil leaves, 4 tops for garnish', u'1/4 cup sliced scallions', u'12 large (U-8) dayboat scallops', u'1 tablespoon ancho chile powder', u' Canola oil, to cook', u' Salt and white pepper, to taste']
title: Ming's Seared Scallops with Spicy Thai Rice Noodle Soup

directions: [u'Preheat broiler or prepare grill. ', u'Rub flank steak with black pepper, pressing it into meat. Grill steak on an oiled rack of a broiler pan, about 3 to 5 inches from heat 6 to 7 minutes on each side for medium rare. Or, grill over glowing coals 5 to 8 minutes on each side for medium rare. Transfer steak to a cutting board and cool. If desired, chill beef, loosely wrapped, at least 2 hours and up to 1 day to facilitate thin slicing. Cut beef across the grain into very thin slices. ', u'In a large bowl stir together lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, and chilies until combined well (sugar should be dissolved if using). ', u'Add steak, shallots, scallions, coriander and mint and toss well. Score cucumber lengthwise with tines of a fork and cut crosswise into thin slices. ', u'Arrange cucumber around edge of a platter and mound beef salad in center. Garnish with coriander sprigs.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound flank steak', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice, or to taste', u'1 tablespoon Asian fish sauce, or to taste', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar, or to taste', u'1 small fresh red or green Thai chili or serrano, seeded and minced', u'1/3 cup thinly sliced shallots', u'2 scallions, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup packed fresh coriander leaves, washed well and spun dry', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh mint leaves', u'1/2 seedless cucumber', u' Fresh coriander sprigs']
title: Thai Grilled Beef Salad

directions: [u'Remove the grassy tops of the lemon grass, leaving stalks about 6 inches long, and cut off any hard root section. Using the blunt edge of a large knife or cleaver, bruise each stalk all over, then chop. Combine marinade ingredients in blender, process until smooth and pour into a nonreactive bowl. Add chicken, turning to coat all over. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. ', u'Meanwhile, combine the sauce ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil while stirring. Reduce heat and simmer 2 to 3 minutes, or until thickened slightly, then remove from heat. ', u'Prepare grill or preheat broiler. Remove chicken from marinade, and grill or broil breasts and thighs until golden brown on all sides over high heat, starting chicken skinside down first. Then move chicken to a medium hot part of the grill or broiler until cooked through, 20 to 30 minutes total. Serve with Sweet and Spicy Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 stalks fresh lemon grass', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro', u'1 1/2 cups light soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons red curry paste', u'2 pounds chicken breasts and thighs, on the bone', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped chiles', u'1/2 cup white vinegar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped very fresh garlic']
title: Thai Bbq Chicken

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a large, deep nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Drizzle in extra-virgin olive oil and add sausage. Break up meat as it browns. Add garlic and onion and cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to medium low. Add tomatoes and beans and simmer 2 or 3 minutes. Remove pan from heat and fold in basil to wilt. Combine sausage mixture with cooked macaroni and serve immediately with grated Parmesan or Romano and crusty bread.', u'Note: If your butcher counter does not have bulk sausage, buy links and split casings to remove bulk sausage meat.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon (1 turn around the pan) extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 /2 to 2 /3 pound bulk sweet Italian sausage', u'1 /2 to 2 /3 pound bulk hot Italian sausage', u'3 cloves garlic, crushed', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'1 can (28 to 32 ounces) chunky style crushed tomatoes', u'1 can cannellini beans, rinsed and drained', u'20 leaves fresh basil, torn', u'1 pound ziti rigate (with lines), cooked to al dente', u' Crusty bread and grated Parmigiano or Romano, for passing at table']
title: Gran'pa Emmanuel's Macaroni with Sausage and Cannellini

directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. Once boiling, add the lime leaves, galangal and lemongrass and boil for 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms, thin soy sauce, Thai chiles, lime juice, tomatoes, onions and tofu, if desired, and boil for another 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and green onions.', u"Cook's Note: For extra spice, add more Thai chile peppers", u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups vegetable broth', u'5 kaffir lime leaves', u'3 slices unpeeled galangal, about 2 inches long', u'3 slices lemongrass, about 2 inches long', u'1 cup sliced button mushrooms', u'2 tablespoons thin soy sauce', u'10 Thai chile peppers, pounded with the edge of a knife or cooking mallet to release the flavor', u'1 lime, juiced', u'1 medium tomato, sliced', u'1/2 onion, sliced', u'8 medium-size cubes tofu, optional (your favorite brand)', u' Dash chopped cilantro', u' Dash chopped green onions']
title: Araya's Place Tom Yum Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Make the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk the lime juice, lemon juice, fish sauce and honey. Set aside.', u'Make the larb: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, shallots, lemongrass, chile, and salt to taste. Cook until the vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the turkey and season with salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until the meat and vegetables are cooked through, about 5 minutes. Add the dressing to the pan and cook 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the mint. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Spoon the turkey mixture onto the lettuce leaves and arrange on a serving platter. Serve with sticky rice.', u'Photograph by Kat Teutsch']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup fresh lime juice (from about 5 limes)', u'1 to 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (from 1 large lemon)', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'3 tablespoons vegetable or canola oil', u'1/2 medium red onion, diced', u'3 small shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 4 -inch piece lemongrass, minced (about 1/4 cup)', u'1 Thai chile (such as prik kee noo) or serrano chile, stemmed and thinly sliced', u' Kosher salt', u'1 1/2 pounds ground turkey (preferably dark meat)', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh mint leaves', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 head butter lettuce, leaves separated', u' Sticky white rice, for serving']
title: Turkey Larb

author: Emeril Lagasse
