directions: [u'Place the chicken in a 1-gallon re-sealable plastic food storage bag. In a medium bowl, combine the lemon juice, water, kosher salt, Bloody Mary Mix, and pepper vodka. Mix well to combine and pour over the chicken in the bag. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 2 and up to 4 hours, turning the bag occasionally to ensure even marinating.', u'Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.', u'Set a large, 6-quart cast iron Dutch oven over medium-high heat with 3-quarts of vegetable oil. Heat the oil to 350 degrees F using a frying thermometer to gauge the temperature of the oil. Remove the chicken from the refrigerator, drain through a colander, and set aside until ready to fry. ', u'Place both flours in a 1-gallon re-sealable plastic food storage bag and place the chicken, 8 pieces at a time, in the flour and shake to coat. Lay the coated chicken on a wire rack set over a sheet pan to rest for 10 minutes before frying. Continue with the remaining chicken pieces until all of the chicken has been coated. Fry the chicken in batches of 12 pieces. The temperature of the oil should drop to around 300 degrees F. The chicken should fry at 300 degrees F until they are golden brown and begin to float, 7 to 9 minutes. Place the fried chicken on a paper-lined sheet pan and place in the oven to keep warm as you fry the rest of the chicken. Be sure to allow the oil to return to 350 degrees F or so before adding more chicken to the hot oil.  Serve hot with Thai-Inspired Chili Dipping Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'5 pounds chicken wings, separated at joints, and wing tips reserved for stock', u'1 1/2 cups lemon juice', u'1 cup water', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 cup Bloody Mary Mix', u'1/2 cup pepper vodka', u' Vegetable oil, for frying', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 cup rice flour', u'1 recipe Thai-Inspired Chili Dipping Sauce']
title: Fried Chicken Wings with a Thai-Inspired Chili Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Garnish: long chives', u'In a mixing bowl, mix together wasabi and honey. Wasabi mixture should be a pourable consistency. Transfer into a squirt bottle and place aside.', u'In a saucepan, reduce orange juice to a sugar syrup, be careful not to burn. Add vegetable stock, red curry paste, white wine, shallots and garlic and bring to a boil. Reduce by half. Transfer contents in a blender. Add rice wine vinegar and puree slowly adding the safflower oil until emulsified. Transfer to a squirt bottle. Set aside.', u'Season tuna fillets with Kosher salt and black pepper (using 7/8 salt and 1/8 pepper) then grill tuna fillet to desired doneness.', u'In a saute pan emulsify butter and water, add jasmine rice and heat.', u'In another saute pan over high heat, heat oil and saute straw mushrooms, lychee nuts. On a serving plate arrange seaweed in a circle. Place rice in center on top of seaweed, carrot strips on top of rice keeping in mind you want to see carrots. Sprinkle around the edge of plate straw mushroom-lychee nut mixture. Place tuna fillet on top of carrots, squirt Thai vinaigrette on top of tuna and then squirt the wasabi glaze on top of Thai vinaigrette. Garnish with long chives.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup wasabi', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 cups orange juice', u'1/2 cup vegetable stock', u'2 tablespoons red curry paste', u'1/2 cup white wine', u'1 shallot chopped', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1/3 cup rice wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup safflower oil or vegetable oil', u' Kosher salt and pepper to taste', u'4 (6-ounce) tuna fillets', u' Butter and water', u'2 cups Jasmine rice, cooked', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 cup canned whole straw mushrooms, drained', u'1 cup lychee nuts, quartered', u'1 cup wakame seaweed (rehydrated)', u'2 carrots, peeled and shaved into strips with peeler']
title: Grilled Tuna Over Jasmine Rice with a Wasabi and Thai Vinaigrette

directions: [u'Heat tea in a pot on the stove until hot, but not boiling. Add sweetened condensed milk and chai latte mix. Stir until latte mix is dissolved. Stir in remaining ingredients and let cool to room temperature. Stir in Irish whiskey and cream-based liqueur, if desired.', u'Fill highball or iced tea glass with ice. Pour tea over ice.']
ingredients: [u'1 (16-ounce) bottle unsweetened iced tea (recommended: Lipton)', u'1/4 cup vanilla chai latte mix (recommended: Pacific Chai)', u'1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk', u'8 drops yellow food coloring', u'4 drops red food coloring', u"2 shots Irish whiskey and cream based liqueur, optional (recommended: Bailey's Irish Cream)", u' Ice cubes']
title: Thai Iced Tea

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Rub the fish with 1 tablespoon curry paste and the lime zest in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate while you cook the vegetables.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, bell peppers, half of the jalapeno and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables are just crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon curry paste and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 1 minute.', u'Add the squash, coconut milk and 2 cups water to the saucepan and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the squash is almost tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Add the fish, cover and simmer until just opaque, about 8 minutes. Stir in the cilantro and season with salt. Serve over rice; top with the remaining jalapeno.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds skinless mahi mahi fillets, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 tablespoons Thai green curry paste', u' Finely grated zest of 1 lime', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 large onion, thinly sliced', u'2 red bell peppers, thinly sliced', u'1 jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced (remove seeds for less heat)', u' Kosher salt', u'1 20 -ounce package cubed peeled butternut squash (about 4 cups)', u'1 cup light coconut milk (about half of a 14-ounce can)', u'1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'3 cups cooked rice']
title: Thai Fish Curry

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'MAKE THE FILLING: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, scallion whites, and seafood seasoning. Cook until the vegetables start to brown, about 5 minutes. Add the turkey and cook, breaking up with a wooden spoon, until golden, about 5 minutes. Stir in the fish sauce and scallion greens and cook until the liquid is almost completely absorbed, about 5 minutes. Stir in the pineapple, cilantro, and lime juice. Remove from the heat.', u'SERVE: Spoon the filling over the hot cooked rice and serve with lime wedges and lettuce leaves to make lettuce wraps.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced', u'1 bunch scallions, sliced (white and green parts kept separate)', u'1 teaspoon seafood seasoning, such as Old Bay', u'1 1/2 pounds ground turkey', u'1/4 cup Asian fish sauce', u'1 1/2 cups diced fresh pineapple', u'1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u' Juice of 2 limes, plus wedges for serving', u' Hot cooked white rice, for serving', u'1 head of Boston lettuce, leaves separated, for serving']
title: Thai Turkey Lettuce Wraps

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Stir-fry the coconut cream in a small saucepan over medium heat, until the oil separates and sizzles, about 2 minutes. Add the curry paste and stir-fry until fragrant, about 2 minutes.', u'Whisk in the broth, coconut milk, peanut butter, and fish sauce. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce the heat to maintain a gentle simmer and cook, stirring, until thickened, about 10 minutes. Transfer the sauce to a serving bowl and cool to room temperature. Whisk in the lime juice just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons coconut cream, skimmed from the top of canned coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Thai Red Curry Paste, see above', u'1 cup chicken broth, homemade or low-sodium canned', u'1/4 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/4 cup chunky peanut butter', u'1 tablespoon Southeast Asian fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lime juice, or more to taste']
title: Peanut Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Season the steak all over with salt and pepper; cook about 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest. Reserve the skillet.', u'Put the noodles in a bowl; cover with warm water and soak 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat. Add the ginger, chopped jalapeno, scallion whites, 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and 3 cups water; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low; simmer 10 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, wipe out the reserved skillet; heat the remaining 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Drain the noodles, pat dry and toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Add to the skillet to form a pancake; cook, undisturbed, until slightly golden, 5 minutes. Flip; cook until crisp, 3 more minutes. Transfer to a cutting board; cut into 4 wedges. Slice the steak against the grain.', u'Add the snow peas, carrots and half of the cilantro to the soup; simmer until tender, 3 minutes. Divide the soup, steak and fried noodles among bowls. Top with the scallion greens, sliced jalapeno, fried shallots and the remaining cilantro.', u'Per serving: Calories 478; Fat 27 g (Saturated 6 g); Cholesterol 59 mg; Sodium 802 mg; Carbohydrate 38 g; Fiber 3 g; Protein 23 g', u'Photographs by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'12 ounces skirt steak', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'4 ounces stir-fry rice noodles', u'1 21/2 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced', u'1 red jalapeno pepper (1/2 chopped, 1/2 thinly sliced into rounds)', u'1 bunch scallions, thinly sliced (white and green parts separated)', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'2 cups snow peas, trimmed and halved', u'4 carrots, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/2 cup packaged fried shallots or onions']
title: Thai Steak Soup

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Place the bunch of cilantro in a bowl and let it soak for a few minutes to remove the dirt.', u'Put each salmon fillet in a parchment paper pouch, flesh side up. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Pour the olive oil over the fish, then smear the green curry paste on top of the salmon.', u'Dice the garlic and shallots and sprinkle them on top, then place the lime leaves on top, as well.', u'Cut the lime in 1/2 and squeeze the lime juice over the fish.', u'Finally add the fish sauce, wine and chicken stock.', u'Drain the bowl of cilantro leaves and pat them dry with a paper towel. (You can wrap them in a fresh paper towel, place them in a baggie and put them in the refrigerator. The leaves will stay fresh longer that way.) Garnish the top with some chopped cilantro leaves.', u'Close up the pouches and place on a baking sheet. Bake 20 to 30 minutes. Chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour and serve with fresh cilantro sprigs.', u'Jasmine rice can also accompany the dish if you are eating it hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 bunch cilantro', u'1 to 1 1/2 pounds fresh salmon fillets', u'1/8 teaspoon salt (optional as the fish sauce is quite salty)', u"1/8 teaspoon Asian white pepper (you can substitute black pepper if you can't find it)", u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil (peanut oil can be substituted as well, but I like the rich flavor of the non-traditional olive oil)', u'2 tablespoons green curry paste', u'4 cloves garlic', u'1 shallot', u'2 kaffir lime leaves', u'1 lime', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1/4 cup white wine (the drier the better, I am not married to any particular vintage or variety)', u"1/4 cup chicken or fish stock (you can substitute a dreaded chicken or fish bouillon cube if you're in a pinch)", u' Cooked jasmine rice, for serving (optional)']
title: Cold Thai Salmon

directions: [u'To the soup base, add the coconut milk and lime leaves. Bring to a boil, then lower to a simmer. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, lime juice and sugar. Add the dumplings and simmer until done, about 3 minutes.', u'Divide the softened glass noodles on four soup bowls. Place two dumplings crisscross on top of the noodles, leaning to the side of the bowl. Divide the soup onto the four bowls. Garnish each bowl with julienne of carrots, leeks, Thai chiles and lime leaf. Serve immediately.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 cups Soup Base, recipe follows', u'1 cup coconut milk', u'6 Kaffir lime leaves', u' Salt and pepper', u' Lime juice, to taste', u' About 1 tablespoon palm sugar, to taste', u' Sugarcane Chicken Dumplings, recipe follows', u'1 ounce glass noodles, soaked in water until softened', u'1/4 cup carrots, cut into julienne', u'1/4 cup leeks, cut into julienne', u'4 Thai chiles, stems removed, split in half lengthwise, seeded', u'4 Kaffir lime leaves, cut in a thin chiffonade', u'2 1/2 cups lobster stock', u'1 tablespoon chili paste', u'1 lemon grass, cut into 2 inch sticks', u'10 fresh Thai basil leaves', u'1 Thai bird chile', u'4 ounces ground lean chicken', u'1/2 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon mushroom soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons potato starch', u' Pinch freshly ground black pepper', u'8 (4-inch) sugarcane sticks']
title: Thai Coconut Soup with Lemon Grass and Sugarcane Chicken Dumplings

directions: [u'Pat the chicken dry and season with salt. In a casserole set over moderately high heat, warm the oil until it is hot, add the chicken and cook it, turning, until no longer pink.  Transfer chicken to a plate. Add the onion to the casserole and cook it, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes.  Add the garlic and gingerroot and cook, stirring, 1 minute.  Add the carrots, bell pepper, mushrooms, and salt to taste, and cook the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes more. Return the chicken to the pan, add the curry paste and cook the mixture, turning and stirring, 1 minute.  Add the coconut milk, galanga root powder, lemongrass flakes, cumin, and bay leaf.  Bring mixture to a boil, and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes. Add the broccoli, bamboo shoots, water chestnuts, corn, and salt to taste, and simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.  Discard bay leaf.  Before serving, stir in the lemon juice, cilantro, and mint.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds chicken legs, separated into drumsticks and thighs, skin removed', u' Salt to taste', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 cup minced onion', u'5 cloves garlic, peeled', u'1 tablespoon grated gingerroot', u'1 cup sliced carrots', u'1 cup 1-inch pieces red bell pepper', u'1 cup sliced mushrooms', u'1 to 2 teaspoons red curry paste, or to taste', u"2 (14-ounce) cans 'light' unsweetened coconut milk", u'1/2 teaspoon galanga root powder', u'1/2 teaspoon dried lemongrass flakes', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 cup broccoli florets', u'1/2 cup canned bamboo shoots, drained', u'1/2 cup canned water chestnuts, drained', u'8 ears canned baby corn, drained', u' Fresh lemon juice, to taste', u'1/4 cup minced fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup minced fresh mint']
title: Thai Chicken Stew

directions: [u'Grind the chicken, preferably with a coarse grind. Add 1 cup water, the coconut milk, lime juice and sesame oil to the meat and incorporate. Then add the curry powder, basil, salt, garlic granules, white pepper, coriander and chili powder, and mix into the meat thoroughly. Mix just enough as not to break down the meat.', u'Stuff into the hog casings, and remember to pin prick the links when done. You can grill, broil, saute, or bake...just make sure it reaches a safe internal temperature of 165 degrees F. One way to enjoy is to place in a hot dog bun, add Asian slaw with some hoisin and sriracha (Thai hot sauce).', u'Alternatively, instead of stuffing the meat mixture, you can saute it and use in such recipes as Asian-style lettuce wraps. Just add crispy noodles, chopped onion, hoisin sauce and enjoy!', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and makes a large quantity. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'10 pounds boneless chicken leg and thigh, skin on', u'1 can coconut milk', u'3 teaspoons lime juice', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 cup mild curry powder', u'1/4 cup Thai basil leaves, chopped', u'6 tablespoons salt', u'4 teaspoons garlic granules', u'3 teaspoons ground white pepper', u'1 teaspoon chili powder', u'29 to 32 mm hog casings']
title: Falconetti's Chicken Thai Sausage

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Equipment: Bamboo skewers soaked in warm water for 10 minutes', u'Using a sharp knife, slice the steak, against the grain and on angle, into thin strips about an inch wide.', u'In a large bowl, whisk together the paste, coconut milk, sugar, fish sauce, and turmeric, if using.  Add the beef, mix well, and set aside at room temperature to marinate for at least 1 hour.', u'Preheat an outdoor grill.', u'Thread the beef onto skewers, then lightly spray them with oil. Working in batches grill the beef, over high heat until just cooked through, about 2 to 4 minutes. Transfer the beef skewers to a serving platter and serve with the peanut sauce.', u"Cook's Note: Slicing meat thin can be tricky. The meat will be much easier to slice if it is chilled in the freezer until firm."]
ingredients: [u"1 flank steak (about 2 pounds), very cold (See Cook's Note.)", u'1/2 cup Thai Red Curry Paste, recipe follows', u'3/4 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/4 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon Southeast Asian fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon ground turmeric (optional)', u' Spray oil', u' Peanut Sauce, recipe follows', u' Thai Red Curry Paste', u'8 dried red chiles, like arbol, stemmed and seeded', u'1 tablespoon coriander seeds', u'2 teaspoons cumin seeds', u'1 teaspoon white peppercorns', u'1/4 cup packed roughly chopped coriander leaves, stems, and roots (cilantro)', u'2 tablespoons Southeast Asian fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom (optional)', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'2 medium fresh red chiles, stemmed and chopped', u'5 cloves garlic', u'3 shallots', u'2 fresh lemongrass stalks (about 6 ounces), trimmed and thinly sliced', u'1 -inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and chopped', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil, like soy, peanut, or corn', u' Peanut Sauce', u'2 tablespoons coconut cream skimmed from the top of canned coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Thai Red Curry Paste, see above', u'1 cup chicken broth, homemade or low-sodium canned', u'1/4 cup unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/4 cup chunky peanut butter', u'1 tablespoon Southeast Asian fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lime juice, or more to taste']
title: Grilled Ribbons of Thai-Style Steak

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'For the stock: Put all the ingredients into a large pot and cover with water by 1-inch. Bring to a boil, skimming any foam that rises to the surface. Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken and save it for another meal; strain the stock. Makes 10 to 12 cups.', u'For the soup: Put the Asian Chicken Stock into a pot over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, limes, chiles, fish sauce, and kaffir lime leaves, if using. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt. Add the shrimp and simmer just until the shrimp are cooked through, about 5 minutes, then add the cilantro and basil leaves. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve garnished with cilantro leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1 (4-pound) free-range chicken', u' Reserved shells from shrimp, see below', u'6 scallions', u'4 cloves garlic', u'1 stalk lemongrass, lightly smashed, or zest of 1 lemon', u'1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns', u'1 (2-inch) piece fresh ginger, sliced thick', u'4 kaffir lime leaves, fresh or frozen, or juice and skin of 1 lime', u'2 serrano chiles, halved lengthwise', u'1 recipe Asian Chicken Stock', u'1 (15-ounce) can straw mushrooms, drained and rinsed', u'2 limes, juice and skins', u'4 serrano chiles, halved lengthwise', u'1 teaspoon fish sauce, or more to taste', u'5 kaffir lime leaves, fresh or frozen, optional', u' Kosher salt', u'1 pound large shrimp, shelled and sliced in 1/2 lengthwise', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves, plus more for garnish', u'1 tablespoon Thai basil leaves or regular basil leaves']
title: Spicy Thai-Flavor Soup

directions: [u'Soak the noodles in cold water for 4 hours, and then drain.', u"Heat a medium wok over high heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the oil to the hot wok and swirl using a ladle. Allow the oil to heat to almost the smoke point. Add the chicken and cook for 30 seconds. Then add the eggs and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Don't stir the eggs too much. You don't want to make scrambles eggs; you want the bottom of the eggs to get crispy to keep your wok as nonstick as possible. Keep the eggs separate from the chicken as best as you can.", u'When the eggs and chicken begin to brown, add the white onions and the noodles. Toss the noodles and stir occasionally to loosen the noodles and cook evenly. After 1 to 2 minutes the noodles should begin to soften. Add the paprika, fish sauce, vinegar and tamarind. Cook for 1 to 2 more minutes, and then lower heat to medium. Add the sugar, Thai chile, cabbage and green onions. Cook for about 1 minute. After the noodles begin to caramelize with the sugar, it is done. Serve topped with the ground peanuts, fresh bean sprouts and a lime wedge.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u' One 16-ounce package medium-size rice noodles', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'4 ounces sliced chicken breast', u'2 eggs', u'1 ounce diced white onion', u'2 teaspoons Spanish paprika', u'2 ounces fish sauce', u'2 ounces distilled amber vinegar', u'2 ounces tamarind nectar or puree', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons ground and roasted Thai chile', u'2 ounces sliced green cabbage', u'2 ounces sliced green onions', u'2 ounces fresh peanuts, ground and roasted', u'2 ounces fresh bean sprouts', u'1 fresh lime, cut into wedges']
title: Thai Place Phad Thai Chicken Thai Hot

directions: [u'Special equipment: a deep fryer with lid or a Dutch oven', u'Mix the sweet chili sauce, rice vinegar, fish sauce, ginger, garlic powder, garlic and pepper in a mixing bowl with a whisk until the ingredients are incorporated; set aside.', u"Fill a fryer or large Dutch oven with oil according to the manufacturer's instructions; heat the oil to 350 degrees F. Working in 2 batches, carefully drop the chicken wings into the fryer, and cover it with a lid. Fry the wings until they are golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a clean bowl. Drizzle the Thai sweet-and-sour sauce over the wings."]
ingredients: [u'2 cups sweet chili sauce', u'1 cup rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons Asian fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon peeled and grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon garlic powder', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u' Coarse black pepper, for seasoning', u'1 gallon shortening oil, for frying', u'18 to 24 chicken wings, cleaned and dried']
title: Thai Sweet and Sour Wings

directions: [u'Combine vegetables, blanch in salted water until done. To this mixture add basil, mint, cilantro, ginger, hot chili pepper flakes, salt and pepper.', u'Place 1 tablespoon of mixture on egg roll skin, roll like a cigar. Fry in hot oil, until brown and crispy. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces leeks, julienne', u'8 ounces carrots, julienne', u'8 ounces celery, julienne', u'1/2 bulb fennel, julienne', u'3 Japanese eggplants, julienne', u'2 tablespoons chopped basil leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped mint leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped cilantro leaves', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger pulp', u'1/2 teaspoon hot chili pepper flakes', u' Salt and pepper', u'24 egg roll wrappers', u'4 cups canola oil']
title: Thai Spring Rolls

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk together the peanut sauce, 2 tablespoons water, the soy sauce, hot pepper flakes and lime juice in a large serving bowl. Set aside.', u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Stir in the noodles, edamame and bell peppers and cook according to the noodle package directions, or about 4 minutes. Drain the noodles and vegetables. Rinse under cold water to cool; drain well. Transfer to the bowl with the peanut sauce and toss to evenly combine.', u'Top with the cilantro leaves and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve at room temperature topped with lime wedges for squeezing.']
ingredients: [u"1/3 cup bottled all-natural Thai peanut sauce, such as Annie Chun's", u'1 to 2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon dried hot pepper flakes', u' Juice of 1 lime', u'8 ounces buckwheat soba noodles', u'6 ounces frozen shelled edamame, thawed', u'2 large red bell peppers, very thinly sliced into long strips', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves (do not chop)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons toasted black or white sesame seeds', u' Lime wedges, for serving']
title: Thai Peanut Noodles with Confetti

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Put the rice into a medium pot and pour in 6 cups cold water. Put the pot over medium-high heat, cover, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the water is absorbed, 20 to 30 minutes. (Reserve 2 cups cooked rice for Rice Pudding with Coconut Milk recipe.)', u'Remove the chicken breasts from the bone and slice into thin strips. (Reserve the bones and the legs, thighs, and wings for Round 2 Recipe Coconut Chicken Soup.) In a large wok or skillet over high heat, add the oil. When the oil is hot, add the chicken and stir-fry until it is almost completely cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the onions and peppers and cook until slightly softened but still crisp, about 3 minutes. Add the chile and garlic and cook 1 minute.', u'To a bowl, add 2 tablespoons water, sugar, soy sauce, and fish sauce. Stir and pour over the chicken and onions and cook for another minute. Add the basil and remove from the heat once it has wilted. Add the lime juice into the chicken mixture and stir. Serve hot over rice.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups white rice', u'1 (4-pound) whole chicken, cut into parts', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 medium onion, sliced', u'1 green bell pepper, sliced', u'1 small serrano chile pepper, sliced in half', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'2 teaspoons brown sugar', u'2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'1 cup fresh basil leaves', u'1 lime, zested and juiced, (zest reserved for Rice Pudding with Coconut Milk recipe)']
title: Basil Chicken

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a large saucepan, bring the coconut milk and curry paste to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth, carrot, red bell pepper, onion, baby corn, basil, chile, lime leaves and fish sauce. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium-low heat. Cover the pan and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.', u'Pour the oil into a large wide saucepan. Attach a deep-fry thermometer to the side of the saucepan and heat the oil to 350 degrees F. Add half of the noodles and fry until crisp, about 20 seconds. Drain on paper towels and set aside.', u'Remove the lid from the curry and add the shrimp, snap peas and the remaining noodles. Simmer, uncovered, until the shrimp is cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove the lime leaves and basil sprigs and discard.', u'Ladle the curry into bowls. Garnish with the fried noodles, cilantro and peanuts.', u'Tip: To substitute dried rice noodles, use 4 ounces and soak half in water as directed; use the rest for frying.', u'Photograph by Kat Teutsch']
ingredients: [u'2 13 .5-ounce cans coconut milk (about 3 1/4 cups)', u'1/4 cup yellow curry paste (such as Mae Ploy)', u'1 cup low-sodium chicken broth or clam juice', u'1 medium carrot, sliced into 1/4-inch-thick rounds', u'1 small red bell pepper, chopped into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1 15 -ounce can baby corn, drained and rinsed, cut into pieces', u'5 sprigs Thai basil, with stems (or regular basil)', u'1 Thai chile (such as prik kee noo) or serrano chile, stemmed and thinly sliced', u'3 kaffir lime leaves (or the zest of 1 lime)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'4 cups canola oil or safflower oil', u'8 ounces fresh thin rice noodles', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'4 ounces snap peas, halved', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/4 cup lightly salted peanuts, chopped']
title: Shrimp and Vegetable Yellow Curry

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Using a fork, pull chicken meat from bone in shreds. ', u'Place lettuce in a large bowl (or divide onto individual dishes). Top lettuce with chicken, cucumber, tomato, and scallions.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together broth, peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, and sesame oil. Pour mixture over salad. Top with peanuts just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'2 cooked chicken breast halves', u'4 cups chopped romaine lettuce', u'1 cup diced cucumber', u'1 cup diced tomato', u'1/2 cup chopped scallions', u'1 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons smooth peanut butter', u'1 tablespoon reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1/4 cup dry roasted peanuts']
title: Thai Chicken Salad with Peanuts and Lime

directions: [u'Dressing: Mix garlic, palm or brown sugar, fish sauce, lime juice, chiles, and lime leaves in a bowl. Roughly chop shrimp and peanuts by hand or in a food processor and add to garlic mixture. (The dressing can be made in advance and stored up to 3 days in the refrigerator.) ', u'To serve, arrange each variety of melon cubes in alternating rows on a platter or in individual bowls. Spoon dressing over melon in a strip and garnish with cilantro. Serve chilled.']
ingredients: [u'3 garlic cloves, pureed', u'2 tablespoons palm sugar or dark brown sugar', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'1/4 cup fresh lime juice', u'3 or more serrano chiles to taste, stems removed and thinly sliced with seeds', u'1 tablespoon chopped kaffir lime leaves or 1 teaspoon grated lime zest', u'1/2 cup dried shrimp', u'1/2 cup roasted, unsalted peanuts', u'6 cups assorted melon cubes, in 1/2-inch cubes, each variety separated', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves for garnish']
title: Thai Melon Salad

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a large saucepan or wok at high heat. Stir in the chopped garlic and cook until it is golden brown. Add the Thai chile pepper and stir well.', u'Add the ground chicken and cook it just halfway done. Reduce the heat to medium and add the mushrooms, fish sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, sweet soy sauce, and chicken stock. Mix well.', u'When all the ingredients are cooked, add the red bell pepper and the Thai holy basil. Mix well and season to taste with salt. Serve over steamed jasmine rice.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 to 2 tablespoons chopped Thai chile pepper', u'8 ounces ground chicken breast', u'1/2 cup sliced white mushrooms', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon oyster sauce', u'1/2 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 tablespoon sweet soy sauce (optional)', u'1/3 cup chicken stock', u'1/2 cup sliced red bell pepper (optional)', u'1/2 cup Thai holy basil (Ga-Prao)', u' Salt', u' Steamed jasmine rice']
title: Thai Holy Basil Chicken: Pud Ga-Prao Gai Sap

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Put all the vegetables on a baking sheet and toss with the oil to coat. Sprinkle with salt and roast until they are soft and pliable, about 15 to 20 minutes.', u'While the vegetables are roasting whisk together all of the ingredients for the vinaigrette in a small bowl. Remove the vegetables from the oven and put them in a bowl along with the papaya. Add the vinaigrette in stages to make sure the vegetables are well coated but not overdressed. Add the basil and papaya and toss. Arrange on a pretty platter alternating the vegetables. Garnish with the lime wedges, peanuts, and cilantro. Drizzle with 1 or 2 more spoonfuls of the vinaigrette and serve. Delicious!']
ingredients: [u'4 baby fennel bulbs, cut in 1/2 lengthwise', u'2 baby bok choy, cut lengthwise into quarters', u'1 red onion, rood end trimmed but left on, cut into thin wedges', u'3 Fresno peppers, cut lengthwise into quarters', u'3 baby eggplants, cut lengthwise into quarters', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon grated ginger', u'1 garlic clove, smashed and finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon sambal oelek', u'3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon palm sugar', u'2 tablespoons chiffonade Thai basil leaves', u'1 green papaya, peeled and julienned', u'1 lime, cut into wedges', u'1/4 cup chopped peanuts', u'2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves']
title: Roasted Vegetables with Thai Vinaigrette (Thailand)

directions: [u'In a large saucepan combine stock with gingerroot, shallots, lemon grass, rice and salt to taste. Bring to a boil and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 to 30 minutes, or until soup is a porridge-like consistency. Remove and discard lemon grass. Add the pork and fish sauce and simmer 5 minutes more. Garnish with scallion, shallots and cilantro.', u'Drink:  Tea']
ingredients: [u'6 cups pork or chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh gingerroot', u'2 large shallots, minced and crushed', u'1 stalk lemon grass, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'3/4 cup rice', u'1/2 pound minced ground pork', u'2 tablespoons Thai fish sauce', u' For garnish: firm bean curd, cut into cubes, sliced scallion, deep-fried shallots and sprigs of fresh cilantro, to taste']
title: Khao Tom (Thai Rice Soup)

directions: [u'Soak the rice in a container that holds at least twice the volume of rice:  Cover the rice with 2 to 3 inches of room-temperature water and soak for 6 to 24 hours. If you need to shorten the soaking time, soak the rice in warm (about 100 degree) water for 2 hours. The longer soak gives more flavor and a more even, tender texture, but the rice is perfectly edible with the shorter soak in warm water.', u"Drain the rice and place in a steamer basket. Set the steamer basket over several inches of boiling water in a large pot or a wok. The rice must not be in or touching the boiling water. Cover and steam for 25 minutes, or until the rice is shiny and tender. Turn the rice over after about 20 minutes, so the top layer is on the bottom. Be careful that your pot doesn't run dry during steaming; add more water if necessary, making sure to keep it from touching the rice.", u'Turn the cooked rice out onto a clean work surface. Use a long-handled wooden spoon to flatten it out a little, then turn it over on itself, first from one side, then from the other, a little like folding over dough as you knead. This helps get rid of any clumps; after several foldings, the rice will be an even round lump. Place it in a covered basket or in a serving bowl covered by a damp cloth or a lid. Serve warm or at room temperature, directly from the basket or bowl. The rice will dry out if exposed to the air for long as it cools, so keep covered until serving.']
ingredients: [u'3 cups long-grain Thai sticky rice']
title: Basic Sticky Rice

directions: [u'Put the noodles in a large bowl, cover with cold water and soak until softened, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a wok over medium heat. Add the shrimp, garlic, sweet radish and tofu, if using, and stir for 30 seconds. Add the noodles and continue to cook for 1 minute. Add the Pad Thai Sauce and cook, stirring frequently, until the noodles absorb all of the sauce, about 1 minute. Add the eggs, tossing with the noodles occasionally, and cook until set, about 1 minute. Add the bean sprouts and green onions and toss to combine. Transfer to serving plates and garnish with some crushed peanuts, ground chiles and the lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 pounds rice noodles', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1/2 pound peeled and deveined shrimp', u'1 teaspoon minced fresh garlic', u"1 teaspoon chopped sweet radish (see Cook's Note)", u'2 tablespoons chopped pressed tofu, optional', u' Pad Thai Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 large eggs', u'8 ounces bean sprouts', u'2 tablespoons green onions, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'3 tablespoons crushed roasted peanuts, for serving', u' Ground dried chiles, for serving', u'1 lime, cut into wedges', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'6 tablespoons brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons tamarind paste', u'2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons distilled vinegar', u'1 tablespoon chopped grilled red onions', u'1 tablespoon salt']
title: Shrimp Pad Thai

directions: [u'Preheat a medium wok over high heat. Add the oil, garlic and chilies. Add your protein selection and brown the outside. Add the onions, noodles, dark soy sauce, fish sauce and sugar. Cook for about 2 minutes. Throw in the peppers, tomato and basil and cook for 1 minute.', u'This recipe was provided by a chef, restaurant or culinary professional and may have been scaled down from a bulk recipe. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon vegetable oil', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'2 Thai chiles, chopped', u'6 ounces chicken, pork, shrimp or tofu', u'1/2 cup chopped white onion', u' Fistful of flat wide rice noodles, cooked', u'1 tablespoon dark soy sauce', u'1/2 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper', u'1/2 cup chopped red bell pepper', u'1 large tomato, chopped', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil']
title: Opal's Thai Stir-Fry

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'In a medium pot, stir together the rice, 1 1/2 cans coconut milk (reserve remaining coconut milk for Round 2 Recipe Coconut Chicken Soup), sugar, and lime peel. Put the pot over medium heat, bring it to a simmer, and cover. Cook until the pudding becomes very thick, 20 to 25 minutes.', u'While the pudding is cooking, toast the shredded coconut in a dry skillet over medium heat until golden brown.', u'After the pudding has cooled 10 minutes, stir in the vanilla. Serve the rice pudding topped with diced mango and sprinkled with toasted coconut.']
ingredients: [u' Reserved cooked rice from Basil Chicken recips', u'2 (14-ounce) cans coconut milk, divided', u'1/3 cup packed brown sugar', u'1 lime, peeled in strips', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 mango, diced', u'1/4 cup sweetened shredded coconut']
title: Rice Pudding with Coconut Milk

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Put the flank steak in the freezer for a few minutes to aid in thinly slicing safely.', u'Heat 1/2 cup oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Dredge the shallot slices in the cornstarch and shake off any excess. Add the shallots into the heated oil and remove them to a paper-towel lined plate when they become a light golden-brown color.', u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium heat. Salt the water and add the pasta. Cook to al dente. ', u'While pasta water comes to a boil, stem and thinly slice the mushrooms, and seed and thinly slice the sweet and hot peppers.', u'Remove the meat from the freezer and thinly slice into 1/4-inch wide by 2-inch pieces. ', u'Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the beef and cook in a single layer for 2 to 3 minutes. Turn the meat over and add shiitakes, sweet and hot peppers, garlic and scallions. Stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes, then add the curry paste, fish sauce and stock and bring to a boil. Add in the edamame, and cook for 1 minute to heat through, then add the basil.', u'Drain the pasta and put into a large serving bowl. Add the beef mixture, the lime zest and lime juice. Toss vigorously and season with some black pepper, to taste. Garnish with the fried shallots sprinkled on top.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pound piece flank steak', u'1/2 cup high temperature oil, such as peanut, canola or safflower, plus 2 tablespoons', u'2 shallots, peeled and thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch', u' Salt', u'1 pound whole-grain or whole-wheat spaghetti', u'6 ounces or 1/3 pound shiitake mushrooms', u'1 red bell pepper', u'1 red hot chile pepper', u'3 to 4 cloves garlic, grated or chopped', u'4 to 5 scallions, thinly sliced on an angle', u"3 tablespoons curry paste, mild to medium heat (recommended: Patak's)", u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'1 cup shelled frozen edamame, thawed', u'1 cup loosely packed, basil leaves, thinly sliced or torn', u'1 lime, zested and juiced', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Thai it You'll Like It Hot Curry Beef Noodle Bowls, Green Melon with Lime and Lemon Sorbet

directions: [u'Make the sauce: Pour 1/4 cup boiling water over the brown sugar in a bowl and stir to dissolve. Add the lime juice, fish sauce, rice vinegar and Sriracha and stir to combine. Add the cooked turkey to the sauce and let it absorb the flavors while prepping the rest of the dish.', u'Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add the linguine and cook 1 minute less than the label directs. Drain and set aside.', u'Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large saute pan over high heat until very hot, almost smoking. Add the onion and stir-fry 1 minute. Add the garlic and stir, then add the eggs and cook for 30 seconds, stirring. Add the linguine and turkey (with the sauce) and cook, stirring, for a few minutes. Remove from the heat and toss in the grated carrot, peanuts, cilantro, bean sprouts and scallions. Serve with lime wedges.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup brown sugar', u' Juice of 1 lime, plus wedges for serving', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 tablespoon Sriracha', u'11/2 cups shredded or cubed cooked turkey (about 9 ounces) Salt', u'8 ounces linguine, broken in half', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 onion, sliced', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 large eggs, slightly beaten', u'1 large carrot, grated', u'1/2 cup chopped peanuts', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 cups bean sprouts', u'3 scallions, cut into 3/4-inch pieces (about 1/4 cup)']
title: Turkey Pad Thai

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, lemon juice, fish sauce and honey. Set aside.', u'Larb: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, shallots, lemongrass, chile, and salt, to taste. Cook until the vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the turkey and season with salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until the meat and vegetables are cooked through, about 5 minutes. Add the dressing to the pan and cook for 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the mint. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Spoon the turkey mixture onto the lettuce leaves and arrange on a serving platter. Serve with sticky rice.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup fresh lime juice, from about 5 limes', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, from 1 large lemon', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce*', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'3 tablespoons vegetable or canola oil', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u'3 shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 (4-inch) piece lemongrass, minced (about 1/4 cup)*', u'1 Thai chile, such as prik kee noo, or 1 serrano chile, stemmed and thinly sliced*', u' Kosher salt', u'1 1/2 pounds ground turkey, preferably dark meat', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh mint leaves', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 head butter lettuce, leaves separated', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets', u' Serving suggestion: sticky or steamed white rice']
title: Turkey Larb

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Set a 12-inch saute pan over medium-high heat and add the peanut oil. Once the oil is hot, add the ginger and garlic and saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the cabbage to the pan and saute until wilted, about 3 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper. ', u'Set the cabbage in a medium bowl, and add the pork, green onion tops, oyster sauce, cilantro and curry powder to the bowl and stir to combine. ', u'Preheat a fryer to 350 degrees F.', u"Combine the flour and water in a small bowl, and stir to blend. This will be used as a glue to seal the egg rolls. Lay a spring roll wrapper on a clean work surface, being sure to cover the wrappers that you are not using with a damp towel. Have 1 point of the wrapper facing you, and lay 1/4 cup of the filling just below the center of the wrapper. Push the filling out to spread about 1-inch wide and 4 inches long. Fold the corner closest to you over the filling, and fold the 2 ends in towards the center. Continue to roll the wrapper until the far end is nearly touching the rest of the wrapper. Use your finger to dab a bit of the 'glue' on the edge of the far corner, and seal it against the body of the roll. Continue this procedure with the rest of the rolls until you have 12 to 14 rolls. ", u'Once completed, fry the rolls in the oil until golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes. Serve with the dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/2 head napa cabbage, shredded, about 8 cups', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon fresh cracked black pepper', u'2 pounds Kalua country-style pork loin ribs, recipe follows', u'6 tablespoons thinly sliced green onion tops', u'4 tablespoons oyster sauce', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/2 teaspoon curry powder', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1 (11-ounce) packages spring roll wrappers (8 by 8 inches)', u' Orange-Thai Chili Dipping Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 pounds boneless country-style pork loin ribs', u'2 tablespoons Hawaiian sea salt or other sea salt or kosher salt', u"2 tablespoons Emeril's Asian Essence", u'4 tablespoons mesquite wood chips for a stovetop smoker', u'2 large or 4 small banana leaves, rinsed well', u'3/4 cup Thai sweet chili sauce', u'1 tablespoon Sriracha sauce', u'1/3 cup orange juice', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon minced fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons canola oil']
title: Tchoup Chop Kalua Pork Egg Rolls served with Orange-Thai Chili Dipping Sauce

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and chiles and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add the steak and cook, stirring frequently, 2 minutes. Add the shallots and bell pepper and cook 1 minute. Add the fish sauce, sweet soy sauce, black soy sauce and chili paste. Bring the mixture to a low simmer and cook, stirring frequently, until the meat is cooked through and the vegetables are tender, about 3 minutes.', u'Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the basil and mint until wilted. Serve over rice.', u"Tip: If you can't find sweet and black soy sauce, use 1/4 cup regular soy sauce mixed with 1/4 cup honey or sugar.", u'Photograph by Kat Teutsch']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable or canola oil', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 to 3 Thai chiles (such as prik kee noo) or serrano chiles, stemmed and thinly sliced', u'1 pound flank steak, very thinly sliced', u'3 medium shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, cut into 1/8-inch-thick slices', u'1/4 cup fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons sweet soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons black soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon chili paste in soybean oil', u'1 1/2 cups chopped fresh Thai basil leaves (or regular basil)', u'1 cup whole fresh mint leaves', u' White rice, for serving']
title: Spicy Mint Beef

author: Paul Young
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, peanut butter, sugar, and vinegar. Add in the cabbage, parsnips, carrots, cilantro, onion, and garlic. Toss to coat with the dressing.', u'Heat a large oven-proof saute pan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. Season the beef tenderloin with salt, and pepper, and sear on all sides until brown. Transfer the pan to the oven and cook the tenderloin for \ufffd\ufffdabout 20 to 30 minutes, or until medium-rare and internal temperature is 145 degrees F. Remove the beef from the pan. Place the pan back on medium heat and deglaze with the soy sauce. Stir the sauce to scrape up the brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Remove the pan from the heat. Thinly slice the tenderloin and lay on a bed of parsnip slaw. Serve with a side of Thai Peanut Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup peanut butter', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u'1 head Napa cabbage, shredded', u'4 parsnips, peeled and grated', u'2 carrots, peeled and grated', u'1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', u'1 small onion, diced', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 beef tenderloin (about 2 pounds)', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u' Thai Peanut Sauce, recipe follows', u'1/2 cup peanut butter', u'1 (8-ounce) can coconut milk', u'1/2 cup agave nectar', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u' Garlic powder', u' Red pepper flakes']
title: Beef Tenderloin with Parsnip Slaw and Thai Peanut Sauce

directions: [u'Heat outdoor grill to medium-high or indoor grill to 325 degrees F. ', u'Peanut sauce: Place coconut milk in saucepan and bring to a near boil (but not boiling). Add remaining ingredients. Simmer until well blended.', u'Mix chicken, fish sauce, garlic, shallots, sugar, tamarind, garlic chives, and salt in a bowl. Shape into 4 patties. Grill burgers approximately 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until juices run clear when pierced. Place each burger on a sesame seed bun with Chinese cabbage and bean sprouts. Spread peanut sauce on the bun and serve.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon tamarind', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon red curry paste', u'1 1/2 pounds ground chicken', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 shallots, diced', u'3 teaspoons tamarind', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic chives', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'6 sesame seed buns', u' Chinese or napa cabbage', u' Bean Sprouts']
title: Pad Thai Chicken Burger

directions: [u"Place the eggs in the bottom of a medium saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring the water just to a boil and remove the pan from the heat. Cover the pan with a lid and let stand for 12 minutes. Drain the eggs and rinse with cold water. Once the eggs are cool enough to handle, but still warm, peel off the shell and you're ready to go.", u'Slice the eggs in half lengthwise. Gently remove the yolks by pressing your thumb against the back of the yolk, and pop it out of the white. Place the yolks in a medium bowl and mash with a fork until smooth.', u'To the yolks, add the mayonnaise, Sriracha, fish sauce, lime juice, cucumber, carrot, shallot and salt to taste.', u'Spoon or pipe the filling into the egg whites and garnish with the cilantro before serving.']
ingredients: [u'8 large eggs, chilled', u'2 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons Sriracha', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 teaspoons lime juice', u'1/4 cup finely chopped cucumber (brunoised)', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped carrot (brunoised)', u'1 small shallot, minced (1/4 cup, brunoised)', u' Kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped, for garnish']
title: Thai Deviled Eggs

directions: [u'Set up a steamer that can hold the 4 fillets. Mix lime juice, salt, sugar and water. Add the fish and brine for 20 minutes. Add the fillets to the steamer (should be lined with red leaf or banana leaf), top with the scallions and steam for 8 to10 minutes until cooked though. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the peanut oil very hot until almost smoking. Mix the kaffir, chile, ginger, garlic and salt and pepper. First plate the halibut and right before serving, add the mix to the hot oil, mix and immediately flash the halibut. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 lime, juiced', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 cups water', u'4 (6-ounce) thick fillets of halibut, square shaped', u' Red leaf or banana leaf for steaming', u'4 each scallions, 1/16-inch ribbons', u'1/2 cup peanut oil (Lion and Globe or an artisan roasted peanut oil)', u'6 fresh kaffir lime leaves, 1/16-inch ribbons', u'3 Thai bird chiles, 1/16-inch slices', u'1 tablespoon ginger, 1/16-inch ribbons', u'1 tablespoon garlic, 1/16-inch slices', u' Salt and black pepper to taste', u' Canola oil to cook', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'4 chopped scallions, 1/8-inch slice', u'4 cups cooked, day old jasmin rice (add 1 teaspoon of tumeric to raw rice to cook in the flavor and color)', u'2 tablespoons thin soy sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon white pepper', u' Salt to taste', u'4 cups chinese long beans, cut into 2 inch pieces (can substitute blanched haricots verts)', u'1/2 tablespoon sambal oelek', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u' Juice of 2 limes', u' Salt and black pepper to taste']
title: Steamed Halibut Flashed with Thai Bird-Kaffir Lime Oil Turmeric Fried Rice and Long Bean Salad

directions: [u'Put the rice in a medium pot with 3 cups of water. Gently swirl your fingers in the pot to allow the starch to separate from the grains. Once the water becomes white, tilt the pot over the sink to drain out the water. Be careful not to let your rice go into the sink. Repeat this process twice more. With each time, the water will get less cloudy. The idea is not to get rid of all the starch, just enough so that the rice will not be too sticky or too dry when cooked. After you have drained the rice the third time, add remaining 1 3/4 cup clean water. Swirl you fingers in the pot once to ensure the rice is leveled and place the lid on the pot. Cook the rice over medium heat, stir the rice with a wooden spoon a few times, then let rest, covered, for 5 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup long-grain jasmine rice (yields 3 cups cooked)', u'10 3/4 cups water']
title: Jasmine Rice

directions: [u'Saute green onion, garlic, mushrooms and ginger with the olive oil in a large saucepan over moderate heat until just beginning to color. Stir in curry paste and continue to cook and stir for 2 minutes more.  Add stock, wine and 1 1/2 cups of the coconut milk and reduce over high heat by half (approximately 5 to 7 minutes minutes). Add cream and reduce to a light sauce consistency. Strain carefully pressing down on the solids and return to the saucepan. Stir in lime zest, juice, remaining 2 tablespoons of coconut milk and season to taste with salt and pepper. Keep warm.', u"Note:  Shellfish stock can be easily made by simmering raw shrimp shells (which hopefully you've saved in the freezer after you've peeled raw shrimp) with chicken stock and a splash or white wine for 5 to10 minutes.  Alternately you can add a bit of shrimp paste (available in jars in Asian markets) or dried shrimp (available in Hispanic or Asian markets) to flavor the basic chicken stock.  Don't ever use bottled clam juice!"]
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup chopped green onion', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 cup chopped mushrooms (crimini or shiitake preferred)', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 to 3 tablespoons Thai curry paste', u'2 cups rich shellfish stock (see note below)', u'3/4 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons coconut milk (Mae Ploy brand preferred)', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon finely grated lime zest', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice (or to taste)', u' Salt and freshly ground white pepper']
title: Thai Curry Cream

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Cook the noodles according to the package directions. Drain, transfer to a large bowl, and cover with aluminum foil or plastic wrap to keep warm.', u'Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, whisk together the sauce ingredients until well blended and set the pan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and let simmer for 10 minutes.', u'Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ginger and garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the bell pepper and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the beef and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add 1 cup of the peanut sauce and simmer until the beef is cooked through, about 5 minutes.', u'Transfer the beef mixture to the noodles and toss to combine, and then serve on individual plates topped with the peanuts and scallions. The leftover peanut sauce will keep in the refrigerator up to 4 days or in the freezer up to 3 months; thaw completely in the refrigerator or microwave for about 3 minutes on LOW before using.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces somen or soba noodles or whole-wheat spaghetti', u'3 cups reduced-sodium beef broth', u'2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon hot sauce', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'1 teaspoon peeled and minced fresh ginger', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 medium red bell pepper, seeded and diced', u'1 1 \u20444 pounds lean beef steak (such as sirloin or flank), cut crosswise into 1\u20444-inch-thick strips', u'1 \u20444 cup chopped dry-roasted peanuts', u'1 \u20444 cup chopped scallions (white and green parts)']
title: Beef and Noodles in Thai Peanut Sauce

directions: [u'In a large pot of salted, boiling water, cook rice until tender. Drain, set aside, and keep warm. ', u'In a food processor or blender, combine shallots, garlic, chopped cilantro, ginger, tamarind paste, anchovy, and brown sugar and puree until smooth.', u'In a soup pot, combine puree, cayenne, fish sauce, and clam juice and bring to a boil. Add fish and let simmer for 5 minutes. Add rice and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove soup from the heat and stir in lettuce, radishes, and snow peas. Ladle soup into bowls and serve sprinkled with scallions, cilantro leaves, and cucumber.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup uncooked long-grain rice', u'4 shallots, peeled and coarsely chopped', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1/2 cup chopped cilantro, plus 1/4 cup cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon tamarind paste, softened with 2 tablespoons water, (use 1 tablespoon lime juice if tamarind paste is not available)', u'1 anchovy fillet', u'2 teaspoons brown sugar', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne', u'1 teaspoon fish sauce', u'3 cups clam juice', u'1 to 2 pounds white fish fillets (cod, halibut, or snapper), skinned and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'2 cups shredded iceberg lettuce', u'6 radishes, thinly sliced', u'1 cup snow peas', u'2 scallions, sliced', u'1/2 small cucumber, peeled, trimmed, seeded, and cut into thin julienne strips']
title: Sweet-and-Sour Thai Fish Soup

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a large saucepan, bring the coconut milk and curry paste to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until smooth, about 1 minute. Add the potato, carrots, onion, bell pepper, corn, chile, basil sprigs, lime leaves, and fish sauce. Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 30 minutes. Remove the lid and continue to simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Discard the lime leaves and the basil sprigs. Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with chopped basil and serve over steamed white rice.']
ingredients: [u'2 (13.5-ounce) cans coconut milk*', u'1/2 cup (4 ounces) yellow curry paste (recommended: Mae Ploy*)', u'1 small (about 8 ounces) russet potato, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'2 carrots, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch thick rounds', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1/2 red bell pepper, cored, seeded and chopped', u'1 (15-ounce) can baby corn, rinsed and drained', u'1 Thai chile, such as prik kee noo, or 1 serrano chile, stemmed and thinly sliced*', u'5 sprigs Thai basil, with stems, plus 1/4 cup chopped *', u'3 kaffir lime leaves*', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce*', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets', u' Serving suggestion: steamed white rice']
title: Veggies in Yellow Curry

directions: [u"In a non-reactive saucepan, simmer milk with basil, mint and the vanilla bean and reduce 50%.  If time is available, let herb steep in milk overnight.  Strain out herbs and vanilla bean and heat with sugar.  Bring to scalding.  Hand whisk the yolks in a stainless steel bowl. Temper the yolks by adding only a ladle of hot milk to the yolks.  Mix well then add tempered yolks back to the saucepan.  On medium heat, whisk constantly for 2 minutes.  Strain and cool in an ice bath.  When mixture is cooled, add heavy cream.  Spin base according to manufacturer's instructions.  Do not overspin the base.  Spinning should stop when a soft-serve consistency is achieved, about 8 to10 minutes.  Place in freezer before serving.", u'For the Beaumes de Venise Fruit Compote: In a non-stick skillet, heat everything together and reduce by 20 percent.  Fruit should be hot, but still tender-firm.', u'PLATING In a pasta bowl, spoon the compote and top with 3 quenelles of ice cream.  Serve immediately.', u'Wine Recommendation: Jean Thaeder, Muscat de Rivesaltes']
ingredients: [u'4 cups milk (reduced with Thai basil to 2 cups yield)', u'2 cups Thai basil leaves', u'1/2 cup mint leaves', u'1 Tahitian vanilla bean, split lengthwise and scraped', u'1/2 pound sugar', u'3/4 cup egg yolks', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'1 small pineapple, peeled and 1/2-inch dice', u'2 mangoes, 1/2-inch dice', u'1 small strawberry papaya, 1/2-inch dice', u'1/2 cup Beaume de Venise wine (sweet muscat from Cotes du Rhone)']
title: Thai Basil Ice Cream with Beaumes de Venise Fruit Compote

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and chiles and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add the steak and cook, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes. Add the shallots and bell pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add the fish sauce, sweet soy sauce, black soy sauce and chili paste. Bring the mixture to a low simmer and cook, stirring frequently until the meat is cooked through and the vegetables are tender, about 3 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the basil and mint until wilted. Transfer to a serving dish and serve over steamed white rice.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable or canola oil', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'3 Thai chiles, such as prik kee noo, or 3 serrano chiles, stemmed and thinly sliced*', u'1 pound flank steak, very thinly sliced', u'3 shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, stemmed, cored, seeded and cut into 1/8-inch thick slices', u'1/4 cup fish sauce*', u'2 tablespoons sweet soy sauce*', u'2 tablespoons black soy sauce*', u'1 tablespoon chili paste in soy bean oil*', u'1 1/2 cups chopped fresh Thai basil leaves*', u'1 cup whole fresh mint leaves', u' *Can be found at specialty Asian markets', u' Serving suggestion: sticky or steamed white rice']
title: Spicy Mint Beef

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Place a large, deep skillet over medium heat and coat with the oil. Saute the onion and green peppers for 3 minutes to soften. Split the piece of lemongrass down the middle and whack it with the flat side of a knife to open the flavor. Add the lemongrass, ginger, curry paste and lime leaves to the skillet and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth. Lay the chicken pieces in the mixture to poach; add a pinch of salt. Stir together and simmer over low heat for 10 to 15 minutes. Squeeze in the lime juice and shower with basil and cilantro; serve in dinner bowls with lime wedges.', u'']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, cut in 8 wedges', u'1 green bell pepper, cut in 8 wedges', u'1 stalk lemongrass, white bulb only', u'1 tablespoon coarsely chopped fresh ginger', u'3 tablespoons Thai green curry paste, recipe follows', u'2 kaffir lime leaves', u'3 cups unsweetened coconut milk, 2 (13.5 ounce) cans', u'3/4 cup chicken broth', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut in 1-inch strips', u' Sea salt', u'1 lime, juiced', u' Fresh Thai basil leaves', u' Fresh cilantro leaves', u' Lime wedges, for garnish', u'2 tablespoons coriander seeds', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds', u'1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns', u'8 fresh Thai green chiles', u'2 shallots, coarsely chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, smashed', u' Small handful of fresh cilantro sprigs', u'2 -inch piece galangal, peeled and coarsely chopped', u'2 lemon grass stalks, white part only, coarsely chopped', u'2 kaffir lime leaves, torn', u'2 teaspoons dried shrimp paste', u'1/2 cup water']
title: Green Curry Chicken

directions: [u'Spread the hot leftover rice in a thin layer on a sheet pan and place in a 200 degree F oven overnight or until dry and crispy. Let the rice continue to dry at room temperature for another day for best results. ', u'Break the rice into large chunks and deep fry at 375 degrees F until they puff up and float, approximately 1 minute. Drain on paper towels and set aside.', u'Grate the persimmons on the large hole of a cheese grater, add the remaining ingredients, and adjust seasoning. ', u'Let sit for 5 minutes before serving to let flavors blend. Serve the rice crackers with the dip. Best if eaten within 4 hours.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups boiled white rice (still hot)', u'3 firm fuyu persimmons', u'2 tablespoons dried shrimp, soaked in warm water and chopped', u'1/2 lime, minced (flesh, peel and all)', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 small jalapeno pepper, minced with seeds', u'1/2 bundle Vietnamese mint or cilantro leaves']
title: Thai-Style Rice Crackers with Persimmon Sambal

directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine green mango, papaya, string beans and lemon juice. Set aside for 5 minutes. In a wok or frying pan, heat oil, add garlic and fry until golden. Add onions and fry until clear. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside on absorbent kitchen paper.', u'To the mango mixture add fish sauce, sugar, dried shrimp, chili, cilantro and dried chili flakes, if desired. Toss gently and chill. ', u'Serve on a bed of 2 Bibb lettuce leaves, with garnishes of tomato halves, peanuts, fried onion and garlic']
ingredients: [u'1 green papaya, peeled and julienned', u'2 large green mangoes, peeled and julienned', u'1 pound haricots verts or long string beans, cut into 1-inch sections', u'6 tablespoons  lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon  vegetable oil', u'3 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 onions, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 tablespoon ground dried shrimp*', u'1 teaspoon finely sliced fresh Thai Red Chili*', u'1 bunch cilantro, stems removed', u'1 teaspoon dried chili flakes (optional)', u'8 Bibb lettuce leaves (to serve)', u'12 cherry tomatoes, cut in half (to serve)', u'2 tablespoons roasted ground peanuts', u' Cathy, telephone: (212) 962-2028']
title: Green Mango and Papaya Salad in Classic Thai Dressing (Yam Mamuang)

directions: [u'In medium bowl mix lime juice, fish sauce, garlic, chiles, ginger, sesame oil and sugar. Pour half of the sauce over the fish and let sit for 1 hour refrigerated. Discard the marinade used for the fish. Grill fish over high heat, about 5 to 7 minutes, or until cooked through, and serve with the remaining half of the sauce.', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. The FN chefs have not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups fresh lime juice', u'1/2 cup Thai fish sauce', u'1/4 cup minced garlic', u'1/2 cup Thai bird chiles, seeded and minced', u'2 tablespoons grated ginger', u'1/4 cup sesame oil', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'6 (5-ounce) sea bass fillets']
title: Grilled Sea Bass with Thai Chili Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"You'll need a 2-quart bowl or small trifle dish for these dips. Scoop them out with a big spoon; each dip serves about 8.", u'Fried Noodles ', u'Heat 2 inches of peanut oil in a saucepan until a deep-fry thermometer registers 375 degrees F. Fry 1/2 ounce broken thin rice noodles in batches until they puff, 15 seconds. Drain on paper towels. (Or use chow mein noodles.)', u'Herb Salad ', u'Toss 1/4 cup each chopped mint, cilantro and scallions with 2 teaspoons lime juice, and salt to taste.', u'Spicy Cucumber ', u'Toss 1/2 diced cucumber with 1 1/2 teaspoons sweet Thai chili sauce.', u'Peanut Sauce ', u'Pulse 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter, 2 tablespoons coconut milk,1 tablespoon each soy sauce and rice vinegar, 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped peeled ginger, 1 teaspoon each Sriracha and honey, and the juice of  1/2 lime in a food processor until smooth.', u'Rotisserie Chicken ', u'Shred 1 cup (skin removed).', u'Carrots ', u'Shred 1 cup (about 3).', u'Coconut Dressing ', u'Pulse 3 ounces cream cheese, 1/2 cup cilantro leaves, 1/4 cup coconut milk, the grated zest and juice of 1/2 lime and salt to taste in a food processor until smooth.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
title: 7-Layer Thai Chicken Dip

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Cook noodles according to package directions.', u'Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, combine chicken broth, soy sauce, peanut butter, sesame oil, and hot sauce. Whisk until blended and set pan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer. Simmer 10 minutes.', u'Heat peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ginger and garlic and saute 2 minutes. Add bell pepper and saute 2 minutes. Add shrimp and saute 2 minutes. Add 1 cup of the peanut sauce sauce and simmer 2 minutes, until shrimp are bright pink and cooked through. Drain noodles and add to shrimp mixture. Toss to combine.', u'Transfer noodle mixture to 4 individual plates and top each serving with peanuts, scallions and cilantro, if desired.', u"Reserve remaining peanut sauce for additional meals such as Robin's Steak Salad with Peanut-lime Dressing, or Chicken Satay with Peanut Dipping Sauce."]
ingredients: [u'8 ounces uncooked somen noodles', u'3 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'1 teaspoon hot sauce', u'2 teaspoons peanut oil', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 green bell pepper, seeded and diced', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'1/4 cup dry roasted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup chopped scallions', u' Chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish, optional']
servings: 4 servings (with leftover sauce for additional meals)
title: Peanutty Somen Noodles with Shrimp

directions: [u'Cut 1 stalk of lemon grass in half and on bias.  Skewer the swordfish.  Fine dice the other stalk of lemongrass and mix with 1 tablespoon chopped garlic and 1/4 cup soy oil.  Marinate the swordfish steak.  In a blender, add the Thai basil, egg yolk, rice vinegar, jalepeno, Parmesean cheese, and one tablespoon chopped garlic.  Add 4 ounces of soy oil in a slow steady stream to emulsify the sauce. Blanch long beans in boiling salted water, then saute quickly in a little bit of oil.  Season with salt and white pepper, and then dress the beans with the sesame oil, sesame seeds, soy sauce, and 1 tablespoon rice vinegar. Grill the swordfish for about 8 to 10 minutes. Toss the long beans in sesame dressing, put in the middle of the plate, and on top of the beans put the fried potato noodles.  Lean the swordfish against the potatoes and finish with the thai basil pesto.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces Swordfish', u'2 stalks lemon grass', u'3 tablespoon garlic, chopped', u'2 cups soy or canola oil', u'2 ounces Thai asil (blanched)', u'1 egg yolk', u'1 cup rice vinegar, plus 1 tablespoon for sauce', u'4 ounces oil', u'1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese', u'1 jalapeno', u'1 pound Chinese long beans', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds', u'1 teaspoon sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u' Salt and pepper, to taste', u'1 potato (cut thin on Japanese mandolin and fried)']
title: Lemongrass Skewered Swordfish W/ Thai Basil Pesto & Sesame Long Beans

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'In a saucepan over medium heat, bring 2 cups of water and the soy sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and add the chicken thighs. Simmer until cooked through, about 15 minutes.  Remove the chicken from pan to a cutting board. When cool enough to handle, shred meat and discard the bones. Reserve 1/4 cup for Round 2 Thai Chicken Spring Rolls recipe. ', u'In a small bowl combine the peanut butter, lime juice, sugar, garlic and red pepper flakes. Whisk in about 1/3 cup water and simmer until thick, and a pourable consistency is reached. Reserve 1/4 cup of the dressing for Round 2 Thai Chicken Spring Rolls recipe. ', u'Warm the tortillas in microwave wrapped in a slightly damp towel for about 45 seconds to make them more pliable. Assemble the wraps by layering, the chicken, dressing and vegetables. Top with more dressing before rolling up. Secure with toothpicks and slice in half.  Reserve 1 cup of vegetables for Round 2 Thai Chicken Spring Rolls recipe.']
ingredients: [u'2 cup water, plus 1/3 cup', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'2 pounds, about 5, bone-in chicken thighs', u'1/2 cup peanut butter, chunky style', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon chopped garlic', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'4 large flour tortillas', u'2 carrots, grated', u'1 small cucumber, julienned', u'2 cups shredded cabbage, (reserve 4 outer leaves for Round 2 Pork Cabbage Wraps recipe)', u'1/4 cup freshly chopped cilantro leaves', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Thai Chicken Wraps

directions: [u'To make cilantro paste, puree first six ingredients in a mortar and pestle, or blender, until a fine paste is formed. You can also do this by hand by first chopping all ingredients, except fish sauce, together on a board to form a paste. Then mix with fish sauce in a small bowl. Set aside. ', u'Follow directions on packages for reconstituting cellophane noodles and dried mushrooms, if necessary. Noodles usually need to soak in warm water for about 15 minutes; mushrooms about 30 minutes. ', u'While ingredients are soaking, make dumplings by combining ground pork, fish sauce, garlic, and cornstarch in a bowl. With your hands, form small meatballs, about the size of hazelnuts. Set aside. ', u'When noodles and mushrooms are finished soaking, drain. Remove and discard the tough stems and slice mushrooms into julienne strips. Cut noodles into 2 by 3 inch lengths. ', u'Place all ingredients near stove and bring chicken stock to a boil in a large stockpot. Reduce heat to a simmer and add pork balls, mushrooms, and noodles. Cook, uncovered, until pork is done, about 10 minutes. Stir in paste and adjust seasonings with pepper and fish sauce. Ladle into serving bowls, sprinkle with sliced scallions and cilantro leaves, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 bunch fresh cilantro, stems removed', u'1/2 tablespoon palm sugar or brown sugar', u'1/2 tablespoon freshly grated ginger', u'1 teaspoon cracked black pepper', u'1 teaspoon pureed garlic', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 -ounce cellophane noodles or bean threads', u'1/4 pound fresh or 2 ounces dried black fungus (wood ear mushrooms)', u'10 ounces ground pork (or chicken, turkey or shrimp)', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce', u'1 teaspoon pureed garlic', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'10 cups chicken stock or canned broth', u' Freshly ground black pepper and fish sauce to taste', u'1 bunch scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced', u'1/2 bunch cilantro, leaves only']
title: Thai Pork Dumpling Soup

directions: [u'Make the dressing:  Mince and mash the garlic with the salt until the mixture forms a paste.  In a small bowl stir together the lime juice, the soy sauce, the sugar, the garlic paste, the chilies, and the mint until the sugar is dissolved and let the dressing stand at room temperature for 30 minutes to develop the flavors.', u'Sprinkle both sides of the steak generously with the pepper, rubbing the pepper into the meat, and brush them with some of the oil.  Grill the steak, seasoned with salt, on a well oiled rack set 4 to 5 inches over glowing coals, turning it once, for 16 to 18 minutes, or until it is springy to the touch for medium-rare meat.  (Alternatively, the steak may be cooked in the same manner in a well-seasoned ridged grill pan, brushed with the oil and heated over moderately high heat until the begins to smoke.)  Transfer the steak to a cutting board and let it stand for 15 minutes.', u'While the steak is grilling, in a skillet heat 1/2-inch of the oil over moderately high heat until it is hot but not smoking and in it fry the shallot, stirring, for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until it is golden.  Transfer the shallot with a slotted spoon to paper towels and let it drain.  The shallot may be cooked 1 day in advance and kept covered and chilled.', u'Cut the steak across the grain into 1/4-inch-thick slices and divide the slices among 4 plates, overlapping them in the center.  Surround the steak with the green beans, top the green beans with the bean sprouts, and sprinkle the bean sprouts with the shallot.  Spoon 2 tablespoons of the dressing over each serving of steak and serve the remaining dressing separately.']
ingredients: [u'2 garlic cloves', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 4 -inch fresh hot chilies (preferably red) or jalapeno peppers, or to taste, seeded and sliced thin crosswise (wear rubber gloves)', u'1/3 cup thinly sliced fresh mint leaves, or to taste', u'1 pound boneless sirloin steak (about 1 1/2 inches thick)', u' Freshly ground black pepper to taste', u' Vegetable oil for brushing the steak and for frying the shallot', u'3/4 cup thin lengthwise slices of shallot', u'3/4 pound green beans, trimmed, cut diagonally into 3/4-inch pieces, and cooked until crisp- tender', u'1 1/4 cups fresh bean sprouts, rinsed and the ends trimmed']
title: Thai-Style Steak and Green Bean Salad with Spicy Mint Dressing

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'7 ounces medium rice stick noodles1/4 cup fish sauce1/4 cup rice wine vinegar3 tablespoons palm sugar or dark brown sugar1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper1/4 cup coconut milk1 teaspoon tamarind concentrate, optional1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil3 tablespoons peanut oil12 ounces medium shrimp, peeled and deveined1 cup diced firm tofu1 cup sliced shiitake mushroom caps1 cup mung bean sprouts2 large carrots, cut into matchstick-sized strips1/2 cup matchstick-sized red bell pepper strips2 tablespoons minced garlic1/2 cup roasted, unsalted peanuts, roughly chopped1/2 cup diagonally sliced green onions2 tablespoons fresh lime juice1/4 cup chopped cilantro leavesSriracha (Thai hot sauce), for serving']
title: Shrimp and Vegetable Pad Thai

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Soak the rice stick noodles in tepid water for about 15 minutes.
