Remove them to a cutting board and cut into 4-inch pieces then place in a strainer to let all water drain off, and set aside.', u'Coat the bottom of an omelette pan with a small amount of oil and pour off excess. Beat the eggs together and add to pan forming a thin layer, and cook as you would a thin omelette. Remove from heat and chop cooked egg roughly and set aside, keeping warm until ready to serve.', u'Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a wok or large skillet and add garlic, onion, and red and green peppers, and cook for 2 minutes. One at a time, add the ground peanut, fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar and pepper powder, stirring the mixture the entire time. (Note: chicken, shrimp, or tofu can be added to this dish at the saute stage.) Add the noodles and be sure to stir! The noodles tend to burn if not continuously stirred. Check to see if the taste of the dish is suitable to you, if not, then add in either fish sauce or soy sauce (both salty), or sugar (sweet). (Here is where a matter of preference comes into play.) To serve, place the noodle mixture on a plate, top with cooked egg and garnish with bean sprouts, peanuts and cilantro.']
ingredients: [u'1 (12-ounce) pack dried rice stick noodles (sen lek)', u'6 eggs', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons smashed garlic', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped onion', u'1/2 cup red bell peppers, julienned', u'1/2 cup green bell peppers, julienned', u'1/2 cup ground peanut', u'1/2 cup fish sauce', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons Thai pepper powder', u'1 cup fresh bean sprouts, for garnish', u'1/4 cup shelled peanuts, for garnish', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish']
title: Vegetable Pad Thai

directions: [u'For the chicken: Mix the chicken, coconut milk, fish sauce, soy sauce, turmeric, white pepper and garlic together. Place in the fridge to marinate for at least 3 hours.', u'Once the chicken is marinated, grill or broil it until fully cooked. When cool enough to handle, shred the chicken into bite-size pieces.', u'For the pizza: Lightly oil the crust and place the shredded chicken on top. Cover with the cheeses.', u'Cook according to instructions or the recipe for the crust you are using and cooking device (grill, oven, wood oven).', u'For the plate: After the pizza is cooked, top with the cilantro, nuts, carrots and chili sauce (or a selection of your own favorites).']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds chicken, deboned', u'1 can unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u' Oil, for brushing', u'1 large pizza crust', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 cup shredded mozzarella', u'1 cup shredded Monterey jack', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves', u'1/2 cup peanuts or cashews', u'1/2 cup shredded carrot', u' Sweet garlic chili sauce']
title: Thai Pi

directions: [u'In a large bowl soak the noodles in cold water to cover for 30 minutes, or until they are softened, and drain them well. In a small bowl stir together the fish sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, and cayenne.', u'In a wok or non-stick skillet heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over moderate heat until it is hot but not smoking, add the eggs, and cook them, stirring, until they are scrambled and just cooked through. Transfer the eggs to a bowl and break them into pieces with a spoon. ', u'In the wok or a large heavy skillet heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil over moderately high heat until it just begins to smoke and in it stir-fry the garlic and the shallots until the mixture is golden. Add the shrimp and stir-fry the mixture 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimp are just cooked through. Add the fish sauce mixture, noodles, 2 cups bean sprouts, scallions, and water. Cook the mixture, stirring, for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the noodles are tender and the excess liquid is evaporated. Add the egg, toss the mixture well, and mound it on a platter.', u'Sprinkle the noodle mixture with the peanuts and red pepper flakes and arrange remaining cup bean sprouts around it. Garnish the dish with the chilies, coriander sprigs, and lime wedges.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound dried flat rice noodles* (about 1/4 to 1/2 inch wide)', u'3 tablespoons naam pla* (fish sauce)', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons firmly packed brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne, or to taste', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'3 large eggs, beaten lightly', u'8 garlic cloves, minced', u'4 shallots, minced (about 1/2 cup)', u'3/4 pound medium shrimp, peeled, deveined, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'3 cups fresh bean sprouts, rinsed and spun dry', u'4 scallions, halved lengthwise and cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces', u'3/4 cup water', u'1/3 cup crushed roasted peanuts (use a rolling pin)', u'1/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u' Small fresh red chilies, if desired', u' Fresh coriander sprigs, if desired', u' Lime wedges', u' *available at Asian markets']
title: Paad Thai

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the lime juice, sugar, chile paste, and fish sauce in a bowl until the sugar dissolves. Add the peanuts and cilantro and stir until evenly dressed with the sauce.', u'When ready to serve, arrange the lettuce leaves on a large platter. Put about 14 cup of pineapple in each leaf and season with salt to taste. Top the pineapple with the nut mixture. Serve, letting your guests wrap (or fold) each lettuce leaf to enclose the filling.']
ingredients: [u' Juice of 2 limes (about 14 cup)', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons chile paste, such as sambal oelek (see ShopSmart, right)', u'2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'2 cups roasted peanuts or cashews, roughly chopped', u'23 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro (leaves and stems)', u'12 Bibb lettuce leaves (about 1 head)', u' Half a medium fresh pineapple, peeled, cored, and cut into bite-size chunks (about 3 cups) (see page 274)', u' Kosher salt']
title: Spicy Thai-Style Pineapple Wraps

directions: [u'For the smoked pork butt: Trim some of the fat off of the pork butt and expose about a quarter of the meat. Stir together the cayenne, 2 cups salt and 2 cups pepper and rub the pork butt all over with the spice mix. Let sit at room temperature, 1 hour.', u'Meanwhile, prepare a smoker for cooking at 225 degrees F. Place the pork butt in the smoker and smoke, adding wood chunks as necessary and maintaining a temperature of 225 degrees F, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the pork registers 165 degrees F, about 9 hours. Remove the pork and shred off the meat. (Yield: 10 to 12 servings)', u'For the Brussels sprouts: Fill a large pot with canola oil and bring to 350 degrees F over medium-high heat. Line a baking sheet with paper towels. Fry a quarter of the Brussels sprouts until caramelized, 2 to 3 minutes, then transfer to the lined baking sheet for 30 seconds. Transfer to a stainless steel bowl and toss with a quarter of the Thai vinaigrette, a quarter of the cilantro and a quarter of the sesame seeds. Bring the oil back to 350 degrees F and repeat with the remaining ingredients in the same manner.', u'Put the Brussels sprouts into a bowl and garnish with lime wedges and some toasted sesame seeds. Serve with some Smoked Pork Butt and Sweet and Smoky BBQ Sauce. Reserve the remaining']
ingredients: [u' One 8- to 10-pound pork butt', u'1/4 cup cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Sweet and Smoky BBQ Sauce, recipe follows', u' Canola oil, for frying', u'1 pound Brussels sprouts, roots trimmed and halved lengthwise', u'1 cup Thai Chili Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted, plus additional for garnish', u'4 lime wedges', u'8 ounces brown sugar', u'1 ounce Bourbon Barrel brand bourbon-smoked paprika', u'3 tablespoons cayenne pepper', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1 teaspoon onion powder', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'30 ounces tomato sauce', u'18 ounces ketchup', u'8 ounces tomato paste', u'6 ounces honey', u'6 ounces molasses', u'6 ounces Bourbon Barrel brand bourbon barrel-aged Worcestershire sauce', u'4 ounces cola, such as Coca-Cola', u'4 ounces apple cider vinegar', u'2 ounces browning and seasoning sauce, such as Kitchen Bouquet', u'3 tablespoons liquid smoke', u'1 1/4 cups fish sauce', u'1 cup white sugar', u' Zest of 3 limes plus 1/2 cup freshly squeezed lime juice', u'1/4 cup rice wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons peeled and chopped ginger', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic', u'1 teaspoon minced kaffir lime leaf', u'3 Thai chiles, de-stemmed and chopped', u'1/2 cup sambal oelek (an Asian chile paste)']
servings: 4 servings with leftover pork and sauce
title: Smoked Pork Butt with Sweet and Smoky BBQ Sauce and Brussels Sprouts with Thai Chili Vinaigrette

directions: [u'On a dinner plate, mix together the flour, tumeric and cumin.  Season the fillets with salt and pepper and dredge in the flour mixture.  In a large saute pan on high heat, coat lightly with oil and pan sear the fillets until brown on both sides, about 4 to 5 minutes a side.  Let fish rest 5 minutes to carry over before serving.  In a medium, non-reactive saucepan on medium heat, coat lightly with oil and saute the onions and ginger until soft, about 3 minutes.  Add the preserved lemons, tomatoes and juice.   Season and check for flavor.  Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, until tomatoes are melted. Pull off stove and keep at room temperature.  Check again for seasoning.  Add the parsley right before serving.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 cup chick pea flour', u'1/2 tablespoon ground turmeric', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'4 (6 to 8 ounce) fillets mahi-mahi, preferable center cut', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Oil', u'1 red onion, 1/4-inch dice', u'1 tablespoon minced ginger', u'1/2 cup preserved lemon, 1/4-inch dice (1 large lemon)', u'3 cups ripe tomatoes, 1/4-inch dice (2 large tomatoes)', u'2 lemons, juiced', u'1/2 cup chopped flat leaf parsley, plus extra for garnish', u' Extra virgin olive oil, for cooking', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1/4 cup minced shallots', u'2 cups sliced shiitakes', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'3 cups blanched orzo (about 1/2 pound dry)', u'1/4 cup basil oil, plus extra for garnish) (Already made: 1 cup basil, 1/2 cup spinach, 1/2 cup canola oil, pinch of salt. Blanch in salted water, 2 minutes, drain, and blend with oil.)', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Pan Seared Mahi-Mahi with Preserved Lemon-Tomato Chutney Thai Basil-Shiitake Orzo

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Combine the yogurt, ginger, garlic, and curry powder in a shallow mixing bowl, stir to combine. Place the chicken strips in the yogurt marinade and gently toss until well coated. Cover and let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at up to 2 hours. ', u'Thread the chicken pieces onto the soaked skewers working the skewer in and out of the meat, down the middle of the piece, so that it stays in place during grilling. Place a grill pan over medium heat and brush it with oil to prevent the meat from sticking. Grill the chicken satays for 3 to 5 minutes on each side, until nicely seared and cooked through. Serve the satays on a platter lined with lettuce leaves and cilantro; accompanied by a small bowl of peanut sauce on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'1 teaspoon freshly grated ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon curry powder', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips', u'20 wooden skewers, soaked in water 30 minutes', u' Vegetable oil, for grilling', u' Butter lettuce leaves', u' Fresh cilantro leaves', u' Peanut sauce, recipe follows', u'1 cup smooth peanut butter', u'1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons red chili paste, such as sambal', u'2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', u'2 limes, juiced', u'1/2 cup hot water', u'1/4 cup chopped peanuts, for garnish']
title: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the cucumber, peppers, tomatoes and red onion in a large bowl.', u'For the vinaigrette, whisk together the garlic, oregano, mustard, vinegar, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Still whisking, slowly add the olive oil to make an emulsion. Pour the vinaigrette over the vegetables. Add the feta and olives and toss lightly. Set aside for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Serve at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 hothouse cucumber, unpeeled, seeded, and sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'1 red bell pepper, large-diced', u'1 yellow bell pepper, large-diced', u'1 pint cherry or grape tomatoes, halved', u'1/2 red onion, sliced in half-rounds', u'1/2 pound feta cheese, 1/2-inch diced (not crumbled)', u'1/2 cup calamata olives, pitted', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup good red wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup good olive oil']
title: Greek Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Combine vegetables, olives, and parsley in a large bowl. Rest sliced feta on the top of salad. Combine oil, vinegar, and oregano in a small plastic container with a lid. Shake vigorously to combine oil and vinegar and pour over salad and cheese. Season with salt and pepper and let the salad marinate until ready to serve. Serve salad with pita bread blistered and warmed on a hot griddle or grill pan.']
ingredients: [u'3 vine ripe tomatoes, cut into chunks', u'1 red onion, thinly sliced', u'1/2 European seedless cucumber, cut into bite-size chunks', u'1 small red bell pepper, seeded and chunked', u'1 small green bell pepper, seeded and chunked', u'1 cubanelle pepper, seeded and chunked', u'1 cup Kalamata black olives', u' Several sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, about 1/2 cup', u'2 (1/4 pound) slices imported Greek feta', u'1/4 cup (a couple of glugs) extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 tablespoons (3 splashes) red wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed in palm of your hand', u' Coarse salt and black pepper', u' Pita breads']
title: Greek Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, garlic, salt, and oil. Stir in the oregano and pepper to taste. Set aside.', u'When ready to serve: In a large bowl lightly toss the lettuce with some of the dressing. Divide the lettuce among 4 salad bowls. Scatter the olives, cheese, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and peppers over the top of the greens. Serve and pass the remaining dressing at the table.']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt plus more to taste', u'1 cup extra-virgin olive oil, preferably Greek', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh oregano', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 head romaine lettuce (about 1 pound), trimmed of tough stems and torn into bite-sized pieces', u'6 ounces calamata olives, about 1 cup', u'1/2 pound Feta cheese, crumbled', u'1 English (seedless) cucumber, trimmed, cut into 1 inch chunks', u'12 ounces vine-ripened cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 small red onion, cut into 1/2-inch wedges, soaked in cold water for 5 minutes and drained', u'1 green pepper, trimmed, seeded, and diced', u' Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
title: Greek Salad

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'To prepare the eggplants: Cut off the stems, remove the skin with a vegetable peeler, and cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch thick slices. Season all the pieces of eggplant with salt and pepper on both sides. Coat a large skillet with oil and heat over medium flame. Fry the eggplant in a single layer, turning once, until brown on both sides- you will need to do this in batches, adding more oil, as necessary. Drain the eggplant as they cook on a paper towel-lined platter.', u'Add a little more oil to the pan and toss in the onion, garlic, lemon slices, oregano, and parsley. Cook and stir until soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add the ground lamb, stirring to break up the meat; season with salt and pepper, and toss in the cinnamon stick. Stir in the tomato paste and hand-crushed tomatoes. Simmer until the liquid has evaporated, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Line the bottom of a 9 by 13-inch glass or ceramic baking dish with 1/3 of the eggplant slices; they should completely cover the bottom with no gaps. Spread 1/2 of the meat sauce over the eggplant, evening it out with a spatula. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the feta and Parmesan. Repeat the layers again, ending with a final layer of eggplant. Cover the top with a nice even layer of bread crumbs. Bake the moussaka for 30 to 40 minutes or until the top is golden. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'3 large eggplants', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'1/2 lemon, sliced in thin circles', u'1 handful fresh oregano leaves, chopped', u'2 handfuls fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped', u'2 pounds ground lamb', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'3 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 (16-ounce) can whole tomatoes, drained and hand-crushed', u'8 ounces feta cheese, crumbled', u'1 cup freshly grated Parmesan', u'1 cup fresh bread crumbs']
title: Greek Moussaka

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Whisk together the lemon juice, vinegar, oregano, garlic and some salt and pepper in a small bowl. Slowly whisk in the oil until emulsified. Let sit at room temperature while you prepare the salad to allow the flavors to meld.', u'Rinse the quinoa in a strainer until the water runs clear. Combine the quinoa, 2 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small saucepan, bring to a boil and cook until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes.', u'Transfer to a bowl, fluff with a fork and let sit for 5 minutes to cool slightly. Add the tomatoes, olives, green onions, cherry peppers, red onions, cucumbers and dressing and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to 8 hours before serving. The longer it sits the better the flavor.', u'Just before serving, transfer to a platter and sprinkle feta on top.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 clove garlic, smashed and finely chopped to a paste', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup quinoa', u' Kosher salt and pepper', u'2 cups red and yellow grape tomatoes, halved', u'1 cup pitted kalamata olives', u'2 green onions (green and pale green part), thinly sliced', u'2 pickled cherry peppers, diced', u'1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'1/2 English cucumber, cut into small dice', u' Feta, for sprinkling']
title: Greek Quinoa Salad

author: Robert Irvine
directions: [u'Add the vinegar to a blender, replace the lid, turn it on, and through the feed tube add, 1 at a time, the garlic, crushed red pepper, salt, and black pepper. Leaving the blender running, add the olive oil in a slow thin stream. Set aside until needed.', u'Toss the greens, olives and cucumbers together with enough dressing to coat. Fold in the feta cheese. Serve additional dressing on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u'1 large clove garlic, quartered', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'3/4 cup olive oil', u'6 cups mixed mesclun greens, soaked in salt water to remove grit, dried in a salad spinner and torn into bite-sized pieces', u'1 cup kalamata olives, pitted', u'2 English cucumbers, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch disks', u'1 cup cubed feta cheese']
title: Greek Salad

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'For the lamb: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the lamb, sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook until the meat gets nice and golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes. With a slotted spoon, remove the lamb and reserve. Lower the heat to medium and saute the onions in the lamb juices until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the oregano and garlic and cook until fragrant. Season. Add the tomato paste and cook until it caramelizes. Deglaze with the red wine and scrape any bits up that have adhered to the pan. Add the lamb back in, stir and set aside.', u'For the tzatziki: Grate the cucumber on the large holes of a box grater and place in a fine-meshed strainer or cheese cloth fitted over a bowl. Salt the cucumber and let sit 10 minutes. Then squeeze out any excess moisture. Add the strained cucumber into a bowl with the yogurt, feta, garlic and mint. Adjust the seasoning if necessary.', u'For the cucumber tomato relish: Toss the olive oil, vinegar, tomatoes, cucumbers and onions in a bowl and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Cover and let sit at least 1 hour to marry the flavors.', u'For the sandwich build: Schmear the tzatziki on the pitas, then place on the lamb and top with cucumber tomato relish.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'2 pounds ground lamb', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 red onion, minced', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'2 tablespoons dry red wine', u'1 English cucumber', u' Salt', u'1 cup whole-milk Greek yogurt', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1 clove garlic, minced or pressed', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh mint', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'2 firm tomatoes, seeded and diced', u'1 English cucumber, seeded and diced', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'4 non-pocket pitas, oiled and lightly griddled on each side']
title: Greek Taco!

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large saute pan. Add the bread cubes and sprinkle with salt; cook over low to medium heat, tossing frequently, for 5 to 10 minutes, until nicely browned. Add more olive oil as needed.', u'Place the cucumber, red pepper, yellow pepper, tomatoes and red onion in a large bowl.', u'For the vinaigrette, whisk together the garlic, oregano, mustard, vinegar, 1 teaspoon salt and the pepper in a small bowl. While still whisking, add the olive oil and make an emulsion. Pour the vinaigrette over the vegetables. Add the feta, olives and bread cubes and mix together lightly. Set aside for 30 minutes for the flavors to blend. Serve at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u' Good olive oil', u'1 small French bread or boule, cut into 1-inch cubes (6 cups)', u' Kosher salt', u'1 hothouse cucumber, unpeeled, seeded, and sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'1 red bell pepper, large diced', u'1 yellow bell pepper, large diced', u'1 pint cherry or grape tomatoes, halved', u'1/2 red onion, sliced in half rounds', u'1/2 pound feta cheese, cut in 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/2 cup calamata olives, pitted', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup good red wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup good olive oil']
title: Greek Panzanella

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Season both sides of the cheese with salt and pepper. Place the cheese in a shallow dish and cover with brandy. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Season the flour with salt and pepper. Remove the cheese from the pan, reserving 1/4 cup of the brandy and dredge in the seasoned flour, coating completely. In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Pan-fry the cheese for 2 minutes on each side. Add the reserved brandy and carefully flame the liquor, shaking the pan back and forth several times. Add the lemon juice. Remove from the pan and serve with the pita bread and olives.']
ingredients: [u'8 (1/2-inch) slices Kasseri cheese', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups brandy', u'1 cup flour', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'2 lemons, juiced', u'8 rounds of pita bread, brushed with olive oil, grilled and quartered', u'1 cup Kalamata olives']
title: Greek Saganaki

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Pour the canned tomatoes into a 3 1/2-quart baking dish and spread to cover the bottom. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients (excluding the bread). Toss to coat. Pour the vegetables over the canned tomatoes in an even layer. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake until the edges of the vegetables are golden, about 30 to 40 minutes.', u'Serve alone as a side, or over toasted sourdough bread for a main dish.']
ingredients: [u'1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes with their juice', u'2 zucchini, cut into 1-inch rounds', u'2 summer squash, cut into 1-inch rounds', u'2 tomatoes, cut into wedges', u'1 large Japanese eggplant, cut into 1-inch rounds', u'1 red onion, peeled and cut into 1-inch wedges', u'1 potato, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'4 to 6 slices toasted sourdough bread, optional for main dish']
title: Greek Caponata

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Combine chick peas, juice of 1 lemon, oregano and parsley in food processor. Mash garlic into paste with some salt pressing under the flat part of your knife then add garlic to processor along with tahini paste. Process hummus, drizzling in olive oil, until smooth then transfer to a bowl and stir in olives, reserving a few for garnish. Serve dip with pita crisps and vegetable sticks.']
ingredients: [u'1 (15-ounce) can chick peas, drained', u'1 lemon', u'1 sprig fresh oregano, leaves chopped', u' A handful fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 clove garlic, finely chopped', u' Salt', u'2 rounded tablespoons tahini paste', u' Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 cup kalamata olives, well drained, coarsely chopped', u"1 sack pita chips, sea salt variety (recommended: Stacy's)", u'1/2 seedless cucumber, cut into sticks for dipping', u' A medium red pepper, seeded and cut into strips for dipping']
title: Greek Hummus

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Season both sides of the cheese with salt and pepper. Place the cheese in a shallow dish and cover with brandy. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Season the flour with salt and pepper. Remove the cheese from the dish, reserving 1/4 cup of the brandy, and dredge in the seasoned flour, coating completely. ', u'In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Pan-fry the cheese for 2 minutes on each side. Add the reserved brandy and carefully flame the liquor, shaking the pan back and forth several times. Add the lemon juice, to taste. Remove from the pan and serve with the pita bread and olives.']
ingredients: [u'8 (1/2-inch) slices kasseri cheese (about 1 1/2 ounces each)', u' Salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups brandy, or enough to cover cheese slices', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'3 to 4 tablespoons lemon juice', u'4 rounds of pita bread, brushed with olive oil, grilled and quartered', u'1 cup kalamata olives']
title: Greek Saganaki

author: Michael Symon
directions: [u'In a medium skillet, sweat onion and garlic in 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat until translucent, about 2 minutes. Let cool and set aside.', u'Wring the excess milk out of the soaked bread cubes. ', u'Place all ingredients, except flour and garnishes, in a large mixing bowl and combine by hand until fully incorporated. Form into little meatballs (about 1-ounce each). ', u'In a large skillet, heat remaining oil over medium heat. Dredge, or roll the meatballs in flour, and fry in the skillet until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Remove from the pan and place on paper towels to drain the excess fat.', u'Place on platter and garnish with lemon wedges and torn mint leaves.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup grated onion', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1 cup olive oil', u'1 cup day old bread, small diced and soaked in milk', u'1 pound ground beef or lamb', u'1 egg', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Pinch nutmeg', u'1 lemon, zested', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Flour, for dredging', u'12 lemon wedges, for garnish', u' Mint leaves, for garnish']
title: Greek Meatballs

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Toss 3 quartered tomatoes, some fresh oregano, 2 tablespoons capers (with 3 tablespoons of the liquid), 1 tablespoon sliced pickled peppers (with 1 tablespoon of the liquid), 3 tablespoons olive oil, and salt and pepper. Toss in watercress, sliced scallions and pitted Greek olives.', u'Photographs by Con Poulos']
title: Greek Salad

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Add the chopped lettuce, tomato wedges, cucumber chunks, onion slices, halved olives, half the feta and some parsley to a large bowl.', u'Combine the olive oil, vinegar, sugar, garlic, 1/4 teaspoon salt, pepper and chopped olives in a bowl or mason jar. Whisk or shake together until combined. Taste and adjust seasonings (I almost always add a little more sugar).', u'Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients, then add some salt and pepper. Toss with tongs or clean hands. Just before serving, top with the remaining feta and squeeze a little lemon juice over the top.']
ingredients: [u'1 head romaine lettuce, chopped', u'4 whole ripe tomatoes, cut into 6 wedges each, then each wedge cut in half', u'1 whole (large) cucumber, peeled, cut into fourths lengthwise, and diced into large chunks', u'1/2 whole red onion, sliced very thin', u'30 whole pitted kalamata olives, cut in half lengthwise, plus 6 olives, chopped fine', u'6 ounces crumbled feta cheese', u' Fresh parsley leaves, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar, or more to taste', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 whole lemon, for squeezing']
title: Easy Greek Salad

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the crust: Place an oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Dust a heavy baking sheet with cornmeal. Set aside.', u'On a lightly floured work surface, roll out the dough into a 1/4-inch thick rectangle about 16 inches long and 8 inches wide. Transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet.', u'For the topping: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the leeks and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds until aromatic. In batches, add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and add the feta cheese and mint. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Using the tines of a fork, prick the surface of the dough all over. Spread the spinach mixture on top and dot with butter.', u'Bake until the dough is golden and crunchy, 15 to 18 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Cornmeal, for dusting', u' Flour, for dusting', u'1 (1 pound) ball store-bought pizza dough', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 leeks, pale green and white parts only, thinly sliced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'12 ounces baby spinach leaves', u'1 (4-ounce) chunk feta cheese, crumbled (recommended: Athenos)', u'3/4 cup chopped fresh mint', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened']
title: Greek Pizza

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Place a cooling rack over 2 baking sheets for roasting the meatballs and toasting the pita.', u'Soak the bread in the milk. Peel the cucumber and grate into a strainer. Salt it and let it drain for 20 minutes.', u'Pour the EVOO into a bowl, then add the meat and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Squeeze out the bread and crumble between your fingers as you add it to the meat. Add the mint, onions, oregano, cinnamon, 2 of the garlic cloves, egg and 1/2 of the lemon juice, and mix to combine.', u'Using a small ice cream scoop, form the meat mixture into about 24 balls and place on the baking sheet. Roast to golden brown, 15 to 18 minutes. Remove the meatballs from the oven and place the broiler on high. Char the pita under the broiler, 30 seconds to 1 minute on each side.', u'Press the cucumber in the strainer to get out the excess water and add to a food processor. Then add the yogurt, dill, remaining 1 clove garlic, zest and remaining juice of the lemon. Season the sauce with cumin and salt and process until smooth.', u'Serve the meatballs with the sauce and pitas.']
ingredients: [u'2 slices white bread, 1-inch thick', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup milk, to moisten', u'1/2 seedless cucumber', u' Kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons EVOO', u'1 1/2 pounds ground lamb or beef', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh mint', u'3 tablespoons grated red onion', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh oregano', u'2 pinches cinnamon', u'3 cloves garlic, grated or pasted', u'1 large egg', u' Zest and juice of 1 lemon', u'4 pocket-less pitas or flat breads, cut into wedges', u'1 1/2 cups Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup fresh dill', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin']
title: Greek Meatballs and Tzatziki

directions: [u'Heat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Cut pita rounds into 6 wedges each with knife or kitchen scissors. Scatter wedges onto a baking sheet and spray with olive oil cooking spray. Season with salt and bake 10 minutes until golden. Remove from the oven and cool. ', u'Heat a large high sided skillet with extra-virgin olive oil, 2 turns of the pan, over medium- high heat until oil ripples. Add beef or lamb, brown and crumble meat, about 5 minutes. Season the meat with salt, pepper, oregano, cinnamon. Add the onions, garlic and eggplant and cook 6 to 7 minutes then stir in spinach and tomato sauce. Simmer a few minutes and adjust seasonings.  ', u'Chop olives with lemon zest and parsley - Greek Gremolata!', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook orzo according to box instructions.', u'Drain orzo and combine with meat goulash. Top bowls of goulash with feta cheese, pita chips and olive gremolata.']
ingredients: [u'6 pita rounds', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 pounds ground sirloin or lamb', u' Black pepper', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano or 2 sprigs fresh, finely chopped', u'2 pinches ground cinnamon', u'1 onion, chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, grated', u'1 small eggplant, peeled and chopped into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 box frozen spinach, 10 ounces, defrosted and wrung dry in towel', u'1 (15-ounce) can tomato sauce', u'1/2 cup pitted, chopped kalamata black olives', u'1 lemon, zested', u'1/2 cup chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'1/2 pound orzo pasta', u'1 1/2 cups crumbled feta cheese']
title: Greek Goulash

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the carrots, onion, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables soften, about 5 minutes. Add the farro and cook, stirring, until toasted, 1 minute. Add the chicken broth and 3 cups water; cover and bring to a boil. Add the lemon zest, reduce the heat to medium low and simmer, uncovered, until the farro is almost tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in the chicken.', u'Whisk the eggs and lemon juice in a bowl; drizzle 1/2 cup of the hot broth into the eggs, whisking constantly. Gradually stir the hot egg mixture into the pot. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 3 minutes. Season with 1/4 teaspoon salt.', u'Combine the feta and dill in a small bowl; season with salt and pepper. Fill the pita halves with the feta mixture and lightly brush with olive oil. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake until the cheese melts, 2 to 3 minutes. Top each serving of soup with more dill; season with pepper. Serve with the stuffed pitas.', u'Photograph by Ryan Dausch']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing', u'2 carrots, chopped', u'1 onion, chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 cup farro', u'4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 wide strip lemon zest (removed with a vegetable peeler), plus the juice of 2 lemons', u'1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken breast, skin removed', u'3 large eggs', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese (about 2 ounces)', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, plus more for topping', u'2 pitas, halved']
title: Greek Lemon Chicken Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"Make your own Greek yogurt: Line a sieve with a coffee filter and set it over a bowl. Place 4 cups plain whole-milk yogurt in the filter and refrigerate for 12 hours (you'll get about 2 cups thick yogurt). Divide among bowls; top with honey, dried fruit and walnuts. Serve with almond cookies.", u'Photograph by Tina Rupp']
title: Greek Yogurt

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u"Into the largest saucepan or casserole you have that will go into the oven, pour 3 tablespoons of the oil. Brown the meat in batches over high heat and remove with a slotted spoon to a plate nearby. You may need more oil as you do this. The onions will certainly need it, so pour the remaining oil or add more, add the onions, sprinkling a little salt over them and cook then until soft and translucent. Add the garlic, celery, thyme, and oregano. After a couple of minutes or so, when the smell of garlic wafts up, remove half the mixture. Add the meat to the mixture in the pan, cover with the remaining half, add the bay leaves, carrots, tomatoes, stock and wine. I use a big but flattish casserole and this amount of liquid covers the meat, but if you find you need more liquid, add water- you want a lot of liquid, because you will, eventually, be cooking some pasta in it. Bring to a boil, remove scum, and let bubble for about 3 minutes. Then cover, transfer to the oven, and bake for about 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or cook on a very low heat. The meat should be tender and yielding. Remove the carrots (and eat, cook's treat) and bay leaves, too, if you want, and season, to taste, with the salt and pepper.", u"Of course you can proceed to the final stage now, but I am presuming you're not going to. In which case, let the stew cool and keep it in the refrigerator until you want it. Skim the fat off the top, and do remember to take it out of the refrigerator a good 1 to 2 hours before you cook it again. You can reheat this in the oven, but because the pasta will be put in on the stove, I tend to heat it there. Make sure the stew is piping hot. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a boil. When it boils, add the salt and then pasta. Cook this until it's nearly but not quite cooked; it should have a couple of minutes still to go.", u"Then drain the pasta and add it quickly to the bubbling juices in the casserole, making sure first that there are enough bubbling juices. You don't want the meat to be drowned, but you want enough for the pasta to be covered. The pasta will absorb some of the liquid as it finishes cooking, of course.", u'In a couple of minutes, the pasta should be cooked. Crumble some feta and put in a bowl with the chopped parsley, oregano, or basil. Stir to combine and then leave the spoon with it, so that people can sprinkle the herb-spiked cheese over the stew as they wish. Ladle the stew into shallow soup bowls.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons olive oil, plus more if needed', u'5 1/2 pounds boned shoulder of lamb, trimmed of excess fat and cut into cubes about 1 1/2 by 2 1/2 inches', u'5 medium onions, sliced finely', u' Salt', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 celery stalks, minced', u' Leaves from 4 thyme sprigs', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3 bay leaves', u'2 carrots, peeled, halved lengthways, and then halved across', u'3 (14.5 ounces) cans diced tomatoes', u'1 1/4 cups lamb, beef stock or water', u'1 bottle dry white wine', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 pound ditalini or other small tubular pasta', u'2/3 pound feta cheese', u'2 to 3 tablespoons finely chopped parsley, oregano or basil leaves']
title: Greek Lamb Stew

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 325 degrees F. Coat a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray. Wrap the bottom and sides of the pan with a large piece of foil and place the pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Put the pita chips into a food processor and pulse until fine. Add the butter and process until the crumbs are moistened. Press the crumbs into the bottom and about 1/2 inch up the sides of the prepared pan. Bake until the crust is slightly dry in appearance and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Cool completely.', u'Meanwhile, combine the yogurt, cream cheese, eggs, sugar, flour, vanilla, lemon zest and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a food processor and process until well blended and smooth. Pour over the prepared crust and bake until the center is just set, 40 to 50 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack, then cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours or overnight.', u'Meanwhile, put the blueberries and pineapple juice in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes, then remove from heat. Sprinkle the gelatin over 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl and let stand 5 minutes. Stir the dissolved gelatin into the hot blueberry mixture until combined. Transfer the mixture to a medium bowl, cover and chill until thickened, about 3 hours.', u'After chilling the cheesecake, remove the springform ring. Slice and serve, topped with the blueberry sauce. If the sauce is too thick, rewarm it in the microwave for 20 seconds at a time before spooning over the cheesecake.', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'2 cups cinnamon-sugar pita chips, lightly crushed', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'1 17 -ounce container plain 2-percent Greek yogurt', u'8 ounces reduced-fat cream cheese, at room temperature', u'3 large eggs', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups frozen wild blueberries', u'3/4 cup unsweetened pineapple juice', u'1 teaspoon unflavored gelatin']
title: Greek Yogurt Cheesecake

author: Claire Robinson
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the oil, oregano leaves, garlic, lemon juice and salt and pepper, to taste. Pat the chicken dry and place in a re-sealable plastic bag. Pour the mixture over the chicken and seal the bag, pressing out any excess air, and then turn the bag over several times to distribute the marinade. Put the chicken bag in a shallow dish and marinate, in the refrigerator, for at least 12 hours and up to 24 hours.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degree F.', u'Place a grill pan over moderately-high heat until very hot. Place the chicken skin-side down and cook until well browned, 10 to 13 minutes. Flip the chicken over and cook for another 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a sheet pan and finish cooking in the oven until golden brown and cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. Let the chicken rest 10 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 bunch fresh oregano, leaves picked', u'4 cloves garlic, finely minced', u' Juice of 1 to 2 lemons', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1 whole organic chicken, quartered']
title: Grilled Greek Chicken

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Special equipment: strong scissors or poultry shears', u'To spatchcock the chicken, use strong kitchen scissors or poultry shears and cut down either side of the spine. Pull out the spine, turn the chicken over and press down on the breast of the chicken to flatten it out to one thickness.', u'Whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice and zest, garlic, oregano, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium bowl. Put the chicken in a gallon-size resealable plastic bag in a rimmed dish. Pour in half of the marinade, reserving the rest for serving later. Seal the bag and rotate it around to evenly distribute the marinade. Refrigerate for 1 hour.', u'Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and season generously all over with salt and pepper; let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.', u"Prepare a grill for medium indirect heat: For gas grills (with 3 or more burners), turn all the burners to medium-high heat; after about 15 minutes turn off one of the middle burners and turn the remaining burners down to medium. For charcoal grills, bank one chimney starter-full of lit and ashed-over charcoal briquettes to one side of the grill. Set up a drip pan on the other side to avoid flare-ups. (Be sure to consult the grill manufacturer's guide for best results.)", u'Place the chicken skin-side up on the indirect side of the grill with the legs facing the hotter side. Cover and cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the thigh (avoiding the bone) reads 150 to 160 degrees F (almost cooked through), about 50 minutes.', u'Move the chicken over to the direct-heat side of the grill. After 2 minutes, flip the chicken to char and crisp up the skin side, another 3 or 4 minutes.  Check that the temperature in the thigh is now at least 165 degrees F. If it is not, then move the chicken back to the indirect side, cover and cook until the final temperature is reached. Remove from the grill; let rest 20 minutes before carving.', u'Stir the scallions and dill into the reserved marinade. Drizzle over the chicken or serve on the side.', u'', u'Copyright 2016 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1 whole chicken (3 1/2 to 4 pounds) spatchcocked', u'1 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u' Juice of 2 lemons and zest of 1', u'3 garlic cloves, finely grated', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 scallions, sliced', u'1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh dill']
title: Grilled Spatchcocked Greek Chicken

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'Combine the barley, 3 cups water and a pinch salt in a medium-size saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the barley is tender, about 45 minutes. Drain in a colander and let cool.', u'Combine the tomatoes, feta, olives, mint, bell pepper and shallots in a bowl. Add the cooled barley.', u'Whisk together the red wine vinegar and olive oil in a separate small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Dress the salad and toss. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator until ready to serve.', u"Cook's Note: It's best to make the barley salad at least 3 hours ahead of time so the flavors have time to mingle."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup pearled barley', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups yellow and red cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1/2 cup pitted kalamata olives', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh mint', u'1 small red bell pepper, seeded, ribs removed and diced', u'1 shallot, minced', u'3 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Barley Greek Salad

directions: [u'Season 1/2 chicken with salt, pepper, oregano and lemon juice. Place on grill for about 30 minutes or until juices run clear.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 chicken', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'1/2 lemon, juiced']
title: Greek Chicken

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'In a large bowl combine the beef, spinach, zucchini, onion, bulghur, egg, oregano, salt and a few grinds of pepper. Mix until thoroughly combined.', u'Arrange the pepper halves cut side up in a 9 by 13-inch baking dish and fill each pepper half with the meat mixture. Pour the tomatoes over the peppers and sprinkle with the feta cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake until the meat mixture is completely cooked and the peppers are tender, about 25 minutes longer.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound lean ground beef', u'1 (10-ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry', u'1 medium zucchini, coarsely grated (about 2 cups)', u'1 small onion, minced (about 1 cup)', u'1/2 cup bulghur', u'1 egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'3 red bell peppers, halved lengthwise, cores and ribs removed', u'2 (14 1/2-ounce) cans low-sodium stewed tomatoes, finely chopped', u'1/3 cup crumbled feta cheese']
title: Greek-Style Stuffed Peppers

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring 1 3/4 cups water, the quinoa and a pinch of salt to a boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce the heat to medium low; cover and cook until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is absorbed, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and fluff with a fork; let cool slightly.', u'Meanwhile, toss the chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, vinegar, 2 tablespoons olive oil and the oregano in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper and let sit 10 minutes.', u'Pulse the feta, 2 tablespoons water and the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a mini food processor until smooth, adding up to 1 tablespoon water, if needed; season with salt and pepper.', u'Divide the lettuce among bowls; top with the warm quinoa, the chickpea mixture and olives. Drizzle with the feta dressing and sprinkle with oregano.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'1 1/4 cups quinoa, rinsed', u' Kosher salt', u'1 15 -ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed', u'1/2 seedless cucumber, chopped', u'3 large plum or 5 Campari tomatoes, chopped', u'1/2 red onion, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh oregano, plus more for topping', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese (about 2 ounces)', u'1 small head romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1/4 cup halved pitted kalamata olives']
title: Greek Quinoa Salad

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the garlic, rosemary, oregano, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 3/4 teaspoon pepper in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade and pulse until the herbs are finely minced. Add the lemon juice, olive oil, and red wine and combine. Place the chops in a glass or ceramic dish just large enough to hold them in a single layer. Pour the marinade over the chops, turning to coat both sides. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours but preferably overnight.', u'When ready to cook, prepare a grill with one layer of hot coals or turn a gas grill to medium-high heat. Remove the lamb from the marinade, sprinkle generously with salt and pepper, and grill for 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Remove to a platter, cover tightly with aluminum foil, and set aside to rest for 10 minutes. Serve hot with the cold Yogurt Mint Sauce.']
ingredients: [u'4 large garlic cloves', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary leaves', u'1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (4 lemons)', u'1/2 cup good olive oil', u'1/2 cup dry red wine', u'2 racks of lamb, frenched and cut into 8 chops each', u' Yogurt Mint Sauce, recipe follows', u'6 scallions, white and green parts, chopped', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh mint leaves', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh dill', u' Pinch crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 tablespoon good olive oil', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'7 ounces Greek-style yogurt (recommended: Fage Total)', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Lamb with Yogurt Mint Sauce

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Soak the onion in a small bowl of ice water, about 5 minutes. Make the dressing: Whisk the vinegar, pepperoncini or olive brine, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Whisk in the olive oil in a slow stream until blended.', u'Drain the onion and add to the bowl with the dressing. Add the lettuce, herbs, tomatoes and cucumbers and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Divide among bowls and top with the pepperoncini and/or olives, feta and stuffed grape leaves.', u'Per serving: Calories 338; Fat 27 g (Saturated 8 g); Cholesterol 33 mg; Sodium 1,018 mg; Carbohydrate 16 g; Fiber 4 g; Protein 9 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1/2 small red onion, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 cup pepperoncini and/or kalamata olives, plus 1 tablespoon brine from the jar', u'1 small clove garlic, minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 romaine lettuce hearts, thinly sliced crosswise', u'1 cup mixed fresh herbs (parsley, dill, mint and/or oregano)', u'1 pint cherry tomatoes, halved', u'2 large cucumbers, peeled, seeded and cut into chunks', u'1 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'12 stuffed grape leaves (from the deli counter)']
title: Greek Dinner Salad

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Heat a grill pan over medium heat.', u'Slice both eggplants lengthwise into 3 thick steaks. Drizzle with some olive oil and sprinkle with the chili powder, salt and pepper.', u'Grill the eggplant steaks until tender and nicely marked by the grill pan, about 4 minutes per side.', u'Transfer the eggplant steaks to individual serving plates and sprinkle with the feta cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers and chopped parsley and top with a squeeze of lemon. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 eggplants', u' Olive oil, for drizzling', u' Sprinkle of chili powder', u' Sprinkle of kosher salt', u' Sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces feta, diced', u'4 Roma tomatoes, diced', u'1 hothouse cucumber, seeded and diced', u'1 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped', u'1 lemon, sliced in half']
title: Greek Grilled Eggplant Steaks

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Arrange the food items decoratively on a platter and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Sliced Spinach Pie, cut in slices (see recipe)', u' Hummus (see recipe,) drizzled with olive oil and topped with toasted pine nuts', u' Sliced feta, drizzled with olive oil', u' Greek olives', u' Sliced tomato', u' Whole tomato', u' Grape leaves stuffed with rice', u' Pita bread, cut in triangles', u'3 cups chopped yellow onions (2 onions)', u'2 tablespoons good olive oil', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'3 (10-ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, defrosted', u'6 extra-large eggs, beaten', u'2 teaspoons grated nutmeg', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese', u'3 tablespoons plain dry bread crumbs', u'1/2 pound good feta, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/2 cup pignoli (pine nuts)', u'1/4 pound salted butter, melted', u'6 sheets phyllo dough, defrosted', u'2 cups canned chickpeas, drained, liquid reserved', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'1/3 cup tahini (sesame paste)', u'6 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (2 lemons)', u'2 tablespoons water or liquid from the chickpeas', u'8 dashes Tabasco sauce']
title: Greek Platter

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Meanwhile, whisk the vinegar, lemon zest and juice, honey, dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Whisk in the olive oil in a slow, steady stream until emulsified. Add the tomatoes and olives and toss.', u'Peel the cucumbers, leaving alternating strips of green peel. Trim the ends, halve lengthwise and slice crosswise, about 1/2 inch thick; add to the bowl with the tomatoes. Drain the red onion, add to the bowl and toss.', u'Drain the feta and slice horizontally into 4 even rectangles. Divide the salad among plates. Top with the feta and oregano; drizzle with olive oil and season with pepper.', u'Photograph by Johnny Miller']
ingredients: [u'1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u' Grated zest and juice of 1 lemon', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling', u'12 to 14 small vine-ripened tomatoes, quartered', u'1 cup kalamata olives, halved and pitted', u'5 Persian cucumbers', u'1 4 -ounce block Greek feta cheese, packed in brine', u' Fresh oregano leaves, for topping (optional)', u' Soak the red onion in a bowl of heavily salted ice water, 15 minutes.']
title: Classic Greek Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and cook, stirring frequently, until translucent and soft, about 5 minutes. Add 1/4 cup of water and the balsamic vinegar, reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until the shallots are browned and caramelized, 12 to 15 minutes.', u'Combine the shallots, yogurt, milk, chives, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium bowl and stir until blended. Cover and chill for 30 minutes before serving. The dip will keep, refrigerated, overnight.', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 cup chopped shallots (about 2 large shallots; 1/3 pound)', u' Kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar', u'1 cup 2-percent Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup 1-percent milk', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh chives', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u' Cut-up vegetable sticks, low-salt pretzels or pita chips, for serving']
title: Greek Yogurt Onion Dip

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, shallots, garlic, oregano, and parsley in a medium bowl to blend; season with salt and pepper.', u'Toss potatoes with 1/2 cup vinaigrette on a heavy, large, rimmed baking sheet. Reserve the remaining vinaigrette. Pour chicken stock around potatoes and season potatoes with salt and pepper. Roast potatoes until tender and golden brown, turning occasionally, about 45 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and drizzle with the remaining vinaigrette and more chopped parsley.']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups olive oil', u'6 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 large shallot, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano, or 1 tablespoon dried', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh Italian parsley, plus more for garnish', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3 pounds large russet potatoes, cleaned, each cut lengthwise into 6 wedges', u'1/2 cup chicken stock or canned low-sodium chicken broth']
title: Greek Potatoes with Lemon Vinaigrette

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Place an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 400 degrees F. Butter a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook the noodles until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, 7 to 9 minutes. Drain and transfer to a large bowl.', u'Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add the onion, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally until soft, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add the lamb, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, allspice, 1 teaspoon salt and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until cooked through, about 6 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and mint. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes.', u'For the sauce: Simmer the milk and cream over medium heat in a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan. Reduce the heat to low. Add the cheese and whisk until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the yogurt.', u'Add the meat sauce to the pasta and toss well until the noodles are coated. Transfer the mixture to the baking dish. Spoon the cheese sauce evenly on top and bake until golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped mint if using, and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Butter, for greasing the baking dish', u' Kosher salt', u'12 ounces egg noodles', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped or smashed', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'2 tablespoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice', u' One 26-ounce jar tomato-basil sauce (3 1/4 cups)', u'1 1/2 packed cups fresh mint leaves, chopped', u'1 cup milk, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup heavy cream, at room temperature', u'3 cups grated Parmesan (about 6 ounces)', u'1 cup plain Greek yogurt, at room temperature', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves, optional']
title: Greek Noodle Casserole (Pastitsio)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a blender combine juice, 1 tablespoon oil, garlic, coriander, cumin, salt and pepper and mint or cilantro leaves. Process until smooth and pour over chicken to marinate. Refrigerate chicken and allow to marinate for 30 minutes. In a small bowl stir together yogurt, cucumber and chopped mint. ', u'In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium high heat. Add marinated chicken and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Heat pitas under a broiler or in a toaster oven. Slice open pitas and stuff with chicken, tomatoes, lettuce and top with yogurt dressing. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u' Juice of a lime or lemon', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 clove garlic, peeled', u'1 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon cumin', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 cup mint or cilantro leaves', u'2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, Sliced into thin strips', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'1/2 cucumber, peeled and chopped', u'2 tablespoons chopped mint', u'1 tomato, chopped', u' Mixed lettuce leaves', u'4 pitas with pockets']
title: Greek Chicken in a Pita

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the bread, garlic, oregano, and parsley in a food processor and process until everything is finely chopped. Add the vinegar and olive oil and process again until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a large mixing bowl.', u'Place the peppers, red onion, cucumbers, tomatoes, and olives separately in the food processor and process until very coarsely chopped. Add to the mixing bowl. Add the tomato juice, salt, and pepper and stir well. Taste for seasoning, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Fold in the feta and serve cold.']
ingredients: [u'2 thick slices day-old bread, such as ciabatta or peasant white, crusts removed', u'6 large cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 tablespoons freshly chopped oregano leaves', u'2 tablespoons chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'5 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'5 tablespoons good olive oil', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded chopped', u'1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'2 red onions, chopped', u'1 seedless cucumber, unpeeled, seeded, and chopped', u'4 large ripe tomatoes, chopped', u'3/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped', u'1 (46-ounce) can Sacramento tomato juice', u'4 teaspoons kosher salt', u'2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces good feta cheese, small-diced not crumbled']
title: Greek Gazpacho

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'To marinate the chicken: In a non-reactive dish, combine the lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper and mix together. Add the chicken breasts to the dish and rub both sides in the mixture. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes and up to 4 hours.', u'To make the dressing: Combine all the ingredients in a resealable container and shake vigorously. Refrigerate until ready to serve, and then bring to room temperature before tossing salad.', u'Assemble the salad: cut off any dark tips and the bitter white bottoms from the romaine leaves. Cut the lettuce into 1-inch strips and place in a bowl that is large enough to hold all the salad ingredients comfortably. Scatter cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, olives, and feta over the top. You can prepare the salad up to a few hours in advance. Cover it with a moist paper towel and refrigerate until 30 minutes before serving.', u'To cook the chicken: Heat a nonstick skillet or grill pan over high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook, turning once, until well browned, about 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Let the chicken rest on a cutting board for a few minutes before slicing it into thin strips.', u'Give the dressing a good shake and pour it into a nice little serving bowl, using the lid to strain out the garlic.', u'Toss salad just before serving and fan chicken out on top.']
ingredients: [u'1 lemon, juiced', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u' A couple good pinches salt', u'10 grinds black pepper', u'4 (6 to 7-ounce) boneless skinless chicken breasts', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 lemon, juiced', u"2 cloves garlic, smashed with the side of your chef's knife", u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3 pinches salt', u'10 to 15 grinds black pepper', u'2 to 3 hearts romaine lettuce', u'1 English cucumber, peeled, cut in 1/2 lengthwise, then cut into 1/2-inch chunks', u'3 vine-ripened tomatoes (about 3/4-pound), cored and cut into 1/2-inch chunks', u'1/2 red onion, very thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup pitted kalamata olives, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese']
title: Greek Salad with Oregano Marinated Chicken

author: Valerie Bertinelli
directions: [u'Combine the vinegar, lemon juice, oregano, and salt and pepper to taste in a small bowl and whisk together. Add the oil in a steady stream, whisking constantly.', u'Combine the lettuce, onion, bell pepper, tomato, cucumber, olives and feta in a large salad bowl. Pour the dressing over and toss until all of the ingredients are well coated. Taste and adjust the seasonings, adding more salt or lemon juice as desired.']
ingredients: [u'3 teaspoons red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'8 large leaves red leaf lettuce, sliced crosswise', u'1/4 large red onion, thinly sliced', u'1/2 green bell pepper, cut into large dice', u'1 vine-ripened tomato, cut into wedges', u'1/2 English cucumber, halved lengthwise, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'6 Kalamata olives', u'2 ounces feta cheese, crumbled']
servings: 2 servings for lunch or 4 as a side
title: Classic Greek Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Place the rice in a large microwave-safe bowl and add 1 cup water. Cover with plastic wrap, pierce with a knife a few times to vent, then microwave until the water is almost absorbed, 10 minutes. Uncover and fluff the rice with a fork; let cool completely.', u'Lightly beat 1 egg in a small bowl. Add to the bowl with the rice along with the lamb, beef, provolone, onion, half each of the mint and parsley, the marjoram, garlic, allspice, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Mix with your hands until just combined (do not overmix); cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.', u'Dampen your hands and form the meat into 18 balls (about 1 1/2 inches each). Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add the meatballs, cover and cook over medium heat until tender, about 30 minutes, turning halfway through.', u'Whisk the remaining 2 eggs and the lemon juice in a small bowl until frothy. Remove 1 cup broth from the pot and gradually whisk it into the egg mixture. Push the meatballs to one side of the pot; reduce the heat to low and pour the egg mixture into the other side. Cook, stirring gently, until the sauce thickens slightly, about 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining mint and parsley; season with salt and pepper. Serve the meatballs and sauce in shallow bowls. Top with arugula, drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.', u'Photograph by Christina Holmes']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup converted rice', u'3 large eggs', u'1/2 pound lean ground lamb', u'1/2 pound lean ground beef', u'1/2 cup chopped deli-sliced provolone cheese (about 2 ounces)', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh mint', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh marjoram (or 1/2 teaspoon dried)', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'3 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/3 cup fresh lemon juice (from about 3 lemons)', u'3 cups baby arugula', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling']
title: Greek Meatballs with Lemon and Arugula

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler on high. Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil.', u'Pulse 1/2 cup of the pita chips in a food processor until finely ground. Transfer to a large bowl and drizzle with 1 tablespoon each red wine vinegar and olive oil.', u'Coarsely chop one of the onion halves and add it to the food processor. Add 1/4 cup of the mint and the garlic and pulse until very finely chopped. Add this mixture to the bowl with the ground pita chips and mix well with your hands. Add the beef, cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and mix gently with your hands until well combined.', u'Dampen your hands and form the mixture into 24 small meatballs, using about 1 tablespoon for each. Place on the prepared baking sheet, spacing the meatballs about 1 inch apart. Spread the tomatoes cut-side up in a single layer on the other side of the pan.', u'Broil until the meatballs are almost cooked through and browned and the tomatoes are blistered, 4 to 5 minutes. Let cool slightly.', u'Combine the yogurt, the remaining 4 tablespoons red wine vinegar and the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to make the dressing. Very thinly slice the remaining onion half and add it to a clean large bowl along with the lettuce, bell peppers and remaining 1/4 cup mint leaves. Toss with the dressing and 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Top with the meatballs, tomatoes and remaining 1 cup pita chips and serve.']
ingredients: [u"1 1/2 cups thin pita chips, such as Stacy's Simply Naked", u'5 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 medium onion, halved', u'1/2 cup fresh mint leaves', u'2 cloves garlic', u'12 ounces extra-lean ground beef', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup grape tomatoes, halved', u'1/4 cup lowfat plain Greek yogurt', u'2 hearts romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1 yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced']
title: Greek Meatball Salad

directions: [u'Put the potatoes in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water by 2 inches and season generously with salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, lower the heat to maintain a gentle simmer and cook until very tender, about 30 minutes. Drain the potatoes and let cool slightly. ', u'Rub the skins off the potatoes and discard them. Coarsely chop the potatoes and puree them through a food mill or ricer into a medium bowl. ', u"Meanwhile, on a cutting board, lightly sprinkle the garlic with a generous pinch of the salt and smash it into a fine paste with the side of a cook's knife. ", u'In a food processor, combine the garlic, almonds, and oil and puree into a paste. Mix the oil mixture into the potatoes until incorporated; then mix in the 1 tablespoon and 1 teaspoon salt, water, lemon juice, and vinegar and season with pepper, to taste. Serve.', u'Copyright 2001 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'2 russet potatoes (about 1 pound), scrubbed', u' Kosher salt, as needed, plus 1 tablespoon and 1 teaspoon', u'8 medium cloves garlic, minced', u'3/4 cup whole blanched almonds', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 cup water', u'5 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'3 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Skordalia (Greek Potato and Garlic Dip)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'For the soup: Heat the EVOO in a soup pot over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper and cook until tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the stock and peas, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook until just tender, 20 minutes. Remove half the soup and puree with the mint and parsley until smooth in a food processor or high powered blender. Return the puree to the pot, and stir in the lemon juice. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper. Cool and store for a make-ahead meal.', u'For the flatbread: Arrange the flatbread on a wire rack over a baking sheet, spray with the olive oil on both sides and season with salt and oregano. Roast in the oven to toasted and crisp. Store at room temperature in an airtight container.', u'Reheat the soup over medium heat. Serve the soup garnished with feta crumbles and a light sprinkle of cumin and paprika, a drizzle of EVOO and flatbread chips.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons EVOO, plus some for drizzling', u'1 onion, chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'6 to 8 cups chicken, or vegetable stock, or a combo of both', u'2 cups green split peas', u'1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped', u'1/2 cup fresh parsley leaves, chopped', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' Naan, pita or flatbread', u' Olive oil spray', u' Salt', u' Dried oregano', u' Greek feta cheese crumbles, for garnish', u' Cumin, for garnish', u' Paprika, for garnish']
title: Greek Split Pea Soup with Lemon

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'Add the salt, ground peppercorns, sumac, oregano, lemon juice, olive oil, brown sugar and vinegar to a mixing bowl and mix to combine.', u'Use on your favorite protein and cook as desired. The rub will last up to 4 days if stored in the fridge.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons black peppercorns, ground', u'2 tablespoons ground sumac', u'2 tablespoons dried oregano', u'2 tablespoons lemon juice', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon sherry vinegar']
title: Greek Wet Rub

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Grate the cucumber on the large holes of a box grater into a bowl. Toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt and pour into a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl. Let stand for 10 minutes. Using your hands and working with a bit of the cucumber at a time, squeeze the excess liquid out of the cucumber and place the cucumber in a large bowl. Add the yogurt, feta, garlic, 1/4 cup of the chopped mint, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the bowl with the cucumber. Stir to combine and add more salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a shallow serving bowl.', u'Toss the tomatoes, red onion, olives and remaining 2 tablespoons mint together in a medium bowl. Sprinkle the mixture over the cucumber mixture. Serve the dip with warm pita or vegetable chips.']
ingredients: [u'1 seedless cucumber', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups low-fat Greek yogurt', u'4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 small vine ripe or plum tomatos, diced', u'1 small red onion, diced', u'1/2 cup pitted black olives, such as kalamata or nicoise, coarsely chopped', u' Warm pita bread and/or root vegetable chips (such as Terra Chips), for serving', u' Copyright 2012 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
title: Greek Salad Layered Dip

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Arrange the cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and peppers, artichoke hearts and parsley on a platter. Squeeze the lemon juice over the platter, juicing the fruit cut-side-up to keep the seeds from falling into salad. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Place shallots, vinegar and oregano in a bowl and let stand 5 minutes. Whisk in extra-virgin olive oil in a slow stream. Pour dressing over salad. Garnish salad with chunks of tuna, hot peppers and olives.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 seedless cucumber, chopped', u'2 vine-ripe tomatoes, chopped', u'1 medium red onion, chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1 can quartered artichoke hearts in water, drained', u'1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves, coarsely chopped', u' Coarse salt and black pepper', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'1 small shallot, minced', u'3 tablespoons red wine vinegar, eyeball it', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball the amount', u'2 cans imported tuna in oil, drained', u'12 pepperoncini hot peppers', u'1 cup pitted kalamata olives']
title: Chic Greek Salad

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'In a large bowl, combine the feta cheese, tomatoes, olives and cucumbers. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Pour the dressing mixture over the vegetables. Garnish with the mint.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups feta cheese, crumbled', u'24 grape tomatoes, halved', u'16 pitted black olives, such as kalamata', u'16 pitted green olives', u'1 English cucumber, cut into chunks', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u' Pinch of salt and pepper', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint']
title: Minty Greek Salad

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Cut each of the romaine hearts in half, leaving the stem end intact so the leaves stay together. Top each with a few rings of onions, and place 5 olives in a small pile on each plate.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt and pepper. Drizzle some dressing over each lettuce half and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 small hearts romaine lettuce', u'12 rings thinly sliced red onion (about 1/4 medium onion)', u'20 kalamata olives', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Romaine Hearts with Greek Dressing

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring the pineapple juice and blueberries to a boil in a small saucepan. Cook until the blueberries soften and pop and the juice is thickened and syrupy, about 15 minutes. Stir in the peaches and cook for 5 more minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, whisk the yogurt, eggs, sugar and zest in a large bowl until combined. Mix together the flour, baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small bowl and fold into the yogurt mixture until combined.', u'Heat a large nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat and coat with cooking spray. Working in batches, pour the batter about 1/4 cup at a time, evenly spacing the pancakes, onto the skillet or griddle. Cook until the tops are bubbly and look slightly dry, 2 to 3 minutes, then flip carefully and cook until golden and cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes more. Repeat with more cooking spray and the remaining batter. Serve the pancakes hot with the blueberry-peach sauce.', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'6 -ounce can unsweetened pineapple juice', u'1 cup frozen wild blueberries', u'1 large peach, pitted, peeled and diced, or 1 cup frozen peach slices, thawed and diced', u'2 cups 2-percent Greek yogurt', u'4 large eggs', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda', u' Kosher salt', u' Cooking spray']
title: Greek Yogurt Pancakes

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'With a sharp knife, make 20 slits across 1 side of the lamb and insert the garlic slivers.
