Place in a large non-reactive dish.', u'In a bowl, whisk together the oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Pour over the lamb and rub evenly across the surface. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate, refrigerated, for at least 2 and up to 6 hours, turning occasionally.', u'Remove from the refrigerator and let come to room temperature. Season lightly on all sides with Essence. Brush a grill lightly with olive oil and preheat to medium heat.', u'Remove the lamb from the marinade and place on the grill. Cook, turning occasionally until the meat reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees F for medium-rare, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove from the grill and transfer to a platter. Tent with foil and let rest for 12 minutes before carving.', u'Thinly slice the lamb and place the meat in the center of the pita breads. Top with Tzatziki Sauce and chopped tomatoes, and serve.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 (4 to 5-pound) boneless leg of lamb, trimmed of visible fat', u'5 cloves garlic, peeled and cut into 20 slivers', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u' Essence, recipe follows', u'16 pita breads', u' Tzatziki Sauce, recipe follows', u' Chopped tomatoes', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u'1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded and finely chopped', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 teaspoon lemon juice or white wine vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon oregano', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic']
title: Greek Grilled Leg of Lamb: Gyros

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'For the sweet Greek dressing: Whisk together the vinegar, honey, mustard, oregano and garlic in a bowl. Slowly stream in the olive oil while whisking. Add salt and pepper to taste. Measure out 1/2 cup of the dressing for marinating the chicken. Set aside the remaining dressing for drizzling on the salad.', u'For the chicken: Put the chicken in a nonreactive container, pour the reserved 1/2 cup sweet Greek dressing over it and toss to coat. Marinate the chicken, refrigerated, for 2 hours.', u'Preheat a grill to medium heat.', u'Oil the grill grates with vegetable oil. Grill the chicken until golden on each side and the internal temperature registers 165 degrees F, 7 to 8 minutes per side. Let rest before slicing.', u'For the salad: Brush each romaine half with vegetable oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill on high on the cut sides until slightly charred, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Place a seared romaine half on a serving plate. Line up some tomatoes, feta, olives, cucumbers, onions and sliced chicken atop the romaine. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Drizzle with the sweet Greek dressing. Garnish with cracked black pepper and sea salt and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 clove garlic, minced or zested with a rasp grater', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u' Salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts', u' Vegetable oil, for oiling grill grates', u'2 hearts romaine lettuce, halved', u' Vegetable oil, for oiling romaine', u' Salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'2 cups grape tomatoes, halved', u'1 cup feta crumbles', u'1 cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped', u'1 English cucumber, diced', u'1/2 red onion, thinly sliced', u' Sea salt']
title: Grilled Greek Summer Salad

author: Cat Cora
directions: [u'In a food processor, pulse the flour and salt until combined. Add the shortening and pulse until the mixture resembles cornmeal mixed with pea-sized bits, about 10 times. While the motor is running, drizzle in the water until a dough forms.', u'Form the dough into a disk, wrap it in plastic wrap, and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, at least 1 hour.', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Grease a 9 by 13-inch baking pan. Divide the dough in half; press half the dough up and around the inside of the pan. Set the remaining dough aside covered with plastic wrap.', u'Line the pan with foil and fill with dried beans. Bake the dough for 20 minutes and remove the beans and foil. Continue baking the crust until golden brown, about 10 minutes more. Let the pan cool on a rack.', u'Meanwhile, make the spinach filling: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 6 minutes. Add the rice and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add the spinach, little by little (adding more as the previous batch wilts), and cook, stirring, until completely wilted. Season with the salt and pepper and stir in the parsley, dill, and scallions.', u'Drain the spinach mixture in a colander in the sink and let cool.', u'Once the spinach is cool, stir in the feta and spread the mixture into the crust. Roll the remaining dough out on a well-floured surface, into a rectangle large enough to cover the baking pan. Top the spinach with the dough and pinch around the sides to seal. Score the top of the pie in the center, brush the surface of the dough with egg wash, and bake until golden brown, about 40 minutes.', u'Remove the pie from the oven, let cool, cut into squares and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2/3 cup shortening, plus more for the baking pan', u'1/3 cup ice water', u' Dried beans, for pie weights', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus additional for greasing the baking pan', u'6 cups chopped onion (about 3 medium onions)', u'3/4 cup uncooked long-grain white rice', u'4 1/2 pounds fresh spinach (about 3 bunches), stemmed', u'2 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper', u'3/4 cup finely chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh dill', u'3 scallions (white and green), chopped', u'1 1/2 cups crumbled feta', u'1 egg beaten with 1 teaspoon water, for egg wash']
title: Spanakopita (Greek Spinach Pie)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat a medium skillet over medium high heat.', u'Combine meats, onion, parsley, salt, and pepper. Add butter and oil to pan and begin rolling small, bite-size balls, adding balls to pan as you roll them. Cook balls 10 to 12 minutes, shaking pan occasionally to brown equally on all sides. Deglaze pan with wine and allow wine to reduce by half, 1 or 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat and squeeze the juice of 1/2 lemon over the meatballs.', u'Serve in a bowl.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound ground lamb', u'3/4 pound ground beef or ground veal', u'1 small yellow skinned onion, minced or grated with hand grater', u' A handful flat-leaf parsley, chopped', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1 tablespoon (1 turn of the pan) extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 lemon']
title: Greek Meatballs in Wine Sauce

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Place a large pot of water on the stove to boil. Salt water and cook pasta to al dente.', u'Season the shrimp with salt and pepper.', u'While the pasta water comes to a boil, heat extra-virgin olive oil in a deep skillet with garlic. When garlic is brown, remove and reserve. Add shrimp and cook 3 to 4 minutes. Add red pepper flakes, lemon zest, oregano, olives, and wine and cook together a couple of minutes more. Remove from heat. Add a ladle of starchy pasta cooking water to sauce and some lemon juice. Remove the sauce from the heat. Drain pasta and add to the skillet. Let pasta soak in juices for a minute then toss with parsley and feta. Use tongs to pull pasta from skillet, giving it a turn to twist in as many ingredients as possible. Then, use the tongs to remove and arrange the shrimp and ingredients that may remain in the pan, distributing them evenly among the portions.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound linguini', u' Salt', u'1 pound medium to large shrimp deveined and peeled, tails removed', u' Pepper', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u' Couple pinches red pepper flakes', u'1/2 lemon, zested and juiced', u'2 sprigs oregano, finely chopped', u' Handful pitted kalamata olives, chopped', u'1/2 cup white wine, eyeball it', u'1/2 cup chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'1 cup feta cheese crumbles']
title: Greek Style Shrimp Scampi and Linguini

directions: [u'Halve 2 of the eggplants lengthwise, score their pulp deeply with a sharp knife, being careful not to pierce the skins, and with a grapefruit knife scoop out the pulp, reserving it and leaving 1/2-inch-thick shells. Sprinkle the shells with 1 teaspoon salt and invert them on paper towels to drain for 15 to 30 minutes. Cut the reserved pulp and the remaining whole eggplant into 1/2-inch pieces, in a colander toss the pieces with the remaining salt, and let them drain for 15 to 30 minutes. ', u'Pat the shells dry with paper towels, brush them with 1 tablespoon of the oil, and broil them on the rack of a broiler pan, skin side down, under a preheated broiler about 4 inches from the heat until they are tender, about 5 minutes. ', u'In a skillet, heat the remaining 3 tablespoons oil over moderately high heat until it is hot but not smoking. Saute the onion and the garlic until translucent. Add the ground lamb and the eggplant pieces, patted dry, stirring, until meat loses all color and eggplant is tender. ', u'Remove the skillet from the heat, stir in the parsley, mint, tomatoes, feta, and salt and pepper to taste, and divide the filling among the shells, mounding it. Broil the stuffed eggplants in a large flameproof baking dish for 5 minutes, or until the filling is bubbling and golden.']
ingredients: [u'3 (1/2-pound) eggplants', u'1 teaspoon salt, plus 1 teaspoon', u'1 tablespoon olive oil, plus 3 tablespoons', u'2 cups chopped onion', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 pound lean ground lamb', u'1/3 cup minced fresh parsley leaves', u'3 tablespoons minced fresh mint leaves', u'3 plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise, seeded, and cut into julienne strips', u'1 cup crumbled feta']
title: Greek-Style Stuffed Eggplant

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat grill to medium. If using hardwood or other charcoal, move over to 1 side of grill; if using gas, leave 1 section off.', u'Season chicken on both sides with salt and pepper, and drizzle well with canola oil. Place on the grill skin side down over direct heat, cooking until golden brown and slightly charred. Open and close the grill, as necessary, to maintain the heat without letting the skin burn. When skin is nicely charred and blistered, flip over and move to indirect heat, close lid and continue cooking until just cooked through, about 17 minutes longer, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the chicken registers 155 degrees F. Remove from the grill and let rest 10 minutes before cutting.', u'While the chicken is cooking, brush tomatoes, lemons and onion slices with oil, and season with salt and pepper. Grill lemons cut side down until golden brown, and tomatoes cut side down until slightly charred. Grill onion slices, flipping once, until softened and slightly charred.', u'Make the vinaigrette by whisking the vinegar and mustard until smooth. Slowly whisk in the olive oil, then whisk in the oregano and season with salt and pepper.', u'To serve, carve the chicken into 6 to 8 serving pieces and arrange in a large shallow serving bowl. Arrange the tomatoes and onions, all but 1 of the lemon halves, and the cucumbers over and around the chicken. Scatter the olives and feta cheese over, then drizzle with vinaigrette. Tear the basil leaves over the dish, and then dollop the yogurt in the center.']
ingredients: [u'1 (3-pound) chicken, washed, patted dry and butterflied', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Canola oil', u'6 plum tomatoes, halved', u'3 lemons, cut in 1/2', u'1 red onion, skin on, cut into 1/2-inch thick rounds', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1/2 to 3/4 cup Greek olive oil', u'2 to 3 tablespoons chopped oregano leaves', u'1 English cucumbers, sliced', u'1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted', u'6 ounces feta, crumbled', u'1/4 cup basil leaves', u'1/4 cup Greek whole milk yogurt']
title: Butterflied Chicken Greek Style

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the Skewers: Thread the skewers starting with a tomato, then a piece of feta cheese, an olive, a piece of onion and finish with another tomato. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.', u'For the Vinaigrette: In a small bowl, mix together the lemon juice, red wine vinegar and oregano. Whisk in the olive oil until the mixture thickens. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Arrange the skewers on a serving platter. Spoon the vinaigrette over the skewers and sprinkle with the chopped oregano.']
ingredients: [u'24 grape or small cherry tomatoes', u'3 ounces feta cheese, cut into 12 (1/2-inch) cubes', u'12 pitted kalamata olives', u'1/2 small red or sweet onion, cut into 12 (1/2-inch) pieces', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano leaves', u' Special equipment: 12 (6-inch) bamboo or wood skewers', u'2 teaspoons lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons red wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Skewered Greek Salad

author: Cat Cora
directions: [u'To make the salsa: Cut the red peppers into a medium dice and mix in a bowl with the garlic, salt, and oregano. Stir in the olive oil. Taste and add more salt if necessary. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to meld the flavors.', u'To make the nachos: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Spread the pita chips in a single layer on a baking sheet or a large heatproof platter. Sprinkle both cheeses evenly over the chips. Scatter the pepperoncini over the cheese. Bake just until the cheese is melted, about 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and scatter olives and cherry tomato quarters over the top. Spoon some of the red pepper salsa on the nachos and dab on small dollops of Greek yogurt. Place the remaining salsa in a serving bowl. Serve the nachos right away with the remaining salsa on the side for dipping.']
ingredients: [u' Roasted red pepper salsa', u'1/2 cup strips of roasted red pepper from a jar (or 1 large red pepper, roasted)', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u' Pinch of kosher salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons minced fresh oregano leaves', u'1 1/2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Nachos', u'2 6 -ounce bags pita chips (or 10 cups homemade chips)', u'2 cups shredded pepper jack cheese', u'8 ounces (1 cup) mild feta, crumbled', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced pepperoncini', u'1/2 cup green Greek olives, (such as Mt. Athos), pitted and sliced', u'1/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted and sliced', u'1/2 cup quartered cherry tomatoes', u'1/2 cup fat-free Greek-style yogurt']
title: Greek-Style Nachos

author: Cat Cora
directions: [u'Dunk bread quickly in milk and press the liquid out to dampen the bread.', u'Combine the beef, bread, onion, garlic, oregano, mint, vinegar, eggs, nutmeg, salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix well. Take a large spoon of the mixture and roll into a ball until all the mixture has been rolled.', u'In a saute pan, add the olive oil and bring it to 360-degrees F for frying. Dust the balls in flour and add to the oil. Brown on all sides, leaving room in the pan to roll them around. Pull from the pan and drain on paper towels.', u'Serve with pita and cucumber yogurt sauce.']
ingredients: [u'3 slices white bread with crust', u'1 cup milk', u'2 pounds ground beef', u'1 yellow onion, minced', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/3 cup finely chopped oregano', u'2 finely chopped tablespoons mint', u'2 teaspoon white wine vinegar', u'2 eggs beaten', u'1/4 teaspoon grated nutmeg', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u' Flour, for dusting', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Pita Bread', u' Cucumber Yogurt Sauce, recipe follows', u'2 cups plain yogurt', u'1 cup seeded and small-diced cucumber', u'3 cloves minced garlic', u' Salt']
title: Keftedes: Greek Meatballs

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Preheat the broiler.', u'For the lamb meatballs: Soak the breadcrumbs in the milk for 5 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the lamb, coriander, cumin, garlic, oregano, mint, some salt and pepper, and the soaked breadcrumbs. Mix well, but do not overwork. Fold in the feta, then form the mixture into eight 2-inch meatballs.', u'Place the meatballs in a large, greased cast-iron pan. Place the pan 7 to 8 inches from the heating element; broil for 10 to 12 minutes, or until cooked through, turning once halfway through.', u'For the tzatziki: Grate the cucumber into a small strainer and squeeze out excess water. Combine the grated cucumber with the yogurt, lemon zest, olive oil, dill and garlic and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.', u'To assemble the sliders: Load a meatball onto each bun. Top with tomato slices and some tzatziki. Secure the sliders with bamboo skewers. Serve on a large platter with extra tzatziki on the side.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup panko breadcrumbs', u'1/4 cup milk', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon fresh mint, chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese', u' Canola oil, for greasing pan', u'1/2 English cucumber, peeled', u'1 cup plain Greek yogurt', u'1 tablespoon lemon zest', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh dill', u'1 clove garlic, finely minced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 soft Hawaiian buns', u'2 Roma tomatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'8 bamboo skewers']
title: Greek Lamb Meatball Sliders with Tzatziki

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Prepare the couscous as the label directs. Cover and keep warm until ready to serve.', u'Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are pink, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate using a slotted spoon.', u'Preheat the broiler. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in the skillet. Add the tomatoes, fennel and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 4 minutes. Add the wine and bring to a simmer, then add the chickpeas and 1/3 cup water; cook, stirring occasionally, until the chickpeas are slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Return the shrimp to the skillet and add the scallions and 1 tablespoon dill. Top with the feta, transfer to the broiler and broil until golden, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon dill. Fluff the couscous with a fork and serve with the shrimp mixture.', u'Per serving: Calories 481; Fat 14 g (Saturated 3 g); Cholesterol185 mg; Sodium 392 mg; Carbohydrate 51 g; Fiber 10 g; Protein 36 g', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'1 cup whole-wheat couscous', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u' Pinch of red pepper flakes', u'2 medium plum tomatoes, diced', u'1 small bulb fennel, halved, cored and sliced', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1/3 cup dry white wine', u'1 15 -ounce can no-salt-added chickpeas, drained and rinsed', u'2 scallions, sliced', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese (about 2 ounces)']
title: Greek Shrimp and Couscous

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook as the label directs. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain.', u'Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium-high heat. Add the bell pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, about 3 minutes. Add the chickpeas, garlic, red pepper flakes and 1/2 teaspoon salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is lightly browned, about 3 minutes.', u'Add the olives, pasta and the reserved pasta cooking water to the pot; cook 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the arugula and oregano until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Top with the feta and drizzle with olive oil.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos ']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'12 ounces penne pasta (preferably spinach-flavored)', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling', u'1 yellow bell pepper, cut into -inch strips', u'1 15 -ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1/2 cup pitted kalamata olives, rinsed and chopped', u'5 cups baby arugula (about 3 ounces)', u'1 tablespoon fresh oregano', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'3/4 cup crumbled feta cheese (about 3 ounces)']
title: "Greek Salad" Penne

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Brush the pitas with the olive oil and cut each into 6 triangles. Spread the triangles in a single layer on a baking sheet, sprinkle with salt and cook until they are crunchy, 10 to 13 minutes (turn the sheet halfway through cooking if necessary).', u'In a bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, dill and lemon juice. Add the black olives, cucumbers, tomatoes and red onions and mix to combine.', u'Spoon the yogurt sauce over the pita chips and sprinkle with feta.']
ingredients: [u' One 6-count bag pitas', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 cup Greek yogurt', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill', u'2 lemons, juiced', u'1/4 cup black olives, chopped', u'1 cucumber, finely chopped', u'1 tomato, finely chopped', u'1/2 small red onion, finely chopped', u' Feta cheese, for sprinkling']
title: Greek Pita Nachos

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat the grill. Brush the bread with oil on both sides and season with salt and pepper. Grill bread on both sides until lightly golden brown. Remove the bread to a platter and let sit at room temperature to get slightly hard. ', u'Meanwhile, whisk together 1 cup olive oil, lemon juice, and dill in a medium bowl. Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Fold the cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and feta into the oil mixture and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Spoon the mixture over the bread. Garnish with additional dill and drizzle with chili oil, if desired. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 loaf country bread, sliced into 1/2-inch thick slices', u'1 cup Greek olive oil, plus more for brushing on bread', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, plus more for garnish', u'2 English cucumbers, quartered and cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'2 ripe beefsteak tomatoes, cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'1 red onion, peeled, halved and thinly sliced', u'12 ounces feta cheese, crumbled', u' Chili oil, for drizzling, optional']
title: Dakos (Greek Bread Salad)

directions: [u'Make the salad: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the barley and cook for 15 minutes. Using a sieve, remove barley from the water and transfer to a bowl.', u'Bring the water back to a boil and salt, to taste. Add the barley and rye and wheat berries and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 30 to 40 minutes. Drain, transfer to a bowl, and cool.', u'When cool, combine with the remaining ingredients.', u'Meanwhile, make the Dressing: Whisk together the vinegar, dill, and garlic. While whisking, drizzle in the oil to make a smooth dressing. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Toss the salad with the dressing and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound barley', u' Salt', u'1/2 pound rye berries', u'1/2 pound wheat berries', u'1 cup pitted, halved kalamata olives', u'1 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1 cup 1/4-inch diced cucumber', u'1 cup 1/4-inch diced tomato', u'1/2 cup 1/4-inch diced red onion', u'1/2 cup chopped parsley leaves', u'1/2 cup chopped dill', u'1/4 cup cider vinegar', u'1/4 cup minced dill', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'3/4 cup olive oil', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Greek Grain Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Halve the eggplants lengthwise and with a sharp knife score the pulp in a diamond pattern, being careful not to pierce the skins. Scoop out the pulp with a spoon, leaving a 1/2-inch shell. Chop the pulp.', u'Place the eggplant shells on a greased baking sheet and lightly brush the inside of each half with about 1 teaspoon of olive. Bake until the shells are softened but not brown, about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool.', u'In a heavy skillet heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil over medium-high heat. Add lamb and cook, stirring, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon to drain on paper towels. Add the onions and bell peppers to the fat in the pan and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Add the garlic, eggplant, salt, Essence and pepper, and cook until the eggplant is soft, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook until they give off their liquid, 3 minutes. Add the parsley and oregano, and stir well. Remove from the heat. Stir in 3/4 cup of bread crumbs and mix well into the vegetables. Stir in the feta, and re-season as needed.', u'Divide the filling among the eggplant shells, and sprinkle the remaining 1/4-cup of bread crumbs over the tops. Bake until the tops are golden and the stuffing is heated through, about 30 minutes.', u'']
ingredients: [u'3 medium eggplants (about 11/4 pounds each), split lengthwise', u'4 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 pound ground lamb, or lamb sausage removed from casings and crumbled', u'1 1/2 cups chopped onion', u'1/2 cup chopped green bell peppers', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon Essence, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'3 medium Roma plum tomatoes, seeded and chopped', u'1/4 cup minced fresh parsley leaves', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh oregano', u'1 cup bread crumbs', u'1 cup crumbled Feta', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Greek Stuffed Eggplant

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, combine the butter and salt and whip until light and fluffy, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the sugar, egg, brandy, and vanilla and beat until all of the ingredients are integrated. With the mixer on low speed, gradually add sifted flour to the butter mixture. Using a rubber spatula, remove the dough and transfer it onto a piece of waxed paper or parchment. Refrigerate for about 45 minutes before rolling.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'After the dough has cooled, pinch off small pieces and roll them into about 1-inch balls. Place them in a single layer with space in between each, on a greased baking sheet. Repeat the process until all of the cookie dough has been rolled. Place a clove in the center of each cookie. Alternatively, shape the ball into half moons with a clove in the center of each.', u'Place the sheets in the oven and bake until the cookies are just slightly brown, about 15 minutes. Allow them to cool thoroughly, and then roll them in powdered sugar.']
ingredients: [u'3 sticks unsalted butter, soft', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 cup powdered sugar, plus additional for coating', u'1 egg yolk', u'2 tablespoons brandy', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3 cups all-purpose flour, sifted', u' About 45 whole cloves']
title: Greek Christmas Cookies (Kourambiedes)

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the vinegar, lemon juice, oregano and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a large bowl; slowly whisk in the olive oil until smooth.', u'Add the cucumber, tomatoes, lettuce, olives, caperberries, Peppadews and red onion to the bowl with the dressing and toss. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Photograph by Anna Williams']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small cucumber, chopped', u'1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 large head romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1/2 cup kalamata olives', u'1/2 cup large caperberries', u'1/2 cup chopped Peppadew peppers', u'1/2 red onion, thinly sliced']
title: Big Greek Salad

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line 1 or 2 baking sheets with foil. Cut the pita rounds into eighths. Split each piece in two and place on the prepared baking sheet(s), with the inside of the bread facing up. Spray with the olive oil cooking spray and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of the Greek seasoning. Bake 7 to 10 minutes, or until golden.', u'Meanwhile, in a large skillet, brown the ground lamb with the garlic salt and the remaining 2 teaspoons Greek seasoning. Drain and set aside. In a shallow 1 1/2-quart dish, spread the hummus on the bottom. Top with a layer of ground lamb, then the tzatziki. Layer with the lettuce, tomatoes, onion, olives and feta. Serve the dip at room temperature with pita chips.', u'Photograph by Kana Okada']
ingredients: [u'1 14 -ounce package pita bread', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'4 teaspoons Greek seasoning', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'1 teaspoon garlic salt', u'1 16 -ounce container prepared hummus', u'1 1/2 cups tzatziki (gyro sauce)', u'1 cup shredded iceberg lettuce', u'2 medium roma tomatoes, diced', u'1/2 diced red onion', u'1/2 cup kalamata olives, chopped', u'1 4 -ounce container crumbled feta cheese']
title: Greek Layered Dip With Pita Chips

directions: [u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the first 6 ingredients until well blended. Season with cayenne, salt, and pepper to taste. Refrigerate in a covered container. When ready to use, whisk again.', u'In a large mixing bowl, combine the romaine, baby lettuces, bell peppers, onions, olives, cucumber, tomatoes, cheeses, and Greek Salad Dressing. Toss until blended. Season with salt and pepper. Divide and mound onto 4 chilled salad plates.', u'In a medium bowl, toss together the shrimp and Shrimp Dressing. Arrange 8 shrimp halves over and around salad mound. Top with pine nuts and garnish with dill sprigs.', u'* To toast pine nuts, place the nuts in a small skillet in a single layer. Over low heat, toast until lightly golden, stirring often to prevent burning. This takes 3 or 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'2 tablespoons cucumber, peeled, seeded, and finely diced', u'1 tablespoon minced red onion', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh dill leaves', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u' Pinch cayenne pepper', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 romaine heart, torn into bite-size pieces', u'4 cups mixed baby lettuces, washed and dried', u'1/2 cup each red and yellow bell peppers, cored, seeded, trimmed, and cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1/2 cup Caramelized Onions (recipe follows)', u'1/2 cup Kalamata olives, pitted', u'1 small cucumber, peeled, seeded, quartered, cut into 1/2-inch slices', u'1 cup yellow pear and Sweet 100 cherry tomatoes, cut in halves', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese', u'1 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1 cup Greek Salad Dressing, recipe follows', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'16 large shrimp, peeled, deveined, cut in half horizontally, blanched', u'1/4 cup toasted pine nuts *', u' Fresh dill sprigs', u'2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', u'1 large red, yellow, or white onion, (3/4 pound), peeled, trimmed and cut into 3/4-inch dice', u'2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh dill leaves', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley leaves', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh thyme leaves', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1/4 cup Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1/3 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper', u'1 1/2 cups extra virgin olive oil', u' Sugar']
title: Greek Shrimp Salad

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'Cook pasta according to package directions.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together broth, oil, vinegar, Dijon mustard, thyme, salt and pepper to taste. Add diced chicken, green pepper, and mint.', u'Drain pasta and add to bowl with dressing and chicken. Toss to combine. Cover with plastic and refrigerate until ready to serve. Top with feta cheese just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'12 ounces ditalini or other pasta', u'1/2 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon dried thyme', u' Salt and ground black pepper', u'2 cups cooked cubed chicken (about 1 pound)', u'1 green bell pepper, seeded and diced', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese']
title: Greek Pasta Salad with Feta and Chicken

directions: [u'Cut potatoes across width into 1/8-inch slices. Place in a large bowl and wash in cold, running water until water runs clear.', u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes, bring back to a boil, and cook until slices are barely soft, about 3 to 5 minutes. Drain in a colander.', u'Combine remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Add warm potato slices and toss to combine. Serve immediately or chill. Potato salad may be kept in a sealed container in refrigerator for 2 to 3 days.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds red potatoes, washed, with skins', u'1 cup olive oil', u'3 shallots, chopped', u'1 1/2 bunches oregano, leaves only, chopped', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon white pepper']
title: Greek Potato Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season the chicken all over with salt, pepper and the paprika. Add to the pot and cook, turning once, until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate.', u'Add the fennel bulb and bell pepper to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until lightly toasted, 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and return the chicken to the pot; bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce the heat to low and cook until the rice is tender and the chicken is cooked through, 16 to 18 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and let cool slightly, about 10 minutes. Add the sun-dried tomatoes, olives, lemon zest, scallions, parsley, oregano, fennel fronds and cheese; stir to combine.', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Lay out 1 sheet of phyllo on the parchment and brush generously with melted butter. Layer another sheet of phyllo ontop; brush with butter. Repeat with the remaining 6 sheets of phyllo; do not butter the last sheet. (Reserve about 2 tablespoons butter to brush the outside of the strudel.)', u'Mound the chicken mixture down one long side of the phyllo, about 2 inches from the edge. Use the parchment to lift the phyllo and roll it around the filling to make a long cylinder with open ends; arrange seam-side down on the parchment. Cut several small slits in the top of the roll and brush with the reserved melted butter.', u'Transfer to the oven and bake until golden brown and crisp, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly, then cut into thick slices.', u'Photograph by Ryan Liebe']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'6 skinless, boneless chicken thighs (about 1 1/2 pounds), cut into 1-inch pieces', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 teaspoon paprika', u'1 small bulb fennel, cored and chopped, plus 2 tablespoons chopped fronds', u'1 red bell pepper, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'1/2 cup basmati rice', u'1 1/2 cups low-sodium chicken broth', u'1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped (not oil-packed)', u'1/4 cup pitted kalamata olives, chopped', u' Finely grated zest of 1 lemon', u'3 scallions, thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano', u"4 ounces manouri cheese or goat's-milk feta, crumbled (about 1 cup)", u'8 sheets frozen phyllo dough, thawed', u'1 stick unsalted butter, melted']
title: Greek Strudel with Chicken and Rice

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Put the olive oil, lemon juice, shallot, garlic, oregano and parsley in a food processor; add 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste. Puree until mostly smooth.', u'Toss the potatoes with 1/2 cup of the prepared vinaigrette in a large bowl and spread in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet. (Reserve the remaining vinaigrette.) Roast the potatoes until tender and golden, turning occasionally, 45 minutes to 1 hour.', u'Transfer the potatoes to a platter and drizzle with some of the remaining vinaigrette. Season with salt and garnish with the chopped parsley. Serve with the remaining vinaigrette on the side.', u'Photograph by Yunhee Kim']
ingredients: [u'1 cup extra-virgin olive oil (preferably Greek)', u'6 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 large shallot, quartered', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'4 sprigs oregano, leaves only (or 1 tablespoon dried)', u'1/4 cup fresh parsley leaves, plus', u'1 tablespoon chopped, for serving', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'3 pounds large russet potatoes, cut lengthwise into wedges']
title: Greek Potatoes With Lemon Vinaigrette

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt generously. Cook the orzo according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain, rinse with cold water and drain again. Transfer to a large bowl.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together the ranch dressing and lemon zest and juice. Toss the mixture with the orzo and season with salt and pepper. In layers or strips, add the feta, olives, tomatoes, cucumber and red onion. Garnish with the Crispy Chickpeas and fresh mint.']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 cups dried orzo', u'1 cup Greek yogurt ranch dressing, such as Hidden Valley', u' Zest and juice of 1 lemon', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta', u'1/4 cup chopped kalamata olives', u'2 firm tomatoes, seeded and diced', u'1 English cucumber, seeded and diced', u'1/2 red onion, diced', u' Crispy Chickpeas, recipe follows', u'1 tablespoon sliced fresh mint (chiffonade)', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u' One 15-ounce can chickpeas, drained, rinsed and dried thoroughly', u"1 teaspoon za'atar"]
title: Creamy Greek Orzo Salad with Crispy Chickpeas

directions: [u'Heat the oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the onion and bell pepper and cook, stirring frequently, until they begin to soften, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and seasoning and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add the tomatoes, garbanzo beans, broth, bay leaves, and pepper. Stir well. Bring to a boil and boil for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the chicken, lower the heat to medium, and simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Stir frequently to prevent sticking. The mixture will thicken. Remove the bay leaves and discard. Stir in the olives and lemon juice, and serve immediately over the couscous.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large onion, chopped (about 1 cup)', u'1 large green bell pepper, chopped (about 1 cup)', u'1 tablespoon jarred minced garlic', u'4 teaspoons dried Greek seasoning, crumbled between the fingers', u'1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes, in puree', u'1 (15-ounce) can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained', u'1 cup fat free, less sodium chicken broth', u'2 bay leaves', u' Pepper, to taste', u'1 rotisserie chicken, cut into serving pieces', u'1/2 cup pitted kalamata olives, coarsely chopped', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', u' Cinnamon Couscous, recipe follows']
title: Greek Chicken Stew

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Pour 1/3 cup water that is hot to the touch (about 110 degrees F) into the bowl of a stand mixer. Gently whisk in the yeast, 1 tablespoon of the flour and 1 tablespoon of the sugar. Cover with a towel and set aside until bubbly, 5 to 10 minutes (depending on the temperature of the room).', u'Meanwhile, heat the milk in small saucepan over medium heat until bubbles start to form around the edges, about 6 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter, remaining sugar and salt. Set aside to cool, about 5 minutes.', u'Using the paddle attachment, stir the milk mixture into the yeast mixture. Stir in the 2 beaten eggs. Gradually mix in the remaining flour, fennel seed and almond extract, and beat until a soft dough forms. Increase the speed to medium-high, and beat until the dough pulls away from the sides and forms a ball, about 5 minutes (the dough will be sticky).', u"Remove the dough from the bowl and place on a lightly floured surface. Knead, adding more flour as needed, until the dough is as smooth as a baby's bottom, about 5 minutes.", u'Put in a lightly buttered bowl, cover and place in a warm spot to rise until doubled in size, about 1 1/2 hours.', u'Punch down the dough.', u'Lightly flour a work surface. Place the dough on the surface and cut into three equal parts. Gently roll out each piece into a 16-inch-long rope. Line a wide-lipped cookie sheet with parchment paper. Transfer the ropes to the prepared sheet. Press the ropes together at one end and braid loosely. Arrange the braid in a circle. Press the ends of the dough together. Gently stretch the circle to make it 10 inches across and the hole in the middle 3 1/2 inches across. Cover and let rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour.', u'Rub the eggs with a little vegetable oil, and then buff with a paper towel. Gently press the eggs into the dough, evenly spaced. Cover and set aside until doubled in size, about 1 hour.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Brush the bread with the remaining beaten egg. Bake until the loaf is dark golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped, about 45 minutes. Cool about 30 minutes before slicing.']
ingredients: [u'1 envelope active dry yeast (2 1/4 teaspoons)', u'5 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 1/3 cup milk', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for greasing bowl', u'1 teaspoon fine salt', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten, plus 1 egg lightly beaten for egg wash', u'2 teaspoons ground fennel seed', u'1/4 teaspoon almond extract', u'3 hard-cooked eggs, dyed red', u' Vegetable oil, for rubbing']
title: Greek Easter Bread

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Combine the allspice, oregano and garlic powder in a bowl. Pierce the pork all over with a fork. Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper; rub with the spice mixture.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork and cook, turning, until browned all over, about 5 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the oven. Cook until a thermometer inserted into the center of the pork registers 145 degrees F, about 20 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the couscous and cook, stirring, until toasted, 5 minutes. Add 1 3/4 cups water, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low; cover and cook until the liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes.', u'Fluff the couscous with a fork; let cool. Add the feta, cucumbers, herbs, sun-dried tomatoes, lemon juice and the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil; toss. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with the pork and lemon wedges. ', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1 large pork tenderloin (about 1 1/4 pounds), trimmed', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup Israeli couscous', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'2 Persian cucumbers, halved and thinly sliced', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh dill and/or parsley', u'3 tablespoons chopped sun-dried tomatoes (not oil-packed)', u' Juice of 1/2 lemon, plus wedges for serving']
title: Greek Pork Tenderloin with Israeli Couscous

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the yogurt, lemon juice, Parmesan, anchovies, olive oil, mustard, garlic, oregano, 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Cover and chill for at least 30 minutes. The dressing will keep, refrigerated, for up to 3 days.', u'Per serving (3 tablespoons): Calories: 60; Fat: 4 g (Saturated: 1.5 g); Cholesterol: 5 mg; Sodium: 410 mg; Carbohydrate: 2 g; Fiber: 0 g; Protein: 4 g; Sugar: 1 g', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup 2-percent Greek yogurt', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (about 1 lemon)', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan', u'5 anchovies', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1 small garlic clove, chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Yogurt Caesar Dressing

author: Cat Cora
directions: [u'In a medium salad bowl, combine the potatoes, onions, scallions, olives, dill, and oregano.', u'In a small bowl whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.', u'Pour over the salad and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds red Bliss potatoes, boiled and quartered', u'1 medium red onion, halved and sliced into half moons', u'2 scallions, thinly chopped', u'24 Kalamata olives, pitted and halved', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped dill', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh oregano', u'2 ounces olive oil', u'1/2 ounce red wine vinegar', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' Kosher salt', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Potato Salad: Patatosalata

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Cut the spaghetti squash in half and scrape out the seeds with a spoon. Place the halves cut-side down on a rimmed baking sheet and roast until the halves look somewhat wrinkly and collapsed, about 50 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 15 minutes.', u'Use a fork to scrape the inside of the squash to form spaghetti-like strands and transfer to a large serving bowl.', u'Heat the oil over medium heat in a very large, deep skillet (or even a large Dutch oven or pot). Add the garlic and saute until just golden, about 30 seconds. Add the shrimp and onion, season with salt and pepper and saute until the shrimp are pink and almost cooked through, about 4 minutes. Add the tomatoes, olives and oregano and saute until the mixture is hot and the shrimp are cooked through, another 2 minutes.', u'Turn the shrimp mixture into the serving bowl and toss with the spaghetti squash. Sprinkle with the feta and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 large spaghetti squash (about 4 pounds)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 pound peeled and cleaned extra-large shrimp', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups diced tomatoes', u'1/2 cup roughly chopped kalamata olives', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'1 cup crumbled feta']
title: Greek-Style Spaghetti Squash with Shrimp

author: Danny Boome
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Core the nectarines and cut into 8ths. Take 4 (12-inch) pieces of foil and divide the nectarines in the middle of each foil sheet. Drizzle the nectarines with the honey and fold foil over creating a packet. Place packets on a baking sheet and in the oven for 10 minutes. Once nectarines are soft remove the nectarines from the packet. Serve on a 4 plates and top with 1/4 cup Greek yogurt. Drizzle with honey and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 nectarines, pitted and cut into 8ths', u'4 tablespoon honey, plus more for drizzling', u'1 cup Greek yogurt']
title: Baked Nectarines with Greek Yogurt and Honey

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine the garlic, zest, juice, oregano and oil in blender and blend until smooth.  Put the pork in a baking dish, add the marinade and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours. ', u'Heat a grill to high. Remove the pork from marinade and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Grill until golden brown on all sides and cooked to medium doneness. Brush the radicchio and tomatoes with oil and grill until lightly charred. Remove the pork from the grill to a cutting board and loosely tent with foil. Let rest 10 minutes before slicing. Remove the radicchio and tomatoes from grill and set aside to cool slightly.', u'Whisk together vinegar, mustard, anchovy paste and a touch of honey in a medium bowl. Slowly whisk in the olive oil until emulsified. Add the radicchio, tomatoes, arugula, cucumber, olives, and capers and toss to combine.  Transfer to a platter and top with feta and pork slices. Garnish with fresh oregano and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 lemon, zested and juiced', u'2 tablespoons chopped oregano leaves, plus more for garnish', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'1 1/2 pounds pork tenderloin', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 head radicchio, cut into quarters', u'2 beefsteak tomatoes, cut into wedges', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1 heaping tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1 tablespoon anchovy paste', u' Honey', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 cups baby arugula', u'1 English cucumber, cut into big hunks', u'1 cup pitted kalamata olives', u'1 tablespoon capers', u'1/4 pound Greek feta, crumbled']
title: Pork Tenderloin Marinated in Garlic, Lemon and Oregano with Greek Salad

directions: [u'Arrange the salad mix among 4 bowls, piling it high. Top each with the cucumber, red onion, and cheese. Scatter the tomatoes, olives, and pepperoncini over each salad. Drizzle each salad with 2 tablespoons of Greek dressing.']
ingredients: [u'8 cups salad mix', u'1 cup sliced cucumber', u'1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion', u'8 ounces feta cheese, coarsely crumbled', u'2 plum tomatoes, cored and quartered', u'4 ounces kalamata olives (about a heaping cup) (may use any Greek or Italian marinated olives)', u'8 pepperoncini, plus more to taste', u' Greek Salad Dressing, recipe follows']
title: Ernie's Greek Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine 2 cups spinach, the feta and 3 tablespoons water in a bowl. Insert a paring knife into the thickest part of each chicken breast, cutting along the side to make a deep 2-inch-wide pocket. Stuff the spinach mixture into the pockets.', u'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat and add the olive oil. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Add to the skillet, rounded-side down, and cook until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Add the chicken broth, vinegar and sun-dried tomatoes. Partially cover and cook until the chicken is just cooked through, about 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add the ditalini and cook as the label directs. Put the remaining 1 1/2 cups spinach in a colander; drain the ditalini over the spinach to wilt it. Return to the pot.', u'Remove the chicken to a cutting board and slice. Add the pan sauce to the ditalini along with the mint and 1/4 teaspoon salt; toss. Serve with the chicken.', u'Photograph by Christopher Testani']
ingredients: [u'3 1/2 cups chopped baby spinach (about 8 ounces)', u'1/4 cup crumbled low-fat feta cheese', u'3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts (8 to 10 ounces each), trimmed', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped sun-dried tomatoes', u'8 ounces ditalini (about 1 3/4 cups)', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint']
title: Greek Spinach-Stuffed Chicken

directions: [u'Place the tomatoes, cucumbers, onion and bell peppers in a bowl. Mix in the olives and feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, oregano, and salt and pepper, and pour over the salad to coat.', u'Variation: Use up stale pita bread by toasting it, breaking into pieces and adding to salad.']
ingredients: [u'3 firm tomatoes, thinly sliced into rounds', u'1 large cucumber, peeled and thinly sliced into rounds', u'1 onion, thinly sliced into rings', u'2 green bell peppers, stems removed, cut into rings', u'1 cup pitted Kalamata, or other black Greek olives', u'6 ounces feta cheese, cut into chunks', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh oregano', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Village Salad

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'Click here to see how she does it.', u'In a small bowl, stir together the yogurt, oil, lemon juice, garlic, dill, and salt and pepper.', u'Heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the feta cheese, dill and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and stir to combine.', u'Divide the turkey into 4 equal sized rounds. Make 2 equal sized patties out of each round so you have 8 patties total. Put 2 tablespoons of the spinach-feta mixture onto half of the patties. Top with remaining patties working the turkey around the edges to seal burgers closed. Season the burgers on both sides with the salt and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper.', u'Spray a nonstick grill pan with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat, or prepare the grill. Grill the patties until cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.', u'To serve, place a burger on the bottom half of each bun, top with about 2 tablespoons of yogurt sauce, then 2 or 3 cucumber slices and a lettuce leaf. Top with the other half of the bun and serve.', u'Per Serving:', u'Calories 360; Total Fat 10 g; (Sat Fat 2.5 g, Mono Fat 4 g, Poly Fat 1.5 g) ; Protein 42 g; Carb 29 g; Fiber 4 g; Cholesterol 65 mg; Sodium 650 mg', u'Excellent source of: Protein, Vitamin A, Manganese, Selenium', u'Good source of: Fiber, Vitamin C, Vitamin K, Calcium, Iron, Magnesium, Phosphorus']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup nonfat Greek style yogurt', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 clove garlic, minced', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh dill leaves', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u' Pinch freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1/2 small onion, chopped', u'2 cups lightly packed baby spinach leaves, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, or 1 teaspoon dried', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/4 pounds lean ground turkey breast', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'4 whole-wheat burger buns', u'1/4 English cucumber, thinly sliced', u'4 small leaves romaine lettuce, hard ribs removed']
title: My Big Fat Greek Burgers

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'To marinate the lamb, whisk together 4 tablespoons of the olive oil, the garlic and oregano in a medium baking dish. Add the lamb and turn to coat. Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours.', u'Heat your grill to high.', u'Remove the lamb from the marinade and season with salt and pepper on both sides. Place on the grill and grill until golden brown and slightly charred, 3 to 4 minutes. Turn the lamb over and continue grilling to medium-rare, 2 to 3 minutes longer. Remove to a cutting board, tent with foil, and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing into 1/2-inch-thick slices.', u'While the lamb is resting, brush each pita on both sides with the remaining 2 tablespoons oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill until golden brown and slightly crisp, approximately 30 seconds per side.', u'To make the salad, whisk together the lemon juice, vinegar, dill, salt and pepper to taste, and the honey in a large bowl. Slowly whisk in the extra-virgin olive oil until emulsified. Add the spinach, cucumber, tomatoes, olives and feta to the bowl and toss to combine.', u'Top each pita with some of the salad and top with several slices of the lamb.']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons olive oil', u'4 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'1 1/2 pounds lamb tenderloin, trimmed of fat', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 pocketless pita breads', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, plus more for garnish', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons honey', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'6 ounces baby spinach', u'1/2 English cucumber, sliced', u'2 plum tomatoes, sliced', u'1/4 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and chopped', u'4 ounces feta cheese, crumbled (1 cup)']
title: Grilled Lamb with Greek Spinach Pita Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat a grill to medium-high.', u'Rinse the fish well under cold running water and pat dry with paper towels. Season the fish all over inside and out with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Brush each fish generously with 1/2 tablespoon of the olive oil and place directly on the grill. Cook, turning occasionally and coating with more olive oil if necessary, until flesh flakes easily and fish is cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Place fish on a platter. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine remaining olive oil with the lemon juice, parsley, and oregano. Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Serve fish drizzled with the olive oil-lemon mixture.']
ingredients: [u'4 whole branzini, or other small Mediterranean fish, 14 to 16 ounces each, gutted, scaled and bones removed but head, skin and fillets left intact (should be about 8 ounces each after processing)', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup olive oil, plus more if necessary', u'1/4 cup lemon juice', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano leaves']
title: Grilled Whole Fish, Greek-Style

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Place a cooling rack over 2 baking sheets for roasting the meatballs and toasting the pita.', u'Soak the bread in the milk. Peel the cucumber and grate into a strainer. Salt it and let it drain for 20 minutes.', u'Pour the EVOO into a bowl, then add the meat and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Squeeze out the bread and crumble between your fingers as you add it to the meat. Add the mint, onions, oregano, cinnamon, 2 of the garlic cloves, egg and 1/2 of the lemon juice, and mix to combine.', u'Using a small ice cream scoop, form the meat mixture into about 24 balls and place on the baking sheet. Roast to golden brown, 15 to 18 minutes. Remove the meatballs from the oven and place the broiler on high. Char the pita under the broiler, 30 seconds to 1 minute on each side.', u'Press the cucumber in the strainer to get out the excess water and add to a food processor. Then add the yogurt, dill, remaining 1 clove garlic, zest and remaining juice of the lemon. Season the sauce with cumin and salt and process until smooth.', u'Serve the meatballs with the sauce and pitas and alongside the Orzo with Feta and Walnuts.']
ingredients: [u'2 slices white bread, 1-inch thick', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup milk, to moisten', u'1/2 seedless cucumber', u' Kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons EVOO', u'1 1/2 pounds ground lamb or beef', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh mint', u'3 tablespoons grated red onion', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh oregano', u'2 pinches cinnamon', u'3 cloves garlic, grated or pasted', u'1 large egg', u' Zest and juice of 1 lemon', u'4 pocket-less pitas or flat breads, cut into wedges', u'1 1/2 cups Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup fresh dill', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u' Orzo with Feta and Walnuts, recipe follows', u' Kosher salt', u'1 1/2 cups orzo', u'1/2 cup chopped walnuts', u'1 cup finely chopped flat leaf parsley', u'1/2 pound Greek feta cheese, crumbled', u' EVOO, for drizzling', u' Freshly ground pepper']
title: Greek Meatballs with Tzatziki and Orzo with Feta and Walnuts

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat the EVOO in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the meat, brown and crumble. Remove the meat and drain off the fat. Melt the butter in the same pot and add the zest, oregano, garlic, onions and some salt and pepper. Cook to tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Then add the fresh herbs, stir. Add the flour, stir a minute or so and then whisk in the stock. Cook to thicken a little. Add the meat back in along with the lemon juice and spinach. Combine. Turn off the heat, cool and store for a make-ahead meal. Reheat over medium heat until hot. Stir in the feta crumbles just before serving.', u'For the puff pastry topper:', u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Flour a work surface and lightly roll out the puff pastry.  Cut the size and shape of 1 large casserole or up to 6 individual bowls or large ramekins, using sharp paring knife. Place the dough on a nonstick baking sheet and wash with egg. Bake until evenly puffed and deep golden brown in color.', u'Serve the hot filling in a casserole dish or individual bowls topped with the pastry.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon EVOO', u'2 pounds ground lamb, beef or chicken', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'1 tablespoon lemon zest', u'1 1/2 teaspoons dried Greek oregano or marjoram, half a palmful', u'4 cloves garlic, thinly sliced or chopped', u'2 medium onion, chopped', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves and dill combined, finely chopped', u'2 round tablespoons flour', u' About 2 1/2 cups chicken stock', u' Juice of 1/2 lemon', u' One 10-ounce package organic chopped frozen spinach, wrung dry in kitchen towel', u'1 cup feta crumbles', u'1 sheet puff pastry', u' Flour, for rolling', u'1 egg, lightly beaten with splash of water']
title: Greek Diner Meat and Spinach Pot Pies

author: Nikki Martin
directions: [u'For the chicken: Blend the turmeric and some salt with the yogurt in a large bowl and add the chicken. Toss to coat and marinate chicken for at least 10 minutes or up to 2 hours (in the fridge).', u'Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade and grill for a few minutes on each side, until cooked through.', u'For the vegetables: Drizzle olive oil on the onion, tomato and lemon and season with salt. Grill all until a bit charred on each side.', u'For the tzatziki: Incorporate the yogurt, dill, mint, lemon juice and cucumbers. Season with salt and set aside.', u'To serve, drizzle the chicken with garlic herb oil and spoon a scoop or two of tzatziki directly on top. Plate each dish with a few pieces of grilled veggies and, before serving, squeeze 1 grilled lemon half over the chicken and sprinkle with oregano.', u'This recipe was created by a contestant during a cooking competition. The Food Network Kitchens have not tested it for home use, therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u' Fine sea salt', u'1/2 cup Greek yogurt', u'4 boneless skinless chicken breasts', u' Olive oil', u'1 red onion, sliced thickly', u'1 tomato, halved', u'1 lemon, halved', u'2 cups Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh dill', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh mint', u'2 lemons, juiced', u'1 1/2 cucumbers, peeled and chopped', u' Fine sea salt', u' Garlic herb oil, for serving', u'1/2 tablespoon fresh oregano leaves, roughly chopped']
title: Grilled Extraordinary Chicken with Greek Tzatziki

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u"Cook's Note: To make 1 cup cooked couscous, bring 1/2 cup water or stock to a boil. Add 1/3 cup uncooked couscous and cover the pan. Remove the pan from the heat and allow the mixture to sit for 5 minutes until all the liquid has been absorbed. Fluff with a fork and allow to cool.", u'For the meatballs: In a large bowl, mix together the lamb, couscous, scallions, garlic, egg, parsley, olive oil, mint, oregano, salt, cumin, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper. Form the mixture into 15 to 16 (2-inch diameter) meatballs.', u'For the sauce: Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and cook until brown on all sides, about 6 minutes. Add the marinara sauce, cinnamon sticks, and ground cinnamon. Bring the sauce to a boil and reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook, turning occasionally, until the meatballs are cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. Discard the cinnamon sticks. Transfer the meatballs and sauce to a large bowl and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound ground lamb, or 20-percent fat ground beef', u"1 cup cooked and cooled couscous (see Cook's Note)", u'3 scallions, chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 egg, at room temperature, beaten', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 tablespoons dried mint', u'1 1/2 tablespoons dried oregano', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 (25-ounce) jar marinara sauce', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon']
title: Sweet and Spicy Greek Meatballs (Keftedes me Saltsa Domata)

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u'For the roasted salmon: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Line a cooking sheet with foil and lightly oil.', u'Pat the salmon dry. Check for bones by running your hand over the salmon from the thinnest to thickest end. Remove any bones. Sprinkle the salmon with the 2 teaspoons oil, lemon zest salt and pepper. Cook the salmon until just cooked through, 7 to 8 minutes. Let the salmon cool slightly, then flake with a fork.', u'For the yogurt sauce: Whisk the yogurt, 1 tablespoon water, lemon zest, juice, mint, salt and pepper in a bowl until combined.', u'For the Greek salad: Toss the olives, tomatoes, lettuce, scallion and cucumber in a medium bowl. Whisk the vinegar, oregano, salt, pepper and garlic powder in a small bowl. Gradually add the oil, whisking until emulsified. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss. Sprinkle the feta on top.', u'Serve the flaked roasted salmon on top of the Greek salad and drizzle with the yogurt sauce.']
ingredients: [u'2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for sprinkling', u'2/3 pound wild salmon fillets, skinned (1-inch thick at thickest part, preferably center cut)', u'1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup low-fat plain Greek yogurt', u'1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons fresh mint leaves, finely chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup mixed olives', u'2 Roma tomatoes, chopped', u'1 head romaine lettuce, thinly sliced', u'1 scallion, chopped', u'1/2 cucumber, peeled, sliced into half moons', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta']
title: Roasted Salmon Greek Salad with Yogurt Sauce

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Combine all of the ingredients in a medium mixing bowl.  Put 4 layers of cheesecloth in a fine mesh sieve set over a large bowl or plastic container. Add the yogurt and cover with the cheesecloth overhang. Put a small plate directly on the cheesecloth and top with a 16-ounce can.  Refrigerate for 1 hour. The desired consistency is that of Greek yogurt or thick sour cream. Store in the refrigerator, in an airtight container, for up to 10 days.']
ingredients: [u'1 quart plain yogurt', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Style Yogurt Herb Cheese Spread

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Bring 8 cups of cold, salted water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the orzo and cook until al dente, 7 to 8 minutes. Drain well.', u'While the orzo cooks, whisk together the mustard, vinegar and some salt and pepper in a medium bowl until smooth. Slowly whisk in the olive oil until emulsified. Set aside.', u'Combine the orzo, green onions, tomatoes and cucumbers in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Scatter the feta and dill over the top, drizzle with the vinaigrette, and toss again. Serve immediately, or chill for up to 8 hours.']
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 cup orzo', u'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'3 green onions, thinly sliced', u'1 cup grape or cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 medium English cucumber, diced', u'1/2 pound feta cheese, crumbled', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh dill']
title: Greek Orzo Salad with Mustard-Dill Vinaigrette

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside. ', u'Lay the phyllo on the counter and cover with a damp kitchen cloth or damp paper towels. ', u'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1/4 cup of the oil. Add the lamb and cook, stirring, until no longer pink, about 3 minutes. Add the onions, garlic, salt, Essence, pepper and nutmeg, and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Add the oregano, stir well, and transfer to a large bowl. Add the cheese and mix well.', u'Place 4 sheets of phyllo on the counter in front of you, and re-cover the remaining sheets. Brush the top sheet with 2 tablespoons of the oil. With a knife, cut the sheets in half lengthwise and then in half again, leaving 4 piles of phyllo, each about 3-inches wide. Working with 1 pile of phyllo, cover the remaining pieces. Place about 1/4 cup of the filling along the bottom of the phyllo. Bring up the bottom edge over the filling, then fold into a triangle (like folding a flag) to form a triangular package. Tuck the ends under and seal with oil. ', u'Repeat with the remaining phyllo and filling, placing the filled packages on the prepared baking sheet. Bake until golden brown, about 12 to 15 minutes. ', u'Remove from the oven and serve 1 or 2 phyllo triangles per person.']
ingredients: [u'8 sheets phyllo dough, thawed', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1 pound lamb sausage, casings removed', u'1/2 cup finely chopped yellow onions', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 1/4 teaspoons Essence, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh oregano', u'1 cup crumbled feta (about 1/2 pound)', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Greek Lamb Phyllo Triangles

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u"*Cook's note: Greek yogurt is thicker and less sour than plain yogurt. If you can't find Greek yogurt, drain regular yogurt, refrigerated, overnight through cheesecloth.", u'Toast the nuts in a saute pan over medium heat until they become fragrant. Put the nuts onto a plate and set aside; when cool enough to handle, chop them roughly.', u'In a small saucepan over medium heat, add the figs, dates, honey, water, lemon juice, and cinnamon stick. Cook for about 10 minutes until fruit is soft. Set aside and let it cool slightly; remove the cinnamon stick. Place the yogurt in a big bowl. Spoon the warm fruit onto the yogurt and gently swirl the fruit through the yogurt. Sprinkle on the nuts and garnish with mint leaves. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup walnuts', u'1/4 cup almonds', u'1/4 cup pine nuts', u'6 figs, fresh or dried, cut into quarters', u'6 dates, pitted and chopped', u'1/2 cup honey', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'2 cups Greek yogurt*', u' Mint leaves for garnish']
title: Greek Yogurt with a Fig, Date, and Honey Swirl

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Special equipment: 4 wooden skewers', u'Soak the skewers in water and heat a grill pan over medium to medium-high heat while you make the dressing.', u'In a jar, add the olive oil, vinegar, sugar, oregano, red pepper flakes and some salt and pepper. Shake to combine. Pour half the dressing over the chicken strips in a bowl and stir to combine.', u'In another bowl, add the cucumber, tomatoes and red onion. Pour the remaining dressing over and stir gently.', u'Thread the chicken strips onto the skewers. Grill until cooked through and charred, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove and let cool.', u'Top the salad with the feta cheese. Serve with the chicken skewers, olives, pita bread and Roasted Red Pepper Hummus.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips', u'1 English cucumber, peeled, seeded and sliced', u'1 pint cherry tomatoes, sliced in half', u'1/2 red onion, finely sliced', u'4 ounces feta cheese, cut into cubes', u'1 cup kalamata olives, for serving', u'4 pita breads, for serving', u' Roasted Red Pepper Hummus, recipe follows', u' Three 14.5-ounce cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained', u'1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon tahini', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped, or more to taste', u'2 jarred roasted red peppers', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon olive oil']
title: 16-Minute Greek Feast To Go

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.', u'Mix the canola oil, agave syrup, honey, cinnamon, brown sugar and vanilla extract in a small bowl until smooth. Combine the oats, almonds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, flax seeds, wheat germ and salt in a large bowl. Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and stir, making sure everything is evenly coated. Spread the mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet; bake, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crisp, 25 to 30 minutes.', u'Remove the granola from the oven and let cool slightly, then break into clumps while still warm. Let cool completely, then toss with the dried mango in a bowl. Serve with the yogurt. Store leftover granola in an airtight container in a cool place.', u'Photograph by Andrew Mccaul']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup canola oil', u'1/4 cup agave syrup', u'1/4 cup clover honey', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3 cups old-fashioned rolled oats (not instant)', u'3/4 cup slivered almonds', u'1/2 cup raw sunflower seeds', u'1/2 cup raw pumpkin seeds', u'2 tablespoons flax seeds', u'2 tablespoons wheat germ', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup diced dried sweetened mango', u'1 pint 2% Greek yogurt']
title: Mango-Agave Granola With Greek Yogurt

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Combine orzo, cucumber, green onions, and tomatoes in a large bowl. Place dill, vinegar, and mustard in a blender and blend until smooth. With the motor running, slowly add the olive oil and blend until emulsified. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Pour the vinaigrette over the orzo mixture and stir well to combine. Gently fold in the feta cheese. ', u'Heat grill to high. Brush shrimp with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill for approximately 2 minutes per side or until just cooked through. Divide orzo salad among 4 take-out containers or plates and top with 4 shrimp. Garnish with additional dill.']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound orzo, cooked al dente', u'1 large cucumber, seeded, quartered lengthwise, and sliced', u'3 green onions, thinly sliced', u'1 pint grape tomatoes, halved', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh dill, plus extra for garnish', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1/2 cup olive oil, plus additional for brushing shrimp', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'3/4 pound feta cheese, crumbled', u'16 medium shrimp, peeled and de-veined']
title: Greek Orzo and Grilled Shrimp Salad with Mustard-Dill Vinaigrette

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat a grill to high. Whisk the olive oil, vinegar, herbs, honey, 3/4 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper in a medium bowl. Remove 2 tablespoons of the vinaigrette to a large bowl; set aside. Add the cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, feta and olives to the bowl with the remaining vinaigrette; toss to coat.', u'Grill the corn, turning occasionally, until charred in spots, about 8 minutes; remove to a cutting board. Meanwhile, season the steaks with salt and pepper. Working in batches if necessary, grill the steaks until the edges start browning, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, about 30 seconds. Transfer to the bowl with the reserved vinaigrette; toss to coat.', u'Cut off the corn kernels and add to the salad. Serve the steak with the corn salad.', u"Note: Cube steak is an inexpensive cut of beef that has been tenderized by machine. If you can't find it, pound a top round steak with a meat mallet.", u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano and/or mint', u'1 teaspoon honey', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 English cucumber, peeled and chopped', u'1 pint grape or cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 small red onion, diced', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese (about 4 ounces)', u'1/3 cup pitted green olives, sliced', u'2 ears of corn, shucked', u'1 1/4 pounds cube steaks']
title: Grilled Steak with Greek Corn Salad

directions: [u'Combine the ground pork and onion in a mixing bowl. Add the tomato, mint, salt, and pepper, and knead well for 3 minutes to combine. Pour in the milk and continue kneading until the liquid is completely absorbed. If the mixture is so loose that the keftedes do not retain their shape, add a few tablespoonfuls of plain fine bread crumb. Cover the mixing bowl and refrigerate the mixture for at least 1 hour or up to 6 hours, so that the flavors meld.', u'To form, season the flour with salt and pepper, and spread out on a large plate. Have a second, clean plate ready. Take a tablespoonful at a time of the meat mixture and form into a small ball, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Roll in the flour and shake in the palm of your hand to remove the excess flour. Place the dredged meatball on the clean plate. Continue with the remaining mixture until all the meatballs are shaped.', u'To fry, heat about 1-inch of olive oil or other oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Using a tablespoon or small spatula, gently place as many meatballs as will fit in the pan without crowding. Fry them, turning once or twice so that all sides are browned. Remove, drain slightly on paper towels, and serve, either hot or at room temperature. The meatballs may be made several hours ahead and stored, covered, at room temperature.']
