ingredients: [u'3/4 pound ground pork', u'1 large red onion, minced or grated (about 1 cup)', u'1 large tomato, grated', u'2 tablespoons dried Greek mint', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 cup milk', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup plain bread crumbs, as needed', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour for dredging', u' Olive oil, for frying']
title: Greek Pork Meatballs: Pork Keftedes

directions: [u'Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, zest, garlic and rosemary in a medium shallow baking dish, add lamb and turn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours. Preheat grill. Grill lamb on both sides for 3 to 4 minutes for medium doneness. Let sit 10 minutes and slice into 1/4-inch thick slices.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped lemon zest', u'4 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', u'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped rosemary leaves', u'1 1/2 pound lamb tenderloin', u'4 pocketless pitas or Lavash', u'1 cucumber, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'2 tomatoes, cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'1 small red onion, finely sliced', u'2 tablespoons mint chiffonade', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 cup yogurt, drained', u'1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1/4 teaspoon cumin', u'1 tablespoon lemon juice', u'2 cloves garlic, finely chopped']
title: Grilled Lamb Greek Salad Wrap

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Soak 20 wooden skewers in water for about 20 minutes. Rinse the calamari tubes and pat dry. Split the bodies from top to bottom so you have 2 triangular pieces. Thread a soaked skewer through the length of each piece. Put the skewers on a platter and set aside. To make the vinaigrette, whisk together the oil, vinegar, garlic, dried and fresh oregano, thyme and lemon juice; season with salt and pepper. Pour 1/2 of the vinaigrette over the calamari; set the other 1/2 aside while you make the salad.', u'In a large bowl, add the tomatoes, onion, cucumber, cheese, olives, and romaine. Pour the remaining vinaigrette over the salad and toss to combine. Let marinate while you grill the calamari.', u'Heat the grill or a grill pan and oil it lightly. Grill the calamari for 2 minutes on each side, no longer or they will be tough. To serve, put the salad onto a large platter and top it with the calamari skewers. Garnish with fresh oregano leaves and lemon wedges.']
ingredients: [u'20 wooden skewers', u'10 small whole calamari, cleaned, tentacles removed', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for grilling', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'4 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon fresh oregano', u'1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 tomatoes, seeded and cut into chunks', u'1 medium red onion, sliced thin', u'1 medium cucumber, sliced thin', u'1/2 pound feta cheese, crumbled', u'1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted', u'1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite size pieces', u' Lemon wedges, for garnish', u' Fresh oregano leaves, for garnish']
title: Classic Greek Salad Topped with Grilled Calamari Skewers

author: Robin Miller
directions: [u'In a medium saucepan, cook couscous according to package directions. In a separate pan, add olive oil and shrimp. Add tomatoes, olives, mint, garlic and herb seasoning, and oregano. Simmer for about 3 to 5 minutes to cook shrimp and heat through. Season, to taste, with salt and black pepper. Pour over couscous and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 (10-ounce) package couscous', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 pound frozen shrimp, thawed, peeled and de-veined', u'1 (14-ounce) can diced tomatoes with green pepper and onion, drained', u'1/2 cup Greek black olives, pitted and chopped', u'1 tablespoon dried mint leaves', u'1 teaspoon garlic and herb seasoning', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Shrimp and Couscous

author: Cat Cora
directions: [u'1 cup Sushi Rice, recipe follows']
ingredients: [u'2 sheets nori', u'4 ounces roasted red peppers, cut into thin strips (if canned, drain before using)', u'8 to 10 kalamata olives, pitted and halved', u'1 to 2 ounces crumbled feta cheese', u'1 medium cucumber, peeled and sliced into thin strips', u' Pickled ginger, for serving', u' Wasabi, for serving', u' Soy sauce, for serving']
title: Greek Roll

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the pasta.', u'Heat the EVOO in a large skillet or pot with a tight-fitting lid over medium to medium-high heat. Melt the butter into the oil. When the butter begins to foam, add the oregano, garlic and onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the wine and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook until the tomatoes have burst and the sauce is thickened, 12 to 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, add the pasta to the boiling water and cook until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid, then drain the pasta.', u'Stir the sauce, then add the feta and cook until melted, about 1 minute. Add the pasta and the reserved cooking liquid and toss to combine, 1 to 2 minutes. Top with the mint and parsley, and serve.']
ingredients: [u' Salt', u'2 tablespoons EVOO', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1 tablespoon fresh oregano leaves, finely chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 large red onion, chopped', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'2 pints cherry tomatoes, halved if large', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1 pound penne with ridges (penne rigate)', u'12 ounces Greek feta, crumbled (about 1 1/4 cups)', u'1/4 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves']
title: Greek-Style Fresh Tomato Sauce

directions: [u'Combine the grated zucchini and kosher salt. Set aside for 5 minutes (no more, or it will be mush). Rinse in cold water and squeeze dry in a kitchen towel or press in a strainer or colander until dry.', u'Combine the cheese, egg, green onions, flour, pine nuts, dill, oregano, garlic, and pepper in a large bowl; fold in the zucchini. Form into 24 small cakes (about 2 tablespoons of mixture for each) and saute in olive oil, turning once, until browned, about 3 minutes on each side. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound zucchini, grated', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt or 3/4 teaspoon table salt', u'3/4 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'3 green onions, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup chopped pine nuts', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, or 1 teaspoon dried', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano leaves, or 1/2 teaspoon dried', u'1 garlic clove, finely chopped', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly milled black pepper', u' Olive oil']
title: Greek Zucchini Cakes

directions: [u'In a large bowl, toss together all ingredients except the feta. Put feta on 4 serving plates and spoon some of the salad over each. Serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 small green bell pepper, chopped', u'1/2 small red onion, sliced', u'1/3 cup Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives, rinsed', u'1/4 seedless cucumber, chopped', u'1 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, halved', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh oregano', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'4 thick slices feta cheese (about 8 ounces)']
title: Greek Salad: Horiatiki Salad

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. ', u'Roll dough out into a large rectangle and transfer to a large baking sheet. Top dough with mozzarella cheese, to within 1/2-inch of the edges and then sprinkle garlic flakes all over cheese. Top with chicken, mushrooms and olives. Sprinkle feta cheese over top and then sprinkle oregano over everything. Bake 10 to 12 minutes, until crust is golden brown and cheese melts. ', u'Serve with Cherry Tomato Salad.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound fresh or frozen pizza or bread dough, thawed according to package directions', u'1 1/2 cups grated mozzarella cheese', u'2 teaspoons garlic flakes', u'2 cooked chicken breast halves, diced (about 2 cups)', u'1 cup sliced mushrooms', u'1/2 cup sliced pitted kalamata olives', u'1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 recipe Cherry Tomato Salad, recipe follows', u'2 cups halved red cherry or grape tomatoes', u'2 cups halved yellow cherry tomatoes', u'1/4 cup freshly chopped basil leaves', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u' Salt and coarsely ground black pepper']
title: Greek Pizza with Chicken, Feta and Olives with Mixed Cherry Tomato Salad

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Grease a large baking sheet lightly with butter or cooking spray.', u'Fry or bake slivered almonds until a light golden brown.', u'Beat butter in blender or with a hand mixer on high for 20 to 30 minutes until white, light and creamy. Add the egg and yolks one at a time mixing well to incorporate.', u'Add 1 cup powdered sugar, vanilla, optional gum powder, rose water, ouzo and then almonds.', u'Next sift together baking powder and flour. Slowly add to mixture,', u'The final dough should be soft and easy to work with. So now form them into small balls -- about a fist-full. Form like dumplings and imprint thumb on all sides of the cookie. ', u'Bake for 10 to 20 minutes until light golden brown. Immediately splash with hand a mixture of 1/4 cup water and 1/2 cup rose water.', u'Finally, place cookies on a serving tray and use a sifter to sprinkle powdered sugar on cookies until coated. ', u'Then say, "Hopa" and enjoy with friends and family!!!', u'A viewer, who may not be a professional cook, provided this recipe. Food Network Kitchens has not tested this recipe and therefore, we cannot make representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup slivered almonds', u'1 1/2 pounds fitini butter or 6 sticks unsalted butter', u'1 cup powdered sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u' (Optional: 1/2 teaspoon ground gum powder from Hios Island in Greece)', u'1/4 cup rose water', u'1/4 cup ouzo', u'1 large egg', u'2 egg yolks', u'3 teaspoons baking powder', u'4 pounds all-purpose flour', u'2 cups powdered sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'1/2 cup rose water']
title: Kourabiedes: Greek Festive Cookies

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Decoratively line the outer rim of a large bowl with the artichoke leaves. Remove and discard the hairy choke in the center. Thinly slice the heart.', u'In a large bowl, combine the artichoke heart, tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, and onions, and toss to combine. Crumble the cheese over the vegetables and add the olives. Sprinkle with the oregano, parsley, and lemon juice, and drizzle with the oil, to taste. Serve immediately with bread for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1 large artichoke, boiled', u'2 large tomatoes (about 3/4 pound) cut into thick pieces', u'1 large cucumber, peeled, seeded and sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, cored, seeded, and sliced into rings', u'1 large sweet onion, cut into thin wedges', u"8 ounces sheep's milk feta cheese, drained and crumbled", u'1/3 cup Kalamata olives', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, or to taste', u' Crusty whole wheat bread, accompaniment']
title: Emeril's Greek Salad

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'For the wings: Heat 3 to 4 inches of oil in a large, high-sided pan until it reaches 375 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer. Add the wings in batches and cook until golden brown and cooked through, 13 to 15 minutes.', u'For the dipping sauce: Meanwhile, to a bowl, add the Greek yogurt, chives, garlic, lemon juice and celery salt. Stir to combine and taste. Adjust seasoning as needed.', u'For the hot wing sauce: In a saute pan over medium-high heat, melt the butter, and then add the honey and warm through until loose and viscous.', u'In a large bowl, add the garlic, rosemary, lemon zest and juice and crushed red pepper flakes. Pour the honey-butter into the rosemary mixture.', u'As the wings come out of the fryer, toss in the honey-butter sauce. Season to taste. Serve with the Greek yogurt dipping sauce.']
ingredients: [u' Canola oil, for frying', u'1 dozen chicken wings split at the joint, wing tips removedand discarded', u'1/2 cup Greek yogurt', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh chives', u'1 clove garlic, smashed and minced', u' Juice of 1/2 lemon', u' Pinch celery salt', u'2 to 3 tablespoons butter', u"2 tablespoons chile-infused honey, such as Mike's HotHoney", u'2 cloves garlic, smashed and minced', u'2 sprigs fresh rosemary, leaves finely chopped', u'1 lemon, zested and juiced', u' Crushed red pepper']
title: Honey-Rosemary Wings with Greek Yogurt and Lemon Garlic Dipping Sauce

directions: [u'Preheat a grill over indirect medium-high heat.', u'In a large bowl, combine the parsley, yogurt, garlic, coriander, salt, cumin, paprika, and allspice.  Add the lamb and mix gently by hand until evenly combined. Shape the meat into 4 patties, each about 4 by 6-inches by 1/2-inch. ', u'Oil 1 side of the pizza dough very lightly. Grill, oiled side down, over medium-high heat until the bottom side is blistered. Lightly oil the top and flip over. Scatter the cheese over the dough and cook until the underside is blistered. Move to indirect heat, cover, and cook until the cheese is melted and the dough is cooked through, about 3 to 5 minutes. Cut the dough into rough rectangles about the size of the patties and keep warm while you grill the burgers. ', u'Lightly oil the patties and arrange them on the hot side of the grill. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, flip, and cook another 2 to 3 minutes for medium-rare to medium. Transfer the burgers to the bread, top with some Muhamarra and grilled onions and top with another piece of the grilled pizza dough. Put them back on the grill over low or indirect heat for a few seconds per side. Remove them from the grill, halve the sandwiches on a long diagonal, and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup finely chopped parsley leaves', u'1/3 cup whole milk Greek yogurt', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons ground coriander, from toasted seeds', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin, from toasted seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1 1/4 pounds ground lamb', u' Olive oil', u'1 (20 to 24-ounce) prepared pizza dough, rolled into 1 large or 2 smaller rough rectangles', u'1 pound aged Kasseri cheese, grated', u' Muhammara, recipe follows', u'4 large sweet onions, thinly sliced and grilled', u'1 pound red bell peppers, charred, peeled, seeded and roughly chopped', u'1 to 2 small hot red peppers, charred, peeled, seeded and roughly chopped', u'1 cup walnut pieces, about 5 ounces, toasted', u'1 clove garlic, roughly chopped', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin, from freshly toasted seeds', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses', u'1 tablespoon sherry vinegar', u'1/2 lemon, zested and juiced', u' Put all of the ingredients, except the lemon zest, in a food processor and process until a smooth paste forms. (Start with 1 hot pepper, taste, and then add more if you want it hotter.) If the mixture is too thick, drizzle in a little more olive oil. Stir in the lemon zest by hand. Taste and add more salt and hot pepper, if desired.']
title: Greek Patty Melts with Kasseri Cheese and Muhammara

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 400F.  In a large saucepan set over moderate heat, heat oil until hot, and add the onion and cook it, stirring occasionally for 4 minutes.  Add the garlic and cook for 3 to 4 minutes more, or until the onion and garlic are golden in color.  Now add the tomatoes, oregano, red pepper flakes and salt and pepper to taste and simmer the tomatoes for 6 to 8 minutes, or until lightly thickened.  Add the basil and shrimp and cook, stirring gently, for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimp are just turning pink.  Place cooked pasta in a large bowl, gently stir in shrimp and tomato mixture, 2 tablespoons of the parsley and half of the feta cheese.  Transfer to an oiled 3 quart shallow baking dish and sprinkle with the remaining feta cheese and parsley.  Cover loosely with foil, place in the oven and bake for 20 minutes, or until bubbling.  Run under the broiler until golden.']
ingredients: [u'2 Tbsp olive oil plus enough for coating your baking dish', u'1 onion, sliced thin', u'2 large cloves garlic, sliced thin', u'3 cups drained chopped canned plum tomatoes', u'2 tsp minced fresh oregano, or 1 tsp dried & crumbled', u'1/2 tsp dried red pepper flakes', u' salt & freshly ground pepper to taste', u'2 Tbsp minced fresh basil ( I need a dry substitute)', u'1 lb large shrimp, shelled & deveined', u'1/4 cup minced fresh parsley leaves', u'3/4 lb ziti, cooked & drained according to package directions', u'1/2 lb feta cheese, crumbled']
title: Ziti Baked with Shrimp & Feta Cheese - Greek Style

directions: [u'For the burgers: Place the ginger, garlic, lime leaves, shallots and lemongrass in a food processor and pulse until a chunky paste is formed. Place the lamb in large bowl and add the lemongrass paste, curry powder, white pepper, soy sauce, Worcestershire, cilantro, mint and parsley. Mix until combined. Portion into 4-ounce patties.', u'For the yogurt sauce: Combine the yogurt with the lime juice, curry powder, white pepper, salt, mint, cilantro, mint and parsley.', u'Cook the burgers until light pink in the center. Toast the brioche buns. Place the burgers on the buns and top with the yogurt sauce and pea sprouts.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup peeled and diced fresh ginger', u'6 cloves garlic, peeled', u'6 kaffir lime leaves', u'4 shallots, peeled', u'3 stalks lemongrass, white part pounded', u'5 pounds ground lamb', u'4 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 tablespoons Chinese white pepper', u'2 tablespoons dark soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1 bunch fresh cilantro, minced', u'1 bunch fresh mint, minced', u'1 bunch fresh Italian parsley, minced', u'24 ounces Greek yogurt', u'1/2 cup fresh squeezed lime juice', u'4 tablespoons curry powder', u'2 tablespoons Chinese white pepper', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 bunch fresh cilantro, minced', u'1 bunch fresh mint, minced', u'1 bunch fresh Italian parsley, minced', u'20 brioche buns', u'3 cups pea sprouts']
title: Lamb Burgers with Greek Yogurt Sauce

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Metal skewers', u'']
ingredients: [u' Salt', u'1/2 pound orzo', u'4 cloves garlic, grated or minced', u'4 sprigs fresh oregano, leaves stripped and finely chopped', u'6 sprigs fresh rosemary, leaves stripped and finely chopped', u'1/4 cup green olive tapenade', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'2 lemons, juiced and 1 zested', u'1/3 plus 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'1 1/2 pounds firm white flesh fish, halibut or swordfish, cut into 12 (2-inch) chunks', u'2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 12 (2-inch) chunks', u' Black pepper', u'1/4 cup pine nuts, lightly toasted', u'1 small red onion, finely chopped', u'1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped', u'1 cup feta cheese crumbles', u'8 Greek hot peppers, for garnish', u'1/4 cup kalamata olives, for garnish', u'2 tomatoes, diced, for garnish', u'1/2 cucumber, diced, for garnish']
title: Greek Mixed Grill Kabobs and Pine Nut-Orzo Salad

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat grill pan over high heat. Place chicken in shallow dish and season with salt and pepper.', u'Preheat oven to 275 degrees F. Wrap pita breads in foil. Place in warm oven and heat until dinner is served.', u'Combine lemon zest, juice and vinegar in a bowl and whisk in oil. Add oregano, garlic and whisk again to combine into dressing. Pour half the dressing over chicken tenders. Turn tenders in dressing to coat.', u'Combine remaining salad ingredients in a bowl. Pour remaining dressing over salad and toss well. The salad should be very lightly dressed. Season salad with salt and pepper and transfer to a large serving platter.', u'Grill tenders 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Transfer hot tenders to the salad lined serving platter. Remove pitas from oven and unwrap. Cut pitas in half and arrange around the edge of platter.', u'To serve, each person can pile grilled chicken and veggies into pita halves, wrap up on either side and enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'1 1/3 to 1 1/2 pounds chicken breast tenders, 2 packages from meat case', u' Salt and pepper', u'8 pita breads', u'1 ripe lemon, zested and juiced', u'3 tablespoon red wine vinegar, eyeball it', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it', u'2 tablespoons fresh chopped oregano, 4 stems, stripped of leaves and chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'2 hearts Romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1/2 cup pitted Kalamata olives, coarsely chopped', u'8 ounces feta cheese, crumbled', u'2 vine ripe tomatoes, seeded and diced', u'1/3 seedless or English cucumber, diced', u'1/2 red onion, chopped', u'1/2 cup flat leaf parsley leaves, a couple of handfuls, chopped']
title: Greek Grilled Chicken and Vegetable Salad with Warm Pita Bread for Wrapping

directions: [u'Make the meatballs: In a bowl let the bread soak in the milk for 3 minutes.  Add the lamb, garlic, mint, scallion, cinnamon, salt, and pepper, and combine the mixture well.  Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls, in a large kettle brown the meatballs over moderate heat for 5 minutes, or until they are just firm to the touch, and transfer them with a slotted spoon to a plate.', u'Make the sauce: In the kettle cook the onion in the oil over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally and scraping up the brown bits, until it is softened.  Add the tomatoes, chopping them with a spoon, and stir in the wine, carrot, garlic, salt and pepper to taste.  Bring the liquid to a boil and simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.  Add the meatballs and any juices that have accumulated on the plate and simmer the mixture for 5 minutes.  Stir in the mint and the Feta and keep the sauce hot over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally.', u'In a kettle of boiling salted water cook the spaghetti for 8 to 10 minutes, or until it is al dente, and drain it well.  Transfer the spaghetti to a heated platter and spoon the sauce over it.']
ingredients: [u'1 slice of homemade-type white bread, torn into pieces', u'1/4 cup milk', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1/3 cup minced fresh mint leaves', u'3 tablespoons minced scallion', u'1/8 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper, or to taste', u'1 cup finely chopped onion', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 28 -ounce cans Italian plum tomatoes, drained in a colander', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'2 tablespoons finely grated carrot', u'1/2 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh mint leaves', u'6 ounces Feta, cut into 1/4-inch dice (about 1 cup)', u'1 pound dried spaghetti']
title: Spaghetti with Greek Meatballs and Tomato Feta Sauce

directions: [u'Put the shallot into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until well chopped. Add the lemon juice, feta, oregano, salt and pepper and pulse again to combine. With the processor running, add the oil in a steady stream. Pour into a small pitcher and set aside.', u'Yield: 2 cups']
ingredients: [u'1 shallot, diced', u'1/2 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon salt', u' Freshly ground pepper', u'1 1/2 cups extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 heads Romaine lettuce, washed and torn into bite sized pieces', u'1 pint grape tomatoes, halved', u'1 cup kalamata olives', u'1 cucumber, sliced', u' Greek vinaigrette, recipe follows', u'12 pepperoncini', u'2 small red onions, thinly sliced', u' Saganaki, recipe follows', u'1 pound kasseri cheese, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'3 tablespoons butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons brandy', u'1 lemon, juiced']
title: Greek Salad with Saganaki

directions: [u'Remove the outer leaves of the romaine, reserve for the salad mix. Save the hearts to put the completed salad in. Shred the outer leaves of the lettuce, and add to a mixing bowl with 1/2 the cheese and all of the remaining ingredients. Season with salt and pepper. ', u'Arrange the lettuce hearts on a serving platter. Fill the leaves with some of the salad, and put the rest of the salad in the center of the serving tray. ']
ingredients: [u'2 heads romaine lettuce', u'1 (6-ounce) feta cheese block, soaked in warm water', u'1 cup kalamata olives, pitted', u'2 green peppers, seeded and julienne', u'2 red onion, julienne', u'1 bunch flat-leaf parsley, leaves only', u'6 Roma tomatoes, seeded and small diced', u'1 cup red wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Greek Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Fill a large pot 3/4 full with water. Add 1/4 cup of the salt and bring to a boil. Rub the cut sides and bottoms of the artichokes with the lemon wedges. Squeeze the juice from the lemons into the boiling water. Add the artichokes and lemon wedges, weight with a heavy dish or bowl, and simmer, partially covered, until the bottoms are tender and can be pierced with a sharp knife and an outer leaf pulls out easily, 15 to 18 minutes. Reserve 2/3 cup of the cooking liquid for the sauce. Drain the artichokes upside down in a colander.', u'Cook the sausage in a medium skillet over medium-high heat, stirring, until browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the onions to the fat in the pan and cook, stirring, until soft, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic, oregano, and parsley, and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and let sit until cool enough to handle.', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'When the artichokes are cool enough to handle, gently press back the center leaves so the inner choke and prickly leaves are revealed. Pull out the cone of undeveloped white leaves in the center and gently scrape out the hairy choke with a spoon so as not to damage the heart. In a large bowl combine the bread crumbs, feta cheese, 6 tablespoons of the olive oil, the water, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, the Essence, remaining teaspoon of salt, the red pepper, and the cooled sausage mixture. Adjust the seasoning, to taste.', u'Gently pull the artichoke leaves outward to make space between the leaves. Fill these gaps with the sausage-bread stuffing, pushing down to pack lightly. Place the artichokes in a large baking dish and drizzle the tops with the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. Bake uncovered until the bread crumbs develop a nice golden brown crust, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove the artichokes from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.', u'To make the sauce, in a small saucepan bring the reserved 2/3 cup of artichoke cooking liquid to a boil. In a bowl whisk together the eggs and remaining 1/4 cup of lemon juice. Whisking constantly, add about half of the hot liquid to the egg mixture in a stream, then add back to the saucepan with the remaining hot liquid. Whisk until thickened enough to coat the back of a spoon, 2 to 3 minutes, being careful not to let boil. Strain through a strainer into a clean bowl.', u'To serve, arrange the artichokes on a large platter or 4 individual plates. Drizzle the hot sauce over the artichokes and serve immediately, reserving any remaining sauce for dipping.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup salt plus 1 teaspoon', u'4 medium artichokes, rinsed well, top third removed, and leaf tips trimmed', u'2 lemons, cut into wedges', u'1 1/2 pounds lamb sausage, removed from casings and crumbled', u'2 cups chopped yellow onions', u'1/4 cup minced garlic', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh oregano', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley', u'2 cups fine dry bread crumbs', u'1 cup crumbled feta cheese', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus 1/4 cup', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 tablespoons plus 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'4 teaspoons Essence, recipe follows', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper', u'2 large eggs', u'2 1/2 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons salt', u'2 tablespoons garlic powder', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon onion powder', u'1 tablespoon cayenne pepper', u'1 tablespoon dried leaf oregano', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme']
title: Greek-style Stuffed Artichokes with Avgolomono Sauce

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'Skewers: Thread the skewers starting with a tomato, then a piece of feta cheese, an olive, a piece of onion and finish with another tomato.', u'Vinaigrette: In a small bowl, mix together the lemon juice, red wine vinegar and oregano. Whisk in the olive oil until the mixture thickens. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Arrange the skewers on a serving platter. Spoon the vinaigrette over the skewers and sprinkle with the chopped oregano.']
ingredients: [u'24 grape or small cherry tomatoes', u'3 ounces feta cheese, cut into 12 (1/2-inch) cubes', u'12 pitted kalamata olives', u'1/2 small red or sweet onion, cut into 12 (1/2-inch) pieces', u'12 (6-inch) bamboo or wood skewers, soaked for 20 to 30 minutes', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'2 teaspoons lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons red wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh oregano leaves', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Skewered Greek Salad

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Preheat a grill or a large rectangular grill pan over medium heat.  Brush the grill grates or grill pan will canola oil before the grilling bread', u'Roll out the dough with a rolling pin on a floured work surface into a long rectangle, about 1/4-inch thick.  Put the dough onto the grill or gill pan and grill for 3 minutes per side. Remove the bread from the grill and put on a sheet pan.', u'Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F', u'Brush the grilled flat bread with the Chicken Souvlaki marinade.  Top with onion, tomato, chicken, and feta cheese.   Bake until flat bread is cooked through and the cheese is melted, about 10 minutes', u'Remove from oven and let cool for 2 minutes. Drizzle with Tzatziki Sauce, slice and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 bag (1 pound) refrigerator pizza dough, at room temperature', u' Flour', u'1 1/2 tablespoons leftover Souvlaki Marinade, from Chicken Souvlaki recipe', u'1/4 cup leftover chopped onions from Chicken Souvlaki recipe', u'1/4 cup leftover tomatoes from Chicken Souvlaki recipe', u'1 cup chopped leftover chicken from Chicken Souvlaki recipe', u'1 (4-ounce) container crumbled feta cheese', u'3 tablespoons leftover Tzatziki Sauce from Chicken Souvlaki recipe']
title: Round 2 Recipe - Greek Flat Bread

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Put a roasting pan in the oven to preheat.', u'Cut the zucchini in half lengthwise, then cut across into thirds. Put the zucchini into a bowl and add the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, shallots, parsley and oregano, and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Toss to combine.', u"Carefully remove the hot roasting pan from the oven and add the zucchini mixture. Put the pan to the oven and roast for 3 minutes. Remove it, and stir in the olives and preserved lemon. Return the pan to the oven and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes, don't let the zucchini get too soft. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve immediately."]
ingredients: [u'2 large zucchini', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 garlic clove, diced', u'1 tablespoon chopped shallots', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh oregano leaves', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup kalamata olives', u'1/2 tablespoon chopped preserved lemon, store-bought or homemade']
title: Roasted Zucchini with Preserved Lemon and Oregano (Greek)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat a grill pan to high heat. Heat a toaster oven or oven to 250 degrees F.', u'Wrap breads in foil and place in oven to warm.', u'Combine yogurt and next 4 ingredients. Coat chicken in mixture then thread meat onto metal skewers. Brush grill pan with oil and grill meat 5 to 6 minutes on each side.', u'Combine chopped lettuce, chopped veggies, olives and hot peppers on a large platter or in a serving bowl. Dress the salad very lightly in lemon juice and extra-virgin olive oil and salt and pepper.', u'Place all ingredients for pesto in the food processor except extra-virgin olive oil. Turn processor on and stream in extra-virgin olive oil. ', u'Remove bread from oven and cut into wedges. ', u'Place grilled meat on salad and top liberally with pesto. Place cut flat breads or pita wedges around the platter or serving bowl and serve.']
ingredients: [u'4 flat breads or pitas, any flavor or variety', u'1 cup plain yogurt', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 tablespoon grill seasoning (recommended: McCormick Montreal Seasoning)', u'2 to 2 1/2 pounds white meat chicken, cubed into bite size pieces', u'1 heart romaine lettuce, chopped', u'2 vine ripe tomatoes, chopped', u'1/2 seedless cucumber, chopped', u'1/2 red onion, chopped', u'3 ribs celery, chopped', u'1/2 cup pitted kalamata olives', u'6 pepperoncini hot peppers, chopped', u'1 lemon, juiced', u' Extra-virgin olive oil, for drizzling', u' Salt and pepper', u' Special equipment: metal skewers', u'1 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1/2 cup feta crumbles', u'1 clove garlic', u'1 teaspoon coarse black pepper', u'3 tablespoons chopped walnuts', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil']
title: Chicken Greek-a-Tikka Salad with Parsley-Feta Pesto

directions: [u'3/4 teaspoon smoked sea salt (large crystals - if using fine salt cut this amount in 1/2)', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'1/2 cup sour cream', u'4 ounces good quality feta cheese', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'1/2 small clove garlic, grated', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds good quality ground lamb', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1/2 teaspoon dried mint', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'4 slices mozzarella cheese', u'4 good quality kaiser rolls or hamburger buns, split', u' Romaine lettuce', u' Sliced tomato', u' Sliced red onion', u' Mild banana pepper rings', u' English cucumber slices']
title: It's All Greek to Me Burger

directions: [u'Cook pasta al dente according to package instructions. Rinse, drain and set aside.', u'In a large nonstick skillet coated with olive oil spray, add the shrimp and garlic and cook until the shrimp turns salmon-colored. Remove from heat and allow to cool.', u'In a large bowl, combine the pasta, cooled shrimp, olives, artichoke hearts and tomatoes.', u'Season with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, whisk together oil, zest, juice, vinegar and parsley. Pour over shrimp mixture. Toss thoroughly to coat. Add the crumbled feta and gently toss.', u'Serve it up Suzy-Style:', u'For an outing or picnic, I like to make this seem like gourmet takeout so I put it in small aluminum containers with clear lids. You can get them at the store or from restaurant supply companies online. I place it in and put cute labels on the clear top and write the name of the recipe on it.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces dry mini shell pasta', u' Olive oil cooking spray', u'1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', u'2 cloves minced garlic', u'16 Greek olives, pitted and quartered', u'1 (12 or 14-ounce) can artichoke hearts, quartered', u'1 cup small cherry tomatoes or grape tomatoes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 lemon, zested and juiced', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves', u'4 ounces crumbled fat-free or regular feta cheese']
title: Greek Goddess Shrimp Salad

directions: [u'Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a 4 to 6-inch nonstick skillet. In a food processor with grating attachment, grate potato. Transfer potato to skillet. Pat into thin pancake. Cook until golden on one side, 4 to 5 minutes. Turn pancake over and cook until golden on other side, 4 to 5 minutes more. ', u'Pour 3 tablespoons olive oil into another non-stick skillet. Thinly slice 2 cloves of garlic. Place garlic in cold oil and bring up to heat slowly. Saute until garlic is just golden. Remove garlic from pan and add spinach. Cook until just wilted. Remove from pan. ', u'Beat 4 eggs until just combined. Do not beat in too much air into eggs or the texture will be dry. Add 1 tablespoon butter to spinach pan. After foam has subsided, pour in the eggs. While stirring the eggs with a fork, shake the pan back and forth. ', u'Once the bottom of the omelet has set, slide in potato pancake. Add spinach and crumbled feta cheese on top of potato. Run omelet under broiler until cheese starts to melt. Remove from broiler and fold into half moon shape. Sprinkle sauted garlic slices over top of omelet.']
ingredients: [u'1 Idaho baking potato, peeled', u'4 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'2 cloves garlic', u'1 (10-ounce) bag of spinach, washed, stemed, and spun dry', u'1/3 cup feta cheese, crumbled', u'4 eggs', u'1 tablespoon butter']
title: Greek Potato Spinach and Feta Cheese Omelet

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'For the lamb: Soak the currants in warm water for 30 minutes. Drain.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a 6-quart saucepan over high heat. Add the lamb, cinnamon, ginger, allspice, cayenne, and salt and pepper and cook, stirring to break up the meat, until browned, about 5 minutes. Transfer the lamb to a large strainer set over a bowl and drain; discard any liquid left in the pan. Return the pan to the heat and add the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil and heat until it begins to shimmer. Add the onions and bell pepper and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the serrano and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.', u'Return the lamb to the pan, add the wine, and cook, stirring occasionally, until almost completely evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add the tomato puree and currants and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until thickened, about 30 minutes. Stir in the parsley and oregano and season with salt and pepper and honey, if needed. Remove from the heat.', u'For the eggplant: Heat the canola oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Season the eggplant slices on both sides with salt and pepper. Working in batches, add the eggplant slices and fry until tender and lightly golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes. Transfer the eggplant slices to paper towels.', u'For the bechamel: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, whisking constantly, until pale and smooth, 2 minutes. Still whisking constantly, add the milk and bay leaf and cook until thickened. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg and discard the bay leaf. Let the sauce cool for 5 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, goat cheese, and lemon zest and whisk into the bechamel sauce until smooth.', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Butter a 3-quart baking dish or casserole dish.', u'To assemble: Put half the eggplant slices in the dish and cover with half the meat sauce. Top the sauce with the remaining eggplant slices, and then the remaining meat sauce. Pour the bechamel over the top of the meat sauce and spread evenly with a rubber spatula. Sprinkle Romano evenly over the top, place the dish on a baking sheet, and bake until browned and bubbly, 45 to 50 minutes. Top with more chopped parsley, if desired. Let cool for at least 20 minutes before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup dried currants', u'1/4 cup Greek extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 large yellow onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'1 red bell pepper, stemmed, cored, and thinly sliced', u'1 serrano chile, finely diced', u'5 cloves garlic, finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 cup red wine', u'1 (28-ounce can) plum tomatoes, pureed until smooth with their juices', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat leaf parsley, plus more for garnish', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano', u' Honey, if needed', u'1 1/2 cups canola oil', u'1 1/2 pounds eggplant, cut crosswise into 14-thick slices', u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup flour', u'2 1/2 cups milk', u'1 bay leaf', u'1/8 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'3 egg yolks', u'1/2 cup soft goat cheese', u'1 cup grated Romano', u'1 lemon, zested']
title: Moussaka

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the chocolate chips into a medium glass mixing bowl. Set aside.', u'Combine the milk, cocoa powder, sugar, vanilla and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk constantly until the cocoa is dissolved and the mixture comes to a simmer, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heat and pour the milk mixture over the chocolate. Let stand for 5 minutes, then whisk gently until all the chocolate is melted. Whisk in the yogurt until smooth and blended, then cool completely.', u"Divide the mixture evenly among eight popsicle molds (about 1/3 cup per pop) and freeze until solid, at least 5 hours. (They'll keep up to a month.) Just before serving, briefly run the molds under hot water to release the pops.", u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces semisweet chocolate chips', u'1 1/2 cups 1-percent milk', u'1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u' Kosher salt', u'1 cup 2-percent Greek yogurt']
title: Greek Yogurt Fudge Pops

author: Amanda Freitag
directions: [u'For the burgers: Add the beans to a large bowl with the breadcrumbs, lemon juice, oregano, salt, pepper, garlic, eggs and onions. Mash with a fork or your hands until the mixture is homogeneous. Portion into 6 patties and refrigerate for 1 hour.', u'For the mayo: In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise, oregano, pepper, salt, garlic and lemon juice.', u'Heat a medium pan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. Cook the burgers until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Place each burger on a bun, and top with lettuce, tomatoes, onions and some Greek mayo to serve.']
ingredients: [u' Two 15-ounce cans black beans, drained and rinsed', u'1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs', u'3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3 to 4 large cloves garlic, minced', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'1 small onion, finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'6 whole-grain hamburger buns', u' Serving suggestions: lettuce, tomato slices and red onion slices', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 cloves garlic, grated', u' Juice of 1 lemon']
title: Black Bean Veggie Burgers with Greek Mayo

directions: [u'In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, garlic, salt, and oil. Stir in the oregano and pepper. Set aside.', u'When ready to serve: In a large bowl lightly toss the lettuce with some of the dressing. Divide the lettuce among 4 salad bowls. Scatter the olives, cheese, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and peppers over the top of the greens. Serve and pass the remaining dressing at the table.']
ingredients: [u'6 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt plus more to taste', u'1 cup extra-virgin olive oil, preferably Greek', u'2 teaspoons minced fresh oregano', u' Freshly ground black pepper to taste', u'1 head romaine lettuce(about 1 pound), trimmed of tough stems and torn into bite-sized pieces', u'6 ounces calamata olives, about 1 cup', u'1/2 pound feta cheese, crumbled', u'1 English (seedless) cucumber, trimmed, cut into 1 inch chunks', u'12 ounces vine-ripened cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 small red onion, cut into 1/2-inch wedges, soaked in cold water for 5 minutes and drained', u'1 green pepper, trimmed, seeded, and diced']
title: Greek Salad

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'For the relish: Put the garlic, pine nuts, serrano and some salt in a mortar and pestle and mash to a chunky, pesto-like consistency. Add the cilantro and continue to mash; the pesto should be very coarse.', u'Put the avocados and lime juice in a bowl and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Gently fold in the pesto until just combined, being careful not to mash the avocado too much.', u'For the crema: Heat a grill to high. Toss the tomato halves with some canola oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill until the tomatoes are charred and softened, turning once or twice, about 5 minutes total.', u'Combine the grilled tomatoes, vinegar and chipotles in a food processor and pulse a few times to combine. Add the garlic, onions, cilantro, oregano and some salt and pepper and pulse until slightly smooth.', u'Put the yogurt in a medium bowl and swirl in some of the salsa, being careful not to stir it in completely.', u'For the slaw: Put the lemon juice, orange juice, honey, mustard, basil and some salt and pepper in a blender and blend until smooth. With the motor running, drizzle in the canola oil until emulsified.', u'Combine the Napa cabbage, red cabbage and carrot in a large bowl; add half of the dressing and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper; add more dressing if needed, reserving a little for fish.', u'For the rub: Combine the ancho powder, cinnamon, cumin, salt, brown sugar and black pepper in a bowl. Mix to blend.', u'For the fish: Brush the top of the fish filets with canola oil, and sprinkle them with salt, pepper and about 3 tablespoons of the spice rub. Let stand for 5 minutes, then grill the filets, spice-side down, over direct heat until the fish is lightly charred and comes away from the grill easily, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook another 2 minutes to sear on the reverse side. Move the fish over indirect heat, cover the grill, and cook until the fish is just cooked through, another 3 to 4 minutes; the fish should be just firm when squeezed lightly on the sides. Remove the fish to a platter and let rest for a few minutes.', u'While the fish rests, grill the tortillas over direct heat until slightly charred and just warm, about 5 seconds per side. With a fork, flake the fish into large chunks. Drizzle with the remaining slaw dressing and top with cilantro leaves.', u'Serve the fish family-style with the tortillas and butter lettuce (for wrapping), and the avocado relish, tomato crema, and cabbage slaw in bowls on the side.']
ingredients: [u'2 cloves garlic, crushed', u'1 serrano chile, seeded and roughly chopped', u'2 tablespoons pine nuts', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves, chopped', u'2 ripe Hass avocados, halved, pitted and diced', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'3 plum tomatoes, halved', u' Canola oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons chipotles in adobo', u'3 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 small Spanish onion, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves', u'1 tablespoon dried Mexican oregano', u'1 cup 2-percent or nonfat Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup lemon juice', u'1/4 cup orange juice', u'2 tablespoons clover honey', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'2 cups thinly sliced Napa cabbage', u'2 cups thinly sliced red cabbage', u'1 large carrot, peeled and grated on the large holes of a box grater', u'3 tablespoons ancho chile powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon light brown sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u' Four 8-ounce mahi mahi fillets', u' Canola oil, for brushing', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'6 -inch flour or corn tortillas', u'1/4 cup cilantro leaves, roughly chopped', u'6 leaves Boston lettuce, for wrapping']
title: Grilled Fish Tacos with Avocado Relish, Smoky Tomato-Greek Yogurt Crema and Red Cabbage-Citrus Slaw

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. ', u'Under running water, trim the outer layer of fat from the lamb and blot dry. Allow the lamb to reach room temperature and squeeze the juice from the lemons over the lamb. Slice cloves of garlic, lengthwise. ', u'Put salt and pepper into a small container. Cut 6 small slots into each side of the leg of lamb, about 1-inch deep. Insert garlic slivers, followed by salt and pepper, into the lamb. Lightly sprinkle top of lamb with oregano. Pour the water into a roasting pan, add lamb, and cover with foil. Roast on lowest rack of oven for 40 minutes to 1 hour. ', u'Remove foil, lower heat to 375 degrees and roast for 40 to 50 minutes, or until lamb reaches desired temperature. Remove and let lamb stand about 30 minutes as the lamb continues to cook.  To test the temperature of the meat, insert a meat thermometer into the thickest part of the leg without touching the bone. For rare lamb, the thermometer should register 140 degrees. For medium, the thermometer should register 145 degrees.']
ingredients: [u'1 (8 to 10 pound) leg of lamb, bone-in, trimmed', u'2 lemons, cut in half', u' Salt and pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, sliced lengthwise', u' Dash oregano', u'8 ounces water']
title: Roast Leg of Lamb, Greek Style

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Bring the meat to room temperature. Pat the meat dry with paper towels, then sprinkle liberally with salt and pepper and dredge in flour. Heat a drizzle of EVOO in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the meat in batches and cook until deep brown all over. Transfer to a plate.', u'Add another drizzle of EVOO to the pot and reduce the heat to medium. Add the butter and let it melt into the oil. Add the onions and cook until very tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Add 3 tablespoons paprika, the cumin, garlic, bay leaves, bell peppers and tomatoes, and stir to combine and heat through, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the stock and wine then return the meat to the pot. Cover with a lid, transfer the pot to the oven and cook until the meat is tender, about 2 hours. ', u'Remove the meat to a platter and cover with foil. Using an immersion blender, puree the sauce in the pot. Stir in the creme fraiche and cook until the sauce is reduced, 20 to 30 minutes. Return the meat to the pot. (If you are not serving immediately, cool the stew and then refrigerate until ready to use. Reheat in a moderate oven or over a medium flame.) Just before serving, stir in the remaining 1 teaspoon paprika to brighten the flavor. ', u'For garnish, fry the caperberries in a little EVOO until crisp. Top the stew with a few dollops of creme fraiche and the fried caperberries. (The green, red and white colors signify the Hungarian flag.)', u'Any leftover stew is great for lunch or with poached eggs.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 pounds veal shoulder or boned shank meat, cut into bite-size cubes, or 2 1/2 pounds lamb shoulder or boned leg meat, cut into bite-size cubes', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u' All-purpose flour, for dredging', u' EVOO, for drizzling', u'6 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces', u'3 onions, chopped', u'3 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon good-quality sweet paprika', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 to 3 large cloves garlic, crushed', u'2 large fresh bay leaves', u'1 green bell pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped', u'1 large heirloom or organic tomato, chopped', u'1 1/2 cups chicken stock (if using veal) or beef stock (if using lamb)', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine (if using veal) or dry red wine (if using lamb)', u'1 cup creme fraiche, plus a few dollops for garnish', u'1/2 cup drained caperberries, for garnish, optional']
title: Veal or Lamb Paprikash

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the yogurt, 2 tablespoons water, rice vinegar, olive oil, chives, parsley, garlic and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Cover and chill for 30 minutes before serving. The dressing will keep, refrigerated, for up to 3 days.', u'Per serving (3 tablespoons): Calories: 60; Fat: 5 g (Saturated: 1 g); Cholesterol: 0 mg; Sodium: 170 mg; Carbohydrate: 3 g; Fiber: 0 g; Protein: 3 g; Sugar: 1 g', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'3/4 cup 2-percent Greek yogurt', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh chives (from a small bunch)', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley', u'1 small garlic clove', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Yogurt Herb Dressing

author: Amanda Freitag
directions: [u'For the doughnuts: In a mixing bowl, add the yeast to 1 cup warm water, mix with a fork and let sit for 5 minutes. Add the flour, milk, sugar, olive oil, zest and salt. Mix thoroughly until the batter is smooth, 2 minutes. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and rest the dough in a warm place for 1 hour.', u'Preheat the deep fryer to 375 degrees F.', u'Dip a tablespoon measure in water, and then scoop out 1 tablespoon of dough. Wet your hands and roll the dough into balls, about 16 total. Place the doughnuts, a few at a time, in the fryer and cook until golden, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'For the honey: Place the honey, walnuts and 1/4 cup water in a pot set over medium heat for 3 minutes.', u'Coat the doughnuts with the walnut honey to serve.']
ingredients: [u' Two 1/4-ounce packages active dry yeast', u'4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 cup warm whole milk', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 teaspoons orange zest', u'1 teaspoon salt', u' Oil, for frying', u'1/2 cup honey', u'1/4 cup finely chopped walnuts']
title: Greek Doughnuts with Walnut Honey

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.', u'Under running water, trim the outer layer of fat from the lamb and blot dry. Allow the lamb to reach room temperature and squeeze the juice from the lemons over the lamb. Slice cloves of garlic, lengthwise.', u'Put salt and pepper into a small container. Cut 6 small slots into each side of the leg of lamb, about 1-inch deep. Insert garlic slivers, followed by salt and pepper, into the lamb. Lightly sprinkle top of lamb with oregano. Pour the water into a roasting pan, add lamb, and cover with foil. Roast on lowest rack of oven for 40 minutes to 1 hour.', u'Remove foil, lower heat to 375 degrees and roast for 40 to 50 minutes, or until lamb reaches desired temperature. Remove and let lamb stand about 30 minutes as the lamb continues to cook.', u'To test the temperature of the meat, insert a meat thermometer into the thickest part of the leg without touching the bone. For rare lamb, the thermometer should register 140 degrees. For medium, the thermometer should register 145 degrees.']
ingredients: [u'1 (8 to 10 pound) leg of lamb, bone-in, trimmed', u'2 lemons, cut in half', u' Salt and pepper', u'4 cloves garlic, sliced lengthwise', u' Dash oregano', u'8 ounces water']
title: ROAST LEG OF LAMB, GREEK STYLE

author: Michael Symon
directions: [u'Position a rack in the lower third of the oven; preheat to 350 degrees F. Combine the nuts, cinnamon and ground crackers in a bowl.', u'Brush a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with some of the butter. Layer 10 pieces of phyllo in the dish, brushing each piece with butter before adding the next (keep the remaining dough covered with a damp towel). Sprinkle a quarter of the nut mixture over the dough. Layer 4 pieces of phyllo on top, brushing each with butter before adding the next; sprinkle with another quarter of the nut mixture. Add 4 more phyllo pieces on top, brushing each with butter, then add another quarter of the nut mixture, 4 more pieces of phyllo with butter, and the remaining nuts.', u'Layer the remaining 10 pieces of phyllo on top of the nuts, brushing each with butter; brush the top piece with extra butter. Cut into the baklava to make strips, about 1 1/2 inches wide. Then make diagonal slices, about 1 1/2 inches apart, to create a diamond pattern. Bake until golden, about 1 hour.', u'Meanwhile, make the syrup: Bring the sugar, honey and 1 1/2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat and cook, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the lemon juice and boil 2 more minutes, then let cool slightly.', u'Pour the syrup over the warm baklava; let soak, uncovered, at least 6 hours or overnight. Garnish with nuts.', u'Photograph by Jim Franco']
ingredients: [u'1 pound pistachios and/or walnuts, coarsely ground, plus more for garnish', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste', u'1 cup ground zwieback crackers or breadcrumbs', u'4 sticks unsalted butter, melted', u'16 sheets phyllo dough (thawed, if frozen), cut in half', u'3 cups sugar', u'1 6 -to-8-ounce jar honey', u'1 to 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice']
title: Baklava

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Shred the cucumber on a box grater, toss with a large pinch of salt and let drain in a strainer for 10 minutes. Squeeze out any remaining liquid. Mix the drained cucumber with the yogurt, olive oil, garlic and mint in a medium bowl', u'Toss together the parsley, olives, lemon zest and scallions in a small bowl. Place the artichokes in a piece of cheesecloth or in a strainer and squeeze dry. Repeat with the peppers.', u'Layer the dip in a medium 3-quart clear glass trifle bowl or your favorite small serving bowl. Spread out the artichokes on the bottom, then top, in even layers, with the cucumber-yogurt mixture, peppers, pita chips, hummus, feta and the olive-herb mixture.', u'Wrap and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour or overnight (if refrigerating overnight then top with the olive-herb mixture right before serving). Serve with pita chips.', u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'1 medium cucumber, peeled and seeded', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups 2-percent Greek yogurt', u'2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', u'1 large clove garlic, finely grated', u'1/2 teaspoon dried mint or oregano', u'2 cups fresh parsley leaves, chopped (about 1 large bunch)', u'1/2 cup chopped, pitted kalamata olives', u'1 teaspoon lemon zest', u'4 scallions, chopped', u' Two 14-ounce cans artichoke hearts, drained, coarsely chopped', u'2 cups chopped jarred roasted red bell peppers (about 14 ounces)', u'2 cups crushed pita chips, plus more for serving', u'2 cups prepared hummus', u'1 cup crumbled feta (about 8 ounces)']
title: Seven-Layer Vegetarian Greek Dip

directions: [u'Cut away any tough stems from the greens and discard. Wash the greens thoroughly and cut any very large leaves in half. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the greens and cook, uncovered, for 7 to 10 minutes, or until the greens are just tender. Drain leaves in a colander and cool, pressing down with the back of a spoon to extract all the water. Place greens in a baking dish, using a fork to loosen and separate the leaves. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. Pour over the greens. Serve warm or room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds fresh greens, such as Swiss chard, dandelion, or mustard greens', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'6 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Greek Greens

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u"If you're serving this baked pasta on the night you prepare it, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.", u'Heat the water to a boil for pasta, salt the water and undercook the pasta by about 2 minutes.', u'While the water comes to a boil, heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium to medium-high heat, add the garlic and onions, soften a few minutes then stir in chard to wilt. Then add the scallions, dill, mint, parsley, and black pepper. Reduce the heat to a simmer and keep greens warm.', u'Meanwhile, heat the butter in a saucepot over medium to medium-high heat. As soon as the butter melts, add the flour and stir 1 minute. Whisk in milk and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg, to taste. Cook 4 to 5 minutes, or until the sauce is thickened.', u'Drain the pasta and place back in hot pot, stir together with greens and feta to combine, taste to adjust seasoning. Place the pasta in a casserole dish and top with bechamel sauce and Parm cheese, place in oven and bake until bubbly and brown, 20 minutes or, cool and cover then store. To reheat, place in 375 degrees F oven and bake 45 to 60 minutes until brown.']
ingredients: [u' Salt', u'1 pound ziti or long, hollow pasta tubes (recommended: Buon Italia or Greek macaroni #2*)', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 cloves garlic, sliced or chopped', u'1 large or 2 medium onions, chopped', u'1 large or 2 medium bundles chard, stemmed and chopped', u'1 bunch scallions, trimmed and chopped', u'1/4 cup fresh dill leaves', u'1/4 cup fresh mint leaves', u'1/4 cup fresh parsley leaves', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 cups milk', u' Freshly grated nutmeg', u'1 brick Greek feta in water, drained, about 1 cup crumbled feta', u'1 cup freshly shredded or grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese', u' *Available online or at specialty markets']
title: Green Pastitsio

directions: [u'In a blender or food processor puree until smooth, the olive oil, lemon zest and juice, parsley, oregano, mustard, and cinnamon. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ', u'Make a wreath of spinach leaves on the outside edges of a large shallow pasta bowl or dinner plate. Combine the pasta with half of the dressing, the cucumbers and the scallions. Center the pasta salad in the middle of the spinach. Drizzle the remaining dressing over the spinach and garnish the spinach with black olives. Garnish the pasta with feta cheese and tomato.']
ingredients: [u'1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon grated lemon zest', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 cup (packed) fresh parsley leaves', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u' Pinch ground cinnamon', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'6 to 8 ounces fresh curly spinach, stemmed, washed, leaves torn into 1-inch pieces', u'2 cups (measured uncooked) medium shells cooked, chilled and patted dry', u'2 kirby cucumbers, washed, peeled, seeded and cut into half moons', u'2 scallions, thinly sliced', u'6 kalamata olives, pitted and halved', u'1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled or cut into dice', u'2 plum tomatoes, seeded and cut into fine dice']
title: Greek Pasta Salad

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the guava juice and apricots in a small bowl, and cover. Microwave until the apricots are tender and the juice reduces to a light syrup, 1 to 2 minutes. Let cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally to help cool faster.', u'Put the yogurt in a cereal bowl. Spoon the apricot-guava compote into the center. Arrange the grapefruit, mandarin oranges, cereal and pistachios in neat piles or rows around the compote. Then take a photo!', u'Per serving (1 bowl): Calories: 370; Fat: 8 g (Saturated: 3.5 g); Cholesterol: 15 mg; Sodium: 160 mg; Carbohydrate: 57 g; Fiber: 7 g; Protein: 24 g; Sugar: 44 g', u'Copyright 2015 Television Food Network, G.P.  All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup 100 percent guava or orange juice (no sugar added)', u'4 dried apricots, diced', u'1 cup 2 percent Greek yogurt', u'1/2 medium pink grapefruit, cut into segments', u' One 4-ounce cup mandarin oranges in 100 percent fruit juice, strained', u'1/4 cup bran flakes cereal', u'2 tablespoons toasted or raw pistachios, roughly chopped']
title: Tropical Greek Yogurt Breakfast Bowl

author: Bobby Deen
directions: [u'Heat an outdoor grill or grill pan over medium heat. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u"Carefully make a slit into the side of each pork chop using a chef's knife to create a pocket to stuff ingredients into. Mix together the feta, spinach, olives and sundried tomatoes in a medium bowl. Stuff each pork chop with the spinach mixture and rub each with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Secure each pork chop with a wooden skewer or toothpicks (remember to remove before serving).", u'Brush oil on the grill  grate to prevent sticking. Grill the pork chops until nicely browned, 6 to 8 minutes, turning every few minutes to create grill marks. Transfer to a baking sheet and finish cooking in the oven until the pork reaches an internal temperature of 140 degrees F, 15 to 20 minutes.']
ingredients: [u' Four 1 1/2 to 2-inch-thick pork chops, bone-in', u'2 ounces crumbled feta cheese', u'1/2 cup chopped frozen spinach (thawed and well drained)', u'2 tablespoons chopped kalamata olives', u'2 tablespoons chopped sundried tomatoes', u' Canola oil', u' Salt and pepper', u'4 wooden skewers, soaked to prevent burning']
title: Mediterranean Stuffed Pork Chops

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until just softened, 3 minutes. Add the rice; cook, stirring, until slightly toasted, 2 minutes. Add 2 cups water, the apricots, cumin, cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Increase the heat to medium high; bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low; stir, then cover and simmer until the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the spinach (do not stir). Let sit, covered, until wilted, about 7 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, season the chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cookuntil golden, about 3 minutes per side. Drizzle with the lemon juice.', u'Fold the spinach into the rice and serve with the chicken. Divide the rice and chicken among plates. Thin the yogurt with 1 teaspoon water; drizzle over the chicken. Sprinkle with the almonds.', u'Per serving: Calories 445; Fat 8 g (Saturated 4 g); Cholesterol 97 mg; Sodium 503 mg; Carbohydrate 97 g; Fiber 4 g; Protein 38 g', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1 1/4 cups basmati rice', u'1/4 cup dried apricots, roughly chopped', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Kosher salt', u'5 cups loosely packed baby spinach (3 ounces)', u'1 1/4 pounds thin-cut skinless, boneless chicken breasts', u' Freshly ground pepper', u' Juice of 1 lemon', u'1/4 cup fat-free plain Greek yogurt', u'3 tablespoons almonds, roughly chopped']
title: Middle Eastern Chicken and Rice

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Process the onion in a food processor for 10 to 15 seconds and turn out into the center of a tea towel. Gather up the ends of the towel and squeeze until almost all of the juice is removed. Discard juice.', u'Return the onion to the food processor and add the lamb, garlic, marjoram, rosemary, salt, and pepper and process until it is a fine paste, approximately 1 minute. Stop the processor as needed to scrape down sides of bowl.', u'To cook in the oven as a meatloaf, proceed as follows:', u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.', u'Place the mixture into a loaf pan, making sure to press into the sides of the pan. Place the loaf pan into a water bath and bake for 60 to 75 minutes or until the mixture reaches 165 to 170 degrees F. Remove from the oven and drain off any fat. Place the loaf pan on a cooling rack and place a brick wrapped in aluminum foil directly on the surface of the meat and allow to sit for 15 to 20 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 175 degrees F. Slice and serve on pita bread with tzatziki sauce, chopped onion, tomatoes and feta cheese.', u'To cook on a rotisserie, proceed as follows:', u'Form the meat mixture into a loaf shape and place on top of 2 overlapping pieces of plastic wrap that are at least 18 inches long. Roll the mixture in the plastic wrap tightly, making sure to remove any air pockets. Once the meat is completely rolled in the wrap, twist the ends of the plastic wrap until the surface of the wrap is tight. Store in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to overnight, to allow the mixture to firm up.', u'Preheat the grill to high.', u'Place the meat onto the rotisserie skewer. Place a double-thick piece of aluminum foil folded into a tray directly under the meat to catch any drippings. Cook on high for 15 minutes. Decrease the heat to medium and continue to cook for another 20 to 30 minutes or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 165 degrees F. Turn off the heat and allow to continue to spin for another 10 to 15 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 175 degrees. Slice and serve on pita bread with tzatziki sauce, chopped onion, tomatoes, and feta cheese.']
ingredients: [u'1 medium onion, finely chopped or shredded', u'2 pounds ground lamb', u'1 tablespoon finely minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon dried marjoram', u'1 tablespoon dried ground rosemary', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u' Tzatziki Sauce, recipe follows', u'16 ounces plain yogurt', u'1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded, and finely chopped', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'4 cloves garlic, finely minced', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'2 teaspoons red wine vinegar', u'5 to 6 mint leaves, finely minced']
title: Gyro Meat with Tzatziki Sauce

directions: [u"Put the cucumbers and tomatoes in separate bowls and pop them in the fridge just until they're cold, about 30 minutes.", u'Meanwhile, add the onions to a small bowl. Add the vinegar, 2 tablespoons of the oil, and a healthy pinch of salt, and mix well with your hands. Let the onions sit just until they get pickly, a few minutes.', u'In a separate small bowl, stir together the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil, the lemon juice, and a good pinch of salt until the mixture looks creamy. Combine the tomatoes and cucumber in one bowl, pour in the lemon dressing, and toss gently but well.', u'Grab a large platter (or 4 to 6 plates) and make a pretty layer of cucumbers and tomatoes, so the colors and types of the vegetables are well divvied up. Give the onions one more toss, then use your hands to add them (reserving their pickly liquid) here and there over the cucumbers and tomatoes. Scatter on the olives and mint. Use your hands to crumble the feta into pieces large, medium, and small as you scatter it on top. Finally, drizzle on the liquid remaining in the onion bowl. Eat straightaway.', u'Photo by David Loftus']
ingredients: [u'3/4 pound crunchy cucumbers without big seeds (preferably a few varieties), peeled and cut into irregular 3/4-inch pieces', u' Generous 1 pound mixed heirloom tomatoes, halved, cored, trimmed of any pale bits, and cut into irregular 1-inch pieces', u'1/4 pound cherry tomatoes (about 3/4 cup), halved through the stem end if large', u'2 slender spring onions, green tops and root ends trimmed, bulbs cut into 1/4-inch-thick rounds and separated into rings (about 1/2 cup)', u'2 tablespoons Banyuls vinegar (available at specialty shops and online)', u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u' Maldon or another flaky sea salt', u'1 tablespoon lemon juice', u'20 or so Nicoise olives, firmly pressed with the flat of a knife and pitted', u' A five-finger pinch of mint leaves (preferably black mint)', u'5 ounces creamy feta cheese (preferably goat feta)']
title: Greek Salad

directions: [u'In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the olive oil, onion, garlic, black pepper, to taste, the bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, and cloves and saute for a few minutes. Add the ground beef, stirring continuously, until all the meat is cooked and browned. Stir in salt, to taste, fresh tomato and tomato puree. Let simmer for about 20 minutes, then remove the bay leaves, cinnamon sticks and the whole cloves.', u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.', u'Brush a large casserole dish generously with melted margarine. Add the cooked ziti, beaten egg, cheese and the meat mixture. Mix until well combined. Top with Bechamel Sauce and sprinkle with more grated Parmigiano. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven and serve.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 cup chopped onion', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh garlic', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'2 bay leaves', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'3 to 4 whole cloves', u'2 pounds ground beef (80/20)', u' Salt', u'1/2 cup peeled and chopped fresh tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon tomato puree', u'1 tablespoon margarine, melted', u'1 pound ziti, cooked', u'1 egg, beaten', u'2 tablespoons grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, plus more for topping', u' Bechamel Sauce, recipe follows', u'1 quart milk', u'1 cup (2 sticks) margarine', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'2 tablespoons grated Parmigiano-Reggiano', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' Freshly ground nutmeg']
title: Pastitsio

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Put the potatoes and bay leaf into a medium saucepan, cover with cold water and bring to a simmer. Cook over medium-high heat until fork-tender, 35 to 40 minutes, adjusting the heat as needed to maintain a simmerthe water should not boil. Reserve 1 cup of the potato water; drain the potatoes well, and return them to the saucepan.', u'Meanwhile, heat the oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the scallions; add the remaining scallions, garlic and 1/4 teaspoon salt to the skillet, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the scallions are tender, about 5 minutes. Turn off the heat, and whisk in 3/4 cup of the yogurt.', u'Add the yogurt mixture, 1/2 cup of the reserved potato water, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper to the hot potatoes. Mash with a potato masher until mostly smooth (a few chunks are fine). Stir in additional potato water if you want creamier potatoes. Transfer to a serving dish, dollop the remaining Greek yogurt on top and garnish with the reserved scallions.', u'Copyright 2014 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'2 pounds small, thin-skinned all-purpose potatoes (15 to 20), scrubbed', u'1 bay leaf', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 bunch scallions (about 6), thinly sliced', u'2 cloves garlic, grated (about 1/2 teaspoon)', u' Kosher salt', u'1 cup full-fat Greek yogurt', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: Smashed Potatoes with Greek Yogurt and Scallions

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u'For the vegetables: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cook the potato slices for 5 minutes (do not cook longer) in heavily salted, boiling water. Meanwhile, slice the eggplant into 1/4-inch slices, brush with the olive oil and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoons salt and the pepper on both sides. Place on a baking sheet and cook in the oven, 6 to 7 minutes per side. Set aside the potato and eggplant slices for assembly.', u'For the meat sauce: In a large saucepan, sweat the onions with some salt in the olive oil over medium heat. After 5 minutes, add the ground beef and cook until golden brown, 7 to 8 minutes. Add the oregano, cinnamon, nutmeg and garlic, and cook until fragrant.  Turn the heat up to high, and then deglaze the pan with the red wine, allowing to bubble and reduce for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and lower the heat to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove the sauce from the heat and set aside.', u'For the bechamel: In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the flour, whisking to make a paste. Whisk constantly for 2 minutes, allowing the mixture to bubble. Add the warm milk slowly, whisking constantly to avoid lumps. Once the sauce starts to come to a boil, reduce the heat to low and cook until thickened, about 10 minutes, whisking very frequently. Add the salt, pepper and nutmeg, and set aside.', u'For assembling the moussaka: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Before assembling, taste each of the 4 layers and confirm that they are properly seasoned. Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking pan with vegetable oil. Lay out the potato slices, pressing gently into the pan. Sprinkle with 3 tablespoons of the Parmesan. Place the eggplant on top of the potatoes. Sprinkle with another 3 tablespoons of the Parmesan. Spoon the meat sauce on top, followed by 3 more tablespoons of Parmesan. Finish with pouring over the bechamel and top with the last 3 tablespoons of Parmesan. Cover with foil (sprayed lightly with vegetable oil) and bake for 30 minutes, then uncover and continue baking for an additional 30 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'3 medium or 2 large red potatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u' Kosher salt', u'1 medium eggplant', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 onion, chopped', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'8 ounces ground beef', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/2 cup red wine', u' One 8-ounce can tomato sauce', u'5 tablespoons butter', u'5 tablespoons flour', u'4 cups milk, heated to very warm in microwave', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u' Vegetable oil, for greasing', u'3/4 cup grated Parmesan']
title: Moussaka

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spread the french fries on a baking sheet and bake until golden and warmed through, about 10 minutes.', u'Put the garlic, almonds and olive oil in a food processor and pulse until finely ground. Add the french fries, lemon juice, 1 1/4 cups water and 1/2 teaspoon salt and pulse until almost smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Serve with pita chips and/or vegetables.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'4 cups frozen curly french fries (about 12 ounces)', u'6 to 8 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1/4 cup blanched almonds', u'3/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Pita chips and/or vegetable sticks, for dipping']
title: French Fry Skordalia

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Lightly grease 4 individual baking dishes with butter (oven proof ramekins or cocotte dishes work well). Peel beets and cut into pieces so they can fit comfortably in a food processor. Process with blade attachment until finely chopped.', u'In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and spices. In a separate bowl, mix molasses, applesauce, eggs, buttermilk, and sugar together. Now mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients, add a pinch of salt, and then fold in the processed beets.', u'Set ramekins out on a sheet tray. Divide batter amongst ramekins and bake in the oven for 20 to25 minutes until they have puffed up and a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean.', u'Serve with Sweet Greek Yogurt and top with Beet Garnish and powdered sugar.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, to grease baking pans', u'3 to 4 medium beets, to make 1 1/4 cups finely chopped', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u' Kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'2 tablespoons pomegranate molasses', u'1 cup applesauce', u'2 large eggs', u'1 cup buttermilk', u'3/4 cup dark brown sugar', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u' Sweet Greek Yogurt, recipe follows', u' Beet Garnish, recipe follows', u'2 cups unsweetened Greek yogurt', u'1/4 cup honey', u'1 small beet', u'1/4 cup powdered sugar']
title: Beet Cakes with Sweet Greek Yogurt
