Reduce heat and simmer 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Place oven rack in top 1/3 of oven and heat broiler.', u'Cut country bread in rounds large enough to fit mouth of oven safe soup crocks. Place the slices on a baking sheet and place under broiler for 1 minute.', u'Season soup mixture with salt, pepper and cognac. Remove bouquet garni and ladle soup into crocks leaving one inch to the lip. Place bread round, toasted side down, on top of soup and top with grated cheese. Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden, 1 to 2 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'5 sweet onions (like Vidalias) or a combination of sweet and red onions (about 4 pounds)', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups white wine', u'10 ounces canned beef consomme', u'10 ounces chicken broth', u'10 ounces apple cider (unfiltered is best)', u' Bouquet garni; thyme sprigs, bay leaf and parsley tied together with kitchen string', u'1 loaf country style bread', u' Kosher salt', u' Ground black pepper', u' Splash of Cognac (optional)', u'1 cup Fontina or Gruyere cheese, grated']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Mix water, sugar, and yeast in a large bowl and let sit for 10 minutes.', u'In another bowl, beat the eggs, salt and evaporated milk together. Mix egg mixture to the yeast mixture. In a separate bowl, measure out the bread flour. Add 3 cups of the flour to the yeast mixture and stir to combine. Add the shortening and continue to stir while adding the remaining flour. Remove dough from the bowl, place onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Spray a large bowl with nonstick spray. Put dough into the bowl and cover with plastic wrap or a towel. Let rise in a warm place for at least 2 hours.', u'Preheat oil in a deep-fryer to 350 degrees F.', u"Add the confectioners' sugar to a paper or plastic bag and set aside.", u"Roll the dough out to about 1/4-inch thickness and cut into 1-inch squares. Deep-fry, flipping constantly, until they become a golden color. After beignets are fried, drain them for a few seconds on paper towels, and then toss them into the bag of confectioners' sugar. Hold bag closed and shake to coat evenly."]
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 cups lukewarm water', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1 envelope active dry yeast', u'2 eggs, slightly beaten', u'1 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'1 cup evaporated milk', u'7 cups bread flour', u'1/4 cup shortening', u' Nonstick spray', u' Oil, for deep-frying', u"3 cups confectioners' sugar"]
title: French Quarter Beignets

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F.', u'In a large shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, orange zest, vanilla, honey, and salt. Slice the challah in 3/4-inch thick slices. Soak as many slices in the egg mixture as possible for 5 minutes, turning once.', u"Heat 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon oil in a very large saute pan over medium heat. Add the soaked bread and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, until nicely browned. Place the cooked French toast on a sheet pan and keep it warm in the oven. Fry the remaining soaked bread slices, adding butter and oil as needed, until it's all cooked. Serve hot with maple syrup, raspberry preserves, and/or confectioners' sugar."]
ingredients: [u'6 extra-large eggs', u'1 1/2 cups half-and-half or milk', u'1 teaspoon grated orange zest', u'1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1 tablespoon good honey', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 large loaf challah or brioche bread', u' Unsalted butter', u' Vegetable oil', u' Pure maple syrup', u' Good raspberry preserves (optional)', u" Sifted confectioners' sugar (optional)"]
title: Challah French Toast

directions: [u'Combine the honey, yeast and 1/2 cup warm water. Stir to combine and let the mixture stand until the yeast is activated and begins to foam, 5 minutes.', u"Mix the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl with a dough hook and slowly add in the yeast mixture. Gradually add 1 cup warm water and mix until the dough comes together into a ball that is not too wet (you may not need all of the water). If the dough is sticky, add a little bit more flour. Turn out the dough onto a floured surface and knead until the dough is smooth and elastic, 2 to 6 minutes. You can do the thumbprint test: press in the dough with your thumb and it should bounce back when it's ready.", u"Form the dough into a ball, place it in a lightly-oiled bowl and cover with a dishcloth, so it doesn't dry out. Let rest in a warm environment until doubled in size, 25 to 30 minutes.", u"Punch down the dough and divide it in half. Shape into 2 baguettes by making a flat rectangle out of your dough, then folding the top and bottom towards the middle, like an envelope, and sealing the seam with your fingers. Keep repeating the folding and sealing, stretching the rectangle lengthwise as you go, until it's about 12 to 14 inches long and 2 inches wide. Fold and seal either end to round. Flip seam-side down and place on a sheet pan or baguette pan that has been dusted with cornmeal. Score the tops of the loaves, making deep diagonal slits 1/2-inch deep, cover with a dishcloth and let rise in a warm environment until they have doubled in size, 25 minutes.", u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F and position your oven racks with one on the bottom and the other in the middle. Place an oven-safe (non-glass) bowl or pan on the bottom rack.', u'When your bread has doubled for the second time, remove the towel and quickly and simultaneously, slide the sheet tray with the baguettes onto the middle rack while carefully throwing the ice cubes into the bowl on the bottom rack. The ice will create a burst of steam that will give you a nice crispy crust. Quickly shut the oven door so no steam escapes. Bake the baguettes until golden brown, 15 minutes.', u"Cook's Note: If you have a glass window on your oven, place a towel over it when throwing the ice in, hot glass can shatter if ice touches it."]
ingredients: [u'2 envelopes dry active yeast (1 1/2 tablespoons)', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'3 1/2 to 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting', u'2 teaspoons salt', u' Canola oil, for greasing bowl', u' Cornmeal, for dusting pan', u'3 to 4 ice cubes', u' Serving suggestions: ricotta cheese and acacia honey']
title: Homemade French Baguettes

author: Marcela Valladolid
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly butter a 12-by-8-inch baking pan.', u'In a large bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, condensed milk, regular milk, cinnamon, vanilla, eggs and 1 tablespoon of the melted butter and whisk until combined. Grab a slice of bread and submerge it in the pumpkin custard. Soak with enough custard to cover both sides of the bread, then transfer it to the prepared baking pan. Repeat the process until the bottom of the pan is covered.', u'In a stand mixer with the whisk attachment, mix the cream cheese and powdered sugar until combined and the cream cheese is clump free; the mixture should be soft and spreadable.', u'Spread enough of the cream cheese mixture on top of the bread in the pan to cover all the slices. Soak the remaining bread slices in the remaining custard. Layer them on top of the cream cheese mixture. Combine the pecans, brown sugar and remaining 4 tablespoons melted butter in a bowl. Add a pinch of salt. Top the casserole with the pecan mixture.', u'Bake until the top is golden, 40 to 45 minutes. Serve with a drizzle of maple syrup.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, plus more for buttering the pan', u' One and one-half 15-ounce cans pumpkin puree', u' One 14-ounce can sweetened condensed milk', u'1 cup milk', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'4 large eggs', u'1 loaf brioche bread, sliced', u' Two 8-ounce packages cream cheese, at room temperature', u'1 cup powdered sugar', u'1 cup chopped pecans', u'1/2 cup packed brown sugar', u' Pinch of salt', u' Maple syrup, for drizzling']
title: Pumpkin French Toast Casserole

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'In a large stockpot on medium-high heat, saute the onions with the butter and bay leaf for 20 minutes, until the onions turn a rich golden brown color. Deglaze the pan with the sherry and brandy and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Add the white wine and simmer uncovered for 15 more minutes.', u'Add the beef and veal stocks plus salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove the bay leaf, taste for salt and pepper, and serve hot with grated Parmesan.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 pounds yellow onions, halved, and sliced 1/4-inch thick (8 cups)', u'1/4 pound unsalted butter', u'1 bay leaf', u'1/2 cup medium-dry sherry', u'1/2 cup brandy or Cognac', u'1 1/2 cups good dry white wine', u'4 cups beef stock', u'4 cups veal stock', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper', u' Freshly grated Parmesan']
title: French Onion Soup

directions: [u'Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the mussels, wine, cream, butter, and parsley and season well with salt. Give it a good stir, cover the pot, and cook until mussels open and are cooked through, about 10 to 15 minutes. Divide the mussels and the juices between 2 bowls and serve with the crusty bread.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 shallots, finely chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'2 pounds mussels, cleaned', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into pieces', u'1/2 bunch fresh parsley, chopped', u' Kosher salt', u' Crusty bread, to serve']
title: Classic French Mussels

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Whisk 4 eggs, 1 1/2 cups half-and-half or milk, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon sugar and a pinch of salt in a shallow bowl. Heat 1/2 tablespoon butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, dip 6 thick slices white bread, challah or brioche in the egg mixture and cook in the skillet until golden, 2 to 3 minutes per side, adding more butter as needed. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake until puffed, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, melt 4 tablespoons butter in the same skillet until browned, about 5 minutes. Drizzle the French toast with the browned butter and maple syrup.', u'Photograph by Kang Kim']
title: Perfect French Toast

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Combine the ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Fill a martini glass with ice and pour the cocktail over the ice.']
ingredients: [u'2 cups fresh pineapple juice', u'2 1/2 cups vodka', u'1/4 cup Vermouth', u'2 teaspoons raspberry liqueur (recommended: Chambord)']
title: French Martini

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the French toast: Grease the baking pan with butter. Tear the bread into chunks, or cut into cubes, and evenly distribute in the pan. Crack the eggs in a big bowl. Whisk together the eggs, milk, cream, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla. Pour evenly over the bread. Cover the pan tightly and store in the fridge until needed (overnight preferably).', u'For the topping: Mix the flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt and some nutmeg in a separate bowl. Stir together using a fork. Add the butter and with a pastry cutter, and mix it all together until the mixture resembles fine pebbles. Store in a re-sealable plastic bag in the fridge.', u"When you're ready to bake the casserole, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Remove the casserole from the fridge and sprinkle the topping over the top. Bake for 45 minutes for a softer, more bread pudding texture or for 1 hour or more for a firmer, crisper texture.", u'Scoop out individual portions. Top with butter and drizzle with warm pancake syrup and sprinkle with blueberries.']
ingredients: [u' Butter, for greasing', u'1 loaf crusty sourdough or French bread', u'8 whole eggs', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup whipping (heavy) cream', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons vanilla extract', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u' Freshly grated nutmeg', u'1 stick cold butter, cut into pieces, plus more for serving', u' Warm pancake syrup, for serving', u'1 cup fresh blueberries, for serving', u' Special equipment: 9-by-13-inch baking pan']
title: Cinnamon Baked French Toast

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Drop the white and red potatoes into a large pot of boiling salted water and cook for 20 to 30 minutes, until they are just cooked through. Drain in a colander and place a towel over the potatoes to allow them to steam for 10 more minutes. As soon as you can handle them, cut in 1/2 (quarters if the potatoes are larger) and place in a medium bowl. Toss gently with the wine and chicken stock. Allow the liquids to soak into the warm potatoes before proceeding.', u'Combine the vinegar, mustard, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and slowly whisk in the olive oil to make an emulsion. Add the vinaigrette to the potatoes. Add the scallions, dill, parsley, basil, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and toss. Serve warm or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound small white boiling potatoes', u'1 pound small red boiling potatoes', u'2 tablespoons good dry white wine', u'2 tablespoons chicken stock', u'3 tablespoons Champagne vinegar', u'1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'10 tablespoons good olive oil', u'1/4 cup minced scallions (white and green parts)', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh dill', u'2 tablespoons minced flat-leaf parsley', u'2 tablespoons julienned fresh basil leaves']
title: French Potato Salad

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the soup:  Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Slice the onions in half from root to tip, then slice them thin.', u'Melt the butter in a heavy ovenproof pot or Dutch oven over medium-low heat. Add the onions, stir to coat them in the butter and cook, covered, until translucent and soft, about 20 minutes.', u'Transfer the pot to the oven with the lid slightly ajar. Roast the onions for 1 hour, stirring twice to keep them from burning. (Some brown bits on the bottom of the pan are fine though.)', u'Return the pot to the stovetop over medium heat (keep the oven on) and pour in the wine. Stir, scraping the pan. Cook until the wine reduces, 5 minutes. Next, add the beef broth, chicken broth, thyme, Worcestershire sauce and garlic. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for 45 minutes.', u'For the croutons: Meanwhile, drizzle slices of French bread with olive oil and toast in the oven until golden. Set aside.', u'To serve, turn on the oven broiler. Ladle the soup into ovenproof bowls. Place 1 or 2 pieces of the croutons on top of each serving of soup, depending on the size of the bowl. Place a thick slice of cheese on top of each bowl, then place the bowls on a baking sheet and broil just long enough for the cheese to become melted, bubbly and slightly toasted.', u'Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 large yellow onions', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) butter', u'1 generous cup dry white wine', u'4 cups (1 quart) low-sodium beef broth', u'4 cups (1 quart) low-sodium chicken broth', u'3 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves', u'4 to 5 dashes Worcestershire sauce', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u' Several thick slices French bread or baguette', u' Olive oil, for drizzling', u'8 ounces Gruyere cheese, sliced thick']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine melted butter, eggs, flour, sugar, coconut, and milk. Pour into pie shell. Bake until firm, about 45 to 60 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter, melted', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 (3 1/2\x96ounce) can shredded sweetened coconut (about 1 cup)', u'1 cup milk', u'1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell']
title: French Coconut Pie

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u"Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Lay the bread slices in one layer (it's OK if they overlap a little) on a baking sheet. Bake the slices (to dry them out a little) for 6 minutes, then flip and bake for 6 minutes more. Set aside to cool. Reduce the oven temperature to 200 degrees F.", u'Whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, granulated sugar, cinnamon, vanilla and salt in a large casserole dish.', u'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-low to medium heat. Place 2 slices of bread in the egg mixture. Let the bread completely soak in the egg mixture on both sides, about 30 seconds to 1 minute total, checking after 15 seconds. (Bread should feel heavy and soaked through but hold its shape without breaking apart.) Melt a tablespoon of butter in the skillet and add the 2 soaked slices; cook until the outside is golden brown and crisp and the inside is cooked through, 4 to 5 minutes per side. You will need to watch and adjust the temperature between medium and medium-low if the bread is browning too quickly or not browning fast enough. Keep finished French toast slices warm on a rack nested in a rimmed baking sheet in the oven. Repeat with the remaining slices.', u"Serve with a dusting of confectioners' sugar and drizzle of maple syrup.", u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'8 slices Texas Toast or other 3/4-inch-sliced white bread', u'8 large eggs', u'1 1/2 cups half-and-half', u'3 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon kosher salt', u'4 tablespoons butter', u" Confectioners' sugar, for serving", u' Maple syrup, for serving']
title: Classic French Toast

author: Nancy Fuller
directions: [u'Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Stir in the onions, butter, thyme and bay leaves. Cook, adding some water and scraping up any brown bits from the bottom of the pot occasionally, until the onions are deep golden brown, about 45 minutes.', u'Stir the flour into the onions and then add the beef stock, wine and some salt, and simmer for 30 minutes. Discard the bay leaves.', u'While the soup cooks, slice a few inches from the tops of the boules and pull out the bread inside, leaving a 1-inch thick crust. Reserve the insides for serving with the soup.', u'Preheat the broiler. Put the bread bowls on a baking sheet. Ladle the soup into the bread bowls. Divide the Gruyere among the bowls and broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the soup bowls to plates and serve hot with the reserved bread, for dipping in the soup.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'6 medium yellow onions, sliced thin', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter', u'4 sprigs fresh thyme', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 tablespoon flour', u'1 cup dry white wine', u' Kosher salt', u'6 cups Homemade Beef Stock, recipe follows', u'4 sourdough boules, each about 1 pound, and 10 inches in diameter', u'2 cups grated Gruyere cheese', u'2 - 3 tablespoons olive oil', u'5 pounds meaty beef bones, such as shank bones', u'4 carrots, halved', u'4 stalks celery, halved', u'2 large yellow onions, halved', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 head garlic, halved', u'1 teaspoon black peppercorns']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Rinse cut potatoes in a large bowl with lots of cold running water until water becomes clear.  Cover with water by 1-inch and cover with ice. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes and up to 2 days.', u'In a 5-quart pot or Dutch oven fitted with a candy or deep-frying thermometer, (or in an electric deep fryer), heat oil over medium-low heat until the thermometer registers 325 degrees F. Make sure that you have at least 3 inches of space between the top of the oil and the top of the pan, as fries will bubble up when they are added.', u'Drain ice water from cut fries and wrap potato pieces in a clean dishcloth or tea towel and thoroughly pat dry. Increase the heat to medium-high and add fries, a handful at a time, to the hot oil. Fry, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are soft and limp and begin to turn a blond color, about 6 to 8 minutes. Using a skimmer or a slotted spoon, carefully remove fries from the oil and set aside to drain on paper towels. Let rest for at least 10 minutes or up to 2 hours.', u'When ready to serve the French fries, reheat the oil to 350 degrees F. Transfer the blanched potatoes to the hot oil and fry again, stirring frequently, until golden brown and puffed, about 1 minute. Transfer to paper lined platter and sprinkle with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 large russet or kinnebec potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/4 by 1/4-inch thick batons', u'2 quarts peanut oil', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Perfect French Fries

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Crush the crackers in a food processor or resealable bag. Pour them into a bowl and stir in the melted butter and sugar. Press into a pie pan and bake until golden and set, 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool slightly.', u'For the filling: In a small microwave-safe bowl, melt the baking chocolate until stirrable (about 45 seconds on high). Set aside to cool.', u'It is important for the bowl and ingredients to be cold for the next stage of making the filling--to get the right texture and result. In a large chilled bowl with an electric mixer, beat the sugar and butter until fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'When the melted chocolate is cooled, drizzle it over the butter/sugar mixture. Add the vanilla extract. Beat the mixture thoroughly until combined (on a stand mixer, you will be using the whisk attachment).', u'Turn your mixer to a medium speed and over a period of 15 to 20 minutes, add in the 4 cold eggs, one at a time, leaving about 5 minutes between each egg addition. Once the pie filling is well mixed, pour it into the baked pie shell, scraping every last speck of it out of the bowl. Smooth out the pie filling and place the pie in the refrigerator to chill for at least 2 hours (preferably longer).', u'For the topping: Add the heavy cream and sugar to the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and whip until it is stiff. Cover the pies with a thick layer of cream. Grate the semisweet chocolate over the top.']
ingredients: [u'12 graham crackers (the 4-section large pieces)', u'1/3 cup butter, melted', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'4 ounces unsweetened baking chocolate', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'1 cup (2 sticks) salted butter, softened but still cold', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'4 eggs, cold', u'1 1/2 cups heavy cream', u'1/4 cup powdered sugar', u' Piece of semisweet chocolate, for grating']
title: French Silk Pie

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Heat the 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a medium saute pan, add the leek and carrots, and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, place the lentils, 4 cups of water, the onion with the cloves, and the turnip in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes, or until the lentils are almost tender. Remove and discard the onion and turnip and drain the lentils. Place them in a medium bowl with the leek and carrots, and add the butter.', u"Meanwhile, whisk together the 1/4 cup of olive oil, the mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Add to the lentils, stir well, and allow the lentils to cool until just warm, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve. The longer the lentils sit, the more salt and pepper you'll want to add."]
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons plus 1/4 cup good olive oil', u'1 leek, white and light green parts, sliced 1/4-inch thick', u'2 carrots, scrubbed and 1/2-inch-diced', u'1 teaspoon minced garlic', u'1 cup French green Le Puy lentils', u'1 whole onion, peeled and stuck with 6 whole cloves', u'1 white turnip, cut in half', u'1 teaspoon unsalted butter', u'4 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: Warm French Lentils

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the pizza base: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Lay the rolls cut-side up on a large baking sheet. Top each half with marinara sauce (or pesto for the tomato basil pizzas), followed by the mozzarella. Then add your toppings of choice. See below for directions for assembling specific pizzas.', u'Once the pizzas are assembled, put the baking sheet on the lowest rack for 8 to 10 minutes. Then turn up the heat to 425 degrees F and put the sheet on the highest rack until the cheese starts to bubble a bit and turns golden. Remove and serve immediately! Cut the pizzas in half right across the middle so there are mini French bread pizzas for everyone.', u'Pizza Varieties:', u'For the Canadian bacon and pineapple pizzas: Top with the Canadian bacon slices and pineapple and bake according to the directions above.', u'For the Greek salad pizzas: Leave off the sauce and brush the sliced rolls with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with the mozzarella and bake according to the directions above.', u'While the pizzas are baking, toss together the olives, feta, tomatoes, cucumbers, parsley, the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil and salt and pepper to taste in a medium bowl. Top the cooked pizzas with the chopped Greek salad.', u'For the pepperoni and jalapeno pizzas: Top with the pepperoni and jalapeno slices and bake according to the directions above.', u'For the tomato basil pizzas: Use pesto instead of the marinara sauce, and top with the tomato slices. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake according to the directions above. Top the cooked pizzas with the basil leaves.', u'For the hamburger pizzas: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef, red pepper flakes and salt and pepper and saute until the beef is no longer pink. Top the rolls with the sauteed ground beef and bake according to the directions above.', u'For the hamburger taco pizzas: Top with the Cheddar and ground beef and bake according to the directions above. Top the cooked pizzas with the chopped lettuce and tomatoes.']
ingredients: [u'6 deli rolls or small baguettes, halved', u' One 24-ounce jar marinara sauce', u'1 jar prepared pesto, optional', u' Five 8-ounce packages fresh mozzarella, sliced', u'5 ounces Canadian bacon slices, halved', u'8 ounces canned pineapple chunks', u'5 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u' One 12-ounce jar kalamata olives, chopped', u'8 ounces crumbled feta', u'4 ripe tomatoes, diced rough', u'1/2 English cucumber, seeded and diced', u'1/2 bunch fresh parsley, chopped', u'1 cup sliced pepperoni', u'6 to 7 jalapenos, sliced', u' Sliced Roma tomatoes, for topping', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 bunch fresh basil', u' Olive oil, for sauteeing beef', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces grated Cheddar', u'1 pound browned ground beef', u' Chopped romaine lettuce, for topping', u' Diced tomatoes, for topping']
title: French Bread Pizzas

directions: [u'Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, mixing well until incorporated. Keep refrigerated until ready to use.', u'Filling:', u'Fold all ingredients together in a bowl until well incorporated but not completely smooth.', u'Syrup:', u'Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and let reduce by 1/3. ', u'French Toast:', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Heat a large saute pan and then add butter. Dredge the bread in the batter and place in the pan. Cook until golden brown on both sides, approximately 2 minutes. Remove from pan and let cool. Divide filling between 2 pieces of the bread top with the remaining 2 pieces of bread. Transfer French toast to oven and bake for 8 minutes.', u'Cut each French toast in half and serve with the cinnamon syrup and, if desired, a large scoop of vanilla ice cream and fresh berries.']
ingredients: [u'2 eggs', u'1 cup milk', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1 1/2 cups cream cheese', u'1/4 cup dark chocolate chips', u'1/2 cup medium-diced banana', u'1/8 cup orange juice', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 cup water', u'3 cinnamon sticks', u' Butter, as needed', u'4 (2-inch thick) pieces challah bread', u' Vanilla ice cream, for serving, optional', u' Fresh berries, for serving, optional']
title: Stuffed French Toast

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'For the pastry, place the flour, salt and sugar in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade. Pulse for a few seconds to combine. Add the butter and pulse 10 to 12 times, until the butter is in small bits the size of peas. With the motor running, pour the ice water down the feed tube and pulse just until the dough starts to come together. Dump onto a floured board and knead quickly into a ball. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper.', u'Roll the dough slightly larger than 10 x 14 inches. Using a ruler and a small knife, trim the edges. Place the dough on the prepared sheet pan and refrigerate while you prepare the apples.', u'Peel the apples and cut them in half through the stem. Remove the stems and cores with a sharp knife and a melon baller. Slice the apples crosswise in 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place overlapping slices of apples diagonally down the middle of the tart and continue making diagonal rows on both sides of the first row until the pastry is covered with apple slices. (I tend not to use the apple ends in order to make the arrangement beautiful.) Sprinkle with the full 1/2 cup sugar and dot with the butter.', u"Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour, until the pastry is browned and the edges of the apples start to brown. Rotate the pan once during cooking. If the pastry puffs up in one area, cut a little slit with a knife to let the air out. Don't worry! The apple juices will burn in the pan but the tart will be fine! When the tart's done, heat the apricot jelly together with the Calvados and brush the apples and the pastry completely with the jelly mixture. Loosen the tart with a metal spatula so it doesn't stick to the paper. Allow to cool and serve warm or at room temperature.", u'Photograph by Steve Giralt']
ingredients: [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, diced', u'1/2 cup ice water', u'4 Granny Smith apples', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) cold unsalted butter, small-diced', u'1/2 cup apricot jelly or warm sieved apricot jam', u'2 tablespoons Calvados rum or water']
title: French Apple Tart

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Combine onions, broth, consomme, and soup mix in a slow cooker. Cook on HIGH setting for 4 hours, or LOW setting for 8 hours.', u'Ladle soup into serving bowls. Top with a slice of French bread. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over each bread slice. Put soup bowls under broiler until cheese is melted. Alternatively, place the bread on a baking sheet and top with cheese; broil until cheese has melted, about 30 to 40 seconds, and set on top just before serving.']
ingredients: [u'5 small onions, thinly sliced', u"2 cans (14 ounces) low sodium beef broth (recommended: Swanson's)", u"2 cans (10 ounces) beef consomme (recommended: Campbell's)", u"1 packet onion soup mix (recommended: Lipton's)", u'8 slices French bread, about 1 inch thick', u'1 cup shredded Gruyere']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Slice French bread into 20 slices, 1-inch each. (Use any extra bread for garlic toast or bread crumbs). Arrange slices in a generously buttered 9 by 13-inch flat baking dish in 2 rows, overlapping the slices. In a large bowl, combine the eggs, half-and-half, milk, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt and beat with a rotary beater or whisk until blended but not too bubbly. Pour mixture over the bread slices, making sure all are covered evenly with the milk-egg mixture. Spoon some of the mixture in between the slices. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight.', u'The next day, preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Spread Praline Topping evenly over the bread and bake for 40 minutes, until puffed and lightly golden. Serve with maple syrup.']
ingredients: [u'1 loaf French bread (13 to 16 ounces)', u'8 large eggs', u'2 cups half-and-half', u'1 cup milk', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u' Dash salt', u' Praline Topping, recipe follows', u' Maple syrup', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) butter', u'1 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1 cup chopped pecans', u'2 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg']
title: Baked French Toast Casserole with Maple Syrup

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u'Melt the butter in a heavy-bottomed Dutch oven or large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the onions; sprinkle with salt, cover and cook 10 minutes to get them going. Uncover, add the thyme and bay leaf, and continue cooking until the onions are deeply caramelized, 1 to 11/2 hours.', u'Turn the heat up to medium and sprinkle the onions with the flour. Stir and allow the flour to cook, 1 to 2 minutes. Deglaze the pan with the wine and allow to reduce. Add the beef stock, chicken stock and lemon juice, and simmer, about 10 minutes. Taste the soup, and add salt and pepper as needed.', u'Meanwhile, preheat the broiler to high. Ladle the soup into 4 ovenproof crocks.', u'Mix the Swiss and Parmesan in a small bowl. Top each crock with a baguette slice and evenly distribute the cheese on top of each. Place the crocks under the broiler just until the cheese is bubbly and browning, about 1 minute. Serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'4 yellow onions (about 1 3/4 pounds), thinly sliced with the grain to hold theirshape', u' Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1 bay leaf', u'1 teaspoon all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup dry red wine', u'2 cups beef stock', u'2 cups chicken stock', u'1 teaspoon lemon juice', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon lemon juice', u'1/2 cup grated Swiss', u'1 tablespoon grated Parmesan', u' Four 1-inch-thick baguette slices, cut on the diagonal']
title: French Onion Soup

directions: [u'In a large heavy-bottom pot, melt the butter over low heat. Add the sliced onions, thyme, salt, and pepper and continue to cook, stirring occasionally until the onions become a deep golden brown and very soft, about 30 minutes.', u'Add the flour and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the white wine and scrape up any dry bits on the bottom of the pan, increasing the heat to a boil for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the beef stock, and the chicken stock, and allow the soup to simmer for an additional 30 minutes as the flavors develop. Season the soup generously with salt, and pepper, to taste.', u'Preheat the oven to broil, or turn on the broiler. Arrange the ciabatta cubes on a baking sheet and toast until crispy, about 3 to 5 minutes.', u'Remove the thyme sprigs and pour the soup into 4 to 6 oven-safe crocks or bowls. Top with the toasted ciabatta cubes and a generous amount of grated Gruyere.', u'Place the crocks or bowls under the broiler for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and begins to brown.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter', u'2 pounds yellow onions (about 6 medium), halved and thinly sliced lengthwise', u'8 to 10 sprigs fresh thyme', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more for seasoning', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more as necessary', u'1 tablespoon flour', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'4 cups beef stock or low-sodium beef broth', u'2 cups chicken stock or low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 1/2 cups cubed ciabatta bread', u'3 cups grated Gruyere cheese']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'Coat a large deep pot with olive oil. Add the onions and sprinkle generously with salt. Bring the pan to a medium heat. Stir the onions to coat with oil. Cover the pot and sweat for 15 to 20 minutes. ', u"Once the onions have gotten very soft and let off a lot of water, remove the lid and let the onions cook looooow and sloooooooooow. That's right low and slow to really develop their rich brown color and sweet flavor. There is no shortcut or rush for this, DO NOT TRY! Caramelized onions take a long time, about an hour, accept it and move on.", u'When the onions are very brown and have gotten considerably smaller, add the sherry and cook until the sherry has reduced by half. Add the bay leaves, thyme bundle and chicken stock. Bring to a boil and reduce heat and simmer for at least 1 hour. TASTE for seasoning, you probably will need to season with salt. If the stock reduces too much add water to keep the liquid level up- this IS a soup after all. When done, the soup should be thick and very full flavored. TASTE! You may need to resason, caramelized onions are very sweet and require a fair amount of salt.', u'Toast or grill the baguette slices. Fill ovenproof crocks 3/4 of the way with the onion soup, float 2 toasts in each bowl and top with grated Gruyere. Place the crocks under the broiler to melt the cheese and make it brown and bubbly. Top with chopped chives.', u'Voila!!']
ingredients: [u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u'8 large onions, thinly sliced from stem to root end', u' Kosher salt', u'6 ounces dry sherry', u'4 bay leaves', u'1 bundle thyme', u'2 quarts chicken stock', u'12 thin slices baguette', u'1/2 pound Gruyere, grated', u'1/2 bunch chopped chives']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Melt the 2 chocolates in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water.', u'Meanwhile, line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Using a ruler and a pencil, draw a 9 by 10-inch rectangle on the paper. Turn the paper facedown on the baking sheet.', u'Pour the melted chocolate over the paper and spread to form a rectangle, using the outline. Sprinkle the cashews, apricots and cranberries over the chocolate. Set aside for 2 hours until firm. Cut the bark in 1 by 3-inch pieces and serve at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'8 ounces very good semisweet chocolate, finely chopped', u'8 ounces very good bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped', u'1 cup whole roasted, salted cashews', u'1 cup chopped dried apricots', u'1/2 cup dried cranberries']
title: French Chocolate Bark

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the onion spread: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the onion and a pinch of salt; cover and cook, stirring, until golden, about 35 minutes. Add the shallots and scallion whites; cover and cook, stirring, until browned, about 25 more minutes. Stir in the scallion greens, then remove from the heat and let cool.', u'Chop the onion mixture and transfer to a bowl. Add the sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and 1 teaspoon salt. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours and up to 1 day.', u'Make the beef for the sandwiches: Mince the garlic, then sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt and mash into a paste with the flat side of a large knife. Transfer to a bowl; add the olive oil, celery salt, cayenne and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Cut small slits all over the beef with a knife, then use your fingers to push the garlic paste into the slits. Cover; refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight.', u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Bring the beef to room temperature. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Place on a rack in a roasting pan; add 1 cup broth, 3/4 cup water, the celery, onion and parsley to the pan. Roast 10 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F and roast until a thermometer inserted into the center of the beef registers 115 degrees F, about 45 more minutes. Transfer to a cutting board; let rest 20 minutes. Strain the pan juices; reserve.', u'Meanwhile, make the jus: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Whisk in the reserved pan juices and the remaining 3 cups broth and bring to a boil, whisking. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the sherry.', u'Brush the rolls with some of the onion spread. Thinly slice the beef against the grain. Dunk the slices in the jus, then layer on the rolls. Serve the remaining jus in small bowls for dipping.', u'Photograph by Jonny Valiant']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 large onion, thinly sliced', u' Kosher salt', u'6 medium shallots, thinly sliced', u'2 bunches scallions, chopped (white and greens parts separated)', u'1 1/2 cups sour cream', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons white wine vinegar', u'2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', u'6 cloves garlic', u' Kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon celery salt', u' Pinch of cayenne pepper', u' Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 3 -to-4-pound beef eye round roast', u'4 cups low-sodium beef broth', u'2 stalks celery, roughly chopped', u'1 small onion, roughly chopped', u'3 sprigs parsley', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons dry sherry', u'6 6 -inch Italian rolls, split and lightly toasted']
title: French Dip Sandwiches

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease 12 muffin cups.', u'In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg. Set aside.', u'In a separate large bowl, cream together the sugar and shortening. Add the eggs and mix again. Alternate adding one-third of the flour mixture and one-third of the milk to the creamed mixture, beating well after each addition.', u'Fill the muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake until golden, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove the muffins from the pan and set aside.', u'To make the coating, melt the butter in a bowl or glass pan. In a separate container, combine the sugar and cinnamon.', u'Dip the warm muffins in the butter, coating thoroughly.', u"Then roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Don't be afraid to really coat 'em up. Let the kids help!"]
ingredients: [u'3 cups all-purpose flour', u'3 teaspoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 cup sugar', u'2/3 cup shortening', u'2 eggs', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) butter', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'3 teaspoons ground cinnamon']
title: French Breakfast Puffs

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Saute onions and garlic in oil over low heat until tender and golden yellow. Sprinkle flour over onions, cook a few minutes more, browning the flour well. Add stock and wine and bring to a boil, add thyme and bay leaf. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer gently for 20 minutes or so. Add salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Meanwhile, slice French bread into 3/4-inch slices and butter both sides. Toast slices on griddle until golden brown. Ladle soup into an ovenproof bowl, add toasted bread and cover with cheese. Place ovenproof bowl on a baking sheet lined with tin foil. Bake at 350 degrees F or 5 minutes under a hot broiler.']
ingredients: [u'8 onions, sliced', u'2 cloves garlic, minced', u'1/3 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'8 cups beef stock', u'1/4 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1 bay leaf', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 loaf French bread', u'2 cups grated Gruyere']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Combine the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl and mix very well with a fork or a whisk. ', u"Set a plate by the stove.    Heat a small (about 6 inches) seasoned omelet pan or non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. When the pan is warm, add the butter (it should sizzle gently). Swirl the pan to distribute the butter as it melts. When the butter stops sizzling and the foam subsides add the eggs. Pause to let the eggs heat slightly and then stir vigorously, with a heatproof spatula, making sure you include the sides of the egg mixture occasionally so the omelet cooks evenly. Once the eggs are just set, bang the pan gently on the burner to release the omelet from the pan. Check to see that it is not sticking to the sides or bottom of the pan, if so release the omelet with a heat proof spatula. Hold the pan at a 45-degree angle to the stove and carefully fold the omelet like a business letter. Cook just until the desired degree of doneness lifting the pan or reducing the heat to prevent browning. (A classic omelet doesn't have any browning on it.) Transfer to a warm plate and serve.", u'Omelet Filling Suggestions: There are many omelet fillings, both raw and cooked, sweet and savory. Here is a starting point, but feel free to improvise. Once the eggs are set add any of these ingredients before folding. An alternative method, to use with delicate fillings, like creme fraiche and herbs, fresh fruits or caviar; is it to roll the omelet and then slice the top open, as you would a baked potato, and then fill it. ', u"- 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh herbs, like Italian parsley, basil, dill, tarragon, chives, thyme, and chervil. Use the herbs alone or in combination, like the classic combination fine herbs (equal parts parsley, chervil, chives and tarragon.) Brush the finished omelet with butter and sprinkle with additional herbs. Herbs can also be added to the omelet mixture to flavor the eggs more fully.  - 2 to 3 tablespoons cooked vegetables like, chopped asparagus, spinach or other greens, zucchini, mushrooms, eggplant or peppers - 2 tablespoons diced fresh tomato or avocado  - 2 tablespoons grated cheese, like Gruyere, Goat cheese, Cheddar, Monterey Jack, Gouda, Feta  - 1 tablespoon currant jelly, then dust omelet with confectioner's sugar - 2 tablespoons chopped proscuitto or other ham, crumbled cooked bacon or other cured meat - 1 to 2 tablespoons chopped smoked salmon or trout, with a tablespoon sour cream, cream cheese or creme fraiche - 1 tablespoon honey with 1 tablespoon ricotta cheese - 2 to 3 tablespoons sliced apples, pears or strawberries, alone or with a complimentary cheese", u'Copyright 2003 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'2 large eggs', u'2 tablespoons milk', u' Pinch kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u' Omelet filling suggestions, optional, follow']
title: French Omelet

author: Claire Robinson
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'On a work surface, roll the puff pastry into a roughly 10 by 16-inch rectangle. With a sharp knife, trim uneven edges to make a perfect rectangle. Evenly cut off the outer 1 inch of each side of the rectangle in strips; put the puff sheet on the baking sheet. Dip your finger in water and run around the top edges of the rectangle and replace the removed strips of pastry along the edges of the sheet, pressing lightly to adhere. With a fork, pierce the interior of the tart shell to prevent rising; do not pierce the adhered edges. Bake until the outer edges have puffed and are golden in color; about 15 minutes. Set aside.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add onions and thyme sprigs and season well with salt and pepper, to taste. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions begin to brown. Add the stock, a tablespoon at a time, as the pan gets dry, scraping and stirring the brown bits that are stuck to the bottom oft the pan. When the onions are caramelized to a dark golden color, remove from the heat and discard the leafless thyme sprigs (the leaves fall off while cooking).', u'When ready to serve, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Evenly spread the caramelized onions on the cooked pastry shell and heat in the oven until warmed through, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from oven, to a cutting board and cut into wedges. Arrange on a serving platter and garnish each wedge with a sprig of fresh thyme. Serve immediately and enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed in refrigerator', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 large Vidalia onions or other sweet variety, thinly sliced', u'4 thyme sprigs, plus more for garnish', u' Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'1/3 cup good quality beef stock']
title: French Onion Tart

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'In a large saute pan over low heat, add oil and butter. When butter is melted, add onions and saute stirring occasionally until golden brown and caramelized, about 35 minutes. Add shallots and saute for 15 minutes more until onions and shallots are dark brown. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 to 6 minutes, then chop into 1/4-inch pieces. Set aside to cool to room temperature.', u'Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine sour cream, mayonnaise, celery salt, Worcestershire, salt and pepper. Fold in onion mixture. Chill at least 1 hour or overnight, prior to serving.', u"Cook's Note: Dip can be pureed until creamy. If too thick, add milk to get desired consistency."]
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 tablespoon butter', u'2 Vidalia onions, sliced into 1/4-inch rings (about 4 cups)', u'2 large shallots, sliced into 1/8-inch rings (about 1/2 cup)', u'2 cups sour cream', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'1 teaspoon celery salt', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon salt']
title: French Onion Dip

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk together the egg, milk, maple syrup, cinnamon and a pinch of salt in a large mug until combined.', u'Evenly spread the butter on one side of the bread. Cut the bread into bite-size pieces and add them to the mug, pressing down lightly so all the bread is submerged. Sprinkle with the chocolate chips and raisins, nestling them between the bread pieces.', u'Microwave the bread mixture on high power for 2 minutes, pausing every 30 seconds. Let the French toast cool in the mug about 1 minute before serving.', u'Copyright 2014 Television Food Network, G.P.  All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1 large egg', u'1/4 cup milk', u'1 1/2 tablespoons maple syrup', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Kosher salt', u'1/2 tablespoon unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 slice white bread', u'1 tablespoon semi-sweet chocolate chips', u'1 tablespoon raisins']
title: French Toast in a Mug

directions: [u'Trim crusts from bread. Arrange half of the bread in a by 9 by 13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. ', u'Combine milk, 1 1/2 cups egg substitute, half-and-half, and 1/2 cup sugar in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk. Pour half of milk mixture over bread in dish. ', u'Combine 1/2 cup egg substitute, 1/2 cup sugar, vanilla, nutmeg, and cheeses in a food processor or blender; process until smooth. Pour cream cheese mixture over moist bread in dish. Top with remaining bread; pour remaining milk mixture over bread. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours overnight. ', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'Let the dish come to room temperature about 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 55 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar, if desired.']
ingredients: [u'24 (1-ounce) slices cinnamon-raisin bread', u' Cooking spray', u'3 cups 1-percent milk', u'2 cups egg substitute', u'1 cup half-and-half', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 (8-ounce) block fat-free cream cheese, softened', u'1 (8-ounce) block 1/3-less-fat cream cheese, softened', u' Bottled cinnamon-sugar, optional', u' Accompaniment: Canadian bacon and mixed fresh fruit with chopped mint']
title: Stuffed French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Special equipment: four 12-ounce soup crocks', u'For the soup: Melt the butter in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat. Add half of the onions and season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Top with the remaining onions and season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and a few more grinds of pepper. Add the bay leaves and thyme. Cook, stirring occasionally, until all of the liquid evaporates the onions are very soft and just begin to turn golden, 45 minutes to 1 hour.', u'Add the white wine, bring to a simmer and cook, stirring, until almost completely evaporated, about 6 minutes. Pour in the beef broth and 1 cup water, bring to a high simmer and cook until the soup has reduced to 5 cups, 30 to 40 minutes. Season with salt and a few grinds of pepper. Remove the bay leaves and thyme. Either keep warm on a low burner or cool completely, refrigerate and reheat later. (The soup can be made and refrigerated up to 2 days in advance or frozen for up to 1 month).', u"For the mac 'n' cheese: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil, add the macaroni and cook according to package instructions. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid.", u'Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour until smooth, about 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the milk and reserved pasta water and stir until thick, about 4 minutes. Stir in 1 cup each of the cheeses, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper; stir until melted and smooth. Remove from the heat and stir in the cooked pasta until coated. Let cool slightly, stirring frequently.', u"Preheat the oven to broil. Place the soup crocks on a rimmed baking sheet and divide the hot soup among the crocks, filling about three-quarters of the way. Top each with a quarter of the mac 'n' cheese (some will sink into the soup, which is fine). Evenly sprinkle with the remaining cheeses and the panko. Broil until the cheese is melted and golden brown in spots, 2 to 3 minutes (the soup will bubble and some may spill out). Serve hot.", u'Copyright 2013 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter', u'4 medium yellow onions, thinly sliced (about 14 cups)', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 bay leaves', u'2 to 3 sprigs fresh thyme', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'4 cups low-sodium beef broth', u'4 ounces elbow macaroni (1 cup)', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup milk', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 3/4 cups shredded gruyere', u'1 3/4 cups shredded sharp yellow Cheddar', u'2 tablespoons panko breadcrumbs']
title: French Onion Macaroni and Cheese Soup

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Combine the chopped vegetables, garlic and thyme in a large roasting pan. Rub the dried herbs and spices all over the beef; season generously with salt and pepper. Place the beef fat-side up on the vegetables and roast until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat registers 130, about 45 minutes. Remove the meat from the pan, cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest for 30 minutes.', u'While the meat is resting, put the roasting pan on the stove and cook the vegetables over high heat until they are browned but not burnt and the liquid has evaporated; pour off any excess fat. Add the beef broth to the pan, using a wooden spoon to scrape up any browned bits that cling to the bottom. Transfer the liquid and vegetables to a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the liquid reduces by half, about 30 minutes. Strain the sauce and season with salt and pepper. Keep warm.', u'Trim any excess fat from the beef and thinly slice. Halve the rolls horizontally and warm in the oven. Dip the bottom of each roll in the sauce and top with some of the beef; dip the cut side of each roll top in the sauce and place on each sandwich. Serve with the hot mustard.', u'Photograph by David Lauridsen']
ingredients: [u'1 small onion, roughly chopped', u'1 small carrot, roughly chopped', u'1 stalk celery, roughly chopped', u'1 small leek, white and light-green parts only, roughly chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 sprig fresh thyme', u'1/4 teaspoon dried sage', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice', u'2 pounds beef top round roast', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 cups beef broth', u'6 French rolls', u' Hot mustard, for serving']
title: French Dipped Sandwiches

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.  Line 2 sheet pans with parchment paper.', u'Unfold the sheets of puff pastry and cut each sheet into quarters.  Place the pastry pieces on the prepared sheet pans and refrigerate while you prepare the apples.', u'Peel the apples and cut them in half through the stems. Remove the stems and cores with a sharp knife and a melon baler. Slice the apples crosswise in 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place overlapping slices of apples diagonally across each piece of pastry and place a slice of apple on each side.  Sprinkle the full 3/4 cup of sugar over all the pastry pieces and dot with the butter.', u"Bake for 40 minutes, until the pastry is browned and the edges of the apples start to brown. Rotate the pan once during cooking. If the pastry puffs up in one area, cut a little slit with a knife to let the air out. Don't worry! The apple juices will burn in the pan but the galettes will be fine!  When the galettes are done, heat the apricot jelly together with the Calvados and brush the apples and pastry completely with the jelly mixture. Loosen the galettes with a metal spatula so they don't stick to the paper. Allow to cool and serve warm or at room temperature."]
ingredients: [u'2 sheets frozen puff pastry, thawed in the refrigerator', u'6 Granny Smith apples', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) cold unsalted butter, small-diced', u'3/4 cup apricot jelly or warm sieved apricot jam', u'3 tablespoons Calvados, rum, or water']
title: French Apple Galettes

directions: [u'Blend the ricotta cheese, sugar, orange and lemon zest in a medium mixing bowl. Cover and set aside. Beat eggs and milk in a wide flat bowl.  In a large saucepan or griddle, melt margarine on medium heat. Dip each piece of bread into the egg mixture briefly on each side. Place in saucepan and cook until browned on each side. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of the ricotta mixture onto 5 pieces of French toast and spread. Place remaining 5 pieces of toast on top of mixture.']
ingredients: [u'2 1/2 pounds ricotta cheese', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 orange, zested', u'1 lemon, zested', u'2 eggs', u'1/2 cup milk', u'3 tablespoons margarine or butter', u'10 slices white bread']
title: Stuffed French Toast

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'Place the chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl and place over a saucepan containing barely simmering water (or use a double boiler). Melt the chocolate and butter together and stir with a wooden spoon until smooth. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Add the egg yolks to the chocolate, 1 by 1, beating with a whisk until incorporated. Set aside.', u'In another bowl, beat the egg whites until foamy. Add the cream of tartar and continue to beat. Gradually whisk in 1/4 cup sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form.', u'Beat heavy cream in a chilled bowl until it begins to foam and thicken up. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and vanilla. Continue to whip the cream until it holds soft peaks.', u'Gradually and gently fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten it. Then, delicately fold in the whipped cream. Take care not over work the mousse. Divide mousse into 4 individual glasses. Cover and chill for several hours. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings before serving.']
ingredients: [u'6 ounces semisweet baking chocolate, chopped', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'3 eggs, separated*', u'1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 cup heavy cream, cold', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u' Whipped cream and chocolate shavings, for garnish']
title: French Chocolate Mousse

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.', u'Heat the olive oil in a 10-inch ovenproof omelet pan over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook for 3 to 5 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the bacon is browned but not crisp. Take the bacon out of the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside on a plate.', u'Place the potatoes in the pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Continue to cook over medium-low heat for 8 to 10 minutes, until very tender and browned, tossing occasionally to brown evenly. Remove with a slotted spoon to the same plate with the bacon.', u'Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, beat the eggs, milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper together with a fork. After the potatoes are removed, pour the fat out of the pan and discard. Add the butter, lower the heat to low, and pour the eggs into the hot pan. Sprinkle the bacon, potatoes, and chives evenly over the top and place the pan in the oven for about 8 minutes, just until the eggs are set. Slide onto a plate, divide in half, and serve hot.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon good olive oil', u'3 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 cup (1-inch-diced) unpeeled Yukon Gold potatoes', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'5 extra-large eggs', u'3 tablespoons milk', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon fresh chopped chives']
title: Country French Omelet

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In the bowl of an electric mixer and using the whisk attachment, beat the eggs, coconut, sugar, buttermilk, butter, flour and vanilla until well combined. Your mixture may look curdled but keep beating on high until it comes together (it will still be chunky from the coconut).', u"Pour the filling into the pie shell. Bake until lightly browned, the center of the pie doesn't jiggle when shaken lightly and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out moist but not covered with custard, 45 to 50 minutes. The coconut will rise to form a top crust during baking. Set the pie on a wire rack and cool completely before serving, about 1 hour."]
ingredients: [u'3 large eggs', u'2 cups store-bought frozen grated coconut, thawed', u'11/2 cups sugar', u'1/2 cup buttermilk, well shaken', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 deep-dish unbaked 9-inch pie shell, homemade or purchased']
title: French Coconut Pie

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u"For the blackberry syrup: In a saucepan, combine the blackberries, sugar and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a gentle boil and cook for 5 minutes on low. Stir in the cornstarch, then continue cooking, using a whisk or spoon to mash the larger pieces of blackberries. Remove from the heat when it's nice and thick.", u'For the croissant French toast: Split the croissants in half through the middle.', u"In a bowl, whisk together the half-and-half, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon and eggs. Dunk each croissant half into the mixture so that it's fully coated. Set the pieces aside on a plate.", u"Heat a large nonstick skillet over low heat, then melt a small amount of butter in it. Add as many croissant halves as will fit, cut-side down, then increase the heat very slightly (don't go above medium low). Allow the pieces to cook on the first side for 3 to 4 minutes. Move them around in the skillet a bit to make sure they don't burn. When they're deep golden brown on the bottom, flip them to the other side and let them cook for another 2 minutes or so. Remove from the pan and cook the rest of the croissant halves.", u'Serve a top and bottom piece together with butter, warm blackberry syrup and maple syrup, strawberries and whipped cream.']
ingredients: [u'1 pint fresh blackberries', u'1 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'8 croissants (a rounder shape is best)', u'1/4 cup half-and-half', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'5 large eggs', u' Butter, for frying and serving', u' Warm maple syrup, for serving', u' Strawberries, for serving', u' Whipped cream, for serving']
title: Croissant French Toast

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.', u'Arrange the bread in two layers in a 9 by 13 by 2-inch baking dish, cutting the bread to fit the dish. Set aside.', u'In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, honey, orange zest, vanilla, and salt. Pour the mixture over the bread and press the bread down. Allow to soak for 10 minutes.', u"Place the baking dish in a larger roasting pan and add enough very hot tap water to the roasting pan to come an inch up the side of the baking dish. Cover the roasting pan tightly with aluminum foil, tenting it so the foil doesn't touch the pudding. Make two slashes in the foil to allow steam to escape. Bake for 45 minutes, remove the aluminum foil, and bake for another 40 to 45 minutes, until the pudding puffs up and the custard is set. Remove from the oven and cool slightly.", u"With a small sieve, dust lightly with confectioners' sugar and serve hot in squares with maple syrup on the side."]
ingredients: [u'1 challah loaf, sliced 3/4 inch thick', u'8 extra-large eggs', u'5 cups half-and-half or milk', u'3 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon grated orange zest', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u" Confectioners' sugar and pure maple syrup, for serving"]
title: French Toast Bread Pudding

author: Alton Brown
directions: [u'Trim the ends off each onion then slice from end to end.  Remove peel and finely slice into half moon shapes.  Set electric skillet to 300 degrees and add butter. Once butter has melted add a layer of onions and sprinkle with a little salt. Repeat layering onions and salt until all onions are in the skillet. Do not try stirring until onions have sweated down for 15 to 20 minutes. After that, stir occasionally until onions are dark mahogany and reduced to approximately 2 cups. This should take 45 minutes to 1 hour. Do not worry about burning.', u'Add enough wine to cover the onions and turn heat to high, reducing the wine to a syrup consistency.  Add consume, chicken broth, apple cider and bouquet garni. Reduce heat and simmer 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Place oven rack in top 1/3 of oven and heat broiler.', u'Cut country bread in rounds large enough to fit mouth of oven safe soup crocks.  Place the slices on a baking sheet and place under broiler for 1 minute.', u'Season soup mixture with salt, pepper and cognac. Ladle soup into crocks leaving one inch to the lip. Place bread round, toasted side down, on top of soup and top with grated cheese.  Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden, 1 to 2 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'10 sweet onions (like Vidalias) or a combination of sweet and red onions', u'3 tablespoons butter', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups white wine', u'10 ounces canned beef consume', u'10 ounces chicken broth', u'10 ounces apple cider (unfiltered is best)', u' Bouquet garni; thyme sprigs, bay leaf and parsley', u'1 loaf country style bread', u' Ground black pepper', u' Splash Cognac, optional', u'1 cup grated Fontina or Gruyere cheese']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Place the beans in a bowl and cover with water.  Soak in the refrigerator overnight.  ', u'Drain the beans, place in a large saucepan with the chicken stock, and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes, until tender but not mushy. Add 1 tablespoon of salt for the last 10 minutes of cooking.  Drain, reserving the stock.', u'In a large saute pan, heat the olive oil, then add the onions, diced carrots, and celery, and cook over low heat for 10 to 15 minutes, until tender. Add the parsley, garlic, rosemary, and thyme and cook for 1 more minute. Add the beans and 2 cups of the cooking stock.  (If you dont have enough liquid, add additional stock or water to make 2 cups.)  Cook for 15 minutes until the stock makes a little sauce, adding more stock if necessary. Finish with the Parmesan cheese.  Serve with a garnish of chopped parsley.']
ingredients: [u'14 ounces dried Great Northern beans', u'1 quart homemade chicken stock or canned broth', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1/4 cup good olive oil', u'2 cups chopped yellow onions (2 onions)', u'1 cup medium-diced carrots (2 carrots)', u'1 cup medium-diced celery (2 stalks)', u'1/4 cup fresh chopped parsley, plus extra for garnish', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic (3 cloves)', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh rosemary', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh thyme', u'1/3 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese']
title: Provencal French Beans

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'For the syrup: In a medium saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a boil over high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Boil until the syrup reduces to 1 cup, about 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the cream and cinnamon. Keep the syrup warm over low heat until ready to serve. (The syrup can be made 1 day ahead. Cool, then cover and refrigerate. Reheat before serving).', u'For the French toast: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Preheat a nonstick griddle or large nonstick saute pan over medium heat.', u'Using a serrated knife, remove the top from the panettone. Cut the bottom of the panettone in half crosswise. Cut each half into 4 equal pieces. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, milk, and sugar until smooth. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter on the griddle. Working in batches, dip slices of panettone into the custard, turning to allow both sides to absorb the custard. Cook the soaked panettone slices until golden brown and firm to the touch, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer the French toast to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven. Repeat with remaining 1 tablespoon butter and panettone slices.', u'Transfer the French toast to plates. Drizzle the cinnamon syrup over the French toast and place a dollop of mascarpone on top. Lightly dust with powdered sugar and serve with fresh berries.', u"Cook's Note: The top of the panettone can be reserved and used for toast."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup water', u'1 packed cup brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 (1-pound) panettone, paper removed', u'6 large eggs', u'3/4 cup heavy whipping cream', u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided', u'1/2 cup mascarpone cheese', u' Serving suggestion: powdered sugar and assorted fresh berries']
title: Panettone French Toast

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'In a large saute pan, heat the butter over medium-high heat. Add the onions and saute, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown and caramelized. Add the shallots and saute for 8 to 10 more minutes, until the onions and shallots are dark brown. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool for 5 minutes, then chop the onion mixture into 1/4-inch pieces. Set aside to cool to room temperature.', u'In a bowl, mix the sour cream, mayonnaise, celery salt, Worcestershire sauce and 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Fold in the onion mixture. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Garnish with chives and serve with potato chips.', u'Photograph by James Baigrie']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 Vidalia onions, sliced into 1/4-inch-thick rings', u'2 large shallots, sliced into 1/8-inch-thick rings', u'3 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 cups sour cream', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'1 teaspoon celery salt', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Chives, finely chopped, for garnish', u' Potato chips, for serving']
title: French Onion Dip

directions: [u'In a shallow dish, whisk together eggs, cream, and cinnamon. In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons butter over medium-high heat. Dip 4 croissant halves in egg mixture to coat both sides. Using a fork, remove croissants from egg mixture, letting excess mixture drip off. Place croissant halves in hot skillet. Cook 2 to 3 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Repeat procedure with remaining butter and croissant halves. Set aside and keep warm.', u'In a large skillet, combine corn syrup, brown sugar, maple syrup and pecans. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat, and simmer for 2 minutes. Add banana halves and rum extract.  Coat with the syrup mixture, and simmer 1 minute. Spoon over French toast. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 large eggs', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'8 tablespoons butter, divided', u'8 large croissants, halved', u'1/2 cup dark corn syrup', u'1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar', u'1 cup maple syrup', u'1 cup chopped pecans', u'6 ripe bananas, halved crosswise and lengthwise', u'1 teaspoon rum extract']
title: Bananas Foster French Toast

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Heat a deep pot over medium to medium high heat. Work next to the stove to slice onions. Add oil and butter to the pot. Add onions to the pot as you slice them. When all the onions are in the pot, season with salt and pepper and 1 teaspoon fresh thyme. Cook onions 15 to 18 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender, sweet and caramel colored. Add bay leaf and sherry to the pot and deglaze the pan drippings. Add 6 cups stock and cover pot to bring soup up to a quick boil.', u'Arrange 4 small, deep soup bowls or crocks on a cookie sheet. Preheat broiler to high. Once soup reaches a boil, ladle it into bowls. Float toasted crusty bread on soup and cover each bowl with a mound of cheese. Sprinkle remaining fresh thyme on cheese and place cookie sheet with soup bowls on it under hot broiler until cheese melts and bubbles.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'6 medium onions, thinly sliced', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons fresh thyme, picked and chopped or poultry seasoning', u'1 bay leaf, fresh or dried', u'1/2 cup dry sherry', u'6 cups beef stock', u'4 thick slices crusty bread, toasted', u'2 1/2 cups shredded Gruyere or Swiss cheese']
title: Oh So Good French Onion Soup

directions: [u'In a small heavy saucepan melt butter with butter with brown sugar and corn syrup over moderate heat, stirring, until smooth and pour into a 13 by 9 by 2-inch baking dish. Cut 6 (1-inch) thick slices from center portion of bread, reserving ends for another use, and trim crusts. Arrange bread slices in one layer in baking dish, squeezing them slightly to fit. In a bowl whisk together eggs, half and half, vanilla, Grand Marnier and salt until combined well and pour evenly over bread. Chill bread mixture, covered, at least 8 hours and up to 1 day. ', u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and bring bread mixture to room temperature. Bake uncovered, in middle of oven until puffed and edges are pale golden, 35 to 40 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter', u'1 cup packed brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons corn syrup', u'1 (8 to 9) inch round loaf Challah bread', u'5 large eggs', u'1 1/2 cups half and half', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 teaspoon Grand Marnier', u'1/4 teaspoon salt']
title: Creme Brulee French Toast

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'On a lightly floured surface roll out dough into a 13-inch round and fit it into a 10-inch tart tin with a removable fluted rim, trimming the excess.  Arrange the apples decoratively on the pastry shell, overlapping them.  Sprinkle the sugar on top of the apples, top with butter slices and bake in the middle of the oven for 45 minutes or until the crust is cooked through and the apples are golden.  Brush with the heated apricot jam while the tart is still hot.  Serve each portion with a small scoop of ice cream or a small spoonful of whipped cream.']
ingredients: [u'1 recipe pastry dough, recipe follows', u'6 Golden Delicious apples, peeled, cored, halved and sliced 1/8-inch thick', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 stick cold butter, sliced thin', u'1/2 cup apricot jam, heated and strained', u' Vanilla ice cream or sweetened whipped cream, as an accompaniment', u'1 stick cold unsalted butter', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 to 4 tablespoons ice water']
title: French Apple Tart

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'In a large skillet over medium high heat, warm the olive oil. Season the chicken, brown it in the oil for 2 or 3 minutes on each side, and remove to a plate.', u'Return pan to stove and reduce heat to medium. Add butter to the pan and saute the shallots, carrots, and mushrooms. Saute for 3 to 5 minutes until mushrooms darken and carrot bits are fork tender. Add tarragon and parsley and stir. Add wine and reduce liquid for 1 or 2 minutes. Add tomatoes to the sauce and stir to combine. Add chicken back to the pan and simmer chicken in sauce for 6 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.', u'Serve chicken with Herb and Butter Noodles and Sugar Snap Peas.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons (2 turns around the pan in a slow stream) extra-virgin olive oil', u' Coarse salt and pepper', u'2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breast, thighs, or combination of both, cut into chunks', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'2 shallots, chopped', u'3 small carrots, peeled and thinly sliced', u'10 creminis, finely chopped', u'4 sprigs fresh tarragon, leaves removed and chopped to about 2 tablespoons', u' A handful flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped', u'1 cup dry red wine', u'1 (32-ounce) can chunky-style crushed tomatoes or diced tomatoes in puree', u' Herb and Butter Noodles, as an accompaniment', u' Sugar snap peas, as an accompaniment', u'1/2 pound extra-wide egg noodles,cooked until just tender, about 6 minutes', u'2 tablespoons butter, cut into small bits', u'2 sprigs fresh tarragon, leaves removed and chopped to about 1 tablespoon', u' A handful flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped to about 2 tablespoons', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds snap peas, rinsed and drained', u'2 teaspoons butter', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon (a couple of pinches) salt']
title: Country French Chicken

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'Slice French bread into 20 slices, 1-inch thick each. (Use any extra bread for garlic toast or bread crumbs). Arrange slices in a generously buttered 9 by 13-inch flat baking dish in 2 rows, overlapping the slices.', u'In a large bowl, combine the eggs, half-and-half, milk, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt and beat with a rotary beater or whisk until blended but not too bubbly. Pour mixture over the bread slices, making sure all are covered evenly with the milk-egg mixture. Spoon some of the mixture in between the slices. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight.', u'The next day, preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spread Praline Topping evenly over the bread and bake for 45 minutes, until puffed and lightly golden. Serve with Raspberry Syrup.']
ingredients: [u'1 loaf French bread (13 to 16 ounces)', u' Butter, for pan', u'8 large eggs', u'2 cups half-and-half', u'1 cup milk', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u' Dash salt', u' Praline Topping, recipe follows', u' Raspberry Syrup, recipe follows', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) butter', u'1 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1 cup chopped pecans', u'2 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg']
title: Baked French Toast Casserole

author: Food Network Kitchen
