When they are cool, drain and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, in a large bowl toss the onion and bell peppers together with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast for about 15 minutes, tossing with a spatula from time to time to be sure the vegetables roast evenly.', u'Just before serving, reheat the string beans in a large saute pan drizzled with a little olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and arrange on a platter. Spoon the roasted vegetables over the string beans and serve hot or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound French string beans, both ends removed', u' Kosher salt', u'1 red onion, large- diced', u'1/2 red bell pepper, large diced', u'1/2 yellow bell pepper, large diced', u' Good olive oil', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: French String Beans

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Rinse cut potatoes in a large bowl with lots of cold running water until water becomes clear. Cover with water by 1-inch and cover with ice. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes and up to 1 day.', u'In a deep-fryer, heat the oil to 325 degrees F. Be sure not to fill the oil beyond the maximum fill line.', u'Drain ice water from cut fries and wrap potato pieces in a clean dishcloth or tea towel and thoroughly pat dry. Add fries, a handful at a time, to the hot oil. Fry, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are soft and limp and begin to turn a blond color, about 6 to 8 minutes. Use the basket to carefully remove fries from the oil and set aside to drain on paper towels. Let rest for at least 10 minutes or up to 2 hours.', u'When ready to serve the French fries, reheat the oil to 350 degrees F. Transfer the blanched potatoes to the hot oil and fry again, stirring frequently, until golden brown and puffed, about 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to paper lined platter and sprinkle with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 large russet or kinnebec potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/4 by 1/4-inch thick batons', u'2 quarts peanut oil', u' Salt and pepper']
title: Emeril's Perfect French Fries

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and granulated sugar. Spread the cream cheese on half of the bread slices and top with strawberries. Top with the remaining 6 bread slices and press around the edges to seal.', u"Melt butter on a griddle over medium-low heat. Dip the sandwiches in the egg mixture for a few seconds on each side. Cook the sandwiches until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve with maple syrup, Strawberry Syrup, or confectioners' sugar."]
ingredients: [u'2 eggs', u'1/2 cup milk', u'1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar', u'8 ounces cream cheese', u'12 slices white bread', u'1 cup sliced fresh strawberries', u' Butter, for cooking', u' Maple syrup, for serving', u' Strawberry Syrup, for serving, recipe follows', u" Confectioners' sugar, for serving", u'3 cups sliced strawberries', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u' Zest and juice of 1 lemon']
title: Strawberry-Cream Cheese Stuffed French Toast

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Fill a large bowl with ice water. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add 1 tablespoon of salt. Add the beans and cook for 1 minute only. Time it carefully! You want the beans to be crisp-tender. Drain the beans and put them in the ice water until completely cool. Drain the beans again, dry on paper towels, and place them in a large bowl.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together the mustard, vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and the pepper. While whisking, slowly add the olive oil to make an emulsion.', u"Pour enough dressing over the beans to moisten them well, reserving the rest for another use. Toss with the dill, season to taste, and serve at room temperature. (If the beans aren't served immediately, refrigerate them and add a little extra vinaigrette and a sprinkle of salt before serving.)"]
ingredients: [u' Kosher salt', u'1 1/2 pounds French string beans, both ends trimmed', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup good olive oil', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh dill']
title: French String Bean Salad

author: Jeff Mauro
directions: [u'Melt 1 tablespoon unsalted butter with 1 tablespoon olive oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Slice 2 yellow onions 1/4-inch thick from root to tip and add to pot. Season with salt and cracked black pepper, and spread in an even layer. Cover and turn heat to medium-low. Sweat, steam and soften the onions, 10 to 15 minutes. Uncover and continue cooking until caramelized, 25 to 30 minutes, stirring frequently. Add 1 tablespoon dry sherry and scrape up any bits from the bottom of the pan. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme and season with salt and pepper. Preheat the griddle to medium-low heat. Put 1 slice white American cheese on 4 pieces country white bread and 1 slice yellow American cheese on 4 more bread pieces. Add some onions. Close and butter both sides with softened salted butter. Place on the griddle; cover with a metal bowl and let the sandwiches get a nice golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip, cover again and cook until the cheese is melted and the sandwiches are golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'Food Networks Kitchen Tip: Be patient! Let the onions get nice and brown to coax out maximum flavor.']
title: French Onion Grilled Cheese

author: Ree Drummond
directions: [u'For the berry butters: In separate batches, whip 2 sticks butter on high in the bowl of a stand mixer using the whisk attachment. Switch to the paddle attachment. Add the blackberries. Turn the mixer to low for only about 5 seconds, just long enough for the berries to begin to mix in and break up, but not so long that it turns into a mess. Clean the mixer bowl and attachments and repeat with the remaining 2 sticks butter and the raspberries.', u"With each batch, turn the berry butter out onto a long sheet of plastic wrap set over a long sheet of foil. First seal the plastic wrap around the cylinder, and then secure the foil around it. Twist the ends, gradually applying more pressure as you twist in order to make the cylinder taut. Once it's a nice, neat cylinder of foil, place into the freezer for 30 minutes in order to quickly solidify it. Then transfer to the fridge until you're ready to use. The butter should be very firm.", u'For the French toast: Cut the bread into slices 1/2-inch thick. In a dish, whisk the egg yolks with the half-and-half, sugar, vanilla and lemon zest. Dip the bread slices in the egg mixture, coating both sides. Then remove from the dish and set aside. Repeat until all the bread is coated.', u'Heat a cast-iron skillet or griddle over medium heat. Sizzle some butter in the skillet when hot. Cook the French toast on both sides until golden brown, being careful not to burn. Remove the berry butters from the fridge. Unwrap one end and cut some slices. Lay one slice onto each serving of French toast. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired, and then drizzle with maple syrup.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound (4 sticks) unsalted butter, softened', u'1/2 cup blackberries', u'1/2 cup raspberries', u'1 loaf crusty bread, such as baguette, French loaf, etc.', u'4 whole egg yolks', u'2 cups half-and-half', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u' Zest of 1 lemon', u' Butter, for frying', u' Sifted powdered sugar, for serving, optional', u' Maple syrup, warm, for serving']
title: French Toast with Berry Butters

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. ', u'Melt butter in a heavy bottomed skillet over medium heat. Once butter is melted add the brown sugar and pinch of cinnamon. Stir with a wooden spoon until the sugar melts into the butter and becomes a sauce. Add bananas and toss together. Let cook until the bananas are soft and incorporated into the sauce. Remove to a bowl and let cool completely. Once cool, add cream cheese and mash with a wooden spoon. ', u'Using a paring knife, cut a 2-inch-long slits in 1 side of each bread slice, cutting 3/4 of way through bread and creating pocket that leaves 3 sides of bread intact. Divide banana mixture equally among the bread pockets.', u'In a large bowl, add eggs, heavy cream, milk, cinnamon and rum and whisk to combine. Pour mixture into a 13 by 9-inch casserole dish. Put the bread into the egg mixture and let soak for 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove the bread from egg mixture, using a spatula, letting the excess drain off. ', u'Spray a wire rack with nonstick spray and put the rack on a baking sheet. Put the bread on the rack and transfer to the oven. ', u"Bake the French toast until it is golden brown and filling is hot, about 25 minutes. Transfer the toast on a serving platter and garnish with confectioners' sugar and maple syrup."]
ingredients: [u'4 tablespoons butter', u'1/4 cup light brown sugar', u' Pinch ground cinnamon', u'3 ripe bananas, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch-thick rounds', u'4 ounces cream cheese, room temperature', u'1 large unsliced loaf French bread, bread cut into 8 slices', u'4 large eggs', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 1/2 cups whole milk', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon rum extract', u' Nonstick cooking spray', u" Confectioners' sugar, for garnish", u' Maple syrup, for garnish']
title: Banana Stuffed French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Cut the bread into 8 large wedges. Whisk the eggs, buttermilk, cream, granulated sugar, vanilla and cinnamon in a large baking dish. Add the bread and turn occasionally until soaked through, about 15 minutes. Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F.', u"Put the confectioners' sugar in a fine-mesh sieve. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add half of the bread and dust generously with the confectioners' sugar; cook, turning and dusting often with more confectioners' sugar, until golden brown and caramelized, 10 to 12 minutes (add more butter to the skillet, if needed). Transfer the French toast to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven. Add 1 more tablespoon butter to the skillet and repeat with the remaining bread. Serve with maple syrup.", u'Photograph by Andrew Purcell']
ingredients: [u'1/2 round loaf (about 9 inches in diameter) crusty sourdough bread', u'4 large eggs', u'1/2 cup buttermilk', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'3 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u"1/2 to 3/4 cup confectioners' sugar", u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more if needed', u' Maple syrup, for topping']
title: Caramelized Sourdough French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Rub the turkey breast with 1 tablespoon olive oil, the thyme, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat. Add the turkey, skin-side down, and cook until golden, about 3 minutes. Turn and cook 2 more minutes. Reduce the heat to medium high; add the carrots, celery, onion and garlic and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and Worcestershire sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover and simmer until the turkey is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Transfer the turkey to a cutting board; let rest 5 minutes, then slice.', u'Preheat the broiler. Drizzle the cut sides of the bread with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Arrange the bread bottoms on a baking sheet; top each with a slice of cheese. Broil until melted, about 1 minute. Top with the turkey, vegetables and some of the pan juices, then cover with the bread tops. Serve with more pan juices for dipping.', u'Per serving: Calories 720; Fat 32 g (Saturated 10 g); Cholesterol 149 mg; Sodium 1,373 mg; Carbohydrate 40 g; Fiber 3 g; Protein 64 g', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds skin-on, boneless turkey breast', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced', u'2 celery stalks, thinly sliced', u'1 large onion, roughly chopped', u'2 cloves garlic, smashed', u'1 cup low-sodium chicken broth', u'3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', u'4 mini baguettes (or 6-inch sections of baguette), split', u'4 slices provolone cheese']
title: Turkey French Dip Sandwiches

directions: [u'Thaw the puff pastry in the refrigerator overnight. The next day, roll it out slightly to make it more flat, even and square. Using a 10-inch pan lid as your guide, cut out the largest disk possible with a pizza wheel and place it on a parchment-lined sheet pan. Chill it while you make the filling.', u'Place the applesauce in a saucepan with the lemon juice, cinnamon, brandy, and lemon rind. Stir and bring to a simmer, then cook down to 3/4 cup. Spread it on a sheet pan to cool it to room temperature.', u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Take out the puff pastry and spread the reduced applesauce on it to cover the surface of the pastry, leaving a 1/2-inch edge. Fan the apple slices in concentric circles over the applesauce decoratively. Sprinkle all over evenly and lightly with sugar then dot it with butter. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes until the apples are tender and the edges are golden brown.']
ingredients: [u'1 sheet puff pastry', u'1 cup applesauce, sweetened', u'1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon apple brandy', u'1/4 teaspoon grated lemon rind', u'4 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, and cut in thin slices', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'4 tablespoons butter', u' Pizza wheel']
title: French Apple Galette

author: Guy Fieri
directions: [u'Batter: In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients until a smooth batter is formed.', u'Sauce:  In a saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter, then add the brown sugar.  Stir continuously until the sugar has dissolved.  Add the cinnamon and orange juice and bring to a simmer. Remove the pan from the heat, pour in the rum and creme de banana, if using, then return the pan to the heat. Brush down the sides of the pan with water using a pastry brush.  Remove from heat.', u'In a small saute pan, add 1/4 cup of the caramel sauce and the bananas.  Saute over high heat until just warmed through.  Keep warm.', u'Toast: Preheat a griddle or a nonstick pan over high heat. Dip the bread slices into the batter, then put them on the griddle, turning over after 2 minutes.  To each serving plate, add 1/4 cup of the caramel sauce and top with the French toast. Spoon the bananas, over the toast and drizzle with some of the caramel sauce.']
ingredients: [u'3 eggs', u'1/3 cup milk, preferably whole', u'1/3 cup heavy cream', u'1/4 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon orange-flavored liqueur (recommended: Grand Marnier)', u'1/8 teaspoon sea salt', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 cup unsalted butter', u'2 cups packed brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 cup orange juice', u'1/4 cup dark rum', u'1 tablespoon creme de banana liqueur, optional', u'3 bananas, peeled and sliced', u'6 thick bread slices, preferably French toast bread (brioche) or Texas toast']
title: Texas French Toast Bananas Foster

directions: [u'For the batter: Beat all batter ingredients together in a medium-sized bowl. Set aside.', u'For the French Toast: Slice the baguette into 18 thick slices. Soak the slices in the batter for about 3 minutes, turning to coat evenly on each side. Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Lift the bread from the batter and place it in the hot pan. Add only enough slices to fit easily in the pan. Saute on both sides until golden brown. Keep warm until all slices have been cooked.', u'Place 3 slices on each plate. Drizzle with warm Bourbon Vanilla Custard. Garnish with chocolate syrup and Kentucky Bourbon Whipped Cream. Top with sliced strawberries and toasted pecan halves. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'6 eggs', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/4 cups milk', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 (16-ounce) loaf firm textured bread, preferably a baguette', u' Canola oil, for frying', u' Bourbon Vanilla Custard, recipe follows', u' Chocolate syrup', u' Kentucky Bourbon Whipped Cream, recipe follows', u'1 pint fresh sliced strawberries', u'1 cup toasted pecan halves', u'2 cups half-and-half', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'4 large egg yolks', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'4 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1/3 cup Kentucky bourbon', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'3 tablespoons powdered sugar', u'3 tablespoons Kentucky bourbon']
title: Bourbon Ball French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Toss 2 sliced sweet onions with 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 cup water, and salt and pepper in a baking dish. Cover; roast at 425 degrees F until tender, 25 minutes. Toss 1 cup croutons and 1/2 cup grated gruyere with some parsley, olive oil, salt and pepper; sprinkle over the onions and bake 5 more minutes.', u'Photograph by Antonis Achilleos']
title: French Onions

author: Giada De Laurentiis
directions: [u'To make the syrup: Combine 1 cup of water and brown sugar in a heavy medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Boil until the syrup reduces to 1 cup, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and whisk in the cream and cinnamon. Keep the syrup warm. (The syrup can be made 1 day ahead. Cool, then cover and refrigerate. Rewarm before serving.)', u'Meanwhile, prepare the French toast: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Trim the bottom crust of the panettone. Starting at the bottom end of the panettone, cut it crosswise into 6 (3/4-inch thick) round slices (reserve the top piece for toast!). In a large bowl, whisk the eggs until well blended. Add the cream, milk, and sugar and whisk until well mixed. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter on a large nonstick griddle over medium heat. Dip 3 slices of panettone into the custard, turning to allow both sides to absorb the custard. Grill the soaked panettone slices until they are golden brown and firm to the touch, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer the French toast to a baking sheet and keep them warm in the oven. Repeat with the remaining butter, panettone slices, and custard.', u'Transfer the French toast to plates. Dollop the mascarpone atop each. Lightly dust with the powdered sugar. Drizzle the cinnamon syrup over and around the French toast and serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup water', u'1 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 (1.1 pound; 500 gram) loaf panettone bread, baking paper removed', u'6 large eggs', u'3/4 cup whipping cream', u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup mascarpone cheese', u' Powdered sugar, for dusting']
title: Panettone French Toast

author: Trisha Yearwood
directions: [u'For the salad: Layer the salad ingredients in a large salad bowl, beginning with the lettuce, then adding the tomatoes, bell pepper and onion.', u'For the French dressing: Put the vinegar, sugar, mustard, onion, paprika, salt and 1/2 cup water in a blender and process until well blended. While the blender is running, slowly stream in the oil. Chill in the refrigerator for 3 hours.', u'When ready to serve, pour some of the dressing over the salad and toss.']
ingredients: [u'6 cups torn romaine lettuce', u'4 medium tomatoes, chopped', u'1 small green bell pepper, finely chopped', u'1/2 medium sweet onion, such as Vidalia, finely chopped', u'1/2 cup apple cider vinegar', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon yellow mustard', u'1 tablespoon grated onion', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup vegetable oil']
title: Green Salad with French Dressing

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Make the compote: Combine the strawberries, rhubarb, 1/3 cup sugar, the vanilla and cloves in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat; cook, stirring occasionally, until broken down and thickened, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. (You can make the compote up to 2 days ahead; cover and refrigerate.)', u'Cut a 3-inch-wide slit into one side of each bread slice, cutting about three-quarters of the way through to make a pocket. Fill with the compote, reserving about 1/4 cup for topping.', u'Whisk the eggs, milk and the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar in a large baking dish. Add the stuffed bread and soak, about 5 minutes per side.', u'Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the stuffed bread and cook until golden brown and cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes per side, adjusting the heat if necessary. Top with the reserved compote and yogurt.', u'Photograph by Andrew Purcell']
ingredients: [u'2 cups strawberries, hulled and chopped', u'4 small rhubarb stalks, chopped', u'1/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u' Pinch of ground cloves', u'4 1 1/2 -inch-thick slices challah bread', u'3 large eggs', u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u' Vanilla yogurt, for topping']
title: Strawberry-Rhubarb Stuffed French Toast

directions: [u'The dough can be made in advance.  You will need 1 pound of dough to make this pie. Blend the shortening, flour and cold water together in the bowl of a stand mixer on low speed, using a dough hook.  Mix until well blended.  Remove the dough from the bowl, wrap in plastic wrap and put it on a sheet pan. The dough can be stored for up to 1 week in the refrigerator, but allow it to come to room temperature before rolling.', u'Cut the dough in half and roll out 1 piece of dough to fit into a 10-inch pie plate. Fit the dough circle into the bottom of the pie pan, pushing it snugly against the edges.  Roll out the other piece of dough and set aside until ready to use.', u'For the Filling:', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat.  Add the potatoes and blanch until al dente.  Drain and set aside to cool.', u'In a large skillet over medium heat, add the beef, pork, and the onions. Brown the meat, then discard the grease. Add the potatoes and moisten the mixture with the beef soup base, as needed.  Use the instant potato to tighten the mixture, if needed.  Season with cinnamon, nutmeg, garlic, black pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt.', u'Pour the filling into the dough lined pie plate.  Level it off and cover with the remaining circle of dough.  Pinch the edges of the bottom layer and top layer of dough together and create the knuckle-like pie edge ridges.  Trim off any excess dough using a sharp knife.', u'Brush the top of the pie with the egg wash. Make a few slits in the top crust to allow the steam to escape.', u'Bake until cooked through and the top of the pie is golden brown, about 45 minutes.', u'Remove from the oven and serve.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'5 1/4 ounces all-purpose vegetable shortening', u'8 1/4 ounces unbleached pastry flour', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons cold tap water', u' Salt', u'9 ounces 1/2-inch diced potato', u'1 pound ground beef', u'9 ounces finely ground pork', u'9 ounces 1/4-inch diced onion', u'1 7/8 teaspoons beef soup base, prepared according to package instructions', u'3 tablespoons, plus 1 1/2 teaspoons instant potato powder', u'3/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon granulated garlic', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u' Egg wash, for topping']
servings: 6 to 8 servings depending on slice size
title: 10-inch French Meat Pie

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'Whisk together the eggs, milk, cream, orange juice, vanilla, cognac, granulated sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and a pinch of salt in a bowl.', u'Place the bread in 2 shallow baking dishes in a single layer. Pour the egg mixture over the bread; let soak for 10 minutes.', u'While the bread is soaking, preheat a grill to medium. Place a flat cast-iron skillet on the grill. Brush the bananas with the melted butter; cook in the skillet until they are browned on all sides and beginning to release their juices, about 3 minutes. Use a spatula to transfer the bananas to a plate, then wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel. When the bananas are cool enough to handle, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices.', u"Remove a piece of bread from the egg mixture, allowing the excess to drip off. Place on a cutting board, top with four or five banana slices, then cover with another piece of bread. Brush the skillet on the grill lightly with vegetable oil. Add the sandwich to the pan; place a grill press or heavy pan over the sandwich to weigh it down. Cook until the bread is nicely toasted and golden, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip, press and cook on the other side until golden. Keep warm; repeat with the remaining bread and bananas, adding more oil as needed. Transfer the panini to plates and slice in half diagonally; top with confectioners' sugar and plenty of maple syrup.", u'Photograph by Miki Duisterhof']
ingredients: [u'6 large eggs', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/4 cup fresh orange juice (from about 1 medium orange)', u'2 tablespoons vanilla extract', u'2 tablespoons cognac (optional)', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg', u' Salt', u'8 slices Texas toast or other thick white bread', u'3 large ripe bananas', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u" Confectioners' sugar, for garnish", u' Pure maple syrup, for garnish']
title: French Toast Panini With Grilled Bananas

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk and vanilla. Set aside.', u'Place 1 tablespoon of ricotta in the center of 4 of the pieces of bread and spread around slightly. Top with about 6 slices of strawberries and a teaspoon of chocolate chips. Cover each with another piece of bread to make a "sandwich".', u'Spray a large nonstick skillet or griddle with cooking spray and preheat. Carefully dip each of the "sandwiches" into the egg mixture until completely moistened. Then place on the skillet and cook over a medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side, until the outside is golden brown and the center is warm and chocolate is melted.', u"Transfer to serving places. Top with remaining strawberries and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar."]
ingredients: [u'3 eggs', u'1 1/4 cups nonfat milk', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 cup part-skim ricotta cheese', u'8 slices of whole-wheat sandwich bread, crusts removed', u'1 (8-ounce) container strawberries, hulled and sliced', u'4 teaspoons bittersweet chocolate chips', u' Cooking spray', u"2 teaspoons confectioners' sugar"]
title: Chocolate and Strawberry Stuffed French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'For the casserole: Generously butter a 3-quart casserole dish. Arrange the bread slices over the bottom of the dish in three rows of 6 slices, shingling slightly.', u'Whisk the eggs, granulated sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and 1/2 teaspoon salt in large bowl until combined and smooth. Whisk in the milk and heavy cream. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the bread slices, making sure that all slices have been coated. Cover the dish and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 12.', u'Position an oven rack in the center of the oven, and preheat to 350 degrees F.', u'For the crumble: Toss the brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and 1/4 teaspoon salt together in a medium bowl. Add the butter and work it in with your fingers until the mixture is crumbly with pea-sized bits of butter. Mix in the walnuts.', u'To assemble: Give the bread slices in the casserole dish a gentle push into the custard. Sprinkle the crumble evenly over the top.', u'Bake the casserole until the top is puffed and browned and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes (it will still be a little wiggly but will continue to cook a bit out of the oven); check halfway through the baking time and tent with foil if the topping is browning too quickly. Serve hot.', u'Copyright 2014 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, softened, for the casserole dish', u'1 loaf Italian-style bread, cut into 18 half-inch-thick slices (about 1 pound)', u'6 large eggs', u'1/3 cup granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u' Kosher salt', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'3/4 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u' Kosher salt', u'1 stick unsalted butter, cut into cubes', u'1 cup chopped walnuts']
title: French Toast Casserole with Brown Sugar-Walnut Crumble

author: Claire Robinson
directions: [u'In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, milk and salt. Working in batches, melt some of the butter in a large nonstick skillet over moderately-high heat. Dip the bread slices in the egg mixture and quickly transfer to the skillet. Cook 2 slices of the bread until golden brown, and then flip over and cook until golden brown on the other side. Spread 2 tablespoons of the chocolate hazelnut spread on 1 piece of the bread, and place the other piece of cooked bread on top to enclose the chocolate hazelnut spread. Gently press down with a spatula so the pieces stick together. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Serve with grade B maple syrup or powered sugar.', u"BYOC: A beautiful and tasty garnish would be toasted chopped hazelnuts. Also, bananas, strawberries or blueberries would be delicious as well. Go ahead and make a fruit sauce to go with it for mom on Mother's Day. She will absolutely adore the sauce and you."]
ingredients: [u'4 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'1 cup whole milk', u' Pinch of salt', u'3 tablespoons butter', u'8 (1/2-inch) thick slices brioche or challah bread', u'8 tablespoons chocolate hazelnut spread, divided', u' Grade B maple syrup or powdered sugar, for serving']
title: Chocolate Hazelnut Stuffed French Toast

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'For the plums: Put the cranberry juice and sugar into a wide saucepan and stir to help start dissolving the sugar. Then put the saucepan over a low heat until the sugar dissolves entirely.', u'Halve the plums and remove the pits, then halve them again if they are big brutes.', u"Once the sugar's dissolved into the red liquid, add the cinnamon stick, then turn the heat up, bring to the boil and let the pan bubble away for a couple of minutes until the mixture is on the way to becoming syrupy.", u'Now turn the syrup down to a simmer and add the plum halves or quarters and cook them gently for about 10 minutes, although note that this is based on starting off with viciously unripe fruits so you might need less time.', u'Once the plums are tender but not disintegrating, remove the pan from the heat, cover and leave to keep warm. You can make the plums in advance and either serve them at room temperature with the French toast or warm them up again.', u'For the French toast: Whisk together the eggs, milk, ground cinnamon and sugar in a pie dish.', u"Sit 2 pieces of bread in the eggy mixture, turning after each side has soaked up enough to color the bread yellow, so that it absorbs the liquid but doesn't fall to pieces.", u'Melt half the butter in a frying pan and cook the 2 soaked pieces of bread for a couple of minutes each side. Transfer the yellow, eggy bread, scorched golden in parts, to warm waiting plates. Meanwhile, soak the next 2 slices.', u'Melt the remaining butter to cook the last 2 slices in the same way.', u'Serve alongside the beautiful scarlet plum compote.', u'Make Ahead Note: The compote can be made 1 day ahead. Transfer to bowl to cool, then cover and refrigerate. Warm the compote gently in saucepan before serving.', u'Freeze Note: Cooled compote can be frozen in airtight container for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator and reheat as above.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup sweetened cranberry juice', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 cinnamon stick', u'1 pound plums', u'2 eggs', u'1/4 cup whole milk', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'4 large slices stale white bread', u'2 tablespoons soft unsalted butter']
title: Cinnamon Plums with French Toast

directions: [u'In large soup pot, melt the butter  with the oil.  Add the onions and  cook until translucent.  Add sugar  and flour, cook for 1 minute.  Add  beef broth, water, salt and pepper.   Simmer for 30 minutes.  Stir in  wines, simmer for 2 hours.', u'Preheat broiler To Serve: Pour into onion soup crocks.  Place  a piece of French bread on top.   Cover bread with choice of cheese.   Place in oven and broil until  cheese is melted and bubbly.', u"The recipes for this program, which  were provided by contributors and  guests who may not be professional  chefs, have not been tested in the  Food Network's kitchens. Therefore,  the Food Network cannot attest to  the accuracy of an"]
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons butter', u'1 tablespoon oil', u'3 large onions - sliced', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons flour', u'5 (16-ounce) cans beef broth', u'2 1/2 cans water (empty broth cans)', u' Salt and pepper to taste', u'1/4 cup Port wine', u'3/4 cup Burgundy wine', u' French bread', u' Mozzarella, Gruyere or Swiss cheese']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Combine lettuce and chopped veggies in salad bowl.', u'Add all of the dressing ingredients into a blender. Put the top in place and blend on high until dressing is combined. Pour dressing over salad and toss. Adjust salt and pepper, to your taste.']
ingredients: [u'1 head iceberg lettuce, core removed and chopped', u'4 radishes, chopped', u'4 scallions, chopped', u'1/3 seedless cucumber, chopped', u'1 cup shredded carrots, available in produce section', u'3 tablespoons white wine vinegar', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it', u'1 teaspoon garlic powder', u'2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', u' Salt and white pepper']
title: Iceberg Lettuce Chopped Salad with "French" Dressing

directions: [u'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 4-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook onion, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 6 minutes. Add carrots and celery and cook, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add lentils, water, salt, and pepper and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to moderate and cook, covered, until lentils are tender, about 30 minutes.', u'While lentils are cooking, heat remaining tablespoon oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over high heat until hot but not smoking, then brown sausage on all sides, about 5 minutes. Cool sausage slightly on a cutting board, then cut into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Add sausage to soup and stir in vinegar.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'2 medium carrots, finely chopped', u'1 celery rib, finely chopped', u'1 1/4 cups lentils (preferably French green)', u'6 cups water', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'4 ounces smoked sausage, like kielbasa', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, or to taste']
title: French Lentil Soup with Sausage

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Fit a baking sheet with a wire rack.', u'Slice the pound cake into 8 slices. Place the prepared baking sheet. Toast in the oven for 12 minutes.', u'In a small pot, heat 1/4 cup heavy cream over low heat. When hot, whisk in the white chocolate chips until melted and fully incorporated into the cream. Remove from the heat and chill in the fridge until cool but still a pourable consistency, about 30 minutes.', u'In a blender, combine three-quarters of the strawberries with the sugar. Reserve the remaining strawberries for garnish. Blend until smooth. Strain the puree through a strainer into a bowl. Cover and place in the fridge until ready to serve. Strawberry sauce can be made the day before and keep in the refrigerator in an airtight container.', u'In a large chilled bowl, combined the remaining 3/4 cup heavy cream and the cooled white chocolate cream mixture. Whip with a hand mixer until medium peaks form. Cover and place in the fridge while you make the French toast.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat.', u'In a baking dish. whisk together the chocolate milk, vanilla, cinnamon and eggs until well blended. Place 4 pieces of the pound cake into the egg mixture and let soak for 15 seconds. Flip and soak the other side for 15 seconds. Remove the cake from the egg mixture, allowing any excess to drip off, and place in the heated skillet with the butter. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove to a platter. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons butter to the skillet and repeat with the remaining 4 pound cake slices.', u'To assemble: Place a small pool of the strawberry sauce onto 4 plates, 2 to 3 tablespoons per plate. Place 2 pieces of French toast onto each plate. Top each with a large dollop of the white chocolate whipped cream, sprinkle with the some chocolate chips and garnish with a fresh strawberry and mint sprig.']
ingredients: [u'1 chocolate pound cake', u'1 cup  heavy cream', u'1/3 cup white chocolate chips', u'1 pint strawberries, washed, tops removed', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'1/2 cup chocolate milk', u'2 teaspoons  vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon ground  cinnamon', u'3 eggs', u'1/4 cup  chocolate chips or shaved chocolate', u'4 sprigs fresh mint, for  garnish']
title: Decadent Chocolate French Toast

author: Patricia Heaton
directions: [u'In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the grapefruit juice, vodka, elderflower liqueur, lemon juice and lemon bitters and shake well. Strain into 2 coupe glasses. Float a thin lemon slice on top of each.']
ingredients: [u'4 ounces grapefruit juice', u'2 ounces vodka', u'2 ounces elderflower liqueur', u'2 teaspoons lemon juice (about 1/2 lemon), plus 2 thin lemon slices, for garnish', u'2 dashes lemon bitters']
title: French Blonde Cocktail

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Topping: Combine bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese in a small bowl and set aside.', u'Bechamel Sauce: Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter over low heat in a medium saucepan. Add the flour and stir to combine. Stir constantly, for about 3 minutes. Increase heat to medium and whisk in the milk or half-and-half, adding a little at a time and cook until thickened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Lower heat, season with the salt and pepper and add Gruyere and mozzarella cheeses. Stir until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth. Set aside.', u'French Onion "Soup:" Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter and olive oil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Add onions, cover, and cook 10 to 15 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove cover, add garlic and honey, and continue to cook uncovered, stirring frequently, until onions are caramelized, about 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and a generous amount of pepper. Remove pot from heat and add sherry. Return to heat and stir to remove browned bits from bottom of pan. Reduce sherry by half, then add stock and thyme and cook until almost all liquid is evaporated. Remove from heat.', u'Grease a 3-quart baking dish or casserole with the last tablespoon of butter or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Combine cooked pasta with onion "soup" mixture and bechamel sauce, and stir well to combine. Transfer pasta to baking dish and sprinkle with bread crumb/Parmesan topping.', u'Bake until top is golden brown and cheese is bubbly, about 35 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup bread crumbs', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups whole milk or half-and-half', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces Gruyere, grated', u'3 ounces mozzarella grated', u'2 tablespoons butter, plus 1 tablespoon (or nonstick spray)', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 large white onions, thinly sliced', u'6 cloves garlic, peeled and chopped', u'2 tablespoons honey', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 cup dry sherry', u'2 cups beef stock', u'8 sprigs fresh thyme leaves', u'1 pound pasta, cooked al dente (elbow macaroni, ziti, or fusilli work well)']
title: French Onion "Soup" Mac and Cheese

author: Ellie Krieger
directions: [u'The hardest thing about this dish is waiting for it to come out of the oven because as it is baking it fills your kitchen with the most enticing, heartwarming, vanilla-cinnamon aroma. Its looks and taste hold up their end of the bargain too. Inside it is egg-y, perfectly sweetened, and studded with bursting warm blueberries. Outside it is crisp and crowned with sugared toasted almonds.']
ingredients: [u' Cooking spray', u'1 whole-wheat baguette (about 18 inches long, 8 ounces), cut into 1-inch cubes', u'8 large eggs', u'8 large egg whites', u'2 cups 1 percent lowfat milk', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/3 cup pure maple syrup', u'2 cups fresh blueberries', u'1/3 cup sliced almonds', u'2 tablespoons dark brown sugar']
title: Blueberry Almond French Toast Bake

directions: [u'Slice baguette horizontally with a serrated bread knife. Spread preserves on both sides of bread. On bottom half of baguette, lay down overlapping slices of ham and top with slices of brie. Place top of baguette on sandwich. Cut into 1-inch pieces and secure with decorative sandwich picks.', u'Optional: heat in a 400 degree F oven for 10 to 12 minutes.']
ingredients: [u'1 (18 to 20-inch) baguette', u'1/3 cup peach or raspberry preserves', u'1 (6-ounce) package deli ham slices', u'1 (5-ounce) wedge brie, sliced, room temperature (recommended: Alouette)']
title: French Brie and Ham Baguette

author: Alex Guarnaschelli
directions: [u'Put a sugar cube in each of 6 Champagne glasses. Use a vegetable peeler to remove a few pieces of orange peel. Trace around the rim of each Champagne glass with the orange peel to give it that hint of orange. Halve the orange and squeeze some juice into each glass. Add a squeeze of lemon juice to each glass also.', u'Add 1-ounce of gin to each glass. Stir to blend and top with sparkling wine. Serve immediately. This can be made in a pitcher as well.']
ingredients: [u'6 raw sugar or brown sugar cubes', u'1 orange', u'1 lemon', u'6 ounces gin', u'1 bottle sparkling wine']
title: The French 75

author: Geoffrey Zakarian
directions: [u'Crack the eggs into a blender and add the milk and cinnamon. Blend until the yolks and whites are incorporated. (This step can be accomplished in a shallow dish with a whisk or fork as well.) Pour the mixture into a shallow dish or wide-bottom bowl.', u"Heat a large nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of the butter and swirl it around the pan; when melted, place 1 piece of bread in the egg mixture to soak in for about 10 seconds. Turn over and let soak on other side. This is a quick process  don't let bread soak too long as it will get too soggy. Drain off excess egg and place the bread in the hot pan. Immediately soak 3 more bread slices, taking care not to over-crowd the pan.", u'Cook until golden brown, turning once, about 2 minutes per side.', u'Repeat with remaining butter and bread slices. Serve with Strawberry Syrup spooned over or on the side at the table.']
ingredients: [u'3 large eggs', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'4 tablespoons salted butter', u'8 slices basic white bread', u' Strawberry Syrup for serving, recipe follows', u'1 cup sliced strawberries (about 6 large whole)', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract']
title: Classic French Toast with Strawberry Syrup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Whisk the eggs, 1/4 cup sugar, the milk, orange zest, orange juice and vanilla in a large bowl. Put the croissants in an 8-inch-square baking dish, squeezing them in to fit in a single layer. Pour the egg mixture over the croissants, then put a plate on top and press down to keep them submerged. Let soak in the refrigerator, at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Remove the plate from the croissants, cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake until set, about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and turn on the broiler. Uncover the baking dish, sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and broil until the sugar is bubbling in spots, about 2 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, mix the marmalade with 1/4 cup water in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave until warm, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve on the side.', u'Photograph by Andrew Purcell']
ingredients: [u'3 large eggs', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 cup whole milk', u' Grated zest of 1 orange', u'2 tablespoons fresh orange juice', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'4 croissants', u'1/2 cup orange marmalade']
title: Baked Croissant French Toast With Orange Syrup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'In a small saucepan, heat the half-and-half with the cinnamon, just until bubbles form around the side of the pan. Remove from the heat; set aside to steep for 30 minutes.', u'In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs with the nutmeg and sugar. Strain the half-and-half into the eggs and discard the cinnamon pieces. Whisk to make a smooth batter.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'Slice the bread with a serrated knife on the diagonal, into 18 1-inch-thick pieces.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add half the butter. Dip 9 of the bread slices into the batter and add to the skillet. Cook the slices, turning once, until golden, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer the toasts to a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining bread. Bake until the toasts are warmed through and slightly puffy, about 8 to 10 minutes.', u"Divide the toast on large plates and dust with confectioners' sugar. Top with the berries and serve immediately."]
ingredients: [u'2 cups half-and-half or milk', u' Three 3-inch cinnamon sticks, broken up into pieces', u'6 large eggs', u' Pinch freshly grated nutmeg', u'3/4 teaspoon sugar', u'1 baguette (French bread), about 2 feet long', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u" Confectioners' sugar", u' Marinated Berries, recipe follows', u' Marinated Berries', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 vanilla bean, split lengthwise, and seeds scraped out with a knife and reserved', u' Grated zest of 1/2 lemon', u' Grated zest of 1/2 orange', u'1 cup water', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed orange juice', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1/2 pint raspberries', u'1/2 pint blueberries, rinsed', u'1/2 pint strawberries, rinsed, tops trimmed, halved or quartered, if large']
title: French Toast with Mixed Berries

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Special equipment: eight 12-inch skewers', u'Thread 6 bread cubes onto each skewer, leaving at least 1/4 inch of space between cubes. Leave the skewers out overnight, uncovered, to dry out.', u'The next day, prepare an outdoor grill for medium heat. Grill the bacon, flipping as needed to ensure even cooking, until most of the fat has rendered and the bacon is charred in spots on both sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate to absorb any excess fat. (Note: If you have a charcoal grill, cook the bacon in a grill pan. It should not be grilled over charcoal because of the risk of flare-ups.)', u'Whisk together the buttermilk, eggs, butter, sugar, cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl until combined; pour into a rimmed baking sheet. Put the skewers of bread in the buttermilk mixture to soak, turning as needed, until the bread has absorbed some of the liquid but is not falling apart, no more than 5 minutes.', u'Spray a large piece of aluminum foil all over with cooking spray and place it on half the grill. Transfer the skewers to the foil in 1 layer, at least 1/2 inch of space between them. Grill, covered, turning the skewers a few times as needed, until the cubes of bread are golden in most places and no longer wet, 5 to 8 minutes.', u'Remove the skewers and foil from the grill, and return the bacon to the grill just until warmed through, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Serve the grilled French toast kebabs and bacon with warm maple syrup.', u'Copyright 2014 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
ingredients: [u' Half a 12-inch brioche loaf, end discarded, bread cut into 1-inch cubes (about 48)', u'8 slices thick-cut bacon', u'1 1/2 cups well-shaken buttermilk', u'4 large eggs', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', u' Kosher salt', u' Cooking spray', u' Pure maple syrup, warm']
title: Grilled French Toast Kebabs

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Grate the chilled chocolate with a fine grater or rasp and set aside.', u'Whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and sea salt.', u"Beat the butter and sugar in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until just combined. Mix in the yolk. Add the dry ingredients to the butter and beat lightly together until just combined but still crumbly. Fold in grated chocolate with a spatula. Bring the dough together by lightly squeezing in your hands; but don't knead or overwork, as the secret to these cookies is their delicate, sandy texture.", u'Divide the dough in half. Lay half the dough on a long sheet of waxed paper and shape into a log along the width of the waxed paper, leaving some space at each end. Pull the paper over the top of the log. Grip the edge of the top piece of paper, and use a straight, firm edge, like a ruler or the edge of a pan, to press gently against the edge of the dough where the papers come together to create a solid, firm round log. Repeat with remaining dough and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. (To keep logs round store inside an empty paper towel roll.)', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.', u'Slice logs into 1/2-inch thick rounds with a sharp, thin knife. Divide rounds onto the  prepared sheets, leaving about 1 inch between them, and refrigerate for 15 minutes.', u'Bake until cookies smell fragrant with a full cocoa aroma and set on the outside, about 12 to 14 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool on the pans, about 5 minutes.', u'Transfer cookies to a rack to cool completely. Serve.', u"Busy baker's tips: Dough can be made and frozen for up to 2 weeks. Store baked cookies in an airtight container for up to 5 days. Baked cookies can be wrapped in plastic wrap, then aluminum foil and frozen for up to 2 weeks.", u"Cook's note: For super uniform cookies, place each sliced disk of dough in a muffin tin and bake. The cookies will be chewier, less sandy this way.", u'Copyright 2007 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved']
ingredients: [u'3 ounces bittersweet chocolate, frozen for 10 minutes', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/3 cup Dutch-process cocoa powder', u'1/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'5 1/4 ounces (11 tablespoons) unsalted butter, softened', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 large egg yolk']
title: Double Chocolate Sable Cookies (France)

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Place paper liners in a 12-cup muffin tin. Prepare the cupcakes: Combine the flours, pudding mix, baking powder, potato starch, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt in a bowl with a whisk.', u'In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugars with a mixer on low speed until combined, 6 to 8 minutes. Gradually mix in the vanilla and egg whites. Scrape down the sides of the bowl; continue mixing until light and fluffy. Add the flour mixture in 3 batches, alternating with the maple syrup and half-and-half, mixing after each addition and ending with flour. Mix until the ingredients are just combined; do not overmix. Fold in the bacon. The batter will be thick. ', u'Pour the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about three-quarters of the way. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Cool completely. ', u"Meanwhile, prepare the glaze: Beat the cream cheese and butter with a mixer on medium speed until creamy. Add the confectioners' sugar, maple syrup and cinnamon; beat until combined. Spread on the cooled cupcakes; top with chopped bacon, if desired.", u'Photograph by Kate Sears']
ingredients: [u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 cup cake flour', u'1 3 .9-ounce box instant vanilla pudding mix', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 tablespoon potato starch', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 stick unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1/4 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'4 large egg whites, at room temperature', u'1/4 cup maple syrup', u'1/2 cup half-and-half, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup chopped cooked bacon (5 strips)', u'1 8 -ounce package cream cheese, at room temperature', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature', u"2 cups sifted confectioners' sugar", u'1/4 cup maple syrup', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'3 strips bacon, cooked and chopped (optional)']
title: Maple French Toast and Bacon Cupcakes

author: Tyler Florence
directions: [u'In a large saucepan over medium heat, fry 4 strips of bacon until crisp.  Discard bacon.  Saute onions and shallots in bacon fat until tender, about 10 minutes.   Add balsamic vinegar, wine and oregano; cook for 30 minutes. Stir frequently until the onions caramelize and are golden brown.', u'Blend in chicken broth.  Simmer gently for 1 hour, stir occasionally.  Season with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into 4 ovenproof bowls.  Float the croutons on top of soup and sprinkle with grated cheese.  Broil until cheese melts.  Garnish with flat-leaf parsley, serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons bacon drippings (4 bacon strips)', u'6 Maui or Vidalia onions (3 pounds/8 cups), thinly sliced', u'2 large shallots, chopped', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', u'1 cup burgundy wine', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano', u'3 quarts chicken broth', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u' Sliced baquette, toasted and seasoned', u' Swiss cheese, grated', u' Flat-leaf parsley, chopped, for garnish']
title: French Onion Soup

author: Nigella Lawson
directions: [u'Beat the eggs with the milk and vanilla in a wide shallow bowl.', u'Soak the bread halves in the eggy mixture for 5 minutes a side.', u'Heat the butter and oil in a frying pan/skillet, fry the egg-soaked bread until golden and scorched in parts on both sides.', u'Put the sugar onto a plate and then dredge the cooked bread until coated like a sugared doughnut.']
ingredients: [u'2 eggs', u'1/2 cup full fat milk', u'4 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'4 slices from a small white loaf or 2 slices from a large white loaf, each large slice cut in half', u'1 -ounce butter, plus a drop flavourless oil, for frying', u'1/4 cup sugar']
title: Doughnut French Toast

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Put 2 tablespoons of the butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil into a large skillet and place it over high heat for 2 minutes. Season the chicken breasts with a sprinkling of salt and pepper and place 4 of the breasts in the pan skin side down. Sear for 1 minute or until the skin is crispy and a golden brown. Turn the breasts and sear 1 more minute. Remove to a baking dish and repeat the process with the rest of the butter, oil and breasts. Place the baking dish into the oven for 10 to 15 minutes.', u'Add orange juice, chicken broth, and tarragon to the hot skillet. Cook until reduced by about 3/4 (sauce should coat the back of a spoon). Right before serving, whisk in the butter. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.', u'Serve the chicken with the sauce spooned over the top.']
ingredients: [u'8 chicken breasts, skin on and wing bone attached', u'4 tablespoons butter', u'4 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 cup orange juice', u'2 cups chicken broth', u'2 sprigs tarragon', u'4 TBS unsalted butter, cut into bits']
title: French Chicken Breast with Orange Tarragon Sauce

directions: [u'Heat milk in a medium saucepan until warmed through- but do not boil. While the milk is being heated grind the coffee beans in the coffee grinder. Add the freshly ground coffee to your French press.  Add 3 1/2 cups of hot boiling water then add the lid/filter assembly. Let it steep for 3 to 4 minutes then slowly press the plunger down in a steady, even manner.', u"While the coffee is steeping, remove milk from heat and set on a kitchen towel on your counter top so it's on a slight angle. Set an immersion blender in the shallow end of the pot and froth the milk on high speed until the foam holds, about 2 to 3 minutes blending on high.  Divide the coffee out amongst the cups and spoon the frothed milk on top of each.  Serve immediately."]
ingredients: [u'1 cup whole milk', u'1 cup of your favorite, good quality, coffee beans (use 1 rounded tablespoon ground coffee per cup of coffee)', u' Special equipment: immersion blender']
title: French Press Vanilla Cappuccino

author: Ina Garten
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Blanch the string beans in a large pot of boiling salted water for just 4 minutes. Drain immediately and immerse in a large bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. When they are cool, drain and set aside.', u'Meanwhile, in a large bowl toss the onion and bell peppers together with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast for about 15 minutes, tossing with a spatula from time to time to be sure the vegetables roast evenly.', u'Just before serving, reheat the string beans in a large saute pan drizzled with a little olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and arrange on a platter. Spoon the roasted vegetables over the string beans and serve hot or at room temperature.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound French string beans, both ends removed', u' Kosher salt', u'1 red onion, large-diced', u'1/2 red pepper, large-diced', u'1/2 yellow pepper, large-diced', u' Good olive oil', u' Freshly ground black pepper']
title: French String Beans

categories: [u'Beans And Legumes', u'Side Dish', u'Baked Beans']
directions: [u'Pour the beans onto a plate, and pick-over looking for bad beans, or stones. Place beans in bowl, cover with water by at least 2 inches, and soak overnight. ', u'Preheat oven to 250 degrees F. ', u'Drain beans and place in 4-quart bean pot. Add onion, dry mustard, pepper, salt, and maple syrup. Add water to cover. Cut salt pork into 1-inch pieces and place on top of beans. Bake covered, approximately 8 hours. Check each hour to see if water needs to be added. You can add more maple syrup in place of water for flavor, if desired.', u'Serve the beans with brown bread, franks, or ham. For breakfast, serve with eggs, bacon, and home-fries. ', u'Note: If all the water evaporates, you end up with bean bullets.', u"The recipes for this program, which were provided by contributors and guests who may not be professional chefs, have not been tested in the Food Network's kitchens. Therefore, the Food Network cannot attest to the accuracy of any of the recipes."]
ingredients: [u'1 pound small white pea beans', u'1 onion, coarsely chopped', u'1 teaspoon dry mustard', u'2 teaspoons ground black pepper', u'1 to 2 cup pure maple syrup, plus more if desired', u'1/3 pound salt pork', u' Salt']
title: French Canadian (Not Boston) Baked Beans

directions: [u'Prepare coals on a grill and let heat reduce to a moderate heat. ', u'In a blender, combine eggs, cream, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Blend until the ingredients are smooth. Set aside.', u'Slice peaches in half and remove the pit. Brush the flesh side of each half with melted butter. Place the peaches on the grill for 5 minutes, or until the flesh side is evenly caramelized and begins to soften. Remove the peaches from the grill and dice them. Transfer to a bowl and add lemon juice and sugar, to taste. Set the peach mixture aside.', u'Pour the egg batter into a pie plate. Dip the croissant halves into the batter, making sure that each side is coated. Place the croissants on the grill, flat side down. Grill for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the batter appears cooked and the croissant begins to darken; watch carefully, as they will cook quickly. Flip the croissants and grill on the other side for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove the croissants from the grill.', u'Place the bottom half of 1 croissant on a plate. Add 1/4 of the peach mixture and place the top half of the croissant over the peaches. Pour Bourbon Pecan Maple Syrup over the top and garnish with fresh mint. Repeat with remaining croissants.']
ingredients: [u'4 eggs', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'2 peaches', u'2 tablespoons butter, melted', u'1 lemon, juiced', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 croissants, sliced in 1/2 lengthwise', u' Bourbon Pecan Maple Syrup, recipe follows', u' Fresh mint sprigs, for garnish', u'1/4 cup butter', u'1/2 cup bourbon', u'1 cup maple syrup', u'1/2 cup chopped pecans']
title: Croissant French Toast Stuffed With Grilled Peaches

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spread the french fries on a baking sheet and bake until golden and warmed through, about 10 minutes.', u'Put the garlic, almonds and olive oil in a food processor and pulse until finely ground. Add the french fries, lemon juice, 1 1/4 cups water and 1/2 teaspoon salt and pulse until almost smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Serve with pita chips and/or vegetables.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'4 cups frozen curly french fries (about 12 ounces)', u'6 to 8 cloves garlic, chopped', u'1/4 cup blanched almonds', u'3/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u' Pita chips and/or vegetable sticks, for dipping']
title: French Fry Skordalia

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u'Spread 4 bread slices with 1 tablespoon cream cheese each; spread the other 4 slices with 1 teaspoon marmalade each. Combine to make 4 sandwiches.', u'Whisk the whole eggs, egg whites, orange zest and juice, and vanilla in a shallow bowl. Place the bran flakes in a resealable plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin or your hands. Pour the crumbs onto a plate. Dip both sides of each sandwich in the egg mixture, then in the crumbs, gently pressing the crumbs onto the bread.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon each oil and butter in a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Add the sandwiches in batches and cook until the outsides are golden and the insides are melted, 3 to 4 minutes per side. (Add more oil and butter, if needed.)', u"Slice the French toast sandwiches into triangles. Let cool before serving to little ones, as the cream cheese can get quite hot. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar, if desired, and the kids won't even ask for syrup!", u'Photograph by Ngoc Minh Ngo']
ingredients: [u'8 slices whole-grain bread', u'4 tablespoons light cream cheese', u'4 teaspoons low-sugar orange marmalade', u'2 large eggs plus 2 egg whites', u' Zest and juice of 1 orange', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 1/2 cups bran flakes cereal', u'1 to 2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 to 2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u"2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar (optional)"]
title: Crunchy Bran French Toast

directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a large skillet, saute the onions, sugar, and 1 teaspoon of the salt in the clarified butter over medium-high heat; stir constantly to prevent burning. Cook until golden brown. Add sherry and stir to lift any caramelized onion on the bottom of the pan. Remove from the heat and set aside.', u'Spread out the bread pieces evenly on a baking sheet. Place in the oven for about 5 to 8 minutes to dry the bread slightly but not to add color. Set aside to cool.', u'Whisk together the eggs, cream, mustard, thyme, the remaining salt, and pepper. Soak the bread in the egg mixture for 5 minutes.', u'In a casserole dish, layer the bread with the onions and cheese. Pour the remaining egg mixture over the top.', u'Bake for 35 minutes or until the egg mixture is set.', u"*Cook's Note: Clarified butter is unsalted butter that has been slowly melted, separating the milk solids from the liquids. After removing any foam off the top, the golden butter is poured or skimmed off the milky residue. Clarified butter is used to cook at higher temperatures because it has a higher smoke point."]
ingredients: [u'1 1/2 pounds onions (2 to 3 medium onions), thinly sliced', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'3 teaspoons kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons clarified butter*', u'1 tablespoon sweet sherry', u'1 large Italian or French bread loaf, crusts removed, cut into 5 by 1-inch pieces', u'6 eggs', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon grainy mustard', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped thyme', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 cups grated Gruyere cheese']
title: French Onion Bread Pudding

directions: [u'For the roasted grapes: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. In a bowl, combine the sliced grapes, grapeseed oil, rosemary and salt. Mix to coat the grapes evenly. Scatter the grapes on a sheet pan or in a large skillet and roast in the oven, 15 to 20 minutes. They should not be shriveled up, just plump and juicy.', u'For the syrup: In the meantime, in a stainless steel saucepan, add the wine and rosemary sprig. Simmer on medium-low heat until reduced by half, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the rosemary, add the syrup, turn off the heat and let rest. (This can be done ahead of time)', u'For the egg wash: In a bowl or casserole dish large enough to fit the bread flatly on the surface, beat the eggs, milk, sugar, cinnamon and vanilla. Beat until all the ingredients are well combined.', u'For the French toast: Heat a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet to medium-high. Dip the bread in egg wash on both sides, allowing the egg wash to soak in but not over saturate the bread. Add the butter to the skillet and let melt. Place the bread in the skillet and let brown, about 3 minutes. Flip the bread over and place some brie on the cooked side of 1 slice of bread. Allow the cheese to soften while the second side cooks to golden brown. Turn off the heat and sandwich the 2 slices together. Cut the bread on a diagonal and plate. Top with roasted grapes and drizzle with pinot noir syrup.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup seedless red table grapes, sliced in half', u' Scant 1/2 teaspoon grapeseed oil', u'1/4 teaspoon ground rosemary', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'1 cup pinot noir', u'1 fresh rosemary sprig', u'1/3 cup maple syrup', u'3 organic eggs', u'1/4 cup whole milk', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u' Two 1-inch-thick slices challah bread', u'2 tablespoons butter', u' French brie, sliced from wheel']
title: Wine Country French Toast

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.', u'Split bread lengthwise and hollow it out. Cut in half across, making 4 shells for pizzas.', u'Heat a skillet over medium high flame and brown sausage in extra-virgin olive oil. Brown and crumble sausage. Add red bell pepper, onion and garlic. Cook 3 to 5 minutes, add spinach. Remove mixture from heat and season with a pinch of salt and black pepper, to your taste.', u'Transfer to a bowl. Combine sausage and veggies with ricotta, Parmesan, sopressata and pepperoni. Fill bread shells and top with mounded mozzarella and provolone cheeses. Place in hot oven on cookie sheet and bake until cheese melts and bubbles and bread is super crisp, about 10 to 12 minutes.  Top pizzas with oregano and hot pepper flakes. Serve immediately, or snack all night!']
ingredients: [u'1 (2 foot long) loaf French bread', u'1 pound sweet Italian sausage', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small red bell pepper, seeded and chopped', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'2 large cloves garlic, chopped', u'1 package frozen chopped spinach defrosted and squeezed dry', u' Salt and pepper', u'1 1/2 cups part skim ricotta', u'1/2 cup grated Parmesan', u'1/2 pound sweet sopressata, from the deli, sliced thick, chopped', u'1/2 stick pepperoni, chopped', u'1 sack (10 ounces) shredded mozzarella', u'1 sack (10 ounces) shredded provolone', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes']
title: Super Stuffed French Bread Pizza Rustica

author: Sandra Lee
directions: [u'Nonstick cooking spray', u'For Syrup:', u'In a small saucepan, combine butter, pumpkin pie spice, molasses, brown sugar and 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil, add bananas then lower heat and let simmer for 3 minutes. Remove syrup from heat, cover and keep warm. Serve over French toast. ', u"Cook's Note: Also makes a great topping for ice cream.", u'For French toast:', u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Slice bread into 12 slices. Reserve 2 slices plus the ends for the bread pudding Round 2 Recipe. Place remaining 8 slices on a baking sheet. Toast in oven for 3 minutes. Remove and lower oven temperature to 250 degrees F.', u'In a large bowl whisk together the milk, eggs, flour, vanilla, brown sugar and salt. ', u'Spray a 12-inch skillet with nonstick cooking spray and place over medium heat. Working in batches of 4, dip the bread into the batter and soak both sides. Remove allowing excess to drip back into the bowl and place in the hot skillet. Cook until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer the toast to a baking sheet fitted with a wire rack and keep warm in a 250 degree F oven. Repeat with remaining slices of bread. Save remaining batter and extra syrup for bread pudding Round 2 Recipe.', u'Serve hot with Brown Sugar Banana Syrup.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons butter', u'1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice', u'2 tablespoons molasses', u'1/2 cup brown sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'2 bananas, cut into 1/2-inch slices', u'1 loaf challah', u'2 cups milk', u'3 large eggs', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 tablespoons light brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt']
title: French Toast with Brown Sugar Banana Syrup

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat an oven to 200 degrees F, and place a rack on a sheet pan.', u'Whisk the milk and eggs in a glass pie or casserole dish until evenly combined.', u'Whisk the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add about 1/2 a tablespoon of butter to the skillet, swirling the pan to coat the surface. Dip 2 slices of bread into the egg mixture and immediately lay in the skillet. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar on top and cook until the undersides are brown and crisp, about 4 minutes. Add a nut-sized bit of butter to the skillet, as needed, and flip the toast, cook until golden on the underside, about 3 minutes more.', u'Serve immediately or transfer to the rack in the oven to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining bread and batter.  Serve with jam or maple syrup.', u'Copyright (c) 2005 Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved.']
ingredients: [u'1 cup milk', u'3 large eggs, beaten', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'8 thick slices white bread (about 3/4 of a white sandwich or Pullman loaf, cut into 3/4-inch-thick slices)', u' Suggested servings: Jam or hot pure maple syrup']
title: Cinnamon Sugar French-Style Texas Toast

author: Anne Burrell
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Put the eggplant, zucchini, squash, and tomatoes in 1 layer on a baking sheet or baking sheets, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle generously with salt. Roast until the vegetables are soft and pliable, about 20 to 30 minutes, turning them halfway through the cooking. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. When cool enough to handle transfer them to a cutting board and cut them into 1/2-inch pieces.', u'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and coat the bottom with olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the onion, crushed red pepper and season with salt, to taste. Saute until the onions are soft, about 5 minutes. Add the peppers and season again with salt, if needed. Cook until the peppers are soft, about 5 to 10 minutes.', u'Add the roasted vegetables to the pan along with the vinegar, marjoram, and thyme. Toss well to coat and add 2 to 3 more tablespoons olive oil, if needed. Taste to check the seasoning and transfer to a serving platter or bowl. Voila!']
ingredients: [u'1 eggplant, cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices', u'1 large zucchini, cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices', u'1 summer squash, cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices', u'3 beefsteak tomatoes, cut into 1/2-inch slices', u' Extra-virgin olive oil', u' Kosher salt', u'1 large red onion, cut into 1/2-inch dice', u' Pinch crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 red bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'1 yellow bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh marjoram leaves', u'1/2 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme leaves']
title: Roasted Veggie Ratatouille (France)

author: Valerie Bertinelli
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Place the rolls in the oven to crisp, about 5 minutes.', u'Stir the mayonnaise, cornichons, Dijon and tarragon together in a small bowl. Lay out the bread, cut-side up, and spread with the mayonnaise mixture.', u'Make sandwiches with the beef, lettuce and tomato.']
ingredients: [u' Two 12-inch French bread rolls, halved and split', u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup cornichons, finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon whole-grain Dijon mustard', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh tarragon', u'3 cups Beef Bourguignon, roughly chopped, recipe follows', u'4 leaves romaine lettuce', u'2 medium tomatoes, sliced', u'2 bay leaves', u'4 sprigs fresh thyme', u'3 sprigs fresh parsley, plus extra leaves for garnish', u'1 sprig fresh rosemary', u'4 slices bacon, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 pounds stew beef', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, plus additional as needed', u'10 ounces cremini mushrooms, halved or quartered if large', u'1 onion, halved and thinly sliced', u'4 cloves garlic, roughly chopped', u'4 carrots, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'2 cups dry red wine', u' One 14.5-ounce can reduced-sodium beef broth', u' One 16-ounce bag frozen pearl onions, thawed']
title: French Beef Sandwich

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'For the green salad: Mix the celery, cucumber, goat cheese, lettuces and tomatoes in a large bowl.', u'For the French dressing: Combine the ketchup, vinegar, sour cream, mustard, Worcestershire, paprika, cayenne and lemon juice in a small bowl. Add the oil slowly while whisking constantly. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Toss the salad with the French dressing and serve.']
ingredients: [u'2 stalks celery, sliced', u'1 European-style cucumber, sliced into half moons', u' One 4-ounce log goat cheese, crumbled', u'1 head butter lettuce, torn', u'1 head romaine lettuce, chopped', u'1 pint cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon low-fat sour cream', u'1 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u' Juice of 1/2 lemon', u'1/4 cup canola oil', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Green Salad with Homemade French Dressing

author: Aaron McCargo Jr.
directions: [u'Preheat indoor grill or griddle.', u'In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, vanilla, cinnamon, pinch of salt and sugar until well combined.', u'Lay 6 slices of bread out and lightly brush egg mixture around edges. Press a "pocket" in the middle of each slice of bread for the filling. Heap 2 teaspoons of apple or cherry pie filling in the middle of each bread pocket.', u'Take remaining 6 slices and brush the edges with egg mixture. Place on top of bread with filling and seal edges with fingers.', u'Dip stuffed bread in the egg mixture and place on sprayed griddle; cook for 6 to 8 minutes, turning once, until lightly browned. Sprinkle with cinnamon and/or powdered sugar.']
ingredients: [u'6 jumbo eggs, beaten', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons vanilla extract', u'2 tablespoons ground cinnamon, plus more for topping', u' Salt', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'12 slices brioche bread, about 1/2-inch thick', u'6 ounces apple pie filling', u'6 ounces cherry pie filling', u' Cooking spray', u' Powdered sugar, for topping']
title: Super-Stuffed French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Bake the fries as the label directs. Meanwhile, toss the steak with 1 tablespoon soy sauce, the grated garlic and a pinch each of salt and pepper in a bowl; set aside 10 minutes.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steak in a single layer and cook, stirring once or twice, until browned but not cooked through, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate using a slotted spoon.', u'Add the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to the skillet. Add the red onion and jalapeno and cook, stirring, until slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and the sliced garlic; cook until the tomatoes start breaking down, about 3 minutes. Return the steak and any collected juices to the skillet along with the remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce and the vinegar. Remove from the heat; add the fries, parsley and cilantro and toss. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Photograph by Justin Walker']
ingredients: [u'1 pound frozen french fries (about 5 cups)', u'1 1 -pound boneless rib-eye steak, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 cloves garlic (1 grated, 2 sliced)', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 large red onion, thinly sliced', u'1/2 jalapeno pepper, chopped (remove seeds for less heat)', u'8 Campari or other small vine-ripened tomatoes (about 10 ounces), quartered', u'1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
title: Beef Stir-Fry with French Fries

author: Dave Lieberman
directions: [u'Beat the eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon together in a mixing bowl until well blended. Pour the egg mixture into a baking pan large enough to give you room to turn and soak the bread. (A 13 by 9-inch pan works well.)', u"Lay the bread slices in the egg mixture and let them soak, turning them several times, until the bread has soaked up all the egg. Turn them gently so they don't break apart on you. ", u'Heat the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. When it starts to bubble, lay the soaked bread in the pan. Cook, turning once, until the bread is nicely browned and the egg in the center of each slice is cooked through, about 12 minutes. Serve warm with the Orange-Rum Bananas.', u'Note: If your skillet isn\'t large enough to hold all the bread slices at once, cook them in batches. Before you start your first batch, preheat your oven to 200 degrees F (or "Warm"). Keep the cooked slices warm on a baking sheet in the oven while you cook the rest.']
