ingredients: [u'4 large eggs', u'1/2 cup milk', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'2 pinches ground cinnamon', u'4 (1/2 to 3/4-inch-thick) slices brioche, challah, cinnamon raisin bread or any moist and fluffy bread you like', u'2 tablespoons butter', u' Orange-Rum Bananas, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons rum', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons butter', u'2 tablespoons orange juice', u'2 large bananas sliced thinly on an angle']
title: French Toast with Rum Bananas

directions: [u'In a small bowl, combine ricotta cheese, chocolate chips, and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, and sweetener, and mix well.', u'Split hot dog bun open lengthwise, without fully separating the 2 halves. Spoon ricotta mixture onto the bottom half of the bun. Gently press the top 1/2 down over the filling. Carefully slice into 4 "nuggets."', u'Mix egg substitute, cinnamon, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract in a small bowl. Set aside.', u"Bring a skillet sprayed with nonstick spray to medium-high heat. Add butter and allow to coat the bottom of the skillet. Meanwhile, coat each nugget on all sides with the egg mixture. (You won't need to use all of the egg mixture.)", u'Once butter has melted, place nuggets in the skillet and, flipping occasionally, cook until golden brown on all sides, 3 to 4 minutes.', u'Plate your nuggets and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Top with syrup, if using. Enjoy!', u'PER SERVING (entire recipe): 228 calories, 6.5g fat, 395mg sodium, 31g carbs, 3g fiber, 10.5g sugars, 12.5g protein']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons fat-free ricotta cheese', u'2 teaspoons mini semi-sweet chocolate chips', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 no-calorie sweetener packet', u'1 light hot dog bun (about 80 calories)', u'1/4 cup fat-free liquid egg substitute', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'2 teaspoons light whipped butter or light buttery spread', u'1/2 teaspoon powdered sugar', u' Sugar-free pancake syrup, for topping, optional']
title: Cannoli-Stuffed French Toast Nuggets

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Rinse cut potatoes in a large bowl with lots of cold running water until water becomes clear. Cover with water by 1-inch and cover with ice. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes and up to 2 days. ', u'In a 5-quart pot or Dutch oven fitted with a candy or deep-frying thermometer, (or in an electric deep-fryer), heat oil over medium-low heat until the thermometer registers 325 degrees F. Make sure that you have at least 3 inches of space between the top of the oil and the top of the pan, as fries will bubble up when they are added. ', u'Drain ice water from cut fries and wrap potato pieces in a clean dishcloth or tea towel and thoroughly pat dry. Increase the heat to medium-high and add fries, a handful at a time, to the hot oil. Fry, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are soft and limp and begin to turn a blond color, about 6 to 8 minutes. Using a skimmer or a slotted spoon, carefully remove fries from the oil and set aside to drain on paper towels. Let rest for at least 10 minutes or up to 2 hours. ', u'When ready to serve the French fries, reheat the oil to 350 degrees F. Transfer the blanched potatoes to the hot oil and fry again, stirring frequently, until golden brown and puffed, about 1 minute. Transfer to paper lined platter and sprinkle with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.']
ingredients: [u'4 large russet or Kennebec potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/4 by 1/4-inch thick batons', u'2 quarts peanut oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Perfect French Fries

directions: [u'Mix together all ingredients except bread slices. Dip bread in the egg mixture, coating both sides. Place on heated griddle and cook until golden. Turn and cook opposite side until golden. Serve immediately with your favorite topping.', u'Suggested toppings: Maple syrup and bananas, strawberry sauce or syrup and try Great Harvest low-fat granola sprinkled on top.']
ingredients: [u'6 eggs or 1 1/2 cups egg substitute', u'1 1/2 cups milk, can be skim or any other', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons orange juice', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u' Cinnamon, optional', u'10 to 12 thickly sliced bread, preferably from Great Harvest Bread']
title: French Toast

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Heat the oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the onions and thyme and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are very soft and browned, about 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, stir together the sour cream, mayonnaise and Worcestershire sauce; season with salt and pepper. Fold in the onion mixture until well combined. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour or up to overnight. Mixture can be stored in an airtight container for up to 3 days.', u'Arrange the bread in an even layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle each slice with about 1 tablespoon cheese. Bake until the bread is golden brown and crisp and the cheese is melted, 6 to 8 minutes. Serve dip with the cheese toasts and endive leaves.']
ingredients: [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 yellow onions, diced', u'2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves', u'1 1/4 cups sour cream', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 baguette, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices on the bias', u'4 ounces grated gruyere cheese or other Swiss cheese', u'2 heads endive, leaves separated, for serving', u' Copyright 2012 Television Food Network, G.P. All rights reserved.']
title: French Onion Dip with Gruyere Toasts

directions: [u'Pat dry the meat and season with salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat oil over moderately high heat until hot.  Add the meat, in batches, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until browned on both sides.  Transfer meat as it is cooked to a heatproof platter.  Keep warm in a slow oven. Pour off fat from skillet.  Add butter and melt over moderate heat.  Add shallots, garlic and thyme to the skillet and cook, stirring, for 2 to 3 minutes, or until vegetables are softened.  Add the wine and reduce by half.  Add the stock and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove meat from oven and pour platter juices into simmering jus. Have rolls split and arranged on a platter. Drizzle some of jus over cut sides of rolls. Divide meat among 4 bottom halves and top with remaining bread.  Transfer sandwiches to serving plates.', u'Transfer jus to individual dipping bowls and serve sandwiches with jus.']
ingredients: [u'11/2 pounds sirloin, sliced across the grain on the diagonal bias until very thin', u' Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste', u'2 tablespoons olive oil, plus additional for sauteing', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/3 cup minced shallots', u'2 cloves garlic, minced fine', u'1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups beef stock or canned beef broth', u'4 French rolls, split and lightly toasted']
title: French Dip Sandwich

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Remove the stems from 24 large cremini mushrooms.', u'Wipe the caps clean with a damp paper towel, then toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil and season with salt. Arrange on a baking sheet.', u'Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 thinly sliced onions and 2 teaspoons chopped thyme; season with salt and pepper and cook, stirring, until the onions are caramelized, about 20 minutes. Add 1/4 cup red wine; cook until evaporated, 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup beef broth; simmer until the onions are glazed, 3 minutes. Sprinkle breadcrumbs inside the mushroom caps; fill with the onion mixture, then sprinkle with 1 cup shredded gruyere and 2 tablespoons grated parmesan.', u'Bake until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is golden, 15 to 17 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes, then remove from the baking sheet. Top with parsley.', u'Photograph by Ryan Dausch']
title: French Onion Soup Stuffed Mushrooms

author: Aarti Sequeira
directions: [u'Make the French toast: Whisk the egg yolks, milk, vanilla, orange juice and zest, brown sugar, cinnamon, garam masala and a pinch of salt in a large glass baking dish.', u'Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Put a wire rack on a baking sheet and place in the oven.', u'Set a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon butter. While the butter melts, prick a few holes on each side of a slice of bread with a fork. Lay it in the egg mixture and, using either a fork or your hands, push the bread into the egg mixture so the bread loosens up a little and soaks up the liquid. Flip and repeat.', u'Using a slotted spatula or tongs, pick up the bread, allowing the excess egg mixture to drip off, and lay it in the hot pan. As the first side is cooking, 2 to 3 minutes, push chocolate chips and chopped dates into the soft, uncooked side of the bread. Be assertive! Then flip and cook 2 to 3 more minutes. Remove and set on the rack in the oven to stay warm. Repeat with the remaining slices of bread, adding more butter to the pan if needed.', u'Meanwhile, make the syrup: Combine the maple syrup and bourbon. Warm it in the microwave, if you want. (You can make the syrup the night before; store in a jar in the fridge, then warm before serving.)', u'Photograph by Kat Teutsch']
ingredients: [u'6 large egg yolks (save the whites for your ultra-healthy breakfast tomorrow!)', u'1 1/2 cups whole milk', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 cup fresh orange juice', u'1 teaspoon grated orange zest', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon garam masala', u' Kosher salt', u' Unsalted butter, for frying', u'1 small loaf challah bread, sliced 1 inch thick', u' Small handful of semisweet chocolate chips', u'4 dates, pitted and chopped', u'1/2 cup pure maple syrup', u'1 teaspoon bourbon']
title: Chocolate Chip-Date French Toast

directions: [u'In a pot with a steamer insert, steam the potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes. (The potatoes can also be cooked in boiling salted water for the same amount of time.) Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature.', u'In a pot of boiling water, blanch the leeks for 30 seconds, or until tender. Rinse in cold water and drain. Set aside.', u'Cut the roasted peppers in 1/2 crosswise and then cut them into 1/2-inch slices.', u'Cut each potato into 8 pieces. In a medium bowl, mix the potatoes, leeks, peppers, thyme, and tarragon. In a separate bowl, stir together the Champagne vinaigrette with the mustard. Drizzle the vinaigrette on the potato salad and toss gently until the vinaigrette coats the salad evenly. Season with the salt and pepper and toss again.']
ingredients: [u'3 pounds small creamer potatoes (about 30), unpeeled and scrubbed well', u'4 pieces leek (white part only), split lengthwise and thinly sliced', u'2 roasted red peppers, jarred or homemade', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme leaves', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh tarragon leaves', u'2/3 cup Champagne Vinaigrette, recipe follows', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'2 teaspoons sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
title: French Country Potato Salad

author: Patrick and Gina Neely
directions: [u'Remove the outside leaves from the lettuce and cut in half. Remove the core and slice the halves in half again, making 4 wedges and wash thoroughly. Drizzle with Creamy French Dressing and sprinkle the tomato halves and bacon over the salad.', u'']
ingredients: [u'1 head iceberg lettuce', u'1 cup halved cherry tomatoes', u'4 slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled', u' Creamy French Dressing, recipe follows', u'1/4 cup white wine vinegar', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'1 tablespoon sour cream', u'1 teaspoon dry mustard', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Wedge Salad with Homemade French Dressing

directions: [u'For the fruit-nut mixture: Mix the butter with the apples, pears, walnuts and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Refrigerate to chill briefly.', u'For the French toast: Meanwhile, in a large flat dish, whisk together the eggs, milk, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and vanilla.', u'Make a deep slice from the side into the center of each bread slice to form a pocket. Stuff a couple spoonfuls of the fruit-nut mixture into each piece (reserve any leftover fruit-nut mixture for serving). Dip the stuffed bread in the egg mixture to moisten on both sides (but not so much that the bread falls apart).', u'Heat a large skillet over medium heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter. In batches, add the stuffed bread and cook until golden brown, flipping gently, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Continue cooking the remaining bread, adding additional butter as needed.', u'Put the extra fruit-nut mixture in the skillet and cook a few minutes over medium heat, just to soften the fruit. Spoon over the French toast and serve with warm maple syrup.']
ingredients: [u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 Gala apples, peeled, cored and chopped', u'1 pear, peeled, cored and chopped', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped walnuts', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 dozen large eggs, lightly beaten', u'2 cups whole milk', u'6 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'2 teaspoons grated nutmeg', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract', u'1 day-old (or slightly older) loaf challah bread, cut into 1-inch-thick slices', u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, for cooking', u' Pure maple syrup, warmed, for serving']
title: Apple, Pear and Walnut Stuffed French Toast

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.', u'In a flat dish, crack eggs and add milk, vanilla extract and cinnamon. Whisk until well combined then lay challah slices in mixture to coat and absorb it all, turning occasionally.', u'Set a 10-inch skillet, seasoned cast iron if you have, over medium heat. Add the butter and 1 cup sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until the sugar has melted and caramelized, about 8 minutes. While the sugar is melting, peel apples, core and cut into halves. Remove from heat and gently whisk in the heavy cream.  Sprinkle in the pecans, dried cranberries and gently press in the apple halves so there is a flat surface. Lay soaked slices of challah over the top so it is completely covered - you should be able to arrange the large slices and small slices so there are no gaps. Sprinkle the top with some brown sugar and place into the preheated oven.  Bake in the middle of the oven for 40 to 45 minutes until the top is golden and puffy.', u"When done, allow to cool for 2 to 3 minutes then invert onto a large plate. Dust with confectioners' sugar, if desired, and serve.", u"Chef's Note: FYI - if your cast iron skillet is not seasoned, the cranberries will react with the skillet and turn black."]
ingredients: [u'4 eggs', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 loaf challah bread, cut into 1 inch-thick slices', u'1/2 stick unsalted butter, cut into small cubes', u'1 cup light brown sugar, plus more for sprinkling, divided', u'4 Granny Smith apples', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup pecans', u'1/2 cup dried cranberries', u" Confectioners' sugar, garnish, optional"]
title: Upside-Down Apple French Toast with Cranberries and Pecans

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook until crisp, about 4 minutes per side; transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Cool slightly, then break the bacon into pieces.', u'Make the dressing: Whisk the mustard, pickle, pickle juice, ketchup, mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar and 2 tablespoons water in a large bowl. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste.', u'Add the french fries, bacon, tomatoes, red onion, romaine and cheddar cheese to the bowl with the dressing and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the salad among bowls. Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired.', u'Photograph by Charles Masters']
ingredients: [u'3 cups frozen curly french fries (about 9 ounces)', u'4 strips bacon', u'1 tablespoon yellow mustard', u'3 tablespoons chopped dill pickle, plus a splash of pickle juice from the jar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons ketchup', u'3 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'1 1/2 tablespoons malt vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u' Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper', u'1 cup grape tomatoes, halved', u'1/4 cup thinly sliced red onion', u'2 romaine hearts, torn', u'1/4 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese', u' Toasted sesame seeds, for topping (optional)', u' Bake the french fries as the label directs until crisp. Let cool.']
title: French Fry Deluxe Salad

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'In a Dutch oven or large, heavy pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add half of the onions and cook, stirring, until dark golden brown and caramelized, about 15 minutes. Add the remaining onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until a deep caramel color, about 1 hour. Add the bourbon and cook, stirring occasionally, until evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients except the cheese, and stir well. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thick and fragrant, about 1 hour. Remove from the heat and cover to keep warm.', u'To serve, sprinkle each portion with grated Swiss cheese.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon olive or vegetable oil', u'3 pounds yellow onions, peeled and julienned', u'1/3 cup bourbon whiskey', u'2 quarts beef stock', u'1 quart chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper', u'1 teaspoon hot red pepper sauce', u'1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u'1 cup freshly grated Swiss cheese']
title: French Onion Soup with Shaved Swiss Cheese

author: Emeril Lagasse
directions: [u'Preheat oven to broil. Slice baguette into twelve slices. Brush each side with olive oil. Broil croutons for one minute on each side until golden brown. Remove from oven and rub one side with garlic clove. Set aside.', u'Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees.', u'Place onion, peppers, garlic, corn, tomato, and potatoes on baking sheet. Toss with olive oil, salt and pepper. Roast for 40 to 45 minutes or until fork tender. Skin on peppers and tomatoes should be broken and slight charred. Cool. Peel peppers, tomatoes. Squeeze softened garlic from skin.  Remove corn kernels from cob. ', u'Chop vegetables into large chunks and place in large heavy bottom pot. Add enough chicken stock to almost cover vegetables. Add adobo sauce. Simmer until heated through. Strain vegetables from stock. ', u'Heat oven temperature to 450 degrees. ', u'Divide vegetables among crocks. Top with two croutons. Add enough broth to come to the top of crock. Cover top of crock with grated cheese. ', u'Place crocks on baking sheet and bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until cheese is browned and bubbling.']
ingredients: [u'1 baguette French bread', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'1 clove garlic', u'1 large yellow onion, peeled and quartered', u'1 large sweet red pepper', u'1 large green bell pepper', u'1 head garlic, halved though center', u'3 ears corn', u'1 large tomato', u'2 Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and halved', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u' Salt and pepper', u'3 cups chicken stock', u'1 tablespoon adobo sauce, from canned chipotle in adobo sauce', u'1/2 pound Gruyere cheese, coarsely grated']
title: Karen's French Harvest Soup

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter an 8 1/2- by 4 1/4- by 2 1/2-inch light-colored loaf pan.', u'Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt into a medium bowl. Combine the melted butter, sugar, yogurt, oil, zest, vanilla and eggs in a large bowl and whisk until well blended. Gradually whisk in the dry ingredients. Transfer the batter to the prepared pan.', u'Place the pan on baking sheet on the middle rack and bake until the cake begins to pull away from the sides and a tester inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached, about 50 minutes. Cool the cake in the pan on a rack for 5 minutes before unmolding. Cut around the sides of the pan to loosen the cake, and then turn the cake out onto the rack. Turn the cake upright on the rack and cool completely.', u'Stir together the marmalade and liqueur in a small saucepan over medium heat until the marmalade melts. Brush the hot mixture over the top of the cake. Let the glaze cool and set. Cut the cake crosswise into slices.']
ingredients: [u'1/4 cup melted unsalted butter, cooled slightly, plus more for greasing pan', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 cup plain Greek whole-milk yogurt', u'1/4 cup canola oil', u'2 teaspoons finely grated orange zest', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3 large eggs', u'1/4 cup orange marmalade', u'1 tablespoon orange liqueur, such as Grand Marnier']
title: Orange French Yogurt Cake with Marmalade Glaze

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Heat the cream in a small saucepan over low heat.', u'Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over high heat and cook, without stirring, until amber brown, about 8 minutes. Slowly whisk in the warm cream, blackberry puree and liqueur and cook until smooth and slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.  Remove from the heat and whisk in the vanilla extract.  Let come to room temperature.', u'French Toast:', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.  Put a baking sheet in the oven.', u'Whisk together the eggs, sugar and salt in a large baking dish until smooth.  Add the pumpkin puree, ground spices, milk, 1/4 cup of the heavy cream, vanilla and rum and whisk until smooth.', u'Put 4 slices of the bread in the custard mixture and let sit for 2 minutes.  Carefully turn over the slices and let sit until the bread is completely soaked through, about 2 more minutes.', u'While the bread is soaking, heat 3 tablespoons of the butter and 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large pan over medium-high heat until the mixture begins to sizzle. Cook the 4 slices of the bread until golden brown on the bottom, about 2 to 3 minutes. Flip over and continue cooking until the bottom is golden brown, about 2 minutes longer.  Remove to the baking sheet in the oven to keep warm.  Wipe out the pan with paper towels and repeat the process with the butter, oil and remaining 4 pieces of bread.', u'Combine the mascarpone and remaining 1/4 cup of heavy cream in a bowl and using a stand mixer or hand-held mixer, beat until fluffy and smooth.  Scrape the mixture into a bowl and fold in a few tablespoons of the blackberry-caramel sauce.   Put the sauce into a small saucepan over low heat and heat or put it in the microwave for a minute or so to just warm through.', u"Remove the French toast from the oven and arrange them on a serving platter. Top 4 slices of the toast with a large dollop of the blackberry-caramel mascarpone and some of the blackberries. Cover with the remaining 4 pieces of toast and drizzle each with some of the warm blackberry caramel sauce. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar, garnish with fresh mint sprig and serve."]
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/2 cup blackberry puree', u'2 teaspoons blackberry liqueur', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'4 large eggs', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon fine salt', u'1/2 cup pumpkin puree', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 3/4 cups whole milk, plus more if needed', u'1/2 cup heavy cream, divided', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1 tablespoon dark rum', u'8 slices day old challah, sliced 1/2-inch thick', u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 1/2 cups mascarpone, at room temperature', u'1 pint blackberries, halved lengthwise', u" Confectioners' sugar", u' Fresh mint sprigs, for garnish']
title: Pumpkin French Toast Stuffed with Blackberry-Caramel Mascarpone

author: Food Network Kitchen
directions: [u'Grease the bottom and sides of a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with butter. Slice the bread into 3/4-to-1-inch-thick slices. If your bread is very fresh, lightly toast the slices before assembling. Tile all the bread in the dish, each slice overlapping the next. Scatter the blueberries over the bread, letting some fall to the bottom of the dish.', u'Whisk the eggs, milk, 1/2 cup cream, 2/3 cup granulated sugar, almond extract and salt in a medium bowl until the sugar is dissolved. Pour over the bread and berries and press gently to help the bread start soaking in the egg mixture. Cut the 2 tablespoons butter into small pieces and dot over the top of the casserole. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand in the refrigerator 8 hours or overnight.', u"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Remove and discard the plastic wrap. Bake the casserole until golden brown and set in the center, 45 to 50 minutes, tenting with foil if the bread starts to become too dark. Let stand 10 minutes. Dust with confectioners' sugar if desired.", u'While the casserole bakes, toss the strawberries and raspberries with 1 tablespoon granulated sugar in a medium bowl and let stand until juicy.', u'Before serving, whip the remaining 3/4 cup cream with the remaining 1 tablespoon granulated sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form. Serve the casserole with a dollop of whipped cream and a generous spoonful of the berries with their juices.', u'Serves: 6 to 8']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus extra for buttering the dish', u' One 1-pound day-old loaf challah or white bread, unsliced', u' Two 6-ounce containers blueberries (about 2 1/4 cups)', u'6 large eggs', u'3 cups milk', u'1 1/4 cups heavy cream', u'2/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon pure almond extract', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u' One 16-ounce container strawberries, sliced', u' One 6-ounce container raspberries', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u" Confectioners' sugar, for dusting, optional"]
title: Blueberry French Toast Casserole with Whipped Cream and Strawberries

author: Paula Deen
directions: [u'To make the dip, whisk the mayonnaise and mustard together in a small bowl.', u'Heat the oil in deep-fryer or heavy-bottomed pot to 350 degrees F. ', u'Add the potato sticks into a bowl of water and allow it to sit for 4 hours. Remove them from the water to paper towels to drain. Fry in batches, letting them cook until a pale gold color develops, about 2 minutes. Drain the fries on a paper towel-lined plate. Cooks Note: Soaking the potatoes in water for 4 hours is just a suggestion. You can skip this pre-step and go straight to frying.', u'Raise the temperature of the oil to 375 degrees F and fry the potatoes in batches until they just start to become golden, about 2 minutes. Pull the potatoes out of the oil and let them stand for 1 minute. Drop the potatoes back into the oil and fry them until deep golden brown, about another 2 minutes. Drain the fries on a paper towel lined plate, and toss with salt and pepper, to taste. Transfer them to a serving bowl and serve hot with the mayonnaise dip.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'6 cups peanut oil or vegetable oil, for frying', u'2 pounds russet potatoes, skins scrubbed clean, cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch sticks', u' Salt and freshly ground black pepper']
title: Crispy French Fries with Mayonnaise Dip

directions: [u'In a medium bowl, using a hand beater, beat the 2 tablespoons of butter, and the cream cheese until combined. Add the marmalade and mix until incorporated, then fold in the strawberries and guava shells, using a rubber scraper. Transfer the mixture to a pastry bag fitted with a large tip.', u'Make an incision (pocket) on the crust side of the 4 pieces of bread about 3/4 of the way through. The incision will allow you to stuff the pocket. Leave the slices with the incision, covered, at room temperature before stuffing. Gently stuff the room temperature slices with the filling. Refrigerate the stuffed slices with the pocket opening facing up for 20 to 30 minutes.', u'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.', u'Egg batter:', u'Add all the ingredients to a medium shallow bowl and mix well.', u'French Toast:', u'Add the corn cereal and almonds to a sheet pan and crush together. Dip the bread slices in the egg batter and then into the cereal mixture.', u'Put a large skillet on medium-high heat and add 3 to 4 tablespoons butter. When the butter has melted add the stuffed bread slices and brown on 1 side, then flip and put the skillet in oven for 8 minutes. Remove the skillet from the oven and transfer the toast to a serving platter. Drizzle with guava marmalade and a dusting of powdered sugar before serving.', u'This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.']
ingredients: [u'2 tablespoons soft unsalted butter, plus additional for sauteing', u'4 ounces cream cheese, room temperature', u'1 1/2 tablespoons guava marmalade, plus additional for drizzling (recommended: LaFe)', u'5 ounces diced strawberries', u'3 ounces guava shells (recommended: LaFe)', u'4 thick slices Pullman-style bread, refrigerated', u' Powdered sugar, for dusting', u'6 extra-large eggs', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'4 ounces whole milk', u'4 ounces evaporated milk', u'10 ounces corn cereal (recommended: Cornflakes)', u'6 ounces sliced almonds']
title: La Isla's Stuffed French Toast

author: Melissa d'Arabian
directions: [u'In a small pot over low heat, add 1/4 cup of the cream, the milk, 3 tablespoons of the butter, the sugar, vanilla and salt and bring to a simmer. Put the chocolate into a medium bowl and pour in the cream mixture. Let sit until the chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Add the eggs and mix until well combined. ', u'Grease a 9- by 5-inch loaf pan with the remaining tablespoon of butter, and line it with the bread slices, overlapping slightly. Pour the chocolate mixture over the bread, making sure to cover the tips. Push the bread down with your fingers to coat the bread completely. Refrigerate, covered, for at least 2 hours and up to overnight. Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before baking. ', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. ', u'Bake until the custard sets and the bread turns golden at the edges, about 30 minutes. ', u'Add the remaining 1/4 cup cream to a chilled bowl and whisk until soft peaks form. Serve the French toast on individual plates with a dollop of cream.']
ingredients: [u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup milk', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u' Pinch kosher salt', u'1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips or chopped chocolate', u'2 large eggs', u'6 slices white bread, crusts removed and cut into triangles', u' Special equipment: 9 by 5-inch baking dish']
title: Chocolate French Toast (pain perdu)

author: Rachael Ray
directions: [u'Bring 1 inch of water to a boil in a high-sided saute pan. If using fresh beans, cut them lengthwise while you wait for the water to boil. ', u'Add salt and green beans to boiling water and cook until just tender. Drain beans and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Return the skillet to medium heat and add the butter. When butter is melted, add the almonds and cook until golden brown. ', u'Return the green beans to the pan, along with the juice of 1/2 a lemon, add salt and pepper, to taste. When warmed through, top with fried onions.']
ingredients: [u'1 pound fresh green beans or frozen French-cut green beans', u' Salt', u'1 to 2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/4 cup slivered almonds (2-ounce package)', u'1/2 lemon, juiced', u' Ground black pepper', u'1 can fried onions']
title: French Cut Green Beans with Almonds and Fried Onions

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'Remove crust from bread. Lay bread out on counter and spread a thin layer of peanut butter on each slice. Peel banana and slice enough to cover every other piece of bread. (You will be making 3 complete sandwiches). Drizzle a small amount of honey on each piece of bread that does not have banana on it. (These are the tops). Place honey drizzled piece of bread on top of a piece with bananas on it to make a sandwich. Repeat until you have made 3 sandwiches.', u'In a shallow medium sized bowl, gently whip, by hand, the eggs, cream, vanilla, rum, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. ', u'Heat skillet to medium heat, around 350 to375 degrees F, or until butter melts and begins to sizzle. Dip 1 sandwich at a time into rum batter and place into skillet. Cook until golden brown (about 3 to 4 minutes before turning) on each side. Remove from skillet and cut in 1/2 diagonally. Top with powdered sugar, butter and maple syrup.']
ingredients: [u'6 slices day-old white or wheat bread', u'1 to 2 ripe bananas', u'8 tablespoons creamy peanut butter', u' Honey, for drizzling', u'4 eggs', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon vanilla', u'1 tablespoon dark rum', u'1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon nutmeg', u' Dash salt', u' Butter or oil, for frying', u' Powdered sugar, for topping', u' Maple Syrup, for topping']
title: Peanut Butter and Banana Stuffed French Toast

author: Bobby Flay
directions: [u'For the whipped cream cheese: Put the cream cheese, vanilla and orange zest in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whip attachment and whip until light and fluffy.  Add the cold heavy cream and whip until soft peaks form. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.', u'For the french toast: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Whisk together the sugar and eggs until smooth. Whisk in the milk, cream, cinnamon and vanilla until combined.', u'Make the French toast in 2 batches. Heat 2 tablespoons each of the butter and oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until the butter is melted and the oil begins to shimmer.', u'Place 4 slices of the bread in the custard mixture and let sit on both sides until soaked through. Remove with a slotted spatula to allow the excess custard to run off. Cook until the toast is golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.', u'Transfer the French toast to a baking rack set over a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven while you cook the second batch with the remaining butter, oil and bread. Keep French toast warm until ready to serve.', u'For the banana foster topping: Heat the butter in a large saute pan over high heat until it begins to sizzle. Whisk in the brown sugar and cinnamon and cook until the sugar has melted and the mixture has thickened slightly.', u'Add the bananas and cook until slightly softened. Remove from the heat and add the rum and banana liqueur. Return to the heat and cook until the alcohol has burned off.', u"Serve 2 slices of toast per person, topped with some of the bananas and their syrup, a dollop of the whipped cream cheese, some fresh berries, and sprinkling of confectioners' sugar, if using. Garnish with mint."]
ingredients: [u'8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1/2 teaspoon finely grated orange zest', u'1 cup very cold heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'6 large eggs', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'4 tablespoons canola oil', u' Eight 1/2-inch-thick slices day-old brioche, left out overnight on a baking rack', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 cup packed light brown muscovado sugar', u' Pinch ground cinnamon', u'2 small ripe bananas, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'1/2 cup dark rum', u'2 tablespoons banana liqueur', u" Confectioners' sugar, optional", u' Mixed berries, for garnish', u' Mint sprigs, for garnish']
title: Bananas Foster French Toast with Whipped Cream Cheese

directions: [u'Add the flour, salt and honey to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook. Mix until combined.', u'Add the water and yeast to a small bowl and allow it to sit for 15 minutes. Add the yeast water to the flour mixture and beat until well mixed. Put the mixing bowl in a warm place, cover and let rise until the dough is doubled in size. Punch the dough down and divide it into 6 equal parts. Form into six 6-inch loaves, cover and allow them to double in size.', u'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Arrange the loaves on a baking sheet and bake until light brown. ', u'Enjoy!']
ingredients: [u'3 cups bread flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'1 1/4 cups warm water', u'1 1/2 tablespoons yeast']
title: Chef Rick's Classic French Bread

directions: [u'Heat a Dutch oven over medium-high heat with extra-virgin olive oil. Add bacon and cook until crisp, about 5 minutes, remove with slotted spoon.', u'Heat a pot of water to boil for egg noodles.', u'While bacon crisps, scatter 1/2 cup flour on a shallow dish. Season the chopped chicken with salt and pepper and add to flour. Toss the chicken to coat and shake off the excess as you add it to the hot bacon drippings. Lightly brown the chicken about 3 minutes on each side then remove. Add mushrooms to the pan and add the celery, carrots and parsnips as you chop them Season with salt, pepper and thyme. Cook vegetables 5 to 6 minutes to tenderize them. Scoot vegetables off to the sides of the pan forming a well. Add 2 tablespoons butter to the well and melt them whisk in 2 tablespoons flour. Whisk wine into roux, shake pan to combine then stir in stock. Add chicken back to the pan and stir in the onions. Simmer the chicken 10 minutes. Adjust seasoning.', u'Salt water for egg noodles. Add noodles and cook to al dente. Drain noodles and return to hot pot. Add 2 tablespoons butter to noodles and toss to melt. Season noodles with nutmeg, salt and pepper, to taste, and garnish with parsley.']
ingredients: [u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'4 slices good quality bacon, chopped', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour plus 2 tablespoons', u'2 pounds chicken tenders, cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch pieces', u' Salt and pepper', u'1/2 pound button mushrooms, quartered', u'3 ribs celery from the heart of the stalk and leafy tops, chopped', u'1 carrots, peeled and chopped', u'2 parsnips, peeled and chopped', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme, 4 to 5 sprigs', u'4 tablespoons butter, divided', u'2 cups white French burgundy wine, 1/3 bottle', u'1 cup chicken stock', u'2 cups frozen pearl onions', u'1 pound extra-wide egg noodles', u' Freshly grated nutmeg, to taste', u' A handful flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped']
title: French White Burgundy Chicken and Egg Noodles

directions: [u'Preheat oven to 375 F.  ', u'Peel, core, and cut each apple into 3/4 inch thick wedges.  Place the apple wedges in a large mixing bowl, and toss gently with the lemon juice to prevent discoloration. Peel the bananas, and slice them crosswise 3/4 inch thing. Add the bananas to the apples and toss to coat evenly with lemon juice. Sprinkle the cinnamon over the fruits and toss well to combine.', u'Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fruit and saute until tender, about 30 seconds. Add the brown sugar and maple syrup and cook until the sugar is dissolved, 30 seconds longer, remove from heat.', u'Pour the contents into a lightly buttered, non-reactive, 9- inch round baking dish. In a medium size bowl, beat the eggs, then stir in the milk and vanilla. Dip the bread slices into the egg mixture just to moisten (both sides), then place them over the fruit in a single layer in the pan, making sure to cover the fruit entirely. Pour any leftover egg mixture over the bread. Let the mixture sit for 10 minutes. (This can be prepared up to this point in advance, covered and refrigerated overnight)', u'Bake the French toast, uncovered until the top is golden, 30-35 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Place a serving tray over the pan, and carefully turn them over to unmold the French toast. Spoon any syrup or fruit left in the pan over the bread, and serve at once.']
ingredients: [u'4 tart apples, such as McIntosh or Granny Smith', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'3 large ripe bananas', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup (firmly packed) light brown sugar', u'1 tablespoons maple syrup', u'2 large eggs', u'1/2 cup milk', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'4 to 5 slices challah bread (1-inch thick)']
title: Upside-Down Baked Apple French Toast
